title: I was SO surprised I WILL return
text: My husband and I just celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary We normally stay at very high class hotels but that night we wanted to try something new without spending a fortune St Regis Ritz etc are our norms We wanted the Tribeca area so we pulled up to the hotel unassuming front The Bell guys were so nice and took care of our bags right away While checking in we had at least 3 people come up to us and say Happy Anniversary Being Starwood platinum we had it all set up to hopefully get an upgrade We gave 12000 points which was the minimum They told us we could not have a suite and we were a little disappointed but it would be fine because he was giving us a great view Then the manager came in and changed everything and gave us the nicest suite ever They gave us the top floor They brought champagne and chocolate strawberries quickly to our room It was the best ever The room was simple but beautiful The view was amazing The bed was soooo comfortable and I slept like a baby I cant say enough about the bathroom It was sooo nice I would give the bathroom a 5 star Im not kidding For a sheraton it was very impressive I dont know why I havent been to this hotel before Now that I know how nice everyone is there and how extremely comfortable they made us I will go back soon We go into the city a lot and I will for sure go back Thank you so much Sheraton You wowed us

title: A MotherDaughter vacation
text: I could not leave a bad comment on any part of our stay Everyone was so nice Our room was kept in great shape for us too This place was so clean

title: Good Choice for Precruise
text: I spent one night at this hotel prior to a cruise Friendly staff is very noticeable wherever you go in hotel Building is historic site in old bank building Lobby is particularly beautiful Breakfast was excellent as was comfort of very large kingbed room No pool and no balconies but everything else is excellent Yes there is a large number of homeless people walking around the neighborhood but they didnt bother me Large shopping center and excellent restaurants in Gaslight quarter outside your door Its about 10 blocks downhill or a 800 cabride to the port

title: Great Value for a King Queen and Princesses
text: Great Value for a King Queen and Princesses We stayed at the Pacific Terrace with our two daughters 35 and 8 months old for five nights in early March The hotel was beautiful clean and comfortable It looked even better in person than on the hotel website Everyone was friendly We really enjoyed our patio and even the view was great from our partialoceanview The room was roomy I wish the beds werent so high off the ground since I have two young children but the rooms were beautiful There was a big flat screen TV The sink and mirror were separate from the tub and toilet which made it easier for us to all get ready There was always a fresh basket of linens outside the door the next morning in case we needed an extra towel The included breakfast was very good with fresh fruit cereal pastries juice coffee water and yogurt The afternoon wine reception was very relaxing We sipped our wine by the pool The pool area was beautiful and comfortable Our 35 year old daughter loved the fresh baked cookies in the afternoon and adored the turn down service because she got chocolate on her bed at night I enjoyed the free internet access in the lobby We walked to dinner many nights The hotel did a fantastic job of referring us to different dining spots We really liked being able to push a stroller all along the beach on the sidewalk above The area is difficult to pinpoint exactly It is a 50s beach bungalow type location There are alot of college kids that live in the area As with any busylarge town there were occassional homeless people along the Pacific Beach boardwalk That being said we were never uncomfortable Right across from the hotel are condos that are starting at 750000 The hotel was really convenient to La Jolla and to Seaworld We loved that we stayed right on the beach and could hear the ocean We paid 15 day to park in their garage under the hotel They even had music playing in the garage that was relaxing I found the convenience of the parking well worth the 15 This was such a great value We would definitely go back in a heart beat

title: Pleasant stay
text:
Great location in the heart of lively Georgetown
Previous reviews have been quite variable which caused some concerns when booking this hotel We had no problems whatsoever So no hessitations in recommending the Latham

title: Learning lessons from highend chains
text: A tremendous hotel the like of which we would never see in Europe certainly not at this price Space comfort well equipped rooms a choice of pools an impressive spa and a wellequipped gym with a consistently high quality standard of service throughout Details have been looked after and lessons learned from the sometimes antiseptic feel of the highend chains The food is excellent with the Addison worth a visit in itself The golf course is fantastically maintained and tuition is handson and effective An instant favourite

title: Very beautiful Old San Francisco Hotel
text:
This hotel is very beautiful to walk into There is real Tiffany glass above the checkin and fantastic chandelliers throughout the main floor The room I stayed in was somewhat small the bathroom a remodel from the 60s or 70s but very clean and adequate Bed was very comfortable and that really counts And the window opened I like real air
The hotel is steps away from BART and Muni and streetcars I did not have a rental car nor did I miss having one Parking fees in San Francisco are hideously high
The drawback is the neighborhood But I wonder if the police dont take care of the Financial District do they really watch any place Walking to and from the Warfield Theatre I passed by plenty of homeless people andor drug dealers but nobody threatened me
I think the staff is very nice and efficient
And I think the restaurant is fantastic A real chef not a cook runs the kitchen and the menu items are creative and expertly preparedChef actually met us in the lobby and informed us of his newest creations How could we refuse
Oh yes I will most definitely return

title: Great Views Clean Room Convenient Walk To LA Live
text:
As a preface I travel to a limited degree to review rock concerts and have begun to include hotel and resort reviews as well which I am republishing here is modified form This review is for The Westin Bonaventure Hotel  Suites in Los Angeles during my recent Los Angeles Trip February 2012
Room TypeClass Traditional Room
Date February 710 2012
Overall Rating 45
This trip was explicitly to attend two concert events  one at Club Nokia and the other one in Hollywood I lived and worked in Los Angeles for many years while I was in graduate school so Im really familiar with it Since Club Nokia is part of LA Live I thought it made sense to find a hotel that is within walking distance of LA Live which put me downtown I considered the Marriott and the RitzCarlton that are part of LA Live but they were much more expensive compared with The Westin Bonaventures Hotwire price
I ended up deciphering a hidden discounted offering on one website to purchase on another and found that The Westin Bonaventure was the hotel being offered within that class range for a highly discounted cost off the base rate and booked it
So the hotel has valet parking but it is an additional 35 per night If you dont mind walking a block or two I noticed that there appeared to be some other public parking alternatives that would be cheaper I ended up using the valet which is underground and you walk down a hallway adorned with movie poster one sheets of films shot at and around the hotel see photos below and up an escalator toward the main entry level where the front desk is located
Checkin was quick and otherwise unremarkable I had originally booked two nights but one of my events was canceled and rescheduled I asked if I could add a night at the discounted price and was told they couldnt sell rooms at that price but the guy at the front desk looked in his computer to see their occupancy for the desired night and more or less indicated that if I went on that reseller website again I would likely be able to add the third night at the same reduced rate when I went up to my room I was able to do this and add it on
I was actually really excited to check out the elevators as there is a scene with Arnold Schwarzenegger in True Lies where he goes up one of the elevators on horseback the gentleman at the front desk was able to direct me to the exact elevator I was seeking
As for the room itself I had the basicbase room and was pleased that it was on one of the higher floors better views While on the small side it was very clean and nicely appointed as Ive learned to expect from Westin properties
Maybe because it is an older property the shower and bed are maybe not as Heavenly as some other Westin properties but overall the room suited my needs perfectly traveling alone with kingsized bed and computer desk Internet connectivity via WiFi was good but not spectacular
For me the best bonus of the room was the view Most of the outward facing wall is glass floor to ceiling as the view was spectacular particularly at night
There are some amenities in the hotel that I just didnt have the time to use  restaurant bar etc
As noted I had come to LA for a concert at LA Live and found that it was definitely a reasonable walking distance from the Westin Bonaventure  maybe too far for some peoples taste but I walked back and forth several times and I dont think it took more 15 minutes
Overall I dont have any complaints at all though it would be nice if valet parking was included but I knew from my research ahead of time that was a cost to factor into the overall value proposition of the stay When I attend a future event at LA Live I would likely return to the Bonaventure unless there is a special deal at one of the competing properties

title: Spring Training Greatness
text: I came down for some spring training games and stayed here Staff was very friendly and helpful If i come to Phoenix next year Ill definitely return to this hotel

title: Hello does anyone work here
text: Everything at this hotel seems slow and staff are nonexistent Checkin was slow despite an empty lobby room service doesnt answer room is ok but ac is a noisy unit like the kind found in motels This is my second stay and last was the same

title: location is good rooms suck
text:
the palmet hotel website descibes itself as an elegent art deco hotelit isnt while the location is greatits one block from S Michigan Ave and Art Institute of Chicago the rooms are tiny and oldand has a staff that borders on arrogant
I booked online specifically asking for a king size bed and paid an additonal  10 per night for it and yet when i checked in it was a battlethe check in staff tried hard to push me into a smaller bed  it was the chicago marathon weekend and i had to argue to get a room that i was paying for i am almost tempted to think they tried to bully me into this thinking i was a desi it was only when i gave them my US passport  is when they shut up the room was tiny the bathrooms smallno free internet and it takes them forever to get luggage to and from you room
the hotel is old with noisy train lines and traffic
the positives were the helpful concierge the locationi would not stay here again

title: Great family friendly vacation
text:
I went to the FHP at Ghirardelli Square with extended family and this is a great property for those traveling with friends or family that want a two bedroom with a livingdining room We saw a lot of three generation travelers at breakfast and location is very touristy right next to Fishermans Wharf 
The rooms are very quaint and comfortable with a great view of the ocean and beautiful red brick walls 
The Fairmont has great amenities like an Escalade that will take you back and forth for about 2 miles around the hotel but be prepared to wait for it 
If you like fine dining make sure to check out Gary Danko a mere 2 blocks from the hotel

title: Cant wait to return to The London NYC
text: Absolutely overthetop experience from beginning to end Not the least expensive spot in town but I defy you to find a hotel of this caliber that offers suites of this size at lower prices You wont Since the hotel is freshly renovated every inch of the property is spotless  fresh We had a London Suite on the 17th floor which was silent when the windows were closed Our suite had a parlor which was separated from the bedroom by a small entryway  a very welllit bathroom which was enormous The huge mirrors on the bathroom wall were separated by fabulous light panels that made makeup application a breeze In addition the shower area was 9 x 4 with a rain shower type fixture on one end and a shower massage fixture on the other There was also a Euro handheld fixture so the bases were covered regarding your showering options The bed offered super deluxe pillowtop comfort and the pillows were fab The linens were very high threadcount sateen The ambiance is minimalistelegant in the suites  throughout the hotel Didnt try the restaurantbar Loved every moment that we were there  look forward to returning Hopefully their discounted rate will continue forever

title: Big hotel in an excellent location needs some modernisation
text: Stayed in early June for a conference Huge hotel with helpful staff and decent size rooms Beds were also very comfortable I had a nice view of Michigan Ave Magnificent Mile The bathroom though was surprisingly tiny Overall it needs some renovation to compete with the likes of Trump tower The breakfast on the first day was a bit of a disaster It was just so chaotic the food itself was pretty decent tho Decent size pool and gym for those who are keen to keep fit I would look to the newer places to stay next time tho

title: Great Location
text: We stayed here in August with 4 adults  4 kids 468 10 Great location because it is an easy walk to inner harbor The down side was they had no pool  bar closed early We wanted to bring a glass of wine up to room when kids went to sleep but it closed 89 We did get 2 rooms that had an outer door that closed from the hallway so we had great privacy Rooms were very clean and breakfast was nice The front desk was helpful when asked about restaurants  directions We left our car parked the whole time  walked to Inner Harbor Aquarium Childrens Museum and even to Little Italy Would stay here again

title: Loved the Omni Shoreham
text: The Omni Shoreham was the venue for the US Chamber of Commerce  Small Business Summit This hotel is amazing I had a very spacious king room This is a fullservice hotel with a topnotch restaurant barlounge nice outdoor pool for a city hotel gift shop jewelry store and large fitness center Staff was professional and very courteous The location is great  close to the zoo subway and Georgetown I would definitely consider staying here again although its  Includes free wifi access if youre an Omni Rewards member

title: Good value great people
text: Recent renovations and upgrades make ones stay very comfortable while also offering green options for the room But it is the attentive professional and very pleasant personnel at the hotel that make ones stay enjoyable JJ Elizabeth and Tezelia at the front desk provide excellent service always and Stacy in the front office is equally laudable For these reasons I have been a repeat guest during 4 years of business travel to Charlotte

title: Another Kimpton Gem
text:
Solamar is by far one of the nicest Kimpton properties Ive stayed in Greeted by very friendly staff who were helpful in getting me into my room 3 hours before the 300 checkin Room was HUGE So much room to spread out Bathroom was very spacious and bright Speakman shower heads Bed was immensely comfortable View was looking out over the 4th floor rooftop pool and bar 
Wine hour from 56 was great and then moseyed up to the bar where John the bartender took care of my beverage needs Pool and bar area are bustling around 7 but a great place to catch some rays and enjoy some conversation 
I will definitely make this my San Diego hotel of choice after my stay here

title: Great hotel cheap price
text: We were really worried after reading so many horrible reviews about this hotel before our trip to NYC but the hotel ended up to be really nice The room was clean 16th floor though it was a little shabby The furniture in the room were new and the bed was ok Bathroom was very clean and had fresh towels almost every day The services in the hotel and in the lobby were also great though we sometimes needed to wait for some time to get to our safe deposit box But hey they have 1700 rooms Altogether the hotel is really a bargain Just dont expect Plaza for that price

title: Brilliant location
text:
I stayed at this hotel last year on my first trip to New York and thought it was brilliantly placed as did my boyfriend whos been to NYC several times We were able to walk absolutely everywhere and it was great to be slightly away from the madness of Times Square whenever we walked through there we said it was nice how calm our street was in comparison 
Wed asked for a high room and were given a lovely room on the very top floor with a fantastic view of the Chrysler building The room was really big and the bed one of the comfiest Ive slept in All of the staff were really helpful and friendly would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it

title: Nice Stay for Business
text: I recently stayed at the Magnolia while on business in Denver The location is great Close to light rail the 16th street mall and all the fun stuff downtown The service at the front dest was excellent and efficient The building is older and the long hallways can be a little confusing The room was clean and nice Enjoyed the nice couch for lounging and the bathroom was very nice The evening happy hour cookies and milk and continental breakfast at no extra cost are great perks If staying downtown and looking for a nice place to stay that isnt too expensive this is the place for you

title: Pretty nice place
text: We just got back from a week long stay at this hotel which happened to be our honeymoon We had to change our original Florida plans due to the hurricanes Neither of us had any major complaints The staff was excellent as was our room We were on the 8th floor overlooking the Charles River The suites have ample space and the beds are perfect Once you climbed into the down comforters and pillows it was difficult to get out The concierge would do anything for us and was well prepared to dish out any information concerning the local area Among the things we didnt like were the 20 per day parking fee I thought this was a little steep for a paying guest at the hotel The only other complaint I have is the entranceexit to the hotel If you drive to the hotel you will curse entering or exiting the property We rented a car for the week but after being there one day we found it completely unnecessary The hotel offers free shuttles to areas of interest and cab fare to other places is reasonable Plus you dont have to deal with the insanely packed streets of Boston

title: Enjoyed Couples Massage
text: Came to stay at the hotel over the weekend to celebrate our Anniversary The stay was wonderful the staff took really good care of us and made sure everything was going well The king bed was so comfortable it felt like I was sleeping at home

title: A bit old but service is great
text:
First the positives the staff are great Friendly and knowledgeable They seem to really enjoy their job and want to help guests The hotel is also fairly clean and the rooms are quite large They have a business centre swimming pool and gym which are small but adequate The breakfast is continentalnothing spectacular but adequate for your needs
I guess the hotel seems a bit dated but fine for any 3 to 3 12 star hotel The neighbourhood and some guests are a bit eclectic It is not unsafe but I would describe some guests as edgyartsy The hotel has a funky vibeagain not bad but just different
All in all it is a great hotel if your expectation is correct It is not a Four Seasons but very adequate There is noise from the highway but not really disturbing Some of the appliancestaps can be noisydripping but again easy to fix I think the staff really turn this from an OK hotel to a quite a decent place to stay

title: Wonderful Hotel with Great Service
text: My husband and I just returned from an overnight stay in the city to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary The Chatwal was a perfect choice We were very pleased with the service the accommodations and the location of this hotel The hotel was very thoughtful and provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates in honor of our anniversary Im hoping to return again in October with my 5 year old son as it is also a very safe facility

title: Very Nice Time
text:
We stayed on the 25th floor and the same week the Dallas Cowboys had their training week My stepdad had some meeting there
The athletes stayed there  my family and I got to meet a few trainers 
It had a very gorgeous view of the riverwalk It was tad bit expensive though But they have a pool half indooroutdoor The hot tub was very relaxing  They have a neat workout gym 
The beds were OHSO comfy I even napped in jeans 
We had a balcony  got the gorgeous view of the riverwalk Its really neat at night The location is great The elevators are fast Lobby smells good Valet parking Nice staff Clean room I cant complain really Id say go for it

title: Comfortable stay
text: Weve stayed here a few time while visiting our daughter at school Rooms are clean quiet and comfortable Unfortunately this Sheraton doesnt run any specialsthey dont need to The hotel is a short walk to both Penn and Drexel

title: 2nd time is not a charm
text:
Wrote a review this summer about my displeasure with this Westin Got stuck there again this time via hotwire which booked me at the intercontinental but then switched me to the westin Same pet peeve Staff who dont care why would they tell me the mall opens at 900 am when it opens at 1000 am tired bathrooms and loud long running toilets The kicker is waking up and having not an ounce of water hotelwide
Yes it was only for two hours but it just is indicative of the state of disrepair at this property They offered me a free night and I passed it up Wont stay there for free 
All in all a solid 3 star hotel max Which is why I gave it an average rating It would be an average Hampton Inn Not a Westin Shame on you Westin sell this dog and keep our confidence

title: Nice place and good deal
text:
We liked our room and the pillows were not as bad as some other reviewers have indicated It says something about the hotel when the worst thing i can think of is the hard pillows We really liked the lack of check in and invisible staff but found out they are around if you really need help
We have relatives in Boston and plan on staying at St Botolph again

title: Location Location Location
text:
Stayed March 14  17 2008 The Tuscin Inn is a great hotel depending your room location Location is the best Everything is in walking distance shopping etc The weather is great just a little cold and windy but no rain there were sunny days on our trip Walgreens was a great store and purchase clothing less than the vendor on the street were offering 
I had a government rate which was very good for the room selection We had a double beds for the first 2 nights and a suite for the next two nights The room are exact has they appear on the wedsite Made our reservations on Best Westerncom The room 454 had double beds and no view The closet are very small but the room was comfortable When checking in remember to asked for the bar key so you can store beverages in the refrigerator Room 402 was the suite large bathrooom no closet space nice room fireplace but the sofa bed was terrible In addition the heater did not work so I had to order additional blankets to get warmeven received a slight cold upon return Room 402 did have a view they were willing to change room but we had already uppacked and did not realize the heater was not working until our 2nd night Did not asked for a discount they told me to contact Manager who was unable at the time each time I inquired The Corceige was excellent and some of the hotel staff did care and others did not may be the government rate The coffee in the morning was great did not attend the wine party Did not eat at the restaurant but room service was great If you book a room asked for the courtyard view if possibe Location is everything at this site everything you need is right in the area Pier 39 and other activities are in walking distance Do you go the aquarium not worth the price
Grayline tours were great Took the 10 per person on the ride around the bay best price The battleship was a great tour also Did not do Alcaraz tour due to the kids Overall the stay at The Tuscan Inn was great and would highly recommend due to the room service There are other hotels in the area who do not offer room service We traveled with 2 adults and 2 children

title: Comfortable
text:
I stayed here for an overnight weekend with my out of town friends I originally booked at the Plaza Bevery Hills but my friends couldnt get reservations there as they are already fully book So I cancelled my reservation there and booked here I was surprised how the Plaza Hotel and this little Marriott hotel have pretty much the same price I would probably prefer to stay at the Plaza but Im still glad I booked here as I personally did not have issues on this hotel In fact I actually had a pleasant stay My room was perfect for me It was roomy smells and feels clean My sheets and my king size bed were comfortable Most importantly my room was very quiet My first time to sleep 7 hours straight since my son was born So yea this deserve a 4 stars in my book By all means this hotel is more of a 3 stars hotel but pleasant stay and good night sleep is priceless 
Timmy the valet guy was also very pleasant and helpful Marco the front desk was accommodating to me He seems apologetic for my friends plight when I told him about their issues which he also tried to amend But hey thats their issues  their review

title: Great hotelwould stay again
text: Great hotel superb location and really helpful friendly staff The room was immaculate comfortable and tastefully decorated The rooftop pool was faba little cool maybe but very refreshing with plenty of loungers and chairs and it provided welcome down time for my kids We had a meal in the restaurant and also in room dining and both were excellent quality We would definately stay here again

title: Great hotel not the best location
text: The hotel itself is lovely fantastic breakfast with everything you can imagine The managers reception was the best we have had at an Embassy Suites Hote The room itself was very spacious clean and I would definately say this is more plush than other Embassy Suites Unfortunately you do have to pay for internet in the rooms and the free internet lounge was often fullThe location is great for the airport but not particularly convenient for Downtown Boston the underground is about a 510 minute walk and for adults the return fare is not especially cheap With children you may want a more convenient hotel if you are exploring the city What I would say is the hotel overall was very good value For 5 people we couldnt find anything of a similar price

title: This has to be my favourite hotel in California
text: I loved this hotel  it is such a little hidden gem Very cosy and beautiful There are fresh cookies and cake available in the hotel reception Breakfast is a lovely affair with fresh hot food brought out all the time In the evening there is a little drinksfood reception this is a great time to meet other guests and share ideas I will definitely return again to stay The staff were very friendly and helpful Our room was basic but there is something about this hotel that is magical I hope you agree if you get to stay there

title: Great Hotel Great location
text: I have stayed at this hotel more than 5 times during the last few years If you want to be part of the West Village I know of no better choice The staff is friendly and helpful The rooms are typical NYsize The entire facility is clean Theres a lot going on in this unique central area and the Washington Square Hotel makes you feel like part of the neighborhood

title: Nice place but service
text:
For a relatively cheap quite clean place the Drury Inn in Denver certainly appeased us They provided pizza and some snacks during the evening which was certainly welcome and very much appreciated
When we checked in the lady greeted us and advised that we could get a king room for two nights at 54 US each night
I was elated given that Id read pretty decent reviews about this hotel So I sign up we go to our room everything is fine
The pizza the popcorn and the pool all great
On our final morning when we were checking out they placed the bill under the door a subtle reminder that we need to leave and had charged us 54 for the first night and 96 for the second
When querying this the woman treated me as though I was lying and that I must be dreaming if Id get the same room for 54 on a Saturday night After much frustration and complaining she eventually knocked it down to 64 for the second night
I was not particularly happy but it certainly was a lot better than the original price We left and probably wont return The place was good but the service was not so
Having said that Denver was awesome

title: Good choice in River North
text:
We have stayed here on several occasions and I enjoy this hotel
I like that you can walk to shopping theater good restaurants lively bars HOB so depending on what you are in the mood for it is nearby The public transportation is only a couple of blocks away and if you use the attached parking you get a bit of a discount it is a bit expensive
The rooms are a really good size for downtown and very clean

title: Great location Average hotel
text:
We stayed at this Sheraton for a conference my husband was attending The hotel is located on the river between the lake and the Miracle Mile The location is a great starting point to shop and sightsee The hotel itself is clean and the staff was friendly Our room was average with the bare essentials It was a decent size but there were no perks Basic shampoo conditioner and soap No bathrobes or even cotton balls
The staff was very helpful They provided directions and even a pass to skip the line at a local Chicago style pizza place BTW ordering a pizza from Malnatis or Ginos is cheaper than room service and they deliver Concierge will give you a list of who delivers

title: very nice and clean hotel
text: very nice and clean centrally located to all major subway stops they are going thru lobby renovation so the lobby might not look to appealing but i understand they are improving rooms clean and spacious very quiet check in was a breeze and guy was amazing gave us top floor and a couple of travel tips thanks hyatt for making our trip to boston amazing

title: Conference Meeting Space  Perfect
text: I had a work conference at the Sheraton Crescent and everything was done perfectly The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating Everything was very clean and the whole place smelled wonderful Yeah I know it sounds funny to say that but there is something nice about walking into a place that just smells great Thank you Sheraton for making our work conference there a perfect setting

title: Did not even get past the initial phone call  wont book here
text:
I just called the hotel to ask a couple of questions I could not find anything on their website if wifi was complimentary and I needed to know if wifi was only in the lobbycommon area or in the rooms also I have been burned before with this distinction
I called and asked the front desk if there was a charge for internet access I was told no one word answer So I asked if wifi was available in the rooms or if it was just in the common areas Her response I just told you it was free what more do you want
OK thenif I am getting attitude before I even get there this is not a place I want to stay Yes she may have been having a bad day But I have 20 people that I need to put someplace for 5 nights and I need to know they will be treated well
Sorry Hampton you lost our business from the initial phone call

title: New SF hotel
text:
We returned from our 2 night stay at the Hotel Vital which opened recently 
Location It is located close to the freeway so it easy to find but so close that you hear traffic noise It is right across the street from the newly remodeled Ferry building which includes restaurants and shops and down the street from Pier 39 
Service Upon making reservations we had to switch days and they were not especially friendly over the phone but not rude either I suppose efficient would be appropriate The rooms are significantly more expensive during the week than the weekend which is the opposite of most places we visit Our checkin was very pleasant and we did arrive four hours before checkin We were greeted and to our surprise promptly given an available room 
Hotel The hotel has a modern zenlike feel The hallways are very dimly lit which may not be plus for many people The artwork and lavendar pieces in the hallway are a nice touch Our room was average sized with a great bed and nice linens Flatscreen tv cd player with four cds bathroom amenties from the Fresh co Our view was of a building wall but if you are able to get a view of the water it would be amazing My husband hated the bathroom door as it is more visually appealing than suited for privacy 
RestaurantBar We did not eat at the restaurant although the menu looked great and it was crowded The bar was nice and had a similar feel as the hotel with great service even though it was a busy night 
Gym We had the room to ourselves with a couple cardio machinestvs and free weights Small room with no windows
Overall we had a nice experience but were able to get an introductory rate We would most likely look elsewhere for the current price

title: Very average room Not best location
text: I was a tad disappointed with this hotel Lobby beautiful Actually stunning But to to room which was supposed to be big enough to fit a portable bed if we decided we friend  I didnt want to share a bed as they had no twins available But getting back to room size we could barely fit extra rack for suit case let alone another bedas for Location well its a lovely view perched on top of snob hill but makes exploring a chore because the road to it is soooooo steep had to take heels off walking down as its that steep so not a handy easily accessible location I would have perfered bottom of hill near Union Square cheaper less impressive lobby Service was ok but hardly worth the  for the tiny room Oh did I mention window in room looking at wall

title: Considering the cost and location this is a good place to stay
text:
If you are only after an affordable place to stay in a top location go for this hotel We were out all day during our stay so we knew we only needed a bed to stay in My husban and 3yr old and I slept comfortably in the bed we were on a higher floor facing the street and did not hear much noise 
 Its perfectly located near Union Square The Bart stop though an uphill walk the cable car stop as well We took the BART easily from the airport and within 30mins arrived at Powell st station and walked some blocks to the hotel The room we had had two double beds and large clean bathroom flat screen tv Some people complained on reviews about the breakfast but if you are getting pastries for free there isnt much to complain about Free wifi in the lobby 
Once again if you want a fancier experience go for a nicer hotel as this is the basics no hairdryer but apart from that it is good Some staff members need to smile a little more

title: Beautiful hotel perfect for our honeymoon
text:
We stayed here for two nights as part of our honeymoon tour of the west coast in April This was the best hotel we stayed in  we absolutely loved it It is very different to the modern hotels we stayed in on other parts of the trip  this one one is grand and old style with afternoon drinks and an actual key for your room The staff were lovely and very helpful The location is stunning  Pacific Heights is the most beautiful area and you are surrounded by traditional houses and views of the bay SF is very hilly so do expect a few walks up and down steep roads  but it is totally worth it Follow Pacific Avenue right down and you are in china town which is great fun
The room was lovely and big and had a luxurious bathroom  you really felt you were staying in a big old housein the 1940s
The hotel has a lounge where you can get tea and coffee 247 and home made biscotti in the afternoons The breakfast was included and was a nice buffet with plenty of options
I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city  but especially if you are looking for some quirky charm and tradition This was just the perfect place for a honeymoon escape

title: Great stay as expected
text:
After reading the many many positive reviews I didnt have any worries about booking a stay here for a weekend getaway w a friend Andas expectedwe had a very good experience The lobby is small but very sleek  modern Every staff member was friendly and helpful Our room was clean  comfortable Even though the hotel is in a GREAT location just a block  half off Michigan Ave it was too cold for us wimps to walk around so we cabbed instead Valet parking is only 9 more and worth it because the self park is on the next street over and down a little plus it offers inout privileges
We had reserved a room w two doubles and asked to be away from the elevators since my friend  I are both light sleepers We were told that all the doubles are by the elevators  the kings make up the rest of the rooms on each floor but were assured that there was soundproofing so we shouldnt hear the elevator noise We were happy to find this true we didnt hear a PEEP from the elevators just the crying baby next door
A breakfast buffet is included which had all the standard cereal yogurt bagels juice etc plus hard boiled eggs oatmeal a waffle maker  batter and breakfast sandwiches  miniquiches that you could heat in the microwave
Its not a 5 star plush hotel w fancy robes and such but you cant beat the cleanliness  value for the money here
The only negative was that we came back after a long Saturday night out  were planning to watch a payperview movie but the tvs do not have that option Oh wellminor detail 
Thanks Fairfield I will definitely be back

title: Very Nice
text: I really ejoyed my stay with the hotel I stayed with a friend of mine on the spg floor David the manager was really great and friendly and VERY professional There were to young ladie working with him as well that were really nice but quiet I will recommend this hotel to anyone I wasnt a fan of Starwood however after the service i received I have changed my mind

title: Waste of Money
text: Dont waste your money This hotel is overpriced dont let the breakfast fool you not worth it The hotel is dirty The staff could care less about you Just a bad experience One good thing it was cold so we could shop right there or take the metro to get out of there You may want to take your own sheets since the sheets in our room were dirty We complained and it took forever to get new ones The shower was not cleaned Again the staff took no action The once nice staff was at breakfast who seated us They are more interested in talking to each other that you There are plenty of places to stay take some time and do your research

title: Not much Quality at this Inn
text: Checkin was alright friendly staff Park in front of room and was 3 min from where I had to be in the morning but all downhill from there No fridge or micro Gross beds desk falling apart with sticky crap on the leg when I went to prop it up with a phonebook Looked like dang oil spots on the carpet Internet actually worked great but the tv was not a flatscreen One serious problem was sharing a parking lot with a very seedylooking strip club Not a place youd want to stay with kids Also nasty fake eyelashes on the mirror Property unfortunately had the feel of a cheap brothel At least it was cheap

title: Cheap and Cheerful
text: We stayed in the Baldwin Hotel in November 2012 and were generally happy with our stay The hotel itself is located on the edge of San Franciscos china town and feels safe comfortable and quiet It is also close to Union Square and the main shopping district You will need to jump onto the famous trams if you are wanting to visit other sites however though these are just around the corner The rooms are a little dated but were clean and tidy and the staff were always happy to help us with our queries

title: Great Location nice hotel rooms not quite as grand as in the past
text:
Mellia the concierge made my stay very knowledgable and friendly The other hotel staff could take pointers from the two female concierges They know how to provide topnotch service
When you enter the public spaces will wow you The rooms are nice but dont feel as grand as the public spaces Large flat screen tvs are nice fridge safe plenty of storage space Walls thin Temperature difficult to regulate Beds comfy
GREAT LOCATION Muni across the street close to Union Square museums restaurants etc
I recommend the tour to wine country The concierge can set it up for you take the smaller of the two tours
If the price is right Id stay at the palace again

title: Simply lovely
text:
I was in town for a conference and this hotel was picked by a colleague for its location and fair price I was thrilledalways loving the W brand
 this hotel did not disappoint 
First walking in the floral scent is lovely and inviting I love the modern design water features and fresh flowers everywhere The reception area and bar have a cool modern edge The staff were very friendly and helpful storing luggage and help at conciergeaka whatever desk
Our room was a good size for NYC 2 beds and it fit luggage It was modern and clean Bed and linens were top rate The bathroom was complete with tub shower and fantastic Bliss products
Location is great for the tourist and Jatvis conference attendee Yes there is some trafficsiren noise but common anywhere in NYC Overall I highly recommend

title: The Very Best
text: I often stay at the St Regis in San Francisco and find it to be absolutely the best The facilities are excellent but what really separates it from the rest is the level of service and attention All staff is extremely helpful and capable It is my hotel of choice in a city with other very good hotels

title: friendly staff comfortable rooms great free breakfast
text: I stayed here one night during a work trip and got a great AAA rate The staff was very friendly and as requested I was given a quiet room on an upper floor There were cookies and candy canes twas the season at the time at the front desk at certain hours The continental breakfast was better than most offered at hotels and included herbed eggs that tasted fresh and were delicious The coffee something important to me was great as well The location of the hotel is near the convention center and Chinatown which is known for great restaurants etc The hotel is also within walking distance of some notable attractions as well The valet parking fee and tax was the only thing I found objectionable though this is a common problem in DC

title: Stay some where else
text: The rooms are very very small My bathroom is bigger Not a good location for families There were no in room amenities glasses ice bucket towels etc The parking is not at the hotel and is 3000 per 24 hour period The staff is very snotty and not helpful I would not stay there again and I would not recommend this hotel

title: Wonderful stay at the Chancellor
text: My husband and I are just back from our first trip to San Francisco I chose the Chancellor based on reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed I emailed the manager Wes Tyler several times prior to our trip with questions and he always responded promptly which was a nice touch Im not sure one would get this at a larger hotel EVERYTHING about our stay at the Chancellor more than met our expectations We had booked shuttle service from the airport with Lorries which I found on the hotels website and which Im sure saved us considerable time as we were unfamiliar with getting around San Francisco We arrived early in the morning and our room was not yet ready but we had expected this and left our bags to go on an Alcatraz tour When we returned we went to our room which as requested prior to our arrival was a corner room with a view of Union Square room 1203 Surprise Waiting for us was a bottle of sparkling wine two Chancellor wine glasses giftwrapped photo frame and nice note from the hotel staff congratulating us on our recent marriage What a way to welcome your guests The room was painted in lovely shades of green and taupe with nice prints on the walls The bed had a soft white comforter and many pillows Television armchairs dressers lamps etc were more than adequate The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept like babies for the four nights we were there The bathroom was plenty big for the both of us and wellappointed with soap shampoo lotion tissues cotton balls and QTips hair dryer and makeup mirror plus the rubber ducky was a cute touch The ceiling fan and open windows provided more than enough ventilation The large closet was much appreciated as was the iron ironing board and inroom safe The room was very quiet at all times and street noise was not bothersome All of the staff that we encountered were efficient friendly and helpfulparticularly Steve helped us with restaurant reservations Susie answered transportation questions and arranged shuttle service back to SFO and Matt brought our bags to the room Everyone that we saw truly seemed to enjoy working at the hotel We visited both the bar and restaurant and had pleasant experiences along with moderately priced tasty mealsdrinks As many reviewers have previously noted the location of the Chancellor cant be beat for just about anything a tourist would want to do in San Francisco particularly shopping and dining If we ever return to San Francisco which I sincerely hope to do because I fell in love with it there is no way I would stay anywhere other than the Chancellor THANK YOU

title: I will alwyays stay at the St Gregory hotel
text: I stay at the St Gregory Hotel for the second time and I must admit that it is great M Bah was very helpful during check in We came in at 1 am in the morning and was upgraded to a suite for 129 We will always return If you need a good hotel in a nice neighborhood stay at the St Gregory Hotel the rooms are very specious with kitchen There is a business center that is free to use

title: Not fancy but worth the perks
text: This hotel is just around the corner from the main Times Square which is great because it puts you in a convenient location without actually being right on the most crowded noisy street in NYC The hotel is small and the lobbyrooms are not anything extravagant It reminded me more of a European hotel in its size For us that was totally fine but if youre only interested in space and want the newest fanciest hotel with a view then this is not the one you want However if you want a friendly staff a cleanquiet room free breakfast free winecheesefruitveggies every evening and 24 access to coffeeice waterbaked goods then this IS the hotel for you  You also get free WiFi and access to a fitness center should you want it though we did not use these options The hotel was nice enough to put a complimentary bottle of wine in our room for our anniversary which we appreciated Also the cafe on the second floor where all the free stuff is has a nice little outdoor terrace that we enjoyed sitting on at night

title: Just about perfect
text: We just came back from a weeks stay here It was just what we wanted an inexpensive clean comfortable room in a good area Close enough 2 blocks to Fishermans Wharf to be convenient to everything in the city but far enough to not be noisy Friendly helpful staff The included hot breakfast every morning was a real plusId recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again

title: Spotlessly clean Different kind of hotel
text:
Keep in mind  Ive never stayed at a Club Quarters hotel despite my 60 nightsyear in hotels That having been said I was made to feel quite foolish by the front desk staff when I didnt know that checkin was via an automated kiosk and not from the front desk attendants Regardless I wouldnt let that spoil my visit  the hotel itself is just a few steps off Wall Street making it a great location Monday  Friday and totally desolate Friday night through Sunday The hotel restaurant and bar were closed but there is a Duane Reade across the street with limited hours and South Street Seaport is a few blocks away
The hallways are very narrow making it difficult to balance a laptop bag and suitcase while attempting to get to your room Big perk  chilled purified water stations on every floor adjacent to a closet with extra pillows blankets and ironing boards The room itself was adequate for a solo traveler double bed desk with ergo chair flatscreen TV decently sized bathroom with nice toiletries and good WiFi Everything in the hotel is spotlessly clean and the TVcomputer lounge on the main floor is a nice perk Bizarrely enough the cost for a 3 PM checkout is 35  Ive never seen that before but I suppose its just part of a limitedservice hotel
Net if I cant get in to any of my usual hotels in NYC or if I really need to be on Wall Street I would probably consider the Club Quarters again

title: Good room for the price
text:
Pear Tree is a good place if you are on a budget and need a room for a good value This is a slightly older property but still well maintained The staff is very courteous and helpful Check in was easy and quick The hotel is located on 410 not far from Northstar mall There are a few restaurants close by and a short car ride will get you to many more restaurants As we were there in the winter we didnt get to try the pool 
THE ROOMS  They are pretty roomy and our room had the minifridge and microwave The bed was reasonably comfortable I wish it was a little softer but for a weekend it will suffice The bathroom is average sized and like most hotels seems to fog up quickly if you take a hot shower The floor gets slippery so definately law down a towel to keep you from slipping 
CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST  This was the best thing about the hotel They had a good supply of food The bagels were fresh and the waffle maker a good touch It gets packed especially the waffle maker stationbecause everyone staying there eats the breakfast so expect a crowd 
BUILDING  It was nice and tidy Not extravagant or posh but wellmaintained and not musty smelling like many Ramadas It could use some new carpet in the hallways and maybe in the rooms too However the carpet is an old style but not dirty or dingy The building is well insulated from sounds and it was surprisingly quiet 
This hotel is a good deal if the price is right I recommend it if you are looking for a nice room and are not concerned with needing a lot of luxuries

title: An excellent newly renovated property
text: My husband  I stayed here as we had a 7am departure from San Diego airport As I was unfamiliar with the proximity of downtown etc we thought it would be a convenient base Overall I was extremely happy with the newly branded Holiday Inn Express and the value we received for just under 130nt incl tax The hotel is 100 located parallel to the freeway so I requested a room facing away from the freeway and Jose was very happy to oblige when we checked in just after 8pm In fact Jose was friendly attentive and helpfulwhich is not the usual response when you check into a property so late in the day We had rm 347 and you could not hear a peep from the freeway The one complaint my husband had was that the airconditioner was very noisy To make matters worse it kept turning itself onoff all night which was noisy and frustrating We couldnt seem to figure out how to keep it constantly onif management could somehow fix this I think it would certainly help I would suggest bringing ear plugs if youre a light sleeper We had a rental car from Enterprise and it was literally down the road so it was very convenient so early in the morning The Holiday Inn Express also had a little convenience store in the lobby which was open 24 hours so you could easily grab some water or some snacks to tide you over The renovation was really well done  new carpet furniture microwave kettle tv duvet set etceven the bathroom had been preened still keeping in with some of the retro outfit though All in all I was very happy with the Holiday Inn Express

title: Warm and cosy room
text:
Some people here have rated the wrong hotel You can not complain about the restaurant or bartender when it doesnt have a restaurant or a bar I have come across other reviews for the wrong hotel and Im definitely going to use TripAdvisor very carefully now Its not necessarily accurate
Anyway this is a good place to stay The room is warm and cosy The bed very comfortable The breakfast is nice too I would stay here again any time The only drawback for me is that there is no restaurant nearby If I had a car no problem Theres plenty of parking too The free internet made up for it thats always a bonus for me

title: Location location
text: In South Park near Staples Center and other tourist attractions Great service nice rooms and very reasonably priced Even saw P Diddy and his entourage in the hotel lobby

title: Modern Clean great location great service
text: My husband and I went out for a date night here Were in our 30s so was most of the other guests young hip friendly Front desk was helpful and efficient Hotel room was beautiful and clean AND price was reasonable Would book again I was expecting a dump after reading other reviews so I was compelled to write about MY experience OH and bed was crazy comfy

title: its an awful hotel
text: The room we got was dark and dingy due to a blown out ceiling light and the carpet felt and looked dirty The ceiling was peeling and patched several times The bedding had holes in it and the beds were hard One of the shower taps was loose and you could see the holes the taps came out of the wall I thought we were in the hood Theres signs on the hotel entrance door about the amount of the cash kept in the lobby and a bullet hole in our rooms window I would never stay here again The pictures are deceiving

title: Birthday weekend made perfect by Helix Associates
text: We were celebrating a 30th birthday in DC and Hotel Helix really pulled out all the stops to make it perfect for us Great location friendly associates and cool decor We were welcomed with framed pictures of the birthday girls loved ones complimentary champagne was brought to room as well as extra pillows sheets and additional animal print robes upon request No special request was overlooked We will be back

title: Please please stay somewhere else
text: For all of you looking for a budget hotel with friendly staff and clean beds please look elsewhere The ladies if you can call them that who staffed the windows were beyond rude I honestly could not believe how selfabsorbed and obnoxious they were My sheets had what I called mystery stains all over them as did the top cover and spare blanket The sheets looked like theyd been laundered But the covers looked like theyd never seen the washer I barely touched them and you should do the same They were filthy On the contrary to other reviews my bathroom was OK It could have been worse As a matter of fact it was a lot like the dorm bathroom I used in college Thank God for flip flops and Lysol The TV was about 20 years old with bad reception and barely 4 channels But you dont come to NYC to sit in your room and watch TV One great thing about this hotel is that if you arent leaving NY until late in the day and need a place to store your things you can pay 1bag to store them at the hotel Also the hotel is in an excellent location just a block away from Times Square and the 42nd Street Subway But there are other hotels in the area that offer better service and nice clean rooms Your best bet is to go with one of them instead

title: Pleasant Hotel on Business
text: I had business just a block away from this hotel so I decided to give it a try The building contains offices as well so you take separate hotel elevators from the entrance floor to the lobby The lobby is elegant and tasteful You need your room key to go to any hotel floors above lobby level which is a good thing in Baltimore My room had a very high ceiling and a very nice bathroom with a stand up glass walled shower and Aveda bath products It was a spacious room with a nice flat screen TV The bed was supposed to be a king and maybe it was but it was small in length and my 6 2 frame hung over it Not sure it was the bed but I did not sleep well for some reason It happens For Kimpton members there was free internet access of course and also 10 for use at the inroom minibar The gym was nice with a decent selection of equipment

title: Average is a good description
text:
Was here for a conference and stayed in the lowrise section The room was very dated with an odd layout Plenty of space but not well used
Hotel is very busy A colleague had a wallet stolen from the conference area The fact that the hotel has a loss prevention officer should lead you to believe that this is a common occurence especially given that this is the hotel that Alex Trebek was in when his room was robbed
The hotel serves its purpose but you might see if you can get in a less dated room and watch your stuff carefully

title: Will use this hotel again
text:
Great location as close to the subway so makes visiting lots different areas in the city easy Having visited several hotels in New York this has good sized rooms is really clean and they are contemporary The Sky Bar has lovely views over the city and the barman made a mean cocktail
Only problem we had whilst staying was one of the lifts wasnt working so we did have to wait sometime for the other lift to visit our floor lol
and i nearly forgot it was lovely and quiet at night how could i forget that

title: Ill be back
text: This was my second stay at the Beverly Garlands Holiday Inn The staff has always been courteous pleasant and very attentive The rooms are clean comfortable and beautifully decorated On this trip I ate at the onsite restaurant and was very pleased with the quality of the food I was doubly impressed when room service delivered a hot meal The onsite bar has a great lounge atmosphere that plays music videos on several flat screen TVs I truly enjoyed the pool area especially in the evening when I could sit close to the outdoor fireplace Overall it was great experience staying here and Im looking forward to my next trip

title: Good Hotel Great Location
text: Stayed at the Comfort Inn Manhattan recently the hotel is in a great location only a 2 minute walk to Macys and the Empire State Building just behind the hotel on 34th St Rooms very clean very comfortable bed could have had better lighting though Breakfast good cereal eggs bagels toast but plastic plates cups and cutlery As earlier posts have said staff very helpful especially Mathew staff booked our tours and transport back to JFK Brendans also a good place to eat if you want to eat close by Would stay again

title: One of the best stays in New York City ever
text:
The Affinia 50 Hotel has everything going for it For the same price as a room at the Hilton or Sheraton you can have a clean large onebedroom suite They are basically apartments with a full kitchen large bedroom and the great Affinia bed 
 One thing many people dont think about or maybe dont care about is the number of electric outlets in a hotel room Well Affinia 50 has this covered  I had no problem finding a place to plug in 2 cell phones my Moms Palm Pilot and my TMobile Sidekick device
 I think one of the best things about the Affinia 50 is the incredibly friendly courteous and professional staff Even though I was only there for 2 days I felt as though I had acquired extended family members 
 I would highly recommend this hotel and cannot wait to stay there again

title: Great Location
text: This hotel was in a great location to the Wharf and other sites in the city Although the rooms are small it was very clean Hugo the concierge was very knowledgeable helpful and fun too

title: A very pleasant stay in downtown DC
text: Our stay for 2 nights at The Normandy was very pleasant The continental breakfast buffet was delicious and our room was comfortable The hotel is within walking distance of many restaurants and also within walking distance of the doubledecker sightseeing bus Also about 4 blocks from the nearest metro stop Conveniently located but also in a very quiet and residential neighborhood Derek at the front desk was always courteous knowledgeable and very attentive had a very customerfriendly disposition Overall a great stay

title: Wonderful hotel  you will not be disappointed
text: Excellent service and amenities The room was very comfortable The night services and breakfast buffet cannot be beat We traveled with an infant and young child and we all had a wonderful experience

title: Quiet AreaLove Complimentary Treats
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night We booked a standard room no bay view was available through Pricelinecom for super cheap My advice is to shop around to get the best deal for a room since the hotel website can be pricey Overall we enjoyed this hotel Heres a few proscons
Pros
1 Quiet street away from the major tourist spots like Fishermans Wharf which is about 2030 walk
2 Complimentary treats at specific times beer wine cookies milk and ice cream Served in main lobby Because it was our anniversary we were given a bottle of sweet wine and chocolate in our hotel room too
3 Very friendly customer service
4 Nearby shops in market building and as mentioned Pier 39 is only a short walk
Cons
1 Upon arrival our room wasnt ready so we waited for about 40 minutes
2 Valet parking is available 4200 nightly 
3 Rooms are very small
4 Homeless people hang out at street corners but it seems like they are around every corner in San Francisco
If we stay overnight in San Francisco again we dont mind staying here for a night We loved all the PROS

title: Class Class Class
text:
This place screams class Old school classic motif with paintings and sculptures of US Presidents and historical events Jackets necessary at all times No jeans All the reviews are pretty accurate so read closely but heres some other stuff to know
Great breakfast included in price of room Omelet station Belgian waffle station Best Belgian waffle I ever had normal bacon sausage bagels oatmeal pastries cereal etc
25 parking across the street Solid price for Philadelphia
Close to a lot of bars within walking distance
Cigar bar and hotel bar are very nice
Room is OK Normal hotel room nothing special really Only critiques would be if you are a light sleeper ask for a room on the inside of the building not sure if its a courtyard or if the rooms just dont have windows because the rooms on the outside are very loud due to street traffic Walls are also very thin could hear other peoples wake up calls very clearly
Overall great place to stay in Philly if you want to stay in style

title: Wonderful stay
text:
Great hotel in the Times Square area First time staying here this winter and was very impressed The rooms were spacious clean and staff was extremely helpful I was also in the city to see Broadway shows and this was conveniently located near all of the shows in the Theatre Disctrict Im returning to New York City next month and will definitely be staying here again
Only place Id stay in the city

title: Cant wait to go back
text: Other reviewers have pretty much said it all We stayed for three nights in February and loved it The staff are exceptionally helful courteous and knowledgable Our room was immaculate with a great view The pool was heated just right and the large king size chaises were to die for Top it all off with the super location and no less than 75 restaurants you can walk to and the Horton plaza Seaport Village and the ferry to Coronado and you have all the makings of a wonderful holiday or business trip

title: Cool and Trendy
text:
We stayed one night in W Times Square for a family birthday and Broadway show with my two children and parents This hotel is very cool and trendy with a fun entrance and check in arealobby When we tried to check in several hours before check in time one of our rooms was ready However when we got to the room my parents werent happy with the location next to the elevator When I went downstairs to the desk to ask for another room the receptionist not only politely moved us but made the effort to find us connecting rooms and actually upgraded us to a corner room with no extra charge My parents were thrilled with their corner room and we all loved the newly redone and trendy details in both rooms
Later in the evening we spent some time at the extremely cool bar in the hotel which was fun and the next morning ate a delicious breakfast at the restaurant downstairs
Valet parking was convenient and fast
Location is smack in the middle of Times Square and while this is convenient and fun it is also extremely noisy even on the 48th floor so keep this in mind This city really doesnt sleep people

title: Be warnedshuttle service stops at 10
text: Booked a night at the crowne plaza north for a quick stay over in columbus because I saw they had an airport shuttle Unfortunately the shuttle service stops at 10 the hotel is nowhere near the airport and ended up taking a cab which cost close to 50 from the airport The hotel itself is otherwise average location is quite poor

title: Great hotel great location
text:
What a great hotel We were on the 27th floor with an excellent view Hotel is next to the Prudential and Copley Place Shopping Center 1520 min walk to Fenway Park in case youre attending a Red Sox game
Hotel room was very clean comfortable and the bed was excellent This room really felt like home
The Sheraton offers valet parking for 39night quite reasonable considering the location

title: Trendy Hotel in a Great Location
text:
This is a beautiful new luxury hotel in an excellent location in downtown Boston Room was very large and modern with an elegant and spacious bathroom Bed was very comfortable and furniture was all very highend Service was wonderful and extremely courteous however we found some of the concierges recommendations to be somewhat biased towards select restaurants In fact some of our own finds turned out to be much better than the hotels suggestions we discovered Flour Bakery for breakfastlunch and had an amazing dining experience at Toro one night The hotels own restaurants and bars were very lively and quite good both in terms of the food quality and the bar scene
This hotels location was very central and ideal for walking around and discovering the city and it acted as an excellent base to start our day Would absolutely stay here again for our next visit to Boston

title: Weeknight stay was great for the price Cant vouch for the weekends
text:
I had really low expectations for The Standard after reading the reviews posted on TripAdvisor The reason we ended up booking our stay here was in order of importance 1 price 140 a night for a medium room 2 location we needed to be downtown and 3 we wanted to try something besides the Westin Bonaventure which was over 230 a night for the same days 
You should take everything I say with a grain of salt given that we stayed here from Sunday through Wednesday and therefore missed most of the alleged weekend pretentiousnessnoise and attitude We had no problem checking in or with any of the other amenities By amenities I mean that we ate dinner and breakfast at the restaurant downstairs food was good service was fine went up to the rooftop bar on Tuesday night no wait because you get a wristband for staying at the hotel used the gym small and depressing and used the valet parking at the hotel every day Each of these services were provided in a timely and appropriately polite manner 
My biggest complaint is that on Sunday the day of our arrival the floor that we stayed on was littered with plates and cups from room service earlier in the day and the plates and cups were not removed until around 11 pm that night even though a number of hotel staff maids included passed the littered areas Plates and cups may not sound that gross but there were half eaten omelettes oatmeal and fruit left on the floor to attract god knows what kinds of pestilence If this small incident is any indication of how service on the weekends is I probably would not stay at The Standard However our stay for the rest of the weeknights went without incident and in fact we made bets about how long it would take before the room service plates on Monday morning would be removed we left our room at 830 am and they were removed by the time we returned at 11 am  an overall improvement from our experience the previous day 
The rooms are decorated and reminiscent of college dorms The furniture is plastic and the bed is on a platform on the floor We both agreed that despite the underwhelming decor the rooms were very clean
Our parting words are as follows if you need a place to stay in downtown LA during the weeknights and can get a good price stay at The Standard Otherwise you might want to go elsewhere

title: Lovely hotel but
text:
My family and I stayed a long fall weekend at the RitzCarlton Boston and overall very much enjoyed our stay As previously noted in reviews the hotel is more modern than many other RitzCarltons but we still found it welcoming We had an executive suite which had enough room for our family of 5 with a rollaway 3 children under the age of 9 The room was nicely decorated and the king bed in the bedroom was very comfortable I was not impressed with the quality of the sofa bed but at least they gave us a featherbed topper to put on top of it The bathrooms were outstanding in particular the full bath in the bedroom and I really liked having a coat closet in the front foyer The location of the hotel is convenient to most attractions but its in a rather random few blocks on the edge of Chinatown and in the middle of a couple of schools so there are a lot of students and bars There are not a lot of restaurants in the immediate vicinity 2 block radius  however that is not a huge consideration for most people
On the slight downside the staff was helpful but not overly so  Ive had more helpful staff at other similar hotels but that alone would not dissuade me from the RitzCarlton Boston For me the biggest downside which was still rather minor is that they really didnt make any accommodations for the kids Frequently at similar hotels there will be a small treat waiting for the kids in the room coloring book or similar or the housekeepers will do something sweet with their beds a treat or tucking in their doll etc  but really they were pretty much overlooked during our stay I did note in the book in our room that they offered amenities for the kids  bathrobes etc  but there were none in our room and it wasnt worth it for me to call housekeeping Note this was a minor detail on a very nice stay  it was not that the kids were unwelcome and everyone was very kind to them
Overall we had a great trip and a lovely stay at the RitzCarlton Boston Would we stay there again Perhaps  but Id probably look around for other options in particular if the kids were with us For me it felt best suited to a business traveler but comfortable nevertheless

title: Very good choice
text: My friend and I decided to have a girls weekend in the Big Apple The hotel was conveniently located just minutes from the Empire State Building Great location easy access to the train Staff was very nice and helpful The room was very clean with Philosophy toiletries Would highly recommend

title: Had the best expirence
text: What can i say about this luxury hotel it really was a holiday that we will never forget the staff was amazing any thing needed from room service to concierge graham  was our guy and he directed us to some top places to eat from Xmas day in a very good steak house Benjamins good menu and great wine We had another fantastic meal at the bull and bear which is underneath the hotel and the service was second to noneI have read some reviews saying that its a little run down i just think for a hotel as old as it is its in great shape it is old but i think it adds to character truly a brilliant stay

title: Great Experience at the W in BostonMA
text:
It was our first time but will not be our last Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and could not do enough to make sure we had a good time We had a hard time with working the lights in the room but that was taken care of once we listened to the phone message The rooms were good size and the beds were very comfy I love the extra wording around the hotel and in the rooms I will let you find them yourself The location was good and there were always taxis right outside We used valet and they were quick considering the location on the street
We are going back to try out the spait look great

title: Four nights at The Shoreham
text:
This was my 6th time to New York City and we were there with another couple who had never been before The Shoreham is a very modern and trendy hotel with beautiful decor and a comfortable bed The location is terrific just blocks from 4 subway stops and an easy walk to various hot spots
The free coffee bar and New York times is a great touch and we hear that they offer a free fitness centerwe wouldnt really know about that
I stay at a different hotel everytime I go to NYC And while I have a lot of good things to say about this hotel I must add that it was my least favorite of all of my experiences 
I am of the theory that a traveller spends very little time in their hotel room in New York City so size isnt an issue However the size of these rooms are to the point of inconvenienve and discomfort You are bound to get a smaller room when you book a boutique hotel but the rooms at the Shoreham are so so small You really have to maneuver just to get around the side of the bed and if you have more than one large bag there are very few options
The bar is beautiful but very high priced there is a great pub just about 6 doors east on 55th
So far the best hotel I have stayed at is the Hyatt Grand Central and if you want a boutique style hotel check out The Benjamin
If you are alone and want a trendy room in a good location book The Shoreham the people are friendly and the place is very nice If your party is larger than one then look elsewhere

title: Not up to usual Hampton Inn standards
text: I stay at many Hilton properties and Hamptons in particular I have been here a couple of times now but I wont be anymore My company has many people that have stayed here and they all report that the wifi is basically unusable And that has been my experience also I asked at the front desk and they admitted they get a lot of complaints but that there is nothing that they can do about it On top of this problem I went to work out in the gym but the elliptical machine was completely out of service with a broken wheel and the mini tvs that are part of each machine were all inoperative Front desk stated that the repair service was on the way Well two days later still nothing fixed Given the number of other hotel choices in Burleson one would think the local management would try a little harder

title: We loved it and we will definitely be back
text: My name is Ginette Ventura my husband and our 11yr stayed at this hotel for 1 night we checked in on Fathers day and stayed until mon 20th We were in town for a school interview with our son we arrived at the Hotel early before the check in time The staff was so wonderful and accommodating that they checked us in and held our bags we were so appreciative Courtney at the front desk was absolutely wonderful and just a lovely person We told her why we were there and she was so excited for our son she told hime not to be nervous that he would do great We then asked her if there was a way to have our bags held while we were at the interview and she told us not to worry about anything that they would take care of everything This was our sons first trip to New York and you made it such a wonderful trip Our stay was a bit short but Tylerson loves NY so we will be back before he goes back to school Please thank the staff at this location its nice to know that Great customer service does exists Thank you

title: Excellent location a bit of an old style hotel
text: Excellent location A bit of an older hotel and it shows in the rooms though completely acceptable and clean Had a room facing north and between the hotel and the next building there must have been below large trash containers as you could hear from 45 am garbage trucks in an out taking the trash out  which woke me up even on the 11th floor Besides that a nice hotel Seems like Priority Club members get a free complimentary Starbucks voucher of 5 that can be used in the Starbucks of the hotel which is a nice touch Would stay again

title: Rooms with views to mask the problems
text: This hotel has a lot of potential Cosmetically it looked pretty good Bathrooms were great but the rooms could use a better upgrade When we checked in we asked for a king with a sofa bed Was told they were completely sold out She even checked with the manager and she said the same thing We are platinum members so we are supposed to be abe to get upgraded rooms if available We were fine with her answer so we got our key and went to our room After a few hours the AC unit in our room started making a horribly loud noise We couldnt hear anything over it Maintenance couldnt fix it so they moved us to a different room Surprisingly it was a king room with a sofa bed Pretty sure thats what I asked for in the first place but whatever It was a corner room with views of the river and it was literally the most amazing view That view was almost worth the troubles Except at 200 am this AC unit started making the very same noise Really So irritating There was no way we were dragging all of luggage to a different room in the middle of the night I turned the AC completely off and tried to sleep Not the best when its been 100 degrees outside all day I called the manager the next morning and he refunded the points we used for the room I feel he couldve done more than that but at that point we just wanted out of the hotel When we were leaving our room I heard over the maintenance radio that someone else was also having problems with a noisy AC unit Im thinking its time to replace the AC units

title: Great Stay
text:
Majestic is a great little hotel in the Lakeview district Close to everything we needed They were very accommodating about anything we requested and the 22 parking fee was reasonable for Chicago
