Will definitely stay here they next time we visit

title: Love it
text: Stayed at this hotel in Declast business trip of the year I travel every week and try to stay at nice hotels and the St Regis was no disappointment Its as clean nice and upscale as any hotel Ive been in The bar isnt the hippest in the world but theres a W Hotel a block away if hip is what youre looking for Overall the attention to detail friendliness and helpfullness of the staff and overall upscale feel of this hotel makes it a true oasis after a long day at work Take a look at the starwood web site from time to timethey have some great dealsfar less than what you might expect to pay

title: 1st Time in Boston
text: Picked this hotel based on reviews here and price for other 4 star hotels in Boston and we were very impressed The hotel looks every bit as good as it does in its website photos We arrived by train from NYC taxi to the hotelunder 10 and were shown to a great room on a corner not a great view but it is in the city centre surrounded by other buildings The staff were very polite and helpful and nothing was to much trouble tips Ate once in the hotel bar and the meal was fine but you will pay hotel prices but you know that dont you Did a waking tour which was excellent and would also recommend the duck tour The hotel couldnt be better placed for getting around with most things within an easy walk Would recommend the Bean town pub and the Union oyster house Quincey market and the sea front are also buzzing with life Overall we loved Boston and if and when we return would go back to the Parker house

title: Good for price
text:
My rating is based mostly on value I got a large very acceptable room for 79much cheaper than the nearby hotel of the conference I was attending I found the service to be efficient and the hotel has history and character 
On the downside my room had windows facing other rooms and was a bit dark It also felt a bit worn You can ask for a room with a view if that is important to you 
It is also a bit of a walk to the metro 
Good if you want a relatively lowcost option in the city

title: Great value great location
text: Stayed here over thanksgiving 2012 Couldnt ask for a better location in NYC Huge for ny standards room free wifi plethora of charging stations in the room free bottled water beautiful view of Rockerfeller plaza Very nice staff too Id give it a 5 but we were moved from our original Club Quarters WTC to the one on wall st then here due to Sandy and they didnt do the best job of communicating that to us which was a hassle when we arrived Great value for your

title: What a pleasant surprise
text: Came to Baltimore for a conference and found our hotel choice to have been spot on Nothing but top notch customer service from the time we pulled up out front Every staff member that we have interacted with has made it a point to go the extra mile Special thanks to Jason Brown who took time to offer us a number of entertainment and dining options for our evening out A great time was had by all Thank you Jason well be delighted to return to this hotel

title: beautiful and wish i spent more time here
text:
The rooms are not the best part of the hotel The public areas are The style quotient of the hotel was superb details were taken care of even down to the Wifi password The rooms are small but above average by new york standards I liked the attention to detail in the rooms 
The check in was smooth the check out smoother concierge service helpful 
The room service was unhurried but efficient
All in All a good stay

title: A wonderful hotel with fantastic staff
text: we stayed for 9 days in this wonderful hotel It was very well located just off times square Not too noisy so we got a good nights sleep in very comfey beds the staff were very pleasant friendly and helpful and helped to make our stay a very pleasant one Very clean and comfortable Complimentary breakfast and free nibbles throughout the day We would certainly return Karen from Ireland

title: Good affordable place
text: This is a great place to stay when in Boston for a short period It is on the airport property as well as close to the metro The airport metro station is a short walk and you then have easy access to all areas The hotel is one of the better run that we have stayed in The breakfast is one of the better complimentary that you will fine The rooms are spacey and well laid out Would stay here again when we return to Boston

title: very nice right in the heart of downtown
text:
Stayed here for two nights this April In town on business and the institution I was visiting arranged and paid for the room At check in they did not have an authorization form to have them pay and needed my cc number No problem They emailed my contact who had booked the room he sent a consent to charge and all was good Staff was professional and courteous through all of this But it is a pricey hotel as is understandable in downtown
Valet parking 31 a day kind of steep but guys working it was fast efficient and friendly Offerred advice directions really top notch Room was a king size on 4th floor Bed was nice sheet good but I like a harder bed and it was the soft pillowy top wife would have loved it TV plenty of channels great deep soaking tub Top notch restaurant in the lobby Italian I however only had room service breakfast last morning Hand cut oats with honey and fresh berries and a fresh squeezed OJ All was very very tasty
The hoetl is about 12 blocks from 10th St Mall with loads and loads to do see and shop all down the mall Stadiums are also close by SPa in lobby did not use but heard folks give it rave reviews

title: Thieves
text: The rooms were not clean our reservation was NOT in the system and they said there was no shuttle service My wife left her flat iron there inthe bathroom She called 1 hour after we left and they said they had it and would mail it within the next business day 3 weeks later it STILL has not arrived and the hotel staff will give us NO information JR the manager will NOT return calls and you can not get ahold of him We have now had to file a report with Ft Worth PD

title: Worth a shot
text:
I stayed at the Onyx June 1st for a business meeting the next day in the downtown area The hotel is tucked away on a smaller one way street The surrounding area was probably one of the only disappoints with this hotel The area wasnt lively at night at all and had few choices other than the hotel for dining Not an ideal to take a casual stroll either I found 
What the location lacked the staff made up for Small touches put a smile on my face such as a preshipped UPS package already placed in my hotel room before checkin Top that off with a handwritten personalized greeting note placed on the rooms desk was really a prime example of the touches youll find from a boutique hotel versus a megachain hotelier The room was small but average to what youd find in a NYC hotel Ultra modern room with touches in white black gray and red rounded out the room

title: Absolutely Fabulous
text:
This was our first trip to San Francisco and unsure where to stay The hotel was very nice for the money 99 per night had excellent views and was clean and quiet Fishermans wharf offered a safe place with much to do in the evening Nearby were many dining options in all price ranges Transportation to pretty much anywhere you would want to go was within a few blocks most could be reached within one block The hotel staff and conceirge were very helpful Dont miss Alcatraz or Johnny Rockets both were great fun
One tip if you go to haight ashburygreat for us old hippies do not go into golden gate park at the end of Haight it is the back entrance we later discovered nicknamed dealer heaven Very scarry even in broad daylight

title: Great Location
text: A small friendly great located hotel in NYC at a good price

title: Lovely hotel but shame on the afternoon tea effort
text:
My wife and I stayed in the Palmer House Hotel for 4 nights in early August 2012 The hotel was very nice and the staff were very accommodating when we asked for a quite room we got one on the nineteenth floor away from the noise of the train going by
We were in Chicago a few times in the past and we like that city very much This time we decided to do something special and invite my 2 sisters and their husbands for afternoon tea in the Palmer Hotel They live 40 miles outside the city
My wife booked the reservation for six people at Lockwoods by phone from Ireland just to ensure everything was OK We then looked forward to a very special little event which we thought our US folks would appreciate a lot as we have similar in the Shelbourne Hotel Dublin and the standard is of the highest
We checked at the desk at 2 oclock and were asked to take a seat We did not realise that the table wasnt even ready Finally at 215 we were shown to a small oval coffee table not big enough to hold the cups and saucers When the teapots arrived we had to move side plates to make space Milk arrived 30 minutes later which we had to ask for I spoke to the person at Lockwoods She quickly vanished and was not seen again When sandwiches arrived the waitress wondered where she would put them so my wife had to hold them while she got a small table to put beside her so she could dish them out At this stage we were highly embarrassed and hurt The bill arrived with an 18 cover charge I did not think it was the fault of the waitress but the Supervisor who was informed from the beginning
We complained to the Duty Manager of the hotel who was shocked and got the manager of the restaurant to ring us He offered a bottle of wine which my wife declined He gave us 20 off which did not mean anything as the afternoon was totally destroyed

title: Awesome trip
text:
This Westin is very convenient to Balboa Park the Zoo as well as close to the water The room was very comfortable We especially enjoyed our breakfasts in the hotel I was very impressed with the service and attentiveness of the staff Nate N was very helpful and pleasant and my husband and I enjoyed conversation and felt very welcome He even arranged for a special breakfast dessert for my birthday Juan in the dining room was also very kind and we enjoyed the conversation and the special extra touches the staff did to make us feel welcome 
Roxana Ramirez our cleaning person was very attentive in cleaning our room She greeted us in the morning as we were leaving for breakfast and when we were finished the room was clean and fresh

title: Great Great Hotel
text:
Searching for a Hotel in NY Look no further you have found it
We have just arrived from a 3 day stay in NY Although it was not our first trip to NY I searched for a hotel at the trip advisor and believe me this hotel worth is position there
It is more expensive then others you can find but if you can afford it you wont regret it
The Sofitel is very well located just two blocks from Times square the rooms are large specially for NY great bed great bathroom well soundproofed modern furniture
The staff were all very efficient polite the check in and check out without any problem
The food at the restaurant was great and come out quickly
In Summary A case where what you found is even better then what is showed in the pictures
In favour almost everything
Against A hotel like this should have free access internet in the rooms

title: Dont stay on floor 25 of the historic tower
text: Hotel location is great bed was wonderful nice bathroom towels are a little smallbut I cant help but wondering if they put us on the 25th floor  where the elevator mechanism is for the entire historic tower  because we perhaps paid a lower rate We were trying to nap after an extremely early morning flight and I kept hearing a consistent thud which woke me from my nap I thought I was crazy and went out to the elevator lobby I complained to the desk clerk who said they have never had complaints about that room or floor hard to believethen they sent security to see what the issue might be and he opened the door in the elevator lobby to a huge room that contained an ancient looking elevator machine They moved us but were not too apologetic about the incovenience

title: Really good
text:
Great hotel Wonderfull location Best service Everybody very friendly Thanks for everything guys of the Sanctuary hotel 
Carolina Machado
Marcos Braga Machado
Leonardo Abou Kamel Machado

title: Not the best start to a stay
text: I stayed here for six nights on a trip that included both business and pleasure purposes I booked through a conventions site and my room was paid for in advance There were some issues upon checkin about what was included with my reservation and it was handled poorly I was assured that everything was in order but later the night I checked in a very curt voice mail was left by the checkin staffer who was also a member of the hotel management saying the issue was my problem and that I should take it up with the convention folks I had a printout of my confirmed reservation that showed the addon in question but I did not get what I paid for it would have been so easy for the DT to fix the problem At checkout a different hotel manager admitted the hotels mistake although no one bothered to correct it during the six days I was there They did take off parking fees to make up for the misunderstanding  that was a good thing Other problems with the property ridiculously slow Internet service and theres a 12 per day charge for it but I was told at checkout that they are hoping to have this upgraded by the end of August 2011 I had to change rooms the first night as the room I was initially given abutted the elevator shaft and every time someone pushed the call button I could hear the elevator going up and down The second room was very quiet 1012 I found hairs on most of the towels I pulled off the shelf  not mine wrong color Heres the good turndown service with the always popular DT cookies is terrific The trolley stops right across the street and there are plenty of restaurants and other businesses close by  great location if you dont need to be downtown or by the beach A cab ride downtown without traffic will run you 20 with tip I had room service twice and both times the food was excellent Other than the aforementioned checkin staff member the rest of the staff was polite and helpful The room itself was fine Bottom line its a value thing  for 200 per night I expect a bit better service

title: Great Hotel Near San Jose Airport
text: Modern new clean hotel located close to SJC Airport I loved the contemporary decor Gilchrist  Soames shampoo body gel and hand lotion available in pump bottles next to bathroom sink and in shower Breakfast buffet was wonderful Excellent price on room Would definitely stay here again

title: Great hotel great location
text: Loved this hotel It was in a great location opposite the Waldorf Astoria and the Intercontinental next to the subway and only a ten minute walk to Times Square should you feel the urge to go there Great rooms very comfortable beds small kitchen area with fridge and Microwave the bathroom was small just about the tiniest sink in the world but very well appointed and nice amenities The aircon took a bit to work out but overall it was a really nice hotel room The new restaurant and bar The National was fantastic  really great atmosphere for evening drinks and great food with very good service  could not fault it

title: Great Location Friendly Staff
text: I recently stayed here for 4 days for a Navy ReunionAt first glance I thought it would be a done over Hotel and datedPleasantly surprised at quality and cleanlinessGreat lobby barBoth bartenders were very friendly and attentiveI ate in both restaurantsRuths Chris and hotels restaurantBoth excellent Breakfast Buffet a bit pricy but very good Best view on the waterfronthaving a balcony a plus over Hyatt and direct waterfront over OmniDesk staff and function staff very friendly and helpfulTry the Southern Grillwithin walking distance

title: Great for the Lake and Trail
text:
Stayed here for just under a week in October 2008
Very pleasant hotel Best to stay in the new lake block at the back rather than in the circular block at the front
Had absolutely fantastic views of the lake and surrounds
Very quiet room given the closeness to the Highway
Room service was excellent every day and they deserved a good tip when we checked out
There is free parking in the multistorey car park which takes up the first 45 floors of the rear block
There is a small gym two treadmills and a recumbant bike and maybe one other piece of equipment There is a nice rooftop pool its fine for a quick swim can sunbathe around the pool no problems at all
Meals were pleasant at the hotel Had breakfast a couple of times it was 10 each for as much as you like they will cook an omelette to order Given I like to eat lunch and dinner and the huge portions you get everywhere I didnt eat breakfast every day Restaurant is quiet in the evenings but food and service were fine Had 2 evening meals at the hotel on nights that we couldnt face travelling anywhere else
The hotel is a 1520 minute walk away from the downtown Austin nightlife along somewhat lonely streets but not a great problem if you can drive get a cab or just dont mind a quick walk 
Dont get me wrong this hotel is central and right on the lake just its on the eastern border of central Austin and theres not too much right on the doorstep
Next door but not obtrusive at all there is a gas station that doubles up as a minimart with snacks drinks fruit etc which is handy if you need something if you are on the way out for a walk or drive
I would certainly come back again to this hotel unless I was in austin just for the nightlife when I would choose a hotel more central

title: Cant beat the location
text:
Location location location  need I say more This hotel is in the centre of the CBD close to the trolley cars buses and BART station As a family of five travelling from Australia we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Handlery We had a corner family suite in the front older part of the hotel which had plenty of room for us and all of our luggage The smaller room held a double or queen bed while the adjoining room for the kids was huge with two twin beds and a fold out double sofa bed With the sofa away we had a large lounge area with coffee table  perfect for lolling around in after a day on the streets of San Franciso
This kids also enjoyed the pool  which was outdoors but heated Nearby there are plenty of family friendly options for food including a Walgreens around the corner where we were able to buy breakfast supplies there was a fridge in the kids room The Irish pub next door has a fantastic dinner buffet and the bar around the corner has a champagne happy hour and live music for Mum  Dads time out
My tip for familys is to use the BART to travel back to the airport We easily wheeled 7 suitcases between us yes 7 to the station as it is all downhill and caught a fast and clean BART train to the airport terminal for a fraction of the cost of an airport bus More money to spend in the wonderful shops in Chinatown

title: Big and Impersonal
text:
This hotel is in a great location in the heart of Times Square and the Theater District It is a huge property so it is somewhat impersonal Youre just a number here not a guest The checkin and lobby area are on the 7th floor or was it the 8th floor which is a bit of a hassle if you are meeting people The elevator system confused many people because you have to select your floor on the outside of the elevator and then go to the specific elevator you are directed to Many people missed that and simply got in the elevator only to find that there are no buttons to select the floor They were then taken for a ride with the people who used the system properly I heard a lot of complaints about this
The room was clean and quiet and the staff was friendly I did not like the Concierge Lounge at all because it was busy loud and the food was cold Not exactly a quiet sanctuary The bar prices in the lounge were more than the bars in the area which seemed like a rip off
Choose this hotel for the location and nothing else

title: Great location
text: Stayed here en route from Toronto to Washington on an escorted tour Very comfortable hotel  a bit large for my liking though However I would recommend it as it is so central Had our breakfast here which was a bit pricey but you would expect that from a large hotel in central Boston Rom was a bit smaller than other hotels we stayed in but then that is what happens when it is such an old building I would recommend this hotel for its central location and comfort Within easy walking of the main shops and the park

title: The perfect getaway
text:
How in the world is it that on a particular day Motel 6 in San Diego cost just as much as Kona Kai for the same night Well thats exactly what happened and we ended up stay at this hidden little paradise instead of winging it and spending the night at a motel Quite honestly probably the best decision we made The check in process at Kona Kai was quick we were charged a decent amount for parking and the rest was beautiful beautiful experience
Okay so Ive had my fair share of outdated and silly decor and rooms Kona Kai just barely dodged that bullet Their decor I would have to describe as quaint and cute Honestly the carpet and whatever else may have been outdated really didnt matter We open up the two doors and it opened right up to the beach The most gorgeous views and Kona Kai played it RIGHT I loved how humble the room came off as while boasting such a beautiful property There was a big sparkling pool next to a great little hot jacuzzi
My boyfriend and I walked around the property checking out the sea life in the dock stalking seagulls swinging on the childrens playground swing set next to the dock We walked across the street walked next to the beautiful beach and watched the sun set 
Their room service was beyond amazing They have these pork nachos that were everything my boyfriend and I ever dreamt of in a nacho I still drool at the thought of them Ive yet to encounter such perfection anywhere else

title: Easily a great choice
text: Visiting Philadelphia on leisure for two days and two nights my wife and I elected to stay at the Sofitel based on the positive reviews on this and other websites We were not disappointed Paying only a little above 200 per night we got a very spacious suite  a corner one at that  and the experience was impressive in every aspect The service was friendly professional and efficient The valet parking which cost us a mere 30 total meant that our car was ready at the door when we wanted it and upon arriving back at the hotel we could just get out of the car and go back to our room Very convenient The decoration and styling of the hotel is not as gaudy and florid as some other highend brands but the look is very elegant modern and artistic no less You might call it luxury without ostentation The suite was most accomodating in every way from the numerous spacious closets to the heavenly comofortable bed to the wellstocked refrigerator bar and the wall finishings and all the furniture Oh and the bathroom  extremely impressive It was tremendous with two sinks a comfortable bath and a spacious shower If I had to find anything to quibble about I could say that the wireless internet should have been free rather than 10day though I was able to get a free signal from a nearby hotel and it would be nice if the bathroom would have a jacuzzi rather than a plain bathtub though strictly speaking it was actually a Jacuzzi brand bathtub but anyway Cant speak for the barrestaurant as we did not partake Dont forget to bring cash to tip the valets room service and bellhops All in all you cant go wrong with this hotel certainly at the price we paid Strongly recommended We would easily stay there again

title: completely ridiculous
text:
Stayed in a serenity suite this time around at a lower price due to a poor experience previously at the Dana I wanted to give them one last shot before I wrote them off completely 
Can I just say putting someone in a handicap accessible suite when the guests are so obviously not handicapped is ridiculous Secondly the pictures are 800 doctored on their website to look more glorious than the rooms actually look The website shows stone seating in the shower area Our bathroom did not include this luxury The website also shows a privacy curtain up on the window dividing bedroom and living area The room did not have this curtain 
What our room DID have was a lot of broken lighting fixtures PAINTERS TAPE EVERYWHERE yes were talking bright blue tape on various walls throughout the room Also included at no cost was the abandoned LUNCH COOLER on our balcony outside This room would normally cost upward of 500 a night Do you not AT LEAST do a run thru before putting guests in the room Professional this place is not 
When we called down to the front desk to discuss the issues we were greeted with blatant rudeness Well I see you had a problem with your stay last time what is it THIS time If you would like we can downgrade you into a normal room
My friend and I have never been talked to SO condescendingly 
Surely we will not be coming back Ever Im sure the Trump would provide a higher level of service without the obvious snobbery and carelessness 
On a positive note there is a complimentary breakfast downstairs on the main floor and it was a pretty nice spread Delicious granola fruit bagels etc 
But I didnt pay hundreds of dollars for bagels did I

title: Just right
text: Just right for an overnight trip to Boston Great location  walking distance to wonderful shops theater restaurants We found out we needed double beds instead of a king at the very last minute Staff was very accommodating and gracious Room and beds quite comfy with a large bathroom and plenty of toiletries Beautiful historic building lobby and common areas Nice restaurant and bar on the premises Valet parking absolutely no problem at all Would definitely stay again

title: As Expected at this Price
text: The hotel was as advertised The shared bathrooms were generally clean depending on the previous user There are four bathrooms on my floor but only two of them had sinks In response to another reviewer I didnt have a lot of towels In fact I had a face cloth hand towel and a body towel that is large only by European standards It wasnt large by American standards On my first night I inquired about how to control the heat in my room because it was too hot In fact the heat cannot be controlled on a per room basis Instead the heat is centrally controlled and is on a fixed schedule The radiator in my room turned off at 1130pm and turned on at about 630am In between I used the air conditioner to cool the room On the brighter side the heat allowed me to do laundry and everything dried easily The staff was nice and polite Noise from the bathrooms are noticeable Wifi wasnt very reliable I relied on my cell phone service instead

title: Was a great friendly place to stay
text: The motel is set up alittle different The rooms were spacious and quiet The staff was friendly and helpful I enjoyed my stay there

title: Pardon our dust Dont bother until its finished
text: We paid 189 plus taxes for a room that looked like it hadnt been decorated in fifteen years on a corridor in the process of being refurbished although nobody appeared to be working on the refurbishment during our stay The ice and vending facilities were out of use while the floors were being retiled The signs said very helpfully Pardon our dust Im sure itll be nice when the refurbishment is finished and the staff were up to usual Doubletree standards To be honest though Id steer clear unless the hotel can guarantee you a room in a part of the building where the work has already been completed The parking spaces are TINY by the way so be prepared to breathe in if youre getting in or out of a normal or larger sized car

title: Really different
text: I spent one night here and a friend I was travelling with stayed for a week The staff were friendly and really helpful they made the trip for us The rooms were really nice and comfy and spotless Breakfast was ok bagles and muffins nothing fancy teh Mini cinema with the free popcorn was a definte plus as was the area 5 minutes from union square f line bart and cable cars I would definitely go back when Im next in the city

title: Fabulous 40 at the Mark
text:
Just returned from a special 40th birthday treat to New York and stayed at the Mark Hotel A great quiet location in New York but really close to central park On arrival we were informed of breakfast being included in our room rate   Our room was spacious and the bathroom was luxurious The staff were quite friendly and chatted and being a smaller hotel had that more personal feel As we had a late evening flight the hotel let us use a room in the afternoon to freshen up and change before we left for the airport
The only downside was the extortionate price for room service which we got on our first night as we arrived quite late
Would certainly return if I went to New York again

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This is a very nice hotel geared toward the business traveler but quite accommodating to families We had a great room and wonderful service The room was in the west tower requested thanks to suggestions of other reviewers which has been renovated and is quite nice The location of the hotel is fantastic Our room overlooked Lake Michigan and was great Due to the location of the other high rise buildings we were disappointed that despite our great view of Navy Pier we were not able to see the fireworks from our room Oh well We had a great stay and will return to this hotel

title: Best of breed
text:
This Residence Inn beats out every other hotel of its category and even hotels with more stars that Ive ever stayed in 20 years of worldwide travel in 5star to nostar hotels I intend to return here any time I come to Memphis 
To begin with it has great service From Jesse the professional competent friendly guy at the reception desk to Tracy the sales manager Doug Carl and a few others whose names I didnt catch all of the staff were on the ball and obviously cared about providing good service in a real way not a plastic smile way The hotel has the charm of an old building with a lovely view of the river lovely big room suites with clean bathrooms comforatable beds and wellappointed kitchens all the important amenities small workout room and complimentary passes to nearby health club rooftop hot tub free WiFi free local calls ironing boards and blow dryers laundry service etc and a nice location near a variety of good restaurants 
It provides a complimentary varied breakfast and a pleasant reception every evening The evening reception has complimentary light fare beer wine coffee tea and soft drinks and on Thursday evenings becomes a rooftop barbeque with homecooked picnicstyle food eg grilled veggies sausages BBQ chicken potato salad coleslaw chips watermelon 
Summary The hotel is clean the rooms spacious the beds comfortable the staff professional and responsive the amenities complete If you need any more than that youll have to go up a couple price categories and have good luck as well

title: A new standard for hotels
text:
Alexis has created a loyalty for me to Kimpton hotels This boutique hotel demonstrates what other hotels lack down the small details Its modern chic and luxurious My stay at Alexis was not only pleasant but felt as a retreat as well Will definitely be back and will definitely be visiting other Kimpton hotels from now on
Alexis is conveniently located near Pike Place and by Elliot Bay It was a very short walk to the pier 1 block where there were plenty of delicious foods to eat I even walked to the Space Needle which is the farthest attraction I wanted to see and on my way back I walked through downtown I only had to park my car once and never had to move it until I left for the airport because everything is in close proximity to the hotel
If you forget a few things like we all usually do Alexis provides them complimentary while you stay at the hotel Things like cell phone chargers curling irons bandaids etc This will definitely save you a trip from the convenience store and having multiples of these items when you get home
I will definitely be coming back and now Im excited to visit other Kimpton hotels

title: Great Time in Chicago
text: Location was great we walked to Navy Pier and Michigan Ave The kids loved the pool

title: Great hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Peabody which is in an excellent location for seeing Memphis although you will need transport to get to Graceland The hotel is quite grand and our room was very clean spacious and well appointed Staff are friendly efficient and welcoming and the service excellent We did experience a problem at breakfast on one day when it seemed they did not have enough staff available but this was addressed satisfactorily Definitely recommended for a comfortable stay in Memphis and ideally located

title: CLASSYELEGANTTHE ELDON IS A REMARKABLE HIDDEN DC GEM
text:
We stayed here for Memorial Day weekend and loved it 
The Eldon is a relatively new hotel that just opened in March of this year We took the subway in from DCA This airport has a direct line to the hotel if you hop on the yellow to Mt Vernon SquareConvention Center exit 
From the outside The Eldon has a historic facade which is very Washingtonian The inside however is a totally different story in itself The hallways boast very luxurious marble floors and walls There is a unique set of glass artwork on every floor and the lobby has soothing spalike music to really help you relax the moment you walk in Did I mention checking in was a snap The front desk staff were very friendly and more than willing to go over and above to help us with finding our way around helping us with our bags Great personal service that youd only find at small hotels The concierge there Vinh is exceptional He has first hand experience of the area being a DC native and recommended to us some local favorites like Marrakesh 7course Morrocan dinner with live belly dancer Phillips all you can eat seafood right by the waterfront
The designers spared no expense in making you feel very pampered The trend of marble floors and artwork continue onward into the Guest Rooms themselves The furnishings have a very modern and contemporary flare The rooms are bright spacious and luxurious My girlfriend loved sleeping on the down pillowscomforter The hotel provides guests with bathroom amenities from LOccitane a very high end french brand The showers themselves are state of the art with a massaging jet function a real treat at the end of the day of sight seeing
There is a complimentary continental breakfast served every morning in the lounge area across from the lobby with very lovely pastries the cherry filled danishes were my favorite There is also a fitness center on the rooftop with a breathtaking view of the city We didnt have time for it this trip but we were up there to look at the facilityviews 
I am not sure what else to add The Eldon has everything you want while visiting DC Complimentary WiFi in the rooms Great location to downtownnational mall Metro accessible Located on the same block to a CVS and 3 blocks from a Safeway A friendly and personable staff that is willing to serve you and make you happy In room spa services The Eldon made our first trip to DC a memorable one that we wont soon forget 
A Place
A Service
A Location

title: A good place to stay in San Francisco
text: I reserved the hotel on the basis of reviews I saw here The hotel is well located on Lombard and Steiner The place is clean with a good sized room slightly dingy in the halls has a parking lot downstairs good wifi and has a very helpful frontdesk staff The best part is that it has LOADS of restaurants right downstairs on Lombard Steiner and Chestnut streets Good bus transportation too A nice home base to see SF

title: Great staynot so great room
text: The Sheraton was a great hotelonly a couple blocks from Camden Yards and a few blocks from the Inner Harbor We booked thru Hotwire and upon arriving to our room we found ourselves in a handicap room We didnt mind the low bed rails near the toilet or in the shower but we did have issue with the condition of the bathroom It seemed as though the room had been recently renovated but someone forgot to update the bathroom There was old dirty caulk in the corners rustry shower rails and a rickety rusting pole holding up one end the the sink The bed was hard as a rock Weve stayed in Sheratons in the past and loved their cushy beds and heavenly pillowsbut this bed was the equivalent to sleeping on a slab of sheetrock I wont give up on Sheraton but I will not pay full price to stay at the Sheraton Inner Harbor

title: What you would expect but too pricey
text:
Great location  check great service  check great lounge  check clean rooms  check Great big bill  double check 
My husband and I stayed the weekend of October 5th which was extremely busy due to the Chicago Marathon and a game at Soldier Field When we booked this hotel in August this was one one of the few rooms available in downtown Chicago
The hotel is very large but very well run It was everything you would expect at a downtown hotel The staff was very professional and the rooms were fine I can say that it was probably one of the smallest bathrooms Ive encountered in a US hotel  but it was not an issue
I was particularly happy when a staff member found my drivers license by the elevator on the 39th floor where we stayed It was the day we were checking out and they promptly called our room to say that they had the license at the front desk I can only imagine how my day would have gone showing up at the airport without my license
Overall a good experience but nothing to write home about particularly when paying topdollar

title: Dont Waste your money
text: Ill be honest I read the reviews that came before me and thought they were all just being overdramatic Its a twostar in NY what do you expect So we went anyway We checked in on 21605 and were supposed to stay 7 nights We checked out the next day Two stars are two too many for this dump Most places in our price range were already booked for the weekend but we were lucky enough to find the Super 8 in Times Sqare a onestar according to this website that was head and shoulders above the Pennsylvania Everything that has been said in the other reviews is accurate Its not even worth it by budget hotel standards

title: Daughters Birthday
text: Very nice despite still being under construction Two issues first the walls are very thin and we heard a lot of ambient noise Second there was only one mirror in the entire king suite With 4 of us including a teenage girl this was nearly catastrophic For us the fitness center could be an issue as well only 2 treadmills and 1 bike

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed a couple of nights while a family member was having surgery at one of the area hospitals It is very clean comfortable bedspillows The staff was very polite and the in house restaurant was really good we ate there twice They also offer free shuttles to area locations and all the hospitalsmedical centers which makes it really nice to have one less thing to worry about It is also close to plenty of restaurants and stores Would definitely recommend to others and would stay here again if in the area

title: Great with kids
text: I took my 9 year old niece for a weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the Hotel del Sol She had a fantastic time They accomodated all her needs She got to check out videos books and games from their closet at the front desk Her favorite part was the chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon We hung out on the hammock and at the pool I live nearby so I had chance to see my neighborhood as a visitor Its a safe neighborhood with lots of amenties nearby and has a hotel with a good price We will stay here again

title: New York Tradition
text: Ive stayed at the Roosevelt on my last two trips to New York I like the history and tradition of the Roosevelt Its where Guy Lombardo used to do his New Years eve broadcast Ted Husing and Lindsey Nelson mentioned the Roosevelt in the autobiographies Its a Hotel of the Cafe society of the 20s and 30s The closest hotel to Grand Central Station Walking distance to the Broadway theatres Someone mentioned how relaxing the bar isI agree For New York its an affordable hotel thats also a famous hotel Big hotel for a big city

title: I owe Trip Advisor for this one
text:
Went to Chicago for a conference  not my first vist  and sought some advice on the Chicago travel forum on hotels that would help me mix a little buisness with pleasure I intended on getting my brother and sister to join me on the trip  but they never got their act together So I ended up traveling solo
I usually  because of just pure laziness and the prospect of accumulating points stay with Marriott but I decided to take a leap of faith and try out this boutiquetype hotel that offered river views So very glad I did 
 First the view was excellent Nice large windows to enjoy the view from The Hotel is situated somewhat perpendicular to the river So from your river view room you Look down the river as it opens out on the lake gives you such a unique feel to Chicago Especially at sunrise and sunset The way the light plays along the streets river makes it seem as if Chicago has laid a golden carpet out you and only youand that the city is yours for the taking I think this is by far this Hotels top selling point 
The service was excellent I booked my room through the hotels website because they had a special running at the time I got a Deluxe room  with two queen beds and river view for 227 night during the last week in August The room was Clean appeared freshly renovated more spacious than I expected I think the catch was that it was a Physically impaired disabled accessible room but dont let that fool you You could hardly notice the modifications Contemporary styling keeps the bars looking as if they are just part of the decor and I did not note this until I was checking out 
Of course you cant beat the location Took one train from midway to the StateLake station  45min ride one way and had 5 min easy walk to the hotel Another 510 min walk from the hotels steps and I was in a millineum park enjoying a sandwhich and perrier listening to jazz floating through the air from the free summer concert series Ahh heaven 
Loved this hotel so much that when I had to return to Chicago 1 month later I tried to book it outright and didnt even bother searching for an internet dealBut they were full  The horror
No worries though investigated the closest hotel that offered the same location and thus the same views and found the River Hotel next door with slightly cheaper rates However in comparison River Hotel had much smaller rooms and they were missing the nice decor no friendly doorman had to wait in a line at the checkout counter sigh Yes I had been spoiled by Hotel 71 and I probably looked like a jealous lover as rolled my carryon luggage past that day with a huff But let that speak to Hotel 71s quality and value not truly anything against River Hotel
Would return to hotel 71 in a heartbeat If Hotel 71 would take me back

title: Had a great time
text:
We stayed for 4 nights July 1317 We had a great time We had a tower room with a view of the bay The opposite side of the pool It was great we watched the fire works from Sea World on our balcony and did not have the hot afternoon sun 
We ate breakfasts at the Red Marlin and it was delicous I recommend the buffet What a great way to start the day The service was great
Pool was good as was the slides for the kids 
There is a little fish place right down from the hotel we walked to which was excellent Luckily we waited for a table outside as the inside leaves some to be desired So go early
We will go back

title: Thumbs up for the Metro Hotel
text:
We are a family of five adult New Zealanders who returned just a few days ago from our first visit to New York We spent a week at the Metro Hotel which we found difficult to fault The location was excellent allowing us to walk to many of the places we wanted to go as well being close to the subway for longer trips We all got a buzz seeing the Empire State building from our windows and especially the roof terrace
Our rooms were spacious and scrupulously clean Our family all appreciated the breakfast and found it perfectly adequate it was so good being able to just get on with our day rather than have to search for a breakfast cafe
We found most of the hotel staff friendly and helpful with the exception of a couple of those manning the front desk However on the whole we were delighted with our choice of hotel and would thorougly reccomend it to all visitors to New York

title: Comfortable and Accommodating
text: The Laurel Inn is in a great location on the corner of California and Presidio a pleasant area with good restaraunts they do offer a continental breakfast as well as lemonade and cookies in the afternoonThe staff was helpful upon check inout Our room had two double beds with comfortable bedding and pillows We had a nice view of the city from our room Parking is not freenot unusual but we had the comfort of knowing our vehicle was in a safe garage and could access it easily We would definently return to the Laurel Inn

title: Good choice of hotel near the airport
text:
This review is written by a business traveler who frequents Marriott and Hilton hotels around the world primarily in the US and it is based on a onenight stay in May 2009
I wont rehash everything previous reviewers have described so here are the highlights for fellow frequent travelers
Pros
 This property meeting or exceeding the Fairfield Inn standards
 Wireless Internet access is free and fast 54Mbs speeds
 Renovated bathroom flooring
 32 LCD TV in the bedroom area 32 CRT TV in the living room area
 Large breakfast area with fireplace  two LCD TVs
 Across the driveway ie less than a street are Starbucks pho  Vietnamese retaurant Hawaiian BBQ restaurant Chipotle Mexican restaurant a dental office pizza restaurant Subway restaurant and a Chevron  food choices abound
 Close proximity to the San Jose airport without the airplane noise
Opportunities for improvement
 Property is large with a central courtyard area your room could be far from the checkin lobby so you may want to mention this during your booking
 No Market available in the lobby for latenight snacks
For business travelers and other folks looking for value and convenience this property will meet ones needs in the San Jose area

title: Nice place to stay
text: Just back from a 4 night stay on Marathon weekend 6 blocks from magnificent mile Lots of great restaurants surrounding it Yolk Wildfire Uno Due Ginos East Eggcitement Greeted by Micheal a stand out the staff was friendly helpful and offered fantastic options for our stay The room was great Comfy beds clean well appointed The pool was good to cool our tired legs after running Only negatives would be poor wifi small slow elevator fire station 4 blocks away  mediocre restaurant Would stay there again in a second however

title: Highly Reccomend the Affinia 50
text:
We stayed at the Affinia 50 for one night in March 2006 The staff was very friendly and helpful The concierge was very knowledgeable and went out of her way to find out our preferences before making suggestions for dinner
The location is great a few blocks from Rockefeller Center and on a relatively quiet street
Our only complaint was that the bathroom was a little small Otherwise we had plenty of room in room internet access and even a kitchen in the room
After we got home we received a survey and after completing it were given a discount certificate for our next stay
We will definitely stay there on future trips to New York

title: Great hotel
text: A group of us stayed here for a long weeekend when we got a good deal through British airways Slight hiccups on checking in as requests such as 2 beds and smoking rooms had not been passed through to the hotel but were easily resolved Rooms were big for NYC well 3 times the size of the room wed had at the Hudson Location was fine very near subway lines so easy to get about The staff at the hotel were fabulous Ben at reception couldnt have been more helpful getting us reservations and information about bars etc The bar at the hotel wasnice for a drink before going out to dinner All in all a lovely place to stay

title: Definitely not your ordinary boutique hotel
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights The main draw of this hotel is its proximity to LAX This is my first time staying at custom hotel and absolutely fell in love with this place
Servicecheck incheck out
Checked in a little early with now hassle I wish the front desk receptionist was a little more pleasant and smiled more After a long flight you definitely want to see you pleasant face greet you upon your arrival Be prepared for high hold fees on your card We booked our stay online and paid in advance and wasnt expecting a 50day holding fee Other hotels usually dont charge that much holding fees for a prepaid stay Valet parking is a little pricey too Other hotels in the area Charges 15over night stay Wish there was an option for paid self park at their parking structure but it wasnt too bad to valet The valet attendants were really nice and gave good directions on getting around town And it doesnt hurt that theyre very easy on they eyes 
Breakfast buffet isnt worth it At 11 there was very little options All they had was bacon eggs oatmeal potatoes and pancakes At their price point they should over a lot more options May more Pasties Just more choices
Room
The room was very neat I myself admire the minimalist design aesthetic and this definitely suited my taste The rooms are a little on the small side but it doesnt really matter You get great views a cool mood light and a flat screen tv and of course free wifi We stayed on the 2nd floor and was awaken Sunday morning by loud music cheering and singing A church event was going on next door to us in their conference room It wasnt a good way to wake up to such loud music wish their conference rooms were sound proof or they should address the sound due to the proximity of the rooms to the conference hall
Pooloutdoordeck 33
Spent sometime out here and find it just divine Its a great spot to kick back grab a drink and just unwind after a long day of touring the city Wish they hosted parties or some sort of activities during the weekend to make it much more lively Maybe they do during summer
Location
Perfect location Located on a less busy street and definitely avoids all the traffic in the seemingly congested century blvd with all the other lax area hotels Its also close to stores and restaurants at this condo building next door 
Overall
Had a great stay at custom hotel and would definitely return and recommend this place to friends and family visiting LA Theyre not just an ordinary hotel but they have raised the standard of hotels around lax Definitely can compete with the big name chain hotels

title: Cockroach encounter
text:
I stayed in W San Francisco for three nights from January 29 to February 1 2009 In the past I stayed in W Los Angeles on Hilgard Avenue and it was superb so I decided to stay in W when I was on my business trip to San Francisco together with my two friends from Canada
I prepaid my room through Travelocity ang got the rate of approximately 250 Canadian 200 US per night
I have seen a lot of hotels in my life but this stay was the most horrible one account for the amount I paid for the room First of all the hotel lobby is converted to a bar which attracts so called fashionable San Francisco individuals In reality the bar is full of punks enjoying themselves listening to the ugliest and loudest music I have ever heard You can be sure that you will have a chance to listen to those musical masterpices from your room
In the evening of the second day I encounterd a live cockroach in my room This fellow came out of the gap between the wall shelf and television and rapidly proceeded to the work desk in the direction of the window What an opportunity to have such a wonderful neighbour for only 250 a night It took me five minutes to chase and execute my guest
Next morning I reported this incident to the front desk and it seemed to me that their receptionist was not surprised at all I suspect that the whole building is infested because cockroaches usually do not come alone The receptionist assured me that the hotel would perform disinfection of my room and issue an official apology Certainly no special cleaning was done apart from regular room service and I am still waiting for that promised apology
After we had checked out one of my friends discovered a charge of 75 applied to his account for drinks in the lobby bar he has never visited Since it happened last week he still keeps calling the W trying to get his 75 back
The other friend of mine who also prepaid his room discovered a charge equalt to 8 cents EIGHT CENTS on his account when checking out According to the hotel they made a mistake when giving a quote for his stay so the actual rate was eight cents more than the one my firend has prepaid This EIGHtT CENTS charge was applied to his credit card
I can continue sharing my experience relating to this W hotel but I assume that what I have already mentioned herein is enough for a prospective visitor to San Francisco to make his decision about this hotel

title: Good value and Convenient Location
text: I have stayed at this hotel 46 times per year for the past several years It under went a remodel about four years ago and is holding up well More recently the breakfast area was opened up to provide more room Its a practical change that works but do miss the old gas fireplace Myriad dining choices nearby and with the opening of the Domain shopping area this hotel is convenient to some of the newest hippest shopping Austin has to offer The staff is courteous friendly and helpful While rarely an issue it has been my experience this hotel takes seriously quest comfort and will enforce its noise policy The business center has one computer and printer Overall in my opinion a good value and convenient location

title: If you come with low expectations youll enjoy your stay
text: I stayed for five nights from January 10th15th and would recommend the hotel for wellprepared budgetconscious travellers Having read several rants before booking my room I was fortunate enough to arrive on a late flight from Europe avoiding the 4 pm checkin ordeal it also helped that the airline lost my luggage so I came even later than planned I had earplugs so managed to slumber through the latenight revelry and cleaning lady cacophony I requested a quiet room low down  stairs instead of lift queues I had a shower in my room instead of a bath no peering in revulsion at hair clogging the plug The room was freezing the last day but I burrowed down beneath my cosy bedding and survived The few occasions I approached the front desk the staff were just like any other New Yorkers friendly and direct I had breakfast across the road every morning You save quite a few bucks staying here and I didnt have any complaints having come expecting the worst The localisation is perfect for concerts at Carnagie Hall or the Lincoln Center If you dont mind walking 10 blocks then maybe the Hilton at Times Square would be an alternative Naturally the YMCA is only 25 dollars a night

title: Central hotel lots of extra costs
text:
We spent some nights in this hotel and had booked a queen size room We were offered an upgrade to a room twice the size of the queen room that we gladly accepted although it was our honeymoon no free upgrade was possible unlike in the other hotels of our trip
But the room was VERY small wondering how small a queen size room would have been 
The bathroom was nice and clean and the view was nice
The hotel is in a short walking distance of Union Square and three Cable Car stations 
For breakfast a Starbucks is located within the hotel with free wifi
What was really annoying were all the extra costs for everything internet the only hotel on our trip where we should have payed for wifi  spa large pool but not newwellmaintained sauna steam bath  water the only hotel on the trip where we had to pay for water  and parking REALLY expensive

title: Bad deal all around stay somewhere else
text: This is a glorified sideroad motel with dirty looking outdated rooms with an awkward location Kids enjoyed the pool but but you have to drive for everything else and the parking is a ridiculous 18  night This hotel  motel  warrants about 1 star We will not go back

title: They just dont care
text: The room was ok but the front desk staff were rude Use this place as a last resort At least there are no bugs

title: Nice place at a good price
text: A very nice property with a very accomodating staff Beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was good We had purchased the summer special that included breakfast We arrived rather late and the staff directed us next door to a Hilton where the bar was still open for food service

title: Absolutely beautiful hotel
text: We live in Michigan and have made many trips to Chicago with our son he was 7 at the time of this trip and the Affinia was the best hotel weve ever stayed in We stayed in a queen suite with a fold out couch The room was beautiful and the whole hotel was immaculate I cant comment on service since we didnt order any but the location was great It was within walking distance of the pier and many other Chicago attractions There was also an awesome pizza place right next door Its more of a businesstype hotel so I wouldnt recommend it to people who want to have entertainment at the hotel for their kids

title: Nice Hotel but a little Out of the Way
text:
We chose the Savoy Suites in Georgetown mainly because of the free parking We parked our car at the beginning of the trip a long weekendThursday to Monday and didnt use it until we left With that said the hotel is a little out of the way Yes there is a shuttle that takes you to the closest metro This is VERY convenient We only had to wait about 2 minutes at the longest On the other hand we werent really sure how the pickup at the metro to get back to the hotel worked and we were usually coming in very late the shuttle only runs until 10pm so we ended up taking cabs back to the hotel Those ran about 8 The hotel is also not that close to Georgetown We walked down to M Street and it took us the better part of half an hour Plus on the way back to the hotel its all uphill
Location aside the hotel is super clean and everyone that works there is so friendly Our beds were comfortable and the complimentary shower products were very nice We ate a late lunch in the hotels restaurant and our cobb salads were delicious The bar tender Francisco was lovely 
If we return to DC we may look at hotels that are closer to where the action is ie we spent all of our time by the mall and at Nats Stadium But for the price you cant beat it AND you get free parking 
We had an very enjoyable stayif only we could pick up the hotel and move it a little closer
OH if you do stay here and take the shuttle to the metro there is a fantastic restaurant on the corner called Open City We had breakfast here twice and it was amazing

title: Perfect locationgreat hotel
text: upon my 3rd visit to nyc i stayed at the edison and im so so glad that i did What a great hotel perfectly situated off time square so your only a stones throw away from the hustle ans bussle of the nyc lifestyle The room was greatcomfy and very clean The staff were really nice and very polite and really helpful when we needed to hail a taxi down to go out for dinner All in all a cracking hotel and i will be staying there again next month cant wait

title: Really affordable luxury the gem of Boston
text: The property is located across from Boston Common in a trendy part of the city The lobby and reception are sumptuous and very high class The hotel rooms are a bit dated but well maintained and appointed and have everything you needSort of a classic feel but with all the luxery of a super high end hotel The best part the price Boston is notorious for extremely high priced accomodations and this is the exception almost too good to be true I used to pay upwards of 250 for HI Express downtown which is what you would expect but this property does it all including a plethora of restaurant options for 120 Full time concierge gift shop business and fitness centers no pool but who has time in Boston A true value and pleasant professional crew to assist your every needs Highly recomended

title: Great Staff Great Breakfast Great Value
text:
The woman taking our madetoorder breakfast orders had an amazing memory and my eggs were perfect every time 
I like that they served cooked oatmeal rather than packets of instantoats which so many other hotels have with their free breakfast The fruit was fresh and sweet 
We were there on business and never tried the pool or fitness center It seems like a place where you could stay easily with kids 
Our beds were comfy I like the furniture 
They provided shampoo conditioner and soap in our room We asked the friendly competent front desk staff and were immediately given shower cap body lotion etc I guess they arent putting one of everything in the rooms now to prevent waste My partner comment on how well trained staff wasseveral times

title: Good value for the budgetminded traveler
text:
Last time I was in San Francisco I saw the Astoria and thought it looked like a decentenough hotel When I was called to the city on sudden business I checked the Astorias rates and found them to be astonishingly low for the hotels location I also checked Trip Advisor and saw mixed reviews Based on what I read I wasnt sure what to expect but I decided to go ahead and stay at the Astoria  I needed a cheap place to stay
Maybe its because I didnt hold high hopes for the Astoria but my stay there was a pleasant one The hotel reminds me very much of places Ive stayed in London  small lift narrow staircases
My room which had an attached bath I understand that some rooms do not have an ensuite another similarity to small London hotels was rather spartan there is a television but no clock radio but very clean The very large window looked onto a small patio and could be opened widely for lots of fresh air My room was very quiet too While I could hear people pass in the hallway now and then I did not hear guests talking in their rooms or watching television It was peaceful
The bathroom was immaculate In fact I am hardpressed to remember a cleaner hotel bathroom in my more recent travels In terms of amenities you will want to bring your own hair dryer but the hotel does provide a shower cap soap and shampoo  very basic toiletries on par with what you might find at a Red Roof Inn
The hotels location is fantastic The Montgomery BART station is two blocks away Union Square and shopping heaven are two blocks down and one over Chinatown is literally right outside the door For people who want a bit more than the Astorias continental breakfast there is a Starbucks right across the street another one a block down and several pubs and cafes in between
Overall my experience at the Astoria was great Its clean and functional and while it might not be the ideal setting for a romantic weekend getaway or a luxurious vacation its perfect for people who just need a convenient clean economical wellsituated place to crash I will definitely be staying there again

title: What you would expect from Kimpton
text:
I am not a boutique hotel guy Give me a relatively generic but comfortable chain hotel and Im fine Quirky decorations and a stylish lobby are great but since Im not living there I can live without them If youre like me then this hotel really hovers somewhere between 3 and 4 circles if you are in to the boutique thing then this is a 4circle hotel for sure
First the good news The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff is friendly and efficient overall But like a lot of boutique hotels you get a pretty small space to work in This room inspired the punchchline when I put the key in the front door I broke the back window They have a desk but the TV is mounted right above it so while I like working with the TV on I dont get into the front row movie theater experience and so couldnt do without resorting to sitting on the bed And the bathroom is classic NYC hotel if you are over 6 tall I am not you could possibly hit your knee on the wall when you sit on the toilet unless you ride side saddle can that be done safely
The breakfast buffet is definitely up to par except in rare occasions can you really get excited about a breakfast buffet They have good quality food for the full buffet and good enough for the cold those little boxes of cereal are always okay The lone waiter bordered on indifferent and gets a demerit for giving himself a 20 gratuity for a buffet I later was told by the manager that 20 is industry standard for buffet service so they add it for your convenience I have actually never had that added to my bill for a buffet breakfast at any other hotel in the United States I was a party of 1 Plus 20 for almost no service its a buffet people But I realize that some people tip the guy at McDonalds for handing them their food so for those people Im sure this would be a nonissue 
Dinner food was very good and they had a good selection of wines by the glass Yes they did add the industry standard 20 gratuity to the room service tab that one I have seen everywhere before so no issue there
So would I come back if I needed to be in this part of town probably Its a well run hotel in a good location and my company got a very good rate making it a great value versus most nearby hotels

title: Mixed Bag  Depends on what is important to you
text:
My family and I 2 adults 1 teen 1 child just spent the night at the Residence Inn Charlotte South 177 as we were driving back home from our Florida vacation I chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and its proximity to the roads we were using to drive home I usually have no problems following reviews on trip advisor and am very happy with the results but this time I was disappointed and have a mixed review
First the Pros
1 Hotel located conveniently for easy access to I77
2 The staff was very friendly helpful and polite About 15 minutes after checkin they called our room to see if everything was satisfactory and if we needed anything At breakfast on Sunday morning the staff was very friendly polite and efficient They made our Belgium waffles for us cleared our table as soon as we were done with an item and gave us advice about the drive home 
3 The room was very large and let us really spread out We stayed in a two bedroom room Both bedrooms had queen beds full bathroom and tvs There was also a living room between the two rooms that had a small sofa desk chair gas fireplace and another tv There was a small kitchen as well  with basic serving for four stove full fridge etc With our AAA discount we had a rate of about 125 a night 
4 Free breakfast On the Sunday morning we were there they offered scrambled eggs biscuits and gravy sausage bacon grits oatmeal Belgium waffles made as requested oatmeal cold cereals and muffins They food was nice but typical of hotels that offer breakfast 
5 There was a tiny pool on property and an outdoor grill 
Cons
1 NOISY We stayed in their hirise building on the second floor A three level rectangular building with one tiny elevator and rooms indoor front entrances equally distributed on either side of it The walls were very thin and noise traveled easily We could hear neighbors flushing toilets showers walking around upstairs the elevator bell we were four rooms down from the elevator and even the train whistle from the tracks up the road None of the noise that bothered us was people being rude or rowdy  just everyday living noises  so it was nothing to complain about and have fixed  it was a function of the building with very thin walls 
2 DATED while functional and clean the room was very dated in appearance Cracks dents and dings all over This does not usually bother us  but there were so many here coupled with the old decor  it was hard not to notice 
3 BED SOFT The bed was also too soft for my preference as well It was not saggy as in old  just too soft and not high quality 
Maybe the garden style rooms would have been quieter  I dont know However the cons noise and bed are things that are really important to me in a hotel as I am a very poor and light sleeper So I will not be returning to this property But I didnt just want to give a negative review instead I tried to portray all aspects of this property so that others could decide based on what is important to them

title: Excellent Service2 small complaints being very picky
text: It was fantasticthe service was exceptionalevery staff member we encountered was very friendly helpful and attentive Our only complaints and they are small oneslack of water pressure in the spa suites andlolhorrible quality toilet paper

title: Above all expectations
text:
I picked this room up with my points and got a STEAL With how little points I was spending and reading the reviews here I figured it was at least worth a gamble The lobby was beautiful and the restaurant was new 
We landed early on a Friday and they accommodated my family by giving us a very early checkin so I didnt have to keep our luggage in the back of the pickup truck  My wife was not happy about the pickup truck hah
Their generosity didnt quit They gave me a bunch of drink coupons that I regret I couldnt use them all a nice bag of goodies at check in free appetizer etc Dinner costed me like 16 w tip that night Kids eat free for breakfast The food was fabulous the breakfast was top notch
The room was a typical hotel room They all look the same to me now The view looked over the airport and I could see downtown in the distance My family was stoked and I was a hero for picking such a great place

title: Ambience taken to the extreme
text: Although a hip and buzzy hotel was expected this was ambience gone mad Inadequate lighting throughout the whole hotel and it was almost impossible to see the floor numbers on the buttons in the lift the dark atmosphere was far too oppressive Looks have been designated as more necessary than comfort The room was ridiculously small for the price charged hardly room to go to the toilet in the bathroom area Cleaning was inadequate in the hall areas of the floor that we were on Air conditioning very noisy in the room and the blinds inadequate to keep out the early morning light Bed too small for average height man Inadequate storage space for clothes and suitcases Overall a hugely disappointing experience Such a shame  great location and the idea is good but it is at the price of common sense and comfort

title: Great Hotel for families
text:
I really really liked the Affinia Dumont for our family trip to NYC It is not the biggest flashiest hotel in New York but it has a nice friendly feeling The front lobby is small but has everything you need The staff was wonderful and very helpful The rooms are VERY big for New York standards We had a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and a sitting room  plenty of room for my husband and I and our two kids ages 9  12 The room even had a small fully functioning kitchen which was great The beds were comfortable which you want after a long day touring the city You can hear the traffic outside but hey it is NYC you not here for the peace and quiet The decor is beginning to show its age but I thought the hotel was well kept 
Originally I thought we should book a hotel in the center of Times Square  I am soooo glad we didnt Times Square is manic and way to touristy The Dumont is located within walking distance of Times Square Less than 15 minutes and it is very close to the Empire State Building There is also a nice selection of restaurants near by to suite a variety of budgets The Barking Dog Cafe is right next door and is really good 
I would definitely recommend the Dumont to any traveling families You can not go wrong with the location or the value for money

title: SLS Style Lacking Substance
text:
I recently stayed here for two nights on a business trip 
If the underlying philosophy of this hotel is to create a hotel room that does not look like a hotel room then the proprietors have succeeded Alas many conventional design features in hotel rooms serve a functional purpose For example it is fine to have lights that do not look like lights but not if they only illuminate a patch or two of the rug and it is fine to have chairs and sofas that do not look like chairs and sofas but not if they are so uncomfortable that no human being would want to sit upon them And an illuminated clock goodness how jejune lets get rid of it but it sure would have been useful in the middle of the night And a master light switch near the bed not very slick lets not have one etc
Other annoyances
The lobby was so dark that when I came in from the California sunshine I had to stand for a minute for my eyes to adjust 
The lobbyreception staff wasnt that attentive and when attentive creepily obsequious 
The fun little sayings riffing off SLS For example in business center Surf Lovely Sites These were posted everwhere I dubbed them Stupid Little Sayings and came up with some of my own including the title to this review Subpar Lighting Systems So Laughably Smug Staff Largely Smarmy and so on 
Fortunately I am an early riser so the loud conversations taking place outside my door from 430AM530AM didnt bother me that much 
It was not all bad of course There was a certain feeling of luxury The bed was quite comfortable They had dishes of these tasty miniapples near the elevator The pool and gym looked nice though I didnt have a chance to use them 
My last visit I stayed in the Sofitel around the corner and I much prefer it

title: Excellent location very comfortable hotel
text: I was on business when I stayed at the hotel in January 2011 The hotel is in a great location just one block from the Gaslamp Quarter where there are lots of shops and restaurants The staff were very welcoming and when one of my colleagues experienced a flight cancellation after checking out the staff member put her back in her room and even ended up extending her stay at the conference rate The Business Center also offered free computer use and printing which was nice for printing boarding passes I had breakfasts and a few lunches in the hotel restaurant and it was very good I also thoroughly enjoyed the rooftop bar The room itself was fine with a working area although the chair really needed to be replaced as it was about shot

title: Really nice
text:
I have enjoyed staying at the Roger Smith Hotel on Lexington and 47th several times The rooms while older in style and fixtures are very comfortable and CLEAN The bed is really nice with a pillow top and several styles of pillows to choose from Each room has a small collection of hardcover books for your use and I am sure you can take one after you check out  courtesy says to replace it with another or return it on your next trip 
I also enjoy the continental breakfast which is included with the room rate It has more than the usual American style pastriescereal yogurt croissants juices excellent strong coffee whole fruits bagels and bread that is more like dinner rolls I think this is to appeal to the foriegn travelers as I have met quite a few of them on my visits there
You cannot beat the location and price of this hotel while in the Big Apple

title: Great Location great rooms
text:
No complaints at all about the hotel It is perfect to everything Pier 39 and 42 Close to transport cheap taxi from the airport 
Room was a good size for San fran air con was good bathroom great and big staff extremely helpful at all times Quick check in and out Extremely efficient young male works on the front desk he needs an award 
Only downside is the restaurant next door which offers extremely poor service at all times and has very rude staff Avoid at all cost We had vouchers for breakfast so went each day we were no too concerned as we had booked room only so breakfast was an added bonus

title: Great location  Great hotel
text: This hotel is in such a fantastic location  very centrally located on club row Our room was very comfortable  quiet  and not at all cramped which is what one sometimes finds in NYC The staff was also very helpful I would not recommend the restaurant that is in the hotel  we tried it for both breakfast and dinner and found the food mediocre and expensive for what it was Next time I will try the diner recommend by the other reviewers We received a decent rate online through quikbook and would definitely stay again at this rate

title: amazing hotel with even better views and really friendly and professional staff
text: i stayed there 4 nights in dec 2010 first time in new york with husband and we both really loved the hotel which made our stay even more special giving us a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates The location was perfect the room really big with such an amazing view the staff very professional and friendly room very clean and everything was thought of

title: Great Stay at the Westin
text:
My husband and I have stayed at this Westin two or three times most recently in October 2009 I have to say that this hotel keeps getting better and better The lobby is spacious and modern and the rooms are comfortable and inviting One of my favorite touches was water flavored with freshcut fruit in the lobby 
Rooms The beds are ultracomfy and luxurious the TVs are flat screen and every possible amenity is at your fingertips The views of the harbor and the sweeping downtown skyline are simply gorgeous The rooms are so nice that it almost makes it hard to leave but of course San Diego is such an amazing city that you just have to get out and explore 
Location The location cant be beat The Westin is only steps from Horton Plaza Little Italy Downtown Seaport Village and the Embarcadero Petco Park is only a few blocks away Walk to the Embarcadero and hop on a ferry to Coronado Stay here if you want to be close to everything that downtown San Diego has to offer restaurants shopping nightlife etc 
Service We received excellent service from the front desk staff and especially from the free shuttle service We needed transportation to several appointments and a wedding and the shuttle drivers were more than accommodating in helping us and our friends get to where we needed to be 
I highly recommend this hotel to anyone making a visit to downtown San Diego

title: Very disappointed in our outcome it could have been great but wasnt
text:
