This hotel has some definite pros and cons many of which other reviewers mentioned A couple pros even the smallest room which we had is big for New York standards the staff was quiet but still courteous and helpful and the rates were reasonable Lobby spacious and pretty with computers They had some kind of spalike aromatherapy thing going on scentwise which my sister loved but was a little much for me We didnt try the restaurant or fitness center but both looked perfectly acceptable And we didnt venture over to the pool at the other Affinia nearby but thats a nice option
Some cons slow elevators lots of noise from renovation room next door to us no coffee maker Also we were told our My Affinia requests were ready and waiting which they werent and never did show after repeated requests Im torn over the location Yes its walkable to Times Square 30 Rock but definitely not a stroll Really convenient to Grand Central and Empire State Building Only close to green line of the subway I guess it depends how close to the action you want to be
So we went into this fully aware of those types of details from tripadvisor but I had high hopes that the Shelburne could exceed because we were using a gift certificate that I won at a charity auction The certificate was issued by the hotel itself and invited the recipients to be special guests of the Shelburne It wasnt specific as to what that meant exactly but with a 1000 value it seemed like that could be a really nice weekend Let me just say they were kind enough to tweak the terms right away letting us check in a day earlier than specified and also letting us add an extra day for a reasonable price But from that point on our experience was NOT SO HOT 
From my initial contact with the manager David I had asked what would be included in our weekend as special guests their words not mine The manager said that because the room was a 500 value it had two beds our first 2 days were the full value of the certificate No meals no extras no drink at the bar Okay not what I was expecting to hear but surely a 500 room surely would be nice right WRONG When we arrived they stuck us in one of the smallest rooms across from the elevator right next to a room under contruction One morning we were not so pleasantly roused from sleep by a drill the next day a shop vac The bathroom vanity was ridiculously tiny with no shelf or anything with only the back of the toilet for keeping your toiletries handy which is not great for three people I realized pretty much right away that this was not a 500 room A quick check online put our room at 250 with the larger more suitelike rooms going for 369 and up And I was REALLY irked when I saw online that this room says max 2 people when you are booking and here they stuck THREE of us in there Our room had no coffee maker no lovely granite pantry or kitchenette but we managed to squish some drinks and snacks in around the honor bar items Yes we fit just fine but this was not what was implied by the certificate If it had been just me or my family I would have complained quite vigorously but I was with friends who didnt want to move or make a fuss Compared to other rooms they had experienced in New York ie no room to walk around bed no room for luggage etc this one was pleasant and decently sized and they were not inclined to want to move I went along with that to make my friends happy but I was getting more and more steamed at the special guest line because no My Affinia amenities ever showed up even after repeated requests They never delivered the paper as promised Also part of me was expecting at least a Hi how are we doing phonecall or a welcoming note but nothing And I kept hoping our My Affinia complimentary kit would show up with the maid at some point Or that internet would be comped Or they would remember THEY had invited us as special guests for the weekend and offer us a drink or some breakfast But they NEVER DID Not even a peep 
Affinia has a long way to go to reach the level of service that they boast We visit New York frequently and Affinia had the chance to win over new customers and they failed actually falling quite flat In my experience Kimpton properties still win hands down It really felt like the Shelburne shut us away in the closet despite the promise the weekend offered 1000 value my foot You dont want to rush back to a place where you are not treated fairly

title: Great for the price
text: Within walking distance to wharf Very economical considering prices of other hotels nearby Continental breakfast is more than just donuts and coffee but cereal fresh fruit muffins juice etcand is included in price Front desk was very helpful wdirections and transportation Rooms are cute  clean wHBO Only 2 flaws I could find was 1most rooms dont have a view But if youre not in your hotel or dont mind walking 2 blocks to the wharf its not an issue and 2any San Fran hotel is going to cost you 30day in parking but youre so close to cable cars wharf  busses that we didnt need a car for our stay

title: What a great place Beyond our expectations Will definitely stay again
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and found our room very large for New York with a separate bedroom and a pull out couch in the living room In order to save money we used the kitchen every dayit all worked and the fridge was full size The staff at the concierge desk went out of their way to make our stay pleasant gave us directions and they always asked if there was anything else we needed It is in a central location right across from Madison Square Garden clean comfortable and a true bargain The street noise took a day to get used to but I loved leaning out the window and watching the cabs and people mill around Penn Station We will stay here again next time were in New York

title: It was great thank goodness
text:
I booked a double at the Chruchill for over the ChristmasNew Year holidays despite some dreadful reviews here  but because of a few good ones It was really great We went to visit our son and wanted someplace convienent easy walk to Dupont Cirlce and Metro with a restaurant very good food and open all day with a decent size room as we knew wed spend more time than usual in the room it was more than fine even with another separate little sitting area room service till 11 I think and the staff were all very nice and helpful It probably isnt great for business people and they dont have mini bars or room safes
We will be returning to DC and will certainly stay at the Churchill

title: Mixed review
text:
I stayed at the Hyatt for a conference The conference rate offered to the attendees was the same as the regular rate posted on the hotel website which I found a little odd The hotel is in a great location convenient to BART and right on the Embarcadero The Ferry Building across the street is a fantastic place with wonderful restaurants and shops  we ate there several times during the conference We also were lucky to have wonderful weather and it was great to be able to stroll out of the hotel for a nice walk along the bay
The hotel is nice but not outstanding My room had a bay view I paid for the upgrade and a balcony which was nice  beautiful morning view of the piers The weird thing is if you sit on the very comfortable balcony furniture you cant see anything because the concrete railing is tall and thick The room as noted in other reviews was nice but kind of basic Very nice bed and bedding and very comfy desk chair but the bathroom is kind of vintage and the lighting over the bathroom sink is pretty bad My room also had studs on the wall where apparently a framed picture once was gave the room a halffinished look 
The temperature control in the room was inefficient theres one vent near the ceiling that pushes air in the general direction of the tv takes a while to cool or warm the room which was a problem as the large balcony doorwindow meant it was a bit drafty Also in my bathtub the shower faucet was loose enough that it wouldnt stay put at the chosen temperature the handle would just slowly sink until the water was scalding I solved it by wedging a cardboard coffee cup sleeve from the coffee service between the handle and the rest of the fixture to stop the thing from sliding down but sheesh
I didnt eat in the hotel as there are so many other lessexpensive options in the area You have to pay 10 daily for internet which always annoys me in hotels especially those with rates like the Hyatts 
Housekeeping also was very late the first day I was there ie returned to a still uncleaned room at 430pm It was subsequently cleaned earlier not sure if that had to do with the fact that I leave a daily tip with a thank you note Housekeeping staff I passed in the hallway were unfailingly friendly and courteous
I cant recommend the Hyatt for people who are expecting true 4 or 5 star accommodations although the location is great and the staff are good

title: Great place to crash
text: Rooms were nice with refrigerator and microwave The continental breakfast could have been better I was able to print my boarding pass from their computer in the lobby and they did not charge a fee Beds were very comfortable They are right next to the on ramp that takes you to LAX and yet you do not hear any freeway noise from the room which was nice

title: Honeymoon Stay
text:
We chose the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego for its excellent location in the Gas Lamp District Many attractions are within walking distance Sea Port Village Petco Park Star of India ect Suggest that you forgo the hotel restaurants and visit The Broken Yolk on 6th Ave for breakfast they have the best California Breakfast Burrito on earth They were featured on Man v Food and for lunch or dinner try Freds Mexican Restaurant on 5th Ave lots of food and very reasonably priced Both are within a block of the hotel
When we mentioned that we were on our honeymoon the staff sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne and champagne flutes They also included a very nice congrats card 
Some negatives Although our room on the 11th floor had an excellent view of Coronado Bridge and the bay it was right across from the rail road crossing and the trains and trams run ALL NIGHT The whistle from the train about blew us out of bed We were also surprised about the parking your choices are metered or valet This is not mentioned on the website for the hotel and came as a shock as we are from Arizona where parking is FREE 
If you drive the Gas Lamp beware of the One Way streets
The pool is very smallconsidering this is a MAJOR hotel but it is on the roof
We would consider staying at the Hard Rock again but would ask for a room away from the tracks

title: Stay somewhere else
text:
This was our last hotel on our tour in America and luckily we were only there for 2 nights 
Our say didnt get off the to best of starts when the bellboys taking our luggage to the room delivered it to another even though wed seen it on a trolley on the floor and it was only when we created a big fuss did they seem interested in trying to find it
The room we got was at the front of the hotel but wasnt too noisy  that was the plus 
The room was grotty  again who knows when it was last renovated  and was very small too which was not great considering the amount of luggage we had The screens were absolutely thilthy god knows when they were last washedcleaned 
Bathroom didnt fair much better Quite small although the shower was good with good pressure However we didnt get any clean towels for the 2nd night and didnt notice until the next morning as wed arrived late back the previous night 
The Starbucks in the foyer was nice but seemed quite expensive for noncoffee items 
The bar is cheap for beer 3 but very expensive 9 for a glass of wine Didnt buy breakfast so not sure how that was 
Hotel is opposite the subswaymetro station which was great for moving around will take you to Universal Studios and the 720 stopped right outside the hotel too 
The hotel seems to run its own taxilimo service but did get ripped off going to the Beverly Centre 20 and only 17 by a public taxi 
Cant say we did an awful lot of walking around the hotel partially because there didnt seem to be much around it and there wasnt a lot of people on the move around the hotel which also put you off

title: Great hotel in a great area
text:
This hotel is situated in a great area for the Metro Very safe and clean area
The hotel is very good with the staff very helpful The room was a very good size and the kitchen area great for cooking your own food especially from Safeway on the next block The two cooker rings microwave and toaster were more than adequate
The only slight critisism would be the lack of anywhere to hang clothes and towels in the bathroom you could not even put clean clothes on the toilet and there was no lid to the seat  a couple of hooks on the door would not go amiss But this was a very minor problem in an otherwise top class room

title: Good for business travelers
text:
My husband and I recently stayed three nights in the Hotel Felix for pleasure The hotel was clean and modern but quite small in size The room is fine for business travelers and couples with no children Im VERY glad we found a sitter because there is NO WAY we could have squeezed a packnplay in that room and still have met fire safety standards 
The hotel staff was very polite I would suggest going DOWN to the front desk if you have an issue however Each time we called guest services they did not complete the task even after HOURS of waitingfor CUPS or PILLOWS Easy things but after going down the desk they were given to us right away 
The location was quite good A few blocks away from the Michigan Ave near the Cathedral district There is a whole foods kitty corner from the hotel which is quite convenient 
Overall nice for a quick weekend trip with your sig other or a business trip but not if you have kids

title: perfect choice
text:
Excellent hotel in its class
Very good location just minutes from Broadway and 5th Avenue
Price  quality ratio very interesting
ALL Personnel is competent friendly and smiling I would like to especially thanks to Monika who was really helpful and professional She advised mi excellent restaurant to it

title: Will definitely stay here again
text:
I cant believe how good this hotel is Ive just come back from staying here 10 days and loved every minute of it
I booked through Expedia  and because it was sooo cheap i thought that maybe it wouldnt be that good  but boy was i wrong As soon as we arrived outside i couldnt believe how good it looked The staff were very helpful and the room was much much bigger then i expected It was also very clean Kitchen and bathroom were both spotless and still quite new
Its location is also great  about 5 min walk from times sq  but the best thing is that it is accross the road from Penn station  so all u have to do is cross the road and u can travel virtually anywhere in manhatten I advise anyone considering staying in New York to stay here  you wont be disappointed

title: Pleasant  great location
text:
Am visiting NYC for 4 nights and the location of this hotel has been amazing Im mainly here to see shows and they are literally in my doorstep 
Its good value too
Lovely helpfull staff
Downside is that the walls are v thin and on the first night we were kept awake by our neighbours After a long day travelling that is not what you need But they were politely asked to be quiet and then we could get some more sleep
Would definitely stay here again though and recommend it to others

title: Fabulous stay
text:
I recently stayed one night at the Inn on my way to take a cruise out of the port of Baltimore the next day The rooms were very nice Clean and roomy The staff there was fantastic from helping us with our bags to providing a great breakfast the next morning I would definitely stay there again
After I got there and told the deck clerk that I was leaving on a cruise the next day she pointed out that they offered a cruising package where I could leave my car there and be shuttled to and from the port rather than having to drive my self to the port and park my car there It was actually cheaper than driving to the port They use a driving service called Executive First Transportation They were great We even used them when we went out to dinner that evening in Little Italy Their vehicles were spacious and very clean They always arrived on time to drop us off and pick us up It was a great relief not having to try and figure out how to navigate our way around the city Definitely a great stay

title: Location Location Location
text: Weve stayed at many of the hotels in and around Times Square over the years but what a delight it was to find the newly renovated Hilton Garden Inn on 8th Avenue Hilton is trying very hard to cast the Garden Inn chain between the Doubletree and regular Hiltons and this property certainly fit the bill We loved the fresh baked cookies at check in and the cooler of ice cold lemonade even if it was Country Time was a welcomed relief as NYC sweltered through a heat wave On top of that the certificates for the free bottle of water from the Pantry was a welcomed and unexpected bit of relief We upgraded to a corner room and it was spacious and comfortable I understand it is a company policy but I have to admit it seems kinda silly to charge Hilton Honors guests 15 for this upgradeyou should just provide a gratis upgrade for Hilton Honors members like other chains do for their valued loyal members On the other hand offering free Wifi when Marriott and others hit you up for this fee more than made up the difference My only other concern about Hilton Garden Inns not just this property is the thread count for bathroom towels and bed sheets The beds are very comfortable sleep number beds that allow you to adjust the firmness of the mattress for each side of the bed What a shame to waste such a nice feature with sheets that were stiff unyielding and noisy Indeed the sheets and towels is the only reason I couldnt rate this hotel a 5 but I recognize it is true for all Garden Inns What this property has hands down however is a FANTASTIC location Youre one block from the Hershey and MM stores six blocks from Times Square and literally less than one block from several big name theaters and restaurants In fact we were able to eat shop and see the shows we had tickets for and never walked further than five blocks With the temperature near 100 degrees each day we were there having a hotel in such close proximity to everything was terrific Finally I offer high compliments to ALL of the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square stafffrom the front desk to the security guards to the housekeeping staff everyone was friendly offered assistance and seemed genuinely pleased that we were their guests As a result of this weekend this hotel property has assumed the  1 spot on our list of favorite places to stay when visiting New York City You cant go wrong here

title: Best place to stay in Philly Beautiful rooms friendly staff
text: Beautiful rooms friendly staff The only downside is the tab so look for weekend specials

title: A Wonderful Experience That Was Good for the Soul
text:
My husband  I recently stayed at this wonderful hotel and I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone who is visiting Chicago We stayed here for 2 nights and the staff were excellent in their professionalism and warm rapportThe amenities are first class the room was a great size and the restaurants had a fantastic choice of menu optionsThe hotel is situated in a great position that offers easy access to all sight seeing opportunities and shopping
Anyone who is visiting Chicago must stay at the Swissotel as it is good for the soul
Congratulations to all of the staff who work there
Petal

title: Same as last 5 years good fun and very convenient
text:
Have been coming here on first weekend in December for 6 times now Not much has changed But I still love being smack in the middle of the best Chicago has to offer Everyting is nearby and the Christmas shopping spirit is full omn Recession What recession Youd never know there was one if all you did was walk up and down Michigan Avenue for 10 blocks in either direction
The rooms are modest in size and not well cllimate controlled due to the windows good for cooling drinks The decor is a bit tired as are finishes The lobby is hopping and fun I have never stayed in a hotel with such a social lobby bar area and kudos to Marriott for making it so
Ill be here again next year for another four nights

title: Nice rooms good stay
text:
I just got back from 4 nights at the Hilton LAX I had read a couple of bad reviews here and was wary Fortuneatly those fears were dashed as soon as I opened the door to my room on the 13th floor
My room was spacious and very clean Yes the bathroom is small but I was travelling by myself so that was not a concern The bathroom was clean and showed no signs of wear and tear The shower put out a nice steady stream of hot water which is always a plus to me
The king side bed was terrific A little on the soft side which I prefer
The only negatives I had The maid neglected to put face cloths in the bathroom 2 nights in a row The other I ordered a pizza and a couple of slices were burnt I would have sent it back but I wasnt that hungry anyway and couldnt have finished those slices I highly recommmend the chick and rice soup I had that 2 nights in a row and it was delicious
Another post mentioned the elevators from the parking garage They are NOT scary and work just fine Just a little on the slow side perhaps but they only service about 4 floors so its really no big deal
My company booked this room through Priceline at just 60 a night A GREAT bargain in my opinion Ive already told my boss to book me there again the next time I travel to LA

title: Overview of my stay at the Omni
text:
We just returned from an eight night stay at this hotel The location was great very convenient to the Metro many restaurants within a couple of blocks There was also a CVS between the Metro stop and the hotel 
 Checkin was pleasant I asked if we could get a room with a refrigerator and was told that would be an extra 2500 PER night We didnt want to pay that for 8 nights so the girl at the front desk suggested we take the stuff out of the mini bar and use it Sounded like a good plan until we got to the room and found out the mini bar had not been installed yet We had one of the newer remodeled rooms The coverings for the bed had not yet arrived so we only had sheets and a very thin feather comforter with no duvet cover on it There was no dust ruffle so the box springs were exposed Not a big deal but it did take away some from the overall experience of a nice hotel It seemed to me that they remodeled very halfheartedly The bathroom sink was new but the holes from the old one were still in the wall No attempt had been made to patch or cover them They hadnt replaced the old rusted dirty blinds in the bathroom They really stood out Not much water pressure in the shower and there was no massaging shower head like the hotel claimed to have in all rooms The room did have a large flat screen TV Personally I would rather have a regular TV and have a minifridge and small microwave
The room itself was very clean Housekeeping was excellent We returned everyday to a spotless room 
Noise was our only real problem During the day the construction from nearby rooms made it impossible to rest It sounded like it was IN our room The air conditioner was so loud it woke us up just about every time it turned on OR off we had to run the fan on it constantly to try to drown out all the noises around us Every door in the hallway slammed loudly when shut I attempted to close ours quietly and it just wasnt possible 
We had no problems with the staff everyone was VERY friendly and helpful The hotel itself is beautiful Im sure the rooms will be when the bedding finally arrives 
Overall it was a pretty nice stay I would have been really disappointed and upset if I had paid full price for the room For what we ended up paying it wasnt all that bad

title: Great location but be careful which room to choose
text: This hotel is part of the Personality Hotels group and I stayed at other hotels before always having been very satisfied This time I was a bit disappointed as the room was tiny without window and got very hot as there was no aircon either I was expecting a small room as it was explained on the hotels website but not that small as the price was actually not that cheap in comparison to standard sized rooms in other hotels in the Union Square area Apart from that the location is excellent just 200m away from the Powell St cable car stop and around the corner from Union Square also very conveniently located to Powell St BART station and transportation to the airport The design is also very modern and very nice They served coffee every morning and wine every afternoon in the hotel lobby which is a nice touch I wish I had stayed in one of the other room types I probably would have been more satisfied but I cannot recommend the economy class room category at all

title: Nice place to be but get ready to be Nickle and Dimed
text: This hotel really is a great place if you are on a layover at Detroit Airport The hotel is right in the concourse and even has its own security personnel so you can clear security without having to face the long lines elsewhere The rooms are great with the super heavenly bed that Westin offers The food is excellent and the meeting rooms are very good The downside is that the staff especially the front desk tend to be brisk and borderline rude The other negative is that the hotel nickle and dimes the customer to death 16 for internet access  a bit high plus 250 for a local phone call Ridiculous As well after a certain period of time you start getting dinged 10minute even after paying 250 for a local phone call I ended up going downstairs and using a payphone rather than pay what they wanted for a local call The hotel unfortunately is using their convenience to squeeze more money out of its patrons in the form of local calls and internet access etc While the food is good it certainly is overpriced as is everything at the hotel

title: Not the greatest
text:
The hotel was very convenient to Times Square but that was pretty much the extent of what I liked about this hotel
The lobby was nice too but the rooms were very standard and somewhat old
The hallways were hot as were the elevators
The ac window unit in the rooms were a pain because the curtains covered it up
At night we had two choices 1 Run the ac and keep the curtains open couldnt sleep with the light shining in 2 Run the ac with the blinds closed keeping any air from circulating throughout the room not the best feeling for a summer night
The bathroom was very small with no where to place your things
There were zero additional pillows or blankets available
Each night we had to ask for additional towels to be brought up to the room
The doorman wouldnt allow me to use the luggage cart when I was checking out so we had to lug everything down to the lobby ourselves I couldve used his services but after a few days in NYC I was tipped out
Finally upon checkout I was told the valet would bring my car around in 15 minutes so after the above mentioned trek down to the lobby with all of our stuff we had the pleasure of waiting in the lobby for over 1 hour for our vehicle
I probably wont be returning to this hotel anytime soon

title: Finally a place to stay in this part of town
text: I first found Ink48 when they offered special room rates for their soft open in 2009 I have been coming back ever since It is my NYC hotel of choice unless rates are through the roof  which can happen in NYC The Hells Kitchen neighborhood has so much to offer  especially great cafes and dining spots along 9th The hotel is a Kimpton which always makes me happy  robes free wifi wine hour and a very reasonable upgrade plan The view from the city view rooms at dusk and dawn are worth it  especially if you can get a photo The Hudson Suite  one of their premier suites on each floor offers a beautiful Hudson view I think I have stayed in every size room this hotel offers and I am always comfortable The bath products are either Aveda or Italian and when you have a soaking tub they leave you salts The soaking tubs are so worth the room upgrade but all of the bathrooms are topnotch I have not had an inside room which might be a bit claustrophobic but the lobby lounge is a comfortable hangout spot with a giant wooden table and comfy chairs I have also dined at the inhouse restaurant Print and the food is consistently delicious The Press Lounge is a great place for a drink while you soak in the city views The staff are attentive and respectful  I truly feel like Ink48 is my second home The only draw back is there is not a subway stop close by but the walking feels great

title: Would definitely stay again
text: I was a bit leary from the reviews on here but I was more than satisfied with my stay here I booked on priceline and then upgraded to a suite when we got there only 40 more a night  cant beat that We were on the 5th floor overlooking the construction site Yes it was noisy but I was well aware it was going to be Didnt damper our stay The people were very friendly They helped with check in and upon check out came over and asked how our stay was etc Always greeted when we came in from outside The breakfast wasnt bad The food was ok and the price was ok It was very convenient and the view is great There was 3 of us staying Me my husband and my 8 yr old daughter Would stay again in a hearbeat Definitely also recommend the BLT grill right down the street in the W hotel Great food

title: Luxurious Resort without hurting my wallet
text: This hotel really is Grand The hotel rooms were beautiful and spacious Also clean clean clean The landscape around the resort was breathtaking Centrally located in the city close to shopping and movie theaters We did take a some time for the spa What a treat The friends we went there with went back the following summer with their kids A very family friendly place Yet we went needing quiet and relaxation and never heard any kids Best of both worlds

title: Great even with lobby under refurbishment
text: Great location on the nicer side of Union Square had room on a high floor with a great view Room was modern and nicely furnished Lobby was being refurbished but theyve done a great job at the temporary setup  you could easily not notice anything was going on

title: Ok but disappointing for a seasoned traveler
text:
Check in confronted with a clerk who clearly could not care less got to our room a SINGLE For 2 people with a weeks reservation And we paid PREMIUM prices Nope went back down to the desk stated our case the first clerk told us this was the room grade for 1800hotelscom guests Fortunately Mohammed was able to find us a slightly larger room and KEPT apologizing about the lack of view I just was happy to be able to get to the bathroom without tripping over my spouse So room amenities were fine The problem came in the bar When we asked for a rocks glass  a wine glass for the room we were told that the bar was separate from the hotel and could not accomadate us So why could I charge my bar tab to my room Just dont LIE to your customers in hope of one more round Believe me we found a place that sold glasses so we could have a quiet drink in our room And we spent plenty in that bar anyway so why unsult us of by being greedy 
I have to complain about one blond bartender on our Friday night who was so rude as to be deservedly fired She was so busy chatting up some lawyer type that she got completely snooty when an Irish patron asked her to repour his beer with a proper head and an Englishman who rightly complained when she poured him bourbon instead of the Scotch he requested I dont need attitude from a server its why they are there

title: Good location  enjoyed our stay
text:
We took the BART from SFO airport to Embardadero last stop and the hotel was only a 5 minute walk from here The hotel is in a good location 5 mins walk to the Ferry Building and about 20 mins walk to Pier 33 Alcatraz departures with the main Fishermans Wharf area a further 5 mins
The room was very modern with a very comfortable bed The rooms were reasonably clean but nowhere near what I would expect from the Le Meridien No coffee making facilities in the room unless you ask We did and they immediately delivered a great coffee machine with Starbucks coffee filters v good Bathroom accessories provided were minimal eg no shower cap small touches provided in most other hotels of this standard Concierge was really helpful Pub across the road Elephant  Castle was good
We ate breakfast at Loris Diner on Powell Street 50s style diner about a 15 min walk from the hotel and twice at the Eagle Cafe on Pier 39 following a recommendation which was v good about 30 min stroll from the hotel which is needed to walk off the huge portions
If you are visiting for leisure then make sure you go to Alcatraz the highlight of our stay and the tram station was also very interesting

title: PHOENIX HOTEL NEAR I17
text:
We stayed at this hotel and was quite nice and not too long to drive into downtown Phoenix
The rooms are clean and the each day the rooms are serviced to a good standard There is a breakfast on each morning which was a pleasant suprise and an added bonus
The TVs in the rooms could be updated with flat screens but this is only a minor issue Also the air condition units were the noisiest out of 7 hotels so far on this vacation
The only negative experience was from a visiting junior baseball team who kept banging on doors at gone midnight with no concern for other guests which I hoped the front desk staff would have dealt with but took care of this myself
Other than that quite a pleasant stay and would use again if I visit Phoenix

title: good value for the money
text: clean room small but comfortable bed no hand towels in roomeven when we asked at the front desk they gave us more washcloths quality of breakfast needs improvement overall good value

title: Its OK
text:
I was expecting something amazing having read other reviews such as I travel 150200 days per year and this is the best hotel Ive stayed in over the past five years or The rooms were exceptional or rank up there with and possibly exceed a Four Seasons type of property
What I found was a reasonable but not exceptional 4 star property My room was very dark with little natural light plus poor lighting and in an average but soon to be tired decorative state or maybe it just looked like that in the poor light
There is nothing wrong with this property if you want to stay in this area but to me it is by no means as amazing as many of these reviews made out and I dont understand how it ranks so highly on Tripadvisor 
If it wasnt ranked in the top 10 hotels at the time of writing Im not sure I would have spent the time typing out this review Interestingly many of the fanatical reviewers have not reviewed any properties other than this one I wonder why

title: Top notch service great location
text:
I had never heard of the Library Hotel however based on the reviews I read decided to give it a try Great decision Every single employee we met was friendly and very happy to assist in every way possible The bed was very comfortable and the room extremely clean Loved the reading room on the second floor which provided snacks and beverages around the clock continental breakfast each morning including fresh fruit and wine cheese and snacks in the evening The service here was superb as wellwe have stayed at other hotels that provided happy hour but here they actually come to your table to see if everything is okay and to offer refills 
The hotel is in a great location walking distance to Grand Central Station and Bryant Park which is beautiful
We stored our luggage after check out so that we could tour the city a bit prior to catching the train home and were told that we were welcome to visit the 2nd floor when we came back to retrieve our luggage A very nice touch  even though we were checked out they still wanted us to be comfortable until we caught our train
We have stayed at many hotels around the world and the service here was definately at the very top of the list Will definately be back

title: Mixed feelings about this hotel but generally positive
text:
We had two rooms at the Belvedereone Executive Double and one Executive King It is essential to book the executive rooms otherwise dont bother Definitely worth the extra  The location was perfect for us The double room was spacious for three people although the beds were a bit small for two people who are used to a queen The bathtub was wonderful The king room was great for two people but the bathtub not as deep apparently not all rooms have the same set up All beds were very comfortable The microwave and fridge were added bonuses although the fridge in the king room was too cold and ruined some of our food 
The decor was pleasant the rooms clean and the elevators not as bad as we had read use the service elevator as a back up I would recommend this hotel especially if you can get a good deal It is better than others we have stayed in at a similar pricelocation

title: Great Location
text: Hotel 71 is located on Wacker and Michigan a great location for anywhere to go in downtown chicago Everywhere is in a walking distance including the metro train The room is spacious adequate but not luxurious There is a good coffee maker in the room and a free wifi internet which is a plus There is a small gym which I think is rather limited This modern day people are health conscious and exercise is very important for frequent business travellers There is only one tread mill that is not enough but better than most places that have none I will have no hesitation to stay at this hotel again

title: Not overly impressed
text: My husband and I spent three nights at the Warwick and enjoyed our stay Upon our checkin we immediately got an upgrade at no extra charge The rooms are pretty compact but comfortable I expected the bed to be a little more comfortable than it was We were also a little disappointed that there were only three very small drawers for clothing I left most in my suitcase and hung the rest All in all the hotel was very nice compact and charming just not that outstanding The elevator is big enough for about three people which added to the charm actually For the price I think well try another hotel next time Staff at the front was young and maybe a little indifferent Good location though

title: Great location
text:
My husband and I stayed here over Thanksgiving vacation of last year We paid about 200 a night including taxes and fees We loved the quiet UWS location its proximity to Central Park and easy access to the subway We love to walk and explore cities so this was a fabulous place for us to stay When we arrived we were told that we would have access to an outdoor lounge on the 15th floor Shortly after we unpacked and got settled we went up to the outdoor lounge and were pleasantly surprised to find it empty beautiful decorated a Christmas tree and decorative lighting with fantastic north views of the city
The rooms are spotless nicely decorated and while a bit small the large bathroom size makes up for it
The concierge was more than helpful and when seeing how much luggage we had took us in a hotel car to Newark Airport on our last day
Im not sure if well stay here again as we enjoy trying out different hotels but On The Ave was worth every penny

title: This hotelwhile in a good location needs better service and a review by corporate
text: Cleaning detail falls short and they really need to hire people who are service oriented and friendly at the front desk

title: Girls Weekend with American Girl
text:
We take a yearly Girls Weekend There were eight of us ranging in ages from eight to eighty I called the Intercontinental Hotel ahead to request ajoining rooms two beds in each room and nonsmoking I mentioned that we were going to visit the American Girl Store as we have two girls with dolls We arrived around noon and to our amazement there were two hot pink star cookies with milk in each room Waiting on the bed was a personal invitation to the girls to visit the store and a fold up bed for each one of the dolls as a complimentary gift to the girls You can only imagine how excited the girls were
The hotel staff was great The girls had a fun time in the pool then took their showers in the Athletic Clubthey supplied everything from shampoo and conditioner to a blow dryer One of the girls did not pack a toothbrush so we called the front desk and they sent up toothbrush and paste We received Red Carpet treatment We Pricelined this hotel and sometimes because of that you get inferior service We did NOT The staff was awesome and we would go again

title: Nice HotelBusiness
text: I visited this hotel for a business trip in the convention area Rooms were very clean restrooms clean oh and the view from our room was very nice I liked the convention space the staff was very prompt and made everything room smooth during our lunchs and dinner party was very nice Food during our evening meal was only on the fair side There was a nice sports bar on premise very nice Parking fees were a little on the high side so be prepared to pay Overall a very nice downtown hotel

title: Top notch
text:
I loved the Wit exceeded expectations on all levels When I arrived checkin was speedy yet personable All the staff was excellent  I wish I wouldve taken note of their names I was recognized as being a Hilton Gold member and given a couple of breakfast vouchers which could even be used for room service This is uncommon based on my experience
I stayed in the Paramount Suite which was almost like having my very own condo downtown The room was spotless and full of nice touches With floor to ceiling windows in 3 directions it made for a quite an experience Room service in the morning was great and thankfully I had 40 to apply to the bill
I went up to the Roof on a Saturday night and was provided free cover charge This place is pretty amazing even during the winter  I can only imagine the crowd during the summer Despite the noisy atmosphere my room was completely silent even with the L below and the Roof bar up top
I definitely will stay here again In certain respects The Wit has a few legs up on its Conrad sister up north on Michigan Ave It all depends on what youre looking for

title: NYC TRYP Hotel
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights Oct 58 The location was perfect since the hotel is close to the subway entrance It is south of Times Square which in my opinion is good since your not in the middle of everything Our room was a premium room which would hold 5 people comfortably The room was very big for any hotel room in any city but especially for NYC There were two queen size beds and a sleeper sofa The bathroom was big and very clean There was also an additional sink and mirror outside of the bathroom where someone could put on make up brush teeth etc
There was also a mini frig Over all this is an excellent choice for a hotel in NYC due to its location cleanliness and newness 
Stephenie

title: cooper square we will stay again
text:
we only stayed one night 53009the hotel was unique the staff friendlyvery very clean
we recommend to any onethe re was no front desk yetstill being worked on but you dont miss the desk because the staff was right there and very helpfulsharonbrian
 toms rivernj

title: So choiceif you have the means
text: I have stayed at this hotel on two different occasions each for 3 nights The hotel is spectacular but you are going to pay for it Beds were great room was nice but nothing that would just blow you away The main thing here is the hotel itself Very large  beautiful Great stay if you are doing something at the convention center next door Easy walk to the Gas Lamp district Joes Crab shack is just right behind the building which is highly recommended The hotel does have nice bars  food inside though again pricey I would certainly stay here again especially when my company is paying for it

title: Homeless person sleeping by hotel entrance
text: Dont take a chance Very disappointing The hotel is next to a loud multilane freeway On the first night its too dark right outside the entrance walking back from dinner we saw a homeless person sleeping on the ground right before you get into the hotel We saw several homeless roaming around within a block of the hotel at night It was a bit concerning Keep in mind this hotel is right next to the freeway 5 After paying for the hotel on HOTELSCOM La Quinta charged us again for the stay on our credit card  double hit It was an absolute mess trying to reverse the charge and getting it off our card Even through that credit card mess which the front desk person created he was rude condescending unprofessional and didnt really apologized for his mistake The hotel also failed to disclose that they charge for parking Its not about the money its about their unprofessional and dishonest attitude When we asked about the additional charge on the card more than one person said that it would be reversed once we check out That wasnt the truth The hotel is very dated and beat up The air conditioner went on and off all night and it sounded like a very loud motor  no restful sleep for us The room was somewhat clean and you can walk to the restaurants in Old Town San Diego  these were the only positives But be careful walking to and from the hotel We crossed a few homelessdrugged people at night and it wasnt the safest feeling Well never stay there again

title: Very friendly and clean
text: Its right where we needed to be in Chicago For price and size of room along with breakfast through in a decent pool and hot tube This good enough for me Like others said its by the CFD but you would hear at other hotels cause they use same roads It actually made my family feel safe so there you go

title: Solid Choice Great Location
text:
Stayed here 5 nights Apr 610 1 adult w two teenagers Very polite and professional staff from front desk bellhop housekeeping concierge etc Felt safe walking around this area even at night Rooms are tight but this IS NYC Location couldnt have been better for our purposes touringcollege visits Subway station less than a block away Grand Central NY Public Library Bryant Park 5th Avenue shopping just a couple blocks over Easy walk to Times Square but far enough away from the maddening crowds Only issues  1 TV didnt work in first room but was reassigned next morning no problem They even sent up a technician when we called about 1100 PM to report the issue 2 My laptop got lost in baggage storage  we checked out of room and had to store our bags with the bellhop while we finished up a few last minute errands While loading the car I didnt notice that the laptop wasnt there As much my fault as bellhops as I didnt count the claim tickets as I was a bit overwhelmed trying to pack the car in front of the hotel on busy Lexington Ave and just wanted to get out of the way Upon arrival at our next stop Boston I discovered the loss and called the hotel Manager immediately connected me with Hotel Security and they made arrangements for the laptop to be shipped wherever I wanted immediately I directed them to send it to my home as we had a few more stops on our road trip and am awaiting arrival now Hotel security called me this morning to see if I had received it yet and when I hadnt he provided me with the tracking number and asked that I call to confirm receipt Very professional and responsive despite my somewhat frazzled state 
Regarding the renovations there was a notice about this on the reservation page and we did not find it to be a problem at all Our first room was on the 10th floor then moved up to 19th after the TV problem At neither room did we find noise to be an issue 
Quite a few international guests which adds a nice vibe
Enjoyed our visit here and would book here again

title: Great Service Great Price Great View Great Location
text: When I walked in I was instantly greeted as a guest should be greated Everyone that I passed or encountered provided me with the best service This location is in a great spot just a few steps from a convenient subway the rates were great as well as the views location and service Times square was about a 5 minute subway ride away Anytime I stay in NYC I will be sure to book at this hotel

title: Excellent location for conventioneers or sight seers
text: We were greeted by bellman who was savvy enough to read luggage tags and address us by name as we got out of taxi The hotel is in a landmark building of the city and is ideally situated for events at the convention center visits to Reading Terminal Market and about 34 mile to many of the historic sites The walk was well lighted at night so we felt safe Also there was a tremendous number of city police and transit police as well as another area security service in the immediate area The room was a bit tired in that the wall paper was peeling in corners and seams and veneer on furniture was chipped off in places It was clean and quiet Restaurant was quite good for a large hotel and prices on food were reasonable Prices on bar items was a bit steep though Staff was pleasant and helpful In the afternoon a station is set up in the lobby to serve lemonade and citrus water to guests  very welcome after a long day of walking the city There is a pick up station right out the front door for Phlash the citys trolley service which serves most of the tourist destinations

title: Nice hotel in a great location for the price
text: Nice hotel for the price Rooms were a bit small  TVs outdated but furnished nicely Friendly front desk Great location Walked everywhere we needed to be

title: Nice Accomodations for a Reasonable Rate
text: The Hilton NY is in a great location very convenient to head anywhere in Manhattan either by cab or subway My fiancee and I booked a room for a sat nite stay just a few days beforehand through priceline We got a pretty decent rate 170nt and when checking in asked for a renovated room which we got After reading some of the other reviews I wasnt sure what to expect but we were happily surprised that our room was very clean modern  comfortable Overall we had a positive experience at this hotel and its a very good value if you book through priceline or a similar discount travel site

title: Could be so much more
text:
The Hotel Blake is situated on the very busy Dearborn St close to the even busier Congress Parkway and occupies the old Morton building The room we were given was of a nice size complete with 2 comfortable chairs and a seat at the bottom of the bed This is one of their upgrade rooms and the bathroom was of a nice size with a walk in shower and 2 wash basins 
The room was unfortunately facing Deraborn St and was very noisy making sleep difficult  book a back room if you are a light sleeper The bathroom and entry way are tiled making for cold floors We had the heat set at 85F but never got warm in this large room the air vent was also filthy Bathrobes are provided but no slippers on the tile floors meant cold feet
The door to the corridor fitted quite well and if it were not for the street noise I think our sleep would have beeen much better A very slall closet with 4 hangers was available for the room  totally inadequate as was the availabe drawer storage Plenty of hot water from the shower but the bathroom had no heat source so always cold and fogged mirrors
The doormen and front desk were always polite and courteous but the Free Continental Breakfast is an insult Basically donuts and coffee with about 10 places to sit  most mornings we skipped it as it is unhealthy and an uncomfortable setting Not sure why theu bother putting this pathetic attempt on This area becomes a basic bar in the evening  basic beer and wine offerings didnt bother with that either The hotel is next to the Custom House restaurant Found the food to be fairly good and reasonable wine list  a bit pricey but not a bad option if you dont fancy walking  has a nice bar as well
We were attending a trade fair  room rates of 180 and talking to other guests we over paid by a hefty margin as you can usually get this hotel on Hotwire for 90 and that is about what it is worth On its website the Hotel proclaims the hotel as a landmark of luxury  frankly I have stayed in better Hampton Inns

title: Good Location but hotel barely average
text: I wanted to like this hotel because my past experiences with Doubletree have been good And their chocolate chip cookies can sway me to forgive a lot of inconveniences However there were more negatives with this hotel than positives As many other reviewers have said the location is excellent The Doubletree is a short walk from Beale St and from many wonderful restaurants and clubs They also had nice flat screen TVs in the rooms The hotel has free Wifi but as I have learned this generally means bad wifi No streaming videos on YouTube with this wifi but its adequate for checking email Other reviewers have said the beds are comfortable  but that was not my experience The double beds were too small and hard I am not sure why hotels even put double beds in rooms anymore The halls of the hotel were kept very warm and the smell of cleaning products overwhelms the lobby and hallways The fitness center is a joke  two treadmills one elliptical one bike and free weights Two mornings I got up at 530 and had to wait for a treadmill and the third morning I gave up waiting Since Memphis has one of the highest crime rates in the US I did not feel safe to run outside This hotel should either expand their fitness center or work out a deal for guests with a local gym although I didnt see any gyms around the hotel The air conditioning in the room was very loud and would sometimes wake me up at night when it came on The ice machines were also unbelievably loud There is a TGI Fridays in this hotel and I thought it would be convenient for quick lunches but it wasnt Avoid TGI Fridays if you only have an hour for lunch The two days I ate there they took more than 45 minutes to bring us our salads and sandwiches and offered no apologies I do recommend the nearby Flying Fish for lunch andor dinner I would have to agree with the other reviewers who found the service at this hotel lacking Many of the staff were unfriendly and making guests happy does not appear to be a priority here Does management read the Trip Advisor reviews This hotel could be a gem with some work

title: holiday inn express great location
text:
great location only a couple of blocks from times square
Reception staff were very helpful
good value for money Rooms were quite tight as would be expected for something this close to times square
Breakfast area is too small for the number of guests but staff do their utmost to make it work and keep people circulating through the area

title: Much better than expected after seeing previous reviews
text: We arrived at the hotel at 3am after a sticky start at the airport It was my husbands 50th birthday that day and with all the negative reviews of the past we were anxious However we neednt have been We were upgraded straight away from a standard double and given a corner room with views over central park on the 23rd floor The room was quiet very clean as was the bathroom Although it was a little on the small side the shower was very good and we were given plenty of clean towels every day The temp outside was very hot in the late 80s but we had very efficient air conditioning so it wasnt a problem The staff were very friendly and we didnt mind having to use the safety deposit boxes behind the desk as they were very efficient We would definitely use the hotel again you couldnt fault the location A must is the Rockefeller Centre at night great views of the Empire State and all of New York also do the Staten Island Ferry best free trip ever The best bus tours to go on are the Gray Line  blokes in red waistcoats The night loop to Brooklyn is brilliant Have a great stay and enjoy

title: Nice stay
text: This hotel is located about 2 blocks from China town and a short walk from Union Square The cable cars are also about a block away The rooms were spacious and clean and had good amentities The staff was not what I expected for this class of hotel I think the bellman should have been managing the front desk He had the best pesonality and was most helpful I would stay here again The only negative was that the cost did not match the service

title: Great Location
text:
Rite in the middle of everything a few blocks from Empire State and Rockafeller couldnt fault it
Clean rooms breakfast was nice
I would recommend based soley on the location

title: Great hotel
text: That was a great hotel good service and very nice rooms I wanna go back there

title: Great location
text: This hotel is right next to Times Square so is well situated for the tourist stuff Subway station is also nearby Hotel rooms are small by US standards and some have not been renovated recently We had 3rd floor room that was a bit tired but asked to be moved and ended up on the 12th floor in a better and quieter room street noise is noticeable on the lower floors Free wifi in the lobby was a bonus but could have easily walked across the road to Starbucks which is open all night

title: OMG Can we have minus ratings
text:
2012 Texas Line Dance Jamboree was held at this place sorry I can not call it a hotel because it was NOT From checkin till checkout there were problems Im estimating 300 to 400 people staying here for the jamboree on 101912  102012 May have been more or less but an estimated 400 people were expected for the jamboree Some were probably fortunate to stay at other hotels
Lets start with checkin for these 300 people Our first Jamboree activity started at 300 pm Many people were told that hotel checkin would start at 100 pm By 100 pm there were at least 40 people waiting at the registration desk ready to checkin A little after 100 we were told that checkin would not be until 300 It was requested to speak with the manager A man came out and I think he said he was the Assistant Manager but I could be mistaken He told us that the rooms were not ready and checkin would not start until 300 MANY unhappy campers I suggested that since the checkin process takes a while perhaps we could take care of that you know  credit card etc and pick up the room key later Oh no that wouldnt work Could we get key and not go to room until 300 No couldnt do that I guess he finally saw our mob mentality and perhaps fearing for his life he relented and said ok you can check in but if the rooms not clean youll have to wait Ok we agreed to that Now  expecting this many people and that most would be checking in around the same time so that we didnt miss the first activity wouldnt you think theyd have several people available for checkin Well youd be wrong There were 2 people checking us in After about 30 minutes 2 other ladies showed up to help One of these was a young lady named Celine Celine was wonderful 
Ok let me back up a little We had 21 ladies in our group and when reservations were made months ago we requested that we all be located on the same floor and that we have one hospitality suite Well they had us scattered on at least 3 different floors  maybe more Celine took some of our names and somehow arranged that most of us were on the same floor however the hospitality suite on the second floor was not ready so in addition to being scattered everywhere our hopitality suite ended up being on the 6th floor no one ever asked for that floor
Ok by now its 300 so we rush off to our first activity
Problems experienced 
Electronic Door Lock  card wouldnt open the door door wouldnt lock when closed
Rooms air conditioning unit didnt work toilet paper holder loose in wall and fell out when you pulled on the paper toilet handle had to be held down several seconds before it would flush and then had to jiggle handle to get water to turn off bugs found under a mattress fortunately they were dead and were not bedbugs but  bed mattress so sunken in middle that one rolled into an abyss I could go on and on
Overall There were 4 elevators but one didnt work and another one some people got stuck on for several minutes because door would not open One elevator on Saturday the doors just stayed open and it wouldnt move Carpets were filthy and worn walls and tiles etc were nasty looking Ice machine on floor 2 my floor didnt work finally found one vending machine with Pepsi in it that worked dont remember which floor OLD television set in my room so didnt even turn on Someone said they turned theirs on but no reception Geez
I could keep going but I think by now you understand that this is NOT a place to stay Room rate was 89 and not worth it Id prefer a nice clean LaQuinta or Springhill or any place else 
Its not like all these people just showed up on Friday They had our reservations for a long time But they acted as though wed just unexpectedly walked in off the street
Oh back to the main reason we were there  line dancing jamboree in their 11000 sq ft ballroom Well it seems they decided to refinish the rooms wood flooring which sounds nice right but it wasnt completed and the floor was a disaster Sticky rough etc
PLEASE Dont waste your  at this place They should just just the doors and turn out the lights  the partys over

title: Classy comfortable beds friendly discreet staff
text:
I stayed here for one night after an unpleasant stay at The Hampton Inn 
I wish I had stayed here the entire time  the bed was so much more comfortable The staff was very polite and understanding of our needs 
The rooms were a little small but we scored a handicapped room so it was a little bigger than the room my parents were in 
Very nice lobby  impressive

title: Huge room great service great location
text: The title says it all  my room was the size of a New York apartment Service was impeccable No complaints

title: Seattle
text: The breakfast area was not large enough and the breakfast was very limited even more than other LQs The location is very good The rooms were quiet but the internet in the rooms was not strong

title: The Holiday of ours lives thanks to great staff
text:
We visited the Affinia 50 last week and we had the holiday of our lives the hotel was fabulous and the staff were the best they were so helpful and so nice they could not do enough for us
We met Carmel on the reception when we arrived such a nice person so helpful and looked after us with a beautiful room Brian was the same so professional and chatty and helpful he even booked a table for us at the pig and whistle
We would love to return and I would highly recommend the hotel with great staff each and every one of themthey staff even organised our transfer to airport great success
Hope to see you all again

title: We would recommend this hotel to any Cubs fan and the 2 people who arent
text: On a recent visit to go to a night Cubs game we stayed at this property The staff was amazingly helpful and courteous The accommodations were spacious tastefully decorated and very clean Everything associated with this hotel was wonderful We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone else also

title: Better than expected very convenient to medical services
text:
Stayed here for almost 2 weeks while a relative was hospitalized at Beth Israel Location was very convenient only a block from the hospital and numerous other hospitals as well Had a floor on the 6th floor facing the street Insulation to the street was pretty poor so the sirens from ambulances which were pretty constant were audible in hotel room This was not a concern for sleep because I brought ear plugs I would recommend this to anyone staying here Bed was quite comfortable and there were plenty of pillows The room furnishings were in good condition room clean not sparkling clean but clean enough Bathroom pretty small Toiletries were very minimal only soap and shampoo no conditioner or lotion at all Hair dryer supplied TV channels are pretty limited but as someone else noted in their review the internet here is lightening fast so I was able to watch some TV programs online Maintaining temperature in the room was difficult either too cold or too hot It was also hard keeping the water the right temp in the shower pretty variable Continental breakfast quite nice served by wait staff in restaurant downstairs The hotel restaurant downstairs was surprisingly good had several very nice dinners there The food court next door was handy as was the CVS adjacent to the food court I recommend Upper crust pizza and penguin pizza if you are looking for pizza delivery There is a large movie theatre within walking distance which can provide some much needed respite from the stress of caring for someone in the hospital 
Overall I would not hesitate to stay here again However if you are coming to Boston for tourism rather than medical services I would look elsewhere not a convenient location to tourist activities

title: Avg subluxury hotel save wAMEX promo rate
text:
Although a local resident of DC I decided to stay at this luxurious property for one night with the sole intent of relaxing being pampered by superior service fine dining and the use of their spa 
A member of the free RitzCarlton rewards program I was entitled to an AMEX promotional rate of 220nt because I am a platinum cardholder So I booked the room wo using pts at the AMEX travel website because of the following additional benefits none of which were honored by Ritz management
 Room upgrade if available
 Daily continental breakfast for two
 400PM late checkout
 100 foodbeverage credit
Long story short avoid this Ritz as it is no different then the Capital Hilton or Renaissance both of which are far less expensive 
If you decide against your better judgment continue to read on for detail on what to expect
The Large Premier Room with king bed was very clean but not the least bit luxurious and rather small The bathroom was really fit for just one person The ordinary bathtub was supposed to be a jacuzzi with water jets and fitted with a headrest The separate shower is a tight squeeze even for one person felt a bit claustrophobic The very soft beds are in need of replacement springs seemingly worn down woke up with a soar lower back 
TIP If you order room service food  beverages you would be wise to pre negotiate the cost prior to ordering let them know you will pay them in cash I personally saved 150 this way

title: Old world New world
text:
We were warmly greeted on arrival and checked very quickly which was good as the afternoon complimentary wine and cheese was about to be served
Our room was comfortable and quite spacious breakfast was american style croissants coffee or tea fruit and pastries 
the reception are well informed and helped with all enquiries and helped with booking the tours I would highly recommend the Beresford Arms

title: Convenient very clean great bargain easy walk to restaurants coffee and sites
text: We loved staying here The room was simple but did have a great flat screen and good size bathroom  squeaky clean the staff professional and helpful and we could walk just about everywhere This location just above DuPont circle gave us walking or metro access to the sites Starbucks is served in the hotel lobbybistro and there are an abundance of coffee spots restaurants etc just down the hill The pool is summer only but there is a fitness center and convenient little coffee shop downstairs that is open day and evening Great computers in lobby Highly recommend if you are looking for a convenient clean bargain with easy access to the sitesand there was thay friendly staff too A great little restaurant is just down the hillBistrot du Coin French open late hours Wadham

title: Aother Wonderful Stay at the Palomar
text:
We returned to the Palomar and were not disappointed The staff are all so welcoming and helpful particularly the front desk staff 
I am noisesensitive and love the courtyard rooms at the Palomar where you can stay downtown without having your sleep disturbed HOWEVER the Palomar now is petfriendly so do NOT stay on the 9th floor if noise is an issue

title: Clean but basic accommodation  great staff who are very helpful
text: I stayed here for one week as I was attending a conference at the hotel and thought it would be convenient to just pick the one hotel rather than check into a couple  especially after such a long flight from England The rooms are quite spacious and the cleanliness is to a very high standard  the cleaning staff work very hard The first room I was given was looking at the runway so I moved rooms and was given one overlooking the pool which was a much better view They have a policy of rewarding you with 5 per night if you forego the maid service  I only received 3 vouchers in total even though I left the ticket on my door every night and the queue in the morning at the check in desk was always so long I couldnt be bothered to wait and get my voucher The main thing I would have liked in my room would have been a mini fridge to store my own drinks The internet was 1295 for the night  very pricy Albert in the concierge was so helpful and friendly  that guy knows everything about LA and the places to check out and nothing is too much trouble The staff on the check in desk were a little frosty and stiff but very professional and polite The Starbucks and lobby area makes the hotel feel a bit more luxurious than it actually is however the pool is always a bonus  there is also a spa jacuzzi but its always busy If you want a hotel right near the airport to use as a base to explore the rest of the city or for business then this place is fine but if youre looking for something special and romantic then personally I would choose something well away from the airport and near the vast amount of beaches that are a 2030 min drive away

title: Great Hotel near Seattle Center
text:
I stayed at the Maxwell to visit the attractions at the Seattle Center it was very close to before moving to another hotel for SakuraCon and I must say that I wish I could have stayed at the Maxwell for my whole trip 
Let me give you a quick list of the things I loved the room bathroom and shower were nice clean and very very roomy I found the bed to be very comfy there were a lot of good restaurants and 2 good grocery stores within walking distance a fridge and a microwave I made good use of every staff member I ran into was very polite and friendly it was good to have free wifi and a flat screen tv that got HD channels
There were a few things that did not lessen my opinion of how awesome the hotel was but could be a potential dealbreaker for others You can really hear the people walk around and roll luggage on the floor above you pretty clearly The nice big tvs in the rooms had a shelf near it that looked convenient if I had brought a video game console However from what I could tell there were only had composite video inputs and not the hdmi I would have preferred Also the hd channels on the tv werent on the hotel provided channel listings but were there way past of all the other sd channels and seemed to be a pretty random selection of what was there The shower was designed to not need any sort of curtain or door but it seemed to me that to make it work and not get water all over the bathroom the shower head was pointed towards a corner and was not adjustable at all That made the very roomy shower seem kinda cramped as I had to huddle in the corner of the shower to stay in the water flow
All of that said I loved loved loved the Maxwell Hotel The next time I stay overnight in Seattle they will be my first and probably only choice

title: Hilton Garden Inn was worth the price
text: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn downtown the evening of Jan 1 2011 prior to watching the Indianapolis Colts We normally stay at the Hampton Inn downtown but the Hilton Garden Inn was much cheaper I was very impressed by the service complimentary breakfast honor members and the pleasant attitude of the staff The room was on the 5th floor with a king size bed that was perfect for us The bathroom was topnotch and was very comparable to the Conrad Hilton in Indianapolis Overall it was a great stay and we intend to stay there again this coming weekend for the Colts Playoff Game Self Park was 900 and totally convenient across the street and in a covered garage

title: Decent stay huge difference in staff makes the difference
text:
Decent hotel where we stayed with our kids during our last three days of a five week roadtrip Two guys at the front office never must have heard of costumer service since they responed very unfriendly when i told them that i had a confirmed reservation for a queen bed suite They kept telling me that they only could give me a king bed suite so my kids had to sleap on a fold out sofa Since they are at an age that it is more fun than a burden it worked out but they never showed any hospitality and never tried to even the situation
Luckily the other people at the front desk were much better the other day even in spite of the fact that they couldnt or wouldnt change our room they at least acted professionally
The room was all right and cleaning was excellent
The pool was a mess filled with leaves and insects i would not take a swim in it 
Next time I will prefer the Westin above this one

title: RUN FROM THIS HOTEL
text: This is the most HORRIBLE Hilton Ive ever stayed at Ill list Positives first Room was ok  Location was greatBUT these 2 things would never make me come back to this Hilton Property The rudest people and most horrible service Ive ever encountered Hilton needs to send a mystery shopper into this hotel and stay a week and observe how horrible this place is They would immediately remove their Hilton logo off the front I wont bore you with every detail  just suffice it to say  as an experienced traveler  this was the most horrible staff and service EVER in my travels If you are a Hilton member  stay at the Hilton on Avenue of the Amercas RUN from this Hilton If you want to stay right atTimes Square area  then try Marriott Marquis Crown Plaza Times Square or Doubletree Do NOT stay at this hotelUNLESSyou love horrible rude staffand love horrible service Then go aheadstay and enjoy As for meIll never be back to this Hilton EVER

title: I Need of a Total Refresh
text:
I tried to stay at the Hilton Mission Valley as I was hosting an event at the hotel in the conference center The event was great but the rooms leave something to be desired
What I liked not much The service was average the lobby area was clean but dated The location however is good
What I disliked half of the hotel rooms overlook Interstate 8 I asked some other tripadvisor reviewers of this hotel how the noise was they said it was tolerable I found it to be too loud I ended up leaving the hotel and going to the Doubletree newly remodeled to sleep keeping my event at the Hilton MV I found the parking system to be questionable at best I had paid for parking but the meter outside didnt take the card 
If you stay here do not stay in odd number rooms regardless of floor number I was on floor 14 top and the noise from the freeway was almost 20db higher than at the Doubletree in the room using a sound meter on my android phone 
In Summary I dont plan on coming back Its fine if you cant find anything else but I would not recommend this hotel

title: Great location good servicerooms need makeover
text:
The Omni is a old favorite of mine in Houston and this past weekend was our first time back in a couple of years The location is one of the best in Houston for access to shopping dining major interstates and even downtown Its tucked between a small forest and some office buildings and a new high rise condo but theres very little activity on the weekend from the offices I would even say the setting is serene for a large city hotel The grounds are immaculate with a cool swan pond in front of the property Two restaurants and a great bar The Black Swan 
The service this weekend was friendly prompt and overall above average especially at check in I had requested and they accomidated without my asking again at check in a corner room overlooking the pool and pond These rooms are a bit larger and at end of the hall far from the elevators and service areas However the rooms are in desparate need of an aesthetic makeover especially in the bathroom Paint and wallpaper in poor condition bathroom fixtures are loose and turn all the way around The bathroom marble is not in the best condition and they need new shower curtains On the other hand the carpet was in good shape and the bed was very comfortable but Im surprised the sheets were not of a better quality I hope they get new TVs when they remodel to catch up with the competition
Finally our very fair rate included the buffet breakfast for two in the Cafe The food was great especially the fresh berries The service was good but not exactly friendly 
Im checking four stars but its really a 3 12 at least until the rooms are remodeled

title: Tired and just adequate
text: Our family stayed here one night on a cross country trip Unfortunately our son age 22 needed to sleep on the pull out sofa It was very uncomfortable The queen sized bed was fine The actual room was adequate although tired looking and sort of dingy It was located in Downtown Denver but not walking distance to where you would want to go out to eat or walk around Breakfast was not very good at all If you wanted a banana and cold cereal you would be ok The breakfsst room wasnt big enough and we had to take our food back to the room to eat

title: Clean and nice
text: I was there with my family and felt very secure in their hotel The hotel was newly remodeled and very clean inside and out The staff was very friendly and help The rooms very good size It was a gated parking lot which made it even better It was next to freeway but noise wasnt a problem I would definetly stay there again

title: Really good location good price and good service
text: Great location downtown walking distance to Magnificent Mile as well as to bussubwaytrolley stations The manager even gave my son a gift card to area restaurants to treat us on his birthday Although rooms were a bit small they were clean and comfortable Breakfast at Marriott is always great

title: Gracious Southern Hospitality Lives
text:
my husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Memphis Peabody and enjoyed it immensely The georgous lobby lavish details piano playing in the lobby recalled the gracious charm and elegance of a bygone era The twicedaily duck procession to and from that exquisite lobby fountain was too cute for words 
Our spacious comfortable room was in the club level on the 12th floor and included a lavish continental breakfast with amazing freshbaked pastries fruits cereals etc our own concierge and valet parking The entire hotel is spotless from the shining marble floors to the woodcarved and stained glass ceiling Everyone was so friendly and welcoming Most attractions such as Beale Street Civil Rights Museum Mississippi River boat rides shopping all within walking or trolley distance Neeleys BBQ a little more of a walk but worth the effort 
Cant wait to come back next year for Sunday brunch and the rooftop partiesand more DUCKS
