title: Hotel staff apparently stole my iPhone and Kindle from my hotel bedroom
text: This hotel seemed fine but I left my belongings in the room before going to dinner and it transpired that when I returned to my hotel room my iPad and Kindle had been stolen I realized they had vanished the following morning was very distressed and complained Later that day after vigorous pursuit by my office the hotel retrieved my items They didnt so much as apologize and were so inefficient in returning them to me that I nearly missed my plane The fact that my belongings werent safe in my locked room plus the fact that management were unperturbed and not apologetic about causing me extreme stress and inconvenience means Id advise anyone to avoid this hotel at all costs

title: Noisy in the mornings
text: The hotel is definitely central to everything and makes it convenient Room is average probably outdated as they still use shower curtains for showers After a shower the floor is all wet The one thing that I didnt appreciate was woken up at 9 to the sound of housekeeping outside my door vacuuming bumping into things loud talking Its only 9 and Im trying to sleep not the best hotel if you cant even sleep in some peace and quiet

title: San Diego MiniVacay with two toddlers
text:
My husband two daughters aged 2 and 3 arrived on a Saturday There is a plaza directly below the hotel that has different food options httpwwwmiramesacomsorrentotowers so we had lunch there and then headed to the hotel Checkin was easy and staff was friendly They gave us a two queen room on the third floor facing the courtyard Facing the courtyard is your best bet as far as a view goes as the outer views are office buildings or the freeway The room is a basic Marriott Courtyard room nothing fancy very standard The lobby has a cafe and there is a pool jacuzzi area and courtyard to lounge outside
After checking in we headed to Coronado and rented bikes at Bikes  Beyond Great experience compared to our last trip to Coronado Last time we had parked near the Coronado Hotel and its was too crowded with tourist This time we went on the opposite side of Coronado where it seemed to be a mix of locals and tourists After renting our bikes we went around all of Coronado and it was so much fun for all of us 
I had done some research on places to go and one big attraction was Balboa Park but when we drove by we decided to pass on it and go back to Liberty Station where we had been to last time We love Liberty Station very familykidfriendly with a great park httplibertystationcomsliderparkrecreation and the Corette Diner httpwwwcohnrestaurantscommenurestaurantscorvettediner which is always so much fun for our kids Its a completely decked out 50s diner with a turquoise corvette big beehive hairdos singing dancing games etc
The next day after checking out we headed to Sea World and had a great day there as well

title: Not Luxurious but Good
text:
I spent one night in this hotel on a business trip and stayed in a Cozy Queen room This is a nice hotel at a very good location if you want to be close to Midtown appointmentsTimes Square Fifth Ave shopping and Central Park Its central but without the noise and flashing lights of cheapersmaller places that can get really annoying when youre trying to relax or sleep
I was disappointed by the room but only for small reasons There was no water glass in the room and had to call up for a paper cup I also had to call up for a iron The desk is set up without a free outlet for your computer Luckily I had an extension cord so I was able to plug in across the bed but it was annoying The bathroom was tight and had very little counter space which made getting ready a bit frustrating Its a small room but easily workable for one
But the bed was comfortable there were plenty of towels it was quiet and its well located
Includes hair dryer shampoo conditioner and soap bar
Doesnt include shower cap shower gel mini bar water glass

title: Perfect location
text:
Our stay in this hotel was good Stuff is friendly rooms are clean quiet except for the dogs barking in the hallways sometimes The bed is extremely comfortable I enjoyed that Food is overpriced You only get one shampoo conditioner etc in the room for two people I dont get thatbut we asked for some extras and that was no problem No shower gel though only some weird soap bar with a hole in the middle 
I would appreciate more hangers in the closet for our clothes The sliding door to the bathroom is a bad idea its loud and doesnt give you much privacy Also if you turn the light on in the bathroom it also automatically turns the light in the room which is not great when you dont want to wake up everybody when you go to use the bathroom during the night
The coffee in the room is terrible and we always got just one creamer for two people
The size of our room King Superior was just fine for me Im European so Im used to it  
Parking is a little bit pricey and it can take some time for you to get your car because they have it parked in a garage that is not in the hotel
Location is perfect
Overall it was good not great not bad

title: Bridge and Tunnel
text: The hotel was okay The staff were a bit odd on checking in we were greeted with well check out the high rollers Staying in a Bryant Park Suite I get the checkin guy was being friendly but you would not get this at The Mandarin Oriental The room was nice big and light The furniture was very uninspiring in particular the dining and coffee tables were very student accommodationey Like other reviewers we appreciated the huge bathroom We did not appreciate the charge to use WiFi  come on people its 2010 make it free or go the whole hog and have coinoperated TVs too The event which characterises our stay most is the crowd at The Cellar Bar As one of my New York friends put it this is the worst bridge and tunnel scene I have seen in Manhattan EVER There were girls in bunny ears guys in pimp suits and girls in hotpantsinbuttcrack not a good look There appears to be no door policy and the hotel is situated within moments of the Lincoln Tunnel and the Port Authority building figure it out Koi was lovely but the descent from there after dinner to the bar was scary Like other reviewers the doormen were either absent or unhelpful

title: LoveHate Relationship
text: Ten our my girlfriends stayed the weekend for a Bachlorette Party Most of us had mixed reviews Each room has something wrong with it yet it was still fabulous As I stated we had a LoveHate Relationship with The W Hotel Lakeshore Love The decor was hip the beds were O so comfortable the view is the best in Chicago The hotel is clean and provides everything you need Just being there makes you feel very sexy Hate The rooms are so dark you cant find anything you are looking for Girls beware of trying to put makeup on Our sink was constanlty clogged One of the 3 rooms wasnt ready for check in until 7PM The staff at the restaurant was very unorganized Id definetly stay again considering it is the best hotel Ive stayed at in Chicago but next time Ill pack a flashlight

title: Awesome experience
text: Hotel is very nice attention to details in every way I got a beautiful room overlooking the pool and outdoor lounging area but the first night the party going on down below coupled with the neighbors on both sides made sleeping hard I asked at the desk the next morning and they moved me to an exact room overlooking the entry facing west where I was able to sit on the balcony and enjoy spectacular sunsets No noisy neighbors Every staff person Ive met  whether at the front desk concierge pool restaurants housekeeing etc has been exceptional As a Marriott elite member I got a few extra goodies such as entrance to the Spa fitness center for free Free refridgerator on request also The pool area is huge and easy to find a quiet place if thats your thing Plenty of areas for families with kids too Even the lazy river is cool I had a spa day which was nice  the spa is wonderful however my massage therapist acted like she could care less Otherwise everything else has been PRIMO

title: One of our All Time Favorite Hotels in America
text:
Celebrating New Years Eve at The Vintage Park was very special for us this year  We usually stay safely at home to watch TV Our checkin was smooth and welcoming with front desk Beelyn remembering us by name and had our suite ready so that we could enjoy an afternoon seeing Seattles Christmas lghts and decorations Elizabeth was pleased to see us againand later welcomed back by Lane and Tina front desk The evening traditional Wine reception then turned into a Wine and Champagne tasting with etched Vintage Park futes and glasses served by a local vitner and our friendly Concierge Louis from Hawaii with his warm Aloha spirit and smile  and preceeded our always gorgeous four course dinner at Tulios professionally served by our favorite James at our favorite table  and then to our warm beautiful suite to watch TV fireworksand our thoughtful gift from Louis Mahalo LouisNewYears Day Brunch was delightfulbefore we headed home by ferry to the Olympic Peninsula We return Feb 3rd to attend a ballet matinee AND a repeat of our traditional evening at Vintage Park and Tulios Many thanks to all of our friends Sharon and Phelps
PS We have a fun competiion going on between Kimptons Morrison House in Alexandria VA and Vintage Park in Seattle WA to see who has the most excellent marks noted from our frequent trips to each coast of the USA

title: Not a 5 Star
text:
Stayed for 2 nights for a wedding as the father of the bride Requested a suite with two bedrooms close to the Ballroom When we checked in with another couple at 330pm the suite itself was available but not the 2nd bedroom which was not available until after 5pm The 2nd bedroom only had access to the suite via the 1st bedroom Otherwise you had to walk around the outside of the building The suite was not close to the Ballroom you had to walk the entire length of the row of condos via the drive and then hike through the parking lot
The suite had a kitchenette but it was not furnished with any dishware or towels or any pots pans utensils I had to call housekeeping to get glasses and cups and dishware I had to go buy papertowels and dishwashing soap and other accessories It did come with a small microwave undercounter frige no ice cube tray and coffee maker Housekeeping was very accommodating but only brought items specifically requested including 2 hand towels to use as dish towels and wash cloth
I also requested maintenance come to replace the air filter The dust clogged the filter and hung down from the ceiling mounted air vent in long tendrils The flow of AC was hampered by the clogged filter Maintenance never did come onsite during our weekend stay The suite fronted onto a lagoon that while quaint did not look well maintained and had newspaper floating in it After visitors commenting on the newspaper I found a branch lying on the ground and fished out the newspaper
The room itself was comfortable albeit dated The bathtub was badly cracked and the porcelain had peeled off the interior but they tried to hide most of it with a plastic mat Lights were dim everywhere No hooks for towels just one towel bar over the toilet in the water closet 
One annoyance was returning to the room at 11pm after the wedding only to find neither my nor my wifes keys worked They worked at 6pm and were not placed next to any item that would have cancelled the programming Had to call the lobby via my wifes cell phone to have them send out new keys while standing outside the room
The charge for parking was exorbitant  22 per night for each car There is one parking space per room I had to park the 2nd car in the neighboring parking lot and hoof it to the room No reason for the charge when parking is free during the day to guests
The suite cost more than 600 per night and the extra bedroom was 400 Far too expensive for the quality of the property Booked via the phone and wanted to get the AARP discount but was told that discount could only be done over the internet asked again for the discount upon checkin but was told that the AARP rate had to be booked at the time of reservation

title: Highly recommended
text: I have stated in a number of New York City hotels and found this to be one of the best First of all the rooms are QUIET Im used to hearing horns all night in Manhattan but the soundproofing was great The room was also very comfortable and clean The location is very convenient  we walked to the hotel from Grand Central even in a light rain The staff was helpful and theres a Starbucks a block away if you need your morning coffee Plus we got a great deal on the room

title: A FAB STAY AT THE MUSE
text: Stayed at The Muse with my husband and two children 21  18 the hotel was fantastic very chic welcoming and friendly We had two beautiful rooms linked through a small private lobby both rooms were very clean stylish and the beds where to die for wide soft and very comfortable Complimentary tea and coffee was very welcome in the morning and the complementary wine each evening was a good way to wind down after shopping  sight seeing before hitting the nightlife An excellent location for Times Square 5th Avenue The Rockefeller Centre Empire State Building and much more The staff were very helpful this is a super hotel to stay in and we would definitely stay here again

title: Nice location and good value
text: We stayed here before New Years Hotel is in a great location around the corner from Michigan Ave Our room was clean and nicely appointed but a bit small The only small downside was that the windows are thin so even though we were in the 30th floor we could hear street noise at night The bathroom also needs to be updated Along the baseboards the paint and wallpaper were peeling back Hotel rate was low though so this was a solid value

title: Grand old Lady needs a facelift
text:
The Good 
 Excellent location on the edge of Dupont and easy walks to many bars and restaraunts The Metro is 4 blocks away
 Free wifi in the Lobby two lobby bars very good bar food
 Very good exercise facility
 Concierge provided good advice on restaurants and bars to visit
The Bad
 Tiny dated rooms Wallpaper peeling dirty vents I had the same garbage wrapper on the side of my bed for 5 nights
 Long walks from elevator to the rooms HUGE hotel but it was a good 10 minute walk from the room to the elevator
 No free wifi in the rooms they wanted 14day Totally unacceptable
 Using the exercise facility cost 10visit Not cool at all
 Lobby bar waiters and bartenders provided terrible service Walked out twice while waiting
If I paid 125night to stay here it would have been fine For double that price I expect much more I would not stay again and do not recommend other Trip Advisors to do so either If you have a conference here stay across the street

title: Very nice and clean hotel
text: We just got back from a one week stay in fabulous NYC We arrived about an hour early to our hotel and Irene front desk was so helpful in finding us a room before our check in time Since the hotel is in the flower district it was always a treat to walk out in the morning and seesmell all the beautiful flowers It was a bit noisy we were on the 9th floor but we turned on the coolerfan at night and slept through all the street noise Hotel very convenient to subway and bus route purchase a metro cardcan be used for both subway and bus We rode bus most of the time just to experience the city Highly recommend staying at this hotel For the reasonably price you get a helpful staff modern and spotless room and convenience to all city sights

title: Good value Great Costumer service
text:
Our free Internet didnt work for our entire stay but the staff was extremely helpful with fantastic recommendations on where to go during our first visit to San Diego especially Jose the hardest working vallet guy on the planet
We will be back

title: Worth the expense an oasis in the middle of New York City
text:
Just stayed at this fabulous hotel The staff  service were friendly  extremely helpful without being intrusive They all seem to enjoy their job and are proud of their hotel Whilst we were checking in another guest was having problems with a financial institution and the front desk staff were going out of their way to assist in ensuring that the guests problem was being fixed without fuss
The rooms are great lovely to find your bed turned back when you return after night out Not to mention chocolates as well as a weather forecast for the next day with temperatures in both F  C those of us not from the USA use Celsius  really cant quite grasp the temperatures when in Fahrenheit The rooms are not large but in New York space is at a premium 
The complimentary breakfasts were a great start to the day plenty of choices healthy as well as muffins  pastries To have someone toast your bagel for you  then bring it to your table was just lovely
The complimentary wine  cheese in the afternoon 3 hours was delightful to recharge your batteries before going out to explore NY at night or see a show
Being able to make yourself a coffee or tea endless varieties and nibble on fresh cakespastries  biscuits at any time was fabulous
The entire library theme is a winner it adds to the uniqueness of the hotel as well as setting a mood of serenity  relaxation away from the hustle  bustle of New York
Whilst the hotel is not exactly cheap it is worth the expense for an indulgence

title: loved heartbreak
text:
barnoldswick lancs England 
 We went in july this year and stayed at the heartbreak for two weeks and it was absolutley fantastic I loved everything about it Our room was big and very comfortable we had two televisions one in your bedroom Elvis films on all day and sirius elvis radio The staff were very helpfull and the desk clerks were dressed in black and it was down at the end of lonely street
Graceland is just across the roadand you can go up to see elvis grave every morning from 730 till 830 You can catch the sun tour bus down into memphis through the day which comes every hour and the hotel shuttle bus at night which you book at the desk and drops you off near beale st
We didnt have a problem with the hotel apart from the fact that the jungle room bar could be a bit bigger All in all we really enjoyed our stay at heartbreak hotel and all the staff were really helpfull and friendly We would go back tomorrow if we could We are starting to save up for our next trip and we will be going to heartbreak hotel First time i have ever been to the usa and it was my dream come true absolutley brilliant

title: Honey they shrunk the hotel
text:
The Doubletree is a nice enough hotel  just everything in it is smaller compared to most of the other NYC hotels I have stayed at Small rooms hallways and elevators a total of 3 of which service 46 floors
I go to NYC on weekends about six times a year on average and often stay downtown at the Millenium Hilton which is supersized compared to the Doubtletree downtown and usually in the same price range 
Despite a good location I cant say I will go out of my way to stay there again In addition to the small room the sink had some major cracks and the door between our room and the next did not fully close or lock other than the inside latch
I would stay there again if the price was right but there are better options in the Hilton Family

title: Love it here
text: This property is within walking distance of many restaurants bars the Astros Minute Maid Rockets Toyota Center and the Convention Center Cost effective the staff is very friendly and professional and the location is always comfy and clean We parked in a paid lot block and a half away 8 across the street from main building of Houston Police Department lots of Houston Police Cars coming and going by the lot Felt safe here Starbucks attached to property We stay here for pleasure and feel safe walking around to bar hop go out to eat etc

title: Great hotel awesome location
text: Great spot with a great view Pool on the top floor is excellent Nice staff great location

title: Gaps in service
text:
We utilized our Marriott points to stay at this hotel and found the service lacking continuity The front desk was helpful the folks at the resturant were nice and the food was very goodwhat bothered me the most was we were expecting a very important package which was shipped Fedex and clearly signed for and recieved with a name on a specific date When we inquired about the package we were told it wasnt recieved We requested the tracking number from the shipper and retracked the package the following day Needless to say the package was delivered the previous day but someone in loss prevention apparently was too lazy to look We readdressed this issue when were told the package was not delivered the previous day but was delivered latera clear falsehood Then the person on the phone in loss prevention had a clear attitude If you make a mistake admitted it and move on but dont lie about the issuepoor poor service from the loss prevention group
The pool was dirty the maid service never left soap in the room and left trash on our floor The people had an attitudenot what I would expect from a Marriott and we have stayed at Marriotts throughout the world

title: Great location BUT
text: ask for a room on the inside The cable car bells get to you after awhile Also be sure you have lots of energy to get back to your hotel at the end of the day doesnt matter where you go you will have a steep incline to climb to get back to this hotel This where the three cable car lines come in handy all stopping in front of the hotel Hotel is great for easy access to Fishermans Wharf Union Square and shopping on Market St and Ferry Market 30 minutes to airport by cab 30 minutes to Golden Gate Park by transit 30 minutes to Sausalito by rental car

title: Very nice after all its the Ritz but
text: But they took over an hour to seat us for dinner even though we had a reservation I think they get too busy for Christmas but the hotel part of it all was typical Ritz

title: A delightful new NYC hotel
text: Although I live just 12 miles from midtown Manhattan occasionally I stay in the city because of business Last week was one of those times I decided to try Ink 48 in general I am a fan of Kimpton hotels Ink 48 is a truly wonderful hotel Its fresh clean spacious and is most attractive and appealing The staff are extremely nice that goes a long way with me as well I stayed in a deluxe room there was a special rate on the 14th floor with a view of 11th Ave looking east  it was simply fantastic One word about the hotels location  its a little off the beaten path but if you are reasonably fit you can easily walk from the hotel to Time Square in less than 10 minutes The subway is also just three long crosstown blocks away Cabs are everywhere buses are just one block over Over the years I have stayed in at least 25 NYC hotels Ink 48 is now officially my favorite

title: Very Upscale  Great Hotel
text: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for a family wedding that was in the hotel ballroom I thought the place was expertly maintained and the room was very clean and modern The bed was comfortable the bathroom was huge by comparison to most hotels The view of the Hudson River was fantastic The catered food was very good Overall an excellent experience  although the one strange thing I found was that the hotel lobby was on the 22nd floor of the building not a bad thing just odd

title: Many more Positives than Negatives
text:
We stayed June 15 thru 17 Arrived at 1pm We had already advised the hotel by phone a day earlier that we would appreciate early check in self parking garage for this hotel is easilly accessed on 41st street heading toward 10th ave by the way A parking attendant actually parks your car and asks you if you are staying at the hotel Fee was just 25nite This is great for NYC parking believe me Valet parking is double that rate The elevator up to ground level takes you to the luggagebot we did not use and easy self checkin computer terminals A Bell Services staff member helped us our room WAS readyand guided us on a brief tour of the hotel and the nuances of our room
 Room Small just what you have seen in pictures We have been charged double the 149 we paid for smaller rooms at luxury addresses Yes  the liquid soap has a pine odor Yes only a curtain seperates the bed area from the shower sink toilet area A minor issue for us as I am generally more odorproductive than my wifethere is a window which can be opened a small way and that helpsNo tissue box Fabulous for NYC hvac system Cooled the room in minutes Be warned to save  a sensor turns it off when you are not in the roomgood thing it works so quickly when you come back in Bed was firm but we liked that This Room  1736 hadbar none the best soundproofing of any room in any hotel in which we have ever stayed I know only too well how New York City can invade other hotel rooms and how other rooms can leak sound into yours We generally turn in earlyAh Relief
 Hotel Fourth floor Terrace is just wonderful Rest have a drink before going up to the room Free computer terminals Didnt try the restaurant Staff there was very nice Free continental breakfast is also on four and some inside lounges as well Each floor has a small room dedicated to a coffeeicecold water soda machine These are very frequently used by guests and you can find them messy if more guests than staff have preceeded you
 Area All of NYC is accessed by walking andor taxi This part is not the most happening zone in the cityyet It is as secure as any neighborhood however and I frequently walked between Times Square and the hotel 43rd st is a particularly good street to travel up or down when going to or from Times Square small shops etc and pedestrian friendly
 Overall more pluses than minuses for us

title: A real Dallas star
text: I have stayed in this hotel over 4 years every time I am here on business The staff is super friendly and courteous    the updated lobby is contemporary elegance    and the restaurant can compete with the best of them

title: Great place to stay
text:
We stayed at the Affinia Manhattan for new year 2005 The hotel was in the perfect location deep in manahattan not far from Times Square From our window looking one way we had views of the Empire State building and the other way was Madison square Gardens 
The room was spacious and really cleanwhat more do you want Additionally it had everything we needed kitchen to avoid spending loads on breakfasts safe tv BIG fridge microwave even an ironing board
A great touch was a little king kong teddy you could buy to remind you of your new york expierence
If we do manage to visit the big apple again we would definatly stay there again

title: Good value easy to catch early morning flight
text: Room was nicely furnished and clean Hotel staff was polite and competent One night of parking was 12 and the garage is a little tight High speed internet for 995 Room charge through hotelscom was 132 I would definitely stay here again if I have to fly out of LAX the next morning You can walk about 10 minutes and get a tasty meal at In  Out Burger

title: I Wont Stay Anywhere Else in Boston
text: Although we live close to Boston I surprised my wife with a birthday weekend in the Hub I selected the Commonwealth because of Trip Advisor reviews and my expectations were exceeded What a wonderful place Most important is the customer service which gets an A  from the time we arrived to the time we left everything was perfect The nicest surprise was a free upgrade to a suite when I mentioned we were celebrating my wifes birthday The hotels two restaurants are also excellent and the location is convenient to Boston attractions

title: Not Perfect But Great Value
text:
I highly recommend this hotel but there are a few little things that bothered me 
Note This hotel does not have a restaurant or bar on premise  it offers a small breakfast and not much more Also all the rooms floors are stone  no carpets I did not mind but you might
GREAT
Very reasonable price Great bang for the buck
Nice huge rooms
Kitchen is well appointed
Incredibly comfortable bed
Bathroom is really fancy with an incredible shower
Free WiFi 
Many closets and storage especially for hanging up clothing
DirecTV has many many channels
Continental breakfast offered coldhot cereals breads pastries hot drinks and OJ  for only 5
REALLY BOTHERED ME
No TV in bedroom 
Bedroom desk was very small and the chair stunk They really need a proper chair with wheels and a high adjustable seatback
OTHER CRITIQUES
Bathroom only had one small hook to hang towels I had to hang my second one on top of the bathroom door
Bedroom closet was huge but shelves were 12 as deep as the closet 
Living room furniture was sparse
They charged me for my complete stay the day after checking in Hmm

title: Pay for WiFi
text:
OK The room was great as usual with a slight we sprayed the room with a Deoderized because some schmuck smoked in a nonsmoking room The desk was a great working area but the chair was broken to where it would not adjust so I put a pillow in it so I could reach the keyboard To my surprise the chain cant seem to do what the smallest and most remote Motel 6 can do  free internet Nope 10 a day Come on I stayed at the hotel because I was taking a class there the next day I had their just like your Mom used to make breakfast Bacon was the normal fare of paper thin and uniformly exactly like every other Is that Tofu or an edible plastic The fruit had not been vetted as it had zero taste but the coffee was good The managers reception I did not have time to attend but it looked pathetic with low cost bar mix 
The front desk was fantastic They were always saying hello like they meant it and were always ready to help

title: A wonderful spot for many reasons
text: From the conversation prior to arriving had on the phone assisting us in choosing a room to the numerous conversations we had in person while there that helped us plan our trip around town this hotel definitely holds up It was very personable This hotel was superior Our room was perfectly described very clean and bright and we enjoyed ourselves staying in this great spot We would definitely stay here again The nighttime bedside Godiva chocolates and the plentiful fresh fruit salad for breakfast were a very nice option too

title: Location cant be beat
text: The main reason why I booked this hotel was its location and it certainly did not disappoint You cant go wrong being literally next door to Grand Central and only 1015 minutes away from all major attractions not to mention the great food choices that wont break the bank found nearby on 3rd Ave Try the Libretto Pizzeria on 3rd and youll love the food as well as the homemade NY favorites cannoli and tiramisu were the best I had Just a side note Anyhow the hotel room itself was nothing special room was very small but the bathroom I found designed for a little child and not for adults so this was the worst thing about the room However I knew going in that Manhattan hotels had tiny rooms so I wasnt expecting anything Keep in mind that there is no way more than two people could be comfortable in one room so get two rooms if you are three or more in number Hotel staff were friendly and attentive to all my questions and issues with the room TV reception is horrible and I complained about it but was told nothing can be done I assumed all the tall buildings cause reception problems so it didnt bother me much was out all day anyways I didnt appreciate all the nickel and diming they did with the costly WiFi charges charges for using the hotel phone for toll free and even local charges or the final surprising charge that Id never encountered before which was for luggage storage upon check out They charge per piece of luggage which I didnt appreciate But I figured that this is NY so was expecting to be ripped off here and there Overall this was an excellent first time visit to NYC and we had a great time Cant wait to go back again and will definitely stay at the Hyatt each time I visit because again its location cant be beat by any other major NYC hotel in the area All of Manhattan was right outside my doorstep and I loved it

title: Great staff excellent location
text: Although the hotel is exactly what you would expect from a Renaissance by Marriott the staff was absolutely excellent

title: Perfect location  great staff
text:
I have just come to the end of a 9 night stay It was supposed to be 3 but we had to stay on due to Hurricane Sandy
The staff have been exceptionally helpful and accommodating given our circumstances I have have heard all sorts of horror stories from other stranded travellers this week and it appears we certainly struck lucky
The location of the hotel is perfect too Just a short walk to Time Square and yet far enough to escape the noise 5th Avenue is literally around the corner and Grand Central is just 5 minutes walk
I dont like recommending hotels as everyone has different expectations but the Iroquois has exceeded mine this last week or so for so many reasons 
Thank you Team Iroquois

title: Great for families with kids ONLY
text:
As usual the Hyatt provided great customer service For whatever reason our room wasnt ready on time and they provided comps to make our wait tolerable The pools were incredibly small and in one single location which were filled with hundreds of small children In fact the entire hotel looked like Disneyland with all the children swarming everywhere 
My bad for not reading Trip Advisor reports before booking here since I was looking for a quiet romantic getaway and this was not quiet

title: Great Hotel Great Staff Great Place to Stay
text:
Hotel was wonderful staff very helpful especially Jacki the concierge 
Breakfast was quite a spread 
Very centrally located hotel near bus and train station Easy to get train to Dallas 
Buses very easy to use and cheap
Sundance Square alive at night lots of lovely restaurants
A must is to go to the Fort Worth Stockyards easy to get to with bus great fun and if you can go and see a real Rodeo with bull riding  awesome
We went in May time weather was very hot Hotel was exactly as the pictures show Rooms very spacious and well equipped Housekeeping staff friendly and efficient The only gripe I have is the air conditioning was quite noisy
Stayed on 9th floor over looking convention centre
I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone staying in Fort Worth

title: Perfect hotel in great location
text:
Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and could not ask for more Reception staff were very polite and friendly o arrival and gave us all relevant information including the free wifi code and a drinks token They also gave us the option of a two double or a king room which was nice We opted for the king room was was amazing
Bed very comfortable bathroom was spotless tv was around 40 and gave you the usual American tv channels A free safe was very useful to store expensive items The room was refreshed every day without fail with fresh towels and didnt have to call reception once with any problems Our toilet became blocked and we requested help as we were leaving the hotel one morning and they said they would get someone up to sort it which they did well before we got back that day
Staff always acknowledged us each morning and night as we left and returned to the hotel The concierge lady was also extremely helpful with suggesting where to go to eat
This hotel is only 3 stops on the subway from times square which takes around 4 minutes Theres a subway two blocks down which takes 2 minutes to walk to
I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone staying in new york for any purpose and would easily stay again when I revisit

title: Very Nice Place
text: Stayed for one night in January Very close to where I needed to be and plenty of restaurants around that are of decent calibur Rooms were clean lobby was nice Breakfast was good the cocktail hour wass nice and had decent food I dont know how much the room was as I was on a company trip but it seemed like a good value My only complaint was the roomvery bright at night time and nothing I could do about it

title: Perfection
text: This was my third time to New York city and my first at this hotel I will definitely be staying here again The location is undeniably perfect Close enough to Times Square obviously broadway shows Grand Central Station Rockefeller Center subways I couldnt believe my luck The staff was so accomodating rooms were clean and the breakfast was amazing My compliments to the management You can tell that they take pride in their hotel and it shows Thank you for making my New York experience a real treat I love New York

title: Nice for a conference
text: I recently returned from a conference held at this hotel I was worried reading some of the other reviews before I departed for the trip but I returned with a positive impression My room and bathroom was clean The bed and pillows were quite comfortable The bathroom was nice with its extended shower curtain as well as dual head shower fixture I did not bring my laptop on this trip so I cannot comment on the easecost of internet use The food served at the conference was one of the best treats I did not have a bad meal during my stay Thank you to the considerate friendly staff I encountered

title: This hotel should be banned
text: THE WORST Im a Marriott Platinum stay over 100 nights a year at different hotels primarily Marriotts This is the WORST hotel I have stayed at since I was in college 30 years ago DIRTY Disgusting would be better description Most personnel were courteous and friendly EXCEPT person animal named Mike at checkout in morning Left message for GM to contact me contacted Marriott corporate to have GM contact me That was Oct 31 The response of the GM I believe her name is Mary Pat Hartman is indicative of the level of professionalism at this eyesore Ther isnt any

title: Comfortable and Classy
text: The fastest check in I have ever had at a hotel Room was comfortable but I had requested a ground floor and instead of a living room with a couch I got a board room and large table It didnt matter for me as I arrived late and just needed to crash Staff was very friendly grounds and facilities clean and what you would expect from an Embassy Suites Definitely would stay again

title: Mixed review
text: I booked my stay on Hotwire My stay was determined by price and ratings I attended a workshop at another 4 star hotel nearby The posted rate for the other hotel was 130 avg per night I paid 99 per night plus 22 per night parking fee and 1095 per night internet connection which I was told is not wireless because the hotel is too old and the cost to install wireless in every room is prohibitive The other hotel didnt charge for parking or internet nor did a local 2 star hotel where one of the other attendees stayed Also you could hear people using the toilet in adjacent rooms My bargain room overlooked the freeway which could be heard at all hours of the day and night I think it is time for some soundproofing On a positive note the staff is great the grounds are beautiful beds very comfortable and the food delicious

title: Hotwire No Deal at St Francis
text:
Lets not get issues mixed here the Westin St Francis is a wonderful property The problem is if you think you got a deal guess again
I stayed at the Westin or two day on business I booked the room through Hotwire as I usually do The problems started before I even got to the hotel I called the St Francis to confirm my reservation a few days prior to my stay I was told at that point that all hotwire rooms were only the rooms that provided a full bed There is no way my wife and I would fit in a full bed so we had to pay 35 a night for the upgrade I have never had to add money to get a bed we could actually sleep in 
Another detail that was conveniently left out is that the Westin St Francis charges 5130 a day for parking I am used to paying for parking as most hotels now charge you Even though you are staying at their property and in most cases there is no other parking options they charge you for parking This however in my honest opinion is a complete rip off 
So take your great deal at the Westin 125 a night Now add the parking and the up charge for a bed large enough for two adults to actually sleep in another 8630 Im not sure you tell me is it a great deal any more at 21130 a night

title: Great location and comfortable beds
text: We stopped off here for a few days on our way to Maui The location is brilliant and easy to walk around with lots of options for eating and shopping Staff and accommodation was good and we stayed in a luxury room which was good with wifi and movies

title: Lovely Little Gem
text:
The nutshell is I really enjoyed my stay at Petite Auberge and Id really recommend it
The hotel itself is a charming boutique hotel in French decor Im not particularly a Francophile but I enjoy what they were trying to do If Anglophilia is more your thing then next door is the White Swan Inn their sister hotel done in English style I found the room to be spacious clean and well appointed the bed was very comfortable Breakfast was continental with a heavy French slantthink croissantswhich is more my speed 
What really knocked my socks off was the service I booked a stay of several days on Bookingcom but I had an knee injury landing me in emergency prior to my trip that cut short my visit to only one night Even though the nofee cancellation deadline had already passed when I explained what happened to reception they bent over backwards to help Not only did they waive the cancellation fee they worked with Bookingcom to get the reservation updated I really appreciated that they were so helpful during a time that was otherwise so stressful Very impressive I

title: Good Renovated RoomsGreat Value
text:
I stayed at this place in AprilMay 2003 and then again last month
What a difference Everything in the rooms is new They all comes with fridge  microwave and even hispeed internet access What all the rooms offer compared to what I paid was a great value You should check it out if you go to Phoenix

title: Walking Distance to Times Square
text: We stayed at this hotel both before and after a tour of Eastern USA and Canada and found it to be the best hotel on the entire tour The rooms were both bright and well furnished and as quiet as a hotel on Manhattan can be We were on Floors 4 and 5 which both faced a side street with the Red Cross Headquarters directly across the road A railway line passed right under the hotel and a regular low rumble could be heard although this was not enough to keep us awake may be louder on a lower floor As other reviewers have stated several fast clean and relatively in expensive breakfast stores across the road From 10th Avenue it is an easy walk across 9th and 8th Avenues to the 7th where Times Square is located

title: Great Location
text: Very nice hotel bed was comfortable room was clean staff was very friendly and the hot breakfast was awesome My only complaint was the shower The water pressure was so high it actually hurt to take a shower It felt like sharp pins and needles were stabbing me While they cant do anything about the high water pressure they could certainly use adjustable shower heads to compensate Other than that everything was wonderful and the location was great We walked everywhere the Riverwalk and the River Center Mall were only a few blocks away as was the Alamo You can park your car here parking is free but space is limited although they let you park a couple of blocks away in another lot All in all a great hotel

title: The Cool Room
text: This hotel is a good place to stay when youre flying out of Phoenix In the summer the room is kept very cool Front desk is always helpful and they provide the things you might forget They offer a breakfast in the morning but our flight was too early Shuttles were on time and not a long wait in between the time you call from the airport to you get back to the hotel

title: Good Hotel for Business Meetings and Golf
text:
Good hotel to stay if your purpose of visit is to be in the hotel itself Probably one of the few places that can hold so many people in one place Some excellent restaurants and great staff 
The only negative is the long distance from Almao Riverwalk and downtown area 
Comparatively nearer to airport though 
If you are there in summers you could enjoy a swim in their uniquelt designed pool Golf course is large and well maintained You can even take a tour on Segways in this hotel 
Impressed

title: The small in Chinatown
text: I only stayed for one night before going to Albany We arrived much earlier from the check in time but the receptionist by the name of Alice was so great in trying to get the room for us to check in She was very helpful The location is excellent which is very close to Chinatown Soho and Little Italy The subway station is just few steps away

title: one thing kept it from being perfect
text:
A great hotel  located 2 blocks from Penn Station and within walking distance of Times Square nice comfortable rooms with adjustable beds extremely friendly staff and a nice but small cozy bar WiFi service was decent as well
So what kept it from being perfect  I set my alarm for 530 AM and awoke when it went off I started packing up and was about to get into the shower when I looked at my cell phone and realized it was actually 430 The hotel had failed to adjust the clocks to account for the end of daylight savings time the previous weekend
Despite that I would still stay there again highly recommended

title: Very Nice Hotel Near PHX Airport
text:
This property is actually a motel design with access from a large outdoor courtyard the courtyard a large pool as will as multiple setting areas with orange trees and umbrella tablesbut be forewarned the interior officerestaurant and rooms are nonsmoking but the courtyard is not During our visit there were both cigarette and cigar smokers nearby which pretty well fouled the air in an otherwise delightful venue
Our suite had a very comfortable bed seating refrigerator and microwave oven all clean and good working order Most of the suites face the courtyard and are accessible by both elevators and stairs In addition the lobby and restaurant were attractive and comfortable The full complimentary breakfast provided a wide array of items to choose from and was very good

title: love this hotel
text: I have stayed at this hotel in the halloween time The location is absolutely perfect for clubbar hoppingjust in the heart of gaslamp he rooms are trendy with a modern designclean The fornt desk staff are very polite and helpfull If I got to sand iego back I definitely stay at this hotel The disadvantage is the expensive parking price

title: Nice location for the
text: Yesterday April 4th 2005 I returned from a 3night stay at the Harrington with a group of 5th graders including my daughter from south GA The hotel is old and some group members had problems getting enough heat However the accommodating staff gladly provided a space heater We had 5 in our large room with 4 double beds and a pullout sofa The bath was small and the tub would not drain properly However the staff quickly provided maintenance to unstop it every time Given the location and the price I would stay there again even with the problems The staff were so nice and since we were travelling on foot or by Metro the location was great I didnt eat at Harrys but the Blue Plate Diner offered a great breakfast buffet for those that enjoy that meal Youll enjoy the location and the price if youre not looking for luxury and you want a good deal

title: Corporate parent in trouble
text:
I desperately wanted to like this hotel I like old historic properties and hope to encourage others to stay in them 
This place does indeed have a grand lobby The bar in the lobby is an attractive clubby space but expect to drop 67 for a domestic longneck There really is no excuse for that anywhere although it has become commonplace 
The room was plenty big for one person and the bed and linens were comfortable There was a ceiling fan which was a nice touch
Unfortunately said ceiling fan had not been serviced since its installation in 1985 and it creaked and moaned Also the room had recently been painted And it smelled like it And the windows had been painted shut All of the foregoing was a recipe for a persistent headache
The final straw was the minibar Minibars are a ripoff we all know this This one however set a new low for me There was a service charge of 15 percent on items from the minibar Items which are already marked up considerably    items which you serve yourself Thats just needless piling on and it makes me wonder how badly the parent company is in need of revenue

title: Would Take A Lot To Beat It
text:
We stayed here Dec 5 to 9 2008and were a bit worried after reading earlier reviewsWe arrived early and were checked in and asked to return for our room key at 3pm as stated no problemo
The room was immaculate as was the whole hotel The staff were very helpful and friendly and our corner room on the 43rd floor made our stay amazing The hotel was clean tidy and except slight works ongoing on the front door area the renovations are all complete There was no noise or dirt from the front door works and the back door is so grand that you dont really worry about it THE TURNDOWN SERVICE AND NIGHTLY WEATHER FORECAST WERE A BONUS IN THE ROOM AND IT HAS THE PERFECT LOCATION FOR A GREAT STAY IN THE BIG CITY1010

title: Fantastic base for seeing New York
text: We booked this hotel based on its location as we wanted to be in the centre of all the action and it didnt disappoint The service was just what youd expect in a good hotel and everywhere was spotless and clean We would definitely recommend staying here to anyone coming to the big apple

title: Was a great value when I stayed
text: I stayed here in 2004 and for about 140night including taxes I had been to NYC about 4 times that year and this was by far the best value I was attending a conference in Times Square and I had a leg injury so I needed someplace walking distance This hotel was much better than I expected for the price The room was large huge by NYC standards and very clean I realise things may have changed and we may have been lucky with our room and the rate was really awesome But this hotel would still be one Id check rates at if I were looking for a room in NYC

title: First Class
text:
I booked two nights at this hotel at an exceptionally good price through Hot Wire earlier this year
I ws rather concerned because of the reviews being posted
The hotel is beautful  friendly helpful staff every member  restaurant opened for the first night while we were there  lovely meal well priced
We were upgraded to a lovely room on 29th floor  as it was my husbands birthday we were treated to complimentary sparkling wine and chocolate dipped strawberries on the first night and compliementary sparkling water and fruit and nut platter on the second night  well done Westin
Great location but as our booking stated New York Helmsley there was a little confusion with the taxi driver as the Hotel name is now the Westin  but otherwise no problems at all  thank you

title: Full of history  luxury
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in August with friends of ours We were upgraded due to my friends Hilton Honors status to the Executive Club and were given a beautiful room on the 21st floor His status also provided us with many perks such as access to the lounge The lounge serves pastries cereals coffee tea juices cheese plate yogurts etc for breakfast  all complementary We never had to eat breakfast outside of the hotel During the day it also served brownies which were invented there cookies pop juices and served hors doeuvres every evening from 5pm7pm A fantastic perk 
The hotel is huge We typically are into smaller boutique hotels but this place is beautiful The lobby is the most stunning hotel lobby I have ever seen with the artwork tiffany chandeliers and beautiful ceiling Its a gorgeous spot for a predinner drink There is a Starbucks right in the hotel as well which is nice Location is good steps from an El train stop The large Macys is a block away and the hotel is also close walking distance to Millenium Park and the Art Institute 
Everyone we encountered at the hotel was very helpful and made our stay fantastic We really loved the little history lesson that we learnt while the Palmer House station on TV which gave us a ton of info on the hotel the Palmers and Chicago Very interesting information 
Overall a fantastic stay at a beautiful hotel We will be back

title: Good Location nice hotel
text: valet parking 2500 per day Room was very nice and clean Comfy beds Trying to find the entrance to the hotel was a bit rough Our Ac went out in the middle of the night They gave us free parking in return

title: Great Location Beautiful Room
text: We stayed only one night because we were in town for a fundraiser at the Boston Public Library We wished we could have stayed longer the accomodations were terrific The room is beautifully designed and the bed and linens are exceptional The hotel is quiet the front desk staff is helpful and friendly and the location is perfect for a weekend in Boston We would definitely return and plan to do so soon The next trip will include a visit to the seafood restaurant the description of the oyster sliders will definitely bring us back This hotel is for the money a better value than some of the comparable firstclass hotels because of the service and the room amenities

title: Location
text: This location is hard to beat Great hotel Excellent service BUT beware of the concierge lounge I think everyone gets a pass in or at least it felt that way It was overcrowded and breakfast ends promptly at 930am  needless to say we didnt eat breakfast there as we couldnt even sit down Room was a bit dark and the bathroom was very small with no pressure at all in the shower

title: Perfect Location for Sox Game
text:
No this is not an ultramodern hotel but the staff was great the rooms were neat and clean and for 138night on a Friday night in Boston to see the Sox it was just right The subway is right outside the hotel and it takes 2 minutes to walk to the Common We did not go to Boston for the hotel and if that is what you want this hotel is not for you If you are there to enjoy Boston and want an affordable place to stay I recommend it to you
Also by calling I got a cheaper rate than hotelcom For breakfast I recommend the South St Diner about a 15 minute walk Worth every step and if theres a wait its worth it

title: I Love the W
text:
Thank God for Fatima If it was not for her we would not have closed a 7 million deal week It all started when our corporate office had no meeting rooms So we were staying at the W and Fatima under short notice was able to secure the best meeting place the W had to offer Im forever in her debt 
Thank you 
SW

title: This hotel is cozy and charming and in a great location
text: I stayed here with my mother for a week for medical reasons The staff was polite and very helpful The food was very good and the beds were comfortable The indoor pool is great and the outdoor firepit is cozy and romantic The guys will also enjoy the outdoor TV The bar is fun and has good energy The hotel has a great location Its close to the medical district downtown shopping fine dining and the airport Its also close to the Denver Zoo and other sight seeing and is surrounded by a beautiful neibhborhood and park The Cherry Creek Trail is great and right here as well The hotel even offers bikes if you didnt bring yours Beautiful area with a bonus view of the mountains Its a great value and I would definitely stay here again on future trips

title: SimplyExceptional
text: There truly is no finer hotel to stay in in the entire Detroit area This hotel in fact ranks amongst the nicest Ive stayed in in the entire United States Everyone here must have taken the Four Seasons school of customer service and it shows There was some concern at checkin and check out Lines are a little longer than expected No level of detail has been overlooked in the design of the hotel Everything is modern new fresh and up to date Things are done with a modern flair but it is comfortable and welcoming The rooms are wonderful Complimentary wireless internet firm but comfortable beds flat screen TVs both in the room and the bathroom fluffy bathrobes Ipod docking machines and more The bathrooms have dual sinks a separate toilet area and gigantic walk in showers The rooms are about 500 square feet and are very spacious and comfortable The design is very modern and up to date and as the hotel itself is relatively new things look great The casino of course is the main focus of the hotel and sadly since it allows smoking it can be a bit of a turn off for those of us who dont enjoy second hand smoke The restaurants are okay but extremely overpriced We ate at Bourbon Steak and while it was a good meal the bill came to 250 and thats with just only one glass of wine each Wolfgang Puck for breakfast was a big disappointment and again priced as if you were eating at the Ritz in Paris Also watch out for the valet parking  they put a scratch on our vehicle and it was never resolved The room rates are always quite high so dont expect any bargains here This hotel is for people who can shell out the dough or those who are big players and somehow get their rooms at reduced rates or fully comped If youve got the dough and you want a luxurious atmostphere you have arrived

title: Austin Embassy Suites
text:
The hotel was good 10 minute walk from 6th street However crossing the bridge made some great pics Plenty of good food and shops within a 510 minute walk 
The hotel pool was small but recently updated and it was a nice relaxing area
The room was a bit outdated One of the maintenance guys had to swap out our mini fridge as it didnt work They were very fast in getting it done Reggie was very nice
He told us that the hotel was getting a huge update in the next year So I look forward to seeing

title: Great location good value
text: second stay in 9 mos Free parking clean rooms and bathrooms So close to Fishermans Wharf Walgreens Safeway and Trader Joes within walking distance Rooms a little dated and in need of some bathroom upgrades but the cleanliness and friendly staff make up for it

title: Nice but almost too big for its own good
text:
Let me start by saying that i really enjoyed my stay at the Omni Dallas The only negatives stem from it being a large hotel and at the moment very trendy so it is very busy and crowded As a Omni Select Guest member I bypass the front desk checkin so I cannot comment on that experience
The rooms are very spacious and great floor to ceiling windows looking out to the Dallas skyline As a new hotel everything is clean and up to date The room could have better controls for the lighting since there is a lot of it I think there were at least 6 lamps in the room Also electronic controls for the shades would have been a nice touch The hotel has several options for restaurants and the Owners Box sports bar was great
I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone but just know that it is likely to have a bit of a hectic feel to the main areas of the hotel

title: Nice hotel in midtown
text: My 15yearold daughter and I spent five days in Manhattan and stayed at the Affinia Shelburne Its a nice property with comfortable rooms and trendy decor Our room had a microwave and mini fridge which were useful conveniences Affinia proudly offers a pick your pillow option and my daughter loved her choice which allowed her to listen to music while falling asleep Service was mixed  there was no stopper for the tub and it took three phone calls over an hour before one was delivered Also some items in the minibar were outofdate We enjoyed the hotel overall

title: Good Location Great Price
text:
Just returned from a stay at the Surfer during the last week of April for 3 nights Its a great hotel for the price  you cant beat the location we had a room on the 3rd floor with an ocean view there are some rooms that dont face the ocean but we resquested an ocean view room when we made our reservations  got exactly what we requested we kept the curtins open almost the whole time just admiring the view from our room we also kept the sliding door half open with the screen shut  never experienced any problems with noise just the sound of the waves in the ocean the room was very clean the bed was comfortable their rooms are nicely remodeled  very modern looking the only complaint that i did have was that the shower is made for shorter people i have read this issue in a previous post so i knew what to expect im 57  i did have to bend down a bit when washing my hair but it really wasnt a major problem the surfer was like a 10 min drive from everything i would totally recommend this hotel for someone who is looking for a hotel on the ocean and close to all tourist attractions in san diego 
thanks surfer for making our trip to san diego very memorable

title: Really Liked It esp vs Chicago Intercontinental
text:
I was in Chicago staying at the Intercontinental on Michigan Avenue and had to change hotels abruptly when the Intercon lost my reservation for the last night of a conference I was attending My secretary got me a standard room last minute at the Fairmont I was skeptical and in a bad mood anyway via Intercon experience but was very pleasantly surprised
For 329 corp rate I received a 33rd floor suite with a view of Lake Michigan The room was spotless and homeycool  think West Elm decor The lobby and reception area are cool and peaceful with a wine bar right in the center Even got a chance to try the hotel restaurant  Aria  which was excellent except for clueless service bringing everything at oncewhat But the food is quite good and left me wanting to try it again  warm nanlike bread with dipping sauces to start gratis a nice touch
Beds v comfortable better that Heavenly Westin beds wellstocked minibar and welcome basket full of goodies extra charge  even the chamber service was friendly  my evening service person actually came in to do the turndown and chatted with me for a couple of seconds unobtrusively which I appreciated traveling alone
I though the Fairmont would be a stodgy choice but I am a fan and convert Would definitely stay here again Great service calmingsoothing atmosphere everythings buttoned down  first class

title: Great Lobby
text:
Wonderful location fun lobby bar and friendly service 
My room  Half the lighting didnt work so I moved the bed aside to see if light was plugged in and found dust bunnies two remotes and a half inch of filth Freshly painted bathroom ceiling but paintercleaner left globs of paint in the tub Wish these hotels could pay attention to the little things

title: The hotel and the staff were amazingly welcoming
text:
The hotel stay was wonderfulWe had a girls weekend in San Antonio with friends we hadnt seen in years The staff was incredibly welcoming and friendly 
Several of the employees made us feel right at home One in particular I believe his name was Marques He was exceptionally friendly helpful and professional with all that we needed The front guest services went over and beyond to accomodate to our need I have stayed at hotels where the Valet is not so friendly Not the case at all  they were great and fast 
Overall  excellent hotel to stay at if youre visiting the San Antonio area 
Thank you La Cantera for making our girls weekend a blast

title: Good value great location
text:
Four of us two couples stayed for four nights in two double rooms We found the hotel to be in a great location walking distance to many of the sights youll want to see and a subway station right next door for those further away
All staff were very helpful particularly concierge and our rooms were great Small but clean We found the rooms to be very quiet 1743  1744 They faced inwards to another section of the hotel so no view but no noise from the streets outside Given that all you do there is sleep and shower they were perfectly OK
Given that we paid not much more than 500 per person for return flight from the UK and 4 nights stay Ebookers we felt that we had great value for money If you want a posh hotel expect to pay posh prices
Carnegie Deli across the road and the deli that is attached to the hotel cant remember the name sorry both did fab breakfasts The deli on the opposite corner to the hotel was great for late night cocktails and food
All in all a great hotel but judging from other reviews it probably depends on the room you have The only thing that would have improved our stay would have been tea  coffee making faciltiies in the room

title: Perfect hotel in a perfect location
text: The rooms at this hotel are simply beautiful The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever stayed in other than my own and the decor is beautiful Everything from the huge flat screen tv king size bed cute bathroom spacious closet and storage space was perfect The heating was also great in the cool weather I guess my only tiny gripes were the pressure of the shower head being really weak and the lack of bar fridge although there was an ice facility close by The location was fantastic being only a 5 minute walk from Macys Union Square and 10 minutes from the Westfield Shopping Mall I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone considering a stay in San Francisco

title: Really nice stay
text: Had an absolutely wonderful stay here The hotel is one step ahead of the flash of some of the party hotels The vibe is very understated cool this hotel doesnt need to inyourface about it We had a lovely corner room king on the 12th with a great view especially from the giant bathtub Staff was very helpful and relaxed in a good way Would definitely return here

title: Avoidable but for the location
text:
To start with the good thingsin fact perhaps the only good thingthe location of this hotel is really nice On the Union Square right near the Macys and otehr shops etc
Regarding the other stuff the hotel is really run down the rooms and lobby badly need a renivationthe staff a lot of training
Go there if you must only for the location but for all else look elsewhere

title: Personal Item that was left in room  no where to be found
text: I left a white night shirt on the bed in my hotel room After I checked out I stopped back in  called  talked to the housekeeping staff so I could pick it up and no one seems to knows anything about my night shirt and did not even seem to care

title: No Bed Bugs in my room on Oct 2225 2011
text: We just flew home to Chicago after a few days in Boston We stayed at the Harborside and had a wonderful visit The hotel is in the middle of EVERYTHING Trolleys harbor and Quincy Market is one half block away The North End is within walking distance The location of this hotel CAN NOT be beat This hotel is clean and wonderful and guess whatI flew home without ONE SINGLE bed bug bite Dont beleive all you read on this site this hotel is WONDERFUL and highly recommeded

title: Comfortable at Comfort Suites
text:
I had a king suite which included a 6counter with sink refrig microwave small table along with a living area with pull out couch chair and tv The bedroom also has a tv and two doors one to the bathroom and the other to the living area The bathroom was spacious but with only basic amenities Rooms were clean Although the hotel is wireless there is a small businness area with computer Fitness area has only 3 machines and there is a hot tub  no pool Breakfast starts at 6 but if you leave early there is coffee and danish in the lobby Down the street are a few other hotel chains and restaurants
If you dont have a car there is a diner next door and they also
share a shuttle with 2 other hotels For the money its fine for a stopover either to or from the airport

title: brilliant hotel
text:
This was our first trip to NYwe stayed 7 nights at The Fairfield bb and had a great time
The breakfast was good and with lots of choice
The rooms were small for NY but spotless and had everything you needed  the shower was more like a wetroom  it was great
We didnt have much of a view from our room  we were on the 9th floor I think it went up to around 18 floors but I did request a high room when booking after reading these reviews
But we soon got used to it and after all you dont spend that much time in your room
The staff were all so polite and helpful nothing was any trouble at all for them
Outside the hotel on the street is awash with flower shops its a lovely area
I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone who wanted to stay in NY

title: Helpful  Honest Housekeeping Staff
text:
We stayed at this hotel for one night this fall The hotel is within walking distance to many tourist sites and so its good option for a vacation stay The rooms are pretty standard but comfortable I didnt like the entrance driveway setup Its all driveway and you have to dodge cars and valets to get into the main entrance There is also a pretty hefty charge for the wireless internet inroom access
But I was quite impressed by the housekeeping staff I left my ipod charging cord plugged into the wall and not only did they find it they mailed it back to me Yeah

title: Greatest hotel in Dallas
text: This is the nicest place Ive ever stayed in Dallas The hotel is great and the service was beyond all my expectations It was competively priced but gave the same service you would get at much more exclusive and expensive properties I will always choose them first when in Dallas

title: Nice hotel for airport convenience
text: My husband and I flew to Arizona for a long weekend to visit the Grand Canyon and other parks in the northern part of the state We arrived in Phoenix rather late and had a very early flight on the return so wanted to stay near the airport on either end of the trip We selected the Fairfield because of its proximity to the airport the complimentary shuttle and of course Trip Advisor reviews We were not disappointed The hotel staff were all very nice Jake and Jenny at the front desk and Mark and Tim driving the shuttle The room and the property were clean the bed was very comfortable and overall it was very quiet However if youre looking for a lively atmosphere then Tempe home of Arizona State University is only 3 miles away There were also plenty of restaurants there as well Unfortunately if you dont have a car as we didnt at the end of our trip since wed turned it back in your choices are limited which could be a negative However the shuttle drivers even though its not advertised and I doubt you could demand this service were kind enough to drive us the three miles which worked out great In short for a clean quiet and convenient place thats close to Sky Harbor International I would recommend this hotel

title: Very pleased with the Kimberly
text:
My cousin and I stayed 6 nights at the Kimberly in a 1 bedroom on the 26th floor The beds were wonderful the best Ive found in New York  including The Plaza The furniture was a bit worn but fine The room was very quiet and the balcony was an added plus
The door staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was in a good location near the subway and many great restaurants
I will definately stay at The Kimberly again

title: Loved our Stay at Days Inn at Graceland
text: This was our 2nd visit to Memphis and stayed at the Days Inn for 2 weeks Previously we had stayed at The Heartbreak Hotel We thought the Days Inn was much nicer and a more pleasant experience Breakfast is included and is cereals fruit juice tea and coffee toast muffins etc and freshly made waffles It is all selfservice which is very good The location is excellent if you are an Elvis fan and the pool area was always very clean and tidy The staff are very helpful The only criticism we could make is that our room was too close to the ice vending machine and can be quite noisy early in the morning There was a door which closes off the machine but it was usually left open It is only nit picking really because in general the whole Days Inn at Graceland experience has been a great one

title: Last minute reservation at the Hilton Garden Inn
text: We were lucky to get a reservation in SA Our trip was a spure of the moment trip to San Antonio to visit SeaWorld during Spring Break Need I say more This hotel is located close to the SA airport Downtown and the Riverwalk was 10 minutes away while SeaWorld was 25 minutes There was road construction surrounding the hotel area but it did not cause much problem The property was well maintained while the swimming pool was small in size This property ended up being booked a few days before our arrival The staff was friendly and helpful

title: Prepare to be indulged
text: Super happy with this hotel Reasonably priced AND perks like free happy hour cookies and milk and breakfast buffet Cant wait to come back

title: We will come again
text:
This was our first time in New York  all our previous city breaks have been to historical European cities  and whilst we were excited at the prospect there was some nervousness too Would we enjoy such a densley packed modern city The omens werent great when our Taxi from the airport was pulled over by the police for jumping a red light just after we arrived on Manhattan Island
It was a real relief therefore to arrive in the lobby of the Affinia Dumont to be greeted by friendly and helpful staff who immediately put us at ease Weve got a great room for you they told us  and we agree we were in an Lshaped 21st floor junior studio with great views of the Chrysler Building and across the East river The room was spacious with a decent bathroom and a small kitchen with a huge fridge Although by no means the fanciest or newest hotel room weve ever stayed in the room was very comfortable and we couldnt fault the cleanliness of the room or hotel generally Id have to say that the room was great value
The location is great we walked almost everywhere but its no problem to catch the subway or get a cab Although theres no Hotel restaurant the Barking Dog on the ground floor of the building offered good quality reasonably priced food and friendly service echoing that in the hotel itself Having a gym and spa helped us to relax after each hectic days sightseeing and our time in New York flew by Too quickly in fact  Well just have to visit again and when we do well stay at the Affinia Dumont

title: Great hotel
text: Have just spent 3 nights at the Waldorf Astoria we have nothing but praise for this great hotel We stayed in a minisuite on the 8th floor and although we didnt really get a view the room itself was fantastic The bed was very very comfortable and the two bathrooms were both perfect On booking in the receptionist noticed I had requested foam pillows due to a fgeather allergy and said she would get our room defeathered we had only just arrived at the room when the foam pillows arrived closely followed by a maid to sort out the room fantastic service Having read some past reviews on this site we were also apprehensive about staying at the Waldorf Astoria but felt we should give it a go and are very glad we did

title: Not bad for the money  take away the uninvited crawlers and it would rate a 5 star
text: First I want to say that for the 49 discount these rooms were great except for the univited crawlers We did see cockroaches on the wall and I alerted the desk They sent two different people up within 3 min of my call to spray the room I live in Florida and know it is very hard to keep the insects out Everything else was 5 star treatment from the front desk girl to the server in the Lounge Florencia who all treated us with great smiles and friendly atmospheres The maids did a good job during our 2 day stay and I have stayed there in the mid 2000 and will stay there again but will carry my own roach spray with me Clean up the bugs and it would be great The pool needs to be heated in the winter also Beautiful decor for the Christmas season I wanted to take the decorator home with me

title: We loved it
text: After reading the reviews of the Boston Park Plaza I was very much doubting myself for making reservations there Not only for myself but for five other people  I was pleasantly surprised that our rooms were very clean the staff were great and very helpful It is also a perfect location and the 200 menu at McCormicks restaurant cant be beat We also had a formal dinner there that was wonderful The next time I go to Boston I will stay there again

title: Happy in Seattle
text:
Great value in this hotel
Not in the downtown core but able to walk everywhere
Safe area to walk at night
Enjoyed the quality of LaQuinta Great room and quality breakfast Service was excellent
Able to walk downtown shop and comfortable walk back
Just below the Belltown area of Seattle Lots of funky stores and places to eat

title: Average dirty room good location
text: We chose the Sheraton for the location We did pay more for a deluxe king and while the view was fantastic the room was dirty and very dated with no fridge or safe Real shame I wouldnt recommend this hotel

title: Really Average
text:
We a couple stayed there 2 nights and I wont repeat it 
The pros  
1 Price 85tax a night
2 Comfy bed and the room looks clean towels and sheets too
3 Free parking  ask to park in the nearby parking lot saves a lot of trouble other people described here about parking
4 The location is very comfortable if youre mainly planning to visit hollywood
And for the cons  
1 the breakfast its coffe and a donut I dont consider this breakfast
2 The Wifi Internet was awful slow and hardly working For me its an important utility in a hotel
3 The blankets were old and I had a disturbing feeling of fleas though never seen any
4 The room itself was very dark  lighting not sufficient
If youre planning to travel and not stay in the room a lot  this is a decent one to consider

title: Loved it
text: Everything about this hotel was brilliant Welcome service room facilities breakfast wine reception 24 hr coffee and iced water Couldnt fault at all

title: Great location on an ugly street
text:
This is the perfect hotel if you are in town to go to Broadway shows You can easily walk the 8 or 10 blocks to most theatres However this stretch of 40th Street backs on the main bus terminal  not attractive and the streets nearby are always elbow to elbow crowded You might want to stay uptown or downtown if you want to leave your hotel go for a leisurely stroll then stop at a nice outdoor cafe for a coffee and croissant
The hotel itself is WONDERFUL The rooms are nice good beds good bathrooms the windows open very clean The staff is very friendly helpful and knowledgeable My only complaint is the minibar  always a problem for hotels The solution in this case is one of those Youtouchit youve boughtit models which leaves no room to put your own cold drinks or food Too bad when the minibar selection is not great and there is a Dean and Deluca one block away We prefer the solution of hotels like Ottawas Westin  take out all their things and just post a note saying We thought you might like this fridge for your stuff

title: Great first impression
