text: We stayed for 3 nights this past week basing our decision only on the reviews weve read The Moderne was exactly what we hoped it would be Clean walking distance to Times Square Broadway restaurants and the staff was very accommodating Yes the rooms are small but thats part of The Modernes charm It has about 40 rooms total and our room was nicely decorated as was the coffee room on the second floor which we really enjoyed Yes the elevator is somewhat slow and hot A few times we walked the stairs for exercise The mattress was extra comfortable and we detected no noise at night A great place to call home after long days of seeing the sites We were so glad we stayed there

title: On the road to Texas
text: We stayed at this hotel on Monday night 21 May This place had courteous staff upon arrival and our departure Very easy to get to and reenter at I40 Room was very clean pet friendly and had a quiet AC system which you received a great night without hearing a window unit running all night Breakfast was great We couldnt say enough When we are in the area again we would definitely stay here

title: Great facilities good location great service ok gym and breakfast
text:
Stayed there with sister and friend and had a very enjoyable stay
Within a 10minute run from the Smithsonian museums along which I ran for a total of 5 miles or so  from hotel to Lincoln Memorial and back
Service is awesome at the Marriott  as usual room spacious and clean As usual I was received with fruits and chose a bottle of fizzy wine
Metro at footsteps plenty of taxis quite centric I would choose it again
Gym was all right  usual Lifefitness equipment but felt a bit too dark  pool a bit small and crowded
Breakfast was just ok  nothing that great compared to that in other Marriott hotels  limited selection of cereals omelets a bit too oily etc

title: Door lock issue for little ones
text: This is an add on to my previous review We never noticed this but our daughter and family spent two nights there with our grandsons ages 7 and 5 There are no deadlocks on the doors to prevent little ones from exiting the room Since the two sleeping areas are on opposite ends of the suite separated by a bathroom and if parents are in sound sleep from a day of exploring they might not hear if an early riser child should get inquisitive and head out Since our 5 year old is on the Sprectrum this created some anxiety about sleeping arrangements The resort hotel is outstanding but this glitch could be fixed easily and without a lot of cost

title: Modern clean and a great location
text:
I stayed at the ATT Conference Center Hotel and loved it from the valet service at checkin to the impeccably clean and modernly furnished guest rooms my experience at this hotel rivaled that of other MUCH higherpriced hotels in downtown Austin 
 The valetbellman swarmed my car upon arrival they were polite  helpful though a little slow getting the bags to my room Slow I can handle if its accompanied by a genuine smile They seemed to enjoy their jobs immensely quite a difference from the typical valetbellman
 The room was beautiful tiny bathroom but it offered a large enough separate sink area always HUGELY convenient when multiple people stay in a room as compensation The room smelled a little musty upon checkin but that was nothing a travel candle couldnt fix 
 The conference facilities were neat clean modern and within walking distance from several great restaurantsnightlife options
 Overall my stay at the conference center hotel was fantastic I will definitely consider this hotel when staying in Austin in the future

title: Be a Select Guest and reep the benefits
text:
I took my 18 year old niece for a 3 day weekend trip to New York City for her high school graduation Ive been to New York 6 times within the last couple of years and like to try different hotels in Manhattan After realizing the prices were definitely much higher than my last visit I decided to try Hotwire I landed the Omni for 237 per night Other hotels I was considering were in the 300 range so I was pleased with the rate and hotel chosen I stayed at the Omni about 8 years ago and truly loved the location We were treated very well by the front desk personnel upon checkin We arrived at 10 am and still one of our rooms was ready The rooms are relatively small but nicely appointed My stay at the New York Palace last year included a room twice the size of the Omnis The bed was comfortable with top of the line linens The bathroom was functional and elegant with a marble shower and granite countertop We had unimpressive views from both rooms I overlooked St Patricks Cathedral from my room at the Palace The housekeeping staff was efficient and helpful The most important point to share about the Omni is their Select Guest program I signed up for this free program after making my reservation I received a Select Guest card in the mail with various coupons that included room upgrades and 50 my next Omni weekend stay As a Select Guest member you receive complimentary morning drinks delivered to your room a newspaper of your choosing late checkout until 5 pm when available and preferences noted of your pillow type and floor youd like to be on in all Omni hotels I was thrilled with these perks I enjoyed freshly squeezed orange juice and hot tea each morning and the New York Times I also utilized the late checkout since our flight didnt leave until 7 pm Most importantly Ive noticed that when other travelers book their rooms through a discounter like Hotwire or Priceline when they checkin they are treated like Hobos on holiday As I said our front desk person treated us kindly and respectfully She was a great introduction to New York for my niece who had never visited this fine city before 
Overall we had a wonderful time The hotel is centrally located The rooms are nice and clean Ive stayed at the Palace the Benjamin and The Waldorf Astoria The Palace is my favorite but the Omni still ranks high in my book If you decide to stay at the Omni you MUST be a Select Guest

title: Great place with a family
text:
HeyIf your looking for an good family place to stay I recommend the Dana Inn and MarinaIt was the perfect place if you are going to Seaworld It is close by and they have a shuttle Even if you take a taxi it would only cost you 4 bucks The rooms were small and the washroom was okHowever the restaurant was very friendly and room service was wonderful An added feature is the poolThey have games during the day and blow toys all the time We took our own however we did not need them I have stayed at the Paradise Point resort near Seaworld in Mission bay and the Dana Inn beats them hands down They were friendlier and accommodating The water in the pool is warm as wellThey really make it a point to win your kids over That is a plus I dont think my kids notices the roomAfter going to Seaworld and playing at the pool all afternoon and evening they pass out triedIt allowed my wife and I to have a vacation beer Incidentally you can see the Seaworld fireworks located near the resorts dock starts at 950pm It is cool everybody standing around looking and going oooooooooo and ahhhhhhh Funny Kids had a blast Check it out once 
Down the street is another amusement part as well I think it is call Baymont Plus the ocean you gotta check it out No they did not pay me This is one parent to another

title: Great Location What I Expected
text:
One of the great things about Tripadvisor reviews is that you are fully prepared for the good and the bad at any property you might reserve That was certainly the case for our three night stay at the Westin St Francis Overall I would say that we got a very good value for our money and had a great stay at the St Francis We especially liked the location
We booked online and got their 3 nights for the price of 2 special So we paid about 500 for three nights in a historic building room with 2 double beds overlooking Union Square from a high floor I chose the historic wing as my son and I have a fear of heights and worried we wouldnt do well on the glass elevator you use to go to the tower rooms The tradeoff is that even on a high floor you can hear the noise from Union Square and Powell St through the windows Not terrible unless you are a light sleeper
The room wasnt large but was fine for the four of us The bathroom is updated with marble and a double shower which was great One complaint is that Westin tries to save money on amenities by only providing the basics shampoo conditioner soap You must call their service hotline for any others eg I needed a shower cap They are prompt with that service but I found it a bit surprising We also had an issue with the feather and down bedding allergies but they quickly fixed that for us
As others here have said dont open the fridge unless you want to be charged for something We did bought a bottle of wine and had to have the charges removed at check out easy to do
I would also agree with others that there is little dresser space for unpacking maybe four narrow drawers I didnt bother unpacking anywhere on the trip but it would have been a pain if I had wanted to
We had no problem with check in or out since we arrived late and departed early It did however look horrendous during late afternoon someone on the elevator told us it took him an hour to check in
We didnt use the gym or the Oak Room We did enjoy coffee and bagelsmuffins in the lobby area which opened at 6 am great when your body is still on East Coast time Loved the elegance of the old hotel Great location for touring We even rented a Hertz rental car for a day of touring right from the Hertz desk in the hotel The agent was extremely helpful and efficient
All in all a great stay And yes the candid photos on this website tell the story

title: Mixed feelings
text:
Most of the service was good Bellhops are working for an expected tip though theyre nice The staff at the registration desk were cold and seemed to have a bit of an attitude
The room had very low light so even with all the lights on oddly placed within the room it was still poor light I ordered room service once but had my laptop at the desk so there was no convenient place to put the tray I put it on the ottoman Not the best way to eat breakfast but at least I didnt have to leave the room
The Wifi came at a charge I dont understand how people can still charge for Wifi when its so common and inexpensive overall Should be complimentary especially at a luxury hotel
I guess that brings me to the next thought which is that this hotel is for old stuffy people It doesnt claim to be trendy or fun and it isnt It does claim to evoke a sense of history and timeless grandeur If you like that great there is a place in everyones life for all that Not for me Im still under 50 I was aging x2 every day I stayed in the hotel
The Cafe Promenade served delicious food for the price it is expected
I stayed 6 nights Heard at least 6 motorcades roaring through the street with a dozen or more police cars ambulances and tactical vehicles disguised as SUVs with the back hatch open Must have been a busy week for the whitehouse I guess you cant really get away from that unless you stay away from downtown
I bring my own hair products with me when I travel This hotel purchased from lathercom for their shampoo conditioner and moisturizer The line claims they are in high end boutiques spas and department stores but Im not sold on their products They do smell good though
Overall I would look at staying elsewhere on my next visit There surely has to be a better experience that combines luxury with a little fun and life in DC

title: Not what I expected
text: Not 4 star in my opinion Lobby impressive thats about it Room decor was below average Hotel did not have correct room accomodation but not sure if that was Bookitcoms fault or the hotels Requested 2 beds in one bedroom suite and a pull out sofa as we were 3 women that wanted to sleep separately Got one bed the pull out and a roll away which was like sleeping in a tree Location good as 3 blocks to subway and near Penn Station Kitchenette had no toaster and an awful coffee maker so thank goodness Dunkin Donuts was just downstairs outside the door Refrigerator is nice to have and should always be in rooms Probably would not stay here again

title: Great location
text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during the Festival of Lights We checked in on Friday a little before 300 pm and our room was ready The rooms are a lot bigger than what other people are saying in their reviews We had a King sized bed with too die for sheets and pillows and the mattress is just heaven Is the hotel older yes but thats the charm in this hotel Elevators were not a problem at all they are small but we never had to wait The staff is very eager to please their guests Sully the doorman is a wonderful man just wanted to add that as my husband and I enjoyed talking with him I would recommend this to anybody who enjoys ambience and charm Thank you Whitehall Hotel

title: Great location
text: Great location clean hotel We thoroughly enjoyed our stay No complaints or problems at all with the hotel When back in Chicago will definitely plan on staying there again

title: Great
text:
Ill start with the quick and dirty
1Easy to find Great location
2Alamo and National rental car return right across the street Same as the parking garage
3Computer and WiFi available in the lobby
4Cable car stop is at the corner
5Excellent housekeeping
6Best price for the area
We booked The Grant because of all the positive reviews others posted about this location Now we dont expect a lot from our hotel so we figured that for the price we would be very happy We were It was a basic no frills place to lay our heads Sure there is limited cable tv and yes it is right next to an alternative adult entertainment facility but it is also two blocks from Chinatown one block from a bus stop that linked us to everywhere and steps away from the cable car that took us to Market and Fishermans Wharf I dont think the location could have been better There was also a laundry mat if you need one just a couple of doors away
They gave us the room pictured in the brochure facing the street Knowing about the noise volume from the street and the open windows we had taken ear plugs I highly recommend them even if you dont think you will get the room facing the street There is a garbage truck that visits at 4 AM and traffic starts early as well but fortunately in May the weather is cold enough to keep the windows shut and still be comfortable 
The staff was friendly from our email correspondence and booking to our arrival and stay I felt very safe and comfortable while we were there It was definitely a multicultural environment as well We met many fabulous and friendly people from all over the world
We didnt have any of the breakfast pastries they supplied but we had a minifridge in our room and there was a Walgreens one block away so we bought cereal and milk for our breakfast They also had a microwave in the lobby
This hotel truly met all our expectations and served us well

title: Great concierge
text: I love this hotel And I stay in a lot of hotels I am quite partial to Westins The rooms are spacious and have nice appointments The hotel staff was fabulous from checkin to check out Extremely professional helpful and friendly One particular associate Thi Nguyen definitely exceeded my expectations She works at the concierge desk and is personable friendly and caring She had a line of peoplebut still took time to work with each and every guest answer every question with a smile She would introduce herself and make herself available for future requests as well I had to visit her several times during my visit and she was always upbeat and positive

title: Nice Hotel Great amenities Close to everything
text:
The Eventi is the second Kimpton hotel that we have stayed at The first was 70 Park Ave which is a slightly different style of hotel but no less friendly with great amenities
The room we stayed in at the Eventi was the King with city view The washroom was a nice marble floored and tiled room The only issue was that the floor was quite slippery Due to the design of the shower which is open to the rest of the bathroom water tends to get pretty much all over the bathroom if you are a messy showerer
The rooms were clean beds were well appointed with nice linens double curtains individual climate control a little noisy and the lighting was variable and well done
Otherwise everything worked and there were nice italian bath products provided
All the basic amenities were provided including robes and a generous closet safe and fridge There is nowhere other than the bed and one chair to sit so this definitely isnt a room to be hanging out in but New York is not a place to hang out in your hotel room anyway
The location at 6th ave and 35th street is a few blocks from Penn Station and not far from any subway or bus Shopping is limited around the area but since its Manhattan nothing is very far away
The FoodParc restaurant on the ground floor is very handy and has a great variety of different types of cuisine at reasonable prices There are lots of other food options in the area The in hotel Spanish BarBasque restaurant is excellent as well One of the best in hotel restaurants that we have experienced There was a summer prix fixe menu on when we were there in August which was excellent value Some may find the prices high but the food was delicious and well prepared with decent portion sizes The staff was very friendly and helpful with our 2 year old too
We didnt use the business centre or the fitness centre so we cant attest to the amenities there
I would definitely recommend the Kimpton to anyone especially those looking for a premium hotel in NYC

title: Royalty at the Palace
text:
My Fiancee and I stayed at the New York Palace to celebreate a birthday As it was our first stay in New York and a special occasion
we chose the Palace based on location reviews and recommendations
WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED
For anyone travelling from the UK wanting to be treated special feel safe be close to most major attractions I can only recommend this hotel
Upon checking in we requested a view overlooking the Cathedral The ever efficient staff gave us a room on the 27th floor overlooking the Cathedral one word AMAZING
The location of this hotel is great one avenue off 5th shopping heaven a 10 minute walk to Central Park Rockefeller Centre Times Square just a few minutes further the rooms are clean large and very well furnished the staff are very helpful and the surroundings the courtyard very inviting
If we come back to New York we will definitely be staying here again

title: Pricey for what you get
text: This was our first visit to San Fran and we decided to take a shot in the dark and stay at the Hotel Carlton First off the rooms are very small and no AC the windows do open for some downtown fresh air Limited towels Noisy streets and lots of sirens There was a laundry shoot right by room could always here something being thrown down it Heavy doors so you hear lots of slamming If your looking for a quick breaky but average quality then eat there They charge 3440 a night for offsite parking and you have to call the front desk and order your vehicle and wait 3045 minutes for it to arrive OH and you have to tip the guy each time The elevators are very small and take a lot of time to arrive as well I suggest you use the stairs There are no ameneties at this hotel either no pool or fitness area The front end staff were nice and helpful and the hotel was Pet friendly but I probably wouldnt stay here again

title: Worst place in NYC to stay
text:
The location is wonderful and unfortunately that is best thing I can say about this hotel The extremely small rooms with even smaller bathrooms is not one I can recommend to anyone for the price The staff did try to accommodate us but the skunk like smell out of order acheating units and 4 power outages this hotel was just horrible I experienced staff at the front desk yelling at patrons for booking rooms through 3rd parties such as Expedia Priceline etc Due to acheating unit going out in our room the staff offered to raise the windows comp our dinner give us a 10 discount bring a fan to our room which too stopped working and comp our last nights stay in the hotel per the manger which did not happen This hotel is over priced  at best a 12 hotel If you want location stay here because that is the only plus to staying at this hotel 
Never recommend this hotel to my friends

title: Room shabby chic  didnt live up to its reputation for either quality or service
text: My partner and I stayed at the Carlyle for a friends wedding that was taking place in the hotel Whilst the ground floor of the hotel is undoubtedly impressive the rarefied or snooty atmosphere leaves one feeling slightly uncomfortable Our room on the 8th floor could best be described as shabby chic It had obviously once been a very nice room but was in dire need of a makeover We ventured into the hotel bar to find that there was a 50 dollar cover charge just to sit down not including drinks  needless to say we didnt stay Even if I were extremely wealthy I dont think I would welcome being ripped off in this way However my friends wedding was perfect in every way from the ceremony to the service and food so the Carlyle redeemed itself there However I wouldnt be keen to return and certainly wouldnt recommend it Reading through some of the other recent reviews it is clear that many others have had a similar experience and I cant help thinking that there are a number of issues that the Carlyles management needs to address as a matter of urgency if the hotel is to hang on to its reputation

title: Great hotel in great location
text: Stayed at this hotel while in NYC Hotel is clean cosy and welcoming with a classic decor staff are also welcoming and friendly The location is also hard to beat being close to broadway the subway and reasonably close to Central Park Price seemed reasonable for the location but the room was a bit smaller than what we would have liked couple  6 yr old and with three suitcases we had to place one on the floor near the door since there was no where else to put it Prices for food and services seemed a little steep not sure how they compare with other hotels in the city but we found a diner only a few doors down which had good food at good prices Hotel would suit a couple who only intend to use it as a base and dont intend spending much time there but being in NYC thats not hard to do A positive experience overall

title: Loved it
text: Great Hotel Loved the location and the rooms It is in Union Square which is great for shopping nightlife and trolly tours The bed was amazingly confortable and the room was well decorated The staff was wonderful as well I will be back

title: Great location amazing service older hotel
text: Took my fiancee to Chicago for her birthday We wanted to stay on Michigan Ave so we grabbed a room at the Intercontinental The staff was amazing Marcus at the front desk got us a room on the 22nd floor with an incredible view of Michigan Ave Keenan helped us with our bags twice and was very nice I had mentioned to both he and Marcus that it was my fiancees birthday and when we got back to the room from our night out they had left birthday cake Really made the visit extra special The room itself is nice if a bit older and in need of a little tlc Weve also stayed at the main competitor to the Intercontinental the Conrad Hilton down the street The room was probably nicer at the Conrad but you cant beat the service level that we had at the Intercontinental Be aware that valet parking only option that I saw is 57 a night

title: Clean and lots of food options nearby
text:
My wife and I stayed two nights at this Comfort Inn location Before I left I asked for a fridge in the room but I guess my note was not received or understood The clerk told me that it was 10 and wheeled out a fridge from the front desk area I had to wheel it to the elevator and plug it in myself Not a complaint but little things like this matter to me and make all the difference to a stay for me There was mold in the fridge but I didnt want to lug it all the way down again and I was tired We cleaned it best we could The rooms were comfortable and very clean we got a king sized bed The breakfast is the usual waffles cereals coffee eggs bacon bagels toast and was always a good stock of items Front desk staff were nice
The hallways are loud like most hotels People can be quite loud and inconsiderate sometimes especially late at night
It is 5 minutes from Fort Harrison State Park Walmart can be seen from the room window along with many restaurants Applebees Bob Evans Marcos Pizza Steak and Shake There was a pool in the hotel that looked clean but small looked sized for children High speed internet is free and quite fast

title: cute cozy clean  classy
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in June 2012 and it was a great experience The hotel staff was extremely friendly the lobby was clean and comfortable and even though the room was on the smaller side we had a king bed and great street views The hotel is walking distance to some awesome restaurants many historical sites and a 7 cab ride to kenmore square  fenway The front desk offered us great restaurant  night life suggestions and helped us in planning our sightseeing Compared to some other hotels in the back bay area the price was just right Allinall I give this hotel 45 out of 5

title: Smooth no surprises
text: Ive stayed here several times for meetingsbusiness Each time its been a smooth nosuprise stay Checkineasy RoomMarriott standard decorclean wired internet free if you are in their rewards program Room servicefast reliable reasonably priced Location is greatliterally connected to the Metro If you are looking for a nodrama experience look no further

title: Service off
text:
Unlike the other reviewers on this site did not have a great experience with the service Called for toothpaste and soap and they only brought the soap Called the next day for a razor for my wife and after 45 minutes of waiting I finally went and got it myself it was sitting at the front desk with my room number on it waiting
When checking out they would not give me a receipt because they said I had booked through travelocitywhich I hadnt And anyway why cant I still have a receipt Receptionist was just cold and unhelpful about it  left a bad taste in the mouth
For the rest the room was all right but nothing special  the desk and chair were a bit nicer than the ones at the Motel 6 but everything else was the same Air conditioner in particular was a crummy against the wall unit instead of a central thermostat and I do not think that our filter had been changed recently 
Did I mention that the hotel is really expensive like almost twice the price of everything else in the area Youre paying for the extra service  the other hotels in the area dont have a front desk bellman who will bring you stuff  a bit nicer room and room service but since my service was no good my room was not really nicer and I never had room service I did not see the value
Still good looking property and you can certainly do worse no bugs no loud noises etc but you can also do better

title: Best stay ever
text: Everyone was very nice When we needed help with something they helped with a smile on their face the rooms were very clean and made my stay here enjoyable i cant wait to visit again and stay in the same hotel

title: Great location good service
text: We stayed 3 nights at The InterContinental Century City over new years eve 20112012 and we are super satisfied with everything The service was great and the location being close to West Hollywood Beverly Hills and the coast is the best place to stay The hotel should however consider upgrading the finish of some public areas and some rooms if they want to claim their fame

title: Great Hotel in New York Theater District
text: We saw good reviews for this hotel in NYC and booked it for 3 nights prior to a cruise The hotel is older but in very good shape Our room was quite roomy by New York standards There was round the clock coffee tea and hot chocolate in the lobby which was handy The breakfast was a fairly standard Hampton Inn breakfast but it did have waffles eggs and a meat each morning It was only a block from Broadway and 7 blocks from Central Park Walking to the park or shows was very easy The price which while high for a Hampton Inn was very competitive for this quality of a Hotel in the area

title: Great Place to Call Home
text: I have been traveling to Houston for business each week since April Each time Im there I stay at the Renaissance The staff there couldnt be better It only took a few times for them to know my name The personalized attention is great but the hotel itself is spectacular I would recommend it to anyone

title: Mostly loved it but beds were a problem
text: We knew it was going to be an older resort hotel so our expectations were set correctly What we didnt expect was how perfect the location is for a quiet familyfriendly relaxation vacation On one side is the private beach and marina and on the other is the bay and a strip of public park that we didnt want to leave We sat in the lawn chairs we brought and took our time with our little barbecue The weather was perfect on July 2nd and 3rd Shelter Island is a gem with a beautiful strip of public park space for boat and people watching along the bay Even though it was very popular on the July 4th weekend as expected it was only on the 4th that it got crazy because locals stake out space early to watch the fireworks at 9pm We got the package that included premium views and a breakfast and free parking The room is the size of a balcony stateroom on a cruise ship except the bathroom is larger The balcony is small and hadnt been cleaned Neither of these facts bothered us because we had a gorgeous view and a wonderful location room 348 The staff was very friendly and helpful with very few exceptions The free breakfast is actually very nice but limited options include 2 eggs a fritatta a waffle pancakes and one other thing I think We sat in the restaurant with a gorgeous view of the marina They serve you coffee and leave the carafe Spouse and I both ordered two eggs and bacon He chose potatoes while I chose fruit Thats it You dont get toast or juice or anything else We didnt care It was presented very nicely Strangely my eggs ordered over easy were really underdone I had to send them back and ask for over medium When the plate was returned the whites were still a little liquidy and the second time the bacon was overdone If you like over easy I would order over hard It was tasty enough though The fruit bowl was lovely Strawberries grapes melon and fresh pineapple The parking gate is a little sticky You need to keep the card in the slot a second and then it opens We would return but maybe ask for a newer room with a better bed Or maybe return on July 4th and ask for a bay view room to watch the fireworks without having to stake a space in the park early in the morning We didnt use the pool though it was nice and not overcrowded The pool and spa close at 10pm keeping things quiet I tried the spa but left after a family let their boy pee in it They were speaking Spanish and assumed I didnt understand them Thats why I hate public spasthe behavior of one or two people who ruin it for everyone We got massages and they were good and included the steam room and a shower Restaurants in Point Loma are only a few miles away One of four Miguels Mexican is right off the island Great chips and the perfect real Mexican margaritasjust tequila lime juice and rocks Overall we had a lovely time

title: Too small of rooms for the price
text:
I stayed at the Marriott downtown recently and I had booked the reservations a month in advance for adjoining rooms When me and my family went to check in at about 3pm the rooms werent available and we had to wait an hour for the rooms to be prepared
When we finally got our rooms I was very disappointed There is no mini bar no refrigerator and you barely have enough room to walk in the rooms
I dont think I would stay at this hotel again

title: Nice Hotel but the Train WOOOOOO WOOOOO
text:
My wife and I have just returned from 4 days at the Omni Hotel in San Diego I really liked the hotel the staff were great the pool is really nice
However I cannot believe no one has mentioned in their reviews the trains Every morning 4am ish except one we were woken up by the train leaving the huge marshalling yards just behind the hotel It would pull up outside the Hotel where the lights were on red and blow its horn about 5 or 6 times I know I am a light sleeper but you could hear it 4 blocks away
It was annoying but not the end of the world just thought I should mention it

title: What a City Hotel Should Be
text: The Conrad has everything a city hotel should have Great location in downtown Chicago a roof top bar and lounge wonderful room and the most comfortable beds and very pleasant service You couldnt ask for more

title: Not the greatest
text: The exterior of his motel is faded pink and totally turns you off The inside of the rooms though large are incredibly shabby The carpets are torn the rooms smell like stale cigarette smoke theres broken furniture chest and dressers missing drawers The showers in the rooms are pretty much a trickle Does not accept credit cards the clientele consists of people who actually live at the motel During the course of the night there was the smell of strong India food permeating the hall and the rooms the owners live in the motel as well and people yelling throughout the night Will never stay there again

title: The Talbott was a Treat
text: Great staff quiet and well appointed room Walking distance from great shopping

title: A great place to stay in Chicago
text: My wife and I along with our son recently spent five nights at this terrific hotel We stayed in a onebedroom suite that included a kitchen with microwave and small refrigerator The room was in excellent shape and was meticulously maintained The breakfast included was also very well done It was a buffet that included eggs with side dishes bagels bread fresh fruit oatmeal and waffles This was not your typical continental breakfast But more than anything else was the attitude of the staff EVERYONE was extremely friendly and helpful even the maid I cannot say enough good things about this place The Manager should be commended for running such a tight ship There is no question that we will stay here again when we return to Chicago

title: Fine Unless You Need The to Do Something for You
text:
First of all you need to appreciate that for many weeks in the year a Motel 6 can charge over 200 a night and generate over 90 occupany in Washington This means that even an Embassy Suites can have a rather cavalier attitude toward customer service
It took four requests to have the staff replace a defective television I got the distinct impression that the staff and management felt they were doing me a favor by responding however slowly and grudgingly My Hilton Honors Gold status and an 250 nightly rate didnt seem to matter
The hotel shows wear and the staff while friendly dont have much of an incentive to solve a problem at the first opportunity I hate it when management reps dont respond to calls and requests for a visit Just hoe you dont have a problem

title: Nice inside and short walk to convention center but needs soundproofing
text:
Appears to be newly remodeled Clean Indoor pool divided into 3 lap lanes and a hot tub One cup coffee maker in room A few blocks to Convention Center Close to monorail Staff was very helpful in getting me packages that I had shipped there 
Big con for me Paper thin walls and a lot of noise can be heard from the hallway The elevator has a loud ding when it comes to a floor Although I was not right near the elevators I could hear it I have to give it 3 stars because of the noise
Other cons Elevator can be slow at times Really need some new pillows for the bedsnot much stuffing in them at all

title: Great all around place to stay
text: We really enjoyed our 4 day stay here Hot breakfast was great plus they have a social hour at dinnertime that provides free beer  wine plus snacks twice it was a full meal  This was a bonus for us as we were on a tight budget and this was a medical trip The staff was friendly and offered suggestions to our questions The shuttle was convenient and the drivers friendly The property was clean room was nice and clean and we slept great on the bed The pool looked inviting although we didnt have a chance to use it My husband and I will definitely be back next year for my followup Its also right next door to Kroger which makes it convenient if you do not have a car All in all we both agreed this was a great value for the price

title: Comfortable lodging
text: I stayed 3 nights and was impressed with their ability to handle 400 women for 2 meals a day  good choices for lunch and breakfast buffets We didnt spend lots of time in the rooom but it did manage to accomodate 2 women getting ready for a conference day at same time I was happy to have access to the floor 15 HH lounge  quiet and well stocked for free snacks and breakfasts It became our groups after hours meeting place Concierge helpful with transport Would stay again

title: Best airport parking deal
text: We traveled to Boston for vacation this year As we always do when we travel we end up parking our car at one of the airport parking lots However this year we learned of a different way of doing it from a neighbor We stayed the night before at the Renaissance Hotel on Airport Blvd and did the Park and Fly You stay at least one night at the hotel and you get 7 days of covered parking for free It is then 1100 a day after that Its a beautiful hotel and the staff were very friendly and helpful We also ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel and the food was awesome Our waiter Sergio was very professional and a great representative and spokesperson for the hotel When it comes to traveling I believe this might be one of the best deals in town

title: Good location and reasonably priced  but watch out for the noise
text: I stayed here for a couple of nights on a business trip in early October It is a great location for visiting the financial district within walking distance of Wall Street and Broadway and reasonably priced compared with other hotels in this part of New York The rooms are modern if a tad functional and basic They are on the small side too with only a shower no bath and a very small double bed The hotel has good facilities however  complimentary wifi throughout the hotel and free PCsprinters in the lounge and a nice touch in the bedrooms with an ipod docking station built into the radio Its greatest advantage though is its proximity to the 911 memorial site Most rooms have a view of the emerging tower and memorial pools and there is a great restaurant on the 20th floor overlooking the whole site This great advantage is also the hotels biggest downside however  Ground Zero is basically a huge building site and the pile drivers start early in the morning and dont finish until late at night So a reasonably priced hotel if you dont mind the noise

title: Good value especially considering the location
text: This hotel is excellently located very close to Times Square and Broadway and very well priced for this location Although the rooms were a bit small this is normal for midprice New York hotels and they were clean well equipped and recently decorated The staff were friendly and helpful Our only problem was a mistake with the bill but this was honourably and quickly sorted out once we were back in the UK and were able to feed back our original booking information To avoid this ask for an email confirmation of your rate when booking and take a copy of the email with you Then ensure that the correct rate is shown on your registration card for all nights of your stay However this problem apart we would thoroughly recommend the Washington Jefferson

title: Very nice w fantastic Spa
text:
Very nice property with all amenities you would expect Several restaurants pools gift shops starbucks spa  golf I personally ate in the lobby bar crooked branch and it was very good food The breakfast and dinner I had at the Ciblo Moon was also great food I heard from others with my group that the steak restaurant on the golf course was very slow to get the food out There are many pools and water slides The adult only pool is not far from the path to the water slides and the kiddie pool so it is not very quiet It was nice service around the pool they will open the umbrellas for you and bring food and drink Some of my group did the segway tour and loved it I visited the Spa and that has its own pool which was the best big and quite has floats hot top nice chairs and you can order food and drink I would recommend the spa we had treatments and everything was 1st class Fitness center located both in the hotel and spa so you have several options as well as walking trails I did not use the golf course but it looks very nice Rooms are nice but not over the top no slippers no balcony in all rooms some do have balconies and just one robe Over all it was a very nice long weekend It is much nicer during the week vs the weekend as the other reviews mention there are crowds at the pools during the weekend There was actually a line to get a wrist band to get into the pool area on Saturday where there was not on Thursday or Friday I would have given it a 5 star but the proximity to town or the riverwalk was not close so a complementary shuttle would have been nice
Overall property and service is what you would expect from a hotel of this price range

title: Great Find
text: We just returned from spending 2 nights in NYC and stayed at the Jewel The hotel was pertect  moderately priced for New York the room was sufficiently large to accomodate 2 adults and a 12 year old furnishings were very comtempory staff was nice and helpful amenties was nice and the location was superb  The only negative thing i can say about the hote is that the key cards were a royal pain  did not work well and kept having to get replaced but other than this minor annoyance everything else was perfect Would definitely stay there again

title: Excellent hotel close to Fishermans Wharf
text:
This was the third time we have stayed at the Tuscan Inn and each time it has been excellent
The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help you We had a double room with 2 queen beds Although the rooms are not huge our room was still easily big enough for 2 adults and a child plus 3 weeks of holiday gear 
The hotel is close to Fishermans Wharf 5 minutes walk max from the seafront but not so close that it gets the noise The base of the cable car line is one block away and there is a Safeways one block away as well
At 5 pm every day the hotel holds an informal reception where you can have a couple of glasses of wine and normally some food brought in from the Italian restaurant next door After spending an exhausting day walking the hills of SF this is a great way to unwind before heading off for a meal In our case we used the adjacent Italian restaurantif you are staying at the Tuscan Inn you get 10 off your bill
Theyve got an underground garage at the Tuscan Inn but we didnt use it as we there is no need for a car in SF The cable cars provide an easy way of getting around SF but the costs can soon mount up if you are using them continually We walked much of the time and took in the views

title: Enjoyed our stay at the Millenium
text: My husband and I stayed at the Millenium Broadway June 1618 This hotel is in a great location right across the street from Virgils Barbecue and next to the Hudson Theater This is the 3rd time I have stayed at this hotel and each time it gets better The staff at the hotel went out of their way to make our stay a wonder experience We had a room on the 50th floor with a great view of Times Square Everyone was extremely helpful and courteous and helped make our vacation great They recommended an Italian restaurant called Carmines  excellent food with huge portions The room was newly renovated with comfortable beds beautiful headboard huge windows new carpet great TV and yes there is a coffee maker in the room The next time we are in New York City we will definitely stay at the Millenium again

title: Make sure you have plenty of time
text: I was at the resort for 3 days and 2 nights for a seminar Check in and check out take FOREVER Likewise with retrieving your bags from the bell cap and your car from the valet Remember that if you have a plane to catch I ate at their upscale restaurant Francescos as well as the grill downstairs Both places were overpriced  especially Francescos Service was great  food was mediocre All hat no cattle If you are not in to golf go to another resort La Cantera is pretty and the views are nice But thats it They dont have a clue as to how to make a guest feel as though hes getting what hes paying for

title: The most obnoxious barman EVER
text:
Stayed here for a week starting on 28th Jan 2012 First evening at the bar there was a very lovely oriental lady Very professional and courteous 
Second evening she was replaced by a 50ish year old American guy Right from the start I found his attitude disturbing He was clearly friendly with another guest who was already seated at the bar and was trading opinions about all sorts of subjects
I hate people who ask me whether the beer is cold was one statement he made shortly after a person came up and asked him that question I hate it when people ask me are you open  was another statement he made He then made the bold statement I hate British people Im British a fact that he must have figured out when I ordered my beer I hate the British They never leave a tip and dont tell me they dont know that tipping is customary in the US They always pretend that they dont know They know alright Theyre just cheap and dumb
I sat there with my mouth open thinking what the hell 
I few minutes later a couple of old ladies came and sat at the bar The barman saw them but needed to move away from the bar for a couple of minutes and told them hed be right back 
True to his word he was back in a couple of minutes but decided to serve his friend from earlier BEFORE serving the 2 old ladies He then went off to run another errand By the time he came back the ladies had gone
They returned later with the duty manager Theyd clearly complained and the duty manager bought them a couple of glassed of red wine on the house 
Just a few minutes later the barman noticed a couple of very large ladies heading towards the bar area Immediately he said in a loud voice but not loud enough that the ladies would hear Holy Guacamole Thank god we havent got an all you can eat buffet here to which his friend at the bar responded and they then went on to make disparaging remarks about the overweight ladies Of course when he went over there to get their drinks orders he was all smiles but back at the bar he continued expressing his opinions about large ladies
Ive been around a bit Stayed at hotels all over the world but this was THE WORST barman Ive ever come across I complained to the hotel but they just asked me to email more senior people which I will get around to doing eventually I eventually left the bar I also made it a point to mark on the bill a tip for a grand amount of 000

title: Great value for the money
text: Located in an upandcoming neighborhood the hotel is a quick cab bus or train ride to downtown You cannot find a better price anywhere elseand the staff was great Although hotel rooms were a bit sparse they were very clean

title: Nice location
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites Riverwalk It was right on the Riverwalk but on the quiet end Room was spacious and very clean Staff was very friendly Enjoyed the breakfast buffet Only complaintsmall pool but we didnt come to San Antonio to swim in the pool

title: Overall a great place to stay
text:
I really loved this Hotel The staff was more than friendly and the room was awesome
The only thing that ruined it was that the restaurant had a limited menu I wish we were informed ahead of time because we specifically wanted a hotel w a restaurant and knew what we wanted to order The limited menu food was awful 
Other than that the room was Very clean and cozy Hotel parking was high but the hotel rate on a weekend made it worth it
I SPECIFICALLY picked this hotel because of the reviews and it was great

title: Quirky throwback to another era but a really good option
text: Strange place felt like a retreat hotel from the 1960s However the location is good rooms are great and service was fine It was a good option for us given that it was cheaper than the other Riverwalk options and as a tourist you definitely want to be close to Riverwalk The pool was slightly green

title: Euro Flair in Dupont Circle
text:
I go to Washington with some regularity Sometimes its every six months other times a year goes by between trips My go to lodging is the Hotel Madera Its got a great locationjust south of Dupont Circle on New Hampshire Avenueconvenient to the Metro and in a in a neighborhood where cabs good restaurants and interesting stores are common 
The hotel lobby is smallas in a European placeand the hotel itself isnt large there are only 83 rooms I think I asked this time But the rooms themselves are generously sized and decorated with the typical Kimpton flairlots of animal prints big mirrors that sort of stuff Theyre also quiet and not only have a good bed but also a nice desk where you can peck away at your computer using Kimptons easy to figure out internet portal 
Sometimes I ask for a room with a street view sometimes I dont Ive stayed there more than a few times and never thought that I had a dog of a room 
The staff is attentive friendly and welcoming Ive spent some time in the lobby waiting for friends to pick me up and so have seem the deal with difficult customersthat front desk staff has WAY more patience than I do I also never get the feeling that the men and women who work there are merely marking time waiting to grab onto the next rung of the corporate ladder the way I do at some larger hotels 
Give the place a shot youll like it Just leave a room open for me on my next trip

title: A good no frills pit stop
text:
All in all I suppose this will sound like a bad review but this hotel served its purpose well Room with 2 queen beds near LAX for under 100 with free parking and breakfast All of our requirements were met satisfactorily If you are looking for 4 star quality and service you wont get it but you arent paying for it either
We normally stay in Marriott hotels but tried to make our recent trip to Los Angeles a little more affordable on this particular night before catching an flight out of LAX the next morning 
The service was pleasant but definitely not the go out of your way to make it the best stay ever that we have grown accustomed to 
The room was surprisingly clean and spacious It was right on a busy street so quietness is not top of the list though with the air conditioner running all night you miss most of it 
Breakfast left a lot to be desired unless all you are looking for is a bagel and an orange Pure continental carbs for a quick getem out the door Also not much room to sit down and eat We had to go sit outside which was ok The hotel is attached to a Dennys but I dont know if there were vouchers to eat there instead They werent offered to us Next time I would definitely skip the provided meal and hit Dennys
If an inexpensiveno frills pit stop is what your looking for then this is a great place

title: Best Priced High End Property in San Diego
text: I vacation in San Diego a few times a year and you cant beat this new sleek resortstyle property  Its biggest draw includes its spacious modern design and its resort pool area thats right on the waterfront as well as the vast parklike area that surrounds the hotel  yet you are also so close to the shopping and restaurants of the Gaslamp district Another great thing I found is the pricevalue compared to other quality properties in San Diego it just cant be beat

title: Historic hotel with modern ammenities
text: I have stayed at many Drury Inns and with this trip being our first time to San Antonio I welcomed a familiar hotel chain The ambieous of the hotel is suburb The staff is very friendly and the extremely helpful The room was decorated above standard and we slept so comfortly we nearly missed breakfast the first morning All the happenings within the riverwalk are within walking distance The valet parking was top notch and we will definately be staying here again next summer

title: Beautifully historic
text: I spent one night in August at the Oxford Hotel in downtown Denver CO and I wished Id had several more there The place is beautifully historic but the rooms are beautifully updated so there is none of the mustiness you might expect in an old hotel The bathrooms especially were nice The hotel also had a nice attached restaurant and is in a lovely part of Denver just a block from my favorite destination The Tattered Cover bookshop

title: Totally Relaxing
text: I couldnt have asked for a better time to celebrate my husbands birthday We enjoyed the spa gourmet restaurant and wonderful service at the Rancho Bernardo Inn The staff went the extra mile to ensure our stay was exceptional I am disabled and while the grounds are beautiful with rolling hills and wonderful plantings the staff made it possible for me to get around with ease and comfort at my beck and call Totally refreshed and ready to meet lifes new challenges we will return hopefully often Thank you so much for the best time

title: Outstanding highly recommended
text: Stayed a total of four days Suite was very clean as was the rest of the hotel Staff was wonderful and friendly Only thing I can complain about is a lack of parking sometimes during the evening since the hotel is located in a shoppingdining area Other than that I would return

title: Its simply not clean Great locationdismal service Unclean hotel that could be much better
text:
Arrived on Friday afternoon for a medical conference Our rate for four people in a room two teens and two adults was 499nt Astronomical rate and they would not budge from it Since this hotel was where the seminar was held we really didnt have a choice We will never again attend a conference at this hotel
Check in was smooth We were ushered to room 1602 Directly across from the bank of elevators As it turned out the room was huge and the elevator noise was not a serious problem
The room itself was in poor condition On the bedskirt on the bed nearest to the door there was a huge liquid stain of some sort Disgusting Every single lampshade had holes and was bent crooked like a brawl had taken place at some point
The carpeting was ancient Ancient to the point of pulling away from the walls and cobwebs and dust and food had settled into the cracks I was VERY happy I had brought my slippers
 This is the kind of hotel that makes you cringe everytime you look into a nook or cranny Behind the tv set Thick with dust and crumbs
Most unfortunate was the fact that this room was connected to other rooms on both sides by reedthin doors Forget about getting a decent nights sleep if you have a neighbor who likes to watch television We were kept up until 3am on a Saturday night by our neighbors television
The Grand Hyatt touts their EConcierge service They have a link to it on their website However I sent two different requests to their EConcierge before we arrived and both requests were completely ignored The first request was for dinner reservations Ignored The second request was for extra towels in our rooman option that their EConcierge offers That request was also ignored We had to phone housekeeping for the extra towels Every single day
We were promised a coffee machine and a fridge in our room We had to phone housekeeping for those as well The maid refused to stock the coffee maker with coffee and cups after the first day 
Forget about getting any glasses in the room We were drinking out of our hands from the bathroom tap while brushing our teeth
If you would like 2 wine glasses delivered to your room the charge is 6
We knew in advance thanks to TripAdvisor that the room service charges were astronomical so we stocked up on juices and water and bagels from the shops down at Grand Central Terminal One morning we did order breakfast One ham and cheese omelette was 24 with no toast and no juice or coffee The omelette was dry as dust and cold 24 for an omelette Astounding
 One small box of Fruit Loops was 10 with no toast and no juice 6 mini pancakes from the kids menu was perhaps the best value I would strongly advise people to order from the kids menu to avoid being absolutely gouged by the laughable prices And make sure to order a pitcher of ice water Its about the only thing that is free in the hotel
All of these complaints aside the thing that really bothered me the most was the filthy condition of the glass in the lobby There are several revolving glass doors and a couple of regular glass doors and every single one of them is literally covered in slime No matter what time of day or night the lobby was thick with the finger goo and faceprints and palmprints of the hundreds of people who go in and out all day and all night Its absolutely disgusting One employee armed with a bottle of Windex and some paper towels could solve this problem by cleaning the doors once an hour But this hotel doesnt seem to care about germs or cleanliness
Try it for yourself and you will see that this is a hotel that simply does not care 
If you want to get gougedstay here

title: Thank you from AZ
text:
We checked in early and was greeted with smiles and kisses for my dog I was hesitant when I saw where our room was elevator and ice machine I would ask for the same room over and over We never heard the ice machine or the elevator and talk about convienient My dog got to know Otisthe elevator real well Everytime we went to the
 lobby we were greeted by name The room was huge and spotless I have to say the hidden gem is the bar inside the Bistro Daisy We were greeted by Martin the bartender who was priceless We mentioned how good it smelled in there and he went and told the chef  Two minutes later Gabriel the chef had sent out a small plate of potatoes for us to sample killer I ordered stuffed salmon on a whim I hate fish OMG I have never tasted anthing so good in my life I could not stop eating My husband had regular salmon and I heard him mew with every bite he took Gabriel came out to meet us and we enjoyed him and Martin more than you can imagine Wonderful people you have there

title: I am not complaining but
text: This is not a gripe but I have 4 issues with regards to my stay First I booked thru Hotwire and I got a ridiculously low rate which is really great for me but for the first time i felt like a second class guest here Why First the room they gave us was nice at first glance but upon closer scrutiny there were minor problems like the shower head was defective the toilet had a leak and the knob in one of the lampshades was missing Second the location was right in front of the tracks so if you are a light sleeper then better bring some earplugs Third we stayed for 6 days and upon checking in I requested for a fridge since I had my family with me They told me that they will bring it to my room as soon as it becomes available It never came although the rooms next to us received theirs even if I came earlier I know what I am talking about because I saw the refrigerators out side the rooms near us Lastly there were 3 occassions that I had to call the cleaning ladies attention with regards to our daily supply of toiletries which she forgot I have been using Hotwire for the past couple of years and never has this happened to me I was always treated as if I was a regular paying guest Anyway as Ive said this is not a complaint just an observation If someone asks me if I would like to stay again at the Hilton Gaslamp I would definitely say yes The location is fantastic the front desk staff were friendly and the ambiance was terrific Ive stayed in 45 stars hotel in San Diego since 2003 and I have to admit this is the best The issues I raised did not really bother us for we were always out enjoying San Diego Lastly will I still patronize Hotwire You bet I will I hope this becomes a wake up call for both Hotwire and the Hilton

title: Great location
text: We had a room with a partial ocean view but when we stepped out into our balcony it was a full ocean view This hotel is within walking distance from Pikes Market Space Needle and the EMP museum We would stay here again

title: Wont go back there
text:
It was my first visit to dallas and Sheraton by galleria was the first Sheraton that I stayed in in the USA
Unfortunately that was terrible there are so many hidden payments 10 for parking  12 for the wifi access Added that their bath towels were smelling so bad furthermore the waster sink and the bath flood
Pricelinecom plz dont give me the Sheraton again

title: Great location
text: We have just returned from 12 days in NYC staying at the Affinia Manhattan in a one bedroom suite We were very fortunate to have an upper floor with a brilliant wrap around balcony that gave us views up to Central Park and down to the Hudson River We sat on our balcony and watched the 4th July fireworks The room was a good size with a kitchenetteThe only negative was the bathroom was very compact The room was efficiently maintained The staff at the Concierge Desk Maureen and Norva were knowledgeable and very helpful They helped us on a number of occasions with answers to such questions as what bus do I get to go to Battery Park and where do I get it to helping with our online checkin and obtaining our boarding passes The location of the Hotel is one of its biggest assets Right opposite Penn Station and Madison Square Garden on 7th Ave it is only a couple of blocks to most of the sitesMacys Empire State Building Times Square and Broadway There are plenty of fast food establishments around Penn Station but we found a great cafe down 31st street Cafe R which had salads and freshly cooked Asian food There is also a Dunkin Doughnuts and Subway right next door The Affinia Manhattan is great value for money in a good central location

title: Nice hotel not a great location
text: Had a good stay Big clean room good water pressure pleasant and helpful staff Cleaning staff were very courteous and did a great job Bed was big and comfy too Decent breakfast included Our only problem is that it is far away from anything Youd really want a car if you were staying here We figured out the bus system and there is a bus terminal down the road but it takes a long time to get anywhere Cab ride back from downtown at the end of the day ran about 30 which really cut into our budget

title: Comfortable stay
text:
Our third trip to NY and our first stay at La Quinta One of the main reasons we decided to book here was the location  a central location near to Penn Station this was also to our advantage as we flew into Newark and decided to transfer by train  as you leave the station on 7th its just a two block walk to the hotel
The hotel is in the Korean district and is surrounded by restaurants and watering holes  the ESB is directly behind the hotel and Macys is a two minute walk away There is also a subway 100 yards away  a perfect location
The reception area is small and has a few loungers next to the lift and the small shop  it makes it feel like a friendly place to stay and indeed the staff were extremely friendly and helpful They also have safety deposit boxes in reception which we took full advantage of
The room itself was basic  a double bed tv coffee machine hair dryer etc The bathroom appeared to have been updated recently and all in all was a comfortable place to sleep  which after all is all you need in a hotel in NYC the only time we spent there was when we were sleeping
The 14th floor houses the bar which was small but cosy An excellent idea as you look out at the ESB as youre supping away The bar is like a conservatory so you have excellent views particularly at night
Breakfast was also included An impressive assortment of cereal bagels doughnuts fruit and youghurts A member of staff was always available to replenish the food so that it was always available This was great as you could fill up before walking it all off
There is also a fitness suite there but I didnt use it so cant comment In the basement area there is also an internet room
A very nice hotel that I will consider again when I return to NYC

title: Great Historic Boutique Hotel
text: A really nice boutique hotel which is located right the heart of the Dallas Historic district The rooms are very well appointed while the prices remain reasonable I strongly recommend if you need to stay downtown Dallas Great staff also Finally we held a conference there and the overall servicepackage was quite good The food was also very good

title: Garish Design but Good Hotel
text:
On a recent business trip this hotel was recommended to me by my corporate travel agent I generally love Kimpton properties so I was excited to stay there
Checkin was great the staff was wonderful The lobby and restaurant are very coolbut I thought that the design in the room was just over the top and wild Its retro its modern its all over the place
But the room was comfortable WiFi was free Breakfast in the morning was quick and good A complimentary New York Times was on the door
Nice enough hotelbut make sure you get a good price

title: Charming staff at this freindly hotel in great central location
text: We took our son for his 8th birthday and you couldnt get a better location right next to Times Square Evereyone at the Mela was extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble Great recommendations for breakfast  Red Flame Diner   Pizza at Johns but dont go with their suggestion of AJ Maxwells for steak unless you dont mind paying 50 bucks each for a sirloin

title: Luxury with a Bit of Noise
text: We stayed at the Casablanca for one night Friends of ours were visiting and had made all the arrangements We found the hotel very clean the room was lovely and the staff was extremely friendly The only issue was the noise Granted in NYC you are going to get noise particularly with the proximity to Times Square It was not inexpensive so I would just warn out of town guests that it is smack dab in the theatre district and you will hear sirens all night long Bring ear plugs

title: A great place to stay
text:
My daughter two granddaughters and I stayed at this location on Friday Nov 4th while in Denver to see The Lion King at the nearby Denver Center for the Performing Arts We had gotten lost on the way there and were tired and frazzled upon arrival Those feelings evaporated as soon as we walked in to the lobby where we were greeted by an extremely friendly young man who checked us in promptly and professionally and made us feel very welcome 
The rooms were beautiful and comfortable I think maybe they have been redone since the last time I stayed
The brerakfast was bountiful and tasty and more importantly was presented very nicely in an immaculately kept area 
The morning desk attendant very graciously allowed us to leave our vehicle in the parking garage for several hours after our check out so that we would not need to find parking for the show Another nice added touch
We stay at Residence Inns across the country as often as we can and lately some have not been up to par This one more than makes up for those What a great place

title: Comfortable stay in Times Square  no frills no issues
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel in New York for two nights during our weekend trip to hang out with friends watch Broadway  ABT shows and enjoy some great restaurants All in all the trip was enjoyable and relaxing and our stay at the Sofitel  while not a standout  does not detract from the trip either
We were given a room right by the elevator bank on the 10th floor of the hotel but we didnt experience any noise issues The vibe in the hotel is definitely luxury though not quite like the Pierre or Peninsula hotels All the hotel attendants and front desk reps we interacted with were helpful perhaps even eager to help While I have no specific anecdotes to relay in my mind and experience that can be a positive There are certainly no aspects to our stay that were suboptimal  I would stay at the Sofitel again particularly if our plans included more Broadway shows and gallivanting around the city The Sofitel is located right off Fifth Avenue equidistant to the BDFV and 456 making it easy to traipse around Manhattan If you know however that your plans dont require you to be near Times Square or Lincoln Center or the general Midtown area the Sofitel isnt necessarily the best option The Bowery and Crosby Hotels downtown are better options for visitors who will be frequenting that area Sofitel however I think is a reliable option for Midtown

title: Perfect in every way
text:
We were spending only one night in New York so I did a lot of online research to pick one that sounded nice comfortable was convenient to the theater district but not right in it and which fit our budget of 300 or less Based on the reviews here I chose Sofitel and booked the cheapest room at 259 What a great deal  you get so much for what you pay particularly in New York
As recommended I mentioned it was our anniversary online not thinking anything would come of it but when we arrived the extremely friendly and helpful Gabrielle told us we had been given a deluxe room on the 27th floor We had a view of Chrysler Building and the Puerto Rican Day Parade preparations the next morning and there was sparking wine waiting for us with a thoughtful note
The bed indeed was the most comfortable Ive ever slept in The room was big by any standards and the bathroom was enormous by any standards Both a shower and a tub with a detachable showerhead large sink with a large lit mirror mood lighting a candle and fresh flowers Lots of closet space with all different kinds of hooks The blackout curtains were great as we were up late the night before The room was totally dark 
Best of all was the soundproofing Not only could we not hear any street noise particularly the preparation for the Puerto Rican Day Parade replete with bands and DJs blaring full blast as we discovered when we went outside but most incredible of all when I opened the door I discovered someone vacuuming right outside our door I couldnt even hear the vacuum when I was on the other side of the door
Left our bags with the concierge as we explored the city on Sunday No charge to leave the bags Also when we checked in the night before Gabrielle asked if we wanted late checkout Staff was extremely helpful We were sad to go and wished we could have stayed longer
Only criticisms bathrobes were a bit scratchy big deal and the air conditioning was finicky Either too cold or too warm even if you only adjusted it one notch

title: Jumping the Shark
text:
Jumping the shark
My stay at the FS in Boston was a great letdown Lets talk about the good features it still retains a very good concierge service and tideness of rooms and common areas But
when I checked in I was given a room right in front of the AC vent which apart from being really noisy it cooled the room too much and it made entering the room a bit of a challenge as servicing the whole seventh floor it blasted out freezing air right on your back
I went right to the reception complaining about it and a young gentleman at the reception told me nobody has ever complained about it if it still bothers you tomorrow morning well turn the AC down
Well one of the reasons I really like this hotel chain is that everything is always perfect and they take care of problems asap I hate having to complain move around once Im settled down so I never went back
Breakfast the following morning was a challenge I asked for a continental breakfast plus yougurt and eggs but I got the bill instead of the eggs Strange I though lets see tomorrow morning The day after I chose the American breakfast same story after a 45 minute wait I still hadnt got my eggs so I just paid and left On the third day they finally managed to deliver the right order in a decent time 
I also had lunch once day and it was decent but not the excellent quality I was used to at the FS Besides you eat on plastic table mats which is really a let down for a high end hotel What a difference from the FS in Paris where they iron the table clothes before setting the table I remember they had them also the other time I was there but being service and food excellent you dont really mind This time though it bothered me a lot maybe because I spent a lot of time staring at them waiting for my breakfast
I had to be back for another two days but I cancelled ny reservation and decided for the Fairmont instead While I was there the hotel was celebrating its 25th birthday an old dame living on fame and memories

title: great fun with a toddler
text: Really enjoyed the night I stayed at the Hudson and would recommend it for travelling with very small children mine is 25 We got upgraded to an enormous room with two queen sized beds and a cot and a little lobby for the buggy to be parked and an ensuite bathroom Lovely views over Manhattan Staff were gorgeous and everyone was incredibly helpful and sympathetic towards me single mother although they are a tad disorganised Food was delicious and not unreasonably priced cocktails on the sky terrace a bit ho hum children not allowed in the gym swimming pool which you can get membership to its across the street which was not what Id been told and there were various muddles like that Its an immense skyscraper and the corridors are a bit spooky  at times I think the design crosses the line between cool postmodern and weird sinister but generally I had a blast here and would happily go again

title: Good airport overnight
text:
This hotel was nice because the rooms though small are brand new and very clean The bed was comfy and there were lots of modern amenities like a flat panel TV and granite counters in the bathroom
The hotel is very close to the airport and is perfect if you have an early flight in the morning The free shuttle will take you to the airport and pick you up after your flight You can leave your car parked at the hotel during your trip and the first five nights are free
The only complaints I have are that there was a problem with our checkin Travelocitys fault not theirs that they said they were going to fix but still hadnt the next morning when we checked out Eventually it was all taken care of Also the walls are rather thinour neighbors TV was turned up loud and was somewhat bothersome
Overall a very good value especially if you take advantage of the Park n Fly program

title: great value at a very nice hotel
text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and i can indeed recommend this hotel huge spacious rooms nicely decorated Elemis bath products and just really good service we took a look at 3 different rooms before deciding  and the staff was absolutely fine with it we ended up with a standard room  the biggest I have seen in SF and with the most amazing view Rooms have everything you need and is just lovely We had breakfast at Top of the Hotel Top of Mark and it was a good experience  good food also healthy options and fantastic views Overall a very positive experience  and at great value too  we paid 150 dollars per night during the weekend which is good value

title: Good value and very clean
text: One night stay for work Very comfortable and clean king room Other reviews prompted me to ask for quiet room which I got almost Very little noise from the L but across from the vending machine room That proved a nonstarter though Much louder are the dorms in the hall slamming shut Room big bathroom immaculate Asked for BB special which incl up to 25 breakfast voucher at 1st floor restaurant Worst coffee Ive had in ages but otherwise it was fine Plenty of Starbucks nearby Did learn that after 7pm most everything closes up which includes retailers on State St as well as a number of food places Definitely not a place that will make you want to wander around at night

title: Extremely Disappointed
text: What a big disappointment This was my 4th trip to the Resort and my experience was not good I had bragged and bragged on the hotel and was so eager to take my son and two nephews for a 4 day trip to San Antonio I phoned the morning of my arrival from the road to make sure all of the reservations were in order and that we would be receving 2 double beds  1 mom and 3 boysages 916 Upon arrival I was told we could only get a king size bed and was treated very very rudely Finally a manager gave us the double bedsof course he never came out of his office to speak to us only sent word with the clerk who was a monster The service was horrible especially by the pool and there was a smell by the pool that smelled like sewer The lazy river failed to work consistently was dirty and was extrememly shallowobviously needing to be refilled I will never return

title: Good Location to Wharf Area
text:
We stayed here for one night to check out Pier 39 Fishermans Wharf and to go to Alcatraz There is a parking fee of 4045 but most nice hotels have that in the area The nice thing is you dont have to worry about your car when its parked in the garage and the hotel is a 12 blocks from Fishermans Wharf 
We stayed in a King Room It was nicenothing to jazzy or special but it did the trick The breakfast in the morning was good as well 
Staff was nice Im rating this place a 3 for some reason and Im not quite sure why I just didnt get that above and beyond service or warm fuzzy feeling Nothing was really wrong either it was just soso to us

title: Tired shabby and larcenous
text:
My wife and I recently visited NYC This was my wifes first visit to the city so I surprised her with a stay at the Plaza Unfortunately the Plaza Experience I had hoped to give my wife turned out to be more akin to the experience one might have expected from the NYC of thirty years ago 
Before I get into the unpleasant aspects of our stay at the Plaza let me first mention the things that I like about the Plaza First the location is hard to beat Second the walkin shower in our room was the best Ive ever seen in a hotel it was large beautiful and the water pressure was strong enough to knock over a small elephant Third the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel Fourth if you like historical buildings which my wife and I do the Plaza has much to offer Fifth the staff was in the main friendly and helpful Unfortunately there were material exceptions to numbers four and five which Ill get into in a moment
The traveler should be aware that the famous Oak Room is not open for business The website does not make this clear unless you actually attempt to make an online reservation
