We just stayed 4 nights in a corner king deluxe room with city views  very disappointing Supposedly some rooms have been renovated but we were obviously not in one of those see picture of the AC vent and blackened ceiling attached for example although we paid the same way too high price which does not feel very fair The room though not in disrepair feels grim and outdated out of the early 80s Carpet and wallpaper give a quite depressing touch to the room and to the hotel in general since they are as outdated in the corridors and elevators On top of that the city view we were expecting was mostly a direct view of another building on one side and a view of the ugly roof of the adjoining mall on the other side see pictures Not worth the extra bucks for sure
And to top it all during the whole weekend there was a convention of japanese anime and video games which attracted hundreds of young people dressed up in all kinds of crazy outfits who wandered around in the lobby and other parts of the hotel from morning till late in the evening  too bad for you if as a guest you wanted to enjoy the lobby and the garden the best parts of the hotel from what weve seen looking for the zen experience of a traditional japanese hotel

title: Fine but location a little suspect
text:
Stayed at this hotel overnight on May 15th and 16th 2012 Checkin went fine and smoothly but for whatever reason the temperature inside the hotel was extremely warm My room in the North Tower was also unbearably warm and the windows were unopenable as well Took some time to figure out how the airconditioning unit worked but even then it still took 34 hours for the temperature inside the room to drop to 70 degrees By the time I took a walk around the block that the hotel was situated on it had become dark outside During that walk I saw various homeless people sorting through the public trash bins drinking out of paper bags and loitering around in the various alley ways On an adjacent block lined with abandoned and rundown properties there were three individuals on their soapboxes using loud and gruff voices to broadcast some type of diatribe inaudible over a loud speaker system Decided right then and there to head back into the hotel and spend my time in Baltimore during the evenings inside the hotel and not wandering around
Regarding the hotel itself the bed was comfortable and offered plenty of room for one person The room was clean The television was good and easy to use The shower was fine but the toilet backed up during its second flush I notified the maid that there was a problem with the toilet before I left for the day and the problem was resolved when I returned in the late afternoon One evening I used the hotel gym only used the elliptical unit and thought it was a good setup The pool wasnt opened yet but I noticed a maintenance worker one afternoon patching the pool bottom and putting a fresh coat of pool blue paint so I woudnt be surprised if it was going to be open soon 
The restaurant was just okay There were plenty of televisions broadcasting a number of sporting events which was fine by me but the meals that I had fish  chips one night chicken parmesian the next were only average at best and I wouldnt be a regular patron at this restaurant if I were dining for pleasure There was also a foul odor like a floor mat that gets gets saturated with detritis and moisture that becomes rank over time think stinky foot odor that came from behind the bar
The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful all around so no problems there
Overall some good elements and overall just an average experience

title: Great Staff
text: We spent a weekend at the Paradise Point recently It happened to be at a time when a black out affected the entire city of San Diego The staff handly this situation beautifully and turned what could have been a stressful event into a fun memorable event They directed everyone to the main pool and cooked burgers on the gas grill and handed out cold drinksall with smiles on their faces We were still able to spend quality time with our family and friends that had travelled with us Kudos to the staff for handling that situation with such grace

title: Great Hotel Friendly staff make for a wonderful stay
text: This is a very nice little hotel It is more along the lines of the European hotelsfairly small but the staff make up for the size Even in a 5 star hotel the staff dont measure up to the staff at Hotel Lawrence It is conveniently located near the West End  not far from Reunion tower They have a shuttle van that will take you anywhere in downtown Dallas The restaurant that is in the hotel is ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS They have the best chicken fried steak I have eaten in years Their mashed potatoes are really home made  not just mashed baked They actually put butter  milk in them The lasagna  the fishin cream sauce were excellent They actually make their own Cesare dressing  it is great I cannot rave enough about this little place called the Founders Grill  the value for the dollar is super Cant wait to get back to Dallas  eat there again

title: Traditional on San Francisco
text: excellent location in the middle of union square everything around you and also is near the cable car station power  Hyde

title: Very Comfortable
text: We called this place after not liking the Best Western or the Days Inn around here They gave us a really great deal The only downside is the 20night inciental charge they charge you when u check in u get it back The staff was very friendly Tamika checked us in and she was very knowledgable about the hotel It was very clean and the breakfast was awesome i would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Market Center Area I would stay again myself

title: Nice hotel pleasantly surprised would recommend
text:
I stayed here for one night while attending a conference at the hotel I noticed the mixed reviews and was a bit leery but was pleasantly surprised with everything
Check in was quick and smooth room was nice good size and comfy beds Main drawback would have to be thin walls but other than that I would recommend or stay here again as well The front desk was always helpful bellman was great as was valet 
We had a nice buffet breakfast and dinner at Delmonicos was amazing

title: Just average wouldnt want to come back
text:
I must have missed the renovations on this hotel that I keep hearing about or maybe my room just didnt have them Upon checkin I was greeted by an extremely friendly clerk who made the experience great from the begining although it quickly went downhill from there
Upon arriving into my room it immediately smelled musty so I turned on the air conditioner which took a while to finally start up The decor was not redone therefore it had a very dated bedspread wallpaper bathroom The mini fridge was a nice addition if it would have worked However the dial was broken off when I called the front desk to come fix it I was told that someone would be up in a little bit to fix the problem however no one came After 3 hours I called again and was told the maintenence person was busy and probably wouldnt be able to get to it today I told them not to bother then seeing as I was only there over night
The bed was hard and was not entirelly clean the shower worked decently however it couldnt keep a consistency between hot and cold just keep switching itself back and fourth 
I went out for the night and when I arrived back to the hotel I found almost no parking there was literally one space left and it was an extremely tight fitting space The next day at check out I called the front desk and asked for a little extra time because I had lost something I was told I had 10 minutes I found the item within 5 and when i was leaving the room to head to the lobby I saw a clerk coming up the stairs checking to make sure I had left the room I know he was checking because I heard him use the walkie talkie to say my room had finally been cleared
This was one of the worst hotels service wise I have every stayed at and I would never return to this location unless some staff members were changed out

title: Hidden Gem Perfect for my Seminar Great access to Midway and MPLoop
text:
I stayed here for a seminar at Dearborn Station which was a short walk away much appreciated coming from GA in Feb I used Freq Flyer miles so was given a premium room with a very useful refrigerator The bedding was extra comfy and the staff were very responsive when I called about a rattling heating grate  came immediately and took care of it I always have earplugs and eyemask for city stays but didnt end up using eyemask good blackout curtains and used earplugs only first night
Transportation Easy ride from Midway to hotel on the CTA Hotel website suggests using Orange line to LaSalle and Van Buren but with rolling luggage the Library stop is much easier because it has an elevator from train level to ground level Easy ride to theater district at night also

title: Good value for money Clean Excellent customer service
text: Stayed here during a 2 day vacation to Schlitterbahn Clean Good breakfasts  very bad coffee though Great customer service

title: Nice location near EMP and Space Needle
text:
You dont need a car  avoid the 20night parking surcharge Easy walking distance to major attractions and neighboring restaurants  around 5 or 6 blocks Duck tour across from Space Needle was a hoot Nice hotel with very comfortable and wellequipped room 42 LG HDTV with some HD channels good free wireless internet microfridge in room VERY comfortable king bed and large enough to sleep on corner couch Small bathroom and tiny closet 
Took free hotel shuttle to Pike Place Mkt on a Friday evening and had trouble getting back They said they had been there to pick us up but that we werent there That did not happen Took 2 calls from a wellknown location and more than hour waiting there on the street after we were done with dinner and ready to return to the hotel Each time we were assured of a pick up time that long passed before the driver arrived with no explanation or apology other than I just started my 11PM shift and that he wasnt aware there was a problem Docked them a star for this probably should have deducted more but it was an overall good stay
If departing SeaTac airport take the free hotel shuttle to the train station downtown to get to the airport 250 one way Its 17 miles away and through Seattle traffic by car or taxi Give yourself plenty of time It took nearly an hour from hotel to airport by shuttle and train And we were shocked at the security lines on an otherwise quiet Sunday AM We nearly missed our flight Arrive EARLY

title: Amazing One of the best hotel stays we have had
text: Stayed for three nights in mid August From the moment we arrived we felt pampered and well taken care of by the concierge and butler staff The staff was always available to arrange great dining choices and to advise regarding activities We took advantage of the hotels complementary car The rooms are spacious and extremely well appointed The view from our huge deck was breathtaking We will be back for sure

title: Affordable elegance
text:
My family just returned from a three night visit over Thanksgiving We chose The Palmer for the location to attend the parade I had not been to the Palmer in over 30 years Back then it was a dump 
The renovation is beautiful The public areas are very nice Our room was small and would only accommodate two double beds where we would normally get queens Some aspects of the room are starting to show wear again Our room had absolutely no view 
Would I stay there againwithout a doubt The location was awesome We walked everywhere we wanted to go Our daughter loved the pool and hot tuba must for a 12 year old We had a super time

title: Very pleasent Stay
text:
We spent a Werk in NYC and stayed at the mansfield Hotel Overall we are very Happy with the hotel The room was a junior suite with a front room and a seperated bedroom Both rooms had ac and tv There is also free WiFi available A little disappointing was that the basin in the bathroom was very small
The location of the hotel was great Its in the 44th street next to 5th Ave Also the timesquare is only a 7 mi walk away 
There are many bars restaurants and breakfast bistros around the hotel

title: 5 star resort on the beach
text: Excellent service Staff was wonderful Beautiful property in the perfect location Very high class

title: A bit of a disappointment in San Antonio
text:
We booked this hotel after reading all the reveiws as we arrived  pulled up to the hotel I was surprised at the location It was on the othere side of the interstate  adjacent to some pretty derelict property It was close to downtown so it wasnt the distance but we were two woman travelling together  like to walk It just didnt feel really safe the one way they suggested was to walk thru the parking lot underneath the interstate thru a fenced area The underpass under the freeway was well lite as well  we didnt encounter any problems but it just wasnt what we expected It was far enough away that we didnt run back to the hotel to drop off shopping or rest before dinner which we normally would do I would not book this hotel again  would pick one closer to the riverwalk
The breakfast was great  the hotel was well maintained  clean The breakfast staff were friendly  diligent  keeped everything clean  well stocked We did not find the front desk staff overly helpful Im sure the website shows that there is conceirge service I dont consider the front desk staff to be a conceirge serviceit was extremely lacking They provided incorrect information  asked about an outlet mall  they said there was no shuttle service from San An  there was they recommended taking a cab to another mall  which cost 20 each way we were told by a salesclerk in a store to go to the same mall using the transit which was 2 they would not make dinner reservations for us one night at 10PM as they said the restaurant would be close  to come back in the morninngwe called from our room  made our reservationsThey just didnt have that happy outgoing helpful attitude that we are used to encountering with conceirge services or even front desk staff
Another experience we didnt appreciate no washrooms on the mainfloor so we had to go up to our room The door key for some reason didnt work it was probably after 10PM we returned to the front desk no one was around we called the front desk from the lobby phone it rang foreverno answer I finally knocked on the door  the front desk staff came out obviously from a very sound sleep He did fix our door key so all ended well but it was a bit frustrating 
The room was spacious clean  comfortable There was quite a bit of noise from the interstate you could hear traffic increase each morning Some morning we were woken by I think a garbage bin being emptied
Also on the website it shows an airport shuffle it is NOT free In fact it works for one person but if there a two its cheaper to get a cab We asked at the airport  ended up taking a cab which is around 30 one way I think they said the shuttle was 19 each way per person 
We stayed 6 days in San Antonio which was too long We didnt find that there was enough to do in the city and we are not country  western fans

title: Bostons Best hotel certainly from a Europeans standpoint
text:
I am from Paris and found the accommodations to be merci suite
the staff is creme de la creme and the chef is awesome
i cannot wait to go back and see this best friendly staff in the whole USA

title: Whole experience was just aweful
text: I normally dont bother with reviews but this stay I felt needed one I always check out trip advisor reviews before booking with a hotel and they have never steered me wrong However this hotel was a huge disappointment I usually take the bad reviews with a grain of salt if there are numerous good reviews Well I should have listened to the bad this time First off all staff that I encountered except for a young lady that had only been there 4 months were rude We booked through expedia which advertised free shuttle free continental breakfast at a special rate which was 3 less than the sign outside the hotel when we arrived We were given a room on the ground floor on a saturday night at about 8pm We were surprised at the amount of people out in the halls and outside but we figured it would calm down No such luckfolks were making all kinds of noise all throughout the night There were a lot of young couples making out in the parking lot and with the mirror over our bed and the extremely small room it made me wonder if there arent a lot of hourly stays here The bed was hard and uncomfortable and with all the noise we were not able to sleep one wink the small uncomfortable room with the hard bed did look clean but there was something splattered all over the mirror headboard like soda or food or something that made me wonder if they really cleaned the rooms ever We were only staying for one night so we could leave the next morning for a flight to disney world When we checked in we told the girl that we had requested the shuttle service for 7am She said ok and wrote our names on some sort of list not a problem Also asked what we would have to do to get the shuttle back to the hotel and she replied just call the hotel and well take care of it Ok Well the next morning no one was at the front deskwe later found out he was the one setting up breakfast When I asked him about the shuttle he did come out and call the driver to wake him up I also asked him if we just called them or how the process worked to get picked up He said to just call He was very short with everyone he spoke to He was very strange cant describe him Anyway there were 5 of us already out there waiting for him he was supposed to be out there at 7am The driver finally showed up at 730 to give us a ride pretty darn tired looking He must have also not gotten any rest from all the partying going on in the halls the night before Anyway we got the ride to the airport and there were no lines so no problems getting to our 930 flight on time The real problem was when we returned I called the hotel to get the shuttle back to where my van was parked All of a sudden they have no record of me even staying there Then the lady on the phone finally finds it and says oh you booked through expedia so you shouldnt have been allowed to park and shuttle without upgrading to our price She also called my price extremely discounted even though it was only 3 less than the advertised price on their signage and it was I am pretty sure the crappiest room they had available After hearing I might have to pay double what I paid to get back to my van which was already parked at the hotel you can imagine I was pretty irrate So I did mention to her that I got a discounted rate for a crappy room She insisted that I had to pay the fee that the 2 employees before should have mentioned to me and made me pay before I left my van there She asked that I pay that fee when I got back to the hotel and since I finally agreed she did go ahead and have the shuttle man pick me up since he was already there picking up another couple But she was pretty rude about it Also if you have small children you should know that the shuttle is more of a small minivan I didnt think to bring a car seat for my two year old son bc I didn know this Next time I will ask the hotel what kind of shuttle Anyway I wouldnt recommend staying here at all but if you still decide tojust know that you will probably pay way more money than advertised I watched a couple check in that morning and the cost ended up being 70 without any kind of park and ride service The sign outside advertised 4999 but with taxes and fees the front desk guy told them it was 70 Anyway this review may not sound too bad to some and I guess I should have known better than to try to save a little money However after these reviews I felt like it would be a good place to stay for one night Boy was I wrong Nothing was as advertised and how can it be a good place for one night when everyone is making noise all night No consideration at all It was a horrible way to start our vacationI should have just waken up at my house at 3am and driven 3 hrs to the aiport myselfit would have been better than paying for this hotel and not even getting to sleep there Just not good experiencesI just want to save others from having similar experiences Oh and the lady that made me pay extra was dissing expedia like crazy and I have always booked through them with no problems whatsoever On the positive side since we were standing in the lobby for 30 minutes waiting for the driver of the shuttle busI did manage to get a bagel to eat and get some fruit loops and juice for my son The breakfast didnt start until 7 a little after though on the weekends Im wondering if those folks with good reviews stayed during the weekday and if that makes a difference Maybe an upper level larger room I dont know But I will say that when we got there I kind of felt like the lady who wrote she didnt feel safe in this hotel It was just the people hanging out in the hallway and the sketchy people walking up and down the road around the hotels I kinda wondered if my van would be safe but the front desk lady just said not to leave anything valuable in it and that they hadnt had to call the cops for any incidents in about 4 months

title: Cowpatties in Cowtown
text:
One might guess from my title that I dislike Fort Worth but its one of my favorite places in the world My tolerable stay at Country Inn and Suites only slightly spoiled the ambiance and thats saying something for the charm of Cowtown My suite was clean and adequate but the refrigerator was very flimsy and small There was only one small closet and the TVs were pretty old However these are minor problems
 Ive stayed in a lot of places and have never complained even at one hotel in Corpus Christi with a lot of mirrors and a lot of cockroaches reflected in them not to mention the flimsy deck that felt as though it might give way at any moment just like the decks in the tier of rooms next to me with one continuous hole through them from floor four to floor one Did the victims survive I wonder But I digress Back alas to the Country Inn and Suites
 Where were my freshbaked cookies Nowhere to be seen The unhappy story begins however when I took my first shower After adjusting the water pressure to a painfree level I noticed that most of the shower ended up on the bathroom floor and the fan did nothing to prevent condensation I had to mop up the floor and dry the mirror and counter afterward The bathroom towels were all damp This might have been prevented if a real shower liner had been put in the room instead of a flimsy curtain that was never meant to be waterproof and clung to me so much I was sorry I hadnt made my introductions before we had gotten so intimate The trick I discovered was to thoroughly wet the bottom of the curtain so that it would leave me alone and hug the side of the tub instead This helped to keep some of the water in the bathtub and not on the floor It was late at night however and after my aquatic workout and cleaning the bathroom I was thoroughly wrung out Only an exasperated call to Management was going to make me feel better Or was it
 After explaining the problem to a desultory nightclerk the phone was handed to a brisk and efficientsounding manager She couldnt have sounded less concerned with my problem and informed me that somehow my showertaking skills were inadequate All of the rooms had these socalled shower curtains and she really saw nothing wrong with them The fault lay in my woeful showertaking skills not their faulty curtains Why she had never heard of such a problem I suggested she take a shower herself in one of her wonderful bathrooms with the fan running and see if she didnt herself have a miserable experience Since there was a convention in town and I couldnt reward Managements attitude by finding another hotel I remedied the problem by buying my own shower curtain the next day I had to make a second call for dry towels
 On the positive side the rooms were clean maidservice was friendly and prompt and the pool was very pleasant Latenight swims were a real pleasure Just dont expect to stay in the shower for more than a few agonizing minutes and expect the bathroom to be drenched unless you ask for room 120 the only room with a real shower curtain

title: Good hotel  you get what you pay for
text:
I stayed at this hotel for a week in late August It was my first stay but I anticipate staying here again in the future My company has a corporate agreement with Club Quarters so I dont have much of a choice on where I stay while in Chicago on business 
The only dings I can really give this place are regarding the front desk and the bedspillows On several occasions during my stay the front desk staff was more interested in discussing their personal lives than helping customers I expected the standard issue hard bed and thats what I got What I was not expecting was the condition of the pillows When I went to lay down the interior contents of the pillow moved to either side of my head and my head was literally laying on the bed So whats the point of even having pillows By piling both of them on top of each other and kind of rolling that into a ball I was finally able to get a marginally acceptable pillow
As others have mentioned this hotel is not going to put you in the middle of the action of downtown If you dont mind some walking in order to get to Michigan Avenue Millennium Park etc then youll be just fine Because its more in the business area of town it can be a bit deserted on the weekends and after about 89PM on weeknights But I walked around by myself on numerous occasions during these times and felt perfectly safe
As for the room size I had a room with one queen bed It is small by US standards but if youre in downtown Chicago you shouldnt be in your room other than to sleep and shower anyway This hotel caters to business travelers so if youre looking for a spacious andor luxurious room then should look elsewhere Overall I had a pleasant stay at the hotel and for the price I had to pay it cannot be beat for downtown Chicago

title: the first time i used travelodge
text: i just want anyone in the bussines office for travelodge need to know that this motel in houston tx did a excellent job on making me feel as though i never left home The staff was great at doing there job and made everything very easy I plan to use them again in the near future Thanks Lionel Taylor

title: Loved our room
text: I loved our room and location We got a suite which included a comfy king bed a huge bathroom area and a kitchenette The room was clean and comfortable The location was awesome Literally 2 minute walk to the mall hollywood blvd kodak theater and chinese theater Very quiet hotel No complaints at all The people at the front desk where very helpful and friendly I would totally stay here again

title: Nice hotel with good breakfast
text: I like the location here as well as the breakfast The only negative was the fact that they dont have an indoor pool or hot tub They do have a mini bar next to the front desk which is nice for a late evening drink Breakfast was good with french toast eggs sausage links hot oatmeal pastries toast and several different miks and juices I would stay here again

title: had a great time at the restaurant  bar
text: the service in the hotel was exceptional we especially felt cared for at the restaurant bar Having missed our reservation time at our restaurant due to the difficulty in getting a cab we decided to head into the hotel restaurant for drinks and dinner That was the best part of our night Not only did Bill the gentleman behind the bar make us delicious cocktails and entertain us with funny stories but he also recommended a couple of restaurants for us to try while in town The dim sum restaurant that he recommended was the highlight of our culinary experience while in san francisco thank you bill

title: Great view but not what Id expect from a hotel this nice
text: I stayed here for 3 nights while taking a class for work at the hotel The hotel itself is very nice and the patio and view of the harbor were great However charging for wifi is ridiculous and I was surprised that there was no refrigerator in the room at a hotel this nice Also housekeeping didnt replenish the washcloths when they cleaned and they didnt take all the dirty towels even though we laid them right beside the tub 250 for a 20 oz pop always kills me seriously what a rip off Maybe thats just Boston pricing but in Ohio thats a lot No pop machines on the floors meaning I had to travel from the 10th floor down to the lobby to get my 250 bottle of pop Concierge was very helpful and the free shuttle to the airport was nice We used the shuttle at one point to take us to the airport where we took the subway to get into the city Theres no inexpensive option for getting from the hotel to the city since you have to get across the harbor The water taxi was neat and we did that once but it was 17 per person round trip Regular taxi was about 25 one way Not sure how much the subway was but it was in between the water taxi and regular taxi pricewise Overall very nice hotel but I was surprised about the wifi charges and lack of the little perks youd expect at a hotel such as this

title: staff needs to remember to clean microwaves
text: Hotel was very easy to findnice room clean but one problemprevious renter left food in the microwavedisgusting not sure how long the food was there but it smelled as soon as i opened the doorstaff should make a point to check and clean microwaves after every rental I love having a microwave in the room but whats the point if its sceevy

title: Great stay
text: We only stayed one night at this hotel but it was a very enjoyable stay Front desk staff were friendly and helpful Room was very clean and tidy Nice new bathroom The hotel is in a great location right in the middle of town on Powell st where the trams run Our room was right on the Powell st side but was still very quiet I would definately stay again

title: Landmark hotel great location
text: I enjoy staying at the Boston Park hotel it has that old classic elegance about it The location is the best it close to all the great shopping on Newbury and amazing restaurants within walking distance LOVE IT I have stayed here a few times on business and have enjoyed it each and every time You dont have to think twice about staying at this hotel you will have a good stay

title: Fitzpatrick Grand central Hotel New York NY
text:
I stayed in this hotel two weeks ago for 3 nights having read good reviews and got an amazing deal The hotel was very comfortable The bedroom was large and the bathroom was enormous Every facility I wished for was available The beds were the most comfortable that I have ever slept in in an hotelit was very difficult to get out of it The staff were very helpful and friendly and the concierge performed a miracle getting us a taxi to the airport The only critisism that I had was that the water pressure was rather weak in the shower 
The location of the hotel is brilliant it is so easy to access all of Manhattan easily from here
I will definitely stay in this hotel again when visiting New York City

title: The Best Red Roof Inn Ever  but still a red Roof Inn
text:
This is the best Red Roof Inn I ever stayed at The rooms were recently updated to a trendy modern decor Some of the rooms have a nice view of downtown The location across the street from the convention center is nice The Arena District is within walking distance theoretically The Short North is a 5 min drive
On the downside it is still a Red Roof Inn the bed was hard the linens were rough and the towels werent soft  but everything was clean
Breakfast was prepackaged muffins bagels and bread You could grab some toast and coffee but dont expect much You could walk across the street to the Convention Center Food Court for breakfast or lunch
Parking is an issue Parking is 10 a day which is cheap but it is across the street There is a few spots to unload by the front door In addition the parking is not in a garage and your car is susceptible to break ins However this is pretty much par for the course in downtown hotels You could park across the street in the convention center parking lot
I wouldnt mind staying here again if I needed a place downtown

title: Weekend stay at the Donovan House
text: My wife took a three day weekend in WashingtonDC and made reservations at the Domovan HouseKimpton on K Street Everything about the hotel was very cool We were met with one of the most enthusiastic greetings ever from hotel staff They were extremely helpful with all of our requests The decor has a retro space age look The roof top bar and pool on the 14th floor was spectacular We will definitely be back

title: Best Spot to stay in Fort Worth
text:
We stayed at the Omni Fort Worth for three nights in July 
Could not have been more pleased with our selection Our room was a Premier King  this gave us a large room with a wall of glass nicely furnished with a beautiful bath featuring a fabulous glass enclosed shower The amenities were fabulous The staff could not have been nicer  one day when we had mistakenly left our do not disturb sign up for the entire day we requested fresh towels in the evening Imagine our surprise to return from dinner and find the entire room had been cleaned and refreshed
Room service was fabulous valets were always eager and cheerful and we cannot say enough good things about the comfort and layout of the rooms
There is a great fitness centre with all the best equipment  and downtown Fort Worth is an easy walk away for dinner and shopping yet highways are easy to access to travel to other parts of the city
Truly the best choice in downtown Fort Worth

title: Hotel pics are DeceivingNASTY with BED BUGS
text: The room was infested with BED BUGS Was moved to a different room at 230 am Management Ramonemgt was rude and pretty much disregarded the incident The second room had three twin beds for four adults and it was filthy I guess this was punishment for complaining The mattresses were covered with mattress covers and the seams were duck taped Not sure if that was so the bed bugs couldnt get in or so they couldnt get out At 6 am we decided we had enough and decided to leave ASAP Spoke with the gentleman that checks bags he was very nice and offered us large trash bags to put our luggage in so we didnt take any bugs home with us Also he indicated that he strips before he leaves work even his socks He fears he will take the bugs home Thats sad when the employees feel this way We asked for our money back they said they will file a report and if the exterminator determines it is in fact bedbugs they will refund our money BUT if it is any other insect they would not These people are NUTS Since it was Friday the exterminator would be called on Monday They have no intention of letting me know of the outcome not that I expected they would But I did call the Health Department first Monday morning so I know a formal complaint was filed I WILL NEVER EVER EVER STAY THERE AGAIN ROOM 1570 15th floor

title: nice location rooms are ok
text: This is a simple clean friendlystaffed hotel in an excellent area if you are coming to chicago to shop It is a block or two from the mag mile and a nice safe area The only 2 detracting items for me are that the rooms are a little on the small side which i was traveling alone so it wasnt too big of a deal The other item is there is only a single elevator so depending on your ability to hoof it on the stairs you can sometimes wait awhile If you were on a low floor probably not a big deal Ditkas restaurant is connected to the hotel and the breakfast area is in the restaurant must be a sharing arrangement

title: A very nice place to stay and a great location
text:
When we found a great deal via TravelZoo for Labor Day weekend we pounced on 2 rooms for our family Turns out it was not just a nice hotel but the staff was super friendly and the location was quite convenient to navy Pier Millenium and Grant Parks the Magnificent mile and plenty of other sites that we walked to during our holiday stay
We had asked for rooms near each other on the same floor but ended up getting adjoining rooms so that was awesome We ate in the main lobby restaurant a couple of times in the morning for convenience more than anything else and though it was just a bit pricey the food was terrific and the breakfast buffet plentiful and quite tasty
My only nitpick is the 13day for internet  cmon folks thats a bit absurd Thank goodness the parking was free as part of our booking
I would stay here again in a heartbeat Great experience

title: Great Place
text: Stayed at LaQuinta Poway as a central base for vacation and visiting colleges in the San Diego area 15 minutes or less to downtown San Diego La Jolla Del Mar etc Many restaurants within 3 miles of hotel Room was relatively large everything was clean and nights were very quiet Will definitely stay at La Quinta Poway again

title: Good clean accommodation
text:
good clean rooms the staff were friendly and helpful
Theres bus service to and from town that stops outside the hotel It stops quite early at night time but a taxi from Downtown is only about 10 to the hotel
Would stop here again

title: The desk clerks always called me by my first name Bellman Dawit was right there I needed non dairy milk it was order
text:
I stayed 9 nights and all requests were immediately handled to our expectationsThe manager made sure that my dietary request was there for breakfast the next morning I would definitely stay there again The service people were the best of any hotel I have ever stayed
However on the negative side the rooms could certainly use some updating

title: Clean Hotel Valet Charge Must Go
text:
Hilton Mgt please open your ears the hotel is well located and the property is kept in good shape but please explain why there is no self parking Why do people have to pay the 26 valet fee
I attended a seminar in Austin and stayed at the Hilton for 2 days when I checked out I was hit with a 56 Valet charge I dont like to complain and paid the fee but I honestly think you will not get a lot of repeated customers The location is great the front desk personnel were very helpful and polite
People if you are looking for a cleanwell located hotel with a 26per day valet charge this is it One other thing call about 10mins ahead of time so your car can be ready for you when you are ready to leave

title: If you want to stay in a Nightclub
text:
If you like the type of boutique hotels then this might be for you but this hotel was not for me
First of all the entrance is very stange there is no sign to say that this is a hotel so you would walk past it and you wouldnt know what it was The doorman that took our cases had no IDbadge so we didnt even know if he worked there or if he was going to steal our luggage
Check in was no good either because we were on our honeymoon we asked for an upgrade the receptionist agreed but said she didnt have the room ready yet and did we mind waiting We were OK with this as were getting an upgrade however if we had known that we would have to wait over 2 hours then may not have bothered The thing was that she said because one of the lights was out in the room she would have to let an engineer go and check it out before we could go in the room Anyway after 2 hours we still hadnt got our room so went up to reception and they agreed we could check into our room but told us there would be someone coming up to fix the light But for the whole 5 night stay the light was never fixed so we wasted over 2 hours for no reason Not happy
I did not like the dark lighting throughout the hotel it was like a nightclub and the music in the lift was very stange 
The worse thing was the hotel bar the bad attitude of the serving staff really got up my nose and you could only sit in certain seats if you ordered the most expensive drinks on the menu what a load of rubbish it wasnt even busy I was not going to tip them after their rudeness
So overall would not recommend this hotel The rooms are very small We had a studio room and you couldnt swing a cat in it The staff were either rude or unhelpful One good thing was the Conceierge they had really good knowledge about the city but that was about it i am sure there are much better hotels in New York

title: Convenient and comfortable
text: I stayed here a few days with my family on spring break The hotel was clean and the staff assisted with anything I needed The bed was soooo comfortable that I didnt want to get up in the mornings There were a lot of families in the hotel but it was quiet nonetheless I would recommend this hotel if you are going on a family vacation as Fiesta Texas and Seaworld are close by and it is easy to get downtown to attractions around the Alamo

title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME
text: What else can I sayIm in NYC for work often and dont want to stay anywhere else and the neighborhood is the bestfeels like Old New York

title: Great Deal hotwire clean rooms decent location Screwed up our reservation and didnt handle it well Other issues
text:
First the good the place is right next to a freeway and getting to the aero port casino and attractions was easy Parking is free and easy too rooms are as would be expected from a holiday inn  spacious clean etc
After getting a great deal on Hotwire and then finding out the name of the hotel I called to make sure that the three rooms we were getting were connected to each other and two of them had king beds  both of these requests were very important since we are traveling with a baby  We were reassured that it will be all good They also set us up for an early checking 10am they said unusual but a nice bonus we thought
We called to confirm that our rooms were ready and as we requested half an hour before we arrived 12pm and all was good
When we arrived however we were informed by a very unapologetic person at the counter that 1 one of our rooms wasnt ready as they were overbooked  we were fine with that at first but didnt turn out to be ready until way after official checkin time2 only one of our rooms had King sized bad  we were willing to live with that 
 and 3 rooms werent connected  that part wasnt ok at all but on top of it she basically was telling us that there is no way we could have requested it she was actually implying we were making it upThere is nothing she could do she said Just like thatsince our hotel was prepaid for all 4 nights we couldnt just leave so waited for a manager who finally got us two connecting rooms  the third one was nearby not connected which was ok I guess it had a view of some dirty roofs too and wasnt ready for hours We were happy though that the main issues were resolved eventually  after probably at least 20 minutes at the counter with a crying baby manager was trying to fix the issues as she felt parenting comradely checkin was off putting I asked what they can do for us to compensate for this drama and they told us wed get a free breakfast the next day and a fridge microwave  both were nice gestures although it took 3 calls to actually get that and the man who brought them finally didnt have a splitter available so microwave had to end up on the floor Odd
Wireless was a real pain and i needed t to workI travel a lot  as u can see I usually leave nice reviews  and wireless works fine in this case I had to call them several times a day  they had to reset blamed my computer and refused to do anything once and in general it was a pain Finally figured out that their nets confuguration couldnt play nicely and consistently with my works VPN which isnt normally a problem Waste of time
Last complain when we went down for breakfast in the morning we waited 15 minutes in a half empty restaurant its more of a bar size and then waited 45 minutes for our food which was pretty good Wait stuff was nice to us but very neurotic as even my 2 year old noticed  They did yell at some couple that they had to wait until seated And I mean bark Odd we were thinking maybe erected is a convention or something in another room that they are catering
Otherwise the place is good  beds were comfortable hot tub was nice on a rainy day  pool wasnt heated though as their website says but that was ok
There is food within walking distance  a great Thai restaurant across the street fast food bagel shop Starbucks View From the 2 rooms was over the highways and hills behind it it ws pretty nice actually
Its not really in mission valley but I liked the location anyways

title: great location comfy bed otherwise lackluster
text: We had a great nights sleep at this hotel and its location was very convenient near Chinatown close to Union Square Fishermans Wharf North Beach Ghiradelli Square etc Otherwise the hotel was quite lackluster especially for the price The room was VERY small and the bathroom was beyond teeny The staff was responsive  even when we stopped by the front desk around midnight to request more bath towels our bathroom was only equipped with one when we checked in The bellhop had a strange altercation with a cab driver while trying to help us get on our way to the airport he was discreet about it and it was fine but was representative of the entire stay safe fine and perhaps a bit too much hype considering the price

title: My familys favorite
text:
We have stayed at the Mediterranean Inn at least 5 or 6 times in the last few years and have never had a bad experience The location is great especially if you have kids as its close to the Seattle Centre Science museum childrens museum space needle and you can take the monorail downtown and to Pike Place Market The area is also great for walking around  there are good restaurants grocery stores a used book store 
The last time we stayed here Aug 2008 I booked a king sized bed and found it very comfortable  on previous trips weve had a queen bed that was a bit too small for us Also you can request a room with a window seat made into a bed if youre traveling with a small child probably not good for those younger than 3 as its fairly high off the ground My 6 year old loves it The one downside is that the windows arent the best and let a good deal of street noise in but I cant say that its bothered us much

title: So good we visited it twice
text:
I have stayed in this hotel twice and on both trips it was excellent Suite type hotel with a very small modern lobby and staff that were second to none This hotel would suit anyone who thinks location and accomodation is paramount over room service which most people wont use anyway
We have always stayed in a two bedroomed suite but have seen a one bedroomed suit which was equally impressive
The kitchens are well equiped and a supply of breakfast goods are provided Top tip when you need more provisions just ask as they are not automatically replenished
I will use this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone

title: SAT to SBA
text:
My expectations were few for this stay just a stop on the long drive home from San Antonio The hotel is convenient to Interstate 10 The front desk staff were courteous and efficient We were in a second floor room with access by elevator or stairway The elevator was appreciated
The room needs to be updated to be really nice The mechanicals all worked and the AC was effective but the grout in the bathtub tile had obvious mold and the worn out tub was badly stained Just the same we were not disturbed by noise and the beds were comfortable The free wireless internet was easy to use
The free continental breakfast and coffee in the lobby were uninviting especially the prepackaged muffins and pastries The only protein was unshelled boiled eggs and there was no fresh fruit We ate elsewhere

title: Great location
text: We loved the location to the Wharf ghardelli the trolley and the bus to golden gate park Great rooms and service Will got back

title: Cant wait to go back
text:
Although it has been months since our stay this hotel stands out as one of the best hotel experiences I had in the past three years
The location was great for us as we took the train from Boston and walked the several blocks from the train station With luggage it was interesting on the busy sidewalks so you might want to cab it but we love to walk as it helps us to get our bearings and really get to know a city
As we approached the building we could see scaffolding and both groaned in anticipation of construction noise What a pleasant surprise then to be told by the Front Desk that our room was not ready so they would bump us up to one of the coveted and more expensive upper floors I wasnt sure if we should do this I have a terrific fear of heights but the woman at the desk said we definitely should go for it as the room was great She was right and I am so glad I made the move We had a beautiful spotless mini suite with a gorgeous view of the city I was with my husband and he really appreciated the separate kitchen which was fully equipped We didnt use it much but it was great knowing we could on a future trip
The king size bed was comfy and the linens high quality and spotless The bath was elegant with fluffy towels and high quality bath products I do believe we had to pay extra for internet which always kind of annoys me but that was truly the only bad note in an otherwise perfect stay
There is a little breakfast place right next door but also plenty of other choices if you feel like wandering a bit 
We stayed for three nights in February which was a good time as far as pricing went and we lucked out as the weather was unseasonably warm and beautiful 60 degree days Hope to do this again next year

title: Very friendly and helpful staff
text: I loved this hotel We got there 3 hours early and they went ahead and let us checked in Everyone was so friendly and helpful Yeah the items in the mini bar were overly expensive 3 for a can of soda but I guess that is normal The rooms were on the small side and not at all what I imagined they would be like considered the hotel is called the La Mansion I was very disappointed when I saw our room but after awhile it kind of grew on me Our room had a view of the pool which was beautiful but it was lould I heard kids screaming every morning which was not plesant to wake up to Over all I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I would stay here again If anyone over 21 reads my review and desides to stay here  you have got to go down to the hotel bar and have a mojito

title: clean quiet and a nice breakfast
text: Classic Courtyard facilities clean quiet and good value for the money Breakfast was extra but at a reasonable price Location is only about 20 min from the Charlotte NC airport Convenient to gas stations shopping and restaurants Stopped here on our way to and from Asheville

title: Gorgeous Indoor Architecture
text: I stayed here at the end of August for a business trip I was very pleased with most all aspects of the hotel The Mediterranean feel of the cental courtyard is absolutely beautiful And the view from the glass elevators made the morning trips down to breakfast and to the start of the meetings so enjoyable The rooms were very spacious and clean The only problem was that I could not get the room to a comfortable temperature Even when I turned the AC off completely it was still cold But since I didnt spend much time in the room it wasnt a big deal Just bundled up good at night The breakfasts were great I didnt use the restaurant although it seemed kinda small but did spend about an hour in the bar area one night when I just couldnt seem to wind down The bartender was very friendly and attentive One other minor complaint and this is at no fault of the hotel was that my room was on the front side of the hotel and there was roadwork being done on Baymeadows that started about 9pm each night Kinda noisy and there were some flashing yelloworange caution lights that made their way through the curtains If youre planning a trip in the next week or so I would call the hotel to see if theyre still doing roadwork there and if so request a room towards the back of the hotel The only other complaint would be that the side door that I used to enter and exit the hotel seemed to be the general smoking area for the hotel staff and any other guests Being a nonsmoker it wasnt very pleasant to have to walk through the blue cloud of smoke every time I left or came back After the 3rd time I just started using the front entrance instead

title: Very Nice Hotel  almost excellent
text: For the price a great option Rooms are spacious clean and well decorated Very comfortable bedding Service was friendly albeit a bit amateurish especially when discussing restaurant options The shuttle service not only takes to and from the aiport but also was availalbe to take us back and forth from local restaurants saves a lot on cab fare My only complaint which is a pet peeve of mine no free wifi in the rooms  only in the lobby

title: Hotel for the classics
text:
So i had a week in NYC and i was looking for a place to stay and pay less than 200 a day 
This hotel is located right in the middle of everything it is near the subway it offers free transportation in the city and most of all it has a great bar and lobby
The room was a bit small but it was clean and tidied everyday the bath was amazing with Gliss products

title: 2nd Stay wasnt that great
text:
My husband and I spent two nights at the Hotel Adagio this past weekend after having a really nice one night stay late last year We were planning to visit their tapas restaurant Cortez this time but it was closed due to some sort of major underground plumbing issue Our room was nice enough 6th floor view facing a brick wall on the back side of the building it sounds boring but was nice and quiet with very little street noise We like the Hotel Adagio for the modern decor bathroom supplies bed cleanliness etc Everything was fine until Saturday morning There didnt seem to be any hot water even after running the tap for awhile sometimes older buildings have issues so I was being optimistic Anyhow we finally decided that there wouldnt be any hot water so we called the front desk They told us that it was a problem with the water pump and someone was working on it but had no idea when it would be fixed The person on the phone didnt seem very interested in explaining the problem to me or very concerned either Eventually after a few hours the hot water was back But not for long
We got back to the hotel from an afternoon of shopping wanting to freshen up before dinner and found that there wasnt any hot water again We called the front desk and they told us there was still a problem with the water pump and it was being looked at again Again they didnt seem too concerned or apologetic which we found really annoying We never did get any hot water and had to suffer with ice cold water not fun 
Sunday was a little better one out of two of us had a hot shower which was an improvement We were never offered any kind of perk for the inconvenience just a halfhearted sorry about that We werent expecting to be comped for the two night stay but perhaps a voucher for a future discount or maybe comped parking Most of the staff was pretty indifferent to the problem and we were really disappointed at their attitude
Anyhow in the future we will not be choosing the Hotel Adagio opting for another of the many boutique hotels in SF

title: Fantastic location and great service
text:
Stayed there for a few nights recently the location of the hotel is fantastic It is near 711 grocery store great restaurants night life the train I walked everywhere The service was great you feel welcome from the moment you arrive I have requested an early checkin and this was not a problem 
Free internet access is standard here as well as access to fitness facilities The bed is very comfortable comparable to Westins Heavenly beds The bathroom is on the small side and bath products are not high end The room was clean 
One thing the walls were not thin but the door was i can hear peoples conversation in the hallway and the elevator my room was close to the elevator If you are a light sleeper that could be a problem However I was up early and returned late so that wasnt too much of an issue for me Cannot comment on the food as I did not eat there they do have a 247 pantry available and a Starbucks on premise

title: There are better choices  Hilton Brand take note  1 night was enough
text:
I seldom travel to this areaso I depended upon a colleague to choose our hotel location based largely upon convenience of travel to our meetings
Checkin was all about getting the credit card imprint and never a smile or welcome word spoken to the guest Efficient  YesFriendly Not  
Rooms are poorly constructed paper thin walls  minimal noise reduction  which mean guests can clearly hear doors opening closingslamming and plumbing sounds at all times of the evening and night Conversations can be clearly overheard thru the walls in the adjoining rooms Bathroom fixtures are completely outdated and frankly peaking a complete joke 2 star properties in 3rd world nations are much higher quality and appointed The television in the adjoinging room could be easly listened to from my room at 0500 am 
Elevators are pathetically slow  so if you are inclined  take the stairsCarpets are sadly worn out and soiled
Frankly speaking  Hilton  Shame on you for allowing your brand to appear on this dump This reviewer felt completely cheated by the poor condition of this property

title: Great place location and staff
text: My husband and I took a quick trip to NYC and selected to stay at the Chelsea Pines Inn based on the great reviews we read on TripAdvisor The reviews were correct this inn is fantastic I would highly recommend it It was so easy to get all around the city from the Chelsea Pines I love that it was right next to Highline Park and the subway As everyone else has said the staff was friendly and helpful The rooms were reasonably priced and quite nice If you are looking for a place to stay in NYC look no further

title: Okay place for one night
text:
The place seems a bit worn down but okay for the price
Was concerned about the area  but we had no problems security wise
Breakfast was poor  and the service was bad almost nothing there

title: This is hotel is a pile of crap
text: They say that they remodeled this hotel 4 years ago It SURE hasnt been remodled good The elevator is a piece of crap that barely works I hit the floor button and 3 different buttons lit up The wall paper is UGLY The thermostat and workout machines in the work out room dont work THERE ARE BEDBUGS And the bed feels like a rock I dont think there is any stuffing in them If you want a nice view inside or out dont expect to get one at this hotel I was getting some ice out of the machine and the coke machine started acting like someone put a dollar in it and i was the only one there Once i left the room i heard a drink fall out i went back and there was nothing there Its a REALLY OLD hotel so its probably haunted The TV is horrible Im surprised it works though because nothing else in the hotel does There isnt a free breakfast They dont allow pets They cant make the hotel any worst I cant get any WiFiThis hotel is an expensive piece of crap If you ever want a good hotel near here there is a REALLY nice Courtyard Marriot like less than a mile from here I usually want to stay in the hotel rooms once i get in them i wanted to leave once i got in there There is even like a 20 charge per night if you pay with a debitcredit card This hotel better not be rated over 2 stars It shouldnt even be rated 1 star

title: Hidden treasure in the City
text: I must start of by saying that I am a born and raised New Yorker that conducts business and lives in the City therefore I pretty much know my way around to say the least I booked the doubletree because I had family and friends coming in from out of town and wanted some peace and quiet that I could only find in lower manhattan To my suprise this is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed in The rooms are up to date and very modern but the best part of the hotel is the helpful and very friendly staff Luisa at the front desk checked our whole group in and made sure we were all on the same floor she welcomed in such sweet and graceful manner  which is hard to find in NY  needless to say we had a great time and felt right at home She also gave us some cocktail drink coupons for the lounge that came in handy for us  Thank you all for you hospitalty

title: Nice and convenient to RiverWalk
text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel with our 6 month old The staff was very friendly and assisted us with any questions or things we needed The room was clean and a typical residence in room small kitchenette comfortable bed clean bathroom The maid service was prompt and good There is a charge for parking but that is consistent with all hotels in the area We did enjoy our stay and would stay there again

title: Suspect Customer Service
text: Rooms were of a satisfactory standard as youd expect from a Holiday Inn Hotel but the service provided by the front desk staff was variable as the evening  nightshift did not work to the same good standards as the dayshift I overheard others in the lift making the same conclusions If you can save any issues you might need help with until the dayshift is on duty

title: Great location and a really nice hotel
text: I booked this over Memorial Day Weekend and got an insanely low 62 rate on Priceline The location is in the heart of Center City with restauarants theaters and historic sights all within walking distance Philly is a great city to explore on foot and the hotel is perfectly central to any place one would want to get to The lobby was lovely and the front dest was very pleasant When a charge for the hotel bar was erroneously put on my room tab they immediately took care of it The room was spacious and clean and even the maids were very friendly Great weekend in Philly

title: Best bang for the buck
text: Was looking for a cheap place to stay during the Sox world series and Chinatown SRO fit the bill perfectly As the other reviews say the night staff doesnt speak english that well but I managed to communicate The only annoying thing was the main doors are lock after midnight so you have to wake up the night door man to let you in But other than that the location is old chinatown and is quite lively in the wee hours I also liked the fact that the red L line was only a block away which run 24 hours great for bars  Rooms werent the best in Chicago they are similiar to what you can expect in a motel 8 or similar level motelhotels Overall I give the place a B for value and location

title: Deserving of rating
text: The staff at this hotel are great without exception Nothing was too much trouble for them from start to finish We were there for 7 days and everything was wonderful This trip was for my 60th birthday and the hotel staff made sure it was a trip to remember I would recommend this hotel to any age group

title: Excellent location friendlystaff  good atmosphere
text: this was our first stay at alexander inn we really appreciated it  very convenient locaton good breakfast comfortable room and very friendly staff this will be our place to stay in Phladelphia should we decide to come back

title: Quaint even though its in the city
text:
This was a bit of a splurge for me but well worth it I would definitely stay again but for only a short time since it was a bit expensive 
 The staff was phenomenal I was very worried about parking since I drove around for 15 minutes and didnt see anything As a last resort I drove right up to the hotel and they had someone right there to take care of everything I cant remember if I paid anything for the parking but it wasnt unreasonable I didnt have to worry about a thing after that was eagerly taken care of for me 
 The hotel was beautiful and luxurious The elevators and hallways were small but gorgeous We were greeted by the friendly staff and taken to our room expeditiously The room was a nice size and had a perfectly clean decent sized closet The bed was very comfortable and there were chocolates and cookies left nearby for us to indulge in They were quite good too The bathroom was awesome The shower was huge and the entire bathroom was immaculate The decor was very romantic and there was just the right amount of furniture in the room It was cozy I wish I lived there 
 When we were ready to go out it was such a pleasure The neighborhood is safe and so beautiful Great place for a romantic walk at night There was a park nearby and the housesbuildings were wonderful to take in There were also plenty of restaurants and shops nearby within walking distance to enjoy

title: Great Location
text: Enough distance from the noise of Times Square Easy walk to most things Spacious suites reasonable price for location Minimal contact with staff is OK unless you need Ritz or Four Seasons treatment Loads of local places to eat Delis Stage and Carnegie are 12 blocks away Rays Pizza around the corner Acceptable breakfast at Cafe Metro across the street Great being able to get up early and sit in the suite without disturbing spouse Fitness club is adequate Great having wifi everywhere including fitness club

title: Love the Marriott on the Water
text: We have been stayed at this hotel as business guests and on vacation We have enjoyed all of our stays

title: Just great
text:
We stayed in the Trump Soho for 4 nights middle of March The hotel was really great huge bed quiet room which I am very sensitive for helpfull staff
One evening we went for dinner and the concierge sent us off in their house car These are the things that make the difference As well as when my partner was making dinner reservations at the concierge desk and got into a conversation as we were a bit jetlegged She offered to sent us a couple of lavender pillows for a good night rest 
The only thing was that at our day of departure the alarm went of at 8am We had a late flight to Europe so Id found that very disturbing We didnt touch the alarm our entire stay so that was really weird would it be a trick to get your guests in time out of the room Im not sure because when mentioning it to the reception during check out the only thing they said was oh sorry about that That was just not good enough
But other than that everything was really great Thumbs up to the lovely doormen

title: Quite comfortable but old
text: The room was comfortable but the bathroom was very small and the interior was quite wore out The staff werent t hat friendly either and the internet access was expensive unless you brought your own laptop with you The hotel is located on 48th Street which is 2 blocks away from the Rockafella Center but still 15 mins walk from Times Square

title: Excellence in the Theater District
text:
I am grateful to other Tripadvisor reviewers who helped me and my wife to consider this hotel We stayed six nights and were very impressed by the size cleanliness quality and location of the Michelangelo New York
Location is excellent It just north of the crowds of Times Square but close enough for a five to ten minute walk to most theaters If you use the subway three different stations are within one or two blocks 
If you want a quality hotel that is wonderfully quiet and well managed in the center of the city this is the place Staying at the Michelangelo makes us look forward to our next trip to New York City

title: Would definitely go back
text: We spent Spring Break with my teenage daughter and her friend Our suite had a family room with pullout bed for the girls and my husband and I had a kingsize room with balcony The bathroom was separated into the toiletshower and vanity area There was an entrance from the family room and the bedroom into the bathroom The grounds have 8 different pools  we chose the adult only pool and the kids went to the bigger main pool The grounds are awesome  especially if you like to walk for a workout  lots of hills The restaurant at the top of the hill was fabulous Even if you just go to the Terrace Room for drinks you can enjoy the view If you are a Hilton Member you get an awesome buffet breakfast for free every morning Workout room did get a little crowded in the mornings but there is also a great walkinghiking trail right next to the resort and tennis courts It was also a short 20 minute drive from the airport

title: Outdated old dirty
text:
I am surprised that they can call this hotel a Marriott Sheets and pillows are the only item that has been updated in the past few years The maroon chair is badly faded and brown from all the dirt on the chair Room and hallway smells dirty No free breakfast for Rewards members on weekends Front dest staff not capable Lost my room key Went to front desk to get another and gave them my information It didnt match what was on the computer 
I stay about 100 nights per year in MarriottHilton chains This particular hotel is worse than a Holiday Inn Express

title: Perfect location for Center City exploring and touring
text:
Friends and I were in town for Whiskey Festival held within walking distance  it was very clean comfortable and the corner rooms are huge  ask for a higher floor with a view of City Hall and the towers  quiet and worth the money
We walked to most of what we wanted to including Reading Terminal Market for a helpful hangover breakfast thank you Down Home Diner
Valet was helpful as was housekeeping for extra towels

title: A Very Pleasant Surprise
text: My husband wanted to set my girlfriend and I up for a nice girls night out in downtown San Diego but all the hotels downtown were booked for a conference He ended up booking us at the Town and Country because of its convenient location to downtown The room was very and the bar at Trellaces treated us very well We were planning on eating out downtown but the food at the restaurant looked so good we decided to eat there It was a great choice After a great night out downtown the bed at the hotel slept great I would go back there anytime The weather was not warm enough to go swimming but the pool area looked great

title: location location location
text:
Arrived on the 15th February to some of the coldest tempretures I have ever experienced 20 centigrade with the wind chill
On arrival at the hotel found the staff to be very helpfull and polite
Had a room allocated on the 18th floor one of the few smoking ones Room was a petite double and while it was small it had all that you would need and was warm even though the heater had two tempretures cold and hot
However we did expierience a problem with the shower as the tempreture would not adjust from either cold or scalding hot we did report this but nothing seemed to happen at first eventually the maitenance manager came to the room to show us how to work the shower
He did agree in the end that there was a problem and apparently in most rooms on the 18th with the water tempreture to this end he got us moved to a double room on the 10th floor with no extra charge the hotel also gave us a free breakfast for the upheavall of moving
Apparently there are 273 Starbucks in New York and you have one in the hotel bar area great if you dont want to go out first thing however this is only open from 711am  but with a branch 100 yards up the road its not a problem if you want a late night one to take back to the hotel which they dont mind well they never chalenged us on it and plenty of people were bringing drinks in
Location of this hotel is great about a 10 minuite walk to Times Square and again a 2 minuite walk to Grand Central Terminal
5th ave is just 5 minuites walk away where you will ceratanly shop till you drop
However on the subject of shopping the Woodbury Common shopping outlet is a MUST You can get a bus from the port authority bus terminal on 8th ave which will take you directly there journey time is roughly 1 hour once there you would not belive the prices Timberland boots 5999 current exchange to uk 3000 all the big names are there and you will not get stuff as cheap as this in the city even in the big stores like Bloomingdales and Macys The ticket does cost 3999 each to get there but the savings far out weigh this people who were in the know who must have been before took empty cases with them
The concierge in the hotel will book tickets for this trip for you
We will return to NYC soon with a spare case Virgin alow you to check 2 bags for each pasenger up to 23kg each even when flying economy and for location will probably stop at the roosavelt

title: Overall VERY good but location could be better
text: The service here is VERY helpful on every level from the valet to the concierge Extremely convenient to semiupscale shopping and dining The location could be better however in terms of Austin nightlife Best suited for business travel or family visits not so much for the hip young crowd

title: Great Family Hotel
text: Stayed in early July with my two teenage children We had a suite that comprised of a full bedroom and a pull out bed in the living room and a full kitchen We were pleasently surprised to find out the kitchen had a full cooker The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly There is a great supermarket across the road that sells everthing The area is very safe a short walk to the nearest subway station But you can easily walk to the main sites

title: Great place for a stopover at the Houston airport
text:
We were on our way back from Honduras and spent the night in Houston to catch an early flight the next morning We booked the La Quinta Inn and Suites because they had a shuttle to and from the airport Everything was great The shuttle driver picked us up promptly after we called The desk clerk greeted us with a smile The shuttle driver recommended and drove us to a great restaurant in the area and also picked us up when we were done with dinner The room was very nice and clean We had to catch the shuttle back to the airport before 7 am so the desk clerk put muffins fruit and coffee out early for us so we could have some breakfast before we left All in all it was a
pleasant experience for us
On a previous trip we had stayed at a hotel just across the street for the same price and had a horrible experience so this was a pleasant surprise Will stay at La Quinta from now on

title: Highly recommend this hotel
text:
I have stayed here on several occasions and have always been very pleased with accomodations and staff I am a HiltonHonors Gold member and usually get the upgraded suite room but even the regular rooms are extremely nice
The only complaint I have is that the food isnt the best in the world but that is often a complaint at DoubleTree hotels The cookies are great though and realistically there are plenty of places to eat in Houston and if you dont want to drive the hotel is always willing to give you a ride in one of the hotel vehicles

title: Basic  Clean No Frills Very Desirable Location
text:
We stayed 5 nights recently at this hotel We read reviews beforehand and were expecting modest accomodations at a budget price Location was excellent close to everything we planned to do Front desk allowed us to check in early 200 at no extra charge and were given a quiet room with updated furnishings on the back side of the hotel The room and bed were quite small but adequate Bathroom and shower were small but updated plenty of hot water Not much of a view from the backside but we werent in the room except to sleep anyway Upon checkout the front desk held our luggage for a halfday at no charge til our flight left 
There were endless restaurant choices and especially enjoyed the Italian cuisine in nearby North Beach Lots of daytime tourists and foot traffic in the area during the day We plan to stay here again

title: You get what you pay for
text: We booked a room via the internet at the Mithila because it was inexpensive centrally located and carried a three star rating on one site We thought it would be an adventure staying in a Charming EuropeanStyle Hotel Located In The Heart Of Downtown San Francisco Instead we found a decaying old building that had been covered over with a coat of cheap paint and cheap carpet It stank of mildew and hadnt had a good cleaning in quite some time Although the pillow cases and sheets had been changed the pillows were old and stained as was the mattress and quilt Truly not an invitation for a restful night Im sure the hotel fulfills the local health codes but if you are looking for even a bit of comfort and a clean bed I would suggest you look elsewhere We stayed long enough to use the phone to book another hotel that we had used before and then checked out The staff said they had to bill us for three days although the policy was stated on several websites as a one day penalty for late cancellation However after a complaint to the web service that we had booked through our money was totally refunded

title: Great location and wonderful staff
text: My family has stayed at this Embassy Suites more than once and always have a good time here It isnt in the heart of the tourist area but it is well located to places all over Memphis There are great places to eat very nearby and the food at the hotel itself is always tasty The atmosphere is comfortable and the rooms are always clean The staff has helped us when things came up out of the blue and we have never had a single complaint

title: Perfect For One Night
text: Its hard to write a review on a place you only stayed in for one night but heres what we noticed while we were there The staff at the front desk were friendly for the most part but not above and beyond in any way For dinner they of course recommended the hotel restaurant which looked very nice but we were in Chinatown and wanted to enjoy a restaurant that reflected that We went with Tazias a recommendation from the nicer of the front desk clerks and loved it Parking was good it was a bit pricey but you are staying in a large city so thats to be expected I did like that the parking was in the same building as the hotel Rooms were basic nothing wowed us but nothing greatly disappointed us either We could hear everyone that passed by outside our door but this didnt seem to be something that was so bad it awoke us so overall we were pleased We would definitely do another overnight here but would probably look to somewhere with a bit more of a wow factor if we were staying in Philly longer

title: overpriced no hot water fridge broken 10 bucks to park on a 300 dollar room
