text: Overall the room was fairly clean but was way overpriced Got up at 7 am to shower and once in the shower found the water was just luke warm not even close to hot Stuck a couple drinks in the fridge and was wondering why the werent getting cold Upon moving all the desks to check the plug found out it was unplugged The fridge made so much noise I ended up unplugging it again I paid 28400 for a room with no hot water When I told the desk woman she handed my complaints to the GM who was on the phone he told her to take off the 1000 parking fee how generous I told him that wasnt enough for no hot water and he never hung up the phone to speak to me just said I should have called to have it fixed I said I was already in the shower and he said that I should have got out and called What a rude idiot I checked out and stayed at the Days Inn across the street 11800 a night and just as nice of a room as the Holiday inn One other thing they advertise and I was actually told you can walk out the hotel and your in the National Arboretum not so its 4 blocks away at least and its not in a neighborhhod you want to walk 4 blocks in My suggestionDays Inn far better value and easier access with a store dunkin donuts and a burger joint on the same side of the road plus a resturant in the hotel itself

title: Simply outstanding
text: Excellent locationsuch attention to detail We had a fire experiencenot a big dealbut the way they handled it all and the special perk for taking good care of us during the evacuation Lasted just minutesearly evening Love staying in a hotel that absolutely caters to its guestseven in the craziest circumstancesThank you for a fabulous timestaff was amazing Right in the middle of Seattle a short jaunt to the Marketand the shopsSO fun

title: great hotel perfect locationfriendly staffgreat value
text: Stayed 2 nights had great time Checked in by Erica who was so efficient friendly  helpful Had requested early checkin as flight arrived 9am  room was ready Room was large modern  bed so comfortable Caught bart from airport  hotel was close by the station Also Market street trams took us to Waterfront area Convenient location for price charged Would highly recommend this hotel

title: Everything I expected and a little unexpected
text: As a road warrier Ive come to reply upon Hilton properties in general and Hampton Inn in particular for a decent room an adequate breakfast and a fair price I chose this property due to its proximity to downtown Seattle While I got what I expected the usual Hampton Inn experience this hotel offered more and reminded me of my two favorite Hampton Inn properties in Chicago and Manhattan The front desk staff were beyond polite always asking what they could do to help me Questions were answered promptly and never did I have to wait for an answer The room I had a King Suite was large very clean and quiet Because of my positive experience my family is now considering this hotel for our home base for our summer 2013 vacation Highly recommended especially if you are going to visit the Space Needle or the EMP museum Oh and the monorail which you can catch at the Space Museum will take you to within 4 blocks of Pike Place Market A little gem offered by the front desk staff and employed by me

title: Parking was ridiculous
text: The hotel room was small but clean If you stay one night though you pay 44 dollars for parkingquite the rip off

title: Loved the Chandler
text: Hotel was in a great location The room was small but very clean and comfortable The bed and linens were very comfortable  the bathroom was great Room was quiet Overall a great place

title: Not the WORST place in the world
text: I agree with other reviews that says it is loud The train literally runs about 100 feet from the building But I think that is mostly because the windows are REALLY old and you hear all the noise coming in from them By newly remodeled they mean Paint Coat number 862 on the walls poorly applied I might add Talking to them on the phone is just about pointless I called twice and both times seemed like I was just bothering them In person they were much friendlier The bellman was quite nice actually Of course housekeeping was knocking on my door starting at 8am to clean the room which was kind of annoying every half hour I would not recommend this hotel if you have any allergies especially to dust My room really could have used a thorough cleaning but it was livable for one night I did not have any bed bug issues so that was good The bathroom smelled of stagnent water which I believe was the shower curtain The tub was REALLY deep Had the tub been clean I definately would have relaxed in a hot bath but there was slight coat of scum on it so I decided to NOT be a human scouring pad But I guess in comparison to other rates in the area it was cheap If you are looking for a hotel experience this is definately not your place If all you need is a bed to sleep in for a few hours and a hot shower you should be fine Just bring a pair of earlplugs unless you are a really sound sleeper

title: Very good for the pricebut they need to dust a bit more
text:
Got a very reasonable priceat least 50 less per night than the best deal I could find on Expedia Its an older refurbished hotel so yes the rooms are small but theyre livable Plus theres an open living room area on the Mezzine that has free wifi so if you do need room to stretch you can do it there The bed was very comfortable and I found the rooms and hallways to be very quiet I think the older construction actually helps in this case Unlike the newer hotels that are basically metal and cinder block the Hotel Pacific actually seems to have thick insulated walls Its also within good walking distance of shopping and Pikes Market I was in town for a conference and it was about a 10 minute walk to the Convention Center
The drawbacks A crotchety elevator that stopped working once or twice and the hotel could use a good scrubbing from top to bottom While the rooms were generally clean the curtain sheers could use a washing Im currently looking at a visible layer of dust on the light fixtures in the hotel lobby Not a deal breaker but they should break out a ladder and take care of details like that

title: Great hotel
text:
Pricelined this hotel for 87 plus tax per night Very happy with the hotel There were three of us travelling together in two rooms and as I snore really loudly I got a huge double double room all to myself Great views of Boston from the room nice controllable aircon Smallish bathroom though actually the same size as the one I had just stayed in NYC Really comfortable beds and nice large LCD TV The rooms have all been renovated in the past year and one of my travelling companions had stayed in this hotel before and confirmed that the rooms are much nicer now They have put a really nice rain type shower in and upgraded the furnishings
The lobby is very plush and check in was smooth Elevators were a little slow but not a real big issue I used the Boston Common parking lot which was about 34 from Saturday evening to Monday morning It would have been only 22 but we failed to get up before 8 am to get the car out in time We took a cab back
Lots of shopping opportunities around the hotel and not too far from the T station although we took cabs mostly everywhere
We managed to hire a speedboat from a guy at the harbour for 75 gas for two hours which was enough really We took it quite a way out to sea and actually to the furthest lighthouse It was also cool to see the aircraft taking off and landing at Logan whilst on a boat
All in al the hotel was pretty good especially for the price and I would definitely stay there again

title: Wil be our first choice for future trips to NYC
text: We stayed here with our family and another family in June 2011 It was our first trip to NYC The staff was very helpful especially the person we spoke with to make the reservations Hotel was clean and very nice inside We were surprised at the normal room size after what we had heard about New York hotels The mattress was great considered buying one Essabagel is just a block or so up the street and Certe Pizza another favorite was just around the corner Great part of town and within walking distance of St Patricks Bryant Park and other attractions We even walked from theater district to the hotel but that was quite a trek Our friends who come to New York on business usually stay somewhere else but after staying with us said theyll switch to this hotel now Definitely our first choice for any future trips

title: They dont care
text: Have you ever stayed in a hotel that didnt have a newspaper free or for sale These people didnt know where we could even buy one let alone care The ladys that worked there seemed to care Other wise they didnt give a

title: spacious and clean
text: Had a suite in 34th floor fantastic felt like an appartmentwe liked it so much that we spent every evening there after walking in manhattan all day Just picked up pizza in the neighbourhood and relaxed we had weddinganniversary and mention that got champagne when we arrived nice We also checked out 1 instead of 12 oclock we are very satisfied

title: Excellent hotel inexpensive and well situated
text:
I really like this hotel When searching for a hotel in NY I looked for one that was fairly central Manhattan and reasonably priced ie as cheap as possible and I found exactly that in Hotel Alexander So as to keep the cost down we opted to have a triple room with a shared bathroom in the corridor I was nervous about it as I dont like sharing bathrooms with other rooms usually but I neednt have worried There were three bathrooms for the floor and in 5 days I didnt have to wait once  at least one was always available 
The hotel is spotlessly clean even the communal bathrooms The room was very clean and the lovely cleaner always tidied it up and put things away for us so we always had a nice clean room to come back to at the end of the day
The location is really good as well We were within walking distance to Central Park and it is a nice area lots of wholesome looking people
The price was right as well We only paid 506 for a four person room for 5 nights so for each person it didnt cost much more than a youth hostel
I would definately recommend this hotel and cant think of one bad thing to say about it

title: fantastic hotel
text: We visited the Hollywood roosevelt in November 2003 for five nightsOn arrival we were upgraded to a fantastic suite on the 11th floorIt was very spacious with two kingsize bedsand a huge bathroom which contained a wet room and a bathThe toiletries were plentiful and of excelent quality we had a view of Hollywood blvdand could see right into the forecourt of manns chinese theatreWe were also very pleased to find that we had a perfect view of the hollywood signThe hotel was in a brilliant locationtaxi to warner bros studios was 10the tube to universal studios is a minute walk away and whilst on the tube is only a five minute rideMels diner is a great place to start the day breakfast is well recomended and not too expensiveNext door to mels diner is the Max factor museum which contains loads of hollywood costumes and make up worn by the stars for examplemarilynjoan crawford we were travelling with our 10 year old son who found the outdoor heated pool fantasticand went for a few moonlit dipsI would reccomend this hotel to anyonethe sheer history of the hotel is overwhelming so dont let other reviews put you offi would love to go back someday

title: Great Stay Detroit is turning the corner
text: Had a good stay Nothing extraordinary but a good find in downtown Friendly staff adequate rooms good location and there is a pool on the top floor that was kind of cool Typical Holiday Inn Express breakfast Would recommend and come back

title: Great location
text:
Great location at the Milburn hotel 
Breakfast is basic
They provide free WIFI for guests Very good
The room is okei size and the bathroom is okei size
Great staff that helps you with your needs

title: Where my guests stay
text: I recommend it to visitors who are on somewhat of a budget Good value for price right in middle of the action of downtown Denver Swimming pool attracts guests and locals alike The Place lobby bar has excellent service thanks Shelley  Tracey and incredible nachos It is extremely understated and certainly not pretentious If you want luxury and extreme pampering try some of the luxury hotels within walking distance Like all hotels downtown it is close to convention center caters to foreign bus tours so the volume will vary with the conventions but they staff accordingly

title: Another nice stay at Embassy Suites
text: The family visited DC for the weekend and Embassy Suites was our home away from home for one night With two small children the room worked perfectly That is the beauty of Embassy Suites no matter where you go their product is consistent It is a good hotel great location and the staff was plesant to work with The property has been updated the room was clean and the furnishings are in nice condition The hotel itself is located in a nice neighborhood and within easy walking distance of Dupont Circle and lots of neat shops and restaurants Downsides inlcude poor shower pressure parking its expensive unless you get lucky and find something on the street which we did and a 12 internet charge Come on really You will give clients endless drinks at the managers reception and all you can gorge breakfast but charge me 12 for internet Any hotel that charges internet fees loses a star on their value rating Yes you get a lot but you do pay for it with an all inclusive rate so they should include the internet and all would be excellent Overall we were quite pleased with our stay and will gladly stay here again

title: Your Home Away From Home
text:
I interviewed 6 different extended stay hotels in the fall of 2011 I picked this one as the perfect location You are truly in the midst of every imagineable shop and grocery store The proximity of the Dallas no tollway George Bush 635 and 121 is an easy get to anywhere
The staff truly went beyond expectationsFrom the moment you check in with Kalina quick and not painful to Freddie who will come and fix anything if needed to the cleaning staff your stay will be very comfortable I was there for 3 and 34 months while waiting for my new townhouse to be built
I would defintely stay again and hope that the staff were recognized as very friendly and efficient in their jobs
Thanks for everything
Karen Koedderich

title: An Oasis for the Business Traveler
text: I have have experienced two exceptional stays at the Orchard Garden and recommend it highly It is truly an oasis for the business traveler offering a high level of service and beautiful accommodations The staff is very helpful and friendly making it even more of a pleasure The fact that it is also a green hotel makes staying there even more of a priority for me

title: A great place to stay
text: This was the perfect place for us to stay while visiting LA We were going to be out all day and just needed a place to sleep The manager of the hotel deserves an award He was so nice and gave us good advice There was free coffee in the office One morning I was leaving at 6am to go somewhere when he called me from the office to remind me to get my coffee This is not an upscale hotel but it didnt cost me much to stay there and the rooms were clean I would go back

title: Great fun for the kidsno doubt
text: We went to the hotel to experience the Carribean Cove attraction my 6 year old loved seeing all the slides and pools when we showed him the brochures He was very eager and got the 180 to go via gift certificate prerequested b day gift this is a great way to have a child this age make the big splash yes the costs are over priced but as a true fun for kids idea the hotel scores very high The check in was short  5 mins on a Thurs and check out a bit longer 12 mins on Fri am but the rooms were clean  the noise not bad at all The water park is tremendous fun for any kidmy 3 year old was soaked from head to toe as well and loved being in the kiddie korner My 6 year never had more fun beats the zoo after the 1st time there the museums the moviesetc Only the state fair might equal the fun quotient Carribean Cove offered to all of us The slides are absolutely over the top drenching excitement no let down Yes 1 adult should be more watereager and we did not buy any overpriced food sold there We drove out and ate for cheaper The arcade was very impressive though another cost to bear and the lifeguard staff was hands down great The proximity of the rooms is ultra convenient  the quiter hot pools are a welcome break from all the rahrah action of running up to the slides I loved just floating around the wavepool riverthat was really enjoyable The fewer small children a parent decides to bring the better I think but its a nomiss love ya kid reward or gift The accomodations are very comfy yes its clean and friendly Our family bought modest souvenirs  drove 30 mins to get there each way We plan to go back family of 4 in March after IRS season or unless it becomes a Christmas wish somehow

title: Wonderful service and location
text:
My husband and I went to the Adagio to see if they could help us The response we received was absolutely outstanding We would like to compliment Kier for her wonderful assistance She managed to find us a lovely room including a complementary bottle of wine Every person we dealt with at the Adagio was friendly and effecient I cant speak highly enough of this hotel and would absolutely stay there again
 We had booked at another Joie de vivre hotel After one night there  incredibly small room noisy overflowing toilet etc we had had enough and the Adagio was wonderful source of refuge

title: What Continental breakfast
text:
My wife and I were here from 280310 to 040410 1 week
I had asked for three different wakeup calls did not receive any 
The buttons on the clockradio were so worn off I could not even set the right time as the radio had been unplugged
Stale bread Extremely minimuffins and donuts do not make a continental breakfast
No transportation from the hotel to the nearest Metro Front desk is more interested in getting you a gypsy cab Unmetered taxi percentage Cleaning staff do not know how to read a Do Not Disturbed sign
At checkout the front desk wanted to keep a photocopy of my drivers license and my credit card after it had been approved by the Visa company Im sorry but Ive had my Identity stolen before by this I was not going to let it happen again

title: So Perfect
text:
Ive been to NYC many times but had never stayed in the Upper Westside area before I found out about Hotel Beacon while going over other TripAdvisor reviews which rate it very high also
At first when I booked I had some doubts about location I thought that this could be too far from Midtown But after my recent stay I am quite sure that this has got to be one of the best places to stay in NYC 
First of all it is very conveniently located The neighbourhood is very pleasant and well kept with mostly local newyorkers passing by There are also many great bars restaurants cafs and stores Central Park is just a few blocks away and a good supermarket can be found just across the street A subway station is only 2 blocks away where you can ride the express train all the way to downtown after only a few stops 
The hotel itself is very well mantained and comfortable with spacious clean and tidy rooms that among other things include a desk a small sofa a flat screen tv and a nice little kitchen stove microwave coffe machine refilled daily fridge and sink All the hotel staff was also quite nice and very helpful
On top of it all the rates are very reasonable considering NYC standards Overall I have to strongly recommend this place

title: 48 hours in NYC
text:
We just decided to go from Montreal to NYC by Bus and stay one night at the Park Savoy
Great location very clean small room and bath but what else do you really need when you are the most time out We slept well and we will come back next time
Carmen

title: A wonderful experience
text:
A friend recommended the Hotel Drisco to us during our stay in San Francisco We could not have been happier with our accommodations From the moment we checked in to our departure four days later we were impressed with the service From the suggestions of local restaurants to directions to various sights the staff was extremely helpful Bob at the front desk went above and beyond in making sure our stay was enjoyable Not only was the location of the hotel wonderful but all the extra amenities added to the pleasure of our stay The Hotel Drisco is a place we would highly recommend to our family and friends and we will definitely be returning soon 
Dennis and Trish Rodrigues Cooper City Florida

title: Good enough
text:
I booked this Hotel as its location is great inside Chicagos loop near magnificent mile and not very expensive I knew is the economic line for Sheraton Hotels and didnt expect for a great hotel but I get really disapointed just when going inside
Unfriendly staff during the night they dont give you any information about hotel services and the only words I get from the girl during check in were  I need a credit card I was carrying a huge duffel and nobody offered a kart to take them to my room
They have a dark and small lobby where WIFI works once in your room you need to work with wired connection
About rooms are not bad you get a small fridge microwave and coffe maker Rooms maintenance is good I cant say the same about corridors maintenance where carpet is old and dirty
In my opinion if you re looking just a cheap hotel it is OK but if you need to work in your room or if your stay is going to be longer than 2 or 3 days avoid it for a few more bucks you ll get a better hotel

title: Please dont stay here
text: I attended a conference so was assigned to Town and Country From the moment we got thereto the moment we left it was a nightmare Check in and check out was total madnessthey dont assign rooms so you take what you can get My first room smelled of mold and mildew so bad I asked for a transfer That took two days and me pitching a fit wthe manager to get a new room Organization and cleanliness were terrible The grounds were lovely  but that was it We ate at The Terrace and it took almost 2 hours to get our food  then they said they ran out of the fish I ordered We ate at Charlies and it took 30 minutes for a waitress to begrudgingly wait on us It was a horrible experience  I would have left after the first day if I wouldnt have been assigned to the hotel for my conference The work out room and internet were an extra fee

title: Better than averagein some aspects
text: The room they gave us was really small It was clean and the bed was just okay There were no amenities but did have wifi And there were dishes and pots and pans and silverware in the cupboards the plus to this place was they actually provided dish soap and even Bisquick and butter Thats not normal I have never seen that before The staff was nice They originally gave us a floor on the second floor and saw that we had children then moved us to the bottom level Also the original room they gave us the door didnt shutlock

title: Good Experience
text: Just stayed at the Fairmont for a weekendvery nice hotelthe price was right199 per night for a spacious room with 2 double bedspretty comfortable and the rooms were very cleanThis hotel is in a really good location10 min walk to Georgetownthe area is really safe and pretty quietDupont circle is a 510 min walk away as wellIf you have a car the hotel has a garage which charges 28 per night to park and its good til 5pm the next dayon the weekend you could probably find parking on the street

title: Would stay here again
text:
This hotel was a great deal  great accomodations for a great price The beds were comfortable on the firm side but very supportive the bathroom was clean and a nice size our shower was very spacious and we had a small refrigerator and microwave in a separate closet room The hotel is within 500 feet of the beach close to many restaurantsshopsetc Parking was free The outdoor pool was heated and appeared clean and in good condition we didnt use it just glanced at it
The only lessthanimpressive aspect was the continental breakfast  pastries and juice  but it was still better than nothing We plan to visit San Diego again and will definitely stay here

title: WOW would go back tomorrow
text:
I was a bit worried at first knowing that the rooms were quite small but when i got there they were bigger than i thought All you need room for is to sleep store your clothes and to have a shower The bathroom was a good size and so was the bedroom for that matter plenty of room The shower was great Lovely compfy bed with clean fresh sheets daily and a big flat screen tv etc The staff and hotel was first class We were given breakfast vouchers which came in really handy The location could not have been better on one side was central park and the other time square The Hudson bar was fantastic very busy and popular with a great atmostphere Very very stylish Although it was freezing in NYC that time of year we were lovely and warm in the hotel We will be going back to the hudson hotel in the summer for sure next time to experience the amazing sky terrace
Thank you all at the hudson hotel for a great stay

title: Convenient place to stay for an early morning flight
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to taking an early morning flight back to Washington DC We arrived late on a Sunday evening after traveling from Vancouver Island where wed been staying but the bar was still serving the full dinner menu even thugh the restaurant was closed We just had sandwiches but the food was good and reasonably priced for a hotel restaurant The hotel isnt fancy but it met our needs for a clean affordable place to stay Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable The only problem we had was that all the numbers were worn off the buttons on the TV remote and it was challenging to figure out how the TV worked without them The hotel is within walking distance of the airport but we took the shuttle because it was pouring rain the next morning They told us that the shuttle runs every half hour but it was running more frequently than that when we left due to the demand We booked at the nonrefundable rate on the website and the price was very reasonable I was concerned that it might be noisy but we really didnt hear planes once we were settled in

title: Great hotel and staff we stay here often
text: While visiting colleges in Chicago we stayed here The suite setup made it great for traveling with a young adult The doorman was the best gave us great info each time Front desk people are not nearly as great as the bell and door people but still good This is our home away from home when visiting our Chicago college student Love the tea The rooms are comfortable bathroom great

title: Great location  some might find it a bit too achingly cool
text:
The location is great the hotel is a little impersonal I had a standard room which was fine for 1 person  but would have been snug for two people sharing There is a handy diner across the road where you can have breakfast at a fraction of the rate that the hotel charges Also the reliable Duanne Reade is on the corner of the block and handy for supplies usually found in the minibar at extortionate rates Stock up there for mineral water and snacks 
When I checked out I was apparently randomly charged for using the mini bar which I never do When questioned the charge was waived immediately with no quibble Almost made me feel that they do it to everyone on the off chance that most people wont query it Check your bill Otherwise would have no problem in staying there again

title: You get what you pay for
text: My husband booked this hotel because he used credit card points and our stay was free Little did we know that the rooms were going to be just as small as the other hotel we stayed at in NYC on this trip We really just felt out of place in a sea of international tourists and youth trips Never again

title: Very Nice Place
text: Great rooms great beds great showersgreat service and hospitality small lobbynot much space down in the lobby if you have a large group to meet with but if you are traveling as a family or small groupgreat place

title: Almost a year since we stayed at the Beacon
text: Our first trip to NYC family of 4 incl 12yo and 10 up We had tried to book a 2 bedroom suite as we stayed for 8 nights Unfortunately no 2 bdr available so went for a 1bdr with sofa in living room  All worked well as we were out and about so much of the time  We were so happy we stayed at The beacon  it was the perfect spot for our family to use as a base during our NYC adventure  friends stayed in 2 bedrm suite at same time  we got to see their room Would definately recommend this room with older kids  Have been thinking about NY so much lately with Sandy Hope all get back on their feet soon  Cant wait to visit NY again in next couple of years

title: Great Stay Will Definitely Use Again for Trips to SeaWorld
text: Based on reviews on tripadvisor we decided to book at this hotel for our trip to Sea World with our three kiddos It was perfect We got a twobedroom suite and I was worried as we were right next to the pool but we never heard any noise from that area The rooms were clean and wellappointed the beds were very comfortable and we loved having the kitchen for meals and heating up leftovers The breakfasts were very hearty which kept us from buying too much expensive food right off the bat at SeaWorld And one day we had the afternoon meal which saved us some more money We were just a few minutes drive from the park which meant we did not have to deal with long rides in the car and it was super hot so this was really good or any traffic I thought this hotel was an excellent value and we will definitely use it again when we go to visit SeaWorld

title: Not so Hip
text:
I stayed with my two daughters 10 and 8 as part of a precruise packageI did choose it due to the price and the reviews on line We arrived in the rain on an early flight and were hoping like some of the reviews that we would be able to check in early No such luck The staff appeared somewhat clueless and confused However I did notice they were much nicer to older couples with out children Maybe that was my clue that the place was just too hip for children However Ive stayed at two placed owned by Joie De Vive in California and they are what I would call hip Not this place And they were nice to my children 
From a a first time in Seattle person I felt I had arrived in nowhere land although that could have been the rain The staff sent us down to a breakfast place that seemed to be the only place in the area open It was quite good When we got back I saw the staff checking in people and I went up and asked to be checked in as well I was told I had a room with a view that was not ready and the other people didnt At that point the kids and I went exploring and found we really werent so far from many attractions including the Space Needle we went on a Duck Tour which was really fun and then got something to eat at a food court that was lively and had music We got back at 300 check in time And guess what no room At 400 we checked in The room was very nice and quite large Guess what our view was of  the parking garage I had to laugh by that time and was just glad to be in a room We enjoyed the in door pool and were the only people in it I could have gone for a spa  but it was nice anyway The next day I went down to get the breakfast sandwiches and drinks included in the package The staff appeared confused about how to handle it but did give me the food and were nice The transportation to the airport was on time and efficient We later came back and stayed at the Inn At the Market The two experiences were like night and day  but the Inn at the Market is also much more expensive I dont think I would ever stay here again even though the rooms are nice

title: Excellent stay in a great hotel
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights in August and were thoroughly impressed by the quality of the hotel the excellence of its staff and the brilliance of its location
Upon checking in we were allocated a very small but well maintained and presented room The clerk on the checkin told us the room would be small which we were expecting but that he would check us into a bigger room for the last two nights of our stay when the hotel was not full to capacity This was without any prompting from us and this excellence was pretty much representative of the whole of our stay 
Both rooms that we stayed in were lovely and everyone on the entire staff were super friendly and helpful The roof terrace afforded great views of the city and the complimentary coffee and internet PC in this area was also a really nice touch
I really cannot fault this hotel and would recommed anyone travelling to NYC to consider staying here Its location is brilliant too nicely situated between midtown to the north and Greenwich VillageDowntown to the south
If you do stay here the Lyric Diner two blocks south from the hotel down 3rd Av does amazingly tasty and good value breakfasts in a traditional diner style The total bill including tip for two excellent breakfasts each consisting of eggs w bacon and home fries fruit cup toast coffee and water was 15 and we really didnt need to eat again until the evening
This is a really exceptional hotel and we will certainly look to stay here again should we be lucky enough to return to NYC

title: Great service
text: The groups that work at the Comfort Suites AlamoRiver Walk 505 Live Oak St San Antonio TX The smiles service and the Head Cook Georgi have made my stay pleastant Keep up the good work Robert L

title: For baseball and downtown action this place is the best
text:
My wife and two boys have been coming to the Omni San Diego since it opened back in 2004 We are Padre season ticket holders and we enjoy doing a staycation every year here in San Diego People come from all over the country to vacation where we live and we pick the Omni every year when we stay home Yes the pool is small but we dont stay here for the pool We stay because of the view the staff the rooms the location the location and the location When you can walk across a private bridge into the ball park and also walk to just about any great type of restaurant in town this place is the best The way you know tha this is such a great place is because we have seen the same staff at this hotel since it opened Be sure to say hi to the head Bell Captain David because they dont come any nicer than this manwe hope you stay for a long time We are select guest members at Omni and that was why we stayed at the Omni in DC From coast to coast this hotel chain is great Janelle you did a wonderful job taking care of us while we were there 
If you are coming to San Diego and are looking for a great place to stay this is your spot

title: Beautiful Hotel that Nickels and Dimes You to Death
text:
We stayed at the hotel January 1617 for the Cubs Convention The hotel is beautiful and for the 20000 crazed Cubs fans running around this weekend they manage to keep it pretty spotless Other than the view weve had some years view of another wing of the hotel or of a train track weve had no compaints about the rooms We have stayed here every year for fifteen years and while service has been exemplary as others said its Tip please every time you turn around
January 2008 we also stayed at the hotel The chlorine concentration in the pool was so high that my three children had fullbody rashes and refused to get in the pool on the second day And for a 12yr old and two 9yr olds to REFUSE to go in the water is highly unusual I talked with other parents whose children has the same problem We have been to several water parks whose pools are also wellchlorinated and never had a reaction like this I let management know during our stay and then followed up with a phone call and internet complaint once we returned home They explained that there might have been a problem with the chlorinator but they offered NO compensation or even an apology letter Rather disappointing for someone who holds one of their Silver Hilton Honors Member cards
This year just my husband and I stayed not bringing the kids Our room this year was 312 with tax and charges The first year I stayed here it was about 175  prices have gone up considerably But the 8 bottle of water and the 1695day charge for internet access are over the top we chose to decline both The Pavilion restaurant offers a buffet only during the convention at 1620person With a family of five I dont relish spending almost a 100 on each meal Buckinghams the steak restaurant apparently closed down recently as it still shows on all of their inhotel literature Kitty OSheas a pseudoIrish pub is a nice place to eat with good prices You can get a good burger there for about 9 if I remember correctly During the convention the hotel also offers some breakfast items at the bar  you could get a bagel for 5 or orange juice for 8 Get the picture I could purchase TWO GALLONS of orange juice for what they charge for a 12oz bottle Thats not markup  thats flatout robbery
Overall the Hilton while beautiful needs a reality check for 2009 Youre overpriced to start with and then you overcharge for everything else In this economy you would do well to rethink your strategy 
I would NOT stay here on a personal visit  Id move up Michigan Avenue to something else Next year I may stay at the Essex next door Someone mentioned they were there for 90night and it was great That would be a 200 savings each night pretty substantial

title: Nice But Needs Some Sprucing Up
text:
If youre staying at the Waldorf the Towers are definitely preferable to the WaldorfAstoria rooms We were upgraded from an Executive Suite to the most enormous suite no 32A Ive ever occupied in the US  a vast living room and a dining room with seating for twelve both with fireplaces and an entry foyer larger than most NYC hotel rooms The bedroom though spacious was oddly cold in atmosphere almost like a hospital room no warmth or charm at all Similarly the bathroom and adjacent dressing area were cramped and poorly laid out and therefore not particularly comfortable The showers in both the stall and tub were completely dysfunctional  they were actually handheld shower hoses hanging in holders literally seven feet high and pointing at the wall not at you no matter what you did Some parts of the rooms needed new paint too Overall there was a slightly tired fusty feel to everything 
Two additional quibbles one the lounge on the 26th floor where the complimentary Continental breakfast is served is far too small to accommodate the guests of the Towers Even though we arrived quite late there were several groups ahead of us waiting to be seated Two all of the restaurants and bars in the Waldorf were mysteriously closed at lunchtime on Saturday and not opening until later in the afternoon so we had to go across Lexington Avenue to the much cooler W Hotel to spend our money This surprised us because we had enjoyed a nice lunch and cocktails at Peacock Alley the Waldorf lobby barrestaurant on Friday Go figure
Overall we enjoyed our stay but would choose a fresher hotel next time

title: Fantastic Fairmont
text: The Copley Plaza presents an example of iconic and grand architecture Inside take a corner suite if you can Our rooms overlooked the square and were spacious enough to dance or hold a yoga class The modern renovated bathroom was a nice contrast to the patrician style Fairmont is consistently superior And the location is central

title: Pleasant surprise the Big Apple
text: I took a chance staying at Affinia Manhattan as this was the first time I had heard of the brand I chose the KingQueen suite which was very roomy and clean We had a nice sized bedroom with a full bath a spacious living room with a pull out sofa bed and another bathroom shower and an insuite kitchen with a refrigerator and oven The staff was very polite and helpful for the entirety of my four night stay The location cannot be beat 510 minute walk from Times Square and almost directly across the street from Madison Square Garden Great Location

title: Great Location small rooms
text: The shoreham is a very stylish hotel The rooms are small but is really clean

title: Washington DC Vacation
text:
The staff are friendly and very helpful Rooms are clean and the bed is great after a full day of walking around Washington DC Very close to the Metro and dinning The hotel is currently renovating their breakfast area and are using what appears may be a small confrence room and we eat our free breakfast in our room when it was crowed 
I do not have any negitive feedback for this hotel and would recommend as you are very close to all points of interest I highly recommend the Hampton Inn DD Convention Center

title: A Very Nice Stay at Affinia
text: Stayed for 5 nights with Family and had a very nice stay at the Affinia The room we had on the 35 floor was really great It had the most fantastic views  The room was very clean and the room was cleaned every day with fresh towels Only gripe was that we did have to ask a couple of times for a couple of extra pillows and did eventually get only one The Kitchen is great to be able to make tea and coffee but it has no kettle and you really need one I used a pot to boil water and almost burned my hand as the handle gets really hot The staff were very kind and friendly and the doormen very helpful Overall a really great Hotel to stay in especially for the location Macys just down the street The subway is also just a block away with the Subway Q R or N taking you to Times square Restaurants all around the Hotel with a great pizza shop just on the corner The Barking Dog restaurant was not great at all to be honest Ordered a burger and when I got it  it was very rare and when It was sent back to be sorted it came back the same way Staff not too friendly very pricey for what we got I love New York and will definetly stay at the Affinia again without hesitation and will recommend it to all my friends

title: Good location needs some upgrades
text: Stayed just one night for a quick get away While the location is good the room was no different than staying in a Quality Inn I expected more from a resort hotel particularly one that charges me for parking and wifi

title: Great place well located
text:
I stayed in this hotel for 04 nights in Jun10 and it is as good it was last couple of years This hotel is ideally located above Metro Center Train stop has lovely places to walk around with in a minute from bustling China town and has some lovely affordable restaurants in the neighbourbood Few minutes of brisk walking will take one to White House and Washington Memorial
Overall the stay is great and place is good One sore point may be very minor I noticed a lot of dust in the work chair positioned in the room but till I left was never cleaned This is no big deal but some one is slipping up and thought should highlight here

title: In the heart of the action
text: My only complaint about the experience was the checkinwe were promised connecting rooms and they attempted to separate us by 5 floors They corrected the problem immediately after I complained to the clerk The hotel is undergoing renovations The lounge area on the 8th floor restaurant area is being redone and should be finished soon The rooms we had on the 35th floor had a wonderful view new decor and very comfortable beds My kids complained that there were no cash mini bars but I was fine with that Even though it is in the middle of Times square the room was very quiet and was an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle We had to leave two days early because of Hurricane Irene but we will shall return

title: Excellent choice for park  fly
text: We selected this hotel to park  fly out of the Indianapolis airport The rate was very reasonable The room was clean and the front desk staff was friendly The park  fly service worked well including the shuttle service to and from the airport The breakfast was relatively limited However since our flight was at 7 AM it was much more important that it began at 5 AM so we were able to eat before heading to the airport I would definitely stay here again to park  fly

title: This place is a slice of heaven in a hectic city
text: If youre worried that NYC is overwhelming hectic and full of stressed out strangers youre partially right BUT dont worry about that as this hotel is the 100 antidote relaxing warm cozy and primed to make you feel at home

title: Good location but noisy
text: We booked at the last minute and the rate here was really good 162 considering location etc The room was great comfortable bed  goodsize bathroombut the outer walls were thin and at night you could hear everyone walk by your room which wasnt conducive to a good nights sleep The staff is very friendly and helpful and there is access to a computer  free wifi

title: What a rip off
text:
We stayed at this hotel for a few days sight seeing after skiing at Lake Tahoe The location is very convenient and the rooms clean but much smaller than the room we had at Harveys in Tahoe The decor was rather strange but that does not make it a bad hotel
What does however is Sheratons policy to charge extortionate rates to use its underground car parking facilities Be warned these robbers charge 43 plus tax PER DAY for the privilege of leaving your car at the hotel you are already paying for Whilst it was obvious that parking in this area was a money making racket the Sheraton was easily the most expensive we saw There were no concessionary rates for guests When we complained to staff they were dismissive and unhelpful I would not return to this hotel

title: My new home away from home
text: I have been traveling to New York City for business pretty regularly these past few years and I have tried the budget places and the break the budget places Finally I have found a place that I want to return to As soon as I stepped in I fell in love with the layout and decor The people were incredible Hector checked me in and made me feel welcome like I was arriving at a friends house The room was great It was the most comfortable bed I have ever had at a hotel Most of the time I stay in my room when I get in I could not wait to get downstairs and relax at the bar I cant say enough about this place I wish there were one of these everywhere I travel

title: The Great Tower 23
text:
3 friends and I decided to take 3 weeks out and venture on a mini road trip around the west coast of the states We began in New York and flew over to LA from there we drove to San Diego where one of my friends had booked 2 rooms at Tower 23 hotel 
From the moment we arrived we were all taken away by the epic view overlooking Pacific Beach The sun loungers and water fountains added to this exotic feel creating a sense of surrealism The rooms were incredibly spacious and immaculately presented Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by a charming young lady on the reception desk who i remember by her name badge was called Rochel She checked us in and even called us once we were in our rooms to make sure everything was ok 
The restaurant and bar offered an array of well cooked food at a pleasant price which suited us just fine 
Overall the stay was by far the best we experienced in the USA its just a shame that the most exhilarating aspect of our time in San Diego was our visit to sea world Oh well theres always next time

title: Stayed here with University of Miami alumni group
text: This was a centrally located hotel 23 miles from Soldier Field and the Shedd Museum and just steps away from Michigan Avenue shopping We spent the weekend walking to a football game museum shopping and dinner We never needed a car or a cab

title: the most sound proof hotel Ive ever stayed in
text: great hotel friendly staff great view couldnt believe how quiet my room was

title: More good points and bad points
text: We stayed at this property twice recently at either end of our holiday We specifically wanted a one bedroom suite as one of us gets up earlier than the other so we only looked at properties that had this I dont agree with other posters that the rooms here are large If you are expecting just a hotel room then yes you would find the rooms large But this property bills itself as a residence In fact the one bedroom suite was very cramped for two people and their luggage Basically the one bedroom suite is the same as the studio with a wall down the middle The photos on the web site are very accurate  the layout looked cramped and it was Other than being cramped our first stay was very good The main reason we chose this suite property over others was because of the hot breakfast included It was good but monotonous  exactly the same thing every day They could vary the hot items a bit We loved the free wireless in the rooms  I wish all hotels had that The happy hour during the week is GREAT If you are a light eater you could easily make this your supper There was always a hot item and a green salad And help yourself to the beer and wine And the wine was actually pretty goodThe staff at the front desk and on the door are very cheery and helpful We did have trouble getting help from the cleaning staff  called the front desk 3 times to get extra hangers Eventually talked to the cleaning staff but none spoke enough English to understand our request Our second stay was a bit of a surprise This time our suite was on the back side of the hotel Right at 10 pm some band started up some where that ratttled the windows We never did figure out where the racket was coming from The hotel is 2 blocks from the party district 6th Street  I thought that would be far enough but obviously not This was on a Friday night so this may only be a problem on weekends We insisted on being moved Unfortunately the hotel did not have any one bedrooms left that were not on the back side of the hotel But they gave us two studios next door to each other which worked out well

title: A good option in Sundance Square
text:
This was my third time to stay at the Worthington We were here for the Cowtown Marathon so obviously the hotel was booked full of runners The Worthington is in a great location to everything in Sundance Square The rooms are nice fairly average size and clean The bathrooms are nice but small with very little vanity space Check in was quick and valet parking was fairly easy but expensive at 23day We got a group rate for this stay If I had to pay the regular rate I would probably shop around There are 2 or 3 other great options in Sundance Square
My only big complaint was the hallway noise when trying to sleep

title: Good location amenities reasonable price
text: Have stayed here several times before and its gotten better Rooms are updated if a little smallish but typical of Manhattan with a giant flat screen HDTV comfortable bed clean bathroom Excellent location in midtown Good place for breakfast right next door Staff is pleasant Free wifi in lobby 14 in rooms the nickel and diming of which I detest No coffee maker in rooms but a minibar if you want to pay the prices Otherwise not a bad choice and you do get a chocolate chip cookie upon checkin as is Doubletrees promise

title: Not flash but excellent value for money
text:
Stayed for 2 nights in early November 2011 This place has no pretensions of being anything than a motelmotor inn Free parking is a bonus and when I booked the room rates were very low sub100 although I noticed that prices did go up substantially at a later date
Clean and roomy with fridge and microwave old style TV FREE quick wireless internet was also a bonus Decor is not overly modern and the furnishings etc are not brand new or overly modern Bathroom is OK and clean
In hindsight the location is not that ideal although it is only 5 blocks walk to the cable car terminus on California St and there are many buses on Van Ness Avenue At night we walked down Larkin St to find some asian reaturants and as per many comments on the forums the area is a bit seedy after dark but not threatening
I have nothing negative to say about Nob Hill Motor Inn but probably wouldnt stay there again as we did also stay a night at Union Square and that was a much better location for us The Nob Hill Motor Inn does everything it sets out to do  good value lodging with free parking
Email and phone communications I had with the front desk re our reservation were always responded to promptly and efficiently although we didnt get the room requested but that was no big problem Aircon was a fiddly to get a comfortable temperature  maybe the thermostat wasnt working properly

title: Best location in town if you want to party on Beale St
text: Clean big rooms great price Only a few steps from the center of Beale St action Also a very SAFE location which can be an issue in Memphis

title: Easy walk to local fun
text: The staff was so helpful and attentive The only real issue we have is that the mirror is placed too high up in the bathroom and there isnt much room for toiletries The room is very comfortable

title: Charming Boston Hotel
text:
My husband baby daughter and I stayed in the Eliot Hotel for one night after a weeklong trip to Cape Cod We wanted to stay in Boston Saturday night to be close to the airport for our Sunday morning flight We have stayed in several hotels in Boston over the years and we were thrilled with this hotel We had a premier suite that was large and perfect for us The living room was a perfect place to put our daughter in her
pack n play and she slept late the next day because of the wonderful draperies blocking the light until you open themwe had a great view of Commonwealth Ave Were able to close the french doors to our bedroom and watch a little tv without disturbing her The rooms are beautifully and tastefully decorated Our room was in hues of blue and chocolate brown The bathroom was restored but still had beautiful old white marble and a seperate area to put on your makeup with good lighting There is also a seperate wet bar area off of the living room that was a great space to keep our daughter supplies food and bottles The bed was very comfortable and my husband really enjoyed the wireless internet The Eliot is also in a fabulous location and just a short walk to so many wonderful restaurants and shops We were sad that we were only staying one night but are delighted to have found a favorite hotel in Boston

title: Good value thats about it
text: It had a bed a bathroom television pool and hot tub on the property Good enough Not the nicest hotel by far but it was located a short drive to Old Town Gas Lamp Fashion Center and Balboa Park For the location the price was right The pool was nice and the restaurant on the premesis served a good breakfast I wasnt there for the luxury just to go for a swim at night and sleep The rooms definitely could use an update

title: Talk about location
text: I stayed 2 nights to enjoy Christmas in NY I never even needed a taxi cause the location is perfect Hotel rooms are lovely  spotless Cant wait until next time

title: Very Pleased
text:
We visited Hotel at Times Square in November 2010 with our 13 year old daughter This was our 3rd or 4th stay  dating back to when it was the Super 8 Hotel Relax hotel has been remodled since then and is actually very nice
Location is good few blocks down from Radio City and a few blocks over from madness of Times Square Grand Central is a 5 minute walk  over a couple streets and down a few blocks
We made reservations online through applecorehotelscom We were able to reserve a 2 room suite for less than what other similar hotels charged for 1 room Upon check in we received a AAA discount of about 15 per night so it was worth inquiring Also good thing is cancellation policy is hassle free up tp day before checkin We actually cancelled first reservation and made another when we saw price on web site had dropped close to time for trip
The room and bathroom were very very clean and seemed to have been recently redone Furnishings were all clean and new
Breakfast was basic but good We prefer to go grab a bagel out but what the hotel offers donuts bagels coffee cereal  is not bad at all and free
Little bar on 2nd floor was a new addition It is tiny but I did have a couple drinks there one night before heading out to a restaurant Has to be only 3 beer in NYC Was clean and waitress was friendly Fine place to grab a quick drink while waiting for others in your party to get ready to go out
On day of check out we stored bags in lobby while sight seeing until late afternoon was a nice service by hotel
Only negatives are that 1 elevators do run slow but we just took stais a couple times Small inconvenience and waiting on the elevators would not have been a big deal
2 catching a cab is a little difficult bc 46th street is not that busy with cabs on the hotels block and there is no cab stand in front of the hotel Unless you are really good at hailing cabs plan to take the subway or to get the concierge to arrange for a car service  or simply walk like we did most of the time
Read review below saying had bedbugs but we saw absolutely no trace and we were looking for them Bed bug registry google it said hotel was not infested
Bottom line this is actually a perfectly good bordering on kinda nice moderately priced hotel in a great location I felt very safe and my wife and daughter were quite pleased  and they can be much more picky than me You will be out and about all the time anyway so why blow the budget on a four or five star place I would give this a very solid 35 stars We will be back  soon I hope

title: Great stay and pet friendly
text: Stayed here during hurricane sandy since my apartment lost power All of the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating Room service took about an hour but all the meals I had here were great Would definitely recommend for anyone looking to be in a convenient midtown location

title: Convenient place to stay in Detroit
text:
Overall we had a good stay at the Greektown Casino Hotel I was a little concerned about the checkin process and service due to other reviews Id read but these were no problem The front desk made the process quick and easy and was kind enough to assign us to rooms on the 29th floor which offered spectacular views of Detroit and the surrounding area The rooms themselves although not big were clean modern and nicelyappointed The rates in the minibar were a lot less than what Ive seen at other hotels in the Detroit area which was a nice surprise The bathroom design was a little inconvenient since there was no way to use the sink without lighting up the whole room and waking anyone who still might have been sleeping but this wasnt a problem 
There were a couple of issues with the hotel First the walls seem to be very thin We didnt hear anything from the street our outside but you could hear anything that happened in the hallway like it was right there in your room Both rooms were awakened by noise in the hallway during our stay Secondly there was a disturbance in the room next to us that required hotel security to be called three different times The good news was that they responded promptly each time and eventually removed the problem so that we could get back to sleep The staff was very courteous about the incident and offered us free breakfasts and a discount on one of our rooms as well Finally the hotel sports bar turns into a nightclub on weekends We came back from our event wanting to have a couple of drinks and watch the NCAA basketball games and were met with deafening music and a line to get in However the front desk was very helpful in finding a place just down the street that was quieter and had the games on
The main attraction to the hotel and the reason I would stay there again was its location Its right in the Greektown neighborhood which offers many different dining and entertainment options Its connected to the casino by a secure indoor walkway and is also adjacent to the People Mover which is the best way Ive found to get around downtown Detroit Its also very easy to get to off the highway which was nice both on the way in and the way out In all we enjoyed our stay and would most likely stay there again when we are in Detroit

title: Good People
text: the marriot overcharged my card and were excellent in making up for it in their effort to show their good service the rooms are spaccious and the staff responsive Excellent hotel for your trips to San Diego

title: 50 th  Birthday Trip of a lifetime
text:
Hotel staff were very nice especially Richard Reeves Hotel Security who for my Birthday had some fruit and cheescake sent to the room which was a lovely surprise after returning from The Phantom of the opera
The overall experience was great apart from one instance in the bar on my Birthday where we had a Manhattan cocktail before our meal booked at Brasserie before the show
 Firstly the bar person ought to have been more attentive as when my husband paid the barman we left to go to our room a couple of minutes later a waitress came running after us to say we hadnt paid our bill which was very embarassing as we were talking to Richard at the time about my cameraso was rather rude  but she apologised quietly It was rather unneccessary as if we hadnt have paid the bill they should have charged our room
Secondly the pre theatre dinner is a bit of a con my husband quietly went off to book it as a surprise It had a notice outside which said three courses for 30 each when we sat down we were led to believe it was for anything on the menu before 7pm It didnt say it was a set menu on the notice outside The waiter came over and gave us this other menu which had gone up to 35 I did complain and he said this was a better choice there wasnt really a choice it was just a set meal In the end we did order the rib eye which was what we thought we were going to get anyway but worked out Very expensive although it was lovely
The room itself was lovely and clean every day apart from one day we came in about teatime and the bed was half made as if she got interrupted and forgotten about it but she came back and apologised The bed was to die for was so so comfortable lovely to get into at night after an exhausting day sightseeing hard to get out of in the morning would reccommend going for the kingsize to anybody who is thinking of staying here FABULOUS baseApart from the couple of glitches I would reccommend this hotel to anyone and say a Big hello to Richard
Thank You for a pleasant stay

title: Friendly and cheap
text:
PLI was our base during our three weeks summer holiday stay in SD and surroundings Very friendly helpful and serviceminded manager He did all the best for us always with an honest smile Our group of 9 four adults three teenagers two under 10 shared two rooms Not much space main bed very good the other one sofa bed a little soft for the kids sharing it  they ended up in a heap in the middle but no serious complaints from the tired ones Bathroom and kitchen ok same with the cleaning
All in all we got what we payed for The only thing we really missed was a couple of extra chairs round the balcony table in the evenings when socialising Keep up the good work
With kind regards
Geirmund and the rest at 14

title: Like visiting grandmothers cottage in SF
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it to be very charming A nice break from the bustling city of San Fran walking into the hotel felt like stepping into a parlor at your grandmothers home They have warm apple cider and cookies at all times to greet you and our room was extremely spacious and delightful We had a separate bedroom kitchenette with fridge and complimentary soda  water a powder room and bathroom The fireplace was a nice touch 
The building itself is pretty old so be prepared for some imperfections although everything is very clean The elevator is little scary you have to manually open the door Each time we got in we found ourselves praying we didnt get stuck The bathroom was also quite small and could use some renovating The breakfast each morning is complimentary and absolutely delicious everything from homemade quiche to eggs to blueberry scones You eat downstairs in a parlor overlooking the courtyard it takes you back to old England charm 
The location is on a busy street in between The Actors Theatre of SF and another hotel the Petite Auberge which has the same owners Parking is much cheaper in comparison to other hotels nearby but it does take about 15 minutes each time for the valet to pull it up Union Square is within walking distance as is Chinatown 
Overall a charming and quaint hotel Lots of great amenities and an excellent value

title: Beautiful Hotel haughty staff
text:
Just checked out this morning The hotel is beautiful and in a great location if you are careful walking at night If you go one block in the wrong direction it gets pretty seedy and a bit scary We met two police officers at the end corner the hotel is on last night who were there to ensure tourists didnt go any further in that direction 
The room was beautiful with floor to ceiling windows that provided a spectacular view The towels were horrible for such an upscale hotel They were rough thin and frayed in spots not at all what I expected The room even on the 23rd floor wasa bit noisy from all the sirens throughout the night All in all the room was really good
The staff on the other hand were rude snobby and unhelpful The gentleman that checked us in early was rude and haughty the Concierge that we asked for additional information on the Barberry Coast walking tour was unhelpful and the bartender that didnt know what Blueberry Tea was had no interest in googling it to find out or offering other alternatives and eventually just walked away from us 
Like a previous post I certainly wouldnt pay these folks again for the privelage of being rude to me

title: Just As Described
text:
What can I say Im another satisfied customer For my first visit to NYC I have to say that the Belvedere met my expectations as described by reviews guidebooks and the hotels own website We stayed for ten days and booked two rooms I think 150  tax etc per night per room for six people in Midtown Manhattan is reasonable for NYC We especially appreciated the competent professional and kind staff as well as the kitchenette in each room
Although I had read about this before booking the hotel the one thing that still shocked me were the smallish rooms and bathrooms Maybe small rooms are typical for NYC
I was thankful however for a good nights rest although others in our family group complained about their hard beds on the tenth floor and a clean airconditioned nonsmoking room although the hallway was a bit smokey smelling with a decent but not great view
I would most probably stay at the Belvedere if I ever visit NYC againunless I find another hotel comprable in quality and location for a better price

title: We love this place
text: Its the second time weve stayed here The location is perfect  near the subway and bus stop The staff is EXTREMELY helpful  especially the bellmen The afternoon Happy Hour of drinks and snacks was great Folks gather here to socialize and we met some nice people from around the country during our stay The breakfast is nothing fancy but the food is fresh and good and nicely displayed on every floor The beds and pillows are VERY comfortable The place is spotless The furnishings are nice We would definitely recommend this place The view isnt great from some of the rooms if thats a big deal to you

title: hotel itself was nice service was not
text: Booked room through Hotwire then immediately called the hotel to request double beds with river facing view Was assured that this was taken care of over the phone When checking in found out that there was no notation or record of my call Was given partial view double beds so was fine with that and went up to room it was 4pm but room was not cleaned dirty towels everywhere tv on etc so called down and was given another room desk barely said sorry This time in new room there were used condoms lube etc found in drawer while I was looking for a pen did not call down because was tired when I discovered but we were very disgusted Late at night housekeeping comes with pillows that were not requested but she insisted they were and disturbed our rest When checking out told all to desk but was given halfhearted apology Very very disappointed with this Hyatt Regency it was certainly the low point of our visit to Philly especially since we were with a guest from overseas

title: Could never be worth the price
text: Given the price the Arctic Doubletree does not live up to what should be available to a customer The rooms are average except for a noisy bar fridge and service was terrible Valet parking is blocks away and took 45 minutes to get a car when I was the only customer getting a vehicle Front desk was worthless in trying to help resolve problems so the hotel was simply not up to what I would expect from a quality hotel

title: Loved the Location
text: Enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Loews Regency  no complaints whatsoever Room was clean service was efficient and location was excellent Great stores nearby a short walk to Central Park

title: Average and expensive
text:
Stayed here for 12 days on a business trip At first glance the hotel looks superb the rooms have all been recently renovated Around 40 tv channels to choose from
Its in a nice location for the financial district with a nice walk along the river only metres away
The hotel add on all sorts of extra state and city taxes at the end of your stay my 360 a night room ended up costing 410 ish
Breakfast and dinner again really expensive large bottle of still water 12 Bowl of cereal 12
I had room service twice first time took 30mins which is expected the second took nearly an hour and to their credit they didnt charge me for it
I had a few issues with my room during my stay namely a toilet that keep clogging and lack of hot water for a shower on two nights
I got the managers email thinking i would get it sorted quickly the next day I have since checked out and still never had a reply to the email

title: Nice large rooms
text: Will be great location once construction in area completed Large rooms clean Would return

title: Perfect for us
text: Yeme front desk clerk was extremely helpful and kind Refrigerator and microwave were brought to our room by request Room looks newly renovated Furniture is nice and bed is comfortable Plenty of lighting in room Free internet Only negativeSeveral hairs in the bathtub

title: Highly Recommended
text:
I booked this hotel through marriottcom after seeing the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor The reviews were spot on This hotel is exceptionally wellmanaged very clean and resides in a wonderful location less than three miles from the airport Built in a new planned community called Liberty Station its surrounded by restaurants and shops is flanked by a lovely inland waterway and is very quiet except for the occasional jet flying over
The earlier reviewer said she thought the place was expensive but she must have bought last minute I reserved a room here less than three weeks before my stay at a AAA rate of 119night I consider this an exceptional value

title: Not too happy
text:
The price was good The staff was friendly However I could not help but to feel cheated These suites are not what you get some where like the Homewood suites where there are two separate rooms TV room and bed room these suites were one big room with bookshelves in between Not good when you want to put two kids to sleep and enjoy some adult time
The pool was great during the day At night forget it its pitch dark I relayed my concerns to the front t desk who adviced me the lights were not working apparently due to some glitch in the remodeling process they are in middle of extensive renovation
One more thing the parking garage has a card reader which allows you to access the premises its in the back of the property through a narrow alley when my wife made the turn into the card reader she took the turn INTO the card reader My wifes fault totally but just something to watch out for she claims that card reader came out of nowhere and hit her

title: This hotel perfectly met out needs
text: What can I say Perfection The wifey  I went to NYC for 5 days to sight see from 222227 We prefer Hilton brands  chose this hotel based upon Trip Advisor recommendations  price The positive recommendations were spot on Hotel was perfectly clean in a perfect location and priced perfectly We stayed in room 1002 It was on the corner perfect facing 8th Ave It wasnt loud at all We will definitely return to this perfect hotel

title: Great comfy stay
text: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights We arrived after a long flight to be greeted by a really helpful cheery reception staff Room was clean and bed was super comfy Clean white bedding we were cold on the first night but had no problem following nights fridge provided luggage stands and tv with more the enough channels Bit out of downtown area but we were given a map by staff and directions to bus and trolley which only costs 9 for a two day pass Within walking distances of good seafood and restaurants Had a brilliant stay and the muffins at breakfast were amazing would definately stay again

title: Theres way better out there
text: I worked in hotels for 15 years from maintenance to management and all points in between so I REALLY give hotels the benefit of the doubt This hotel unfortunately is terrible The first room they gave us was occupied There was a soap wrapper and A LOT of hair behind bathroom door AC controls did not work properly high heat was actually AC Carpet needs to be replaced cleaning wont help it Nasty comforter the coffee maker had the guest before us coffee in it They said they would move us for the 2nd night They didnt The second night it was prostitute central Blatant beyond obvious We put a chair up against our door and hardly slept The third night was a free night using our hotel points We left anyway knowing we would lose those points

title: Convenient location but rowdy lobby atmosphere
text: I stayed with my husband and two children for a trip that combined leisure and business We arrived at 9pm to checkin and the lobby was full of guests socializing This hotel seems popular for childrens sports teams to stay and they were all up and having drinks and snacks at 9pm The rooms were clean and modern Curiously the cabinet next to the TV was at an angle and looked like it was built that way The room included a refrigerator and coffee maker but the coffee pitcher was missing The floor we were on was relatively quiet unlike the lobby The cafe in the lobby was convenient to buy breakfast with good hot and continental selections and there was free coffee in the lobby each morning I took a cab to the convention center the ride cost 22 for a meeting The location was not too far from Sea World less than 10 minutes which was the highlight of our trip Although other customers complained about the 16 parking fee each day I could see why they charged it because it would discourage nonguest use of the space the hotel guests needed I worried we wouldnt get a space each night and sometimes got the very last space

title: What a fantastic little treasure
text:
We went on a long road trip from Toronto to New Orleans LA for new years but made a few stops along the way We got into the habit of stopping at the visitors centers thoughout the states and they always seemed to have the best deals on hotels When we got to Memphis we were recommended to stay at the comfort inn right downtown Memphis and it was 85  tax which we thought was a great deal for the location and one of the cheapest places we stayed all trip They have a comlimentary breakfast rooms were better than expected  very clean and well appointed 
Would stay here again and it was a short 1 tram ride to Beale Stthe greatest little blues spot weve ever been to

title: Great Bar Great Location thats where it ends
text: Was terribly disappointed with the room set up Imagine traveling for business and there is no desk in your room Also the internet hookup required me to go to reception and request a special piece of equipment which I would be charged for 150 should I not personally return it

title: Reasonable
text: The hotel was crowded for two of the three days I was there so I ended up going out for breakfast Otherwise it was a pleasant stay The rooms were reasonable and definitely quiet the staff were friendly and it is in a good location

title: Great location and so pet friendly
text: Thank you Pier Fivegreat location on the water and great staff From the wonderful valet team to the front desk team we all enjoyed our stay Jill and Empress were fun to talk with They offered ideas for city visiting The entire staff treated our pup so special We had a standard room and were very happy It faced the street but was very quiet The room was a great size and we had no complaints at all We LOVED the receptions offered by Admiral Fells and Pier 5 Pier 5 had crabby night on Friday We could bring the pup and enjoy crab roll ups and drinks The Fells property had a reception with cheese and drinks and then a ghost tour through the property provided by Allisonvery good and she was very informative Cant wait to go back in the fallThank you all for making our pups first vacation so special

title: Perfect low budget hotel  Even though the shared bathroom
text:
I went to NY due to intervies for a job The concierge staff were very friendly and helpful where to go and what to recommend Sure the room was perhaps not very fancy but it had everything I needed and the rooms towards the garden were quiet The AC was a bit loud though but after being awake for about 18h that did not bother my sleep 
Even though the bathrooms are shared you could never see that anyone had been there prior to you unless they closed the door after taking a long shower 
The location was perfect Subway station max 10 min away internet cafe 3 blocks away many beauty salons and restaurants close by I love to walk so therefore I walked through half of NY and noticed that the location of the hotel was much closer to everything than I thought 
Definitly a pleasant experience and I would definitly visit Hotel 17 in the future

title: Do NOT stay here
text: Room was tiny and with only 4 rooms to each floor very noisy from other guests using elevators and banging doors On the first night I noticed a bug crawling on the bed after having the window open for a small time I thought it may have just been something that had crawled in Two days later I came out in this terrible rash on my shoulders which then turned into painful and itchy welts extending to my arms hand legs and face including eyelids the following day The same day my friend came out in the same thing We could not work out what it was at first so on returning home from the trip I went to the doctor and did some of my own research the welts are the result of being bitten by Bed BUGS Disgusting All I can say is Do not stay here

title: Amazingly comfortable bed
