text: Spacious and Quiet I was in SF for business and was relieved to have such a pleasant place to rest my head I had a room facing Bush st and never heard any noise for the 6 nites I was there The mattress is amazingly comfortable The fact that this is a ecofriendly hotel makes high marks too The location is great for exploring Chinatown The staff is very friendly and accomodating The only suggestion I would have for them is to offer more TV channels

title: Nice hotel great location
text:
Stayed here in August 2012
Staff very helpful and friendly nice room and included breakfast was good too The hotel was in a great location we got the train from the airport and could easily walk to the hotel from 13th st with our luggage
We could easily walk to the historic district through china town to reading terminal down to the river and to the museum district  it was all much closer than it looked on the map
Loved Philadelphia and I would definately stay at this hotel again

title: Top Notch
text: Top notch accommodations and staff Spacious warm and welcoming The ideal Seattle location

title: Classy indulgence
text: This was an awesome experience Staff couldnt do enough for you and chocolates were left for you every day as well as complimentary bottles of water After travelling through South America this is just the little bit of pampering we needed  Perfectly located close to everywhere Nice end of town midtown I believe  you get used to the lingo when you are there Food really great Really exceptional cheeses and my husband said the wine was pretty great too Perfect to have snacks to get you through between lunch and dinner Just loved this place Bought a mug to remember our time there Thank you to the staff for making this NY trip one to remember We will be back Just be aware that although the prices are on the upper end most NY hotels are expensive even if they are not so classy

title: High price old dingy hotel
text: Great hotel if you need to check in with your probation officer because their office is only a half a block from the hotel and you can see all the other offenders lined up to get in It is a short walk to the theaters and Time Square Inside the hotel the rooms are old with cheap furnishings and a dark dirty looking carpet There was mildew around the tub For the most part the staff was very friendly with the expection of when we checked in The lobby is very small and we were ordered to sit down and not stand in front of the desk clerk They dont have much of a restaurant so dont waste your time there We went across the street There is a side door at the Port Authority with a food court We didnt stay in our room long and enjoyed going to the theater to Phantom and Spiderman If you go to see Spiderman get the box seats so you can enjoy all the aerial stunts To get discount tickets at TKTS avoid the long lines and take the subway to the South Side or Brooklyn locations It is worth the discount In Chinatown go to Pings for Dim Sum at 1130 am where it is fresh and not so crowded at that time

title: It was a great stay
text: Had to go to Houston for a funeral which is never pleasant The hotels staff was wonderful and made us feel very welcomed and comfortable Spent 3 days and would reccomend this property to anyone Room and entire hotel was very clean My daughter last her stuffed animal and we thought it was gone when we asked the desk clerk to keep an eye out for it When we walked into the room later that evening it was sitting on the bed with a note from the clerk that it was found in the parking lot A step above  beyond when double checked that it had found its way home Very nice stay

title: Excellent clean and reasonable
text: We stay in El Paso a couple of times each year This is the best we have found for the price Includes continental breakfast and you can pay for hot breakfast Clean free Internet updated rooms and Hyatt points to boot Well be back

title: Great Service
text:
We competed in the Seattle Firefighter Stairclimb this past weekend and stayed at the Pan Pacific The hotel was beautiful but more importantly was in a convenient location to our competition and Mike one of the Valets was beyond exceptional with his service He went above and beyond on more than one occasion helping us with our gear back and forth to our vehicles This made our whole experience that much better and easier 
Room was nice and spacious with a great layout 
We would definitely go back

title: Merely a club which happens to have hotel rooms above it Nothing more
text: Stayed for a weekend which was supposed to be a romantic stay in the heart of Times Square Other than the location being convenient I dont have any other good things to say of this hotel Management here seems to be more focused on running a club rather than a hotel While staying less than two days I encountered three incidents which left me very dissatisfied First when we were in need of a towel we called the lobby requesting some A card states to leave your old towels by the door to receive new ones Within minutes the old towels were gone but never received any new ones After some time we called again asking for the towels which we were told theyre on the way After about 45 minutes we ran out of patience and were forced to dry ourselves with a hand towel Finally after coming home hours later we see that our room was cleaned and towels replaced Then we requested for a dress to be dry cleaned We were told we couldnt leave it with the concierge and had to return to our room to fill out a form instead We were already running late and they still wouldnt hold the dress for us In addition there was never any form at our room to begin with We skipped that process and proceeded with our night Finally after returning later that evening we asked for a form to request the dry cleaning service again We did not ask for overnight service and were told the regular time would have the dress back by 7pm which was fine The fee as stated on the form was to be 23 We had the dress returned to us at about noon and were actually impressed with the service so we thought Upon checkout we were in need of catching a train and needed to check out quickly We were told we had to wait because the computers were down After making us late and causing us to wait longer they finally had the nerve to charge us 45 or the dry cleaning Since I didnt have time to waste I showed how disgusted I was with the charge yet paid just to be on my way Which then came to 49 after tax So altogether 50 to simply dry clean a dress I was referred to this hotel because of its uniqueness and location though I wouldnt return here in the future nor would I suggest anyone else who is looking for decent service in return for the 250 nightly rate

title: Great hotel great location
text:
This was the second time I stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire and it was another great experience They have redone all the rooms with modern decor Our room had a king size on the first floor which was nice because we didnt have to wait for the elevator since one of them was out Bed was comfortable rooms also had nice flat screen tvs and a minirefrigerator Nice bathrooms clean bath tub was a bit narrow but nothing major Front desk staff was courteous and knowledgeable The weather was warm when we were there for that time of year so the room got pretty hot but we just cracked a window and all was fine
Only two blocks from the subway and close to shoppingfoodbarsgrocery etc Subway makes it easy to get anywhere in the city from this Upper West Side location Also just a few blocks from Central Park Free wireless internet was nice perk as well Great value hotel for the location

title: Nice hoteluntil we found bed bugs
text: We were staying at the Candlewood suites for a convention this weekend When we arrived we found the room to be nice and clean Like most hotels we stay at we check the beds and surrounding areas and found nothing When I went to bed I just happened to wake up and found an apple seed sized bug on my pillow This was one of many that were found in my bed as well as the other bed We notified the desk and decided to check out Im sure this is was an isolated incident but just wanted to let future travelers know

title: Great location not great hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed in the Chancellor Hotel for the second part of our honeymoon First impressions werent great We were barely able to stand in the queue to check in as we apparently arrived on a polling day and there were booths all over the small lobby When I checked in the receptionist really wasnt very friendly at all and seemed to get quite agitated with me As part of our package we were given cable car tickets but when I actually asked the receptionist for these she seemed angry at the request 
We had a lovely welcome in the room of a bottle of wine and chocolates as we were a honeymoon couple but unfortunately we didnt get the best view that we were asking for
The shower in the bathroom was really disappointing and was barely strong enough to wash my hair After the first night the main light in the room also stopped working but didnt want to report this to the reception as they had treated us quite badly the first night
The location was on Union Square and it was definitely a brilliant spot All in all the hotel was adequate but nothing to shout about

title: Great Stay
text: I traveled with my teenage son Rooms were clean staff were friendly and helpful Good breakfast Enjoyed the DVD player in room with list of movies to enjoy after a long day of sight seeing I felt safe here Hidden Gem great price

title: Severely Disappointed Not 4star quality
text:
I just checked out of Pointe Tapatio Cliffs about an hour ago I live in the south valley and had to spend the day in the north valley so my husband and I thought it would be nice to get dinner and stay overnight We went to A Different Pointe of View and I have to say it was exceptional I wrote a separate review for the restaurant Overall dinner was excellent and I would definitely go back 
I cannot say the same for the hotel Before describing the problems I encountered I will state that almost every employee was very nice helpful smiling and generally welcoming I have nothing but the highest praise for the shuttle drivers who were prompt entertaining and super nice both times we called them The furnishings and decor in the room were comfortable and clean but I would say the room itself was a 3 star at most for a 4 star price of course 
I checked in at about 3PM and quickly left to attend a function We returned to the room after dinner at about midnight It was extremely hot in the room I live in Arizona so I do not use the term extremely hot lightly It had to have been almost 100 degrees I couldnt say for sure however because the air conditioner unit was showing 75 which is how I presume it was last set I cranked it down to 68 then we collapsed into bed At 2AM I awoke drenched in sweat I got up to check the air conditioner and it still said 68 but it was definitely NOT 68 in the room I set it to fanhigh instead of auto and tried to go back to sleep After tossing and turning awake for about another half an hour I got up again and checked the vent I found the air was blowing  HOT There was hot air HOT AIR blowing out of the vents when I set it to 68 There was no hotcold function just a temperature setting I was so unbelievably tired I just turned the unit off and decided to open the window Unfortunately the windows at the front of the room dont open at all The only window to open was to the balcony Since no other windows would open it took a while to get cool air into the room Finally around 315 I was able to get back to sleep without any sheets or blankets I might add Luckily we were right near the entrance to the resort so every few minutes cars would drive by or drunken guests would stumble about or in general some very loud outside noise would rouse me There was a brief respite between about 430 and 630 in which I almost got good sleep Almost Then the groundskeepers started their work and I gave up even trying I left the bedroom and went to make myself a cup of coffee I added the creamers they provided and wouldnt you know it they were spoiled A hundred little chunks of what should have been liquid creamer floated to the top of my coffee Thanks Hilton No longer trusting anything in the room I had to drive myself to the Starbucks on the corner 
In discussing this with my husband I decided I wanted to check out personally so I could let the front desk know about the ac and hopefully get some sort of remediation Or at the very least an apology No such luck The petite blonde at the counter had a smile pasted to her face the whole time but never once said the word sorry or apologize What she did say was that maintenance is available 24 hours I attempted to explain to her that at 3AM when I am dead tired I did not want to wait up for the maintenance man and then endure his repairs and lose the entire night of sleep nor did I want to have to get up pack all of my things again and move She gave me the look and repeated maintenance is available 24 hours I pointed out to her that unless they havent rented that room in the past month they had to have been aware of the air conditioner issue so why would they stick us in there She repeated that maintenance is available 24 hours She was not only frustrating she was condescending and rude and if I had the time I would have waited to speak to the manager Since I didnt Ive decided to write this review Maybe they will see it and try to correct their issues I realize that had we been given any other room I probably would have been very satisfied with my stay there The way I see it however is that they take lackadaisical care of their property renting rooms to people when they clearly must have known they were subpar and then showed no interest in customer service or ensuring repeat business when the problems were brought to their attention To imply my sleepless night was my own fault becuase I was too tired to spend the night with their maintenance team is beyond the pale I will never stay at another Hilton I will stick to Marriott from now on I will also ensure I detail this encounter to everyone one I know Just awful

title: Wonderful as Usual
text: Weve been staying at this hotel for many years  it was the Plaza 50 when we began to visit Weve always been very well treated by the staff Most of the rooms are terrific and all are much more spacious than the average NYC hotel room We love the location  lots of good restaurants  bars walking distance to great shopping and not all that far from the theater district This is not the place for a first time visitor to NYC who wants to be in the middle of the action and sight seeing tours It is ideal for families and for people who want to feel as though they actually live in New York

title: Perfect place for me to stay
text:
I stayed in a cabin room on the 6th floor at the Jane for 8 nights in August 2011 I was traveling alone to NYC for the very first time and had a wonderful stay at the Jane It was the perfect place for me as a solo traveler because it was inexpensive compared to other options but you get great value for your money Yes the rooms arent much more than a bed and a bit of space to put your stuff but if you are in New York City why would you want to spend time in your hotel room other than to sleep The staff at the Jane were all very polite and happy to do what they could to make your stay wonderful
The bathrooms are shared but they are frequently cleaned and I never had a problem with their cleanliness or having to wait to use one Brushing your teeth in the morning dont forget to look out of the window for a distant view of the Statue of Liberty
The hotel includes free WiFi which I took advantage of The connection seemed to be very stable and the speed was great compared to other hotels I have stayed at
I also really liked the location of the Jane In west village it is right at the end of Jane Street very close to the Hudson River and the Hudson River Bike Path which follows the west shore
While I was staying at the hotel I recorded a video tour and review of the hotel which you can watch on YouTube for more details httpwwwyoutubecomwatchviRTFgR0NfsM

title: Stay away from this place
text:
When I went to make my reservation which I did two weeks ahead I went on line to La Quintas website I was directed to some other portal I have to pay ahead and the cost was nonrefundable When we arrived they did not have the room we requested so we were going to go elsewhere but the general manager said we would have to get our money back from the middleman website I tried to call that website and to this day have never gotten a call back and no one ever answers the telephone
So we ended up taking a smaller room Hotel is on the freeway very noisy I guess if you are luck you can get a room on the inside court yard and only have to listen to the pool noise The room was clean but the rest of the hotel was dirty
They will also fee you to death They charge you 10 per night for parking in their own parking lot and they will charge you a fee to use the inroom safe even if you dont use it I left my family heirlooms at home so I didnt need the safe but that did not matter
There are so many other nice places to stay in the area Best Western Holiday Inn Express and Marriott Courtyardthat it is worth the further investigation

title: Perfectly nice and reasonably priced
text: We stayed for one night for the Bulls vs Pacers playoffs I was a little nervous after reading the reviews but the hotel was perfectly fine The bed was comfortable the bathroom was nice and there was an extra sink and vanity in the bedroom which allowed my husband and I to both be getting ready at the same time I love having the extra sitting room with another TV I had read complaints about the rooms being too hot at night but ours was quite comfortable and there was an overhead fan I had also read complaints about noise but we were on the 7th floor and we didnt hear a thing from outside or from the inside of the hotel The managers reception and breakfast are always a pleasant touch Theres a really nice fitness center thats open 24 hours The location is great in the middle of downtown with lots of shopping and eating options steps away and easy walking distance to Conseco field Only a few small negatives  the rooms show a little bit of wear and tear in areas the indoor pool area wasnt great the pedestrian entrance is kind of strange and theres a 20 parking fee which actually isnt that bad for the area But for 120night on the weekend we were really pleased with our stay

title: free coffee dodgy location
text:
Although only a few blocks from union square we were dismayed to find that we felt very unsafe around our hotel after 7pm at night meaning that if we wanted to venture out we had to get a taxi
The room was ok but avoid getting put at the back of the building on the first floor ie room 105 as it is right on a back street where people tend to have disagreements in the middle of the night and you are woken up like clockwork at 5am by some loud van
Apart from that the staff were friendly enough coming to fix our smoke alarm as it beeped through the night and calming us down at the false fire alarm that confused us greatly one dark night as we were fast asleep

title: Novotel Broadway a winner
text: Had a wonderful stay at the Novotel on Broadway Prime location for easy access to just about anywhere Our room was extremely clean and comfortable Lovely spotless bathroom We were also surprised at how quiet it was at night We overlooked Times Square but were not disturbed by the noise at alland it is noisy and busy and wonderful We would return to this hotel with no hesitation We had a fabulous holiday

title: Newly renovated hotel
text:
I stayed 2 nights in this hotel The hotel is newly renovated nice furniture bathroom and bed The free breakfast is not the best but above average Free wirless internet with good signalT he location is convenience to everything grocery stores and lot of restaurants are near by
The only problem is the refrigerator in my room there is ticking sound all nights which is not fthe normal sound from the compressor it is very annoying and made us cant sleep all night I complianted to the night clerk and was told the maintenance guy would fix it But it is still the same in next night finally I needed to unplug it I told the manager when I checked out She said that t she knew it and the refrigerator has to be replacded What a customer service why they dont fix the problem before check in guest
Overall I statisfy the hotel and would recommend to others but dont forget to check the refrigerator

title: Great location  close to everything
text: For those looking for good value clean rooms and central location this is a great choice We explored the entire city of Boston and only needed to hop on a train twice in four days T line a few short blocks away Very walkable city and we felt safe even at night Whole Foods and CVS next door very convenient Skip the chain restaurants there arent many and head to the authentic familyowned ones This hotel is a great choice for those families who want to use it as a base and spend most of their time exploring the city Staff very friendly and attentive

title: Great mix of corporate and boutique
text:
Its in a great location in downtown San Francisco  about two blocks from the Ferry Terminal Building and about three blocks from the TransAmerica building
The person who checked us in was very friendly and although we were on the lowest hotel floor 7 we had great views of the Bay Bridge from a small balcony We had a small office area with a desk and two chairs which was great for setting up a laptop Unfortunately the wireless access isnt free
The decor is modern  more boutique hotel than corporate 
The bed was really nice and comfortable The bathroom was large and the products were nice Theres a large gym in the basement of the hotel 
I would definitely stay here again

title: Not the best but not the worst
text:
I booked a nonsmoking room but was placed in a smoking room two nights in a row they were full and could not move me The room smelled like stale smoke it hits you as you get off of the elevator Keep in mind the 5th and 6th floors also allow pets 
I read the upper suites have been remodeled My floor 5 was not The carpet in the suite and on the balcony was stained
There are good things about the hotel The bed was comfortable the views were amazing and you have a private balcony Breafast was good and parking is free

title: Had a very nice stay here
text: I stayed for a long Labor Day weekend The hotel was very nice if a bit far from the Freedom Trail Room cleanliness and amenities were on par with the Sheraton brand Staff was friendly and helpful my room had a nice view of the river The best feature is that it is attached to the Copley shopping mall And the area is very trendy with lots of great places to eat and shop I also got a great deal using Pricelines Name Your Own Price or less than 80night

title: Excellent stay  we couldnt believe what good value it was
text: Stayed here at the start and end of our trip to the States Using satnav it was very easy to find and a convenient drive to and from the airport We liked this hotel very much It was incredibly good value the staff were all very pleasant and welcoming and the accomodation very good There are free snacks and drinks between 530 and 7pm every evening and also breakfast is included in the price Although this was not the best breakfast that we had during our trip it was adequate and we felt that it was excellent for the price that we had paid It is also adjacent to a mall  I could walk across to Macys while my husband sat at the pool It is a lovely mall with lots of shops eating places and cinemas so we were very happy with its location The hotel also had free wireless internet and parking If I flew into Charlotte again I would not consider staying anywhere else

title: Home away from home
text: Despite 3 years since my last trip to San Francisco the staff at the Inn at Union Square treated me like a VIP A perfect location for theatre shopping museums and nightclubs The desk staff provided great suggestions for restaurants and mass transit is available right outside the door The Inn is my first choice when visiting San Francisco

title: Good choice if you have a conference
text: If you have a conference at the McCormick Center this hotel is a good choice If not this hotel is out of the way and the facilities are underwhelming The rooms are adequate  there was a nice city view from the thirtyfirst floor  and the checkin  reception staff was very friendly The rooms are a bit drab If youre not in town for a conference think about a different Hyatt property

title: Dont stay if you plan on moving around in your own room
text: My husband and I and our 10 month old took a quick trip to Chicago We stayed one night at The Palmer house after reading that they were a four star hotel I guess I am just confused as to why they are a four star hotel Yes the lounge area is nice but the rooms were so small I couldnt set up a pack and play for my son I had to call and upgrade my room just so my son could have someplace to sleep The lower levels have been updated which makes them slightly better than a Holiday Inn The wall paper is peeling away from the walls and the shower was dirty I will NEVER stay there again

title: Good value for NYC
text:
Great location if you want to see Greenwhich Village You can walk to Soho East  West Village Union Sq and easy access by subway to all other parts of city 4th street train station is right down the street
Mario Batalis Babbo is across the street and some great little places to eat on Cornelia St about 2 blocks away I especially liked the Cuban place I think its called Havana It on Cornelia 
The staff here can be aloof at best and very rude at worst i stay here a lot as I do work at NYU Definitely worth splurging for a deluxe room as the regular rooms are VERY SMALL
If you are a toursit I recommend the West Village walking tour offered by Big Onion They have a website with a schedule of their walking tours 
The barlounge in the basement behind C3 is hidden but worth finding

title: Great location and price
text: The location is outstanding  on the Upper West Side The rooms are small but nicely appointed The room rates are quite reasonable for NYC

title: Superb hotel highly recommended
text:
Clean quaint and in a great neighborhood
Basement rooms are a little dimshadowy but I understand thats the best we can do
Staff is outstanding in every way
Rental car gets delivered to your doorstep couldnt be easier

title: daughters birthday brunch
text: We enjoyed an amazing brunch on Sunday morning Excellent food with a wide variety of choices The wait staff kept the champagneorange juicewater glasses full as well as kept the dirty plates cleared as soon as they were emptied It was a relaxing meal in a lovely setting with windows opening on to the gardens The dining room had a elegant open airy feel to it but also was appropriately equipped to minimize noise We had a table of 12 and could actually hear each other talk We were not rushed through the meal actually spending the good part of 25 hours A very enjoyable family event

title: Great location small rooms
text:
I had a regular King room on the top floor My general experience was great The room was clean the staff were friendly and I really liked the spacious bathroom 
However it did bother me that the room was very small It was probably the size of two king beds put togheter I felt like the bathroom was almost as big as the bed room Also it bothered me that the TV is not flat screen I guess that is just pure OCD which made the hotel appear older than it actually is But in general it was very clean and a pleasant stay The windows of the room were very big but the view was the Marriott across the street not particularly exciting
For its cleanliness service and very satisfying interior decor it definitely deserve a 4 star 
Quick tips 
 Sign up for Omni membership free you get free wifi at the hotel
 If you work for any government institution ie my bf and I both work at a state hospital the hotel rate is substantially cheaper13100night

title: great location not great for biz travelers
text:
Ill start with the good
Le Parker Meridien is in a fantastic location right near Central Park and all the wonderful shopping a person could ask for I have a yearly business trip and we book a small block of rooms here every year The place is very chic valet is easy and the secret burger joint is cool If you are a business traveler however I prefer to stay in a hotel which caters to this There is no wireless Internet and to get the chord you have to get one from the desk or call to have one brought up they are not just in the rooms I think this is a big inconvenience and I am typically not picky at all The beds are great and there are plasma tvs The elevators are awful staying on the 20th floor like I did this past staywell budget 1015 minutes to get to the lobby They lobby is SO busy which has the great hustle and bustle of NYC but there are better lounge type lobbies in town The restuarant is cute an old charming French place but somewhat forgetable 
I love this place for its location and the chicness but as a business traveler who makes 35 other trips to NYC per year there are many more I prefer

title: Nice stay
text: As usual residence inn meets the needs of my family and I all 6 of us It was about 18 minutes to Sea World walking distance to the Regal Cinema movie theater and two restaurants were all but steps away from the entrance The only issue was that the air in the master was not coming through the vents like the other rooms Mr Cantu the manager was very generous in his addressing this when we paid our final bill and we are most grateful for that We surely will be back there soon

title: Great vacation location
text:
I decided to book The Dana even after reading a bunch of scary reviews  and I am glad that I did The location was great the service was wonderful and we had a terrific time 
When we first arrived I did notice a sort of musty smell in the room but we left the windows open and ran the fan and it cleared right out 
The first night we walked around the marina then then took the bus into Pacific Beach  the concierge was very helpful during our stay and provided us with a lot of information The hardest part about taking the bus is waiting for it to arrive  patience isnt always easy It did take us longer to get from place to place but we saved a lot of money by not renting a car 
We had dinner at the more casual onsite resturant there is another more upscale resturant as well one night and ordered room service for breakfast one morning  both times the food was delicious and the portions were large I enjoyed my surfer burritto for two days because it was so big 
Both pools were great they were clean there were plenty of towels and they werent crowded While we were there the temperature was pretty cool but we enjoyed swimming anyways 
The main reason I selected this hotel was the close proximity to Sea World it really paid off We took the first shuttle of the day and arrived 10 minutes before the park opened At the end of the night we walked back to the hotel it was well after the last shuttle ran  even though wed been at the park for 9 hours the walk was doable and safe 
I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone  especially to people who dont want to spend a ton of money but still would like a location with good atmosphere

title: No complaints and Im picky
text:
I stayed there during a soldout conference and was completely pleased GREAT beds fabulous location great housekeeping wonderful room service amazingly quiet for being so downtown They were also quite kind and accomodating to a colleague who became ill while there very much went the extra mile for him and again those heavenly beds were handy I also had one of the best hot stone massages Ive ever had as a patron in their spa
Only tiny complaints were that the pool is much too small for a hotel of this caliber and there are places when one can see the hotels age A little extra caulking in the bathtubs may be called for fairly soon 
But these are minor quibbles not dealbreakers Overall a heavenly refuge for the traveler I would certainly go again although after reading other reviews I will be sure to check PriceLine next time

title: Great Resort Location needing a little TLC
text:
With all the resorts in the PhoenixScottsdale area the Arizona Biltmore is unique having been built in 1929 well before most of the other resorts in the area The Frank Lloyd Wright inspired architecture is worth a visit on its own and the grounds are well maintained and pleasant to the eye The conference facilities are on a par with most other resorts and their fine dining restaurant Wrights at the Biltmore is excellent The accomodations however are due a makeover The furniture in our room was outdated and worn the carpeting has reached its limit
and the general feel of the room does not match that of the public areas This was our second visit for a conference and the comments regarding our room applied to both visits Our rating of average was in comparison with other resorttype hotels

title: Good value for money
text:
This was our first visit to NYC and the Salisbury was a great base literally on the doorstep of Central Park The hotel itself is a little dated in places but we did not expect anything too luxurious as we were not paying top dollar We were able to explore one of the worlds great cities on foot because the hotel is so well situated Our room was clean and spacious and had everything we needed for our week long stay including a safety deposit box
I would and hope to return to this hotel one day soon to explore New York some more

title: Nice Hotel Great Roof View of Statue
text:
We stayed two nights at the Conrad and was generally pleased with the hotel Nice rooms that were spacious and newly renovated If you needwant to be in the WTC area this is a good one a bit tedious to get anywhere else though 
The only complaints we had were
 Housekeeping disregarded the Privacy light twice Once to ask when they come inhint if the light is onyou are NOT WELCOME TO OPEN THE DOOR TO ASK
 Sheets were dirty makeup smear and had to get replacements
We did appreciate the Nespresso as we have one at home and had none during out two week vacation overseas Also has a great view of the Statue of Liberty from the roof top bar

title: Friendly staff Bathroom wasnt clean on arrival elevator  hallway floors filthy
text: The staff was very nice and helpful However upon arrival there was hair all over the lid and seat of the toilet They offered another room which I turned down at first but after a 30 minute wait for housekeeping I decided to take the other room They kindly upgraded me to a suite which was nice I was also surprised at how poorly maintained the elevator floors and some of the hallway floors were At first glance this is a pretty hotel but look a little further and its not living up to its potential

title: Dont bother
text: The lobby is grand but the rooms and hallways are terrible Bathrooms are so small you have to step out of hem to lather up Paint peeling stains all over carpets in hallways Very disappointing Dont let the pictures on their website fool you I felt dirty after leaving there

title: charming comfortable great location
text:
We arrived here after being ripped off by a nonyellow cab please dont learn the hard way like ustake a yellow cab and were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel There was some building work going on in the square but it was still a lovely open location which made it really peaceful Its extremely close to the Greenwich Soho cool shops and really close for Bleaker Street Everything else is within walking distance or easy to get to from the nearest subway station 
We had booked for a deluxe double which on the webiste was a little more expensive but said it would have either a city or park view The first room they gave us had a tiny window and a view of a drain and brick wallalthough this is quite common in New York we had specifically chosen this hotel and paid a bit extra because of the chance of a view The reception were very accomodating and found another room which was absolutely perfect large for New York standards and had two lovely big windows were we could see the park and the city a little bit The breakfast is great you can either have table service in the restaurant where you get a large choice of things brought to you or if you want you can have it in the lounge where you can help yourself and sometimes there is a bit more variety
All the staff were very friendly and very helpful The interiors are really quite lovely everything is clean and well kept Greenwich itself is a great place to be based as its low rise so its bit calmer than uptown and times square
Some cool restaurants to try are
Johns Pizzeria branch in soho and times square this is a converted chapel  massive yummy pizza very good value for money
Fannellis cafe in soho  great food bit like Cheers on the decor
Joes Shanghai  long wait so get there early also its quite crazy and you will be sat at a table with strangers but the dumplings are amazing  their speciality and so are their other dishes  try the greensmassive portions and cheap
Del Friscos  up market steak house next to the Rockafella Centre quite pricey but the most amazing steak and sides and a wine list of over 2000 wines
The Mercer Hotel kitchen  very cool interiors yummy food quite pricey but yummy cocktails
Just to mention a few

title: Good central location
text: Stayed here for 6 nights covering Thanksgiving 2012 group of 3 Very good location and easy walking distance for Central Park Times Square Broadway Madison Avenue etc The hotels picture gallery on their website does not quite show what you get The apartment we stayed in was spacious and clean but was in need of redecoration I slept on the sofa bed in lounge area which was uncomfortable but my guests were comfortable in their bed Although the hotel knew we were a party of three not enough towels were made available to us However the staff acted promptly when asked for more towels and in fact their maintenance team were prompt and efficient in dealing with a blocked toilet The kitchen equipment was useful but for European visitors a kettle would be welcome As we only used a small amount of crockery and cutlery daily we really would have preferred to use the kitchen sink to wash up rather than the dishwasher every day A washing cloth liquid and tea towel would therefore be welcome The hotels restaurant was not open when we were there and I was told by staff that it had been closed for a month due to refurbishment I saw no work going on Also the hotel provided us with complimentary breakfast vouchers to use at a nearby deli but the one morning we decided to use it it was closed One elevator broken down often The hotel would also benefit from having instructions on how the equipment worked in each of the apartments instead of leaving it to trial and error On our day of departure I had booked a late check out time of 5pm When we returned to the Hotel at 430pm we were locked out of the apartment I had to return to the reception desk to get this resolved which was done promptly but it is a long trek especially when you have two aged elevators I would go back to this hotel because although it had some little things it could improve upon overall it was a satisfactory apartment However these little improvements could make it into a great place to stay

title: Great location
text: Stayed for two nights Great location Convenient to restaurant and theatre Friendly staff Plenty of outlets for the Blacberry iPad laptop and other electronics City view are excellent Furniture was retro 1950s The bathroom was modern with a walkin shower

title: Cozy Chill Vibe
text: Great location great rates Tiny rooms are fine with me  Id rather not pay for square footage when Ive come to see the city Easy walk to Pacific Place Mall and Westlake Center Mall a block each and just slightly longer to Belltown and Pike Place Noisy in window heatingcooling system was the only downside

title: Great Place To Stay
text:
We booked the Legacy through Preferred Access and really enjoyed our one week stay At first we had a studio but upgraded to a 1 bedroom after walking through the models of each It would be easy to stay in a studio here but the 1 bedroom feels more like your own home Lots of parking the on site restaurant is small but the food is great Staff if friendly too Washer  dryer in each room even the studios and the full kitchen is nice and has everything you need Go buy some groceries and move right in There is a Frys market about 1 12 miles away
Only downsize to this resort is no free Internet in the rooms You have to pay 995 per day to get online
Pretty much in the middle of the Phoenix area with easy freeway access Quiet and clean rooms
We will definitely be back to The Legacy

title: A sleek and elegant hotel with amazing service beds and views
text: I stayed overnight here on my way back home I had booked this hotel from a travel zoo special and I had mistakenly booked the wrong month The manager kindly refunded my  and although I couldnt get the same rate I was very grateful they accommodated me and refunded my mistake The beds are heavenly the room was luxurious and the room service was impeccable This is a great hotel for business people as it is in the financial district

title: Comfortable but a little tired
text:
The Westin name doubtless attracts many guests my booking was via a booking system and the price was good but I had no control over which chain I would get There is a lot of competition around LAX and so standards should be high
Westin has a shuttle bus which goes to two hotels and I had approximately a 10 minute wait  the driver checked how long another guest and I had waited making the point that a bus would be there in no more than 15 minutes  reasonable
I had no problems checking in midevening Friday and on making my way to the room had the immediate impression in the corridors of a hotel ready for refurbishment  nothing specific just an atmosphere and old carpeting
In fact the room allocated 419 was large with a large bathroom and good facilities
The bed was large and comfortable
The inbath shower came with a flexible hose but also a selectable large rain head probably the best I have experienced in any hotel lately Towels were large and good quality
It was difficult to find a convenient electrical socket but there were two wander leads with TV lamps etc plugged into them This ought to be a complete nono  I have no evidence of danger but do wonder whether this has been approved by the Fire Marshall
Proper modernization would have separate sockets at mid height on a deskstyle surface adequate for working Other hotel chains manage this better  go across the street to the Hilton to see better design
The bar was pleasant well staffed and the food and drink good if expensive but no more so than other 4 star hotels
Check out was simple efficient and quick

title: You get what you pay for
text:
This certainly wasnt a classy hotel but then we only paid a small price especially when compared to other hotels in New York 
As some people have mentioned there was no elevator service and it was quite an effort to get upstairs with our bags though a porter did help us get down stairs when we left 
The room and the bed were very small we stayed in a double but we werent there to spend time in the hotel so it wasnt a huge issue 
It was snowing outside and the heating in the room was always on very very high so much so that we were in t shirts in the hotel then layering up when we went outside
One thing that we found a little odd was that we had to give our key to the front desk each time we left the hotel and when returning we would tell the staff our room number and the key would be handed over without any checking of whether it was in fact our room Not sure whether this is a great system 
Overall it wasnt a bad stay but next time Id probably try somewhere else

title: If I only had more time
text: One night was not enough What a gem this hotel is Wonderful accommodating staff a beautiful room nice bath products and a super comfy bed I dont want to leave and I hope I have a reason to return real soon BTW the jogging path information provided in the room was a great idea and we used it

title: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL
text:
I had read the reviews on this site and while they made me a little nervous I thought Its a Ramadait cant be THAT bad
It CAN and IS THAT BAD This place is absolutely disgusting The first clue is the dirty dark stairway up to the rooms no elevator All the rooms are enclosed under one roof no outside access I guess that can be good and bad but in this case its bad The smell in the corridor is bad enough but the smell upon entering the room is enough to knock you off your feet The room didnt appear to have been vaccumed in a while the furniture is stained 
While the bathroom appeared to be relatively clean the toilet didnt work We called the front desk about it and their answer was to knock on our door hand my husband a plunger and walk away Ummmmexcuse me That did not solve the problem and with the second phone call the front desk manager entered the room and tried to instruct my husband on how to use a plunger Ummmmagainexcuse me
We explained that we had a dinner to get to and needed the toilet fixed The employee could not say whether or not it would be and said there were no other rooms to move us to 
Id had enough
Right across the street is the Coventry Motor Innsame price 200 better accommodations and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful They did not seem at all surprised when we told them our story and were able to get us a room for two nights Needless to say we immediately went back across the street and checked out of the Ramada Limited
DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY AT THE RAMADA LIMITED

title: You get what you paid for
text: I dont see why people would rate this property very negatively the price for their room was 50 bucks what do you want in 50 A diamond shredded mattress Frankly I was not upset with the stay yes room did need a bit of cleaning and the hotel staff needs to use more air freshner to at least keep the cigarette smell down if not eliminate If I had showed up with my family I would probably not stay here but for one night visit it was okay

title: Great location
text:
The highlight of this hotel is its very good location Tons to do within walking distance and very close to the Market St subway for BART and Muni and close to the cable car for Fishermans Wharf
The rooms may be a bit smaller but otherwise are fairly standard Marriott rooms Id say that if you get a good deal here go for it When its booked up and quite pricey you might not bother

title: Holiday Inn decor still haunts Gild Hall
text:
The only downside of Gild Hall is that the rooms still feel too close to a Holiday Inn The decor has been switched out and the red accents are modern but the layout is still basically the same This is not exactly what I expected from a Thompson hotel 
The staff is stylish and attentive The bar is inviting The valet parking is convenient

title: Great location  no frills but good price
text: I got a great deal through priceline so for well under a hundo doll ers this was a great deal Really cant beat the location No frills but rooms were clean and my stay was great Parking will run you ten a night

title: Better than previous reviews suggest
text: I must admit I was a little nervous after reading some previous reviews Some friends had made the reservation for them and us I was very pleased w the results As other posts had mentioned the staff was very friendly and accomodating It was in a great location to all of the neighborhoods we wanted to cruise The price was far better than others in the same area Yes the fixtures carpet and wallpaper was somewhat dated And yes you had to climb a small flight of stairs to access the elevators None of those things matter to me The roombathroom was good sized and clean The breakfast buffet option was very plentiful and good I would return

title: Could be fine but wasnt during my visit
text: I took a week to give thought to my review here  the hotel is obviously in the middle of an upgrade and that didnt bother me whatsoever Im a penny pincher and I SO wanted to give this hotel my vote of confindence BUT Ive told myself next visit to Chicago Im not going to be so cheap First if you are on a budget there is nothing here that should preclude you from staying here you cant beat the location or the price The staff was as helpful as they could be  Kelly did everything she could  but unfortunately we had three issues during our stay all of which could occur anywhere but it just seems too much for one trip First the remote control to the TV did not control our TV after I went down to the desk several times and five remotes later it still didnt work and I couldnt change the channels manually either so we had a choice of ESPN or nothing  not so great with two kids they did comp our rate for that night for this Second the toilet overflowed Kelly was the only one on duty and there was no maintenance people onsite at this 10 PM time so it took over an hour to get a plunger and fresh towels to solve the issue Both of these items were resolved the next day while we were out and about but upon returning the second day after having walked all over the city alas our keys didnt work to let us back in the room SO back down the SLOW elevator to get the keys reworked Again they fixed it ASAP so they really do try I just think Ill shell out a little bit more for a better chance at a nice relaxing stay next time

title: Newly renovated large rooms in Union Square
text: I loved my stay at the Abri  its a great location close to all the shopping on Powell street Forever 21 HM Macys and they have done a great job with the rooms Spacious especially for a boutique with great modern furnishings Definitely recommend and would be back The staff is very genuine sweet and helpful

title: Great downtown hotel Close to the Mall
text:
My daughter age 16 and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Capitol from July 7  11 2005 We had a very pleasant stay
We arrived from NJ via Amtrak then took the Metro from Union Station through Gallery PlaceChinatown to LEnfant Plaza 
The hotel is a short walk from the LEnfant Plaza Metro Station use the 7th AveSmithsonian Exit
When we arrived our room was ready I had emailed a request for early checkin It was approximately 1230 PM
Our room had 2 double beds with 3 NICEnot flat  pillows per bed Had all the advertised amenities iron ironing board coffee maker etc Air conditioner worked GREAT you need it when it hits 95 degrees The bathroom had a lot of counter space to spread out if you need that 
Got a great rate 124 per night through the Holiday Inn website  prepaid internet rate
We requested a refrigerator which was brought up from engineering WAS surprised that it was 5 per NIGHT extra  but I considered it worth it since we went to CVS right down the street for a few six packs of water for 250 per six pack whereas any tourist area it is 250 per bottle
Must tell you that dining is not a priority with us  we are not interested in the dining experience We did not eat in the Smithson restaurant because of the reviews that it got at this website HOWEVER we did eat breakfast everyday at the Smithson DELI which is in the hotel right outside the restaurant area They had breakfast sandwiches bagels fruit juices coffee tea  selfserve and perfect for us just before sightseeing Cost was approx 3 per person
We didnt find dining a problem We usually ate at restaurants before going back to the hotel However Quiznos Subs is open late and just down the block There is a McDonalds also down the block We ate at Union Station basement level and 1st floor level has food 
Our only disappointment was the crowded conditions at the rooftop pool  but to be expected in July Even if you dont swim its worth a look at the marvelous Capitol view Check out the rooftop bunny rabbits I kid you not  we have pictures
Wed definitely stay again

title: Loved the hotel
text: We loved the hotel When I see other posts about it being shabby I cant for the life of me figure out what they are talking about Rooms were large with TWO bathrooms lobby was fabulous pool was large with two hot tubs and huge gym staff was courteous For us the location was greatacross the street from Grant Park with a great view of Buckingham Fountain and close to all the museums and theatres Im sure others would rather be north of the river closer to the Magnificent Mile but we enjoyed the quieter and more scenic location Got it for 105 on Hotwire What a bargain for such a nice hotel

title: cannot say enough GOOD about this hotel
text: Stayed 2 nights4 adults room incl 2 teens STAFFoutstanding Friendly helpful smiling respond to all requests ROOMtight but highly efficiently organized When we first walked in wondered how we would fit all our stuffno problem Trendyvery contemporary Were on 22nd flr with decent views COMP BREAKFAST  RECEPTIONcomplete and generous food was good You can likely skip dinner out the hors doeuvres are generous LOCATION12 block from subway 1 12 from Times Square quiet location safe  plenty of restaurants nearby Cannot wait to get back to NYC  stay at this hotel

title: Nice stay but small room
text:
I stayed in the Hudson Hotel in December for Christmas shopping in New York
I had a nice stay The food in the restaurant was very delicious They have a cosy library where we enjoyed a cup of coffee
The room was very small but decorated in a nice way
The service at the reception was not so good

title: Spacious beautiful rooms and great service
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Hotel Times Square for 3 nights on February 24 2012
The hotel rooms were spacious and well appointed We also ha a great view of Manhattan from our 28th story room There are over 40 stories in the hotel with no rooms lower than the 15th floor I especially appreciated this very quiet room away from the noise and hustle and bustle of Times Square We could see the bright lights below but were high enough up that the bright lights didnt keep us awake or cause eyestrain when we looked out the window Our sheets and towels were changed every day without asking I believe that there were also robes in the room which came in very handy We didint have time to visit the pool jacuzzi or exercise room but they were also spacious well equipped with all of the usual amenities What really made the hotel outstanding was the incredible Concierge and staff service My husband and I were not familiar with Manhattan and we received great directions and recommendations for restaurants entertainment transportation sightseeing the works All of the staff was well trained professional and had answers for every single question we asked And they seemed happy What a treat after staying in major hotels who have cut back service and amenities because of the recession And we received all of this in a great location for a mere 199 a night Yes it was winter but we lucked out on the weather and it was easy to get theatre tickets sightseeing tours restaurant reservations The only thing I didnt like was that there are no hotel restaurants in sight when you enter the hotel they are all on upper levels and seemed inconvenient to access Maybe they werent but we didnt look for them We had a drink at the beautiful hotel lobby bar one night and were stunned when the check was 32 for a Johnny Walker Black Scotch on the rocks for my husband and a glass of mediocre white wine for me They were double pours and it is Manhattan but it still seemed steep Also there was no entertainment in the hotel not even a piano bar This seemed odd to me given this is a 4 star hotel in a major urban area Maybe everyone just goes to the theatre when they come to New York Who knows Other than these things which werent a big deal to us the hotel was the best deal weve had in a long time Did I mention that we received triple Hilton Honors points for our stay there and earned another 25000 points by attending a fractional share presentation at the Hilton near Central Park All in all it was a great value for us
One tip if you visit the Big Apple make a reservation for dinner absolutely anywhere you want to go especially in the theatre district even if youre eating very early or very late Its the only way to get into the good restaurants You cant just walk into a restaurant with a good reputation even if its only moderately priced Youll wait for at least an hour and maybe longer Reservations and advance tickets are also good for the touritst attractions They save you time waiting in line and guarantee that you can see your chosen attraction when you want to It frees up your day for other things and maximizes your time in the Big Apple This is especially important during the tourist season which runs from Spring to Fall
Also try AAA for discount theatre tickets They buy up blocks of seats all levels for the major shows and discount them around 40 You can get the tickets in advance so you dont have to stand in line at the discount places Also pick up a copy of their NYC guidebook before you leave home Its terrificincludes restaurants hotels sightseeing attractions shows entertainment the works

title: Server at Trellise Restaurant goes beyond
text: Pati Mukzeviez a server at the Trellise restaurant at the Town and Country Resort  Conference Center display excellent customer service When I went to order my food I noticed that I didnt have my credit card I realized that I must have left it at the restaurant I had eaten breakfast at earlier that morning Pati called the other restaurant to see if my credit card was there and then she even went and got it for me while I was enjoying my delicious skirt steak salad Kuddos to Pati for making my day

title: Terrible Customer Service uncomfortable rooms disappointing general manager
text:
I booked through Hotwire I accidentally booked the wrong nights and the assistant manager with hotwire on the phone agreed to a reduced rate for 2 nights The Andaz still received my hotwire payment and we agreed I would pay the difference since it was my mistake I reiterated with the assistant manager I was traveling on business and needed to stay within a specific rate Thought everything was OK since 2 colleagues recieved hotwire rates even much lower Instead I was hassled and basically told I was a liar about the agreed upon rate by the general manager On my second day I was contacted to leave the hotel 3 times I explained I booked for 2 nights and confirmed again my rate
Upon leaving the general manager looked at the note about my rate noticed the exact agreed upon amount I mentioned yet INSISTED there was a mistake I told him I was responsible for the amount above my already paid hotwire and he said the assistant manager who was not there should not have provided my lower rate He then proceeded to bill me over 100 ABOVE the rate HE SAW IN THE COMPUTER SYSTEM When I approached him about this twice he said the assistant manager was not there and that until he figured out why I received such a low rate he would be forced to charge my credit card I mentioned again my two colleagues actually stayed through hotwire for a rate even lower and that I was willing to pay more just not the 100 more he was trying to charge me I also mentioned hotwire was on the phone to confirm and he even has a note in system with the agreed upon rate He said it is complicated because the manager should not have had the authority to do this Essentially after the second time I stated it is an internal problem with the hotel and that he was essentially saying he did not believe the other managers note His response was that he would not bill my credit card until later that day and confirm with the manager So when I left I was charged over 100 above what was agreed and he wasted over 30 minutes of my time trying to explain this I had an afternoon business meeting and left without continuing to argue since it was clear he was going to charge my card anyway 
Terrible customer service In addition the hotel was not that great The bathroom is weird and the shower points straight at your face so I basically had to duck to wash my hair The entire hotel is very snooty On the first night at the supposed hot spot rooftop bar the bartender told us the next night would be off and the greatest place in San Diego and there would be a line but since we were in the hotel we would be good with wristbands Well good thing we had wristbands for the lame 25 person scene the next night When we asked him he was like well come back on the weekend sorry The entire hotel is run by rude want to be black suit wearing wannabe New York nightclub bouncers

title: Perfect for our trip needs
text: I had 9 other fire fighters with me to see the 911 site We used the valet service gym pool and business center during our stay I stayed in the Jr suite with two others and it was perfect I would recommend if your activities are within walking distance to take the T to the hotel to avoid the valet charge

title: Absolutely fantastic
text:
We stayed at this hotel from september 1216 I have seen the mixed reviews on here but thought the hotel looked very nice so we booked it through bookingcom We arrived early so our room was not ready yet but we just got to know the area which was nice I emailed the hotel when I booked and asked for a room on a high floor and when we checked in we got an amazing room on the 51st floor It was very nice and big with a great view of TS Empire State Building and Chrysler building I thought the room was well kept and up to date The cleaning was also good All of the staff were nice and helpful 
The location is also great It only took seconds to walk to Times Square and Avenue of the Americas
We had a great stay here and would love to go back
I really would recommend this hotel to everyone Do not hesitate booking this

title: Fancy but watch out for the valet parking
text: The hotel is beautiful and in a great location Beware of the valet parking 26 but there is public parking very close that is much cheapter 11 It is a large hotel yet the room we stayed in was really large We asked for a king size bed and were told that normally it costs 20 more but Ill waive it this time Have never heard of an extra cost for a king size bed but since it was waived Im giving the hotel the 5 stars it deserves

title: Great conference venue if youre bringing the kids
text:
We were in town for a week at a conference with our two and four year old kids This place is within walking distance of the conference center and there are quite a few things to do nearby Room was fine and ours had a view of the aircraft carrier which the kids loved so yes go for the bay view upgrade
Breakfast and managers reception were obviously busy but we never had problems finding a table for four
Only complaint for a summer stay would be that there is no outside pool so youre stuck in your room if you dont want to go outside Having said that the foreshore park is close Also decent restaurants are a few minutes walk away so bring the stroller and kiddyboard

title: Great Crash Pad in Good Location in NYC
text: We stayed with our two teenage sons at The MAve in June 2010 to celebrate my 40th birthday The hotel is in a convenient and walkable location to the main hub of NYC The rooms yes are small but have everything you need and are clean and maintained well I see from other reviews that it was noisy and yes it was but I have stayed in NYC before and that is part of the experience The City That Never Sleeps We were pretty exhausted with the sightseeing and jet lag so we slept through much of the noise anyway We loved the complimentary pastries and the coffee in the morning as it was booked on a Room Only basis The staff were friendly helpful and knowledgeable The only slight hitch was that we wanted rooms next dooron the same floor as we had out two teenage sons in a twin room Unfortunately they were two floors down but I do put this down to our booking agent not requesting in time Overall I would recommend The MAve is you are having a whistle stop tour of the Big Apple

title: Fashionable but lacking the basics
text: Nice hotel with a very fashionable lobby nice restaurant attractive bar The room was large and nicely furnished but wifi was very slow and there wasnt any power outlets near the desk Also they messed up our reservation and we almost had to change hotels on the middle of our holidays Parking very expensive Small pool on roof top  of the second floor  so enclosed by walls Good service all around

title: Best management and staff in any venue we have used to date
text:
The Crowne Plaza DowntownSan Jose was the host hotel for our dart league championship over the weekend The management and staff were absolutely the best we have ever encountered Friendly efficient and a can do attitude from everyone
If you are looking for a facility to host an event of any kind look no further

title: Nice place inside
text: It was a nice place The beds were really comfy and all the furniture is brand new The outside appears a little sketchyits not in the best of neighborhoods It is also under major renovations But it super close to the beach and Sea World The parking situation is bad They have a garage with really small spots and lots of people with SUVs that go into a second spot Alsothere was supposed to be a hair dryer in the room and they had not installed it yet Overall the room was really nice

title: Fantastic Hotel Superb Staff Great Experience
text: Recently returned from several nights at The Standard East Village and absolutely LOVED the hotel It is located in a perfect spot for exploring the city easy access to the subway yet within walking distance to all the cool areasEast Village Greenwich SoHo Chelsea West Village Little Italy Meatpacking etc Hotel design is sleek and modern The room was great those big windows make for a fantastic view The bed was the MOST comfortable hotel bed ive ever been in and particularly loved the huge tub Housekeeping was thorough and efficient and worked like magic elves Enjoyed a delicious breakfast daily on the penthouse level giving a gorgeous 360 view of NYC Hotel lounge on second floor is so comfy too The entire staff was wonderful attentive courteous and very helpful in every aspect of the stay in particular Fidel in the lobby and Caroline behind the front desk who was indispensible with concierge services and suggesting sights shopping locales and restaurants throughout The Big Apple I will definitely stay here again hopefully soon as the entire staff at The Standard East Village made this a fantastic and memorable visit

title: Cant wait to return
text:
Not knowing exactly where the Colonnade was located we were extremely pleased to find it right across the street from Copley Plaza and with an entrance to the subway right outside the front door
The rooms are efficiently equipped with work space and bright lights Beds are very comfortable and the 37 flatscreenTVs are great The staff at the hotel was very helpful and as a Preferred Hotel member all the amenities were provided with no problem Workout facilities are generously equipped
The doorman was always available to call for a cab which are lined up outside thus there was no wasted time We will definitely choose The Colonnade again

title: Managers Reception Deserves two Thumbs Up
text: We stayed here in July 2011my family loved this hotel The room was clean and spacious The complimentary breakfast and managers reception is awesome Having drinks and snacks at no extra cost is the best We will definitely stay were again

title: Great option in Seattle
text:
I loved this hotel It is new and welllocated I was in Seattle on business and the hotel was very close to my destination The hotel is also walking distance to the Space Needle
The room is spacious with modern tecnology Parking was available and very accessible Breakfast was good and wellsupplied The front desk has a booklet of several restaurants that deliver at the hotel 
I think that with some much to see in Seattle this hotel is perfect for its purpose It has all the basic necessities with a good price good location and modern rooms
I would definetely stay at this hotel again

title: Unparalleled Service
text: Short stay but while I was there it was clear that the staff cares about every little detail to keep you very happy during your stay As for cost performance You will not find a better place

title: Lovely hotel and good value hotel for NYC
text:
We spent four nights at the Park South Hotel in June 2006 We paid around 200night for a queen size room this is a double by UK standards and were not disappointed The rooms were a good size very clean with a decent shower and nice toiletries If you are looking for somewhere merely to sleep and are not planning to spend too much time in your room then the size of the room is perfectly fine The room was nicely decorated and the bed very comfy We had an aircon unit which whilst a little noisy more irritating probably to those of use who are not used to getting air con units in hotel rooms kept the room cool 
The continental breakfast was great plenty to choose from The staff were really helpful and friendly The hotel is well located in midtown a 10 minute walk from the Empire State Building with a subway station at the end of the block which we made great use of I would definitely recommend use of the subway it is cheap and very easy to use and saves a lot of time and energy especially if you only have a few days in NYC 
The only downside to the hotel was that the first room we had cant remember the room number but it was on the same floor as the reception desk and quite near to the reception was located right next to the generators so it was very noisy I asked reception if we could move rooms but there were none available we had arrived at 930pm and it was the last room left However they did say that they would move us to a quieter room the next day and that they would move our bags if we left them in the room I was a little sceptical but lo and behold the next day on returning to the hotel we had been moved to the same size room a couple of floors up We could still here the generators but Im guessing you could probably here them from most rooms anyway 
So I was very impressed by this and generally the quality of the hotel for the price I would definitely recommend it to anyone on a similar budget as it appears that most hotels of a similar quality in NYC are a lot more expensive than this one

title: Our first visit to San Francisco
text: We had an excellent stay at the Chancellor Hotel  excellent location close to everything including Union Square Cheesecake Factory Sears and Macys Great accomodations and excellent service breakfast in the Luques Restaurant is a delightful experiencecheck the Eggs Benedict as well as the Burrito with cheese avocado and baconit is huge and extremely deliciousthere is even a Cable Car stop almost in front of the hotel I checked several hotels in the area using Trip Advisor and I was surprised as to the high number of good ratings this hotel receives from other travellers After our stay I can only say that I am another happy traveller to be added to all travellers that have given high remarks for this hotel

title: Great location but otherwise a mixed bag
text: We chose the Sheraton to be close to Universal Studios and Citywalk and it was brilliant for that The service we had during our stay was also excellent However the hotel itself is quite tired and dated  particularly the pool aeas and the rooms are small and do not have a fridge

title: Rockamada you dont get what you pay for but location is key
text: I have stayed at the this place for years for a one nighter the ROCKAMADA as I like to call it is located across the street from two great music venues the Ogden and Fillmore You can walk across the street not drive and party it up The hotel also takes pets which is a big bonus they have a nice courtyard for the animals to play and go to the bathroom Please pick up after your pet As far as the rates 12500 with tax A bit steep for the worn out and dirty rooms My socks were black from the nasty carpet the tv was ghetto the bathroom sink was clogged and it smelled funny in my room There was a smoking fine if you smoke in the room and my room smelled like smoke from the get go so make sure you drink a lot and just pass out if you plan on staying here

title: This place just keeps impressing me
text:
Sometimes you stay at a hotel when its new and everyone is going out of their way to make it great Come back a year later and it has slipped a notch Not so here Ive made multiple stays at this hotel and every time I visit someone goes out of their way to make it another great stay This time it was Sunny appropriately named as he is a wealth of bright  cheery who put a smile on our faces as we walked through the door and continued to do so through our four day stay Jamie who was ready to help with anything anytime and went out of his way to make us welcome It was especially nice since my sister who was new to New York was given the royal carpet treatment It was also great that Nick took time to meet a special request 
The breakfast area is still wonderful though I wouldnt mind a little better coffee and fruit but the atmosphere makes up for it 
I called down that one of the light bulbs in the bathroom was burned out and the maintenance man was there within 5 minutes Just cant beat this place Great value on all fronts

title: Very nice hotel in a great location
text: I stayed here 3 nights for a festival I was attending Very close to all that is happening in Times Square My corner room had a fabulous view over the city and the Hudson River Would definitely stay here again

title: No Complaints about the Westin
text: We stayed at the Westin Times Square on December 5 2004 and had a very nice stay With hotel prices so high for the holidays we didnt know if we would be able to stay in the city or not We actually had reservations to stay in NJ but canceled because we really wanted to be in Manhattan We then made reservations at the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers We had stayed at the Sheraton Manhattan in the summer and were very pleased with the hotel especially the friendly and helpful staff So when we were able to get a room at either Sheraton for under 300 we decided to give the other one a try this time But then I looked on Hotwire and saw a deal for a Times Square 4 Star hotel for less than 200 I did a lot of research on various sites and deducted that the hotel was probably the Westin at Times Square I had never used Hotwire before but decided to give it a try and boy am I glad I did I purchased the hotel room for half the price of what I was going to pay for a comprable room The Westin had mixed reviews on this site but I knew we wouldnt be spending much time in the room so Im glad I took the gamble From checkin to checkout we did not have any complaints The rooms werent anything great but they were big enough for 2 adults and 2 preteens and most important  they were clean The lady that check us in was very accommodating  we were also able to check in early I asked for 2 double beds and a nonsmoking room and got it without hesitation It was raining the next morning and we were given complimentary umbrellas to use for the rest of our stay The bellhops were great We stayed a Sunday night and the hotel was not very busy and the elevators were alway quick to take us where we needed We stored our luggage after checking out and they were very helpful If the price is right we would stay at the Westin again

title: Lovely but not sure it deserves such high praise
text:
Perhaps its because this hotel is the 1 rated hotel in all of LA but it didnt quite live up to our expectations
On the plus side the staff are absolutely brilliant and really made us feel welcome and at home  so thank you guys Location is great for travelling around LA and seeing the sights  also for Yamashiro which is much better than its web reviews and of course The Magic Castle if thats your thing Parking is free and secure though a bit of a chore if you have a big vehicle Wifi and nibblesdrinks in your room are free which is a lovely touch
Why only 3 stars then To be honest the place is pretty tired and in need of a refit whilst the pool is tiny You know all this when you stay there so its not so much of an issue The major issue for us was noise  we had a road facing room MAKE SURE YOU ASK NOT TO HAVE ONE OF THESE and the traffic keeps going all night so you cant have the window open Even if you have the windows closed it remains seriously noisy The air con units are old and VERY noisy so the only way to get to sleep at all is with earplugs Sorry guys I know theres not much you can do about this but to be fair to all I had to make this clear 
If we hadnt had a road facing room Im sure I would have rated this as a 4 so dont get me wrong its a very nice place to stay

title: Wonderful Rooms Comfy Beds Great Lifestyle Center
text:
We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Sorella for my 20th High School Reunion The two nights we spent at the property were glorious The rooms are spacious clean and brand new Each room is wellappointed and very clean
Its located in a large sprawling lifestyle center with numerous options for eating drinking and even fine dining We only went to one of the restaurants but really enjoyed the environs
The bed was luxuriously comfy Thanks for having us Hotel Sorella

title: Great location staff and room
text: Was a great choice the first time a few years ago so we stayed here again last month We visit DC for the musems the history the memorials etc This is a big hotel that is well run and clean The staff is very friendly and helpful This is the best location for a DC tourist and is now my hotel of choice for my future visits to DC

title: What a great place to stay
text: This is our second visit as we stayed in the hotel about 5 years ago The Hotel Carlton is very well located near Union Square on Sutter near Hyde The Union Square area cable cars and the theatre district are a close walk The hotel although quite old has been very well modernized and has walk in closets safes etc The two elevators although cosy are fun to ride The best thing about the Hotel Carlton is the staff They are all very friendly courteous and knowledgeable respecting the city It is just like speaking to a friend They also multi task as Theo checked us in provided tips on restaurants and driving in San Francisco and then played the keyboard to entertain us during the reception in the afternoon The wine reception in the lobby between 530 and 600 pm was always a highlight with many of the guests in the hotel All in all I would certainly recommend the Hotel Carlton to my friends and we will definitely stay there again when we travel back to San Francisco The only negative is that a fire station is close by and if it is a busy night the sirens may be a distraction

title: Needs a refresh
