text: I stayed just one night whilst on my way back from New York where I had just stayed in the Hilton Times Square It was a lot less expensive in Chicago but I also got a lot less I was upgraded to a suite and the room was quiet large and perfectly fine However everything about this hotel needs a refresh and refit The carpets wallpaper windows and fittings are definitely not modern The room was dark because the windows were small There was a scrolling video in the elevator that mentioned a 185m refurbishment in 1984 and it was said to be the largest most ambitious 1 year project at the time My thought was that it is high time for another one Im not sure I would stay at this hotel again as there is a lot of choice in Chicago but for what I paid and the excellent location I cant complain I also left my toilet bag behind and when I called the security desk they were particularly accommodating giving me clear directions as to how to get it back

title: Worked out great will go back
text: Convenient to everything staff was hospitable and responsive room was right for a short stay by myself comfortable bed clean quiet enough not on the street side Equipment worked supplies were adequate

title: Beautiful hotel awesome staff excellent accomodations
text: We were there for my stepdaughters wedding She had everything right there at the hotel and it was absolutely perfect Beautiful setting and extremely accomodating staff Elevators are very slow but plan ahead and that is okay too

title: top of the line
text: The Omni is an excellent hotelnot only are the rooms large but they are well cared for We stayed for three nights during the Cherry Blossom Festival and it was a real pleasure to get out of the crowds and spend quiet time here We were traveling with a teenager and a 9 year old and we were very comfortable in letting them go to the lobby alone for snacks and such I had heard terrible things about WDC but this hotel made all the difference The Red line Metro is only a short walk from the hotel and the Trolley is accross the streetloved it About two blocks away you can get anything from Lebaneze food to Burgers at the fast food jointsonly thing is the pool doesnt open until Mayotherwiseexcellent

title: A very classy hotel
text: My wife and I stayed for one night on a package that included valet parking room and breakfast all for a very reasonable rate Everything we experienced from check in to check out was first class It seems all of the people who work at the hotel are OSU students but what they lack in experience they make up for in enthusiasm and effort Our king room was large well appointed and everything was immaculate We ate at the small lounge following checkin and sandwiches and burgers were excellent The breakfast buffet included fresh omlettes and waffles Nothing at the hotel is ostentatious or overdone Its just a really nice hotel among the nicest Ive ever stayed at

title: Nice For The Price
text: Stayed here for business and found it very pleasant The location was good a few blocks from shops restaurants etc Neighborhood seemed safe and fairly quiet I have read complaints about the service and found the exact opposite to be true When I checked in they assigned me to a room and when I got to the room the housekeeping staff was still finishing up Not only did I get multiple apologies but managment sent up a delicious bottle of wine along with snacks for my trouble I only waited in the hall for 2 minutes I asked for feather pillows and they arrived in under 5 minutes My room was very clean and quiet but had the oddest shape with a good deal of unusable space The bathroom setup no real vanity area was a little weird This is not a full service hotel with lots of extras but with the prices in Washington it had good value location and a very pleasant staff

title: Pleasant enough
text: We were only in Seattle for one night before a cruise so chose this for convenience Although it is very close to the Space Needle precinct it was too far away from downtown to walk comfortably and staff were only variably helpful re taxis The rooms were ok for the price I guess This was I think staff accom for a company so the rooms are a bit larger than normal and had a small kitchenette which could be useful if you were staying a few days Our first room was at the front smelled odd and we couldnt open the windows The one they very helpfully changed us to at the back was better re smell with opening windows facing straight onto a brick wall But hey for the price I guess not bad And do try the fantastic breakfast place over the road  the one with the queues outside

title: Perfect for us
text:
We got a terrific price through another websitesorry Tripadvisorhowever I wanted to share here We had a really nice suite Everyone at the hotel was pleasant and helpful 
I had problems with the free wificalled the front destk and within just a few minutes a gentleman came to our room and got me hooked up without a problem 
Breakfast was includedusual free hotel fareself made waffles cold cereal yogurt bagels etc The only down side was the eggs and ham The eggs were not freshtasted like powdered The ham was dry and over cooked 
A nice fitness room and indoor pool Our grandkids visited us and had a ball in the pool
Everything was clean and well cared for We WILL stay here again when we visit Columbus

title: They overbooked us and we had to move way out of town
text: I had booked and prepaid for this hotel I confirmed 2 days before we arrived late check in guaranteed We arrived after a long drive from Vancouver only to find there was no room for us They did arrange for us to stay at another hotel in Seattle miles away at Lake Union evidently there were no other rooms available in the downtown area The checkin agent seemed put out to have to relocate and accommodate us He did arrange for us to have a car service with one transfer downtown It would only take 5 minutes for the car to arrive We moved hotels and called the car service only to be told it would arrive in roughly 90 minutes This was supposed to be the capoff of a long 10 day vacation and it turned out to be a horrible experience I would not recommend this hotel to anyone especially after the poor service they showed in dealing with their mistake in overbooking us

title: Get a Deal
text:
I got a deal on a large room at the Inn of Chicago and thank god for that If I had paid full fare for this room I would have been very disappointed 
The good the location and the lobby decor 
The bad the front desk clerk the tiny dark hallways tiny slow elevators the wires and cords running everywhere in the rooms the tiniest bathrooms and the almost working TV remote
Ive stayed in quite a few hotels in the Magnficent MileStreeterville area of Chicago and this is one that I dont plan on returning There are too many wonderful hotels in Chicago to waste my time at this one

title: Good corner rooms Friendly ambience
text: Stayed during the recent heat wave Front desk extremely friendly Corner rooms are neatly arranged and pleasant We received a bottle of wine for our anniversary Stayed on aquarium package which is a great deal if planning to visit with young children Valet parking 36 a bit expensive

title: Just avoid the rooms at the front
text:
We had room 201 It seems that there are two rooms on each floor facing the street I would avoid these especially the ones on the 2nd floor
We had a the hotel sign right outside our window and it was lit up with very bright lights that we could not block To add to that there was whooping and hollering on the street until past 2 am and this was a Monday night It all added up to a terrible nights sleep
The next morning I asked for a quieter room which was accommodated though we got a pullout sofa instead of a second bed But the room was extremely quiet
Location as others have stated was excellent Right in the heart of the historic district Very very convenient
Staff was friendly rooms were clean no complaints other than the noise in those front rooms
We were a little disappointed in the breakfast Maybe its just me but when I think of Belgian Waffles I think of fresh fruit whipped cream etc These were make your own with only syrup Pretty basic and filled the need but still not what was expected
I would recommend this hotel

title: Horrible Customer Service Hotel is Courtyard standard
text:
My family and I just experienced a very unpleasant stay at the Renaissance Washington DC Hotel at 999 Ninth St NW Washington DC DC 20001
Im really not one to complain about experiences unless they go DRASTICALLY wrong And I must also offer the disclaimer that I work in the hotel industry but I dont think any of these issues are that knitpicky or absurd Not to insult my own knowledge or anyone who is reading this review but it would be easier if I just listed the problems and issues that Ive encountered 
Things wrong at the hotel
We were given a handicap accessible room upon checkin Im an employee I know things like this happen I was willing to excuse it as we made a special request upon checkin
Stinkbug wrapped in toilet paper in our new room Picture 1
Toilet paper was used
No remote at checkin Called At Your Service AND stopped by FD FD was less than apathetic after hearing about the lack of a remote and the bug in the room Only saying Thank you for letting us know
4 hours later still no remote I called down to At Your Service again and told them that I called AND stopped by the front desk four hours ago and I still did not have a remote Much to my surprise the female on the phone told me in a harsh tone You might have stopped by the front desk but you didnt call I said Excuse me She repeated You might have told the Front Desk but Ive been here since 200pm you did NOT call Ive never been talked to that way by a service professional It was a sign of things to come
We spent 20 minutes looking for ice on floors 1015 with a sign on our floor saying the ice machine was out of order but instructing us to use the machine on the 15th floor which was also out of order
Only two towels in the room For a Luxury Brand more than two towels should be expected 
ESPN ch8 was not working Called Maintenance and told us It hasnt been working for a long time Thats it No further assistance offered I asked if they could get it fixed and they said they would call tomorrow
Drilling hammering banging and other construction on the roof at 730am Front Desk says Theres nothing I can do about it It was such an absurd hour to start construction especially without notification I asked to speak to a manager
Manager Lauren offers no help even after I tell her about my horrific stay so far and inform her that I have a list of complaints Instead she only says Im sorry you feel that way
Noise complaints 3 times our final night at 1145pm 230am and 430am They had us in a room in the middle of the University of Marylands football team so it was extremely noisy every night that we were there I dont understand why we were put in such a precarious location
At this point I realized that no one at the hotel was going to be of help to me I never even got so much as an Im sorry and it was useless to further voice my complaints at the hotel level

title: A real dump that does not live up to Drurys usual standards
text:
This place is very worn down and not well kept I would avoid it at all costs and I am baffled by the positive reviews that led me to stay here I had stayed in a Drury in Nashville a couple of years ago and so had expected this to be much much better
To make matters worse our room stunk of disinfectant or some such cleaning product that made us all fill queasy We asked if we could be moved to another room but there were four of us and there were no rooms available with two beds there were four of us so that didnt work

title: Simply Beautiful
text: Theres a trendy elegence to Hotel Indigo that understands the quality of everything the hotel provides Beautiful room sheets and pillows are heavenly Bathroom had the ambiance of a spa and couldnt be better Roof top openair lounge Beautifully done Fitness center Small but never crowded  and perfectly outfitted great view too Bar on the ground level is beautiful  and since this is San Diego the windows are opened accordianstyle to united the space with the outdoors Perfect This was a business trip so I didnt bring a pet  but I could have Hotel Indigo is unobtrusively petfriendly but I didnt know it without asking What more can I say Walking distance to restaurants  club as well as the convention center and I had a GREAT view of the baseball stadium from my room This was my first visit to wonderful San Diego CA and Hotel Indigo couldnt be better

title: Always receive splendid service at the Omni Westside
text:
I stay frequently at this hotel on business trips and they know how to look after their frequent travellers
That said even without the perks of being a special guest this is a very comfortable hotel The design is interesting  an all glass facade surrounds a very large atrium with a large pool of fish and a waterside restaurant Outside there is for a hotel a large open air swimming pool which is open for much of the year 
There is also a gift shop which double up as a Starbucks The dark and atmospheric Western  style bar which is open until quite late is typically strewn with peanut shells on the floor 
The rooms are comfortable with a plethora of pillows and cushions on the bed flat screen TV and for a small fee you can even request a treadmill in your room if you dont want to use the hotels own fitness room The service is always friendly and personalised
If I have to be picky and I know the hotel well the service in the restaurant is sometimes very slow and there are few low calorie options on the menu The hotel is slowly moving towards an ecooffering  most hotels have for a long time offered the option of reusing towels for example but given that the clientele is mostly the oil industry I imagine that the hotel management hasnt felt very driven to adopt this approach Thank goodness they finally have

title: Id use it again  then again I have used it 3 times in the last 12 months
text:
First the negatives  you get dumpsters across the street through the night taking away trash from the apartmentoffice buildings and theres currently building work going on at neighbouring buildings Oh and every other morning the breakfast meat option is that curious deep fried or grilled pork fat that seems to pass as bacon in the USA
Positives  in your room there is a white noise machine and earplugs to dull the dumpster noise and the management recognises it as a problem On the mornings when you dont have grilled pork fat there are some really nice sausage patties to go with the scrambled eggs unlimited toast and waffles coffee juices and dairy options
The rooms are very clean the beds are very comfortable albeit shallow there is a bath as well as a shower the work space is more than adequate about the same size as my office desk it is in an ideal situation for my customer sites the rates are reasonable the staff are great the manager Mr Weed will do whatever he can to assist in your stay
It is a few blocks from Times Suare and Broadway and I walked the length of 5th Ave up to Central Park and back comfortably
If you have ordinary needs give this hotel a look I have marked it down a bit on value solely because there isnt a value for money hotel in Manhattan  they all are overpriced

title: Highly recommended
text:
This was the second time i have stayed in this hotel and i couldnt fault it 
The hotel is ideally located to all the major attractions and there is a subway station right next to it 
The hotel room was quite spacious which is a rarirty in Manhatten and the complimentary Bliss products are superb 
When we arrived we found that our hotel room safe wasnt working we called down to the concierge and someone was upto the room within 5 minutes to fix it
If you have had a busy day and cant be bothered to go out for an evening meal the in room dining is well worth a look especially the pizza
I would personally ignore all of the negative reviews as we all know if you look hard enough we could all find negatives

title: Always on point
text: I love this hotel it is in the heart of downtown its beautiful and clean and everyone is always so helpful There is a disconnect though with their business center they charge and arm and legs for anything example I got charged over 150 for the business center just to call me and tell me my FedEx packages had arrived they didnt even touch them I went downt here myself and loaded them in my SUV I talked to the hotel but was informed they are seperate so they couldnt provide any help Its unfortuante because I would likely look to hosting more meetings and events here if there wasnt that disconnect because the space is beautiful and the actual Sheraton staff is always on point

title: Great Downtown Location No Frills
text: Great location reasonable price clean no frills Polite hotel staff The bed was comfortable The bathroom was functional but really outdated If you are looking for a budget hotel with a great location this is a good bet

title: A big thank you to The Whitehall Hotel
text:
We planned a trip from the UK to Chicago following a fab trip to New York the year before and we love the States Chicago is an amazing city and we loved every minute of it people are so helpful and friendly The hotel made the trip even better although the bed was so comfy I could have quite happily stayed in it for the whole trip The hotel is in a great location staff were polite and helpful We got a paper delivered everyday to the room Beds were made up and bathroom cleaned daily Our room was a good size and well equiped
Before we left we read some of the negative comments on here about the hotel Firstly bed bugs we had none in our room but when we went to New York we had read the same about the hotel there and again didnt have a problem Secondly some people had said the furniture and decor was dated I personally loved the old worldy look of the halls and yes the carpet had seen better days in the room but it was clean Yes the toilet was in an odd place in the bathroom but it wasnt an issue I wasnt planning on spending my holiday in there
I guess what I would say to people is that if your used to staying in a modern high end 3 star plus hotel this hotel wont be for you If you want a place to get your head down in while enjoying the amazing city of Chicago and you want a place thats clean and quaint and a bargin then this is for you and its in a great location
I would like to thank the staff at the hotel for a great stay we would definatly stay with you again You made it a holiday to remember and we really miss Chicago

title: Talk about customer service
text: Stayed for 3 nights this past week and loved every minute The hotel staff are very friendly and genuinly care about their guests It just shows The location of the Hotel is perfect if you like to be smack in the middle of the action The rooms are very comfortable  nicely decorated and soundproof The 2nd floor lobby is great to hang out in it features the R lounge where we and friends met for a surprise party for my wifes birthday The staff at the Lounge made us feel more than special Just a great time was had by all I will definitely stay here again

title: Terrific value very little to complain about
text:
I stayed here with 3 friends and we got a terrific rate of USD180night inc taxes which ended up proving to be unbeatable value
The room at Hampton was more than big enough to accommodate the four of us in the same room Even with a couch desk and large TV the room still felt spacious The decor was adequate and the bathroom was good enough to fulfill all basic needs
There were always several staff downstairs ready to help with inquiries and requests and most importantly I felt like they were happy and willing to help people out They even gave out free bottles of water
The free buffet breakfast has been praised continuously and not without reason There is always hot food bagels danishes muffins toasts cakes juices fruits and a wide range of cereal Theyre not joking when they say their breakfast is the best The choice of taking food to your room is a nice option 
Location is also excellent as the hotel is only about 5 minute walk to both Times Square and Central Park There is also the frequent blue line subway just downstairs from the hotel Dont forget that the blue line can take you to the airport also
The only complaint my friends came up with is that there are many more hotels that give you a New York feel Since that is rather subjective anyway I think most people wont mind checking out with the wow this place has been a bargain feel instead

title: very pleased
text: My family stayed at the Wilshire Crest the week before Christmas and we were very pleased Very reminiscent of inns in Europe The location is great museums very close walking distance to the Farmers Market and The Grove Third Avenue shops and restaurants close to Beverly Hills etc The rooms are large spotlessly clean beds have very good mattresses and nice linens The neighborhood is a lovely residential area which seemed very safe The complimentary breakfast is a cut above what you usually receive Parking was onstreet and we were always able to find a spot close to the hotel The only problem is that you can hear other guests walking in the halls the room above younoise seemed to travel easily However it did not bother us as it took place during waking hours and was very quiet at night Room rate was a very good value for Los Angeles

title: Home base for a dream vacation
text: We booked our New York vacation through Air MIles and after considering a couple of options decided on The New Yorker We were not disappointed This is a great hotel with small but comfortable rooms and great security For 10 a night we upgraded to a roomwithaview and it was worth every penny We were in a corner room and out of one window had a view of the Chrysler Building the Empire State building a few blocks away and Penn Station and Madison Square Garden just below Out of the other window we had a partial view of the Hudson River and all the buildings north of the hotel It seems like a small thing but theres something magical about being able to look out over the city at night The lighting on the Empire State Building changes from time to time It was green for St Patricks Day The great thing about The New Yorker is that its within walking distance of many local attractions  Times Square Broadway St Patricks Cathedral The Rockefeller Centre MoMA 5th Avenue If youre ambitious you can even walk to the 911 Memorial about 2 miles and Central Park There are many excellent restaurants in the area and its an easy walk to local favourites like Grimaldi Pizza and Brooklyn Bagels The Chinese restaurant just a block away Chef Yu was excellent For a great lunch take the subway down to 369 Broome Street for a sub sandwich at Saigon Vietnamese Sandwich One of the best meals all week was the Thai dinner we ate at Bangkok House 360 West 46th just a healthy walk from the hotel The bed in our room was extremely comfortable and after walking miles every day we slept well The housekeeping service was good  almost too good  as sheets and towels were changed even when they didnt need to be The smallness of the room wasnt a factor most of the time but the absence of a second chair meant that one of us had to sit on the bed while watching television rare or using the hotels free internet The free internet tended to be a little slow but we decided against the upgrade to premium internet for around 10 per day The souvenir shop in the basement of the hotel was well stocked and reasonably priced If youre considering taking a doubledecker bus tour the consensus seemed to be that the Gray Line is more reliable than the City Sights competitor We had prebooked with City Sights and overall it was pretty good However one afternoon on the Uptown Tour we hopped off at the Metropolitan Museum and never did hop back on Every bus that came by was full with others who had hopped back on There were about ten very tired and frustrated people still waiting when we decided to take a cab back to our hotel Anyway it was a fabulous week and having a great comfortable hotel like The New Yorker as our home base had a lot to do with making this the vacation of a lifetime

title: Great location clean very friendly staff
text: The staff were terrific  warm friendly and chatted with my daughter like any other respected guest Clean modern rooms free wifi Loved the French restaurants in the area and the rooftop terrace Easy to get around town from there The hotel restaurant could use some kidfriendly selections Would stay here again

title: Love it
text:
Great hotel with an awesome staff
Whether youre here for business or pleasure youll be hard pressed to find a better place in San Antonio

title: Good Quality Hotel
text:
For the price I am so glad my boyfriend and I stayed in the Tribeca area as it is a lot less touristy than uptown  and cheaper too
Rooms basic smallish not a great view and tiny bathroom but all we did was sleep here so did not bother us in the slightest They were very very clean rooms maids cleaned and left fresh towels every day
Staff were ok not the type to go out of their way to help and some better than others but on the whole fine Plenty of handy leaflets maps etc in reception
I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel  dont go expecting room service and stunning rooms  you wont get it here
But if you are looking for a very clean well located laid back convenient hotel  this is for you Slightly too commercialised uptown for me  I prefer the uniqueness of Tribeca and surrounding areas like Greenwich Village etc
Also did the Sex and The City tour which was great
Note  the American Museum of Natural History and Museum of Art are a waste of time Guggenheim looks good on the outside ok inside Because we spent so much time at these places we missed out on the Museum of Modern Art  but that looks great so Id only bother with that
Ice skating at Central Park tip  go skating at sundown  its amazing to watch it get dark over Manhattan while you skate
Went to see Chicago and also Phantom  both great  but I cannot believe the lack of dress standards at the theatre  some people were wearing trainers and people were staring at my partner and I for beng dressed smartly in evening wear Very strange  not like England in this sense at all Cannot understand why this city is labelled City Of Style  no Carrie Bradshaws to be seen 
The best guide book is the AA Spiral Guide

title: Excellent hotel  top quality  good prices and friendly helpful staff
text: We stayed at Hotel on the Ave on 77th and Broadway and it was a fabulous choice The location was perfect for what we wanted to see and do our nicely decorated rooms were spacious and the shower stall in our modern bathroom was big enough for a mom to wash five kiddies at the same time We got a newspaper outside our door and coffee was served in the lobby each morning There was free WiFi in the lobby as well However most important to us was the genial hotel staff who offered service with a smile each and every time we requested it When Journeywoman realized she had left her iphone power cord at home the assistant manager happily shared his with her and saved the day Plus there were two female conscierge desks in the lobby and those girls knew their stuff This hotel definitely earned a JW Gold Star rating from us Our group all agreed wed come back here in a New York minute

title: great value for the dollar
text: Terrific location Very clean room that appeared to have been updated recently including crisp linens very clean bathroom flat screen TV Friendlyhelpful staff Small room but its NYC  youre only in the room to sleepshower

title: Top hotel in top location
text: After reading loads of reviews on this hotel mostly good but some bad we bit the bullet and booked it and thank god we did We love the LES so many great bars restaurants cafes and shops within a stones throw of the hotel Check Schillers for dinner and a drink 1 block away and grab an awesome crepe for breakfast on the opposite corner of the hotel We have a room on the 14th floor looking uptown directly at the empire state and have had magnificent sunsets to watch from our room each night i am looking at one as i write this The staff have all been lovely and extremely helpful with everything we have needed we have had complimentary freshly baked cookies dropped off to us in the evening the room has been cleaned well and promptly every day and the tempur beds are wonderful  a little different at first but we love them Great bathroom amenities nice powerful shower comfy bath robes and a well stocked minibar For the money this hotel is a winner if you want to be downtown A 5 minute walk to soho and East village rooms are a good size for nyc standards we have a sitting area and 2 large suitcases and we can still move around easily and free wifi Love hotel on Rivington x

title: Chelsea Pines Inn great example for Hotels in NY
text: I have had the pleasure of meeting Jay Lesiger Owner Chelsea Pines this year Jay has an exceptional Hotel and team with great flow skills creativity and understanding of a how to give guests a very pleasant stay in NY Chelsea Pines Inn can and is an great example for Hotels in NY

title: Just the place to stay if you love excellent service
text:
Daily newsletter with recommendations excellent breakfast businesss center WIFI and printer tea and coffe and cookies 24 hours very friendly and helpfull staff
small but charming room ours facing the back and very quiet
great excercise if you live on the top floors

title: Fabulous Location
text: This hotel has the perfect location for taking in all of NYC sights from a walking distance Central Park is only two blocks away 5th Avenue shopping is around the corner Times Square the theater district garment district and numerous other tourist destinations are just a convenient walk away The hotel rooms are small but typical for NYC standards The rooms are suites with kitchenettes for convenient in room breakfasts and snacks Our room was always immaculately cleaned each day The staff at the front desk and concierge desk were helpful and friendly We were able to access wifi in our room We did not use the pool or fitness center but they appeared clean and easily accessible As in all NYC hotels in addition to the room fees we were met with an additional hospitality fee per night when we arrived This information had been emailed to me ahead of time but I still did not appreciate that this was a mandatory fee regardless of whether or not we used the hotels facilities business center pool gym etc All in all though I would definitely return and stay again

title: Comfortable hotel good location
text:
Stayed for 5 nights with my wife for our 3rd trip to NYC Decent location on corner of 50th and 3rd same avenue as Rockerfeller Plaza so a manageable walk to pretty much anywhere Uptown and decent subway links only a couple of blocks away 
Hotel pretty quiet apart from building works early on first morning from 7am for which the manager left a note under the door very apologetic and it didnt happen again
Good comfortable rooms very clean massive great bed Hotel lounge on 2nd floor is nice for relaxing but no bar which is a bit of a shame but PJClarkes on 55th and 3rd just up the road is highly recommended for drinks and food  try the blueberry crumble wow 
A friend recommended this to me after staying there and although not the cheapest I would definitely pass this on too

title: Great Hotel Wonderful staff
text:
I stayed here over Christmas while on my honeymoon I had mentioned the occasion on the booking form and there was a note delivered from the accommodation manger wishing us a lovely stay and some complementary strawberries following our arrival The room was fairly large and comfortable 
The hotel is well located close to most attractions and the California street cable car runs along outside the door 
The only negative is the cost of Valet parking is quite high 48 plus taxes per night ut otherwise its an excellent hotel
Dont forget to sign up to the Select guest program Its free and provides complementary Wifi and a CoffeeJuice each morning of your stay

title: Loved it
text:
This hotel was great I was in Seattle going through a personal crisis and the staff couldnt have been nicer 
I switched to the Vintage Park from another hotel which was TERRIBLE Hotel Max I felt like a wandering orphan and they took me in gave me a warm and luxurious room free ineternet and free booze They have a free wine reception every evening Great chance for those traveling alone to converse with others
I am extremely picky and this place did not disappoint
One small note The wireless internet in the hotel did not mesh with my computer It ended up knocking out my wireless ability This was remedied when I got home I think this may have been a problem with my computer rather than with the hotels system though Ive never experienced anything like it before thankfully

title: It was ok
text:
We picked this hotel because it was close to the theatre disctrict There was alot of construction going on in the streets so it was hard to find with the directions we had It was very noisy from the construction going on as well
We were put off that the only refrigerator that was in the room was the minibar one and couldnt be used We did order one up to the room and it was only 15 Although they ended up bringing up two so we had to send one back
The pub food was ok but they were out of almost everything when we went there around 10pm even though they serve food there until midnight
The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious although I felt the decor was a bit tacky and could use some updating
Nothing to really complain or rave aboutit was just ok

title: A lovely stay at the Roosevelt
text: Booked a last minute stay at The Roosevelt Hotel for a New Year weekend break and had a lovely experience in this hotel On arrival we were greeted by a very helpful receptionist who offered us a complimentary breakfast and drinks in the bar  a nice way to welcome us to the hotel The lobby was very festive and very inviting Our room a standard king was a good size and was clean and comfortable The Bath  Body Works toiletries were a nice addition The bar is very cosy and there was a lot of choice for breakfast Its in a great location near Grand Central Station Times Square and the Rockerfeller Center We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to others

title: Fantastic stay outstanding service
text: It is very rare to have a flawless hotel stay But the Omni Chicago did it with one minor exception We booked five nights and were contacted ahead of our stay by Mrs Avellana the Loyalty Ambassador She wanted to make sure that we have a pleasant stay and we did Gorgeous quiet and clean corner room with plenty of views The staff service was outstanding from checkin to departure High notes for housekeeping and room service We tried the restaurant several times and the food and service were outstanding  try the smoked salmon flatbread for a breakfast change the buffet is great too Location cannot be beaten The only thing to improve Wireless internet connection on floor 24 war bad to nonexistent we were never able to connect to the Omni router extremly weak signal and used our wireless broadband card instead without any problems vWell be back soon Thanks Mrs Avellana F Diederichs

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Had really enjoyable four night stay in this very clean and modern hotel A very short walk from all the attractions in the Seattle centre and well located for monorail to downtown Room was well equipped with microwave and popcorn fridge safe and plasma TV Afternoon coffee and cakes along with complimetary bicycles were a nice touch Extremely friendly and helpful staff Would definitely stay here again for any future visits to Seattle

title: second stay this year
text:
great breakfast never replaced spa door handle nor filled spa in Dec for over a week and extensive renovations and messes However I still highly recommend this hotel It is a great value and recently renovated I like the old fashioned option of a tub It is conveniently located near the airport and they send the shuttle and allow the shuttle to fetch you to and from the light rail or you can walk from it
so this is an inexpensive option to see Seattle even if it is far from downtown They might have fridges and microwaves available for little extra cost and they have enormous discounts on weekly stays
I also stayed there in May when there was no renovations
I will definitely stay there again as I have business conferences in the Double tree across the street
this hotel is very clean in general and suitable for anyone not requiring a four star or better hotel

title: Loved this hotel
text:
This was our first time travelling to New York I spent hours on Tripadvisor researching hotels I am so happy we chose this one Yes the rooms are small we travelled with our two teenage children and found it a little tight but it was extremely clean and I always prefer a newer hotel The location was perfect for us You could easily walk north toTimes Square Rockefeller Plaza and Central Park We also walked south to Soho Tribeca Little Italy and Chinatown If walking isnt your thing the subway is about a 2 minute walk on the corner of 28th and 7th Ave It was easy to take the subway north to Central Park and then down to Greenwich Village or further south to South Ferry
There are only 7 rooms on each floor ours was at the back of the building which didnt have much of a view however we didnt hear the chimes from the elevator which I believe the rooms on the front with the view of the Empire State building would listen to all night long I am not sure why in a hotel this size with two elevators they need the chimes
This street is all flower shops so walking to and from the hotel every morning and evening was wonderful The sidewalks are covered in beautiful flowers and shrubs and the scent was lovely
The breakfast was typical for a Fairfield Inn and there was no trouble finding something to please everyone 
The staff was fantastic especially Mia She was extremely helpful and always had a cheerful hello Each evening we would head up to the rooftop patio and enjoy the incredible view of the Empire State building We will definitely stay at this hotel again

title: Club floor Is the way to go
text: The room was beautiful and perfect in every way Especially enjoyed the club floor breakfast and cocktail hour Club room food selection had a wide variety and a very comfortable atmosphere

title: Great Place to StayClose to Mayo Clinic
text: We are staying at the Jameson Inn due to my husbands visits to Mayo Clinic The Jameson is only 9 miles away from the clinic The rooms are clean and inviting The staff is very friendly and accomodating They offer a wonderful continental breadfast including biscuits  gravy We have even stayed in the spacious and emmaculate handicap room Great value also for the Jacksonville area You need to stay here as it is close to several eating establishments to accomodate most tastes close to 95 and direct route to the beach also

title: Wonderful time at the Seton Hotel NYC
text: Not sure where to begin REALLY The location is nothing short of AMAZING The staff makes it EVEN BETTER The facility is spotless and fresh I had a group with five rooms EVERYONE WAS ECSTATIC Every request and we are a demanding lot was met with PROMPT PERSONAL SERVICE The place is 5 stars at a 2 star price Cant say enough about this WONDERFULLY UNDERSTATED ELEGANT HOMEAWAYFROMHOME Thanks to everyone at the SETON to making me look good to all my traveling friends before our cruise

title: Classy Dame
text:
Spent 6 nights with my family magic started with the bellman Caesar who belongs to a bygone era in style and class Regaled us with helpful tips and ever willing to assist Were upgreded to penthouse level without asking another reason to remain a Club Carlson member
Breakfast was excellent with top line pastries Position is unbeatable with most sites within walking distance and the underground being accessible outside the hotel for further travel 
Will surely use this hotel again in the future when travelling to the Big Apple
PNaidoo

title: Fish Palace
text:
Hotel was cheap so didnt expect much It was clean and basic but slightly further out that I would have liked
Main problem was that after the room had been cleaned each day the bathroom absolutely stank of fish I have no idea what they cleaned it with but the smell was very bad as there were no bathroom windows and only a small window in the bedroom it was a case of having to get used to it

title: Updated well kind of suites in fantastic neighborhood and location
text:
The River Inn is a pretty recently updated hotel in the adorable quiet neighborhood of Foggy Bottom just 25 blocks to the Metro Foggy BottomGWU on the BlueOrange Line I stayed with two other people for three nights in a nicesized Corporate Suite which includes a queen bed sofabed desk flatscreen TV kitchenette and dressing area outside the bathroom
At first glance the room is very very nice and brandnew as the photos on their Web site would have you expect The furniture made the room look very modern The dressing room had a large mirror and marble counter  this space really let us spread out When you start looking around through three things give away the age of the building the kitchenette the bathroom and the curtains The kitchenette was everything we needed for a quick stay but the appliances were pretty old Same for the bathroom  the glass shelf along the mirror made everything look modern and polished but the fixtures just dated the place The tiles in the shower needed a good cleaning The towel bar was the kind with porcelain holder on either side of a plastic foursided rod My sister who was traveling with me and I agreed that it reminded us of the bathroom in our grandmothers house that was built in the 1950s The rooms curtains were tattered and frayed with holes in them
Overall the room was very clean and comfortable and a great value under 200 a night But just a few little updates could really take the room to the next level

title: Great location
text:
We stayed at TheWit over labor day weekend for a wedding  so do note that we paid a group rate which is whoknowshowmuchless than a normal rate 
The location of this hotel is superb Really easy to get everywhere L stations nearby you can walk practically anywhere The service was also quite good  we arrived super early around 1030am expecting to be told we needed to just leave our bags and check in later Nope got checked right in given delicious cookies and brought up to our room The room was great  comfy bed everything you need The only thing lacking was a fanvent in the bathroom so it got quite steamy when you showered The concierge was also very helpful  gave us quick and easy directions to Wrigley Field 
For anyone doing their wedding here thought Id briefly mention my experience with this hotel as a guest at the wedding We were told that the wedding cocktail hour would be on the roof  and based on the website that seemed really exciting Unfortunately it was only a partial section of the roof and it was indoors which I thought was somewhat disappointing It was also much too loud and too crowded The rest of the wedding  ceremony and reception in one of the ballrooms  was great we had a blast 
The crowds going up to the Roof in the evenings were a bit of a turnoff Really sceney and totally not where Id want to hang out But you only really interact with them in the lobby and potentially the elevator I just ignored them and was fine We specifically asked for a floor away from the roof  we preferred to risk train noise of which we heard nothing to barparty noise Id definitely stay here again Its hip great location good amenities and great service

title: Great hotel option near Seatac
text: I had heard that Cedarbrook was an oasis near Seatac and finally gave it a shot myself I was pleased to find everything I heard was correct My daughter had an early morning flight There was confusion about the charge for parking but the front desk made that right The room was comfortable and the living room conceptsnacks in each wing of the complex is a great idea The early morning shuttle was on time the to go box breakfast for my daughter was waiting as promised My wife and I enjoyed the free breakfast and the surroundings before departure The lodge feels more like a mountain retreat than an airport hotel I will certainly stay again when I have an early morning flight out of Seatac

title: Stay WELL clear of this hotel
text:
My colleague and I arrived on the 26th October having flown in from the UK We asked where the restaurant was and were told we do not have a restaurant we had to close it down and refurbish the whole kitchen so tired and hungry we asked where we could get a quick meal and were told  I dont know Im not from these parts 
Our first rooms were dirty my sofa was clearly broken and my colleagues room smelt of mould So we changed our rooms and were given a junior suite at no extra charge We were assured breakfast would be a a range of cereals and pastries  plus coffee etc  I woke up at 3 am in the morning to hear my neighbour chatting on his phone as the walls were paper thin and the room again smelt so badly of mould that I was wheezingso I changed again 
Later my colleague and I went down for breakfast only to discover that breakfast was a muffin nothing else We asked for a drink of water and were told we do not have water On asking the staff to show us the gym one smiled and said well thats a kind of a jokehe was rightneedless to say we checked out and moved to the Hyatt 
This hotel we were informed on arrival had just gone through a bankruptcy and was being refurbished my advice would be to knock it down and start afreshDO NOT BELIEVE THE PICTURES ON ANY OF THE WEBSITES RE THIS HOTELTHEY ARE EXTREMELY MISLEADING

title: Fabulous location
text:
Excellent location a block away from the Magnificent Mile Restaurants everywhere
The hotel even provides breakfast and dinner MTH The food was good they even served beer and wine Friendly dining room staff
Very helpful staff the bellman have a wealth of knowledge on where to eat and what to see
The rooms are clean and large with a fully equiped kitchen Trader Joes and Jewel market close by
I will definitely return to this hotel

title: Mutton dressed as Lamb look but DONT STAY
text:
Our stay was at the end of a five month tour round the world and we felt this was a safe hotel to book as this is THE Waldorf Astoria and having good experiences with the brand elsewhere we thought we would finish here in New York 
We were wrong 
I can only retell our experience here but I spoke with other guests and heard many similar stories I can only presume that good reviews for this hotel are from those who did not stay here or who have never stayed at a good hotel
The first room was old tired and not clean It actually had broken glass on the floor of the bathroom we couldnt believe it We went back to reception and were assured an upgrade in light of this so we went to a smaller room with a smaller bed This was unacceptable so we went back to reception again This time we were given a large suite of two room size and were then informed that there was no water on our floor due to maintenance actually we were told it was the whole of midtown without water even though the water was working elsewhere in the hotelI must say we were offered compensation for no water a voucher for their own spa at a value that meant you had to spend more unreal
So finally three hours later we got a room that was clean and didnt have wallpaper peeling off the walls no joke the second room had broken lamps and peeling paper
We stayed here for four nights paid in advance wont do that again and by the end of the stay we had TV problems bad housekeeping curtain issues blinds stopped working and met with several managers
These managers did try to compensate us for our problems however at no point did this really work the rooms were all bad that we were moved to the offer of a car to the staten island ferry one evening resulted in us being threatened with being stranded there by the driver and the complimentary meal that we had at the Bear and Bull I think thats the name was mediocre to say the least Had I had to pay for that meal there I would have been very angry at the state of the food for the cost
This is a tired old hotel that according to two managers we spoke with hasnt really got any perfect rooms as they all need a little something no joke we even met with the building maintenance manger
Please visit this hotel see the ballrooms see the lobby this is great but dont stay here No free wifi no coffee or tea makers in the rooms and massive prices for a really run down hotel Coffee from room service was 8 plus a 525 per person charge plus a 15 gratuity plus state tax A 15 dollar coffee is acceptable on a desert island 20 room boutique hotel but from a run down motel it is not 
This hotel is mutton dressing as lamb I am a hilton Gold Member and can not recommend this hotel even though I love the brand This should be their flagship hotel and in fact I have to say it was the worst Hilton we stayed in
I can only hope others do not make the same mistake as us it was a real shame to have our travels finish with what should have been a glamourous great experience at one of the worlds most famous hotels and instead it just never came out that way

title: Large rooms comfortable hotel great staff
text: My family was traveling for a graduation and decided to stay at The Kimberly because of the location I was surprised when I walked into the room because the suite we had was much bigger than any NYC hotel room Ive stayed in We had a bedroom with 2 beds a living room with a pullout couch a kitchenette and a bathroom not to mention a small balcony and multiple closets The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean and quiet I love that they use Neutrogena products in the hotel The staff was super friendly and provided multiple recommendations for restaurants over the 3 days we were there The rooftop bar is adorable with great views of the city Will definitely come back here

title: Cold at night
text:
I stayed in this hotel several times over the past 15 years the last time was around 8 years ago This time I stayed there 3 nights The location is decent especially for Union Square Chinatown and North Beach sightseeing but other than dim sum theres really no place that Im aware of at least to get a reasonably priced quick hot breakfast nearby anymore since the McDonalds that was 2 blocks away closed
Be aware that the lowest priced rooms for one person are VERY small which doesnt really bother me since I spend little time in the room  the large bathroom and the actual hotel room are almost the same size The hotel is decent overall and the room I had was clean I dont recall ever having a problem with the rooms not being clean at this hotel
The rooms get very cold at night I had what was the end of a cold when I arrived on a Saturday night and when I called the front desk after waking up freezing and coughing to ask about the heat I was just offered an extra blanket instead of a space heater like I should have been offered and was told the heat would come on in around 2 hours it never did I then spent another night with no heat and the day before I left I asked someone else at the front desk about the heat and was told that the heat was not on at all in October and I could get a space heater instead
I finally got the space heater on the 3rd night the night before I went home after freezing for 2 nights I told the front desk about this when I left and just got a sorry about that for a response I was then told again by the man at the front desk that they had central heat in the hotel and it should have been working after being told the day before that there was no heat at all in the hotel in October They should get their story straight and also train the staff to respond to problems like this in a more acceptable manner
Also definitely bring earplugs if you get a room facing the inner courtyard of the building because you never know how much noise there will be loud talking TV noise etc
After this last experience I doubt Ill ever stay there again despite the cheap rates

title: good base for fun in NYC
text: Cool and funky contemporary decor modern rooms well located around the corner from Central Park and close to the subway Hudson is a good base for a trip to the Big Apple Rooms were on the small but adequate side altho my colleague complained and was moved to a bigger quieter room without any fuss Also the Hudson Bar doubles as one of Manhattens popular evening hangouts and you can walk straight past the folks queing up to get in Id go back again

title: Hotel Pennsylvania in the centre of New York
text:
I am honestthis hotel is not the very best where I have ever been to but youre in the middle of the centre of NY and the beds are clean and ok the shower is good and the rooms are cleanand the price is very reasonable So when I ever go back to NY I will surely consider to book this hotel again
I had the time of my life in NY and lets be honestyou only make use of your hotelroom at night
So if youre an easy person and and little demanding than this hotel is a must
For those who intend to go to NY have fun in this vibrant city that never sleeps
Greeting
Nicole
Amsterdam The Netherlands

title: Great location great hotel
text:
When booking this we had mixed ideas as to what to expect on our arrival but we were pleasantly suprised
The check in desk staff were very helpful and friendly and offered us many maps of the area and also some good places for breakfast and dinnermaxis cafe for breakfast was one of their best recommendations 
The rooms were very spacious had a good sized double bed tv good sized bathroom and a good sized wardrobe area with an iron and ironing boardi hate calling to reception and waiting hours for them to bring irons so this was a bonus
There is a also a nice bar area which from memory is on the 1st or 2nd floor
The hotel was in a good location not too far from Bart stations and Union Square 
Overall we were very pleased we booked this hotel and would stay here again

title: Hotel with character
text: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of days for sightseeing and it was a great location The hotel has plenty of character and history the lobby is gorgeous The rooms are a bit small and my bathroom was very small but I guess this is the price you pay for a hotel with plenty of character in a great location

title: Excellent hotel and great service
text: This was my first trip to Houston and I can say that I was treated first class by the staff at the hilton garden inn The hotel itself is in a good location and has all the facilities you require for a business or pleasure trip to Houston The staff in the hotel were exceptional The shuttle service provided free of charge by the hotel was also a major plus point I will be returning to this hotel on my next visit to houston

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
We stayed at the Sofitel for a quick anniversary getaway in Manhattan  I picked it based on its excellent reviews on this site and couldnt have been more pleased The service was amazing  we checked in early got upgraded to a suite when they didnt have a room on the upper floors which I had reserved online and received a complimentary bottle of champagne with a handwritten note congratulating us on our anniversary I recommend mentioning this in the comments section when making the reservation 
The bed was very comfortable with luxurious linens very similar to the Westin Heavenly Bed and the bathroom was beautiful as well The suite was spacious we did see the standard sized room as well and it was reasonably sized The room was well soundproofed
I had looked at many of the other luxury hotels in Manhattan  I cant imagine how they could have been any nicer than the Sofitel which was priced more reasonably I would definitely stay there again and would consider staying at its other resort locations in the future

title: Very good choice
text: Stayed here for family trip Hotel is close to Rockfeller Center Times Square maybe 10 minute walk St Patricks Cathedral and Central Park Very good location from which to explore the sights of the city Rooms were very clean and functional Stayed around 11th floor so some street noice but not bad is NYC after all Hotel suited us perfectly and would stay again anytime Great stay no complaints at all

title: very reasonable
text:
Firstlylet me say while this motel is definitely not a luxury hotel but you pretty much get what you pay forThe price was very reasonable since i had done a lot of research before booking this one had the best price for the location which is really greatIt really is 10 mins from walk of fame and universal studios tickets are given at a discount price for 2 days cheaper than 1 day at the studios 
The front desk staff was actually very polite and competent and helped us with directions and booking shuttles for disneyland as wellWe had no problems with the service in fact since I had read previous reviews regarding bad customer service i has happily surprisedmaybe they did change their staff
The pool was not heated but the Spa was great and our kids made ample use of that tooThe coffe shop was ok nothing to rave about but since so many restaurants are so close by it didnt matter but we had breakfast everyday which was alrightit seemed like they were renovating the coffeeshop as we saw new carpets and wallpapers done during out stay 
The staff informed us on check in that all rooms do have wireless internet so that was a welcome addition as when we had called prior to booking they had told us they only had internet connection in the lobby
The rooms were good sized and had microwave and mini fridges also with coffeemakers and hairdryers which was a definite plus for a family of 5The room was nothing fancy but very clean which is the only thing my girls were concerned withno bed bugsThe housekeeping staff was very prompt with requests for more towels and extra amenities 
The only problem was parking issues which was a challenge every single evening esp with a big Suv but indeed it was free so cant complain too muchAlso the open walkways were little intimidating what with young girls and family but turned out not to be any issue after all thankfully
I must say this is the most positive review on this site and Im thankful that we didnt change our plans due to bad feedback as we really did get value for moneyOur only suggestion would be to have a shuttle for local areas and if possible free continental breakfast which is important for budget travellers and pretty standard for all best westerns
In short stick with national chains if you want to be sure of the standards you will get

title: Ill be back
text: The rooms are SMALL which is normal in the city The room was clean and the shower was great Next time I need to stay in the city Ill be back to the Astor

title: This hotel flatters to decieve
text: We stayed in the empire hotel on the 29th and 30 th of August for the final two nights of our honeymoonHaving stayed in New York many times before we were well aware that hotel rooms are tight but the rooms in the Empire are like a coffin with you Tripping over each other if you dare move with getting ready to go out requiring military planningin sufficient air conditioning in the room leaving you waking from your sleep with sweat dripping off you and gasping for airIF you think the room is small then wait till you experience the bathroom it resembles a cubicle in a pubOUr room 1010 was located beside the elevator and the constant singing of the elevator would drive you mad room service knocking on doors from 800am this hotel was a totally disappointing experience and flatters to deceive

title: Hotel lobby and restaurant renovations are fantastic
text: I was pleasently surprised to find the Renaissance Dallas Hotel finished out in such a beautiful manner The new restaurant and menu with smoked items and new wines was excellent I would highly recommend this hotel to friendsfamily and other business travelers

title: Hotel nice but AmEx CC was compromised here
text:
This was our 2nd stay at this hotel within the past year The room was nicely appointed bed was comfortable and ac worked reasonably well We STILL did not like the fact that the only covers for the bed included a regular sheet and a HEAVY downfilled comforter The comforter was nice but in Texas in the Summer when its HOTTER than you know what it would be nice to have a lightweight blanket to use or just the thin sheet The blankets are so heavy you absolutely burn up under them even with the ac cranked up on high I complained about this on our last stay but nothing has changed 
I can say that the entire hotel is extremely clean and smells great Everyone you see on staff is extremely friendly they hold the doors open for you greet you upon arrival and departure so its a very nice touch The lobby is elegantly decorated and this trip the elevator seems to have been adjusted because it was not so unusually slow
The only negative thing I have to contribute is to beware of using your credit card The only place we used our AmEx card was at the front desk for incidentals which we had none and anticipated none and at the lobby coffee shop for morning coffee Almost immediately after we got home a fraudulent order was placed at walmartcom with my AmexCard There is no other place the card was out of my hand so there is no other explanation for where it got compromised than at this hotel I called the manager and he said they have little to no turnover  yet the person who checked us in was a newbie in training He said he would investigate but until I get the additional info from Walmart as to where the IP address is that the order was placed and the ship to address I cant prove anything Once I get that hopefully law enforcement will do something although I doubt it Its almost an acceptable crime these days Its still not acceptable for me Next trip well probably stay elsewhere and I will no longer provide my AmerExp card for incidentals on my other c cards Ive scratched off the 3 did CIC code for just such security

title: Amazing Service  Great Property
text: We had a great time in Denver  New Years Eve was a treat and the staff was exceptional They are all very guest focused and the fellas behind the omlete station were gettin it done

title: No problems with the Edison
text:
A friend and I stayed at the Edison for seven great nights in March 2007
Yes the room and bathroom were rather small but they were clean and well serviced every day
The location of the hotel simply cannot be beaten Minutes from Times Square Restaurant Row and all the great shopping of Midtown
Cafe Edison downstairs is a great place for breakfast at very reasonable prices
This hotel has a lot of charm but could do with some updating
This was my second time in New York and my first time at the Edison I will definitely stay there again

title: NYC kept secret  this was fantastic
text:
We arrived at the hotel after a long flight and many delays due to weather and were greeted with a warm friendly face We got up to the room and realised that we had the wrong suitecase  we rang down and Matt at the front desk was nothing but helpful
This was the start to a fantastic stay at the Distrikt Hotel NYC Great location next to the Port authority bus depot and right near the metro line which runs trains ACE  you can walk almost anywhere from this location
Roomservice was discreet and left the room in clean and neat the bar  cafe downstairs  such friendly service and GREAT food  it was like eatting at home as we missed our Aussie home cooked food this was terrific
Only negative about the hotel is that we ordered roomservice on our first night and last day for breaky and both times the meals came up luke warm This could be improved
Overall the entire team go out of their way to make a great stay and are very helpful

title: Greatly Improved
text:
I visited the Hilton a little over a year ago and vowed never to return However since its one of the if not the major convention spaces in town I found myself booking another trip there for the weekend of July 16th This time though the Hilton was greatly improved
Last time I reviewed I was unhappy with the cleanliness of my room the temperature control it never got below 78 degrees or so in our room and the location
This time I already had an idea of what to expect I prefer to be a little further north so walking is easier to get to a lot of the things I like to do in Chicago but this time I knew what to expect Just remember that while the map doesnt seem to show it its a bit of a hike to get up to the river and beyond that But hey its good exercise and to be fair a lot of buses DO run up that way Theres the train too which is a few blocks walk to get to I wouldnt say getting public transportation from the Hilton is a cinch but you dont have to go too far out of your way to find a bus or train
The temperature of the hotel in general including conferences spaces is still a problem in the warm months Its extremely humid and sticky and never really refreshing and cold However our room had an updated digital thermostat didnt have that last time and I was able to keep it around 72 degrees which was fine I dont know if theyre working on overhauling the cooling system for the entire hotel or if just the rooms got redone but I will say that the public spaces in the hotel were pretty uncomfortable
The room was spotless and wellappointed We had superb service the entire time from every employee we encountered and enjoyed our visit overall I cant bump my review to 5 stars but maybe next time

title: The Absolute Worst
text:
In terms of the cleanliness smokiness  shifty characters hanging around and remote location from the airport this is all true And it does not surprise me that folks have had credit card issues with this hotel Here is our experience
We checked in for a 3 day stay We ended up checking out a day early because this hotel apparently uses their facility as a Park and Ride We came back at 10 am on a Sunday from breakfast and there was absoutely no parking spots in the lot or underground We checked out at that point
30 days later we are checking our credit card statement and there was a 353 extra charge from the hotel  We called and were informed that we stole computer equipment from our room We were dumbfounded They said they had proof The manager told my wife nobody was in the room for 4 days and then the computer equipment a wireless router he said was discovered missing when the next people checked in And he said that we stole the router and he charged our credit card can you spell fuming mad at this point
We called the Tukwila Police Dept and no police report was filed about any theft We contacted our credit card company and they put the courtesy credit on until situation was resolved We called Ramada corporate and filed a complaint We called our relocation company I was being transfered to Seattle for my job We called American Express who made the reservation for us We called my employer where I have worked for 30 years 
A week later my wife got a call from the manager with a tepid apology saying in fact it was the people who stayed the night after us who stole the wireless router Of course he forgot that originally he told us that nobody stayed in the room for 4 days and then they discovered it He said our credit card was being credited and the next day the credit showed up My wife coldly told him that he called us thieves and he should be ashamed of his conduct 
In 30 years of corporate and leisure travel we have never had such a horrible experience at a hotel I think the guy thought we were out of towners and perhaps we would not review our credit card statement I did not read any of the comments prior to mine until after this expereince was concluded My employer says that they will make sure that no other of the 30000 employees of my company ever will stay at this hotel BTW we have yet to hear back anything from Ramada corporate Shameful

title: Good value for money
text: Location is not ideal but hotel is quite good The staff is friendly and helpful rooms are big and comfortable Like all other Sheraton hotels you can get free internet in the lobby at excellent speed Hotel has been renovated abt 2 yrs ago and is amazingly well maintained Will stay there again

title: Quiet and very relaxing
text: Even though we were in such close proximity to the airport and our room faced the airport I never heard any planes while in the room The best way to describe this stay was functional The room was fine except for the fruit flies that were present when we got there and remained for our entire 3night stay They werent harmful just annoying Desk staff was lukewarm but OK The did make it clear to us that they knew we booked through a vendor and not through them not sure what was up with that Housekeeping was OK but probably the reason the fruit flies existed We had each brought a glass of wine back to the room to enjoy When finished we rinsed them and left them to be collected the next day Housekeeping did not remove them The next night the same thing and again they were not removed By the time we checked out we had quite a set of glasses on the settee Ive not experienced that before We didnt complain and actually found it a source of humor Paying 17 per night to park was frustrating Especially when we had to pay up front and the gate was open half the time to any and all who wanted to park there for free Allinall Id go back but only if the price was right There are a lot of hotels to choose from in the area so I wouldnt go out of my way to find it again

title: Newer isnt always better
text: Have stayed at the Shelburne dozens of times over the past 20 years but this was my first visit since the total renovation and rebranding Overall the updating has improved the look but reduced the value and the functionality of the rooms On the plus side the hotel has become downright stylish with modern attractive decor improved lighting welcoming public areas and a vibe that is much hipper and far less like staying at your grandmothers But a lot has been sacrificed to trendiness Whereas the hotel previously had kitchens in all rooms there is now only a pantry in the the deluxe rooms with just a microwave and minifridge No more fullsize fridge oven stovetop coffemaker dishes or dishwasher Likewise dining tables have been removed TVs are now flatscreen but not HD Wireless internet expensive 1395day and glacially slow Bathrooms are totally redone with improved lighting and fixtures but far less counter space medicine cabinets removed and threeway mirrors gone and the trendy soapdish in the shower doesnt hold the trendy soap they provide And the only previous bathroom shortcoming did not get resolvedcommodes in many of the rooms have so little space that you practically need to remove your left leg in order to achieve a seated position And finally the fitness center has moved from the basement to the second floor but has become smaller and the saunas have been eliminated All in all its still a good hotel in a great location but the renovation is not necessarily an improvement

title: OK its not the best hotel in DC but
text:
We booked a long weekend for leisure I was concerned over the poor reviews Harrington had on TripAdvisor My husband had stayed there over 10 years ago and said it was nice so I figured if he liked it it couldnt be too bad 
We chose this hotel because we came to DC via Union Station and could take the Metro to within one block We were only steps away from the Mall and could walk just about everywhere and we did
We arrived at 1030 am and our room was ready so we checked in We were in the new wing built between 1917  1918 We booked a standard King Our room was small but clean and comfortable A small TV microwave refrigerator and hot pot were in a corner of the room The bathroom had clearly been renovated but had some cracks in the tile and water damage by the window Back in 1918 there werent any showers so they had to put the shower head in an odd place when renovating 
The staff was very helpful and very very nice There was Harrys Restaurant and Harrietts restaurant We had breakfast in Harrietts 1200 buffet includes juice and coffeee and it was good We ate a Harrys and the sandwiches and hamburgers are huge and tasty
Why did I rate the Harrington as poor overall but gave each category a better rating Because for the price we paid in any other city I would have expected a 3 or 4 star hotel This is DC and you pay for location even in a lesser hotel You are close to everything a tourist would want to see ieFords theatre was a block or two away Keep an open mind and enjoy the age the hotel has to offer but if you are very particular choose another venue

title: Staff is very accomodating
text: This is a very nice hotel Do not hesitate to stay here It is a little distance from Beale Street and Graceland about 20  25 minutes but well worth it The hotel is set back from the street and is located close to Germantown There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby and the highway TN355 is very close There is a free breakfast and the staff is wonderful Miss Betty will take care of any of your needs

title: Loved it great hotel
text:
Just back from 3 nights at AFFINIA CHICAGO 15th nov  18th nov 07
What a GREAT Hotel didnt think our room would be anything like we got  I actually thought we were upgraded but i was told that was just a standard room  We had a Bedroom  a Sitting room which were both very spacious had a sofa bed also  a lovely bathroom of a nice size i really cant complain about anythin in the room
I read before i travelled that the hotel was under construction but it never bothered me one bit  i dont even think i seen a construction worker on my stay
They dont have a bar or restaurant at the hotel at the moment but they offer complimentry water and snacks at reception and theres also menus in the hotel rooms from alot of restaurants in the area that deliver food direct to ur door so that came in handy for us
The location of the hotel is great too a couple of steps to all the shops
The staff at the hotel cant do enough for u either there so helpful  the bell hops are so friendly 
Overall i had a fab stay at AFFINIA and would definetly recommend it to anyone
Chicago is great
Louanne ireland

title: Would have been a 5 but they dont have AC if its cool outside
text:
Nice location Tiny parking garage for free in the back Walking distance to yummy restaurants They either have heat or AC on at one time in the hotel So if you like to sleep cool but it is cool outside they put the heat on
Their reaction Open the windows LOL What an adventure
Tip Book from the hotel directly and you will save Its a safe area for kids families or people traveling alone The metro is across a couple of streets

title: Small rooms well located
text: I had high hopes for a fairly deluxe experience as my work travel service managed to source a room for US530 per night Unfortunately that turned out to be misguided as the smallish room turned out to be the usual bland American chain fare With a very low ceiling which may have been comforting for a hobbit it made me feel slightly claustrophobic Ditto the bathroom On the plus side the staff were friendly and happy to help and the downtown location is great Some other guests told me they were paying US200 per night on an internet deal which I think is about right

title: Left us holding our bags
text:
Not a good start to our stay when the Hilton shuttle bus left us standing outside the airport in the heat for 55 minutes We had to call from the airport 2 times before someone finally came out to pick us up We stood there watching the Sheraton shuttle bus go by THREE rotations during our wait When the driver finally arrived he was friendly but also mentioned that it was pretty common for guests to be left for at least 20 minutes Considering they are the only hotel on airport grounds this is inexcusable
When we finally arrived at the front desk I told the clerk about our long wait and she seemed so unconcerned and never even hinted at an apology
We asked this same clerk for directions to our AA departure flight the next morning and she said to just cross the street to the right of the hotel Turns out this was in the airport parking garage We found out later that we had to take another Hilton shuttle for quite a distance around the airport
The room was nice and the bedding comfortable but the bathroom was well below what we expected from a Hilton 
We figured after a long international flight it would be nice to take a dip in the hotels pool We figured wrong after finding out the charge was 600 EACH for a swim We should have guessed after seeing the sign in our room saying welcome your first pot of coffee is on us if you require additional coffee there will be a charge of 495 per pot
If you like being nickled and dimed to death along with poor service after spending a large amount on a room this is the place for you

title: City of Blinding lights
text: The New Yorker Hotel is in a great location just opposite Madison Square Gardens and a small stroll away from Macys and the Empire State Building There are 3 subways near by A 10 minute walk from Times Square It was our anniversary and the hotel kindly put us in a room with a view of the Empire State fantastic The room was clean and the lobby looked great with its marble bell hops and art decco security was tight which was reassuring although I never felt threatened once in the City We used the Tick Tock diner once which was a little disappointing compared to others we ate at although it was always full and busy The Bar was ok but very expensive 9 dollars for a glass of wine The hotel met my expectations and I would use again I was a little miffed by the long queues to check in and the reception staff looked a little fed up and were short tempered at times however elsewhere the staff were helpful especially the cleaners who we tipped everyday

title: Good hotel near China town
text:
I stayed here while attending some ceremonies in DC in May The hotel is very nice and the best that I have stayed in while in Washington DC I have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn and another Marriott property in the past The rooms were clean and large The bathroom was a little tight but oh well
I really liked the location very near China town basically in China town The metro is very close by and very walkable I agree with other reviews that the hotel has some of the best beds I have ever slept on I even called the housekeeping staff to find out the brand Apparently the brand is only sold to hotels and not available for purchase by private citizens at least under the same model number
