I didnt eat here There was a Starbucks in the hotel and a nice bar Try the District Chophouse nearby They have great steaks and its a microbrewery with good beer For late night Chinese check out Big Wongs Its in the basement and a little seedy but had the best General Tsos Chicken Ive ever had
The parking was expensive Im not sure there is a way to avoid this

title: Swankier than the nearby Hyatt Century Plaza
text:
After a disappointing experience at the InterContinental Hotel in San Francisco not the Mark Hopkins  the newer one it was a relief to experience a much higher level of hospitality at this hotel Service is very warm and solicitous I was never made to feel like I was a burden when making any request and in general everyone seemed to be at the top of their game
The rooms are very large and the one I was given had a huge balcony including 2 lounge chairs and two regular chairs with a 270degree view of the Los Angeles skyline as well as two flatpanel TVs The bathroom was also large with both a shower and a tub and the vanity in a separate room In general this hotel feels a lot more exclusive and fancy than the nearby Century Plaza Hyatt Regency which has much more of a tourgroup and conventionconference feel to it At the same time the IC Hotel is not quite as centrally located as the Hyatt  it is about a 10minute walk farther from the Westfield mall and most of the big office buildings except for Fox Plaza including the office that I frequent
The last time I stayed here 4 years ago this hotel was a Park Hyatt It seems that not much has been changed which is actually fine The furnishings are still holding up although I can see that a renovation may be needed in another 45 years The gym is exactly the same as it was in the Park Hyatt days same equipment even So far it is still working
When I need to be near the office I will stay at the Hyatt but when I can afford to be a bit farther away this is where I intend to return

title: Probably nicer choices close by
text:
Stayed here to attend a training that was in close proximity to the hotel Im not that familiar wtih Austin but it was near the training center and all the comments on tripadvisor about the proximity and view of the lake were appealing 
The rooms were clean but the property could use updating The garage is attached to the lake tower but my room was in the other tower so you have to go down to the lobby from the garage and across the restaurants shops and lobby to another set of elevators Also the fitness center is in the lake tower also so maybe I wouldve liked being in that tower better The lake tower also must have the lake views because my view was of the parking garage 
The folks who have mentioned the noise from I35 arent joking It is loud and constant all night Now that Ive seen the area I have spotted a few places that are close by that look newer and a little nicer

title: Great weekend with my daugther however
text:
My daughter planned a trip for us in April 2012 The hotel Helis was Hip and fun we both enjoyed vipe I really has a change to see DC loved it however I am going to say lost one of my favorite rings which had a lot of meaning for me I know one of the cleaner has to take it 
Because I remember  i said to my daughter Oh no my ring is on the night stand let me go back and get it  she said to me Ma dont worry they dont steal her  well what do you know we can back for our day in DC and the dang ring was gone  a lessoned learned for me  but I still miss that dang ring

title: What a disappointment
text: I have been wanting to stay here for the last 10 years and what a let down We are relocating to Columbus and my company put me up here so I didnt even pay for it and complained for their money First my SO and I are both tall I am 59 and he is 62 Why they put us in an ADA room with a short shower is beyond me Then the shower was dirty complete with someones sliver of soap The sheets are not high quality as you would expect in this hotel Parking is a nightmare for guests You either pay the 10 for valet or be prepared to hoof it to one of of the mall garages with your stuff The Internet is 10 a day Upon check in you are asked to sign an agreement saying you will pay 100 fee if you cuy your stay short  Ive traveled all over the world and have never encountered this They clearly know this hotel is not worth the price Ive stayed on the other end of the strip at the Courtyard and would go back there in a second The atmosphere is pretty though When I complained to the from desk gal regarding all these issues all I got was a bunch of blinking eyes and continued Im sorry Hardly makes up for 400 of wasted money

title: Location made up for the downsides
text: Late update as Im catching up  stayed there in June and Nov of 2008 Wanted to go to the Helmsley Palace on the second journey but couldnt get in The reviews are all pretty accurate I was there on a business trip and took along my partner too for a short break in June I came alone on bizz in Nov As another person said I have stayed in numerous Leading Hotels of the World in but this hotel falls behind in overall quality not so much the servicebut in general the old girl is just looking and feeling a bit tired  The room we had was an ordinary roomit did the jobbut thats about it there was nothing wrong with it well decoration was pretty old and dire  but then again there was nothing to shout from the hill tops about  The dining room on the 2nd floor is one of the most pleasant of places to have breakfast for sure As most of the people have said location for guests is the one thing that saves this hotel For visitors to the Big Apple its the best place to start from My partner loved it she was a stones throw from 5th AveCentral park right in front  my office 3 blocks awayso everything for her was within easy distance For a personal break I would go to another hoteljust to be able to have a few more modconsbut as I invariably go there on business and Im tied to a handful of hotels and the Helmsley group will get my custom again

title: My new favorite for family trips to NYC
text:
This is a nice quiet upper east side place with large rooms that is only a few blocks walk to the Museum of Natural History Across the street is a great Fairway market grocery store with excellent prepared foods and desserts Better than Whole Foods says my spouse It was a business trip for me and the family came along for the ride to enjoy the city Beacon worked out perfectly Theres a Starbucks right next to the hotel The red line 1 2 metro is a few block south and there are tons of restaurants nearby Surprisingly we took a cab from the hotel to a Yankee game on a Thursday night and it was clear sailing hardly any traffic on the way there
The hotel is right next to the Beacon Theatre which hosts smaller shows Steely Dan in September There didnt appear to be anything going on the 4 nights we were there so if shows at the theatre become an inconvenience to hotel guests my guess is not

title: Service Service Service wowand amazing boutique hotel
text: Total value and modern hotelgreat great servicea must if in San Diego

title: Good value and location
text:
The Midtown is a fairly basic spartan hotel but ultimately it is good value for money For the price paid compared to what others are charging you get a clean reasonably sized room and best of all you are in a great location close to the heart of Boston So value for money is very good
As mentioned the hotel itself is pretty spartan with limited amenities I found the service to be OK although not outstanding And the room I was in was fine  reasonably spacious and clean with everything I needed Not outstanding but not terrible either 
The best part of the hotel is where it is located Close to the subway close to the city and close to most of the major attractions You wont be disappointed with this aspect of things

title: Perfect location friendly staff historic and worth the money
text: Despite several dodgy reviews on trip advisor our experience was amazing Yes the systems went down at check in meaning we had to wait a while but the staff went out of their way to help and in the end we scored the best room in the hotel so no wonder were happy Our room had recently been renovated and was on the 10th floor Not quite what I expected as parquet floors chrome fridge modern kitchen and bathroom flat screen TV The stairwells are full of amazing art cool characters hanging around in every corner If you are looking for bell boys room service gym etcthis is not the place for you however if you want history cool characters SPACE compared to the other hotel wed been in this is like a palace and charmhighly recommend staying here Cant believe expedia have down graded it to a two star Not in our experience Dont go to the ribs place a couple of doors down though Got a slight touch of food poisoning Great little gay bar a few doors up on the left friendly to those who are not gay as well

title: Great boutique hotel in the perfect location
text: If you are looking for a unique place to stay in SF this is definitely the place to go My fiance and I stayed here for the weekend to celebrate his birthday and we couldnt have asked for more special attention I contacted the hotel manager Wes a few weeks before to arrange a few surprises for my fiance They took care of every detail which helped to make it his best birthday ever The location of the hotel is great too You are right in the middle of everything Parking was easy and we were right next to the cable car stop Forget about staying at nearby chain hotels the Chancellor is definitely the way to go Thanks again Wes

title: Long on pretention short on customer service
text:
My husband I and I spent last weekend at the W hotel We are what made the trip awesome not the W hotel My impression of the hotel is that they have tried to create this phony expensive world for the cool kids and if your not one of the cool kids forget about getting service let alone a good morning from staff except for the man cleaning the rooms The morning we left there were two men I think they were suppose to be doormen that openly spent the 45 minutes that we waited for our shuttle leering and gesturing at women walking by Neither one of them attempted to make any contact nor offer help to my husband nor myself They reminded me of something out of American gigolo I found them both disrespectful and objectifying towards women They made my skin crawl
The room was starting to look shabby If you like to feel like your in a cave youd like the room We called the front desk for two items never received them and the clerk was rude I think I was bothering her The bed was awful My husband had a sore back the three days we were in NYC The music that is played all day creates this sleazy atmosphere The hallways are very dark and I didnt feel comfortable walking by myself I felt bad for my husband because he went through a lot of trouble and money to book the trip The hotel again did not add to our experience Shame on the W for trying to create false impressions Install some lights get rid of the techno music and train your staff to understand that they should be trying to please the customer not the other way around Differently not family nor couple friendly Maybe a good place to come if your a swinging single and want to score some action

title: Great value Hotel we will be back
text:
Arrived late on Friday to find our double standard room to be right opposite the bar on the first floor Asked the guy on the front desk for a different room due to the noise from the bar and he explained that the only avaliable room at that time was in the Smoking side of the hotel Reluctantly we agreed to stay in it but found it to be clean and fresh apart from the corridor outside He said that tomorrow Saturday some guests were leaving and that he would move us to a non smoking room with a free King Size upgrade
The next day we went out early and upon our return found we had a front of hotel first floor King Size bedded room and that our luggage had been transfered to the room too
Excellent service
Complimentary breakfast was great too Cereal bagels fruit yoghurt cream cheese toast pastries and doughnuts in abundance with fresh coffee and juice
Will definetly return the next time we visit NYC

title: Extremely relaxing and beautiful room
text:
This place is a steal for 90 Its walking distance or a quick drive to some trendy bars and about a 10 minute drive from the arts district in NoDa for some restaurants and live music at night The rooms are gorgeously decorated and extremely clean I stayed in a studio with my sister and it had a double bed pullout couch recliner desk dining table refrigerator kitchen and stove vanity and of course a toilet and bath And a flatscreen television and highspeed internet access a cord not wireless
One of the light bulbs went out and within a couple minutes of calling the front desk someone came by to replace the light The complimentary breakfast is pretty awesome with everything from your typical collection of cereals bagels and donuts to a waffle station scrambled eggs hash browns sausage coffee tea juice muffins yogurt parfait you name it They also have a full bar available for evening socialization The staff is also pretty friendly
We only stayed here for a night but it was definitely worth it

title: Very good option in Manhattan
text:
My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and we were very satisfied with our hosting Its not a hotel for those seeking luxury or design but brings other advantages efficient service huge rooms clean and well kept with comfortable and large beds  Discreet decoration in traditional Courtyard by Marriotts style Bathrooms clean and well equipped 
It has a small lobby with few employees but all efficient and attentive Good location 3rd Ave for those who like to stay in Midtown East near major attractions with good restaurants around 
Internet free for guestes in the business center There is a Duane Read in the building  In general if youre just looking for spacious comfortable and clean rooms in a nice hotel is a great option in Manhattan

title: Wonderful Service Wonderful Hotel
text:
We stayed at the Grand Del Mar over Labor Day weekend We were extremely impressed with the quality of service even during what was presumably one of the busiest weekends of the year
We stayed at the hotel with our 5 month old baby We requested a crib for the room when we made our reservations The hotel contacted us before our stay and asked us the name of our baby When we arrived in our room the hotel had spelled out our babys name in colorful sponges around the bathtub The hotel also gave us a gift for the baby upon our arrival We were blown away by the attention to detail
The food at the resort is better than most other hotel food and there are plenty of options We also thought the food was reasonably priced especially compared to other hotels of this class 
The pool area was very crowded but the staff still managed to help us quickly 
The hotel is a little isolated so a car is a necessity But the isolation also makes for scenic views of the golf course and the mountains The hotel is in a beautiful setting  much nicer than the Four Seasons
The staff consistently impressed us Everyone seemed genuinely happy to help us The concierge and bell man remembered our name after our first meeting 
We are usually very picky travelers but the Grand Del Mar exceeded our expectations in every way

title: Stunning views lovely staff
text: I had booked this hotel as part of a surprise trip for my other half because of the central location and the stunning views afforded by the huge windows in the rooms I mailed the front desk a couple months before our arrival explaining what I was up to and asked if we could be placed on a high floor They promptly replied and were very helpful Id booked a superior queen which only covers floors 417 so they were true to their word and we were shown to a room on the 14th floor when we arrived The views are just stunning The room was very clean and as described Enjoying a shower in the wet room whilst still being able to admire the view is brilliant There were lots of towels nice clean robes and the bed was very comfortable indeed The only issue was being right by the lifts room 18 meant it was a little noisy and on the one night they had a function up on the 17th floor the music travelled down the lift shafts and I had to go for my ear plugs The location of the hotel is excellent for the subway and walking north along the Highline is a pleasure The bar on the 17th floor while expensive is fantastic the German beer place underneath left a little to be desired Overall though a fantastic place to stay

title: Great location in theater district
text: Clean convenient location in Times Square and theater district Easy walk to theater restaurants and Metro much betterfaster than taking a cab Noisy even though we were on the 7th flconstant noise from traffic and sirens A block from a grocery store for fast meals Exceptionally helpful concierge Larry Gave us good suggestions for dinner shows and attractions

title: Nice place to stay but
text: The hotel was very clean and well maintained The staff was very professional and helpful However the bed was one of the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in I slept in hideabeds which were more comfortable The idea it is adjustable is miss leading yes it adjusts but only leaves a hole in the bed where u were sleeping The top is so firm there is no element of comfort If you have a bad back and enjoy firm mattress these are the beds for you

title: Not as great as the last
text: I stayed here again for work and was surprised by my room The last time I stayed here I must have gotten a newly renovated room because it was fantastic This time it was just your average hotel room and small bathroom The service and location still make this hotel worth it The other issue is for some reason I have to follow up with this Omni to get credit for stays Ive only come across this issue at this particular Omni

title: Best location but not for everyone
text: For the price and location this is one of the best deals in the San Francisco I paid 9800 bucks a night for a Thursday and Friday Now when I say location please keep in mind it is steps from Union Square great but also steps from the Tenderloin not so great Now being so close to the Tenderloin doesnt bother me but it is not for everyone so please keep that in mind If you want a nice clean basic room in walking distance then yes If you want luxury and spa and massage experience then skip the Metropolis and go pay

title: Great place for business meeting
text: I was only in Dallas for less then 40 hours but thought the Hyatt DFW was great The meeting rooms were conveniently located and well appointed All of the meals were well prepared and very tasty The banquet meal was especially good and I appreciated being served by well dressed polite and professional staff  These genterlmen were very attentive and went out of their way to provide a great dining experience The hotel lobby and guest rooms were contemporary but comfortable and very well appointed If I had to pick one item that the Hyatt excelled at it would probably be the prompt  friendly and professional service that they provided from check in to wait staff and bar service I hate it when sloppy service ruins the experience but I rreally appreciate it when the service puts the hotel or resturant over the top Well done Hyatt DFW staff and management

title: Lovely Location Nice Hotel
text:
This hotel really does have a boudoir feel to it and is in a great position so was happy with our stay there the room was a nice enough size and was stylishly designed and the bed was 5 star quality for comfort
On the negative side I think if I was to go to New York again I probably wouldnt stay here as I would have liked more facilties such as a swimming pool and a much better breakfast area than simply cereal fruit and bagels
If your not that bothered about being lavished with spas then ignore me and go here Its a great base hotel for getting out and experiencing new york

title: some rooms have cockroach and have bedbugs
text: post hotel has a good location i have lived in different room i lived here two semesters my room had a lot cockroaches when i lived why i didnt move out because too busy to move i was busy on school and no time to find another hotel i still study in San Francisco and hope finish sooner and leave this bad areadont book hotel of downtown because the price double upActually the most of hotels have bedbugs in San Francisco most price of hotels are too expensive with bad servicesto live in SanFrancisco now

title: Nothing extraordinarywouldnt go back
text:
My family and I stayed in the Granduca Hotel for 2 nights and although the service is very good I didnt like the ambiance 
The beds were very good but the bathrooms are very dark and very small bath towels I like brighter rooms
Too expensive for what you get I travel regularly to Houston and have stayed in 2 other hotels by the area I wont come back

title: Very nice place with good service decent location
text: We had a pleasant stay here for the 4th of July weekend The hotel has a beautiful lobby and is clean and well apppointed not brand new but nice The rooms were large enough to be comfortable and the service was good The concierges were not particularly helpful with restaurant choices Im being kind they were pretty much useless but they tried We did not love the location but it is pretty close to Georgetown and DC is small enough to walk almost everywhere anyway My wife had a poor experience booking spa treatments

title: Pretty good for a overnight stay
text: After having a issue with my flight I had to stay over in San Jose for the evening For a overnight stay it was very convenient The staff has been friendly and accommodating The place was very clean Bed was so comfortable When I travel DoubleTrees hotels are always my first choice

title: Center of Town
text:
This hotel is close to historic sites bars restaurants and Reading market The hotel
had speedy check in and was more than helpful in makiing reservations at local restaurants The ground floor bar at LOEWS has great jazz

title: You only get what you pay for
text:
My daughter aged 10 and myself stayed for 4 nights at the Jolly Hotel Madison Towers in November 2007
I read a few reviews before booking and decided I should book a deluxe room an extra 125 for a total of 4 nights  well I tried very hard to find fault with this hotel  and sorry I couldnt
I took advice from previous reviews and avoided breakfast  so no problems there Our room was wonderful  15th floor with a view of the Empire State Building Looked exactly like the photos on the website Tea  coffee in the room Beautiful bathroom together with toiletries Lots of room for luggage and shopping Requested a nonsmoking room  so no smells of cigarettes
Reception was very helpful  but then we had no complaints and doormanporters were very pleasant and cheerful Free umbrellas free local phone call from reception
My daughter and I travel abroad at least 3 times a year for holidays and I travel abroad on business fairly regularly our overall experience was very good with this hotel it certainly met up to our expectations
Ideally situated in walking distance of everywhere in central Manhattan Only disappointment from our trip was that most of the shows on Broadway were cancelled due to strike action from stage hands but this is nothing to do with the hotel
Would certainly go back to this hotel

title: Greatly and Pleasantly Surprised
text:
Its a big hotel The great staff make it feel more intimate than it is When was the last time you were having breakfast paid your check and your server asked if you wanted a coffee to go Huge bar area which is great for a drink when having a meeting with colleagues There is a big rooms renovation going on  not to worry it is not a distraction I was in an room that had not yet been redone and I was very happy with the room size amenities etc Only minor snit  tv did not get sufficient channels and some of my reception was poor 
If you are attending a meeting at the convention center it is a very short walk  and much of it indoors

title: Location location locationnot to mention brand new
text:
My wife and i just got back from 3 nights at the HGI Tribeca and we thought it was fantastic Keep in mind its not an oppulent over the top hotel This is basic stay place done right The lobby is small there isnt alot of glitz and glam but then again for the price you cant beat the location
The location as been said is between 6th Ave and 7th Ave just below Canal St We were originally worried about the Holland Tunnel traffic but it wasnt that bad until Saturday const in the tunnel Most other days it was typical NYC The location is so close to the SoHo shoppingrestaurants and not to mention the trendy scene in Tribeca If your not familar with the area its not like MidtownTimes Square at all there arent throngs of people there arent big bus tours its just geniune NYC We were able to walk to the WTC Site the Brooklyn Bridge and Greenwich Village all within 15 mins
As far as taking a cab to the hotel that can be tricky dont say its on York St York St is a one block long alley and noone will know wher that is Instead say its on 6th Ave between Walker and Canal in Tribeca As you come up 6th Ave its on the left one block before Canal Look for the red restaurant awnings that say Bar Artisenal
As for the hotel when we checked in we were informed that no King size beds were available they instead offerred us a room with a jacuzzi tub Now that was an unexpected surprise and came in handy at the end of long days hiking around the city The tub was huge allowing two people to fit very comforatbly The double bed rooms had full size beds not queen which was a bit cozy but the room itself had plenty of space The beds were comfortable and they were the airadjustable variety so you could adjust the firmness It was very clean throughout There was a mini fridge and microwave as well as a coffee maker in the room They have full Comcast digitialHD cable TV including HBO and HBO On Demand nice for a chain hotel
There is no pool so dont be misled by the website There also arent safes in the room There are plenty of cabs going uptown on 6th Ave and youll never have a problem getting one There is a Dunkin Donuts across the street when you need a DDfix in the morning

title: Nice hotel nice location
text:
We spent Xmas and New Year in this hotel We liked the room very much it was clean and comfortable nice smell and it is very important for me as I am a non smoker The heather was working fine and it has the most comfortable beds I had ever been  The hotel is in a nice location next to the subway and it is a quiet place at night so you can sleep
I disliked the dirty windows and it is a real pity because of the nice view you have from the room
We had another problem with the bill they charged meals in their restaurants we never had  I wish I would jajajaja instead of a pizza outside the hotel
About the renewing works outside we didnt suffer them because most of the workable time we were out the hotel visiting places
The bathroom was clean and hot water all day long And the courtesy shampoo conditioner cream etc were enough and of a very good quality One nice thing you will find for every woman is the hair dryer it is a real one to dry hair and not to feel a simple breeze
The free coffee and tea at the room was a nice touch we enjoyed it very much specially on winter
This is a hotel I would go back

title: The Ultimate in Service Beauty and Compassion
text: We selected Hotel Palomar after a lengthy search for a honeymoon spot that would not only allow our dogs to be with us but that would honor them as guests Palomar exceeded even our highest expectations Our beloveds were permitted to be with us even in certain common areas as we enjoyed the fabulous daily complimentary wine event and we were assigned a suite in an area that was incredibly peaceful and nonscary for our little ones  Every area of the hotel was adorned with truly beautiful original artwork which filled our senses without interfering with great relaxation  The kindness of the service was unmatched in our experience and cleanliness and freshness of the air and all environs were splendid  Our Concierge on arrival the brilliant young Philip welcomed us so warmly that we felt like celebrities  This notwithstanding that all four of us my husband our 2 dogs and I are all mutts and I am a funnylooking one at that   We shall probably never enjoy such luxury and comfort again at any price  and our memories of this stay are crystals of bliss

title: Location great room not so great
text:
We traveled to DC over Columbus Day weekend for a wedding We LOVED the location of the hotel  close to the Metro Starbucks eateries etc We also liked the decor of the hotel  very modern and sleek The final thing we really liked was the bed  very comfy 
However everything else about the room itself just sucked Ive had a better nights sleep in a group hostel room in Amsterdam than this 4star hotel 
The bathroom  this was set up to look cool but was totally dysfunctional First there was no door between the bathroom and the bedroom There was a small door between the toilet and the sink but it only provided visual privacy no sound privacy It was really uncomfortable to use the toilet I love my husband but there are just some things I dont want to hear There was no shower curtain only a super sleek looking super useless halfwall up near the shower head As a result shower water sprayed out all over the bathroom  kinda dangerous definitely annoying We called the desk and asked about a shower curtain they said they had to check and get back to us No one called We stopped by the desk and they said they might be ordering shower curtains  We asked for a bunch of extra towels to put on the floor
The room  there was no dead bolt on the door This combined with the wacky do not disturb sign see below resulted in me opening my eyes at 8 am and finding a member of the cleaning staff standing just inside our door presumably trying to figure out if she should clean our room So there were definite safety and privacy concerns This combined with the fact that the metal room door seemed to superconduct hallway noise other guests doors elevator voices I got very little sleep Finally the do not disturb sign was a metal button that you pushed on the inside of the room which lit up a red electric do not disturb message next to the door in the hallway Very cool concept but poorly thought out The only way you could tell if the light was on was to go outside and look I think the morning the mad came in we had neglected to go out and check if it was on All in all if location is your main priority I could recommend the hotel but otherwise I think a traveler could have a better experience elsewhere

title: Old World Upscale Hotel
text:
Here is an old world hotel with lots of charm and amenities for a price This is definitely how the wealthy enjoy a weekend or longer in NYC If you can afford it I recommend a weekend during the winter when the city is decorated and festive This hotel is classy with butlers who are available with a call day and night You pay for service and service is what you get from the moment you walk into the lobby until you leave 
The restaurant onsite is very high end but the King Cole bar is affordable and an institution If you enjoy an old fashion Manhattan or any of the old school cocktails these bartenders do them all justice

title: top class budget hotel
text: Queen deluxe room was great Clean and cozy  and bathroom was especially clean and nice Nothing bad to say Friendly service excellent location It was nice that the breakfast in a nearby bagelstore was included Definitely going to stay there again Excellent value for the money to say the least

title: Would definitely return
text: I stayed at the Broadway Manor Inn for a week in early January and it was the best decision I made As a British female travelling on my own I was concerned about safety and cleanliness The are the Broadway Manor Inn was located in felt really safe reasonably quiet but walking distance from just about anywhere The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and the rates were great The room and bathroom were clean and spacious and there was a fridge microwave coffemaker and TV What more can one ask for especially if youre travelling on a budget I would definitely recommend it

title: Nice mid priced place
text:
This was a nice mid priced one night stay The room was clean but a bit dated The pool was warm and clean but showing a bit of age also Monday through Thursday there is free snackssodabeer and wine in the lobby area 
 from 5 till 7PM A nice way to kick back after driving
 The morning free breakfast was nice perphaps even a bit better that other stays at more expensive spots as there was meat and other hot items to be had
 The place was busy but very quite at night and safe feeling Easy to get to and many food joints walking distance and 3 or 4 that deliver to the Inn
 The Staff was friendly and both check in and out were very fast no wait deals
 If Your looking for a mid priced 82 spot to spend a night or two Im sure Youll be happy here

title: Good location for quick stay
text:
The hotel was very close to the airport Also free shuttle every 20 minutes 
Front desk staff were friendly and quick Rooms are standard Hilton rooms Good wifi reception and TV channels
Lobby is spacious and beautiful There are a few PCs free to use in the lobby with printers 
The lobby restaurant Spencers steak and chop offers variety of dishes and I had a great service at the bar table Food was not impressive but OK
I was Hilton Gold so I got a voucher for coffee drink and one fruit cup or fruitbecause they dont have a lounge Not great but its better than nothing
Its a good hotel to stay one night before taking a flight

title: cleanmoderm room
text:
I stayed here for 4weeks The staff was friendly and the manager was very friendly and helpedful
Free WiFi connection was good and the flat screen TV and cable programing was great I would definitely stay here again

title: Perfect central location
text: I stayed here for a weekend and was very happy with the hotels location cleanliness and affordability The standard room with a double bed was small but comfy I liked the pillows too I expected the room to be small so there were no surprises Wifi is free and signal strength is just okay The TV was old school big square box with some channels that had unclear reception I hope an upgrade is imminent The property is large and feels labyrinthine  our room was about as far away from the single elevator that serves the entire hotel as one can get I parked at the hotel for 24 per day Valet with in  out privileges The valet staff are very nice and efficient but be forewarned that it seems that only one guy is on staff at a time So you have to call for your car well in advance  dont expect this to go too quickly as cars are parked about a block away and the guy has to run out to get them This also means that when you pull up he may be out getting another car So you have to put on your blinkers and wait until he returns you cant just pull up and leave your keys with anyone at the front desk  they arent supposed to do that as the valet company is subcontracted Overall though the place is great Its a great home base from which to explore Chicago

title: Expensive overpriced business hotel
text: Rooms are adequate but hotel is busy and service and staff is marginal on a good day bordering on rude Price is nowhere near worth it Free wifi is freeif you can acquire the weak signaldont bother Stayed twice last month and the second time I was upgraded to a suite right next to the elevator banks I called to complain and the gentlemen asked why I was complaining that I was upgraded I asked for a manager to call me back and am still waiting Will stay here again only because this is where my company tells me to stay Breakfast buffet is good but pricey Concierge was better allowing us to check out umbrellas on a rainy day

title: If you want to be in the Gaslamp area this Hilton fits the criteria
text:
The Hilton Gaslamp is nice and in a good location We had one of the suites and it was a good size for San Diego You know immediately that noise is going to be an issue when earplugs are on the nightstand
The hotel brings the old and new together with the more modern furnishings 
The valet unloading area makes the best of a tricky location It works It isnt as functional as some but it isnt a mess as it appears
Suite 1112 also had a view of air conditioners from the living area We kept the drapes closed to reduce noise and cover up the lack of a view in that direction The other windows had an okay view

title: Great Deal
text: I must say I really enjoyed my stay here Very close to downtown without the downtown prices The staff was great as well I enjoyed the free parking Thank you to all of the staff for assuring my family and I had a great stay

title: Wonderful facilities and location  the staff is what makes it so great
text:
This is a beautiful historic hotel in a great location  quick walk to the waterfront and Union Square etc The rooms are very nice sized and well maintained Overall the facilites are great including the gym
What sets this property apart is the staff I have stayed at many high end hotels and the warm friendly and attentive service from the staff of this hotel ranks up with the very best Every single person I encountered was delightful  I stayed 3 nights and the valets doormen front desk folks and housekeeping folks all went out of their way to be friendly and helpful The concierge I believe his name was Lex gave us some excellent advice as we were departing for a weekend in wine country I cant say enough about how great everyone was
While there may be more grand hotels in SF with more modern facilities I strongly believe you will not find one with better service

title: Good stay Outstanding omelette chef
text: Repeat stay because of past good experiences and proximity to family but one major additional factor was the madetoorder omelettes available at the breakfast included with the room cost all cooked by one truly excellent extremely friendly chef Go early to beat the long line but its definitely worth it Gets your day off to a good start The room was fine even though showing a little wear particularly the somewhat tired matress Definitely would stay here again

title: Awesome place
text:
I love this hotel Arrived off the Virgin flight into SFO and into the cool and calm lobby which has a great feel and checked in to the first surprise they had upgraded us to a panoramic suite and then on showing us up on a beautiful day we had to stop and take in the view Its awesome as was the suite itself Very spacious great fixtures and fittings loads of space to play work relax  you could have a cocktail party in it
I liked the amenities particularly the Bose Soundock to plug the iPod into and charge it which is now just a basic requirement that so many places dont get the very well stocked mini bar and not a rip off either the bed was extremely comfortable The bathroom and shower were lovely though a little more water pressure would be cool the lobby area a little oddly shaped and not really enough wardrobe space for a long stay but this was a minor negative
We found the staff charming and attractive All our requests were efficiently and politely handled I particularly liked the explanation on checkin of the charges they would apply to my card I wish many more hotels would be that honest and up front
The views really do make it however I would strongly advise a waterfront room when the fog clears and sun comes out you get a great sense of wellbeing with karma of the place and the light
A week later I came back this time to a deluxe waterfront king no Soundock but still a great room nonetheless
One thing to be aware of the bar and outside deck are extremely popular in the early evening do not bank on getting a table

title: Front Desk Service Was Aweful
text: Family of Four arrived after Midnight The front desk clerk a sour looking black lady in her late 30s or early 40s was rude to me and my wife We paid with cash and she was handed the money yet when it was time for her to give us the change she never counted it she basically just threw it at us so to speak She was very impatient as wellThe night time security guard was very nice though We went to speak to the manager the next morning and the house keepers warned us that it was no good They stated that everyone complains about the front desk clerk at night but she was untouchable Erica and Luis Ponce

title: Perfect central locationbetter than avg hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel at the end of October and would suggest it to others because of its location and value We walked everywhere from this hotel and thought it was perfect for its central location We did not eat at the restaurant but stopped in the bar a few nights which was quite nice with very good bartenders On the downside and its been mentioned in other reviews the elevators are very slow during peak times and the walls are paper thin The shower in the room next door sounds like its in your room The room size is very good and the amenities are average The bay view rooms are beautiful

title: So pleased with our selection
text:
We have had a tough year and a weekend break to NY was long awaited so to make it perfect i spend weeks looking in to hotel and studying reviews I loved the look and location of this hotel according to the hotels own website but there were one or two trip advisor reviews which left me with doubts Nevertheless i decided to go ahead and book it for 4 nights
Delighted is all i can say the entrance is small yes and a couple of sofas if you wanted to wait around but reception staff was helpfull friendly and so very polite The lifts were ok i dont feel we waited exceptionally long for one to arrive The corridors are clean neat and tidy We were on floor 10 in an executive room which i believe is the same as a standard room just slightly bigger 
No great view but i wasnt there to sit and look out of the window there was a desk which i used as a dressing table not a massive amount of space to put things in the bathroom but seriously we were there for 4 nights so there was enough room for what we needed Just a shower no bath but that was hot and good pressure
A safe in the wardrobe and about 20 hangers for the two of us there were three drawers either side of the massive comfortable bed which again for 4 nights was perfectly adaquate for what we needed
The TV was large and had the usual channels we managed to watch a film on ABC or something like that and you can pay extra for new films etc if you wanted too not too sure how much they are The mini bar is motion sensitive and that includes the things on top so i would recommend not touching any of it
The coffeetea mmmmm well not too great to be honest you have to make one cup at a time and there is only creamer and sweetners in the little packet so not too good but if black coffee if your thing then all good
You can have laundry room service wake up calls etc etc the usual staff
The only small thing was one day after the room being cleaned they left a glass of water next to the bed and didnt empty one of the bins but that was it you can have your towels and sheets changed as often as you like
Location  Could not do better if you come out of the hotel and turn left within about a 1 minute stroll you are in the centre of time squares all the lights etc etc are there right in front of you If you then turn left of right you are on broadway
If you turn right out of the hotel and walk two blocks you are on fifth ave this is about a 3  4 minute stroll away Central park is just passed Tiffanys and takes about a 1520 minute stroll empire state is about 10 15 minute stroll with a pass by Macys
Everthing is walking distance and if not for you the main bus terminal is 5 minute walk Nearest subway is no more than 5 minutes walk
The Restaurant right next to the hotel you can charge to your room we had breakfast there and it was about 45 for two of us for breakfast juice toast  Coffee 
Overall the best decision i have made on a hotel To give you an idea i stay in 5 star hotels generally but in a city a 4 star as you dont spend any time there we were out by 9am and not back until 12am or a quick pop i for shower and change A clean friendly and lovely hotel dont waste money on others for a fancy entrance with a man on the door as they are not worth it

title: Good location not new
text:
This is my 3rd stay at this hotel and my experience is very consistant
The hotel location is good  within walking distance of the park times square and right above the subway station
Breakfast is very good and there is a Starbucks on the same block
Gym is well equiped and good size
The rooms are relatively old but clean
Overall good value and a default choice for me on business trips to the city

title: Phil W review
text: This a great hotel to stay new clean very nice people and a good breakfast Not much else to ask for A terrific deal too I have stayed here 4 times in the past year and have had a great experience each time and i highly recommend it

title: great locationvery noisy
text:
I chose this hotel due to the location and it being trendy The location is perfect for NYC Probelm is that the downstairs barclub has loud thumping music till 3am on Friday and Saturday Even though I was on the 10th floor could hear every word This was unacceptable
The check in desk is like a cattle ranch very chaotic The staff at the reception are hurried and very curt and give minimal info concierge also very rushed every request seems an effort and answers are brief and unhelpful
It was also annoying that in the evenings burly guards stand at the elevators rude and unfriendly they ask for ID if you enter the lifts This is irritating as one feels imprisoned and it takes the freedom of the holiday away
Except for the location which is excellent this hotel is noisy and has rude staff It iis not cheap so these faults are unacceptable

title: Nice Stay
text:
My husband and booked the Andaz Wall Street to stay for 4 nights but due to hurricane Sandy we had to be moved to the Grand Hyatt
The first thought I had in mind was the location is great next to Grand Central but how about the amenities I was entitled to at Andaz
Andaz offers free wifi internet complimentary snacks at the room and in the lobby free luggage storage etc
But I was glad to find that Grand Hyatt did the best they could so that we could get the same ammenities we were supposed to have at Andaz
At check in they said we would be able to use wifi in the room for free they gave us some vouchers for watercoffee etc They gave us a king room and stored our luggage for free after check out I had to go to front desk and talk to an agent I couldnt make an agreement with the front desk agent over the phone
I can say the hotel is very professional serious and I was very glad to see that they made everything possible to make us feel comfortable despite the fact we were supposed to be staying at Andaz which is a top notch property
The room itself is very nice clean The only con is that the bathroom is a bit small but this wouldnt spoil my stay for sure
The location is GREAT Right next to the Grand Central Bryant Park and if youre keen on walking like us to Times Sq
And to top it all we were given a complimentary bottle of wine and a basket of fruits as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary
Impeccable hotel very professional staff
Loved it would certainly be back

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed here for a brief overnight minivacation Despite not being one of the classiest places to stay in the Inner Harbor it was quite nice The room was big and well appointed The bathroom was very nice and accommodating The room was clean and I was only able to find a few minor things wrong with the stay The lack of a minifridge in the room was a little bit of a disappointment Also the TV was hard to work and for being an High Definition TV it did not receive any high definition channels The staff was very nice and personable I only stayed there one night but I would recommend this if you are looking for a simple place to hang your hat Dont pass up their complimentary breakfastit is one of the best free breakfasts of any hotel I have stayed in

title: Overall very good experience
text: I throughly enjoyed by stay at Becks Its a basic motel but my room was very comfortable and clean My room looked like it had just been renovated and was very spacious The best thing about this motel is its very close to Castro street No more than two blocks to the Metro bar and another block to all the other bars in the Castro If its convenience you are looking without having to get a cab to the Castro I would recommend Becks I also took BART from SFO airport to Civic Center station and then connected to the Muni and then its only a two block walk to the motel I would not have a problem staying here again and would recommend it to others

title: Fantastic Everything
text: Just got back from this property and I was exceedingly happy with the experience The service was amazing across all levels Room was clean and spacious The bedding package was amazing And the location is unparalleled Whether in Boston for business or pleasure you cant beat this hotel It is walking distance from most anything you could want to do Combine a premium location with staff that genuinely seems to care and its a combo that you cant beat

title: Great Hotel for NY
text:
Booked following reviews read on Trip Advisor and what a great hotel Stayed for 4 nights on vacation
Pros
Room size
Shower big enough to take all 4 of us
Bed
Cleanliness
Free wifisodasnackscoffee in the lobby
The staff welcomed us every time we came into the building
Cons
The basin trendy that they are are a pain to shave in
The carpets in the halls probably looked nice in a catalog but look messy with footprints
Yes thats all I can think of
Given this was our first time in NY was concerned that it was away from the action Having spent 30 seconds in Times Square I am so glad we decided on the Financial District
Hotel is 5 mins from 23 subway station which is about 1015 mins from Times Square on the Express train  perfect
South Street Seaport has a collection of nice shops and places to eat if you want to eat close to the hotel
Would recommend this place in a heartbeat

title: Perfect fit
text:
The Days Inn was a perfect fit for me and my family
We had two suites that were good sized and each was more than enough room for 4 people The rooms were clean and had they had a fridge and microwave in each Breakfast was good pancakes and eggs but the unlimited coffee was better
The best part of this hotel is its central location to everything in San Diego the zoo beaches and Sea World are all less than 10 minutes
Thank you to Joey at the front desk you made our weekend trip worth repeating well be be back in January

title: Lots of promise a little short on delivery
text: I booked the Rock Star suite I was expecting to be wowed based on my experience at the Hard Rock Vegas and found the room less interesting than most normal hotel rooms The room was dark and split up into 3 areas that made it seem cramped The small living room is loaded with so much in room selling that it looked like a convenience store The food is decent and big The internet was rather slow Closets are tiny The gym is good for a hotel A very high style lobby

title: Huge by New York Standards
text:
I booked this trip using Hotwire which gave it a 45 star boutique hotel 
I was treated wonderfully by the hotel clerk when I happen to ask for a room with a king bed 
Normally Hotwired rooms are always queen size beds
To my delight when we opened the door we were amazed to find a two room suite that even included a small kitchen
The living room was huge But mostly the king bed was luxurious
The location was one short block from the subway And the midtown location at Lexington and 50th was spoton
The next morning i called and asked for a late check out and they extended our visit for 2 hours

title: One of the best sleeps ever
text: I stayed at the hotel from August 25th to the 29th Other than navigating the way from the BART 495 per person as opposed to 16 per person for the shuttle and approx 40 for the taxi to the hotel the W is easy to find The closest BART station is Montgomery which is about two blocks from the W The hotel itself is very chic The lobby during the day doubles as a DJ lounge at night we didnt mind the music whatsoever The front desk staff were very friendly and were able to meet my request of an early checkin The room was small but quiet comfortable and meticulously clean We practically melted into the beds making that alone worth the stay Shops are not too far away though a walk to Union Square will be about six blocks The views from the room were spectacular and it was relaxing to spend evenings sitting on the alcove reading a book and looking at the San Francisco skyline I would definitely make another stay at the W San Francisco when I visit again

title: Not Recommended
text: My two dogs and I recently stayed at this hotel for two nights While the room was clean it was small and there was no hot water  I couldnt get it hotter than lukewarm This was a huge disappointment when I longed for a nice hot shower there was also no massaging showerhead nor were plush upgraded towels provided as stated in the advertisement Despite the fact that they advertise pets are welcome there were no poop bags provided so some guests just left their dogs poop on the property Other LQs where I have stayed provided poop bags and made you truly feel welcome with your pets When I asked the front desk to safeguard my purse and laptop in the guest safe while I was gone during the day the desk clerk had no idea what I was requesting She suggested I just leave things in my room with the assurance that there had been no thefts in the year she had worked there I doublechecked later to ensure that the hotel stated they provided this service In fact their inroom brochure encouraged guests to use their safekeeping and specifically stated not to leave valuables in the room I never saw an employee in the breakfast area and I never met Chris Patel as many reviewers say they did He was apparently not there the three days two nights I was there I did not make use of the very small exercise room but it looked clean There was an indoor pool that I also did not use but I liked that it was indoors In Fort Worth TX the summer days can get way too hot for an outdoor pool to be very enjoyable Though I will be making many more trips to Fort Worth for events held at the Will Rogers center I will not be staying at this particular hotel I would not unconditionally or enthusiastically recommend this hotel to others

title: Not impressed
text:
We were not impressed with the Wyndham at Franklin Plaza
The people were rude not knowledgeable of what was in the area and the staff was not available they did alot of socializing between themselves and very little with their patrons
Since our stay we have been back to Phily and have stayed at other hotels in the area Grant it the lobbies did not compare to the Wyndham but they were CLEANER and MUCH MUCH FRIENDLIER
It was okey if your expectations are for an average Motel 6 no Motel 6 would be much more warming and friendly

title: The Carter is Unique crazy and not the best in the world but still good fun
text:
Ive stayed here every summer for the last 5 years and this year I was there for 4 nights in August and 1 in September I use it as transit hotel for next stop 
First off the bad bits the hotel is pretty old and although renovations are going on with 700 rooms and the fact its usually very busy dont expect a fancy room The first room I was in was not two bad but as with alot of old hotels the door to the bathroom no longer closed and unfortunately the bath was so dirty I went out and bought cleaner for it
However the hotel itself is in one of the best locations in New York literally walk out the front door turn right and within 2 minutes your on Times Square At the prices they charge you cant get anything better
Over the years I have heard horror storys about the carter but to be honest you just have to use common sense If your a single traveller and have a fancy laptop dont go and sit in the lounge using it at 1am and then return to your room the next time you go out chances are it wont be there when you get back Also dont wave the fact youve just got paid around all of this is pretty much common sence but as alot of the people staying at the carter are young and have just finished working at Summer camps in August and September of course they dont usually use common sence
During my stay the computers in the there lobby were upgraded to nice new Dell machines with 2122 inch monitors Dont worry about taking a laptop if you dont really need it as there is normally one free at anytime 
You dont see much of the staff but they tend to be friendly and helpful as long as your polite to them except one checkin lady who seems to be ready to flip for no reason Again use common sence if you start shouting straight away they wont help but be polite and they can be very accomodating 
This isnt a four star hotel were you can walk into the lobby in your PJs with your laptop in the middle of the night and feel totally safe this is a hotel were you need to be aware of your surroundings but is always an interersting place to stay
Also the hotel has improved alot over the last 5 years its still got a way to go but its heading in the correct direction

title: Nice location bad room
text: Stayed in the hotel for 9 nights bed is comfortable but after a while me and my boyfriend felt itch and have some bug bit marks on our legs the 2nd last night the hotel had water issue hot water was brown my boyfriend has to take a cold shower when I try to take shower there was no cold water I been told there will be water in an hour after 4hours the cold water is back the hot water is still brown Its not worth it

title: Great place
text: Had a great stay at the Shelburne The staff was great and friendly The room was large and clean The furnishings and bathrooms were a little dated but for the money it was super We had a few bumps in the service the first night  no sheets on the pull out But all in all a great place for families needing more room

title: Better than expected
text: I will have to admit first I was a little skeptical about how my stay was going to be at this property after reading some of the reviews just prior to my stay here To late to cancel I had to just find out for myself which Im glad I did It was great location wise The one thing I will say is the elevator was a little slow and you needed your key to access it felt great for security but I was in town visiting family so when they came to visit me it was a little hassle to get them up but it wasnt a major problem Front desk team could have been a little more welcoming but they got the job done overall not a bad choice if you need a hotel downtown

title: Great location and good value
text: Partner and I stayed here after our cruise to Vancouver Great location 1 12 blocks from the Quick Shuttle from Vancouver and and easy walk to the Space Needle Pike Market and downtown Free shuttle within 1 mile helped get us to the shuttle to SeaTac Friendly service and breakfast included

title: Great hotel convenient location
text:
Stayed for 3 nights in early September  for less than 100 a night inc breakfast this hotel proved to be outstanding value In fact I cant think of another hotel that comes close of providing the facilitiesservices this Hilton offered for that price
Transfers from the hotel are available but youll probably end up needing a rental if youre heading out of the downtown area so you may as well pick up the car at the airport and drive the 10 mins to the hotel  its not a difficult route and there is amble selfparking available but the parking garage layout can be a little confusing
It seems a bit odd that in order to access some of the amenities sports bar starbucks etc you have to leave the hotel walk round a corner and enter from the outside Then repeat the exercise to back into the hotel Not a major trauma but its a bit bemusing that you cant access them from inside like you can the cocktail bar and restaurant
A quick walk over the bridge delivers you to the Gaslamp area and more restaurantsbars that youll probably ever need and catering to every budget and preference If you just want to stretch your legs then the waterfront is right outside and you can wander along looking at various floating maritime attractions
Breakfast is good with an amble buffet and portions from the menu are sufficient to see you through the morning and maybe more Food at the Fox sports bar is perfectly acceptable if somewhat predictable but then its a sports bar so you know exactly whats what
Rooms are clean and tidy sensibly sized the same can be said for the bathroom Higher floors have better views and if you plan to spend time looking out the window then opt for one overlooking the bridge rather than the container docks The higher up you go the less noise is apparent and theres little need to close the curtains  no one can look in  and if youre not fussed at the scenery then save yourself the extra  charged for the bridge view and stare out the window at nothing in particular from the comfort of the bed
Im sure its an endless source of amusement to the checkin staff as bemused guests wander around the lobby looking for the elevators that take you to the floor youre looking for  it isnt immediately obvious
Will be using this hotel again

title: Best kept secret in Downtown LA
text:
This is an open letter to Ian Gee the General Manager of the Sheraton Hotel Downtown in Los Angeles This is my 11th consecutive year as a Starwood Platinum Member and in all that time I have only been inspired on three other occasions to write a review of a property Therefore I am honored to write this review to make known my gratefulness for youre Staff providing such an exceptional experience at my recent stay at your Property I had the opportunity to thank Maricora earlier for her role in providing exceptional service upon checkin I appreciated your Teams hospitality the room upgrades the early checkin the late checkout and the overall warmth and personal care your property extended to my Guests and I
To my Peers here on Trip Advisor please know that when your travel calls for you to be in Downtown Los Angeles dont spend hundred of dollars a night to stay in some overrated property The Sheraton is inexpensive I booked my nights for only 159 a night and about 200 less then some of the other swanky hotels that dont come close to offering the warmth charm and value I found here at this property For those with access to it the Concierge Lounge was excellent A perfect place to unwind and get some work done with free refreshments and scrumptious appetizers The location is perfect Close to everything The property is clean and warm and very cheerful Every staff member that I encountered was authentically concerned about our comfort and enjoyment They really want to make sure your experience is memorable We took advantage of ordering some room service and were completely satisfied The food arrived hot and tasty In under 20 minutes The hotel was immaculate and felt very cozy The beds were a dream pun intended The rooms were clean as a whistle and the bathroom was luxurious 
I have informed Daniel Kerzner as he is the Director of the Starwood Ambassador Program and He should know I recommend he send his VIP Guests to stay under your care I have also shared my gratitude with Tanja at Starwood Corporate as she is my Personal Travel Ambassador and her Manager Laurie McBeath They ask me to provide details whenever I encounter a truly exceptional experience that goes above and beyond the normal high standards Starwood sets for its guests and you are without question the example they had in mind In the words of one of your most famous Govenors Ill be back 
My finest and best regards
Mitch

title: Awful Rooms Most Uncomfy Beds Obnoxious  Rude Conceirge and lacklustre manager
text:
Stayed here on a recent trip to San Fran with friends and considering the reputation of Intercon and the cost of the room was expecting a 5 stayWhat all four of us got was a four day backache from the terrible bed a headache from the anger at the treatment we received from the concierge service  the were so rude and obnoxious and made us feel as if we were not worthy of their assistance and on complaint to the manager  who responded with a glassy look in her eyes thanks for the feedback its always appreciated Oh and to add insult to injury 40 per hour to use the internet
 All in all we were very disappointed with this hotel and I would not recommend it at all
Last visit to San Fran I stayed at the Parc 55  superb hotel

title: Handlery Great if you get a special rate
text: This is a pretty good hotel located in San Diegos Hotel Circle We were there for a group event so our pricing per night was almost half of what was listed on their web page The hotel is older but seemed to be kept up pretty well Several nicks and scratches on the furniture but nothing terrible The bathrooms were older but kept clean and updated the best that they could without a complete overhaul Ask for a balcany room overlooking the pool for the best experience If you dont ask you probably wont get Checked in early around 1230PM with no problem On Saturday evening they set up a large movie screen by the pool and showed the movie Scooby Doo Several families were down at the pool sitting in lounge chairs enjoying the movie It was kinda neat The only thing is is that if your room overlooked the pool you could hear the movie with the sliding door open But it was shown early enough in the evening that it wasnt an annoyance The hotel circle area has many midrange hotels to choose from and this one is pretty good size and probably my favorite right now The only sad thing about the area is that with all the hotels there are few in any restaurants I guess the hotels want you to eat at their hotels but havent been lucky enough to eat at a good one there All in all not bad

title: Great location Good hotel
text:
The Hilton in the inner harbor is a nice stay especially with that significant other The location is prime you have access to many restaurants bars clubs and other amenities The service is self explanatory w the hilton The rooms decor was nicely layed out over looking the city  night makes you feel goodThe gym and pool over look Orioles stadium NICE  fabolous voiceMy problem which is the problem that i always have in staying  these hotels is the THIN AIR CIRCULATION in the room I cant stand that  You and your partner will wake up in the middle of the night with some serious dry mouth scavenging for some water I know many people have experienced this before Bring your humidifier LOL other things that bothered me which is always common in luxury hotels is that everythings overpriced
but for a nice getaway for young couples i would recommend this hotel and location

title: Needs to Lose Its Crown
text:
I thought that the Crowne Plaza label was a higherend hotel chain for Intercontinental which inclludes the Holiday Inn brand Well I was wrong with this place It is a lowend Holiday Inn in disguise  no crowns for this dump I was here for one night only since I had to catch an early flight at LAX
Checkin  unprofessional  nothing went wrong but the clerks were behind the counter having graphic personal conversations
Parking Garage  I realize it is not managed by them but they have a sign out front directing you to park there so they have an interest in its appearance the elevator is filthy pieces of the formica has fallen off the elevator wall the ceiling panels are missing  makes you wonder about the mechanical capabilities of the elevator
Halls  walking to our room small pieces of trash on the carpet doors slam shut  with a hotel that is going to get people inout at all hours to catch flights they should have a better door set up that dont slam The door to the room next to us slammed and literally shook our room
Room  filthy carpet full of stains chipped furniture desk entertainment cabinet no safe in room expected for a hotel in my opinion small bathroom with extremely low counter  needed to bend over to wash up and no this was not a handicap room old TV not an updated HD flat screen
Pros  location close to the airport I got a very good rate via Priceline BUT Priceline rated this as a 35 star hotel  NO WAY  more like a 2 star 
I have not stayed at other hotels near LAX but they have got to be better than this

title: The Affinia 50 Feels Like Home
text: After weeks of internet research and reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor I decided to book the Affinia 50 for a vacation stay with 3 other female family members What a great choice We arrived just a little past noon and the doorman saw us from the corner with our luggage and quickly came with a cart to greet us and help us get settled All of the staff members were helpful friendly and polite Checkin was quick and easy and even though it was just past noon our onebedroom suite on the 9th floor was ready We were so surprised when we walked in and saw the size of the suite The living room and dining area were quite large and the kitchen even though small had a fullsized refrigerator microwave dishwasher dishes and a toaster The beds were big and comfy and the bathroom wasnt huge but was bigger than most other NYC hotels Ive stayed in We really felt like we had our own little apartment in the city Everything was very clean and the abundance of Aveda products was a nice touch There was even a fitness room and a nice lounge on the second floor that I wish wed had more time to enjoy but we were out exploring most of the time The midtown east location was great  lots of shopping and restaurants nearby EssaBagel was great for getting breakfast bagels and a little shop called Azure had milk fruit cereals soft drinks etc to take back to the room The walk to the Times Square area only takes about 15 minutes and there are subway lines closeby that get you anywhere you need to go I would definitely recommend the Affinia 50 and I would stay there again without hesitation When you walk into the lobby the doorman always says Welcome home and thats just how we felt  at home

title: Everything I expected was met by a simply magnificient staff
text:
If your looking for an experience in which you worry about nothing come to the Brown Palace Spa The staff is simply magnificient They assist with your every want and need 
Everything I expected was met and exceeded my hopes for the day

title: Loved this hotel
text:
I loved this hotel The company I work for is headquartered right next door to it so it is only a 3 minute walk As a result this is where they put up everybody that comes in to town for business trips to the general offices The sleep number bed was very comfortable and I really enjoyed it Other people that work for my company said it did not inflatedeflate properly but mine worked great The staff is very friendly and attentive The breakfast buffet is pretty decent for a hotel breakfast buffet I had coupon vouchers provided by my company so I am not sure how much it cost I would not have been happy paying much more than 8 for it but it was good when it was free 
They have a little loungebar area near the lobby where we had a great time The beer selection was limited but the staff was excellent and they had flat screen HD TVs that were good I did not bring the proper attire to check out the pool or the fitness room but they looked solid the best I could tell I would definitely recommend staying here and I look forward to the day my company flies me back to Seattle 
The only negative thing about this hotel experience was the shuttle was very limited That is to say it only went to the airport across the street and that was it I would like to see a free shuttle service that would go 23 miles in either direction That is all it would take to get to just about any restaurant Other than that this place is top notch for the price I highly recommend it

title: Upscale La Quinta with Excellent Service
text: Our experience at this hotel was excellent After a long day of travel the hotel was close to the airport and easy to find The staff were friendly and helpful and checkin took less than 2 minutes Our room was spacious immaculate and quiet We pickedup toiletries and snacks at the nearby Walmart  used the inroom microwave to heat them up The inroom refrigerator was welcomed for our beverages The bed was extremely comfortable and we had a great nights rest The complimentary breakfast offered many selections of breads pastries cereals boiled eggs coffee  juices Checkout was as quick as checkin  again with a smiling helpful staff member After getting to our car I realized I had left my cell phone in the room The staff member immediately reissued me a room key and I retrieved my phone within 5 minutes We thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay and will definitely stay there again when in the area

title: Great value for the
text: After a day of shopping at San Marcos outlets we stayed the night at Ramada in Austin For a 45 a night room we were very surprised It was roomy very clean the employees were extra helpful and very friendly We took a dip in the pool which was cool on a very hot day The room was quiet and the bed comfortable They offer a free happy hour and a great hot breakfast It was delicious We had scrambled eggs hash browns sausage OJ coffee and a Texas shaped waffle They also had many cereal pastry and bread selections The only negative is its a little confusing getting to from the interstate We also dined at Land and Cattle Steak Co For 10 each we had a wonderful steak dinner We truly enjoyed our stop over in Austin

title: Thanks Michael Ednilao
text:
I stayed at Cova a classinlineAdmedialink hrefhotela for 2 days and the staff were really helpful Michael Ednilao checked us in and upgraded us to a deluxe room i asked him why and he said today is my lucky day The shuttle to union square and fishermans warf were also helpful because i didnt have to walk around homeless people which is the down side of the hotel breakfast is good and the roof top is amazing if ever ill come back to san francisco im sure im spending my nights at this lovely hotel 
thanxs again michael

title: Great stay
text:
What a great hotel in a great location Tribeca is a great jumping off point for seeing New York It has the feel of being where people seem to live And the Smyth is right in the middle of that The subway stops right at the door literally and another is just a few steps away Lots of great restaurants in the neighbourhood For breakfast and lunch check out the Kitchenette on Chambers St And for a great dinner try the Odeon Cafeteria on W Broadway
But the hotel itself An upgrade for my birthday was just the start The rooms are comfy and beautiful And the bathroom was awash with towels and amenities But the best part of the Smyth is the staff The desk people were always friendly helpful and courteous but William and Ela the concierges were outstanding Friendly patient full of great tips and personal knowledge and eager to please us They couldnt have done more for us if they had taken us to our destinations themselves 
All and all a great place to stay Its our second visit but wont be our last

title: W Union Square  not very Wonderful
text:
We have stayed at many W hotels dozens of times and this particular visit was the only time we were met with so much disappointment
While the decor of the hotel was quite hip and the location was very good the service was really lacking Here are some examples
  We checked in at 630 pm after a long day of travel and our room was not ready it still hadnt been cleaned
  The next day we were gone from 9am until 5pm and when we returned after a long day of sightseeing our room had not been cleaned
  turn down service was only offered once on a fournight stay
  we had 2 nonsmoking rooms and of the rooms reeked of cigarette smoke they kept saying they would put some kind of filter in it to clear it up but they kept forgetting and didnt do it until the 4th of day of our stay
  we decided to eat breakfast one morning at the the hotel restaurant  OLIVES Six of us ordered cereals granola and bagels at 915 am nothing that to be cooked I told the waiter we had to be OUT of the restaurant by 10 and at at 950 our food still had not arrived When we complained it came in shifts and it was not even correct
  the construction in Union Square began with jackhammers at 7am it sounded like someone was tapping a fork really loud on your bedside table and we were on the 17th floor

title: Absolutely Pathetic Service
text:
Okay  there was a blackout for 7 hours which was not the hotels fault but what transpired during the blackout makes me really angry when I think about it Not once did the hotel try to contact guests over a telephone system that was still working There were fire trucks outside and alarms going off and nothing  10 floors on the hotel maybe they could find ten employees with flashlights to go through the floors making some kind of announcement People whos windows were not facing the right way had complete darkness People who were entering the hotel during the blackout were given necklaces that you get an amusement park that glows and told to walk to their rooms 
I could go on but enough  you get the message  the hotel did not care one bit for its guests and even pushed people out early the next day offering a paltry free coffee

title: Everything the business traveler needs for a comfortable stayin Detroit
text:
I have to go to Detroit a few times a year for business purposes and I always stay at the Hilton Garden Inn In general Hilton Garden Inns are good bets for business travelers because most contain the following free Internet access microwave fridge VERY comfortable bedding quiet guests who are also business travelers and not partiers fitness center and pool The one in Detroit has a breakfast diner that serves the typical breakfast fareI always get pancakes and the fresh fruit 
The staff at this particular Garden Inn are very courteous and accommodating One hotel desk manager was especially kindI think his name was Dwayne perhaps Staff were very helpful and responsive 
The hotel is located in a somewhat odd area but all areas of Detroit are kind of odd at this point in time The city is riddled with closeddown shops and restaurants Each section of the city is hitormiss on each block The Hilton Garden Inn is within walking distance to Comerica Park and Ford Field Game nights tend to attract rowdier guests The hotel is also within walking distance to a CVS Ben and Jerrys and the Hard Rock Cafe Just ask hotel staff to point you in the right direction

title: Great hotel great location clean and great views
