text: Awesome hotel in perfect location Clean great viewsstayed in tower one with balcony Get a balcony facing bridge What a view Staff friendly great services I will stay here every time in San Fran Close to cable car

title: Great hotel with great staff Ellen
text:
The location of the hotel is perfectits close to Central Park and Time Square
The staff working at the hotel is great Particularly Ellen who worked at the concierge desk was fantastic She made the whole process faster and more efficient My friend and I arrived a little earlier than the check in time which is 4pm but she was able to find us a room without making us wait It really made our experience a lot better 
I didnt eat at hotels restaurant so Im not sure if thats good But for a short stay in NY this hotel is a great value

title: It has now been 5 weeks since we stayed at this hotel 1 night but were charged for two And I still dont have my money back
text: During our stay there the front desk was so rude They do not have the continental breakfast that they advertised either

title: Great Hotel in the middle of the action
text: Spent 3 nights here in a partial water view thanks to the manager who upgraded me from a straight city ciew room This is a lovely hotel surprisingly quiet given its location just metres from the Pike Street Market Comfy beds very clean bathrooms unobtrusive service and good restaurants on site Bacco for breakfast was excellent but busy with lovely food and fresh juices Very good place to stay in the heart of Seattle

title: Prime location with phenomenal views from balcony  Bfast buffet
text: I recommend asking for a high floor overlooking Logan Square The view is spectacular Elevators are not slow unless there are many stops which during peak check in and out times they are very slow Breakfast buffet is downstairs in the TGI Fridays and very acceptable All in all this hotel is a great value Oh and free beer and full alcohol bar each evening in the lobby for the managers reception Parking is very expensive and you should really just not bring your car here anyway If you must park the garage across the street is 10 cheaper per day

title: Take care in booking this hotel
text: I stayed here 4260642906 This hotel is undergoing floorbyfloor renovations As a Priceline guest paying just 60 a night I was only offered a runofthehouse roomsmoking on the third floor with the comment from the front desk clerk that that was all they could do because I booked the room online I couldnt breath for three nights I could hear late night noise from people exiting nearby clubs on the street and I was awakened at 530 one morning by the slamming of a liftgate on a foodservice truck making a delivery below my window Add to this a security guard firm was using a room down the hall for hiring with people camped outside the elevator Not a pleasant stay at all In another room on another floor this would have been a great deal Sometimes you get what you pay for

title: Value for Money
text: I must say I was worried about going to this hotel but I had no need The Hotel is spotlessly clean the staff are extremely helpful and pleasant the beds are clean and confortable I have travelled and stayed in many hotels and this one is very good value for the money On the down side it is a little way from the likes of Time Square and 5th avenue shopping area but we got a Metroticket for 29 lasting 7 days and is unlimited travel this I would also recommend Regarding the noise from the trains we never heard a thing just ask for a room on the quiet side of the hotel The location is in China Town and the shops display all their wares in the pavement which makes it a bit smelly but once past these shops everything is fine I would not let this put you off I would stay here again it is value for money

title: Never stay here
text:
Just one word  Terrible 
I read many reviews before our stay and became very convinced that the hotel would be great I booked for 8 nights and got a pretty good rate for the queen pod
We arrived at the hotel in the evening after a 9h flight and some hours immigration queuing I had asked the hotel for a quiet room in forhand to make sure we would get some sleep 
The room was really small and had a window to the bathroom why Our room was located in the ninth floor so I was sure it was going to be silent BUT outside our window there was a huge chimney and about 5 acdevices that made a horrible noice It was like staying inside the engine room of a passanger boat We tried to get some sleep in the hardasconcrete bed When the time was 0700am and we had slept about a blink of an eye I went downt to the reception and informed that we were going to change hotel
The decoration and lightning in the corridor were straight from some brothel they even had half nude people running around
The only good thing about this place was that they didnt try to argue when we wanted to leave
Do not trust these reviews the only thing this hotel is good for is arriving dead drunk and leaving with vision impairing day after

title: Great hotel comfortable and fun
text: My wife and I stayed here in November and had a great time The guys could not haver been more friendly and helpful Location is great and they make very helpful suggestions of stuff to do in a newsletter every morning Rooms are comfortable and fun

title: Very comfortable stay
text: I am here with my son for our first trip to New York We chose this hotel as it is one of the few to have twin beds Our room is big spacious and clean and comfortable We have a room to the rear on the 17th floor of the north tower so the view over the city skyline is spectacular Staff are friendly and helpful The location is greatcentral being close to Columbus Circle and Central Park They even filmed an episode of Law and Order here the other day The lobby area and the bar are very nice My 17 year old son was able to sit with me and have a soft drink I would definitely come here again so long as I could get one of the higher up rooms with the fabulous views Very nice hotel

title: perfection has a name Four Seasons in Beverly Hills
text:
We stayed two nights in a suite in this hotel When we arrived we met one of the most friendliest receptionists ever He was very interested in Europe and The Netherlands We were escorted to the room together with our luggage this is very efficient
The room was beautiful decorated A large living room and a large bedroom We had two bathrooms In the room they have an Ipad so you can order roomservice concierge assistance etc from the Ipad 
The spa area is beautiful but without rest area The swimming pool is heated the service is like the rest of the hotel perfect I went to the gym and sauna and left my bracelet in a locker The staff from the spa did not know my name but when I was in the lobby the receptionist came to me and said that I left my bracelet in the spa So they could describe me and reception did know who I was The spa reception excused because they did not know my name I said that I liked the service a lot as they knew me All the staff know you immediately For example when we had breakfast on our second day the lady in the restaurant knew what we ordered the day before Another lady in the restaurant she served lunch the former day knew us and came to us for a small talk This is service we appreciate and like 
One thing that was not top was the reservation for a restaurant I gave 2 names to the concierge for a restaurant Thought it was one restaurant but by accident gave 2 different restaurants I also said that if they did not have a table I wanted to go to another trendy restaurant They made reservations for one of the two I gave unfortunately this was not a trendy restaurant Partly it was my fault as I gave two names partly the concierge could contact me and asked which restaurant I was more interested for The food in the other restaurant was good but I expected another restaurant
We liked this hotel so much If we return to LA we definitely will come back This hotel is known for the service We got the best service in America in this hotel

title: Simply the best
text: The staff very very friendly and Knowledgeable Great midtown location Rooms very clean Received cookies upon arrival We were checked in by Vicki employee of over thirty years She went above and beyond to meet all our needs I will choose this hotel in the near future

title: A Tad Expensive the Roosevelt  But the old 20s decor makes up for it
text:
My wife and I stayed in the Roosevelt for 3 days whilst we were on a short break to New York the rooms are quite small but the decor is in the 1920s theme and I think thats when the hotel was built 
We really enjoyed are stay and it is central for everything in NYC we even used the room service one night at a cost of about  50 Like other people have mentioned it is just around the corner from Central Station 
Lots has been already said about this hotel so I will keep it short
Lots of rooms Reasonable Service and Staff Expensive to stay but it is central like a comfortable suit its got it all  Nice
Mark  Michaela

title: One of the best hotels Ive ever stayed at
text:
LIterally i would go to New York again just to stay at this hotel I could not fault this hotel in the slightest it is modern it is clean the staff were the nicest and most helpful ive ever come across The roof top terrace was amazing relaxing by day and buzzing by night The location was top notch
The Hotel
The hotel itself is modern and clean It has an amazing rooftop terrace and is also connected to the Rare Bar  Grill which serves lovely food
The Rooms
Me and my partner stayed in one of the suites and my friends stayed in the standard room The suite was absolutely worth the money Theyre not that much more expensive than the standard rooms and the amount of space you get is incredible for the price All modern furnishings with a wet room large COMFORTABLE bed the most comfortable bed ive ever slept on I went in to my friends room which was the Standard room this was modern clean and same comfortable bed which was a large double enough space to walk around etc and just in general a really nice room
Location
Took about 10 minutes to get to 34th street where there is and endless amount of shops and also just a couple of blocks away there are many little bars and irish pubs and restaraunts which are not crowded by tourists and along with it cheap prices including 1 Draft night on Tuesdays Literally you come out the hotel you turn left if you want to head out and see the sights and the main shopping areas or you turn right if you want to see the more local side of new york little bars and pubs and restaraunts that arent extremely busy and rather cheap
The reception staff gave me a list of restaraunts to try out each one was absolutely amazing and the food was better than anything i had in Times Square or on 34th Street
Across the street and down a little bit literally two minutes you have a little convenience store if you need anything down a few blocks you have a uro Diner which reminds me of the classic american diners you see in the films that serve all the pancakes and large milkshakes and everything
Couldnt have asked for a better location when i was visiting New York
Thank you to everybody at the Affinia for what was an amazing stay

title: Nice hotel location just okay
text:
The Distrikt Hotel is a very nice design hotel located across the street from the Port Authority bus terminal 
The hotel has minimalist design and small rooms that are comfortable and clean The free wifi works well and they include nice little touches such as chocolates on your pillow a New York Times every morning and complimentary beverages in the lobby On a rainy day they had platy of umbrellas available for guests
The only downside is the neighborhood It isnt terrible  they have cleaned up the Port Authority a lot in recent years But the neighborhood is less fun than may others in Manhattan That said there are some great restaurants in Hells Kitchen and Times Square that are only a short walk away It is also very convenient to the Javits Center

title: Loved the location will recommend it to friends fabulous room
text: Staff were very friendly from our first greeting at the cab door when taking our bags to our speedy check in We had one of the renovated rooms on the 15th floor a two bedded suite which was immaculately clean The beds were extremely comfortable just what was called for after long days treking the city This was my first time staying in NY city with my 12yr old son and im really glad i choose this hotel for its location comfort and safety I thought it was a bit overpriced initially when booking on line but after 4 nights stay it was so worth it I would definitely stay here again but would book earlier in advance to get a better deal I loved the fact that they held our luggage after check out so that we could browse the streets for a few hours before we actually left town And yes i had read about the noise from the firestation nearby but after the 2nd night it didnt really bother uswe were so exhausted we slept soundly

title: Awesome Family Trip
text: My husband and I spent Labor Day weekend at this hotel with our 2 girls ages 2 and 3 At first we were looking into staying Downtown as there was an Art Fair we wanted to attend but after much consideration we found this hotel and read the reviews and thought wed give it a shot It looked more kidfriendly than the hotels in Downtown San Diego It really exceeded our expectations Great water front location great staff clean rooms nice decor nice outdoor pool  patio area and excellent food options in the area There is a nice walkway and about a mile from the hotel there is a nice park with two playgrounds one for older kids and the other for toddlers Also in the Liberty Station area there is a restaurant called the Corvette Diner that we stumbled upon which is a 50s Diner where the staff dresses up and the women have beehive hairstyles and dance around The girls loved it and so did we The location of the hotel is convenient and close to Downtown and Coronado which we loved Highly recommend

title: Good location
text:
Unassuming hotel within easy walking distance to Madison Square Park Flatiron Building Madison Square Garden Empire State Building and 34th Street shopping area The decor is fashion themed  multicoloured mural made of thread spools in lobby mannequins in front window and sewing themed prints in hotel rooms Interestingly there is no sewing kit provided
My daughter and I had room 1103 with 2 double beds Very comfortable Roomy Tiny closet but adequate for a weekend stay Has a safe inside Nice bathroom although the sink leaks  solved by placing the waste basket underneath Bite sized cupcakes at reception was a very delicious touch The Biggest disappointment in this day and age is that they charge for internet connection  quite unusual for most equivalent hotels

title: Great staff hotel needs refresh
text:
We stayed in Le Meridien for over 3 days during the week while we had some social and business events The BEST thing about Le Meridien is that they allow dogs AWESOME Second the staff are really great very attentive and client oriented 
However their rooms do need a refresh We stayed on a high floor in a junior suite but the room just felt dusty and a bit worn The bed was not particularly comfortable Overall however it was clean I would really hesitate now to put my business travelers here
The lobby also needs some help There were several noticeable large dark stains on the lobby carpet right upon check in and walking through the lobby 
Overall great location nice staff But the property itself is discouraging

title: Once grand now mediocre Doesnt live up to its name
text:
I usually associate this hotel chain with upscale properties Sadly this hotel has passed its prime 
the carpets are DIRTY and threadbare in places There was a patch under the desk in our room that was actually coming unsewn
the poor maintence man had to come to our room three times for a clogged toilet I know dont say it
The ice machines on 3 of the 4 floors were not working
The chrome on the fixtures in the bathroom was coming off
We booked our room through Hotwire and the price we paid through it was just about right or even a little too much
They count on special events to fill the place when we were there there was a soccer tournament nearby can you imagine what that was like Wisely the kids were banned from certain floors 
Now the good nice personnel
In short Id opt for other places nearby which are much nicer newer and cheaper
Look for this Crown Plaza to be removed from the Crown Plaza line of hotels soon It simply doesnt measure up to their high standards

title: Great hotel in heart of Korea Town NYC
text: We booked a block of rooms at Hotel Stanford for our wedding this past fall and the hotel was a dream Its by far the most affordable hotel that is centrally located and we love KTown so that was a major plus The rooms are not huge but definitely a decent standard size They are very clean and have all the amenities you would expect Customer service was EXCELLENT Curtis an assistant manager in the group reservations department was incredibly helpful very responsive and prompt with emails and phone messages and personally greeted us when we arrived Room service and housekeeping were also very helpful The executive suites are very nice especially the bathrooms which have showers and bathtubs Id definitely recommend this hotel for individual travelers and for groups

title: Residence Inn ManhattanTimes Square
text:
I would definitely recommend this hotel It is a 20 minute walk or 5 min taxi to Grand Central Station so you can get or catch the airport shuttles to La Gaurdia or JFK that was 2100 round trip Also a not to far to walk to Times Square or many other attractions Was nice to walk by Byrant Park looked so relaxing The staff was always friendly and helpful The room was very nice we changed our choice of room and was able to obtain one as soon as we arrived at 930 am It ended up being a wheel chair accessable room which was fine we had a view of the ESB The only down side is there were large fans on the roof of the building next door so would not want to open the window But we did not want it open anyways The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable The only comment I would say against the room is it was way too cold but they did come and fix that for us The breakfast buffet was very nice way to start the day and ended up being the only meal of the day we did have everyday 
If you are looking for something to eat near by cross over Avenue of Americas and go up 39th Street to Cafe 39 just a few doors up they have a great Chicken Wrap small chips and pickle for 536 tax incl It was so filling it lasted me two meals

title: 5 Star Entrance 4 Star Bedrooms 3 Star Bathrooms
text:
I am going to break this review down to 3 parts 1 the entrancelobby 2 the bedrooms and 3 the bathrooms 
1 The lobby entrance  5  5 
When you walk into this hotel you will instantly feel out of place in a good way Everything looks new grand and magnificent
2 The bedrooms  45
We stayed in a cosey double double The bedroom was small but adequate The air con unit was loud but that did not annoy me The double beds were very comfortable The room had a large tv with lots of channels All in all the room looked like it did online except for the lack of a good street view  luck of the draw I guess
3 The bathroom  35
The bathrooms are not new They look like they are years out of date The ground gives off the impression that it is dirty when in fact its likely just years of wear and tear 
In summary I would come back here again to stay but it would still need to remain a cheaper option  The total price on my bill was 750 for 3 nights stay I agree with other reviewers that the checkin desk people were not very pleasant However on the upside the cleaners always had a smile on their faces and said hello This hotel is very very close to everything that matters in NYC

title: Modern clean and friendly
text: Very nice modern hotelvery clean and a great location downtown The valet and shuttle staff were very helpful Beds were very comfyWould stay again for sure

title: bed and breakfast on a larger scale
text:
Once again my partner and I had to leave the heat of Texas and go somewhere we felt at home We went to the Hotel Figueroa and enjoyed ourselves as always in paradiseThe feeling is of a bed and breakfast but on a larger scale We sat by the poolwhich by the way is the nicest I have seen and spoke to a couple from BrazilThat night having drinks at the bar we engaged in conversations with some Dutch people along with some from Australia
 Our room had a king size bed and plenty of closet spaceThe canopy and flowing fabrics above the bed made it a romantic and relaxing feeling when you went to sleepWe inquired about the other rooms from the owner Uno and he graciously told us about the history of the rooms he showed usIt was fascinating to hear all the stories
 Each time we stay there I find something else about this hotel that marvels me and makes it even more special
 In a world where people have become so into themselves this place makes you feel like there is hope out there when other countries can sit down together and just laugh

title: Great HotelA must stay
text: This was my first time visiting Chicago it was a family trip so I wanted it to be a memorable and rewarding experience The Palmer House was definitely the place to make this happen The hotel was great Had a little plumbing problem notified the front desk and we were placed in another room and compensated I really enjoy the historic ness of the hotel and my eleven year old daughter loved it Would definitely stay here again Its in the heart of everything could not have picked a better hotel The breakfast buffet was awesome Homemade omelets cooked to order and all the extras you could want The concierge was a great help very knowledgeable about the surroundings Loved it Loved it Loved it The beds were like sleeping on CLOUDS

title: Elegant Hotel in a good location
text:
We stayed at The Algonquin for 5 nights on our first ever visit to New York The location in the Theatre District is very good It is not too far from the metro although no stop is really close either 
Reception was consistently friendly and helpful 
The room was not large but perfectly comfortable Had a very good double bed flat screen tv a nice little walk in cupboard and a large room safe The bathroom was a decent size very clean and had bath  shower with lots of powerful hot water
Overall the hotel has a bit of elegance It is not just a standard box with standard box rooms It is in a quieter street and there is a very good diner  The Red Flame  for breakfast just a couple of doors down There are several other restaurants near the hotel too
I think this was a really good choice of hotel

title: Best Hotel for the Money in NYC
text: I found this hotel in the AAA guidebook in 1986 I havent stayed anywhere else on my trips to NYC The location and price have always more than met my needs Its close to Central Park Subways and right across the street from Carnegie Hall The staff is friendly and helpful The elevators can be slow at peak times And the 4 Continental Breakfast could be better But I will continue to stay at the Salisbury on my next trips to the Big Apple

title: Honeymoon Retreat
text:
My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful 2night stay at the Langham Due to work commitments we had had to postpone our honeymoon for almost a year and finally were able to take a muchneeded vacation back to my home state of Massachusetts We stayed at several properties during that time and the Langham far exceeded the rest in quality and service In making our reservation we had noted that the trip was a honeymoon and when we arrived at our room we were greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine hors doeuvres beautiful roses and a handwritten card It was a lovely unexpected touch
The hotel itself is extremely convenient in location  just steps from Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall and close to all the shopping you could hope for The room was very clean and quiet and had a great view of the financial district Plush robes and slippers are provided and the beds are extremely comfortable The bathroom was large and spacious 
The only difficulty we had was in finding parking when we first arrived but that was handled fairly quickly Well be staying at the Langham again when we return to Boston

title: Excellent location friendly staff and comfy rooms
text: My daughter and I stayed here for a week Our room was a great size with a kitchenette The room was quiet and comfortable I agree with one of the other reviews that plates would have been helpful in the kitchenette but we made due We grabbed some extra disposable cutlery at Whole Foods The little coffee shop down the street has wonderful croissants and the best apple juice which we enjoyed eating on the roof top of the hotel Loved the neighbourhood and felt very safe at all times of day and night Close to Grand Central Station an easy walk for a six year old We cant wait to come back

title: Grand service location and FIREWORKS
text:
We stayed at The Willard Hotel for several days over the July 4th holiday Our taxi brought us to the front of the hotelwow The pictures do not do it justice We were greeted by friendly staff at the door and directed to checkin The ceiling in the lobby is magnificent the State Seals of each state is painted on the ceilingjust beautiful There is an antique room key divider behind the desk Our bags were brought up to our room promptly We had a beautiful room extremely large suite with luxurious vintage Carrera marble bathroom Extremely clean room with comfortable beds with a view of the side streetUnfortunately LOUD construction complete with concrete trucks jackhammers started that night at midnight and continued until 7am We were moved that morning to another room with an apology from the front desk staff The second room was smaller but just as clean and comfortable
We used the exercise room which is in the spa area downstairs The exercise room looks out to the sunbathing area in a courtyard
A BBQ was held at the Parc restaurant outside on the 4th looked good but we ate elsewhere
The fireworks were amazing we sat outside the hotel and had a fantastic view 
Staff at the Willard were courteousholding doors open for our daughters and ourselves hailing taxis etc 
Location was great for us with two children Corner Bakery was near the rear entrance of the hotelclose to Metroand shopping CVS 
I would highly recommend The Willard Hotel

title: my visit to New york
text: The wow factor of visiting New York for the first time was matched only by staying at the skyline Hotel and swimming in the pool on the top floor of the hotel whilst looking across at the Empire Sate bulidingvery surrealThe food was of excellent quality and the staff very helpful and friendly

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: My husband and I stayed here twice this year and each visit was extremely disappointing First Im not one to nit pick but I do expect quality customer service Each time this establishment was under par The General Manager is clueless On our first visit I filled out the guest survey and she sent us a letter for an upgrade to a suite if we gave them another chance You would have thought they would have made some kind of note on our account to make sure that our every need was taken care of for our visit Not the case Called room service and asked for a bottle of champagne The rep said that she didnt have the liquor cabinet key and she wasnt going to be able to do that for us Not one attempt to resolve the situation or just say of course and figure it out on her own Our room was not properly cleaned Empty Champagne bottle left in room chairs askew from the table Countless of things But what made me more upset than anything was how the General Manager handled the complaint Not only that but the President of the company wasnt much better and gave her employee the way out instead of apologizing for her General Manager behavior If you want decent hotel service I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Nice hotel to stay in NY
text: They have very helpfull staffNice hotel with good location very close to area attractions

title: College Roomies Reunion was great at the Hilton Garden Inn
text:
My college roomies and I spent a wonderful 4 day weekend at this hotel It is the staff that makes this hotel experience wonderful There was a little mix up at checkin when our room still was not ready by check in time but the staff quickly corrected this and gave us breakfast vouchers for the hotel restaurant We were very pleased They were more than happy to check our baggage when we arrived early the day of checkin and then again when we had a later flight after we checked out Our room was always clean and the few times that we ran into housekeeping the ladies were so friendly and cheery The front doorman got to know our faces and always had something funny and cheerful to say to us 
The location was great the subway just a mere block or two away depending on which color you needed Times Square was literally just around the corner and over a couple of blocks and we came to love the fact that the hotel was slightly removed from the chaos there You could be in the heart of it all in a few steps but you didnt have to fight crowds every time you went out the front door 
Our room was lovely The microwave and minirefrigerator are a rare find in an NYC hotel room The size of both the room and the bathroom was very large by any standard not just NYC standards The room not only had two beds but two QUEEN beds which I have not seen in any other NYC hotel The room stayed temperate all the time which we loved since the temperature outside hung at about 95 degrees during our visit Wifi was free and easy to access We would come in the door after a long day and say Were home

title: Great Party and Excellent Party Planner at this hotel
text: We had a birthday party for approx 25 guests at the pools at this location We dealt with Jennifer Bryant the party planner at this hotel She went above and beyond to help us and deal with our budget She even stopped by at our party to see how it was going I highly recommend this party host and this location The location was spectacular with two beautiful pools water slide great cabanas and excellent food choices My 13 year old and her guests were thrilled I cant wait to plan another party with Jennifer Bryant and The Pointe Hilton at Tapatio Cliffs in Phoenix Arizona

title: Nice hotel and cannot wait to return
text: Great location and most of hotel staff very friendly The front desk very responsive to special requests We only wish there was in room or complimentary coffee or tea at hotel

title: Nice clean with large rooms
text: We stayed here in July for a mini family vacation We had two large rooms that were very clean The lobby was nice with free wireless internet access Adjacent to the Holiday Inn Express which had an indoor pool which we could use Had underground parking and was a 5 minute walk to the Space Needle Could use the monorail to get to downtown We used the free bus service to jump from underground station to underground station to get around town We paid 89 which was the cheapest the manager had seen with the entertainment card

title: Great Place to Put your Wedding Guestsand the Bride and Groom
text: My Husband and I reserved a room block at the Holiday Inn Center City for our wedding guests as well as ourselves for the wedding night We were having our reception at a local venue along the Charlotte Light Rail and wanted guests to be able leave the reception and easily get to the hotel andor go out on the town for the rest of the night In addition we rented a suite at the hotel to get ready in for the wedding The staff at the hotel was AMAZING After getting ready we wanted to use some areas of the hotel for pictures and the staff was great about helping us access these rooms In addition they allowed us to use the rooftop to take additional night time photos They also made sure all of our guests received their out of town gift bags when they checked in All of the rooms have been renovated and are extremely clean We would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone looking for a room block or just a nice place to stay in Charlotte

title: Second visit thoughts 4 years on
text:
We first visited the Grand Del Mar the year it opened and were very impressed hence when the opportunity came to visit San Diego again we did not hesitate to book a second stay
Was it as good as the first time Almost the staff and hotel itself were excellent standards as high as before all the staff were very courteous and friendly and the rooms were beautifully kept with no expense spared to provide beautiful towels and bed linens daily
Only a couple of grumpy comments regarding the adults only no cellphone rule at the quiet poolwhy put families with young children in the rooms opening directly onto the serenity pool area and why dont other guests take note of the no cellphone rule This was really annoying as people could not be bothered to get off their backsides and move away from the pool area to speak on their phone When Im trying to relax and read in a quiet area I do not want to hear other peoples boring conversations A few of the pool attendants mostly young students were brave enough to ask guests to put the phones away but the majority did nothing about it The hotel needs to make this rule more obvious there are signs but not big enough ones
Another tip would be to check your account daily which you can do on the room tv as we found that on the first day somebody else had charged their breakfast to our room It was taken off our account but best to do it as soon as it occurs and saves time on checkout We paid cash as much as possible and ate breakfast at the cafe on the third floor and kept all receipts until the end of our stay in case there were any other occurances
Finally as the hotel is spread out over three floors there can be a very long walk to the room ours was at a far corner of the hotel which involved a trek to the lobby and pool area There was probably a short cut by going outside but we never discovered it Therefore if you find a long walk too much request a room close to the centre of the hotel
We spent 13 nights there and it was definitely more enjoyable for us when the weekend crowd disapeared as the pool area was a lot more relaxing which was the main reason for our stay trying to pack a years worth of sun into 2 weeks important when you live in rainy England the hotel is much busier than during our last trip but we were also there during the 4th July which is a major deal in the US and we are glad that the hotel is obviously enjoying success
On balance still one of my favourite hotels to stay at

title: It didnt meet my expectations
text:
I stayed in this hotel in MidJuly with my family and to be honest this hotel isnt really what I expected The hotel looked more of and office block What made the hotel even more undesirable was the extremely noisy air conditioning in the room this made our sleep unbearable Too when we arrived it was over 100 and when we went in our room there was one bottle of water for 6 and when we checked out it took 15 minutes
I had higher expectations for this class of hotel

title: Small but perfectly formed
text:
I was really happy with Hotel Azure
The staff were friendly and really helpful with local restaurant tips and things to do that tourists wouldnt know about the local secrets
Our room was very small but perfectly arranged and we had completely expected space to be a premium in New York City
The Hotel is at the corner of Little Italy Soho and ChinaTown and there is a great buzz around the area with local delights in close proximity
We were in walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge and the Financial District and a subway station right next to the Hotel which definitely helps
The hotel looked after our bags even once we had checked out for the rest of the day Free local calls from the hotel
Basically I would sum Hotel Azure up as
Small but perfectly formed
I would happily stay there again

title: Adequate but not impressive
text: I just finished staying here and it was an OK experience The free breakfast was nice but not exactly an appetizing selection each morning What I did like was that there was an infinite supply of free coffee in the lobby One of the two elevators in the hotel was out of service and I was on the 11th floor It was a real pain to wait for the elevator and the stairs were not only narrow but steep They were an acceptable access point up until about the 15th floor If I needed to go any higher it was a long and tedious wait for the elevator The rooms were alright We had four people in one of the rooms and were were somewhat cramped The beds were alright but the pillows are extremely soft so if you need a firm pillow I suggest bringing your own Its a great location though Id give my stay a three for what we paid

title: Good service great location
text: I recently stayed here for 4 nights on a vacation to San Antonio The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful The accomodations were clean and comfortable We had difficulty with ordering NFL Sunday ticket on our tv and the hotel staff were kind enough to spend a half hour attempting to troubleshoot the problem and when they found out that the service was down for the entire hotel they comped us free breakfast for the remainder of our stay The hotel location was perfect for enjoying the downtown area and I loved that room service was available 24hrs I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I return to the area

title: Another lovely hotel with poor staff
text:
Hotel was beautiful Just like something right out othe pages of history The staff however well they were lacking to say the least When I came to check in I was clearly bothering Ann I think that was her name at the front desk She was englufed in whatever she was typing and who am I to interupt The bellman were just as rude Had to say excuse me as we walked through the front door becuase the doorman and the bellman were standing in the doorway talking When we had to check bags I was handed a ticket and that was it No do you know where you are going or come pick them up here later Perhaps I am asking for too much When I checked out I had our bags held came back later on and stood at the bellstand while the same bellman stood talking to someone else who worked there and kept looking at us We clearly needed help but he was again too busy talking to be concerned with us He finally came over and tells us that he does not have a key the other bellman has the only key 
Our suite was beautiful though Great touch with the bottles of water and plums in the room AC in the bedroom did not work as well as it did in the living room and our bed had no sheet just a duvet

title: Great stay night before cruise
text: I knew we  adult son 22 yrs old pre teen daughter 12 yrs and self would have a long drive to our cruise port out of Jacksonville FL wanted a nice place for us all to sleep comfortably the night before our cruise after the drive in and that was close by the port After searching decided to stay here last Sept 18 2011 and was so glad I did we arrived late the front desk was pleasant even at the unpleasant hour of night   directed us to the closest door and directions to our room The room was very large and nicely laid out for the three of each having our own queen bed to sleep in Very clean room  nice breakfast and met several other guests going on the same cruise  a pre cruise get together lol Check out was not until noon which was a HUGE plus since we could not check in to our cruise until noon We didnt use the pool or fitness room due to arriving late evening but did visit appeared clean with extra towels in fitness area Would highly recommend this hotel and stay here again if taking another cruise out of Jacksonville in the future

title: Fantastic location
text: We were bit worried about staying at the Roosevelt but our stay was fine Located corner of Madison Ave designer shops Its about a 40 min drive from JFK airport Roughly 55 We stayed on the 4th floor Room was small but adequte for two people Bathroom was large Only problem with the shower was tha the drain hole was near the door so water would be all over the bathroom floor Towels avaliable and changed everyday Bathroom also has soaps creams shower gels Flat screen tv Wardrobes and drawers avaliable Hotel is a few steps from Grand Terminal Fantastic location with all the major attractions close by If you want to book theatre tickets you can book them in the reception area Hotel is clean There are shops on the ground floor we had trouble with openning our hotel room door because the key would not work all the time Safes are avalable free of charge in the roomWe booked Mary Poppins on the day of the show from the box office i would recconmand to book them before you travel otherwise its gets very expensive When you go to NY you must try one the Pink Berrys Amazing Loved the stay as we were hardly in the hotel so it was just what we needed Shopping go to Soho Best shops and 5th Ave Food is on 9th ave We also did the sex and the city tour which was brillant Yo ucan breakfast from anywhere if your hotel does not provide it New York is amazing

title: Lots of wow
text:
We booked 5 nights through Priceline and got a real bargain but had to stay there just to say we did There are renovations going on outside so maybe thats why were able to stay for 200 a night
Let me say this place is nice Our room was big enough for two rooms in some hotels and it looked great We overlooked Park Avenue from the 9th floor
We didnt eat at the hotel because its certainly very pricey The staff was extremely good and everything was spotless
It is well located for most activities and we always felt safe in the neighbourhood
One little thing that bugged me was they charge 16 per day for wifi that most hotels offer for free It seemed a little odd for a premium hotel
It would be an incredible place if you had an unlimited budget but if money matters to you at all youd best think hard about this one

title: W Hotel is the Best in Dallas Hands Down
text:
My wife and I stayed at the W Hotel on our anniversary recently so we could walk to dinner at Kenichi and go to a concert at House Of Blues The service was an after thought for us when booking but I have to say I have not experienced such excellent service from any company in a long time
Thomas the general manager saw to it that every special request I made was fulfilled EXACTLY as I had requested and even took it a step further From check in to to inroom service and every experience in between it was perfect The atmosphere is great rooms are always immaculate and it was service with a smile all around We stay at the Ritz on occasion but I much prefer the attitude at the W  luxury all the way  hip

title: Fresh Air
text: The manager must be very meticulous because every staff member cared about our experience the hotel was spotlessclean and the attention to detail was obvious The room was great and the windows open for fresh air The restaurant manager went out of her way to help us find glutenfree options  the chef even modified a recipe for us The Max is a great hotel

title: The perfect oasis for a trip to the city
text: The Affinia Dumont is a lovely hotel in an excellent location for easy walking to almost everything We shopped around Times Square saw Broadway shows and wandered the Lower East Side Little Italy and Greenwich Village from this peaceful and beautiful hotel right in the middle of the city

title: Good location reasonable price a little shabby
text: Dont be fooled by the glitzy website In exchange for a good location and a reasonable price for San Francisco be prepared for dingy hallways small rooms minuscule bathrooms and fireescape views That said the Diva does splurge on highend mattresses and bed linens and if you get a room at the back it will be very quiet

title: Nice hotel but be careful of the TV after dark
text: Had a very nice stay in the hotel until I accidentally flipped through the TV channels in the evening The porn channels are not blocked so it is easy to accidentally run across them Hotel caters to new GWU students and graduates so hard to believe this is what the hotel intends Raised the issue with the management by email but didnt even get a reply

title: RUDEST and WORST Customer Service EVER
text: Dont buy the groupon special If I could give no stars I would I was planning on buying the more expensive option Valid for checkin on Friday or Saturday I called to make a reservation for check in on Saturday and stay saturday and sunday night When I talked to the lady she said No its only valid for check in on friday I politely told her that the group on special states that it can be friday or saturday and the fine print also gives you that option She was very rude and said it was a mistake and she would not do it Then she said she would see if they even had a room available for me coming back to say you can only book a reservation if you get the deluxe king which would be 35 extra a nightI will never book through Groupon or anywhere with this hotel I understand if the groupon print was a mistake but she was very unprofessional and rude

title: Fanciest Hotel Ive Ever Stayed In
text:
I shot a wedding here and was amazed with the hotel when I walked in Right next to the White House Incredible The front desk was very helpful and informative as I didnt have a good idea of where anything was The lobby itself is quite impressive The gym was great and not crowded at all huge bonus for the gym being open 247 Location cant get any better did I mention its next to the White House I only have two negatives One is the parking the only option is 40 valet parking Its DC I understand I guess The other negative is wifi isnt included really guys I personally wouldnt have paid for it but I also travel on a much tighter budget Really nice hotel
PS The breakfast buffet is to die for If I woke up to a breakfast like this every morning Id be in Heaven and 500 lbs

title: Friendly staff
text:
Front desk staff were super They arranged transportation to the airport at the appropriate time and supplied and early breakfast for those of us leaving very early from the hotel
Room was basic but clean well equipped with coffee and refrigerator Bathroom was large clean and well supplied An excellent value
I would definitely say it was the best hotel we have stayed in the Denver Airport area

title: Not worth the price
text:
Summary this hotel is not worth the price I felt nickeled and dimed every time I turned around I do not recommend staying there
 The decor seemed to be a 70s acid trip gone awry My curtains bedspread and the bedskirt that was above the bed on the ceiling  what in the world is this called were a green floral paisley pattern It was tired old and icky
 Room service expected tips on top of the service charge and 18 mandatory tip The food wasnt that great either
 Paying for internet connection on a daily basis I dont understand why this isnt rolled into the price of the room 
 The front lobby hotel staff werent all that friendly  there were three of them standing there I was not even given a courtesy well be right with you acknowledgment

title: Warwick looks War Torn Look elsewhere
text:
The elevators were claustrophobically small My trip from the highest floor 33rd was always onerous due to small elevator car and multiple stops along the way Room carpet was blatantly filthy in large areas room 3301 to be exact Toilet broke with normal use TV Cable service was nonfunctional for most of one day on our twoday stay no I dont travel for the TV but it is our routine to put on a movie between sight seeing and dinner Only views were boring facades of adjacent buildings
I cant imagine all of these things happening simultaneously again but with all the hotel choices in NYC I dont think I will be staying here again The lobby was touted as having a major renovation and it was handsomebut who stays in the lobby

title: Loved the Muse
text: My husband and I stayed at The Muse from October 4thOctober 6th We loved it The Muses location is greatwe walked everywhere The hotel was very clean the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and we loved the wine hour The room was much bigger than I expected large by NYC standards I have no complaints and will recommend this hotel to all my friends and family that travel to NYC I highly recommend The Muse

title: Central Location Impersonal Atmosphere
text:
I stayed a long weekend at the Gansevoort Park in late January and I wasnt altogether impressed After the success of the original Gansevoort downtown there was significant hype about the opening of one closer to midtown The Gansevoorts location at a good median between uptown and downtown is probably the hotels largest asset as its atmosphere definitely is not The decor though trendy is not very tasteful and did not feel particularly luxe or interesting When we were at the Gansevoort the lobby was always impersonal and empty save for blaring house music and even verged on feeling kind of pathetic The room with a view of Park Ave was function though rather spare and the design did not feel very rich From the lobby to the halls to the guestroom the whole hotel felt cold and impersonal and the passiveness of the staff did not help 
The service at the Gansevoort Park while not terrible was certainly not standout The staff seemed to prefer standing beside the elevator rather than going out of their way the help Small things could be changed to improve the experience greatly For example we were offered the hotels Porsche to take us uptown and the driver apparently the car breaks down if it goes above 50th simply dumped us at the corner of 50th and Madison when in reality we were headed fifteen blocks away
Overall the Gansevoort Park is a decent but not special hotel and a very good value if discount rates can be found There are so many other choices of fivestars in NYC that I likely would not stay at the Gansevoort Park again

title: Comfortable Hotel Downtown
text:
A massive hotel  really a shopping center within a hotel Interesting design that has been filmed in a number of movies Glass cylinder towers with elevators that run on the outside On the lower levels are take out places as well as some sit down restaurants The pub with outdoor patio was fabled for having one of the best burgers in downtown LA  and the burger was very good There are also other shops The hotel itself has a few restaurants and a bar at the lobby level There is a Starbucks across the ramp from the pool The outdoor pool is pleasant  a massive office building overlooks it which can be a pleasant irony
My room was small but comfortable  very clean and fairly well appointed  although a bit dated Bed was very nice Due to the cylndrical nature of the hotel the windows on the room curve around
The hotel is downtown and as such street parking is virtually nonexistent Hotel parking is 25 per day Expensive but they were fairly efficient and pleasant There is another lot across the street from the hotel parking entrance but I dont know the cost
Id probably stay here again if I wanted to be in dowtown LA

title: Good stay and great location
text: I stayed at the Sofitel the weekend of Aug 11th thru the 13th and I would definitely stay againThe hotel was nice and cleanthe staff was polite and helpfuland I have no complaints about my roomMy room was clean and everything workedI could even see the Hollywood sign from my bedThe only downside is the poolIts small and dosent fit the hotelbut that didnt stop me from getting my feet wetIn other newsYour right in the middle of everythingWalk out the front door and Rodeo Dr is 10 mins to your rightThe Groove and Farmers Market is 5 mins to your leftSanta Monica Pier is about 20 mins behind youVenice Beach is about 2025 mins in front of youand if you dont feel like driven The Beverly Center is right across the streetDefinitely check this place out

title: Not good for your health
text:
I would not recommend the hotel for many many reasons 
1 Service and attitude  really a mixed bag Some staff very helpful and friendly and others just talking amongst themselves and ignoring the guest
2 Lobby  so unattractive cold and unwelcoming
3 Location  Although convenient the restaurant was closed midday and there really is nothing for sit down in the immediate area 
4 Breakfast at Shulas  Terribly overpriced and the fruit was brown 
5 Rooms  Clean and comfortable but I asked for an nonfragranced room and guess what I got after two rooms moves a fragranced room 
Starwood has to get rid of these awful smelling rooms deodorizers Those of us with allergies and asthma cannot stay with you This is dangerous to our health 
Bottom line I love Starwoods but found this Westin a BIG step down from the brand that I had imagined You are over promising and under delivering 
Sorry but its true PS Stay well is not a good brand line since you obviously do not care about those of us with severe fragrance allergies

title: Great Hotel
text: The hotel was fabulous housekeeping was excellent and is close to the Alamo Riverwalk and is attached to a mall I got a great price for this hotel because of the conference I attended otherwise it is a bit pricy

title: A New Years To Remember
text: My partner was eager to spend New Years Eve in New York and I reluctantly agreed All I could picture were crowds noise and tacky 2007 sunglasses We made our reservation a few weeks prior and got a reasonable rate The Hotel is close to Times Square but we decided to brave it and drive in Surprisingly enough I recieved a phone call from an employee at City Club two days prior to our arrival informing us of the street closures in and around Times Square She was very pleasant suggesting that if we were driving to leave early not something I would expect from a NYC boutique hotel She even offered directions from New Jersey by train if we decided against taking the car I must admit this was a nice gesture We arrived at City Club and were greeted by the bellman at the curb The check in was quick and the staff offered assistance with dinner reservations and some suggestions on what was going on around town We had already had made reservations so declined their assistance before we knew it we were upstairs in our room which was wonderfully appointed clean and comfortable in size The water pressure in the shower was amazing the beds very comfortable and the service impressive I felt like I was part of the family right away Though our dinner reservations were not the best choice for us maybe we shouldve taken the offer for help at checkin our stay at City Club was great Ive already recommended it to my friends and will stay again And the best part was we didnt even feel like we were near Times Square

title: FunLively Easy Contemporary
text:
New concept easy as boarding a plane in First Class well organised in short but perfect space
Helpful welcoming staff with no snobishness as often seen in many hotels 
Great music for every time of day joyful Terrace where you long to hang around at all ours 
Well situated walking distance from the High Line so then to Meatpacking Greenwhich Times Square and Midtown and subway of course ACE line getting you every where

title: Friendly hotel in a central location
text:
I enjoyed my stay at The Handlery  I would stay there again As a family of four two adults two adultsized teenagers it was a good place to stay in terms of accommodation location  hotel atmosphere Given that the hotel is in the city centre it was sometimes noisy but I guess it is difficult to have one without the other Our sleep wasnt disturbed
I very much appreciated the hotel offer of free breakfast vouchers in the Daily Grill as San Francisco is not a cheap city to stay in
One San Francisco tip if you are travelling in August  bring warm clothes

title: Great value at the Renaissance
text:
I booked this hotel through AAcom and got a 79usd fare per night For that price this hotel was highly satisfying The location wasnt glamorous but it was very convenient close to the airport I arrived by midnight so that was a good thing and with easy access to most freeways
The room wasnt particularly big but it was comfortable The bed was what you would expect for a chain hotel like this one great sleep Bathroom and dcor were just average 
I didnt request much from the hotel staff so I cant say much about the service I had a nice stay and I would definitely stay here again if I got a similar rate

title: Delightful stay
text:
Much better than expected We tend to prefer BBs but none were available nearby for this time period The staff couldnt have been nicer the room was large and bright overlooking Independence park Beds and pillows were very comfortable and all seemed well taken care of Supercomfortable chairs for reading too
We didnt have a streetnoise problem because the AC was running so acted as white noise Slept very wellof course wed walked several miles each day
There are plenty of buses to get you wherever you need to go for 2 per person per trip discounts if you get a day pass but we enjoyed walking everywhere  strolling though Society Hill and along the water as well as hoofing it down Market Street about a mile or so to the Mutter Museum and the Franklin Institute Felt very comfortable wherever we walked
Be sure to visit the new 2010 National Museum of American Jewish History on Independence Mall  four floors of a historical timeline from Revolution to modern day Allow at least two hours
Didnt have meals at the hotel but LOVED their complimentary hors doevres in the evening Lobby is very comfortable to hang out in and chat with other guests For a large hotelactually felt quite cozy
Cosi and a casual countereatery called Mrs Ks were right next door and offered good inexpensive breakfasts
Only big complaint is the price of parking at the hotelwe left the car in a nice garage four blocks away to save about 14 per night

title: Great Hotel in a Superb Location
text: Stayed in the Chancellor Hotel and its really very good the room had all the facilities we needed There was no teacoffee making facilities in the room but they had it free in the Hotel Lobby The staff were helpful and friendly and the location was brilliant for the tour buses and restaurants

title: Great Stay
text: If you are going to the theater or doing midtown activities the Marriott Marquis is in an excellent location We were so impressed by the helpful staff everywhere Housekeeping was excellent very clean room and our towels were thick Our king room had a fold out sofa  perfect for me and my two teens The beds are very comfortable The view of Times Square was fantastic and instead of watching TV at night the kids would stare out the window Our room seemed quiet not a lot of outside noise However the walls are a bit thin and you could hear your neighbor use the bathroom next to you toilet flush and phone ring We were very lucky to have calm respectful people staying on either side of us so we had no noise issues Overall most of the guests were very pleasant not the Las Vegas type that come in the room and start a party at all hours The only criticism I have are the restaurant prices Im willing to pay extra for the convenience of an inhouse restaurant but the Marriott was too overpriced At least for dinner we were able to walk two blocks down 46th street to Restaurant Row and had some great food and no wait

title: Awful Stay Will never return
text:
June 26thJune 28th We have stayed at this hotel every time we have come to Baltimore
It has always been a great getaway and we always look forward to our stay there 
Our last stay was awful
 The Front Desk girl that was there was very hospitable We arrived 5 hours before check in time and she still found us a room right away She was very kind and always willing to help out with whatever we needed She made us dinner reservations and even brought our bottle of wine to our room 
The housekeeping staff could not understand a word that we said and we had left things on the dresser and in the bathroom when we went out for the day and everything was moved around when we came back It took me a few minutes to find my lotion that I had left out 
We did not have the room type that we wanted It said we had a Harbor View room and when we arrived our reservation said Garden View The Front Desk agent apologized profusely and she changed it back to what we originally reserved 
Upon check out I asked for the hotel managers card so I could call him and explain my concerns I left a message on his voice mail the next day and I still have not heard back I did not want to resort to putting this on here but seeing as no one has contacted me I feel it is my last resort 
It is a shame that we had a bad experience I hope to maybe return one day in the future and have it be like it was every other stay besides the last

title: The Perfect Choice
text: I find it tough to decide where to stay in a new city especially when we look for someplace reasonably priced The Donatello was a perfect choice Our corner room was large and clean The location is great Loved the club floor terrace and beverages Very nice to have a refrigerator and a safe We did not use the dvd player or microwave but had those too Every staff member was friendly and helpful We were on the 10th floor and the street noise was loud at night Its a big city There is going to be street noise

title: The Library Hotel  perfect location service and features
text:
I had previously stayed at the related Casablanca Hotel and thought that was fabulous but the Library Hotel was even better The location was brilliant the staff were welcoming helpful and very friendly 
The included features computers and printer in business centre breakfast reading room rooftop conservatory and garden tea coffee and snacks library of books and DVDs nightly cheese and wine reception were exceptional
I stayed in the smallest room type but was perfectly comfortable and found the room contained all that I needed It couldnt have been cleaner and I loved having a docking station as well as the beautiful library and tv and dvd player

title: Great time at JW Marriott in DC
text:
My son and I stayed at the JW Marriott Hotel Pennsylvania Avenue July 13  16 2006 and had a wonderful stay The lobby was elegant and very clean lots of comfy sofas and chairs to sit and chat or just people watch When we checked in earlier than the 4 pm check in time the desk representative gave my son a sun visor from the FBI and a White House snow globehe was thrilled 
The room was beautiful and newly refurbishedand a plasma tv which my son thought was out of this world Room had a view of the Washington Monument and if you looked to the far right you could see the Lincoln Memorial The beds were doubles but very comfortable especially after a long day walking around the city Bathroom is small but completely new and nicely appointed and meticulously clean Thick soft terry robes were in the closet and I saw lots of people wearing them back and forth to the pool
The location is greattwo blocks to the White House close to monuments on the mall metro etc 
Ate at Avenue Grille one evening for dinner and once for breakfast buffetFood was very good We also went to MS Grille around the corner  yummy food and also Corner Bakery corner of 14th  F Streets
We really enjoyed our stay in Washington and would highly recommend the hotel and would definitely stay there againand PS Im pretty picky when it comes to where I stay

title: Not for the working man
text:
Now lets start from the begining When me and family arrived in the valet we were greeted by very nice guys who emptied our luggage from the car while carrying on a nice conversation tip expected so be ready Now after check in we made it up to our room and our bags were right behind us different guy another tip When we got in our room the crib we asked for was not there no big deal one call and less than five minutes later another guy was there with the crib Again another tip and dont get me wrong it is well deserved but most of the workers expected it and would even linger around until they recieved it I know I sound cheap but I work for a living and every dollar I give to the valet for retrieving my car is taking away from what I can give my kids I would suggest if you drive park in the garage across the street It is 8 a day if u leave it is another 8 but you will be walking most of the time anyway It certainly beats the 32 plus tax for the hotel valet
The rooms were very clean and the turn down service was great Just about every night while we were out the turn down service would bring milk on ice and two huge cookies for my kids This hotel is very nice and should commended on their luxurious appeal Allthogh they are trying i dont think it is a very kid friendly place I would recommend this hotel to any couple looking for an expensive get awayand I do mean expensive

title: monaco rated 1 so we went and were sorry
text: Advice online that monaco is the bestpaid top dollar got a small room with a view of nothing but a brick walled hotel noisy geary street traffic all hours small bathroomnothing special very overrated so sorry to spend all that money many other hotels we visited would be far superior No service at the desk concierge seems like 20 somethings with attitude are running the place

title: Nice hotel not far from Dicks Sporting Goods
text: This was a nice hotel and some of the rooms have balconies The staff was very friendly Was there for concerts at Dicks Sporting Goods arena and it is not far from the hotel Lots of restaurants and convenience stores a short drive away Finding the hotel is difficult as you must make a left after passing over the road leading back to the highway It is easy to mess this up

title: Multiday stay in Fort Worth
text:
We stayed at the Hyatt Place Fort Worth Cityview in early June 2009 for five nights The hotel has the standard Hyatt Place brand setup and amenities After staying in different hotels in and near Fort Worth over the past few years we chose this hotel based on the Hyatt Brand which we prefer and the hotels general location The hotel is conveniently located off of I20 near several shopping centers and restaurants It is very convenient for accessing TCU which was our primary destination each morning It is a quick and easy 10 minutes drive to the campus 
Overall the stay was nice The hotel was very quiet The room size is standard compared to other Hyatt Place locations with plenty of space for luggage and for relaxing The room has plenty of electrical outlets for charging electronic equipment Staff members were very pleasant and always greeted us upon arrival The selfserve kitchen was well stocked with cereals yogurts and juices each morning 
Parking is sufficient but not covered and the area around the hotel is fenced off and separated from the shopping area and restaurants Exiting the hotel parking lot requires caution It is difficult to see crosstraffic as you leave and incoming traffic is typically traveling at fairly fast speeds Dont make the mistake of pulling out too far or without looking 
The quality of cleaning was lacking The floors were not cleaned and used glasses were never replaced despite placing them in obvious locations to indicate they had been used The television channel selection is somewhat lacking particular for children Ceiling in the bathroom is low particularly when you are in the shower If you are over 64 you will be hitting your head Be sure to duck 
Overall we were pleased with this hotel The cleaning was the biggest disappointment However the hotel is quiet and very conveniently located particularly if you are commuting to TCU Given the lack of decent options within this area of Fort Worth we would recommend this hotel and will likely stay again

title: Its a Sheraton what more do you need
text:
Stayed at the Sheraton Boston for a PreCruise hotel in October 2009 Previously we had booked a hotel in Cambridge but after a colleague noted how far from town that was So off to Priceline to see if we could snag another hotel This one came up at an attractive rate so we booked it
We were not disappointed Its centrally located and attached to one of the malls downtown
You have to realize this is a HUGE hotel Lots of people coming and going 
Even though we booked with Priceline this hotel put us into a Sheraton Rewards room  very nice customer service 
The one beef I have with all Sheraton hotels is their insistence in charging for WiFi The lobby was packed with people because that was the only space in the hotel where the WiFi was free Why not have it free in all the rooms now I posted something similar about a recent stay in Waikiki Are they listening
Rooms are spacious Bathroom spacious View of the Charles River was awesome
Would we stay at this hotel again Possibly but only for a stopover similar to this stay

title: Great stay at the Millennium Hilton
text:
My mom and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel The room was clean and very comfortable We didnt hear any streetconstruction noise from our room on the 12th floor The hotel was very accommodating and gave us a room with 2 double beds even though we had booked a king through priceline The room was quite large by NYC standards 
Its very accessible by public transportation and very easy to get to via train from Newark Airport Also you are able to print your boarding pass from the lobby which is a big plus

title: room with a view only on standing
text: The upholstery was shabby It didnt feel as if it was a 4star hotel The windows were so high that u could not look out if u sat on the bed or on the single dirty chair We requested 4 a room with a good view but the staff refused flatly saying they had no 2 doublebedded rooms with good views but i found my room with wonderful views of the river as well as empire state building very strange attitude of the staff  How long can one stand and admire the view Since the hotel is undergoing renovations i suggest they seriously consider increasing the window size so that one gets a good view without having to stand  This is the only good thing about the hotel After i complained that the hotel was not upto the mark they sent a microwave and a fridge to my room normally i think they charge extra 4 the microwave In the mornings theres a hotdog van down at the entrance which has good bagels and coffee At the next street are numerous places serving lovely food taxi takes about 57 to times square or u can walk it No free wifi either

title: Beautiful and Reasonably Priced
text: Decided to visit the Windy City for a 3night endofsummer treat with our college bound sons Found The Willows on line and it was just as lovely as the pictures had shown Rooms are very affordable had to rent two and the location was quite picturesque quaint Chicago neighborhood very quiet and away from downtown hysteria Still had plenty of stores and eateries just around the corner Breakfast included with stay afternoon sweets and best of all a daily complimentary pass to Ballys Fitness just around the corner Wine available in your room for only 15 a bottle and snacks for just a buck This place is a terrific find Will definitely be back

title: good downtown location
text: There for several days on business The staff was excellant the rooms were comfortable They serve breakfast each morning and dinner MonThursday It is all free and nice when you are looking to save money Although you will want to get out for dinner at one of the many good places nearby It is near the bay and easy walk You dont want to go to far off the beaten path though The inner city of Baltimore is really really bad I could not get over the terrible living conditions with abandoned buildings and people lotering Again though you will be fine in the area of the hotel If you get a chance DC is only 40 minutes away You can drive up there for early dinner and walk the main parts and be back in no time Beds were comfortable and all rooms are suites with kicthens sofa desk etc free wifi There is a awesome gym that guests can use in the building Parking is valet 32night or self park 22night the self park though is per inout I highly recommend spending the extra 10 per night It is a lot safer and much more convieint

title: Loved the hotelbut check your credit card statement
text:
We stayed at the George between Christmas and New year 2003Everything about the trip was great until i got my credit card statement last weekThe hotel George charged my card for 4 nights accomodation even thought I was on a package with a UK tour operatorI emailed the george only to be fed a line about it being the tour operators fault and that I should chase the tour operator for a refund
Thompsons holidays have so far been fantastic in sorting out the problemthe george have stopped replying to my emails
Ill keep you posted

title: Service that easily beats a Four Seasons or Ritz and a beautiful property to boot
text:
Spectacular property  lush comfortable sprawling wellmaintained comfortable inviting We had a standard Fairway room which was enormous Bathroom is very grand beds were super comfortable Housekeeping did an outstanding job and remembered all sorts of little details such as what time of evening my husband likes to have a bucket of ice in the room The hotel was also superb with our 3 12 year old giving her a present from a toy box when we checked in and then there were items waiting for her in the room The restaurants also have good childrens menus We only ate at Amaya several breakfasts plus one lunch and it was excellent Fresh good food and great service 
But what really stood out the most for us was the level of service provided by every single member of the staff here They are trained exceptionally well and really they could teach other luxury hotels a few things about service The valets produced our car in record time offered us directions wherever we were going plus bottles of water The concierges were also exceptionally helpful And just every time you interacted with someone they really went out of their way to welcome you and attend to whatever it was you needed An outstanding hotel
We traveled easily to the San Diego Zoo the Animal Park Sea World and La Jolla although you can certainly choose a hotel that is closer to these spots Nonetheless we would do the same all over again given how comfortable and relaxing the Grand Del Mar was We loved it

title: A Very Nice Hotel with a Great Location
text:
We recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco for a four day weekend getaway I was quite pleased with most aspects of the hotel although it is showing signs of wear and could use a bit of freshening up We stayed on the 33rd floor in a Club King room with access to the Club Lounge on the 32nd floor Our room was small but very clean and the comfortable and the view was fantastic Access to the club lounge brings with it a contintental breakfast afternoon snacks and evening desserts Sodas bottled water and sparkling water is available from 6 am to 9 pm at no additional cost There is also a computer with printer available for use at no fee The view from the lounge is also fantastic with a clear view of the bay
The staff of the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful We did not try the restaurant or lounge on the 36th floor but I would definitely stay there again Its location is perfect for access to Chinatown Nob Hill nearby shopping Market Street restaurants etc

title: Bed Bugs Poor response killed this otherwise great hotel
text:
This used to be my favorite hotel in the Cityin midtown next to subway and a supermarket plus the best Hilton Diamond breakfast in the chain and all at a reasonable price It was all ruined when I received the most callous and poor service after being bitten all over my bed bugs The infestation was awful but the hotel first tried to make me prove that it happened there and then only offered an apology No offers on how to properly clean my clothes to take care of any medical expensesnot even an offer to discount the room The superviser said I would have to take it up with hotel administration Only after contacting Hilton HHonors customer service did I receive a response from the hotelan offer to send a discount certificate on a future stay Really Incidentally it still hasnt come
Needless to stay not only will I never stay there again but I actively encourage others not too

title: Hotel was nice but service NOOOOTTTTT
text: We really enjoyed the room and what the city had to offer The people we found to be sort of rude Be prepared to pay an arm and a leg for parking The parking rates are ambiguous and if you try to talk to the person in charge be careful We learned that she gets crabby if you wake her up Reading Terminal Market was awesome Try the crepe place It was very good

title: A Quite Place In Middle Of It ALL
text: Wonderful 3 day stay in NYC for my wifes birthday Thanks to entire staff the quite room and very good room service Special thanks to Alan for arranging theatre tics and dining suggestions every experience was top shelf Will be back

title: Find a better hotel for the money
text:
I live in the Boston area and stayed at the Westin for a quick lastminute getaway We paid 479 for a Riverview Deluxe room and Im so sorry we did The room was incredibly ordinary Although the view across rooftops to the Charles was nice it wasnt worth the money
The shower was good but the tub didnt drain The climate control didnt work properly we were hot and the bathroom was small  needing renovation and new grout The beds were very comfy The location is excellent  attached to the shopping centers The oddlyshaped and dark lobby was always crowded with conventiongoers and business people Overall this is a business hotel and wildly overpriced 
Youd do much better across the street at the Copley Plaza where for a little less money you get much more style and grandeur Or for the same price choose the Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons a few blocks away but much nicer and on the park
My favorite hotel rooms in Boston are the harbor view rooms at the Boston Harbor Hotel at Rowes Wharf Those rooms are plush gorgeous updated and have amazing views The hotel is much friendlier and serviceoriented Its just a short walk from there to Quincy Market Copley or downtown
I would not stay at the Westin again

title: Great Beds Great Value
text:
Stayed at this property for 3 nights the beds are GREAT the staff is friendly and the price was right 
The staff bends over backwards to meet your needs and Gus the General Manager went out of his way to say hello and make sure everything was perfect for my stay Dollar for Dollar you wont go wrong with this property

title: Good hotel in great location
