text: Stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for a conference and brought along the girlfriend to make a side vacation of San Diego I dont know if there are any bad views in this hotel but our room had an amazing view of the bay the water front parkvillage downtown and the Padres ball field The rooms was exceptionally clean and comfortable I only wish that it still had the refrigerator for all the left overs we had from many good meals The hotel staff were suprisingly friendly for such a large and busy place We enjoyed the spa steam bath relaxation rooms and the oil scented couples bath all very relaxing and suprisingly affordable The swimming pool and hot tub area was well maintained and clean with an unfortunate view of ships loading at the Dole warehouse Food in the resturant downstairs was actually good the 3 times we ate there I did find the Gift shop to be very expensive paying nearly 8 for a toothbrush Would love to stay here again in the future

title: Brilliant for a short stay
text: It would seem a shame to stay here and not pay the extra for the Harbor view Its absolutely stunning From the lobby or Grill you get a good view but from our full 7th floor window it was even better The location is made more fun when you use the water taxis to get back across to the city Costs will mount up pretty quickly if you are staying for a long time but we were only there for a day and a half and one night Hotel service was poor in the bar but the bell boys were good and looked after our luggage all day after we checked out No problems there When we were staying the small swimming pool was freezing to the point of being useless  hopefully thats fixed now and its not meant to be unheated We enjoyed our brief time here very much in the summer but can see why it may not ideal when the temperature drops the harbor gets too choppy to enjoy the water taxis and the sun isnt there to show Boston off at its best

title: Where is the free wifi
text: I couldnt wait to find a McDonalds with free internet to write my review The hotel has a pleasant setting near Piestewa Peak with beautiful swimming pools and suites with two large screen TVs What is missing Free wireless connections in your room A charge is made for the wire connection in the room That is so 20th Century when I can get free wifi at McDs or a the Sleep Inn on Scottsdale Road with a much lower room rate The other item missing is a free breakfast as provided at Embassy Suites or at the Sleep Inn or Best Westerns The Rico Grill on the premises has good steaks and garlic mashed potatoes

title: Superb staff and great location
text:
Stayed at this hotel room for 4 nights and had a pleasant stay This hotel has a superb location with loads of sight seeing and shopping trips within a short walk
Slightly disappointed with the standard of the rooms but they were clean and the maid service was good 
Staff were very helpful and friendly especially Rafael the bell boy and Juan Carlos who served me every morning at breakfast

title: Not recommended
text: The wireless Internet for which youre billed 10 bucks a night functioned maybe 40 of the time and in low power at that everytime you call the front desk you got put on hold dont even bother with wakeup calls since they miss them and checking inout takes an eternity Was definitely not impressed and will think twice about booking Hilton hotels Only reason why I stayed past the first night was to attend my conference

title: Really convenient for the airport and good rooms
text: This is just the easiest way to catch a morning international flight Spend the night have a nice dinner and walk to the plane

title: This Best Western isnt the best
text:
Our room was quite large but there were problems with the service 
After repeated requests to the front desk for bed linens for the pullout 
sofa we finally had to go down to the front desk and get them 
ourselves The TV didnt work although that was fixed the next day The water 
pressure in the shower was poor The continental breakfast buffet was 
adequate and the swimming pool is tiny The hotels best feature is the 
free shuttle service to the Inner Harbor Camden Yards etc However 
space on the hourly shuttle is limited so you need to reserve your spot 
as early as possible Since the hotel is connected to the Baltimore 
Travel Center formerly known as a bus station there are some 
interesting people wandering around the area You cant beat the price though 
compared to the downtownInner Harbor hotels

title: Great for the price
text: My daughter stayed here Dec 26  30 and really enjoyed it She said the place was very clean and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful to them She was traveling wth a friend and the walked or took the monorail everyone The hotel was in a great location for all the places they wanted to go Her only complant was the breakfast was lacking of many choices They booked the hotel at a great rate and it was well worth it

title: A great place to stay and play near Harbor East
text: Celebrated my husbands birthday with an overnight stay here and dinner at Chazz in Harbor East and it felt like we had been to the big apple The hotel has a cool boutique feel as soon as you enter the lobby with its contemporary design and clean new vibe Our room was huge Flat screen TV can be aimed at the unbelievable hot tub jacuzzi your sofa or the ohsocomfy king size bed Wow The staff is super friendly Youll love it

title: Great property in perfect location But
text:
We had an issue at checkin we arrived at the prescribed checkin time and we were told that they did not have a room ready for us They told us it would be less than an hour and they would call our cell when the room was ready Even tho wed just driven 2 hours we left our bags with the bellman and went to explore the riverwalk for a whileand the hotel never called over and hour later we went back on our own and they did have our room but had never called for some reason Next to us at the counter was a woman whod just driven 7 hours to attend a wedding that night and they did not have her room ready either over 25 hours after scheduled checkin time They did give us a voucher for 30 in drinks at the hotel bar there which was nice they also later slipped an apology note under our door Not sure if this is the norm for them or if they were having issues on the holiday weekend but this is a nice large hotel Get it together 
After the issue at checkin the room was surprisingly nice We chose a smaller king overlooking the pool rather than a larger king on the street for less noise It was nice to be given a choice The room had cable with showtime but no movies on demand I guess they think the riverwalk is entertainment enough but after everything at checkin and the holiday crowd we just wanted to relax in and watch a flick no such luck They were also out of the champagne we ordered but did sub a nicer bottle for the same price Overall this is a nice hotel with its own riverwalk entrance which was great They did work to accommodate us after the snafu at checkin but it was just superficial bandaids  no real apology I would stay here again cuz its nice but for the price It would not be my first choice

title: You will not get enough towels andor wash clothes
text: So heres the thing One would expect wash clothes and towels to be a basic item you would receive with your room Not here Every night of our stay we have called for towels to accommodate So far tonightwe have waited over two hoursstill waiting with a promise of towelswash clothes to come Maybe by shower time tomorrow we may have them BYOT

title: Nice hotel in great location
text:
Went to DC for a conference and a friend told me about The Quincy The price was great and the location was fabulous right in the golden triangle The metro stop was just a block away and there are a ton of restaurants and shops all around 
The room was very nice and quite big Very nice bathroom and toiletries I was especially happy to find makeup remover towelettes on the vanity  The bed was comfy and they put a ton of pillows on the bed which I enjoy 
I cant finish the review without talking about the staff They were superb So incredibly helpful with everything I have never felt so welcomed at a hotel I would come back just for them

title: Cleanist friendliest most individualistic and generous hotel Ever
text:
This is a must stay hotel in San Francisco No down sides whatsoever Having stayed in many hotels all over the world  this tops the lot  I stayed at the Waldorf New York recently and although very grand this is a far better hotel altogether
Tip join kimpton intouch which is free to join on kimpton website before you go and get various perks including free in room wifi
This place is so clean  from the main lobby to the rooms and restaurant  faultless
Fabulous place for kids especially when greeted steve the doorman He is so much more than that always there to lend a hand no matter what you needTerry the concierge is fantastic a sorting out your trips and adventuresCarmel and Monterey trip on greyline tours was amazing  Stephanie on the front desk did everything she could to make our stay very special There is no member of staff that would not go out of their way to help you Location is Fab  so central to Everything  
This hotel is totally Excellent alllround Oh and the wine hour is pretty good too at 5 6pm daily very relaxing and enjoyable after a great day in the city

title: Good central location for seeing sights
text:
My son and I stayed at this hotel We found everyone to be friendly and helpful Great breakfast buffet included in price We were seated at table and then went up to buffet No hunting for tables
I asked for extra pillows when I booked hotel and they were in our room upon arrival Rooms desperately need renovation to freshen things up Employee said they are hoping to do that next year Great location easy access to main expressways and nearby cities

title: Fabulous Hotel
text:
Lots of negative criticism of the W Washington on this site but it must be that I live in some sort of parallel universe as I had a completely different experience which was pretty much first class from beginning to end 
On arrival late on Thursday night I was greeted by Dag on front reception who booked me in but unfortunately the room chosen for me was a little close to the elevators for my liking so Dag changed my room without any problem Rooms are quirky with a vanity sink and mirror actually in the room and a semiopaque shower which might not be to everyones liking Beds are superb as always so comfortable The walls are a little thin and I accept TV noise and other noise enough said could on occasions be heard but it was never ever intrusive
On the Saturday Kelsie on the front desk was once again superb arranging a table for 8 at The Source at very short notice huge thank you
Breakfast in JGs Steakhouse was delicious with highly attentive waiting staff I recommend the Eggs Benedict
The roof top bar POV is a fabulous place for sundowners contrary to previous reports on this site there was never a problem getting in for a drink and Im an untrendy 40something On Sunday night we were even treated to the sight of Marine One helicopter arriving with Mr President arriving back at the White House my god the hotel lays on everything 
I didnt try getting into POV late at night so cannot comment as to whether thats a nightmare I know there is a 35 per person charge for a table so they are clearly going for the pretty people but heyho
On checkout I noticed that there was a duplication of an Internet Fee 1495 come on guys free WiFi should be the norm in a hotel of this quality for its guests but it was immediately removed and the bill corrected without any fuss
On the whole however I have no complaints whatsoever I would thoroughly recommend to anyone wanting to get the vibe in DC

title: Great hotelbut too open too mall
text: I recently stayed at Marriott Copley Place I like itIt They have the BEST beds I have ever slept on They have a street entrance and a mall entrance this where I get to the part where it is too open to the mall It is so open they have security guards in the atrium There should be a better separation between the hotel and mallI ate at conexion in lounge they have THE BEST Asian wings in the world I was on the 34 floor I had a amazing view they called it a habor view the harbor was a harbor view The harbor was like 10 miles away The concierge service was not the best on the first day We wanted to go to the USS Constitution we need the name of the ferry he told us F4 I found out that is its name on the map as in ferry 4 it was really Rookie and Rita rookie is one Rita is another The boston duck tours broads right across the street from the hotel We had the concierge floor with free breakfast and deserts and appetizers A employee that stood out to me was Ashley from the concierge floor She gave me desserts to take homeshe is just one of the best employees i have encountered Out of the many hotels iI have stayed at she is the best employe I have met

title: So chic
text: My friends and I made a very last minute booking and the staff could not have been nicer Despite the chaos of families and pets from the storm and resulting power outage that week Kristen along with Casey and a couple of other colleagues at the Front Desk were exceptional with checking us in making us comfortable by attending to any special needs and advising us about what Philly has to offer The decor of the room and the lobby was some of the most welldone Ive seen from a hotel in a long time Grabbing a drink on the rooftop bar is an absolute must This property and its wonderful staff totally made our stay in Philly  we could not have had a more wonderful experience

title: Comfortable and goodvalue
text:
We had a great stay here for 10 nights on our honeymoon It had a great vibe I enjoyed the funky looney tunes decor in the heart of Times Square The inhouse bars were great for a cocktail to begin the night or perhaps a nightcap before bed Having a Dean and Deluca in the building was a huge bonus for our early morning coffee and fresh fruit salad onthego We had unlimited complimentary wifi for our stay which was really handy While the rooms are a bit small thats basically expected across this pricerange in the heart of NYC
While we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves there were some negative aspects that are worthy of mentioning for future potential guests to this hotel
the airconditioning in the room sounded like an aircraft landing on our heads It also seemed as though it only had two temperatures  1 Siberian winter and 2 Arabian desert We constantly flicked between the two in attempt to set a relatively tolerable room temperature but it made sleeping kind of difficult
while the staff at concierge were friendly we found them to be unhelpful Firstly they were very difficult to get a hold of in the lead up to our trip from Australia According to our emails we had booked and paid for a shuttle bus to collect us from the airport but when we arrived at the airport in NYC noone came to collect us and we had to arrange our own transport to the hotel not great after 24 hours in transit During our stay we asked the concierge desk about certain restaurants in the area and they didnt offer much information  we found our Time Out pocket guide to be far more helpful
Other than these slight issues we were suitably impressed We would happily recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience the Time Square energy from comfortable and good value accommodation

title: Way below Omni standards
text:
If youve stayed at other Omni hotels do not except the same quality and service at this hotel The rooms were small outofdate and did not include many of the amenities the hotels site has listed 
Disappointed I asked to view the Executive King Suites Not impressive they just added an old loveseat to the room Dont waste your money Although their web site lists complimentary shuttle dont count on it Its actually an airport shuttle 24 fare and if it happens to be around it MIGHT be able to take you somewhere The restaurant was nice but way overpriced for this everyday traveler 250 for just a cup of coffee The only thing this hotel has is a good location However within two blocks is the Adams Mark Hotel For about the same price you can stay at this first class hotel instead of the run down Omni Like I said my past experiences with Omni have been superb this hotel just doesnt live up to the Omni name

title: Worth Paying A Little Extra For
text:
Due to the price this is not a property we would have ordinarily considered Even with the special deal we got it was still pricy for us but WELL WORTH the extra money in all respects
Pros 1 Location  We had never been to Boston and wanted a central location to explore the city with kids There is no better location than this Just a few dozen feet from the Old State House and the subway station that is located underneath From that station we could go anywhere we needed to go with minimal hassles and delay We were able to conveniently walk the Freedom Trail and take meals at Fanuil Hall which is just a block away 2 Service  The staff went out of its way to welcome us with young children Disregard what you may have read elsewhere all comments about this being a kid unfriendly place The staff was among the most friendly we have encountered anywhere in the world 3 Style  Ultra hip and supercontemporary Not something we usually go for but it was a great change fo pace Pretty neat 4 Immaculate Probably the cleanest property we have ever visited
Cons 1 Price
This is our first choice next time we go to Boston No doubt about it

title: Rooms are too cold and you cant manage temperature
text:
Cold rooms AC is way too high and there is no way to manage it from the room
The lift is very oli and almost scary to use
Rooms apart for the tempature are ok
Free wifi with decent speed Nice staff

title: great hotel for the money
text: large roomsvery clean staff was fantasticespecially the cook and serverfor the money i have never stayed in a better hotelonly 5 minutes from riverwalk

title: Clean Stylish Great Service
text: I stayed for six nights and had a great time The hotel was clean and quiet and the staff was super helpful Great central location

title: Wonderful romantic weekend in NYC
text: We checked into a spacious room that was well appointed and quiet Hotel is near to everything and very impressive We enjoyed every minute of our stay

title: Great Location
text:
Arrived 031212 in New York for my 1st time
Hotel was in a great location just a couple of streets away from Maceys department store and Empire State Building Also just a 10 minute walk to Times Square
We had to queue to check in but this is possibly due to being in December there were 4 receptionists so we didnt queue for long 
Our room was located on 32nd floor It was a bit small to other hotels ive stayed in It was clean and modern The bathroom could have done with a bit of TLC but you dont go to New York to stay in the room 
Attached to the hotel was a diner and a restaurant we ate at both of these and recommend them
If you have never been to New York before the taxis restaurants etc all expect to be tipped and they will ask for one if you dont give it straight away They all put about 15 plus onto your bill
When i go back to New York I will stay at this hotel again

title: The Palace is truly a Palace we felt like Royalty
text: We appreciated the on point service and the quiet reserved atomosphere that allowed us to basically enjoy our time unimpededalso the room service tasted 5 star on the one hand we were able to really relax on the other we didnt get to expierience Friscos dining but that is why everyone wants to live in a Palace

title: Excellent choice for our family
text: My wife our two children and I stayed between 914 to 922 The Hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly especially a lady by the name of Frankie My kids took to her and she treated us very well Free wireless free continental breakfast  and free parking was all a huge plus What did it for my wife was that they let us print out our boarding passes the night before we left on their computer saving us tons of time that we wouldve spent in line at the airport You know how that goes with two young kidsWe would definitely stay there again without a doubt

title: Great hotel
text: Great little hotel  clean rooms Rocky made the stay worth it all  gave us a plethora of info on what to do in San Diego He printed maps  even came around the desk to give us specifics on how to get to places where to park etc He even retrieved me a beverage after the soda machine decided to eat my dollar SUPERB customer service

title: Hotel Mela is the nicest hotel at the best value in the Times Square area of NYC
text: I have stayed at several different hotels in the Times Square area of NYC and none can beat the Hotel Mela in terms of design style service and value This was our first stay there and we were not disappointed The staff was amazing and fulfilled our every desire Fabulous location

title: memphis
text: Went on a long weekend for our 26th anniversary Memphis is a city on the decline Never been there before looks like a place that once had a lot going for it but no longer We come from NY and we felt this city was very unsafe in the down town area Beale St was a great disappointment Great potential a lot of great music history but it is all going to get lost in the crime We stayed at the Hampton Inn there on Peabody around the corner from Beale st Lesson learned many say why get a room that is expensive all you do is sleep there The room can make or break the vacation It was very noisy some of it seemed under construction Recommend you spend a few extra and stay at the Peabody Hotel beautiful place we had dinner there 2 nights Visited Grace land Very nice but growing up with Elvis also very sad Highly recommend you visit there

title: Good location and nice hotel
text: I was impressed with the Muse It has a nice restaurantbar in the lobby Very trendy in the decorations The location was nice Not too far from grand central there is a busshuttle to airports from there I usually wouldnt choose to stay in times square but this hotel was off broadway enough to get away from all of the crowd but had easy access There was some noise coming from the irish bars below If you are going to NYC to see broadway shows and have easy access to all things midtown this is the place my opinion

title: Great place to stay near Times Square
text:
The Residence Inn is a great place to stay if you want to be near Times SquareBryant Park The rooms are very large by NYC standards and you can request a room with a great view which we did Its nice to be in the city and have a couch and small kitchen in your room 
The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful and the Residence Inn has some great features like free wireless internet and a free full breakfast 
My only caution would be that if youre used to staying at the Four Seasons or the Mandarin this may not be the hotel for you The decor is not plush but its still very nice Honestly the Residence Inn was better than a lot of 4 and even 5 Star hotels Ive stayed at in NYC Our room was large clean and had tons of ammenities including a flat screen tv And the bed is very comfortable 
Id recommend the Residence Inn to anyone travelling to NYC especially if you are going to spend a few days there its nice to have the extra room and features that it offers

title: Affordable and great location
text: I stayed here when it was Jurys and the location was so great I thought I would give it another try This time the rate was amazing through a third party website and when I called the hotel to ask if we could come a night earlier and have the same rate honored they agreed and were very pleasant The room was large clean and quiet The pub downstairs is a great place to meet for a drink The hotel scene in Boston isnt that great  the W and Nine Zero are popular but sparse and poor in service The Fairmont Copley and Park Plaza are from another era I would definitely recommend staying here to visitors of any nature

title: Nice but quirky ending and still no receipt
text:
Stayed in this hotel recently for business and the meeting was held here as well Nice modern lobby  good restaurant and small snack shop off the lobby Never saw the pool but pictures are nice Hotel is right on the water
When I made the reservation was offered a potential upgrade You could choose from several that were offered on line No guarantee you find out at checkin or the day before if you call You can also decline prior to checkin Neat concept Got a corner room upgrade for 9  well worth it with four large windows Great views but a little noisy on the street side Room nicely equipped  even had toothpaste and upscale bath toiletries
At checkin was told I had an automatic 2 pm checkout which would work very well for me Gave me a chance to go upstairs and change after the meeting and freshen up before starting to drive home 2 hours Well  not really headed up to my room at 1130 to use the restroom and my key would not work Thought I had the wrong room but another guest answered Even though I had the Do Not Disturb insert in the key slot  the maids must have entered the room without consulting the late checkout list saw the room was empty reported it vacated and cleaned it in record time Glad I wasnt in the shower Really  there wasnt that long between my trips to the room to accomplish all that plus get another person checkin to the room wow When I told the front desk they apologized and offered me another room I declined the new room  thought it was a waste but the whole thing irritated me 
The other quirk is the the statement Upon checkin  they ask if you would like your final bill emailed to you This was a new to me So if you say yes you do not get a bill under the door not sure if they do this at all anyway It has been more that 24 hours and I still do not have an invoice  which I need to file my expenses I had to call  they instruct you to go online and through a series of clicks request a copy of your statement  says it can take up to 48 hours Normally I would not leave without a bill I guess that was my fault for not getting that when I exited the hotel  was too POed about the room thing
Note  wireless Internet is NOT free We selfparked in adjoining garage 30night
All and all  nice hotel great location just be aware of things noted
Oh  breakfast buffet was great Service there wonderful

title: Wonderful Stay at InterContinentalBoston
text: Great long weekend stay in Boston for a wedding Central location close to Northend Downtown Markets MTA Red Line Stop at South Station and surprisingly short walk to Boston Commons Very helpful staff Arrived on redeye flight from West Coast and staff stored bags and had a room for us by 1100 AM Honored Government Per Diem rate on busy weekend in Boston and still got corner room Room faced street which other reviews complain about as loud These fussy business travelers must not stay in the hotels I usually do because the soundproofing was very good with little street noise for a large city Bathroom and TV were 5 stars Lobby bar lively and hip No hot tub in spa though Also room service breakfast was disappointing for price Hotel should consider more affordable breakfast buffet for business travelers If you can get a discounted rate this is a great hotel and location for a romantic weekend

title: Great value for money
text: This hotel is excellent value for money huge rooms friendly  helpful staff at prices which are good for your pocket No bar in hotel but just around the corner at 906 7th Avenue theres an Irish pub  PJ Carneys  which gives huge helpings of foodrelatively cheap steaks  the Gaelic burger  Buffalo burger are fantastic generous measures of booze served in an atmosphere of the way pubs used to be like in UK years ago Everyone is made welcome Passing traffic can be a bit noisy but then nowhere in New York can be said to be quiet

title: Location Location Location
text:
Just back after our extended stay at the HiltonThanks to SANDY we had an extra 4 days in the big apple  the hotel and staff and occupants all pulled together thru this 100 year event
We spent a fair bit of time in the hotel especially during the stormservice at the bars was very efficient snacks were tasty and although crowded at times the drinks soon came a bit pricey though 
The room was an adequate size and the beds very comfyjust one minor complaint the toilet flush was under the vanity unit so very difficult to reach 
The position of the hotel is perfectwithin walking distance of everything in midtown Manhatten
We didnt have brecky in the hotel so cannot comment on that facility

title: luxury hotel at government rate
text: This is a beautiful property with especially nice bathroom and shower as previously reported The area may someday be developed but it is not yet The nearest restaurant outside of the hotel or Starbucks is a long walk The Smithsonian is not too far but still 5 miles or more Nevertheless the walk was pleasant with cabs readily available when the weather isnt good for walking The staff was almost uniformly friendly and helpful The conference room for our meeting was fine although their internet there and in the rooms could use more bandwidth Only other small problem the pillows are not goodlong with too little filling At full price I would not give 5 stars but at the rate we obtained it was a great stay

title: Horrible experience prepare to be snubbed
text:
Awful experience
At the front desk the staff made a note that we booked on Orbitz
This was supposed to be a nice date with my husband and when we arrived at the room it look very used The tv was old and small and also obviously broken When we called about the broken tv they didnt send someone up for over an hour The phone by the bed was also broken There was a large stain by the bed and the bedspread didnt look the cleanest Also the front desk clerk forgot to give us the bar key We would have put up with this even though we were surprised at their lack of concern for our experience
We thought we could have a romantic dinner at Randolphs The waiter immediately got menus and was going to seat us when the GM came up and said it would be 5 minutes but we could sit in the bar We were dressed casually but not inappropriately We had a beer and waited over 30 minutes The GM obviously aware of us but rushing around It was obvious that they refused to seat us Also in the bar was a drunk buch of groomsmen who had awful language and conversation I have never been insulted or snubbed like that in my life We left and decided to check out of the hotel as well The front desk clerk appeared to not even care if we checked out There was no attempt to make our stay positive in the least We will never go there again and you shoudnt either 
We checked in to the Embassy Suites and had excellent service and friendly staff who cared about our stay

title: Fantastic unknown hotel Room 302 has 74c in prizes
text:
If you are lucky enough to stay in Room 302 Da Vinci Hotel New York we have hidden 74c in pennies in the room If you find them you can keep them GOOD LUCK 
I researched hotels in New York for about 2 weeks leading up to book
For what I wanted to spend I was either looking at something a little better then a Hostel then the prices seemed to jump dramatically to Hotel prices
I some how stubbled across this place and read many of the reviews After staying there I understand what the negatives are saying but I also wonder what they were expected
This hotel does not have a massive star rating but that should not affect your decision 
New York Hotel rooms are going to be small end of story For what you pay here the rooms are a decent size What do you need the extra space for anyway The hotel was a place to sleep and shower thats pretty much it
The desk is attended 247 and the staff were lovely I asked them for directionsadvice a couple of times and they were more then friendly
FYI you pay for the hotel on arrive I knew this and it was no big deal
Wifi is included
Breakfast is available from 7am till 10pm But you wanna get down there before 9 to get the good stuff 
Breakfast isnt anything special but its more then you get at any other hotel without paying Its simple there are croissants small muffins and rolls No toaster Spreads Butter and jams
Also a kettle for Tea and a coffee machine possibly instant coffee
I got in a routine in the morning of getting up about 7308 walking to Starbucks 1 block away and grabbing a croissant for me and a muffin for my girl and taking it back to our room for her breakfast in bed haha
Our room
We arrived about 2am in the morning and lucked out and scored room 302 bad room reviews from previous reviews
This room faces the street that you enter off and is 2 levels up So there is a bit of traffic noise dump trucks etc at night and 1 of the nights there were road works outside all night
We use to live on a main road back home so we were able to deal with the city noise But I can understand how others would be annoyed If so you are probably better off with a room with no view Who looks out the windows anyway
Also room 302 has a resident next door Kind of a strange situation I asked about this and apparently he came with the hotel He doesnt make noise and I assume is respectful to guests but seems to be home all day and smokes like a chimney Thus the hall way does smell of smoke as soon as you step out the lift
Bed was ok nothing amazing I have to agree with previous people the pillow were horrible Rather thin and hard 1 pillow wasnt enough 2 was too much And they were very stiff
Air Con worked fine when required
Bathroom was clean shower was good and soaps etc nice
House keeping does come very late some days Shouldnt be an issue unless you are hanging around in your room all day They have a little envelope for tips We just put 2 in there each day better then nothing 
 Best parts 
Hotel is in an AMAZING location 
Work to times square in 10mins Rockefeller in 10mins Central Park in 5 mins BEST LOCATION TO SEE THE CITY We only caught a cab once because it was raining
Great Price
No bed bugs
Clean and friendly
Wifi And share computers down stairs
Breakfast

title: If you like small cramped rooms  this is the place for you
text: The standard queen at this hotel is equivalent to a closet If you like cruise ship style rooms youll be fine If not and your are claustrophobic this is not the right hotel for you The rooms have a ship nautical theme and the galley thing goes along with it The room I had was nothing more than a closet on the noisy street with a desk The bathroom had no door as it could not open due to the hall from the room door to the bed not having the appropriate width When I called to ask if I could change as I was feeling very claustrophobic I was informed most of the rooms were like this Needless to say the rooms that are described and pictured on the hotel website are not what the hotel actually has I have traveled to many countries several times and this is by far the smallest room I have ever been in Oh and did I mention it was right next to the service elevator Yes it was So we got to hear that until late into the night I wont even mention the street noise and the fact that I had to sleep with ear plugs in Oh and one more thingdont be presumptuous and assume you as a client have the right to use the luggage cart If you do you will be accosted by the bellhop with the alien helmet polite not being in his vocabulary All in all I would rate this hotel an overall of a 1

title: Rapacious staff and management
text:
The rooms are very nice  and particularly spacious for a nyc hotel Beyond the rooms the hotel doesnt have a great deal going for it
Some of the staff are pleasant as other reviewers have mentioned some of them are rather selfimportant  for example I was told by Vittorio the frontdesk manager that we couldnt move a chair from a colleagues room to my room to hold a meeting because it would make it look untidy
Of course New York is expensive but theres a difference between transparent costs and billfiddling Check your bills very carefully  wherever possible someone will have added an additional spurious charge  whether bogus items on a drycleaning bill or an extra 170 on an unitemised limo hire

title: Excellent hotel for early morning flight
text:
After reading on TA that this hotel had breakfast starting at 4 AM  and an airport shuttle it was a nobrainer to make a reservation here The La Quinta is on Tower Road  only a 15 minute ride to the airport We had a 7 AM flight and having experienced the security line at DIA many other times we wanted to get there early
The room was large and very well appointed The desk and working area was large but the wireless was much slower than were used to Front desk staff was very helpful and amazingly patient with some of the guests  not us 
We only had one problem with the room  the bathtub did not drain well While taking showers we ended up standing in about 2 of water by the end Reported it to the front desk upon check out so hopefully the next guest wont have the same problem
Plenty of dining options within walking distance of the hotel including a Ruby Tuesday right next door Would definitely stay here again

title: Great but not for us
text:
My girlfriend and i stayed at the Omni for 3 mights in early january We had mixed reviews of this hotel
This is a very well maintained clean modern hotel It was immaculate the beds are huge and bathroom was amazing
However we were aware that this hotel is chatered towards business stays and that there are a lot of confrences etc at this hotel and is not ideal for tourists which was our reason for stay For a hotel that is based around business people the internet connection and cell reception was terrible We spoke to hotel staff about this and they said yes it is pretty bad at times Also another negative was that there was one terrible conierge at this hotel He told us he didnt know the area that well and he also stuffed up a hire car booking we had made thru him However there is a very capable female concierge there whom saved us on a couple of occasions
The location is okay once you figure out where you are and where everything else is but it was daunting at first
Overall the hotel is very nice one of the nicest we stayed in but just wasnt for us

title: What a great place
text: I just left the New York Palace after spending 10 nights there with my husband and teenage children What a fantastic hotel The rooms are huge the location could not be better but what really takes it above others is the wonderful concierge service There are always enough people manning the concierge desk so its never a long wait they are friendly patient and sent us to great restaurants Thanks for making our stay in New York so special Well definitely be back

title: A GREAT Hotel the staff make you feel welcomed
text: My husband and I stayed here for our 5 year wedding anniversary The room was CLEAN The bathroom was CLEAN The king bed was comfy not like your normal hard hotel bed They have a pool but it is not very deep so it would be great for kids When we come back we would stay here again and bring our kids

title: Nice hotel but Ill try another next time
text: I stayed for 3 nights with my family wife and 2 boys ages 8 and 6 for a conference in January 2012 The service is what you expect from a Ritz Carlton elegant and refined but not too intrusive Check in and check out very smooth with no wait Be aware that if you bring a car you have to valet it and it is pretty expensive each night I didnt bother looking for street or garage parking because of the convenience Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was good as was the room service menu options Location is nice close to walking distance from Chinatown Little Italy and Union Square We did have some issue with noise from the hallway and adjacent rooms I guess soundproofing could be better We had a room with double beds on the 5th floor with a view of the Transamerica Pyramid Bathrooms were of decent size The hotel and rooms do seem somewhat old and could use some updating of the decor

title: Wonderful Hotel in a good location
text: The Westin Hotel could not have been more accommodating They allowed us both early check in and late check out We were there for a wedding and they helped with several requests for things we needed and made great suggestions for things to do and where to eat The room was extra clean and spacious very comfortable with a lovely view of the river The only criticism is that the lobby is a lilttle dark They need a little better lighting Would definitely stay there again as well as recommend it

title: Special three nite package offseasion
text: A few years ago we booked a three nite stay in the fairmont in San Francisco and it could not get any better for hospitality or accomodations You have to be careful of the  it is definately not a cheap datealthough we were lucky enough to get a fantastic package for the price We always come away from a getaway holiday with some lasting feelings and beleive me this was the top of the line

title: Fabulous Location
text:
Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Le Meridien in San Francisco The hotel was clean the rooms comfortable and the location was fabulous 
The rooms On the small side for 300 but the view was great Room 707  a lower floor in this 22 floor beauty and the room had a very functional plan Mini bar was not overpriced for SFO
The hotel Bar 333  Bistro serves a stiff drink and is a great place to relax Our friends enjoyed eating in the Park Grill on the 3rd floor and felt the menu was great The fitness center offers some nice equipment to run on and lift weights 
The location Wow A few blocks up hill and you are in Chinatown a few blocks to the west and you are at Pier 39 and a few blocks to the east and you are shopping at Union Square Dont overlook the Embarcadero Center across the street which has some great stores and places to eat Late night drinks cant be beat right next door at the Elephant  Castle Pub
We did a Sonoma Wine Tour with Beau Wine Tours and it was great We had an 8 person limo for 9 hours for under 1000 with tip and it came with champagne and a knowledgeable driver Ask for Steve He took us over the Golden Gate Bridge and we stopped for pictures in both directions He recommended The Girl  The Fig for lunch in Sonoma  it was fabulous

title: The JWJust Wow
text:
Stayed for a gymnastics meet held at the convention center 
When booking you will want to upgrade to the concierge level More on that shortly 
Check in was prompt and efficient Staff were very helpful Hotel layout is fantastic except some of the elevators dont go to some floors so look sharp 
Hotel rooms were spacious and clean Have everything you would need except for maybe a refrigerator or microwave Our shower was greathad three jets and the water was fabulously hot 
There is a Starbucks on the second floor A real Starbucks not a we serve Starbucks 
There are two restaraunts in the hotel I didnt eat at the Italian place but it looked rather pricey The sports bar was very upscale and had a good selection of food and drinks at about regular pricing The food there was pretty good 
If you have a chance to upgrade to an executive room or get upgraded you will want to check out the Lounge on the 31st floor They have snacks out all day breakfast in the mornings sodas and waters in refrigerators all day and beerwine for purchase in the evenings Plenty of TVs and couches for relaxing Very comfortable for unwinding 
Hotel is centrally located and connected via skywalk to the convention center and other hotels There is a mall in walking distance as well as numerous other restaraunts at all price levels 
They do have a gym and indoor pool Gym had ellipticals treadmills machine weights and some free weights Was health club quality for sure And they have chilled wet towels for cooling off if one might need that in Indianapolis in the winter 
In closing this was perhaps the best hotel I have ever stayed at Very clean very upscale If I could choose one hotel to live in this would probably be it Very impressed and glad we stayed

title: Great For 2 People
text:
My father and I just returned from a trip to NYC and were very pleased with our stay The room was clean nicely furnished and had all the aminities advertiesed If I ever go on vacation in nyc this is the hotel for me I would however not recommend this hotel for a family however it is a great place for 2 people or a couple I was very satisfied 
Thanks Candlewood

title: Location yes value and privacy no
text:
Pros  just a few steps to the famed Riverwalk and just down the road from the Alamo
Cons  over priced rooms self parking is 30 per night in a very cramped parking garage walls are paper thin I had to call front desk two of the three nights I stayed there due to parties in adjacent rooms past midnight Constant sirens and traffic kept me awake even on the 18th floor Breakfast buffet was good but over priced at 20 The overall feel of the hotel was dated a little run down but a friendly staff I love the area but not the hotel

title: Excellent stay Convenient and great value
text:
Had a wonderful stay at the Greektown Casino Hotel The value was awesome and it was easy to find Paid around 100 with tax AAA discount and they have free parking garage was right off the interstate The other hotels in the area were 150 and didnt include parking
We chose this hotel partly because it was connected to the people mover Just walk through the casino and youre at the people mover Fifty cents for a ride which we used to go to Joe Louis Arena Very crowded after the game
From the parking garage you can get to the hotel and the skywalk to the casino Had to use your room key to get to the floors with rooms on them so that added a bit of comfort The room was nice Beds were comfortable room extremely clean had a work station of course I believe it was 999 for WIFI snack bar flat screen TV on wall and plenty of room The hotel was also extremely quiet Thought that it would be loud and full of less than splendid people since it was a casino but I was pleasantly surprised
Not much of a gambler casino seemed nice though Seemed to be big too Only thing I didnt like was it seemed like more than half the slots were either penny or 2 cents Everywhere you looked to no surprise there were more penny machines
Ate lunch at the buffet It wasnt wonderful but it also wasnt horrible It was a cold rainy day so we didnt want to go looking outside for a place to eat so we decided on this If youre in the casino hungry and dont want to leave Id go for the 999 lunch buffet but if you dont mind leaving the casino I would
Ate a late night burger at Shotz Bar in the lobby Once again didnt feel like dealing with the rain and cold at 10PM and it was better than I thought it would be Bar type food but the burgers were awesome and wasnt that expensive for being a bar in a hotel lobby 2 burgers 1 beer 2 jack and cokes were 35 Not bad for a hotel bar
I would definately recommend this place beacuse of its convenience value and comfort Thinking about coming back for a Tigers or Lions game and this will be the place I stay

title: Perfect city hotel
text: This is a perfect hotel for visiting NYC Great location rooms are super spacious compared to similar hotels in NYC Very clean Price was good as well

title: Excellent hotelsmall touches made all the difference
text: We stayed at the Amalfi Hotel in Chicago for four nights in September The small touches made all the difference between an average hotel and one that is really exceptional Two nice touchesbreakfast is served on each floorjust wander down towards the elevators for a huge selection of fruit cereal breads etc each morning The second nice touchan open bar on the 6th floor each night where you can meet and greet other travellers or just bring your fave drink back to your room What a treat Clean and with great helpful staff Its also very central to lots of attractions

title: Definitely one to recommend to friends
text: We have just returned from a short break in New York and would thoroughly recommend the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square The room was spacious clean and well equiped The staff at the hotel were all very helpful and the hotel was in an excellent location for all the major tourist attractions We would highly recommend a visit to the Top of the Rock  we did this at night and the view was spectacular

title: Small clean  funky
text: The room is small but the worst thing was that there was no chest of drawers where to put our stuff My husband and I couldnt fit all of our clothes on 6 hangers So we had to live out of our suitcases the whole time The shower curtain was too short and after one of us took a shower water was spilled everywhere The bathroom door didnt stay opened it kept closing on us which was really annoying But we were lucky to have a bathroom door people on the 9th floor didnt have that There was no real light only small lamps by the bed and some funky light behind the bed When we entered the room late at night we had to walk all the way to the bed to turn on the little lamps Some people from our group complained about the noisy heating system The heater was making clunky noises and kept waking them up They stayed on the 9th floor We stayed on the 17th floor and didnt have this problem The cleaning staff was very friendly they kept our room very clean The bar was cool The phone in our room wasnt working properly the TV was way too small and old for such a funky hotel For such small rooms they should install flat screens on the walls We paid 10 for 24hr internet connection in our room but the connection was very slow Theres a European bakery next door Starbucks CVS a supermarket an Irish pub and sushi place Subway is very close The room was clean and the queen size bed was very comfortable I liked the bed sheets they felt clean And there was no dirty comforter as in other hotels which I appreciated Overall impression  small but clean and friendly staff

title: very bad service
text: The agents were not helpful friendly or caring The check in was not welcoming at all The room smelled bad and the concierge was interested in his computer more than he was of the people in front of him

title: Great location amazing staff
text: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Fairmont Copley in Boston The accommodation and location was perfect The staff was very helpful in helping us arrange our itinerary to see the most of Boston in our four days there The room was clean and fresh and the hotel is very elegant I would highly recommend this hotel

title: Frustratingly disappointed
text: Unfortunately this property lived up to more of the negative than positive reviews posted here Dark dreary rooms very oddly laid out Though we had booked it in May and clearly stated there were 3 of us over the age of 17 we were given a room with only one king bed the staff begrudgingly supplied a rollaway but it was the most GHASTLY bed ever provided 3 inch thick matress encased in plastic and I had to beg for a pillow On an up note the breakfast offered was good enough and unlike a previous review cookies were available in the lobby Best thing I can say is the coffee was fantastic Id recommend choosing another place to stay

title: Really is a TWO STAR MOTEL
text:
I have never stayed at a Red Roof Inn before but I found this one to be comparable and smaller than other 2 star motels like Sleep Inn Days Inn The lobby is sparsely furnished with a GREAT coffeecappuccino machine The staff were pleasant and professional The doors to the rooms are located outside motelstyle The neighborhood seemed safe though even though it says on the inside of the door to lock both deadbolt and regular locks When I walked in I was surprised by how small the room was I got the room with the one King size bed If you want something bigger I would suggest requesting 2 Double beds since there was no way 2 doubles could fit into my room The water pressure was on the milder side and the bathroom light was linked to the loud fan so you couldnt turn on one without the other 
It was HOT the entire night since the automatic radiator was on and it kept on making clinking noises throughout the night I had to turn on the AC even though it was 20 degrees outsidesuch a waste of energy I didnt notice that the bed was extraordinarily comfortable but the sheets were clean with a thin blanket not down 
I was surprised also to find a 20 tax on my bill from county to state to city tax I would not stay here for leisure Red Roof Inn was simple and did its job but did not have any of the extra amenities or comfort that a higher starred hotel would have Be aware of what you pay for

title: Great airport hotel and great service  very nice staff
text:
At the end of October we stayed overnight because we had a morning flight out of LAX The checkin was quick and the service by front desk staff was outstanding Special thanks to Jason for helping us with our parking issue It made a huge difference to us The parking garage is nice and convenient
We had no airplane noise The service was outstanding At the evening managers reception and at breakfast the hotel staff went out of their way to make sure we got what we needed The shuttle to airport was convenient and frequent
The room was well appointed and spotless This was a real great place to stay and we would do it again

title: Do not choose this hostel
text:
The hostel is located near the subway station so its easy to go
everywhere in DC Also the rooms are clean and cozy
However the problem is the insincere attitude of the manager 
toward those who stay there Very bad Veryvery bad
I recommend you to choose another hostel or hotel even if
it costs you a little more

title: Didnt meet expectations of a Marriott
text: We were disappointed with our recent stay at the South Park Marriott Although the front desk and bellman were very pleasant and helpful the service in areas such as room service and restaurant fell far short of what we expected After our room service meal was delivered we had to call back for them to deliver cream for the coffee and silverware Needless to say by the time they came back the rest of the meal was cold They only had one person bartending and waitressing in the afternoon No fault to this lonely employee who was trying to serve everyone to the best of their ability but was not able to provide prompt service Aside from the service there was mold growing on the bathtub tiles I was interested to see if they would clean it the next day which they did not The maid service also knocked on the door and asked if we we needed anything I thought daily cleaning was the norm for Marriott and it was not necessary to request this service The computer area for business and customer use was at the junction of two hallways with alot of noise and traffic The computer was also facing the center of the room making everything on the screen visible to the other people standing around I would not stay at this hotel again with so many other options in the immediate area

title: Stayed here when JFK flight was cancelled
text: The location is outstanding It is near the 911 Memorial The views of the waterfront are breathtaking The rooms are small but clean and updated We had a 22 hour weather delay at JFK resulting in our staying at this hotel I am an Elite Marriott Rewards member and stay at Marriott properties throughout the USA and Canada I was very frustrated by the hotel staff here This stay was well below par because of the staff They were overwhelmed both at the front desk and in the very expensive restaurant by the influx of unexpected guests There was a lot of confusion and they were obviously offended when I asked to speak to a manager The experience went downhill from there Except for the staff everything else is very good

title: Nice hotel but understandibly impersonal
text:
We stayed here for two nights upon arriving in San Francisco before setting off on our road trip
Location
The hotel is well located for shopping and main business section of the city It takes about 20 minutes to walk to pier 39 but is a pleasant walk
Issues
Nothing
Positives
Nothing spectacular  the hotel was lovely but very big
Restaurant
We ate one meal in the restaurant  it was a nice location within the hotel although not particularly private Food was good and prices reasonable Service was friendly
Room
Our room was spacious and clean Large wooden desk with plasma tv and a large bathroom
Other comments
Dont use the internet in the lobby  it cost us a fortune Other than that a nice hotel The prices varied massively  we paid about 199 per night 100 at the time but then when we tried to book for two weeks later it was around 400 Not worth that

title: Enjoyable would go back
text: I spent two days in Houston and chose the Houstonian because of the reviews and spa connected with the hotel I wasnt dissapointed The spa was wonderful The hotel was clean attractive and made you forget you were in a major city The location of the hotel was perfect shopping nearby and many restaurants from which to choose I would certainly stay here again

title: Mixed at best
text:
We didnt know what to expect when we booked our room at the Catamaran We read through numerous reviews which were mixed at best All in all it turned out to be a just thatmixed Here are our pros and cons from our stay
Pros
The location is great Its right on the bay and the ocean is right across the street
 The grounds on the resort were very nice and well maintained
 It was a good sized room
Cons
 Our hairdryer didnt work
 The water in the shower was inconsisent at best Going from very hot to cold in a matter of seconds
 The 13 a night parking was just outrageous cause there is more than enough parking in the area to have to charge for parking
 The TV was fuzzy on most stations
 The thing that made the worst impression on us was that our cell phone charger went missing during our stay We are sure it was the housekeeper who had to unplug it to vacuum our room cause it was the in the only unused outlet in the room I guess if you plug something into their outlets than they get to keep it
So if you like location and are willing to overlook some inconveniences than I would say give the Catamaran a shot

title: Would not stay again
text:
I really dont understand how this hotel is ranked so high on TripAdvisor My wife and I were in our late 20s just stayed here at the end of July for 3 nights and were somewhat disappointed Like other reviews mention there is no elevator and TON of steps If youre carrying up luggage good luck Checkin was fine no issues
I know the rooms were described as being small by other reviewers and even the hotel when booking but jeeez man They were TINY With both of our suitcases on the floor we literally had no room to walk Our room was at the back of the hotel with a terrible view The hotel has no AC and even though it was not that hot the room always felt stuffy and warm The bathroom was also very small and found it difficult to move around in Im 60 175lbs
The location is the best part of the hotel Within walking distance to most tourist attractions in the city and there are bus stops located very close to the hotel as well The restaurant located to the left of the hotel when exiting was terrible I think it was called Calzones The following night we had dinner at The House which was only 1 block from the hotel It was by far one of the best meals Ive had ever 
Stan the evening shift front desk person was also very helpful with directions and suggestions for sightseeing and meals 
I would not stay here again

title: Great Stay at Hotel Gansevoort
text: I recently stayed at the Hotel Gansevoort in NYC I must say that the experience was fantastic The rooms service and atmosphere were all first rate The location accross from Pastis Spice Market and other restaurants makes it a truly New York experience I plan to stay at the Gansevoot from now on during my trips to New York

title: Loved this Hotel
text:
I just got back from a weekend stay at Le Parker Meridien The hotel is wonderful and the staff was great The check in was extremely quick 
Room service was fast I must have called the front desk a dozen times for information on where an ice cream shop a dunkin donuts a candy shop etc and they were so helpful Rooms were extremely clean and the beds were comfortable

title: Could not ask for more
text: We had a family wedding The hotel was selected for us Reading reviews I thought Oh Boy But honestly it was great Yes there is an airport but it did not bother us EVERTHING was exceptional The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a motel I am a bad sleeper so that is saying something The only problem we had was commication with the cleaning staff Not very good english Happens most places these days Would never thought to much about it but we lost a a member of our family the housekeeper did not have clue what I was saying

title: Great location elegant hotel
text: Had a great stay here for a 4day conference and it was a great stay From the valet parking attendants to reception to room service everyone was helpful and efficient The view of the city and the fog rolling in was beautiful from my 19th floor room I had the breakfasts in my room which arrived on time and piping hot the room was spacious and nicely decorated Large desk and lots of plugs for charging my devices on the desk and on the bedside table were great The bed was slightly hard but I still slept very well There are plenty of restaurants nearby plus youre just a short walk to Market Street and Union Square about halfway up a hill between them

title: Clean comfy room in a nice neighborhood
text:
I am not sure what everyone is complaining about but my recent 5 night stay at the Hilton was fantastic
Lets begin with the front desk The agents were helpful and friendly I was able to check in right away with a smile 
My room was clean and comfortable The bathroom was clean towels were folded neatly My room had the view of the reservoir I suggest you get the rooms in odd numbers to face the reservoir
The barrestaurants service was impeccable The manager my guess knew the regulars even if they were not staying in the hotel greeted them by walking to them shaking their hands and getting them seated to the table personally My bartender was friendly and got my drinks right What else is there to criticize
There is a work out room which has 3 treadmills and 2 ellipticals and a stretch machine which if I can bring home I wouldve The pool is little disappointing but I wasnt planning on swimming so that was fine
The business center was also well managed Clean and the programs offered users to delete every cookie and history every time you logged on FANTASTIC only minus thing was that only one printer was working but no biggie Wifi charges are 1495 per night I believe though I agree those things should be free by now
Parking is 10 per day selfvalet You can find street parking if youd like but I went ahead with valet parking
There is Saks Fifth Avenue within walking distance so is Target Lord  Taylor is maybe half of a mile from the hotel The neighborhood seemed safe enough to walk down to TargetSaks if needed There isnt a whole lot of sightseeing with an exception of The Barnes Foundation  which was life changing
Location safe Rooms clean Service good What else are you looking for

title: A little dated but nice accommodations
text:
I stayed here at The Westin July 2427 while I attended the ECHO Conference in Dallas and I was very pleased with the large room extremely comfortable bed they even sell and market their bed set at crazy high prices and the goodsized flat screen TV I didnt get to try out the pool or fitness center but they are very accommodating the fitness center has lots of machines and space to work out 
The rooms are a little dated but big and the hotel area seems safe enough I didnt have a car so I walked a lot I went across the large highway one night just venturing out but I didnt feel that safe coming back in the dark With a car youd be fine

title: Great stay
text: Great stay Hotel staff were very helpful and kind Hotel lobby was freezing cold because of a nasty cold frontIm sure it would be pleasant any other time  Beds were comfy and I slept like a baby I think you really need a car in this area I would not feel comfortable walking at night However the hotel shuttle comes very oftenFast food restaurants across the streets I would recommend this hotel to travellers

title: New and neat design
text: This is a great hotel for a business stay Quick check in ample and welllit parking nicely laidout room with an empty fridge Target is just across the way Bar with small takeout selection including fruit and lots of seating areas 24 hour fitness Two TVs sparkling bath good lighting nice teas and coffee  in short everthing one needs for a comfortable stay

title: A perfect staycation spot to celebrate my husbands birthday
text:
Since we are a part of the Starwood Preferred Guest program we tend to stay only at Starwood properties and are on the whole very impressed with their hotels We chose to celebrate my husbands birthday with luxuriating at the St Regis in town  and it was one of our top experiences with the Starwood brand
Once the staff realized it was my husbands birthday they sent up a special treat as a welcome gift after checking in We so enjoyed starting off the evening with a fantastic spread of champagne cheese and raw honey 
The room was beautiful the service was detailorientated and fullservice and the atmospheredecor was fantastic for the holiday season
Thank you to the DC St Regis for making my husbands 35th birthday that much more special

title: There are small rooms then there is the Standard
text:
I realise that New York space comes at a premium but this room is ridiculous 
Ive stayed in small hotel rooms on the past like in Tokyo but this room lacks the super smart design that is required to get away with it and still charge over 250night on sale 
There is no where to put even one suitcase 
There is only one bedside table so my phone and stuff are on the ground 
They have dedicated half of the wardrobe to an albeit excellent minibar 
And the customised desk was not customised enough to fit into the unusual corner it occupies so it is wasting space and jutting into the very tiny room 
Other than these points everything else is excellent The bar and restaurant staff and food are both wonderful The fitful of the lobby and restaurant spaces are done in a sophisticated but welcoming fashion and the exterior of the hotel is very interesting 
The Standard East Village rooms ours is on the 11th floor and has a great view would be ok for one person not two but if you do decide to stay here be very clear with your cab driver on the address because ours took us to the other Standard which was frustrating after 17 hours in the air

title: Conference
text: I would like to thank all of your staff  from your sales department when we booked the hotel Yulya to our events coordinator Stephanie and to your reservations specialist Anna EVERYONE was superior and made our conference fabulous Jose greeted me and unloaded many many boxes and checkin went smoothly We had help from Josh Ernest Angel Omar Arturo Chris and countless others but wanted to let you know that each one understood what Customer Service wasis and assisted us It was a great having someone to cover our backs and assist us when we didnt think of something or had to make a last minute change THANK YOU

title: Great Location
text: We stayed here while attending conference This wouldnt have been my first choice as far as a place to stay as it was pricey but work foot the bill I was disappointed to find a pretty dirty hotel room and for this price bracket I expected more We did enjoy lounging on the roof pool and looking towards the city from the roof I did visit the gym and I thought it was pretty dirty I am usually not too picky about these things but when you find hair in the bed and bathroom it is always a turn off Meeting facilities were perfect

title: SoSo for the price
text: The room was clean not too bad but a little on the small side My problem is not with the room but the fact that I was not aware that there was a fee to park My boyfriend and I drove seperately since we were coming from 2 different directions so we ended up paying 20 plus tax PER parking pass So that total ended up being 4480half the cost of the room just to park our cars What makes this worse is that it was totaled into the cost of the stay but now the hotel is holding that 4480 on my charge card Not a good system and should have on their website before making a reservation that there is a fee to park

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed at the Residence Inn for a July weekend and had a great time Our suite on the 16th floor was spacious clean and comfortable We looked over City Hall and loved the view We could hear no noise from the hotel but you could hear city noise outside even from the 16th floor Breakfast was excellent and the dining room was spacious and clean We walked everywhere  Independence Hall 15 minutes Rittenhouse Square 15 minutes Phil Museum of Art 25 minutes and the Franklin Institute 20 minutes Neighborhood is fine during the day but do keep alert at night especially around City Hall Staff was helpful and we appreciated that our room was ready for us when we arrived at 11 am Tiny quibbles only one shampoo conditioner etc provided for two people for the weekend  we could have used a refill Also the lobby is pretty sparce  no sitting areas or bar Regardless we would definitely return

title: comfy friendly hotel in a great neighborhood
text: I stayed for one night prior to a conference The staff is personable and professional The food was very good My room was small but I expected that and it was fine The neighborhood is historical and quaint The hotel is close to the Boston Common There is a Starbucks and a CVS nearby but the stores are predominantly boutiques and nonchain cafes etc I gave 4 dots for sleep quality because the garbage trucks show up on Charles Street in the dead of night but I am a light sleeper anyway I would go back in a heartbeat

title: Great hotel in heart of San Fran
text: Our stay at Hotel Rex was terrific The hotel is charming and in a great location The staff was respectful and polite Yes the rooms might be smaller than an average American hotel but not by much The size of our room certainly did not present any problems  all amenities were readily available The charm of the hotel more than made up for any room size issues The room size was definitely larger than most European hotels Ive stayed in We ordered nonfeather pillows from the front desk and they were delivered promptly We were able to easily store our bags after checkout because we had a late flight A perfect stay

title: Excellent Hotel that lived up to expectations and standards
text: This hotel is conveniently and centrally situated The staff are excellent and superbly trained in every area I have kept this review short because there are no ifs and buts and things to wactch out for The hotel is excellent and of the highest standard

title: Average or Below
text: The Marriott Wardman Park is an at best average hotel in an excellent location We stayed during a conference when rates at this hotel were quite high certainly far beyond the quality of the rooms or hotel amenities Our room was small with an adequate bathroom This is a large hotel with little charm In the future I will plan to stay elsewhere because there are many nicer options in the area

title: never disappointed with hampton inn
text: Have stayed at several Hampton Inns over the years and always leave satisfied the pricing is fair room very clean and comfortable The staff always greets you with a smile and very helpfull with knowledge of the local area Stayed here on business so did not have time to enjoy the facilities They do have valet parking for 35 or park yourself for 25 both off site at the end of the block Its next to the Convention center so you can leave your car and walk The breakfast buffet is very convenient or if in a rush grab a bag on the way out if back in Philly would stay again

title: These Guys Block Netflix and limit TV to make you buy their movies
text: Id recommend this hotel with caveats Nice older hotel but not up to date with limited electrical outlets no bars furnished and they block Netflix Really a tacky way of doing business I will look for somewhere else next time or preload my computer with what I want to watch

title: Location Location Location
text: My wife and kids stayed here for 3 nights This hotel is centraly located from all attractions We spent lots of time at the Farmers Market and The Grove Although the room were small and there were only double beds for our family We enjoyed the stay

title: Great airport hotel
text: Very nice hotel The rooms have just been renovated and they are large and comfortable The staff are very friendly and helpful Ive stayed here several times and never had an issue with noise from the airport Very clean Nice restaurant

title: Plusses and minusses of a good hotel
text:
The quality of the Omni Berkshire is undisputed After a weeklong stay for a short vacation in New York I want to add my voice to the crowd of satisfied customers Being generally satisfied I do not want to point weaknesses without also spelling out the more satisfying facets of my stay at the Omni What has displeased me
 The Omni Berkshire website describes their premier room as enjoying sweeping city views but dont dream about sweeping allaround The first room they sent us to 702 was instead enjoying the full frontal view of the office building on the other side of the street There was not a chance to see even a bit of blue sky from that place We protested at first to no avail but finally a manager came and offered us to a higher floor room with a better but still far from sweeping view To be fair that second room was Ok but the point is that you dont want to have to fight to get what you have paid for 
 The WIFI network is free for those subscribing to the fidelity program which is very good but incredibly slow hell you are in New York how can such a slow connection be offered in a business hotel
 The Fireside restaurant pretends to serve Starbucks coffees we took a latte and a cappuccino 7 bucks each and both were very bad
In all other aspects this is a pleasant hotel
 The location could not be beaten
 The staff is always courteous and friendly
 The bed is very good
 They offer breakfast beverages to the members of their fidelity club
 They offer both national and local newspapers
If you are not counting on an Internet connection to work and you dont bother that much for the view the Omni is an excellent hotel for you You will sleep well and enjoyed a friendly environment But if you care for a view and you need to use the Internet you may be a bit frustrated

title: Great Location
text:
Wonderful location great stay This hotel is on 40th between 6th and 7th Ave We took the train into Penn Station so we only had 6 blocks to walk to the hotel Bryant Park with ice skating in winter is on the corner 
From here we walked to Rockefeller Center and the Broadway Shows we attended
The beds were very comfortable the concierge helpful and the rooms were clean The elevator was slow  but that seems to be the norm in NYC
We recommend this hotel

title: Excellent customer service at checkin
text: I stay at this hotel at least 23 times a month and love the personlaized service I get Kudos to Eduardo for always extending a helpful hand and for making my stay superb  your welcoming smile when I check in close to midnight after a long day helps ease my feelings of exhaustion Keep up the excellent service

title: Fantastic stay at the Flatiron in Chelsea NYC
text: This was our first stay in NYC as a family 3 kids ages 6 to 12 years and LOVED this hotel The room was beautifully appointed with all sorts of electronic gadgets including automatic curtain closers which the kids loved along with the TV screen built into the bathroom mirror and the amazing fish tank in the lobby The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room was spotless However Room 504 faced the street and was drafty and a bit noisy the windows are original single pane windows Got a great deal thru Hotwire

title: Only thing good was the Location
text:
I was on a business trip and booked this Hotel If someone is looking for a good location and doesnt care about anything else this would be the hotel for them The lobby was renovated but deceiving
The rooms were old Shower was not clean AC didnt work and it was 85 degrees that night Beds were squeaky Extremely old rugs doors were scratched and not painted In all it was a disastor I have travelled a lot and have stayed in many Hotels I would certainly categorize this one as the worst

title: Very pleased with hotel and staff
text: My wife travels with me during the summer on my business trips She was so excited with the wonder view from our hotel room The staff were very friendly and courteous and respectfull of us The room was clean and well maintained We were very pleased with our stay

title: Passing thru
text: The room was big and designed perfectly The lay out of the room was exceptional Compared to some of the bigger names in suites this one compared The little bar area with fridge and microwave was perfect in space and placed in a neat area The only thing Id change would be the paper productsa little rough

title: Nice hotel good location
text: The hotel was great Nice pool for my son and the rooms were very clean and nice The only thing I didnt like was at checkin Our room wasnt ready so we had to leave and come back There arent a lot of restaurants SUPER close But within a few blocks which is ok if its nice out Overalla recommend

title: Andaz 5th Ave is Excellent Hotel in NYC
text:
We visit NYC several times a year Andaz 5th Ave is our home away when we are in NYC We had a corner suites with beautiful views love the foot bath especially after a long walk all day long 
Love the coffee bar and breakfast at The Shop was so good make sure you order Chef Vences specialty Lemon Poppy Seeds pancakes it is so delicious and please do say hello to chef Vence he is a great chef
The staff on this hotel is very friendly and yet professional always ask if we need anything over drink and wine while waiting for room to be ready or waiting for friend to pick us
We are looking forward to get back to this hotel

title: if you love cockroaches  stay here
text:
Blech We stayed here in August and on the last morning I discovered a cockroach doing the backstroke in my wineglass which was on the bedside table from the night before
The manager seems apologetic and offered to comp our foodbill of 60 which was the only charge we incurred as I had booked with SPG points However I see on my AmEx bill that they only comped us 20 and charged us the remainder for some inexplicable reason
That issue coupled with the apparent tap dancing family residing above us I swear they were running around in their room from 7am to 1am every night we were there made for a terrible experience My usually unflappable 10 year old insisted that we never stay at a Sheraton property again I would have to agree
