title: Pinch me  can this be real
text:
My wife and I spent one night at the Andaz Hyatt this past Saturday The service was superb the room was spacious and very comfortable with the sorts of amenities that I rarely splurge for In this case it was no splurge at all  the room rate was downright reasonable  205  night which included a 50 credit per couple towards their excellent hearty brunch The decor in the room was similar to a W Hotel I stayed in recently complete w large soaking tub rain forest like separate shower huge desk w built in hookups for internet power plugs etc The refrigerator was fully stocked  help yourself to anything  you only pay for the booze Free chocolate bars granola bars chips Saratoga bottled water soda etc The room utilizes mobile and rotating furniture modules that i had never seen before  very cool There was also a complimentary coffee  wine bar in the lobby I have heard of exceeding expectations  but this was outrageous
And dont let me forget to mention how helpful and professional all the staff were  from lobby to maid service to dining room Oh yeah Wall Street is kind of a cool place to stay

title: Bare bones lodging experience
text:
My wife and I stayed here while visiting friends in the city The hotel is in a great location steps away from public transit options to some of NYCs best destinations and surrounded by a neat area Inside the property and rooms can best be described as bare bones almost hostellike this might be great for the traveler on a tight budget who just needs a place to crash but dont expect much beyond that
For our case in particular we asked when making reservations whether there was WiFi access in the rooms to get some work done and were told we would be placed in one that did have inroom access When we arrived we were told no rooms had wifi but that it was available in the lobby Then even in the lobby the connection was only barely usable and most of the time not even that The staffs final recommendation just go to a Starbucks We also were apparently placed in a room adjacent to a storeroom of some sort and so at various intervals during all times of night and day the wall our beds headboard was against would shake with the loud sounds of equipment being moved or stored When we called about it they said theyd look into it and never got back to us
The pros unique decor convenient location in a neat neighborhood very friendly staff Cons some misleading marketing about amenities small rooms with not much room to maneuver and sound seems to carry between hallways and the rooms

title: Most likely will not return
text:
I would think that anyone who runs a successful hotel would know that the front desk person is the face of the hotel to anyone who is arriving The front desk folks were just well kind of blah Actually they were almost condescending I like to feel welcome and made to believe that they are happy I am there but that did not happen And this was the whole three days Not a smile within a mile I had a groupon deal and showed him the wrong code He just said thats not the right one and went back to doing whatever it was he was doing on his computer I asked about a restaurant the following morning and got the name slightly wrong I was curtly corrected The whole ambience of the front desklobby was just kinda snooty 
Other little things added up to a not so exceptional stay
The sheets would not stay tucked in I hate waking up during the night and having to retuck the sheets They were too small
The carpet was wrinkled up in several places in the room
The room had a mildly mildew smell not overwhelming but just unpleasant when you first entered
The TV remote would not turn the TV onoff Had to do that manually
The lamp plugins and our phone chargers kept falling out of the wall sockets dont know what was up with that
It cost 3000night fo park and valet parking is the only option available I know this is a trend with downtown hotels but 30night is dang near highway robbery There might have been a parking garage in the area but we did not check it out
This is an historical hotel and generally we love to stay in the older hotels but it felt like perhaps the Menger is resting on its laurels these days We stayed here many years ago and had the most amazing wonderful stay Thats why we booked again
Other stuff
The rooms are very small but to be expected in historical hotels
The ac was cold A good thing in Texas in August
The location is wonderful Its right across the street from the Riverwalk and next door to the Alamo
Real glasses not paper cups but they are VERY small
Coffee maker in the room
The cleaning staff were wonderful and accomodating I asked to exchange a decaf coffee packet for a regular and she gave me four regular for the next day too She was smiling and welcoming and just plain nice maybe they should put her on the front desk
Strong shower pressure and the tub drains well just one of those little irritations if it doesnt work
If I were returning to San Antonio anytime soon I woud not book the Menger Hotel again I might add that a pleasant welcoming staff will often cover a multitude of sins but when you dont feel welcome those little things add up real quick

title: Hotel Pennsylvania New York
text: Im amazed that such a run down dump as this hasnt been shut down I cannot believe that it cost 100 for a nights stay The staff were rude The room was filthy and the whole place felt in the mid stages of decay The walls in the corridors and rooms were a disgrace the carpets filthy and torn I think the sheets and towels were clean but wouldnt vouch for the blanket or bed cover An absolute disgrace

title: Outstanding stay at The W Times Square
text: I couldnt be happier about our recent stay at the W Times Square Dec 1721 Our stay was perfect from the minute we walked into the beautiful lobby We were greeted right awaycheck in was a breeze and our room was ready earlier than expectedan added bonus Throughout our stay the W staff were super quick to accomidate any request we had The hotel itself is gorgeous trendy yet cozy and located in the heart of Times Square I cannot stay enough positive things about The W and look forward to a future visit

title: Trip of the Summer
text: Six months ago we purchase tickets to six flag for my familys upcoming trip We were in Cincinnati all excited to go to six flags Only to find out that they werent six flag anymore We pulled up waterparks and discover Fort Rapids which was about 2 12 hours drive The kids were excited so we purchase 8 tickets and proceed to the water park Wow my kids had a blast after riding all the slides It was just perfect for our family the staff were very friendly and willing to answer all our questions We got a villa suite which had everyhing to cater to our needs Nicely laid out private bedrooms and bathrooms On the day of check out we had the opportunity to swim all day again This is now our family vacation destination because of price and distance we will definitely be back

title: Great location and very nice room
text:
Its always nice to come back to the New Yorker when visiting New York The hotel was refurbished after my last visit and the new rooms are even better than before
Since they had a nice offer the week before Christmas I decided to have a little luxury and stayed in one of the Tower Suites with a great view of the Empire State building It seems these rooms were made by joining two rooms So you have one living room and a bedroom with bathroom
The location couldnt be better bit I knew that already Just next to the subway and within easy walking of most theaters
Service was good but I didnt need very much Just checkingin and out and fortunately the lines werent very long
The weather was also very good during the 5 days I visited

title: Exceeded expectations in a mostly disappointing city
text: This motel is a block away from Greyhound terminal A local there warned us about staying at this place called Kings Court I walked around town and found and booked this place because it was the cheapest and they let us check in early Only later did I find out this was the old KINGS COURT I took our key and made my way towards our building expecting the worst But the hotel is fully renovated Everything worked including the TV The staff were good not exceptional but hey this is not a 5 star place The room was clean bed linen and towels were all clean For the price you cant go wrong in Memphis

title: Good location rooms small but only by US standards
text:
My partner and I stayed at the Milner for two nights during a twoweek tour of the US East Coast 
Originally we were supposed to be staying across town but the Icelandic Volcano had other ideas so we changed our plans and stayed at the Milner instead
After browsing some of the reviews I must admit I was a bit apprehensive about staying at the Milner but due to the last minute nature of our arrangements we couldnt exactly be piccy about our accomodation
The first thing Id have to say is that the Milners location is excellent especially if you are only in Boston for a short time The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Boston Common and the beginning of the citys famed Freedom Trail Bus and T connections are frequent from Boyleston station located at the edge of the common and also within close proximity to the hotel
Secondly Id like to dismiss some of the ridiculous claims about customers being unable to move due the size of the rooms at the Milner
Yes they are small but the hotel doesnt ever claim that they are large and I think its important to remember that the Milner was built in the Civil War era and not exactly with 21st century needs in mind
So yes dont expect kingsize beds vast expanses of carpet or faceless furniture fittings  that is all part of the Milners appeal
If you want all that then go to a large coporate chain hotel in fact there is one right across the street
In fact I was marginally impressed at the size of the hotel room not to say that theyre large but by the number of overthetop references on here about the room sizes I was expecting something resembling a shoebox I have travelled extensively in Europe and the rooms at the Milner are typical of what youd expect in a similartype guesthouse in Paris Rome or Barcelona for example
Having said all that there isnt much space in the lobby or the dining hall which can be a squeeze on busy mornings but like I said thats all part of the Milner appeal
There was plenty of choice for a small breakfast buffet and even a chance to have a go at making your own waffles this may sound strange but for me and my partner this was a first
The rooms were more than adequate for what me and my partner required which in no particular order wasp a comfortable bed plenty of cupboard space an iron and ironing board a TV with plenty of channels adequatelyfitted bathroom towels and a few flyersmagazines about what to do in Boston
All in all the Milner is ok with me

title: Clean Hotel
text: This hotel was very clean and well maintained The bed was extremely comfortable Overall we had a great stay

title: Great location nice hotel
text:
Yes it is a bit dated but the retro decor is fun and funky The bed was heavenly New downlike lite comforter and thick soft pillows The pool area is happening on weekends It is close to everything and convenient Best of all as a woman traveling alone I always felt safe there 
 I was a bit put off by the 1000 a night parking fee but it seems to be common in the area

title: Great staff
text: My bookclub reserved 8 rooms here for a 1 day trip to Chicago The location was perfect and the price reasonable for that location The staff was so helpful  we had to store our luggage because we got to the hotel before checkin time then the next day they let us store our luggage after checkour since our train did not leave for several hours The room was clean and comfortable and we took advantage of the coffeebar area in the lobby Will definitely stay again

title: Great bang for your buck
text: This hotel is great The extras that come with your room is a reason to keep coming back Each day of your stay there is a breakfast buffet complete with eggshashbrowns sausage pancakes biscuits gravy cerals pastries bagels and juices AND there is also an evening reception that offers 3 alcoholic beverages per person along with hot foods like hot dogs nachos mac and cheese meatballs pasta salad and chili What is extra special about the hotel are the many terrace and roof top spots to enjoy We visited 3 rooftop spots there may have been more The staff was very friendly and helpful This hotel is on the Riverwalk you just take the access from the lobby downstairs and around the corner is the most lively part of the area We will definitely stay here again

title: Exquisite Hotel Not to be missed
text:
My mother and I have just returned from spending 3 nights at the beautiful HayAdams hotel in room 806 The visit was our annual motherdaughter break and a birthday treat for my mother Therefore I was very appreciative of the room upgrade given after our long journey to DC We were both extremely delighted with our room It had a sensational view of the White House and it really was a dream come true for my mother to wake up and go to sleep looking at this incredible iconic view I was also thrilled with the goodies in the room including a cake to acknowledge my mothers celebration
The HayAdams hotel is absolutely superb The level of service and understated luxury truly sets this hotel apart from others I travel very often for work and am extremely particular about where I stay This hotel far exceeded my expectations and hence it is now my favourite hotel in the US and hence I can not recommend it highly enough It is one of those hotels that I would urge everyone to experience at least once 
We had cocktails at Off the Record and breakfast at The Lafayette which we thoroughly enjoyed Unfortunately we did not have time to have lunch or dinner at The Lafayette however we will ensure that we do so next time we stay here
The location is faultless which helped us to make the most of our time in DC Every member of the team provided exceptional service and did everything possible to ensure that our stay was perfect in every way As a result we will be back and will certainly be recommending this fine beautiful hotel to family friends and colleagues An experience not to be missed Do not hesitate to stay at one of the most exquisite hotels in the US You deserve it

title: Location ideal Not Luxury but great bang for the Buck will do over
text: Location as to the Gas Lamp districtHorton Plaza Mall about 6 blocks down hill cab runs you about 5 each way We used our AAA card and got a Fabulous Rate on our room We were shocked the rooms are small but all you need is there nice big TV micro fridge nice bathroom and comfy full size bed perfect for cuddling  Very Clean Continental breakfast in the morning a plus Parking is street parking and found it to be great since its free between 6pm  8 am on weekdays and no metering on weekends Didnt see any children running around Most guests we saw i would say are in there mid 2040s  There are i believe 3 floors elevators available Staff was pleasant I would def do over unless i was planning a indoor getaway which i would never ever do in San Diego

title: The Iroquois is as nearly perfect an experience as you can get
text:
We spent three nights at the Iroquois in Aprilmyself our teenage daughter and my husband We chose a suite and in effect found it was two rooms for the price of one Our daughter could shut the door and have her own space and a very comfortable bed
The hotel is brilliantly locatedan easy walk to the theatre district Times Square Empire State Building Fifth Avenue and of course good shopping At the same time when you walk inside it feels like an oasis The door is opened for you with a smile and its quiet and comfortable inside The desk staff greet you with a steaming cup of cidervery refreshing
The room was spacious immaculately clean and nicely furnished Each evening your bed is turned down and chocolates and a weather report left on your pillow If I could change one thing Id have windows that can openbut that would allow noise so it might not suit somethe double glazing meant it was very quiet There was also one waitress who disappointed with her cool attitude
However the rest of the staff were terrificand thats what really makes the place Absolutely everyone elsefrom cleaners doormen and most of all the desk staff were ready and willing to help and generously sorted out any problem For example we were offered umbrellas on rainy days and were allowed to shower and warm up after a drenching on the last day of our stay long after we should have checked out of the roomand for a very reasonable extra fee Really the staff make the place what it isa perfect spot for wonderful holiday

title: Crapprepare to be shouted at and have your money stolen
text:
The reviews seemed mixed between satisfied customers and bad experiences 
I choose this hotel based on recent positive reviews attractive location and low price 
We were not expecting too much based on the price but I am completely shocked at the service we received 
Upon checking it we were given a room that seemed to have been unoccupied for decades Dirty smelly with cobwebs hanging off the headrest of the bed and the various corners of the room When my wife asked if there were other rooms available the man at the counter shouted at her that they were fully booked and challenged us to move out 
With most other hotels fully booked due to the Fleet Weekend we of course had no choice but to stay unless we could find another hotel We politely requested that room service clean up the room while we were out We came back to find absolute nothing done In the end we had to clean the room ourselves
We woke up the next morning itching after a nightmare night in the dirty bed To make things worst we went down to the breakfast room to be greeted by the same grumpy old man who shouted at my wife He proceeded to grumble at us and all the other guest and bang the food onto the tables
To complete the nightmare we realized that housekeeping had stolen money from my wifes purse We were sure that she had not misplaced or dropped the money as she had counted the money the night before and did not remove her purse from her handbag from the time she counted her money till the time we realized the loss The only time her purse was left unattended was when she left the room for a few minutes to use the very slow Wifi in the conference room Housekeeping was just cleaning the room next door when she stepped out and nowhere to be found when she returned a few minutes later
In short DO NOT STAY HERE Spend a little bit more money for peace of mind in a better Hotel In fact we saw a much better posher hotel Grand Plaza Hotel just around the corner which offers room at the same price It was unfortunate that they had no rooms available or we would have moved there

title: Creepy Isolated and Waaaaay Overpriced
text: If you wanted to get away from it all or hideout this might be a good choice If you think you are checking into a luxury resort forget it If you are not a nature lover or staying on property the entire time for a program this is a lousy choiceremote limited services and downright spooky at night The restaurant closed at 9 chairs and equipment were piled up in the former bookstore and classrooms Its outrageously overpriced for what you get There was no tv in the room understandable for a  holistic retreat experience but not as a luxury accomodation Our package included breakfast for an additional 50 but not worth the 45 min it took the first morning or the second morning which I chose to skip entree choices due to the long delay in even getting coffee The scone I settled for was tiny and cold The property was nearly deserted but we were put in the farthest building next door to a building that was totally dark and looked abandoned and very creepy at night We had to walk 10 minutes in the dark to get anything out of the car which had to be left at the top of a hill in a parking lot Big uncovered holes along the path could have been a disaster as could the campfire left burning and unattended on a windy night with acres of dry timber The golf cart that transported us crammed up next to our luggage to our room at check in had wet seats but was better than checkout where our luggage was tossed into the flat bed of another cart filled with tools and maintenance equipment and no room for us Not my idea of either luxury treatment or a retreat experience This place is riding on the beauty The Crossings created and charging rates you would pay at a true luxury resort but it is far from luxury I think even the staff is uncomfortable being in what feels like an isolated if not nearly abandoned property since my walking in the door during the day caused the clerk to jump and say I had scared him The largest number of other people I ever saw in the place was 12 and 8 of those may have been part of the crew doing a promotional photo shoot there I was so disappointed that such a formerly beautiful and peaceful place now seemed to be so badly exploited Or was it just me who felt exploited I can tell you I did when I checked out and saw a gratuity had been added onto the entire cost of the bill on top of the already excessive costs I will never stay at this place again as long as it is under this banner

title: Excellent Stay Friendly Staff
text: Stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham in November for a conference Everything from the reception desk to the cleaning staff was perfect The beds are super comfortable It was actually the best sleep Ive had in awhile I had a very nice corner room with panoramic views of downtown San Francisco The staff was more than accomodating in helping me arrange a semiprivate dinner at the restaurant on the property I was very impressed with all of their efforts The hotel is downtown  so its very close and within walking distance to the Moscone Convention center and many other attractions and shopping areas My one and only issue is that there is no free internet access about 15 per day For the cost of the hotel one would think internet would be a complimentary amenity especially since most of the guests are business travelers Otherwise  no complaints

title: Not bad on a budget
text: This hotel is in NE San Antonio right off I35 I didnt hear the train noise some were complaining about but was at the back of the property Overall not a bad budget hotel One issue I encountered was they were renovating a room on the ground floor right below ours and started at 8am friday morning Awoke to sounds of hammers and drilling Not sure what they were thinking but anyway Breakfast is average liked the happy hour and pool was ok Staff were good Parking is a bit tricky if you arrive late

title: Great Service
text:
My business partner and I were wowed by the service at the Gaslamp Hilton when we stayed Every employee that we spoke to from housekeeping to management were courteous and eager to please Another plus is that the hotel is very close to both the gaslamp restaurants convention center and the Trolley  prime location
Some things to consider if you want a room here
Parking can be extremely expensive everywhere in the Gaslamp  the area is deliberately not carfriendly On a Saturday night just use the hotel valet service Be careful because they charge up to 30 a night  but the service is really nice if you take your car out all the time Best bet is to be dropped off or find another way here and forget the car 
The room furnishings are adequate although people who pay over 200 a night may find themselves wanting better quality Trains and Trolleys pass by the convention center side but with windows closed its not a big deal at night I thought the bed was wonderful  I had trouble getting to my conference sessions 
Service in the lobby restaurant is great although the food is pretty basic fare We thought it was a great place to stay but our business footed the bill so it might be different if we payed out of pocket I will say that Ive never had a friendlier total hotel staff than the one at the Gaslamp Hilton

title: Pleasant staff good location cheap toilet paper
text:
The Hilton Garden Inn Uptown is very conveniently located just a few blocks from the main drag on Tryon Street and close to the sports stadiumarena The staff was pleasant and the rooms were clean The breakfast was not great not terrible  slightly stale pastries and whatnot but Ive had worse Its pretty inexpensive for the area so its a good value 
The only major complaint I have is the extremely scratchy toilet paper If I ever stay here again Ill bring my own roll No joke

title: Better than last time which was pretty darn goodnear perfect stay
text:
Finding a familyappropriate hotel is sometimes hardbut the Catamaran was wonderful The grounds were beautiful and very entertaining for our kids ages 4 6 9 Our room was really nice We stayed there three years ago and I could tell that our room had been updated since then I think the furniture was the same but it appeared to have new carpet and the bathroom vanity area appeared newer It was very clean too Wore white socks around the room the first night and couldnt see anything on the bottoms The tubtoilet area of the bathroom is not fancy Just a simple tub and toilet If you are expecting glass shower surrounds and seperate tub and shower area you might want to look elsewhere Our room was on the ground floor of a twostoried building and was SUPER quiet We could only hear our neighbors when they were coming in their door from the outside We could hear our upstairs neighbors walking around occassionally but overallprobably one of the quietest we have ever stayed in Room was a great size for our family of 5 Our littlest slept on a toddler cot we brought from home We requested a microwave and with that and the refrigerator we were able to make several light meals in our room
Location location location Seriously it cant be beat Loved being on the bay and one block from the beach It was our sons 4th birthday the day we arrived and upon checking in the gal helping us out made it a point to wish me happy birthday for him and gave us a nice little perkfree parking for our stay That was awesome Our kids used the pool every day and had a blast It was never overly busy in the pool area and was very familyfriendly 
Mission Beach is a beachy downtoearth community If you are expecting more glitz and glamour perhaps you should try La Jolla Shores area I have spent many summers in my youth at Mission and PB and I love that it is so casual comfortable and not overlypretentious The restaurants are small and there really arent any big chains in the area unless you count Subway 
We ate a couple times at the little Mexican restaurant right next to the hotel and it was super yummy and very afforadable We also ate at World Famousbeachocean view and it is a nice family restaurant When eating there with small children we actually prefer to sit in the bar area over the regular restaurant because there are more kidfriendly meal options plus its cheaper 
The Catamaran was very easy to find and very close to Sea World and other touristy areas 
Only recommendation for the hotelselflaundry service The hotel laundry is too expensive and if you are staying for an extended time it would be nice to have laundry facilties onsight

title: Served a purpose  Would not stay again
text: The room is clean and the bed was made after a nights stay Some of the towels given were dirty Placed some items in the closet  they came out damp Would not stay here alone however had a friend with me Complimentary breakfast  not really worth it  didnt even have bread to make toast Staff were polite however did not understand what I was saying at times I would not stay again Near the airport  planes can be heard and fly right over the Inn however not a huge issue for us but could be if you are a light sleeper or want some peace and quiet

title: Perfect location to see the sights in DC
text: We just returned from our first time staying at this hotel We booked on Priceline and I think we got a really good deal I was hoping to find a decent hotel that we could afford on a Saturday night that was in a good downtown location I couldnt have asked for more After hearing so much about the Metro and how easy it is to use and the convenience we figured wed give it a try And how perfect this hotel is built on top of a Metro station Not all stations have parking though and since it costs 33day to park at the hotel we chose a nearby station that did offer free parking on weekends We left the car there overnight Saturday to Sunday with no problems And free We arrived at the hotel around 1pm and inquired about check in They said they dont start that until 4pm It wasnt a problem we just continued with our sightseeing and riding the Metro We came back to the hotel around 430 and checked in with no problem We had a room with two double beds overlooking the roads and also a nice view of the harbor The beds were comfortable and the room was clean I personally loved the blackout shades they had on the windows This is so important when trying to sleep in when Im on vacation and not all hotels have them A definite plus in my book We didnt choose to eat at the restaurant at the hotel because of hearing how pricey it is but at least you have it as an option We did use the hotel pool for a short period of time it was pretty crowded but a nice little refreshment after walking all day Overall I would say if you are looking for a hotel downtown so you dont have to drive everywhere this is your place It has character and may need some updating which I guess they are working on based on the construction we saw going on but it met all of our needs If you are someone who needs complete peace and quiet during your stay this might not be for you You can definitely hear the trains going in and out And from what I can see on their website I think I saved almost half of a normal nights stay by booking through Priceline

title: This was in a great location
text:
The room was clean and comfortable Housekeeping was very good as was the friendliness in the restaurant The food on the 17th floor was excellent The woman at the desk whose name tag said Edith was very friendly and helpful The valet service people were also very friendly
The only suggestion for improvement would be that it would have been helpful to have a luggage rack in the room

title: Good Deal for the discount
text:
The Hotel was good we had no problems Having read prior reviews about construction I asked for a room far away from the 4th floor and they kindly gave us the 15th so there were no noise issues The rooms were clean the staff was nice
Some people say it is far away but were Bostonians and walk all the time anyways so to us well we love a nice walk anyways Walking through the Upper East Side strolling to delis and shops on our way to the museums and Central Park was wonderful If you have trouble walking  well cabs are always available and cheap by Boston standards or you may want to choose someplace closer to your destination If youre going to the Met Guggenheim etc this is fine
Parking was no trouble and cheap for NYC the hotel gives you a validation and if you leave your car there its 20day
The hotel is not in the heart of the Upper East Side it is in fact in YorkvilleCarnegie Hill There is public housing right across the street but that doesnt bother us since thats exactly the same as where we live in Boston Rampant crime in public housing is a myth In seven years in this location in Boston we have never experienced streetcrime living near public housing Similarly we had no trouble in NYC If myths about public housing scare you then by all means pay double for the Midtown asphalt noise and pollution Otherwise like us you may enjoy strolling through the leafy streets in the nicest part of NYC the Upper East Side

title: great location
text: We stayed here on Feb25 while visiting for a Pacers game Hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly They have a pool hot tub and exercise facility in the basement which is very nice The hotel is within walking distance of Conseco and Circle Centre Mall and to save money park at the Hallmark building on Pennsylvania for 8 a night For breakfast I would recommend La Peep on the corner of New York and Illinois just about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the hotel Highly recommend good value for the price

title: Great property lousy rooms
text: Just spent the weekend at this resort participating in meetings with coworkers from around the country Grounds are beautiful Lobby is modest but modern conference rooms and food are exceptional But the guest rooms A good amount of our spare time was spent comparing stories about bugs dust mildew slow draining sinks and tubs rusty bathroom fixturesManagement should gut all the rooms and remodel them to meet current standards

title: Perfect place for a trendy week end in NYC
text:
We have just returned from a 3 days weekend in New york Our 2 nights at the Revington Hotel contributed to make it a memorable experience First of all the location is just great for those who do not want to stay in the so crowded and so touristic areas of the city The lower east side is a great alternative to discover the inside Manhattan atmosphere The hotel is 10 mn walk from Soho Tribeca Nolita and Little Italy 20 mn walk from Greenwich Village or Union Square and 5mn walk to the metro station from where you could reach Central Park in the upper side  we only took metro twice when our feet couldnt carry us anymore 
The hotel is trendy and design Rooms are immaculate and offering an astonishing view ours was on the 11th floor The shower is just huge and spotless Above all the matresses are really incredible Something like a new system taking into account your weight to support your entire body sur mesure Cant describe it has to be experienced
The evening service left both nights on our bed side table either cookies and browniesvery appreciated attention
We definetly and highly recommend this place

title: OK not great
text: The room was adequate but weve stayed at better places in SFran It was noisy and had an odor Only 6 blocks from Bart but up steep hill tho you can ride the cable car

title: Perfect Manhattan Hotel
text:
I just stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square July 27 2007 the hotel was immaculate and in the best possible location The staff was very nice and happy to assist in any questions about local hot spots We were a a block from the subway a couple from Times Square and Broadway Do not believe the bad reviews because this was one of the nicest hotel I have stayed inn We booked the King Sitting room it was very big by NYC standards and was very clean every day when we returned 
 Parking your vehicle was a breeze right next door in a secure undergound lot I think it was 26 USD a day but on par with everywhere else Like the other reviews say this place is a gem and will stay there again when i return
I strongly reconmend the Harbour Lights Cruise the guide was very knowledgable and did not over talk Take it the first night there and you will know where everything is and what it is called after you are done incredible views of Manhattan NY and Hoboken NJ 
Also the HoponHopOff bus tour for 48hrs You can use it as your taxi around the city and a bus comes every 15 mins if you want to jump back on
Stay here if you want no problems

title: Great hotel but disappointing service
text: On our trips to New York City for client meetings we have always stayed at this hotel The location is perfect for us and we love the view of Central Park This year because of tis past weekend being so close to Christmas it was indeed very busy As we had breakfast included in our rate roomservice or the dinning room we ordered room service We were told it would be up right away an hour later the coffee arrived but no breakfast Then a half hour later the breakfast came However there were no knives so we buttered our toast with our spoons The next morning we decided we would go to the dinning room The wait to be seated was onerous with vacated tables in sight It took almost

title: If you are going to a conferencestay here
text: Fabulous hotel with a great choice of bars and places to eat to fit everyones budget Staff were great very friendly and helpful Bar food was good value as was the bagel bar The pool area was nice and clean and the sun terrace was great to escape to at lunch timewould definitely go backMake sure you visit the little shopping are in the Arizona Centre  theres a great Greek restaurant there lovely atmosphere in the whole areaInternet is free if you join as an executive member so you may as well join as thats free too

title: Alright for a family on a budget
text:
We stayed here on the advice of several people on the TA Forums and it wasnt that bad Its not in a nice area really but very convenient I dont think its worth what they charge and we had the Managers Special but otherwise not bad The room we had was very dark and dreary located behind the office but it was nice for getting three kids in and out of parking lot It was depressing to have it so dark and the decor doesnt help but you cant have everything I was also annoyed to discover that while they say they have a laundry there actually isnt one and its a good drive away  you couldnt walk to it carrying any amount of laundry The pool and hot tub area is small but my kids and hubby had no complaints It would be nice if some parents of some teenagers would control their children so they dont run wild and act like hooligans but that was no reflection on the motel The staff at this motel were the best we encountered on our trip and any requests were dealt with immediately and professionally
My biggest complaints were no laundry although advertised with one and the price doesnt really make it a good value The room we had needed some cosmetic maintenance but otherwise was comfortable Very convenient to Seaworld

title: Great value the title speaks for itself
text: I loved it would stay here again very comfortable beds

title: Great Hotel
text: Central location wonderfully historic old building pleasant staff looking for opportunities to serve their customers great rooms clean throughout Will surely return

title: Fantastic view poor feng shui room
text:
We stayed for a weekendour 2nd time hereand loved the view from our room of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan HUGE hotel with 2000 roomsif staying on an upper floor prep for a long wait for an elevator and car downit can easily take 15 minutes to get from your room to outdoors
Guest room recently remodeled is a great example of poor feng shui the kingsize bed was pulled away from its traditional spot against the wall and literally plunked in the center of the room facing the entry door and bathroom A business desk and the rooms huge window are behind the headboard Mattress and bedding were good but it took awhile to get to sleepit felt like someone was going to pop through the door even though it was lockeddeadbolted
Tip for cheaperthanthehotelgiftshop food drinks and amenities go a block down the street to Bockwinkels grocery store

title: this place was great
text: awesome place to stay if you are on a budget my wife and i stayed here and could not be more satisfied with the staff and location it is close to many things in chicago nearby

title: No Frills Hotel with Location Location Location
text: My husband and teenage son and I stayed four nights at the Edison July 20th until 24th It was our first trip to NYC and really wanted to be near Times Square The hotel was recommended by people I work with and I was told great loacation  clean etc  So we booked thru their website and got a deal pay now save later so for 211oo a night we got a huge breakfast every morning  eggs bacon fired poataoes toast juice and coffee  included and two drinks at the Rum room bar So it was def a good deal  The hotels best feature is the loaction its literally 30 secs form the Times square bleachers This a good for our son bc some nights he would just go and sit and watch people when we went to bed I felt very safe with him doing this since the hotel was that closeThe hotel lobbey is art deco sofas and chairs around to sit and chat with people or wait for someone The rooms are tired We were in room 1526 and we had a quite room we heard nothing and it had 2 double beds and a bathroom  very small   The beds are standard and we slept well  no pillow top mattress etc  the bedding was clean and changed daily and no bed bugs  a selling feature as well for us  The towels were clean and we always had enough for the three of us  The room could have used up dates our air condtioner worked well thank Goodness it was 108 degrees when we were there The people working at the hotel were nice  There is security 24 hours a day and they stand at the elevators and make you show a guest key before you can go up Nice catch The cafe we had our included breakfast in was like a 1960s cafe its no frills but the service was fast and the food was good The people who work there work very hard and were always friendly Would I stay there again I would recommend it for thoses who want times sq area for sure and are not into luxury hotels just clean and basic  for those who like pillotop mattress 400plus thread count sheets and duvets and new decor no this is not for you But its a great bang for you buck  We liked the location bc we could go back to our room at 5 or 6 have a nap shower etc before we headed out for a broadway show all are really near thsi hotel  and supper So like I said LOcation Loaction LOcation

title: Good resort feel with limited food options
text:
This property is awesome Friendly check in and personal escort to our room Rooms patio walked out to the golf course which was just too cool Huge hd tv spacious room two chairs and plenty of room for activities Aveda bath products are always nice This was one of the best rooms I have ever seen
Staying here 4 nights was way too much because of the limited food options There is really only one bar that serves substandard cuisine and some I the restaurant menu We came in expecting several distinguished dining options but it all was blah We were forced to sculp out the surrounding area instead of doing the true resort thing by not leaving
For over 600 in breakfast lunch dinner for 2 we left feeling like the food was a ripoff and trust me it was all average You know the feel when one chef cooks for several menus
 Even room service served the same menu options However room service was a life saver as it rained all day Sunday Food was delivered perfectly each time props to their staff for this How you deliver cold salads hot food and appropriate condiments every time AND in the rain is astonishing

title: Great hotel great location
text:
This is a great hotel in a great location The only downside was the building work that was taking place while we were there It started early at 7am however it was useful to get us up early for sightseeing
Staff were excellent as was the room would definitely stay here again

title: Great Hotel and Location
text: Everyone here was kind and helpful Happy Hour here was better than most Embassy Suites Breakfast was great The restaurant was great I agree with previous posts I had no cell service at all but rooms were comfortable and it was a Great Location Would definitely go back

title: location location location
text:
Wow What a city We have just returned from a 4 day break to new york staying in the hotel 41  we took advice from trip advisor reviews and so glad we did we thank you for this everything we read was true so we were prepared
rooms  they were small hardly spent time in there too much to do but cleaned everyday and fresh towels everydaythe bed linen was fresh and cleanimportant to meair conditioning unit quite noisy but we just unplugged it at night  not a problem to us we had a room to the front of the hotel which was quite noisy we asked if we could be moved to a quieter room this was done straight away for us
Location  superb  right on the edge of times square  subway taxi terminal and bus terminal minutes away shops restaurants theatresbars right on your doorstep
bar  the drinks in the hotel we found quite expensive but fine as a one off at the beginning or the end of an evening it was very comfortable and had bowls of snacks on the bars to dip into
breakfast and coffee making facilities  the breakfast was complimentary continental  it was fresh bagels cream cheesejammarmalade and lots of different pastries and cakes  tea coffee orange juice as much as you can eat luverly juberly not good for my waistline would have liked to have seen some fresh fruit as a choice  but it was complimentary coffe was complimentary up until 400pm this was a shame as when we did want one it was usually in the evening so we had to find a starbucks which was obviously only minutes away
reception area and service there was always someone on reception waiting to give you friendly advice and a doorman to open the door for you and to wish you a good day all in all i would definately recommend this hotel for your stay in new york  a small friendly boutique hotel  living on the edge

title: New clean hotel
text: Located about one mile south of the Katy Freeway just south of Memorial on Eldridge parkway this is a new hotel with great weekend rates on priceline Remember you are close to highway 6 so you are 15 miles west of downtown Safe upscale area

title: Good Hotel Nice Restaurant Near Airport
text:
When you arrive in LA airport there are several terminals but is relatively easy to travel You need to walk out from the terminal Just outside the terminal there are busstops Look for busstop with a Red color sign board if you want o take free shuttle bus service to your respective hotels Waiting time will not be more than 1520 minutes
HolidayInn LA is only about 5 mins ride from the airport I stayed in this hotel for only one day but my impression on this hotel was good The staff seem knowledgeable on recommending places to visit The in house restaurant serve good food with reasonable price There is also a gift shop near the restaurant If you are traveling on budget there are some fast food restaurants just outside the hotel MacDonalds is just next hotel The Hotel also organize day LA trip for busy travelers Overall experience has been great I will use this hotel again

title: Great stay
text: Spent a week at the Carlton in November First time in San Francisco so I was a little apprehensive about previous guests concerns about the hotels location on the fringes of the Tenderloin but didnt have an issue with this during our stay The Carlton offers great value in a good location the staff were really friendly and I loved my room

title: No frills but value for money
text:
A very unexpected bitter cold snap meant this hotel was in a good location for running back to in a hurry whilst in the central area Our first recognitition was that of extremely helpful staff especially the concierge Larry 
 Although coventional this hotel was essentially just a bed to stay in as it offered nothing else really except location The Lobby very small just about passed for a lounge  
I definately not recommend the Pigalle restaurant attached to hotel as this somewhat discredits or contradicts the simplicitiy of the place as a it was very overpriced and b the staff were pretty useless 
For the English traveller the tea and Coffee making facilities were a bit rubbish no kettle tea or milk only a Coffee machine which proved very awkward to move and use  my husband kindly went to Starbucks over the road to get my obligitory first morning cuppa
 I would though highly recommend the Cosmic Diner a couple of blocks North on the same side of the road for a good breakfast  it gets busy around 103011am so try and get in earlier  this is also the place to catch the Brilliant City sights Blue Bus Hop on Hop Off tour 
For other eating Facilities without using the highly overpriced Times Square area we walked to Hells Kitchen just over the block for an unlimited choice of Restaurants and Bars  
Back to the Hotel  I would probably recommend to others but as Ive stayed in New York a few times now I would prefer to stay around the Soho area where this seems to be where more things are going on

title: Good attitude good servicegood price
text: We stayed fro 2 weeks on the upgraded rooms on the top floor The first room we were offered backed onto the lift shafts but this was quickly and efficiently changed A greeter was arranged to help us find our way around who was friendly and knowledgeable The Tenderloin district is not an issue during the day It would be great if it was 5 mins walk nearer Union Square but what you save in money pays for a lot of taxis downtownWe would definitely stay here again The room even had a view and if you fill in the survey online they will offer you 25 reduction off your next stay Room was fine and kept very clean Thin walls not an issue on our floor it was all very quiet its not 5star but it is very good for what you pay

title: Very pleasant will return again
text:
My friends and I stayed at the Moorpark again this summer Like last year the staff was very helpful the room clean and cheerful the beds comfortable the free apples in the lobby crunchy Good airconditioning system 
This year our room was on the ground floor right by the pool so it was fairly noisy in the afternoon and early evening But quieted down by nightfall when we returned Parking was easy with the extra underground parking in the rear 
 Two minor things that made our stay less than perfect this time their computers were down with no internet access for another 2 weeks That didnt help us Also our room was booked as a triple but initially there werent enough towels set up After a call to the front desk housekeeping arrived promptly with an armfull of extra towels All and all a very pleasant stay We will certainly return next summer

title: Another good visit
text: This is our third visit to Holiday Inn Downtown The morning and evening concierge are very helpful and courteous Sean is especially helpful and friendly By now when we arrive they call us by name When we ask for a wake up call its on time ask for a cab its on time All in all a very satisfactory place to stay

title: Good for conferences at McCormick PLace
text:
Stayed here just last week for a few nights 
Location is great if going to the convention centre which is what we were in town for but quite a distance from downtown 1315 cab fare each way You are better off driving to the downtown area and paying for parking which is way cheaper than taking a cab each way 
Hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful and the hotels workout facilities are good too
This hotel is VERY south That said if you are in groups ok to go out at dark but I was warned by hotel staff not to walk around alone at night I guess it gets sketchy as some other reviewers have pointed out in other posts Daytime you are fine
There didnt seem to be a lot of restaurants in the area but theres a great Italian place that delivers called Ricobenes that I ordered pizza from and it was great Didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment on the quality of the food there
I asked for a hotel away from the elevators and on the opposite side that the bar is on on the rec of another post due to noise which I got 
Where I was situated room was quiet as was the floor and the room was very spacious Quite huge actually and the bathroom was a good size with a full size hair dryer and not those rinkydink wall blow dryers that a lot of hotels have
Beds were alright but not overly comfortable Full size closet in the room with ironing board and iron which came in handy for getting work clothes ready in the mornings
Since we were here for a conference and its proximity to McCormick place was great it served its purpose

title: We loved this hotel
text:
My partner and I absolutely loved this hotel We were trying to find an accomodation close to union square and close to public transportation The Orchard was perfect We stayed in a room with a kingsized bed and it could not have been more comfortable To this day we compare hotel beds to the one we had at the Orchard The room itself was clean and spacious We didnt require a lot of room because we spent most of our trip on the streets of SF If you want to lounge in the hotel you can rent DVDs from the front desk But why would you Better to explore San Francisco
As soon as you step out of the hotel youre on a cable car line Turn left and youre on another cable car line Walk 23 blocks downhill and you reach yet another cable car line the main drag for several bus routes and the underground train The Orchard offers a breakfast buffet that you must pay for We found it convenient though you may not want to pay the price We didnt have to deal much with the staff because we had no issues with our stay but when we spoke with them they were extremely friendly We are definitely staying at the Orchard the next time were in San Fran

title: LOVE the Donatello
text:
We are Shell Vacation Club members and the Donatello is part of SVCs network It was really a pleasant surprise as Ive always heard how small the rooms are in SFO Our roomsuite was incredibly spacious with the best bed ever I also like the stereo and DVD player in the room 
Location is really key The Donatello is just a couple of blocks from Union Square and less than a mile walk to Chinatown It was very easy to get around on buses and trolleys bus is definitely the way to go and you dont need to buy the 18 week passits only 150 for the bus with a 2 hour transfer for free
My only complaint about the hotel was that the jacuzzi tub was broken and apparently has been since November 2007are there no repairmen in this town and there is no pool But we were so busy sightseeing everyday that it didnt impact us in the least
Staff were incredibly friendly and theyve got a pretty darn good happy hour everyday in the lounge We absolutely recommend it

title: Great Location Adequate Staff and Great Management
text:
Stayed here with my wife for anniversary trip Am SPG Plat but stayed on points So I will not comment on value for dollar as have no clue what rate was on our stay 
First the manager was very responsive and accomodating to certain of my requests I did receive a bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate strawberries for our anniversary from the management That was a great gesture and was indicative of how managment treated us during the stay 
The location of the hotels is great for seeing the city Right next to Union Square station which is perfect for subway access uptow and a quick ride on the F to Williamsburg if you want to see the hipsters there Also perfect to walk to Chelsea SOHO Greenwhich and even Midtown
Room cleanliness was average For example shower curtain was quite stinky but they did replace immediately upon my request Maid service however was fine and prompt
Staff was adequate By that I mean they always were responsivenot overly friendly but not abrasive either 
Room was quite for NY especially since hotel is on Park We were on 7 which is fairly low floor but NYC noise was not an issue
So I recommend this place as a jumping off point for seeing NYC and props to the management for being so great

title: March 30 and 31st Stay
text: My daugher was married on March 31 2012 at the Room on Main venue in downtown Dallas Texas We stayed at the Hotel Indigo in downtown Dallas since only about 34 block away from the venue We had a fantastic stay They delivered all my goody bags to my guest transported us Friday night to reherasal dinner about 3 blocks away and made several trips to the venue all day Saturday They allowed the bride and bridesmaid to check into their rooms at 11 am instead of 3 pm on Saturday so that they could start getting hair and make up ready I could go on but just note outstanding service all around

title: the best around
text: i arrived at the hotel and was greeted from the moment i got to the door all of the staff was friendly and welcoming the rooms were spacious and very clean from start to finish it was a fantastic experience

title: What a gem
text: First stay here and am loving the staff the King suite and the view of the beautiful Charles Clean and comfortable And even though the living room faced the interior courtyard never heard a single sound from the outside A firstrate front desk that has a cando attitude with a smile Only downside is the location is odd and not an area you want to explore on foot but its easy to reach any area in BostonCambridge Would definitely stay here again Thank you Doubletree

title: Excellent Service Beautiful Room We Will Return
text: A special birthday weekend had been planned  3 months in advance Wanted all to be perfect  and it was Front desk was efficient  personable Our room  2 Queens Harbor view was beautiful complete with a fresh Stargazer lily Everything attractive  immaculate Outstanding location able to walk most everywhere  enjoyed music  outdoors there on the Harbor Needed a little extra time  1 hr next morning before check out this was graciously granted as a special brunch had also been planned  knew we would need time to return to room afterwards  check out I have not seen customer service like this in a long long time Looking forward to returning

title: Great Hotel But Bar is SubPar
text: Our stay was pleasant and the staff attentive and helpful The room was clean and spacious and we had no unexpected surprises The service at the bar however was incredibly slow With under ten people in the place it took 15 minutes for two bottles of beer to be delivered after we waited 10 minutes to place our order So after half an hour of waiting to get a bottle of beer we decided to move on to another location The Sushi service was however excellent This may be a case of a single bad waitress

title: Beautiful hotel top notch service
text: I agree with the previous review about missing the lobby experience but the staff rushed us right in before we knew what was happening and we were up in our room We had a great room on the fifth floor overlooking the park and in our case the Thanksgiving Day parade Floor to ceiling windows really made a difference and our guests you were allowed up to ten truly enjoyed the experience We had a Keurig in the room and complimentary waters We also had the use of a kitchen in an adjacent room Nightly turn downs with chocolates slippers and robes reminded you that it was a five star experience Room service was fantastic and the food unforgettable You will be spending top dollar to get a parade view room anyway why not book the best this was our fourth parade view room

title: already cancelled my reservation and havent even gone yet
text:
I recently reserved a room at this hotel through orbitz I called to find out what type of room we were getting with a bathroom or shared bathroom
I also wanted to make sure we had a reservation after reading the reviews on here
The man was very rude and said call back tomorrow I called back the next day and he said call back tomorrow So 4 days leter I called back and he confirmed my reservation for a triple room with a private bath 
Well I am 4 months pregnant and will be 5 when we get to NY so call it maternal instinct but I decided to book us a room at Embassy Suites musch nicer for only 40 more a night 
I called hotel 31 to cancel the day after I had called to confirm and they couldnt find my reservation The man even implied that I didnt make one Why on earth would I waste my time trying to cancel a reservation I didnt even make Finally after arguing he sort of owned up to the fact that he had confirmed my reservation the previous day and cancelled it Luckily I was able to cancel on Orbitz as well 
Just make sure you check and double check that you indeed have a room reserved Cant say anything about the hotel quality but Im tempted to stop by and visit during our stay 
I would have been really POd if we arrived labor day weekend with no reservation in an overbooked hotel 5 months pregnant

title: Cant Imagine it gets any better in NYC
text: This hotel is hitting on all cylinders Incredible Interior Design impeccable cleanliness excellent service great rooms excellent food quaint location and the list could go on I am critical to a fault but this Hotel has done a wonderful job Strong water pressure in the oversized marble shower heated towel warmer upscale finishes it is just nonstop fantastic The Soho location is tucked away and perfect There is an awesome Dean and Deluca half a block away Balthazar across the street and the subway around the corner Nonstop shoppingstrolling in Soho and adjacent areas I would not say the hotel is necessarily intended for families with small children Our teenage boys had a blast though Just a perfect NYC experience to be had Congratulations to all the hardworking people at this hotel I will certainly return

title: Worst hotel stay ever
text: Horrible experience Air conditioning barely working Room smelled The bathroom was disgusting and tons of hair in the tub and sink The room looked like a bad dorm room Stay away if you can This is the worst hotel I have stayed in in the times square area and is not worth 100 let alone 300

title: Cant beat the price
text:
As most everyone mentioned the location is excellent Since I was alone I particularly liked having everything literally steps away Metro is also close I have traveled extensively and visited New York before and selected the Wellington because of its price and location vs atmosphere and luxurious accommodations I was in NY to visit a family member but also want to do my own thing I researched several places to stay and could not beat the price of the Wellington 
When I arrived at 930 AM check in was fast and my room was ready
I didnt bring a computer but used the ones in the lobby fee just to check my email Wireless is also available for a fee
My room was quiet and clean and the bed was extremely comfortable The bathroom was small and old nothing fancy for sure but it had a good hot shower not lacking in water pressure a pet peeve of mine You can get a good breakfast in the hotel restaurant before heading out Starbucks is across the street no lack of Starbucks though along with a deli if you want to grab a yogurt or piece of fruit
The bellmen are very accommodating When I checked out in the morning they stored my bag until I returned for my flight later than evening and they arranged for a driver to the airport When I returned I discovered my flight had been canceled and rebooked to the following day The bellman immediately contacted the driver I booked another room for the night and the receptionist provided me with a fantastic room with a view Thank you
When I return to New York I am definitely staying at the Wellington

title: Oktoberfest was a BLAST
text: Oktoberfest at the Brookshire Suites was a BLAST I would totally recommend this hotel to friends and family The staff was super nice and provided a fun and relaxing atmosphere Well done

title: Fantastic stay
text: The Affinia Dumont was better than expected I stayed for 5 nights for business travel Location was great for seeing the city within walking distance of Grand Central station subway Empire State building Times Square the UN buildings all nearby Had a nice good size studio suite with kitchenette convenient area with lots of restaurants pubs and bars and there is also a deli on the corner just outside the hotel door Most impressive was the onsite spa and fitness room

title: Charming Hotel in the Heart of Downtown Chicago
text: This hotel was absolutely wonderful The staff was unbelievably helpful and the location was perfect right near Millennium Park multiple L train lines great shopping and restaurants and walkable to many major attractions We loved the lobby and overall decor of the hotel It was really classic and elegant but not over the top The restaurant seemed very busy though we didnt eat there  I would imagine its quite good given the popularity The hotel is dog friendly and it was such a treat seeing our furry friends in the elevator and lobby They do a daily wine happy hour from 56pm which was a nice touch and great way to unwind after a long day or have a preevening drink in the comfortable lobby I would definitely return and absolutely recommend this wonderful gem of a hotel We got a great deal via SniqueAway but I think its relatively affordable even without a discount

title: Great Hotel I would definately recommend to friends
text: We had a wonderful time at this hotel The staff could not have been more accommodating We requested an early check in and we actually got it We requested a crib for our 6 month old which wasnt in the room because of the early check in but was delivered within 5 minutes of our arrival The breakfast buffet was great a little crowded but good food and everything was replenished promptly The staff at this hotel made a very good impression on us

title: Still Great
text:
Just stayed at the NineZero and am happy to report that it is still a great destination when visiting Boston I havent been there since the first year they opened and was delighted to see that most things are still up to par 
The most alluring feature of this hotel is the location  I cant imagine a more convenient hotel in all of Boston Its sleekhip design is also very cool But like all trendy hotels it seems to tire from hipness While still sharp nothing really has changed since Ive been there 4 or so years ago
The room is very comfortable and stylish but was showing slight signs of wear minor wall scuffs slightly aging furniture Also on my first visit the robes and towels were Frette and that was no longer the case The Mario Russo products were great but seemed to be smaller in size And the cheap plastic made it difficult to actually get the shampoo or conditioner out And as mentioned in another reviewit is a little tacky that there are so many things for sale in the room The bed was super comfortable and very roomy A luggage rack would have been nice
One great addition from my last stay was the evening cocktail hour Nice wines were served in the lobby from 56 A nice touch Staff was friendly and helpful Needed some extra soap and it was sent up promptly As instructed when I needed my car I called about a half hour before hand I came downstairs and it was ready and waiting Although the 38 fee is quite steep
The NineZero is no bargain but look around the web I got a great rate through one of their promotions and it was actually a little cheaper than comparable hotels such as the Hilton

title: Average for a Fairmont
text:
Were President Club members for Fairmont Hotels so weve stayed frequently The Millenium property is in a good location and my room on the club floor was nice Overall the hotel is nothing special and certainly not on par with my expectations of a Fairmont I most recently stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim in Vancouver Talk about a night and day difference 
I spent 10 days at the hotel in June I had breakfast in the club lounge each morning and the food was very good The lounge itself is just okay  great views but not very comfortable to sit and have a glass of wine Its also small given that Overall the staff was fine but didnt offer nearly the personal attention as other properties which may be due to the size of the property The housekeeping staff was great  very friendly and caring about their work I didnt try the restaurantsbar in the lobby area primarily because they were dark and not terribly inviting  felt more night cluby Overall it was good but not great and I rated it average for the experience given the price

title: We wouldnt stay anywhere else
text: My Mum and I stayed here for 4 nights in August during Elvis Week The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to many attractions and the trolley line The staff were very friendly and helpful It was nice to see a smiling face every time the lift doors opened in the lobby Our room was a decent size and clean We could hear the music from Beale St but it didnt stop us from sleeping it just added to the atmosphere of being in Memphis The internet access was fast and we felt safe with the secure access building The complimentary breakfast was adequate and Mum enjoyed the coffee in the lobby that was available day and night We would definitely stay here again

title: never come to mgm and here is why
text:
Do NOT ever go to mgm detroit casinoYou will be extreamly disappointed and here is why
1 Overall feel and atmosphere in general there is a little on par with a decaying corpse
2 99 of the Food offered at the different eateries is just Rancid to the core i once got an extreame case of food poisoning from eating there at the  pallette
3 I was just recently in there casino with my grandfather who is over 70 years of age Went went on Monday June 27th 2011 Were walking around walking around gambling  doing our thingwe go down a row of slot machines that looks like a ghost town So we sit down lose 20 and start to get up
In the process of getting up i happen to look over to my right at the insescent beeping noise and see a cashed out ticket hanging out of the machine Thinking nothing of it because people leave nickle and dime amounts on there all the time and walk away mad they lost or whatever it is they choose to do
So what would you do would you pull the ticket out of the machine to make it stop beeping loudly of coursethat beeping is LOUD and ANNOYINGso i pulled the ticket out and looked down
To my surprise what do i see 500 and 75 cents on the ticket I say to myself wowmust be my lucky daytheres no way anyones just gonna walk away from 500who in their right mind does that So heres where people differ some say wow thats luckysome say well gee golly gosh there sally sue you should take it up to the counter
So what did i do Maybe not the most moral of options i suppose but then again i didnt know there was a law in michigan that moderated someones moral values I picked it up and walked it over to the cash out machine and promptly put it away At which point we hadnt been there oo long and my grandfather still felt like gambling some more so we went up near the front of the casino
No more than 30 minutes later i was confronted by a man wearing a security badge who very nicely at first said  this is important that you be honest with medid you find a ticket laying around at which point thinking ive done nothing wrong said  well yah i did actuallythis is when the situation turned Disgusting and the man became EXTREAMLY RUDE and Very Demeaning in his attitude towards not only myself but my elderly grandfather
All of a sudden im being told im a thief im lucky i dont have the police called and im lucky i dont get charged with larsony i said hold on excuse me you have to be joking I was then at that point told that if you walk away from somthing it automaticly becomes property of the casino So calmlypolitelyi tried to explain the honest mistake to the gentleman and he was not trying to hear a word of what i had to say He just kept getting ruder by the second and kept threatening the cops on me over and over So now at this point the take my id from me not sure what they did with it came back told me i was now banned from MGM casino and all mgm affilated casinosim thinking to myself  WOWReallySo Then the madman very rudely turns to my grandfather who was close by and tells him that he also has to leave the casino and that he couldnt cash his ticket out that he had real life money onkeeping in mind he never did anything wrong
Tuesday June 28th 2011 I Called up their security department and was very very quickly handed off to an answering machine to leave a voicemail to a lead investigator that has yet to get back to me
In my opinionthe situation could have been handled much betterpull me off to the side perhaps to start But maybe even before thatyou obviously saw who i was on the camerabut didnt take the time to proporly assess the situation If you had you would have seen it was an honest mistake of not knowing that MGM is the only casino with their own specialized rules and regulations Perhaps by law they should be forced to put the specialized rules and regulations on a big plaque at the entrences before you enter saying that if its our and it touches anything of ours and you stop touching it its ours and if you touch it its stealing and we have the right to harass you and treat you like crap in front of a bunch of random strangers

title: A great stayover at LAX
text:
This is a great airport hotel Its fairly far down Century Blvd from LAX but the van goes every 1520 minutes 24 hours You dont have to call for it or make reservations Typical Westin rooms very plush and comfortable From my room I had a great view of planes landing At first I thought it was going to be noisy but finally realized they had the window open Once I closed that it was quiet Staff fawns on you They dont have much in the way of food outlets 
As for the reviewer who complained about the hotels being isolated and there not being food around thats a bunch of hogwash Likewise the complaints that the neighborhood is dangerous There is a Taco Bell across the road as mentioned Its also a Pizza Hut Express But just continue a few steps down Century and theres a cafe at the LaQuinta And just on from that is a McDonalds On the same side of the road as the Westin just a few doors down is a 24 hour Subway sandwich place and a few doors from THAT is a dinercafe of some sort You can walk to all of this in less than 10 minutes max and mostly much less Century Blvd is in an industrial neighborhood but its a huge busy road with lots of businesses around I felt very safe
For the kind of overnight stay between flights that I had it was ideal better than the Crowne Plaza because there were more fast food places around

title: Nice location decent place to stay
text: Recently stayed at the Essex Inn Liked the location  it was an easy walk to the Adler Aquarium Field Museum Art Institute and Millennium Park The hotel rooms were fine with decent space and a fridge which was handy The kids liked the pool and the rooftop garden area Overall Id stay again It was just an average place to stay but if youre just looking for a place to crash itll be just fine

title: Nice hotel close to Denver airport
text: We stayed at this hotel after our flight direct to Denver It was handily placed about 3 miles from the airport Check in was smooth staff were very pleasant The room was large clean and modern Breakfast was good Thoroughly nice place to start our road trip

title: Beautiful and elegant property  so nice it didnt feel like NYC
text: Won this hotel on Priceline for a holiday weekend We were delighted with our accommodations Charming hotel good location near Grand Central The lobby is stunning and the room was spacious and modern Would definitely stay here again No problems with noise despite being right next to elevators Good but expensive breakfast in the restaurant

title: A Very Good Hotel
text: The Omni Berkshire is a very good hotel The location is great the lobby is nice and the service is friendly We were perhaps a little underwhelmed by the expensive breakfast we had in the hotel restaurant Although one night we returned for late night smores and cocktails at the Fireside the immaturity of smores coupled with the sophisticated ambience of the restaurant made for a superbly enjoyable evening The room which was a single king bed was a little on the small side with not much leg room between the bed and walls This wasnt entirely unexpected though were talking about NYC after all Our room was located on a fairly low level and unfortunately we were awakened each morning by the sounds of nearby construction Overall we were very pleased with our stay at Omni Berkshireits a safe bet in the city

title: Good staff but looking a little tired for the price
text:
This is the flagship Sheraton in downtown Chicago with great views over the Chicago river or the city depending on both dimensions of your elevation The staff were very friendly and very courteous However the hotel itself is beginning to look a little tired and the bedrooms I was in 2734 could do with a makeover for the price
The desk location is not replete with electric sockets to plug all todays gagets and chargers in and the WiFi in the bedroom although 1399 for 24 hours was intermittent with the connection and kept dropping out 
This may be a feature I have seen often in this type of hotel where the capacity of the WiFi does not keep up with the increase in charge for the service
The hotel is well located for amenities and is close walking distance to pretty much all downtown locations although the nearer L station at GrandRed is a good 15 minute walk away With luggage you would need a taxi to transport you to and from there

title: Loved It
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during April 17th18th We were really excited to find our room had a great view of the space needle which was only a 5min walk away
Our room was very quiet even though we were overlooking the main road 
The room had a modern look and was very spacious We had a King size bed to die for
The only negative was that there was no fridge Although there were Ice machines on all levels
The business centre in this hotel has free internet access
The continental breakfast was very good 
There was a free bus zone about a 5min walk from the hotel which takes you into and out of the city centre between the hours of 96pm
We felt very safe in the area surrounding the hotel but a little less so in the city centre after dark
Would definatley recommend this hotel

title: Great Hotel
text: I spent many hours online searching for the best deal for flight and hotel in DC This hotel was ranked 1st on Orbitz for best deal and ranked 3rd of 140 hotels on Trip Advisor Nonetheless I continued to spend hours researching other hotels before finally deciding on Palomar The reviews were great and now having just returned from there today I can definitely concur The staff is inviting and accomodating they will recommend restaurants make reservations for you print out directions etc The complimentary popsicles and ice water are a nice touch on a hot day The complimentary wine reception in the lobby from 56 each evening was always bustling Our room was enormous  an executive king  must have been 550 sq feet with an entire wall of floor to ceiling windows The restaurant was pricey for breakfast I thought We did have calamari there one night and it was excellent The bartender Joe was wonderful Dupont CIrcle and the Metro are just up the street Many have said but the Metro is the best way to get around  fast clean and safe We had lunch at Front Page on New Hampshire St off Dupone Circle very good dinner at James Hobans across the street just ok Crepes place across the street was great A 2030 minute walk down P street to Georgetown  and its a great walk by historic homes We had dinner at Agraria on the waterfront in Georgetown and it was fantastic

title: Great Staff
text: I stay at this property once or twice a month and the staff is always so helpful and courteous Gwen at the front desk always makes sure we have everything we need and that our crew is aware of all the benefits the hotel has to offer

title: Great place to stay
