text: The guy that helped us check in was amazinghe made the difference for us for sure The staff were all very helpfulwe liked the location staff and atmosphere so we would stay there again Thanks

title: We loved our stay
text: My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Point for our 10 year anniversary The resort was lush and well maintained The lagoon and beach areas provided a romantic and secluded atmosphere We were upgraded to the presidential suite and it was gorgeous We are considering coming back with our family and staying longer to enjoy the other amenities pool boat rental and bikes since we ran out of time Beautiful resort in a beautiful location

title: Give it a big miss
text: For those thinking of staying at this hotel due to its price and location tot he city  think again I booked this hotel for the above reasons and now regret that decision You would be better off paying a few more dollars and staying somewhere decent or staying a little further out of the city  everything is close so walking is not much of a problem Rooms are small beds are like sleeping on a cement base and the smell When i arrived in my room I found hairs in the bed and somones dirty old sock on the second shelf of the bedside table  and it was not my sock Dirty in other words The cleaning of the rooms is brief and not through by my view The light from the hall waywalkway outside the room shines under the gap from the the door keeping you awake and if that was not enough the noise from the traffic would wake you anyways once you did finally get to sleep I had 5 nights booked and ended up checking out of the hotel and cutting my trip short from australia just so i didnt have to stay any longer in the hotelIf you are looking for a room like that described above have a grat stay I however would never stay there again This is the first time I have had written a review on here even though I have travelled alotI just hope it saves at least one other person the dissatisfaction of booking a room here only to be disappointed

title: Very nice Hotel
text:
The hotel was nice However upon checking in there was a band concert in town and the hotel was packed full of high school kids I asked when checking in if we would be on the same floor with them We were told that they were on a seperate floor than we werewrong They actually took up two floors of this hotel and one of them was ours However they were really not that loud and the stay was rather pleasant We will be staying there again if we come to town This hotel is right across from SeaWorld and easy access to other fun places 
There is also a resturant attached to the hotel which was ok not the best but it was free they gave us coupons I suggest getting there ealy on the weekends since they have buffet style food Over all it was really good food

title: For a solo traveler convenient and inexpensive
text: If youre traveling solo cant beat the price and location All I want is a clean bed clean shower and a place to drop my clothes At the gates of Chinatown couple of blocks from Market St and within walking distance of all tourist attractions including the Wharf and AT T Park Street noise was only issue Looking forward to another visit and Ill be back to the Astoria

title: Building a bit dated but service was excellent
text:
Stayed here recently on business The property is conveniently located to the Houston Hobby Airport My first impression was that the hotel is a bit dated but the staff were extremely professional
Tip on the parking  its a bit crowded between the hotel and the street with plenty of parking to the west There is a entrance to the ground floor that is tucked around the back The door is operated with your room key so it is extra safe
I ate breakfast in the roomy restaurant The buffet was ample and fresh Could have had a custom made omelet if I had wanted one
The room was big and comfortable The door to the bathroom was a little odd If the door was open you couldnt sit down on the toilet Overall the bathroom was very small in comparison to the room itself
One final note  this hotel did not have a lot of restaurants located nearby 
Id stay here again but I do think Ill look around next time and see what else is available

title: Lots of character
text: Cute hotel  lots of character Enjoyed te gated parking Rooms a bit on the smaller side lack of mirrors only one small mirror in the bathroom  made trying to get ready a but complicated sharing one single mirror the lobby and hotel in general well kept and adorable For our stay the location was great The first two nights we were there we were charged 99 per night which was great price for the room  last three nights due to comic con in area price rose to 229 a night  which was extremely high and not worth the room we were staying in we should have researched our trip better and timed our trip better to avoid this busy time Avoid the red fox bar attached next door both times we went to get a drink we were never greeted by a bartender or told a bartender would be right with us and no one ever showed withing ten minutes of waiting we just left Also the bartender of the bar in restaurant seemed bothered by the times we came in to get a drink as well my advice great hotel if u get a reasonable price otherwise I would look elsewhere

title: Hilton great stay
text: Just returned from a 4 day business trip and I must say the hotel is 1st class Great checkin and super assistance from Ashley I stayed on the executive level and it included the hospitality room which was great for a simple breakfast with ample variety and fesh food The room was great and very comfortable The conference was handled well and the meeting rooms many of which were hotel rooms were great The food for the conference except for one dinner was buffet style and I must say the quality was excellent Great variety and flavor for all the dishes presented The location is somewhat central with many shops and restaurants in walking distance

title: six towels what for
text:
Good location Having had large company discount I still had to pay 500 USD pp for 1 night for a deluxe room It was airy nice bathroom showerbath toilet was separated 
The bed was way too soft the aircon was extremely noisy
In the business centre 10min internet costed 10  USD Ridiculously pricey The staff was pushy even in US terms 6 towels for a single placed in the bathroom simply unnecessary 
No breakfast befor 6am even no room service before that time
No amenities no fruits water ect in the room that you would expect from such a hotel like in Four Seasons

title: My first trip to NYC  the Marquis helped make it great
text:
My boyfriend and I just returned from the Marriott Marquis last night and had a great stay 
The purpose for our tirp to New York was that we attended Wine Spectators California Wine Experience event which was taking place at the hotel  so for convenience sake  we decided to stay at the Marquis Glad we did
Our check in took a little bit but it was because we had requested a Times Square view but the only beds available were two double and my boyfriend and I wanted a king So  we opted for a king room that was available immediately that overlooked Broadway 
This room was great We had the last room at the end of the hall 3224 king bed and a little sitting area with a sofa bed Very roomy The bath was small and it was a little tough for both of us to get ready there at the same time
The room look like it had been updated somewhat recently  at least with the furnishings carpet and the bedding  but it was tired in a few areas There was a large flatpanel TV that we never turned on and a desk and chair if youre doing a little work as well I think they charge 17day for the internet  which I think is a bit excessive  but thats just my opinion
The window was on the small side too but we looked directly out at the Virgin store and just to the right is 1 Times Square where they drop the ball on New Years Eve 
Needless to say we were happy with the room and stayed even after the front desk called to say they had a Times Square view become available
I suppose I should back up the bus a bit and say this hotel is HUGE Something like 2000 rooms and you can tell that by going to the elevator bank where there are 15 elevators Crazy We never really waited all that long but there were a couple of occasions where we were jammed into a elevator with too many people  Im sure we looked like circus clowns getting out of a VW a few times
Anyway the lobby is on the 8th floor and thats where youll find a Starbucks shopping and a restaurant and bar There is the View bar at the top or close of the hotel and it movesever so slowlybut there was a line of probably 30 people waiting and it seemed to be a big hit We had a few nice drinks but didnt eat so I cant comment on the food There is also another Starbucks on the first floor as well
The first floor lets you out in every direction so its nice you dont have to walk around an entire block to go inout Everything and anything you can think of that you want to see is in walking distance this IS New York  so bring your comfortable walking shoes The Lion King theatre is across the street as is the one that Katie Holmes is starring in now There were tons of people hoping for a Mr and Mrs Cruise sighting  so be prepared for larger than average crowds in front of this theatre
If you go out the Broadway door maybe youll get to see the Naked Cowboy This is where he hangs out ew and there is always quite a crowd around him as well
A quick tip
We had purchased a New York Pass and did the hop onhop off CitySights open top bus tour  which is a bit corny but it was really nice We also did the Circle Line cruise to the Statue of Liberty  that was very cool If you intend on spending a few days going to several sights I do recommend buying a pass Our threeday pass got us into several museums the bus rides the cruise and the Empire State building  all included in one price It was very handy
Back to the hotel
They did a great job with Wine Specator event  we were amazed at how quickly they transformed the ballroom spaces The staff was professional and friendly and it didnt seem like we were just another event  so kudos to everyone
Some people have mentioned how busy the hotel is or how busy the streets are by the hotel Um this is TIMES SQUARE If you want a peaceful boutiquey staygo to Tribeca If you want to walk out your door and be in the thick of thingsthe Marquis is a great base camp for what Im sure will be a great New York experience
Happy Travels
Lisa
Minneapolis

title: Do not stay here
text: The first room that they gave us had just been sprayed with something to what mask we think was a smoke smell and it just took our breathe away when we walked in Everything was dated and not very clean The second room they gave us was even worse The carpet was not even tacked to the floor it had about a one inch gap There were cheerios on the floor of a room that had been cleaned and when I took the spread off something had spilled on the blanket in a long streak One of the worst I have seen It was advertised to be airport close but was fifteen miles away and the shuttle didnt start until six in the morning We just left and went straight to another hotel

title: Great place to stay
text: We were looking to get away for the weekend last minute I looked online but decided to call and reserve a room at this hotel The clerk was very nice and answered all my questions When we got to the hotel check in went very smoothly the only thing was not enough parking It seemed like maybe there was a conference of some sort going on Aside from that it was great The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean We will be staying here again

title: Loved the Pan Pacific Hotel in Seattle
text:
The service was excellent and we loved the hotel in general I can see how some might say the living space in the rooms is a bit small but I think the use of space and pocket door features make it work The bath room was large and had a nice sized shower and a big tub We were in town for a wedding and to sightsee so the size of the room was not a major focus The bed was not very comfortable but it wasnt too bad The service from the staff was fantastic though and we would stay there again 
One thing to be aware of is the cost of parking 33 per night Parking in Seattle is expensive anyway though

title: Perfect location nice room good value
text: Weve stayed at about five or six Dupont Circle hotels This one is the allaround best including the three other Kimpton Hotels there This location is ideal  close not only to Dupont Circle and the Metro but also a short walk down to a good convenience store and in the Marriott an Illy coffee bar adjacent to the hotel lobby seating area The large room we had with two comfortable queen beds for 2 adults and one teenager worked out perfectly There was a large dividerdouble closet between the bedroom and the washroom  nice privacy with the toiletbath in their own room The staff is friendly and helpful The room was quiet although I recommend asking for a room away from the elevator which you can hear every lift if you are close Finally we came in an offweek the price was superreasonable best value in the neighborhood One more tip  if you are not going to use your car during your stay and want to save money on parking try the Ritz hotel nearby  they have reasonable rates

title: Great Place to Stay at Times Square
text:
Great experience and great hospitality Neat and Clean rooms
Lifetime experience Mr Singh at reception was very helpful Great for couples Peaceful and calm Have bubble bath together and enjoy your trip

title: A very pleasant experience
text:
I stayed there with my family for four nights and found the experience to be very pleasant I was a little concerned after reading reviews of other people but because I have really paid for it already I was ready to take the chance I drove there from Erie PA and I stayed near the airport because of the convenient location since I am very familiar with Philadelphia It served my purposes excellently since I was away most parts of the day but also close enough to return for a short daytime stay The hotel was well kept and it was a very busy weekend which made it difficult for the breakfast area to be immaculate The room was in very good condition and the bedding is in great condition I did not have to use the shuttle but I saw the regular departures to the airport
I want to add my two cents worth since unsatisfied clients are more apt to write nasty reviews

title: Awesome fantastic modern hotel
text: The highly efficient executive assistant Colleen Fink friendly Yesenia at mission control and JJ and Elvis are staff members I have to mention for their outstanding service All the staff is so friendly and helpful Yotel is a wonderful modern futurestic clean hotel with an excellent location and great value for money 24h CVS across the road two blocks to port authority metro 3 blocks to Times Square walking distance to great restaurants in Hells Kitchen Free coffee and muffins every morning and galley with coffee machine on every floor Stayed for 6 nights and couldnt be happier with the Yotel it was awesome stay

title: Great Option for Theatre District and Touring
text: This property is a great option if you enjoy staying at a wellmaintained and fully modernized hotel that has served as a hotel for many years It is not a brand new hotel or a luxury property It is convenient functional comfortable spacious by NYC standards and wellequipped It is like many many hotels in the city but in far better condition than others from its era because of the standards of the Hilton Corporation It features all of the customary services and amenities of the Hilton Garden Inn brand Instead of the bfast being served in the hotel a French restaurant located next door and accessible through an interior walkway serves a buffet bfast to those with bfast coupons The restaurant is also offers a menu for outside patrons and hotel guests without coupons Its location is fantastic for those visiting the Theatre District or touring the city It is convenient to most any theatre I noted that it is also close to stops for the major hopon hopoff bus tours and the Subway You can walk to Times Square Central Park Lincoln Center or anywhere in Midtown West within a few minutes Its location on 8th Ave places one close to the Times Square action but on the edge of residential living Noise level from a hotel room is typical for the city with slight addtl noise from an adjacent fire station The hotel is only about 15 stories so most views will be of surrounding buildings If your room faces 8th Ave and is on a high enough floor you will be able to see the river All rooms along 8th Ave provide a view of the avenue and the hustle and bustle of cars and pedestrians One negative to the 8th Ave vista  you may be able to see across the street to apartments Im not sure if they could see in the hotel windows but one might be best to make sure the curtains are drawn A few recommendations  check out Le Rivage on Restaurant Row for a tasty pricefix French meal Trulia located up 8th about a block serves fantastic American food with a Mediterranean twist Monday night at Birdland for Open Mic night is a must for a true Broadway lover

title: Renaissance Hotel was great
text:
Hugh and I stayed at the Renaissance hotel when we went to see Chelsea Football Club play the Seattle Sounders
We arrived early in the day  and they allowed us to check in early and get out of our travel clothes 
The concierge was knowledgable about the surrounding area and suggested some great restaurants
We ate at both hotel restaurants and found that the quality of the food was well worth the cost Hugh had Salmon and clam chowder  both which were execellent
We will definitely stay at teh Renaissance for our net trip to Seattle

title: A 4 Star Hotel with 2 Star Service
text: The location of this Hilton was terrific however the following occurred I had two beds only on our last night as Priceline could not guarantee bed arrangements ahead of time the hotel did provide a rollaway that was too short for someone 6 feet tall I was wrongly charged 25 for valet parking fortunately refunded by the hotel the oatmeal in the restaurant was likely made with water but still cost about 7 two hallways in the hotel were cold refrigerators and microwaves were not standard in the rooms but had to be requested hotel staff said the hotel only had 15 microwaves and couldnt understand why more werent available and a curtain in our first room was torn

title: Excellent location for seeing San Diego
text: Not having been to San Diego before I looked for the most affordable hotel in a good location It was just by luck and other reviews that I found The Bay Club The hotel is on Shelter Island a convenient location to see the sights from It is an older hotel but very well maintained Our room was very spacious and comfortable You have the option of either a bay view or marina view We opted for the bay view and enjoyed watching the ships move about Realize that youll be looking over a parking lot so a second floor room is best By the way its a great walking area since the entire length of the shore line is a park The staff at the hotel was excellent all very helpful and attentive And the breakfast is not the standard continental one that most hotels offer It consistently offered scrambled eggs fried potatos fresh fruit and often pancakes Plus you look out at the beautiful boats in the marina as you eat A lovely place

title: Very good value for money
text: This is a very nice motel conveniently located to visit the LA area Although its situated next to the main road Pacific Coast Hwy it was very quiet The room was perfectly clean and bathroom looked recently renovated There was indeed a modern flat screen with lots of TV channels highspeed Internet fridge and microwave but no coffeemaking facilities The staff at the reception was very friendly Overall it was an excellent value for money

title: Great service and excellent localization
text:
Great Service excellent place Near the Central Park and Times square
I want to register the courtesy of Elizabeth at the front desk
She was very nice and helped me to find a delivery
The staff in general is very polite
I also want to thank Ernesto in the package room

title: Just a place to put your head
text:
My first trip to New York and I cant really complain about the hotel itself The rooms were spacious clean and comfortable the bedroom could of done with abit of an update but for 4 nights it was adequate enough We were on the 7th floor and heard no traffic noise whatsoever so a good peaceful nights sleep 
The restaurant in the hotel was nice but just as expensive as other restaurants around anyway 
The location was ok central park being the closest attraction and about a 1015 minute walk to times square 
The staff were miserable and probably the most unhelpful I have ever experienced The use of lockers were free which was great 
All in all Yes if I absolutely had too then I would stay at this hotel againHowever Id probably like to find a hotel that was a little closer to where it was all happening and staff with a smile

title: Outstanding Hotel  lots of hostory wrapped in a brand new look
text: Dont normally like to stay in older hotels but the Blackstone is a brand new old hotel Lots of history wrapped in a brand new look Rooms are completely redone and modern Hotel staff was very friendly and attentive The hotel gym was larger than most I have been in and had brand new equipment The restuarant on the first floor is also very good if you can get in and dont want to go to far from the hotel

title: Wedding Party and family stayed there
text:
Great job hosting all of our guests and accommodating everyone for a short notice for 30 people on a morning brunch Wish we would have had our rehearsal dinner there lol
Great staff and the prices were very reasonable given the location in PHilly Cleanliness was very good too

title: Greatest Stay
text:
My wife and I have traveled to numerous locations throughout the US and Mexico I have to say that The Donatello is the greatest hotel we have been to The staff was excellent especially the front desk and the concierge I have read numerous reviews and want to dispel the rumor that it was noisy Yes there is a club across the street and maybe room location has something to do with it but we slept every night with the windows open and were not bothered one bit by the noise
 We are returning to the Donatello in two weeks and would never think of staying any where else in San Fran

title: Avoid  dirty overpriced and disinterested staff
text:
So having read all the TripAdvisor reviews  we were looking forward to our 6 days at the Diamond Head Inn Ok some some reviews were extremely negative  but most were very positive There lies the issue Dont believe all you read
We booked into the small untidy office and collected the room key As soon as we entered the room 110 we were in total darkness and no light switch After opening the blinds and turning on all the sidelights this was at 3pm it became obvious why dark would have been better
The carpet was badly stained in several places pillows were off white with stains walls had shoe scuffs on them and the chair was badly stained Its at this stage you look deeper The vertical wall radiators were filthy with dustdirtgrime on every element and the place just felt dirty Even the wall picture above the bed was broken
The back door opens out to a very dubious rear footpath and the rear windows have no security on them at all Rear door just has a standard lock on it
Kitchen utensils can be counted on one hand
We asked to see another room that was even smaller though marginally less stained  with the staff being entirely indifferent to our issues with filth and staining
Time to call Hotelscom for a full refund and get the hell out of the dump
I read a lot about the wonderful staff offering up a valuable car parking space But lets figure this one out The Hotel only has 4 spaces allocated to it  when it has 21 rooms The Manager thinks its ok to suggest having to use parking facilities several blocks away  and yet reviewers have thanked staff for moving their cars to allow them to park
So you think Diamond Head is cheap Think again You have to pay 795 a day for internet and will probably have to park several blocks away We got a reservation at the Dana om Missionary Bay for the SAME price as the Diamond Head
If you have already booked or are still going to book  CHECK THE ROOM OUT FIRST Also book with someone with clout who will ensure you get a 100 refund  like hotelscom
A final note  I emailed the Hotel 3 times before we arrived to inquire up an upgraded room  not one email was replied to
This may be a great hotel for surf bums who will likely be too smashed out of their heads to notice the filth  but with age comes an expectation of what a Hotel should be  and clean is usually top of the list
It amazes me that there are so many positive reviews for what is a dump of an establishment It has tainted our faith that all the reviews are genuine but not that the negative reviews do follow a common thread

title: Good Hotel Watch the Neighborhood at Night
text:
I paid about 7500 a night for this hotel for a 2 night stay Everything was within walking distance Oriole Park at Camden Yards The National Aquarium Inner Harbor Plenty of good places to eat around the Inner Harbor which was a 3 block walk The bad news is downtown Baltimore can get be very dangerous especially at night If you walk a block or two in the wrong direction you will find yourself in a bad place Even the walk to the Inner Harbor can at times be unsafe Even in the day you might encounter street poeple in the downtown area But these issues are more to do with the city then the hotel itself
The hotel was great value for the money I paid The public areas of the hotel were very nice This is a well maintained historic hotel The lobby area looks fantastic The room was quiet clean and comfortable The only downside was the bathroom had seen its better days It can use a renovation Not terrible though THis hotel was great for the price and would be good even at 15000 at night

title: Top of the line
text: Wow this place was wonderful It was an easy and great location The whole place was renovated and its very very nice This is definitely a 3star easy It was quiet the beds are really nice and the linens were so great The staff was always very helpful and kind The pool was really nice parking easy and free Honestly there is not one thing i can say against this placei was very impressed I want to stay next time

title: Wedding perfection
text:
My daughter chose the Westin for her May 5th wedding having done considerable research It was very important to her that the food was of the highest quality that the venue offered a great city view and was a comfortable place for all of our out of town guests to enjoy 
Ted the wedding consultant was a home run with the bases loaded A true professional in every sense of the word The bridal suite knocked our socks off The female members of the wedding party assembled to have hair and makeup done The space was clean spacious and offered a gorgeous view of the city As parents of the bride my husband and I were given an upgrade to a junior suite It was also clean spacious and since our son had an adjoining room we were able to host a post wedding after party with room for the party goers 
The ceremony and reception were held in the Staffordshire room It was perfection So beautiful and we are so delighted with the photos that show off the room and the view The food was not your average wedding fare Filet mignon  fish salad were all exceptional Our guests are still raving The following day we had a small brunch for overnight guests To my delight they decorated the room with the flowers from the reception and they packed up all of the extra favors and other items that were special to us The brunch selection was superp Lastly the staff went out of their way to help us pack up our rooms and our cars This did not go unnoticed What a great decision to host our daughters wedding at ate Westin In a word PERFECT

title: A good but not preferred choice for a day stay before evening flight
text: I had a 12 hour wait for my overnight east coast connection and spent much time the day before my flight trying to arrange a day rate room at LAX No easy task as no one has this on their website and ringing through I found most of the properties are either disinterested bounce you around from one person to the next who has no idea what you want or tell you to turn up on the day I followed the latter advice and with my luggage booked through and time to spare I took the first shuttle after 90 seconds to arrive at Tom Bradley  the Marriott  I had a friendly helpful welcome and with my Platinum Elite card had a nice room on the Concierge floor with lounge access and free WiFi I had a relaxing day The pool area was functional but lacking any character and no poolside service which was a shame and you need to like Latin American music or have a good noise cancelling headset with your own player This is an airport hotel not a resort so I was under no illusion  a couple of hours on a nice sunny day lying on a comfortable lounge bed was restorative after a 14 hour flight Having stayed at other hotels nearby before I opted for the Hilton deli for lunch food to take back as the boring Starbucks was the only choice at the Marriott for take away food and the Concierge floor and in room dining had ridiculous prices The Marriott lobby is busy and characterless and lacks the spaciousness of either the Hilton or Westin or the Sheratons space comfort and ambience If I had not been given the run around on my international call the day before by the Sheraton I would have opted for there for the day The Marriott Concierge Lounge evening canaps were not only very disappointing but really bad with the only offerings a dreadful green curry chicken a canap  and some crudits that were most uninviting I decided to head for the QantasAdmirals Club airport lounge instead at least the drinks were complimentary When I found I had just missed the shuttle back to my terminal I decided a bit of exercise in the early evening was in order and in fact arrived on foot just before the next shuttle  just be watchful of traffic that doesnt expect pedestrians to be crossing and be ready to run the gauntlet of smokers outside terminals also less traffic fumes on the departures level

title: Modern Luxury  Incredible hotel book this one now
text: All I can say is WOW from start to finish this property delivers Everything about this hotel 100 pure luxury I felt like a celebrity staying here  We were upgraded to a Harbor Suite and it was huge Large living room 2 full bathrooms lovely bedroom with balcony The TV in the living room is huge  The waterviews are incredible and everything is top quality The spa is one of the best I have ever been to and the spa passes with complimentary when staying at the hotel  you would only pay for hotel services and it is open till 1000pm which is nice The pool and outdoor hot tub look nice but I think personally they should be open later at least till midnight or so currently they close at sunset We had breakfast delivered to the room each morning and it was all top quality as well  and in room dining was available 24 hours a day which is a nice touch Everyone working the the hotel is extremely pleasant and the location of the hotel is wonderful Would definitely stay here again

title: A Welcomed Retreat from the Overactive City
text: This hotel is in walking distance from Times Square leaving behind the overactive pace of the city It was a welcomed retreat after spending all day visiting the sights and sounds of what NY has to offer From the moment you walk through the front doors you start to feel refreshed and were greeted by the receptionists in a pleasant and professional manner The entire hotel staff was excellent including both concierges the housekeeper and the men and women taking care of the breakfast area I appreciate this type of topnotch service that seems to be done as an everyday routine versus an act put on to suffice for good service Thank You Hampton Inn

title: Great service
text:
I was overwhelmed with the staffs level
Of service Its not like we really needed much but when we did it was if they were holding our hands and listening 
Someone did an outstanding job recruiting those folks And that person should be proud of the folks heshe has
Steve Boudreau

title: Clarion Hotel Lets be honestMOTEL would be flattery
text:
Im a guy who travels all over the country and stays in a variety of hotels While I love the Four Seasons and the Fairmont Im fine with the Holiday Inn Express too So Im traveling from the east coast to San Jose for business for a week and my wife and 2 yr old son are traveling with me Recognizing that we will getting into San Jose late I decided to find a hotel near the airport so we could get a good nights sleep before heading up to San Francisco for a couple days of sightseeing I was assured transfers from airport to hotel would be no problem as the hotel has a shuttle 
Upon arrival at the airport I called for the shuttleFirst Red Flag you know the board with the phone in baggage claim where you can choose from the airport hotels and call for info well the Clarion was not included in the listso i called on my cell phone and assured the shuttle would be there to pick me up in 10 min and I was instructed to go outside to the pick up area45 minutes later while my wife and infant son sat in the cold and 5 phone calls to the hotel the shuttle finally showed up no apologies
so we drive to the hotel  it is NOT an airport hotel as far as location is involved now im not that particular but the hotel lobby is A DUMP the other reviews about the front desk staff trying to stick you is correct I paid 89 for rooms and anything over 39 was overpriced If youre into the motel style accomodations where there are no interior corridors or hallways and your door opens onto a walkway or balcony or where you have to haul all your luggage up stairs or if you enjoy a good prostitution ring then THIS HOTEL IS YOUR KIND OF PLACE 
my room along with my business partners rooms had a peculiarly terrible smell and the staff would do nothing about it Throughout the night there were vagrants walking around the grounds and at 5 am someone who did not appear to be a guest at the hotel unless it was a guest by the hour was walking around on the balcony outside our room 
While Im sure if I stayed longer at this location I would have much more to write Im not chancing my health or the health and wellbeing of my family and were leaving as soon as we can get out TAKE IT FROM A GUY WHO STAYS IN ALL KINDS OF ACCOMODATIONS DONT STAY IN THIS PROPERTY the Holiday Inn is across the street and looks like The Waldorf compared to this place If youre looking for a true airport hotel  try the Courtyard Marriott which is right outside the airport grounds and good shuttle service  i watched every other hotel shuttle pass 3 or 4 times before our shuttle ever showed up Definitely not Clarion quality

title: Very Good Hotel with Great Views and Great Value for Money
text:
Overall Impression very very good value for money I paid 150 plus taxes
Pros
 views I had view of the east river from the 36th floor just amazing
 room very big lots of space comfortable bed and clean
 indoor pool wow amazing views from the pool fairly decent sized too
 gym was under renovation so Im not sure
 service people are pretty nice
 rooms are quiet so sleep quality was very good
Cons
 location although it is midtown it is way east and I found it a bit harder to get to places on the subway although buses are easy than some of the hotels located in the theatre district

title: Bed bugs dont stay here
text:
The beg bug rumor is true Although the hotel comes at a great price and a fab location to public transportation everything else about this hotel is awfull I will never return to this hotel and will tell everyone else to stay away There was obvious prostitution going on out of this hotel Hookers with their Pimps sitting in the car until a customer would come up and then they would go into the room 
Once I got home I noticed the bites from all of the bugs I counted 27 bites on one hand alone
Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else

title: Not planning on staying here on our next visit to NYCq
text:
We arrived early our room was not ready and we were told they would store our luggage and we could return at 300 pm for check in We returned at 315 our room wasnt ready until 330 The desk clerk was unfriendly and did not offer us water or champagne as noted on their website 
 We booked a Junior Spa Suite On day 3 of our 5 day stay the jacuzzi tub malfunctioned and started up on its own through out the night The front desk sent a technician at 200 am He disabled the tub and never returned to fix it We paid for this amenity and never received it We were compensated with a 1 day complimentary continental breakfast 
We booked this hotel through Expedia Both Expedia and the hotel websites listed a guest laundry facility as an ammenity To our dismay there is not a laundry facility at the hotel They offer only laundry service a paid service 
The bathroom has no counter space and the wash basin is the size of an airline basin On a good note the Bed was comfortable The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square shops and the subway Would we stay again Probably not

title: Good place to stay
text: Our family had a very nice stay at this hotel Good location clean great breakfasts with bed and breakfast rate cool rooftop bar Good service

title: Great basic San Fran accomodations
text:
Clean room friendly staff free wireless and super close to a BART station The lobby looks like it has been recently renovated
Its San Francisco so there are some homeless people around but we still felt safe walking back at night

title: Home Away From Home
text: This is such a friendly and warm place The staff is extremely helpful and friendly The suites are huge and cleaned daily The daily breakfast buffets are wonderful

title: Great Resort Great Golf Course Great New Villas
text:
My wife and I visited in February it was our third stay in the last two years We stayed in the new villas that overlook the 1st Fairway of the golf course The Villas are beautiful Kitchen Living Room Master Bedroom with a huge bathroom marble throughout There was a waterfall right outside our master bedroom the sound of water at night was very relaxing The Golf course was in great shape unbelieveable views was fun to play wish I could say the same about my score We ate at the restaurant only once as we were spending time with friends in Scottsdale the food was very good and fairly priced
The new lobby  Restaurant  Pro Shop were almost complete which will add another level of quality of the Resort We didnt spend time at the Water Park but everyone there looked to be having a good time
All in all we had a wonderful time and will be back again I would recommend this highly

title: Just Disappointing
text:
I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights in March and what a disappointment Having stayed at the Marriott Marquis for my previous visit to the Big Apple the Crowne Plaza was no where near the same standard even though they boast the same star rating
We arrived to check in at 3pm as requested and found that our room was not available We then had to endure a tedious wait in the stuffy front desk while the staff tried to find us an alternative
The room was adequate but was missing a few luxuries that it boasts on its website We were promised a mini bar only to find that the hotel had made the decision to remove them all but failed to update their website We were promised a bathrobe which never materialised and on arrival to our room we found a shattered light bulb and a broken window
We had to report our maintenance issues twice before we were acknowledged and were severly disappointed that their Foreign Exchange Bureau was merely a front desk attendant with a 100 dollar a day limit and an attitude problem
The Crowne Plaza is still an ok hotel in a good location just book it up expecting average then you wont be disappointed

title: Worse than i expected
text: I hated this hotel My room smelled humidity The air condition is so loud The area around the hotel is dodgy and far from a subway stop 15 minutes walking The hotel and the rooms badly need renovation Old furniture Comfy bed The cover and blanket always seemed wet because of the humidity in the room So noisy because of the construction site in front of the hotel that starts around 6 am  hotel reception employees were ok Some better than others but not that friendly Breakfast is average Overall it is not horrible but for the price i would not recommend it

title: Comfortable clean gentle staffs 15min from city center
text: I went to San Diego for busimess in november 2012 and stayed in Hilton Mission Valley for 1 week Great Hotel Rooms comfortables staffs always smilling and helpfull Beakfast with fruits juices hot plates Isnt close to the city center but if you have a car is not a trouble or if like to walk you can walk until thetrolley center and take 15 min by train Thereis a tax for the internet us 90 per day I would like to stay there again

title: good location bad hotel
text: We booked 4 suites for a family reunion at over 400 a night for each room The resort seemed full which I cannot understand after seeing our rooms Its what you would expect from a Motel 6 that has a suite Formica countertops old furniture and carpets cinder block walls We left after 2 of the 4 planned nights and moved up the coast to the St Regis at Dana Pointe for almost 600 a night In comparison the St Regis should have cost 2000 a night The Bahia was nice about letting us leave early though Its still hard for me understand that people are willing to fork over the amount of money for this place

title: Needs a ton of work  Caution Advised
text: A pretty ordinary hotel I am used to staying in budget accommodation  especially on a weak dollar  but this was pretty ordinary even by those standards Room was clean and the blokes on the front desk for the early morning shift and the night shift were pretty friendly and helpful That is about the best that can be said The day shift front desk bloke was unhelpful Seemed more interested in his iPod than attending to guests Room was incredibly noisy  so much so that I had to brave the San Francisco beggars and run up to the pharmacy at midnight to buy earplugs The room had no remote for the TV and no alarm clock The hot water was temperamental at best and there is no air conditioning There is no room directory the phones have no little sticker on them to assist you with dialing out or roomtoroom so I had to run down to a pay phone on occasions Needs more than a lick of paint and the elevator is so slow that its quicker to take the stairs Dodgy locks on doors Will take considerable work to get it up to acceptable  even complimentary ear plugs for the rooms facing Geary Street would be a start Im sure they can be bought in bulkDefinitely would not take a family there Okay for young single people

title: Right up my Alley
text: Close to the beach if you wanted  but for me was not too far from my business meeting and restaurants close by  everything was in its place  quiet and peaceful after a hard days work  this will be my resting stop each trip to the area

title: Beautiful old hotel brought back
text: My husband and I stayed here When we checked in there was a mixup with our reservation and the front desk staff very graciously upgraded us to a luxury suite for our few minutes of inconvenience no additional charge to us The hotel staff was eager to please in every way Our Suite had obviously been renovated new modern bathroom new windows but it had the charm and large rooms of an older hotel Nice room appointments Will visit again

title: Very Comfortable
text:
As other posts have highlighted the location of this property is unbeatable The rooms are small but comfortable with bathrooms fridge plasma tv etc The hotel has a coin operated washing machine and dryer for use and there is 1 computer for use Continental breakfast entailed teacoffee and pastries a usual continental breakfast ie nothing special or fancy 
The owner is extremely helpful and attentive with anything you require The roof top is basic but a great place to relax with a couple of drinks as the sun goes down 
The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the craziness of the Venice Beach stalls etc and a 2 minute walk to Washington Avenue There is no supermarket within the immediate vicinity apart from a small grocery type store however I guess the aim is to eat out every night anyway My wife and I hired some bikes for one of the days I think they were 20ish dollars each for a full day and rode down to Malibu
We caught a bus from Hollywood and it was relatively easy to navigate We then caught a bus to Union Station which was quite easy too

title: Smokey and poorly managed
text:
The first night was uneventful check in was smooth The elevators are tiny and the rooms tiny halls are datedbut thats ok since we got the room for 70 a nightIf you are from NY you wont really mind the space if you are from TXmaybe you will think its tiny too  Bed and bedding were great
But the real problems began the second night when the people in the room next to us were completely out of control We had to call down three times because of them running screaming and jumping THEN  5am someone started smoking I called down around 6 to see if the front desk could please do something about it but I ended up having to call down again a little later in the morning because of another wave of it hitting our room 
The front desk staff were nice but did not offer to let me use some Fabreze or something to freshen the terrible smoke smell and they wouldnt do anything about it At one point I went downstairs to sit while my husband was sleeping just to get away from itand I told the front desk clerk and she just looked at me then she said that they are going to charge the guilty party 100okthis does nothing for me
So I called the manager who was rude helpless and really nailed the coffin down for me about this hotel Simply being apologetic offering a way to freshen my room and convincing me they were going to do something about it would have calmed me down instantly but instead he was just simply rude and helpless 
Having proper management that can deal with a situation like this is imperative for any hotel I would assumeso I wish them luck 
Bottom line loud small no free coffee in lobby as advertised management inept good location in Chicago front desk nice good beds and bedding if you like to smoke illegally in a hotel room this place would be great for you

title: A hotel to be excited about
text:
We came to NYC so my niece can tour some of the colleges on her list After checking in at 1100 PM after a nonstop tour from Los Angeles to St Louise MO we were tired and a bit hungry So we were delighted to find that they have a 24 hour complimentary snack bar on the 2nd floor which they also use for complimentary breakfast Finding anything free in NYC is rare What they serve is not very costly to them but it has a 10 fold return on investment because we would definitely recommend this hotel and will come back the next time were in NYC
I gave it a 4 star instead of 5 for 2 reasons The reservation guy messed up on having a car pick us up at the airport  no show And the windows in the room did not block and nightlight and daylight very well so it was hard to fall asleep

title: Good for the price
text:
This was a decent hotel for the price We stayed for three nights and didnt have any problems The room was neat and clean and nothing was broken The people at the desk were helpful and nice our card deactivated but the staff promptly reactivated it for us without hassle Breakfast was disappointing all they had were little powdered doughnuts and bananas What The pool was nice though small and it could use a vacuuming it also closed way too early 900pm Not much opportunity to go swim without children around
Overall a nice stay and Id stay there again

title: nice hotelbut beware of pricing
text: The hotel itself is in a great neighborhood clean quiet and the front desk staff and door men are super friendly That being said the rooms are ok but the walls are thin and you can easily hear conversations happening between floors and hallways The spa is BEYOND overpriced The facility itself is pretty and serene but the prices would overpower the relaxation DO NOT RENT A CAR FROM THEM The facility they use have too many hidden fees they do not check the car out before you use it or when you return it and by opting for a full tank of gas we were charged 72 yet were never told the grade of gas the amount of gallons put into the car the price per gallon The friendly concierge desk turned into nightmares once you check out For a little more  there are nicer hotels to stay in I will not be staying here ever again

title: Clean comfortable room
text:
While the room was small and the bathroom tiny we were quite satisfied Downtown hotels often have small rooms Everything was clean and the bedding was luxurious 
The only real negative was that the walls were thin and you can hear everything going on in the hallway
I would stay again

title: Marginal in Phoenix
text:
Stayed just one night arrived late into Phoenix left at 8am the next morning We wanted to be in north Phoenix as we were heading to the Grand Canyon the next morning and did not want to get stuck in bad central Phoenix traffic 
It was a good 25 cheaper than anything else I could find nearby The neighborhood was quiet we felt safe The room was very small Cant use a more flattering word than adequate Bed was comfortable climate control worked fine got some decent shut eye Room dcor was passable Chair in room was clean but stained and a bit beat up Sink in bathroom drained very slowly as if it was 75 clogged and sink area was a bit beat up Television was small Towels were rough on the skin 
For this short stay the hotel worked but just barely I could see it not working for the more fussy in the world The room definitely looked worse in the light of day versus the night before when I was dead tired My overall rating 55 out of 10

title: Great except for one thing
text:
I met some business associates this past weekend April 1617 at this hotel I have to admit I liked almost everything about it The location is great the fact they have a pubrestaurant attached is convenient and I think the rates are comparable to the surrounding areas 
My issue with this hotel is the parking rates It is about 50 to park from FridaySunday I am supposed to stay at this hotel again this weekend family trip this time but I am just not sure about having to pay fees like that to park my car
I will certainly provide more feedback as I learn more about this parking situation

title: At the end of the day its pretty good
text:
I stayed at the Ramada Hollywood near Universal studios for 6 nights in the month of May Me and 3 other friends shared a double room And even though we were sorta nervous after reading the reviews online We went ahead and kept our reservation Well first of all this hotel really isnt that bad I think a lot of the reviews are a bit on the dramtic side 
1 The location Yes this hotel is located in Hollywood However it is NOT in the glam end of it I wouldnt call the neighborhood scary at all Its just a hispanic neighborhood but we had no problems and ventured out often The metro line and busses are about 1 block awayThe hotel is pretty close to a lot of touristy spots and there are city tours daily from the hotel I would advise buying a map before heading out 
2 The building Although the outside of the hotel isnt attractiveat all The interior isnt too bad I found the place pretty clean and some of it looked a lil more modernized The room we shared wasnt a bad size we had a balcony fridge and small sofa The bathroom was a decent size and the shower was huge The hotel has an outdoor pool it is inground its not the biggest pool but it was refreshing and has lots of loungers and plants around it
3 Continental breakfast Every morning there was a free breakfast We all found it decent they serve cereals fruit like fruit cocktails toast bagels croissants eggs meh sausages yummy and waffles also good The eating area is pretty nice and its well maintaned and clean
4 Customer service This is the only issue I had with this hotel We did have one bad expirence On Monday nights the hotel bar has a comedy show Well I did find the show a little amatureish but for the most part it was greatThat is until they had one comic come on He was the most vulgar rude performer I have ever seen He not only made disgusting jokes about incest rape and drug use But he picked out people in the audience and made extremelely rude comments and jokes at their expense and on top of all that all he did was yell We did end up walking out When we brought this issue up to the front desk they simply stated Thats how comedy is here And to this I replied You guys find incest rape and drug use funny The older gentlemen at the counter didnt take us very seriously and shrugged us off Also when it comes to calling cabs make sure to tell the front desk to call you a Yellow cab the Hotel cab they use there charges you more than double than all other cab companies We also found the front desk staff rude and always quick to get rid of you They dont seem to know a lot of basic questionsdirections When we asked them where malls grocery stores good bars in the area werethey look confused and just sorta mumble an answer 
This is a very honest review If you are looking for a basic hotel in a pretty central area with moderate prices than definatley book here Its great for the price And served all our needs I would definatley stay here again

title: Loved it
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Westin At first we were annoyed at having to pay 32 per night for parking but it made our stay so much easier We were in and out a lot since we met up with family staying at another hotel and it was so easy The service was great it is near most attractions and within walking distance from some great restaurants Everything about the hotel was so relaxing and comfortable  we would definitely stay there again

title: Even the front rooms are OK
text: I usually request a back room but they were sold out so my mother and I settled for the seventh floor front rooms that they had set aside for us The soundproofing is quite good really You hear trolleys and saxophones outside but they also quiet down as the night moves on I still would request a back room but its the Chancellor great location excellent service friendly staff So nice to not stay in a big chain hotel and also I have to admit that I love those deep long tubs WiFi was worthless on my iPad but my iPhone with Verizon wireless worked well Great breakfast Just as good as Sears next door which I also love

title: beware of bugs
text: Okay little place for the money but I had a bad experience with bed bugs I had five bites on my arm and even caught one little guy in the actgross Beware room 407

title: Second stay even better than the first
text:
I stayed at the Wyndham Baltimore Peabody Court with some family members for my daughters graduation from MICA The hotel has a lot of charm and we all loved the neighborhood and seeing all of the dogs in Mount Vernon square This stay was even better than our first stay in April The service issues were ironed out We had top notch service from the time we arrived until our departure 
Starting with the valet he directed us to a very close parking lot where we saved a lot of money over the valet parking cost Transportation to the Inner Harbor and even to Fells Point was easy using the free Circulator bus which had a stop a block or two away The front desk staff was cordial and helpful The housekeeping was excellent too We were also pleased with the service at the bar
Both rooms we reserved were beautiful and we enjoyed the views from our rooms For the price and convenience this hotel was an excellent choice for us

title: Great location and rooms
text: Had one night here at the beginning of a trip around New England  perfect location for all that Boston offers The staff were extremely helpful welcoming and friendly Rooms really good and clean Wouldnt stay anywhere else in Boston for value and location Fine for young children too

title: Most exceptional customer service of any Fairmont hotel I have stayed at
text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Fairmont Copley Plaza while I was in Boston on a business trip It was my first time visiting Boston I am a Fairmont presidents club member and have have the pleasure of staying at many Fairmont properties in Canada and the United States I am pleased to say that this was by far the best hotel stay I have ever had The hotel setting was amazing and the service of all the staff at the hotel was phenomenal From the bellmen the front desk attendants housekeeping and food and beverage staff I was always made to feel like a valued guest of the hotel 
One night when I was dining in the Oak Bar I asked the food and beverage manager where I could find a particular brand of cucumber vodka Adam took the time to research the information for me and called a few liquor stores until he found a place where I could find it Unfortunately when I took a taxi to the liquor store they were sold out To my pleasant surprise when I returned from my business meetings the next day there was a bottle of vodka in my room for me Adam had taken the time to find out another store that sold it and went out purchased a bottle for me
This was one of the many shining examples of the amazing customer services of this hotel As a result I know that I will go back and stay here again in the future

title: Great location
text: When we went to NY for the first time we didnt have any idea of the place at all so went through a Travel Agency The put us in the Edison Room was very basic and not too large but clean The location is absolutely fantastic They have a bar The Rum House which is a piano bar and is a great bar even though quite small Music 5 nights a week Bartender at the time Jose extremely friendly and helpful Next time we went we booked direct and paid up front but when we got there we were told that we had been sent an email to say that there was only one room available no email arrived but the accommodated us in a doublebedded room which was far superior to the previous one We never ate in Sofias but had breakfast a couple of times in the diner attached Altogether enjoyed our stay especially with its closeness to Times Square Restaurant Row Broadway Central Park Maceys Penn Station etc  the list is endless Would definitely go back

title: Take all your valuables from your car
text:
no breakfast but FREE pet friendly
rooms with two beds are very small if you stay at the hotel during the day in the morning is veryvery noisy in eight days housekeeping have not vacuum the room even once
the rate is higher compared with the room comfort

title: Amazing hotel and staff food not so much
text: We were here for a week for a confernce and really enjoyed our stay Being walkers it was an idea location close to everything Concierge was very helpful providing routes and tmes Fourtunately she also gave us great tips to eat in all price ranges Would we stay here againABSOLUTELY Would we eat here again NO We are returning in Nov for another week for a family event but will eat elsewhere

title: Poolside cabanas were wonderful after a spa day
text: We didnt stay overnight but we did have a spa day here and that includes use of the facilities The pool and pool area were very small but fortunately it wasnt too crowded The terry covered cushioned lounge chairs under the white cabanas were amazing What a nice spot to have lunch after spa treatments The only downsides are small 1 the only restroom is inside the gym next to the spa 2 spa waiting area is tiny 3 you can call in your food order from the poolside phone but once its delivered the waiter disappears and doesnt come back to check on you or for refills Still we had a wonderful time

title: Not a great hotel
text: It was not the worst hotel that I have stayed in but it really was not that great a place We arrived very late at night and when we entered our room the air conditioning was not working The front desk person came up and reset the unit which worked for 5 minutes but then proceeded to stop again after the 5 minutes We had to be up for a dance competition in 5 hours so we had to sleep with the window open thankfully it was only in the 60s We complained to the front desk before we left for the day and when we got back later that night it was working The room was very outdated except for the new flat screen tv they apparently just put into all the rooms The pool was dirty you could not see the bottom because it was so cloudy The breakfast was ok it was like all hotels give you cereal make your own waffles toast eggs and sausage juice and coffee There was not enough staff on site when you called the front desk or went down to it no one was ever around and you had to wait for someone to come back

title: Great staythis is my new place in NYC
text:
This is a great hotel in NYC Rates are very very reasonable I was expecting the typical very small hotel room like most in The City but not here Room was a regular standard size roomnice high ceiling Room was VERY comforablewe got a King and the bed was fantastichighend pillows comforter Room was clean bright and spacious I cant say enough how much value I thought we got for what we paid 
Its an easy walk down Broadway to the subway station and Times Sq is I believe 3 stops away Easy easy 
Book it you wont be disappointed

title: Good option for weekend in Boston
text:
My husband and I along with two friends chose this hotel to be our base while visiting Boston for some sightseeing shopping and concert going The 5 shuttle to and from the airport was quite convenient as is the hotels proximity to a subway station The walk to the subway station is basically through a residential neighbourhood that seems decent and ends near a Dunkin Donuts On the other side of the hotel is a big box store plaza  Target Best Buy Home Depot etc which was nice and convenient
The hotel staff were quite friendly and helpful rooms were clean and big There is no restaurant though they do serve breakfast We did not try it but Bickfords nearby has a great breakfast Room service is provided by a nearby restaurant and while the food was really good there was some menu confusion since they had recently updated their menu and the hotel did not change the ones in the rooms
Our concert and shopping took us away from Boston so we needed to rent a car for a few days The free parking at the hotel was a nice bonus to this
Not being downtown you are a little out of the action and nightlife But for the price and closeness to the subway station this shouldnt matter too much

title: Good service but an older motel
text:
I have to commend the staff for excellent service  they really try to do the best they can Free shuttle to the cruise ship was much appreciated
However this is an older motel type establishment and the rooms are dark and furnished in an outdated 80s style It felt a bit depressing with no outside light for privacy the curtains have to remain closed It might be a great improvement if they could add some sheer type curtains that allowed daylight to enter and yet maintained some privacy
The passageways are run down and while the paint is new they need some sort of reburbishment  doesnt give a good impression upon entering
Breakfast consisted of donuts and weak coffee with something that was vaguely suggestive of juice Perhaps some healthier alternatives like bran muffins and a better brand of juice
The price of course was very good but could be summed up by you get what you pay for Next time we will pay a bit more and try something a bit more upscale

title: Great value but could improve
text: Overall really appreciated the comfort of the hotel Rooms comfortable and clean with sofa bed for 2 kids Part of room a bit stuffy as ac far from master bed Free breakfast but it is pretty basic stuff and the breads are stale and not tasty It is also a it of a mad scene with too much activity in the breakfast area Free shuttle is very convenient as I goes to the major sights There is also free parking

title: The Muse  fantastic location
text:
This was our first visit to New York  therefore we opted for a hotel close to Times Square the Muse Hotel did not disappoint
The location is excellent  approximately 300 yards from Times Square and the theatre district 2 blocks from 5th avenue shopping area and an easy stroll from Macys and Central Park
We had an executive room which was spacious and had the benefit of a very comfortable bed and small sofa The decor is very modern and clean with a large bathroom and quality bath products
We are aware of other reviews commenting on the noise from the street We had 3 windows onto 46th street and had no problems with noise

title: Plan to return
text: During our Spring Break we stayed at this hotel so our family could enjoy the many sites in DC The hotel was conveniently located near all the major museums Capital White House and other attractions We didnt need to take a bus or subway we just walked and felt safe everywhere we went The service was also wonderful Barbara at the front desk was very receptive to our many questions Everyone seemed genuinely interested in us having an enjoyable stay The hotel room was clean and well maintained as well My kids couldnt get enough of the pool and we enjoyed the roof top terrace We hope to return and will definitely stay at this hotel

title: Perfect anniversary visit
text:
Elegant old Boston landmark Very helpful competent friendly staff from checkin to departure
Junior suite on a high floor Spectacular view of the Commons Traditional decor and furnishings Delicious breakfast served in suite Amenities to honor anniversary delivered on arrival Beautiful linens et al Immaculate and comfortable

title: A good choice in a City that doesnt have many options
text: The Atheneum is a good choice in a city that really does not have many decent hotels Rooms are big and have decent beds Lobby is a little dated and the staff is a little indifferent but the hotel overall is pretty good Location is convenient to some restaurants in Greektown and sports stadiums are very close by The People Mover is a block away which makes a circle around downtown Detroit For the price you probably get the biggest room in the City Good choice for families who want to put their kids to sleep and close the door

title: In need of a facelift
text: This hotel room is clean the minimum standard for staying but the entire hotel is in need of repair Some repairs are in progress but the quality of the repairs looks as if it has been done by Jethro Bodine Definitely not to Marriott standards and the worse Marriott property I have ever stayed

title: Not that nice
text:
Stayed here in early Jan 2004 for one night The hotel lobby is nice but the rooms need work They have old furniture and are in need of an update The staff was friendly but they were not willing to give me a room on a higher floor even with my Hilton Gold Card I would stay here again but it is on the lower side of most Embassy Suites One major plus is PF Changs Rest which is located in front of the hotel 
For good steak try Donovans down the street You will pay top  but it is worth it Also a large mall UTC is dirtectly across the street

title: An hotel near of the action
text: This an excellent address to be near of everything in NYC Very clean not too noisy with an excellent breakfast buffet included We loved the situation so we can walk around or take the subwayThere is a lot of restaurants nearby on the 9th Av

title: Fantastic Location
text: Fantastic location convenient to shopping and great restaurants We booked the Deluxe King room for 4 nights  it was small but not unreasonably so for 2 people The room was clean and comfortable with a great view of the city I wasnt sure what to expect after reading other reviews but every member of the staff that we encountered was friendly and helpful  and I never got the feeling that the property was understaffed Checkin was fast and simple room service was as scheduled As one reviewer wrote the tables in the lounge were marked reserved  but we were immediately seated at a reserved table on a busy Saturday night without reservations Service at the bar and in the lounge were above average There were nice touches like cookies in our room at checkin and a coffeehot chocolate machine by the ice machine

title: club level lake view was great
text: As a an spg member the extras were great Club level lounge was very nice and had a beautiful view of the lake Staff was very nice especially Tamera in the club lounge The room was okay after you get past the wierd divider wall Very nice location Close to the high end mall and a lot of restaurants I would stay here again

title: Looks nice but lacks substance and service
text:
The common areas are very sleek and good looking The Library Bar is a great space But this is not a hotel that is luxurious or offers great customer service We stayed in a Superior King room and it was pretty good except the bathroom still had an old bathtub and was small They have clearly skimped on the upgrade of the rooms  bed was pretty stiff you could see the old paint job and there is zero art on the walls 
In terms of service the front desk doesnt allow guests to borrow umbrellas in a town where it rains for like 5 months nonstop it took them 20 minutes to check us out and fix a charge on our invoice and it wasnt fixed so now I have to call them when I get home and no one was particularly welcoming our 3 day stay there Plus the Pump Room was unable to move our dinner reservation from 2 to 4 people which is silly and tells me they dont value guests staying at the hotel 
There were two things I liked about the hotel the fitness room had many new machines and was decent sized and the people who came to get dinner and drinks at night were all well dressed It was a good scene if you stayed in the Library Bar and didnt hang out in the other bar near the Pump Room
Overall Id say this hotel is just a 3 star hotel that caters to one time guests and locals who will take friends and business clients there for drinks and dinner Nothing really wrong with that but potential travelers should book knowing this

title: The best
text: The suite was beautiful the breakfast was outstanding and the GMs reception was most delightful The Omaha Steakhouse restaurant provided very attentive service delicious entrees and courteous room service What more could anyone want

title: You have roommates
text: Its fine as long as you dont mind the roaches bedbugs and rats staying with you Oh did I menation the long black hair and bodily secretions on the sheets when we checked in Homeless people would not stay here Staff is nice They must be hiding from the law to work here

title: Would Definitely Stay Here Again
text: We had three rooms traveling before a cruise The staff here was excellent went out of their way for you very friendly and courteous Loved the rooms and art deco decor Very clean and the pillows were extremely comfortable We hung out in the lobby they made us feel very much at home Also very close to the Space Needle Pikes Market and the Pier

title: Returning next month
text:
My wife and I stayed in the Rex in April 2008 for 3 nights we loved the European feel to this hotel We are now at this minute booking the Hotel for another 4 nights in March 2010 I remembered the secluded feel of the hotel and the excellent local knowledge of the staff The parking is obviously not great it is right in the middle San Francisco after all what do you expect However their system for parking works and you do not have to wait long
The rooms are compact not small but extremely comfortable it all adds to the intimacy of the hotel like it is a secret place that no one else has discovered yet
If you want stay somewhere that puts the customer first go for it at the Rex

title: Lovely Hotel in a GREAT LOCATION
text: There is no doubt that the location of this hotel is great We had a room on the 5th floor over looking 10th St I was expecting more noise based on the reviews that I had read prior It was actually quiet for a large city The bed was very comfortablewith lots of pillows The room was VERY clean The staff was very helpful and the bar and restaurant although pricey were very good We only had dinner and dessert The bartender makes great cocktails The nightly water is a nice touch especially when you have been doing a lot of walking Overall a wonderful experience

title: I LOVE this hotel and their staff AMAZING
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks for work training and the guest service was 
absolutely wonderful Housekeeping was prompt when called valet always had my car promptly for me The ladies in the restaurant were pleasant and attentive as were the front desk staff 
I would recommend this hotel to everyone and my husband and I have told everyone what a great hotel this is 
Cant wait to come back and visit again

title: What a Dump
text: Whoever came up with the phrase the customer is always right would be appalled by the service received at this hotel The staff is rude and uncaring and they seem to care more about the people who come to their pool bar then the people staying at the hotel itself Imagine advertising that they have a pool and then not being able to take your kids to it because of the MTV Beach Party that is going onand that was on one of the few days that they actually allowed us to access the pool Nearly all of their staff who interact with guests need charm school classes from the front desk staff one of whom hung up on me when we called to complain that the elevator still hadnt come after 15 minutes of waiting to the onsite managers who tell you to fill out their customer service survey as a way to voice your concerns Although the common spaces are very nice catering more to their celebrity visitors then the actual hotel guests the rooms are small and sparse a waste paper basket would have been nice and the air conditioning incredibly loudif you are lucky enough to get a room where it actually works which wasnt the case for some of my fellow travelers We kept hearing were still getting the kinks out but the problems they have are with their people and the utter lack of concern that they have for their normal paying guests

title: top notch
text: 4 nights at the palmer house was a real treat room was large well appointed clean and classy the beds were very comfortable and everyone was courteoushelpful and professional the lobby is awesomethe ceiling is a work of great beauty they have this huge work out facility on the 8th floor which i think occupies 10000 sq ft the pool is good i swam laps 7 strokes end to end so its not nor does it claim to be a lap pooland they keep the temp at a comfortable setting not near boiling like some places the palmer house gets highest marks not cheap altho great rates are possible anywhere with a little luckpricelinefor ex and skilltrip advisor is a great resource with chicago right outside yr door a trip to skydeck of sears tower lgt building in no america incredible architecture caf boat tours are outstanding millenium pk world class city pizza at giordanos on jackson downtown was fabulous and i know pizza go  bring lots of money stay at the palmer house youll love it

title: Excellent Hotel  Great Staff
text: We recently were guests at the Hotel Beacon and would thoroughly reccommend this Hotel to fellow travellers from NZ This Hotel is in a great location  offers excellent value for money and is staffed by a great team who do provide excellence in Customer Service  making sure all the guests needs are met and providing a welcome after your time out and about The proximity to the 72nd St Station  Central Park  The Beacon Theatre  catch a show and all the other attractions make the Beacon a great place to stay The kitchenettes are fine but you will clearly get yourself into the swing of a Deli Breakfast and Fairway over the road is great to top up the fridge

title: Tre Chic
text: The Hyatt Regency is a great business travelers hotel  very clean modern yet comfortable relaxing decor I stayed for a week and enjoyed every time I was in the hotel They have an amazing workout room  glass looking out on the city The staff is over the top helpful and accommodating If you dont believe me just order room service once They got everything right down to the noice in the water Problems you have to pay for Internet either TMobile wireless or 1024 hour period for wired luckily I had a broadband card which wasnt blocked other wireless signals including the free downtown wireless seemed to be blocked Also parking can be a bear but if you Super Shuttle it from the airport and are downtown its great Just a block from 16th St Pedestrian mall and lots of great restaurants The concierge got me a reservation at a lovely Italian restaurant that included free afterdinner drinks limoncello All in all a very nice stay

title: River North gem
text:
In the River North section of Chicago the Felix is a very comfortable place Rooms are standard size for Chicago hotels and the location is a few blocks west of Michigan Avenue Some funky bars and restaurants on Clark St are worth checking out Try Orange two blocks north Wholefoods just east on Huron and the Italian deli east of that great sandwiches and gelato Hotel is convenient to the El and bus lines which provide excellent service to the entire city
Staff very friendly and helpful

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed 6 nights and would definitely stay again The location for Times Square and the theatre district is perfect The staff were very helpful and there were plenty of them  from reception to security to luggage storage guys Our room was new and the bed  very comfy
For a big hotel in a very big city this place was better than we hoped for Will return to see the renovations completed Thanks Milford we were on a trip of our lifetime and you were part of that

title: DONT LET THE PICTURES FOOL YOU
text:
Hotel is under renovation There were no baseboards on my entire floor half the light fixtures in the hallway had no lights in them the vending machines were empty and the ice machine didnt work
The weirdest thingthere was no closet in the room There was a small refrigerator that we had to prop up on something to make it stand up and not tilt over The light fixture in the bathroom was hanging by the wires out of the ceiling The swimming pool was just a mosquito magnet
I could go on and on and onbut I wont Hopefully once the renovations are complete the hotel will actually look like th pictures that are advised
The best thing about thishotelthe television in the rooms was really nice and the location is awesome

title: Loved the rooms
