text: It was a great experience and loved the simplicity of the hotel The bathrooms are well equipped and clean Good heating system installed in the rooms

title: Excellent location and huge room
text:
I would definitely recommend Hotel Contessa for people who want to stay on the Riverwalk in downtown San Antonio Hotel Contessa is located right on the Riverwalk and you are minutes away from all the restaurants bars and shops on the Riverwalk Hotel Contessa is not in the center of the riverwalk action but it is definitely in a great location Also its kind of nice to be slightly secluded especially when enjoying drinks or dinner outdoors in front of the river at the hotel restaurant The hotel is also within 10 minutes walking distance to The Alamo and other sights in downtown San Antonio
The hotel itself is very clean with nice and modern decorations The rooms are HUGE Each room is a suite and the rooms are very nicely appointed The bathrooms are large and beautiful as well There is free wired and wireless internet in the hotel rooms I have no complaints about my stay The price is better here than at the more central riverwalk hotels but this hotel is close enough to everything to be worth the stay

title: Five days in Boston
text: We visited Boston just after Hurricane Sandy came up the coast but luckily there was very little damage done here We picked the Colonnade Hotel because of its location to many attractions and because of favouable reviews that we read We were not dissapointed The rooms were spacious and the beds were particularly comfortable All the staff were very friendly and were more than eager to give us good advice about things to see and places to eat We took a daylong tour of the greater Boston area took a Duck boat ride went up to the skybridge walked all over the Back Bay area and of course did our share of shopping in the many malls and shops in this area We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to others staying in Boston

title: Nice hotel in a perfect location some organizational kinks
text:
I stayed in this hotel while on a road trip with my mother I used some of my Starwood upgrade certificates to upgrade to a Deluxe room
Valet parking at the hotel was easy but very expensive more than 50day The checkin process was a little disorganized We arrived around 830PM on a Saturday but to my surprise there was only one counter open for this massive hotel and the SPG line was closed We had to wait around 10 minutes to get to the counter when another agent finally arrived Overall the checkin was smooth but the agents didnt seem certain about some of the hotels newer policies For example there is a new benefit for free continental breakfast for Platinum members But no one seemed sure what it included or any of the details about it Even at the cafe where it was served there was uncertainty about how to process the order and what to do with the coupon they wanted to keep it although we needed it again for the second morning
After checkin we headed to the Tower where our room was The elevators ride on shafts outside the structure and are all glass which is pretty cool But they can be really cold and so can the lobby so be prepared We stayed near the top floor which was pretty cool because our room had a great view of the Golden Gate bridge The room itself was a little smaller than I expected but I thats what you get in most downtown areas of major cities It was certainly clean and comfortable with the normal Heavenly bed and shower There was a refrigerator in the room but it was automated so you cant expect to store anything personal in there I did see a note about requesting an additional fridge if you need to store things Im not sure about that process we didnt need it
We didnt need the concierge much but the one time we did the gentleman helping us was great The other team members seemed less engaging
The breakfast at the cafe in the lobby did the trick for us They had tasty baked goods fruit yogurt and coffeetea We also ventured out and waited on a huge line to get to Dotties cafe down the street We waiting a long time but it was totally worth it awesome breakfast joint
The location of the hotel is perfect right in Union square Its within immediate reach of the street cars cable cars buses BART and walking distance of Chinatown Little Italy and others We had dinner one night at Scala nearby which was very good and at The House of Prime Rib which was amazing one of the best mealspresentations Ive had in a long time
Overall I would recommend the hotel as long as the expectations on the room size are in line and the possibility of delayconfusion at checking
Safe travels

title: Great hotel Amazing city
text:
After reading some reviews on the site I was apprehensive but had no need to be Room was big with 2 double beds bathroom small but had huge shower Great location Taxi rank outside and Grand Central Station Metro subway linked to the hotel Bought a week metro card for only 24 When we checked out had a bill for 110 dollars for food which was not mine Sorted out quickly and wiped off my credit card
Statue of Liberty breathtaking Well worth a ranger trip around Ellis Island Empire State queues big but had to be done Did Rockerfeller Centre in the night and noticed they did a special pass to go up in the day and night on the same day Views from helicopter out of this world Brooklyn Bridge  well worth the walk for the view but dont bother with Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory Shopping in Macys better than Bloomingdales Guggenheim and Met both excellent Movie tour well worth it  never thought the Friends building looked like that What an amazing place Cant wait to go back Will be booking the Hyatt again too

title: Excellent Service Room No good entrance nor spa or pool services
text:
This is an excellent hotel although it is important for them to make some reforms to keep in his position
Cleaning service was no very good we found dust in many places and almonds in the carpet the carpet was no clean at all
The tub in the bathroom was a bit old and a bit small
The matresses of the beds were no good I think they were quite old same for pillows
There was no pool working they told us they were reforming it
The spa closes very soon which we dont find it ok for this type of hotel category
The shop at the hotel was very poor so we could not find anything we needed
The service in the hotel is excellent in general and the room service is really good It makes you feel confortable and feeling welcomed really warmly
The entrance to the hotel is not very good cars arriving cars living and people going in and out makes it a bit unconfortable and you feel not being very secure between all this cars

title: Great Stay
text: Ten of us stayed here last weekend for four nights Although this hotel is old it is run really well by some very friendly and helpful staff From booking our stay a few months back  making some changes along the way Veronica at reservations was very helpful and nothing was too much trouble  The receptionists and door staff were really friendly and helpful Our suite was spotless the beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was clean and shower very good The location is second to none Next time In in New York I will stay again hopefully

title: Awesome in every way
text: Great location great room great service fantastic value

title: Excellent hotel and location
text: Stayed for 5 nights on our first trip to New York Hotel is in an excellent location and we had no trouble finding our way around The hotel was of a very high standard and efficiently run Our room was a good size with two comfy if high double beds We were on the back of the hotel with side views of the Hudson riverThe bathroom was clean with plenty of towels shampooshower gel and body lotionI thought it was windyas we were quite high up but it was the sound of the lift It didnt cause any inconvenience though We could probably have found somewhere less expensive to stay but were warned that hotels in New York can leave a lot to be desired The menu was rather expensive but it is more fun going out to eat New York is such an atmosphoric place The only downside was that internet access is expensive but then New York as a whole is expensive

title: Central location but not great
text:
First off the location in Little Italy is great Its right in the heart of the disctrict with lots of dining options all around although none of them blew us away but we only tried a few But the first thing to know is that because its right in the midst of the action YOU HEAR IT ALL midnight partiers dogs in the hotels central courtyard orbiting police helicopters crying babies trains and the local clocks carillonTough if you really want to get a good nights sleep 
Other tipsthe rooms are very small European style rooms with only a separate wc with the toilet and tubshower inside the vanity and sink are in the entry area next to the tiny clothes rack and the only appliance included is a hairdryerno iron in the room although they have them at the deskjust test it before you take it back to your room our first one didnt work and no alarm clock or radio Also if you have a car wed definitely recommend reserving a parking space for 10 Its worth it since the local metered spaces may be hard to come by and your coins buy a lot of time though they do take all coins not just quarters Dont try to enter with a huge car though its tight
Too anyone with babiesDONT open the balcony door There was no actual balcony out this door and a sizeable gap between the threshhold of the door and the bars in front meant that any small child would be in danger of falling through Crazy
Other notes basic toiletries loudflushing toilets basic flat pillows though they do give you 4 and not much storage space 
On the plus side the locals were super nicewe were impressed by how friendly everyone in the area was Have a fun trip

title: Almost Perfect Stay
text: Just returned from a 7 night stay at the Palomar It is high on my list but Iwe did encounter just a few weak spots The things we loved The rooms are well appointed and spacious We were upgraded to a suite extremely nice and large for a nomimal charge The basic rooms are great too it was nice to have the extra space The front desk was very helpful and always pleasant the pool area though small was very nice for a downtown location The room was clean bed great very restful after a long day  It was very nice to have coffee in the lobby in am lemon water during the day and a very nice wine reception each day fro 56pm The retuarants in the area are plentiful and very good Didnt have a bad meal Urbana restaurant attached to the hotel is very good too The location of the hotel is very convenient near Dupont Circle Now for the negatives The concierge was not up to par They were rude at times very curt and were not very knowlegable One example we wanted to take a side trip to Mt Vernon and got poor and multiple information They need to spruce up the concierge department The only other complaint I had was that for a suite  we only had one sink  a modern above sinkvery impractical and the shower looked liked it needed a good scrub wallpaper needs freshening All in all we would recommend this hotel and would return

title: They made a difference I am sold
text:
I had the untimely experience of getting stuck in San Antonio with my spouse after a business trip San Antonio not being the first place that comes to mind when spending time with a spouse for me but I have to say that we took a chance on this brand new property and had the most incredible time
A hotel stay is made of a few key elements and here is my opinion on them for this property
Cleanliness Without a question these people know what it means to make a guest feel that they care about the upkeep on this place There was someone on our floor cleaning everyday during working business hours There was a friendly employee in the lobby that seemed to love her job and meeting guests It was just refreshing to see that this was not an area taken for granted
Location While not on what they locally refer to as the loop this property is located on the Riverwalk and is just a step enough away to get some well needed peace and quiet from time to time
Rooms Fantastic Every room is again clean arranged as a tworoom suite which is nice if you want to leave a loved one sleeping quietly in the bedroom as well as spacious in comparison to other properties
Value You will pay for parking 29 you will pay for internet 10 but you will not pay for breakfast everyday nor the evening reception again everyday and while there be cheaper locations in the area the overall value is unmatched Great room Nice view New property Free fooddrink
Last but certainly not least in my book
Service Unmatched The valets were polite and speedy The folks in breakfast were friendly and always looking to help My true pleasure came in dealing with the front desk folk I want to commend several of them namely Katlyn who always greeted us with a smile Tim who was both polite and professional Madison who seemed to know more about San Antonio than I think anyone else on the property and then Ronnie who was introduced to us by Madison as her manager and I have to say this young man is a true professional He was engaging professional and personable He took time to learn about us and the nature of our trip and sought out ways to make it better than it started If this is the person who is training your team I commend his efforts job well done He made sure everyone knew our names and I felt that if we needed anything that he and his team would jump at the chance The front desk served service like it was the blue plate special and they had to give out as much as they could before the day ended I am sold

title: Hotel Helix Exceeded my Expectations
text: We were in town for a wedding and the groom recommended the Hotel Helix From the internet site it looked hip and fun and the room rates were very reasonable Checkin was fast staff was friendly and accommodating letting us check in early and out late as we were from out of town made restaurant recommendations and arranged our transportation The room was spacious Will stay there again when in DC

title: over 40 read this
text: I stayed at the Hudson recently and would not return Not because it was terrible it wasnt Its that while it had some wonderful qualities it lacked some essential amenities The good location interior design staff HVAC and a reasonable value I did not sample the nightlife but the bar looked like fun My room had two full size beds so it never felt claustrophobic The bad if youve hit the age where you need glasses it is not a good hotel choice The lobby corridors bedrooms closets bathroom all VERY DARK Its a look I know and a great one at that but I couldnt see Forget applying makeup And no drawers Theres a small shelving unit but I dont like my lingerie on display each time I open the door for room service And the Cafeteria was very pricey for overcooked Eggs Benedict So although its a fun place that does many things well it doesnt score highly in some categories that are nonnegotiable for me

title: Great location affordable friendly staff
text:
Very well located downtown and at an affordable rate Stayed at a more expensive hotel last time i was in town and the Sonesta is just as every bit as good for half the price
Checkin was a breeze room is clean and enough space I dont spend much time in my hotel rooms so all i need is the basics to be good and covered and they were

title: Loved this place a bit loud from street side
text: Beautiful place great comfortable bed big towels loved the riverwalk Our room faced the street on one side but with the doors closed so it was a bit loud from the partiers and street traffic so request a riverwalk view or pool view if possible It wasnt that big of a deal We had two sets of french doors one facing the street the other facing the courtyard Highly recommend and would definitely return

title: Very modern like hotel A true Courtyard in a cold city
text: nice amenities friendly front desk staff and good quality free coffee Bed quality is so so Needs new mattrees that is very importantLocation is great and close to everything A true Courtyard in a cold city If your room is facing the courtyard is pretty

title: Great service good location
text:
I went on a short trip to Boston and this hotel was right near to the place I visited Metro meeting center  I liked the rooms though they could have been more spacious Bed was good and so does the other amenities 
Service is the area where it shines and get high five for that Be it front desk or the concierge desk guys at door or the ladies at room service they are all warm and welcoming 
I tried both the restaurants one glitch is that the Bond is small considering the number of people gathers for dinner Once we did not get a seat and had to go out The saver here is that there are many eating outlets around the area and they should suffice your hunger and taste buds in such case
Additionally it is near to Quincy market New England Aquarium the place from where Boston tour buses starts so a nice convenience if you intend to take a tour

title: Huge Rooms Great Prices
text: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights last week I thought it was a very good deal for the size of the rooms We stayed in a 2 bedroom2baths The decor was a little outdated but nothing too bad It was a great location too We walked to Times Square several times Grand Central is a short walk too That was great I thought all the employees I dealt with were very kind It was a great stay

title: Good value for the money
text: Stayed in the Kings Inn San Diego March 2006 The rooms were large enough to hold three adults two good sizedenough luggage for 10 days and two queen sized beds Barely Of course we werent planning to have dances there The room containing the bathtub and toilet is minute No dances there either So what The price was good and the place is convenient to Sea World and the San Diego Zoo the two places we visited I would definitely consider it on a return trip It also is really easy to get to since its visible from I8 The place is clean the waffle place does a good breakfast Over all it was a good deal It has in room hair dryers but no in room coffee a definite negative to my wife

title: Very nice but feel nickel and dimed
text:
We stayed here 3 days while visiting some friends I dont mind the high fees to stay there It is a 5 star hotel and the room was nice enough to justify that However what I will never understand is why the nicest places charge for incidentals What does a little travel toothpaste cost them 0015 The mandatory valet parking was also a little excessive But I think in nice hotels the thing that most irritates me is charging for wifi when cheaper hotels offer it free
Overall a very nice hotel as long as you dont mind being charged for every little thing

title: Would go somewhere else
text:
The location of this hotel is amazing but thats about the only good thing Its right in the middle of Times Square and everything you want is nearby
The staff are rude and not very helpful The internet is very expensive The rooms are old and the only thing that looked clean was the sheets The bathroom was falling apart and the door was very rickety so I didnt tend to leave valuables in the room Its also overpriced for what you get I also read in the paper that a dead body was found in one of the roomsbut not sure if thats true Anyway I wouldnt bother staying here you could probably get somewhere a lot better for just a little bit more money

title: Beautiful Room Great Location and Food
text:
This was my second time staying at the Sofitel and from now on this is my choice hotel when in Philadelphia From the conceirge service to the room service everything was fantastic
As mentioned before the beds are very comfy and the bathrooms have all the amenities you would need The price for room service is a bit high but good food especially the breakfast french toast
I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton before and was greatly disappointed being there so from now on the Sofitel it is

title: Good value Best Western but tough beds
text: We stayed for 5 days at the end of Feb 2007 The local on Hotel Circle is great  very convenient to Mission Bay and Mission Ocean and Pacific Beaches to Old Town to Balboa Park and to downtown The heated pool and 2 hottubs were nice There is a little workout room not mentioned by Best Western listing it seems with extra towels for the pool Plenty of vending machines Rooms at the east side of each of the 3 buildings are near the 163 freeway you can hear traffic noise unless you run the heaterAC Rooms near the jungle walkway through the property ie lots of plants very nice had more tropical location ours was far from this and seemed more like a standard motel room The room was clean The TV had many cable channels though some hotels have more eg no AE HGTV or History and no movie channels only pay Movies on Demand The major problem was that the beds were very firm and somewhat sagging toward the middle Nice place but uncomfortable sleeping There was a single computer in the lobby for guest use for the internet dont know whether there was wireless

title: NYC brownstone
text:
Because my partner and I were relocating to New York City we thought this place sounded perfect for the two weeks we would need to find an apartment We were hoping to find something that would feel more like a home than a hotel and Inn New York City was just perfect for us
The Inn is basically a brownstone on the Upper West Side of Manhattan The owners see to it that you are well taken care of but do not interfere when they are not needed so you really feel like you have your own apartment in the city and they even do your laundry upon request
We ended up staying in the Opera Suite on the main floor as it was the only one available for the entire 2 weeks we would need We were very pleased with the arrangement of the suite There were no stairs to climb other than the steps outside which was helpful for us at the time Inside the suite we had a lovely firm  and very comfortable  queen sized bed facing the fireplace We only used the fireplace one night but Ruth one of the two owners needs to come and light a firelog due to too many mishaps of guests in the past but it was lovely all the same You do need to be aware however that the owner needs to be notified in the afternoon if you would like a fire in the evening 
We also really loved having a kitchen with everything you could ever need to cook and we enjoyed preparing some of our own meals from time to time They also leave fresh sweets fruits and flowers every afternoon along with some basics such as juice milk and quiche in the fridge
Our suite also had a baby grand piano in it along with many piano books and opera magazines  great for the classical music lover
The only downside for me is that one night I fell terribly ill with food poisoning and was not able to get a hold of anyone in the inn as it was the middle of the night There was an emergency contact number for the inn by the phone but nobody answered As we were new to the city we were hoping they could put us in touch with an emergency doctor I did eventually find a house doctor online who was able to come to the inn the following morning  which was a lifesaver
Overall we were very satisfied with our stay here as it was greatly helpful in our transition of moving to the city I would highly recommend it for anyone visiting the city looking for something more personable than a hotel
Oh and the Inn really does look exactly like the photos on their website so no need to post any of my own

title: Old Man Rivers Gem of Southern Hospitality
text: We have stayed at River Inn of Harbor Town several times this year since discovering it based on a good friends recommendation You will enjoy the rooftop terrace which is ideal for group events We were greeted with complimentary champagne in late afternoon and each time we have stayed in a different room or suite all of them spacious wellmaintained all of the amenities you would expect in a four star hotel and on the west side you can enjoy a view of the Mississippi River lazily flowing by a scene in late afternoon with a beautiful sunset in the background takes you back a century General Manager Karl Friedrich and his excellent staff make each guest feel welcome and the hotel overall has achieved the highest standards in our judgment and we have been a few places Paulettes Restaurant is the Inns fourstar restaurant that consistently earns its Most Romantic and Best Continental designation clearly a Memphis favorite made even more memorable by our waitress Donna who knows the menus by heart and guided us to some delicious grouper and salmon dishes with lobster bisque homemade raspberry sorbet they make it every three hours and a french crepe featuring locally grown plums  grown on a nearly farm on Highway 51 The cosy welcoming atmosphere of the Inn and its superb restaurant and staff that aims to please at every turn will amaze you and keep you coming back We have found our little escape

title: Clean room wcomfy queen bed
text: As a female business traveler it was nice to have a clean room close to the airport for a change The comfy queen bed was a nice plus Looking forward to staying there again

title: Great hotel
text:
I have stayed in this hotel for one night on June 2009 I chose this hotel because it was a couple of steps away from the embassy that I wanted to go to
The front desk representative who was there at the time of my checkin was rude and kept me waiting for more than 10 minutes while he was using the phone and answering questions that seem really not important at 1130 PM while I was waiting Besides that he didnt show any courtesy when I asked him about the time and place of the breakfast and he simply pointed his finger to the sign that were placed on the desk assuming that I can read English That was totally rude and uncivilized and I am really astonished that such a beautiful and elegant hotel has such a rude front desk representative One more thing that bothered me during my stay was the breakfast first I had to pay 10 bucks for a breakfast which consists of a couple of fruits and croissant That was ridiculous and I expected more from this hotel especially after paying 10 dollars A buffet probably not an American continental I would rate my checkin experience as 110 and the breakfast as 010
Thank you and best regards

title: Nice hotel good location but overpriced
text: I have stayed at this hotel many times as it is near a company office The hotel itself is very nice  it has more amenities and services than most Courtyards do including a nice lounge area and full service menu The breakfast buffet is also very nice and reasonably priced Service is always good here and in general the level of cleanliness is very good The exercise room is nice albeit small only 4 pieces of cardio equipment The location is easy to get to from National airport and it is in close proximity to the Nationals Stadium and Navy Yard but this is NOT an area you want to be walking around in after dark especially alone so plan accordingly It is in close proximity to a great small restaurant Justinsgreat food and drinks There are only 2 things that I do not like about this hotel  the beds and the room noise I find it difficult to sleep due to outside noise entering the room and the noise made by the HVAC Secondly I find the beds to be very uncomfortable  the mattresses are hard I appreciate a firm mattress but dont like to feel like I am sleeping on the floor Lastly the hotel is very highly priced  typically close to 300night If not for the mattresses and the room price I would give this hotel 4 stars

title: Location Location Location
text: I spent a little over a week at this hotel I was in town for a national convention of the Future Business Leaders of America FBLA The hotel was filled to capacity The staff was very accommodating The hotel was recently renovated Beautiful After visiting the other two hotels that the conference was at the Hilton by far was the nicest It was located on the Riverwalkat the nicest location Close to the restaurants and shops The only drawback was the small pool and no place to get a coffeeyou had to go into the restaurant on the Riverwalk level Feel free to email me with any questions

title: Paying for the location
text:
Arrived in an always busy NYC and could not wait to shower and rest before tackling the city at night The Dreams bed was awesome Comfy and really cosy We loved it It was by far the best hotel bed ever
Later that night we had to ask for another room at round 3am The noise below our window was incredible Rubbish bins police and ambulance cars we could cope with out of control loaded up peeps we couldnt The noise these geezers were making really drove us crazy Arrangements were made then and there to move to another room and boy we were so happy we did This room was quiet and just as cosy and comfortable
We stayed at the dream over 8 nights Our last night was new years eve Location was fantastic Meant that we did not have to camp out Times Square to catch a glimpse of the festivities 
The lowlight of our stay was getting stuck in the lift for 15 minnow that was a terrible experience Problem was the drinking crowds that made their way into an already cramped liftnot a good idea
We would recommend the hotel but be prepared to pay a premium due to location

title: Stay near a strip club
text:
This was an absolute nightmare
Nothing like having to explain to my 7 year old son why that building across the street from the hotel says nude girls and nudie cuties My wife wasnt exactly crazy about it either
So what comes with a hotel right across the street from a strip club Thats right strange men and women lurking in the parking lot which by the way is WAY too small and filled up every night by 800 pm Your other option is to park in the underground garage which is an ominous and dark desolate place with only one way in or out and youll feel like there is about a 40 percent chance that you wont make it out alive
And the rooms fairly clean but for the cigaretteburned holes in the comforter the tv with no remote control and the very strange men lurking around at all hours of the night see strip club comments above
Dont stay here ever

title: Amazingly comfortable bed and sophisticated looking room with a view of a very tranquil city with a green backdrop
text: It was a great stay only for a weekend but it was amazing and probably the best sleep I have every had The room was very nice and the color scheme and furniture created a very tranquil and sophisticated vibe Furthermore the morning after there was a great all you can eat breakfast with the low package deal I received

title: Just okfriendly staff in the morning
text: At about 60 night yes it is reasonable however reconsider this hotel before booing due to smoke smell in a nonsmoking roomalso we found an ant in my daughters toothbrush when we woke up In fairness we only saw thatt one and one on the nightstand the next morning and could not find evidence of anymore but leaves quite the bad impression  I do believe the smoke smell came from the air conditioner vent when someone would smoke outside close to it because the smell was not always present but when it was present it was as though someone were smoking right in the room The evening checkin guy was just cordial not smiling or anything but not meanhowever the morning check out guy was extremely friendly and addressed my concerns and told me to feel free to call and talk to manager about them and he put them in my reservation notes If concerns are addressed and they fix those it is a great choice for inexpensive stay Thought there was continental breakfast but could not find it there is a restaraunt on site that is reasonable for breakfast but we did not try

title: Dont let the outside fool you
text: I LOVED this little motel Its not in the best area of Seattle but certainly not the worst either Its right on the bus line going to downtown and everything you need is close by I ended up staying longer than I intended and I was pleasantly surprised by everything The room I stayed in was really clean and new and I was treated great

title: One of the best Hotels in Seattle
text:
I have stayed here a dozen times over the past year and have never had an issue Extremely clean rooms and helpful staff make this one of the best places I have ever stayed 
If you partake  Ruth Chris Steak House in in the hotel Happy Hour is a great value and plenty of people to keep you from getting bored

title: Clean but average
text: I was pretty content with our stay at the Four Points You can tell that the hotel is not new but they keep it pretty updated and it was very clean The room was huge and our king size bed was to die for One of the most comfortable beds Ive ever slept in The location wasnt bad Its right next to the highway so its very easy to get to Parking was free Theres also free internet but it is not wireless so that can get annoying Also the shower wasnt built for a tall person If you are taller than 511 you might have to squat a little bit On our last night the heater in the whole hotel was so high that we could hardly sleep so I dont know if that is something that happens constantly or if it just was a one time incident If the price is right I would stay here again

title: Such a wonderful hotel
text: The hotel the location the park across the streetwhats not to love My partner and I were in town celebrating his birthday The staff went out of their way to make our stay extra special Definitely look forward to returning again soon

title: The Bare Basics Leave Ya With WAM Walking Around Money
text: I tried this place out on Easter Sunday 2005 When I FINALLY found a parking place not an easy task with an suv I was surprised at how nice the front entrancelobby to this place was I was thinking  Wow Could I have walked into the wrong hotel How could this place be so cheap The staff was nice and sent me on my way up to my room rather quickly The elevator was VERY small but who cares it smelled and looked very clean When the doors opened for me on the 4th floor I was a little disappointed to find that the quilities Id admired from the entrance where not throughout the hotel The halls are old narrow and creaky and when opening my door to my room I was hit by a blast of smoke smell Yuck Id asked for nonsmoking The bathroom was however very clean and this is important to me They appear to take care of what they have even though its old and needs updating The bed I had desperately needed a new mattress and if you need peace and quiet to sleep I wouldnt recommend this place because of its high traffic location But if cheap and clean is what you want and in the middle of it all is important Id say Youve Found It

title: Decent place to stay
text: I stayed for one night at the Holiday Inn Express in April I had some problems finding the hotel despite it being right on I10 but that was because Id turned off early The building is brightly coloured and easy to spot I asked for a room which didnt face the interstate and I had no noise problems The king room was very big and very clean and the staff were helpful giving restaurant recommendations etc The morning breakfast was the standard continental fare but nice I would stay here again if I was in El Paso

title: Nice hotel but noise can be a problem from the neighbours
text:
I stayed here for a conference over 2 days and received a discount rate in a King size room on an upper floor
The biggest negative of the hotel is the noise The walls are just too thin as the building itself is a bit old You can see this clearly when looking at the windows which are very old but have been sealed with new windows inside Although this is great for keeping the noise outside it does nothing for the noise from those staying in rooms near you
Every noise is audible from toilet flushing showers talking on the phone TV even getting clothes from the closet
My advice is to bring ear plugs if you are at all sensitive to the noise from neighbours
Some other negatives involve the window shade lack of coffee in room lack of space in the fridge and for some the softness of the bed
The window shade is so old it takes like 20 minutes to open and close it It might be a small annoyance to some but it seems like something that could be fixed easily That goes for the coffee and refrigerator space as well It is nice to have a minibar and 10 free stuff for Kimpton members but does it have to be so full that there is no space for anything of your own
The softness of the bed is a good and a bad depending on your own comfort and preferences I just think it is important to note here that the bed is VERY soft If you have a bad back and prefer a hard bed you may want to request it in advance and see if they can accommodate the need
The hotel has a Starbucks attached which is a nice convenience They also offer free wine and coffeetea in the lobby at specific times of the day These are all nice amenities The tea in particular is quit delicious and strongly recommended
Overall this was a nice hotel but perhaps not worth the money For a conference rate it seems appropriately priced

title: Great Weekend at the W
text: We stayed at the W in Seattle the first weekend of August 2004 and it was wonderful We enjoyed the decor food and superb service Our 14 year old thought it was the best ever and wants to return Finally a hotel with wonderful beds  they definitely have the comfort level turned to max My compliments to the designer

title: Not what we thought
text: When I reserved we reserved the family room with bunk beds The person on the phone reserving the room for me said that there was a wall between the bunk beds and regular bed When we got there it was a mini wall not a full wall like described The wall papercoverings was peeling in multiple areas and had a musty old smell The pool said it was heated but did not feel like it

title: reliably comfortable
text:
The hotel was my first InterContinental experience and I left with a favorable impression of the brand
Id always perceived the IC as generic professional and a tad boring  though in reality this also translates to a reliable pleasant and comfortable choice If youre after a cool vibe strong and edgy decor something quirky and unique to San Francisco the IC will disappoint as too safe and bland a choice
If youre after comfortable rooms with a pleasant modern decor in a very central location with a spa gym indoor pool and jacuzzi pleasant looking bar separate restaurant all accompanied by friendly and courteous service you cant go wrong with the InterContinental San Francisco And unlike the sister property you dont have to scale hills to get there 
The hotel has a corporate feel being adjacent to the Moscone I imagine it would be an excellent place to stay for business meetings and conferences The front office seemed to cope well with the high volume of guests when I was checking out but the bellmans team seemed overstretched  the desk was unmanned and there were several full luggage trolleys in the lobby being attended to Despite the rush the team did notice me standing at the desk and I was attended to in a sensible amount of time
Having my own agenda I didnt interact with the Concierge but I know the IC as a company pride themselves on their concierge service
I did not explore their dining and bar products too many iconic SF places to fit in but I appreciated the complimentary chocolates fruits nuts and water which were thoughtfully delivered
Overall a pleasant stay and a hotel i would recommend to those seeking a reliable and modern hotel in SF

title: trade show pricing
text: I stayed there from 1125 until the 30th It was business for me the RSNA Rooms were ok as was the food at breakfast the buffet is ok over cooked bacon and eggs I would wait on the line for the fresh cooked food It is in a good location but if you are going for a family city vacation unless you get a great price I would stay at the doubletree down the block It is not worth 200 a night I paid 300 a night Way Way over priced but that was the trade show pricing

title: Well appointed convenient and a nice stay
text:
When corporate business sites negotiate low rates Im always a bit suspect In this case I was pleasantly surprised The Crowne Plaza was a perfect location connected to my company by a bridge with great restaurants within easy walking distance Pappas and Cyclone Anaya and very comfortable accommodations
Front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly recommending restaurants and routes
The bed was firm enough and the linens were crisp I really appreciated the little touch of a gift bag on the bed with ear plugs sleep mask and a lavendar linen spray I didnt need the first two items but got a kick out of the lavendar spray and used it Mmmmm  smelled great and I had an excellent nights sleep
I ate at the hotel restairant Brazos for lunch  it was resaonably priced and my club sandwich was huge  much too big to finish Lunch with an ice tea tax and tip was under 17
The only thing that keeps me from giving this the highest rating is the internet connection There is free WiFi on the 1st and 2nd floors but not in the rooms The room connection is free but its ethernet That meant I could only use my iPad on the 1st or 2nd floors without the 3G connection That was inconvenient and I hope future updates fix that as Im sure Ill be back

title: Great Birthday Stay in Downtown Austin
text:
We had 3 of the evolution king bed rooms at the Hilton Garden Inn for us and friends so we could stay downtown for my husbands 50th The room was great  loved the little earplugs by the bed they are listening and the bed was very comfy with great sheets We were on the freeway side and it would be nice if they would put in new windows to reduce all noise we only heard noise once when an ambulance went down I35 Our friends were on the same floor as us 10th and they didnt hear it either Although we did have fun on 6th st and not get in until around 130 so were probably not the best noise judges Wed stay again in a heartbeat if we go downtown for a celebration and dont want to drive 
And the parking There is a ton of parking downtown for free on the weekend The valet mentioned it when we came in and our vehicle was fine right by the hotel

title: Perfect location nice hotel
text: Can not beat the location if you are in SA for leisure  it is connected to the Riverwalk and close to the Alamo and other downtown sites The only issue we had was bathroom cleanliness nothing major though hence one less star in the overall rating Size of the bathroom mentioned in some previous comments is not a real issue unless you are seriously overweight or want to fit more than one person in it  yes it is smallish but sufficient and even has extra room for toiletries probably not in all rooms though Otherwise the room was nice and modern breakfast was excellent Had a problem with the inroom safe but a service guy was there in 5 minutes to fix it Pool on the roof parking garage conveniently across the street your room card works to access it Definitely would stay in this hotel again

title: A very nice luxury hotel in the heart of San Francisco
text:
I very recently stayed 3 nights at the Ritz while attending a conference at the hotel and the overall experience was very good I felt it was a good value at the rates we were given for attending the conference 
My only real complaint is with the street noise that I could hear at all hours of the day I had a 3rd story room that was located along the very steep and busy Pine Street I believe the windows are single pane and the traffic noise was a issue Try to get either a higher floor or get a room away from Pine Street Otherwise the hotel is pretty much what you would expect from a high end property
Also with most hotels the bottled water soda and beer in the mini bar is very expensive so be sure to stock up prior to arriving

title: Nice location basic business hotel
text: I stayed here for twp nights in November while traveling on business The rooms were clean and very quiet and the wifi worked well On the 16th floor the views were nice with large windows The lobby was very basic but there is a gift shop to buy basics and they have free umbrellas for the typical weather and you can print your airline boarding passes You can walk to about 10 Starbucks and to Pikes Market and major shopping and restaurants on the water Elliotts was good The only downside was the parking which was valet only and expensive and not much else nearby The hotel is convenient near the freeway too and not too far from the airport The exercise room was minimal with a few machines

title: what a view
text:
I was pleasantly surprised by this Best Western which I tend to think of as a fairly budget chain This Best Western is really an exceptionfantastic view of the Space Needle from my window spacious and exceedingly clean rooms warm and responsive desk staff Plus the committment to Greensuites is impressive
Its a few blocks away from Belltown so there isnt much happening in the immediate vicinity except for construction Seems kind of deserted at night so I dont know if Id walk around there alone at night but hey its Seattle and people drive

title: I think it is a bit unfairly treated
text:
OKAY so it needs cleaning on the outside And OKAY so its not very modern And OKAY so the rooms could do with freshening up But whatever way you look at it you feel a bit special when you go into the entrance and lobby because it is special  thats why half of the people in the lobby are not residents they have come to stare especially at the mindblowing but expensive Sunday brunch buffet
So yes it has been a rather left behind and if you want a modern hotel you would not stay here but if you like tradtional hotels with a bit of old school charm once in a while then for a night or two in the city this is a good choice Id say

title: Bald face lies
text: When we checked in the desk clerk seemed to change his mind about whether breakfast vouchers were included in the room We didnt get one but all my colleagues did We were given a room on the third floor overlooking Madison Avenue A junior suite it was dark sparsely furnished and no wall hangings at all  we were told the previous occupant had stayed for 3 months and had all decoration removed and had a shower so small the water poured out the door as you got in I called the desk and asked to be given a room with a bathtub only to be told there were no tubs in the hotel Our safe didnt work we were blamed and told to read the instructions on the back of the safe door there werent any it turned out it was a broken When we complained bitterly we were given a larger suite on the penthouse floor  with a tub Although it was on the front of the hotel there were no windows overlooking Madison and that combined with the location on the tenth floor meant it was quiet We finally obtained breakfast vouchers I would not trust anything the employees say  and I would strongly discourage anyone from ever staying here

title: A gem in New York City
text: I recently stayed at the Library Hotel in NYC with my daughter to celebrate her 16th birthday I based my choice on Trip Advisor reviews and I was not disappointed This hotel in midManhattan is delightful The service is unparalleled the staff friendly and extremely helpful and location fantastic This boutique hotel offers breakfast included with many choices allday beverages and snacks in their secondfloor lounge and daily receptions on their rooftop terrace The rooms are beautiful as well Upon arrival the staff wished my daughter a happy birthday and in our room was a card for her along with a box of tiny cupcakes  what a nice touch Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again on my next trip to NYC

title: This is the mark to achieve for business gatherings
text: We hosted a business reception and dinner at The Peninsula for about 100 Exquisite environment exceptional service Every employee we encountered acknowledged our team individually and looked for opportunities to exceed our expectations This is a WOW property Guests kept complimenting our team all evening on our selection of the Peninsula

title: Wonderful place to stay and so are the rates
text: You will not even get close to this nice of a place to stay in wlos angeles for the price ILL BE BACK

title: Great Hotel Already Booked Again
text:
We had booked for a few days to take place in the week between christmas and new year There was a snowstorm in New York that meant all incoming flights were cancelled
No worries we got onto the travel agent and rebooked the holiday flying out new years day
We got to the hotel and the check in foyer is upstairs so you get a lift upto there and we were greeted by a very pleasant man called Ian Stergar He advised us on what we could do and where we could go and what to watch out for and recommended some places to eat
Anyway we were given a room on the 29th floor which was perfect People tend to go on about the size of hotel rooms in New York but our room was bigger than most we stay at in England It was just a superior king room but we could view over broadway and also Times Square so it was spectacular
We have rebooked and we are going for a week next year and would recommend to anyone who asked about this hotel

title: Great Value Will Keep You Coming Back
text: I have stayed at the State Plaza a number of times now for weekend trips to DC The hotel is conveniently located near several popular parts of the District which makes for easy access to restaurants tourist attractions and nightlife Street parking is available on both sides of the hotel the main entrance is on E Street the back entrance on F street connects the second building and the hotel offers valet parking that will cost you a nice chunk per day Dining is available on site if you desire to try the fare The hotel decor though wellkept shows its age but also adds a unique charm to the building that the average chain hotel doesnt have The staff is typically helpful and professional If you are looking for a reasonablypriced clean place that provides the basic amenities while you lay your head while in DC for a night or two this is worth checking out

title: very accommodating front desk staff
text:
hotel is nicely located in a quiet area of fells point within walking distance to all restaurants arrived early and room was not ready they let us park in their secured parking lot while we had our lunch nearby front desk clerk very helpful friendly professional and accommodating we were upgraded to harbor view room nicely appointed and spacious with fridge and water bottle 1 is free and 2nd one is 500
breakfast buffet exceeded my expectations fresh fruits like raspberries blackberries strawberries melonsetc with all kinds of bread bagels donuts etc boiled eggs hot oatmeal orange juice all kinds of organic teas coffee yogurtetc the bed is comfortable i love the view housekeeping just need to be detail in cleaning the bathroom found few strands of long hair on the wall and in the tub we didnt use the shuttle service but its included in their 995 destination fee wifi bottle water etc also i heard a clicking noise when the heating turns on not all the time after check out they allowed us to keep our car in the parking lot while we went for lunch i highly recommend this boutique hotel

title: Excellent place in to Stay in Seattle Down Town
text: i stayed in bell town arround 7 months It is really a great place in Down townThe room services and security is very good Easy to reach and all the facilities like kitchen laundry local phones internet are provided by belltown Restaurents and grocery shops are very near including convencebus service All the staff including Pattrick Sujain are very helpful I do recommend to enjoy by staying there

title: truly the best
text:
I usually stay at the Waldorf when in NY but thought Id try a change I am so glad I did This hotel is wonderful I had a truly fantastic stay there The staff are so good at their jobs its kind of shocking We ordered a car to collect us from JFK and they must have radioed to teh hotel as the recptionist  Hazel was waiting on the steps for us to check us in She said you must be X and this must be your daughter x She checked us in so fast then took us up to room When getting our car on return to the airport again I saw one of the staff radio for the car so subtley they have these little ear pieces I heard him say X party on way down get car ready and its there waiting with a smiling driver Beautiful spacious room Lovely details like a memory card slot in the TV to watch your NY photosall room controls done by a little box by your bed you just press a button to have your room made up change the lights air con etc I wouldnt stay at the waldorf again even though Ive previously loved it 
Location is wonderul two blocks from the park and walking distance to lots of stufflovely fancy address and area The pool is lovely you can have your lunch up there and its seriously relaxing
Im not as a rule a big fan of hotels for family stays but this hotel changed that They were amazing with my 8 year old seemed to instinctively know what she wantedall I can say is wow wow wow Go See for yourself

title: Wonderful place to stay
text:
We stayed at the Contessa January 2024 2008 for a business meeting at the convention center in San Antonio The host hotels were all booked so this was a second choice but it would definately be our first choice if we return to San Antonio again The hotel is on the riverwalk 2 blocks from the convention center and very conveniently located to restaurants shops clubs and the Alamo 
We found the the staff to be very attentive and helpful from the moment we stepped out of the cab There was only one minor issue with reservations when one member of our group came a day later and staff thought we had checked into that room already which we had not They resolved the problem very quickly
The entire hotel is beautiful and has an upscale yet comfortable relaxed atmosphere I met a friend across the street at the Westin which was also beautiful but had a much more formal feel to it Our room was on the 11th floor with a city view but we had a partial river view also It was very quiet something I was concerned about after having stayed in San Antonio about 5 yrs ago and my room at another hotel was very noisy from city activity
I would highly recommend this hotel for business or leisure travel If we find ourselves in San Antonio this will be our hotel of choice

title: Bang for the Buck
text: As seasoned travel agents my husband and I were looking for a simple inexpensive room to use as our central location to see various areas around Phoenix It was a wonderful experience for only about 53 per night  still within walking distance of hotels charging in excess of 200 Dan the ownermanager and his wife were gracious hosts helpful  accommodating in every way For example when we returned from a day out and couldnt get a space in the lot Dan moved his car to enable us to access a parking spot on hotel property Has any other hotel manager done that for you lately The breakfast though modest gave us a good send off each morning and the rooms were spotless Microwave refrigerator and wireless internet were added bonuses All in all we came away with a very positive feeling about this property especially in light of the economical rate Would definitely stay there again in the future Emily

title: Great Hotel
text:
On our recent trip to NYC we chose to stay at the Dream Downtown in Chelsea It is a fantastic hotel in a great location Easy access to the restaurants nightlife and shopping of Chelsea and the Meat Packing district right across from the Chelsea Market and also close to the West Village The hotel itself has a very cool vibe I mean where else can you sip on a cocktail in the lobby listening to great music and see up into the pool thanks to an acrylic bottom And the club up on the roof PhD has amazing views of the Empire State building and the Midtown skyline 
As for the rooms they are very nice and comfortable We had a room with a nice view similar to the view from PhD It was very chic and modern but very warm and comfortable at the same time 
Service is great Everyone was very friendly and not too cool for school Really my only complaint was it took too long to flag down a cocktail waitress on Saturday night Hopefully they work on increasing the wait staff because people were at least 3 deep at the bar

title: Good Value for NY
text: The Affinia Dumont is nothing flashy but provides a reasonable value and location for New York Downside lobby are is tiny no room service no wireless in guest rooms and the physical condition is getting a bit tired Positives reasonable room rates and good sized rooms small kitchen are is great for any exrended stay location is walkable to Broadway Time Square etc and close to the subway the noise level is good decent exercise facility and the attached restaurant is pretty good and much cheaper than most of the other NY hotels I have stayed in Overall I would stay there again if I were in town for multiple days and could make use of the kitchen

title: Clean great pool and friendly staff
text:
Stayed for 4 nights on a trip to a friends wedding 
Staff are very courteous and extremely helpful and accomodating Anything we needed we simply asked reception and it was done Cleaned our rooms everyday Aircon works really well all the time
Some great drinks deals in the onsite barrestaurant on certain days
Sure some of the decor is from the 90s but that is the vibe of the city 
Must do for memphis spend a night on Beale st approx 23 taxi from the hotel checking out the blues bars Also ride the tram during the day along the river and get off on second ave to take in the Architecture of the city
Dont forget to introduce yourself to the Captain of the Bell boys Zach he is famous in these parts and has many helpful suggestions if you want to see any sights or eat somewhere He was great for organising transport etc I nearly forgot to mention he is 90

title: A great hotel
text: We recently spent four nights in this lovely hotel The service is happy to see you wonderful The doorman and desk clerk were friendly and helpful Our room was clean and quiet One morning we ate in their small restaurant and the breakfast was teriffic I recommend this hotel without reservation

title: Very comfortable and family friendly
text: We stayed at this hotel just one night before departing at the San Antonio Airport early in the morning The 24 hour complimentary shuttle was a blessing we were able to turn in our rental car the night before and the shuttle picked us up before check in and took us back to the airport in the morning The room was spacious and comfortable with a small refrigerator and all standard features We were also traveling with an infant and toddler and had no problem accommodating the travel crib provided at no charge as well as the fold out sofa bed for the older child The only complaint was that the bathroom had an odor like it was stale or mildewed but after getting settled in our room it wasnt disturbing enough to request a room change We were on an upper floor but the first floor rooms balcony open up to the pool courtyard which would have been really cool in the summer

title: Doubletree Rocks
text: This is a newly renovated hotel that deserves a 10 for so awesome It is very elegant in the lobby I love the grounds and the decor is sophicated with earth tones throughout the building they have 8 or more ballrooms indoorout pool tennis courts gym Lovely friendly hotel staff great security because I personally saw him making his rounds and checking in with his scanner at his stops Great location resturants close by and shopping too The family loved the warm fresh cookies very moist Yum The rooms are very clean and mildew free in the bathroom new shower curtains and granite tops are beatiful The best is the beds Oh gosh they were so comfortable and plush with tons of pillows to sleep on I will definately stay here again and again when I visit the Detroit areas

title: Awesome Staff
text: There are two employees I want to thank for a great stayI am from South Dakota and come from a town of 13000 people so needless to say Houston is a little bigger than that I am clearly out of my element However Henry the front desk dude was awesome he greeted me by name every night I walked in and was very helpful with everything during my stay Plus the dude has a great sense of humor The night manager Rizwan was great as well He hooked me up with the room I wanted for my next stay plus was very personable and greeted me by name every time I saw him as well There has to be 200 guests there and these two gentlemen remembered methanks for a great stay I look forward to returning in a few weeks

title: SAhort stay one night
text: We are regular users of this hotel on our way to and from Europe Make good use of the free car parking and shuttle service

title: Great stay  will try many other Best Westerns
text: We Read no reviews choose hotel due to price pool  close to airport whot deluxe breakfast waffles yum We were very comfortable here Pool  jacuzzui very nice Sauna not so much never got hot All updated clean rooms As far as noise Heard only one plane not bad at all We were happy  will not hesitate to stay again

title: Great family hotel Best not to bring car
text: We stayed here for a family vacation and had a great time The hotel was clean and the staff was exceptionally accommodating The rooms were old but clean although the carpeting looked like it had seen better days Usually I prefer newer hotels but they kept it clean so it met my requirements The amenities were great the breakfasts were satisfying and the cheese and wine every night was an added bonus The 24 hour coffee and hot tea was another plus The location was fine for us We walked almost everywhere but we dont mind walking several miles for dinner or access to restaurants Our only complaint there is no parking and although they offer on weekdays to move your car every 3 hours its not ideal Our recommendation is to use public transportation or walk

title: Great Location Bad Smells
text: The Powell Hotel is situated in a great location with shops restaurants and the trolley literally a few steps away access to muni and bart is also nearby The lobby of the hotel is quite nice and conveys that this place is dignified and contemporary and yet also historical The customer service very cordial hard workers was excellent and the accomodations fair for the price we paid Unfortunately we did not have a great experience with our room The room 401 reeked of stale urine and the shower fixtures for hot and cold water were problematic I would return to the Powell Hotel but not stay in 401

title: Hotel and Residence
text: The Ritz is all about Service and it was up to Ritz standards DEcoration in Rooms awas Ok Hotel as one Restaurent and it was ok also Nothing greet but ok Breakfest was good

title: dont stay on the third floor
text:
The hotel is across the sfreet from a car repair service thats open 247 You can hear hammering in the middle of the night I was on the third floor facing 38th street It was memorial day weekend and the hotel was full or we would have asked for another room 
Other than that the room was clean and the employees were very pleasant

title: Ugh get me out of here
text:
I booked this hotel on Hotwire when it was still owned by Hyatt Somewhere between the booking and the stay Hyatt dumped it and Hotwire downgraded it but I didnt know that until I got there 
It was AWFUL Our first room had a GURGLING toilet and dead bugs in the bathtub They moved us and though that room was at least working there was absolutely NO privacy we could actually hear the entire conversations of the people in the room next to us And they even asked US to be quiet As they opened the dresser drawers it sounded like they were in our room VERY disturbing 
I called Hotwire after less than 9 hours in the hotel and asked for a refund and a new hotel I got both 
DONT waste your money here Its NOT good

title: Classic but Cramped
text: Stayed three nights related to the RIMS conference in Boston Location was good and had what you would expect from a historic hotel quality of furnishings TV and bedding you would expect from an Omni My main complaint was that room was very small and bath was tiny This was fine for one business traveler gone most of the day but would have been crowded with two people for a weekend Service was good and room service ordered came in a timely manner and was tasty

title: Valentines Day Getaway
text: The service is great The people are so friendly and the food awesome Spa was so relaxing We couldnt have chose a better place to get away

title: Iconic but is that good enough
text:
We stayed 5 days at the Waldorf and really had no cause for complant
The doorman the concierge the check staff are all what you would expect from such a renowned hotel
We stayed in a deluxe suite one bedroom one loung room  two ensuite bathrooms 
Which was a free upgrade from what we had booked
The rooms themselves where spacious  decorated in a manner befitting the period 
The bathrooms though old in style worked well so again no complaints
No free WIFi in the room and only congested ie unusable free WiFi in the lobby 
The hotel is huge so there is a lack of personal intimacy that is evident in smaller boutique hotels And there is a hefty price put on the extras ie phone calls mini bar meals WiFi
I get the impression that people are going to go there just because it is iconic Hence the hotel does not have to try to keep or attract new patrons Subsequently you can probably get better value for money elsewhere in Manhattan You are paying a price premium to stay at an icon However they did adjust our bill when we complained about a US50 New York to LA phone call so they are still geared toward customer satisfaction 
Would I recommend it
Yes just to say you have stayed in it But it is not that special to justify a prolonged stay
There are better cheaper lessiconic options available

title: Great Location
text: Very nice hotel in the heart of the action Within walking distance of great restaurants bars live music  the FedExForum We have stayed here twice  enjoyed both of them

title: A very nice quirky hotel in the old part of Philadelphia
text:
The Kimpton Hotel Palomar is in the centre of the city in an old district which has some lovely buildings including a very old Baptist church next door to the hotel The hotel is a well refurbished 1920s building given a modern funky interior decor with some of the wonderful original features retained such as the second floor lift lobby The staff are very helpful and informative which is just as well as the room was devoid of any guide to the hotel and its services There is a charge for the WiFi but if you logon and join the Kimpton In Touch program which is free the WiFi is free too I guess its a good way for the hotel to build its marketing data base
While the public area decor is funky eg art works such as a sculpture of little men abseiling down the wall of the lobby our room was slightly minimalist with a bed tabledesk and desk chair but no other chair and no teacoffee making facilities It did however have a minibar and you are given the key to this  this explained why the inside of the cabinet was quite dusty  the room maid does not have a key to the minibar cabinet
The evening winetastings which are free were quite popular with all the guests and a nice touch which we greatly appreciated The reception staff were very helpful in arranging a limousine hire for us as well as a river cruise and Talisa in particular was extremely helpful in assisting us to sort out some difficulties we were experiencing with our Westpac Bank by scanning and email our passports to the bank for us
A really cool place well situated and very nice One wed certainly recommend and would look forward to staying again ourselves

title: Good location for Chase Field and US Airways center
text: Sheraton Phoenix downtown is a great location spot if you are visiting an event at the Dbacks baseball field or US Airways center Suns basketball or convention center Seems to be a good safe location  did not see many police nor did we ever feel unsafe or worried about being out after dark This is irrelevant for some I suppose because I do carry a gun at all times so I never feel unsafe The good news is that AZ is open carry and concealed carry friendly for those of legal age and not licensed to carry elsewhere just note that the venues mentioned above are offlimits for guns Food choices are limited downtown but there are a few gems within walking distance if you dont mind the  price range restaurants There is a Subway Einstein bagles Starbucks and Hooters right there around the hotel We did not eat at the hotel restaurant which looked decent but pricey Access to freeway is convenient and a short hop in a car to neighboring areas 20min gets you any kind of food style you want Traffic does bunch up at rush hour though so plan ahead The hotel itself was a nice typical Sheraton very accomodating friendly staff with good condition bldg Underground selfparking was slightly pricey 17night but cheaper than east coast or west coast places and convenient The lot is open to public so it does fill up with nonhotel visitors and can force you to park a block and a half away in an overflow lot late at night Rooms are modern with nice HD tv setup and bathroom facilities We did have a slightly sagging bed in a dbl room which was reported There is only ONE water fountain in the hotel and its on pool deck AZ was 113F while we were there and I was shocked that such a place didnt have water fountains therefore rely solely on bottled water The pool was small but good for kids and family to cool off WiFi is ridiculously overpriced 1224hr period this is wrong WiFi should ALWAYS be free for registered guests If you want free wifi the lobby has a signal at no cost to guests but who wants to sit in the lobby and do computer work that should be free in your room Really Sheraton Come on The other odd thing about the hotel is that there are 2 elevator routes and only goes to the parking garage  the other goes to the floors in the high teens and 20s Inconvenient ridiculous design Not a bad place but just little quirks and of course my pet peeve which is to charge guests for internet access

title: Great Location
text: The views were fantastic and its location could not be better but our room could definitely use some updating carpet was worn out furniture outdated our lamp shade and the wall behind it had red stains Our shower head and the inroom safe were not functioning properly we politely asked the front desk to send someone to our room to fix it but that never happened We just ignored the issue for next 5 days since I feel I should only ask once and it gets annoying when your simple requests are being ignored I would give this hotel another chance because of its location but the response to service needs to improve

title: A Towering Absurdity
text:
First the nearly impenetrable crowds of Times Square tourists make entrance to this hotel an exhausting challenge If you were always hoping to see Times Square you should know that it has become little more than a gigantic outdoor mall  a Sunglass Hut here Gap across the street Olive Garden down on the corner But youve got the energy and the nerve hey this is NY and youve made it inside You wait with a dozen other guests now 15 now 21 for the elevators to your room or to the checkin desk which is on the eighth floor The wait is as much as 15 minutes since the computer system that controls the elevators tends to crash when it gets busy And its ALWAYS busy here  there were three conferences going on simultaneously when we were here and that was less than usual Youre grateful when John shows up in his red doublebreasted jacket to excort the now highly impatient crowd to the freight elevators  past the stacked chairs and dusty cases of hotel water bottles Johns nice enough everyones nice enough here and he says simply that this is what happens here when its busy Thats what the waitress said when she tried to deliver our breakfast 35 minutes late But dont worry theyll comp it when its late Theyre used to it Things here are ALWAYS late Now youre ready to check out You stand on the 33rd or 41st floor for 10 minutes 15 minutes as the crowd grows bags in tow waiting for an elevator to stop at your floor Slowly the awkward banter goes silent the humor is gone and someone goes to call from the nearby emergency phone Theyll send someone soon Theyre VERY nice  theyre used to it here The crowd grows On a floor above the alarm rings Uh oh Someones having a worse time than you But at last an elevator stops at the floor ten of the more ambitious of you squeeze on hope that alarm doesnt have to ring and soon youre downstairs thankful to have made it out alive Wait on the 50 person line for a cab No thanks well just walk up to Eighth Ave and hail one ourselves 
But the room was nice 
Good Luck

title: Chic Boutique Hotel in Great Location
text: Hotel Felix is a totally renovated hotel located in a wonderful neighbourhood Rooms are rather small as are bathrooms Lovely amenities and first class restaurant

title: great hotel great location
text:
Our stay here was totally unexpected We were in Boston for something else and having a great time window shopping in all the designer stores and while having a drink in the hotel bar a great place with a huge drinks menu and great food when we decided we didnt want to go home I asked about the rate and was told 329 When I asked if they could do any better I was immediately given a rate of 249 Our room was on the 25th floor and was a corner room We had amazing city views and two entire walls were windows My only issue with this hotel was with the tv of all things The cabinet holding it was in front of one of the windows and because of this I guess it was not very tall This made the tv at a weird low angle Even though it was a flat screen the picture was not very good And surprisingly there is no free tv Everything is pay per view and then not many choices I thought this was odd since I cant remember staying hotel that didnt offer free tv channels The bathroom was small but it was very clean and since it was only one night it was fine Our bed was a king size and was one of the most comfortable beds Ive ever slept in The pillows were great and normally I cant sleep on hotel pillows 
The location to everything cannot be beat at this hotel I will need to be in Boston again just before Christmas and am already planning another stay at this hotel to do a little shopping and check out the shops all decked out for the holidays

title: more history than luxury
text:
Certainly not a luxurious place and as far as I could see not even extensively renovated Still a list of things I like about this hotel could get lengthy Heres a few
Location location location Our room overlooked the grounds of the Alamo Walk to everywhere Nice big outdoor pool was wellkept Historic old bar complete with moosehead and Teddy Roosevelt atmosphere Beautiful little garden perfect for relaxing with a book Lobby areas decorated with period furniture and old photos note to the manager a few big old potted palms would really finish the look 
And every morning stepping off the elevator and hearing the 30s  40s music piped into the lobby areas Billie Holiday Stardust A small thing but a perfect little touch that made me smile every time
Unfortunately our room was in the new part of the hotel functional clean nondescript and not all that new either We would gladly stay here again but next time we will request a room in the old historic section

title: Ignore the naysayers
text:
We booked this quite a long while ago  but as I occasionally checked TripAdvisor I saw a fair number of negative comments and was concerned as to whether wed done the right thing
For sure we had  a great property  lovely spacious room  had a half price upgrade to Grand Club  and that was tremendous  lovely healthy breakfast  and the wonderful Club Terrace  an oasis of peace and calm in the madness of Manhattan
Used the Market most nights  very useful facility
Loved our visit to Grand Hyatt on 42nd St  a really central location  could walk everywhere

title: Not worth the price and watch your bill
text: At over 325 a night for the week I expected a pretty nice hotel I was embarassed at the conditions of the hallways to the rooms It made me feel a little uncomfortable re safe just walking the hall to the room Once in the room I couldnt believe how small the king room was And there was no view  even for the 19th floor There is a dresserworkdeskTV stand unit on one side the bed on the other and a chair between them that you had to turn sideways to get into The bathroom was so small you could almost use the toilet and shower at the same time Dont have high expectations when you stay at this hotel and youll do fine However watch the menu bar as they will charge you every day if you or the maid bumps the tray It automatically hits your bill whether you take anything or not Its supposed to allow you to pick up something and look at it for 20 seconds before billing you I didnt use the minibar at all and got charges everyday Anyway try to get a completed bill when you leave The clerk refused to give me one when I checked out and indeed they hit my CC for some more menubar charges after I left I wont be back at this hotel and will think twice about Doubletree since the clerk said it was corporate policy not to provide a completed bill If Doubletree cares the clerk was working 629 at 615AM and should be fired for his rudeness

title: Location service rooms hall
text:
I and my husband stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel in January 2012 For 5 nights and we had an excellent stay The hotel was beautiful the room was very good and service was very good The hall is outstanding We found out many movies were filmed in the hotel Location was excellent just a few blocks from Times Square and two blocks from Grand Central Station easy to go everywhere in NY
There is a computer where guests can check in their flights for free
There is a Starbucks Cafe in the hall for breakfast in the morning  in the evening it turns into a bar
There are lots of elevators 6 as far as I remember so guests dont waste time waiting for the elevator
I was so afraid about the small rooms size in new York after reading many reviews that I decided to book a superior room it was beautiful comfortable and good sized It was silent too
For sure we had an excellent time at the hotel

title: As usual tip top
