text: Stayed here for 9 days Coming back to the Peninsula after 3 years was as it has to be the welcome back greeting the service the summer special upgrade to an executive suite awsome bathroom with a view on Michigan avenue the environment and not to forget the service Special mention for reception and concierge who had always a listing ear and ready to make your stay as confortable as you wish So for me it was good to be back If you want a hotel without negative surprises with a stable level of very good quality of service do not hesitate Try out also the food from the Shanghai Terrace or The Lobby yes I skipped Avenues because I did not want to have dinner alone but I tried it out previously and it was good The Peninsula is may be not the cheapest around  but pricequality it suits me perfect

title: Very nice Conference site
text:
Returned this year for a conference in late August and this time was accompanied by my wife We had an excellent time here and she was able to keep more than busy with the pool the nearby mall and excellent internet access
She really liked the roses that lined all the walkways something that frankly I did not note last time but thats just typical
We had a great dinner at one of the resturants onsite and the location was perfect for meeting with friends who are spread out all over the San Diego area

title: Nice Place to Stay in Midtown
text: Business has brought me to Midtwon many times this year Ive stayed at several places but have come to rely on the Hilton Manhattan East Good location Clean rooms Nice bar And good prices

title: Enjoyed Indigo  bright botique room
text:
I called their 800 reservation line and they had a two queen room for 129 I wanted a King but the guy on the phone said none were available Checked out their website and was able to get a King nonsmoking for same price
I had a horrible flight A 45 minute hopper turned into a 4 hour mess with a unscheduled 2 hour stop in amarillo So by the time 11PM rolled around i was very happy to be in the hotel When I got the into the room I was very pleasantly surprised The room was bright Spring Iris backdropped the room It was small but had everything I needed Included tea for the Senseolike coffee machine Love the Aveno products too
Very clean very comfortable Will definitely stay again if I ever have business in Downtown Dallas
The shuttle driver was a bitrude But glad for the shuttle service

title: Modern hotel good location
text: Nice hotel very clean room of good size Bathroom also of good size No free internet connection but Starbucks downstairs has free internet connection so we went there for coffee and internet Convenient location down the road to where you can buy your tram tickets Staff friendly and helpful We left some clothes in the drawer and only realised this when we got to Alaska Room service found them and staff organised to have these posted to us right away

title: Good value for money
text: I have been using this place since the early 1970s I returned for the first time in about 20 years Oct 2009 I was afraid I would find that it had suffered maintenance wise since my first visit In the past it was only for Merchant Seamen but now is open to the public but seamen are able to use the rooms without bath for 45 per night a real bargain in Manhattan The staff are friendly the place is clean and the rooms without private bath are nice enough I never had trouble finding a clean toilet and shower across the hall The corner rooms have private baths and are still a bargain Rates Singles 70 to 100 Doubles 90 to 120 the higher prices are for private baths which should be reserved as early as possible Seamen can get good discount from these prices The place is quiet and respectable and since it was opened it has been strict about guest conduct since seamen while ashore have a bad reputation in that area There is a nice chapel on the ground floor and coffee and donuts on the mezzanine in the morning The neighborhood is nice and quiet but it is only two blocks to the subway on 14th street

title: Best deal if you Get a Good Deal
text: Stayed there with Parents  two rooms  two couples  When you talk about Manhattan  you have to expect to PAY between U 300 to US 450 for a Small room with NO Extra service  no  Breakfast  Internet  Parking  etc  BUT the Sofitel  wich is one and a half Block from Time Square  has one of the BEST ROOM in Town  all New  100 clean and one of the Best and Biggest Bathroom in Town  I got a very good Deal  US 260 plus 15 tax  anything till US 300 still a Very Good Deal  remember  we are in a Crazy Dollar Hotel City  Good place for Breakfast next door  and subway station  orange line  one block away  Excelent staff

title: Excellent service really good staff
text: I have to say that all of the staff we dealt with were very helpful and unusually for a NewYork hotle in my experience friendly The hotel is very well situated 5 min walk from Times Sq and close to a couple of Metros stations Our room was perfectly nice with a very comfy bed and clean nice decor Dont expect skyline views as it is not a tall hotel

title: Old and small
text: Bad beds old and small stairs Good service and good light breakfast We had no problems with noise it was quiet at the 4th floor But we had some bites maybe bed bugs Nice paintings and photographies Excellent location

title: Great for Business Meetings
text:
Im sharing this review mainly for others coming with business groups Our company was very pleased with the Renaissance I have high expectations for this brand and they definitely delivered giving our group a competitive rate and great service The staff went out of their way to make sure that everything was just perfect for our meeting rooms
Reception upon arrival was very welcoming and I had no complaint about the rooms We had dinner the first night in the hotel and our waitress was great She even remembered what kind of wine I had had the next night when we went down for drinks before going out to dinner
Breakfast buffet was reasonably good the first morning but nothing spectacular Got a coffee from the Starbucks in the hotel later on and the young lady serving was very nice
As you would expect from a Renaissance hotel the lobby ambiance was perfect and we just enjoyed sitting in the lobby and other common areas during breaks
Overall a great experience and we will be back

title: I lived to tell the tale
text: Well I didnt die so I guess it was a successful stay

title: Great location great fun great staff
text:
Theres a lot of choice in San Francisco not least determining the area in which to stay Having decided what the hell Im a tourist so dont be ashamed to do the touristy stuff I put my trust in the Tripadvisor reviews which rate this hotel so highly and was not disappointed in the slightest I booked the A Discovery Awaits package which included Valet Parking breakfast at the Blue Mermaid Chowder House and Cable CarBusTram passes I upgraded our room in advance to a King Bay View room on the grounds that several reviews complained the rooms were on the small size So I cant comment on the standard room  however I can highly recommend this kind of room although it is pricey Be aware that the view is partial and certainly not uninterrupted However the room is large spotlessly clean and full of quirky touches colours and furniture Staff were absolutely delightful made us feel so welcome and nothing was ever too much trouble Breakfast was fine  of course you can get better but it was included in our rate and was well cooked with friendly service Parking is expensive if not included in your rate The PowellHyde cable car turnaround really is close  in fact it was under our window less than a two minute walk from the front of the hotel
Im sure there are many excellent hotels in SF We took a chance with the Argonaut and it delivered on every level It was so refreshing to stay somewhere where you didnt feel the interior designers had borrowed the Holdiday Inn decor guide even the themed Vegas hotels can be formulaic in their layout and decor Some may find it a bit OTT  we thought it was cool and well be back

title: extremely neat hotel
text:
just returned from CA  spent two nights at the chancellor hotel in SF the location is absolutely perfect great shopping dining and a great base for exploring the entire city yes one of the elevators was out of service but we took this as an opportunity to chit chat with other guests while waiting for the functioning elevator our room was VERY clean staff extremely nice AND professional thanks monica for assisting me with my reservation and the nice frontdesk guy who made our checkin very smooth we arrived super late on thursday
mr manager  please dont yell at me but it really DID get very hot one night even thouth we had the window open and the fan on im aware that it is not your fault but the street artist with his saxophone did get a tiny bit annoying after a while  
does he prevent me from returning to the chancellor hotel not a chance

title: It was pretty good but some minor flaws
text:
Stayed at the OBrien during a weekend trip with my daughter It was very closely located to the riverwalk which was extremely nice The staff were very nice and incredibly helpful It was easy access on and of the highway and to major attractions The hot cocoa machine in the lobby was the best as was the breakfast
 Downsides were the room was so small with no closet or area for clothes was hard for to people to move around in No room in bathroom either the door abutted the tiolet and was hard to close The door lock to the balcony was extremely hard to shut had to pull up on the door to get it to lock Paid 1000 a day for parking Is that standard procedure Or did I get taken by the front desk guy 
 Over all it was a great place to stay wouldnt recommend it with children though because not big enough with them

title: Beware of Construction
text:
Upon arrival at 11 am room was available for check in 
Room was spacious Very clean Separate room with desk and couch was handy for working 
Bathroom well stocked with nice shampoos etc Shower head was circular and dropped a great water stream like a strong rain
Maids checked on room once during day and before bed as well with turndown of bed
Gordon Ramsey bar attached nice but expensive
Good location
Free fitness center that for NYC hotel was ok
Negatives
Working on exterior of hotel during day at times loud no mention at check in so scared me at first Thought it was an earthquake as the whole building shook 
479 a night
3 incorrect minibar charges on bill
Front desk slow on check out
View nothing special
Gordon Ramsey bar fill wine glasses like they are coffee cup at 15 a refill
Service in bar slow not real friendly

title: Nice hotel great location wonderful staff but incomplete rehab
text:
Weve stayed at this hotel many times over the years and really appreciate its convenient location and good value despite the fact that it was a bit dated and worn We were very encouraged to learn that the hotel had recently undergone an extensive renovation and this was our first time back in the new environs The updated decor is very smart and attractive however our mattress did not reflect the renovation as it was extremely saggy in the middle provided littletono support and did not make for a good nights sleep We had hoped that the increase in rates would be reflected by an overall increase in quality and would like to suggest that the owners invest in higher quality mattresses 
Otherwise we do appreciate the friendly and helpful staff and the convenient location

title: Stylish and Convenient
text:
I stayed at the Palmer House for two nights during the Chicago Marathon The hotel is huge and beautiful Here are the good and the bad
Good
1 Location  Great location You can walk anywhere you want to go and public transporation is nearby
2 Room  Our room was very large It was a room with two double beds
and we could have placed two rollaway beds in there and still had plenty of room to walk around
3 Beds  The beds were extremely comfortable They were the most comfortable beds Ive slept on in any hotel
4 Service  The concierge was very helpful with luggage answering questions and finding taxis if we needed them
Bad
1 No microwave or refrigerator I think some rooms had them but ours didnt
2 Phone  you had to pay for any call made
3 Internet service was not included It was available at a price
4 Other services such as the fitness center were only available at a
price
Overall it was a great stay

title: Not a great start
text: Just checked in and so far i would say it is the worst room i have ever stayed in The room spells like vomit and too much cleaning product to try and cover it The hotel is booked out with no available rooms to change to Hopefully after this repulsive night they will be able to change our room But so far i would not stay here again

title: Great base for looking around San Francisco
text:
Like many of the reviewers we found ourselves in the Beach Road property  does anyone actually get to stay in the main building and if so who are you
The walk from the main building wasnt too bad although we had just been traveling for about 12 hours and had loads of luggage The smell from Dennys in the lobby is not great but you kind of get used to it not enough to go and eat there Our room was on the third floor at the end of the corridor facing onto the street though this rarely caused a problem during our stay
The room was reasonably spacious and importantly clean The shower was good and the bed comfortable The internet access was wireless and free and that was important for us We were just minutes away from the whole fishermans wharf area and had good access to transport systems if we wanted it The hotel was just what we needed as a base for looking around San Francisco

title: Always a Gret place to stay
text: Once again my husband and I stayed at the Club Quarters in Boston MA for the weekend As always clean and very comfortable rooms in a quiet and great location in the city Close by to the waterfront and many tourist attractions There is a nice Pub on the property which serves great draft beers and good food  including breakfast as resonable prices But above all the front desk staff go the extra mile for their guests Always helpful freindly and will do what it takes to make every guest feel more than welcome Over the many years that we have stayed at this hotel we always look forward to seeing the staff Those include Michael Beverly and Jason  all wonderful that work there Will return soon

title: Nice hotel very clean and cozy
text: I stayed just one night and was very happy with the accomodations The room was small but adequate and wifi was great Quiet and cozy Close to several great restaurants including Serafina which has outstanding food at a moderate price The restaurant on site was fine for breakfast and cost was okay There were snacks in the lobby which was a nice touch I drove into Philly so I had to park my car around the block in a parking garage with a reduced rate hotel discounts the ticket when you check in No valet and no onstreet unloading in front of hotel I had to call the hotel while driving around the block to determine where the parking garage was located Check in was fast at kiosks if you prefer to waiting in line they set up like boarding pass kiosks in the airport Staff was pleasant and helpful If I go to Philadelphia again I will stay at this hotel

title: Very pleasant stay
text:
The hotel was built on 2010 and was very clean and had a wonderful atmosphere The staff was nice even when we asked to switch rooms because the flip lock on the door was broken The pool area was clean as was the entire hotel Rooms were tidy and well stocked though it seemed the ac kept resetting itself because it got warm Hot breakfast was wonderful too 
The location was minutes from a grocery Meijer and Target

title: Great Service and fine facilities
text: Was treated with respect did not have to wait more than 2 minutes Checkin was a pleasure and parking was easy The room that the conference was held had all of the latest ammenities The food in the hotel was excellence as was the service I would stay there again even on vacation

title: Handy and comfortable
text:
I booked direct with the hotel online and they were always happy to answer any questions beforehand via email from Australia when I was checking out different places to stay It was this promptness as well as price that sealed the deal for me to book There is one place in Beverly Hills that Im still yet to hear from after almost a year
Location  This is a great hotel if you want to be central to the Walk of Fame Chinese Theatre etc It is located in a dead end street that leads directly to the HH centre You will hear some traffic noise in the morning from trucks going to the HH to deliver loads etc but it wasnt too bad We had the room on the front floor directly facing the street and it didnt bother us You are a short walk to the train station to go to Universal and very close to the Magic club
The room  We had a one bedroom suite with one bathroom off the main There is a little kitchen off the dininglounge area It came with basic equipment needed for cooking and has a full ovenstove plus a microwave and fullsized fridge There is a futonstyle lounge that folds out to a bed but it is nowhere near big enough for two children to sleep comfortably so we had to pay extra for a fold up bed for our other child There was some noise from other guests coming and going as we were at the end of the stairs to the first floor but it doesnt last long as they were passing A big flat screen television and dvd player is also supplied in the lounge plus another tv in the bedroom Cable tv was included
The hotel  We took advantage of the free internet available at the public computers downstairs in the lobby There was a great rack of brochures to help with planning tours etc The reception was ready to help with booking transport to the airport and tickets to attractions Breakfast is supplied off the lobby and is basic Coffee juice donuts toast yoghurt etc The food often went quickly but the lady seemed to keep an eye on it and it wasnt long before it would be topped up Disposable platescupscutlery were supplied so we would take our food back to our room or eat at the tables outside There is no other place to eat the breakfast There is no laundry available at the hotel so you have to pay to send it out or look for a laundromat 
I would definitely stay here again

title: Thanksgiving Stay
text: Took the family up to view the Macys Thanksgiving Parade and decided to try this hotel out due to its location to the parade route Not bad The overall appearance was excellent and very clean Help was very friendly and attentive Reserved a 2 Queen room and asked about a better view other than the back of the hotel  was informed that the 32nd Ave view was reserved for single bed accommodations This hotel is located on Korea Way so if you are looking for good Korean food  you are staying in the right place Now the only downside I would say would have to be the size of the rooms Im guessing that from the end of the Queen bed to the front of the dresser would be no more than 3 feet a little tight to say the least and the beds would take up app 85 of the room With that being said if you are looking to stay at an affordable clean and comfortable room and dont plan on staying in your room for long periods of time other than sleeping  then this is an option that I would recommend

title: Unforgetable We will sure come back to this place
text: My husband and I went to the Georgetown Inn for a weekend get away we had a blast time just went fast so we need to come back again hotel is sooo clean the beds are very comfy and the food at the restaurant downstairs is to die for Love it Everything is on a walking distance Lovely place

title: Charming Cozy Hotel With Mediocre Service
text: My wife and I checked into Hotel Burnham on Thanksgiving Day We actually had a wonderful view from our 8th floor room of the parade on State Street First impressions were that the building was beautifully restored and a true landmark Beds were clean Great view and great location across the street from the main Marshall Fields and a block from Millenium Park The room was quite small but we didnt seem to mind The desk would be a joke if I had had to use it so Im not sure Id recommend this hotel for the business traveller The hotel emits charm and grace with simple touches like real keys and a minibar filled with fun creative alternatives to standard fare As for service it was sufficient but lackluster The bed had two lousy pillows and I requested two more Housekeeping left them on the floor outside my door Im a bit of a clean freak so that didnt fly with me but it is to be expected what do you think they do when youre not looking anyway The concierge made reservations at the Park Grill over in Millenium Park a nice stroll away from the hotel The restaurant was a bit of a disappointment good enough but in that strictly generic cheesecake factory sort of way Breakfast at Atwood Cafe was worthwhile Ill write off any lack of service to the holiday The hotel was an incredible value for Chicago and its location its charm and its clean comfortable rooms made for a memorable stay

title: Great location Excellent staff
text: I went for business The hotel is in the perfect location for business and shopping and dining Overall the best thing was the staff  very friendly remembered my name responded to requests quickly and changed my room when I didnt like the one I was in more about the view than anything else The hotel is due for a makeover  its not that its old its just a little lacking in style but I was told that would happen in the lowseason I liked how unpretentious it was and how friendly people were Bed was firm sheets were fine not excellent cotton but not terrible and the TV moved on the wall to adjust to my viewing needs Room was spacious I would go again  the price point is right on for the level of hotel  it felt like it was priced right in the middle to low end of the kind of hotel it is Only downside Too few elevators

title: The Price of Pampering has gone DOWN
text:
My wife and I stay here whenever we plan to travel from CLT Douglas Airport This hotel has terrific rates especially if you are a HHonors Member and takes excellent care of their guests
We were particularly drawn to this hotel as they offer a Park n Fly program as well as great rooms and very comfortable beds Room service is excellent and the staff are very courteous
Give them a trythe airline flight crews stay here too

title: Excellent service and facilities  I was wowed
text:
The LAX Westin was a very pleasant surprise Its not in the best part of city actually most of LA is not the best part of that city  but this property was an oasis in the middle of the bustle The staff from the valet to the front desk to the housekeeping teams and everyone in between was exceptional 
My only complaints were that this is NOT a part of town to walk around and get some air in but hopefully the businesses will help renovate the area My other is that the only restaurant  The Daily Grill  which has exceptional dinners offered a very overpriced and underwhelming breakfast menu No one should pay 20 a head for breakfast Other than that the Westin itself is a fantastic option for any business functions and has a great open bar and seating area for socializing and networking

title: Recommend the hotel to other people
text:
Last week we returned home 
We stayed in Four Season Hotel NY for 3 days 
We really enjoyed it 
The hotel was with plenty of space and not far from the subway
The rooms are spacious and with a lot of light
The hotel is of high standard
Clean facilities good Excellent for our purpose 
We simply enjoyed the stay and it was excellent positioned for our points of interest
The hotel was very good for the money paid Exactly what you need from a hotel 
We will go there again
In the future we will recommend the hotel to other people

title: Superb customer service great room fantastic bed  one of Time magazines places to stay
text:
I trawled for a long time on line to find a place in Chicago not knowing the area there were a lot of positive reviews for the Hotel Blake and the free wifi was the final clincher for me From the moment I checked in the experience the experience was fantastic
Ian  Katherine on the front desk did everything they could to make my stay as enjoyable as possible recommending great places to eat as well as things to do As a side note the architecture boat tour they recommended was amazingly informative and a great way to see the city
The room itself was bright airy great big windows and a fantastic view of the Stock Exchange  the Sears Willis Tower  a great desk to take advantage of the free wifi very reliable to seek out more about the windy city thats also how I found out Time magazine has this as one of its top 5 places in the city
My few grips were the wedding guests on the Saturday night were a little noisy but probably no worse than Ive been after a wedding and the hotel bar is only open till 9pm but theres a couple of nice bars in the neighbourhood that more than made up for that
With all the main CTA lines nearby and great customer service it made my first trip to Chicago a very memorable one

title: Loved staying in Soho and Hampton Inn was easy access to all of NYC
text: This was our first trip to NYC and we were warned to stay away from Times Square  too crazy especially at night Soho was perfect great shops restaurants and bars safe walking at night close to other great neighborhoods and the Hampton Inn is only steps away from the Canal Street subway station which leads you to anyplace else youll want to go in Manhattan The breakfast was generous and impressively healthy The staff were very friendly and helpful

title: Great location but
text:
First thing I will say is that the hotel has an amazing location for anyone who is travelling to NY and for that alone it is probably worth staying at the hotel but being honest there was little else that would make me stay there again
On arrival we checked in very easily and quickly and went to our room to get showered and get out and experience NY just a note but we carried our own bags through the main door and to our room without the offer of any assistance which was fine but I was a little surprised On our way to the room the corridors just felt small and a little claustrophobic and to be honest they were a little shabby at best the staff were cleaning and the cleaning trolleys and bags probably added to this but for the duration of our stay there were cleaning bags and supplies lying around at all times and it didnt look good We got to the room and were immediately disappointed with the size and cleanliness and it was freezing cold We turned up the air con and had showers but the room was still freezing and having checked the windows found one of them broken and the blinds and shutters in poor condition we decided that we were going to ask to be moved and to be fair they moved us without any trouble even taking into account we had showered and our first rrom would need to be done up again Our new room was as small as the first but we decided to make do and thats what we did but its not something you should have to do The bathroom was tiny I could put my left hand on one wall and my right hand on the other while trying to stand in the middle of it in order to open the door I needed to step back and have the toilet between my legs so the door would open and I could get out The shower was good and there was no problem with the hot water the pipes were extremely loud even when we werent using them The bed was very small too and the covers on the bed not great it was comfortable though The view from both of the rooms we were in was awful but that wasnt too big a concern
On previous visits to NY we have stayed in The Westin and The Sheraton Towers and while I accept that we paid more for both of these hotels they were much much nicer hotels and the rooms were far superior A proper bar in the hotel would have been nice too On the website there are two images for the Primary Lounge which makes it look really nice but the truth is the first image with 4 seats at the counter is all there is too it thats the size of the bar and it is located beside the check in desk and right beside the main enterance Its not really a lounge its more a counter beside the check in desk
We didnt have any food at the hotel and there was no room service available
Everyone says you dont spend time in your room when in NY and thats very true but I think I would prefer a little more comfort
As I get to the end of my review the next question is would I recommend the hotel and honestly Im not sure
Its location is great the customer service was very good but we were disappointed on arrival with the rooms and the general cleanliness
I guess I would recommend it but only for its location and I would warn about the roomsize

title: Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego is not set up to handle small events
text:
Being this hotel is one of the few Grand Hyatts in the United States I expected top notch service from the time the contract was signed until we left the hotel after the event I did receive great service from the staff on site however the planning and implementation of the event could have gone a lot smoother
The areas of note are below
1 Beginning two weeks prior to the event I requested the BEO 23 times via email and phone call from our Senior Catering Manager and finally received it days before the event after reaching his assistant
2 The AV order was finalized only 2 days before the event because I couldnt reach the AV department and the Senior Catering Manager on our account didnt take initiative to coordinate the basic AV needs for us
3 When arriving the room was setup incorrectly  nothing close to what was indicated on the BEO 
4 I emailed our final guarantee 3 days prior to the event and my contact confirmed receipt  however failed to communicate that to the banquet team because upon arrival the room was set for 3x as many people 
5 We were the only group in house with the exception of a large convention on the other side of the hotel  however our room placement was in the far corner of the ballroom so our attendees had to walk to the end of the ballroom to find us 
6 Our registration desk and meeting room entrance was located right next to where PSAV enters their offices There was no concern on their end to not allow the door to slam nor did they consider turning down their radios when nearing our room PSAV reps entered and exited the door allowing it to slam each time approximately 30 times throughout the day  this was very disruptive to our event because you could hear their commotion over the presenter
7 The meeting concierge validated our parking for the day  but failed to mention that the validation we received was good for only 3 hours Since wed parked on property longer than the maximum allowable time we had to pay the full valet rate of 38  meaning the 3 hour validation became null 
I have been a meeting planner for over 15 years and have not been this disappointed with a venue ever I do not plan to return to this facility and will probably steer clear of Grand Hyatts all together With a little more organization and planning on the hotels side these things could have been avoided

title: a great place close to action unique for the right price
text:
The Clift is a treasure of San Franciscos past We had a great price for only 175 and it was worth it at that price The rooms are small especially the bathrooms The room was spotless
clean and the linens so refreshing compared to other hotels
White linens We stayed on the inside part of the hotel so there was no noise The lobbybar area is happening at night and seems to be a under 40 group Our rate of 175 included breakfast which was so fresh and the atmosphere was wonderful No ice machines you must ask it by room service
Check their website and maybe you can get a great deal
I would not pay 300 for the experience Have fun and enjoy SF

title: Acceptable stay again
text: We stayed here again for one night to attend the NY International Gift Show The checkin staff were friendly and efficient Our room 1140 North Tower was large and clean The furnishings were a little worn but acceptable The airconditioner worked better this time We had to ask the front desk to turn off the message light on the phoneI couldnt get it off I also asked them to repair the deadbolt while we went to dinner but this repair wasnt accomplished during our stay The concierge wasnt very helpful in finding a restaurantwe were told just to walk down 9th Ave But overall the hotel is a great findboth for value and location

title: Surprisingly Nice and very nice BED
text: I havent stayed at a Howard Johnson in a long time but enjoyed this stay very much The room was very clean and the front desk was excellent The king size bed was very comfortable and a dream to sleep on

title: The only place to stay
text: I absolutely love it here This is the only place to stay in Boston Its like my home away from home comforable independant feel friendly staff personable not reading from scripts and FREE breakfast Why stay anywhere else

title: Not Impressed
text: Expected more from the description Hotel needs to be updated Telephone did not work and staff seemed uninterested in alleviating the problem Shuttle runs on a tight schedule unlike what is described in the Hotel directory Hallways smelled of decaying carpets Could hear the neighbors conversation at 400 am through the vent in the bathroom But the rooms were kept very clean and there is a great view of Lake Michigan

title: Incredible historical hotel
text: We had made a reservation for this hotel 2 mos in advance for our anniversary and the person making the reservation stated that we would have an instant upgrade due to our anniversary Upon arriving we found out that it ws never put into the computer system that way and they had no more upgrades for us It turned out good because they brought us a refrig to our room Disregrding all that we had a very nice stay Very helpful and accomodating We really enjoyed our stay although we didnt eat at the restaurant due to other previous plans they look gorgious and beautiful They sent us a letter apologizing about the mistake and that we would have a free upgrade to use within a year We will be going bak and staying there This hotel is centrally located and we could walk to anywhere we wanted Gray line picked up in front of hotel so we could take all the tours Lots of ammenities and YES we will stay there again

title: Great location and elegant hotel in New York City
text: This beautiful hotel has been restored to perfection The rooms are comfortable but the best thing about this hotel is its location Very close to Grand Central near the park and the subway so that getting anywhere in the city becomes accessible easily The room rates are not exorbitant which is unusual in NYC when the hotel is in a great location

title: Excellent business hotel the best staff team I have ever encountered
text:
I have spent much of the last 3 months at the Hilton Garden Inn It is well laid out clean and quiet and as a business traveller it has more than I would normally expect But without doubt the staff shine their close knit teamwork results in the highest levels of service to their guests
Rooms  I have stayed in the normal rooms and the suites Both types are spacious clean and comfortable and have all the amenities I require The suites are divided into two areas sleeping  lounge separated by the bathroom They have two flat screen TVs settee armchair coffee table work desk free internet wifi  wire table lamp ergonomic chair very few hotels have these and it really helps when youre working There is also a microwave coffee machine fridge iron and ironing board The beds have a facility to change the softness levels of the mattress and a duvet The bathrooms are spacious with a full size mirror good water pressure and plenty of towels 
You can request a room exercise kit if you dont want to go to the gym and an exercise video A great idea I keep promising myself that Ill get around to asking for one one day The swimming pool is out the front of the hotel it is a good size and has a jacuzzi It overlooks the carpark but youre not in a resort so it does very nicely for what it is It is clean well maintained and there are plenty of sunbeds and umbrellas
The hotel is set back from the freeway but very little noise can be heard Mostly guests are individual business travellers and many are regulars or here on longer stays so its relatively quiet 
Breakfast is a buffet with a really good choice and excellent value for money 3 or 4 types of milk including Soya to put on your choice of a dozen different cereals half a dozen different fruits always a large bowl of strawberries a good selection of yoghurts oatmeal pastries bagels 6 varieties croissants plus a cooked breakfast buffet with bacon eggs hash browns omlettes waffles etc Free newspapers at breakfast 
Room Service  good choice good quality and good value for money 
Lounge in Reception  nicely laid out feels homely even though youre just off the lobby Comfortable to sit and work if youre here on weekends Plus there is complimentary teacoffee available all day
There is a small shop selling all those things that you might have forgot or if youre on a longer stay run out of such as hairspray toothpaste etc Also has wine salads microwave meals if you want to cook your own cold drinks etc
Hotel bus  a real plus The hotel run a free shuttle bus service to anywhere within a 5 mile radius They take bookings for office runs in the morning when it is busiest so saves messing with hire cars and taxis To come back to the hotel at the end of the day you either book a time in advance or just ring up when youre ready to be collected Its like having a personal chauffeur They will drop  collect you at restaurants shops Memorial Mall wherever within the radius 
Staff  you can stay in the best hotel in the world but if the staff are haphazard or surly then your stay is marred or even ruined Ive travelled all over the world and in an average year spend 150180 nights in hotels I can honestly say that this hotel has one of the best staff teams Ive ever encountered I wont name them all because Im bound to miss someone but when you have Nancy or LaLa starting to worry about whether youve returned to the hotel at your regular time or when the breakfast team give you a hug then you know that the team really do care They all take a great pride in their work in looking after their guests and they really do work as a team Hilton  take note your other properties could learn a thing or two from this team
Downsides  of course there are some
 Air conditioning units can be a bit noisy and draughty They are next to the bed but if they were at the other end of the room it would be better
 Makeup mirror  would be good to have a magnifying mirror but its not a big deal
 Room safe  plenty of space to put one so would be good to have
 Inroom coffee facilities are good for coffee  but not good for tea Tea needs boiling water and it shouldnt be put through a coffee machine because it taints the taste you can tell Im from the UK An inroom kettle would be great And Im sure if I had ever bothered to ask for one it would have been immediately forthcoming

title: Nice hotel perfect location
text:
We arrived in the hotel and were helped by a very friendly intern Kathleen She gave us room 657 A fairly large room with a cosy bathroom Both of them clean Everything you need is there The only thing we didnt have was a view room was located on the inside of the building This room was quiet during the night no street or other guest noises The hotel has a retro feeling with thick carpets and old fashioned wallpaper
The pool is located in the middle of the hotel and has sun during the afternoon Ideal for a quick swim to freshen up
The hotels location is perfect next to Union Square two blocks away from the Cablecar turnpoint lots of restaurants and shops HopOn  HopOff buses stop nearly in front
Overall we had a nice stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone
Only drawback is no free wireless internet but there are Starbucks and McDonalds which do have it closeby

title: Noisy and not a good nights rest
text: We planned to use this hotel as a midnight 3 am east coast time to early morning departure and figured it couldnt be that bad as other Motel 6 nights have been fine Not so As stated in other reports the hotel employee was behind glass when we checked in after a late flight at 1130 pm I cant hold that against them but there were problems with the room  specifically the door would not close without a lot of effort resulting in a loud noise for my west coast daughter who was still sleeping when we woke up Also the outlets in the bathroom did not work at all limiting use of hair dryers and normal needs for charging cell phones laptops etc But the worst was a local train that passed frequently during the night using sustained loud enough to wake us all horn blast as it passed by the highway intersection I would not recommend this hotel as there are other Phoenix low cost hotels that would likely be a better choice

title: Your one place to stay in San Fran Great service great views
text: We were looking for a place to stay where we had the option to cook in to be able to have a short walk to many attractions and had great views of the city This is it We absolutely loved this place Short walk to the waterfront Ghidadellis next door and cable cars right at your door But the best was the unique deck on the roof  super views and a great place for coffee in the morning and drinks at night Staff was kind service was super  they are always looking for ways to make your stay enjoyable You can trust the Suites to make your visit the best ever  we wont hesitate to come back here again

title: Wellington Hotel  Close to most things
text: The hotel is very well located on 7th Ave between 55th and 56th Street Just some bocks away from Times Square Central Park Apple Store and all the other shops as Abercrombie  Fitch etc on 5th Ave The room we had was small but had windows in two directions and we could even see Central Park from our room A bit old fashion style but functional if you dont intend to stay at the room during the visit

title: Pretty typical highend Hilton property
text:
Geez with over 1000 reviews I dont know what I can add How about some practical stuff
My room seemed large Although the actual room itself was average theres a huge bathroom and entryway that make it seem really big Everything was clean and you get a lot of extras such as robes and slippers to use while youre there Bath includes tub and separate shower with WC in its own well closet The heavy door to it closes automatically and its kind of claustrophobic in there I had to ask for a doorstop to use while I was there to prop it open I used the wired internet and it was plenty fast and free TV was the best Ive ever seen in a hotelHD on virtually every channel and TV was properly set for widescreen reception Everything worked fine and was comfortable and luxurious 
They brought a USA Today to my room on weekdays but on weekends I discovered I could ask at the desk or bellstand and get a free Chicago paper even on Sunday Love that 
On the downside like others I found it a little irritating to take one elevator up five floors then have to completely cross the lobby to get to the room elevators Ive seen this arrangement before but never with the elevator banks so far apart Also lobbies and hallways were COLD
Eating Directly across from the front desk are double doors to a corridor connecting to the mall below Take the elevator at the end of the corridor down one floor and theres a big food court with plenty of cheap food If you proceed down through this mall you can come out on Michigan Ave However if you exit the Rush St side youll have to circle around the hotel and then go up a bunch of stairs to get onto Michigan Ave Next door to the hotel is a Bucca di Beppo across the street is a Cosi There are lots of other things in the neighborhood One night I went about two blocks north and one block west and had a good meal at M Burger I think it was As you can tell Im all about cheap informal food 
Transit two blocks west down Grand is the Red Line your key to Chicago You can also catch all the buses on Michigan Avenue 
All in all it was a good experience and a good hotel It was well worth the discount price I got for it on Priceline

title: All the comforts of home
text: To have a Trader Joes around the corner from your hotel knowing that a frig and microwave await you in your room makes the stay so much more relaxing You can either snack in your room or walk across the street for a decent pizza at Pizzeria UnoDuo Michigan Ave just three blocks away and the trains just four blocks away makes the location ideal Staff is accomodating front desk pleasant and helpful rooms absolutely spotless Easy and efficient climate control in rooms Did not try restaurant  did get busy in evening  so cant be all bad Internet service spotty and unreliable  probably because of traffic

title: Clean and Warm
text: I would have to agree with the other reviews about this hotel We stayed here because we just couldnt pass up the price since all we would be doing was sleeping there The rooms are clean and warm Just your basics though do not expect anymore than that We had a clean bed with cable television a dresser closet nightstand and a refrigerator The staff was extremley friendly and very helpful I never once had a problem with people using the bathroom when I needed it It was also cleaned every morning Its not a gorgeous hotel but it works for the budget minded traveler I will stay here again on our next trip to NY

title: Some positives and negatives
text:
I stayed at Park Plaza during a conference for a week A few things you should know before you bookThe location is right in the middle of everything so getting on the T subway and walking is the best way to get around We rented a car which turned out to be a big mistake Theres no self parking at the hotel and valet is 46 a day There are several nearby public parking garages but you need to park a few blocks away or find a spot on the street Expect to spend about 4050 a day on parking and just finding a space may be a headache and a half
Second thingthe hotel is historic and may not be as new and shiny as some others The lobby is dark but looks clean and updated Going to the rooms its clear that the building is quite old There was paint chipping off the walls in the bathroom and a few rust spots The bathroom is so small I had to straddle the toilet to dry and curl my hair Not ideal for women who like to do a little fixing up The rooms are quite small and average We had one big problem with our room overallit was very stuffy and warm The air conditioner wasnt blowing out much air We told the front desk who promptly had someone come up to fix it The air blew out fine and cooled off the room for a few hours before it stopped and got warm again They gave us a box fan which had to be on for a comfortable nights sleep Thats not quite what I expected for 250 a night 
Nextgood location for a conference The rooms are spacious with plenty of comfortable seating for those long days Coffee and snacks were available at all times with a good selection Finallytake advantage of the concierge desk If youve never been to Boston the people there are very friendly and can fill you in on a variety of things to do there We went to a Patriots preseason game Cape Cod and a Red Sox game Theres lots of fun to be had in the area but dont expect it to be cheap As far as where to eat theres plenty of restaurants within walking distance but dont expect a McDonalds or Burger King Mostly sit down restaurants There is a Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks about 2 blocks away

title: IGNORE THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS
text:
After reading some of the negatives on this board I was a little concerned about my win on Priceline
Check went very smoothly  we did have to return but was very quick
Room was extra large  by NYC standards
View of Chrysler Building from the 36th floor was a great view Would have preferred a Times Square view but hey I got this room on Priceline and wouldnt expect the best room to be allotted
A nice touch was when we returned at midnight and there was a security guy checking room keys  made us feel very secure
I will definitely book the Millenium for my next trip Very centrally located steps away from Times Square

title: Great place to stay in San Fran
text:
We picked this hotel because we wanted something nice but didnt want to pay an arm and a leg for it Although the rooms are on the smaller side think Europe if youve ever been but they were clean and nicely decorated
The location of the hotel couldnt be better Its right on Union Square with plenty of restaurants bars and shops within walking distance There is also a cable car stop right out front that goes directly to Fishermans Warf
We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel

title: Great Location
text: Great location for all the activities in Olde Town We got a super deal on priceline and got a room on the priority club floor  not sure of the difference but the room appeared to be recently renovated Bathroom was small but just fine for an average person The roof top pool was small but good enough for the kids to have some play time and there were plenty of towels Restaurant was good for breakfast especially with kids eat free coupons but there are numerous dining options within easy walking distance of the hotel Front desk was friendly but did not go out of their way to do anything extra for guests Check out the Independence Visitor Information Desk for all the great deals  we got an Amex 2 for 1on lights of liberty which the whole family enjoyed and a 2 for 1 lunch at the City Tavern We stayed 3 days could have probably used one more for all the historical things to do Overall hotel is just above average

title: Good tourist choice
text: Good location and walkable to most tourist sites Rooms were fine  nothing special Staff were good Reasonable rates in washington make it worth a recommendation Good breakfasts across the road and 2 blocks south

title: Great resort If youre white
text:
We recently stayed at the Legacy Golf Resort for a week It was going well until we started using their fitness facility I was basicallly booted out of the fitness center because I was not white I felt like a black man in a KKK meeting
I thought racism has died down since the 70s apparently I am dead wrong Racism and prejudice is still very much alive in this country and in particular Arizona
I wouldnt recommend staying at this resort unless you are white

title: GOOD PLACE for the Price
text: The rooms are small but clean need towel bars and or hooks Location is great subway is 3 min away and plenty of stores and restaurants to meet your needs We stayed for 4 days and will stay again on our next trip to the city Very safe neighborhood even late at night This is a good deal for the price if your going to lay your head down and sleep at the end of the day

title: Compared to other reviews I was disappointed
text: We stayed at the 6th Avenue Inn and based on the other reviews I was expecting a bit more The price was right for downtown Seattle although Ive seen several people say you can use one of the discount hotel finding sites and get a comparable rate for a nicer place Our room was clean enough although our windows needed a thorough cleaningreplacement and on one it looked like someone had spit on it The bathroom was small and we thought it was cleaner than the room actually Beds were comfy enough We didnt experience much road noise there was one group that came back around 1am or 2am that was noisy but not much you can do about that Overall it felt like an old property in need of some TLC felt old to me not quaint I thought there was a bit of an odd odor to the entire place but my wife and daughter seemed okay with everything The location worked out great for us within walking distance of the theatre shopping and the Seattle Aquarium all things we did There was a Starbucks a couple of blocks away that we hit for breakfast We were able to keep our car parked there all day the next day while we explored Seattle with no problems The staff was helpful and provided us a map right away A lot of people were at the breakfast at the restaurant A small exercise room my son and I used a bit outdated The plus sides  you save money theres parking available close to lots of activities The minuses outweigh the pluses for me next time I visit Seattle Ill try somewhere else this was a one time experience for me I must have missed what a lot of others seem to enjoy about this place

title: Loved this hotel
text: It was a pleasure to stay here The location is great walked everywhereinner harbor Camden Yards Rooms are great except that bathroom sink area very small Would stay again

title: Quality hotel in the heart of Boston
text:
This was our second hotel on our recent fly drive to New York City and New England
We only stayed here 2 nights but this was a stunning hotel
The service and friendliness of the staff was first class we had problem with the aircon in the room after contacting reception an engineer was sent up to our room within 5 minutes who sorted out the problem straight away The hotel bar was very popular and therefore always busy but we found a table for a drink on one occasion
The breakfasts in the hotel although pricey were delicous and with the usual friendly staff
 Boston is a great city to get around on foot the freedom Trail is so easy to follow  just follow the red line on the pavement the hotel is well located so even though we only had 1 full day it was possible to get a good look around most things Quincys Market is not to be missed with every type of food available
We loved Boston and would love to go back for another look

title: Would Never Stay There Again
text: After calling days before our arrival to verify that we would indeed have a room with two twin beds we were told upon arrival that all they had was a room with one king bed but after some delay they said that they would send up a rollaway bed The rollaway was so saggy in the middle that sleep was next to impossible and the king bed was not much better The room temperature was extremely cold but we were told that the thermostat was central to the entire hotel and they could not adjust it for one room That was the first night It was late so we went to bed The next morning after complaining again about the temperature they reluctantly said that they could possible bring a portable heater to the room This should have been suggested on the first night The 24 hour coffee was nonexistent since the machine was broken We never saw the sunny reading room that was advertised On our last day we went to the complimentary breakfast to find one bagel left no milk for the coffee and no one around to help us I would never stay here again and would be reluctant to stay at any of their sister properties

title: The worst Hilton I have ever stayed in
text: Im writing this as Im in this muggy damp stinky room As soon as I opened the door I could smell mildew and humidity Its a shame for a hotel under the Hilton name I was waiting for my daughter to arrive from her trip and didnt want to make a fuss but when I tried to log in for wifi they had the audacity to charge 999 as if they were some type of luxury hotel I will never ever recommend this hotel To top it all we had to call for someone to stop the toilet from making gurgling sounds disgusting

title: Great Place to Stay
text: This hotel is a great place to stay it close to the Riverwalk the Alamodome the Alamo The rooms are very spacious and furnished with oak furniture the beds comfortable the free breakfast was good and the staff is great We tried to book on line and were unable it said the hotel was full but with one quick phone call to the hotel and a room change they were able to give us a room we were unwaware of springbreak The free parking and free wifi were an added bonus Thanks for making our stay a great one

title: Good Option
text: I had a short stay here recently on business I would recommend The rooms was a good size and decently appointed considering the price I slept well The staff at checkin were friendly and professional Breakfast was very good with a nice omelette and fresh orange juice

title: Worst Customer Service on the PLANET
text:
First let me say that the staff is unprofessional at best The security guy wore an old dirty tshirt and layed around in the lobby watching TV during my entire 4 night stay Houskeeping came to clean my room and somehow took the remote with them When I asked for a replacement remote after working 14 hours and wanting nothing more than to lay in bed and be lazy I was told that there were no extra ones and I could use the buttons on the TV to change the volume and channel I asked the young lady at the desk to simply move me to another room with a remote since they refused my suggestion of taking a remote from an unbooked room She advised me to come down and get a new key She assigned a new room but just as I was about to move to the new room the security guy came and in front of me reprimanded her for moving me to a room they may be able to sell simply because I dont have a remote He then grabbed an old bag of beat up remotes and tried to get them to work Once he realized they werent working he reluctantly gave me the one from his roomwhere I believe he LIVES 
To make matters worse I was charged twice for the stay and have had nothing but issues with trying to get the money back from them Two weeks have passed and the manager Phyllis Ward has avoided me like the plague I even have my booking agent calling to resolve this and she is avoiding them too They even refused to send me a receipt showing the additional charge they made to my account 
I will NEVER stay at that hotel again and I will NEVER recommend it to anyone The room was nice but the exterior was frightening The staff was unprofessional and they wouldnt even give me a toothbrush after I inadvertently left mine at home

title: Lap of luxury in DC
text: This was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas the room had every amenity we needed including slippers and the staff were super friendly The location just a block away from the White House could not have been more convenient for getting around on foot I loved the 24 hour coffeetea service and the great fitness room We had a delicious breakfast in the dining room which was so filling that we didnt need any lunch later in the day Breakfast started with a shot glass of a berry smoothie and a basket of warm bread which included chocolate croissants We felt very pampered from the moment we arrived

title: Excellent stop near the airport
text: We stayed one night at the hotel after a late arrival from the East Coast Hotel is not new but well maintained and staff welcoming and professional There is now a regular hotel shuttle from the airport that replaces the taxi service mentioned by some The room was clean and comfortable and the hotel quiet Breakfast was very good for an included hotel breakfast Walking distance to a convenience store and 24 hr restaurant Would certainly stay again under the same circumstances

title: Average Hotel Great Location Great Price
text: An older well kept property with a good buffet breakfast that includes home made waffles and sausage The hotel doesnt have an elevator so if you are on the second floor you wil have to lug your suticase and stuff up a flight of stairs Each room has a nice balcony that faces inward towards the swimmng pool The staff is wonderful and very very helpful On the negative side my wife found two dead cockroaches in the drawers and the ACheater had an interesting constant whine Otherwise the property was clean and well maintained with the exception of the cockroaches and ACheater The most positive things were the wonderful staff and the priceI am sure that many travellers may want look at this property

title: scary
text: My friend and I booked the hotel online through CitlyBase when we got there we were scared The place was being renovated and there were sand bags in the front entrance We booked a double bed but the man at the desk kindly told us we could have 2 twins which we accepted The room was awful there were hairs in the bed and our bathroom had no toilet paper and no towels you wouldnt want to step foot in there with fear that you would get a fungal infection and Im not exaggerating We were nervous about asking for reimbursement there was NO way we were staying there We told the guy at the front desk that our room was unsatisfactory he got the maid to clean it and to change the sheets we still hadnt planned on staying we phoned CityBase from the payphone and they told me it was okay not to stay there and refunded my money hopefully by the end of the month my VISA will be reimbursed We went down the street to the Howard Johnson and got a king size bed and a NICE bathroom for 10 more a night my advice is definitly stick with the chains the picture they show of the room online of the New York Inn is deceiving two young women definitly did not feel safe there

title: Lovely service excellent location comfortable rooms
text: I stayed here for one night with my fiance and a friend on a week long road trip around the east coast by far the most relaxing place I stayed Hotel staff was friendly pleasant and attentive We also had a dog on the trip the staff was extremely warm with our dog as well anyone with pets realizes that dogs are not always welcome at hotels The location was beautiful A block from the harbor this is one of the best locations There is also a 24 hour subway restaurant next door that was convenient when the rest of Baltimore is closed down The evening reception in the Cloud lounge was wonderful as was breakfast All in all I wouldnt really think of staying anywhere else in Baltimore Excellent stay The only reason service got a 4 instead of 5 was because the valet parking was slightly backed up when we arrived and the traffic from the street was difficult to deal with when we were not even pulled into the garage yet only took 510 minutes and we were set up

title: Pretty Good
text:
Our visit here with 2 small children started off being dumped on the curb by the cab with a vomiting child nowhere near the main entrance  Bad start but not the hotels fault Cab driver claimed he could not find main entrance however told my parents the same thing when they arrived  
The front desk service was exceptional We were offered a free bar fridge as we had little ones and were very sympathetic with our sick little girl Although it was early in the morning they changed our room to one that was availble there and then We were very impressed Small but clean rooms with pretty impressive viewsWe also found a laundry however it was at least half hours walk But it came in handy 
nfortunately the good service stopped at the front desk While the bell man was awesome the doorman service to get a cab was disgustuing and we were not happy We were ignored told to go out on the street to get a cab and then sent back to doorman who again ignored our request there were taxis lined up he just needed to blow his whistle the lovely bellman finally called one for us however we were late for our tour
The hotel is in times square literally and has a real buzz to it A couple of nights would have been enough though as we should have stayed more central to other attractions within walking distance Dont get me wrong plenty around in times square but 2 days would have been enough for us It is a major toursit attraction and tourists are all you will see  
This is the main reason why we would stay elseware on our next visit to new york ie in the west village or similar Much easier to get cabs wasnt touristy and locals were much friendlier New York is not and easy place to get around if you are relying on cabs which we did because of the kids in my opinion it was the worst place we could have stayed for us
It is a real touristy area and they just dont like tourists as a result we dropped our heads and didnt see half of what we wanted to  
Overall pretty good place to stay for a couple of nights to see times square and surrounds But wouldnt base myself there

title: What a way to begin our trip to Texas
text: We LOVED it It set the tone for our first trip to Texas With its fabulous lobby and bar the terrific terrace cafe had lunch  excellent food and service and breakfast  horrible service but good food Rooms with ultrahigh ceilings marble bathrooms sumptuous bed unique appointments in the hallwaysit was SO big a great start to our trip It says its on Brazos stand was right on the corner of 6th  which right in the HEART of all the 6th street action As busy as 6th waswe did not hear anything at all in our room as we had a very peaceful nights sleep It is also very centrally located for any sightseeing you might want  north to the Bob Bullack Museum and the Capitol and South to the Bridge to see the BatsA SIGHT to be seen

title: Clean comfortable room with very friendly and helpful staff
text: We arrived to a very friendly and helpful staff Everyone that we dealt with the entire weekend had smiles on their faces and were very eager to help The room was clean and tidy It was an average sized room for NYC  not tiny but not huge However it had two queen sized beds which were extremely comfortable and afforded a wonderful nights sleep The bathroom was also clean and appointed as I would expect for this level of a hotel All in all it was a very enjoyable and easy stay I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay near midtown but not in the middle of the hustle and bustle Being located in the flower district it was really neat to see all the flower vendors on the street and added a little something extra to the experience This location was also convenient to Chelsea and the restaurants and nightlife nearby

title: Very nice staff
text: we have just returned from a week at the wellington our room was very small carpet and furniture had seen better days first night there i found a bug in my bed was about 2 ins long husband complained we were moved 2 another room it was beautiful huge with a kitchen bathroom and balcony with lovely views of the city we had a wonderful time the staff are very friendly

title: Great if you are Frank Sin
text:
Travelled with two friends so we decided to take a so called suite that turned out to be a bed room with an adjoining living room that had a sofa bed in it I was the unlucky one to sleep on the uncomfortable sofa bed The windows were very thin and the curtains were even thinner so I heard and saw the sights and sounds of the noisiest island on earth every night Great if you are Frank Sinatra looking for inspiration to write a new song
Breakfast was the typical industrial bland version of egg powderturnomlette and sicklysweetorange juice The breakfast staff casually threw cuttlery and plates around making so much noise it would have been impossible to eat had the food been edible  luckily it wasnt so problem solved

title: a really great experience
text:
Theres a lot of positive things about this place
 First is location  its extremely convenient to the airport and most of the attractions as well There is also a Trader Joes and Vons within less than a half mile  almost walking distance The location on the esplanade park and walkway is wonderful with bayfrontestuary views and a huge walkingbiking pathway right outside the door and a huge park there too Its in a quiet safe neighborhood with the only sound disturbances being the planes taking off because of the proximity to the airport 
 The rooms have a nice almost full kitchen  full size fridge dishwasher microwave 2 burner range and no oven There is a nice large granite type counter area that is very convenient for food preparation and a small dining table with 2 chairs in our one bedroom unit Theres a nice little balcony with one chair on it  for a little reading or coffee in the sunshine There are two LG flatscreen TVs  one in the living room and one in the bedroom that are quite adequate The fold out couch in the living room is smallish and the cushions are showing some age related compression but it was still comfortable Theres a worktable with ergonomic chair and easy web access stuff and outlets that are efficient and comfortable The bed linens are soft and comfortable there are a wide variety of pillows available The toilet paper is Cottonelle  so its nice and soft not the single ply sandpaper stuff that many places are trying to offer now and the toiletries are very nice Neutrogena products 
 The business center computers are antiquated and slow and pretty much only useful for printing out boarding passes The laundry is large and bright with plenty of machines that are modern and do a good job My husband enjoyed the exercise equipment that included a treadmill elliptical stationary bike free weights and a weight machine  drinking fountains and a TV were available in the workout room 
The gardens and outdoor areas were extensive well landscaped and maintained There was quite a variety of outdoor seating available with many areas having gas fireplaces in the seating areas There were several outdoor grills available for guest use that were modern clean and ready to go 
The breakfast and dinner offerings are adequate  but not gourmet You get hot filling food but its just kind of average Standard make your own waffles bagels english muffins etc  three hot offerings which usually are eggs sausage and tater tots  the best of which is the tater tots and a fruit and yogurt bar that has canned peaches canned mandarins cottage cheese and yogurt and some fresh melon chunks Evening offerings are a nice enough salad bar and a hot offering that has been during our stay  edible but mostly because its included Theres drinkable wine and beer and with the nice pool table and fireplace area it offers a nice opportunity to unwind after the day 
I found the staff to be friendly and responsive even when our flight was delayed The cleaning staff is polite unobtrusive and efficient
The hotel offers very good rates with nice discounts for government and AAA and they participate in the HH points program It is a family oriented hotel so there will be kids at breakfast in the pool etc and of course their behavior is up to their parents  but we had no problem with noise 
Overall  the best place to stay in SanDiego if youre not looking for night life excitement etc If you want a great convenient location nice facilities large room kitchen facilities and the open air experience  with just a few minutes to the zoo SeaWorld Balboa park airport and downtown  no parking fees no internet fees and a safe place where you and your kids can stretch out and run around This ones got it

title: Classy Hampton Inn
text:
I recently spent 4 nights at this hotel on leisure travel with my husband At first glance I wasnt sure we were in the right place the building facade and lobby are pretty classy by Hampton Inn standards The rooms themselves are basic Hampton Inn style and are on the smaller side by comparison but definitely still comfortable and clean The loungebreakfasthappy hour location is really nice and access to the outside balcony is great One night we bought a bottle of wine and just sat on the balcony reading and watching the traffic
The location of the hotel is ideal We walked everywhere dinners tourist attractions leisure strolls etc and had no difficultly orienting ourselves and navigating the city There are plenty of places to eat and drink within a block of the hotel if you dont feel like going further but 6th street is a short stroll up the road We even walked to UT and the State Capitol
Morning breakfast was good but basic It was often crowded and staff was soso about refilling missing items Definitely still good but not above average for a Hampton Inn We only took advantage of happy hour one night and staff was friendly and the food and drinks were great
My one complaint about this hotel is the parking The price 23 while we were there is steep but I understand thats the norm in most cities However not having an option for self park is very annoying Having to depend on and tip a valet when Im perfectly capable of walking into the garage and getting my car is just bothersome The valet service was backed up and slow every time we needed the car One evening we waited 15 minutes for our car Im not complaining too much about the price but am complaining about the valet service One tip if you stay on a weekend just park on the street nearby for free and better convenience we did this the one weekend night we were in town

title: Locationlocationlocation
text: Great location for walking subwayattractions and for walking around the city at nightI felt safe walking around late at night Totally recommended this propertyif youre willing to paylike I said locationlocationlocation its worth it especially if you are traveling alone and new to the city

title: An amazing hotel should not be classified as a budget hotel
text: Amazing amazing amazing super helpful staff there was free shuttles available which would take you to all the top sightseeing sights The room was spacious clean neat and the view we were given was wonderful This hotel surprised us considering it is classified as a budget hotel A must stay

title: The Best
text: Just returned from NYC  3 ladies and 2 teenagers on a girls weekend away Affinia was just as reported on Tripadvisor beds very comfortable 2 bathrooms with great toiletries Nice to have a kitchen for quick snacks Maureen at the concierge desk was exceptionally helpful Our only complaint was that we could not turn off the heating If you are looking for a quiet night in Affinia Manhattan is NOT the place for you but if you want to be part of downtown New York do not hesitate to choose this hotel

title: Quick hop to the Metro
text:
This Residence Inn  part of the Marriott line is great for extended stays and families The room was a large suite with a living area kitchen and dining area The bed is not in a separate room but set off to the side The sofa is a sleeper though The kitchen included all the utensils but you dont need them much since this one offers a full breakfast buffet and evening snacks during the weekdays 
The best part of this hotel is that it is right around the corner from the Federal metro stop Hop on that and you are at the mall in ten mintues and luckily on the way is a Starbucks However no eating or drinking on the Metro It is possibly the best public transportation system I have used
The only drawback to this hotel  the bed Every one is hard and uncomfortable But I was so exhausted after 8 hours of walking the musuems that I hardly noticed
The location is good for metro and such but there arent any restaurants nearby so do your eating in town There is a grocery store about a mile away

title: Great location nice rooms but
text: Couldnt ask for a better location Rooms are nice and clean etc Had there not been people picketing and shouting outside I believe they were employees it would have been great They blocked the front so we had to walk around and it was very intimidating to my daughter Im not sure what exactly it was over and Im not taking sides but I work hard and dont get much time off and it certainly punished me more than whomever the picketers sp were trying to punish

title: Anniversary getaway
text: We were absolutely delighted to find out that we could redeem our Wyndham Rewards points for a free night in NYC It was so cool that the hotel was so centrally located in the middle of town We had a fantastic time in the city  the room was so nice the bed incredibly comfortable and the outside patio was especially pleasant for breakfast Service was great

title: First time at the Sheraton Gunter in San Antonio
text: The Sheraton Gunter was everything I expect from a hotel in San Antonio  historic beautiful comfortable and so conveniently located I really loved the historic feel to the hotel Fitness center was great The bed was very comfortable I walked to my convention daily and my husband was able to walk to the River Walk and also to Market Square We have never stayed in this area but we found it was the best location for all we wanted Well go back Thanks

title: Great Stay
text: I stayed here for business and unfortunately had to ship a number of boxes to my hotel room The concierge bell hop and shipping department were wonderful and made the whole process of dealing with heavy boxes manageable The Westin Charlotte definitely has the best concierge Ive ever dealt with He gave great restaurant recommendations and was patient even with the strangest requests I very rarely compliment anyone for doing a good job but I made sure to tell the front desk manager that the concierge was amazing The room was nice and clean and what Ive come to expect from a Westin property and I would definitely stay here again because of my pleasant experience with the staff especially the concierge

title: Dorothy Parker Would Expect No Less
text:
Okay if youre going to be near Times Square which is good because of your proximity to both sides of town and both train stations why not be in one of the most famous hotels in the world Its worth it and you wont find many rooms like this in NYC The beds are extremely warm and cozy the art on the walls all tell tales of the history of the hotel from illustrations depicting the originators of The Atlantic Monthly to handwritten poetry of Dorothy Parker to letters to his editor by Truman Capote The bathrooms are deep the water warm it really has everything you need including vintage old NYC furniture that is comfortable and in unbelievably good condition And to think you are only a few floors above The Round Table to be so close to a round surface with simple wooden legs that at one time hosted the liveliest most important and humorous ongoing literary dialogues in the world If you have a large enough group you can actually reserve that table Positively remarkable considering this piece of furniture should be stored in The Smithsonian 
One drawback some of the help There are the nice men and women who are the waiters and the maids We decided some of the waiters were straight out of New Yorker cartoons And you cant help but get the feeling most of the help has been there since 1934 and still get a kick out of each other and their job Theyre not the problem 
Its some of the unpleasant andor inefficient characters at the Front Desk Though one or two were friendly and helpful most were snobby and seemed put upon  as though they had better things to do And while the day concierge was sweet as all get out he did not as promised provide me with a special store he and I had a lengthy conversation about
