A slightly less inocuous example of poor behavior occured when I explained to the current Front Desk man that the man from the previous evening promised me a great rate for the following night which he truly had The man at the Front Desk smirked barely looked me in the eye and said he didnt know why that happened that gentleman shouldnt have promised me that and he couldnt help me Then he went about his business as I stood there At the moment if I hadnt liked others in the hotel as much and the room I would have asked he move my stuff out and I get my money back His manner was postively rude and discourteous Perhaps he was correct his colleague should have made no such promises and perhaps I should have taken up his colleagues offer when he put it out there but this charming man could have handled it without being so disgustingly unpleasant 
I was further underwhelmed when I discovered I had lost a piece of jewelry Once having discovered the loss on my way to another location I phoned the Front Desk to explain what I had missing But after that call no one got back to me and it was a family heirloom I phoned the hotel to find out about the follow up and had many short conversations that seemed perfunctory with the front desk pleading they check again with Security But neither they nor their Security Officer has bothered to phone me to this day Honestly even if it were to simply say Miss weve interviewed everyone theres nothing we can do We are so sorry I would have been disappointed but felt the proper attention had been paid Instead I am left angry and disenchanted 
Granted I was there during the holidays and no one wants to work during that time but as long as theyre there and Im there and we are all there together I think they could have bent over backwards or sideways or bent their bodies upwards to look me in the eyes so as to make my stay more pleasant and prevent such a complex review 
These to me though are luxurious problems Its not like I would call downstairs ask for tea and it wouldnt arrive within ten minutes although everything cost a buttload  watch out for the costs One one minute phone call to LA cost me ten dollars There were many moments of excellent hospitality And regardless of my specific disparaging remarks The Algonquin is a charming beautiful comfortable hotel in a good location Just bring a little attitude in your bag so when necessary you can throw it back to Mr Charming Pants at the Front Desk Dorothy Parker would expect no less 
ps If you make ressies on line be careful you are not quoted one rate for one evening and another rate for another evening I got stung that way and insisted prior to checking in it be changed at once They did so which was helpful but keep your eye on the ball Im positive this is common practice amongst many hotels but its an odd practice and the ethics of which I question

title: Residence Inn Indianapolis is great
text:
i have done lots of travels but this one is exceptional the front office staff Shelly is really providing outstanding service she tries to accommodate everyones needs i wish all hotels have the same kind of exceptional service
thank you

title: Nice and Relaxed
text: Hotel is close to many businesses for work and a nice and relaxed area to decompress with a happy hour dinner and a little shopping after Love the area and the staff of the Westin

title: Our stay at Houston Four Points
text: Our stay was made so hospitable by Jessica Selcotoshe deserves a 5 star ratingthe location of the motel is easy to get to from the airport The down side is it is located near a major interstate The motel over all was a good choice but the major plus is the staff

title: I am utterly impressed
text:
I stayed at the Staybridge for 1 night while I was in NYC 
My flight from LAX arrived very early and I was at the Staybridge at 8am I was apprehensive if they would have a room for me that early as checkin time was supposed to be 4pm I used my priority club points to redeem for a rewards night I was greeted by Carter This gentleman was very welcoming and polite and he said lets see what we can do I booked a room with view but he mentioned that if I wanted to have a room immediately I could have one on the 4th floorwhich does not really have a view I did not mindas I would like to rest after a tiring flight Check in was quick and he recognized me as a priority club member by giving me a box of chocolates Thank You He even invited me to have breakfast which was going on until 10am I was also given a late checkout til 2pm All in all I was very impressed with Carter
The hotel seemed to be busy and the bellboy apologized as we had to handle our own luggages I was fine with that as I was more than happy to go up and get some rest
One problem with this hotel The elevators are very slow I mean really slow I found myself taking the stairs most of the time Thank God I was on the 4th floor
Very new and modern decoration simple and nice Rooms were visible new and well maintained Comfortable king sized bed flat screen TV mini kitchenette Bathroom was small but clean No bathtub just a shower area Water pressure from showerhead was good temperature control perfect Standard amenities Soap shampoo shower cap No toothbrushes but I requested for them and were given a pair They do not use liquid body soaponly a block of soap No bathroom slippers
Daily hot breakfast served free and cocktail reception at 5pm Breakfast consisted of fruits breads eggs bacon potatoes juices range of coffee etc Very good
Guest laundry provided free There were about 5 sets of washers and dryers detergent not provided free
Every staff from the front desk to the housemaids were warm and always smiling
Location wise also good I would surely return to this hotel the next tim I am in NYC

title: Great Location So So Rooms
text:
I used this site to pick the King George and got a low cost rate I have a feeling their rack rates are high and then they discount heavily to give the impression you are getting a bargain The location cant be faulted It is central to everything and within say 200 metres to the cable cars Union square and major shops on Powell St 
The staff were efficient and friendly The rooms are tiny just the bed and a chair or two and a writing table Separate bathroom and full bath No air conditioning just a fan It was very hot the 3 days I was there in September because the wall faced the afternoon sun Thank goodness I could open the window to cool it down No mini bar but an in room safe Usual TV video games etc The solitary lift in this old building is renovated but can take a while in peak periods Using the stairs is ok but hang on they are steep and only fit one person Heart attack material by the eighth floor I prefer the Cartwright Hotel for a similar old world renovated style but it is higher up on Sutter St near the Crowne Plaza and Westin Overall the King George is in a great location with so so small rooms They are clean and tidy fine for a quick stopover or business trip but nothing to write home about

title: expensive without continental breakfast
text:
On the site there is written they have continental breakfast but they give you a coupon to use in a little caff where you have a little choice or if you want you can go to take a burger at 900 am on the other side of the street
Every time they try to sell you bus tickets and tours
No good restaurants nearby and unfortunately a lot of homeless in the evening

title: Do not stay at this hotel
text:
Date March 29 2007
Reviewer Trip Advisor Member Oregon
This hotel was the worst hotel with the worst staff that we have ever
stayed at We reserved a non smoking room When arrived at 430p we were given a smoking room The smoke smell was so strong I couldnt stay 5 minutes in the room We went back to the desk to get another room They gave us a key to another room It was a smoking room and the room hadnt been cleaned We went back to the desk and they said there wasnt any non smoking rooms and they would get someone to clean the room The smoke smell wasnt too bad so we agreed We went to dinner and when we returned we went into the bathroom and the back
of the bathroom door had a hole punched in it At 930p we had a knock at our door It was the hotel staff asking us what we were doing in the room they said it was not to be occupied We explained and they said ok Anout 1030 pm I noticed there was no smoke detector only wires hanging from the wall The next morning I went to take a shower I could get water to come out of the faucet but couldnt get the water to come out of the shower head My husband came in and after about 10 minutes he was able to force the handel open so I could take a shower When I went to use the hairdryer there
were 3 holes in the wall where the hairdryer used to be We went to breakfast about 800 am There was syrup but nothing to put the syrup on There were no pastries or muffins There was cereal and few
peices of bread to toast and a couple of hard boiled eggs There was no one around to ask to replenish the breakfast buffet When we checked out we told the clerk about all our problems She said ok No apology no concern Another girl behind the desk said you should write the problems in the book so they can be fixed This hotel was not a cheap hotel we paid over 100 for the night
I did contact La Quinta headquarters when we returned home to tell them about our terrible experience They had the manager of the hotel
call us she apologized and said she would check the rooms we were in and get them fixed She also adjusted the charges She said the policy of La Quinta doesnt guarantee you will get the type room you requested I said I can understand if you cant give me the type of bed or the lower flower I requested but does that mean if I request
non smoking I cant be quaranteed a non smoking room She said yes that is their policy I am allergic to smoke and if that is La Quinta
policy I will never stay at another one of their hotels 
I appreciated the call from the manager but she needs to train her staff and be more aware of what is going on in her hotel I would never stay at this hotel again

title: Good place in NYC
text: Rooms were little but not sound proof Could here tv music etc from room next door Staff were helpful and friendly except for one waiter at the outside bar who seemed he just didnt care about serving drinks Good location  walkable to Time square theatres and subway Would recommend this place more for a group of friends travelling rather than a solo person as the outdoor terrace is good place to relax with a few glasses of wine

title: I enjoyed the stay
text: Melissa Kim and Craig were great they showed alot of professionalism and friendly customer courtesy

title: Great Location but Basic
text:
I have had this booked months however on arrival they had no record of my party I nearly died I had all my booking forms from Travel agent so after speaking to Manager Matt they gave me a room after paying again for 1 night Until they could clear this mess up with Thomas Cook Not a great start Room was Basic but clean 2 double beds for our party of 3 Room was on 3rd floor right next to liftHotel was packed full of school trips so can you picture the noise on a nighthowever we were that tired with walking it was no problem falling alseep
San Francisco was greatWeather around 50 degrees every day 1 day it rained bad however I thought we hit lucky with the weather Hotel is right in Fishermans Wharf so great to look around however we liked to walk and went to Union Square a lot too
We had prebooked a few tours and we had to meet them outside Ferry building I do advise a tour of city on first full day it gives you a great idea of location and shows you everything with a bit of history too
Overall Holiday was greatfood too good Would I stay and this hotel again Yes its all you needclean and no hassle

title: Diamond in the rough
text: 3 blks from Times Square great location Nice and clean and generous size rooms Wonderful pool and workout room as well Room service unbelievably inexpensive and delicious Will definitely return there is no other place like this one

title: Great location  room  service
text:
Stayed 3 nights June 1215 2008 in a King room on the 1st floor There was no view just a courtyard of windows  but that didnt matter because we were sightseeing from morning til night and I was too tired to care when we were finished 
If you need a nice hotel in a greatsafe location with a clean room  free breakfast  look no further We got a rate of 187 per night through the hotels website  and when you factor in the complimentary breakfast  thats a pretty good deal There is plenty to eat  not just danish  coffee They had hot cinnamon rolls cold cereal carton milk eggs scrambled or omelet depending on the day bacon or sausage depending on the day biscuits and gravy daily and then breads english muffins and bagels If this doesnt work for you there is a Dennys literally right around the corner  as well as a Walgreen in case you need popwater medicine sunscreen snacks toothpaste film developing socks  or anything else you forgot or think you might need 
The turnaround for the PowellMason is only 2 blocks from the hotel You can pay 5 per way per person Or buy a 3day unlimited ride pass for 18 per person We chose this option which gave us no excuse to explore the city more
Overall a great hotel  no complaints The rooms were big  clean Had inroom safe iron ironing board coffee internet movies video games etc There are 2 computers for internet access just off the lobby that are available 247 at no cost Great for printing boarding passes for the flight home booking tours researching restaurants and attractions  and checking your emails from home  as well as sending the standard wish you were here email to the folks back home

title: Lovely hotel Great location
text: Very big hotel staff are friendly The rooms are big and the beds are the comfiest beds I have come across You get a fridge and iron in the room The gym is big and well equipped and the pool area is really nice The hotel sports bar serves good food and reasonably priced drinks and has a good atmosphere The hotel is connected to the mall do easy to get to the shops and restaurants Great location with loads of restaurants and shops nearby Starbucks within the hotel is a bonus Wifi available also

title: Great Value and Location
text:
Pleasantly surprised at the value this centrally located hotel offers New York hotel prices can be extreme but the Red Roof was excellent 
Room looks small at first but you dont spend much time there anyway Interesting view of the Empire State Building Entrance to 34th street subway at the end of the block was a bonus Walkable distance from Times Square A bit of noise from the street throughout the night and in the morning but it is New York  and still managed a good night sleep Comfortable beds
Clean but slightly dated bathrooms
Excellent conciergebellboys  very friendly
Will stay here again on my next trip to New York

title: well worth a stay
text: Stayed at the Gansevoort over Xmas 2011 Great location and ideal fo rmany sights to visit including the Hi Line

title: Ideal location for steakhouses and shopping
text: We arrived late evening and was immediately welcomed by the bellman Upon arriving at the sixth floor lobby we were again genuinely welcomed by the manager who moved us from the 10th to the 18th floor for a better view We were within walking distance to several restaurants that would please any palate and wallet It was great to take our leftovers back to the hotel to warm in the full kitchen The free buffet breakfast was pleasing with a different menu each day Staff was accomodating and friendly overall we were well pleased Be prepared for the 42 valet parking with in and out priviledges

title: Good for Families
text:
The Beacon Hotel is a great boutique hotel that we found to be family friendly Our stay entailed staying a Friday and Saturday and checking out Sunday at noon My husband had some business he was conducting during Friday  Saturday very near to the hotel hence the reason we stayed at this location and not closer to the main attractions of DC Additionally the bedbug registry was checked there were NO reports associated with this hotel so we chose to stay at the Beacon 
Having bedbug phobia and upon arrival my husband  I took apart the beds to check for bedbugs We saw no signs anywhere around the mattresses or headboards relief The mattresses all seemed new and had those bedbug covers on them I checked the drawers and all around the place and it looked ok so we stayed One night my 5 yr son slept only in PJ pants and no shirt and had no bites in the morning upon close inspection Granted I nor my family have never had a bedbug encounter but Ive just been reading so much about it I feel like I could accurately identify bites So it freaks me out badly 
So anyways we had reserved adjoining rooms one room had two double beds a sleeper couch and a kitchenette and the other was just their standard room with a King sized bed The exact term would be Corporate Quarters Double Double room which had the kitchenette and our room was a King Deluxe room The Double was definitely large and was where our boys 5 yrs 3 yrs and 9 months slept My neighbors sister babysat our children at night as we had plans with friends for dinner during the evenings so it was necessary to make sure there was ample room for 3 energetic boys The kitchenette sink microwave etc sure came in handy We had bought snacks such as microwavable popcorn and frozen pizzas for them while they watched a TV show with the sitter The bathroom was very large and there was lots of closet space Overall the room was clean I had requested a crib for our baby and a pacnplay was brought to us quickly up room arrival I would suggest requesting a high chair from the restaurant as there are none in the room One was brought for us to use during our stay 
The king room that adjoined the double room was very small which was fine for us to sleep in keep our clothes in and have some privacy We were very grateful that we purchased the double and not another King for our boys It was probably not the biggest room Ive stayed in but it was ok for us If you are looking for luxury and plan to spend much time in your room Id suggest upgrading to a larger room 
Overall we were very pleased with the service and our stay It was quiet and we barely heard other patrons or street noise so that was lovely We did not eat in the hotel so I can not rate the food however we had heard through friends that the brunch is very good 
Lastly upon writing this a week after our stay we are 100 sure that we had NO bedbug encounters and have not brought any home although we did take all the necessary precautions to not bring them into our home I would recommend staying here

title: Beautiful view friendly helpful service good value will stay again
text: We found the hotel to be very nice The view of Grant Park and the Lake was beautiful The room was clean The staff was nice and helpful Room service messed up our breakfast order but fixed it in minutes

title: At last a place that I can call home in New York
text:
Great Hotel whos rooms are HUGE by normal New York standards I booked this hotel on the basis of previous reviews and also because we have stayed in quite a few Hampton Inns and have always had a good experience This hotel did nothing to spoil that opinion 
The desk staff were excellent especially Lisa The rooms were always cleaned well and promptly by happy friendly staff The rooms thmselves were well appointed and as previously mentioned huge by New York standards The bed was wonderfully comfortable which is important after hours of pounding the pavement sightseeing and shopping Hmmmmmmmmmm shopping one of my favorite things to do especially in New York As other reviewers have mentioned the location of the hotel is fabulous for all the major shopsDont forget when you go to Maceys to take your passport with you and go to the customer service desk and get a discount shoppers card it will give you 10 off the majority of your purchases even things that are on sale are included Manhattan is great for clothing and shoes because there is no sales tax on an item if it is under 110 so what you see on the tag is what you pay unlike other American states
In a nutshell i wont be staying anywhere else next time we are in New York I have travelled there many times and have finally found a place that ticks all the boxes clean well located well appointed reasonably priced no mean feat in NYC free internet and free breakfast with friendly staff to wrap up the parcel

title: Great value for a family weekend in DC
text: We stayed two nights over Labor Day weekend   overall it is a very nice family hotel in a good location near 14th street clean welllit  travelled easy to get in and out It is a treck to the metro station about 3 long blocks so if your children are younger than 67 I would probably choose something with a closer stop Otherwise we parked our car  forgot it for 2 days   public transport was very efficient and the hotel is close enough to the White House to walk there A cab to Georgetown for dinner was less than 10 The breakfast was plentiful both hot  cold items  delicious  much appreciated by the mother of 3 hungry kids The staff was very pleasant  the children loved our maids creative handiwork with their stuffed animalsbedspreads The beds were comfortable pillows  linens were good quality After walkingsightseeing all day it was nice to come home to a large suite that was big enough for 3 adults  3 children The lobby area was very nice also I dont think it needs updating as some other reviewers noted We enjoyed our stay  would recommend to both families or business travellers My only complaint would be the cost of valet parking but I did see a public parking garage across the street that might be less expensive

title: Lovely hotel but def paying over the top for the name
text: Stayed here for a long weekend The hotel itself is lovely and well situated for shopping  site seeing  eating  drinking but well overpriced Cost 200 a night and there are hotels a lot cheaper and with far better rooms The room didnt have anything wrong it was just nothing special for the price and our view was onto a nearby sky scraper The food was also very expensive though delicious New york is amazing though if I went back it would be a cheaper hotel

title: Avoid this place at all costs
text: My husband and I traveled to the west coast for a family reunion We decided to make a vacation out of it and spent 4 days in gorgeous San Francisco But our trip didnt start off that great We had reserved that hotel because of the indoor pool we found out it was being serviced and we would not be able to use it or the jacuzzi during our stay The clerk didnt even apologize and why didnt I get an email letting me know ahead of time that the hotel would be partially under construction Then we were mortified that when we arrived at the hotel at midnight there was a half empty bottle of water on the floor next to the bed which made me think no one changed the sheets and dried pee on the toilet seat which made me think nothing in the room was clean I called down to the desk to let them know the room wasnt clean and all the desk clerk kept saying way Ill make sure housekeeping doesnt charge you for the water After he finally understood and after a long flight and it was actually 3AM for us we followed the bellman around the hotel looking for a clean room We had reserved a room with 1 king bed they then put us in a room with 2 beds My husband and I dont fit in a double bed but they said that was all they had that was clean but when I checked in and asked if the hotel was busy they said they barely had 30 of the hotel occupied Anyways after 1 hour they finally found us a room that was correct and appeared clean They didnt have a room key so they said they would slide it under the door The next morning we left the room but forgot something we tried the room key they slid under the door and it didnt work I asked a housekeeper to let us in but she wouldnt that was understandable she pointed to the phone outside the elevator so I used it to call the desk They said they would send someone up TWENTY MINUTES LATER we finally got into the room There was no apology or anything in fact they tried to blame us by saying we must have demagnetized it The customer service was awful We decided to check out and find another hotel Our initial reservation was for 4 nights and even though we checked out after 1 night the clerk didnt even ask us why I would assume in this economy they could use every red cent they could get

title: Nice place to stay in Cedar Park Texas
text: A group of us stayed here in September 2012 for a friends wedding that was just a few miles down the road The place was very nice clean and very comfortable as Hampton Inns typically are It was a good location with restaurants and shopping close by and was convenenient to the highways we needed to access

title: Universal weekend and Teen Choice Awards
text: Pleased well beyond what we imagined Have to hand it too this place Cant beat the location Just a 5 minute walk to Universal and City Walk but the shuttle was until 11pm in City Walk It was just my daughters and me for the weekend We had tickets to Universal Studios and the Teen Choice Awards We arrived a little early but had no problems checking in Stewart was amazing A really great first impression for this place We really got an amazing room with views of Universal the Hollywood hills and downtown LA in the distance I also liked the Breakfast in Bed feature to the room It really was a great breakfast though a little pricey I chose Valet parking and it really paid off in the end more so when I checked out We arrived at 1pm Sat and checked out at 715pm Sun Since we had until 6pm check out day to take advantage of the parking they quickly got my car to put my luggage back in after check out so we could continue on with our time at Universal until the show The awards show got out at 7pm and we just waited for the convenient shuttle which took us from City Walk to the hotel lobby our entire stay The valet guys were so nice the extending hour of parking was not a problem for them and within less than a min my car was out and ready for us to go home Most definitely pleased with our stay at the Hilton Though I didnt get a chance to check out the buffet which looked amazing there is always next time

title: Absolutely loved it
text: What a great find The rooms were huge and very comfortable The location was extremely convenient to everything we wanted to see and the service was impeccable and very friendly I highly recommend it for anyone wanting a comfortable affordable hotel with genuinely friendly helpful staff

title: Poor Staff and Overpriced
text:
Just got back from a 3000 person conference at Hilton Bayfront and I was very disappointed with the hotel The staff had no idea what was going on all weekend Had a coworker locked out of her room because of a mistake the hotel made Very overpriced I would not recommend this hotel for personal or business travel 
Rooms were clean

title: Worries Laid To Rest
text: Was worried about the stay after reading other reviews but after arriving I was very pleased The checkin process went very smoothly and the room itself was clean and comfortable The bed was down right luxurious and the bathroom was impeccable My only complaint would be that the walls to the rooms are paper thin Several times normal conversation and moderate TV noise could be clearly heard Would I book again Yes

title: The closest to Universal Studios
text: Our family recently returned from an overnight trip to Universal Studios for Halloween Horror Nights and we loved our stay at the Hilton The walk tofrom Universal was really easy even at 2 am the hotel was safe and clean and every single employee we came across was really nice and friendly and truly seemed to care that we were all happy and well taken care of In total we had three rooms but we all came in one vehicle and we were only charged for one vehicle No issues with billing check in and check out was a breeze much appreciated since my husband and I were traveling with all teenagers It was a flawlessly easy break with the kids thanks to the Hilton Also about an hour after we arrived they brought us all in all three rooms bottled waters compliments of the hotelvery nice touch The view from the hotel was amazing The beds and pillowsso comfy Great trip you cant go wrong staying here

title: Like other reviewers have stated dont stay in a room near the train
text:
Unfortunately the hotel was booked solid when I checked in on a Saturday night Therefore all they could give me was a room near the train near the I think its northwest corner of the hotel The train is pretty dang loud I realize this is tough for the hotel because they cant help the fact that theyre near the train I suppose the only solution expensive solution is to install soundproof windows And we all know thats not going to happen
They couldnt switch my room that night but kindly did so the next night They were really nice about it and didnt seem at all surprised that I wanted to switch
The room the 2nd night was very quiet except for the woman next door who was practicing her singing at 1030pm After a few knocks on the wall she stopped and this is not the fault of the hotel anyway
The breakfast was good but I didnt have dinner there so I cant share my opinions about that The lobby is gorgeous and the staff was very nice and helpful Both rooms were very spacious well appointed and clean
Overall Id say this is a great hotel if you have the right room location

title: Donald Trump has really outdone himself
text: Everything at this luxurious was superb The staff was extremely friendly the rooms were emaculate and everything else was equally as amazing One problem this hotel still has a great location but not ideal some destinations we were headed to were a far walk or taxi from the hotel Overall this was one if the best hotel stays ever

title: great service goes a long way
text: The customer service was incredible Although the 1020 minute walk to areas of interest got a little tiresome the staff at this hotel was so kind considerate and helpful I was asked about my stay by different staff members in different departments at least 5 times a day The employees there created a home away from home feeling Any and every request or concern was addressed immediately If someone even sensed that you may need some help an employee was right there with a smiling face We traveled with handicap elderly and small children and the staff was absolutely wonderful offering assistance and accommodating our needs This hotel is more animal friendly than any hotel Ive visited but still clean A for great service

title: Nice Stay
text: We will stay again if in area Stayed one night and we were very comfortable bed and room Breakfast was very good

title: Loved It
text: It was a nice and clean enviornment They treated me with respect The staff was very helpful and answered all of my questions The rooms were authentic and romantic I think anyone who appreciates the Mexican culture would enjoy staying at this hotel

title: We LOVED this hotel
text:
I just have to say that this was probably the best hotel experience I and my family have had Myself and my family were in town for a family function and we decided to stay at the Palomar because of what other friends and said about the hotel
Not on did they accomindate us by giving us 2 rooms right next to each other but the guest services people went above and beyond and came to our room to make sure we all were satisfied YES It was great to see a hotel that actually is really pet friendly
 The hotel was so beautiful at night when we saw a couple of times its something you raley notice but with this hotel it was so noticeable We had dinner in the resturant on Saturday night and the food was amazing but the chef wasnt there on a Saturday kinda weird right So Im guessing the other chefs did it but it was great food Try the peaches pizza
The rooms were nicely decorated and the pool is AMAZING I think the best part of the entire stay was to see the smile on my family members face when the lady at the concig came over and asked her by name how her stay is going This says a lot about a hotel and the service they give
Just to let everyone know this was an amazing experience Thank you Hotel Palomar

title: Impressive Hotel with friendly Staff
text:
I have to say I was actually impressed with this property This is my first time at a Staybridge Suites hotel but I am not disappointed at all I would like to thank Jane and all the staff at this hotel for all their concerted efforts to make the guests feel welcome 
Check In It was a breeze and they even had a parcel for me that i had preordered online from an online shoe company
Staff Everyone was friendly
Rooms We were allocated rooms on the 26th floor Room size was perfect as i have seen smaller rooms in the city I had a really good sleep on the beds
Gym  Breakfast This is my first trip anywhere that I did not check out the gym Breakfast was goodscramblled eggstoastfruityoughurtoats as well albeit a little crowded but then there are so many options in the city
I have no complaints at all but I would caution people not to trust the negative reviews there are always going to be the whiners and complainers

title: Understated elegance
text:
Having once being a regular I hadnt stayed at The Peninsula for the last four years Before going there I  as usually  checked the Trip Advisor and got concerned with some criticism Even though I decided to check my old time favourite
With all due respect to the dissatisfied ones I was very very happy with my stay The hotel is the best example I know for understated low profile elegance
The room furniture was excellent the marble bathroom a must and the desk superb with accessible eletric outlets wireless internet acces and lots of space to work
The staff has always been courteous and efficient
Since nothing is this life is perfect I wouldnt recomend the Fives Restaurant overpriced and not worthwile But Ill sure go back to this place paying high but getting the best

title: A nice place to stay
text:
This hotel had a nice mix of old and new The furniture and building are definitely on the older side When I first walked into my room it gave me the feel of walking into my grandmothers house which for me is not a bad thing This is not to say the rooms have not been renovated in all the right ways The bed was perfect and very comfortable the bath was newly renovated and having the kitchen was much nicer than eating out every night 
The location was great  walking distance to the park and to Hillcrest The hotel is gay owned and has a great happy hour on the roof deck on Fridays but this is far from a gay hotel  it caters well to everyone My only problem was the lack of air conditioning in the rooms All of the windows opened wide and there was a ceiling fan but the temperature as unusually hot during my stay which made it tough to sleep at night Im not certain that I would recommend staying here if the weather was expected to be hot but I doubt if this is a problem most of the time since from what Im told it is usually much cooler in San Diego than when I was there
The free parking and internet were a plus The view from the room was amazing and a great place to eat breakfast

title: Style Over Substance
text:
The Hudson Hotel clearly places style over substance What I mean by that is that the atmosphere and cool decorating is obviously more important to the owners than meeting basic expectations most of us have of a hotel clean facilites and value for your money 
For example as others have stated the rooms are very small We had a studio  queen and while this may be one of the bigger rooms in the hotel it was still smaller than pretty much any other standard hotel room Ive stayed in across this country Also the shower curtain was stained and since the tub is so narrow it wants to envelope you as you take a shower Nasty The rug looked barely vacuumed The deadbolt on the door usually didnt work The icemaker on our floor and the floor above us didnt work The icemaker on the floor below did work but many of the ice cubes had specks of dirt in them The ice tubs were all dirty The room was dusty A basic breakfast was 29 A bottle of beer was 9 One of our rooms wasnt ready for check in until after 430 I could go on and on
When you pay over 500 a night you should expect basic things such as the aformentioned to not be an issue But at the Hudson they are We were part of a large group with several rooms and I saw the same issues in the other rooms as well Honestly I find it insulting to pay so much and yet still have the issues we had
I know the Hudson staff reads the reviews here from time to time since they do occasionally respond My question is how many times do people have to complain about the same things before you will actually do something about it Talk is cheap 
Yes the location was great and the staff was friendly But there are so many hotels in the area I cannot understand why anyone would return to this hotel We will not

title: Excellent Staff  Comfortable Small Room
text: We spent last week at the Doubletree by the Houston Airport Our room was small but immaculately clean The bed was very comfortable I loved the down comforter  but Im glad I brought my own pillow because the bed pillows were rock hard  The staff at the Doubletree bent over backwards for us everyone who works there must love their job they were always so nice and accomodating I wasnt that happy with the restaurant  the hamburgers were good but the breakfast buffet was not very good I liked that they had a Starbucks in the lobby We would definitely stay here again  the grounds were pretty the staff were great the rooms comfortable

title: resort in the city
text: tourists with daughter and our grandkids great pool excellent service wonderful breakfast buffet large rooms only a block to Metro station but cab fares for the five of us were about the same as Metro tickets lots of restaurants close to hotel a great place to unwind after a days sightseeing

title: Good Location  Poor Rooms
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights while we were in Boston While the location was good  in a cute neighborhood and close to the subway we were disappointed with the cleanliness and general upkeep in the apartment that we were in While the size of the apartment was sufficient the bathroom was dirty and the mattress was old and sagged in the middle The decor of Room 109 was furnished in what looked like secondhand pieces of furniture that were badly banged up We were also disappointed with the staff We seemed to have a different person in the front office each day  while polite none were helpful with our questions

title: What a bad night
text:
I did not notice that my room was overlooking the hotel loading dock until 400 am At that time a truck started to load unload stuff going forward and backward beeping loudly It stopped at 415 I felt asleep And it started again at 445 My night was over
Given the fact that a hotel mission is to provide you with a comfortable sleeping night they failed And upon checkout the person on duty at the front desk did not care moving on so quickly that I did not even have a chance to ask for a cab
Would I return to this hotel  Most probably not

title: Unremarkable in every respect
text: This place is beyond boring as far a accommodations go They do offer an extensive package of in room amenities on the house including a sewing kit and rain bonnet The beds are comfortable enough and there are lots of staff on hand to answer questions and such The elevators are slow and the weight room mediocre Assuming other options are available I will not ever stay there again They did allow me to put down a 100 cash deposit when I forgot my credit card and there was no problem getting it back when I checked out in the morning

title: Good sized room
text:
This was our second stay at the Intercontinental both times using Hotwire or PricelineI still think it was a bit pricey for the month of March approx 248 plus taxes We were however very pleased with the size of the room and they were able to accommodate us with two beds
 The North End really isnt that far of a walk for people that have no walking problems and there are plenty of restaurants in the North End

title: Business traveller  conference
text:
I stayed at the Argent September 11th14th attending a conference being held there ROOMS  were average  nothing really luxurious I saw a couple different rooms  the room set up seems to be quite varied CONFERENCE FACILITIES  the rooms were very cold The lunches were good although the morning and afternoon snacks were not varied at all day to day  not sure if this was a result of catering or the conference organizers LOCATION  well situated downtown  less than a 5 minute walk to Union Square  a 1015 cab fare to Fishermans Wharf SERVICE no problems checking in  I was able to have really early checkin Room service and phone charges are a bit outrageous Consierge was not overly helpful  we ended up going to the consierge at a different hotel to get further help 
Overall  I agree with the last review  it is a hotel more geared to the business traveller I likely wouldnt stay there again unless I had a conference to attend there

title: Great for the Price
text:
Did a name your own price on Priceline and asked for a 3 star hotel got HOJO was originally very upset as it is a 1 star hotel 
After our 4 night stay i must say it was a great overall experience for the value price and location it is a MOTEL not a HOTEL so you must remember that but the room was clean and newly remodeled with nice furniture and detail there was free breakfast not the best but free the location is close to old town and seaworld would definitely stay at again

title: Minimalist vs Barren Depressing and Cheap
text:
I travel a lot to NYC every week Tried the Flatotel because of location the the promise of a Minimalist decor Dont know about you  I want clean and simple when I stay on a hotel 
On checking was upgraded to a one bedroom suite on the top floor It turns out this was the only room on the top floor  just my room and the gym
The room was enormous and sparsely furnished Some of the furnishings were fine  many others looked like they were storing their group function crap in the room  folding chairs chipped tables etc 
It was pretty depressing Sort of like a BIG dorm room with 12 nice pieces of furniture Broken plugs and AC that wouldnt turn off in the living room No minibar Inconsistent room service bread no bitter or no bread  but butter
Basically pretty half assed for hotels in this price range Id look elsewhere

title: Definitely worth it
text: I had a red eye flight and turned up at 630am The staff were very accommodating and checked me in straight away Earliest time I have ever checked in The room was clean and very comfortable The location was just off the Magnificant Mile Great location Overall it was worth staying at The only issue I might have was the cost of internet Not all that cheap

title: Great staff nice decor great rooms
text: Not sure how people found so much to complain about I stayed here for a few days in March and had a great time The front desk staff were friendly and helpful when we asked them a million questions about where to eat and what to do for fun at weird hours The lobby had fun decor the lounge wasnt too bad drinks kinda pricey but friendly bartender Aveda products in the room were great The room isnt huge but unless youve got two obese and clumsy people who need a suite in order to be comfortable youll find nothing to complain about really The only thing worth mentioning was that the toilet flushes loud but thats not really a big deal And at the hotwire rate under 100 this is a fantastic deal

title: Great hotel and staff but be wary of other guests
text:
Just got back from a weekend trip to NYC at the Crowne Plaza Celebrated wifes birthday and taking kids to see Christmas decorations The hotel is nice and well located We stayed on Priority Club points and the hotel sent complementary dessert to the room on my wifes birthday which was great Room was well appointed and clean Staff was very nice and hospitable
My only complaint was some drama going on with other guests Around 1000 on Saturday night there was a commotion in the hallway as a Hurrican Sandy victim was being removed from their room after FEMA funds had expired Pretty noisy endeavor including NYC police Secondally our neighbors got into loud arguements both nights we were there late at night after midnight which we were privelaged to hear as a result of the paper thin walls Freaked our kids 7 and 4 out a bit Not sure what the hotel could do about this kind of stuff but these events put a big damper on our stay there A maid told me they had been having trouble with FEMA recipients being good guests since they arrived Be cautious

title: Just average for downtown Marriott although Concierge lounge as above average
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights recently Am a Marriott loyalist and basically choose Marriott affliated hotels for all business travel However I found this hotel about as standard as any Marriott downlown location I have recently stayed at 
First the location isnt great  would prefer to have more restuarants and other places nearby 
Second while I was upgrade to concierge level as Plat Premier room was quite small and bathroom was downright tiny Of course given that the hotel was likely built in late 70s or early 80s there isnt too much the hotel can do about room size but the reality is that folks expect larger rooms and at least better appointed bathrooms these days and the hotel doesnt have it Bed if I recall was fine but nothing to write home about it
I did think the conceirge loungs was above average  better food options than a few hotel hotel lounges I have recently stayed at Also beerwine was reasonble in lounge vs crazy expensive at some hotels
So I will probably stay here again for a few more upcoming business trips but only because I am getting Marriott Points

title: Great Hotel Great Location and very friendly staff
text: Great Hotel Very friendly staff and were very accomodating to all visitors Room was lovely and clean Great location to central park fifth avenue and all the shops Bar was good fun at night and the Bar Staff made us feel very welcome Overall we had a great stay at this hotel and will definately return again soon

title: Satisfactory but not Spectacular
text:
The good news is that I won the hotel on priceline after indicating a Baltimore inner habor choice Though I was somewhat disappointed that we did not get a location very close to the waterfront the five or six blocks walk is easily done in decent weather We were welcomed efficiently but the desk staff person was not overly friendly and did not offer tips on what might be in the area or refer us to the concierge The decor of the lobby is a bit cold too even though the style is contemporary and has a great mural behind the front desk something more is needed to give a bit of warmth 
The room is on the small side for a 4 star hotel but the beds are very comfortable Wifi service was good Additionally we were pleased with the shower shampoo and lotions provided by the hotel The room was clean with the exception of the lamp which someone neglected to dust Also we were missing items from the coffee making kit 
A couple of things marred our stay a bit Firstthere was a future teachers convention there and several of the students were loud and raucous in the hallways and swimming pool like a frat party Also the bellwoman there told me she would get us a taxi to the cruise port a mere two miles away and stopped the van of a driver she apparently knew Not a standard taxi The fare should just be a few bucks within minutes I inquired about the price and was told 3000 When asked to be let out the driver brought the fare down to 20 I sincerely believe the bellwomandoorwoman KNEW this guy and was trying to get him extra business I did not like the one bit and feel it reflects badly upon the Hilton 
The hotel does have potential and could be an even better venue if the management were to seriously consider the trends delinated in these reviews

title: Best value for a true 312 star central Seattle hotel
text:
We stayed the end of May and again in June May was a great valueAAA rate was 118night June was 134 but for a hotel of this type there was no better deal out there If you dont mind walking a quartermile its a great location because you can use the free tunnel bus to get around Or when not free all buses are 2 
Rooms are very spacious There are many more healthy choices for the free breakfast than for most places including real oatmeal Internet was great Room was a very spacious suite Bed was very comfortable
Ask for a room on the Southwest side and it will be quieter and youll have a view of the Space Needle 
They give you free membership at the 24hour fitness across the street so I took a fun aerobics class
We took Amtrak so I dont know about parking but its right off Interstate 5

title: Family vacation yes Business travel not so much
text:
I read a review of this hotel comparing it to being on an old cruise ship and Id say that is spot on Its huge old and very crowded For a family vacation the location just south of downtown seems very nice as its close to Millennium Park Shedd Aquarium Field Museum Adler Planetarium etc in addition the amenities are niceincluding the pool fitness center and snack shop
The bad aspects for a single HHonors Diamond traveler were as follows
I had to wait in line for 10 minutes checking in before anyone even spoke to me
I reserved a King bed room and was given a room with 2 FULL size beds
The Executive Lounge was a ZOO both mornings I visited Literally crawling with small children
I had to wait in line for 10 minutes in a huge line of people just to get a cab out of there
Bottom line this place is overcrowded old and dated and overall just a big hassle for a single business traveller I would consider going back with my family I suppose but not sure its ultimately worth it given the age and overcrowding of this place

title: GREAT place to stay
text:
To me Drury Inns are like Hampton Inns  theyre very consistent This one is one I could comment on more since I just stayed here for 11 nights It has a great location right on the northbound lanes of Rt 6 and right next to I10 The room was clean comfortable quiet There are a lot of choices for TV viewing though I didnt have much time for that I LIKE the fact that you can program the AC unit so that the fan keeps running even if the compressor shuts off Im one of those who needs white noise to sleep
Drurys provide breakfast and supper In my opinion breakfast is better because all of the normal breakfast foods are available  fruit cereals including hot oatmeal eggs pastries waffles pancakes etc etc Supper is a little less exciting in that its mainly hot dogs chips etc They do provide a basic salad of mainly lettuce Hot baked potatoes and tortilla chips are available too Free soda is also offered After supper popcorn is offered So at least there is something available for supper if you dont have alternate plans
One wierd thing  the toilet Where oh where are the normal toilets that flush normally In the mad rush to be green about everything many hotels have opted for whacko toilets that use less water The problem is that they often dont flush everything  and you wind up flushing 3 or 4 times to get everything down and use even more water and certainly more time 
One note of caution  This hotel is very easy to get to EXCEPT if youre coming toward it on Rt 6 from the north In that case follow these directions Get off Rt 6 on the two right lanes marked for I10 The exit ramp will crest a hill and then come down to the first light MAKE SURE you are in the third lane NOT in either of the left two lanes since BOTH of them are left turn ONLY I watched three people get tickets for going straight from lane 2 As soon as you go through this light get into the FAR left lane Go through the next light At the third light make a left from the far left lane as though entering the ramp for I10 but make a uturn back onto the northbound lanes of Rt 6 Get into the far right lane since the Drury will be just ahead past the first light Confused Sorry  Hopefully not

title: I hated the hotel
text: The Hotel is old and dirty They need to refurbish urgent and a nes staff The staff is very unfriendly and unpolite I never gonna stay at this hotel again and dont worth it i dont recommend for nobody The location is dangerous with a lot of homeless The bathroom seems like it was never clean with dusty and limo

title: Hip AND Helpful
text: Like you would expect from a W Hotel the vibe is very hip from the water cascading down the walls in the lobby to the dimly lit Living Room on the 7th floor When you enter you feel like you have stumbled into an exclusive party which can be a bit intimidating but the staff makes you feel welcome At the front door I was greeted by Eric who warmly welcomed me and escorted me and my bags to the checkin The front desk was also very friendly The room was on one of the higher floors and I had a great view of the city at night I loved the Bliss bath products and the bed was very comfortable I had a great meal at Blue Fin and the fitness rooms Sweat and Stretch though small were well equipped I would suggest they put in a clock The rooms are a little dark if that is a consideration but otherwise I give this place high marks

title: Classically Elegant Hotel with Superb Service
text:
We loved the Langham My partner and I stayed here last week during emergency construction on our condo and we were made to feel very welcome during a stressful time We booked a room at 335 and were upgraded to a beautiful junior suite overlooking Post Office Square  a very nice surprise
We found the hotel to be spotless and wellmaintained Our junior suite was nicely appointed and had a homely English feel Internet connection was fast and reliable 1295 a day  pretty typical for a secure connection Bathroom was spotless and smallish but the toiletries box with everything that one could have forgotten  priceless Only complaint is that there was too much junk on the already small desk
The bar In a word stunning Possibly the best hotel bar we have ever visited Huge crystal chandeliers comfy loungy seating stiff drinks for a price and polite bartenders  what more could one ask for
The health spa is smallish but well done and designed Pool area has lots of natural light and the workout rooms have brand new equipment and are again spotless Best of all no access fee
We easily recommend the Langham

title: Cold Shower
text:
I know that NYC is an expensive city but I believe there needs to be certain standards to uphold to justify charging upwards of 300 per night no matter what city
The fact that my wife and I had to put up with cold showers one morning is just plain ridiculous given the money we were paying We put up with the fact that the room was tiny the cable TV didnt work and the bathroom had absolutely nowhere to hang anything but seriously cold showers when youre being charged 300 a night Come on
Whats worse the response from the Front Desk was Well these things happen and there was no offer whatsoever of any compensation
NYC is a great city but was runied by my experiences in this hotel The fact that my sister got a great deal at The Warwick Hotel on W57th St via pricelinecom a wonderful 4 star establishment at almost half the price just goes to show how ridiculously overpriced this hotel is
Never again

title: Location Great  Hotel Not So Much
text: Location is the only thing that this hotel has going for it fabulous The staff was unhelpful except for concierge the room was shabby small and felt grungy Carpet stained furniture beat up sheets dingy restroom tiny Paper thin walls banging pipes noisy neighbors Yes it is true that you dont spend much time in your room when you visit NYC but you do have to sleep there and that wasnt a very good experience in this place

title: Its that nightclub or a hotel
text:
Its that nightclub or a hotel
Guest feels like an outcast among the people who came to the party
What is more important than the guest hotel or an ugly girl in high heels who came to dance
Bed very comfortable the rooms are clean
Design stunning
I do not recommend

title: A note of praise
text: I already reviewed this hotel as my favorite in downtown Washington DC but want to share a positive experience I had a couple of weeks ago Returning to the hotel one early evening I started to feel very sick because of food poisoning from a meal eaten elsewhere The next morning after a terrible night of pain and suffering I was dehydrated and in desperate need of a chicken broth to recuperate my exhausted body I called the front desk and was told that there were room services just for breakfast but considering my situation they would look into what they could do for me Twenty minutes later to my surprise they send to my room a complimentary chicken broth along with some ginger ale which made me feel much better and able to go see a doctor after a good rest This is what I call excellent customer service

title: If you like mold this is the property for you
text: Property smells like mold and is in poor condition You may want to think twice

title: Great base excellent staff
text: Stayed with family staff all very friendly and helpful clean rooms but very small bathrooms Great amenities fridgemicrowave in room gym Bar a bit pricey for food but great service

title: Roaches dirty sheets no hot water in showers
text: I have low standards but there was no hot water in the showers and our sheets had not been changed when we arrived So we slept on sheets and pillows with hair bugs brushing off small crumbs all night Cigarette holes are OK with me but not a strangers short and curlies Roaches had a field day in my room This is standard for 10 in Mexico but not for 55 per room in the USA But its a great convenient neighborhood not dangerous at all Loved the pawn shop downstairs

title: As expectedyou deliver worldclass customer service yet again
text: Give Jeff Crump a raiseresponsive professional attentivea real pro

title: Lovely clean and comfortable
text:
My teenage daughter and I spent 4 days and 3 nights in NYC last weekend After reading dozens of reviews and checking bedbug registry I chose the Wyndham Garden for our first ever stay in New York We were so pleased when we walked into our room It looked exactly like the picture on their website The bed was comfortable the linens were soft and clean The room was spotless I checked for bedbugs immediately and found none 
The staff is friendly and helpful The concierge gave us spot on advice for catching the correct subway and she booked our return shuttle to the airport The close proximity to both downtown and uptown subways made this an ideal location Our first night we walked to the Empire State building which is just blocks away There is a conveniently located major drugstore Starbucks and other food places nearby
The only minor complain I would have is the shower curtain is too short and if you are not extremely careful water gets all over the bathroom floor Otherwise I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again

title: Unless you are or think you are a rock star
text:
Stayed for one night And one night only in late August 
The hotel was still in renovation mode but I believed it has come a long way over the past few months I checked in late at night and initially I thought I was in a wrong spot It felt like a night club at the entrance No lobby very dim lighting and several dark suits greeted us Check in lobby turned out was on the 2nd floor and the process was quite smooth
What surprised me the most was the room It felt like they simply painted the walls white and rolled over some dark carpeting which looked worn already The bedroom was smallish and felt like I was sleeping next to the window since the gap between the bed and the windowwall was less than 6 inches The electric curtain was fun to play with but what surprised me the most was that light actually leaked out at the edges of the curtain So I was awaken by the morning light with the curtains closed before the morning call
Overall if you want to party late at night and enjoy the rockstar lifestyle the hotel is great But if you want to get some sleep in the morning or perhaps to grab a cab at the door of the hotel there was no cab in the morning avoid the morning traffic uptown you may be better staying in Soho or midtown

title: Great place
text:
Our family stayed here for one night on Jan12 2008 We had traveled to DC on Amtrak and walked from Union Station to the hotel on a nice sunny day But if it were a bad weather day we could have easily used the metro We were early so our room wasnt ready but the gentlemen at the front desk was very kind and told us to hang around in their very nice large lobby area and make ourselves a hot drink There was alot to choose from Several different kinds of fresh coffee gourmet teas chai and Hot chocolate The kids loved the large fish tank with beautiful exotic fish in it 
When we got our room we found it immaculately clean and very well appointed The beds were so plush and there was a mircoFridge That evening the very helpful front desk guy recommended the Chinatown Gardens restaurant in nearby China Town It was only a couple blocks away We were there early 430pm and already it was getting full Great food
That evening we purchased ice cream in the very well stocked little store the Hampton Inn has on the property
The only negative was a group of cheerleaders who were staying at the hotel for a convention All evening they were very loud and we didnt say anything But at 11 PM they were still being very loud so I opened our door and found them in the hall near the elevator doing their cheerleading They were even doing cartwheels in the hall I kindly asked them to stop and they did for a while Then about 30 min later they started again Someone had called security and within minutes a guard was there and it stopped
The next morning at checkout I had mentioned that our stay was wonderful except for the loud girls and I thanked them for sending a guard up to stop it This was not the fault of the hotel but the nice front desk guy took 20 off our already good room rate for the trouble
Great location too We would definately stay here again and recommend this hotel
Susanna in Greencastle Pa

title: Expected a Bit More from Flatiron Hotel
text: Had a one night stay at the Flatiron Hotel a boutique style hotel in New York City The address on 26th St close to 5th Avenue was its best asset as far as I was concerned It was close to where I needed to be as the next day my daughters final fitting at Kleinfelds bridal was within easy walking distance Madison Square Park Shake Shack and Eataly nearby which I like I thought the hotel was good but not great for these reasons upon walking into the hotel for checkin after 930 pm the ground floor entrance was interesting especially the exotic round cylinder fish tank running up the middle of the room However the band playing in the lounge which is open to the checkin area was absolutely blasting so unnecessarily loud We felt bad for the clerk who must have hearing loss by this time Thankfully checkin was so quick we got our room keys and quickly got out of there Security while traveling is important to me so I was disappointed that anyone could enter the elevators and go up to our floor without restriction Our room was practically across the elevator and the hallway was quite narrow in favor of a rather large size room two queen beds in this room with very high tray ceilings and ornate crown molding The beds while stylishly decorated especially the headboards with decorative curtains on either side were not as comfortable as Ive had for the price and the mattresses were hard but some like it that way Nice pillow selection and nice sheets The beds were platform beds with drawers for storage so I promptly banged my leg on the corner of the platform The rest of the furniture in the room in my opinion was cheap looking nothing special Im used to minibars but this one the clerk actually warned us about it upon checkin saying that you only have 20 seconds and if the sensor picks up that something is not in its place youre getting charged That includes a sensor for dry snacks on top which look like theyre in an ordinary tray  theyre not Needless to say didnt touch either One cup at a time coffee maker lousy coffee Theres a Starbucks a stones throw from the hotel much better There is a restaurant which I assume serves meals in the same location that becomes the lounge for entertainment in the evenings I didnt have any meals there The little extras that did not impress me was a TV in the mirror of the bathroom you had to shut the door to get in front of the sink so the only time you might want to watch it is while washing you face etc since you cant see it unless you are standing right in front of it The shower was very nice with a large rainshower head optional jets for lower body plenty of towels etc but no where to hang them except one hook on the back of the door Toilet small very low Air conditioning very good Robes in wardrobe closet Lighted buttons for do not disturb or to request housekeep Very large windows running the width of the room with motorized curtains Free wifi and nice large LG flat screen TV on the wall Clean room but definitely wouldnt say immaculate Seems like a lot of stuff that might appeal to some but when it came down to it I decided Ill stay somewhere different next time

title: Historical District Jewel with Excellent Location
text: My wife and I stayed at the Adolphus for business and personal travel We requested a regular and asked for an upgrade to a King Executive Suite upon arrival Unfortunately they were out of the King Executive Suite but we were upgraded to a 2 Doubles Executive Suite on a high floor The room was very spacious had a great view and everything we needed The furniture is old but that is keeping with the historical nature of the hotel The lobby and bars are clean well laid out and the service was very good particularly the valet guys who got to know us and our car very well Overall we would definitely consider staying at the Adolphus again next time were in downtown Dallas

title: A lovely boutique hotel
text: I was happy to find this small friendly hotel in a lovely part of Chicago The rooms compared favorably to those weve stayed in at much more expensive hotels with spare contemporary Zenlike furnishings The hotel staff was friendly and helpful I would definitely stay here again

title: Decent but not anxious to return
text:
This brandnew hotel is located close to 9th Avenue with the Port Authority bus station across the street and a number of adult shops just up the block There is ongoing construction on the corner which makes for noise whenever you leave the hotel plus you have to negotiate all the scaffolding It is not a pretty block 
However the proximity to the Hells Kitchen neighborhood is actually wonderful Many great restaurants on 9th and 10th Avenues and you can walk to the Hudson where you can rent bicycles walk along the riverfront or visit the Intrepid battleship museum in just a few minutes
The hotel itself is nice enough Rooms are clean and comfortable Staff though arent of the go the extra mile breed To be fair the lobby is tiny and it must be tough to manage guests in such a small space
In conclusion it is a decent place to stay We got a promotional rate and used points for a fournight stay so we got a very good value But if we werent using points I imagine wed use Priceline to stay somewhere better

title: Historic Building Outstanding Service
text:
I booked the Riverwalk Vista based on the other reviews I saw on Trip Advisor Coming in for business over several days the Riverwalk was even more than I had expected It may not be for everyone but for some it probably doesnt get much better 
The Riverwalk is a historic building which is about a 5 iron from the convention center and a chip shot from the river walk There are 17 rooms in a 3 story building overlooking downtown San Antonio The charm and magic of this hotel is all inside From the hardwood floors throughout along with rustic furniture in every room there is an immediate comfort feeling when you walk in
If you are looking for a Hilton or Marriott with bell hops concierge and restaurant inside this is not the place for you You are however given some things that are special Breakfast made each morning that is fresh and unique cookies at 300 and wine at 500 Joan and the rest of the staff are attentive and helpful Free internet is a plus and you can relax in the common area or find a cozy leather chair to camp out and read or work 
When you travel for work and get burned out of the same old cookie cutter chain hotel the Riverwalk Vista is a great change I

title: Nice Hotel good location
text: This hotel is in good position to visit SF just 2 blocks from Union Square Offer nice rooms good restaurant and good service inlcuding wine  cheese free from 5 to 6 PM I recommend for the people wants a central base to visit the city You can walk and see most of attractions excluding the Golden Gate to see it you need a taxi about 15 USD the race or the public bus just 2 USD I also recommend to park the car if you have one in the parkings surrounding the hotel which are less expensive then valet parking of BW Hotel it cost 31 USD

title: Perfect for the Family
text:
We stayed at this lovely hotel in Aug 06 with our family of
5 kids We had 2 suites which were adjoining and perfect for our family They were newly renovated and in excellent condition The bathrooms are new the beds are fluffy and fresh the staff was friendly and accomodating We had excellent service the Valet inparticular was so helpful with our car always going in and out in the city The location is excellent in the City right off of
Michigan Avenue Could not have had a better area in the city It was very residential but accessible to all THe pool was great for the kids and room service was always good We felt so fortunate to have found this great spot with our big family 
We would def go back

title: Could be betterbut not bad
text:
I traveled here for business and it was for an overnight stay Ive always checked in at night and the setting is always calm The lighting is relaxing in the main lobby and in the elevator The two times that I stayed here the interaction with the staff was soso I sensed that they were being nice to me because I was so nice to them but had I been unhappy with something that had to do with the hotel they wouldnt be very helpful or concerned They do have a place downstairs where you can checkin for your flight and print your boarding pass However internet and printerfaxcopier machine usage in the business center one computer and internet in your room come at a cost You can get free internet if you sit in the lobby with your computer but thats it I think thats kinda lame Why only put free internet in an area of your hotel 
The rooms that Ive stayed in were nice enough The last room I was in seemed smaller that the first time I dont know if it was because it was at the end of the hall or what but it felt a little compact 
I will compliment the shuttle drivers though They have always been nice and personable 
So basically it hasnt been great but it wasnt horrible for me So if you plan on staying here you may love it but you also may end up feeling like you could find somewhere better the next time your in town

title: A tad bit better than the reviews
text: Normally before I book a room I read the reviews Actually this hotel was a little better than the reviews For financial security I did not book online but went in and checked out the room prior to booking It was a little smelly but housekeeping sprayed air freshner and that took care of that If I had to complain about anything it would be the bathroom having no window Otherwise not bad for the money Ryan was great

title: It only has the location as its plus
text:
We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in Sept 12 Location wise it couldnt be better Youre just off 7th Avenue and Times Square If you dont care about the room sizes room service cleanliness and smelly hallways then this is for you
After visiting Vegas and Miami we were quite shocked by the tiny little rooms sharing a room is almost impossible 
Although the room was cleaned on a daily basis the staff always forgot to leave back either towels toilet paper and take the rubbish 
The elevator foyer on 6th floor is disgustingly smelly I would definitely recommend not staying on this floor 
The wifi is great and very fast but you have to log on every few minutes  by day 1 we knew the username and password of by heart 
Id recommend this hotel to young kids on a budget as it certainly does not have any luxury whatsoever

title: Small but OK for my needs
text:
We booked this hotel via a special package deal through a travel agent When my travelling companion and I arrived I found the hotel room to be small We were booked into room 751 right next to the elevators The room looked out onto the interior courtyard and contained two single beds a desk desk chair TV on a stand a night stand and another arm chair The closet contained a chest of drawers that did not fit in the main space The bathroom was small but clean and it had been updated 
All in all the room was clean and workable for our needs we spent most of our vacation out seeing the city not stuck inside especially since we paid 12000night as part of our package If I was into spending alot of time in the room I think that I would have found it too small 
Day 1 the TV remote didnt work very well and our window was broken despite being closed the upper pane kept slipping open At approximately 1 am we finally got frustrated with the window and called the front desk A Security Officer showed up after two calls to the front desk The gentleman was very nice but he was unable to fix the window We ended up having to change rooms at 130 am to room 951 It was a litlle frustrating but the new rooms windows were fine The evenings activities ended with the intermittent noise of toilets flushing and water running which we could hear very loudly through the walls 
Day 2 The shower had a partial glass pane that the extended only 2 feet from the wall and allowed the water to spray all over the floor The only way to prevent a flood was to shower in the corner all hunched over After that the hairdryer made alot of noise but it didnt give off any heat to speak of 
Day 3 and 4 we got used to the loud sounds of toilets and water and all in all the beds were confortable enough The staff members were nice and the hotel felt safe 
I would probably stay somewhere else in NYC if the price was right but for the money the Jolly was alright Oh and the Moonstruck diner across the street does offer a good relatively cheap especially for New York breakfast

title: Hotel Felix was cleanaffordablegood locationand professionable
text: When searching on line for hotels I found them very expensive Felix was perfect for vacationers on the go Very clean professionalgreat location for walkingand affordable Dont let the name influence your decisionif your looking for a quiet hotel without all the bells and whistles this would be a good choice for you

title: Amazing time out in the Big Apple
text:
You might be reading several negative reviews on this amazing NewYork hotel around here but I have to confirm the opposite We had a wonderful stay at the Barclay back in May this year in a King Executive room which was simply perfect 
Front desk staff was friendly and more or less helpful when I asked for a room located as high as possible my request got rejected saying room had already been assigned Concierge always smiling and offering their assistance
The lobby speaks for itself spacious elegant smelling of fresh flowers 247 As soon as you step inside you feel like you are back home 
The room was not huge but it was just enough for a NYC hotel room The bed was comfortable and I just loved their linen This is the point when staying at InterContinental or a cheaper chain makes a difference Our room was on the 11th floor if my memory is right facing Lex and the noise level during the night really wasnt as bad as many claim Bathroom was neat and clean and to my greatest pleasure there was a spacious wardrobe with plenty of hangers
Yes the tv is a bit dated but who wants to watch television when in NewYork Definitely not me
Location could not be better within walking distance to all sights you might want to see except for the Statute of Liberty but you can survive a ride on the metro Grand Central 5th Avenue Rockefeller Center Times Square all within 510 mins walk
I would surely recommend this fab hotel and cant wait for my next visit
See you guys at the Barclay

title: Classy yet comfortable
text:
The Fairmont is a classy hotel through and through without a trace of pretense The service at this hotel right from the doormen the front desk staff the concierge room service all the way to housekeeping was Aplus The hotel lobby is exquisite and a highlight for us each night was relaxing in the lively but not loud lobby Special thanks to Dante the lobby bartender who took some extra effort in bringing warm cookies for my son Speaking of
lively the hotel is in the very active Georgetown area and the walk tofrom Foggy Bottom Metro is not taxing at all We stayed in a room facing the hotel courtyard which had the plus of being cut off from the street noise We would highly recommend staying at this charming hotel

title: A true Landmark hotel in San Francisco
text:
I stayed here on a business trip and it was truly a pleasure The location was perfect albeit very busy The timing was a mixed blessing because it was right before Christmas The decor was breathtaking and all the surrounding shops were at the holiday best It was a feast for the eyes and senses Good thing I planned on walking to the Moscone Center and not driving anywhere It would have been nearly impossible to exit the hotel and get away from Union Square
I stayed in the new tower but had wanted to stay in the older part of the hotel The new tower had the newer amenities without losing the charm of the hotel Spacious room standard amenities and the room was very clean and quiet Big plus for work travel I also really liked their gym extra cost but it was a real gym with lots of room and equipment The tread mills had individual tis for those who do watch tv when they walkrun The only part that was a bit rough for me was walking through the beautiful lobby and checkin area to get back to my room in the tower after a work out
