Two things that I would like to point out as to why this hotel was excellent 1 I loved the fact that the hotel made a true effort to highlight its rich history with beautiful photographs and pieces presented like a museum display I really enjoyed taking my time reading about some of the pieces and looking at the Ansel Adams photographs The Clock is still in prominent display and the annual Christmas sugar castle at the entrance is every childs dream Lovely
2 The hotel provided a choice and true incentive for people to be green For the days that you dont request a sheet change they still make your bed you have a choice to add Westin points or a coupon to use at the Coffee stand in the lobby I felt that this was a good idea to give the customer something back for helping them and also the environment
I will absolutely stay here again

title: Great location nice hotel
text: I thought the hotel was great overall  although its an older hotel its keep up nicely and the staff were very helpful My only complaint is that they dont have an outdoor pool I didnt do enough research and really missed being able to enjoy the weather at my hotel Instead I went to Barton Springs

title: Nice location downtown Jacksonville fl  wyndham riverwalk
text:
We were going to Jacksonville to go to the zoo and wanted someplace close We selected the downtown are in Pricelines Name Your Own Price option picked 3 Stars and offered 70 to see what we would get We got the Wyndham Riverwalk Hotel It was normally 114 a night although other three star hotels in the area where asking quite a bit more The location was excellent right on the river near lots of restaurants and I95 Its part of the Riverwalk a pleasant place to walk or jog and see downtown Jacksonville The hotel is about 1015 minutes to the zoo Along the river there are places to take a water taxi over to Jacksonville Landing a semicircular mall with lots of shops restaurants and weekend events 
We normally stay at Travelodge or something similar and generally pay around 35 Aside from being much larger with a better location we found the Wyndham to be on a par with one of those motels It didnt seem like a three star hotel but considering the location neither did the price
We had heard that the hotel was in the process of being refurbished but apparently they hadnt gotten to our room yet The bathroom door was cracked and peeling the coat hanger was coming off the wall the carpet needed replacing and the closet door came off the track But the room seemed clean enough and had everything we needed including a closet full of extra pillows and blankets Our room was on the second floor over the bar in the lobby and we could hear the crowd at night but we didnt hear any of our neighbors and the bathroom blocked the bar noise well enough for us to sleep without complaint
Our window gave us a spectacular view of the air conditioning unit over the first floor but we hadnt asked for a room with a view A room on any higher floor would get a lovely view of the river and the many bridges and impressive skyline We also forgot to ask for a non smoking room and so ours smelled strongly of smoke just inside the door Im sure they would have moved us if we had asked the lady at the counter was friendly and helpful We didnt try room service or either of their restaurants We did go to the Tastings which is on their property to get a picnic for our room Also within easy walking distance along the river is The Chart House Ruths Chris Steakhouse and River City Brewing Company There is a pool which seemed clean and pleasant with a couple of comfy hammocks off to the side There is also a fitness center available but we stuck with the hammocks 
If you choose them I would advise asking for a room with a veiw or on the third or fourth floor

title: Incredible service plush hotel
text:
Just an amazing experience staying here From the minute I walked in past the buzzy upmarket bar and approached the front desk all the way through to checking out today it was perfect
Amazing customer service throughout including at the bar in the Ame restaurant the doormen
The room was fantastic  fourteenth floor views of the city and a sliver of the Bay Bride  incredible bathroom great facilities
And to top it off one night me and some of my fellow conference attendees were heading out to a bar and the doorman arranged for the hotel car to take us for free a 250k Bentley Unbeatable
So yes if you can afford the budget I wholeheartedly recommend

title: Loved it
text: My husband and I had a brief weekend trip to Boston last weekend and stayed at the HIlton in the Financial District What a lovely place The staff was very pleasant The rooms were very clean And the beds were heavenly The only thing I thought was a little over priced was the 38 a day parking Nevertheless we found that parking was expensive everywhere in Boston The location was perfect We were close to the Freedom Trail Quincy Market and many great places to eat Need I say more You cant go wrong with this Hilton Hotel

title: Well Worth A Visit
text: The Rancho Bernardo Inn is one of those resorts at which you need to stay for several days to unwind and enjoy the amenities Unfortunately I was there for only one night and that on business From my brief stay though I saw that it is a warm inviting resort consisting of a cluster of smallish buildings connected by winding garden paths There are numerous small fountains and tranquil gardens scattered throughout The lobby is an upscale rustic Southwestern decor with an open fireplace Very inviting and comfortable The property is reached by driving to the far end of a residential area meaning that there is no street traffic or noise The rooms are extremely comfortable and are well equipped for business travelers The inn automatically charges an all inclusive fee so you dont have to pay extra for wireless internet access in the room or throughout the property The hotels business center was not all that well equipped but the Rancho Bernardo town center with a Kinkos is nearby It was a great location for our small business meeting and I can see where a few days here could be very relaxing

title: Well treated at the Hyatt Regency
text:
Excellent service by all support staff I want to especially compliment the bell staff They went out of their way to help me and were extremely respectful All staff who answered questions on the phone or at any of the desks including the fitness center responded to me by name or asked how they might help me 
I asked for a room on a upper level and they made sure I had a view of the mountains I was there for a conference
Did not use the hotel eatery or bar since I wanted to venture out to the 16th St Pedestrian Mall I was somewhat disappointed in lack of variety and had trouble finding place to eat breakfast But did go to the Sante Fe Ave area and was immensely pleased with the art shops and galleries an up and coming area some of the locals are just now discovering too the clerks and staff at one of the restaurants and Chicano Center for the Arts near the Museum de la Americas were helpful and courteous You must go Take a bus or taxi to get there 
We did have trouble with getting prompt taxi service from that district back to hotel however The bus was actually faster and cheaper
Denver has friendly locals and Im sure you will find it appealing

title: Great Location  Nice Place to Stay
text: My sister and I took our Mother to see the Christmas decorations We loved the Affinia It had 2 bathrooms and a small kitchen It was perfect for us

title: Gem of the River
text: I was fortunate enough to spend three daystwo nights at La Mansion during Memorial Day Weekend 2003 The hotel was beautiful and the service was top notch Would recommend to anyone

title: Poor Internet Connections
text: Do not use this hotel if you expect consistent andor fast wireless internet connections from your room The only place in the whole hotel you can find that is right down in the lobby  everywhere else is spotty and slow Nice rooms but not many amenities They say you can get breakfast at the Holiday Inn but youll be climbing up a rather steep hill to get there

title: DTown Hustle
text:
Pros large clean modern room with Starbucks self serve coffee
Cons Inept front deskconcierge overpriced buffet slowunreliable wifi long hike from the room to casino and cab stand
Comment My confirmed rate was magically increased 30 at checkout I was forced to call the Hotel Operations Manager Joseph J Moultrup from home 12 hours later to rectify this egregious attempted ripoff Caveat travelers

title: Cant beat Riverwalk Location
text: I found this hotel to be very nice and the right in the heart of the action It was great walking everywhere Front desk staff was very friendly Our room was updated and beds and linens were extremely comfortable feel free to email me with any more questions

title: Great Location
text: Hotel is in a great location Depending on the room it could be a little small but definitely has character and charm

title: Everything Top Notch
text: I stayed here numerous times on business 8 weeks consecutively Rooms are nice amenities nice location within walking distance of many nice restaurants Staff extremely helpful very friendly and professional I would recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Very pleased
text: We stayed at this hotel overnight awaiting an early morning connection to Central America We traveled with our two young sons aged 5 and 7 We found this hotel easily accessible from the Houston airport with good signage within the airport to direct us to get there The hotel was clean good bed linens and comfortable beds The rooms were satisfactory in size The bathroom in our room was a bit dated but certainly very clean The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly Unfortunately in the room adjacent to us were guests who were up at 3am and making considerable noise likely in preparation for an early morning flight and we heard more from them than the airplanes outside My only real wish with this hotel is that they have some sort of display in the lobby to direct guests to the appropriate terminal for their flights as I imagine many stay overnight like us in transit to other locations Luckily for us we ran into a flight attendant at the train who looked up our flight for us and directed us straight away to the right terminal We didnt realize this was possible until we stayed at the Newark Liberty Airport Marriott on our way back and realized that they had such a display in their lobby and I thought what a great idea Overall we got value for our money the convenience especially when traveling from abroad with young children could not be beat and our room met our expectations We would stay here again

title: Best hotel customer service ever
text:
We stayed at the Magic Castle twice in the last year and have never experienced such incredible service before The staff is willing to fulfill all your needs everything from a knife for the kitchen to detergent for the laundry to directions to anything in LA 
We stayed in one of the one bedroom suites which was very spaciousabout 800 square feet It had a large living area dining area and smallish but functional kitchen The bathroom was nice and the king sized bed was very comfortable There was also lots of storage
The pool area is very nice and the staff will regularly bring you popsicles The continental breakfast is absolutely delicious and is supplied by a local bakery 
It is within walking distance of the Hollywood Walk of Fame and Magic Castle shows are free to guests although unfortunately we were not able to take advantage of this

title: Renovated rooms but far from
text: I stayed for 6 nights at the Park Central Hotel as I had it recommended from a friend But it did not live up to my expectations My room was suppose to be newly renovated but that was really difficult to see The air condition was an old larming machine in the corner and the bath room was really torn down The room was rather dirty and although I am used to various standard at hotels worldwide I felt that paying close to 300  per night you should at least expect a clean room When complaining at the front desk the reaction from the rather unfriendly personnel was negative and I had to remain in the room Attemps to improve cleaning seemed to fail or this was just the standard of the hotel My room was located at 18th floor and since only one levator was in work during that week you had wait for up to 20 minutes to get up or down The only really positive thing to say about this hotel is the location  close to Central Park

title: Good hotel great location
text: The St Giles Tuscany is a good hotel with a great location Its dated  and feels very much like a W hotel which it was that never got updated since the late 90s which it likely hasnt That said the rooms are huge the beds are comfortable and the staff is extra fun and friendly Located in Midtown near Grand Central you are never more than a quick walk cab or subway ride away from anything in the city Overall the price was right  and although nothing blew me away I would stay here again

title: Very Nice Accomodations Clean and Convenient
text: First of all I am a Returns member and generally stay at a LaQuinta 34 times a year The DIA location is by far one of the nicest We stayed there three years ago and our experience both times was the samegreat You cannot beat the location and accessibility There is a Ruby Tuesday restaurant next door and the surroundings are very clean and upscale The the hotel itself is very clean and everyone was so friendly and helpful Very nice facilities including indoor pool and spa The LaQuinta included breakfast was great and was available at 400am We chose this location the same as three years ago to cap our weeks vacation in Colorado before flying home the next morning From walking out the door of the LaQuinta we were dropping our car off at the auto rental in less than 10 minutes We will certainly be back

title: It was just what we needed
text:
My two teenage children and I stayed at the Magic Castle for 4 nights after reading lots of different hotel reviews I was very happy with our decision as the staff were friendly and very helpful 
We had a one bedroom suite and my only comment would be that because the suite was right in the corner  opposite the reception it was a little dark It was not easy to keep the blinds open as the table outside is where breakfast was eaten 
The rooms were spacious and the kitchen great as we could prepare or bring in what ever we needed The hotel is well located and the staff helped with directions on how to get to anywhere you wanted and would take time to explain things
I would have liked to know about the ability to visit the show at the Magic Castle when I booked as it requires formal attire which I did not have with me but would have bought if I had known Ask about this if you are thinking of going
The breakfast was good and it suited me that I could take it to our room for the kids as they did not rise as early as me I would definately go again

title: Super Accommodation
text: We stayed at the Embassy Suites while attending the Liberty Bowl over New Years Memphis treated us right everywhere we went The hotel was great in every way All of the staff had a very positive attitude and were very helpful The property was centrally located to many events in the Memphis metropolitan area Especially noteworthy was the detail by management for their complimentary breakfasts and evening managers receptions The service and quality were first rate Freddie the managers reception host was beyond superb We heartily recommend the Embassy Suites and will stay there again on our next trip to Memphis

title: ServiceSmiles  Efficiency
text: First visit to NYstayed at the Hotel for 4 days each one better than the last So close to everything all you have to do is walk out the door Desk StaffHousekeeping and 1605 Brasserie Staff  Food excellent We dont usually eat in Hotel Restaurants but because the breakfasts and staff were so warm and welcoming and we were so tired our last night in NY decided to give it try and we are so glad we did it was a fabulous end to our trip Our server Joan was so knowledgeable about both the food and the wine it ended up being our best dinner in NYThanks so much Crowne Plaza Staff for making our first trip so memorable

title: Tiny notsoclean room that smelled of cheeseburgers
text: NYC is a difficult city to find an affordable easy place to stay but I wouldnt stay here again The room was tiny it smelled bad and apart from the room being painted like ALice in Wonderland it really had no charm

title: Amazing Hotel Great Location
text:
I bought a deal off of LivingSocialcom I travelled with my dad to Chicago so we could watch my sister compete in the MIC gymnastics championships The Raffaello hotel is in a great location A little off a side street so all the main traffic isnt in front of the hotel All you have to do is walk a block and you are in front of the John Hancock Center and a big intersection of Michigan Avenue We arrived early around 1200pm ish and nothing was ready as I did request a higher floor So the front desk staff was amazing and held our bags for us as we walked around for a few hours We came back around 3 and our room still wasnt going to be available until 430500 However they did say they had a handicap room available immediately on lower floor To be honest I was exhausted and so I said we would take it GREAT IDEA Our room had plenty of extra space to move around in My dad fell asleep as soon as he laid down on the bed I took a nap too The beds are very comfy with the nice thick but soft pillows Something I noticed was the fanair conditioning It was on my side of the room and I turned it up full blast and it hardly made any noise at all This was a huge plus for meThere were plenty of outlets for me to charge up all my electronics after the flight and before the meet I enjoyed playing with the iHome and my iPod touch  The bathroom was large I dont know if it is like that in all the rooms or just because we had a handicap room The shower was my absolute favorite It is a rainfall shower head but it still had plenty of pressure unlike others I have experienced 
I didnt try out the barrestaurant or anything else really in the hotel as we were there for only one night I did think the cool water sitting out for anyone was a great idea though and the beautiful flowers in the lobby The nice guys at the door helped us get to a couple places we were looking at walking to and quickly getting us a cab when we needed it 
Overall I will most definitely be going back Thank You to the staff at the Raffaello

title: Nice newly renovated hotel adjoining LAX
text: Courtyard hotels are not everyones cup of tea but I enjoy their pragmatic design built with the business traveler in mind and overall comfort This Courtyard has just completed a major renovation and it is a fresh and attractively remodeled hotel The colors are new and vibrant Rooms have nice amenities staff was very friendly and attentive Our room was very quiet and we had a good but short nights sleep Didnt eat here so couldnt comment on this Free shuttle leaves for LAX every 15 minutes a very helpful feature Parking is very limited and expensive if you bring a car as its limited and all valet but if you just want an overnight before heading out early in the morning this is an excellent choice

title: Beautiful New Property
text:
Great brand new property Cool design trendy rooms fun decor Comfortable beds spacious rooms nice view of the river
THe nicest Renaissance Ive seen hands down
The only downside to this property is the location there isnt much around the hotel Be prepared to take a cab if you need a drugstore or anything that you cant get at 711

title: New York New York So good they named it twice
text:
Now as an Englishman in New York I understand there are several protocols one has to observe According to Sting I dont drink coffee I drink tea my dear  and I like my toast done on one side 
Now forgive me dear reader but who the blue heck has toast only done on one side I have been an Englishman abroad many a time from Nairobi to New York to Naples and not once  ever  have I met anyone who likes one sided toast Strike One for your travel advice Mr Sting you will be deleted from my iPod playlist post haste
The only other travel advice about travelling to New York is from the Jeeves and Wooster TV series where Jeeves adopts a voice of grave concern and advises poor old Bertie Wooster that gentlemen do not wear straw hats in the Metropolis sir Well I dont own a straw hat either so Im safe on that score
Straw hatless and sans toast I was still none the wiser about what to do when travelling to New York so in true hopeless man style I devolved responsibility to my girlfriend who triumphantly announced over breakfast one morning that we were to stay in the Times Square Hilton I was so excited I nearly choked on my both sides done toast 
It was a lovely midAugust day in New York City when we arrived As you arrive through the double doors you are hit by the efficient air conditioning and have to do a strange dogleg around the corner and up a lift to the mezzanine level where the Reception Desk is situated but its all well signposted Its also the location of quite a fun looking bar but sadly the view from the bar windows is of the even more fun looking New York City so apart from one drink I cannot comment on the bar as I was much too busy in the City that never sleeps 
In case you were wondering the drink was an American beer called Budweiser and very nice it was too It made me feel so American I wanted to invade a small country and install democracy in it While eating a chili dog
Anyway  being a bit of an American virgin I was quite unprepared for the rocket ship speeds of your lifts elevators to my room and being on the 34th floor I was expecting this to take quite a while It does not You are propelled at high speed towards the sky in American lifts 
I sincerely believe that in all high rise Hilton Hotels after you have pressed the button for your floor a little voice should announce 321Blast Off I would willingly pay extra money for this feature However if you are lazy and press the button only for the next floor up the little voice should announce your weight thus shaming you into exercise I digress 
Anyway after my exciting rocket shiplift ride I found my way to the hotel room with my long suffering girlfriend by my side In true Hilton style it was extremely nice and very comfortable There was a jolly nice bathroom in white Two Queen Beds were in the middle of the bedroom and there was a television with a wide range of channels For any British people you will be pleased to know that BBC World News and BBC Entertainment both feature should you suddenly need to feel all British and watch Doctor Who suddenly
Room TV channels and straw hats aside what is really great about this hotel is the location If its your first time to New York City like me this IS the place to start exploring from If you go out of the front entrance you are literally immediately propelled into the throng of New York and VERY exciting it is too All the big attractions are only a short distance walk away there is a tube sorry subway station round the corner where you can get to anywhere else and there are plentiful taxis in the street as well
So in a nutshell what do you get by booking here Well you get some lovely staff the concierge in the lobby was excellent in helping me find a New York City Helicopter Tour a super room to the usual Hilton chain high standard and all the excitement of living in the very heart of New York City 
New York New York  so good they named it twice Based on that logic the hotel should really be called the Hilton Hilton Youll have a lovely time 
Right Im off to listen to Alicia Keys and put myself back in a New York State of Mind Much better than Sting his advice was rubbish

title: Comfy Hotel
text: Stayed here for a week on business Rooms were clean and the bed comfortable Everything was in good repair The staff was extremely friendly and helpful Would return here again Gym was a bit lacking

title: The Best Front Desk in Town
text: The Baldwin is a nofrills immaculately clean hotel with simple rooms and baths and a fabulous location Its pretty plain and the public areas are almost nonexistent What sets it apart is the staff especially the unfailing kindness and efficiency of the wonderful Chester Im sorry I dont know his full name at the Front Desk The clientele is international and many folks are there for longer stays so the vibe is relaxed and friendly without that forced BB jocularity Its a great value

title: Who knew
text: I had no idea that this fabulous and affordable hotel was located in the heart of it all The staff were very friendly and the room was perfect No real frills but everything was just what I needed and wanted Clean rooms soft comfy bed spalike shower beautiful view of the city internet and a gym Best of all  it was affordable Highly recommend this hotel

title: Dont stay here if you can help it
text: This is without a doubt the worst conference hotel I have ever stayed in and I have been to a lot of conferences The beds were lumpy and uncomfortable The bathroom had the usual sign about saving the world by not changing the linens every day but there were NO towel racks upon which to hang said linenson the one wall where there should have been a rack there was a picture of a cactus There was exactly one hook next to the tub I am a Hilton Honors member and as such I get free bottled water just for being a member I am also a Hyatt Gold Passport member which got me a bottle of water in the room that was mine for only 600 in Phoenix in June My membership was also supposed to get me a paper which I never got The service in the restaurant upstairs was pretty bad we ordered at 700 but didnt get our dinner until 830 at which point I was ready to eat my napkin But the worst was the temperature in the room When we got there it was in the 80s and we couldnt get the thermostat to work we called and asked them to fix it When we got back from our meetings later that evening the temperature was in the low 60s and still going down with the fan on highit was like being in a meat locker I called at 9 to ask them to fix it then called at 930 and again at 10 Finally at 1015 I lost it and called once again asking for someone to come immediately At 1030 someone finally came to fix the thermostat The only thing good I can say about the hotel is that it is convenient to the conference center Period

title: My 1st Pick when I stay in the city
text:
Love the location near a great New York bar Aces a very nice restaurant Brick Saha is quite fabulous food also and the BevMo down the street doesnt hurt either
Lived in SF for a while and used to pick hotels in the neighbourhood that I lived in
But now whenever I visit it is the hotel carlton that gets my business
Friendliest staff nice size rooms anything you might need is easily accessible

title: what a great place to stay
text: This hotel has just undergone remodeling At first I was set back by the detached buildings but by the second night they grew on me and I enjoyed my stroll down the sidewalks to my room Its like staying at a resort They had a complimentary managers reception that included beer  wine and a buffet of real food Rooms are like small apartments and they have flat screen TVs in the bed rooms Breakfast was included in the room price and it really hit the spot with real food again not just cereal bagels and waffles but oatmeal eggs sausage and potatoes Also people who stay there seem more social that most places I go They seemed to stay long in the lobby area with their laptops to do casual work or just be there to watch the community TVs

title: Worked well with our kids
text:
I booked this hotel thru priceline and got a rate of 175 per night for 2 nights which I thought was wonderful The day before we went I called to see if we could get a rollaway in our room since we had 3 kids Luckily I called because they had us booked in a room with one queen bed not good The man I spoke to said he switched us to a room with 2 queens but no room for a rollaway This would work since our 3 yr old usually ends up in our bed anyway so we would just start that way and our 6 and 9 yr old boys could share a bed 
We walked with our luggage from Penn Station and halfway there wished we got a cab not realizing it was so far miscounted a couple of avenues when we were planning Promised our kids we would get a cab back when it was time to check out We got to the Shelburne at 1pm to stowe our luggage but they let us check in Unfortunetely the room change wasnt really made and they still had us in one queen Victoria at the desk was very very helpful After checking a couple of rooms for us we checked into a roof top room that are normally not available in the summer because of their bar But the winter they were perfect with a view of the river and empire state building We ended up with a king and a rollaway bed The older boys switched between the rollaway and a soft lounge chair with ottaman Not the best if the kids were older but worked fine for us 
Loved NY City but wont go again at Christmas since all the lines were crazy We grew up near by Long Island and my husband used to work in the city His funniest comment was that it was nice that the city was now so clean and low crime but because of that more people came in and it was too crowded for him to enjoy
We recommend this hotel highly

title: WOW downtown NY location
text: If you are visiting 911 memorial this is a perfect hotel to stay in The hotel faces the entrance to the memorial and be sure to sip at the lobby bar or even better the outdoor balcony for a superb view of One WTC and the other upcoming WTC towers Inspite of the the on going construction which doesnt really bother me the area is bustling with tourist and within minutes of Soho and lower east side The WTC subway station is minutes away nearby century 21 or the Lexington line is a couple of blocks on broadway The 5 th floor lobby is ideal and feels isolated from the main tourist traffic and 911 memorial crowd unlike the other nearby hotels The wonderfulspectacular rooms are fairly designed and seems normal with enclosed bathroom unlike some of the other Ws We had a corner room facing south east The service is just about average and somewhat cold at the front desk but that didnt really bother me since Im not a high demanding guest and dont expect too much in terms of service and attention However some may find it to be rude and unattentive At night ther area tend to be on a quiet side after the memorial closes Nevertheless you could gawk at the brightly lighted 1WTC tower from the lobby bar balcony The lobby has a good selection of costly drinks and nibbles we we fortunate to have a package deal which offered complimentary drinks Heading out to nearby soho is about a 1520 min walk or a short subway ride I give this 5 Just for the location and property but 4  for the service Would consider staying here again when in NYC Note if visiting the memorial  make sure to reserve free online tickets for designated time slot entry to the memorial

title: A gem in the heart of the city
text: The hotel is a real gem Bostons Back Bay is just out the front doorstep It is located across the street from the Boston Public library and a few steps from Copley Square and the subway stop The room I stayed in was compact but had everything I needed Classical music from the stereo system in the room greeted me as I entered which I thought was a nice touch It was clean stylish and quiet The hotel provides tea and coffee in the evenings and a light breakfast in the mornings Computers are available for internet access and wifi is available for those who have their own wifi compatible laptops The hotel staff were very accommodating pleasant and informative And the price cant be beat in such an expensive location it is a great hotel for the cost Anytime Im in Boston in the future The Charlesmark is where Im going to stay

title: Perfect Location for Partying and Sightseeing Great Value
text:
We looked for ages for a Manhattan hotel within our budget that wasnt icky This one came in on a good deal through Expedia and we jumped at it Four Star at 3 Star Prices Lovely Hotel nice rooms all as described on their web site
The only reason I have marked down the Cleanliness is that the mirrors in the lifts were a bit smeared
The only reason I have marked down the Rooms is that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room but hey walking around the block takes you to a Dunkin Donuts Starbucks Subway and an Independent Deli open 24 hours
The only reason I have marked down the service is that the staff did once allow their tension with each other to show in front of guests at one point but this was an isolated incident and overall we were very pleased with the service

title: Excellent Hotel Perfect Location
text: Efficient friendly staff Clean room central location Cheryl in housekeeping was fantastic Will stay there every time I go to New York

title: Broadway Plaza Hotel
text: A very good small inexpensive hotel near everything and with easy access to the subway

title: great hotel awesome location
text: This hotel was a pleasant surprise The new room are small but very clean The location is two blocks from Times square the only problem we had was trying to control the heat The location was quiet at night

title: A warm place in NYC
text: Its really surprise me that people think this hotel is dirty and unfriendly We stayed this hotel for 3 weeks and we really got great time there The staffs there are really nice and like Patrick he asked me hows everything could I got anything for you I can feel I was staying in a happy comfortable and warm environment There was a man clean the kitchen every morningevery morning I just tried to prepare our breakfast and he also clean the bathroom also Theres a lady clean our room every one or two day If we need towels cups hairdryer matcheswe just went to the counter in first floor and we would get everything we need Therere some crazy people next to useg smash the door drunk people and fight and we just need to call the counter and we would get the peace in around 5 mins I had a fabulous time therebudget rate convenient traffic good living environment  cozy room and nice staffs Stayed this hotel still a very good memory for us

title: 1st class attention
text: We stayed at the Argonaut Hotel for two nights in a queenqueen room The room was spacious and extremely clean We had a wonderful view from our room of the Golden Gate Bridge All the staff we encountered at the Argonaut were professional and attentive The wine hour is not to be missed I would definitely stay here again

title: Inexpensive Heaven
text: I got in at the Hilton Garden for an incredible price below 80 on hotwire It was wonderful the bed was a thick cloud I had more pillows than I could ever use and a giant TV After wondering Philly all day it was exciting to get back to that comfortable bed

title: Wonderful Customer Service
text:
I traveled with girlfriends to The Hamilton Crowne Plaza for a weekend trip in May It was absolutely wonderful Our important booking factors were price point and location to restaurant entertainment and Historic sites Both were great and true to what I had previously researched The customer service at the Hotel blew me away Check in was quick easy and so very nice The front desk agent greeted me with a smile and actually made conversation with me It was wonderful Our room was exactly how it was advertised online and in reviews Everything worked really well although the AC took some time to get going The Concierge Innocent was the most customer oriented person I have ever met and I am in the business He made suggestions for dinner drinks and late night activities He called ahead to get us reservations on a Friday night at a really fantastic restaurant He even went as far as to send us drinks at the restaurant 
I know I mentioned it above but I work for a 4 diamond luxury property and I took notes from this Hotel for my own property I am used to amazing service with quality behind it and that is exactly what we experienced all weekend I cant rave about the hotel enough Definitely a wonderful place for friends and families I would bring my husband and young daughter back as we were in a great location to walk to some of the DC sites The only minor problem was the smell of sewer that ran through the lobby occassionally It could get pretty strong but wasnt bad enough to deter us from anything

title: Great hotel
text:
We stayed for four nights in late July Our trip was a special occassion  belated honeymoon  and we recieved an upgrade to a club level room and chocolates and honey in our room on arrival lovely touches 
Our room was sizeable with a huge and extremly comfortable bed and great TV which had loads of movie choices 
The food in the club lounge was perfect  lots of fresh fruit for brekkie a great cheese selection for lunch and oatmeal cookies that Im still having withdrawal symptoms from
Staff were extremly professional and friendly from reception to doormen
The location is also very convenient Its about a seven minute walk to union square easier on the way to the Square than back as the hotel is on nob hill giving you a free workout while walking back and just a block from the historic cable cars which take you to Fishermans Wharf on one side and Chinatown on the other
Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to friends

title: My fourth stay and Ill be back
text: The Palomar Dallas is one of the most comfortable hotels I have stayed in combining modern luxury an excellent position friendly and helpful staff and every facility you could want from pool to spa to free wifi and courtesy tea and coffee This was my fourth stay within a year and I will definitely be back

title: Fantastic Stay
text:
I havent stayed at many Hyatts but I selected this hotel because of its location its right across the street from the convention center The service was amazing I was greeted when I arrived by a lady in a suit who directed me into the hotel I was then greeted by another woman who walked me up to the counter and checked me in right away 
My room was spacious and very clean with a modern dcor The universal design of the room made it perfect for wheelchair users and those who are not But heres what sold methey have a vegan breakfast option on the menu A delicious breakfast sandwich with grilled veggies served on a grilled wheat bagel I ordered that hash browns and a side of soy milk for my inroom coffee and I was set until dinner 
The staff at the concierge desk was very helpful recommending places to eat They have an entire list of vegan restaurants but also recommended other great spots that happened to be veganvegetarian friendly Have them reserve for you and they may have the folks send over a little predinner treat I ended up eating at Zengo based on their recommendation and enjoyed one of the best dining experiences ever 
I highly recommend this hotel

title: Only if youre tiny
text: Everyone was very nice but the room was the smallest Ive ever stayed in and the air conditioner probably the noisiest Ive ever heard Everything is tiny  you need to go single file to get into the tiny lobby Not for me

title: Loved the Blake amenities and location
text:
Got a killer deal with their February promotion of 129night 
Was a little concerned with some of the previous reviews about noise and such but they appear to be corrected as my stay was relaxing
The room was spacious the king sized bed was extremely comfortable the ipod docking was a nice bonus and the walkinshower even had the same Grohe Rainshower head that I have at home
The Custom House restaurant which is attached to the hotel is a little pricey but I highly recommend it
Great location and excellent value

title: Clean Room Small Good Service
text: Stayed here on business and it was the best I could get for our company rate The location is pretty good The staff is friendly and helpful The room was clean but small and old Nice updated tho like a flatscreen tv and good wifi Id give them a 3

title: Very helpful staff and very nice hotel
text: The staff really went out of their way for you Very helpful and friendly The room was a bit small but very nicely done with all the amenities The style is definitely an updated old fashioned but comfortable The gym is great and there is free WiFi Central location for just about everything you want to do in Boston with a T stop right nearby and lots of shopping around the corner

title: Nothing special
text: The great advantages are location and price Its located in the heart of Theater District a few steps from Time Square The price is fair for a well located hotel with a standard room They dont have free wireless internet I paid a fortune to use internet and print a sheet I would go back there and recomend to a friend

title: Nice for a Super 8
text: Was in town for business and chose a economy hotel right off the Interstate As far as I knew Super 8 was the best in class for economy hotels I was pleasantly surprised by the condition of this hotel as well as the room during my stay The property was brightly lit and clean The room was also nice and clean and the bed was ok The breakfast was as expected for a economy hotel The staff was courteous and helpful The rooms are on the outside so my car was right outside my room and that made my stay even more convenient If needed I will be back to stay here

title: Loved it Recommended mostly
text:
We had a wonderful week in San Francisco and really enjoyed the Handlery I cant imagine a more perfect location and its really a nice place We had a club room and had hoped to get a balcony but they werent available when we got there However our room did have a giant sliding glass door that we really enjoyed We appreciated the coffee maker and little fridge toowe bought fruit at the Ferry Building farmers market and we kept it cooled We didnt use the robes or the shoeshine machine but they were a nice touch Also they had a scale in the bathroomguess its to keep us honest with all the wonderful food in the city 
As I said there were just a couple things that keep me from giving the Handlery a 5 We had a few issues with the staffall of whom were very friendly but generally not that helpful First I had done a lot of research planning our trip and emailing different hotels to see about getting a smoking room The Handlery was one of the few places that indicated that it was likelyno promisesbut likely As suggested we emailed a day ahead reminding them of the request When we arrived we asked again and the clerk said nope none available It hadnt been promised but it sure didnt seem like they made any attempt either We were there a little early and Id have felt better if he had at least been willing to check to see if a smoking room might be cleaned and readied lateranythingif hed just acted like he cared at all but it was just no We might well have ended up choosing the Handlery anyway but a lot of the decision was made because they indicated we could probably get the smoking room and after being there Im guessing that they have very few available Noteon the positive side smoking was allowed at the pool area which was just a level down and very near our room so my brother didnt have to go out and huddle in the hotel doorway like so many other people we saw at many of the nonsmoking properties 
The other issue was with the internet connection We didnt go to SF to surf the net or to work but we both had a couple loose ends to take care of for work My brother travels for a living so has to connect from hotels wherever he is so he knew that the problem was not just his computer or his settings like they implied Longstoryshort they ran us around for several days before a bellman finally admitted that most people had to take their laptops elsewhere and advised us that there was free wifi at nearby Union Square We never found out if it was a temporary problem or they just dont actually have internet available but if they had been honest from the start we could have made other arrangements Once again the staff was extremely pleasant but their lack of honestly caused both a lot of frustration and a few problems 
Tip For the club rooms the hotel garage entry on OFarrell is actually much handier than the hotels front door Just a doorway down from there is a little print shop called Cyber Copy where they have internet access available The guy has a bunch of computers already set up and online so no bothering with special logins or passwords to get connected He just scribbles your time on a scrap of paper and you bring it back when youre done and you can even get pages printed if you need And hes cheap tooI think it was 8 an hour broken down every 15 mins For people who just need to check their emails occasionally its probably a better deal than paying for internet in your roomeven if you can get it to work
A note about the noise Id seen complaints in this forum about noise at the Handlery and many other hotels night I thought these must be sensitive folks from quiet towns or burbs not used to city sounds After being there I got it It is NOISY at night A couple evenings after midnight someone started playing music on the street corner below Another night a fight broke out and went on and on until the cops showed up with sirens blasting Complaints about the garbage collections are legit too I thought people posting that were just nitpicking but this is one loudmother operation For us it usually started around 1AM and went on for about an hour while city workers pick up trash cans left out on the sidewalkswith the perpetual safetybeepers blaring clangingbanging and noisy mechanical lifts jamming it into the trucks working their way block by block We survived I was able to tune it out reasonably easily after the first night Maybe the trick was all the walking we did and climbing up  down those nearvertical streets so we were dead tired by bedtime But Id advise anyone who is sound sensitive to pick up a whitenoise machine or even just run a loud fan to help tune down the decibels We were on the 3rd floor but I think it was loud enough that even the higher floors might get their share of the noise Once again this isnt an issue with the Handlery any more than any of the other hotels in the area Its the tradeoff to be in a such a great location 
Overall despite the few issues with the staff we really did enjoy staying at the Handlery and our entire trip We would definitely stay there again It would be a great choice for most people unless you are a smoker and you absolutely object to stepping out to smoke or you need to use your computer in the room Bottom line was that it was very clean and so comfortable after being out exploring the city all day Not luxurybut it more than met our needs 
One last suggestion Skip the Daily Grill attached to the hotel and eat at the Irish bar next doorforgot the name now Its not fancy at all but theyve got very good comfort food meat  potatoes and more They serve late and are very reasonably priced We give it a big thumbs up

title: Average experience but some housekeeping issues
text:
I stayed here for a business trip recently and found this to be fairly typical for an Embassy Suites If anything set this visit apart it was the staff at the front desk and the breakfast buffet These employees went out of their way and were much appreciated 
I did notice that there were some housekeeping issues iffy bathroom nightstand with sticky rings Otherwise Id say the experience was fine and generally what Id expect from an Embassy Suites

title: good clean and inexpensive
text: stayed there for few days prior to convention in san franroom was clean no funny odorsconfortable bed and yes waffles waffles wafflesthe free breakfast buffet was better than most hotels eggscereal numerous kinds of pastriesand yes a waffles machinewhich i took part of everyday the staff more than hepful with all my needsIE directionscomputer usage and overall knowledge of the area and its attractionswould definately stay here again oh i didnt mention the pricesexcellentcall hotel for unadvertised pricingthank you staff at bw lamplighter i know you guys read these sometimes great job keep up the great work brett

title: Older propertynear airportcruise ships across street
text: I stayed at the HIOTB in March for a convention On the plus side was a free airport shuttle on the minus side it is very near the airport Continually heard the coming and goings of airplanes Also the South Tower where I stayed is right across the street from the Cruise Ship dock Not a problem if you are coming or going on a cruise ship except for the occasional times that the ships blow their horns Finally I was there during an unseasonable cold spell with strong winds The sliding glass door in the room was so decrepit that the wind blew right in all around the opening Kept the room so cool I had to put the heat in the room up to 76 The property has CLEARLY seen better days The neighborhood if you can call it that is not inviting and it is a bit of a hike to the trolley around parking lots etc that are not very friendly at night Plus side the restaurantbar Elephant and Castle Pub has a nice selection of beers and a good happy hour special imported draft beer for 425 Skip buying anything in the gift shop fairly well appointed but there is a CVS Drug store 3 blocks away on ASH street BTW why did I choose this hotel It was the only one that would honor the government per diem when I did my registration for my meeting

title: Place to Stay in the Capital
text:
The JW Marriott did not disappoint We flew into Regan Airport only a 1520 dollar cab ride We arrived at noon and with checkin at 400pm wondered However we got our Kingsize guest room right away and what a view It was fabulous The city view was crazy staring at the momument right in the face Excellent Room was good all the usual with a Marriot property Amenities were spa like very nice Beautuful lobby flower arrangements throughtout the spell of Orchards was incriedable 
Close to and within walking distance to all the Simthsonian Museums Steps away from the White House if you want a tour you must arrange that from your home weeks to months in advance check out the DC website for info All the musuems are free within the Institution which was great Including the National Zoo a must see if you are an animal lover It was great
Old Town Trolley was a great way to see the sights if you did not have a car We actually did it twice One line took you to all the momuments the next line transfer over to the Arlington Cemetry and another line that takes you to the zoo and Georgetown We did them all great way to see it is a hop on off trolley with free maps and fansit was hot so we needed them
We were only there for 35 days so really not enough time to see all the musems although we did get to see all the monuments and the Ford Theatre tour that includes the theatre and house where Abraham Lincoln was assassinated A must see for sure
All in all a great trip to the Capital

title: Super swanky downtown hotel
text: I stayed here for one night on business in NYC The hotel lobby is one of the most architecturally interesting in a very modern trendy sense places that Ive seen I enjoyed the bar later at night with colleagues and a great breakfast in the morning The service at the bar was excellent but a little slow at breakfast The room was comfortable though of course small but its downtown Manhattan Comfy bed and a good shade to get the room very dark despite lights outside One downside to the room was some construction noise from Ground Zero but on the other hand it was quite amazing to sit by the window and see the ongoing construction at the site

title: Good hotel in a great location for sightseeing
text:
The main plus point for us was the location of Nine Zero Right in the middle of Boston on the freedom trail and close to 2 subway stations and Faneuil Hall which was great for restaurants and souvenir shops
The hotel itself was fine for a few nights stay The room was a good size with a great mini bar the prices were steep though so we used the Seven Eleven a few doors down instead The bathroom was ok clean and the shower worked fine Bed was comfortable too
The wine reception held each night at 5pm was good for a free glass of wine which we took to our room as the lounge area was full so get there early if you want to sit in the lounge
The restaurant was expensive but the food was good and had a good atmosphere but we preferred to eat out in Boston anyway where it was usually half the price
Our stay was fine and for the price was good value and again the location couldnt be beaten

title: Nice Hotel and helpful people
text:
We stayed 3 nights on a business trip The hotel was chosen when we booked our trip from our European office and we looked at the internet website first
When we arrived it was clear the impression from the website does not meet the reality at all The hotel itself is not looking this good However all people working there are very very friendly and helpful 
The food is nice and the service excellent the guys in the restaurant are really very polite and paying attention
It was still a nice experience and we will come back soon
Best regards
Sabine

title: Not worth the pricewould not stay again
text: Upon arrival could not get into front of hotelblocked off After circling block could not fit in parking garage SUVs beware Was not told also this parking would cost 2200 Was instructed closest parking was almost a mile awayno shuttle servicecoldlateneed I say more They didnt feel our pain and made no attempt at trying to help us find a solution I guess girls are just supposed to walk alone in the middle of the nite in a strange areahmmm asked for extra towels and pillows on reservations however recieved neither No real views from anywhere in hotel Furniture was old and scratched

title: There is no reliable airport shuttle
text: The hotel chooses not to operate the advertised airport shuttle at late hours substituting a cab instead The cab in my case arrived 32 minutes later than the hotel had promised and the hotel refused to reimburse a ride from any other cab The total time from landing to hotel bed was 1 hour 26 minutes

title: Cheap but sort of crappy
text: Having stayed at a nicer budgey hotel in NYC recently Hotel 17 off of Union Square the Grant Hotel was a complete letdown The bathroom was sort of gross and dirty the whole time I was there the room was dingy and the hotel staff messed up my reservations and gave me the key to a room where someone was asleep in bed Yikes Not pleasant at all Also they said they had cable but they totally didnt

title: beautiful hotel with great location
text: I love this hotel Just a few hundred feet from Union Square and the service is impeccable Beautiful rooms

title: Old world charm with a rock star aura
text: Charming rooms in the heart of dc Easy walk to the white house and Georgetown Unforgettable experience of the best kind

title: The Best Hotel Ever
text:
I stayed at this Holiday Inn Express  Suites this past weekend with my two small children I strongly recommend this property to anyone wishing to stay in the Polaris area We were in town visiting family and paying a visit to the awesome Columbus Zoo Upon arrival I was greeted and checked in by a very friendly desk clerk She was very pleasant and friendly The hotel is immaculate I honestly couldnt find one thing out of place or a speck of dirtor hairanywhere Just a beautiful new hotel The pool area is fantastic for the kids I loved how it was open until 11pm Nice chairs and tables and ample fresh towels in the pool Our room was nice and large The bathroom was roomy with good water pressure and a massaging shower head Clean clean cleanprobably the cleanest hotel bathroom that I have ever come across I cannot say enough good things about this hotel The beds were really comfortable We went down the next morning for breakfast and this is where my one and only complaint comes from No fresh fruit available I asked the clerk and was told that they were all out and expecting a shipment on Monday This was Saturday and I would think that someone would run on down to the grocery store and purchase some fresh fruit for the guests on the weekend Other than that the breakfast area was nice roomy clean and the worker there was friendly and accomodating otherwise
All around a great stay We will return and definately would recommend to anyone

title: Plaza Fifty was nice and clean
text: We stayed at the Plaza Fifty in July 2003 The hotel staff was very nice and let us check in 3 hours early The room was very clean and a nice size There was a microwave coffee pot and fridge in the room I would definitely stay here again

title: Perfect location and very clean
text:
Just got back from a one night stay at the Austin Hyatt Oct 2006 There were four us all together we shared one room 1120 with 2 double beds 
This hotel is in the perfect location just off I35 on the south side of downtown Austin It is a mile from the downtown location of Shady Grove and Chuys and you can walk across the bridge to get to the downtown clubs and restaurants Beats trying to find parking in downtown There is free self parking on the property very close to the main entrance to the hotel
The hotel itself has the same bones but it has been renovated with an updated decor Our room was very nice spacious and clean We requested more towels on our way out and they were waiting for us on our return 
The only odd thing with the renovation is that they seemed to have kept the same old bathroom shower tiles and the same old door and handle Thats is the ONLY thing that I could find with the room 
The rooms were very quiet and the beds comfortable 
You will enjoy your stay at the Austin Hyatt and get a good nights sleep as well

title: beautiful lobby shame about the rooms
text: Rooms were very small and not well kept furniture was very old and tatty needed updating bathroom was very small and badly designed staff were friendly and helpful although seemed to be a bit pushy on sales lobby is beautiful didnt hear any noise from other rooms we had a broken iron and board and called reception for a new one took them 30 minutes and another call to chase them up about it

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: Ive never stayed at a La Quinta property before but you can guarantee I will go back again We booked two rooms as we were traveling with my parents teenage children and our faithful dog in tow The rooms were spacious clean and more than adequate Breakfast in the morning was a nice touch and a great savings for us It was a bit of a pain that pet owners had to stay on the fifth floortraveling up on an elevator with our dog was an adventure in itself for us and others but the elevators were fast and always readily available Internet connections in the rooms were reliable and speedy The hotel location is great within walking distance of an outdoor mall and Jasons deli We did get some noisy neighbors at midnighta young family with loud voices and a young and very unhappy child After about an hour of listening to their every movement and word I called the front desk they responded right away with a phone call to the room Didnt help too much but we were able to turn the AC fan on constant to at least drown out some of the noise

title: Charming and plush and wonderful location
text:
I booked last minute at the Talbott while in Chicago and was very happy with my stay and services The staff was friendly and helpful especially the concierge with directions and recommendations I stayed in a double queenbed room which was huge by traditional hotel room standards The carpet was plush the bed comfortable and the other amenities quite thoughtful such as umbrellas in the room just in case Aveda bath products were also a nice touch 
One caution there is a large construction site next to the hotel so rooms facing that side will be noisy after 800 am most mornings The front desk staff was accommodating though and offered to move me if the noise was too much
I would highly recommend this hotel and definitely would stay there again

title: Comfortable Hotel perfectly situated for the sights of New York
text: The Hilton New York is a large well run Hotel perfectly situated for the sites of New York The Hotel has everything you need for a pleasant stay including a fitness area  Restaurants and two bars The Hotel has recently been refurbished and the rooms are very tastefully decorated with modern facilities such as a walkin shower and a large flat screen TV It is a very comfortable Hotel perfectly situated for the sights of New York The only criticism is that because the Hotel is very large it can feel a little inpersonnel but the staff are very attentive and helpful We were there celebrating our daughters 18th birthday and my wifes early retirement and they were presented with a gift of chocolate strawberrys which was a very nice personnel touch We really enjoyed our stay in New York

title: Hot  Cold
text:
Online specialBuy two nights get one free
Non Smoking  Cool Corner Room  Requested a high floor
 Catch PrepayNo refunds
1 Check  In 
Flight delayed resulting in a late arrival at the hotel 130am
Hotel advises they are sold out of rooms on high floors but assure us one will be available the following night
We get to our room and find it is a Smoking Wonderful Room
We contact the front desk and they tell us they are sold out 
Slightly problematic when you have prepaid for a room that is double the price of the accomodations you are being placed in
The Mgr on duty got involved and said there was nothing on our reservation associated with a Cool Corner Room just their basic room
We had to produce our confirmation email and proof of payment
Upon review they took care of the situation and promised an upgrade the following night
The following night we were moved to a high floor Cool Corner Room however that is what we had paid forso there was no upgrade involved we were just moved to the room we reserved
 The Cool Corner Rooms  High Floors are a MUST 
The view was stunning
2 Room Service
Outrageous Prices but Delicious Food
3 Hotel Bar
20 dollar Festive Concoctions but very Tasty
4 DoormenValet
Outstanding
Very accomodating and helpful
Use the Hotels Acura if availablevery convenient and comfortable ride
5 Check out
Flight delayed 
Accomodated a late check out
Smooth process

title: Very nice property
text: This is a really nice hotel My husband and I came to Austin for an overnight stress relief and this hotel made it easy The front desk was very friendly We asked them to call us a cab and they were very accommodating We had drinks at the bar before we left and the bartender was also very friendly We requested specific pillows which we did receive We did not eat any meals here so I cant comment on the food It was extremely clean neat and well maintained We will definitely come back to this location the next time we need a quick getaway Could not be happier

title: Only the Front Desk is worth a positive mention
text:
This property desparately needs a redo The room was just 1 degree above acceptable Tired wornoutrather ranksmellingThe smoke from the other rooms on my floor was almost as bad as having a smoking roomI realize that this is for people having extended stays and that itself creates specific challenges I was only booked for 3 nightsI asked for the limited maid service just to freshen the room up a bit  a reasonable 500 chargesince I was out a full day looking forward to the bed at least being made when I returnedthe room wasnt touched in my absence I was told the 500 would be refunded I have yet to see it on my statement
It isnt the money its the incompetence of handling such a simple request arranging maid service and not following through The ONLY reason I could possibly recommend this property is that the location is very good The front staff was friendly  That is the only positive thing I can say The elevator was old creaky and a joke overall Graffitti was on the advertisements on the elevator walls I am sure itthe elevator gets a large amount of use because of the inout nature of the property and the amount of luggage sacksboxes etc that guests haul in and out so I would recommend a 1st Floor roomUnless you really need an extended stay I would avoid this property altogether

title: Fantastic hotel and amazing staff
text:
This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in From the moment we arrived the staff were fantastic and so helpful When I originally booked the hotel I mentioned that it was my friends birthday and after we checked in and went to our room we were greeted with a birthday cake which was such a lovely surprise and unexpected The staff were very polite and always had a smile on their face The whole stay was faultless
We opted for a suite which was spotlessly clean and the bed was extremely comfy My only suggestion would be to ask for a room with a view because our room had an internal view of the hotel which wasnt a problem but a view of the city would have been amazing The amenities inside the room were second to none The TV was superb Room service was so easy to use and the food was absoultely brilliant as good as any restaurant Its not cheap but if you fancy staying in and eating good food then its the perfect option
Also the hotel was very quiet and peaceful Location wise youre perfectly situated near to Central Park and 5th Avenue for all your shopping requirements Perfect
Yes the hotel is expensive but you pay for luxury and the standard is definitely 1010 If you visit NYC and want a bit of opulence then this is without question the hotel for you 
Overall an amazing experience
Thank you

title: Wonderful Hotel Excellent Location
text: We stayed at the Millennium Bostonian over the 4th of July I can honestly say that there is no better place to be during this holiday There is so much to see and do in Boston over the 4th The location of the hotel is amazing You are directly across the street from the Quincy Market and the State House is right around the corner There are so many sites in walking distance that I could not begin to mention all of them The hotel rooms were spacious very clean and comfortable It was very peaceful inside We stayed in a fireplace suite that had a balcony that over looked a courtyard and Quincy Market The exterior of the hotel was very european with beautiful flower boxes The staff was efficient and very helpful The food at the resturant was delicious and well portioned and fairly priced There was nothing about this hotel that I did not like We cant wait to go back I would recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Excellent Value in a great area of Manhattan
text:
I was very impressed with the Hilton Garden Inn in Tribeca the rooms were very clean updated and nice with a refridgerator and microwave Pretty lobby free cookies in the evening and coffee in the am Close walk to Little ItalyChinatown and Greenwich Village and RIGHT on the A C E subway line for those that dont want to walk This line takes you right to Times Square if you are heading that way 
I was amazed that the price was right around 200 for a nice hotel in a good location Staff was very friendly and helpful The restaurant that is attached is also worth visitingand the Italian place across the street is very good too 
Free WiFi was great 
Only suggestion would be a safe in the room

title: Boring no frills business hotel
text:
This hotel has a few positives
 Immediate proximity to the Washington Convention Center but not that close to main tourist attractions though with the exception of Chinatown which is located a couple of blocks away
 A great and stylish lobby with various lounge areas and a nice area equipped with several sofas and bookshelves despite the presence of a Starbucks and a junk food store those unfortunately make the whole thing look a bit like a lowkey shopping mall
 Comfortable beds and pillows
 A welcoming staff
Besides the bed the rooms are however more than disappointing Very basic and standard a carbon copy of any Marriott Courtyard room  standard furniture with no particular style noisy and ineffective air conditioning very basic and slightly run down bathroom very old fashioned tiles no separate shower  a simple showerhead in the bathroom and a curtain no courtesy water bottles no minibar or espresso machine in the room no slippers no bathrobe no iPod docking station no central control of lights etc my usual complaints about so many hotel rooms in the US My room was a reasonable size but one may wonder about the presence of two queen or king beds per room which could make sense in a family hotel but really not in a business hotel only one bed but a sofa a table and a couple of armchairs would have been a much more effective use of the available space 
Finally they charge an outrageous 1295 USD per day for wifi access This is really over the top considering the already excessive prices this hotel charges for the rooms
Service at the hotels restaurant was courteous but exceptionally slow

title: Greaat Location
text:
Service from the front desk was great Zack is very personable and helpful All in all the
hotel was very good except for the carpets They all need to be replaced Could also use
a larager room for breakfast although the food was plentiful and good I would definitely
stay there again The loaction is great

title: a great value City Hotel
text:
This is a great city hotel Clean well positioned good value and efficient Used it for a couple of days whilst in Boston It is well located and within a short walk to all the city centre landmarks Car parking is 25 a day in a nearby car park which you pay through the hotel Room had everything we needed and was typical city hotel size compact Shower room was very well provisioned and the whole package was well looked after on the cleanliness side The restaurant was closed during my stay which was puzzling but a nearby bar provided great meals and the centre haunts were close
A good buy in Boston

title: There are better hotels for this price
text:
After checking in at Bay Landing159tax on our first night in SF and at Westin market street169tax on the second night our hotel expectations were pretty high so we were disappointed when we checked in at comfort inn  which actually cost more than the first two hotels at 189taxes I booked these hotels online so I figured the location must be the reason for the high rate but Westin has a better neighborhood than this and a few minutes walk to embarcadero
Here are other gripes
1 One of the front desk clerk was curt and unfriendly when we were asking if we could deposit our bags early enough to make me want to cancel my reservation unfortunately I would have forfeited the fee for the first night so we just let it go FYI at bay landing they let us leave our bulky luggage in their storage room while we explored the city
2 Price for the room is not worth it even with the free breakfast and free wifi Definitely not worth the 200 total I paid online  I have yet to see if the safety deposit box fee is true when I check out later
3 Smell of the room is what greets you when you first come It smells of old cabs with damp carpets They need to recarpet the room and change the AC Its 5am now as i write this and I cant sleep because of this smell  cant wait to check out of here
Will not stay here again

title: Road Trip 4th hotel in 8 days
text:
We decided to stay here due to the brand and obviously the rate that we got
Pool was good a resort type feel and staff helpful
Additional charges for the car parking was acceptable as it is an airport hotel
My only gripe was one had to pay for WiFi in your room as recently mentioned by Mphbrown HOWEVER it was free in the foyer Where there were obviously nonresidents there also taking quite a lot of the avaliable seating The previous hotels in San Francisco Monterey etc an independent one too all provided free wifi in the rooms which is now an essential in most hotels 
So my review was have a recommendation to the hotel would be move with the times So will not be visiting there again unless the rate is cheap enough to negate the wifi costs
Also they were the only hotel out of all of them not to have coffee making facilities forcing one to visit the Starbucks in the foyer

title: Recently redone but still needs redoing
text: We stayed here overnight while visiting family in DC I got a very good rate on Priceline because the hotel is currently in renovations The hotel desk made it very clear that renovations were going on but that we would be on a finished floor The room we stayed in looked finished but there were still some things that were not done The fixtures in the bathroom were cheaply done and the caps on the shower had pulled away from their seals Where you would expect marble there was bamboo Its cute on the surface but very tinny feeling The beds are comfortable but so high off the ground that for someone short like me its actually a little difficult to get on and off For what we paid I didnt mind too much but Id never pay the rack rate for this place

title: Marriott Century City
text:
Here are a few of my observations from my recent stay
1 Valet was AWESOME They were expedient and professional
2 No Concierge floor No Concierge floor in Beverly HillsI dont get it
3 Air Conditioner in room was horrible It was a Hot day in LA and the room would NOT cool down
4 800 Breakfast sandwhich Are you kidding me I have stayed at a lot of Marriotts being a gold member and I can tell you that I have NEVER felt gauged at a Marriott until I stayed here 4000 for a couple to eat at this Marriott Breakfast sandwhichs and drinks for my wife and I totaled just short of 40 Unbeliveable
5 No plug next to the bed to charge phone Most Marriotts have a plug that is part of the lamp next to the bed This facility has NO plugs next to the bed
It is because of the aforementioned items that I will not b staying at this Marriott ever again I will find another Marriott in the nearby area that has these amenities I know they exist because almost every Marriott in which I have stayed has been able to provide the items that I mentioned above
Thank you

title: Great Airport Hotel
text: Ive stayed here a couple of times the night before flying home from Phoenix For that purpose it is a great hotel Quiet comfortable clean and friendly staff Good location for flying out the next morning No negatives to report

title: Perfect for a short business stay
text:
I stayed here for 3 nights on business as my usual hotel was fullcolleagues had recommended the Sierra so I decided to try itfriendly welcome and complimentary cookies on arrival
The rooms were reasonably spacious with fridge and microwave  a colleague had a mini suite with a kitchenette My room was clean no view to speak of back of the car park but perfect for crashing after a day in the office The bed was comfortable and the hotel was surprisingly quiet apart from jet lag I slept well and the breakfast buffet was great with a good selection including an omelette station My only gripe was that the air con unit was a bit noisy
We had bar snacks one evening pizza nachos etc  all reasonably priced quick servicethe bar is a bit clinicallacking in atmosphere but was fine
The location is near to a Target and a number of cheap dining options but not much else  this was fine for us but if you want nearby entertainment stay in Santana Row There is also a free shuttle 5 mile radius but make sure you book ahead Free wifi
When i am here on business again and my usual is full then I would definitely stay here again  its perfect when you have a busy schedule and just need a quiet pleasant place to crash that is reasonably priced Staff were friendly and efficient

title: Only Perfect
text: To put it simply this is an extraordinary hotel but not merely because of the standard concerns of location and amenities It has those in abundance but it has something else that truly sets it above and apart from even what most would otherwise consider the best The Management and Staff of the Iroquois New York genuinely care about the pleasure you take from your stay with them No it is not overt or even subtly obsequious treatment that lacks sincerity and substances It is exclusively about how you the guest perceives the physical characteristics of the hotel the merits of its collective efforts and the overall attitude and manner the entire package is delivered They could not do it better Moreover no hotel my wife and I have ever stayed in fortytwo plus years of traveling in Asia Europe Canada The Caribbean and the United States has come even close

title: Good service but errors in handling room
text: Hotel staff was great BUT I didnt appreciate having my room given to another and ending up with a smoking room First come first serve is my slogan and that doesnt mean arrival time but booking time Aside from that the staff offered to change the following day but not good enough

title: Great Place To Stay
text: Everything was excellent The staff was outstanding We will stay there again

title: Drake Hotel Chicago great value great service and good food
text: Thouroughly enjoyed my stay at the Drake Hotel in Chicago This hotel has loads of history 85 years of it Famous hotel guests from movie stars to Princess Dianaso cool Staff at checkin counter were very helpful with my extra requests This hotel has wellsized nicely appointed clean rooms My room had a view of the lake and a nearby gazebo nice plus Drake Bros Restaurant in the morning for very pleasant breakfast with friendly fast service and good food Short walk to shopping is a big plus too Ill be back to this hotel

title: Great view from our room but a few blocks from everything
text:
Nice room warm welcome nice bed huge bathroom and shower area clean great view of Millenium Park down to Buckingham Fountain Shedd Aquarium etc SOuth facing Not overly spectacular Good room service one night at about 11pm because no restaurants in the area were serving food that late We were in Chicago for my partners birthday and I told the attendant on the phone who sent up a piece of cake with our room service Very nice gesture
The hotel is a few blocks from Michigan Ave and the river although it felt like a miles away from any happening area Seemed more business than tourist although if it wasnt as warm out as it was it would have been easily walkable to most places
Next trip will stay at N Michigan Ave although not because the hotel is lacking in anything in particular but rather location location location

title: Business like and efficient
text:
Nothing to complain about here Rooms are nice and clean The service is efficient Central to everything we want to do in San Francisco 
I would certainly come back

title: Great hotel  location cant be beat
