We stayed here for two nights while attending the NASCAR race and exploring the Phoenix area before heading to the Grand Canyon I used Hilton points so the stay was free but we still got great service Our room was really great with a separate living room area The hotel was arranged nicely with all the room entrances on the courtyard side of the building overlooking the central pool We could also see south mountain once we walked out the front door of our room on the top floor As we approached the hotel it was night and appeared that this maybe wasnt the best part of town as I had read in previous reviews but it wasnt terrible either and we had no problems
Breakfast was included for us as I have Hilton status It was buffet style and was quite good with service to match This was definitely one of the more elaborate doubletrees ive stayed at and wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting the area or who needs to stay near the airport

title: Great value and location
text: I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for good value comfort and great location We had previously stayed at hotels in the theatre district and were a little worried about staying a little further out but the access to the subway was very convenient and we were able to easily get around to wherever we wanted to go The hotel was very clean the staff helpful and even though the rooms are rather small but this is New York the bed was amazingly comfortable The area around the hotel was very safe and had a good choice of inexpensive eateries

title: Home from home in NYC
text: Local travel agents Millingtons Leicester recommended the hotel to us and it proved to be a great choice Situated in a relatively quiet part of town which is most welcome after a hectic day somewhere like Times Square but close to great places to eat like Sarges Deli and Dukes the hotel is clean good value and staffed by incredibly helpful staff Special mention for Joyce our chambermaid who always went the extra mile to look after us

title: Great Rooms
text: My stay was fantastic Staff was great nice oversized clean room Came in town for a convention and wouldnt stay or recommend anywhere else Wish I would of brought the family and actually used the room

title: Another perfect stay
text: Once again my New York stay was perfect As a frequent traveller I want fast efficient no fuss high quality service and this hotel always delivers The newly refurbished entrances make access easier and food and drink from the Restaurant Above and the adjacent bar always great The staff go out of their way to make me feel welcome particularly Raquel Ortiz on the front desk who emailed me back when she was on leave to tell me that she had dealt with a room rate problem I had with a booking The problem I caused but she dealt with it immediately all the same  Thank you Raquel I will always stay at this gem of a hotel as long as I need to stay in or near Times Square

title: Excellent servicecant wait to come back
text: Staying here was an excellent experience The rooms were perfectly clean and comfortable The receptionists were extremely helpful and the waiters very attentive The entire staff pitched in to make us feel welcome and perfectly at home A and recommended for all

title: LA  Celebrity style
text:
We stayed at the W as a family the room had 2 queen size beds and it was decorated in typical W style Our 2 girls loved it As in all Ws you get great toiletries decor and ambience 
Everybody who works at the hotel looks like they are just waiting for a movie director to hire them which gives the hotel an even further Hollywood feeling
The concierge service was below average for a W we saw a guy who did not pay much attention to us and a woman the next day who was more serviceoriented
It still puzzles me why the W chain insists in ripping off guests with things like a 9 bottle of water in the room If you stay at this chain and pay what they charge you are already in a more select crowd however regardless of how much money you have nobody enjoys the feeling of being taken advantage of I think that either complimentary water or a 4 charge is more appropriate
Other than that the pool is superb great beds and lounge chairs to enjoy the pretty people The loungelobby is great for a late night drink and people watching

title: Good hotel Great staff
text:
My wife and 4year old son stayed at this hotel twice using it as a stop gap between the UK and Hawaii and it was really well appointed The hotel rooms are adequate with average facilities The room sizes are okay and the decor is okay I have seen a review where someone states its like Ikea threw up in the room This is a fair observation but that is no bad thing entirely
The location is ideal very close to the attractions that the wharf has to offer The staff are excellent and will bend over backwards to help you with requests We did have a bit of a room mix up initially and ended up in a room that was not as good as the first room we put our cases in much to the bellboys embarrassment This was rectified by a letter of an honest explanation and apology from the manager followed by a plate of chocolate covered strawberrys and a bottle of champagne 
I would go back any time to stay there

title: Good for the price
text:
Stayerd here for our last two nights on the west coast
We stayed in a king room on the street side the quiet side of the hotel was sold out apparently
Street noise wasnt too bad luckily I am a heavy sleeper
Room was very clean functional and HUGE Bathroom also very clean Despite the older style of room and furnishings we found it to be a good choice for what we paid
A word of warning make sure you do not get room near the ice machine it was extremely loud and seemed to make lots of noise when ever we passed it
The location is excellent  far enough away from tacky Fishermans Wharf and right at the edge of the Italian section So many fantastic restaurants and cafes

title: A Great Hotel
text: Stayed for two nights at the Marriott Rivercenter which sits next to the famed San Antonio Riverwalk Room was clean modern and well kept Ethernet cable available for 10day Pool had indoor and outdoor features but was so crowded that you couldnt swim The best feature of the hotel was its central location on Riverwalk making it the center of shopping and dining

title: Nice Hotel Great for business trip
text: This hotel is not hear the beach but for business purposes only it fits the needs very clear the gym is ok not great the breakfast is ok also I am a hilton diamond member and would stay there again

title: Dont know what I love most about Kimpton hotels
text:
What do i love most about Kimpton hotels Not sure whether its the happysocial hour with wine the pat accommodations the delicious aroma in the lobby or the yoga mats delivered to the room The heavy crisp cotton sheets are a treat to go to bed in and wake up under though I do wish they used a duvet cover instead of 2 sheets
At any rate they never fail to accommodate and impress
The Monaco is fun and trendy The staff are delightful the wine at the social hour adequate the room I had very large though last time I was there it felt a bit cramped  the bed took up the whole room I even met a fabulous woman during the social hour  thats what theyre designed for I guess
My only complaint was that the bed was too soft  I like a firm mattress and this one wasnt I also learned too late that I could request a humidifier Denver is exceedingly dry in the room Next time
But overall I cant recommend the Monaco highly enough

title: Love love love this hotel
text:
This is a wonderful fantastic place to stay in NYC It is so friendly yet professional and the staff goes out of their way to make sure you are happy The room was fabulous super comfortable luxurious and well just perfect Its small and intimate and beats the choices in the 50s  Broadway by a mile All the grace luxury and class of the chain luxury hotels with none of the pretense 
The location is perfect Just steps away from the theatres and several amazing bistrorestaurants that feel like neighborhood places just outside the door 
Now I wont stay anywhere else when in the city

title: GREAT Location NOT GREAT Hotel
text:
Truthfully got a 169 per night rate on Travelzoo so it was OK for the money considering NYC standards Room was a superior  on higher floor for viewsI on the 37th floor with view of Chrysler Building but thats all The views were of other surrounding tall buildings and roof tops
The bathtubshower had more than several black hairs in it when I went to use the shower No shower cap no coffee maker and carpets were stained and need replacing The blackout curtain pulls were broken at least you could hand pull since facing East gets the blast of morning sun early 
The large flat screen TV had snow on the local ABC 7 station and all channels had a distortedoversized look The quality of this particular TV was poor but I wasnt in NYC to watch a lot of TV thank goodness I wasnt trying to watch the US Open the day before
Major problem with the elevator when leaving I was shaking when the doors finally opened I did immediately go to the desk and they got security on it right away and shut it down for inspection
I was in town to see the King Tut exhibit dine with friends and shop Location is the one thing going for this hotel and IF you get a really good price go for it Anything over 200 shop around for another bargain the neighborhood is full of hotelsas is the whole city

title: Would stay there again
text: We would definetely stay there again if rates stay reasonable Location is great  walking distance to Central Park and Times Square Though we had expected a bit more from a newly renovated room rooms were reasonably clean Cant complain about bathroom cleanness There are only two negative points worth mentioning They charge 3 USD per piece per day for storing your bags after check out They also charge 125 USD per call if you are using an international prepaid calling card from your room Overall Id rate the Park Central as a pretty good tourist class hotel

title: Best hotel Ive ever stayed in
text:
This is truly the best hotel Ive ever stayed at for numerous reasons The service was excellent the room and view was beautiful the modern deco of the entire building was fantastic the barlounge was great and the food was delicious
 I went to New York City as a graduation present and my mom just happened to mention that to one of the women who worked there After we got settled into our room that same young woman came up with a balloon and package of free souveniers for a graduation present along with a handwritten card It really made my trip
 The room had a sort of modern art theme and had two rooms since we booked the large suite The view was magnificent The beds were very comfortable The art and setup of the room was unlike anything Ive ever seen before Even the minifridge was neat it had all different types of snacks products even a tshirt and teddy bear I admit they were expensive but if youre the type to splurge every once in a while its for you The furniture is both comfortable and creative The room overall is just incredible
 The lounge had a bar and a bunch of cozy areas to sit and chat In the evenings its very busy which is good if you want to meet people but during the day and before 600 its a quiet area to relax in You could just sit there and look at the cosmopolitan modern decorations and furniture for hours and never get bored It also has free internet acess whereas in the room theres a fee The lounge and lobby is on the second level the first level is an entrance with water on the roof and walls very worth seeing
 The room service and everything else about this hotel was excellent I give this hotel 10 thumbs up if I had that many thumbs If you can afford to spend some extra money you defininately should consider the W in Times square

title: The Reviews were right The Michelangelo is First rate
text: The Michelangelo Hotel was comfortable with larger than expected rooms for a position so close to the action in the theatre district Staff were very pleasant and helpful Highly recommended

title: Great place to stay in DC
text: Great location room was excellent staff exceptionally helpful and friendly Really perfect place to stay in DC

title: Old hotel but near Grand Central
text:
I booked this hotel accidentally through Priceline I meant to book a different hotel but used the wrong strategy and ended up getting this hotel After reading reviews on Trip Advisor I made sure to call the hotel to ask if I could request a renovated room They said they will put the request in but its not guaranteed
The hotel location was actually pretty good just a couple blocks albeit long blocks away from Grand Central station When we checked in I reinquired to make sure that we would get a renovated room and they said it should be no problem Check in time was 3 PM and we did get a renovated room thankfully although it still looked pretty old The bedroom was ok size for New York but the room felt dry was very dark and there was not enough air circulation The bathroom was really small and basic and didnt look renovated
Overall I wouldnt recommend this hotel if you have to pay full price  even by getting a cheaper price from Priceline I still didnt think it was worth it and will definitely choose other hotels when visiting New York

title: Still better than mostbut service definitely not up to past standard
text: Still one of my Midtown favscomfortable and newly refurbed rooms great location good restaurant But service level was really down this visit Check in was indifferent and mishandled took 2 calls from room to straighten out Two different days had messages about not providing housekeeping because I had requested privacy which was not the case either day In room breakfast order one morning was wrong with no time to reorder Staff in general just didnt seem to have their hearts in it some of the time All of this is definite change from past visits and I hope just an anomaly

title: Stayed at the Shelburne Murray Dec 911 2004
text: We arrived at the Shelburne Murray on Dec 9 2004 We booked through lastminutetravel We didnt know what property we would be staying at until we purchased the room But the rate was OK for that time of year The hotel is nice the rooms are spacious They put you in the mind of a one bedroom apartment Great if you are traveling with family members We had 2 double beds with a pull out sofa bed in the living room The decor is average The rooms are a little worn but nice I am a big fan of the W hotels with the heavenly beds This hotel does not have the fluffy beds but the pillows were nice The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to Time Square About 5 blocks from nearest subway I would stay again

title: Modern Contemporary Feel
text: Newer hotel with a modern contemporary feel Nice poolspa with a tropical grotto look The hotel is near the airport and planes can be heard departing and taking off thus the name of the hotel No planes took off during sleep hours so we werent bothered That being said our first floor rooms bed was comfortable with quality linens Spotless bathroom was spacious with granite countertop Nicely appointed with numerous plugs and hookups for computers etc Enviable clock radio with ipod docking stationrecharger The Kreuig coffee maker was just too complicated Whatever you do dont use the coffee packet after youve poked a hole in it  makes for a big mess and useless coffee The staff was friendly and allowed us to checkin 30 minutes early The Liberty Station is an interesting destination with the former Naval Training Center having been converted into shops restaurants and office spaces Nice walking path adjacent to hotel

title: Nice hotel great location
text: We stayed at the Sutton Place May 2nd  May 6th 2012 We received a special rate because of the event we were attending which made our rate just under 200 per night including taxes There are MANY restaurants bars and clubs within a short walk of the hotel It is a couple of blocks from the lake and about six blocks from the nearest subway station About a easy walk to the John Hancock Observatory Every staff member we encountered in our five day visit was very professional friendly and helpful from the doormen to the front desk to the housekeeping staff The room had a deskan upholstered chair and ottoman for sitting a comfortable kingsized bed a flat screen TV a stereo receiver and speakers a DVD player a mini bar and an inroom safe The tiled bathroom was very nice with both a soaking tub and a separate shower and a large counter top surrounding the sink plenty of room for toiletries shaver etc Nice additional touches included robes and an umbrella in the room for our use Room service is reasonable but as previously stated there are numerous dining options very close by

title: Great Location
text:
I just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel with a school group and would recommend it It is in a great location with a subway stop on the corner and the Empire State Building and shopping Macys etc nearby
It was very clean and quiet and the rooms are typical size for NYC not huge but adequate and those ending in 11 for example 711 811 are larger than the others I saw Try to avoid those ending in 10  they are right across from the elevator
The continental breakfast was fine  bagels toast doughnuts cereal and fruit juice coffee tea etc but no protein 
The bar on the top floor is terrific very cozy and has an outdoor area The view of the Empire State Building from the bar at night is well worth seeing

title: Great location not great service
text:
We took the kids to New York City for one night on the way to another destination The location was terrific They have a pool which has a great view but beware the pool looks 10 times larger on the web site Its more like a really small lap pool 
They clearly cater to the smoking set because the hallway on out floor and our room smelled like smoke The worst part of the stay was when our son got sick and we asked for pillows and a new sheet to be sent up it took them an hour and a half to get them to us Thats painfully long when everyone should be 
asleep 
The location and he fact that our kids had a great time made for a nice quick visit

title: Nice hotel great service
text:
My family and I stayed here during our 3night stay in Boston We are a family of 2 adults and 3 kids aged 13 11 and 9 and it was difficult finding a hotel in Boston that would allow a rollaway in room with 2 double beds After starting our trip with 4 nights in a suite in NYC I did not want to shell out the money for a suite in Boston too Renaissance gave us the rollaway and even with it open in the room it wasnt too cramped
The location was not all that convenient to sightseeing in Boston but it was very close to the Silver Line of the Boston T system subway and we were able to make our way around Boston without too much difficulty
The service was great the fitness center and pool were added bonuses that we were able to take advantage of

title: great stay
text:
we had a great stay at the columbus motor inn
the location was great for our stay in the city
we enjoyed the room very much it was clean and big and the bed was comfortable
we stayed on the street side and I loved watching the city go by
Loved the fact that we had free parking and still were able to walk a lot of the places that 
we wanted to go
We will definately go back

title: Loved the Blue Moon
text:
I had the great fortune to stay at the Blue Moon Hotel this week and found it a little jewel
It is in the new hip area way downtown Manhattan and it has such a charming atmosphere
The staff Randy Andy Larry were all fantastic and so welcoming I couldnt help but feel comfortable and relaxed
The hotel is restored and some beautiful features I stayed in the Abbott and Costello room
Everything was fresh and clean
There is a cute lounge area in the front which hosted breakfast in the morning We also had all of the amentities of other hotels however they also allowed usage of DVD players in my room and had DVDs for free in the lobby
I highly recommend the Blue Moon
I plan to go back

title: Service
text: The staff at this Embassy Suites go beyond Have stayed several times and have not been disappointed  Brian is the best friendliest omelet maker there is

title: Loved it Best service ever
text:
Stayed here for a conference and was thrilled with the outstanding level of service The staff was exceptional and even indulged a late night dessert craving at the bar after closing They went the extra extra mile and were just so darn nice 
The location is fantastic Right on the Riverwalk  on the quieter end Cant say enough Stay here

title: Worst experience ever
text: I travel very often for work Unfortunately I missed my connecting flight home and got stuck in Charlotte I was unlucky enough to book a room at this fine establishment When I arrived to the hotel their was already 6 people in line to check into their rooms but no one behind the counter After some time we were notified by a maintence worker that one person did not show up to work and the other lady had just walked out No employees still on the premises knew how to use the computer system After about 45 minutes the chef came out and apologized He said that he called the executive chef and that one of the other managers was on their way and would be there in 45 minutes An hour and 15 minutes after my arrival the lady who walked out hopped out of a car and began checking in guests She was rude to me and the 40 guests in line waiting to check in After 1 hour and 20 minutes after my arrival I was finally able to check into my room Only to find that it was only partially cleaned with garbag still in the trash and a bed half made I am so disgusted by the level of service that I received at this hotel that I have requested that my platinum account be deleted as I will never stay at a holiday inn again

title: L is for Luxury  E is for Enjoyable  N is for Nuances  O is for Oh This Place is Great  X is for X Factor
text: I dont typically gush over a hotel but here goes Every good review here is TRUE Fabulous location terrific staff quaint comfortable quet rooms What more to say Ill go on  The Lenox upgraded me to a corner room with a fireplace couch etc It was divine and sooo quet I loved the Aveda products and housekeeping always gave me extra The hotel is within walking distance of almost everything you want to see in Boston The staff is amazingly friendly and called me by my name everytime they saw me The manager Dan even sent up a bottle of wine for me to consume after a long day walking the city As others posters indicate the hotel is not inexpensive but I snagged a pretty good rate online offseason of course The only little criticism not really cause I like the hotel so much is that there is no coffeetea pot in the room However they sent up a pot of water for me at no charge If you visit Boston I would definitely go see the Boston Symphony performance or open rehearsal and spend time on Newbury and Hanover Streets as well as all of the historical stuff Boston has to offer I enjoyed every minute of my time in Boston and every second of my time at the Lenox They treat you as a valued guest and they want your business  they will always have mine

title: New Years at the Ritz
text:
After the 1st night our room was changed because of outside mechanical noise and flushing issues Room was smaller but quieter Many of the rooms are small and the carpet should be refurbished we were with a group so we saw several rooms The housekeepers could not have been more pleasant however they dont know what clean is and need more training One thing I expect from the Ritz is impeccable cleanliness Management was very responsive but not sure they get it either In defense of the Ritz it was New Years weekend and they were overwhelmed by crowds
The lobby is an old bank and is beautiful I must say that although carpet should be replaced in many areas the paint and wallpaper were impeccable 
We would give them another shot at a quieter time however we miss their old location 
Mummers Parade was wonderful and viewing perfect
We have gotten better quality bath products at the Holiday Inn Is the Ritz is changing

title: Hands Down our Favorite Hotel in Houston
text: The perks complimentary happy hour cookie buffet  hot breakfast are unmatched My mom and I stayed for a night and enjoyed a glass of wine while getting ready for the ballet We hopped into the complimentary car service who whisked us off to the theater in no time When we returned to the hotel we were greeted by warm cookies  milk before falling asleep in our comfy clean room The breakfast is hot  plentiful Overall a wonderful staywonderful experience We are definitely repeat customers

title: The staff here deserves recognition
text:
I stayed at the Luxe this last weekend I now realize all the previous reviews on here about how NICE the staff there is is very accurate
So true The minute you walk in here you are treated so well the staff here is great From anyone who you deal with by phone or anyone you simply pass down the hallway we were always treated well
Our room was HUGE I didnt expect such a large space The parkiing situation is unfortunate having to pay but i have nothing negative to say about the service here The location is nice right off the 405 and with a nice little view of the Getty We used the spa services and i felt they were a bit over priced but other than that it was all a great experienceThe rooms are decorated in a neat and modern way i would stay here again

title: The best experience possible Finest Downtown hotel
text:
Thank You Conrad New York for making mine and my new fiances 4 nights there as memorable as possible 
From Allison at the Front Desk to Andy in Concierge who both stand out for making stay as memorable as possible
Room was amazing  RIverview suite is highly recommended no matter which floor your on The cleaning staff did a grand job too on a daily basis
Hotel is opposite the new freedom tower and 911 memorial and is in a great quiet location with 2 subway stops within 5 minutes walk
We will definately stay here again

title: Extremely nice hotel
text:
My wife and I stayed here for two nights Nov 1214 and just loved it We stayed in a 26th floor Concierge suite which was immaculate and had a beautiful view of Downtown Dallas The concierge lounge was closed for the weekend so I dont know what it was like The restaurant was clean and efficient The food was very good but somewhat pricey as is the case with all hotels Wireless internet is free for all gold and platinum members 
Downtown Dallas is less than a 5 minute drive and DFW airport is about a 1520 minute drive with no traffic While in town we dined at the Dakota Steakhouse located at 600 North Akard Street I had one of the best bone in filets I have ever had Definitely go there if youre looking for a great steak

title: Great staff and location
text:
The Hotel Palomar Chicago is located in a great area if you are interested in shopping eating and taking in the sights of Chicago More importantly the staff is wonderful On the second evening the room attendant Gabriela had some soda delivered to the room after she noticed we liked a certain brand When my flight was cancelled I called the hotel in hopes of getting a room for the night and Gan took care of my reservation with a great rate It was so nice to come back to the hotel and Gans helpfulness after a notsogreat day at OHare The room service was quick and yummy too
I spent two nights in the queenqueen deluxe and one night in a king room Both rooms were clean with comfortable beds and great views The rooms are well designed with a spacious closet 
I will be choosing to stay at this hotel when I return to Chicago

title: Cool and trendy but still with a friendly staff Yes please
text:
Dream Downtown is cool clean trendy and comfortable My Deluxe King was spacious by NYC standards the view of the Empire State Building was gorgeous and the bed made me never want to get up The room offered easy connection of my iPhone or any device to pipe my music through the inroom speaker system Rooftop bar complete with the mandatory 20 cocktails Great location in Meatpacking short walk to Chelsea Market and transportation pretty easy cabs going uptown or down
Perhaps the best part is that Dream has not fallen into the NYC trap of thinking an aloof and disconnected staff is an integral part of a trendy feel Im looking at you Empire Their staff was attentive without being suffocating friendly engaging and enjoyable I highly recommend the Dream Downtown for all types of trips PS  Ive stayed at the other Dream too    lets just say to stick with the Dream Downtown

title: opera time getaways
text: This hotel has made our frequent trips to the sf opera possible It is not a trendy new or luxurious acomodation but this location cost ability to park our car and walk to the opera and dining allows us to enjoy our excursion to sf worry free We know we will have a clean spacious room every time with great service

title: Lovely room with great view
text: We were a little hesitant about this hotel due to someof the reviews we read but were very happy we made the choice The location is wonderful We were on the 10th floor with a view of the river and the bridge which was amazing There was some noise from the train bridge especially around rush hour when they ran more frequently but it was not that bad The rooms were newly updated bathrooms really modern and although the lobby was a little dated we really had no complaints about the appearance of the hotel They have a parking lot attached to the motel which is 23 a day but the room rates were so reasonable for the location that we really couldnt object You can take your car in and out all day for no charge but there is really no need as the hotel has a shuttle that will take you anywhere in the historic area and pick you up when you call for it The shuttle was prompt and the drivers were very helpful and polite The desk staff was always busy but made every effort to help us promptly The hatcold breakfast in the morning was fine We would stay there again

title: Good hotel in great location with a few issues and a big price tag
text:
Its difficult to not have high expectations for this hotel when you see Hilton Suites and Chicago Magnificent Mile Overall our six night stay was very good Top kudos go to its location right off Michigan Ave with all the designer stores and across the way from the Hancock Tower with its great Rainbow Room and views 
As for the suites Id warn you not to expect a sprawling layout The standard suite is as large as a regular hotel room broken up into two with a wall in the middle The king size bed in the bedroom left just enough room all the way around to walk and thats about it There are two plasma TVs a microwave and a fridge to give you some options other than the exhorbitently priced restaurants 
My complaints The maid forgot to clean our room the first morning After getting back after a long day and complaining at the front desk it still took another two hours before it was done Just our bad luck Next on the list is the valet only parking at 50 a night with no local public garages running much cheaper than that I hated to cough up a lung to pay for something we hardly used while there At checkin the bellhop misplaced one of our bags which caused a frantic search and wasted another hour More bad luck 
It was all still quite upscale and considering we offset part of the stay with reward points the price was manageable

title: Nice businesshotel
text: Nice businesshotel well situated and very good staff specially at the bar Lounge also serviced nicely although breakfast buffet at the lounge could be better  definitely too few choices Support from concierge a bit slow and room was made after 1600 the first day which is very late

title: Great place
text:
We booked this hotel not knowing what to expect through choice privileges and we were surprised with both the appearance and service from both the staff and the friendly owner of this property We would encourage more Canadians to check this out The rooms are spacious and modern The free breakfast and the afternoon wine and cheese were both a welcome surprise The property is close to the famous riverwalk and the Alamo attractions If we return to San Antonio we would be happy to stay here again
Bob D

title: Pretty hotel central location Poor service Not recommended for meetings
text:
Came for a conference at the hotel Although I did not travel outside the hotel much it was a short ride from the airport and seemed very centrally located with lots of stuff to do around the hotel Appears to be a renovated old building and the facilities are very nice charming and spacious lobby I had a corner room with a king bed that was much larger than I expected compared to standard hotel rooms very clean and a nice bathroom Free internet was a big plus
Service was poor and below expectations During the conference the wireless internet connectivity was poor specifically the section of the room where the presenters stood had no signal  this significantly affected the quality of presentations Air conditioning was not working in the conference room
The front desk informed me that room service is closed for lunch and would open at 430p However when I called around 445p the room service voicemail stated we are closed now and will open at 5 About 510 they were still not open so I called the front desk Heres how that conversation went
Me I was trying to place a room service order but they are closed Can you help me
Tanisha Sir room service opened at 430p
Me Yes I was told that but I just called and it plays a prerecorded message saying they are closed
Tanisha Sir they are open
Me Ummm I just called they are not
Tanisha Yes sir they are I will call them now please hold
I am placed on hold for 1 min then disconnected Thankfully when I call room service they are now open
Oh and the hotel ran out of water when some guests were taking a shower
There are plenty of nice hotels in the area I suggest you pick another

title: Solid hotel with good location
text:
It was our third time in the NYC area It was our first time with Manhattan hotel previously Fairfield Inn in Queens and Westin in Jersey City Four Points has definetely the best location in comparision to the mentioned hotels and the smallest rooms but comfortable
PS I recommend Starwood Preferred Guest program SPG floors have great Empire State Building view

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text:
My fiance and I decided to get away for the weekend and picked DC The hotel was great from the start as they were able to check us in early noon They only had 2 double beds when we had asked for a King but we didnt mind due to the fact that we were checking in early there may not have been a King available The man at the front desk was very nice and friendly The location of the hotel was the best part It was right neat everything we wanted to see The concierge was also so great at night they helped us find a hip spot for dinner and the next morning they helped us find a breakfast place we didnt really want to pay 20 for the buffet at the hotel
I would most def go back to this hotel

title: All we could have wished for
text:
This was our first visit to New York to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary and what a memorable trip it was Our studio suite was upgraded at no extra cost to a one bedroom suite on the 27th floor and wine and chocolates were sent up to us The bedroom and sitting room were very large and the bed was very comfortable The generous four sets of towels were more than adequate and changed every day Two bathrobes were also supplied
All the staff without exception were extremely kind polite and helpful and nothing was too much trouble 
The hotel and indeed New York exceeded all our expectations 
We breakfasted in Niles and also opposite in Bagel Maven Cafe to get a real taste of New York There is the Whole Food Market a few blocks away on the opposite side of the road which was also excellent
Its true New York never sleeps but you dont go to New York for peace and tranquility and the noise and buzz are all part of the scene
All in all a lovely experience and definitely to be repeated

title: We will return
text: Great customer service at front desk and throughout the Hotel Elizabeth H went above and beyond providing information on their killer lights Loved our oceanfront room and Oysters at the bar We will be returning next year and look forward to it

title: Very Disappointing
text:
My daughters and I are just back from a 3 day stay at this tired and worn property The first disappointment was our mountain view from our balcony The mountains were there in view if you could manage to overlook the large and crowded parking lot right there The balcony was so tiny that I dont think I could have actually bent my knees to sit in the 1 chair provided  it was kind of a closedin dark and dusty 1970s Medditerrainian style Sadly I never once sat on the balcony There was a little refrig but no microwave The bed had the stability of a hammock Upon checkin our porter told us we could use the shuttle at any time to take us to the Biltmore shopping plaza at no charge When we decided to go around dinner time we were now told that there was only a Shopping Shuttle that operated during the day for 10pp At 5pm there was no shuttle available to take us anywhere fee or no fee So we ended up spending nearly 40 round trip to get to this shopping area  less than a 15 min ride
The worst of it all was out last dining experience here in their casual outdoor restaurant After finishing my meal and having my plate removed I noticed there was a big blob of bird poop right below where my dinner plate had been Eeeeewwwww I brought it to the attendtion of the waiter and he told me that was very unusual as the tables kind of a psuedostoneplastic are washed every two days As he continued to process my bill I took this up with the restaurant manager who sincerely apologized and saw to it that we were not charged
I would like to comment that all of the staff and we interacted with several were very nice Sadly the lack of attention of detail and cleanliness could not be overcome by the good service

title: This Is A Great Hotel For Business Travelers
text:
As a business traveler I found this hotel to be one of the most outstanding values in the Denver area Because of the job that I do Im required to stay in Denver on a weekly monthly basis and this property has consistently provided me with a well above average room for the price a well mannered and knowledgeable front desk staff that is cheerful and easy to work with  Even during peak periods they have never walked me to another property because of lack of available rooms and that has helped to keep me returning here time after time
The reservations department and hotel management staff are well within reach should a problem arise and have gone out of their way on numerous occasions to correct any problems I have had during my stays They are never without a friendly smile and are again easy to get along with and most helpful
The restaurant and bar are on par with most equally priced hotels in the area and room service is always on time even during peak periods The food is good and menu is decent as far has hotel fare goes
The pool and spa are accessible until 10 pm  which is a little early for weekend and holidays and even thought the pool itself is a outdoor pool it is heated during the winter for year round use
The best views are on the west side facing the mountains near the upper floors There are plenty of restaurants available nearby as a WalMart and 24 hours Walgreens within walking distanceAlthough this property does have its ups and downs as any place will its where I stay

title: Location  Location Lication  thats about it
text:
If your just interested in location than it is ok but everything else about this lousy hotel bad its old and needs an facelift they lie to you and say new renovated but is badly renovated I paid a fortune for this and your not getting your money worth
I strongly say AVOID  Avoid and Avoid

title: Lovely hotel
text: Well located convinient hotel The staff were extremely helpful and the breakfast was lovely Great hotel A

title: Not insulated for sound needs upgrades
text: I give this one a 2 star since it was at least clean and it is located in a great spot It has nothing else going for it As one of the reviews mentioned this location is not what I consider to be Raddison quality It is an old motor inn Dont expect anything more You can hear everything going on outside your room in the hallway and in the rooms next to you The plumbing makes a substantial amount of noise The card key access points at the various doors work inconsistently and sometimes take a few minutes to accept the card andor open the door I personally dont like sleep number beds and that is what we got I woke up with my neck sounding like popcorn inflammed I was cranky after two nights of sleep and when we left with our car we were locked out even though we had paid for two full days 48 hours of parking at check in They reactivated our card so we could leave and said that it was good until 1 pm even though we had checked in at 4 pm two days before How nice of them I think we still got swindled since 1 pm is only a full 45 hours in my mind Anyhow expect to leave cranky and ready not to recommend this place to anyone I am sticking to Best Westerns and Hyatts Pay more and stay in the financial district Even the Sheraton next door looked more appealing

title: Noisy room attitude not welcoming
text: Front desk at checkin clearly did not appreciate being asked questions or making conversation Checkout with different clerk was pleasant Room was very noisy even though a quiet room had been requested and they were practically empty Have to wind around to get to property but follow the signs and you will be okay Breakfast was typical for this chain  limited choices but can make a decent meal of it Pool area was satisfactory Comfortable bed and pillows

title: Remarkable Customer Service
text: From the moment I pulled up to the Hotel Carlton I was impressed The clerk immediately greeted us took our bags and quickly checked us in Although this is an older property the room was stylish and very comfortable Even though we arrived later in the evening 1000 after checking in we walked next door and enjoyed a delicious dinner and drinks at Fly Upon returning we found the hotel to be very quiet and we slept well in the incredibly comfortable bed In the morning we ate a delicious breakfast downstairs and then strolled around the city Even though we were checking out that morning they clerk graciously stored our bags and kept our car until we were ready to depart much later that afternoon Our stay was so wonderful that I will make sure to stay at the Hotel Carlton for all future trips to my favorite city

title: Compact OK location but are there any better
text:
We stayed at The New Yorker Hotel for four nights arriving on 17th July The location of the hotel is OK but in a slightly seedy part of 8th Ave The rooms are typical NYC compact with the bare essentials I expected a room safe and there was none and same for a fridge which would have been useful during the heatwave of the east coast The bed was comfortable and filled a lot of the room The wardrobe was not as deep as a clothes hanger but there were enough drawers I would suggest bringing your own wash products as theirs are not very nice
Breakfast is good at the Tick Tock Diner TIP Shake Shack on 8th Ave and 43rd St is a good place to eat englishsized meals and delicious yoghurt ices 
We did Top of the Rock instead of the Empire State down side was that there werent signs to show what many of the buildings were TIP Virgils on W44th nr Times Sq serves great southern ribs and burgers and Plataforma Churrascheria on W49th St nr 8th Ave was the best meal we had in 2 weeks if you are a carnivore  dont fill up on the starters though
Dont miss Ellis Island book online to skip the queue
We also really enjoyed the USS Intrepid and found it all very interesting for about 34 hrs
We went on to Boston by train so a short walk to the station was brilliant

title: Loved the Smyth
text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Smyth I admit I can be kind of anal about hotel cleanliness and our room was exceptionally clean and comfortable It was also very spacious for New York City and it was beautifully decorated The hotel staff was also particularly courteous and helpful We arrived very early in the morning 2am and were greeted with bright warm smilesit stayed that way throughout our time at the hotel The location is great  just a 10 min walk to all the shopping in Soho and a 10 min cab ride to Midtown Its also very close to several great restaurants I will definitely be back

title: Perfect Location
text: This hotel is in the perfect location for sightseeing It is a short 10 min walk from the train from the airport The Plash an inexpensive way to get to all attractions is right outside their door Overall the hotel is great I felt safe there The hotel passkey was needed to ride the elevator  I thought that was good The suite was great nice bed linens  kitchen It was only a 10 minute walk to the theaters on Broad street We really loved everything about the place All people at the desk were friendly and knowledgeable Even though this is across the street from city hall and right in the center of the city it was quiet inside The area around is ok Philadelphia is a dirty city and there were lots of homeless around the bus and subway stations on Market street around the corner We still used the subway and it was fine

title: good location and value
text: I went for a conference at the Javits conference center and this hotel was great for this purpose It was only three blocks away from the conference center It is also vey closed to the marina  circle line and world yatch cruises and to time square The hotel was clean  and the staff were vey helpful It also has free parking and a deli next door There is a police station just in front of it so I felt very safe

title: Nice place to stay
text: We stayed here for a couple of days back in March This hotel is very nice on the inside It used to be an old bank building so the lobby  atrium architecture is pretty cool No problem with the rooms Nice gym  pool Staff went out of their way to make sure we were happy and being treated well No complaints Nice location downtown right off the main circle

title: Upgrade Made this one of my Top Starwood Stays
text:
I chose this hotel as it was close to my LA office and Im a Starwood Platinum member It was the weekend of the Oscars so the hotel was sold out and when I arrived at approximately 11pm they told me that had upgraded me once but had to upgrade me again since they were completely sold out
Worked for me I got to stay in an amazing Mega suite A bit unnecessary for my 8 hours in the hotel only spent sleeping but the 8room suite was incredible Very nicely done and very spacious there was a huge entryway with wet bar area which lead to a bathroom on the right and one bedroom a table area straight ahead and a large couch area with TV etc Off of that there was a room with a couch and a desk another bedroom and another bathroom with a huge soaking tub
I really cant say I experienced much of the hotel since I was there only to sleep but the little service I had was pretty good The hotel is missing some of the touches Ive experienced at other Ws personal notes or message on the phone welcoming me and even when I was being checked in the man seemed a bit like he was doing me a favor giving me the upgrade Trust me I appreciate it but its also their choice  its a much better experience when they say with excitement we have a great room for you without making you feel like you owe them something more
I think the location is great you can walk to Westwood shops and restaurants so in the morning it was easy to pick something up at the Coffee Bean I was even able to find street parking overnight
The hotel was chaotic on a Thu night very trendy but I didnt have any issue with the noise once I was in my room I agree with the one comment about the lighting though  there are lights everywhere but not a lot of light switches so youre attempting to find the switch on each light in the dark which is a bit of a pain
I will consider this hotel again if I get a deal and it actually looks like I need to go back to my LA office next month so I will check at this hotel first

title: Modern business hotel
text: Modern room good large bed nice view of the hirise city from 14th floor Sliding glass doors to small balcony allowed fresh air in Odd layout with bathroom having only bath shower and wc no mirror or basin The washbasin and mirrors are in the bedroom It felt strange shaving brushing teeth etc in the bedroom and having no mirror in the bathroom The double room had only one officestyle chair although there was room for more WiFi was charged only 2 free terminals in the business centre off the lobby One was out of order Good location with several excellent restaurants nearby

title: great location cozy atmosphere
text:
my wife and i had a short trip to NYC having a great stay at chelsea pines inn we liked the place much more than the usual hotel chain buildings  being more cozy quiet and personalindividually one should absolutely trust the handed recommendations regardings restaurants as well as trip hints  perfect
though the hotel and rooms being small we enjoyed our stay in an very excellent way and will certainly return to chelsea pines inn for the next stay in NYC

title: great hotel great location
text: Top class hotel excellent staffThe hotel is ideally situated with china town on its doorstep

title: Excellent Hotel in a great location
text: Checking in and out was a breeze room was quiet clean and comfortable Midtown location was perfect  steps away from the Herald Sq subway with access to 8 different subway lines Wifi was reliable as well

title: Great Hotel
text:
Just returned this morning from a 5 day stay at this hotel with virgin Holidays
Reception
Very quick check in and at all times staff were friendly polite and helpful
Room
There were two of us and we were in a standard room well supposed to be  but it was huge and great We had 2 double beds tv 2 chairs writing desk and chair walk in wardrobe with safe and ironiron board sink with coffee maker beside it fridge and microwave The bathroom had shower bath toilet sink the usuals Did not see any of the chambermaids as we were up and out early most mornings with loads to do in such short time but our bathroom was cleaned with fresh towels every day and our bed made up
Breakfast
The 3 breakfast is excellent value with coffee tea 3 typed of juice and milk to drink There were also muffins croisants bread which could be toasted doughnuts danish pastries large and small bagels different typed and pain au chocolat also hard boiled eggs all of which was eat as much as you want for the small amount All the plates cups etc were disposable so when you were finished you just dropped in the bin no chore for such a delightful breakfast and charming staff although some guests did find this difficult We were told our breakfast was included in our package but would still have paid the 3 every morning had it not been
Bell Boys
very friendly and helpful
Overall no problems with this hotel or staff it was two blocks from central park and a 20 minute if that walk to time square so very handy for all the places to visit
I would definetely go back to this hotel Loved it

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is massive Though it has a great location with a updated interior My room was in the tower across the street accessed by a tunnel under the street Room was clean spacious and being in the tower was very quiet TV had lots of channels Starbucks coffee in room good wireless reception and good amenities Somewhat insipid show would be my only complaint All my wake up calls came on time which is rare The fitness center is OUTSTANDING Open 24 hours a day with lots of great equipment Pub attached to the tower has good food soup shop attached to tower has good food I would definitely stay here again

title: Great location
text:
We checked in and they said they gave us an upgrade It was a large room with an area separate that had a closet and then bathroom The bath room was small but with the little room between it was a great barrier when one used the bath room during the night The breakfast was continental Good coffee and great service The room was a little warm and got crowded at times but it was great to wake up to in the morning and you could get coffee water cups from a container and cookies and fruit during the day 
The hotel is in a great location Just a couple of blocks from Central Park and walking distance from most everything in the Mid region
We were there celebrating our anniversary and they brought up some Sparkling wine It was a very nice gesture We had to leave a day early due to Hurricane Sandy but we cut our losses since we didnt want to get stuck in NYC Glad we left We drove down 48th  7th street Monday morning at 900 am and they werent a car in sight Real weird feeling

title: Loved the Hampton in Soho
text:
This was our first trip to New York and we were so lucky to stay at such a lovely hotel The staff were friendly and helpfulspecial thanks to Tiana and Jay The location of the hotel with amazing restaurants right around the corner Close to the subway on Canal street within walking distance of lower Manhattan
It was a but pricey but well worth the money Our room was small but very clean and tidy
I left my heart in New York and wouldnt stay anywhere else Loved the room loved the breakfasts great staff serving breakfast too loved the location loved the city
Have already recommended this great little hotel to friends

title: Great location and rooms but a little noisy and pillows are uncomfortable
text:
The hotel is a few blocks from 6th and Congress two blocks from the Congress Street bridge and the river front and only one block from a big convention center Nice location all around 
When you check in your car immediately goes to valet parking and youre charged 14day plus tip Thats kind of annoying but the valet folks are prompt and friendly 
The hotel lobby is beautiful and has a small storepantry with toiletries snacks and even frozen dinners Theres a bank of 3 elevators all very fast to take you to one of 16 floors Breakfast is on the 2nd floor we stayed on a weekend and it was crowded on Saturday less so on Sunday but still managable Food was pretty good didnt try the coffee The fourth floor has a gym and a small rooftop pool  depth ranges from 34 feet maybe 4 12 feet at most 
The rooms are nicer than your typical Hampton Inn room  clean spacious no funny smells lots of storage nice furniture nice blinds a fridge and free high speed internet with a cable included just bring your laptop The cable on TV was pretty limited no comedy central Also the pillows were very hard
The bathroom was a good size with those nice roomy shower curtains and great water pressure in the shower Very clean One major downside to the room  you can hear everything from your neighbors rooms voices television the sound of the curtains being pulled back 
Overall probably the nicest Hampton Inn Ive ever stayed in and I would definitely stay here again
Nearby food 
 check out the Mongolian grill across the street its delicious and only comes to about 10 for dinner
 For coffee walk two blocks down to the Radisson at the corner of Cesar Chavez and Congress theres a Starbucks in their lobby Also a Seattles Best at 4th and Congress and another Starbucks at 5th and Congress 
 A CVS pharmacy is also near 5th and Congress And there is a Whole Foods at 6th and Lamar I think  about a mile from the hotel
 You are about two or three blocks from the Colorado River aka Town Lake and its parks and paths You can get to it by walking past the Radisson and then just behind it where there are TGIFridays tables set up Or continue on Cesar Chavez across Congress Street and hit the path there

title: Nice hotelonce they let you in
text:
So its not entirely the hotels fault that our NYC trip was sunkbut it all started with the fact that they wouldnt let us into our room when we arrived at 130pm after a four hour drive Or when we came back at 330pm because they told us a room would be ready then Or when we came back at 4pm because how on earth could a room not be ready by then So with my exhausted 3yearold we basically napped on the sofa in the lobby until 430pm when they finally let us in having now 30 mintues to get ready before we had to leave So if your trip hinges on the importance of getting a kids afternoon nap in think twice 
The room was nice kind of small but not for NYC good water pressure in the shower Turns out it was useful having a 24hour pharmacy across the street because at 3am my son was sick having been outside all afternoon and missing a nap Then there were the drunk guys screaming in the hall an hour laterfollowed by the cops 
So overall its a perfectly nice hotel but I absolutely guarantee I wont go near it again Again the hotel cant be blamed for the sick kid the drunk guys etcbut not having guest rooms ready until 430pm is unacceptable in my book

title: View and location perfect
text: We had a balcony room on the second floor overlooking the famous Salina bridge over the river Sitting on that balcony in the mornings and evenings watching the world walk  and float  by was the highlight of my trip The close proximity to many wonderful eateries the Alamo the Rivercenter Mall etc was a big plus The atmosphere the service the tiny pool the restaurant best huevos rancheros ever were all exemplary The room could be kept amazingly cool for such a HOT city My only complaint were I forced to find one is that the bed was a little soft and the pillows rather flat so I didnt sleep quite as well as I do in my own bed I had toyed with the idea of changing my reservation to the Westin when it offered a big sale right before I left but Im so glad I did not A highrise cook cutter hotel would not have come close to the scenic historical experience we enjoyed at La Mansion

title: Good if the price is right
text: A group of six of us stayed here for six nights from Aug 31 to Sept 6 This was my second time to stay here and we got a spectacular rate of 88 plus tax per night For a good deal the Park Central is good value The location is brilliant the beds are comfy the rooms are a decent size However there are a few issues which could be improved upon Our room did smell a bit musty not enough to request a move but noticeable The room was always well cleaned a few bucks to the maid always helps with this The elevator system can be a pain but once you use the allocated lift isnt that big a deal The public areas are decent enough We were allowed to check in early on request which was nice The front desk staff were pleasant on arrival One of our group had the same issue of no towels in the room The only thing that really annoyed me was when it came to check out It transpired that the hotel had put a 100 per day hold on our card in addition to the cost of the room As we were continuing our holiday afterwards this was very inconvenient At no time were we informed that they would put this hold in place and as it was a holiday weekend it took a few days to clear The lady I dealt with on checkout was very rude and unhelpful on this matter All other staff we encountered were very pleasant I was there the night the fire alarm went off and I was very satisfied with the system they have in place to keep guests informed Its a shame they only make their announcements in english as I had to explain what was being said to some people who didnt speak english Overall an ok stay though I would probably return if I got the same deal in the future

title: Too big  but a great room
text: This hotel is massive It feels very impersonal so if you are looking for personal service Id go somewhere else However great room and breakfast was good Sleep quality fine Overall nothing negative about this hotel apart from being too big and nothing overly positive An average stay for my business trip to Boston

title: Warm luxurious urbane friendly hip base for our family wedding
text: 3 generations the brides and the grooms family  from the NY region  filled a score of rooms and everybody sang the praises of the Dana staff They are relaxed focused ready to help however Within 24 hours key staff were using my name Very helpful consierges Excellent restaurant aja Excellent details beds linens towels showers iPod stereo Chicago know how to play host and Dana is at the top of the list

title: Good location comfortable and clean
text:
Have stayed in lots of ny hotels This was a very nice stay The rooms are as described we had a high room with two queens it was roomy for new York bath was small but new fixtures and more then functional Nice big tv well placed The location is very nice but be warned on a hot summer day or night a walk to the theatre district or central park is to hard but just far enough to think twice about a cab We walked but it was warm Park was fifteen minutes theatres a little further very safe
Staff at hotel was great Note the lobby was always crowdd free internet and for food plan on going elsewhere which well it is ny you should explore
Would happily stay again

title: Loved the Tomo
text: I dont usually take the time to write hotel reviews but I wanted to share my recent experience at the Hotel Tomo My wife myself and our 2 year old daughter stayed at the Tomo for 2 nights in August and we thought the service was very thoughtful and that our entire hotel experience was extremely fun and different from other hotels The staff went out of their way to make us feel like welcome including giving us a variety of helpful restaurant recommendations Also the rooms were cool funky and fun I would recommend this hotel highly

title: We loved the convenience of Loews LEnfant Hotel
text: We loved the hotel because of its convenient access to the subway and its many shops and eating places below We had two rooms and one was a suite which was fabulous and the suite was less expensive than our regular room Both our views were incredible overlooking the Smithsonian Institution Museums The suite consisted of a living area dining room and bar large bathroom and closets The service was great and the people were friendly and very accomodating We will definitely choose LEnfant Plaza again the next time we are in Washington DC The walking distance to the various locations is great I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Loved the Warwick
text: We just stayed at the Warwick for a week and thought it was wonderful For the price of a hotel room elsewhere we got a very large suite The suite was well equipped quiet clean had great city views and its in an incredible location for seeing all the sites We would stay here again

title: Great stay
text: My family stayed at this hotel back in June 2012 for 4 days and had a wonderful time The hotel is very close to the White House Smithsonian and metro stations Our room was spacious with 2 comfortable double beds And the staff were friendly and efficient We had no problems with the hotel valet parking All in all it was a great stay Will definintely return

title: Great Hotel
text: We had a room with 2 queen size beds The room was large by any standardnot just NY and very clean Staff was friendly nice polite and helpful It was a little noisy for me at night but did not seem to bother my daughterinlaw As for the location I prefer the upper east side but I would never find a roomhotel this nice in that part of town for the price

title: Very pleased with this hotel Recommended
text:
Stayed for 2 weeks in January and I cant speak more highly of this hotel
I was very happy with the room which was a Deluxe room
Room was spotlessly clean with plenty of space
Breakfast was more than I expected and the staff were always friendly
Close to 2 subway lines so getting around was easy
I would definitely stay with them again the hotel was quiet and I very much enjoyed my stay

title: Excellent small hotel in great location
text: Hotel Giraffe is a excellent small hotel Good location near Union Square and Flatiron District very friendly and helpful staff excellent free continental breakfast Our one bedroom suite was very comfortable and quiet I would definitely stay here again

title: Great Location even better Service
text: This hotel couldn have a better location for visiting Boston Across from Fanuel Hall in the North End right on the water near the Aquariumjust perfect And the service is even better I was there for a conference and the staff was so accomodating This is a great place to stay on a visiteven a better place to plan an event And it has had a recent facelift so the decor is very pleasant

title: Great location in the heart of the city
text: We stayed here for a quick weekend getaway and found the location and staff to be exceptional The hotel is currently undergoing construction so there was a little noise Exactly as expected Would stay here again the next time were Austin

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed at Embassy Suites in Denver this past weekend with the fiancee and another couple Great location We were able to walk to Coors Field for a Rockies game and down to 16th Street for a night out on the town Hotel is very reasonably priced for its great location Rooms are VERY spacious clean and comfortable Breakfast buffet was ridiculously busy but the food was good and worth the lines 29 a night for valet parking in Denver is unfortunately a standard So just know that ahead of time Will definitely stay again and recommend this hotel for others

title: Great price and great location huge rooms
text:
I got a really good rate through traveltickercom at this hotel Its located across the street from Carnegie Hall near two subway lines Staff is friendly at the desk Used to be apartments for the church next door 
Microwave sink and refrigerator in the room Nice amenities Lots of closets large bathroom and large room Flat screen tv Request a high floor  window air conditioner so the windows arent total soundproof Heating is via a radiator and only control is to turn it off Still too hot and we had to open the window 
Beds were very very hard No free internet or free wireless internet Price was great for the location

title: Most rundown deceiving hotel ever
text: Horrible place Awful service They acted like they didnt care The hotel is run down The hot water barely works Every floor has a different foul odor and had a different nasty motif There were rooms that you could see inside because the door knobs had been removed and you could see insideripped up wallpaperlooked like a crime scene The hot tub was so thick with dirt and grime you couldnt see the bottom The restaurant closes at 2pm You have to become a member of the bar in order for them to serve you The sink in the mens bathroom wasnt even attached I turned it on and it started spraying water all over me Some rooms wouldnt lock and others your keys would just stop working There was no shuttle to the DFW airport One of the elevators wasnt working I could go on and on

title: Great location but not as nice as Embassy Suites
text:
Stayed in the North Tower fairly low floor for six nights Other than the partying conventioneers below our room two nights it was quiet which was a huge improvement over our last stay in the South Tower We still love the breakfast buffet although 18 is on the expensive side and the location cant be beat Thats all the positive stuff I can think of The experience wasnt terrible by any means but there was a constant trickle of annoyances from a broken shower handle that cut my hand and was apparently the source of the bloody shower curtain that was there when we arrived to the thowupthecoversandcallitmade approach to bedmaking our housekeeper employed The refrigerator didnt work and smelled of mildew The bathtub didnt get cleaned well once while we were there We didnt get the foam pillows we requested in advance and our inability to get TWO extra BATH towels every day for the duration of our stay requested in writing via the Marriott website and confirmed in advance reached the point of absurdity By the end of the week I did a commando raid on a housekeeping cart to get the towels We got six bottles of conditioner and only two of shampoo over the course of the week The pool area which looks lovely still was festooned with little dabs of duck poop from the three families of ducks that live there Worse it stayed in the same spots from day to day ew The pipedin muzak at the pool was incredibly loud and the bass was turned WAY up so you got hours of constant reggae beat fullblast Wed go ask at the pool shack for them to turn it down they would and then twenty minutes later some other shack employee would blast it again 
For the money the Embassy Suites where we stayed earlier this year delivers a much nicer facility and better service Did I mention the surly sarcastic bellboy who said that NO they do NOT have a shuttle and that perhaps the best thing to do if I wanted inexpensive airport transportation would be to take a CAB Did I mention the housekeeper who barged into our room at 7 am when she obviously thought we were at breakfast looking for her tip

title: Intergenerational Hotel Location location location
text: I just returned home from a week and a half stay at the Wellington About three blocks to your right the southern end of Central Park about 34 blocks to your left Times Square nearby the best burger and malt ever at the Brooklyn Diner the Russian Tea Room just around the corner on 7th Ave out the side door of the Hotel the 57th7th Ave subway stop The service 5 star the staff friendlytheir to serve you and make your stay as enjoyable as possible the room just the right size for someone more out than in The room and bathroom clean comfortable room 111 with King size bed Internet free get the details when you checkin Arrangements made for transportation to the airport The bed comfortable but its time is near for a replacement mattress Being on the 11th floor and facing a side street very quiet for city noise factors I would definitely book this home away from home hotel again

title: Its alright
text: Its a great location especially on blues fest weekend The lake view king room is a must as the others have little space and no views I had left behind something in the room and after some prodding and a shift change security finally located it and had it retured to me Rooms are clean

title: Great location
text: Attending a concert at the ogden theater Ramada only one block away So we left are car at the ramada and walk They have bars across the streetresturants very conviniente I would reccomend this place to family and friends staying in Denver

title: A fun place to stay
text:
My mom and I took a weekend trip to New York City to see many shows Broadway and a live taping of The Colbert Report The hotel was nicely situated and walking to Broadway from the hotel was fast and easy We didnt need to use the subway 
The rooms are very modern complete was a cool glowing purple light at nighttime If youre into funky decor like me then you will enjoy this hotel The rooms are small but my mother and I spent very little time there since we decided to sight see all day The bed was comfortable and fun to adjust The Shower was nice but the glass made it kind of awkward to shower 
The restaurant in the hotel features Asianfusion cuisine which I am also a huge fan of We had a great dinner after going to see Stephen Colbert In the morning this restaurant offer complementary muffins and teacoffee the muffins were delicious and offered just enough food to start out the day The restaurant also offers other breakfast dishes but you must pay for the 
Overall I had a great stay and was very pleased by the cleanliness of the room and the professional staff I will stay here again

title: Below ExpectationsI will avoid coming back
text:
First impression loads of people hanging round fron door smoking No concierge Lobby was dark and dingy It only has a tiny seating area that resembles a waiting room a checkin desk and some drinks  snacks on sale The staff were polite but did not offer any advice on the facilities or lack of facilities
On the plus side the hotel has free wifi free buffet breakfast and is centrally located
HOWEVER the wifi signal drops frequently the buffet breakfast was mainly plastic plates and cutlery with very little appealing food I had toast Note  although the location is central  as a lone female on business in the area I was not comfortable alone in the evenings around the hotel as there are so many bums around There is no doorman like other hotels around so you do worry about security in the hotel too
My room was spacious though the bathroom area was too cramped and lacked quality Overall the room was clean though the decor was dated and shabby and the room was overdue a deep clean There was a lot of dust in not so easy to reach places and around carpet edges staining on curtains next to wash basin etc The fridge in the kitchen area was noisy and disturbed sleep at times 
NOTE  there is no restaurant in this hotel not aware of this on my first night with jet lag I ordered room service It was delivered by a bloke in jeanstshirtcap no hotel uniform and it was in a brown carrier bag along with instructions on how to heat in the microwave
I just wanted a decent snacknot DIY
Noise insulation is not great  noisy traffic outside disturbs sleep
This was my first time staying in a Residence Inn  booked by my works travel team as usual hotel was full I have stayed in many Marriotts and knew that Residence was a downmarket version but had not expected it to be so lacking in basic hotel amenities such as a restaurant or a safe in the bedroom 
It is not as cheap as youd expect for such basic accommodation
This place is fine if you want a place with your own inroom kitchen centrally located and nothing more
I will be avoiding in future

title: Great place and good customer service
text: The Chelsea DTH is a clean and relaxing great place to stay With views of 1 World Trade Center from your window and courteous staff When we come back we will stay here again Pretty much central to everything without the touristy feel and little off the beaten path to make a great place

title: Best Kept Secret in Chicago
text: I stayed here with a reunion group recently Aside from the rooms being a little on the small side there is nothing not to like about this hotel The hotel staff was very accommodating and kind The docorum was amazing expecially the lobby with lots of couches chairs and hidden nooks to steal away from the crowdshould there be a crowd I absolutely loved this hotel and everything it had to offer The complimentary coffee and daily wine sip adds an awesome touch of class My group couldnt stop thanking everyone at the hotel for a fantastic stay A definite new favorite spot on the Chicago hotel scene Most definitely two thumbs up for the Hotel Allegro and its staff calvinj

title: Great Experience at the InterContinental Dallas
text:
During my stay I found out that a portion of the hotel has been completely renovated and a portion has been partially renovated the brand new rooms are a vast improvement and are well worth the extra amount they are charging Luxurious and definitely InterContinental standard larger sized rooms than many of the other InterContinental hotels Mayfair London Chicago Mark Hopkins San Fran
The hotel is in a great area of town that is much more upscale than my Downtown Dallas experiences and has much to do within a relatively small area I would certainly stay here again next time

title: Awesome hotelwould recommend over any property downtown
text:
The is a 5 star Embassy Suites in my book The hotel is very clean with spacious rooms and a wonderful poolfitness area The beds were very comfortable the staff very friendly and the breakfast very tasty I will always stay at this hotel whenever I am in Denver
The only small negative I have to report is the valet parking is pretty much mandatory and its 28 per day Otherwise I loved this hotel

title: Nice hotel great staff
text: Had the pleasure of staying here for a weekend for a friends bachelor party The staff was great the drinks were amazing Room was on point with downtown feel Will come back again Rock on guys

title: If possible I would always stay at a Doubletree Suite
text:
We found this hotel through priceline and paid 89 per night Unbelievablel deal
We arrived on the late side but there were still warm cookies waiting for us something I didnt realize was part of their welcome Very quick check in We were also given directions to get to the airport and rental car checkin since wed be leaving early and might be in a rush
Our rooms  well it was just fantastic to have two separate rooms two separate televisions a small fridge a microwave small sink and cupboards to use The couch was comfy the beds even comfier Closets with plenty of space The one downside was that because our bathroom was handicap accessible there was no lip to the bath so the water tended to make a bit of a mess on the floor
We used the pool and hot tub Both were well kept and towels were available even at night
In the morning breakfast is offered but since we were leaving early we didnt get the hot breakfastbut muffins and coffee and some fruit were available Checkout was quick and painless
I wish we had more DoubleTrees were I live in NHbut whenever I travel I will certainly look for this hotel before others One of the reasons we chose the hotel was because of its proximity to the airportso its not exactly close to all things downtownbut there was little to no trafficairport noise and the grounds and surroundings were well kept and attractive

title: Worst Starwood property ever
text:
If youve ever stayed at a W Westin or even Sheraton  this hotel is a disappointment Cheaply constructed and worn  frankly what Id expect of a mall hotel Ill admit I usually stay downtown or Uptown when in Dallas for work  and this was an exception so Im sure that impacts my review 
However the hotelmy room has cheap doors incredibly cheap light fixtures loose bathroom faucets For a 4 star  it leaves a LOT to be desired I realize these things are small  but only 1 bar of soap and when I called for an extra bar and towels they never came I was charged twice for valet parking and I had to chase them down for 2 days after to get credit as I didnt have time to fight it on my way out to the airport They wouldnt respond to me until I called back twice and sent 2 emails
The hotel seems to just try too hard to be trendy  and done on the ultra cheap Only 1 of the 2 elevators was in service as well Staff quality that of a Motel 6
Ill never stay here again  and Im not sure what Starwood is trying to accomplish with the LeMeridien brand  but it has zero identity unlike W Westin or Sheraton

title: Great hotel and really pleasant staff
