text: You cant beat this location for Manhattan This hotel is walking distance to almost anyplace for the adventurous touristfrom Central Park to Battery Park Sure itll take you some time to walk to either of those two places but the journey is part of the experience Plus its within about 4 blocks of 6 different subway entrys so thats a big plus The rooms are appointed quite nicely with very modern touches but my room was amazingly small and cramped Even for Manhattan standards this was small It was hard to close the bathroom door behind me without having to turn and step aside Other than that though this hotel is a super choice for anyone visiting Manhattan Oh yes and the bar in the hotel has a great vibe if youre in the mood for a nightcap

title: Excellent location in the heart of Manhattan
text: Wow we arrived into New York city along with Hurricane Irene Our Hotel was well equipped and the staff fantastic particularly front desk We had a great time again in New York and the location of Staybridge is outstanding Would recommend even to the most hard to please Great place breakfast a welcome start in the sunny atrium room Well done

title: Great hotel most convenient
text:
We had an excellent stay at this hotel It was most convenient to Union Square shopping and within easy walking distance of a lot of other attractions Being close to the cable car turnaround meant that transportation was a breeze I would recomend buying the Muni pass for a week that gets you unlimited transportation
The restaurant was always very busy but we did not dine there and could not comment Unfortunately the night club on the top floor was closed for renovations  it is supposed to be outstanding Sign up to the guest program online and you can get free internet as well as drinks nightly
The only issue was that some rooms near elevators could be noisy so be sure to check that out when you get in the room Rooms can vary significantly in size even for the same room category and price

title: Great location  service
text: Excellent location in Georgetown  great service Our room was small but clean  comfortable The bellman Amadou  Erwing and restaurant staff were very pleasant  courteous

title: Hotel Carlton has become my home away from home when in San Francisco
text: A colleague recommended Hotel Carlton for my stay when I was traveling to SF for business and I was treated so well that it has now become my home away from home while on business I have recommended colleagues to the hotel and have sent staff as well as I have recommended Hotel Carlton to friends going on holidays Make sure to enjoy the wine reception in the lobby and take advantage of the location to access different areas of the city From reservations welcome by front staff to cleaning staff you will be taken care of in a professional but also personalized way I signed up for a Joy of Life club and recommend repeat clients do the same It is also important to me knowing that Hotel Carlton is a Green business in SF as I would much rather support a business that is operating with environmental initiatives then not ENJOY your stay at a great hotel in a great city

title: Good Airport Stay
text: Needed a one night room for staying when flying out of Phoenix after touring Arizona This hotel was close to the airport but not so close that we could hear planes flying around us Lots of resort style plants and courtyard settings inside the hotel Didnt get to hotel till late so didnt do much except check in watch some tv use the wifi internet and then go to sleep Beds were comfortable rooms were clean and most importantly showers were nice and hot in the morning Overall nice place to stay at also the breakfast was nice before the flight

title: Most expensive place to stayAND THE WORST
text: What has happened to Hilton It used to always be a really nice experience to stay at one However for my last 2 visits in two differend citites were both bad I ended up fighting with them for 2 months after my last stay just to get them to do what they said they would do I had to follow up with them several times in order to get them to keep their promises That is really sad when you cant even expect them to keep their word I wont go into any more details of that stay because its already in here somewhere This time however we are againnot happy at all The ONLY thing this place has to offer is the location You will find that they are experts at finding ways to get tip money from you by hijacking your luggage etc You will find that the drinks they make you in the bar will be TERRIBLE and cost 1500 each They dont even have a blender and cannot make frozen type drinks Why not Cant Hilton afford a blender You will find that the wireless internet service will not stay connected The signal will go in and out and have to keep trying to reconnect We had 2 different laptops with us and they both had the same problem We ended up going accross the street to the Star Bucks to use the internet from there We also ended up using the Applebees located inside the Hilton for drinks There is NO pool or and NO spa The gym is very small and poorly equipped We also expected polioterespectfulprofessional staff And sadly this proved to not be true as well They were less than helpful with us on several occassions and were downright rude as well We understood that this would be expensive After all its Times Square But we also expected things to work And that the food and drinks would be good for those prices and we are sad to report that we cannot give the Hilton a good report AND that this is the second time in a row Once in Phoenix and once here in Times SquareNew York city We have been traveling now for over 2 weeks We went to England France Germany etc And all of our accomadations at the other places where we stayed were great None of them were Hilton So we have stayed in different Hotels every night for the last couple of weeks and everyone did a better job than Hilton We are Hilton Honours members and have just about decided to give it all up and tell Hilton goodbye Were also Marriot rewards members Marriotthere we come

title: Hyatt Hill Country Service has stepped up
text:
I just finished another great Spring Break with the family at The Hyatt Hill Country We have visited the Hyatt Hill Country 4 times and this visit had better than the normal really good service Not one time did a doorman or bellman miss opening the main door greating us and asking how we were or if we needed anything I was looking for the ice machine and a lady approached me and asked if I neede help and politely directed me stayed with and chatted for a while I forget her name but she must be easy to id she told me she has been there 13 years One afternoon I was walking in the lobby and stoppped at the restaurant book stand JJ came up and asked if he could help he made 2 dinner reservations for me within 5 mins and both were great The Lil Rhine on the river for steak and Wildfish for seafood
The next day I was walking through the lobby with my daughters I was wearing a hat and glasses out of nowhere JJ approached us address me by my last name and asked how the first night dinner was I have to tell you thats great service The entire stay was filled with great moments with the family and great service from all encountered staff thanks Hyatt for yet another great stay

title: Extremely poor and rude customer service
text:
First of all the pool wasnt working and they act as if thats okay Not for the price you pay
The customer service is horrible They have a shuttle service that take you within 5 miles of the hotel So we wanted to go to the mall which is within range so when I call to ask they told me that they cant take me to the mall because the mall service runs every 3 hours and the next one is in 2 hours So I asked the guy You take guests within 5 miles of the hotel right and he answered Yes but just not the mall So I tell him if I find something close to the mall will you take me there He was like yes so I said Can you just take me to the mall then and he was like sorry We cant do that mall shuttles run every 3 hours
ARE YOU SERIOUS So I ended up looking up a restaurant half a mile away from the mall and going down to the shuttle desk The guy I had just spoken to was there I ask them to take the to the restaurant He asked me if it was near the mall I said yes but you wont take me to the mall so
Then he started being dumb was like well if you have asked me for a favor I would have said yes ARE YOU KIDDING ME You are a 4 star hotel You should have been taught customer service and offered me a ride there when I asked over the phone
Never staying here again

title: Was scared  but wasnt too bad
text:
The reviews on trip advisor had me freaked out However I was traveling in a group and most of them were med students who couldnt afford the 400 hotel rooms may is a busy month in bean town with graduations etc and everything was booked up months ago so we decided on copley house as they were the only ones with reasonable rates we paid about 245 one bedroom which had ample room for 5 people per apartment
We were a group of 15 people celebrating a 30th birthday We got three apartments 2 one bedrooms and one studio Each had its own charm a fire place copious mirors large kitchen etc etc
 I will admit that the carpets were dusty and the blinds let light through but the kitchen was adequate enough to make some scrambled eggs and toast The couch pulls out in all rooms and is just as comfy as the bed in the room  not the comfiest but isnt that bad The pillows are on the thin side make no mistake these are no westin beds 
I took my own towels and toiletries but they had supplied towels and basic toiletries The maids clean the room once a day but they dont do a good job one of the bathrooms had hair and lint that looked like it had been there for a week
The check in is smooth and the staff are very friendly Perfect location right next to the copley plaza and the prudential centre You are next to three T Subway stops Prudential copley and back bay 
Free wifi was great They have limited parking spots at 10night but they gave it to us for free 
We were a group with different levels of income and we all agreed that this place was good for what we needed for the weekend We came prepared and expecting the worst  so admittedly our expectations were low The management is in the process of repainting and repairing things so they clearly do read these message boards As for those complaining about flights of stairs  welcome to boston thats how most apartments are

title: Everything the Reviews had said  and more
text:
My wife and I had a wonderful 5 night stay at The Library Hotel  Accomodation and service were excellent The only reason our expectations werent exceeded was that we had read so many great reviews before we visited that we were not surprised by the high standards This hotel has set the bar very high for itself but unlike many establishments it seems consistently able to maintain those high standards
We were in a suite on the 3rd floor facing onto Madison Ave  well worth the extra money for the views and the larger room 
I endorse all the great reviews that have gone before on this hotel  no point in going over it all again Accomodation  service and staff all top class and I wouldnt hesitiate to recommend this hotel and will stay here again when back in NYC
2 minor negative points  there is a fair amount of traffic noise to be heard on the lower floors  but not a major problem and as other reviewers have said the rooftop terrace bar is very busy most evenings  but then thats down to the quality of the place isnt it

title: Beware of the Sir Charges
text: Apart from the location great but it stops there Upon checkin I was informed I would have a queen bed I asked for a king size bed and I was told there would be a charge for going up to a king GIVE ME A BREAK a surcharge for going from a queen to a king When I got up to the room it was like a oven I could not get the air to work and needed to call twice before getting service Everything in the room had a charge associated to it even down to the coffee 100 Now whats up with that I was very disappointed in the size of the bathroom Very small I have stayed there twice and with so many other options I feel this will be my last

title: Very pleased with accommodations and service
text: We booked this room through a third party but were treated like we were a frequent guest The room was spacious clean with a nice view Everyone we interfaced with provided friendly service We would definitely stay there again

title: Nice Hotel  really busy
text: The Hotel is very nice It has an old world feel to it  very high end looking The room was comfortable and clean the bed a little hard The service was great I really dont have any complaints I just didnt prefer the busyness of it all It is a rather large hotel that hosts lots of events It is noisy in the common areas and with what seemed to be several weddingsparties going on it was a bit overwhelming Location is great

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: I recently stayed here for a business trip The room is well appointed and the beds are quite comfortable There is a restaurant onsite and the food is pretty good The hotel is located in the heart of downtown so practically everything is within walking distance

title: One and Done with this or any Starwood Property
text: We arrived Christmas Eve and stayed through New Years Day  rooms were deluxe which only means higher floor  not deluxe in any other way shape or form Location is the only thing going for this property Rude staff ridiculous charges escalators always broken not enough outlets hair dryer didnt work housekeeping was half way done etc etc etc We had 2 rooms one king for my husband and myself and one double for our 3 children 16 18 22 What is with the door in the bathroom ZERO privacy And it doesnt even work properly Double rooms are not big enough to move around in Downright claustrophobic The fiasco that was New Years Eve is a whole different story too  Hotel said we could only use entrance on 43rd to get back in after midnight yet the police had 43rd entrance blocked so we walked to 42nd where we were crushed and waited another 40 minutes in the cold only to find out the doors on 42nd were LOCKED Unbelievable The people who rated this place high or recommended it obviously have low expectations

title: Very very nice hotel first rate all the way
text: The rooms are amazingly beautiful cozy elaborately decorated and tastefully appointed in a contemporarymodern design I am not easily impressed but this was as nice as any hotel Ive been to in recent memory and I was indeed impressed The bathroom was elegant spacious and very well lit The room had many options for lighting from business bright to mood casual My room was exceptionally clean and in like new condition The bed was very comfortable with real downfeather pillows which I prefer Overall I just can not say enough good things about this hotel The staff was very friendly and helpful as well I stayed for business so I can not actually recall what it cost because I just expensed it but I dont think it was extraordinarily expensive if I recall correctly Two thumbs up big for this hotel Go there you wont be disappointed

title: Great service  fair property
text: Excellent front desk service Clean But  a little scary Best rate I could find near the Galleria but I was not comfortable with the location and did not feel 100 safe I would not recommend to a friend so I cant reccomend to you Pay a little more and stay at another proprty nearby

title: Cant go wrong here if you just need a place to crash
text:
I have frequently visited Austin every few months for the last decade I will typically stay a Friday or Saturday night so I am not in my hotel room often I have stayed at just about every hotel in Austin and believe it or not THIS is my favorite one 
If you are familiar with Austin and know all the roads like the back of your hand this location is easily accessible If this is your first time you may feel out of the way
The room was clean comfortable and had modern amenities that I never expected a budget motel to have I liked the nice personal touches they added you could rent free DVDs in the lobby they put out dailynightly snacks in the lobby the pillow menu and the basket of goodies they have waiting in your room for you upon arrival It reminded me of the Holiday Inn Express with more of a boutique feel
The staff was over the top wonderful I wish I could remember the name of the young lady that was working the lobby during my stay She was fantastic Very sweet girl
I felt safe and comfortable during my stay and would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to others if you are looking for a cheap place to crash for a night

title: Charming and annoying
text: Its tne second time Ive stayed here I like the funkiness of the person operated elevatorsand the friendly professional staff but this time am so annoyed over the nonworking wired connection and the fake promises to address my complaints about a lesser room when Ive brought colleagues and booked several rooms here for several nights No ice machine they bring you ice No wireless you call an 800 number for technical assistance on a wired connection and are very polite about their limits on addressing that Sorry maam the pool is closed for the season All with a very friendly charming face but not meeting my needs for comfort and amenities

title: Memorable SF Honeymoon
text: My new Husband and I went to SF on our honeymoon and Hotel Carlton was the icing on our cake From the moment we arrived it felt like home the staff is really cool the whole ambiance was welcoming and relaxing The WiFi was down for our entire stay is our only complaintbut hey it was our honeymoon we didnt care Theres a cute little place next door with really yummy Sangria The location was super central and we saved a lot of money

title: Use the valet at your own risk
text: Our 1 night stay at the hotel was fine However the valet parked our rental car on the street and the car was ticketed by the DC police The hotel manager was quite apologetic and offered to pay the ticket and waive the valet services Well it seems he forgot to waive the valet services as we were still charged them To make matters worse it seems there was another ticket on the rental car  we found out about this ticket 2 months after our stay after our rental car company slapped us with a hefty bill I am trying to get this all refunded but getting in touch w the billing dept or any staff in an easy timely manner is difficult Disappointed frustrated Our one night at this hotel has left us with a headache

title: Pretty good after a long flight
text:
We called the hotel from the airport and the shuttle arrived in a matter of minutes The driver was very helpful and insisted on taking the cases on and off the bus
He had us at the hotel a few minutes later where check in was quick and easy Our one bedroomed suite was spacious with all the things you needed ie fridge water microwave etc My only comment was the fact that it was beginning to look a bit well used
The hotel was running a special promotion that mean all Hilton Honours cardholders received free wireless which was great albeit it was a bit flaky and sometimes dropped out or refused o connect for no good reason
We ate in the restaurant downstairs which is a bit soulless as it is in the huge atrium area but the service was good and the food was fine Breakfast is also here in the morning and the range and choice was excellent with even a mad to order omelette station
Staff were all friendly and helpful and the shuttle the next morning was morethan happy to drop us at the Alamo lot to collect our hire car The location of the hotel is a little offputting in that its amongst all the car hire depots and in a pretty seedy area but it could hardly be closer to the airport and the shuttles take you to anywhere you require The AC unit can be noisy but turning the fan to low both kept the noise down to an acceptable level and kept the room cool A little noise is always handy anyway to phase out external noise from the corridors although we found the hotel to be very quiet and peaceful even though there were quite a few guests judging by the number who came down at breakfast time
Wed certainly stay here again

title: Excellent Staff Clean  Always a Yummy Cookie
text:
I recently stayed at this Doubletree for a workshop and I was very pleased with the overall attentiveness of the staff My experience was that they worked as a team It was refreshing to checkin to this hotel after midnight and be treated like family was welcoming me home
Aside from the staff the accommodations were sufficient and comfortable My room was always very clean and toiletries were supplied abundantly 
The drawbacks for me were that the food in the restaurant was okay for the price and the walls were a little thin
However with the endless supply of warm yummy cookies I could almost overlook those things Lol

title: Great View Surprising Restaurant
text: Its a nice fancy tall hotel withinw alking distance of most major attractions Usual amenities free wifi flat screen tv gym no fog bathroom mirror Con only some elevators were working and not very well not cheap Pro very helpful smiling and patient staff great clamsalmon chowder But the best thing I found was the beautifu small top floor uncrowded and quiet restaurant on a Saturday night with good food great service and wonderful views

title: Modern hotel concept good parking rates comfy stay
text:
We knew it was going to be a different experience when we pulled up to the curb by a building that looked like an apartment building The hotel seems brand new with what I would describe as a stark modern and minimal interior We were planning on parking on a nearby overnight lot for the weekend but changed our minds when we found out that underground parking with unlimited in and out priviledges is only 15night 
The rooms are oddly numbered with evens on one side and odds on the other Our room ending in 20 did not follow the posted signs and we found out by walking the entire floor It was an end unit room very spacious with two queen beds corner sofa sink area and very small bathroom The bathroom was so small that opening the door was impossible if you were standing in front of the toilet 
Everything was quite clean and it was a very pleasant stay

title: Average hotel Nothing had but nothing extraordinary
text: Location was mediocre pool was decent as was spa Nice fitness room Rooms were average sized was stuck with two double beds as no kings were available Probably expect more from a Hilton overall

title: Very clean small cozy family run and friendly
text: We didnt actually stay here but the sign said come in and see a room so we did Alan the owner showed us around a couple of room They are small but extremely clean and functional and have sitting areas outside the room There is also a breakfast area with free breakfast tables chairs and umbrellas The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming even though it wouldnt fit our needs due to our grandchildrens need for a pool which they dont have But for a place to lay your head gaze at the harbor walk to restaurants with public transportation very close this is a great place We value personality and service and this exceeds the big boys

title: A Great Beach Getaway
text: My Husbands family first introduced me to The Beach Cottages about 20 years ago when I first started dating him They always booked an entire month we usually stayed with them for a week We stayed in a cottage 3 back from the beach The cottage is was large enough to sleep 4 people very comfortably and it is just steps from the beach The cottages are decorated very nicely and the staff are very accomodating We slept with the windows wide open so that we could hear the ocean waves very relaxing There are plenty of places to eat and drink within walking distance and there are plenty of little shops for those who are like me and need a souvenir from every place that I stay Another perk is that the Crystal Pier is right down the boardwalk The cottages have kitchenettes with a small set of dinnerware and silverware so you can bring food and prepare it there there are also barbeques as well It is a family friendly place with ping pong tables for the kids If you want to be close to the beach with all the comforts of home the Beach Cottages is the place to be

title: Good location but many flaws for the price
text: Stayed here 3days for meeting with wife Excellent location next to Grand Central Station and short walk to theatre district but so many little flaws that just shouldnt be in such a prestigious hotel name big city and for 300night Here they are kingbed room too small for 2 people no coffee pot in room no stands to place luggage uncomfortable room temp and thermostat really didnt work TV channels only analog no wifi only 1 sink in bathroom basin small and not enough space for 2 people to keep their toiletries shelf over sink where you could hit your head if you bend over to wash your face alarm clock woke us at 2am we didnt set it I would only stay here again if I could get a larger room for a much lower price

title: River Inn a great value for a suite
text: I took my family on a last minute trip to DC in January and we got a great deal at the River Inn We spent 9900 online and got a very nice room with private changing area and full kitchen If youre looking to spend your money on a nicer room then the Comfort Inn type this was great for a weekend I think a week long visit would need a bigger room then the Jr Suite The doorman gave us great directions and tips on where to go with kids and without This was by far one of the least expensive trips weve taken in a long time Thank you River Inn

title: Elysees A Deal
text:
The Hotel Elysee is in a great location at a great price
If youve been to New York City then you already know that rooms can tend to be on the small side but the Elysees rooms are quite large and roomy Bathrooms were very large huge tub and dressing area Large closet and several dressers to unpack into My only complaint was the hairdryer a 1200 wattit wasnt anything like mine at home and took twice as long as normal to dry my hair next time Id take my own
We found the Hotel Elysee on tripadvisor and as usual the reviews convinced us to depart from our usual larger hotel choice for the smaller boutique size hotel 
It was nice having 56 rooms on the floor and only 15 floors in the hotel but the downside is that there is only 1 elevator to service the entire place So there is alot of waiting for the elevator to arrive
There is free wifi in all over the hotel but very very slow Not a quick connection There is a computer for guest use on the 2nd floor
On the upside the Club Room on the 2nd Floor is very nice and having continental breakfast available until 1030am is definitely a perk as is the all day snacks and then the evening cocktails At 5pm there is a choice of champagne white or red wine with fruits and a variety of cheeses Very nice place to unwind or kick off an evening on the town
We were not overly impressed with the staff Nobody knocked our socks off during our stay or tried to go the extra mile for us but we dont have any complaints on anyone either
The location was great as wellclose to 5th Ave shopping
We liked our stay but will try other tripadvisorcom suggestions next time My husband prefers larger hotels with restaurantbar choices and more elevatorsyou thought twice before leaving the room because a return back for anything could take a while

title: Do you want to be treated like royalty
text:
From the doorman to the management you will be addressed by name and your preferences remembered The staff is professional and friendly All request are granted with a smile and in the blink of an eye I asked for an ottoman at the desk and upon our arrival in the room it was in place Anything you need is available 247 I had to place an urgent call at 400am No problem room service appeared within ten minutes
The location is fabulous The Financial District is not infested with tourists as is Union Square and oh so much safer Its an ideal central location to begin and end your daily adventures and falling asleep to the cable cars below is heavenly
Bobs Steak  Chop House is a treat Sit near a window and watch the world go by
Look for deals on the net you dont have to pay top dollar for this exquisite hotel but it is worth it
You will always remember your stay at the Omni San Francisco with great fondness

title: Great service
text: Got a great conference rate Arrived four hours early and checked straight into my room Clean and spacious only issue from my perspective being poor door soundproofing with huge gaps around it allowing corridoor noise to enter the room Late checkout was easily arranged and the Bellhop arranged for limo transfer to BWI for a good rate The limo arrived on time and made for a more pleasant experience then a cab

title: great hotel great location
text: Just returned from a trip to NY stayed at the jolly after reading reviews before we went i was a bit worried about what we were letting ourselves in for BUT was a great hotel very friendly staff fantastic location i would recommend this hotel to anybody Only one thing to be careful ofcheck your bill as they tried to charge for using the mini bar in the room but after speaking to reception and stating we had not used anything they apoligised and credited our account But overall the hotel was great and the staff more than helpful would i go again YES

title: Typical swanky W Hotel loved the vibe but ZERO ATT service not good
text:
This hotel offers everything a W would offer but probably wont find a hotel with such an electric atmosphere and vibe Probably one of the best locations in ALL of NYC the living room lobby is happening w locals celebrities and chic tourists the place is see and be seen The staff is all good looking young and nice
One MAJOR drawback no cell service with ATTs iphone at all Had to connect with friends in city it cost me 85 to leave 5 voicemails thru W phone I definitely complained there excuse is everyone in NYC has the iphone therefor clogging the airways The front desk lady was nice and reduced bill by 50 As a Platinum member I thought more should have been taken off
The hotel lobby drinks  great
Blue Fin was soso food was just OK i had a better tuna burger in DC 
Rooms great Overall definitely recommend thid hotel for location and vibe but if you have an iphone good luck

title: Wonderful place to host a Business Meeting
text: To all the Event Planners and Conference planners out therethis property is as close to perfect as you can get but be sure to negotiate free water in the rooms  free internet in sleeping rooms AND meeting spaces The food is wonderful the staff is top notch and property is convenient to get to and beautiful

title: Rip off and dont stay there
text: I booked this thru living social vacations and what a mistake The folks were very unhelpful and they hide additional charges till after the fact The service was rotten the people unfriendly and way to many solicitations for purchases of time share when you are having a rotten time The rooms are barely adequate based on the descriptions and they didnt let us check in before 4pm though the no view room we stayed in had message lights from 2 days before Somehow I think they just didnt want to be bothered You are much better off with a hotel than this place

title: Saved the Trip
text: Want to mention that this hotel saved our trip We originally were staying at a hotel on Geary Street and were very turned off about the place We prepaid for 4 nights and it was so bad we went to priceline and were able to secure the Tuscan for the other 3 days The Tuscan is centrally located at the Wharf and its a great placethe beds are great several good pillows and the rooms are superthe lobby is nicerestaurants and shops are close by as wellit saved our trip

title: Kind of scary
text: This hotel is exactly what it is billed to be  a two star hotel I dont stay in two star hotels but the great reviews here led me to try it plus the close proximity to Columbia Not quite sure why there are all these great reviews For a little more  one can stay in a much nicer hotel in a safer area I stayed for one night for a quick visit to Columbia with my teenage sons and would not return We had two rooms one was billed as a suite Really tiny The hotel is very old the decor is really old the rooms are small and dark The air conditioner which is attached to the window and old made so much noise it was difficult to sleep The view out of the windows is into a dark alley and an ugly buidling next door I will say that the rooms are clean and the staff was nice The bathrooms have been updated However I felt uncomfortable and unsafe during my stay It has a very seedy feel to it I saw one of the staff very thoroughly check out my as yet undeveloped 13 year old daughter If you have young girls in your party beware Yuk

title: not sure about this one
text:
I use tripadvisor for every trip I go on and theres certain things I look at
1 Location right in the center of it all a great location
2 Parking 25 a night
3 Pros I disagree with people about the service the people at the front desk were very nice and helpful the only thing is the cons below
4 Cons We got there and the room was FREEZINGwe were awoken our first night to doors banging open and closed and had to tell the housekeeper to please not slam the doors they were very sweet though and didnt realize how loud it was so the noise stopped Then the second night apparently there were two friends staying to the right and left of us and kept visiting each other all night up until 300 am until finally we couldnt take it and had to have our room changed they were very accomodating
I thought the people who worked there were very nice but the huge problem is the walls are paper thin and just a very loud and un peaceful stay
there is a great Italian place on the same side about a block down thats worth going to

title: Central Well Appointed Good Value
text:
Seven minute walk from Powell BARTMUNI station
Nice rooms with uptodate furniture
Comfortable bed
Friendly but not all together efficient staff we waited a day and a half for a wire to connect our iPod to the stereo and one morning we woke up with no coffee
Close to lots of excellent shopping and restaurants

title: Great Westin
text: Spent a weekend at the Book Cadilac for the Detroit Marathon Great location new hotel in old restored building Great Value and service Westin did a great job witt this one Definetly the hotel to stay at when in downtown Detroit

title: Missing The Little Extras
text:
We stayed here for three nights up until Christmas The hotel is nice and the room was a reasonable size especially given the great rate that we got and better than their own web site
The reason that this only gets three stars is the feeling that recouping money is their number one aim rather than pleasing the customer The room is advertised with a coffee maker but they neglect to tell you that the only coffee is from that minibar and you can guess the prices there were no bath robes and there is a charge for high speed internet which hasnt been the case in a lot of other hotels
The most frustrating thing was checkout We had been moved rooms after the first night and I was told that the hotel wasnt terribly full 
However later on when I asked for a late checkout as we were moving to a different hotel on Christmas Day I was told that the checkout was 1200 and the absolute latest we could go was 1230 without incurring an extra half day charge Happy Holidays to you too 
All in all the experience was OK but could have been so much better if you felt that they werent trying to make an extra dollar at every turn

title: Is this a 312star hotel Feels like a 4star
text:
I was in a time crunch having to find a good Manhattan hotel my father and myself only 3 days in advance Prices started at just below 200night and some hotels in this price range were 2star Enter Wyndham Fashion 26 rated by Hotwire to be 312 stars  the best rating within the price range
The stay did not disappoint Located in the heart of Manhattan Garment District to be precise the hotel is sparkling clean with welldesigned lobby and restaurant It offers amenities Id seen before only in 4star hotels such as bathrobes and heavenly beds I mean it literally not as a trademark The staff is cheerful and upbeat The room was wellappointed if a bit on the smaller side The price to pay for my 4star experience Just over 200night we stayed 4 nights and the price I mentioned includes all taxes
I was told at the reception that the hotel was brand new grand opening 3 weeks ago Excellent value and I hope the management keeps it up

title: Location vs Service
text:
Location was fantastic Within walking distance to many downtown attractions The hotel was very clean and comfortable  as I have found most Westins to be The only issue was the service There was usually only one person on duty at the front desk that obviously was equipped for 34 This meant that there was always a line to ask a question or request something Also the room cleaning service never replaced fresh towels or soaps When we asked the nice lady in the hallway about more towels she said she was out Strange
Also really hated that you had to use your hotel room key to use the elevator It may have been an extra layer of security but proved to be annoying

title: An experience in itself
text: For those who are looking to visit New York City for a day or two this hotel cannot be beat There are many things that make the Marriott Marquis the greatest hotel in Times Square but the 1 by far is the location It is located directly in the dead center of Times Square making basically everything in short walking distance The hotel features an incredibly convenient and smart elevator system which makes getting to your room in a hotel with an incredible number of rooms an easy process On the main floor area there is a very lovely sushi restaurant and a complete bar area with a wide range of exotic drinks and a glasswall intimatetableseating area that directly overlooks Times Square giving you a view of the nightlife while chatting with friends All rooms also overlook Times Square so a great view is never too far away from you For those of you who are musical theater enthusiasts the hotel offers a ticket booth where you can inquire about showtimes locations even buy tickets right there at the hotel though with a rather high service charge Also the Marquis plays host to The Drowsy Chaperone itself Service was excellent we requested a rollaway bed for our room which was promptly delivered and the staff was always ready to answer any questions we had Parking was valet and convenient in every way The hotel also offers a huge exercise facility but we didnt get the opportunity to use it I should mention that this hotel is a great idea for a shortterm trip since the rooms are quite expensive For a longer stay in New York I imagine there are more affordable locations but for a shortterm amazing experience the Marquis isnt just a place to stay it will become a memorable part of your experience altogether I recently visited NYC again and even though I didnt stay AT the Marquis I still went there just for the bar and restaurant

title: Wish I couldve stayed longer
text: Stayed here during a onenight business trip and I was quite happy I arrived at noon and was able to check in which was nice My room was clean and nicely decorated with a king bed and a small couch The bathroom was clean and of a decent size with a curved shower curtain rod and citrusylavender toiletries take note of the sign saying theyll only restock toiletries and towels on request My room was fairly quiet though as with most hotels I heard some hallway noise Room service was expensive 1218 plus tipdelivery feetax for most breakfast entrees  to be expected for a big city hotel Every hotel employee I encountered was very friendly although the woman who checked me in was super fast which some people might not like

title: Food and service quality provided tremendous value
text:
My stay at the Brookhollow Sheraton was unintentional but Ive been extremely impressed with the food and service quality especially at such an affordable price Ive run the gamut of hotels and while the rooms could have used very minor touchups I didnt care because the staff and food quality more than made up for it 
Special thanks to the Cimarron staff for making my time here without my family with whom Im NEVER separated easier and even pleasurable
Thanks again
Ruben
Seattle WA

title: A haven in the city
text:
This hotel is absolutely perfect in its own class Its got great service friendly staff clean rooms and both my wife and I are difficult to please and the rooms look nice at that
The extras like the complementary bottled water and breakfast are great add ons to help you start your day in the city
I was worried by the noise at first but being up on the 15th floor at street side this has not been a problem as of yet and we have had great full nights of sleep The long days and the great bed might have helped 
The bed by the way is the kind you wish you could take home on a plane bit big for carry on though
Whether its business or pleasure this hotel is one I would definitely recommend to everyone

title: Great location for visiting colleges in Boston
text: I got a great price that included valet parking with the drive in to Boston and save promotion I was bringing 3 teenage girls to visit colleges in Boston and booked a deluxe room The MBTA green line is almost right outside the hotel entrance and will quickly bring you to most of the colleges in Boston The room was a good size and comfortable for the four of us The bonus was that there were two bathrooms which was key to getting the girls out of the room in a reasonable amount of time The beds two doubles were very comfortable and we were happy with the room The water pressure in the shower could have been better and wifi cost over 12 per device per day which I thought was a bit excessive so we chose not to use it The staff were very accommodating and immediately resolved the minor problems we had We ate dinner at The Melting Pot located in the hotel while it was pricey we had a lot of fun and really enjoyed it I totally recommend this hotel as a great central location for college visits in the city of Boston

title: Great location
text: Weve stayed here for only two days on our Californian vacation We booked petit room but got upgraded to bigger one Room was fine thou bed was quite small and we are not big people Room was clean but it smelled a bit weird and that was only down side to it Staff was very friendly and location was GREAT Our room was facing other rooms but we didnt care and it was quiet which was the benefit

title: Pretty nice
text: The main reason we opted for this hotel was the proximity to the attractions that it claimed to have and the economical rates However it isnt that close The rooms are good and we stayed only for a night Basic amenities were there in the room But the parking is not free

title: Past its Prime
text:
Old hotel looks updated  but has lots of issues
Very very loud wood room doors that will wake you up all night
Poor access to load and unload your bags
Poor access to parking gargage
Snooty staff that are long on attitude and short on service
Found glass in food served
Never stay there again

title: Nothing works
text: I normally wouldnt write a review about a hotel I spent such little time in but this is outrageous The check in was fast and easy but thats the only good thing The TV doesnt allow you to watch movies or TV The phone has the bottons to allow you to connect to room service ect but none of the bottons work The TV and thermostat are both from 15 years ago and most of the people I called to fix these issues either didnt give a crap or were totally clueless as what to do The hotel is so cheap the rooms dont have mini bars I highly recommend you never stay at this hotel

title: Great stay at Georgetown Suites
text: My daughter and I spent two nights at the Georgetown Suites during a college visit August 1113 We had a studio suite 125 a night The hotel was very nice and the location was very central just off of busy M Street NW on 30th Despite its proximity to the shopping district the hotel was very quiet Georgetown U was a short cab ride away and we walked to George Washington U The suite was complete with a full kitchenbig refrigerator microwave sink stovetop cabinets I cant remember if there was an oven The bed and pillow were very comfortableI did not even have to use the pillow I travel with There were many closets and a dresser and desk The hotel features Bath and BodyWorks shampoo etcalways a plus for me Breakfast included cereal fruit yogurt cereal bars PopTarts toast good bagels pastries muffins coffee tea etc I was very happy with the rate although I will warn that there is a parking fee of 18 per day You do have unlimited inout privileges Also note that the ceilings were lowI am not sure an SUV could fit in there Check with the hotel We stayed at the 30th Street location having read on TripAdvisor that it was preferred It has a nice courtyard off of 30th Street that was pretty with landscaping Recommendation for dinner is Bangkok Joes Asian cuisine very tasty and upscale but not too pricey Great location at 3000 K Street NW walking distance from the hotel and in the fun Washington Harbor area shops dining people watching harbor walk M Street has lots of shops and restaurants too All in all a great hotel in a great location

title: When I came true the doorand I met the guy at the front desk his attitude was badhe did explain anything to me  He ask for my
text: When I got up to the room 1902they advertised it as nonsmokingand open the door I could smell that someone was smoking in the roomand this is very important there is a small refrigerator in the room pack with all sorts of drink and snacks in the draws  do not eat or drink unless you are will to pay 900 bucks for a beer and 600 for chipsthe menu was in the drew covered with snacks so becarefuland there is no Internet in the room if you want Internet guess what Yep you have to pay 1200 a daylocation was awesome

title: Best inexpensive hotel in NYC
text: I stayed at the Ramada Eastside Inn for 2 weekend nights when I was in NYC to visit some friends For the price its hard to find a better place I travel to NYC several times a year and have stayed a many different hotels I booked through Priceline and paid 125 a night The hotel is clean modern and the staff was friendly Yes the rooms are small but this is NYC   space is at a premium The rooms had flat screen TVs comfortable beds private baths etc I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice inexpensive hotel option in NYC

title: Great Stay
text: Spent a week in Memphis for a convention and stayed at the Peabody Overall this is a very regal hotel I wouldnt however classify it as 5star PROS Customer service is exceptional From the guys at valet parking concierge front desk  all terrific and very quick to handle any problem The rooms are old classic in decor but bright airy and very clean and comfortable Unlike other historic hotels the Peabody doesnt have that spooky or haunted atmosphere The lobby gives you the impression of old school hollywood where the powerbrokers met to drink bourbon and make deals The bathrooms are of nice size and also very classicaly decorated  walk in closet is a HUGE plus The beds are among the most comfortable Ive ever slept in I didnt use room service but if the number of plates left outside doors are an indicator its probably very good The Ducks are a treat Crowds gather about 3040 minutes from showtime and get ready for momentary blindness given all the flash bulbs going off during their trek down the red carpet The restaurants are very good in service taste and presentation I did not use the pool fitness center or business center CONS valet parking at 21 per day is insane There are other parking garages several blocks away but can be a bear if you have tons of luggage Ive also heard others complain about not having a coffee maker in each room  they have a coffee setup in the main lobby that allows you to see those with hangovers hobble to get their java Starbucks is across the main entrance into an adjacent shopping center I was surprised to hear the live music coming from a few blocks away  at 10pm Overall I thouroughly enjoyed my stay and would certainly stay again

title: Disappointed that this hotel failed to live up to brand expectations
text: Beautiful lobby Bellmen never held doors or offered luggage assistance Wireless internet doesnt work unless close to the elevator Pool listed as an amenity is offsite so very inconvenient and additional charge despite premium nightly ratesRoom quality varied greatly in size layout and view Large by NY standards but small for any other city Ive visited Paid a premium for quality that wasnt delivered Not all rooms have fabulous views Onsite menu options extremely limited for longer stays although exceptional quality Some staff exceptionally accommodating while others were rudeLate checkout request accommodated and location walking distance to Millenium Park was a nice benefit

title: Visit was too short
text:
I accompanied my husband who was attending a 2day conference While he was occupied I had a little time to explore The lazy river pool system was fantastic clean and pleasantly landscaped I wandered around until I found a private spot and vegged I also took the nature trail twice It includes a handicap friendly circuit training course Also visited the exercise room Rows of wellmaintained equipment 
The General Store has a large selection of food and sundries and is a great alternative if you want to skip dining Their chicken salad is made from scratch and was delicious The bar decor made you feel like you were in Texas The bar itself was wellstocked The conferences closing dinner was held outdoors under the stars Full course meal was expertlyserved
The resort is clean and spacious The staff was gracious My only complaints were that the maps could have been more explanatory as the resort is big and it was easy to get lost and that the pool areas needed a few spray cans of Off around for the skeeters that occasionally attacked

title: Go To The Hilton
text:
No Hotel deserves a good rating where the staff doesnt care about the guest When we made the reservation on their web site they have a space for you to make additional comments about any preferences you have while you stay there We specifically stated that it was our sons 13th birthday and all we wanted was a nice view of the city We got a roof top It was laughable At least a response stating that they didnt have such a room would have been an indication that they cared about you
Staff was also very rude Dont tell me that its too difficult to be nice We knew right away this hotel was not friendly so we canceled our second night and stayed at the 10 times better Hilton Went down to the bar in the lobby the next morning to grab some quick breakfast and had to remind them 3 times about the hot chocolate I ordered and paid for I even had to stir the powdered drink myself because they were too interested in the next patron Couldnt sit down to eat because EVERY table had garbage on it from the last person that sat there NOBODY cared at all about the cleanliness of the hotel or the service which was almost non existent Maybe its because I was an American All staff were foreigners and so were most of the guests Too bad if you dont like that comment but thats the way it was Not the first experience with that Dont support any place that treats you like this place did They will never change otherwise Went to the Hilton Times Square and let me tell you it was magnificent We all had a good experience there They couldnt help you enough Get with it Roosevelt With a beautiful Lobby like that it should represent how you treat your guests

title: Good value for short stay
text: My wife and I stayed at the Holday Inn LAX for a 6hour lay over in July Its always hard to choose a hotel for a short layover because even though wed be asleep most of the time wed rather not stay in a shorttime hotel The Holiday Inn airport pickup bus sometimes also picks up for the nearby Westin Hotel or La Quinta Inn so you have to look long and hard at the words spelled out by lights on the sign on the front of the bus they may change in a moment to say Holiday Inn Checkin was adequate rooms are clean and the service was ok but not energetic For example I asked the man at the reception desk standing in front of a sign saying shuttle buses to the airport leave every 15 minutes on the hour and quarter hour or just whenever the bus arrivesfound out later its the latter Were leaving on a Southwest Airlines domestic flight departing at 7 am Whats a good time to leave the hotel Answer with tone of finality A bus leaves every 15 minutes We bought food at the ampm in the Arco station next door The free wireless is provided by a company that serves more than one hotel and it was so slow at 1 am that we had to use dialup to get our days messages But considering the high price of rooms near the airport we would stay at Holiday Inn LAX again

title: Comfortable good choice for business
text: Being there on business attending an Exec education program Comfortable room and meeting facilities Breakfast is kinda togo I was expecting something better Overall food and beverages are standard below from my expectations but acceptable Service is ok Front desk team is more attentive than the rest Location is good however downtown Houston has little to offer

title: Older but not too bad
text:
Good location for business in the area Kind of a rough area with lots of construction going on both on streets and local area Noisy and starts at 6 am
Nice restarurants about 35 miles away BBQ place across the street I would not be walking around after dark
Room was large but a little dated TV was not at the end of the bed but on one of the sides I like reading and watching TV in bed A little difficult with this set up Bathroom average and a little dated

title: Great place to stay with a car
text: I stayed 1 night with my 12 yo daughter while stopping over in NYC on our way upstate to visit relatives I was able to park my car onsite for free and get it when needed This hotel is close enough to Times square to walk to yet off the beaten track of noise and traffic The USS Intrepid museum is just around the corner along with bicycle rentals for Central park We were too busy to try out the swimming pool but it sure looked inviting and is a definite plus The staff was very friendly and helpful The Travel Inn will be the 1st place I check the next time I come to the Big Apple I wish I couldve stayed longer

title: would love to experience the hotel again Loved the beds
text: Hope I have the opportunity to enjoy this great hotel again

title: Clean Rooms and Friendly Staff
text: I have always been impressed with the quality of customer service and cleanliness of Hampton Inn This was my first time staying at this location and it was a great first impression The staff was very warm welcoming and helpful The beds were heavenly I look forward to staying there again

title: Reliable Marriott standardsAlways
text: Nice hotel GREAT staff very friendly and welcoming Rooms nice and clean Marriott beds are the bestAlways comfortable Complimentary  fresh coffee during the day was nice Ice water in the lobby kept fresh all day very nice since it was very hot the recent weekend we stayed Would stay here again Ez access and close to downtown

title: not so cheap but it was a hassle free stay
text: booked three nights all hotels this weekend were very expensive booked this as a last resort good location discrete service and comfortable no issues to speak of Its less Chintzy than most American hotels but not quite Boutique It was a relaxing stay

title: Great Hotel renovated perfect spot on Venice Beach
text:
We stayed there for 4 nights in May 2008 after escaping a too expensive and snobby Beverly Hills InHotel  Although the renovation was still going on we were able to stay in a beautiful newly renovated room on the top floor with a spectacular ocean view Also you were able to step up to the roof where we had great views to Santa Monica and LA
We also loved the surroundings which was by our feeling not at all dangerous but very colorful and interesting It is close to bars good restaurants and caffees Maybe it is not the right hotel for familys but if you want to have a good time and dive into the spirit of Venice Beache go for it We my girlfriend and me loved it and will definetly return

title: Good location Nice Rooms
text: I stayed at this place when I was taking the bar examination Clean and comfortable room It is a great location down by the Watertower and right across from the Drake It has a pretty good value for being right in the middle of the summer time The place was quiet at night The room service was excellent Overall it is a pretty good value for putting you right in the middle of Michigan Ave

title: Definitely would return
text:
It was my first trip to NY and I wanted to stay somewhere in the middle of the action This hotel is perfect for that Everything is just a short jaunt away The room was very clean and the hotel staff made aboveaverage effort to accomodate a rollaway cot and gave about 15 towels 3 women the room which were very very appreciated The hotel was very secure The little drawbacks were that the internet is available only MondayFriday during business hours if you needed to do business which I did but didnt want to drag my laptopand the hotel restuaurant for breakfast was less than fabulous However Foleys the major restaurant was very very nice for supper and excellent seafood
I would definitely stay again for sure

title: Pleasantly surprised but would stay here again
text: Upon my arrival Monica greeted me very pleasantly and offered to upgrade my room at no additional charge Im not sure that I actually got an upgrade from what I had requested to begin with but I must say the room was very nice Hard wood floors in the sleeping room Marble floors and tile in bathroom Cedar lined closet area although I wouldnt say it is actually a closet Cedar lined drawers in desk Free in room safe which is nice to have I locked my netbook up when i wasnt in the room Room was clean and free of any bad smells The whole property is nonsmoking Unique pictures on walls of Life Magazine front pictures from as early as 1913 in my room There isnt much in the way of eating establishments close to the hotel However just over one or two streets are is a wide variety This hotel is convenient if you want to go to Macys and the Empire State Building It also very close to the Herald Square MTA subway stop However for the parade route head way north There is no real good access to see the parade at the Macys store Youll get a better view of the parade from around Central Park West Its crowded but less crowded than at Macys or in other parts of the downtown Manhattan area My only minor complaint about my room was that the bathtub drained slowly Other than that I would definately consider staying at this hotel again

title: Great locationgreat staffgreat value
text: This is a very clean friendly welllocated hotel Latasha was extremely patient and kind through many emails as I wanted know all I possibly could about the hotel and the area We used the valet parking at 22 a day with inout privileges its a bargain here or any other big city and we were treated wonderfully which made for an excellent first impression Checkin was quick and easy and the desk and bell staff were friendly and professional Our room was a twoqueen business class with a microwave refrigerator big closet and very clean and inviting We usually do not have housekeeping done when we stay for an extended period of time except for fresh towels but this Days Inn insists on cleaning the room after three days which we thought was an indication of its dedication to cleanliness The free continental breakfast was fine no eggs or meat just pastries bagels juice and coffee and the breakfast area was pleasant Most of all we really appreciated the location and the helpfulness of the staff We normally stay at Marriott properties and have been unimpressed with other Days Inns but we recommend the Days Inn Chicago It is in a lovely building in a great neighborhood with a wonderful staff We did get what we thought was a good deal by booking in advance

title: Great location and service but be prepared to see pompous or pretentious guests
text: Overall the hotel was wonderful with great service However if you walked in with jeans and a t shirt be prepared to feel completely out of place due to other guests The room was great and the bathroom included a separate over head shower and jacuzzi tub It is only a 5 minute walk from 16th Street Mall and 10 min walk to LoDo and Coors stadium Also be prepared for a 29 valet parking fee Public parking overnight in the area is just as much

title: I loved staying here
text:
Ive been planning on staying at the Alexis for a while but my plans kept falling through Finally I made it for my birthday weekend I reserved the a standard King room through the Kimpton website I am also a Kimpton InTouch member I signed up a while back and I wholly suggest that you do so before making your reservation Doing the online reservation was very easy and I got a deal by paying in advance When I got to the hotel the valet valet is on the side of the building not the front was swift to attend to us and we were helped with our bags to the front reception At the reception we were promptly greeted and the person came across as genuine and sweet We were informed that we were upgraded to a king suite room for my birthday We were then shown to our room and had our bags taken up There was a bottle of sparkling white wine from St Michelle a local winery and truffle chocolates waiting for us from Keith So wonderful and makes me really appreciate being a member of kimpton unlike some other hotel memberships that lack those personal touches The room was fairly big There was a tv lounge room that had the honor barfridge Kimpton InTouch members get a 1000 credit a large bathroom that is designed well a large closet off to the left then it opens to the bedroom that has a dresser two nightstands a desk two chairs and a tv I asked for a quiet room so our room was off to the side of the busy street and it made a huge difference The bed was very comfortable and when making the reservation I asked for extra pillows and there were four there waiting for me 
The hotel is well located but right on the edge for me If you go towards pioneer square you need to be more aware of the homeless people especially at night We went for a walk after dinner and turned back around after a short while due to how many people were on the street begging for money to the left is pike market after a couple of blocks and the SAM on the right Go straight forward and you are in the shopping area If you go down you are right there by the pier
For the less impressive part The cost for daily valet is high 40ni the maid service never replenished the toiletries we didnt bother calling down for someone to just bring us a small bar of soap or lotion to our room maid service threw away my Sunday paper and I barely got to read part of it
The good far outweighs the bad and in all actuality we didnt really need a car until our last day Next time

title: Historical Hotel Not a Cookie Cutter Chain
text:
My husband and I spent this past weekend at the Menger to celebrate a special anniversary The tone was set when I made my reservation with the lovely correspondence from Rose Gonzalez who went above and beyond to insure that our stay was indeed special In this day and age of impersonal computer generated replies when booking roomshow refreshing that someone actually wanted to do everything possible to make sure we had a wonderful visit 
This personal treatment continued throughout our stay from the front desk to the valet parking staff Everyone we encountered seemed to take personal pride in the history and charm of the famous Menger hotel Every staff member was more than willing to share stories of the history of the Menger with us and their pride in the hotel was obvious and well deserved
The hotel itself is like taking a step back in time You are literally in spitting distance of the Alamo Every opportunity we had was spent wandering the hotel  the lobby the landscaped courtyard poolside the various nooks and cranniesand everywhere had reminders of the wonderful history of this hotel There are old photos cases with memorabilia and antiques throughout the first floor so its almost a museum in itself To stroll where Oscar Wilde once sipped margaritas and to sit in the bar Teddy Roosevelt slammed a few whiskeys and recruited his rough riders was a real treat We were just close enough to the River Walk to enjoy all of its amenities without all of the noise and late night revelry A nice bonus was that the trolley stop in front of the Alamo made it a breeze to get around the main sights of the city 
 Our room was charming and in keeping with the style of the hotel We were right next to the beautiful wrought iron balcony with the stain glass skylight over the Victorian lobby The room style was in keeping with the age of the hotel over 100 yrs furnished with Victorian furniture Our bed could not have been more comfortable It was in every way exactly what I hoped for Before we departed we enjoyed Sunday brunch in the hotels Colonial Dining Room with its beautiful buffet and a complimentary mimosa
If you are looking for a shiny sparkly lobby flat screen TVs granite bathrooms with sleek furnishings fast elevators and stairs that dont squeak try any of the many chain hotels in the area But if you want to be reminded of the history of San Antonio at every turn and a time when life was a bit more gracious and moved at a slower pace and if you are able to embrace the quirks of a gracious old hotel then stay at the Menger 
Even if you don t stay here come by after your visit to the Alamo for some of the famous mango ice cream and to take pictures of a beautiful hotel that time forgot

title: Location but not much else
text:
I stayed at the hotel in July 2005 Agree with previous posters about quality of the hotel 
The lobby is nice but the rooms need a facelift Nothing particularly wrong  its just that everything looks tired and dated Beds arent particularly comfortable The vanity area was in the bedroom My shower only had one temperature  extremely hot THe bathroom is too small for more than one person at a time The air conditioner works well but is consistently noisy 
When I arrived I was given a room directly opposite the ice maker When I complained amazingly they had other rooms available I dont understand why youd put someone in such a room when others were available
Room service was prompt and food was tasty Didnt try any of the restaurants 
They have hispeed internet accessunlimited US long distance calls for 10 per day 
I heard numerous complaints about parking expensive and no inout privileges On the plus side the hotel is directly adjacent the medical complex and the light rail so you should be able to walkride to many activities
Bottom line  its fine for one night If you plan to stay awhile Id look elsewhere

title: Nice City Hotel
text: We went into Philadelphia and we tried the Sofitel since I have stayed at the Sofitel in Chicago before and had a good experience The rate was reasonable and the location was nice There was some work being done in the lobby which made checkin inconvenient Room was very nice

title: Really cool luxurious and awesome staff
text:
My fiance and I stayed here for the weekend last month while visiting family We got a rate that was very reasonable for their basic room and it did not dissapoint 
The room was plenty big very well appointed had a nice view of Charles River The minibar is AWESOME Granted we couldnt afford to eat anything in it but the quality of items were a reflection of how well they do things at the Liberty
The bed was really comfy the bathroom was huge and has a shower and bathtub Overall the quality of the room was 5 star 
We used the gym everyday nothing special a few treadmills free weights and an allinone machine but got the job done
What really sets this hotel apart is the staff They were all extremely welcoming helpful and courteous and you can tell they have been very well trained From the door and bell staff the desk agents to our housekeeper everyone was always making sure we were enjoying our stay and wanted to make it better if they could 
We also used the free bikes they have available a really cool option to ride along the river
This will be our goto place when we visit Boston

title: Great location for firsttime visit
text: Really enjoyed our stay here Walking distance to major attractions and easy to get onoff the subway Rooms are immaculate and generously sized though decor is a little dated Only caution is no Wifi and its expensive to buy access Would absolutely stay here again

title: Great for a stop over
text:
The Radisson is probably best if you are just stopping over in LA for a night or two Its about a 5 min walk to the public bus which can take you anywhere The trolley bus that takes you to Manhattan Beach for USD5 is well worth the trip
Rooms are comfy and staff are very quick to rectify any problems

title: Unparalleled Boston location comfortable and not a chain
text: The Copley Square Hotel is a lovely mediumsized hotel in an unparalleled location and you are paying in part for the locationits not inexpensive Its comfortable bordering on luxurious I stayed in the smallest room which wasnt actually all that small and which  although it was supposed to have an interior view  in fact looked out over the street Friendly service appealing lobby and hallways flatscreen TV with betterthanusual selection of cable channels nice bath no tub in my room which was fine and free wifi throughout From here you can walk up and down Newbury Street and get the subway anywhere Its a nice place to come home to after a full day of work or play

title: Great location
text:
The room was nicely appointed but I would have liked to see a small refirigerator and an ipod docking station The room was very clean which is the most important thing to me when I travel However the room was very stuffy as if the thermostat wasnt working We had a very noisy neighbor but as soon as we called the front desk security was dispatched and the neighbors behaved 
Overall I reccomend this hotel even above others that I have stayed at in the vicinity The staff were great the room was CLEAN and they allwed us to bring our dog The location couldnt be better right next door to the convention center and a block or so away from the Paramount theatre and malls

title: great travel location
text:
The Biltmore was great from the time we arrived to the time we left it was nothing but class
We were met at the front desk with some of the most professional clerks Ive ever encountered and they were very informative of the area
The Resort ended up sending us to an amazing steakhouse and comped us a limo
The views are amazing and the grounds are beautiful
Price is a facor but worth it in the long run

title: Good location
text: My husband and I just returned today from a four day vacation in Washington What a great city Stayed at the Residence Inn I must say I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel It was clean and the staff were friendly and reasonably helpful The room was large We had a studio suite which had a full kitchen and sitting room We didnt really use the kitchen as we were out so much but it was nice to have the refrigeratoretc The bed was comfy with lots of pillows The bathroom was ok and with no shortage of towels The ac  heating system was noisy and we had to turn the fan off in order to sleep It was a definite plus having the complimentary breakfast each morning It was quite good and with more variety than I expected The staff in the am were fantastic The complimentary dinnersocial was ok served MonTuesWed Again more food and variety than I expectednot gourmet for sure but ok and great for families The hotel was close to the metro which was great but had no restaurants or pubs nearby which was a definite negative It would have been nice to have a bar in the hotel Able to walk to most attractions Hot tub was nicedidnt use the pool We had an issue with the fee at the hotel I booked online at the Washingtonorg website I thought that I was booking directly thru the Marroitt however apparently it was thru a third party I was given a price when I booked and then another price from the hotel The price from the hotel was lower I called the hotel twice from Canada and was told both times that the lower price was what I would pay Not the case I called the 3rd party and was told by them that they would call the hotel to talk with the manager to straightened the price out When we arrived at the hotel I tried to explain the situation to the manager but felt that he totally dismissed us with very little conversation at all He barely listened to us and walked away while I was talking to him Not a very nice welcome to the hotel When I mentioned Marriott rewards he waved his hand and mumbled something about no Marriott rewards with this type of booking Not sure what that was all about Despite the unpleasant experience that we had with the manager we enjoyed the hotel however Im not sure that I would stay there again because of that

title: For the money you cant beat this
text: I booked a room at this hotel over a month a go 2 weeks before the trip I noticed a special price on their website I requested a change on my reservation to reflect the now lower price it was done in less then 24 hours At that price I even added a second night to my tripso glad I did Asked for a high floorquiet roomgot floor 6  out of 8  and a room with an other room on only one side  very quiet  So far everything looked good Got in the room  boutique queen  small but not too small deco reflected the boutique theme very nice my girlfriend loved everything about it Clean smelled fresh window opens  love to hear the beat of the city  Is it a 5 starno but everything about it was great  check in  2 minutes check out  1 minutes  staff was pleasant I WILL go back to Boston at this particular hotel You are 15 minutes walk to Prudential center  shopping mall  to chinatown you are 20 minutes walk to Boston common and theater district you are 25 minutes walk to Fenway park Loved everything about it Cant wait to go back  only complaint even on the 6th floor we could hear the street noise and people talking lound on street level from the window  it did close well but you could hear the outside easily

title: Great value for the money
text: We stayed 2 adults and 2 children at hotel Milburn for 3 nights The Location was perfect  near Central Park Natural Museum of History and only a few blocks from the subway  red line  leading us to all kind of interesting places downtown The Continental breakfast was very fine and the hotel in general was really good We give Hotel Milburn our best recommendations and we would love to come back and stay at this hotel again

title: My new hotel in New York City and yours as well
text:
It has been a long time since 1965 when on every trip to New York I have stayed at the New York Hilton on Avenue of the Americas Last year when staying there I was reminded that the hotel opened in the mid 1960s  A few months ago I tried to get into the hotel and found that rates were nearly 500 per night thanks to the Hilton Club concept which seems to have cut the available rooms to ordinary folk to about half of the total resulting in twice the price
I took a chance and decided to stay in Soho where a pal of mine owns a great jewelry store and found the above sheraton When I checked in the desk staff acted as if I was a long time lost person who had come home for good In a flash I was in my room all new and nice with internet that worked like a charm  I seem to remember a german phrase  mit raazender geschwindekuit or something like that with great speed and a very very nice room for a very very good price Best of all elevators that got you to your room on floor 14 with even more speed than ever in a hotel in new york No waiting
Once I checked in I found the staff eager to help me get around the city and where to walk to All kinds of flower shops my pals store and every imaginable kind of cool stores are available plus something you will never see in mid town nice little bakeries pizza places and restaurants of every type 
The rooms like many at any four points sheraton are modern design and not the traditional heavy woodsand massive chairs but very very comfortable and well appointed There was even a power strip for those of us who think we are to be in touch with 2 phones two laptops and of course an ipod So for the first time in years my own power strip was deployed to remain in the suitcase 
In walking around I was able to visit my pals store in soho visit art galleries and frankly enjoy myself despite having heavy duty finance meetings ever day over 4 days My worst fear not being able to get a cab or being forced to use the subway a lot were never realised Despite it being a small hotel at least by gotham city standards there was always a cab waiting out front Also the cab fare to LaGuardia was about 10 bucks less than the trip to midtown 
Now it turns out that soho is considered a new emerging area for tech companies lofts and young people If you want to enjoy the City of New York consider staying here Its my new home

title: A Surprise  Will stay again
text:
Located very close to the airport and a big shopping mall We drove there so I am not sure about public transportation around the lodge It is abit off the main road 
The lobby looked really nice and so did the room Very secured Every time you want to enter a certain building you would need to scan you room key The room wasnt big but good enough I have to mention the lobby in each building They have complimentary DVD for you to watch free chocolates yogurts water cheese sticks fruits chips and HaagenDaz icecream different flavours They also have a huge fridge and a microwave which we managed to use We had leftovers from dinner Gym was wellequipped and very clean 
I have to say I wasnt very happy with the breakfast We did have a late checkout but I woke up just for the breakfast and have wished I didnt 
But overall a very good place to stay

title: Would return in a second
