text: We stayed at the Nob Hill Motor Inn for 8 days and were very pleased with the accommodation and services and the location We were in room 224 on the top floor  the northeast corner  and found it comfortable spacious and quiet we didnt encounter any of the mould issues reported in other reviews nor were we troubled by noise from the street or elsewhere in the property The bed was comfortable the daily cleaning thoroughly adequate if not stellar there were cobwebs in a couple corners of the room but the bathroom was spotless every day and the fridge and microwave were very convenient One of the huge strengths of this property note that the signage reads Nob Hill Motel is its location its extremely convenient to Van Ness Avenue and boutitquey Polk Street and to the California Street cable car terminus Its situated in a primarily residential area  we felt as though we were living in a neighbourhood rather than hotel row or a business district which was a huge plus and gave us a much better feel for the city We found plenty of nearby places to eat cheaply check out Nicks Crispy Tacos Polk  Broadway and The Crepe House Polk  Washington No question wed stay here again

title: Just back loved this hotel will stay here again
text: We chose this hotel form the TripAdisor reviews and it was ideal for us Good locationClean nice size roomFridge was a nice bonusFree use of business centerNext time were in NY we are going to stay hereBig Thanks to everyone at this hotel

title: Beware Rigid 48hour cancellation policy enforced without exception
text: We had to cancel our reservation due to sudden illness less than 48 hours in advance of checkin and were charged a full nights rate plus taxes  no exceptions no rain check unless the future booking is made at the time of cancellation Book with care

title: Ended up being a great place to stay
text:
We booked this hotel as we needed a suite to sleep five for the car showour daughter and her husband and our adult son and us 
We also booked this hotel to be walking distance to the car show and because of the parking
We also told them we would be a very late arrival on Friday and needed two queens and a sofa sleeper
When we arrived the valet took our car but there was no bell hop available nor a cart No big deal we grabbed our stuff and went on in
Checkin went fine and off we went ot our room only find one king and the sofa sleeper when we called down to the desk we were told the hotel was completely sold out for the night and they could move us the next day They did not seem to care much about our concerns
But how were five adults going to sleep in one king and a sofa sleeper
They said we can send up a roll away OK we were tired and just wanted to sleep so we said ok
We were checking out the room to find there was only one sheet and one pillow for the sofa sleeper and only two towels in a room designed for 4 or more
A few minutes later the security guard G arrived with the roll away apologizing for the problem and told us house keeping was gone for the night When I mentioned the towels sheets and pillows he said hang on I will go find some for you
A few minutes later he arrived with many towels extra sheets pillows and some blankets and again apologizing Very nice young man Made us feel better about picking this hotel
After a rather rough night sleeping my son in law is 65 and didnt fit on the sofa sleeper very well and our son on the rollaway which is about 5 feet long and he is about 6 feet tall and the room temperature was very hot We could never seem to cool down the room
My husband went down to the front desk and complained and they moved us to a different suite the one we wanted in the first place They also gave him 50 off the cost of the first night seeing as we did not get the room we wanted very nice
So we moved our stuff remembering to grab the extra towels sheets and pillows because this room had only two towels also
This suite had the sink outside the tub and toilet area which was very nice bigger area with the sofa and TV and better heat control
We headed down to breakfast in the lobby a little confusing no one to seat us the omlette station was right next to the hostess center so we asked the omlette chef if we seat ourselves and he said yes so as we go to sit the waitress comes over to ask us if we needed help We asked if we could sit there and yes we could
She then asked for our coupons which we did not have I guess with certain levels of Hilton membership you get free meals we did not
They had two choices of buffett fruit and oatmeal or full buffett with made to order omlettes
It took a while to get our coffee and juices but she was working hard and friendly
The buffett was good and the omlettes very good but a busy place The kitchen noticed the backup and came and took some orders to the kitchen to prepare very impressive
Our second night was much more comfortable for all
Checkout was quick and very prompt with the car
The coffee shop in the lobby was very affordable but was surprised to find it closed at 5 pm Saturday evening when the hotel was booked solid
Rooms were very clean friendly staff did find that the ice maker on our floor was broken and all the vending machines seemed to be sold out of water
The rooms were very quiet never heard the neighbors
It would have been nice to have a list of places near us to eat or delivery food
All in all it was a good stay yes it was a very busy weekend and they could have been better prepared for the number of guests staying there
If in town agin we will stay here again

title: Very beautiful hotel and comfortable room
text:
My wife and I have just returned from a weekend in New York City I managed to get a decent rate on the internet for a queen room at the Hilton The hotel is very big and nice it is in Avenue of the Americas several blocks above Times Square and the area is much more quiet than 7th Ave or Broadway Our prior experience in a Times square hotel had been worse as the soundproofing was very bad and we could hear traffic noise all night long
Check in was very smooth and our room was ready when we arrived 1215 am The room was on the small side but it was clean and had a very comfortable bed and a huge plasma TV The bathroom was also very clean and very well appointed Even though we were close to the elevators and only in the 12th floor soundproofing was great and we had a very good nights sleep 
Check out was fast as it usually is in Hilton properties but we had to pay for each item left in locker room Having to pay for items in the locker room reminded me of the days when I stayed in hostels and I do not think it is a necessary practice for an upscale hotel All in all we will chose the Hilton again next time in town

title: A great stay
text:
We dont normally stay at such upmarket hotels but this was a very good price at the time
The lobby was very posh and so to were the lifts  elevators 
We had an excellent stay in particular I found the staff in the lobby to be very curtious We were always greeted on entry The hotels location is an excellent position within walking distance of all the attractions such as Pier 39 Alcatraz tour  Sightseeing tour buses
The City  Alcatraz tour bus picks up from the hotel
Some things were expensive such as items from the mini bar and bottled water but we didnt use any of these
We did have breakfast in the restaurant one morning and it was very good for the price The chef in there was quite a character
Parking is also very expensive as it is in all of Fishermans Wharf I think it was 38 per day  tips for valet only parking
Parking did not worry us however as we parked our car in a multi story near Budget Hire on Beach road It was expensive at 20 a day with no in out privalages but half the price of the hotel
The car park was about 10 mins walk away
I would certainly stay here again

title: Great reception perfect location reasonable value
text: This hotel lived up to the expectations Tripadvisor reviews had raised We have no hesitation in recommending it

title: It grew on mea little
text: We went there for the Nike Marathon Upon checkin the ditzy desk chick wouldnt get past the fact that I was okay with her charging a ton of money on my debit card Really its okayIm not broke so get past my Vans and hoodie and just give us our key Our room was smallishpaint peeling view sucked and no cool Kimpton robes Im an InTouch member but was told those were in some mysterious Tower room only Oh and the AC was busted And the windows didnt open I called for maintenance and the guy said the engineer would be right up 30 minutes later I called again to be told that the engineer had gone homebut would I like a fan After speaking with the manager the following morning we changed to a different better room At least the AC worked and I got a decent nights sleep before the marathon The manager also comped the night that we sweated rather than slept Beyond that the hotel is in a stellar location in downtown SF The staff mostly was totally coolespecially Keith and LeBan the Doorman The hotel is old The beds are comfy and the housekeeping staff keeps it clean but it is an old buildingjust dont expect perfection No flat panel TVs No coffee makers in the rooms Honor bar is decently priced Room service is available In summary it is satisfactory but Im not convinced its worth the money When we go back well probably give another hotel a shot

title: Amazing service and position
text: We could not have been happier with our visit to the Inn at the Market The staff were outstanding the position absolutely perfect and we were lucky enough to get an upgraded room The hotel also has the most amazing rooftop deck for guest use Brilliant hotel

title: great location for subways Times Sq etc
text:
We stayed during a heatwave in October and had five brilliant nights Our room and bed were huge Room 510 nice and clean No view but that was found on the rooftop bar We only ordered from the bar once as it was expensive 20 for a beer and wine but we took our complimentary coffee us there There was a separate area for smokers and they did not bother us
I would not use the hotel shuttlebus service back to JFK Cost was 25 each could have booked a taxi for same and we made 4 hotel pick ups and 4 drop offs to different Terminals Took nearly 2 hours same journey by cab 45 mins Unfortunately we were dropped at wrong Terminal and had to get the airtrain It was a good job we had left plenty of time to check in

title: Beautiful Hotel  Perfectly Located
text: We spent 4 days at this hotel and we couldnt have been more satisfied This hotel is perfectly located The Biltmore fashion park with many upscale stores and a number of restaurants is right across the street The suites are large very clean and well furnished The bed which is always a big deal for us was extremely comfortable We really appreciated both the complimentary breakfasts and the evening cocktail hour The breakfast was served in a beautiful setting with made to order eggs omelets pancakes etc The atrium lobby with its fountain and coy pond were impressive and a great setting for a drink or a meal any time of the day We had a room service dinner the first night and the hamburgers from the Omaha Steakhouse Restaurant downstairs were outstanding Best of all is the hotel staff Everyone went out of their way to make this a memorable stay for us This hotel is a great choice for anyone visiting the Phoenix area

title: Comfortable and Convenient
text: Chose the Coast Gateway for a day layover in Seattle on my way to Costa Rica The room was a bit small but sufficient for just myself May be a little cramped for a couple The room had a large window a comfortable bed and was very clean The hotel is extremely close to the airport 5min shuttle ride so it is extremely convenient for layovers The wifi access is great and the desk in the room was perfect for me to buckle down and get some work done The restaurant next to hotel has decent food and is open late So far this is my favorite hotel to stay at when traveling through Seattle on my way to other destinations Definitely recommended

title: Yuck Overpriced  Not very nice
text: Being out of towners on a business trip we accidentally chose a hotel on the wrong side of the tracks So we went in search of another and found the Wwith its very cool lobby Well the lobby was the only good part about this hotel After arriving in our room we couldnt believe how small it was You could almost stand in the bathtub and still reach the sink to brush your teeth It looked like a very old run down building that had a lot of knickknacks and trendy furniture added to it to try to justify the high price This was literally the smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in and we have traveled considerably in the states and abroad Besides the 8 bottle of water in the fridge you could find an intimacy kit complete with condoms and lubricating jelly and some waxed lips in your room Gross Yes the L is outside your window and is pretty loud but it is the least of your worries Dont leave your window shades up as there are perverts in the office buildings next door that like the watch the guests This hotel isnt really next to anything except the L and the Sears Tower Do yourself a favor and stay down by Lake Michigan There were many nicer hotels in that area of town There was constant thumping loud music coming from the dj spinning records in the lobby and the hallways were so dark you could barely see your way around They were also having some model shoot in the lobby as well which was weird Their King Sized Bed room was not a king It was a double They had a fleece throw on top of the bedspread that had little hairs all over it I will never stay there again I am glad I can say I experienced the W hotels though so I know never to make the same mistake Stay in a Westin They are much nicer and not as expensive or trendy The only reason one would stay here is to rent a room by the hour The W Chicago says Trashy not Classy

title: Great location
text: Great location in Midtown Friendly staff who will try to help Clean small nice rooms Nice touch to have a fridge and microwave in the room Small efficient business center that always had space and no kids playing on the computers Plenty of healthy and otherwise food for breakfast happy pleasant cook for hot breakfast options 3 small elevators were very quick and always available a big plus in Mahattan hotels

title: Great hotel with a good location
text:
We stayed at the Elan for one night on the 29th August and although we had read the reviews which were positive for some reason we didnt no what to expect and a bit unsure
How wrong you can be
Firstly I can confirm the staff are very friendly and helpfull We asked for directions advice on the area local restaurants and they did all they could to help 
Room was nice clean and the bed was a nice large one
They had wine and cheese in the early evening which was a nice touch  you can help yourself to as much as you want
Breakfast was continental style in the main reception area which was well laid out and had plenty of choices
As a tourist it was well located near the Beverly centre and a short drive to Hollywood Blvd chinese theatre park in the new shopping mall and get a discounted ticket and a short drive to Rodeo Drive
Wish we had stayed a bit longer but will definatley use this hotel if we stay around the area in future

title: Large highclass hotel by the airport
text:
Great modern hotel Wasnt surprised after all its a Hilton Spacious beautiful lobby nice quiet room with modern appointments and a comfortable bed Many choices for dining but the prices for food and drink were exorbitantly high But hey this is California after all
Cant say I had much to complain about However the controlledaccess parking system was a bummer The automated ticket machine was malfunctioning twice during my stay and wouldnt accept my pass To further complicate things buzzing the concierge from the gate doesnt work if said concierge isnt at his station One morning I literally had to back up by car from the gate much to the annoyance of the people behind me repark and sprint to the front desk to let them know that I couldnt get out Almost made me late for my conference 
I will say one thing about the reservation process  dealing with Hilton general reservations has gotten to be a trying experience Four phone calls over a twohour period and each time I was given different availability and rate information for this hotel Even after I booked my stay my emailed receipt showed incorrect pricing information But thankfully the front desk clerk at the hotel helped me out by fixing the problem immediately and efficiently She rocked 
With the traffic in San Jose its nice to stay so close to the airport However the location was also somewhat isolated and there was nothing else within walking distance

title: Just an OK Place to Stay Spend the extra money and go to an Embassy Suites
text:
Arrived very late in the pm and was suppose to have a room reserved from a business block They had no such block but were very accomodating in getting me a room I found out later that they had lost our block of rooms request plus I did not get the corporate rate agreed upon from the block But that shouldnt reflect on the hotel itself as thats probably all arranged through someone else
As I mentioned before the staff was very helpful and a plus I received a room on the 6th floor which I guess was suppose to be something special The furniture especially the living room was really old The refrigerator looked ancient and was very loud Although it was a larger fridge then youd find in some other suites hotels The bed and bedding however were very comfortable
The nightly welcome home reception was not that great Keg beer and cheap wine plus the food didnt look very appetizing Although I did have a salad The morning breakfast was better although I love breakfast food with scrambled eggs sausage links oatmeal plus cold cereal pastries and fruit
Parking is limited so I ended up paying 15 to park in the garage each night 
The location depending on what you want to do can be a plus or minus There is a little grocery store next door if you want to stock the fridge and Buckleys Pub is just up the hill But for sightseeing or business you will definately need a car
I spent 179night not including taxes or parking I would probably recommend it at 129149 otherwise spend the extra 50 and go to an Embassy Suites

title: Conferencing
text:
I spent one week in Omni Shoreham for a conference and as conference hotel this one is excellent the meeting rooms are wide with a good acoustics the material was high quality and the personal extremely friendly and helpful 
I did not use the fitness room neither the pool but they seemed to be very nice
For this levels hotel I was thoug surprised that the phonetic isolation between the rooms and especially the bathrooms was so weak indeed I could hear by above neighbours flushing the toilets and taking their shower I suppose that my below neighbour heard me 
The hotel bar and restaurant are quite expensive but there are a lot of little restaurants just within 5mins walk as well as the metro station

title: Absolutely gorgeous Hotel
text:
This was a really wonderful hotel to stay in We spent a week here and had a brilliant time The hotel staff were really lovely and nothing was too much trouble Raymond and the other staff were so helpful giving recommendations for transport and restaurants Most evenings we enjoyed the complimentary wine and cheese reception which was a lovely way to relax after sightseeing and before going out for a show or meal It was also a nice way to get to know other guests in the hotel
The rooms were lovely and to a very high standard and the breakfast was delicious Highly recommended would love to return sometime

title: Amazing  we will stay here again  again
text:
We stayed here for our 15th wedding anniversary We were able to upgrade to a onebedroom corner suite on the 14th floor for a very reasonable amount thanks to the generosity  helpfulness of the front desk staff My husband is a priority club gold member  they told us they wanted to make our stay very special  they did
The hotel is a little intimidating to pull into at first glance because you have to drive over the sidewalk but the valet service was prompt  efficient  laughed with us at our parking questions He understood it was unusual to pull over the sidewalk
The lobby is beautiful  regal  very oldworld charming As I mentioned previously the front desk staff just could not have been better I mentioned our anniversary  that we wanted champagne sent to the room  they had room service contact us within minutes of our checkin
Although we didnt eat a meal at the hotel we went to the Top of the Mark for drinks  appetizers The view is outstanding The Martinis are great  their trio of grilled cheese sandwiches was really fun  tasty
The walk down to Union Square  Chinatown is pretty short but that uphill walk back is brutal It made us feel less guilty for all the celebrating we did
On Friday night after we returned from dinner in Chinatown there was a beautiful plate of chocolate cake fruit  a chocolate mold of the hotel with a card wishing us a Happy 15th Anniversary We kept the card for the beautiful memory this hotel helped us create
We cant recommend it enough  cannot wait to visit again

title: Loved it
text: I was a bit stressed about finding a clean and decent hotel in Venice Beach I booked the Hotel Erwin based on TripAdvisor reviews What a great experience Great location close to the beach and Abbot Kinney for chic shops and restaurants Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful Although I didnt eat in the restaurant the room service was delicious and very fresh Cant wait to go back Rooms were great value too

title: unreal perfect hotel great staff awesome location
text: A large group of us have just got back from the Sheraton We really couldnt have asked for more The staff were so helpful the rooms had everything we needed The location was perfect Will be coming back to stay at the Sheraton

title: A wonderful place to have a conference and first rate service
text: This hotel is a wonderful place to have a conference or meeting The plaza style of the hotel creates a calming atmosphere which can turn any meetin argument into a discussion The conference rooms were clean and had excellent natural lighting The food was greatI highly recommend the oatmeal for breakfast The close proximity of the hotel to local attractions helped facilite a team building atmosphere as meeting attendees were excited to discuss nightly plans and organize activities The rooms were clean and I loved the patios The service was absolutely first ratethe best Ive ever seen I hope to have the opportunity to come back to this hotel again

title: The Inn with HEART in Boston
text: Recently our family had the pleasure to again stay at The Best Western Inn at Longwood Medical while our son was hospitalized in Boston As usual the rooms and beds were comfy and clean staff supportive and friendly and the location perfect as well as the room rate reasonable for Boston We have been traveling to Boston Childrens for our sons complex heart condition for nearly 10 years now but until recently we have not been fortunate enough to obtain reservations here during our stay This hotel seemed to be very popular and availability limited Once we experienced the Inn at Longwood we began scheduling planned hospitalizations for our son around the hotels room availability We had found out first hand why it was so popular and didnt want to have to return to staying elsewhere During our last two emergency hospital stays the inn had no vacancies but thanks to the caring management and staff we were finally able to get a room The first time their desk clerk Amy with the help of the manager Bill Davies managed to make a room available for us despite their being full to the brim Then just last week we were again faced with the no room at the inn situation and about to give up The manager Bill Davies went above and beyond when he heard of our predicament We were just about to give up late at night after checking back frequently during the day for availability when he raced after us with the good news that there had been a cancellation and he had saved a room for us It is so refreshing to find that there are still caring people out there who will help you when the chips are down We will be returning to Boston and The Inn at Longwood again tomorrow for more medical treatment and are thankful to have this refuge during times of struggle

title: Great location well appointed but small rooms
text: I only stayed here one night but after my terrible stay at the Hilton see other review I was delighted The location is far better than the Hilton  you step out onto lots of highend shops and malls The lobby is hip with accompanying hip music and the staff courteous and friendly The room was small but contemporary clean and with uptodate furnishings and a flat screen TV PLUS it was over 100 less than the Hyatt I was absolutely delighted I would highly recommend this to anyone despite the slow elevators

title: More than expected
text:
By far the best thing about the Roundhouse Suites is Tiara at the front desk Shes a treasure
I was in Boston for a medical trip Most of the hotels were full at the fairly short notice I booked Wasnt sure what to expect from the hotel from reviews
The first experience of attempting to change the room type by email sent to the hospitality manager wasnt good since no one answered Called and that was remedied
Next experience wasnt too good either as the airport shuttle didnt show up Apparently you need to get a confirmation email from the driver He claimed never to have received it
BUT from there on the experience got very positive VERY quickly We were told to take a taxi from the airport which Tiara deducted from the room charge I have a thing about ground floor rooms and though there was nothing wrong with the room we got she changed us WITH A SMILE to a higher room
The complimentary breakfast is very good The nice lady who deals with breakfast is REALLY efficient She keeps things flowing but get there on time because she efficiently packs away too 
The complimentary shuttle around town is excellent The guys are REALLY accommodating and they give you a realistic time when they can arrive Only had one incident with the shuttle and the amazing Tiara was around to fix that for us too
My brother actually used the gym
Theres a great mall within walking distance
We also got stuck in Boston due to Hurricane Maria closing the airport Danielle arranged for us to stay in our room which was a blessing
Great hotel Id stay again

title: Disney Haunted Mansion vibe going on
text:
Theres something oddly cool about the Sax Hotel in Chicago Its hard to put a finger on it
Is it the fancy lobby Absolutely not Quite frankly the lobby isnt really fancy or a lobby its more like a hallway with Bin 36 on one end and a reception desk that doubles as a place to purchase fine crystal on the other Is it the super friendly staff Nope Reception folks are nice but about as nice as they are obligated to be Dont expect a huge smile a hug and a free room upgrade This group  including valet  is all about efficiency and they seem to do it well 
Perhaps one of the reasons I like the Sax is because its just different than most hotels Its got the Disney Haunted Mansion vibe going on When the elevators open or you key into your room or visit the Crimson Lounge you get the sense a fog machine is about to start up and Vincent Price is going to greet you As a side note I swear the eyes on that womans picture in the elevator move But none of this is meant in a negative way by any means Actually the mix of modern and somewhat darker motifs give this hotel a little character which in my humble opinion is greatly missing in most cookiecutter overnighters 
As for the rooms I have always found them to be clean and the late evenings quite The dcor is trendy and unique The showertub combo is a bit small but suffices The phone rings The stereo alarm clock and TV are all in good working order The mini bar good to go Comfy robes Check Beds and pillows are always subjective You should note that when I hit a bed its late Im beat and Im just glad its not a holding cell Could the rooms use a little upgrade at some point Probably but it shouldnt deter you 
Perhaps the Saxs best characteristic is the location No taxi needed to get to Ten Pin Public House Rockit Bar Paris Club Hub 51 Keefers Trump Bar Harry Careys very underrated because of the name sake and a thousand other fun places for great food and drinks Skip the cheesy tourist trap known in Chicago as the House of Blues unless you are attending a concert I love the location and if pressed could whip out another dozen or so not to be missed bars or restaurants without thinking And depending upon the event being hosted and the crowd the environment at the Crimson Lounge in the Sax is a great place to meet people dance drink and ultimately end the night
Guests at the hotel tend to be a little younger under 40and a little wilder looking than what youd find at the Embassy Suites down the street Most are there to have a good time not just crash for the night While there are nicer hotel options cheaper hotel options and hotel options with more well options Spa Pool Full menu room service etc in Chicago the Sax is a unique boutique hotel with an interesting interior and a hard to beat location Worthy of a visit whether you are by yourself with a mate or a group of friends

title: Mandarin brand is amazing
text:
I have stayed at many Mandarin Oriental hotels across the US and have never had a bad experience Everything from check in to check out is always perfect Impeccable service great restaurants and amazingly clean and neat The Mandarin in DC continued to impress They remember your name at check in and always offer you a bottle of water The room had tranquil music playing and a welcome note with a snack which was nice It was clean and the turndown service was great  left robe slippers and shoe shine box by the bed each night The lobby barrestaurant was a great place for a lite bite and a few drinks The service there was great 
I have stayed here a few times and its been great every time Its the first choice for me when I am traveling for business to any city but also highly recommend for personal use  its worth the

title: Construction outside my room
text:
I arrived late and was given a floor that had construction signs on the wall Early the next morning construction started outside my room waking me up It continued throughout the day The hot water seemed to be out because of this as well and I took a cold shower
 On a side note During the winter months the heat is prefixed in the rooms It is very hot with no way to cool it down
 I do like the renovated fitness room and the location is central to downtown Indy

title: Nice but pricey
text:
Long overdue review for the Nikko 
I had a room on the 16th floor with all the usual amenities youd expect The bathroom was a brilliant size with seperate shower stall and bath  excellent The king bed was very comfortable and there was no road noise A lot of the room showed wear  tear old carpet scuffed furniture etc which I didnt expect in this price bracket
I found front desk check in unhelpful and surly Also shocked that despite having a fully paid voucher for the stay they booked the same amount again over 800USD to my visa debit card to cover incidentals beware if you use a debit visa my bank assures me this shouldnt be necessary which seemed excessive
Failed to see any evidence of a Japanese theme in the rooms other than the Anzu  restaurant
The tv in the room wouldnt work I informed front desk to get it fixed several times as I was leaving for tours  meals out but they kept telling me to see them when I was back and theyd arrange it then  not good enough by the time I got in late from excursions I just wanted a drink and the tv working before sleeping and not waiting around for someone to come up 
Overall given the price I was disappointed and would try somewhere else next time I would like to point out that the staff at the front door were excellent and always willing to help perhaps put them on reception

title: A Grand Hotel in a wonderful city
text: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions for business and once with family on vacation If you are watching your budget this may not be the hotel for your next trip This is a hotel from a bygone era Dont let the modern facade of the building fool you As soon as you enter the hotel and make your way to the reception desk and see the vaulted ceilings and furnishings you can feel yourself going back in time The front desk staff is most attentive and often have people from all over the world working there They are quick to help and guide you on any question or concern The location is right in downtown San Diego You can walk to most anything Shopping eating and site seeing can all start from this location Restaurants abound at all prices cuisine and ambiance Shopping is nearby and again in different price ranges When you step off the elevator and circle around to your room you know you are in a very nice hotel Each two rooms share a single keyed entrance to an anteroom Then you enter your own room Spacious is the word The decor is beautiful Everything in its right place The bathroom is as big as you will see Comfortable bed and heatingairconditioning I havent used the hotel eating facility because of the large number of choices nearby I would recommend Marias Mexican Restaurant at 1011 4th Avenue Its a hole in the wall but the people are very nice and the food is quite good The workout room is well maintained with good equipment The USS Midway is a must see There is a showroom with restored cars for sell in the wonderful gaslight District that is well worth visiting I would not hesitate to stay here for business or pleasure

title: Back to this great choice
text: I came back to this hotel based on my previous experiences Rooms and amenities are great free WiFi nice continental breakfast very friendly staff Location is my favourite in DC due to the charming Georgetown with its nice cafes and restaurants nice surroundings and the brilliant Barnes and Noble bookshop opened until 11 pm The Mall is not far from

title: Not as great as before
text: Noisy The elevator was only part of that and even though Id asked for a room AWAY from the elevator I got one CLOSEST to the elevator The sheets were itchy low quality not 100 cotton duvet was sparse Towels were fluffy and fabulous The parking is expensive and there is a 7 hidden tax on top of the parking fee The little fridge in the room went onoff all night long noise and couldnt be turned off or unplugged due to their setup The TV reception was horrible The line to checkout was too long to wait only one staff member and they dont give you an option of automated checkout like most other hotels The hotel restaurant is closed for remodel yet they dont disclose that The gym is also in remodel At a room fee of 127 one queen or 2 doubles plus 32 per nite parking  the extra in hidden taxes and fees of 28 really put this over the top However the location is great for a downtown hotel

title: Worst customer service
text:
We are regualr guests of this hotel since 2008 and we love staying here During our recent stay we noticed a huge drop in service We were made to queue during check in and the front desk staff was very uncaring Looks like they have new people everytimeThe manager Jeff tried to help us but we felt that he was overwhelmed and uncaring
The room that was assigned to us was clean but not what we booked It was a low floor with a street view of ugly buildings We called the front desk and we were made to wait again Jeff finally picked up our call and tried his best to offer a solution to our problem Guess whatno solution We were stuck in this room because the hotel was sold out We asked for the general manager but was told that he was on vacation
We stayed overnight and left early We will never stay in this hotel and not recommend it to our company

title: Very elegant great price
text: We loved this hotel After looking over the options on trip advisor we decided on the Roosevelt for the price and the location The rooms were more than adequate the location was spot on We walked a ton and took the subway got lost for one hour but we were close to Time Square DO NOT stay in a hotel at Time Square it is very bright and you will be sorry  so busy We purchased show tickets when we got there at Time Square but if there is something you must see I advise you purchase them ahead of time well before your departure date New York was fabulous and we plan to go back very soon Very safe cop on every corner Not that they need it people are very helpful and with common sense you will have an amazing trip

title: Great Location
text:
Sandwiched between times square and hells kitchenthis is a great location
The Hotel is a funky modernclean hotel with very attentive staff
You are right in the heart of the city and there is a subway at the top of the streetgiving easy access to the rest of the city
We loved our trip to the Big Apple and this hotel played a big part in our enjoyment

title: Fantastic place for kids
text: We stayed in late April for 4 nights with 2 boys 4 and 8 in a 1 br condo We had such a good time the boys did not want to leave to go to seaworld nor the riverwalk Beautiful grounds very clean condo was gorgeous For the price and what you get  lazy river large pools slides etc we thought it was a good deal

title: Chicagos downtown Sheraton Towers was a great experience
text: With a city full of so many things to do and see it was great to have such an experienced and friendly concierge team helping us at the Chicago Sheraton Towers Hotel Everything they recommended and suggested worked well for us and we had a wonderful experience We used all the services at the hotel From the pool to the wonderful steakhouse restaurant the staff service comfortable and clean rooms and great location make this one of the best hotels in Chicago

title: No Frills with Lots of Frills
text: This is a no frills hotel with lots of frillsnot the least of which is the price I paid approx 107 USD per night for a room with a queen bed The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable Hint the extra pillows in the closet are in better shape than the ones on the bed No view but the sound from the HVAC system in the courtyard provided a whitenoise background and I slept like a top Lots of towels soap shampoo etcnot the expensive spa brands but they work just as well The business centre in the basement has 3 working computers with web access and a monochrome laser printer all at no charge The fitness centre had 3 treadmills and 3 bikes in addition to a other equipment also free Complimentary continental breakfast has decent coffee juice toast and lots of other choices Close to Penn Station Macys 2 subway lines and lots of reasonably priced Korean restaurants If you are on a budget andor luxury is not a must this is the place for you

title: Love the Rock
text: The Hard Rock is one of the funnest places to stay in SD The service is incredible The room are worthy of a rock star

title: Good base for a tourist
text:
We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in September As a disclaimer we got the room for free through the Marriott loyalty scheme so I cant comment on value for money
The hotel is well located if you are a tourist visiting the city Its actually one block off Union Square but its only a couple of minutes to walk there 
The room we had was a bit small by US standards but it was very comfortable and well maintained with an air purifier in the room if you feel the need for such a thing and a well appointed bathroom Once again we thought the shower cabinet was rather small although it was certainly big enough to be usable The only real gotcha with the room was that it was single glazed only so you could be bothered by traffic noise if the same is true on lower floors we were on the 12th 
We never ate in the hotel restaurant so cant comment on the food The bar in the lobby was good  but you certainly paid city center prices in it 
The staff were one of the other real plus points Everyone we met was consistently friendly and helpful  the kind of good quality service I would expect in a Marriott The concierge in particular was incredibly helpful in giving us tips on where to go and how to get round town She also never made us feel rushed and always made time to chat Darlene take a bow 
All in all we liked our stay here Its not the most modern hotel in SF but we found it clean comfortable well fitted out and a good base for exploring the city as a tourist Like I say I cant comment on value but recommended in other terms

title: Great hotel
text: Very accommodating  very clean  great location Stayed here during Sandy and they were wonderful during the storm Nreakfast and internet were included in our package which is such a savings Would definitely stay here again

title: A Chic Compact Oasis Downtown
text: Im reluctant to publicize this hotelfor selfish reasons I absolutely love it The interior design is impeccable and general attention is a pleasure Its located downtown adjacent to the Gold Coast and Magnificent Mile I stayed here for business 4 nights and didnt want to leave While the lobby and guest rooms certainly arent spacious Hotel Felix does a beautiful job Flat screen TVs comfortable beds with nice threadcount linens and H20 bath products engage all the senses The staff is friendly and I never had any issues with reservations or car valet Highly recommend this hotel for business travel or an intimate getaway for a couple

title: Perfect For A Short Stay  Ideal Location
text:
We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express with Virgin Holidays It was only a three night stay so for this reason the hotel was fine The room was large and the beds confortable We stayed in one room with our 2 children and had ample space It is in a fantastic location for getting around San Francisco The bed linen was clean and a maid service was supplied every day We did not have the included continental breakfast as we chose to eat at the Dennys around the corner We had a lot of help from the desk staff who advised us about how to get around and the best plass to visit and how to get there 
Just a suggestion you must visit Alcatras and book tickets at home as it is normally fully booked when you go to buy tickets on the dock on the day

title: Comfortable clean  a great location
text:
So glad I stayed here during my stay in SF a few months ago
We booked through Priceline and got a 2 person room full size beds for only 90 a night for roughly 4 nights which was great given our circumstances Originally we had booked to stay at the Grant Plaza Hotel which ended up being much less than ideal and would not have been a good place to stay for a slightly extended stay The spacious clean and modern rooms of the Holiday Inn were such a great relief The overall atmosphere of the hotel was much better than my prior experience of the Grant Plaza and such a lucky deal
As for the location of the hotel it was amazing as well Its located roughly a block or two from the famous Pier 39 and just about the same distance in the opposite way from the cablecar turnaround station 
While I understand that my opinion of this hotel may have been askew given the poor conditions I saw at the other hotel I still think this is a great place to stay during a visit to San Fran Not sure about what the actual rates of the hotel are but if you can score yourself a deal on a travel website its definitely worth it

title: Exceeded expectations
text:
I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for five nights in a suite I was upgraded from a studio suite to a suite although I dont know how much I gainedthe suite was great though
The hotel kind of lacks the character that many older or boutique hotels in New York have but for a longer stay Id rather be comfortable than feel cool I was very comfortable and for a reasonable price despite paying for a studio suite
I didnt try breakfast in the hotel or use room service There is a 24 hour deli next door which was extremely convenient Bottled water was replenished each day
I was not looking for the typical Midtown tourist experience and the Sheraton Tribeca was perfect for seeing a different side of New York having lived in Hells Kitchen years ago I wanted to stay downtown for a change of pace If you are interested in seeing more of the small businesses and boutiques that are unique to New York I definitely recommend the TribecaSoho area

title: Really comfortable nice decor and not frightfully expensive
text: I enjoyed my stay here Rooms were not too small for new York and the position was easy walk to times square Cabs were easy to hail down out the front Loved the restaurant

title: Our two nights at Night were great
text: The Night Hotel was very cool I have to say after looking at the hotel website I was a bit nervous to stay there When we arrived we were given a warm welcome The room was small but very cool The bed had pillows with our initials on them Shower could have been a bit cleaner Location was awesome But all in all we had a great experience at the Night Hotel

title: I miss the Waldorf
text:
I miss the Waldorf After 2 years of staying at the Waldorf on business I have now switched companies and no longer am allowed to stay at this beautiful hotel If you like charm and class you will love this hotel I miss it so
No two rooms are alike one of my favorites I wish I remember was a room with 2 double beds  a VERY large dressing room with a vanity and floor length mirrors stepping up into the marble bathroom Lovely
I primarily stayed at this hotel for business Oscars was nice for a single person dining alone The immense fresh flower arrangement in the main lobby will take your breath away It is like nowhere else 
Treat yourself and stay at the Waldorf

title: Best stay in New York
text: I last stayed in the hotel back in January 2002 My wife and i went there for our honeymoon The service we received from the staff was exemplary all where friendly and could not do enough for my wife and i also our two friends We where given advice of where to eat and places to see I can not believe the write ups this hotel is getting My wife and I are both thinking of returning there with our two daughters Cant wait

title: Pros and Cons
text: For the money you are spending you shouldnt be surprised I think it was worth the money and its within walking distance of several of the tourist destinations Dont be fooled by the pictures the hotel isnt that great looking but lets be honest neither is San Francisco The building is old and the location makes it difficult to find parking so youll have to fork up the 21 to park in the Hotel parking lot A lot of interesting people roam outside at all times of the day but they dont cause too much trouble The only aspect I truly didnt like was that it was noisy at all 24 hours of the day which made it hard to sleepIm a very light sleeper Room service was fine did a good job Hotel staff was helpful so all in all i have no regrets in booking the Monarch I feel as though it was worth the money but I must say I wish they wouldve left some of those chocolate mints on my pillow

title: Good location friendly personnel clean facility
text:
My husband was here on business and I came along just to keep him company and check out downtown Chicago From the greeter at curbside to the bellmen valet and front desk personnel all were very friendly and welcoming Our room was a nice size and very clean Two comfortable chairs for relaxing TV on the smallish size but adequate however had to have someone come up and jiggle wires to get it to come on Also a friendly employee Love the button by the door that indicates do no disturb or please clean room Very convenient
The bathroom was awkward to use No towel rack for the hand towel Had to drape on the sink which resulted in a wet towel several times The toilet tissue was behind the toilet and difficult to reach We resorted to resting it on the tub The small ledge was not conducive to personal effects And lighting was poor HOWEVER it was very clean 
I wish there was a lobby where you could sit and watch the foot traffic on Michigan Ave They did have a Starbucks and a hotel bar with limited access to people watching The bar food was very good Nice staff very helpful without being intrusive The Starbucks was very busy but good service quickly Lots of business people on computers Fun to check it all out Good view of Michigan Ave 
We ate at Michael Jordans Restaurant at the hotel Nice decor good staff not remarkable food Not bad just not great A tad pricey but to be expected for the location On a side note we enjoyed the bar food so much more
All in all a good visit and would come again

title: the price is right
text:
i had contacted the constitution inn directly after finding the inn thru the internet their pricing is based on your military rating
but also as a civilian your eligible to stay there active duty assigned the uss constitution stay there
 when we got to the inn everything was in place the staff was extremely courteous and very helpful on questions about boston touring in general our room was probably one of the largest that iv ever had the room was clean neat and ready maybe the views are not the best in the world but down stairs there is a full fittness center that includes a monster heated 50 yard swimming pool large saunna free weight room fitness machine room loocker rooms full court gymnasium a full laundry facilitythe business license says armed forces ymca
they have a reading room with books and games
we spent our first two days of the week we had here and enjoyed
ever minutealso our last day three days at the inn
another good point on friday afternoon to monday morning
its free parking the inn is very easy to get to from the airport
boston has serious traffic congestionforget the big dig we
never had to go in it the tours all leave from walking distance from the innin one short sentancewe loved this place

title: Perfect mid priced funky getaway
text: This hotel was priced midrange but was better than we expected We have stayed in great hotels and dives and this was pretty good overall We expected more cheesy from the pics but it wasnt that bad The place had a funky vibe The staff was awesome and friendly The rooms had clean white bedding no nasty bed spreads and the continental breakfast of bagels and pastries was nice Would stay here again

title: 1920s Deco stuck in the past
text:
My partner and I stayed here between 8th December  12th December The lobby is well decorated and unfortunately gives a false impression of things to come The rooms are outdated and in our case bordering uninhabitable 
The window did not close properly causing a draft into the room the radiator  heating system did not work Despite upgrading to a Penn 5000 room the room was worse than a bogstandard room we had last year The corridors could do with a major replaster which can also be said for the rooms
Location is excellent this is a cheap hotel where you really do get what you pay for which is not much Fortunately we did not have any issues with bed bugs

title: This Place Has So Much To OfferExcellent Front Desk Staff Saved Our Families Sanity
text: Our family of 4 was saved by this place We relocated from Arizona and was in the process of finding home to live Originally we had checked into a different hotel we found on the internet when we arrived to the other hotel we realized we had been scammed Small room stolen microwave scary neighborhood was afraid my room would be robbed after staying at the other hotel for 2 days we drove around and came across this place Patty the front desk room supervisor was the Best She let us check out one of the rooms and we were sold The single room was larger cleaner then the other long term hotel suite we had been staying in and much less expensive and had so much more to offerI am surprised that its not rated higherThe service here was Amazing Thank you Patty for all your help If I had more room to rave about this place it would be never ending

title: Great location recently renovated
text:
I had the Queen deluxe room for a conference I was attending here The room is fairly small but it was nicely finished You could tell they recently renovated it It looks like everything but the doors and door trim was changed The bed is super comfortable The bathroom is luxurious with walls lined with marble and some nice Kohler fixtures including a shower that feels like you are in a rainshower I needed to do some computer work and a desk with power outlet was available Kind of disappointed they charge 14day for internet Luckily I was able to tether to my cell phone and got decent reception
I was also made aware that they redid their fitness center It has a bunch of treadmills stationary bikes ellipticals dumbbells and a set of different strength machines I liked it a lot With all the food thats available in Boston it is nice to unwind with a good workout to finish the day
Location GREAT Copley square is a great location The magnificent Boston Public Library is right across the street and is a must see There are a lot of shops and eateries near by and you can walk to nearby Boston public park and commons Chinatown etc I bought a Mass transit 7 day pass for 15 which allows me to hop on any bus or subway Definitely made food possibilities more doable
Staff very friendly I am generally low maintenance during my stay but my interactions were all met with smiles and friendly attitudes

title: Thought it was great
text:
We thought that the Hotel was fine for a small boutique facility that was clean nicely appointed and had a friendly staff Very quaint It doesnt have a bank of high speed elevators like the larger surrounding facilities but you could converse with the staff without having to wait in line for 20 minutes Free morning coffee in the lobby was a nice touch
It is conveniently located off Michigan Avenue across from Water Tower Place and is attached to Ditkas Restaurantthe reason for the faint smell of cigar smoke 
A great facility for couples wanting to experience downtown Chicago

title: This is the best hotel to stay in Houston
text: I have stayed in this Hotel several times I am here again This time with my family This is a really lovely place to stay The Manager is really a wonderful man The owner is a very helpful person I am from Australia and this is not my first stay here I read negative reviews for this place here and wonder why I am here now again I am happy if any one wants to ask me if this is a genuine review I have never ever felt such welcome any where in the world Trust me I have travelled all over the world  this is not my first hotel stay I think this is the best hotel stay I have ever stayed in A friend saw reviews and said to me is this true what people are writing here and when I read them I was so supprised This place is a nice comfortable safe place for any one to stay in I recommend this place to any one who is looking for accomodation in Houston Any one can email me or phone me to confirm my statement

title: Good hotel with soft beds Advance booking to save
text: Be advised peoplethe beds are soft If you like soft go for it If you like firm dont The rooms are small clean  functional The location is central to times square NY accommodation is expensive all round so I suppose 350 last minute per night is about right Advance payment options through the hotel website is recommended to get the best rate Do It months ahead to really save We paid about 210 ex tax 3 months ahead It was almost double that near the date of stay Enjoy

title: Excellent Hotel and Felt Safe as Woman Traveling alone at Night
text: I was a little concerned as a woman traveling alone arriving at night via the airport shuttle but there was absolutely no need to worry The shuttle driver arrived promtly and was very friendly The room was very spacious and clean and room service was quick and tasty I would definately recommend this hotel as a perfect overnight when traveling in and out of Phoenix airport

title: Quality you can trust
text: I stayed here on business and booked only two weeks out so the rate was really high However good location clean convenient small but not by NYC standards even has a microwave and mini fridge with microwave snacks sold at the front desk nice bathroom with granite tile nice shower head plenty of hot water and cant beat free cold bottled water at the front desk in July heat Staff was very friendly and extremely attentive

title: lovely accomodation in a great location
text: Myself husband  our 2 teenagers stayed at teh Beacon for 4 nights August 2010  can honestly say it lived up to the great reviews on here We stayed in a one bed suite with an extra roll away bed there was more than enough space The suite was smart well equipped and immaculately presented while the staff were welcoming and efficient Best of all the neighbourhood is charming with a great range of local restaurants and shops within a stones throw All just a short stroll away from central park  just a short hop on the underground from the main attractions In short the Beacon is a real gem Would stay again in a flash

title: Better experience here than other reviews
text:
My wife and I and our two small kids ages 8  6 just spent 4 days here late March and early April I had read all of the posts on this site about the Westin La Cantera and our experience was more positive than some others Here are some thoughts
First I used Starwood points for the stay and had requested a view of the pool We were very pleased with our room It was on the 4th floor and was plenty big enough for the 4 of us with a nice sitting area balcony large bathroom  of course the Westin Heavenly beds Whether my room was bigger than the majority of the rooms at the resort Im not sure I did notice that there was ongoing construction on the outside of the 1st floor rooms that faced the driveway we speculated it had to something to do with some of the complaints of dampness that visitors have mentioned in earlier posts The Westin has a great location for families just down the street from Six Flags and an easy drive to Sea World Expect however about a 2530 minute drive to the Riverwalk area
Second my family loved the pool facilities The staff handed out pool toys for the kids to use without any rental charge All of the facilities seemed nice but I have to admit that we did not eat at the restaurants since we were visiting relatives nearby
Third like many of the other posts I did notice problems with the service that you would not get at similar resorts We had problems on both days that we ordered lunch by the pool The food was unreasonably slow in coming out of the kitchen despite the fact that the pool area at midweek was not crowded at all Both waitresses got simple orders wrong and I was finally forced to go to the bar and ask for silverware
Finally a word about the parking Do not pay the 12 per day valet charge The self parking is not that far I feel like some of the earlier posts complaining about the distance are from travelers accustomed to staying at motels were your car in right in front of your room 
Overall an enjoyable stay

title: Nice hotel and good location
text: The Palmer house is a beautiful old hotel off Monroe street which puts you close to the waterfront public transportation restaurants and shopping The hotel has a beautiful lobby with restaurants and bar attached I didnt try the bar or restaurant but it was fairly busy through out my stay The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable I was here with family and we needed a crib which they brought up at no charge Nicely decorated to keep the old look but had a new feel The gym is very nice but they do charge a 10 fee to use it The pool is small and could be updated They did offer a movie in the evening for kids but the water was freezing The hotel concierge is very helpful and friendly Beware that if you drive and have to park the hotel parking is 42 per day with in and out privileges Not that surprising for city parking but best to know in advance I would definitely stay here again

title: Not outstanding but pretty good
text: Not an outstanding stay but a pretty good one We found a gross number of hairs on our bed comforter but when we called the front desk they immediately brought a clean one Hotel bar and restaurant is just that a hotel bar Expensive and over priced but if you want a drink without going out it gets the job done Small pool Complimentary internet fridge and microwaves in rooms are a plus wish we brought some food and drinks to stock them so we could have saved some money Valet parking was expensive but consistent with the rest of the city 40 per day Great location to a number of restaurants as well as historical sites Would stay again

title: First class service  part of the culture
text:
I stayed at this hotel for third time this year for a week on business and I will continue to stay there in future visits to Houston The rooms are perfectly comfortable and the general ambience is relaxing and unhurried All the amenities are very good ie bar restaurant gym pool business centre courtesy transport etc However the most striking thing is the consistent friendliness cheerfulness and helpful attitude of the staff They do the hotel great credit For example
1 I realised on the first day that I had forgotten my electrical adapter British to US They gave me one
2 I had trouble printing out in the business centre One of the people on reception came instantly to the centre and explained what I had to do 
3 Hard at work on the stepper in the gym I was pleasantly surprised as one of the cleaners brought me an ice cold bottle of water
4 The restaurant and bar staff are particularly cheerful attentive and courteous serving free drinks etc on the patio during the daily happy hour Although at times very busy they demonstrate an ability to engage all the guests positively making for a great atmosphere
I felt that all this was absolutely genuine and as a customer I felt valued  so I had a really enjoyable stay  what more can one ask for

title: Bring your own light bulbs
text:
The designers of this hotel clearly valued appearance and trendiness over functionality The elevators are so dim it is difficult to find the correct floor button The lighting in the rooms is so poor that I had difficulty finding items in my bag Even the bathroom lighting is relatively dim The beds are very low no box springs so be prepared for a long descent when its time to retire The one chair in the room is metal cold and pretty uncomfortable The seating in the public spaces of the hotel ranges from comfy armchairs to incredibly small uncomfortable yellow plastic chairs Lets not mention the log in the bar with the metal seat backs inserted at random intervals 
 NYC hotel rooms tend to be noisy but this one exceeded any expected noise levels The heatingair conditioning was very noticeable as was the untraceable constant whine that combined with the other ambient noise I was awakened several times during the night by noises that seemed to come from the window frames or outside the hotel
 On the plus side the rooms are scrupulously clean The outdoor garden is beautiful as is the Library You can visit those areas of the hotel without having to endure staying there Stay at the Hudson Hotel if its more important to be in a fashionable than a comfortable functional setting

title: Great choice in Chicago
text:
I booked a room in one of Affinias suites and was very impressed when we walked in The pictures do this hotel no justice Very spatious and clean The layout of the room was impressive as well
Check in went very smoothly and all staff were extremely friendly and helpful I did have one incident in my room involving my curlers blowing up in my facesparks and all I called managment and they sent an engineer and hotel manager up right away to investigate It turned out that it was the curlers that were in its last leg and not the hotels fault They actually took 50 dollars off of that nights stay and they didnt have to do that at all
I do have to add that we used the online conceirge service and ordered rose pedals to be sent to our room We received a confirmation email and everything but they never arrived and we were never charged This incident was the only con about this hotel
Affinia is only a block away from the Magnificent Mileperfect I also like how it was a Walgreens right around the corner very convenient
If you want to experience luxury with a trendy twist make sure you choose Affinia I WILL be back

title: What a deal
text: As a Starwoods member I was upgraded with a view of the Park It was such a treat at such an affordable rate I would go back in a minute

title: Best customer service in the industry
text: After a long road trip from Las Vegas across the scorching death valley desert as soon as I stepped into the lobby the manager was there to greet me with great customer service He went above and beyond his call of duty to help us out during our stay The manager was even kind enough to recommend good places to eat nearby I would recommend this hotel just based on the customer service alone Thank you

title: Contemporary luxury in downtown San Francisco
text: This was my 3rd stay at this property having stayed in their Astor Suite and Metropolitan Suite Contemporary furnishings with ebonized wood floors Luxurious cream marble baths carpeted bedrooms amazingly comfortable king beds Solicitous and mannered staff from greetersvalet at pullup in the rental car and thorough kind mannered and well trained front desk staff Prompt service from room service valet car pickup requests and on premises restaurant Ame  Is there anything else I can do for sir  was a common question with each encounter with this hotels staff Stay here if you like contemporary furnishings spectacular city views Lobby bar and lounge is popular with locals and can get busy and noisy later in the evening Well designed lobby and public areas perhaps this property is not for you if you prefer traditional furnishings though I enjoy the complimentary coffee available in the mornings on the fourth floor by the casual restaurant and the large L shaped gym on 5 I did not use the 6th floor pool or spa however Prompt and thorough housekeeping staff and eager to please turn down service in the evenings with every request met promptly and willingly Museum of Modern Art is next door and Metreon Center is across the street for films Union Square and Market St shopping just a few blocks away My only negative observation is that the roomsuite furnishings are looking slightly worn some stains on the mohair sofa and wood furniture looking very slightly scratched Lovely thick towels bathrobes generous toiletries Closet and drawer space is very limited however a common design flaw among higher end contemporary hotels I find High speed elevators with rarely more than a few seconds wait I love the motorized curtains and sun shades in the suites bedrooms although I must say the centralized touch screen telephonecommand center can be frustrating and confusing to use unless you concentrate and look closely at the screen and its functions

title: Perfect hotel in a perfect location
text: I cannot say enough great things about Henderson Wharf Inn right in the heart of the beautiful Fells Point section of Baltimore I have fallen in love with Fells Point with its many unique bars restaurants and shops its quaint cobblestone streets and its wonderful and friendly residents The Henderson Wharf Inn is a perfect match for Fells Point as its far enough away to be away from all of the noise and hubbub of the bars but only a short walk to be right smack in the middle of all the fascinating night life The hotel itself is gorgeous and situated right on the harbor for spectacular views and panoramas especially thru the door sized windows The two large queen sized beds are extremely comfortable and you even get a complimentary bottle of wine to put in your ample sized fridge upon arrival The service was professional and courteous especially our hostessmanager Lee The parking is free and so is the succulent continental breakfast that offers only the freshest fruits bagels and coffee All of this at a very reasonable price for everything you get My only qualm about writing this review is I dont want everyone flocking here because I want to have the Inn whenever I want it and I plan on making several more trips to this pearl in the middle of the diamond that is Fells Point

title: Extremely Disappointed
text:
I stayed at this hotel on Saturday June 1415 2008 I booked my reservation directly on their website and redeemed 25000 reward points I am a frequent traveler work related and have stayed with the Crowne Plaza and other Intercontinental hotels on a frequent basis over the years
When I checked in the desk clerk had no clue about my room being paid for with reward points I gave him my copy of the confirmation for the reservation and the proof 25000 points had been deducted from my account He said the daymanager would figure it out the next morning and proceeded to charge my AMEX card for the room A clerk in the back came out and looked at the reservation on their computer system and told him it was right there He then removed the charge and then stated he would need to hold 30 for incidentals I did not have any issues with that
When I woke up the next morning I found the standard bill under my door with a charge of 25 for accommodations plus taxes When I went to check out later that morning the desk clerk said she did not know anything about reward points or priority club membersyet they have a section of the front desk roped off for priority club members Go figure
The front desk manager Anna came up and checked my account She said my reservation did not reflect my reward night I said to her the written confirmation is in the file she grabbed it and looked at it  I told her the night manager told the night clerk it was in the system and pointed it out to the night clerk 
Anna snapped at me and in a very unprofessional manner and condescending attitude said it was not in the system I asked her If it was not in the system how did I have a printed confirmation from their website and the night manager pointed out the system reservation to the night clerk She give me this dirty look and said she would manually add it and remove the 25 accommodation charge
During this whole exchange I was calm polite and professional I decided at this point I would never stay at this hotel again I am a corporate training manager with Lockheed Martin and me and my staff 65 trainers live in hotels around the country on a weekly basis I have also earned 100s of thousands of reward points for this hotel and others As a priority club member I was surprised to be treated in such a matter
I was placed in a very small room that faced the parking lot The room and bathroom was extremely small Thankfully the room was clean As usual the Crowne Plaza beds were comfortable
Overall the stay was ok but the attitude of the staff and in particular Anna left a lot to be desired My group and I will never use this hotel again

title: Nothing Special but No Complaints
text: Stayed in this hotel for two nights on business Check in was fast and simple Room was clean and well appointed but not very pleasing to the eye Room could use some updating The refrigerator was an antique but it worked fine The TV was the best aspect of the room The location is very convenient to the Houston medical campus about a 5 minute walk Overall pleased with my stay

title: romantic and cozy
text: We stayed at The Mansfield on a short vacation to the city Loved the champagne reception on our arrival and chatting with the young witty staff Found our room to be tiny with a view of a brick wall but enjoyed the down comforter and modern bathroom Fell down the slippery marble staircase should probably take the available elevator if you dont want to go for a slide

title: You must stay there
text:
I have just returned home and I cant wait to share my good time in Union Square Hotel It was my last destination in 
San fran of my around the world trip Budget accommation must be my target as money shouldnt have left much Price of 
union was relatively cheaper than in Sydney three stars hotel I am working in three stars hotel so I am quite informative in prices and quality  With the cheap price offered i would not expect much more than a bed for a good sleep Suprisingly it is much higher than my expectation
 i was checked in a room in the central of the whole building 
It was quite spacious with a lounge and bed area on different sides of the room A welcom kit has all sort fo needs which i reckon not many hotels would provide Housekeeping and all staffs are very professional room was cleaned thorughfully and flawlessly exspecially in toliet  Awesome location makes your time saved coffee and tea provided every morning from 7am to 10am micro wave to reheat food and ice machine is also ava Check out time is at 12pm and i requested a late co till 1 pm The best moment was when i got my bill it was only less than 85 US per night incl tax what a great value for money
 The only downside is noise noise in room facing powell st  cable car rail is unavoidable you should request a better room when you book will definilty stay there next time

title: Not what I hoped
text: The hotel was hard to find especially at night  you have to go down a oneway alley to it and its not very well marked so its easy to drive right by When I finally arrived there was no parking lot or parking garage a lot of noparking signs and there were many questionable looking vagrant characters standing in the street  didnt feel too safe Off to a bad start The hotel was in ok shape not great  spots on the carpet dingy paint etc The walls were thin  could hear people talking upstairs and in adjacent rooms  so I slept with the tv on low to keep other sounds less distracting There is no thermostat in the rooms  only a baseboard heat system that didnt seem to work and a ceiling fan Two light bulbs out in the room No outlet plug close to the bed Turns out there are a lot of homeless people who live outside the hotel and you have to pay to park a block away This is lower priced than most hotels in the area but its nowhere near the quality I expected The positive reviews I read on the internet before I booked are very suspect whether they were genuine  Dont know how anyone could call this place a great place Put it this way If I had had my kids or wife with me I would forfeited the reservation deposit and stayed elsewhere

title: Had a nice stay
text:
The thing that stands out at the Hilton University Place is the staff My contact with this property began with an email to John Noonan who booked our rooms Although John had been out of town my email was returned within an hour Instantly it was as if I was dealing with an old friend Throughout our stay to a man the staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything that we wanted
I booked two rooms on the exectuive level for the Jimmy Buffett concert Upon arrival we found both rooms to be nice and clean I requested that the rooms be close but not too close The assigned rooms were separated by three rooms Perfect Both rooms had a nice view and were equiped with a microwave oven but no refrigerator Although not a big deal a refrigerator would be a nice addition
We used the executive level lounge for breakfast The food was nice and consisted of bacon eggs fruit cereals oatmeal yogurt and assorted breads and pastries There are only a few tables so when it is crowded you may have to wait if you want to sit to eat
Overall I had a very pleasant experience at the Hilton and would stay there again

title: Nice hotel but limited food services and no meaningful room amenities
text: Friendly staff clean room and great banquet food But with only Ruths Chris Steak House on property limited food choices Breakfast price in Ruths were outrageous 18 for coffee juice and oatmeal Would choose mid range motor inn next trip to Seattle

title: Good business hotel with huge rooms
text: This is a pretty good business hotel located in a nice neighborhood on 34th and Lexington The rooms are massive and well equipped Theyre more like a studio with a full kitchena good bathroom and a big work desk I stayed on the 30th Floor and the view is not too bad from up there either Its pretty close to the 33rd street metro station and theres a deli and supermarket just downstairs For the price that i payed it was a pretty good deal

title: Superb in every way
text: The Blackstone has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at period end of story From the extremely comfortable feather beds to excellent customer service to turn down service with chocolates no detail is overlooked at the Blackstone The staff is very friendly and helpful the hotel is as clean as any hotel I have ever stayed in The fitness center is also excellent it has tall windows with panoramic views as far as Lake Michigan and fresh fruit available for the end of your workout The compliments could just go on and on but simply put stay at the Blackstone and you will not be disappointed

title: What a treat
text:
OK first  the LOCATION Right off of Faneuil Hall near the North End Exceptional You are a quick walk to so many things the whole weekend we were there we walked WITH a toddler no cabs one subway ride and one bicycle cart ride definitely recommend The property is very nice our room was a suite and was spacious quiet and very well appointed We were on an upper floor and the views were outstanding
While I dont rate the breakfast high lots of  for very littlequality the evening cocktail hour is fun and the room where they have it it is very comfortable
Lots of extras  they have a very extensive playroom for kids a nice workout facility etc
It would be nice to have the option of room service and some of the other amenities you might expect from a hotel but I guess you dont get from a timeshare Also plan for valet parking and paying for it there isnt any other way to park your car
All of this being said  none of it outweighs the overall experience which was fabulous

title: Great location cool lobby good value
text: First time at the Hudson was in the City by myself and the location was great The rooms are small but for myself that was just fine

title: Great Service
text: Convenient location gorgeous lobby great service We were given a corner room The hotel room is nothing special but the bed was very comfortable and we had a great view of the PennTower

title: Great Hotel but pricey
text: We stayed at the W Hotel Boston June 9th13th Very nice hotel However be aware you will not receive SPG points if you book through priceline Im assuming the other online travel sites as well I didnt have any issues with noise at night like others had written in their reviews But i do agree the lighting was odd along with the see through curtain to the bathroom Overall great hotel but way too pricey

title: make sure your shots are up to date
text:
