In Forty one years of traveling I have learned to try and stay with major chain hotels when in rural areas to insure at least cleanliness NOT SO anymore this place was simply the WORST and dirtiest hotel i have stayed in since I was a kid renting rooms by the hour every aspect of this place is bad from the ill kept front desk staff to the roach burns on the bedspread no kiddingto the crayon drawings on the walls The fact that in BOTH rooms we rented they only made one bed a day was actually funny This is my candidate for the ALL TIME worst corporate owned hotel EVER
A DUMP

title: As always great service
text:
the view was pure Chicago I was there for business and from my arrival until my departure it was what I always know as the Four Seasons service Everyone was friendly and quick to help with whatever I needed
Thanks Four Seasons

title: Great downtown location and stays are very comfortable
text: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times and remain impressed with the staff and service Although the breakfast line can be long the wait isnt long the managers reception is fantastic after a long day of meetings shopping or sightseeing The rooms are spacious and comfortable I will return again and again

title: Magnificent Lobby Area Unusually Good Service
text: The most striking feature of this hotel is a magnificent lobby It in general maintains the quality that is typical of Hyatt properties The room was comfortable and well appointed but some of the furniture showed signs of wear The staff were unusually helpful and friendly throughout my four night stay

title: great location
text: Great location Girlfriend weadjoining suites Nice size living room area in suiteclean good showers lot of towelsempty refrig microwave hair dryer drapes make rooms really dark Entire staff was extremely friendly  helplful Walking distance to Water Tower Place the bean restauants Includes full buffet breakfast hotcold foods with lots of seating also manager reception in evening Nice lobby Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND

title: Good enough for an overnight stay
text:
The check in was a little slow but firmly and helpful staff Concierge got NE a discount in a cab to town and gave me a coupon for reduced cover charge at Kinston Mines blues club
Smoking room was smelly more so than most
Breakfast was good but pricey

title: Great NY hotel in great location with great staff
text: We booked this hotel for a 1 week family vacation in New York which turned out to be nearly a 3 week stay as a result of air travel cancellations caused by the volcanic eruption in Iceland The hotel was fantastic with spacious and comfortable roomssuites and was in a very convienient midtown locationwalking distance to many attractions and close to the subway for easy access to other areas of NY However it was the welcome and customer service from Robert and his team which really sets this hotel apart from the rest The hotel had to cope with cancellations and delays from many customers but went the extra mile to make sure that standed guests were accommdated and made welcome By week three the hotel was certainly a homefromhome

title: Fantastic Stay
text:
We came to New York for my 50th birthday The hotel was recommended by a friend and we took his word and booked We had a fantastic stay The room was great lovely and clean and we had the view we asked for The bed was so comfy and the choice of pillows is a bonus The staff were very friendly and helpful especially Donald who couldnt do enough for us when asked the same questions he must hear a million times a day
This was a very special trip for me as I have always wanted to visit NYC I would recommend this hotel to anyone We will be back and will stay here again for sure The Barking Dog next door is perfect for breakfast and a nightcap before bed The location of this hotel is spot on in Mid Town a quick walk to the Empire State building We used the subway a lot while we were there and there is a stop just up the road Thank you Affinia Dumont for making our trip a very happy one

title: Nice overnight stay
text: Staff great friendly helpful Hotel just renovated still working on it Priceline deal  76 for the one night stay Hotel did have a contl breakfast but was not included in the priceline price What That was a slite sting to our morning breakfast Also railroad employees coming  going  In  out of the lobbythey have the whole third floor reserved for them But all in all a good stay

title: Comfortable Room Friendly Staff Attentive Service
text: I had an excellent experience at the Hotel Icon The valet greeted us with a warm reception the check in was seemless and the room was very nice and very comfortable We ordered a roll away bed and it came to the room within minutes of checkin We ordered room service which was prepared exactly as requested and received a personal call from the kitchen staff to ensure that the order was correct If you ever have business in Central Houston I would strongly encourage you to stay at the Hotel Icon

title: Great location for convention center
text: We stayed here while attending a conference at the convention center which was right across the street The rooms were clean The staff was very friendly Free breakfast A great variety of restaraunts are within easy walking distance Would stay here again

title: Cold  Impersonal
text:
Stayed three nights on business
First the positives
1 Location Hotel is next to trolley station and close to public transportation Cabs are right outside No need to rentbring a car Easy walking distance to a lot of great restaurants as well
2 View My bayview room had a very nice view of the water Some rooms clearly had spectacular views Others obviously didnt But if you have a water view its special
3 Service The service was generally good No waits or lines even though this very large hotel was hosting a convention However I couldnt escape the plastic smile syndrome Everyone said  did all of the right things but I couldnt get over the feeling that I was nothing but a number among a very large number of people
And now for the negatives
1 Hotel Decor You either love or hate the lobby I agree with the reviewer who described it as 70s modern and cavernous To me it only added to the cold and impersonal qualities of the hotel
2 Rooms Nothing special They are clean but have that somewhat dingynot remodeled look The sink area outside of the bathroom had been redone but they forgot the bath Its tiny and in need of updating You sort of want to get in and out of the tubshower as quickly as possible It really looks like a Motel 6 Amenities are bare minimum and mine werent replaced for 2 days 
Also my room was oddly laid out Sitting in the desk chair you could not see the TV Sitting in the lounge chair you couldnt see the TV You either had to rearrange furniture or sit on the bed to watch TV And some rooms are a LONG way from the elevators
3 Speaking of Elevators    there arent enough and they are tiny If two people with luggage get in the elevator no one else can join them
4 Club Level Dont do it You get continental breakfast which is okay when they are prompt at replenishing food sometime yes sometimes no However there arent nearly enough seats in the lounge As a result one morning people had to eat their breakfast standing up The evening hors dhoeuvres are weak and all service ends at 8 pm Soft drinks are free alcohol will cost you apparently due to CA law 
5 Internet No wired service only wireless for 10 
I know a lot of folks mentioned problems with noise I had none Not sure if this was because I was on a high floor or if the crowd was quieter than usual
Overall I came away with two impressions First they were trying to nickel  dime you to death Water in room is 6 fees in club lounge they serve you coffee and OJ immediately upon being seated at breakfast  before you find out it will set you back 850  taxtip Second it was just another huge hotel and you the guest are just another traveler passing through 
Ive stayed at several other SF hotels and if I came again would stay at one of those rather than return to the Hyatt The experience wasnt terrible it just wasnt terribly good

title: A bit dated in communal areas but nice rooms and in a good location
text: My wife and I enjoyed our stay here The staff were very helpful and courteous We arrived late at night and we stayed in a Junior Suite which was very nice but found we had a leak in the bathroom which was seen to by the staff The carpet in the room as well as the communal areas were a bit dated The bed was nice and we slept well Coming in and going out of the hotel requires you to use 2 separate elevators which was a bit inconvenient All in all a good stay but hotel needs updating in areas

title: Great Family Hotel
text:
We stayed here in June with our 5 and 8 yr old Loved it Staff was great very friendly and helpful with directions to SeaWorld
Loved the free parking and location Short walk to Trolley which takes you all over SanAntonio Breakfast was well above average
In the evening the manager would put out a cheese tray or they would have a popcorn machine All in all a good hotel for a good price

title: Average motel with parking in great location
text:
Weve stayed here many times mainly because it is within walking distance to Castro and possibly the only decent hotel in the area with parking And prices are reasonable for San Fransisco 
Its basically a motel 6 decor Several rooms have been renovated over the past couple of years and are usually clean Showers now have decent restrictedflow heads and the tiny soap dishes are not falling off the wall The cable is Comcast with lots of channels better than a lot of big chain hotels Security has improved with installation of keyactivated doors to enter the stairs which used to be accessible by anyone off the street 
Main irritations all the TVs are old tube type with terrible pictures Many of the small frigs are missing shelf brackets which limits usable space Being right on Market be prepared for sounds trolleys sirens at night 
Many decent restaurants are in easy walking distance Trolley stops are within 121 block which makes it easy to get to downtown and elsewhere Cabs are not expensive and the desk will call for you Typically 30 minutes or so to get to SFO by shuttle If the hotel is full dont count on finding a parking space on your return in the evening Better to take cab or trolley 
If you plan a trip for Gay Pride or one of the street festivals Castro Dore Alley Folsom reserve well in advance 6 months and expect a minimum stay requirement and higher rates

title: The customer service decor location and value of the Element shows why this one is ranked No 1 in Houston
text:
I had a great experience at this Element as I had never stayed at an Element before Upon arrival I was instructed that the room that I was assigned had a maintenance issue They offered a very nice discounted rate and I asked to check it out and declined 
The manager came out and appologized for any inconvenience and I was upgraded to another room without any extra charge I was actually given the discounted rate 
The room very nice with a classy finish to it This would be excellent for an extended stay considering you can cook anything there with a wide variety of appliances The best of course cant be beat being a Westin Heavenly bed 
The stay went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable 
I stayed a day later in July and brought a pet and was given some neat goodies as this is a pet friendly hotel as well 
Rest assured this is in a prime location for business or leisure and I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family

title: Very disappointed
text:
Visited years ago and this visit was very different We remembered an upbeat place with modern hip boutique atmosphere Loved its location decor size rooms This visit the hotel felt as if the place was old and unkept while still trying to be that cool NYC boutique hotel but missed the mark We are a midthirties couple with a child who prefers smaller boutique hotels over your big brands but this time I would have preferred the Marriott
PROSlocation is excellent in the midst of midtown and steps to Rockefeller Center Times Square and Central Park Only other pro is size of roomsvery big and they do have a modern decor a little too much less is more thoughthere is almost nothing that it appeared to be let go not cool 
CONSrun down over the years somewhat dirty they were spraying Lysol everywhere when we arrived and it reaked and roomselevators just felt fine nothing specially attended to no amenities restaurant and room service are closed for some reason and we were never made aware customer service no one greeted us and the reception area was dark and unlit reception had no clue of a room change they just seemed to do their job manager tried bait  switch see below
So we requested early check in and was so graciously given it because they were able to give us a different room that was immediately open and because obviously no one else would have wanted it Being pregnant and with a 4 year old we were very happyuntil we got there The room they so graciously gave us was yes huge BUT it looked like an old efficiency apartment with a new bed thrown in it It was unkept reaked of lysol dirty stained rug had an old disgusting kitchen outdated bathroom and the hallways to get to it looked like rent by the hour rooms If I had never been to the hotel before and not known what the newer floors looked like I would have demanded my money back and went elsewhere We were switched back to our original room and the room was fine but our overall experience left a lot to be desired We got a low rate so I cant complain but would never pay full price or really even go back 
Oh and on a Sunday morning when all 40something floors are trying to leave there were two small working elevators and you had to wait at least 1015 minutes if you could even get in an elevator My husband ended up walking down 9 flights with our suitcase because he had waited 20 minutes and still couldnt hitch an elevator ride All the people who had gone to the lobby to get their complimentary breakfast were stuck waiting forever with coffee and bagels in hand trying to get back to their rooms
My expectations were so good after having been there years ago and its obvious that it has been let go It was fine for one night but if you appreciate the hotel experience this one is lacking We felt like we rented a decent room somewhere not that we had stayed at a comfortable hotel

title: Excellent  if you book a bay view room
text: We had a Bay View room for 4 nights and it was excellent for an extended stay  great room great view I wouldnt have liked to be in one of the other blocks  dark small and rather dreary A few minor elements could have been better  no showercap coffee making facilities but not good for tea paper cups at the price we were paying room crockery should not be disposable no feedback form We were given the option to hold on to our towels for more than one day but this was ignored The Firefly Restaurant and pool area was top class the food good the service mixed Parking at 18 per night was steep and unexpected Where did the managers think we would park our cars Its not an innercity hotel with limited space This was an opportunistic gouge

title: Great hotel
text: Loved this place in spite of it being close to Times Square I tend to prefer less busy parts of the city The staff is great Everyone was helpful The room was a bit small but its NY so thats the norm Use of the NY Sports Club was nice because you get the benefit of a full gym Would definitely stay here again

title: Not a nice as prior trips
text:
Ive stayed at this hotel twice before 2004 and 2006 and wasnt as happy with my recent stay as Ive been in the past 
Although we booked back in Feb we got a room right by an elevator which was disappointing 
The location is really good We were able to walk to Times Square in a few minutes 
The complimentary continental breakfast is lame It is poorly stocked and not all that filling If you like a big breakfast to start your day order from the menu or go out

title: Very comfortable hotel great atmoshere and restaurant
text:
I stay was great I spent some time in the atrium bar and the staff was very hospitable I had room service which was some of the best that I have ever had 
I will definitely stay again my next trip

title: good value very nice stay friendly stuff good location
text:
I stayed there with my boyfriend and another friend in a twin room The room was nice with 2 windows heating television closet to walk in everything was clean and we even had a large sized mirror bathroom was next door 2 on the floor apparently 3 in the aisle on the other site of the elevator and it was never really a problem getting the bathroom sometimes u would have to wait for 5 minutes but really this was NOT A PROBLEM AT all Staff cleaned bathrooms frequently just 2 minutes to the metro direct metro connection to timessquare and all the main spots in the centre the only thing the elevator was quite slow but it was always a challange to see who is quicker elevator or walking and if u dont mind walking its not a problem
Beds were comfortable maybe blankets a little thin so in winther a little cold but i am usually frozen so this might not really mean a lot Tv programms were ok remote control snacks in the lobby to get for little money and coffee for free in the tv common room in the near area many foodplaces and restuarants for very good prices go to broadway and turn right some meters and there is a big take a way place with pizza cake salat paninis sandwiches and so on nice staff there too and so close
Very nice hotel with very nice staff and i will definitely stay there again next time i come to new york

title: Adorable hotel for solo travel in NYC but dont plan an event here
text: The hotels inability to handle a small convening was a nightmare but the hotel was very cute What can I say I thought that I had found the perfect boutique hotel for a clients convening but boutique hotels sometimes come with a price inefficient systems lack of response etc It didnt help that there was a portage fee for each box and the sound person had lunch break scheduled for noon as union members should but the AV company of record for the hotel didnt send in a replacement for that hour Where does that leave a convening Without someone to set up mics for the lunch panel But if you are just hanging out in New York and you are looking for something off the beaten path its a good rather inexpensive alternative

title: Breakfast Chef
text: I hate mornings However when I stay at this hotel and Lassandra greets me at the madetoorder breakfast bar with her wonderful smile and cheerful attitude my day is made Then no matter what I order she creates and serves it with the same attitude and smile Needless to say the food is always delicious Embassy Suites has a gold mine in Lassandra

title: 2nd Time and Still Very Good
text:
We stayed here last year and decided to stay again as we had a good experience We are a family of 2 adults and a 2 year old We like having a separate living room area so we can have our son in another room for a more peaceful nights sleep The rooms are huge and well equipped  the only complaint about the rooms is that the decor is very drab  lots of brown 
The breakfast is great and its nice to find somewhere that includes breakfast in the price There is a great selection including a cooked breakfast and cereals yoghurts breads etc A bigger selection of fruit would have been appreciated but then we were in the minority Most people were eating the fried food and lots of it The managers reception in the evening is also a nice touch 
Check in and out was easy enough and the valet parking was straight forward Yes it is expensive but can anyone tell me where you can find it cheaper in a location like this The location of this hotel is perfect Its right next to Sea Port village and its a few blocks walk to the Gaslamp area We didnt want to be in the middle of it all and staying somewhere a bit quieter was appreciated 
The only real complaint was the booking process I was shopping around to get the best price and phoned up the hotel direct The woman told me that if I booked directly with them they would be able to guarantee a cot for my son whereas if we booked through a 3rd party they could only request it and not guarantee it So we booked direct and then when the email confirmation came through it said a cot had been requested but it wasnt guaranteed When I phoned back I was told that they couldnt guarantee them which is not ideal when youre flying from the UK and cant bring one with you The manager though did sort everything out for us though and upgraded our room by way of an apology so great on customer service We will be back if were in San Diego again

title: Loved it again
text:
Reviews a little late but
My husband  I first stayed at the Amalfi in 806 totally based on reviews I read on this website We were totally WOWED Loved the location the room the Aveda bath products but most of all loved the evening reception  breakfast on our floor
I returned to Chicago with 3 girlfriends in 907 and booked us in a suite at the Amalfi It was great  room was very spacious and my girlfriends were quite pleased Will stay next time Im in Chicago too PS They honor a government rate

title: Fantastic hotel fantastic location cant wait to go again
text:
Just come back from a four night stay The hotel location couldnt be better right in Times Square but very quiet inside Our room was lovely quite small but comfortable Breakfast was lovely and the staff couldnt do enough for you We found because of the hotel location it was ideal to pop back to the hotel to refresh and have a coffee always available in the Lounge area and a pastry or biscuit Also the cheese and wine in the evening was great very friendly atmosphere and a nice way to start your evening out
We couldnt fault this hotel and would definately go again

title: Great location for a fun weekend in NYC
text: Stayed at this hotel with my mom for a long weekend in NYC Great central location for access to downtown Times Square and Central Park The hotel is beautiful and the room was great plenty of space for two people with two beds The lobby bar has a great view of Times Square We paid for a regular room but requested a higher floor and got it You can also request a fridge if you want it

title: Good location reasonable rates
text: We stayed here for 5 nights during April 2012 Paying in advance resulted in a good discount on the room rate The rooms were nicely furnished and spacious The hotel seemed fairly new everything was in good shape The staff was very helpful Breakfast was good but unchanging ie same menu every day No pool but you can use the pool at the nearby Holiday Inn The hotel was literally two blocks from Fishermans Wharf and also two blocks from public transportation cable car trolley and bus The 27 transit pass for a week was a good deal Without the pass a cable car ride is 600 one way so it pays for itself pretty quickly

title: Average works if youre out of the room most of the day
text: Dont accept a room on levels 14 that face the interior of the building Theres no airflow and our room was very warm very uncomfortable The people at the front desk were pleasant except for one woman who was very short with me when I complained about the room The next night we were moved to a suite that had a bed couch and 2 bathrooms It was completely unnecessary and the room with the bed and bathrooms were actually smaller than our previous room I wasnt impressed by the gesture of the suite in some way it felt insulting Other than that the room was clean and nice I was disappointed with area we stayed because the restaurant selection by our hotel was limited and there didnt seem to be much to do

title: Superb value location and service
text: Booked One Washington through hotelscom and had both an excellent rate and complimentary valet parking Enjoyed a spacious suite including a full kitchen internet access etc Staff is extremely helpful Will book it again for next DC travel

title: Very pleasant
text: I thought this place was a pleasant surprise Although I didnt have time to take advantage of any of these nice facilities the pool looked large clean and inviting and there was a hot tub Nice caferestaurant on the premises and very helpful staff and airport shuttle service doesnt begin till 6 am though and ends at 10 pm My bed was extremely comfortable with plenty of nice big pillows and the wifi worked well Good water pressure mini fridge in room but no microwave A very quiet and restful and comfortable place to spend a night or twoId definitely come back here

title: Great for families
text:
This is a great place to stay that is convenient to both downtown or its less than 30 minute drive to schlitterbahn in addition to being near sea world  fiesta Texas The breakfasts are great  the afternoon snacks we have often used as supper which is such a money
saver for families The rooms are always very clean  service is fantastic

title: Our 5th trip to NY and we decided to
text:
Our 5th trip to NY and we decided to escape from Times Square this was the hotel that most matched the facilities of our usual Hotel I found that their website was misleading there was no tea and coffee available 247 in the lobby apart from that minor inconvenience the staff were pleasant the rooms large compared to usual and modern and v clean The area was as expected turn right to Chinatown and left to little Italy and a short stroll to SOHO subway nearby 
Overall an ok trip and glad to have experienced a downtown hotel but sorry we love to be in the hustle and bustle uptown and in walking distance of central park so would probably not stay again but would not dissuade others from visiting this hotel

title: Good location near Anschutz Med Campus
text: Stayed here on business while visiting the UC Denver Anschutz Medical Campus There are one or two closer hotels but this had a much better rate Room was nice and clean and the free breakfast was plentiful and uncrowded It is far from both downtown and the airport and the trains are pretty loud in the middle of the night but would definitely stay here again

title: New hotel  great service
text:
Stayed here on 101510 because we had a 5 AM flight out of JAX airport the following morning 
The good with the hotel being new everything was beautiful and worked perfectly The layout of the hotel and rooms matched prior Hyatt Places Ive been at The room is spacious and includes an Lshaped sofa that converts to a bed a kitchenette with minirefrigerator desk partial wall blocking the bedroom from the sofa area and a massive plasma TV 55 inches The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable The service at the front desk was speedy and friendly Best of all the hotel will let you park your car there and they will shuttle you to the airport as well as pick you up on your return  for NO charge Shuttle leaves every 30 minutes and the hotel is about 5 minutes down the road from the hotel Lastly theres a shopping center 5 minutes away if you need anything for your trip
The bad truly hard to complain about anything regarding this fabulous hotel The only thing I would change is the shower  theres a stationary glass wall rather than a curtain Unfortunately you have to basically walk into the shower to turn it on meaning even if you have lightning fast reflexes youre going to get hit with a second or two of cold water after turning the shower on Not a deal breaker for an otherwise great hotel
No need to post pictures  the hotel and room look exactly as advertised

title: Be very careful what you book
text:
we found a great deal on a night at this hotel when we arrived I found out why T
First off there was no one at the desk and there were around 1520 kids between the ages of 1214 just running around the hotel unsupervised As we waited I walked in the back looking for someone and there was no one around Meanwhile the kids were jumping off the stairs in the front and acting like any junior high kid will when unsupervised They were unbelievably loud After about 10 minutes the desk attendant arrived and apologized saying that she was the only one working that night and she had been called away Thats a little scary I could hardly hear here because the kids were still acting crazy When I asked if we should expect this type o noise level all bight she said what do you mean I said really She said  oh those are just teams Then I said Hey I hauled my kids all over the US with teams for 12 years and have seen nothing like this She then rolled her eyes and went out and said something to the kids who moved down the hallways about 10 feet and continued to be loud and boisterous At that point we just asked where there was another hotel close by that would take us and she called next doo and we moved to another property

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
I didnt know what to expect but I chose this hotel based on the Trip Advisor ratings
The hotel is new and it is evident It feels clean which is a great feeling when you are not sleeping in your own bed
This is what I would consider a cheaper version of Cambria suites It looks like Cambria but finishes and decor are Not as nice
I would definitely recommend it as long as it is new it looks great

title: Beautiful Sheraton
text: This Sheraton Hotel is a convenient choice if youd like to be close to Pier 39 It is beautifully furnishedrenovated just last yearand beautiful through out Quiet elegant hallways very comfortable rooms Weve stayed here a few times usually prefer other hotels in SFdue to area not necessarily the accommodations at this Sheratonwhich are fine We prefer to stay away from Fishermans Wharf and on the occasion that we must stay at FW prefer the area by the Hyde Street Pier as opposed to Pier 39 However this is a beautiful and spacious Sheraton very comfortable with exceptionally professional staff I highly recommend this Sheratonif your preference is proximity to Pier 39

title: Mother Daughter  Girls Trip
text:
My daughter and I just returned from 5 days in NYC celebrating her 30th birthday I have been in NYC previously through work but she had never been We enjoyed ourselves immensely in no small part due to our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Times Square 
The staff were incredible and could not do enough for us We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a corner room so had a great view down the block towards Times Square  great for checking things out but far enough from the madness when you wanted quiet Room was clean and kept that way throughout our stay by great housekeeping staff We got great tips and insider information from the conceirges on staff during our visit We had great times at all of their recommendations whether it be for a restaurant or sightseeing The location was great to catch the Broadway shows we went to and to pick up the subway when we ventured further afield 
I routinely stay at Hilton properties when travelling for work and the Hilton Garden Inn in Times Square outshines is a shining star in the chain I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again when I am back in the city

title: Great Location
text: This hotel was awesome because we drove to Chicago and its right off of the highway I liked that it wasnt downtown but that cabs were cheap and readily available

title: Location Location Location
text: What a find Not minutes but seconds from Times Square and central to many tourist attractions A small hotel with a huge emphasis on customer service From the moment we arrived to the day we left nothing was too much trouble The staff are friendly rooms very clean and the 247 complimentary refreshments extremely welcome when suffering from jet lag I cant recommend this hotel highly enough we enjoyed it so much we stayed twice  once at the start of our holiday and again at the end All staff at the Casablance Hotel deserve high praise indeed they obviously care about the people they look after total strangers who arrive weary after long flights are met with a smile and a helping hand It took me five months of research to find a hotel for our first visit to New York and you did not disappoint thank you

title: If you like bedbugs youll love the Milner Boston MA
text:
After about 20 minutes to get checked in I was given a key to my room I entered the very small room walked into the restroom and was greeted by a small beetle looking bug on the floor I thought no worries just a beetle After a long day it was time for bed The sheets werent the crispiest Id ever seen but this is a twostar hotel When I woke up I saw another beetle crawling across my pillow I contacted the front desk and informed them about the beetles Throughout the day I began itching I noticed red bumps all over my body I thought Oh my God They have bed bugs I complained and the management switched me to another room which I learned the hard way had bed bugs as well 
The bed bugs were one of the many problems at this hotel The hotel is in desparate need of renovation The bathroom tub was extremely grimy This place needs need serious attention It has potential but it is poorly operated

title: Not Very Impressive
text: Quite Simply  this hotel is highly overrated The service as noted by others is lacking I was looking at the Hudson and this Hotel for a three day stay in New York over New Years I chose the Gansevoort for its location in the Meatpacking district and reputation as a fun area to stay The district is entirely commercial during the day and only at night does the area come alive Most of the people coming into the area are coming for the local clubs But if you plan on seeing the rest of the city the location puts you a further cab ride away I reserved the grand deluxe room The room was small but clean and had a modern design The bathrooms were nice for NY standards The view was of the meat packing district and the river However the heater in the room would not turn off call one to the front desk Then the mini bar key was locked with no key call two Then the remote control did not work call three Not exactly what I expected for nearly 700 a night The lobby is small and the rooftop bar is equally small especially when tented during the winter The NY party was packed with very little seating and completely indoors also ran 175 per person just for drinks and a few appetizers For my last day I decided to try the W Tuscany on Park Avenue It had a small lobbybut the rooms were just as nice as the Gansevoort and MUCH bigger for 319 a night Although a more business locationthe hotel was much closer to most of NYCs attractions I also visited the Hudson to see what I missed out on The Hudson still has the Gansevoort beat on style The Library Bar and main Bar are beautiful as is the garden bar Just a much more hip hotel

title: Wonderful service
text: I gotta be honest when I go to DC sometimes I get a little nervous There are some areas that well may not be to safe This wonderful hotel was an oasis We could see many of the historic monuments from out window

title: Great service in a nice hotel
text:
Came for a girls weekend  a nice hotel but we didnt really use much of the amenities of which there are few  no lobby at all but it is attached to the Marriott and LA Live Did walk up to the pool which is beautiful but it was a drizzly day so we didnt get to enjoy it The rooms are pleasant and spacious beds are comfy and i love the TV in the bathroom mirror
The best part of the ritz experience is the service The bellman went out of his way to walk us around and we were always greeted by name And they did mess up with a birthday cake order but more than made up for it by sending up complimentary champagne cookies and cheesecake at 2 in the morning after our night out

title: Classic and Classy
text: Date of Lodging November 911 2012 I wanted to surprise my wife for her birthday with a trip to Philadelphia so that she could take in all the historic sites and great food that the city has to offer I knew nothing about Penns View Inn prior to booking my reservations and knowing that my wife prefers quaint historic bed  breakfast lodging over four and five star any day  I wanted to give this establishment a try Well  I am very pleased to say that not only was my wife surprised but I was very impressed also The staff Antonio  the Manager personally escorted us to our room and you could tell he was very knowledge about the hotel and the surrounding area The room was a small suite on the fifth floor Room 508 It was perfect  from our balcony we could see the river and in the other direction we could see the steeple of Christ Church Dinner in the hotels restaurant was first class  and the room service was quick and courteous When you read this review you have to ask why should I believe this guywellI have stayed in numerous four and five star hotels in many major cities and in Hawaii and even as a Rewards Member of two of the major hotels I have not been this impressed with attention to service and detail Also the different drivers from the limo company that I used daily for our three day getaway all had great things to say about the establishment  and they got nothing for saying it either Nice walk to the historic sites and really great little shops only a few steps away on Market Street Enjoy One little thing extra  when we arrived at the hotel the first night my wife walked into the lobby with a bouquet that I had the driver bring to the airportit was not in a vasewithout askingand this may seem to be a common sense thingthe lady checking us in brought a vase to my wife with a pair of scissorslittle things like that is what I am talking aboutwhen we left the beautiful bouquet was proudly displayed at the hotels front desk

title: Nicely renovated
text:
The rooms at the Blackstone have been nicely renovated The roomsbath are nicely sized and comfortable Front desk staff is friendly and helpful Great place to stay with just a short distance from walking path by lake Food options right near by are limited but hotel catering for meeting was very good 
Lower level room are a bit loud with lots of street EL noise

title: Posh Hotel w free happy hour
text: Nice finish level in this hotel The valet entrance has a blue back lit lighting scheme which was kind of cool We got a suite with a kitchen and sitting room for 218 The bar had a free happy hour when we arrived free beer and wine which was cool Its close to many restaurants and bars but to get to LODO its better to take the free bus

title: Quiet comfortable beds no views free parking
text: Got a cheap rate online of 189 for two queens and free parking which in San Fran can run you up to 50 a night Nice beds good linens dated but quiet great location Nice bar two blocks east great breakfast one block west on Van Ness where you pay for a great eggbacon sandwhich Hotel breakfast was coffee muffins and fruit again free so its worth it if you have kids If you just want a nice bed to sleep in great location and two blocks from cable car go for it Otherwise no view no frills place But the free parking and inout privileges make it worth it Nice folks run the place too

title: Too bad about the noise
text: Good facility even if its 80s avantgarde design is now retro Friendly and responsive service But had to change room at 1 am due to disco noise which the hotel is strangely powerless to stop Also the sky lobby and keyed elevators are a nuisance

title: Great LocationGreat Value
text:
We stayed at the Drury Plaza last week Friday and Saturday night We were able to check in early about noon which was nice The lobby of the historic building is beautiful great historic details
The room was in the San Fernando tower and I was aware based on reviews that it was a bit of a mice maze to get to the rooms in the newer tower But the room was worth it we were on the 12 floor facing the San Fernando church with the riverwalk below us The room was quite large bathroom bedroom and then down a hallway a living room with a bar area small fridge microwave sink etc and a balcony overlooking the church and plaza The room could be used by two couples although there is a frosted window between the bedroom and the living room so not total privacy or a family of four 
The big thing with Drury is the free stuff Free wifi was a plus We hit up the free happy hour once but did not eat there The happy hour was quite busy and there were lots of people treating it as dinner We just had a couple of small cups of draft beer not really worth it to us The free breakfast was better eggs pancakes sausage cereal fruit coffee juice bagels biscuits etc We had breakfast there both days and took coffee to go along with a piece of fruit for later
The location was great right on the riverwalk a short walk to the commercial district on the riverwalk We did not use the pool but the one of the roof has a great view My husband used the gym which he described as basic A couple of times we ended up taking the stairs as the elevators seemed overused 
For the price we paid 140 a night I thought the room location and free stuff was a great deal on a holiday weekend

title: Family Vacation
text: We stayed here during our recent family vacation to Denver It was in a good location easy access to the Interstate and close to the Bronco stadium I felt the room was very nice and clean The free breakfast in the morning was good but typical My daughters felt the beds were uncomfortable but I didnt mind them My only complaints would be the parking is poor Very limited unless you want to park up the hill in a seperate location Also the swimming pool is in the basement Very dismal and spooky as my daughter called it so she chose not to swim which is usually what she looks forward to However I felt the price was reasonable and the decor was new so I wouldnt mind staying here again

title: Dont expect any breakfast unless you wake up early
text:
We stayed in one of the king suites The suite was very very large the decor was modern and the room was very dark It looked like the kitchen hadnt been updated since the 80s but was in good working condition The room wasnt terribly clean and my wife found hairs on the pillows The room reeked of a chemical smell Unfortunately someone who used the room before us had smoked in it My wife is asthmatic and after shortly after we arrived she started wheezing After complaining to the front desk we were transferred to a different room which was much better Unfortunately this room had a loud generator outside the window whirring away but at least nobody had smoked in it 
The buffet breakfast offered in the morning was simply pathetic The buffet runs from 710AM on weekends and we arrived around 9AM It was clearly understaffed and the few people who were working the buffet were unable to keep much of anything stocked despite their best efforts First of all there were no normal size plates available We had to use those little plates meant for toast Cutlery and napkins were a luxury and after a 10 minute wait my wife and I gave up and split the 1 set we were able to obtain The food situation wasnt much better than the dishes and we had to wait a good while to get sausages eggs and potatoes The selection of muffins was never restocked nor was the yogurt bread or oatmeal so I cannot comment on these but what little food we ate was not of good quality 
Parking costs an additional 26 for the valet or 8 per exit if you use self parking There is no pool in the hotel

title: Great Stay
text:
Just stayed at this hotel for a weekend after staying downtown for business and overall had a very good stay My room was pretty big I believe because it was a king size Though my room was facing the train that goes by every 45 minutes or so it did not bother me but do note that there are rooms facing train tracks if that will bother you 
For those not rentingdriving a car the shuttle service to the JFKUMass red line stations was EXCELLENT very reliable came at or close to the times it was supposed to every half hour from the hotel and every half hour from the subway and runs pretty late Most memorable driver was Ike I believe he drives weekdays only very outgoing comedic almost felt like a tour guide Location is also good across the street from major grocery store some other restaurants down Morrissey Blvd and right by the hotel
One minor thing ensure to put your privacy please card in the door or hotel lock on at night or until you leave the room and are ready to have it cleaned The housekeeping staff start their rounds pretty early in my opinion like before 900 am and just start knocking on doors presumably if you do not have the card in your door One housekeeping lady even let herself into my room after not hearing me say just a minute 
Otherwise very nice stay and Id come back

title: Very Pleasant stay at the StRegis Hotel
text:
I stayed in the St Regis for three nights over New Years with my partner Overall I would rate this hotel very highly
It is an old charm type of hotel I found the all the staff to be very polite and helpful especially the concierge who always helped us find the things we were looking for and when I got sick during the visit arranged for the doctor to call me and an appointment with the doctor within 2 hours which was much appreciated
The beds are heavenly so snug and comfy THe bathrooms are a lttle outdated as I have read in the other reviews but they are still nice and have an opulent feel to them they are just a little outdated but the room we had was really lovely
The breakfast room is very charming 
Overall we enjoyed our stay very much and we would certainly go back to the St Regis

title: Loved the Hotel
text:
I got a great rate of 109 on hotelscom so that made our stay even sweeter We checked in got our Arnold Palmers half tea half lemonade with fresh mint and headed up to our room 
Everything was clean and in good working order I loved the bedside lamp that only needed to be touched to work The linens were very nice and the bed comfortable One minor gripe  no free movie channels  not even HBO Our room overlooked the roof and pool area We didnt swim but it looked like people were enjoying theirselves
At the 500 pm wine tasting I tried the sangria It was white rather than the more traditional red and was not sweet at all There was also a hot hors doeurve served Another small gripe is that there is no coffee maker in the room This means you have to dress and head to the lobby before having that first cup of coffee which I would prefer not to do 
Overall it is a lovely hotel The common areas are chic and comfortable The room is fabulous I think anyone would like this hotel

title: Not up to Double Tree standards
text: Have stayed at many Double Tree hotels have always had a suite Was shocked when I entered my room and discovered it was a small single room with a king bed Perhaps I should have looked at the website closer Hotel is very clean everything in the room was in good working order Staff was very always very friendly and helpful check in was a breeze Hotel was very clean Convenient location to the Tufts Medical Center Subway station merely a few steps away from the front door 40 a night for parking valet parking only 1295 a day for wireless internet connection

title: Good Experience
text:
The hotel is in a good location right on Scott Circle NW In the mornings I would walk 510 min to the Farragut North metro station There are eateries and shops along the way In the evenings I would get off at the Dupont Circle station and walk 15 min back to the hotel I always felt safe walking in the neighborhood whether in the daytime or nighttime Its better to take the Farragut North train towards Glenmont in the morning rush hour because a lot of business people get off at Farragut North 
As for the hotel everything was pretty good My room was clean and spacious The bathroom was clean and the shower had good water pressure and temperature I lucked out with a room at the front of the hotel facing the Australian embassy My room had sliding doors that opened up to a balcony railing There was no balcony just the railing The only problems with my room were I had a tough time with the sliding doors Once I opened them I had a trouble closing them And the AC did not kick start right away It made me question myself whether I was programming it correctly Eventually it did start and I didnt have trouble after that
I was surprised the Courtyard did not have its usual breakfast buffet They only had a sitdown restaurant I got the AllAmerican which was pretty standard OJ at 3 seemed a little pricey There are plenty of places in DC to grab breakfast though In the afternoon the front desk offers warm cookies Whats nice is that they are covered so no flies
The library was really nicely decorated and had two computer terminals However I used the free wireless in my room and it worked fine throughout my stay Parking is expensive 28 but cheaper than other hotels If you need to drive there are zipcars across the street on Bataan St NW and an Avis rental nearby on M St NW
The only overall issue I had with the hotel was that the front desk staff could be more outgoing They were friendly when you asked them questions but no one went out of their way to address you I was never greeted They will only talk to you if you talk first The only person that asked if I needed help was the valet He was was in the lobby while I wandered around looking for the bathroom on the first floor

title: Perfect location excellent hotel
text:
We wanted a hotel which wasnt massively expensive but in a great location and this was the perfect answer 
It is located right next to Macys and a short walk from Times Square and obviously right next to the Empire State We also walked to Central Park which did take about an hour and a half but you got to see lots of the city The metro station is a few metres from the hotel so it is very easy to just jump on 
We were on honeymoon and asked for a free upgrade when we arrived and were moved to a queen size room The rooms are snug but very clean and sufficient perfect for us as we hardly spent anytime there 
Breakfast was ok  a buffet of cereal toast pastries and bagels which we were happy with  they only supply plastic plates though I did think it might have been a nicer touch to have crockery 
We didnt eat in the adjoining grill bar but the menu looked ok  we did have a quick drink in the bar There is a nice candle lit bar accross the road from the hotel
Whilst in New York we would recommend visits to The River Cafe which is the most amazing restaurant by Brooklyn Bridge a cafe called Good Enough to Eat which served beautiful home cooked breakfasts and The revolving View Restaurant at the top of the Marriot in Times Square
We would absolutely book this hotel again it was spotless comfortable and in the perfect location

title: Good service and fun atmosphere
text: The hotel was clean had a great bar in the lobby and had a lady at the concierge desk TK Karadzovski who was very helpful TK booked a reservation for one of the best architecture boat tours down the Chicago River for us she gave us good restaurant suggestions and she reserved an Audi car that was being promoted at the time to pick us up and bring us to a wedding we were going to I would definitely stay at this hotel again

title: Mixed Greens
text:
The accomodations at the Sheraton Dallas on Olive are first class all the way My room was exceptionally clean and the opportunity to participate in their Green efforts with a reward was appreciated Their convention facilities are welllaidout and the staff was fairly well organized
Worst Service in the hotel bar Draft was less than stellarwe had to wait quite some time to be served after seating ourselves and the server that did come didnt read us well and engaged us poorly Also while the food was better than average for a great hotel the prices in the restaurant were ridiculously high for the offerings Finally the staff setting up the conference rooms totally misjudged the size of the crowd its possible this was the fault of conference organizers but I dont believe so and it took them three days to get into the swing of having enough seating for participants
Best Clean comfortable rooms well organized registration bell and concierge staff awesome conference facilities More than 5 stars go to Alisa working in the lounge attached to the restaurantshe is the best hostesshotel spokespersonarea tour guide Ive ever had on any business trip Fabulous

title: Good position
text: Very good position the room was clean and comfortable Bed was very large and toilet clean The service was good We left baggage on deposit without any surcharge

title: Great location and great value
text:
Stayed here in January for three nights with friends  had a great stay The rooms had all the expected amenities and were very clean The pool was great and the hotel was a fantastic value compared with nearby hotels As Canadians we always marvel at the chance to buy alcohol in grocery stores and there was one right accross the road
Although the elevators were slow and the rooms fairly small the stay was fantastic and we would all agree that this place should be recommended to anyone

title: Great Stay in Seattle
text: Stayed here for a few nights in May this year Basically loved it The hotel is out of the CBD a bit in a nice suburb with great variety of good value restaurants It is about a casual 10min walk to the Space Needle about 5min to Key Arena To get into the CBD could you always catch the monorail for 2 and save the 30min walk The hotel room was generous well decorated and clean It had a real comfy bed but the bathroom had a noisy exhaust fan which I found kind of annoying even with the door closed The room had a kitchenette complimentary water popcorn and coffee It had a fridge and microwave etc which was great as there is no restaurant or breakfast but there is an awesome supermarket nearby 3min walk with everything prepared at excellent prices There is Starbucks downstairs Free internet access at 2 computers in the foyer The staff should also get a rap they were great  friendly helpful and courteous  cant thank them enough Also dont forget to go to the roof nice views of the city Overall would definitely recommend and would most certainly come back

title: A great location for the Mall attractions
text:
Let me first get something off my chest I like the way the General Manager takes the time to respond to the comments on this forum Im less thrilled that heshe glosses over any negatives but I hope this one grabs the attention and elicits a reply  the parking at your hotel is outrageous To even contemplate charging nearly 50 per night to park shows a contempt to your guests and leaves a nasty taste in the mouth Since so many people here have mentioned it why dont you do something about it
Now after that little rant on to the rest of the review which is overwhelmingly positive My partner parents and myself stayed here for four nights over the July 4th weekend as the eighth and penultimate leg of our 22day Grand East Coast Tour
We booked two king rooms for four nights I found that the prices for this hotel differed widely on many websites so its certainly worth doing a bit of research I was amazed that I ended up paying just GBP63 per night approx 100 through a UK based web site e book ers when the hotels own web site was charging more than double that at the time So do shop around
The rooms were great with a really comfortable huge king bed large flat screen TV chairs coffee table drawers etc Unfortunately no coffee maker or fridge which we would particularly have appreciated and if you end up in rooms 503 and 505 you wont get much of a view to be fair I dont think many rooms would have a view to get excited about
There was a pillow menu in the room which allowed you to choose from six types of pillow if normal feather ones do not suit We ordered two and one was brought up to us within an hour by housekeeping Being British we didnt like to mention the missing one and just smiled politely when it arrived
There was an interesting pool area on the roof deck surrounded by trendy chairs trendy people and a completely bored looking lifeguard Other staff we encountered in the hotel were efficient and polite rather than overly friendly
As many have already said the location of this hotel is great and just a 1015 minute walk from the CapitolMall or to the Union Station area Wanting to see the fireworks on the Mall on the fourth of July and having read horror stories about the crush using the Metro afterwards we really wanted somewhere easily in walking distance This was the perfect solution
We didnt have breakfast in the hotel it wasnt included in our rate and was very expensive otherwise so Johnny Rockets in the food court on the lower floor of Union Station was the best option we found There didnt seem to be many alternatives in the area Neither is the area teeming with restaurants although we had two excellent meals at excellent prices at the Capitol City Brewing Co just opposite Union Station
If you find a good rate at this hotel and want somewhere comfortable and classy within walking distance of the Mall then we very much recommend the Liaison
Finally to end where I started let me say that of course we didnt contemplate parking at the hotel Many others have pointed out that parking at Union Station is a cheaper option Well there is a much closer comparatively priced option on the same block as the hotel just turn first right from New Jersey Avenue onto E Street and its just 50 yards along on your right Its called Colonial Parking It cost 74 for four days cash needed the same price as Union Station and a third of what the hotel would charge It was well staffed and monitored  the staff wanted to see identification on entry and asked how long we were going to be there We felt very safe leaving the car there Thanks to Kim lovenotes who first mentioned this in her review from 11 April 2009  I think its well worth bringing to peoples attention again

title: Worst value for your dollars
text: Here is what you are not getting for their sizzling deal 99night like they call it Poor air conditioning no free internet 999 they have a sign that tells you how to connect but I had to call at the reception to find out about the surcharge no breakfast no newspaper no public phone they used to have one but they took it out for money reason no wine bottle opener it took the lady at the front desk 10 minutes to find one and when she found it she was hesitating on giving it to me saying that people never bring them back ice machine on the 4th floor was broken so I had to go down to 2nd floor The windows in my room wouldnt open 75 cents every time you make a phone call from your room No comment cards at the reception or in the room No paper and pen in the room to take notes My last comment is overcharge for what you get Dont expect much is you go there a tv and a bed and you will be happy then

title: Wonderful time at the Edison
text:
Have just spent 5 wonderful nights at the edison we found the hotel to be clean and comfortable the staff were very friendly and helpful nothing was to much trouble
I admit i was worried about the reviews that had been posted on TA but i have nothing but praise  yes the rooms were a little tired  we had a room on the third floor and it would have been nice to have a coffee maker in the room  but with Starbucks across the road it didnt present to much of a problem 
The location is perfect  Would i stay again YES and hopefully will do so again in July

title: Great Downtown Hotel Service Spectacular
text:
We recently dropped off our daughter at San Jose State University on a Saturday We installed her in her dorm and checked into the Hotel Montgomery which is 34 blocks away We let the hotel know our reasons for staying the night when we confirmed a few days prior Check in was quick and friendly Upon entering our room we discovered a champagne bucket lavender candles vanilla bath salts and a note welcoming us and noting our accomplishment and the staffs good wishes for relaxation
This touch made the bittersweet event more sweet than bitter The staff did a great job making us feel welcome and put us in a celebratory mood
We had drinks in the onsite bar  restaurant Paragon then moved in and had dinner and then back to the room We didnt leave the hotel until we checked out in the morning
Great stay over all The rooms was comfortable the bathroom had a separate shower and a bath so I think they might have even upgraded our room but I cannot be sure
When we visit our daughter over the next four years we will be staying here at the Hotel Montgomery

title: Never AgainHorrible
text: Hotel is old and run down Front desk staff arent friendly or helpful Room rate is supposed to include parking in the adjacent lot but it was full Front desk clerk was unable to assist me on the parking issue so I left a message for the manager He didnt call me back after 24 hours so I left another message Again no call back I cornered him in the lobby the next day He claimed he never received my message When we finally discussed the parking problem he was rude and refused to reimburse me for the cost of parking in the pay lot down the street Stay someplace else

title: Cant beat the Marriott
text: The Marriott in the Fianancial District was the best We really wanted to stay uptown but the rates kept us downtown My first New York experience was staying at the Marriott Marquis but that was when I did not have to foot the bill Prime location especially when you are 19 and single living off of mom and dad was definately needed back then And the Marquis was the best But now travelling with children security cleanliness and budget comes first We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel We were in a great location We could see the World Trade site from the hallway while awaiting the elevator The HUGE discount department store 21 was very near the hotel as were the subway stations It was very easy to catch a cab by the help of the bellman The conceirge helped us with finding Bubbys restaurant in Tribeca And even when it was pouring down rain the front desk gave us nice umbrellas Location is everything and surprisingly the Marriott was the best location to suit our needs We left the hotel early every morning and returned after 10 PM every evening I felt very safe and secure We shopped and dined all day and when it was time to retire it was nice to return to a quiet uncrowded area to unwind We ate the breakfast buffet in the morning a bit pricey at 20 per person children were half price The spread was fantastic though Everything you would ever want from fresh fruit to made to order omelets The fitness center and pool were very nice also The entire hotel was spotless We stayed in the corner room with 2 queen beds and plenty of space to spread outThere was a nice bureau and a desk with a chair and a lounging chair The beds were out of this world comfy The bathroom was full sized and very euro chic And most importantly CLEAN All in all I have not one bad thing to write about the Marriott Financial District

title: Very cool in hot Washington
text: Great hotel great location great city The Four Seasons Washington is a true luxury hotel and is well worth the cost The conceriege were very helpful and helped make our stay very memorable Only slight complaint was that the Olympic opening ceremony wasnt on live not the hotels fault I must add

title: Quality Inn converted to Liaison Hotel Terrible place to stay
text: We stayed at this property for two nights over Thanksgiving weekend When we checked in they had no king size rooms available So we go up to the room and the room had no powerno lights They switched rooms This room had a dirty bathtub It was so disguisting hair all over the tub What 4 star hotel doesnt have a coffee maker The room was very small On top of all this the noise from the other room woke us up at 1am I would definitely not recommend this hotel At check out they didnt even bother to ask how was our stay

title: A Hotel Wed Return To
text:
We prefer the smaller boutique hotels and were not disappointed The nice size room was very bright clean the bed was excellent and it had a lovely view of Michigan Ave and skyscrapers beyond The only drawback was was the small bathroom with no vanity space but this was a small sacrifice for the convenient location and cleanliness of the room The AC was quiet and very efficient as well The location of this historic hotel was convenient to many excellent neighborhood restaurants and cafes off Michigan Ave in addition to being within walking distance to the Millennium Park and other attractions of that nature 
All in all we would definitely return to this hotel for its cleanliness convenient location friendly and helpful staff and reasonable rates

title: The BEST hotel to stay at in Washington DC Excellent customer service
text: My fianc and I stayed at the Comfort Inn in Downtown DC We checked in September 11 2011 and checked out September 17 2011 This was our first time ever visiting Washington DC Our stay at the Comfort Inn was excellent From the first day that my fianc and I checked in we encountered incredible costumer service The staff at the Comfort Inn Kyle The Manager Rachelle and Kevin went over and beyond the call of duty to make sure our stay in Washington was great The hotel was very clean which is very important to me because I am a huge Germaphobe They also had complementally breakfast which was great It included eggs bacon sausage toast cereal and much more It was great waking up every morning and not having to worry about where we were going to eat breakfast They also had fresh coffee ice water with lemon in it and fresh hot chocolate chip cookies in the lobby for the guest The hotel was in the perfect location for everything  We drove from Atlanta GA which is 700 miles away and during our stay there we did not have to drive our car at all They also had free WiFi so you could connect to their internet Their rates per night were very reasonable better than any of the other hotels that I researched The valet parking staff Kevin was very professional and courteous The next time we go back to Washington Dc we will be defiantly staying at the Comfort Inn again I would not stay anywhere else but there I would recommend to ANYONE who is thinking about taking a trip up to Washington Dc to stay at the Comfort Inn in Downtown DC you will not disappointed I guarantee it

title: Many Advantages to Staying at the TC
text: The TC has many positive things going for it It is a beautifully landscaped property The grounds are impeccably maintained and the atmosphere is relaxing It is a great place to stay with kids Multiple pools plenty of casual dining etc I like a good value and I find it at the TC The rooms do show their age but mine was very clean which is all I care about If you are expecting the RitzCarlton you will be disappointed Otherwise you should have no problems Also they do have a golf course Hey at the time the TC was built it was THE premier resort in the areaFinally location  location  location The TC has the best location on Hotel Circle We were in town to see my Cubs play the Padres The Trolley station is directly behind the property so you can get anywhere downtown Seaport Village Petco Park the Gaslamp It is also a short drive from the Zoo and Seaworld Our car never left the TC parking lotIf you have reasonable expectations the TC will probably exceed them It is a very nice place to stay and relax while in San Diego

title: Great Value watch for noise
text:
We stayed a slow weekend in January and got an 80night rate To get a cheap rate look around online for the lowest rate then call the motel directly They will match or beat the best online rate 
This hotel is in a great neighborhood with excellent restaurants and walking distance to Presidio Exploratorium Palace of Fine Arts etc
The hotel was recently furbished and the room we stayed in was clean and spacious Unfortunately our room faced Lombard StHwy 101 and the noise is a big factor La Luna could dampen this noise significantly if they were to seal the door so that it fits better in the door frame This is also a source of cold air We kept the heater on to drone out the noise I recommend not staying in room X01X12 where X is the floor number Ask for room not facing street Another bummer for me was the bed was very soft albeit spacious and new Im used to a firm bed so my back was sore most of the weekend
The front desk help Timothy when we were there was very helpful Good restaurant recommendations and knew where to find things in general
Dont expect much for the light continental breakfast nothing fresh Recommend walking two blocks to Judys cafe on Chestnut St for breakfast they only take cash but good portions of good food

title: Quiet and Safe  whilst in New York
text: We were recommended to stay at The Surrey were glad that we took the advise The Surrey is situated on the east side of Central Park The subway is located a couple of blocks away only a few minutes walk We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of November 11 from the moment we arrived the service was excellent we had no need whatsoever to ask for anything everything was there just the way it should be so for us the room was perfect What is one of the most important things about hotels  the bed well it was perfect as where the various pillow options Well be back in New York in 2012 and we will return

title: Very Nice Historic Hotel
text:
The Best Western at Pioneer Square was a real treat for us staying before and after an Alaskan cruise I made the reservation well in advance and paid for the room rentals in adnvance before cruise and after cruise stays Since the ship arrived back in Seattle very early I contacted the hotel to see if they would store our luggage until our room became available Michael K responded promptly and upon arrival back into Seattle he made arrangements to have our luggage stored until our room was ready The hotel itself is classic history It is centrally located and found that checkin was very smooth and the rooms very well maintained Large room with excellent bath and just the right amount of furniture We felt like we were back in the 50 or 60s The room was spotless and very clean as well as the bath We were placed on the 4th floor for the arrival stay and the 2nd floor for the return cruise stay After checkin on the return stay with in 30 minutes housekeeping was knocking at the door to make sure we were happy with the room and asked if we needed anything or more towels That was Ezekial The rooms offer only a window air conditioner unit for cooling but it served the purpose well The hotel offers a breakfast inclusive of the room rental fee and that was in a separate area of the hotel There were lots of choices just not hot meals except the fresh waffles that the patrons can make themselves There is no restaurant in the hotel but many choices near by We ate at an Asian restaurant right next door to the Hotel Julies Garden small quaint and excellent asian food at such a reasonable price For a drink near the hotel just next door try thePioneer Square Saloon The hotel offers free internet service in their boardroom Their is a printer so you can print your airline boarding passes if you like There is free bus service during the daytime hours which we used with helpful directions from Michael the front desk clerk We used the Seattle Light Rail from the airport for just 250 each way per person saving lots of  vstaxi or shuttle service into Seattle 250 each vs taxi of nearly 45000 each way It was so easy to use Went to the American Idol 2010 Tour at Key Arena the night before the cruise using the free city bus serivce then caught the monorail and light rail back to the hotel after the concert The hotel is just 3 blocks from the light rail station an easy walk Upon arrival back from the cruise we took a taxi from Pier 66 to the hotel for a 600 for 2 people to transport our luggage That afternoon we went to Safeco Field for a ML baseball game Mariners vs Twins and just walked down the street to the ballpark Both Qwest Field Seattle Seahawks and Safeco Field Mariners baseball are within walking distance Also the waterfront and seafood restaurants just blocks away for foot traffic Ate dinner the last night at the CrabPot on the waterfront Alaskan Way which was in our opinion very overrated We enjoyed a free bus ride to Pike Street Market Saturday morning before the ballgame which is really something to see Room price was an average of 20000 per night a bit pricey for us but well worth it in the end considering we saved lots of  for inner city transportation and transportation via taxi shuttle or cruise ship bus to the pier Yes I would recommend the Best Western Pionner Square for either business of leisure visits Lots to do in Seattle and a very friendly city Only concern and negative was the massive amount of homeless and transient people in the city Feel this is a very bad image for the City of Seattle and city fathers should certainly try to clean this problem up 
For an historic hotel close to many venues consider the Best Western Pioneer Square Hotel Friendly staff that is very helpful You will not be disappointed If we ever do another cruise from Seattle we will consider staying here again It was a real treat and a step back in time since it is an historical hotel

title: Fabulous New York Hilton
text: The hotel is ideally located within New York City not to mention a first class property that is very well maintained and very comfortable However what really distinguishes this facility from others in its class is the extremely accommodating staff From early checkin to late checkout and everything in between they were all warm welcoming and eager to please And that they did

title: Great Service
text: My husband took me here for my 40th birthday and it was the extra touches that really made our stay here very memorable We had a few issues and the staff and management couldnt be nicer to make up for it They truly went out of there way to make us feel very important The concierge book us in an amazing french restaurant for my birthday dinner which just topped off the great time we had in New York Thanks to all of the staff for they did the extra special touches made all the difference We truly enjoyed our stay

title: Great surprise Dont judge a hotel by its lobby
text: I typically dont let the boyfriend pick the hotels because I tend to be very picky when it comes to stylecomfort When we arrived at the Colonnade I was a bit scared The lobby was small and I had a feel of a scary old haunted hotel from movies I was already expecting for the worse But when we got to the room I was very surprised It was spacious modernchic and the bed was very comfortable I definitely didnt think that the rooms would be this nice We had a great view from the room windows from floor to cieling and it was a great location

title: We had a great time with our 15month old
text: Well definitely be back Great place nestled among beautiful Hill Country vistas You never need to leave this resort as it has plenty of activities to keep you busy including several restaurants a great selection of swimming pools a room where kids can play and a great spa I didnt play golf on this trip but the green looked beautiful The staff are incredibly helpful and attentive Our room was comfy and cleaned well on a daily basis Shuttle service is available to Six Flags and the local highend mall

title: We loved this hotel
text:
We loved the hotel  great customer service always met with a nice friendly greeting and a smile when we left or came back to the hotel and the concierge David was the best If he didnt know then noone would know  And above all a great rate for a junior suite 
I had orginally asked for a junior suite with a great view however when we arrived it was raining I was cold and wet and had bronchitus and my other half had the flu so we asked if there was anything available right away so we could get out of our wet clothes and have a hot shower We were given a junior suite right away  no great view but in the end that didnt matter
Location
We stayed 10 nights at the Affinia Dumont in late May  early June as we wanted to be in a neighbourhood which had more of a flavour to where real New Yorkers live The hotel is located on East 34th Street between Lexington and 3rd Ave The subway green line is only a block or so away and the good thing about this location is that the station at Union Square is great for changing to other lines Cross town buses were easily picked up  from west to east alight just beyond Park Ave or at 3rd Ave You can also catch a bus to the East River Ferry in 34th Street too so it is quite a handy location
Adjacent to the Affinia Dumont is a restaurant the Barking Dog and a Baskins Robbins ice creamery Theres also a Thai restaurant and a Deli on the corner too Opposite the Affinia Dumont is a Duane Reade pharmacy and market which is handy if you need to top up medications or other items or see a doctor weekdays only
We bought fruit at the street vendor cnr 34th  3rd Ave as his fruit was nicer and cheaper than in the Deli  Duane Reade Nice bread as opposed to plastic wrapped varieties can be bought at any of the Zabars bakeries in grand Central
Along 3rd and Lexington Aves there are many other restaurants and cafes and shops and on some weekends Lexington Ave has a street fair which runs from 34th to about 23rd Street
Around 8 or so blocks north of 34th Street is Grand Central station which is easily walkable from the hotel 
Theres a bank with a couple of ATMs on the corner of 34th and Lexington too  really the location has everything at your fingertips
The room
Our room was a junior suite and had plenty of room and amenities for us It was decorated in dark browns carpet and woods with light grey beiges and light olive green and cream accents We had a double bed and a huge flat screen TV a large desk and a sofa and tub chair Our kitchenette had a full size fridge and stove and washing up facilities too Our room was nicely maintained by housekeeping and always spic and span when we came back from being out and about
If there was one small critiscm there were no cooking utensils such as eg flips and large spoons suitable for stirring a pot etc and only one large bowl which we used to put fruit in However it wasnt a great concern as we ate out most of the time or brought back cooked food from nearby restaurants  delis after all we were on holidays
Laundry facilities
There is a guest laundry in the basement with about 4 machines and dryers as well as a soap dispenser The washing machines take 8 Quarters as do the dryers and the soap powder costs 1
Internet access
Internet access is available throughout hotel and during our stay the cost was 1395 per day I didnt see any nearby cafes apart from one on 28thLexington Ave that actually had a notice that free WiFi was available and I certainly didnt feel like lugging my Notepad around NYC to go to a Burger King just to get free WiFi The way I figured it was that I could pay 1395 for internet access every now and then or go to a cafe and order a couple of coffees which with tip would probably be similar to the cost of access through the hotel

title: Exceptional service and friendly helpfulness with charm and style
