text: The Sleep Inn is one of those Hotels that did not have the look or feel like a chain hotel The rooms were spacious and clean It has an ideal location near Baltimore Convention Centers Camden Yards and the local scenery Not only was this hotel was brand new but the service was also impeccable I was really surprised how well run it was If you want to hang out in Baltimore this has the ideal location for you to experience what Baltimore is really all about

title: Captured Seattle experience
text: We stayed for three nights over the 4th of July We requested a room with a view and we sure got one We had a lovely view of the harbor from the 14th floor Cant say enough about the beauty We had great weather which helped The hotel is convenient to everything The concierge was very helpful and friendly providing maps and good advice We got in late the first night after taking the link from the airport Its only a block and 12 from the stop and it costs under 3  cant beat it Room was lovely Ate at the Elephant and Castle downstairs which has a happy hour from 10pm on Very good very relaxing after a long flight Room was very clean and very quiet Short walk to Pike Public Market which was a great experience you shouldnt miss but we were surprised by the amount of homelesspanhandlers in the area Short walk to monorail Short walk to bus tunnel to Pioneer Square free which we took to the Underground Tour Highly recommend staying here

title: the more you pay the less you get
text:
yes this was a very nice hotel the yard house one of the restaurants connected to the sheraton we found to be exceptionally good and our room was spacious and even had a view of the rockies the downside was we felt that the more we paid the less we got no free wifi no continental breakfast 30 a day just to have your car parked plus this hotel was so enormous you have to go across the street to the other building to use the gym 
not sure if wed be willing to pay so much again but the location is hard to beat you can walk to the capital building downtown shops and restaurants but as long as you dont mind factoring in the cost of the little things that add up this is a hotel worth checking into

title: Getting Dated
text: I stay here once a year   last year I remember a great room this year I got room that needed a renovation Wall paper was pealing in the bathroom the TV was oldstyle with tube you cannot buy these any more and the bathroom was so small that the sink protruded into the tub Be sure ask for a room that has been renovated WiFi was 17 per day unless you select the slow speed for 13

title: Service  attentiveness was terrific
text: Held an annual conference at Paradise Point this year A great property that offered all the features we needed to hold the event and the service from the staff was outstanding Whatever we needed a quick call was all that was needed and it was taken care of Catering was fantastic The property offered an nice tranquil setting which was great for the nonbusiness parts of the event and also featured an excellent array of meeting space that lent itself well to the various types of business meetings and functions that took place

title: Good price bad location
text: While we got a great rate for two adjoining rooms the hotel is isolated from restaurants and commercial areas Good location for visiting the Rodin Museum and parking was free

title: Treated Like Royalty at the Palace
text: My husband and I stayed at the Palace to celebrate our fifth anniversary The location is wonderful because it is a block to Rockefeller Centre and a bit away from the crowded streets of Times Square The service at the Palace is outstanding We had turndown service each night with slippers laid out and chocolate left on our pillows Housekeeping was outstanding and even the water pressure in the shower was strong a complaint I usually have in most hotels I cant wait to return back to New York to stay at the Palace again

title: Reasonably priced rooms and a wonderful staff in a great location
text: This hotel is located between the John Hancock tower and shopping on Michigan Ave and Millineum Park and the Museum campus It is one block from the Chicago river and the boat tours and we were able to see the Trump tower from our room It was very easy to walk or take a short bus ride to any of the attractions we wanted to visit and the hotel was close enough to return to during the day to take a break or drop off purchases The front desk staff was able to give us great advice about how to get places where to eat and where to buy transit passes The room had a small kitchen and a bedroom with a door which was a nice touch although the sleeper sofa was rather small and we were glad only one of the teenagers was with us The hotel also provides free breakfast All this for a very reasonable price for a room in Chicago The only mixup was about parking which I know is always a problem in this area

title: Great restaurant tucked into this beautiful hotel
text:
I stayed at the Town and Country on business all this week  and tonight had the pleasure of eating at one of the restaurants on the premises Trellises The food was delicious but what really made it a memorable experience was the outstanding service provided by our waiter Don and the bartender Craig Both gentlemen went above and beyond to ensure that we had not only great service but also a great time They made us feel so welcome I cant wait to go back on my next trip to San Diego
F Swank

title: Great location but
text:
Location and friendly people are the only things this Days Inn has going for it  If youre going to Memphis for the Graceland experience then this may be the place for you  its a two minute walk to the Graceland facilities Wed booked two nights there  we wouldnt have stayed a third
First impression was that lobby area smelled strongly and unpleasantly of bleach but checkin staff were polite and helpful and there was no problem with our reservation Lobby sofas were quite badly stained
Our room was average size but the door had spillage down the outside and didnt fit very well  looked as if it had been forced at some time Soft furnishings were grubby and stained and you wouldnt want to walk barefoot on the carpet 
Bedlinen was thin old and cheap looking There were stains on the blankets I didnt want to look under the bed  just had the feeling I might not like what I might find Hard surfaces in the bathroom were clean enough but there was mould on the shower curtain Towels were small thin and grey The coffee maker and hairdryer didnt work  a helpful and friendly cleaner got the coffee maker fixed but the haidryer was a dead loss The less said about the free breakfast the better
All the people we dealt with were helpful  we had a problem with the bedside lamp and someone came quickly from Reception with a new lightbulb Overall the place is run down and tacky at the edges and needs a good deep clean and some maintenance 
The famous guitarshaped pool looked clean enough but we didnt try it because the weather was a bit cold
We didnt think it was very good value for money compared to other places we stayed on our trip

title: Great location
text:
This hotel is located just 2 blocks away from times square so we just take a short walk there The room is small but adequate for our family of three and its clean The staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful we got in few hours before checkin time but he managed to get us a clean room shortly after we arrived Thats really cool
The complimentary breakfast was a normal spread but we love the DIY freshlymade waffles My girl and I have fun making a few on our own topping it off with the rainbow loops besides the usual maple syrup and butter Its both pretty and delicious Yummy
Overall its value for money and in great location Definitely stay here again if we are back in new York city again

title: Would not go back
text:
We recently stayed one night at the Days Inn after a trip to SeaWorld This was one of the most economical hotels in the area for that weekend so we booked it The sides of the beds and carpets had stains the bathrooms werent clean really gross actually and we had to go ask for basic items like an ice bucket 
I definitely would not stay again

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff
text: I stayed over NYE with friends and had an amazing time The front desk staff was very knowledgable about the hotel and area and appointed an extremely nice room on the 6th floor The room had a great view and more than enough space The sleeping quality was great as well I will definitely stay here again if I am in Boston and will recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area

title: Beware of low rates
text:
I stayed here in october 2002 having booked over the internet via a reseller and got a really good rate of below 200 dollars 
Check in was great but once I got to my room and tried to settle down for the night I quickly discovered I was above the club in the hotel and was kept awake until 4am
Fortunately the next day I was moved a floor up but this time I was now above the air con unit in the middle of the hotel  noisy still but at least it was constant droning
I spent the rest of my nights there sleeping with ear plugs  not good
Other then the room there were no other negatives  staff very helpful and attentive

title: Disgusting run down with cockroaches
text: I unfortunatly had to stay at this hotel for one night as everything else was booked up or very expensive Im not a hotel snob and have stayed in perfectly nice 2 hotels in the past I paid 180 on lastminutecom for the night which was ridiculous  it wasnt worth 30 I very nearly packed my stuff up and left to find another hotel no matter how much it cost The room was tiny not exactly spotless and I found hair on my pillow I had a terrible nights sleep as it was so unhomely I packed up quickly in the morning oh and my wake up call was 30 mins late and as I was leaving there was another guest saying he wasnt paying for his room as he had found a cockroach and dumped it out on the counter Suffice to say I woudnt recommend staying here under any circumstances  spend a bit more if you have to and stay at a well known hotel or major chain

title: Great hotel
text:
Enjoyed the hotel I stayed with my family over spring break We stayed in a suite so we had plenty of room to spread out The staff was great especially John at the concierge desk 
Room was very clean and hotel was in a good location

title: Good hotel  beware the noise
text: We just stayed 2 nights at this hotel It was so fun being on the waterfront side watching all the activity in the Bay and the cruise shipsbeware rooms 264 and 266 they are over the bar area of the hotel and they have bands on Friday and Saturday nightLOUD does not describe what it does in your room They do stop at midnight but if you are trying to sleep before thatyou wont No cups in the bathrooms for rinsing your mouth or drinking the tap waterview is amazing at night from the loungerestaurantservice in lounge area very slowpretty badBUT I would go back here knowing what to ask for now

title: Great Downtown Hotel
text: Stayed here from Oct 6  10 2011 for a wedding It was within walking distance of the venue saving us a lot of time and parking hassles The location is convenient to the Alamo Rivercenter Mall Majestic Theatre International Center and the Riverwalk Hemisfair Plaza and The Tower of The Americas is a bit more of a hike but doable Valet parking was 23day and the crew was great Never had to wait long for them to bring the car around Room accommodations were excellent The kitchenette was great to have and the bathroom was roomy especially the shower AC functioned almost too well Closet was just a tad small but usable Great view from our room 507 of the SA downtown skyline Could hear just a bit of traffic noise from outside but thats to be expected It didnt disrupt our sleep any Full breakfast in the morning was outstanding Go for the waffles At night to beat the snack cravings we did buy a few items from the little Market thats by the front desk Never used the swimming pool or the fitness center so I cant rate those but Im sure theyre good Other than that I highly recommend this hotel for a stay in downtown San Antonio

title: Service Location and a Wee bit History
text:
This was my 16th trip to the States and this could be my favourite Hotel The Hotel facilities where good Everything where it should be It was the level of service and the little extras that push it up the League After trying for 4 days in DC to find a computer or Internet shop I noticed 3 computers in the lobby one of which was for printing Boarding passes I asked reception how much they cost and was told Free I then asked how long it can be used at one time and was asked why i do not use the room WI FI When told I did not carry a computer an I Pad was provided for my stay 
Add to this Cold water on every landing tea coffee and water in the lobby with dispencers offering nuts chips and Wait for it MMs I Pod docking station in room Microwave and fridge And room srvice available not only from The 5 star Restuarant but 4 local takeaways 
The room was very clean and modern as was the bathroom
This is all organised service but the level of personal sevice was up there to
Oh and location Chestnut Street has everything from Macys to The Liberty Bell and 5 Boys burgers very very walkable 
One little thing a 22 dollar cab to Pats for a Philly Cheesesteak Not worth it get one local
Well done CQ

title: posh hotel great location
text:
I have often stayed at this hotel I really like to central location as well as the property It has an cool vibe to it and the staff has always been so nice and accomodating
Being a frequent guest the hotel staff have become familiar with me and always give me a warm greeting on my return
I usually opt for the studio or loft suite I like the decor of the rooms The one downside is that it is an older hotel and the walls are a bit thin
The hotel restaurant is also very good I really like their bar and it is a very fun spot on the weekends It is full of a lot of the SF locals and a bit upscale
The location is very nice and centrally located to a lot of great shopping in SF

title: An Acceptable Thanksgiving Deal
text:
I spent Thanksgiving weekend in New York for the first time this year My relatives were already booked in more pricey rooms in the Times Square area as well as in a restaurant in the theater district for turkey dinner So I restricted my hotel search to the same areas for convenience Thats why I chose Amsterdam Court on bookingcom based on my main criteria of location price and Trip Advisor reviews
I was assigned a room with a partial view of Broadway nice I was pleased with the location and the price I paid for it alright And the bed was comfortable and room fairly clean in general perfect Unfortunately everything else fell short Space was quite tight and was exacerbated by the odd shape of the room one corner of the room was blocked by the TV and the TV stand It was also poorly lighted and the window AC unit noisy Breakfast and wifi were extra which I did not avail of I was also surprised that bulky TV sets were still used in big city hotels like this one I did not mind my situation too much because I had a packed itinerary and only used the room to come home to at night After a 2night stay however I decided Id look elsewhere next time I come to visit this exciting city

title: Fair but watch out
text: This hotel is fair and again like all Embassy Siutes expect complimentary cooked to order breakfast and evening manager reception The atrium is gorgeous However we were very disappointed in the beddings and service quality My 3 year old son and I came home with bed bug bites on our backs faces necks and legs Due to this reason we decided to check out earlier then expected When I brought this disturbing issue to the front desk the manager gave me a weird look and stated they could have charged us for the additional day because we were originally due to check out tomorrow I could not believe my ears and the unprofessional attitude of this staff member I felt they thought that I was expecting to be comp for the room and felt very insulted Never again will our family stay at this Embassy Suites establishment

title: Nice hotel good location reasonable on the weekends
text: Enjoyed a weekend stay at this location that is well situated near La Jolla Del Mar and the coast The hotel is located off the highway in a small corporate park area The rooms were clean contemporary and comfortable  the staff were gracious and helpful The dining room and breakfast were a bit lackluster as we did not have silverware the buffet was on the lean side coffee running low etc  but nothing huge Overall the hotel provided us with a positive stay  we hope to return

title: Return was not a disappointment
text:
Revisited the hotel a year after our first visitStayed 5 nights and we found the hotel amidst the hustle and bustle of Timed Square a haven of peace and quietApart from one lady on reception we were treated with courtesy and considerationWe checked in very early and though our room was not immediately availableobviouslywe did get a room very shortlyOur room was kept immaculately and the turn down service was good providing clean towelschocolates and complementary bottled water
A very good hotel providing excellent value for moneyLook forward to further visits in the future

title: Great Location Great Price Great Managers
text:
We stayed at the Hollywood Downtowner for our entire week long holiday in LA And had it not been for the location of the hotel we would have had a difficult time getting around No one walks in LA Even the Sunset Strip people drive The hotel was definatly dated and our room had a funky staledamp smell to it but after a couple of days we didnt even notice The area of the hotel is not the greatest of neighborhoods but if you know that going there then its not a surprise 
The managment were very nice and let us check in quite early as our flight got in before noon We had fresh towels every morning and our beds were made up every day The breakfast was pretty simple but the donuts were very tasty 
There is the Metro station under 2 blocks away a Ralphs grocery store and a Starbucks on the corner as well Hollywood Blvds WalkofFame is within walking distance but we didnt like having to walk so far back when the sun set Take the Metro 2 stops and youre in the heart of Hollywood 
For the price and location this hotel is fantastic We didnt use the pool but it was well used while we were there I will for sure be staying there again on my next visit to LA

title: We loved it
text:
We stayed here for a couple of days before heading up to wine country The location is great  very close to a cable car stop lots of restaurant choices in the area and within easy walking distance to Pier 39 
Its hard to beat the eclecticness of a Kimpton hotelI forgot how much I love them And the Kimpton loyalty program includes some unique personal touches that differentiate it from your typical hotel points program
The evening wine hour is a great touch

title: Nice but dont depend on the hotel shuttle service
text: University Inn is clean comfortable  quiet Only drawback was that the shuttle was not running when I needed it despite earlier reassurance from the hotel staff that I could get a shuttle from the light rail stop to the hotel No offer was made to reimburse us for the taxi ride despite my complaints I had to arrange for a taxi in an unfamiliar city and find a sheltered place to wait for it in the pouring rain WiFi for laptop was hard to access so we often had to use the computer available in the lobby instead Other than these negatives the staff was very helpful and friendly and we loved the decor and location Fun shopping and restaurants a couple blocks away Only 2 blocks from the lovely U of Wash campus We were there during the 2week period when the huge cherry trees on campus were in bloom  quite lovely Our trip to the Boeing plant for a tour was a treat too

title: Nice Hotel  Close to Downtown
text: Excellent location to downtown Phoenix Nice Amenities  Great Hospitality

title: In the heart of the action in the Magnificent Mile
text: The Hotel Raffaello is in great location It is close to all the fantastic sites including many great restaurants shopping on the Magnificent Mile the John Hancock Center Lake Michigan the Old Water Tower and the River Boat Cruises various companies This was a good location for us because I was traveling with my Mother She has had ankle replacement surgery so walking long distances was out of the question The staff was very friendly and helpful The weather was very warm over the Memorial Day weekend so I was thankful for the air conditioning in the rooms My only complaint would be that there were no recycling facilities in the room for water bottles newspapers etc

title: Best location excellent service incredible property
text:
The location cant be beat whether in DC for business or pleasure We were just 7 minutes by cab from a meeting near the Capitol a four minute walk from super restaurants and a five minute walk to monuments
Every staff member was welcoming knowledgeable and service focused Our check in and departure was swift and efficient the concierge a wealth of information the bellman quick and remembered me as I came and went
The food enjoyed in Occidental Grill Cafe du Park and room service was fresh and perfectly prepared In each location there were creative choices to satisfy a variety of tastes and dietary needs
Our room was spacious well appointed and pleasantly decorated It was very clean which is a high priority for us The hallways are cheerful and well lit The lobby with State seals on the ceiling and interesting shops took us back to a grander age

title: Clean good value nice location but certainly not perfect
text:
The rooms are clean with new furnishings and the beds are comfortableThe AC works well and the location is convenient The price is also very good for Manhattan So fairly satisfactory for the most part
The problems The showers were occasionally lukewarm The wireless was spotty and kept cutting out no plugin ethernet The doors slam loudly you can tell whenever your neighbours are leaving and the wallpaper is really awful a pastel lime green Minor complaints but worth noting

title: Repeat Customers
text: We have stayed at this Super 8 many times while attending sporting events It is close to the event centers so  if weather allows you can walk It is on the edge of the university area We have always felt safe to walk We have really enjoyed the authentic Mexican food at La Tolteca a block away Hotel staff is helpful and friendly The rooms are clean and quiet with breakfast provided Great value for the money

title: Perfect spot with an amazing view
text:
Just back from a quick trip to Chicago Loved this hotel To begin with they gave me an upgrade and my room on a high floor had an amazing lakefront view ipod dock nice shower great toiletries and was very well equipped It was actually quite lovely
My only complaint was the valet parking was very overpriced But if your visit keeps you within a view miles of the hotel they offer free Accura Car Service so no rental car needed

title: Good experience
text: Stayed here in midJune Reception quick and easy No problem holding luggage on check in and check out days Our room was 1010 on the 10th floor in a corner facing 7th Ave It was very clean and the room looked to have refreshed We had a mix of light and heavy sleepers and we had no problems with noise at all Elevators are fast never had to wait more than a minute for one Watch out for the doors though they are FAST Found the area the hotel is located in very central but not with alot of quaint or memorable places to eat nearby Not the hotels fault Our room was VERY large and the beds were VERY comfortable Wish I could have packed one in my suitcase Overall a good experience and would stay here again if I found a comparable deal as the one that brought me here this time

title: This hotel is amazing
text: The views are incredible and the staff is very attentive Great for families that are traveling The bar is very nice and the staff is on the spot with your drink or food The beds are amazing and super comfy This hotel is also connected to Water Tower Place if you are interested in doing a little shopping Also a great location to Michigan Avenue and the lake front

title: Not as heavenly as Westin should be
text:
I stayed here for work for three nights Upon arriving there was a stain on my heavenly comforter which was promptly taken care of when requested My towels were old and scratchy Overnight dry cleaning did not arrive when I was told and when it finally arrived it was not very clean and had to be sent back for yet another day I have come to expect being taken care of at Westin I felt like I was the one constantly taking care of these issues during my stay
The saving grace is that the location is great Just around the corner from all of the craziness that is Times Square so theres a bit of quiet while still being in the middle of everything

title: Awesome Stay
text: We live in the DFW area My spouse and I along with our four legged child traveled down to San Antonio for the weekend Our experience was awesome This hotel is very nice Wonderful and friendly staff They made us feel right at HOME Oh my gosh it was wonderful The room was extremely clean the beds were very comfy and the breakfast and the 530 kickback were fabulous Cant hardly wait for our NEXT visit

title: Best Hotel in the city
text: Upon arrival you know you are somewhere special Every employee is courteous and knowledgable Rooms are amazing Bed is so comfy and everything is immaculateGreat shower Right within walking distance to everything you can imagine including a Trader Joes across the street Definitely will stay here again the next time I am in town

title: An Outstanding Place for Fun and Rest
text: My sisters mom and myself just spent a beautiful weekend at theWit in Chicago and it was positively the best experience I have ever had with a Hotel The staff is exceptional  from the front desk to the valet to bellhops to the restaurant server  across the board the best hospitality service I have ever come across Not only were the kind and effecient but they were truly Nice and friendly and went out of their way to provide a oneofakind experience The food is also excellent  we ate a delicious breakfast downstairs in State and Lake and had an incredible Italian meal in the upstairs restaurant I heard the Chef had just one some prestigious award for his culinary skills  and it was definitely selfevident Thank you Wit for a memorable weekend

title: A great stay in this timeless hotel
text: Stayed 2 nights prior to our departure from LAX was a little dubious as the price was a third of the cost of other hotels we stayed in the Westin nearby earlier in the trip and that was excellent but you paid for it We found the Travrlodge perfect a convenient location near LAX wIth a Dennys next door for a cheap and cheerful meal If you take the time to read the story of the hotel in the folder in the room you will see what a glorious history the hotel has had Yes there is road and aircraft noise but personally that sends me to sleep there is no elevator but not the end of the world we paid extra for a pool view and it was lovely Free breakfast finishes at 9 which is a little early A special mention for Tony the shuttle bus driver really nice friendly guy an assett to the staff

title: Family fun in California
text: Great experience Friendly staff and beautiful rooms My husband enjoyed the tennis courts and my son loved the in room wireless and video games I layed in the california sun by the lovely pool and enjoyed prompt room service every morning Beds verycomfortable and the double sinks allowed no fighting for bathroom time Free shuttle to Universal very convinent Highly reccomend as a relaxing and fun retreat

title: Worst Experience Ever
text: I found the staff to be horrible  they shouldnt be at a Motel 6 and this place calls itself a 5 star hotel

title: Very Nice Stay
text:
Just returned from a 3 night visit at the Drury Inn  Suites on the Riverwalk Nice and clean hotel I am a very fussy traveler who reads all the reviews and wanted to write a review for once Im not one to overpay for a hotel room I like to get a good deal and stay somewhere nice but I dont like paying alot The prices of the hotels on the Riverwalk are very high This was the best hotel for the money that I could find after hours of shopping My husband and I were very happy with my choice They have a great breakfast happy hour with 3 free drinks each night and soda and popcorn each afternoon included in your rate They also have a pool and hottub for relaxing I was most impressed with the cleaniness of the city after visiting many ciites The hotel has lots of security For me a bit much I do like to feel safe but this was a very nice area 
The location was so convenient on the Riverwalk for walking and going to eat We didnt get a car and walked everywhere The Riverwalk is very close even if youre not a walker We walked up on the streets to the Marketsquare  10 mn walk Tower of the Americas 10 mn The Alamo and the Rivertown Mall Unless you need to leave the city or have a longer visit you do not need a car The cab seemed overpriced 15 min ride for 26 You can take the city bus for 115 but it was annoying with all the stopping Dont expect top shelf for the happy hour still ok though and the breakfast was better than most weve had The staff at the hotel are great Very friendly and helpful
We had a King room facing the River Very nice and comfortable The bathroom area is a bit crowded but no biggy Nice separate sink area

title: Great location for a great city break
text:
My partner mother in law and myself stayed in this hotel in April 2011 for 5 nights
First of all the staff were excellent always friendly and asking how we were and giving advice  also remembering my name the entire visit
The rooms As per many comments were quite small the double bedrooms were smaller than the twin ones as we had two rooms They were very clean and nicely decorated Also as per other comments there was construction work on our floor or was just finishing Throughout our eveningsearly mornings there was a lot of banging and clanging also quite funnily by the end of our trip we got to see the hallway with all lightbulbs and all fittings reattached
All of the above was a slight disappointment as staying in this hotel wasnt the cheapest option however the location made up for most of it Our first morning we walked out of the hotel turned right and then left  in front of us was the empire state building which was very impressive Just around the corner is the subway as well which came in handy
Overall  its NYC so we are biased to say it was a fantastic holiday however we felt the hotel didnt give us the wow factor that the city did

title: Extraordinary value and great style befitting a great old classy city
text: We discovered the KP through a very good 2010 Fodors Guide review liked the descriptions on the hotel web site and reserved a room immediately But the entire experience was much more than we expected particularly the attentive and knowledgeable major domo Bob F Our room was lovely  beautifully decorated comfortable and quiet The amenities were beyond standard like the nicely appointed bathrooms lighted brass magnifying mirror An unexpected bonus for us was finding an outstanding Elks Lodge located IN the hotel wnich we were able to enjoy as members of another Lodge We will definitely return and encourage friends to stay at the KP as well Thanks

title: Friendly front desk clean hotel
text: We stayed here to go to the Ohio State Fair and attend a concert This was a very good choice because of the location It is in a safe part of town and only a few minutes from Crew Stadium and the fairgrounds There are many restaurants and a shopping mall nearby The young men at the front desk are fantastic and really want your stay to be perfect

title: Average hotel high prices
text:
Very average in comparison to all the W brands nice beds and food nothing else decoration is outdated lobby small Not Ws best by far they have a nice bar downstairs a guest came over in the room and smoked a ciggarette we were fined a crazy amount 
all in all decent hotel but doesnt go very far on special look further if you looking for special this place is far from

title: Wonderful stay at 4 Point Sheraton
text:
Spent 4 days at this gem hotel back in July and totally enjoyed the experience To begin with New York hotels are expensive all year around even for a single room especially during the summer months So when I found out this hotel offers a special rate of 140 a night for a nice double room in the middle of Manhattan with free internet included I had to jump on the deal even it is 3 months ahead
Location of the hotel is simply unbeatable  in the heart of Chelsea between 6th  7th Hotel premise is on the quiet W 25th street totally tucked away from the busy traffic So many shops and restaurants around and easy walking distance to subway stations with multiple metro lines E line at 8th23rd St takes you directly to JFK Definitely a good base for NYC trips It is a not a new hotel but 4 Points did a good job of maintaining the interiordecor updated My room was definitely roomy considering this is NYC and you will pay a premium for space and nicely decorated with two twinbeds work station LCD tv and an OK bathroom Couldnt be happier with the space  Hotel does come with a nice bar and a restaurant with outdoor seating which I did not use as NYC is filled with great eateries in every neighborhood so its best to explore the dining options outside Internet as mentioned is included in the rate but there are two free computer downstairs in the lobby for guest use if you dont have a laptop
Many reviews here complained about the front desk staff and service but I did not encounter such problem during my entire stay In fact I considered them pretty ok I guess it all depends on who you ran into Maid service on the other hand could have been a bit better but it did not bother me too much
In all this is an above average hotel from the amenities point of view However for the room space you get  if you find a good rate I must say this hotel provides some very good value I have stayed in a number of other NYC hotels with smaller rooms older facilities mediocre service and significantly higher price before all I can say is this 4 Point Sheraton certainly beats all of them I would definitely return in the future if I can find a special rate again

title: It Served Its Purpose Well
text: My travel coordinator made reservations for me to stay here while attending a seminar and I learned the hotel was undergoing major renovations just before I flew out to San Jose That combined with some of the online reviews I read made me wonder if I needed to cancel and look for another hotel As it turned out the renovation project had very little impact on my stay since most of the time I spent at the hotel was to study prepare for class clean up change and sleep I had a freshly renovated room which was very clean  functional My bed was comfortable and the WiFi access allowed me to stay updated with my local news websites and check email without any issues The breakfast buffet included in my travel package at the restaurant was decent and had a nice variety of fresh fruit in addition to the standard fare of scrambled eggs bacon sausage fried potatoes and French toast The shuttle drivers desk  concierge staff were polite professional and helpful For a business trip it served its purpose well and Id stay there again

title: Shabby chic in NYC
text:
Great location great space great price great people
Handily placed for Central Park and Midtown attractions and with several subway lines within a few minutes walk
The one bed suites are huge plenty big enough for the two of us and our two young children 72 for a week
Terrific value for NYC The 3 breakfast is a steal
Really friendly people  special mention for Al the doorman a font of local knowledge
Decor is a little on the tired side and there is noise from the busy W57th Street  but hey cross the street to Duane Reades and buy some earplugs
Would definitely stay again when in NYC

title: Living up the Hilton name
text: Great location either for business or as a tourist After a long flight from India all that i wanted was a safe and clean place to stay It met the purpose Given that it is right next door to Macys  Empire state you couldnt ask for a bigger room The rooms are very functional concierge desk very helpful And it was right priced i bought about 10 days in advance Cant ask for more in NYC

title: where to stay if your house burns down
text: We were in hotel captivity here for 54 days following the witch creek fire in October 2007 Very passive aggressive hotel if you asked a question about billing you would get a series of reminder calls asking you to extend your stay at 2 AM If that didnt get you they would double your rate saying high inflex of guests even if you had the same rate for 1 month but would send you a gift basket Lots of out side noise too The kitchen staff was very very nice and helpful They provided a pretty good breakfast and allowed pets to stay which was a BIG plus Next time the house goes up in flames think we will stay somewhere else

title: Small but nice
text:
Single rooms in the Chelsea Star hotel are quite small but painted  equipped nicely and very clean
The noise from the 8th avenue is remarkable but hey its the city that never sleeps

title: The good and the bad
text: The staff was courteous The price was reasonable The hotel was reasonably clean We had a few bumps in the road The closet in the room was small and had a broken hinge which made using it pointless We had two phones in the room and neither worked We reported this to the front desk and were told someone would fix the problem No one came to fix the problem during our stay The air conditioning would not cool below 73 degrees but most of our stay it was closer to 80 degrees in the room We reported this to the front desk and maintenance did come and reset the thermostat This did not fix the problem and there was no follow up by maintenance to see if the problem was resolved The front desk staff was polite but upon our check out did not question whether we enjoyed our stay or not The price was good but if I were to stay here again I would definitely insist that the basic room functions work appropriately without question The website indicates that this was a brand new hotel in 2009 but it seemed more like a made over hotel

title: Good value great service and great locale  dated bathroom
text:
We stayed here for an overnight because we got a great rate  under 200 for a Friday night The service was excellent The front desk was nice and very helpful and the bell staff were great 
The hotel is walking distance to almost everything and very near the orange line T at Tufts medical campus Its also only a 10minute walk to Downtown Crossing
The hotel is near the Boston Common theaters Newbury Street Washington Street shopping and Chinatown You can also walk to the North End in about 20 minutes
The rooms are good sized for the city but the bathroom was a bit small and dated  lots of cultured marble and a small toilet BUT everything was very clean
If you are in the market for a good location and a clean and comfortable room Id check this out Its not luxurious but it was a great place for the price We will stay here again

title: Not what I expected from Sheraton
text:
On arrival at this hotel  our room we were surprised  disappointed by the presentation of our room
We were greeted by condoms in a draw food crumbs around the waste bin  a large clump of hair in the bottom of the shower The room obviously hadnt been serviced properly
To be fair on bringing it to the attention of the duty manager we were immediately shifted to a different room

title: Very Charming
text: My family of 6 stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was extremely nice for the money We were greeted by Gretchin who always was perfect to help us with any driving directions or suggestions throughout our stay We were also given sparkling fruit juice upon check in which was very tasty Our room was 106 and had new carpet and was spotless It was also very large which was needed for our 4 teenagers 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms were fantastic It was my daughters graduation trip and they actually had a gift for her ready in the room Very nice I would have given a perfect score but the air conditoner and electricity in the room had problems but they did make sure for the second night we had nice new fans blowing in our rooms which they had to go and purchase and assemble They also mailed a postcard waiting for us when we arrived home thanking us for our stay More than expected is what this hotel does I would definately recommend this hotel for its location size of suites customer service and cleanliness Great Great Hotel

title: Great LocationElevators an issue
text:
The Hotel Allerton is a in a great location you are within footsteps of the Magnificent Mile If you are looking to be in the heart of the city then I would recommend this hotel My room was tiny but I wasnt planning on spending too much time in it Because the hotel is old the elevators are small and I believe that 3 of the elevators were broken That meant that you had to wait 5 minutes for the elevator to arrive and when it did you had to cram into it with other guests It almost became comical Ask about the elevators before you book Breakfast was pricey45 for frittatas and coffee but not bad The prices are typical for hotels in this category There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel that are more economical I did not feel that the hotel and its staff went out of its way to make us comfortable or treat us like valued guests I would not go out of my way to stay here again 
ps the beds were very comfortable

title: Exceeded my expectations
text:
When travelling on business I prefer hotels with kitchen facilities so booked this as it was reasonably close to work I normally consider Residence Inn comfortable but dont particularly look for them over other brands It just so happened this was closest to work with the room facilities I like
I really enjoyed this hotel it is pretty new so feels clean and fresh the staff were very helpful in advising local restaurants and the facilities were excellent Complimentary breakfast was good with a decent selection if a little samey after 2 weeks the gym was reasonable and pool a decent size There is an attached Marriott Courtyard with a bar if you need a beer although the managers reception Mon to Wed has a selection of beers and wine
The WiFi access was free and resonably fast but tended to slow down in the evening  just the numbers accessing it I guess 
Overall this was an excellent hotel at the price not a 5 hotel but 5 for what it gave at the price  recommended

title: Excellent hotel great location value for money
text:
I stayed here with three friends in one room in October 2008 We stayed for 4 nights  we had a room with two large I think Queen beds The room was big enough for the 4 of us and the bathroom was very spacious  clean 
The view was good and the location very handy I have stayed in New York before at the Roosevelt in Madison which was also good see review
The only downside to this hotel is no kettle in the room for us brits wanting Tea  the hotel breakfast is so expensivebut there is a coffee pot in room  so many cheap breakfast places around the corner it doesnt matter We particularly loved the large delicant remeber the name but it had a huge selection  very reasonable
The hotel had out free cookies most days  if you go up to the level with the computers there are free coffeemilk sachets I think the computers were free too so we booked our seats home
The hotel had our private very nice airport taxi booked at 400am for our return flight  were more than halpful during our stay
Overall we loved our stay  the hotel was really rather good

title: Familyoriented hotel than businesstravelers
text:
This is my first time staying at the Embassy Suites in La Jolla It wasnt the first choice nor it was out of faint of the heart However I will admit the loyalty program pays
Most of the business travelers pick their stay based on the location I am no exception However keep in mind that the location of the hotel isnt a tourist hotspot although La Jolla is about 10 miles to the west and the major tourist attractions are down south What surprised me is that there are a lot of families here which translates into lots of kids
Guests aside the hotel is clean modern and very guest friendly Free breakfast 2hour free drink daily what else can you ask
I stayed in the Executive suite Upon checkin I was greeted by if not one of the most friendly staff Ive ever met Prompt service and makes me feel like a valued guest all the way The room is very clean nicely lay out and make me feel like home
Now if you staying here on a weekend or peaktourist periods you will hear kids Door closed or not Some running some screaming but if that bother you or not is up to you
The bedroom on the other hand is like a standard hotel room but upgraded Ceilingtofloor window comfortable bed and sheets However if your room is facing the streets prepare to hearing some car noises Also the AC unit can be loud In my case it actually woke me up when it kicked in However you can always keep it running to combat the outside noise but its louder than comfortable level to sleep soundly if you are a light sleeper
Over all I suggest this hotel to those who wants to get a suite but dont want to pay an arm and a leg for it However some noise problem might be important to those who likes peace and quiet This hotel is more suitable for families than businesstravelers

title: Great location
text: Yes the building is old but that is the charm Great location good service and pool is nice You will get what u paid for

title: Good city hotel
text:
We reserved a regular room at a TravelZoo advertised discount at the hotel website and opted for an upper level room upgrade if one were available upon arrival 9 extra only Im not sure what the other rooms are like but our room on the 32nd floor was huge clean expertly appointed in a sleek modern style and generally fabulous for the price we paid We had a chaise lounge by the window that looked out towards the river and a very large flat screen TV The bathroom had a separate shower and tub and the toiletries were Miller Harris I docked the iPod in one of two different systems in the room and put on some music to celebrate with
Check in and check out via computer were seamless and the ladies behind the desk were helpful and efficient And with lights streaming down onto the floor the checkin counter is striking and fun
The bed was comfortable not heavenly but still great Amenities expected were convenient including ironing board iron and safe The minibar is a fridge so if its not locked you can take stuff out for the night to make room for whateveryour own drinks or meds or a dessert for later Wifi is available for a fee and theres no pool hey its the city and there is a nice spa downstairs if you havent already spent all your money shopping on State St If you have a few minutes try the free dance lessons and yoga sessions on the TV preferably with the curtains open Really When you see the yoga folks dancing around in the desert youll remember this review
Aria the restaurant downstairs is not the best choice especially since you are in a city filled with great places to eat Save yourself the time and money and go to another place more worth it
Walking distance to the northern end of Millennium Park and to Michigan Ave and State St Easy to cross the river and get to the Magnificent Mile Also dogs under 20 lbs allowed with a fee

title: Beautiful suites after renovationbut paperthin walls
text: I stayed at the Staybridge after booking a room through Priceline at 50 per night Room was very clean and quite spacious Nice brunch included in price Friendly staff persons who actually called me at my room to ask me how everything was so far Free highspeed internet My only complaint is that you can hear everything from your adjoining neighbors walls My neighbor had his tv on all night long I called the front desk and they sent security to his room quickly Sure enough I could clearly hear security knock on his door and hear him say hello hello He did turn down the tv for awhile but in about an hr turned it back up In all fairness to Staybridge I am a light sleeper and they did try to get him to quiet down I cant imagine what the noise would have been like if this person had decided to have a party at his room If they added insulation to the walls this would be the perfect place to stay Bring your white noise machine if youre a light sleeper

title: Pretty nice but probably not worth the full price
text: I stayed here for a conference and it was a nice place at the discounted conference rate 125night but the more than 300 that they want as a regular thing would have been much too expensive I was given a room in the old part of the hotel This was both good and bad The bathroom that so many people have complained about was actually quite large larger than the one in my apartment and had an enormous window overlooking the flower garden The room itself was very comfortable The hotel advertises bottled water and a robe in the room and in 5 days I didnt get either A colleague who had a room in the newer part got both of those things but had the tiny bathroom so I guess I probably had the better deal I could get bottled water for 149 a gallon at the market across the street though the refrigerator didnt really keep it cold The old part of the hotel is down a long hall from the main lobby and meeting rooms so I had an extra long walk each day The old part of the building also overlooked the sidewalk where the people protesting the Democratic Rules Committee meeting started shouting and blowing whistles at 830 am and also overlooks as I mentioned the flower garden where it seems that people like to sit and drink and be loud late at night I agree with the people who say that for the price they should provide free internet access in the rooms Rodeway Inn does it in their 40night rooms Surely this place could too As another reviewer mentioned there is a subway stop right outside the hotel but you have to climb a steep hill to get from the subway to the hotel which is kind of a pain when dragging a heavy suitcase after taking a bus and two trains to get there from BWI All the public areas and meeting rooms were far too cold It was only in the low 80s outside We really didnt need Artic air conditioning Dont bother eating at the hotel They are very overpriced and there are lots and lots of restaurants from pizza and sandwiches to Italian Indian Lebaneese Mexican Baskin Robbins Afgan Thai and Chineese within a block and half Dont even think about using room service unless you have money to throw away I looked at the menu and it was possible to spend over 30 on breakfast if you include the tax 4 fee and 22 service charge which if you didnt notice this in the fine print you might give the waiter an additional tip On the whole it was a positive experience and I would probably stay there again for 125night but not for 350night

title: Great spot
text:
This Hotel is in the perfect location to have a great holiday Public transport at the door great food across the road great location
The only bad thing was the lift broke and the door was left open and anyone could of fallen in which could result in injury or death

title: Great Business Meeting Location
text:
I stayed here for a week in February and the place is absolutely fantastic The meeting rooms were emaculate the food served during breaks was also excellent big bowls of raspeberries blueberries and blackberries and the only thing I could pick them up on was that the boiling water was sometimes just hot 
They have a fantastic gym  pool with a basketball court and climbing wall 
I highly recommend

title: Nice Roomsbut
text: The Hotel is not bad the rooms are actually very ncie quite big and comfortable but the service was not adequate at all awe satyed 4 nights and had to change our room after the first night as we santed aking size bed and not 2 queen Eah time we went to the reception for some information the girl wouldnt recognize us The concierge wasnt helpful at all when we asked some adivse for restaurants And parking sapce for one night was SOOOO EXPENSIVE I mean the room is nice only air conditionig was too loud but dont expect too much from concierge and reception and WIFI only at the reception

title: The best hotel I have ever stayed at
text:
Wow What a firstclass place Very charming and modern You really feel like you are in a decent newer hotel in Vegas like Planet Hollywood or TI Everyone was super nice and attentive from the valet to the door menwomen to reception and housekeeping From checkin on it was a wonderful experience They offered to upgrade me to the concierge level in an executive corner suite but I preferred the layout of the Luxury suite so I asked to please keep my original reservation I did not realize that I would have been on the 17th floor instead of the 8th with free breakfast but I liked my Luxury suite 
 We had a corner suite room 801 This room was VERY nice and modern 3 TVs including one in the bathroom mirror 2 bathrooms one with a giant soaking whirlpool tub The only downside of the room is there was no fridge The inroom vending is what your fridge is no room to put your own things in We had to fill our little sink with ice to keep our wine cold
Bed was soft a little too soft But big and the linens were very comfortable I hate scratchy cheap bedding so this was an added perk But all in all the room was exactly what I hoped for an area with a full couch and coffee tables another table with two chairs by the window and a desk with two chairs by the window by the bed We were very impressed and felt the price was worth it FYI they are running a special until the end of the year we got this suite for 150 off of the normal price Email me if you want the code
Casino was bunk Tight slots crowded tables We did enjoy chillin out at the you me drink lounge Had a little luck with video black jack
We also tried the buffet Pallet For those that are not aware this casinohotel is brand new MGM had a temporary casino for years and the only dinning option was the buffet and a small cafe My husband and I loved this buffet It was a little pricey but the food was always topnotch and plentiful Well when they opened the new buffet they lowered the prices a little and the quality of the food as well There did not seem to be as many choices and the food stations are way spreadout The Asian cuisine was the highlight Not much else that I found to be appetizing I think the purposely lowered the prices so people that want to spend a little more will go to one of the expensivo restaurants Bourbon Steak House and Salt Water which the entrees were around 3550 each This is just my conjecture but one FACT is the buffet quality went down from the old casino
Loved this place I will stay here again and eat elsewhere in Detroitmany many other options

title: Fantastic as always
text: Just got back from a weekend at the Palmer House Once again from Rasha and the rest of the crew at the Front Desk to Ernest up at the Executive Lounge our time was superb Kudos to the Palmer House as they consistently exceed our expectations We have been going about 6 times a year for the last 8 years and have always had a wonderful time Clean rooms great food fantastic service and a great location In my book cant be beat

title: Perfectly Situated for Moscone Conventions
text:
The Marquis is the hub for many conventions and has wonderful hustle and bustle in the lobby when a large show is in town The rooms are quiet and easy to get to This hotel is very near BARTMUNI and cable cars and practically connected to the Moscone Center There is a Starbucks in the lobby and a Target Store across the street just opened Movie theaters and restaurants also inside TargetMetreon adding to the excellent locale of this hotel
Tips When a convention is ending for the day the cab line is VERY long you can probably talk to the bellmanconcierge and get a towncar to take you anyplace in San Francisco for 40 bucks

title: A good valueformoney option in a welllocated area
text: In the past Ive stayed nearby at the other expensive Copley Square district hotels Marriott etc but this time I was on vacation with the family in tow and so had to compromise on price It turned out to be a good decision Although the hotel is charmless our two double bedded room was a reasonable size and comfortable The outdoor pool was great for the kids and the location is very near to the Copley Square mall 3minute walk We didnt have breakfast so cannot comment

title: Swanky hotel with great service
text:
Not only is this hotel visually stunning but the staff at the front desk and the door are spectacular I stayed here in August and I wish I would have written names down so I could give them the individual compliments they deserve There is a gentleman at the front desk with glasses that was always very helpful and nice The doormen are all VERY attractive not that it makes a difference just an observation Room service  the food delivered was all very delicious Its expensive but its New York City so I expected it I only have one bad thing to say and that is in regards to the pool attendant She was SO lazy and would stand behind her podium readingstudying most of the time and would even let you know thats what she was up to She had no regard for getting clean towels and two of the days I spent at the pool she ran out of towels There was also a bit of a service issue at the pool even when it was slow
I would totally stay here again I felt at home the whole week and all of my crazy demands were always made with kindness

title: Perfect parking and shuttle to DIA
text: If you need a hotel in Denver for an early morning flight then this is the hotel for you We used the park and fly and were able to leave our car at the hotel instead of using the parking at DIA which was much more expensive Shuttle service to and from the airport was on time and perfect At checkin we were offered fresh cookies hot chili cake yogurt fruit and drinks That was very nice Country Inn also has a library that you can take the books and return them to any other Country Inn when you are done Hands down a perfect hotel to stay at for your 6am flights out of Denver

title: From beginning to end A experience
text: Stayed 4 nights on business and everything was beyond expectations From the front desk assisting me with packages and copiesto the free shuttle to the convention centerto the super clean room and delicious breakfastthe stay was wonderful and Ill definitely be back

title: Great Service Great Location Great Hotel
text:
We had a great five day stay a coupla months ago The service is great rooms well appointed and nice location near Central Park We especially liked the redone outdoor area which is oh so trendy but a lot of fun The people were nice the pool is adequate tough to find a pool in NYC and sauna etc well above average
Seems like a boutique hotel and I have stayed there twice this year and plan a few more stays If you are pinching pennies this is not the place for you with 22 cocktails and 60 parking Ate at Bice and Botega del Vino resturants nearby The restaurant was empty and pricey with just ok food The Salon de Ning bar has some finger foods so a better choiceperfect on a summer night
All in all a great experience

title: Price good on priceline but would not recommend for more than one night
text:
Positive Location It was in the heart of downtown and only a few blocks away from Michigan Ave shops Cleanliness
Negatives Again rooms extremely small  we are talking about really small If you have more than one person staying with you I wouldnt recommend staying more than one night as the cramped quarters gets old very quickly There is hardly any space to put your suitcases especially if you have more than one person in the room Can hardly move around in room 
Hallways and elevators are extremely small Could barely walk two abreast in hallway and rooms are extremely close together and not well insulated Could hear everything going on in hallway and also could hear loud traffic outside window 7 floors down 
Rooms did not have coffee maker People at front desk snooty when we asked if we had king size bed Thought we had reserved room with king sized bed but were told rather snotty that they didnt have any king size bed rooms available 
Would not want to stay here again

title: TRUCK DRIVERS
text: Lots of smokers and Truck Drivers talking about just getting out of Jail etc Deodorant not used here much Thats the greeting upon arrival right out front The rooms are spacious but musty and smelly Very average Ramada I would suggest to management to make a area out back for the Truck Drivers to hang out and talk nasty

title: Warm friendly atmosphere in Century City
text: I went to LA to visit my brotherinlaw who lives in Century City He has such a small apartment that my family couldnt all stay with him so we stayed in this Courtyard Inn It was a very nice property The Bistro is excellent we ate every breakfast there and the service was very good Location is great in that it was on a major street and easy to get to the expressway I found my room to be updated and vry clean I have no complaits

title: Centrally located almost posh hotel
text:
I booked this hotel through Expedia via the 40 option where you dont know the hotel name until after booking 
The hotel is ideally located between Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park home of the bean steps away from the river and next door to the House of Blues I arrived really early in the day and was pleasantly surprised to find my room ready so I was able to check in at 9am As check out was not until noon the following day the central location of the hotel provided a wonderfully central location to walk to all of the Chicago attractions I wanted to visit It is also close enough to the EL that I was able to get myself to and from the airport with my luggage by walking from the transit stop to the hotel luckily weather was on my side and not raining at the time as it was a 10min walk with luggage
The hotel tries to be posh with fancy furniture and decorations The room and bathroom were spacious the bed comfortable and a safe provided in the room However there was no hair dryer free WiFi or information in the rooms about hotel amenities The WiFi issue was a bit of a pain but with the number of Starbucks locations nearby purchasing a coffee for use of the internet once a day was cheaper then the cost at the hotel 
Although this hotel was in a great location I likely would not stay here again There are so many other hotel options in Chicago

title: Marriott Courtyard A Good Choice
text: Very nice hotel and got a great rateTraveled with spouse and extended family with two little ones We had adjoining rooms and were very comfortable Beds a bit firm for my taste and the room a bit stuffy Starbucks in lobby was convenient and courtyard was nice for eating breakfast We parked on the street which was great

title: Great start to the US
text: We stayed at the Handlery Union Square for the first night of our US trip We were given every consideration warmly welcomed and given a quiet room in order to recover from a long plane trip The location was great the service was personal and welcoming and we could not have been happier with our choice of accommodation Thankyou

title: Decent for so close to Times Square
text:
We had a junior suite which was a queen or king with a foldout couch Bathroom was hugh Bubbler bath but bubbler didnt work and a separate shower We had to clal twice to have a refrigerator brought to the room We also had to call to have the room safe opened But other than that we had no problems with the service The elevators 2 are small but again not a big problem 
The one complaint we had was not something the hotel could do anything about We were on the side of the hotel next to a fire station So we got to hear the siren each time they left the station 
Overall we were happy with the hotel and very very happy with the proximity to Times Square theaters restaurants etc

title: Great Location hotel okay
text: We stayed here over the Valentines Weekend 2004 we went with our 7 year old daughter after reading the reviews on here I was dreading it to say the least We arrived at 4pm and we where checked in within 5 mins by very polite staff Our room was on the 8th floor it was dated looking but the room beds and towels were clean We had hot water and a place to sleep As a parent I would not tke my child anywhere unsafe or unclean The location was fantastic the staff were great and the staff in Lindys downstairs were lovely Basically I think you get what you pay for and I would liken it to a travel lodge in England So get on and Enjoy New York yourre not there to stay in your room

title: Very clean and a great staff
text: On a recent business trip to Houston I had the opportunity to stay at Best Western Plus Inns and Suites in downtown Houston The rooms were clean updated and spacious I have been in big name hotels that were not even close to being as nice as the room at Best Western Plus The staff is over the top friendly and customer oriented If you have business in downtown Houston you cant go wrong staying here

title: LOVED The Muse
text: Spent the weekend in NYC with my 2 daughters ages 14 and 10 and we LOVED The Muse The location is awesome We spent time in the Upper East Side midtown Radio City Times Square and The Village Never felt like we traveled far to get anywhere Our room was really nice too Decent space for a New York hotel room and a very nice bathroom And I loved the fact that the comforter was actually wrapped in a sheet so that each guest had a clean comforter cover Everyone was friendly and accomodating as well Well be back soon  and definitely stay here again

title: Great stay
text: Absolutely fabulous Amazing stay All staff we encountered went out of their way to assist us Bellmen front desk clerks everyone was really great The room was great the view was incredible Even left us a complimentary bottle of chardonnay in our room This place is a wonderful place to stay

title: Expensive but worth it
text:
We had a very pleasant stay at the hotel for 5 days We spent the extra money on getting a Times Square view and were given a room on the 42nd floor However due to a family member with fear of heights it took less than 5 minutes from we got to the room until we were offered another room on the 14th floor the hotel was very considerate and helpful with this And in fact being on the lower floors was an advantage now we got to see the Duffy Square and the people on it instead of just looking on the billboards right in front of the window on the 42nd floor
We had a room with two comfortable double beds the room was very spacious and wellequipped with furniture Bathroom was big and in good shape The room was very clean
Only downside was the extremely expensive internetservice And just a headsup if you buy it once they will charge you repeatedly every day without asking for confirmation The staff was however understanding of this problem and removed it from the bill immidiately
The staff was very helpful and the concierges had a lot of good suggestions for more uncommon sights in the city and restaurants The View the bar on the 48th floor is worth a visit

title: Comfortable and Convenient
text: We were in San Diego on a combined business and pleasure trip The location was perfect for both purposes The hotel was very comfortable nicely designed furnished and maintained and had appropriate amenities Staff was helpful We had only one complaint at this level of hotel and pricepoint we found it unacceptable that the hotel charged for internet accesseven in its business center Much lowerend hotels provide free internetwireless access and we certainly would expect more from a higherend hotel

title: Perfect for Service and for Families
text:
First let me preface that I am a Platinum member at Starwood and have stay at many hotels around the world
This hotel by far is probably one of the best hotels I stayed Here are some simple reasons
1 Greeted by EVERY staff member They used the Ritz Carlton approach to say good morning or good evening if within 10 feet of me Nice touch Staff interested in always helping me out
2 Pool One of the only indoor pools WITH an outside deck to view the city This alone is great after a day in NYC
3 Room Very clean and modern Great amenities from soap to shampoo
4 LOCATION I think the video on their website said it best They are the 10 minute hotel 10 minute walk from almost everything in NYC you need to see
To give you some additional information I came here with my family on business and they felt very comfortable I travel to NYC from Boston about once every two weeks to stay for the last 5 years so I know NYC pretty well and would recommend this for business or pleasure

title: Excellence in Chicago
text: My husband and I spent the weekend In Chicago for our Anniversary and stayed at The Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers What an AWESOME place to stay The staff and hotel were exceptional Our room was the most beautiful room I have ever stayed in The food was superb They make you feel like royalty there Also the location was perfect We were close to everything in downtown Chicago It was our first stay in a Sheraton Hotel but it will definitely not be our last This is THE place to stay in downtown Chicago The worst part was having to check out and go home

title: Great location amazingly comfy beds
text:
We stayed at this hotel last Autumn but Ive only just got around to writing a review That should be no slur on the hotel at all its a great place and we got it at a brilliant price through a UK travel agent
Cant comment on the food because we didnt eat there but there are a plethora of diners and restaurants to eat in around and about There is a pretty good Indian place just down the street the food is good but its a bit pricey The Red Flame diner next door is ok I wasnt overly keen but its cheap and easy enough to get to Take a wonder off some of the side streets in and around Times Square and youll find loads of places serving all kinds of food  the fix prix menus are brilliant value
The subway is an easy walk from the hotel in Times Square and you really cant beat this hotel for location As for the hotel itself we found the staff helpful and friendly the room was always clean and tidy and we had no problem with the size of our room or bathroom Yes its not massive but youre in a hotel in a city and its way better than youd get in London or any other European city for the price If I had to say one thing that was slightly annoying there are only 2 lifts so occasionally youd have to wait That said we spent 5 nights here and it was never an issue All in all the Algonquin gets 2 thumbs up from us

title: Quality Hotel and Exceptional Value
text:
stayed one night booking just two days before arriving and had a bill of under 200 What a price for a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location
Location great location just one block off the main streets some women travelers may be concerned but not that bad Cabs were easy to find although my cabbie needed directions to get there
Building with only 9 rooms on each floor you can imagine that this is small but the lobby is nicely appointed the bar cosy Everything is tastefully decorated with little nooks to visit And quiet No sirens or crashing garbage trucks heard from my room Unbelievable difference from my last visit to any big city 
Rooms who says theyre small Ive had smaller rooms at HoJo and Ramada Decorated in ebony wood and dark leather the room is again tastefully decorated a large 46 flatscreen TV is a nice touch I was in the smallest room so the deskdresser wasnt very deep but I could still get some work done after dinner Yes the translucent plastic wall between the room and the washroom could put people off Having the toilet just next to the wall facing into the room doesnt help 
Dont plan on breakfast at the hotel 15 light breakfast through room service could be replaced by walking two  three blocks for some lovely French pastries 
At first I was taken aback by the 10 charge for internet access and no WIFI but then I remembered the price of the room
In the evening there is a wide range of restaurants and bars I was there on Thursday so they were all well populated Do New Yorkers ever go home
All in all a fantastic stay I see why London Times rated the Gild 68 in the top 100 hotels IN THE WORLD note this wasnt top boutique hotels
Definitely planning a trip back

title: Decent hotel  couple of issues
text: Overall this is a very good boutique hotel Staff was great especially concierge Rooms very nice contemporary and I found to be very quiet even though we were on a lower floor They were filming a CBS series at the time which occupied the entire entrance and elevators but was not a nuisance other than that The restaurant below is great and the staff was fantastic My real beef was with the car service It was 15 minutes late and nobody was going to say anything They had a flat and had to bring another car which is not my problem The hotel should be comped that ride and then passed on to the consumer Unacceptable if you are talking about proper service I could have taken a cab or called the service I usually use which is great but kept it simple and used the hotel I wouldnt normally complain but if you pay for service you expect service

title: Highly Recommended
text:
We spent 4 nights in Fitzpatricks Grand Central and were very impressed We arrived early for check in but there was a room available However the receptionist offered us the choice of a bigger room which wouldnt be ready for another hour and gave us vouchers for complimentary drinks in the bar while we waited
The room was gorgeous spotless and spacious enough for two of us and three suitcases The bed which had a canopy overhead was extremely comfortable We had a corner room with two windows which meant we had a view of both 44th and Lexington although there isnt much to see on either Noise was never a problem from the street
The bathroom was supplied with plenty of toiletries and towels and was very clean and new looking As someone who is obsessive about cleanliness I really couldnt fault this hotel The TV had about 50 channels with pay per view movies and internet also available Coffee making facilities iron and ironing board and even an umbrella were all supplied The only problem was the aircon which we couldnt figure out how to adjust so the room got quite cold at times however I never got round to asking about the controls and it really didnt bother us that much
All the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the location is just perfect for visiting the city just minutes from Grand Central Station I would definitely return here and have recommended it highly to everyone I know

title: Mostly very good
text: Our family enjoyed a long weekend in Chicago and a comfortable stay at the Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront  and appreciated being upgraded to a larger corner suite following inquiry upon arrival Like many we seek out Embassy Suites when traveling with the kids as you cant beat the suite rooms free breakfasts managers receptions and atrium space There are 2 Embassy Suites in downtown Chicago very close to each other and I ultimately chose this one based on its 2008 remodel Although nothing that follows spoiled our stay here are my gripes having paid about 200night 1 The bathroom needed maintenance and housekeeping The curved shower curtain rod was so loose that the curtain wouldnt stay closed on either end grout along the top of the tub appeared moldready floor tile never sparkled tub faucet was loose light bulb was out for days toilet paper dispenser placement required you to be a contortionist to access it and the absence of any venting fogged up the entire suite during showers leaving visible moisture everywhere And 2 despite the ES website touting new flatscreens in the living room areas we had an old tube TV 3 we waited over an hour for an extra blanket and pillow to be delivered for the kids sleeping on the pullout sofa 4 our food tray from room service dirty dishes sat out in the hall for 2 days 5 the chlorine was too strong in the tiny pool 6 the bar sink faucet was loose 7 creamer packets for coffee werent always replaced 8 and there were never enough hand towels there are 3 separate inroom sinks Still we rate ES Chicago Downtown Lakefront very good  and a little more attention to the details would have earned it excellent PS Cheers to the hardworking bar staff during the nightly managers reception

title: Great Location
text: My friends and I spent a daynight in Baltimore in October This hotel was fine for us and the location was really good We checked in Sat morning and then walked over to the Galleria at Inner Harbor That was only about a 15 minute walk Spent the day shopping and then walked back towards the hotel and stopped at the Irish BarRestaurant right around the corner from this hotel for happy hour Had dinner at a wine bar right down the street from the hotel and then walked up to Fells Point for a night of drinks Although we didnt spend much time in the room we had no issues and when we did have a room key issue the Front Desk employee didnt hesitiate to walk us to our room to fix it

title: Decent room at a very reasonable rate
text: Clean comfortable basic room at an excellent price Convenient quiet location Good cold breakfast selection PC in the lobby for guest use Adequate car parking but I didnt see parking for larger vehicles

title: This place was 95 with tax Formula One weekend
text: Every other place was either booked or gauging folks thanks you Customer service was good and staff was friendly room was fine love the refrigerator and kitchen utensils etc wifi worked well easy access to the highway twenty minutes to downtown very pleased with the stay

title: All they can do is say Iam sorry But not willing to fix the problem
text:
