Consider yourself very very lucky if you have had anything other than the worst hotel experience of your life here We were there for a week and had 3 rooms in this hotel
The first room was filthy with no air conditioningheating but were not fussy people and knew we werent paying for a 5 star hotel so we gave it a go It would have been ok except that when we got back from a day of sightseeing our room and all the rooms around us were unlocked with doors wide open There were 2 men who looked like they were maintenance people who told us we had to leave our door open so that they could run cables through to the other rooms When we confronted the hotel manager who has a limited grasp of the english language she denied it and said no one had access to the rooms in the hotel We took her up to the room and instead of apologising for the fact that anyone could have walked into our room and taken all our things she just said ok I give you other room
The new room looked a lot better and we were quite happythen we woke up the next day and I looked like I had a disease I had been bitten all over my body more times than I could care to count by either bed bugs or fleas We gave it another night and it only got worse When we went to complain we had to join a queue of people in similar condiotions or people complaining about cockroaches in their bathroom Again all she said was you want another room Uh yes I think we did
So we ended up in the room next door to the first one we had and this one at least had heating but boy was the radiator noisy if it didnt sound like water running it wistled like a boiling kettle I was doped up on anithistamines but my husband got no sleep at all 
We got no apologies or explanations for anything and I must say that the hotel manager seemed all to used to these type of complaints Given the opportunity I would not stay in this hotel again even if it was free
I honestly hope that this has put you off staying here because nothing is worth the experience we had there I only wish I had read the reviews before booking this hotel

title: pre vacation night
text:
great way to star a vacation Ony one issue they forgot the wakeup call Luckily I woke in time and the shuttle had us to the airport in plenty of time
will definately do it again

title: Nice hotel in central San Fran
text:
We stayed for three nights in December and cant fault the place Great location for shopping central to everything and getting transport however we did spend more time out of this area in fishermans wharf bridge area etc
A refrigerator would have been nice
Complimentary coffee and cookies were a nice touch and all staff very helpful

title: Great hotel
text: Very nice hotelconvenient location and nice amenities like spa fitness center etcI was there for a conference so did not see much of the city

title: Wonderful Hotel in the Gas Lamp District
text: I must agree with a few other reviewers it is not five stars The lobby is full of character and charm of a bygone era The rooms are small yet well furnished and with a very nice bathroom If you have a room with a joining door expect to hear every utterance the party next door makes I mean every utterance  The staff was wonderful You can not find a more friendly helpful staff The valet though convenient was very expensive I felt safe walking at night from the hotel into the Gas Lamp district I would stay here again for the right price not 18500 a night

title: Upscale Hotel in Downtown Phoenix
text: We stayed at the Westin for 5 nights surrounding our sons wedding The rooms are very large clean and intelligently arranged We particularly liked having a refrigerator in our room The location is convenient to all downtown venues and is across the street from the light rail for access to Phoenix cultural sites on Central Ave WiFi is available in the lobby but there is an additional charge for room access The fitness center has a great view as you work out and has uptodate equipment My only negative comment is that the valet parking  28day is too expensive especially when you also wind up tipping the valets every time they retrieve your car For the budgetminded the Holiday Inn Express a few blocks away is not as opulent but is clean and convenient and does have free parking and breakfast FYI there is a convenience store in an ASU building 1 block north of the Westin on Central

title: Family gettogether
text: We had a family gettogether and all had a great time We were there from Thursday thru Monday and enjoyed a great buffetstyle breakfast each morning that was included in the room price They could use 1 or 2 more items to the buffet and it would make it fantastic The front desk staff and breakfast assistants were wonderful Parking was plentiful and a very nice pool as well Very centrally located and just minutes to the highway We would definately stay ther again

title: Perfect for families  Great location large rooms free breakfast
text: We paid 8900 a night for a king deluxe suite with a bedroom separated by French doors The den was large with a full size sofa bed The kitchen included a full size fridge a stovetop microwave and a dishwasher Also a washer and dryer are onsite Our first floor room had a 12 bay window in the bedroom and a huge window in the den that both overlooked the beautiful landscaping outside All areas were clean and nicely decorated I35 and other main highways are 1 minute away and downtown is very easliy accessible in 510 minutes The free breakfast was hearty and weeknights include a free dinner Our family of 5 was perfectly comfortable

title: A little expensive but its all about LOCATION The rooms are fine Typical Holiday Inn
text:
A little expensive but its all about LOCATION The rooms are fine Typical Holiday Inn
I mean its right beside the all three stadiums Minutes to the airport and they provide shuttle service tofrom the airport The LoungeResfaurant has good food and is kept clean You may have a bit of a wait when theyre busy

title: Rustic Charm Better Suited to a Rural Inn Rather than a Business Hotel
text: Was looking for a corporate hotel in the Galleria area and defaulted to the Granduca out of curiosity after our cheap corporate travel department took the St Regis off our approved hotel list This is not a hotel for business travelers Perhaps this place would come across as a luxury retreat if it were plopped down in rural Texas Disneystyle as a fauxEuropean country Inn targeted to people who couldnt find Italy on a map But for the global business traveler faced with the torture of having to travel to Houston this place only accentuates the unpleasantness of it all The staff at the front desk tried hard but were defeated by computers that kept freezing The room was highly dated and smelled marginally musty Lighting in the bathroom was awful and the tub was made of fiberglass think cheap American subdivisions Coffee delivered as part of room service was lukewarm Wont stay here again

title: Right in the Middle
text: Nice hotel with good concierge service and great beds good view from the 16th floor however no balconythings to do The duck tour was pretty good Shaws grocery store near by best place to eat The cheesecake factorylarge portionsbig enough to split with someone and not too pricey most things are within walking distance we even walked back from a Redsox gamebe sure to go to  Cheers  I would not recommend renting a car  traffic heavy and parking at the hotel is very high like 40 a day

title: Amazing location
text: This is the ultimate beach location Rooms are clean and the staff is friendly Right on the beach with tons of restaurants and bars Even tatoo shops if your in the mood Price is fair when you take into account of the location Cant wait to go back

title: Very nice staff ok room great locationclean
text:
Just got home from a week in Philadelphia Stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn right next to reading terminal market The market was great for getting fresh foodsalad sandwiches almost anything you would need There is also a WAWA quick market and a CVS Pharmacy nearby that is okay The kmart in the mall near the hotel is awful so dont even bother with that place The hotel is clean and they have a breakfast buffet every morning that is really nice but its kind of expensive they do have a free coffee on the 10th floor every morning and free cookies after 5pm that are freshly baked The repair man and almost all the staff that I seen is always busy trying to make the hotel the best it can be The ladies at the front desk are very informative and one particular clerk Johnaka Ware even personally walked me to the metro to help me find exactly which train to take back to the airport the next day She really went out of her way to help me and we were able to find our train really quick the next day We left our room at 805 and we were on our way to the airport by 825 Zipped right on down there and was at the airport by a little before 9am Cost was 625 each one way I think if you buy your tickets from the window but a dollar more if you buy them on the train We walked to many attractions like independence hallbetsy ross house Philadelphia mintfederal reserveelfreths alleyOld city taverncity hall tower what a great view Eastern state penn museum row the first Post Office which has a really nice courtyard behind it with part of Ben Franklins old home Even a museum coming soonunder construction right now Also Christ Church and the grave sight where Benjamin Franklin is buried We also went to the Aquarium and took the Ferry across the Delaware river which was very short but relaxing Go to the Comcast building to see a neat screen also China town is interesting they have a fortune cookie bakery so I bought some chocolate fortune cookies
 My only complaint is that the exercise room is small and the equipment is nice but well used so they need to keep an eye on upkeep of the machines Just little annoying things like the head phone jack is missing on the bike and one of the treadmills broke down during my last few days and there are tvs on each machine but some dont get all the channels but that is a great feature anyway All in all I enjoyed my time at the Hilton Garden Inn and I would recommend it We took day trips to Atlantic city on Greyhound and New York on bolt bus both were very inexpensive and had a good time

title: Beautiful hotel but the Concierge was very unhelpful and rude
text: We stayed at the W Hotel in San Diego for two nights and had a wonderful trip The hotel itself was beautiful clean and the rooms were spacious The concierge however was extremely unhelpful in providing restaurant recommendations and directions We had three separate experiences where we asked for help and each time we were treated coldly without proper direction When asking for restaurant recommendations we were provided with a few chain recommendations which was not exactly what we were looking for while on vacation I also had to ask in a variety of ways how to get from place to place and again was offered minimal to no help Each person was also extremely unfriendly and actually rude If you do stay at the W you should not rely on any recommendations or help from the concierge

title: Only Airport shuttle TO airport not FROM
text: Airport shuttle is a lie Only to the airport and only at inconvenient times Smells like smoke in a nonsmoking room Bed uncomfortable TV reception fuzzy

title: Loved the film history and ambiance
text: Stayed here for 5 nights back in April Got a great deal for 3 people room was huge 2 lovely comfy beds free internet in the lobby v ery handy found front desk staff on a whole very helpful 1 or 2 grumpy but get that everywhere i think gave me literature on all the filmshows that had been filmed at the hotel and i got great kick out of going through the list of them one of the large function rooms was preparing for a fancy wedding and i peeked in staff in there very welcoming insisted i come in and take pictures which i thought was real nice The swimming pool was small to what i am used to but still clean and acceptable Very close to metro station and a good shopping centre practically around the corner Abolutely loved the hotel lobby and any shows i see on the tv now im checking to see if filmed here

title: Historic hotel with small rooms and understated bathrooms
text:
I booked two rooms at the Westin for me and my girlfriend and my parents The lobby is amazing and the building has a ton of character Very cool public spaces but it is an old hotel and as a result the rooms are small My parents managed to cash in on the upgrade to an oversize room which was very nice My room was small and nothing to write home about If you are looking for a historic building with a ton of charm I say stay here The parking lot doesnt seem that secure for 40 a night and you can probably park in the more secure transit lot across the street for less I think Columbus probably has a lot more luxurious rooms 
Hotel is totally fine for what is doing but one could appreciate its historic character without staying in the rooms

title: Very nice facility and great service by all personnel
text: This is a very nice facility with great amentities The personnel there are very cordial and helpful

title: Good stay at the Marriott
text:
My wife and I age 35 stayed at the Marriott for three nights in October Overall we had a very nice stay 
 The location is terrific near many restaurants and shops 
 The room was nicely appointed standard Marriott The view of the harbor from the terrace was great 
 Bed was the new Marriott type and was very comfortable
 The pool while small for a resort was great
The only issue that folks should be aware of is that the concierge has some deal worked out with some restaurants in the Gas Lamp district We were sent to the same set of restaurants at least twice The restaurants were good not exceptional and we felt like they were not giving their best advice

title: Best Rate great breakfast good room
text: Dont let the address fool you the hotel is on Tyvola Road at Nations Ford Our GPS did not recognize the street address which is actually a named driveway We got our room for less than 60 and it was a nice big room not a suite with a mini frige and microwave The breakfast was great with scrambled eggs sausage bacon waffle station and a good variety of standard fair like cereals and breads and juices Even though the hotel was full the breakfast area was kept clean and fully stocked The only disappointment was the hot tub was out of service We didnt check out the small indoor pool or the small exercise room but they were there The business center had two computers and printers

title: Great hotel and neighborhood
text:
I stayed 3 nights at the Cooper Square now The Standard and this place met all expectations and more First the pros
1 Awesome unobstructed views of Downtown skyline and Brooklyn Booked a Cooper 1 room but called beforehand if it was possible to be upgraded to a higher floor and voila we were placed on a room on the 18th floor with an amazing view 
2 The location surprisingly good I wasnt expecting much from the neighborhood but after briefly walking around I realized it was the perfect location 10 min distance to both Soho and Greenwich Village dozens of trendy bars and restaurants Peels Bianca SaxonParole
2 The Hotel bar was a plus a perfect place to begin and end the night with a perfectly mixed cocktail eclectic selection of beers and really friendly staff
3 Huge bed and high quality linens and pillows
4 Really good minibar especially with alcohol selection 
5 Although I had minimal contact with staff they were always friendly and responsive Checkinout were lightening fast 
Now the cons 
1 Poorly lit hallways and elevators I really would like to understand the person who designed the elevators with its dark and gloomy feel red lights no mirror or musicit simply felt like a dungeon Who would like to start the day like that
2 Due to big minibar there wasnt much room left for a wardrobe and its 3 hangers do you expect a couple to need only 3 hangers
Overall the experience has been overwhelmingly positive the cons being only minor inconveniences I would highly recommend this hotel and Im already looking forward to go back

title: Great location
text:
My husband and I just returned from a four night stay at this hotel So glad that I chose it for the balcony but especially the location It is less than a five minute walk to metro and about 10 to Georgetown
Front desk staff were young but very friendly and pretty effecient We arrived early and were able to check right in our room Room was very nice a queen bed sofa and chair tv table for two and chairs refrig microwavecoffee maker coffee grinder the worksBathroom was also very clean and not small as mentioned in other reviews
Washington Post at your door every morning too
Hotel was a little noisy on the first night but we were so exhausted we didnt hear much
Tried the restaurant downstairs for breakfast but did not have a good experience waiter and cold food Too many other restaurants in Georgetown to choose from so dont waste your time here 
Would definitely stay here again but maybe on the pool side of the hotel as it may be a little less noisy and more private

title: Great value of money and excellent location
text: We booked this hotel via a website and got an incredibly good deal Hotel is not up to Sheraton standard but I think service room and the location are quite goodnot mentioning the value of money The only thing is hotel can be noisy so avoid the room facing the bus station and low floor It can be really noisy if you stay on the low floor and the wall is pretty thin so you can hear your nextdoor very clearly Hotel provides free wireless connection at the lobby so bring your labtop otherwise you end up paying so much for a very very slow internet access at the business centerOverall I do like the hotel and the enjoyed staying at this hotel

title: Nightmare
text:
This hotel is a nightmare No better word to describe it
It is old ugly smelly expensive and very bad service
Above all the rooms are really small the carpets in the halls and in the rooms smells really bad and the bathrooms are terriblesmall old and the water goes very hot and then very cold on its own while your are taking a shower
It is a very loud place too You can hear people talking in the next room and in the halls what can make it difficult to sleep there
If you are in doubt about making a reservation in this hotel dont  You can do better with your money
If you already have a reservation you should definitely try to cancel it  
If this hotel charged 50 dollars per room per night I would perhaps consider staying there again because of its location But the rates are at least 250 and it is way above what would be fare for what they offer you
Avoid this hotel

title: Very good for our first experience
text:
I was in Doubletree Times Square for a vacation with my son We loved the location that was really amazing 
The room was very big with all comforts but it needed some renovation 
I would definitely recommend to a friend of mine

title: Totally recommended
text:
We got a room for a great price through priceline Beforehand I was a bit worried as other reviews were complaining about tiny rooms when booked through priceline so I emailed the hotel and requested a room with two beds And we got a nice spacious top 14th floor room with a view 
The staff was friendly also very kidfriendly and though Im into modern furnishing and design I really enjoyed the historic atmosphere of this hotel
Locationwise this hotel was perfect for exploring Boston everything was in walking distance and if youre not into walking there are two subway stations nearby

title: Good Hotel Great Staff
text:
Stunning location with the best view in Boston The outside terrace is a great place to eat on a pleasant afternoon but we found the portions rather small for the price and filled up on bread although we got a good deal on the room price The views from our large room made a perfect end to our New England road trip and we hauled the sofa around and drank our last beers as we watched variety of working and pleasure craft crisscross the bustling harbour Englishmans spelling and an airship circling in the distance over Fenway Park you can see it on my uploaded photo A magical relaxed evening no need for TV computers or books just bask in the view
When we dropped the rental car off we walked back along the seafront promenade from the rental facility to the hotel which was a beautiful short stroll
The staff were all excellent including a manager who went out of his way to enquire if guests were enjoying their stay but the concierge team were by far the best I have seen in any hotel
If I was being really picky I could point out the cracked tiles in the lift and the weeds along the waterfront not the hotels job I realize but Id get my gardeners to tidy up in front of the hotel if the city wont and my only real criticism of the hotel you have to PAY for WIFI access Even at the cheapest motels WIFI was free and I resented being asked to pay so I didnt Luckily we had those amazing views across one of the prettiest harbours in the world to take our minds off it 
The water taxis across to various points were brilliant and fequent even if youre on a budget do it at least once then use the hotel courtsey bus to the T Bostons subway for other trips across the bay but check with the concierge team on cheapest way
On balance risk the weeds cracked tiles and lack of free WIFI and stay here if you visit Boston

title: Hear and feel the flavor of Venice
text:
I brought my 16 yr old daughter and my 15 yr old nephew for their first visit to Venice We arrived around noon and had no problem getting a parking space Yes it is quite a tight area but very doable Knowing that check in wasnt until 300 we went in to let them know that we were parked in their spots The front desk was very nice and told us that our ocean view room would be ready in about 45 minutes He suggested a place for us to eat and then return to check in 
It was a perfect day so we walked the Boardwalk enjoying the street vendors and by my surprise a few sidewalk shows that were pro a clean life of no drugs or alcohol a nice message for the teenage travelers I had with me By the time we returned it was 330 
Our room was ready and totally added to our trip We had a window that directly overlooked the boardwalk beach and could see the Santa Monica Pier We watched and listened with amusement the people of Venice It was GREAT Before we knew it it was 6pm The kids wanted a snack and there is a little market across from the hotel where I could watch from our room their trip there and back
We walked to the pier about a 25 minute walk before the sun went down We experienced the pier ate dinner and took a taxi back for about seven dollars
They have an all day coffee and hot cocoa machine muffins in the morning and a friendly staff If you are really picky and do not enjoy life to the fullest this place is not for you This hotel is clean yes historic but clean in the perfect location and a great price Enjoy the stay with getting an ocean view room where you can see the ocean even while in bed

title: Rat hole
text: I traveled 400 miles to give my daughter and son n law their first baby shower A VERY special event for us all Upon arriving at this poor excuse for a hotel with a set time to meet the banquet coordinatorunload items for the shower and decorate I was told the banquet coordinator was not available and could not be reached by phone I was also informed that we could not have access to the rooms until later in the day We drove back to my daughters which was an hr drive When we came back that afternoon to get ready for over 100 guest we were told by the manager that the elevator would not work without HER key but she would make herself available at all times to escort our guest to the 4th floor most of our guest had to climb 4 flights of stairs just to enter a room that was so HOT that the 3 tier cake melted and the top layer fell off The temps outside were well over 100 degrees and the humidity was unbearable The room was just as HOT My daughter which is 8 months pregnant nearly fainted from the heat When I complained about the heat in the room I was told to keep the door closed leading into the hall way because there is NO air conditioning in the hall Kind of hard to keep the door closed when you have a 100 guest arriving Do yourself a favor dont waist your money on this place This place should be condemned It is filthy and not fit for animals to stay in

title: Diane Cheek was very prompt and helpful
text: Checkin began with Anza who was very prompt and helpful Then in the morning we had requested water and Diane Cheek was incredibly prompt and had water delivered within a few minutes This is the perfect hotel stay for all of your LAX travels

title: Do not believe negative reviews
text: Me and my partner booked in for 4nights in the Wellington Like most people before traveling i checked trip advisor and was a bit worried about the negative comments We arrived about half 3 and we were given our room straight away My partner had requested a higher level room but we were given a room on the 5th floor Again from reading reviews i was expecting terrible noise but how wrong i was ok the room was an average size and bathroom was small but who cares your in nyc Our room was at the side of the hotel with no noise unless u opened the widow to a little noise from the air con if your looking for a good breakfast go downstairs to the parke cafe or for good Irish breakfast go the Irish bar down the road with good pints of Guinness Judd and frank the concierge were very helpful on return to airport we treated ourselves to private transport organised by the hotel it was 61 including tolls we decided to take this as you are metered in the yellow cabs Overall we had a fantastic stay and as i said dont believe everything u read

title: Prefer other DC hotels but not bad
text: Stayed at this HUGE hotel for a conference and was assigned a room in the older part of the hotel far from everything elseand when I say old I mean colonialera Creaky wood floors peeling paint wornout beds Nevertheless it wasnt the worst place I have stayed I cant comment on the other sections of the hotel but the hotel common areas and amenities were very nice The location was excellent with a metro station a few steps away and great restaurants nearby The National Zoo a few blocks away made for a pleasant visit too Ultimately unless I attend another conference here I would prefer to stay elsewhere instead

title: Great NYC Hotel if you want an authentic city experience
text:
Rooms are very generous in size bedding very confortable As with most NYC hotels street noise can be a bit much so ask for a room as high up as possible and facing Broadway yes Broadway is actually quieter than 77th Street where there is a firehouse
The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful Easy to get cabs and the 1 Red line is a block away and you can be in the theatre district in no time at all Central Park and the Museum of Natural History are an easy walk If you want a hotel in a quiet new yorky neighborhood away from the touristy excess of Times Square look no further then OTA

title: Great Hotel Fantastic Service and Large Rooms
text:
The Sofitel is a great hotel which is close to Time Square but not in all the hustle and bustle 
The service from walking in to the checkin area is very smooth The front desk lady which assisted me was Vivian she was great The room service and house keeping were also great I consider myself high maintenance and called them about four times in the span of three hours and they came up immediately
The room was large for New York standards The room is roughly 360 Sq Ft The bathrooms are all marble and done with great taste The amenities in the bathroom are great there are Qtips nail filer and many other things which women would use 
The room has three phones and a 32 inch flat screen TV which is very nice 
I would NOT recommend eating at the Sofitel the prices are outrageous even for New York I mean 25 for cup of fruit Thats a bit crazy For brunch I would recommend going to Cookshop 44X Hells Kitchen Pastis Cafe Orlin etc 
Right outside of the hotel is a place called DB Bistro Moderne The place is known for 32 burger so if you want to splurge and do something different go there 
There is also a 24 hour Duane Reade Convenience Store  Pharmacy right around the corner from the hotel which has pretty much everything a person in the hotel would want so you always have that option 
The concierge was useless was not able to make any reservations They recommend the touristy spots and was not knowledgeable I had to call AMEX Concierge who got things done I am from the are so I know the places I like

title: Worst hotel in downtown Fort Worth
text: The downtown Fort Worth Courtyard is simply awful I stay in downtown Fort Worth at least once per month and I always try to avoid this hotel but everything else was booked this time The front desk staff is unfriendly and sometimes down right rude For example they refused to call us a cab instead asking us to wait at the curb until one happened by This was very irritating because cabs are not common in downtown Fort Worth The rooms are small old tired and dated The bathrooms look no better than something you would expect in a Motel 6 The only positive is the location but Id almost rather sleep in my car in a parking garage than in a bed in this hotel again

title: What a Great Vibe
text:
My husband and I spent 2 nights November 1819th in a superior queenWhy is everyone so surprised at the small rooms Doesnt anyone google before they go We went expecting small but I asked for a corner unit and they obliged us  2 windows makes a difference If you are getting a Priceline DEAL as we say in kindergarten you get what you get and you dont get upset The breakfast coffee was 400 but it was delicious and served in a large cupWonderful ambiance in the library with the fireplace and New York Times  I loved it So glad this wasnt another cookiecutter hotel we were well received at reception and at baggage storageThe design elements of the room were very well done and if you need drawers and extra hanging space for 2  3 days youve packed way too much Plasma TV was a real treat
Rented bikes just east of hotel and did Central Park Loop 64 miles in 1 hour  Im 65 and I was wearing a skirt What a joy it was We will most definitely return

title: Not even close
text: This is not a 4 star resort Not even close Its squeezed between an Interstate highway and a busy business thoroughfare Roomsuite was good however housekeeping forgot to make up the room one day Golf practice range is a joke with plastic balls due to lack of room Golf course is marginal Gift shopdelipro shopcondo sales all squeezed into one room Main restaurant has very limited menu and quality is just OK Service was good however Savvy vacationers will go northto Scottsdale or Carefree resorts

title: Terrible rooms
text: While the location is very good and the place tried to be hip the rooms are really below what one would expect for a W hotel The room is very small the bed is small the shower is below average the elevator got stuck and the acoustics are poor The hotel staff attempt to make it up by offering Champagne upon check in but I would rather they spend the time upgrading the hotel Avoid if possible

title: Best value in NYC had a great stay Highly recommended
text: My family stayed for 9 nights in a 2bedroom suite The accommodation was faultless with clean bedlinen and abundant fresh towels daily Rooms are a good size with air conditioning and very comfortable beds There was no noise at all and we had good views over the city roofscape towards the Hudson River The hotel is situated in a safe and pleasant neighbourhood with a plethora of excellent restaurants bars fresh fruit markets bakeries bookshops movie theaters etc all close by There is metered parking in the street or plenty of garages to choose from and subway is also nearby The hotel is only 15 minutes by car from Yankee Stadium or Times Square and just a few minutes walk from Central Park and the major museums Front desk staff are especially helpful We have stayed in other hotels in NYC in the past but for location and top value we shall return to the Belleclaire on our next visit

title: I recommend KAWADA because Im stereotyped Japanese guy of Cleanliness
text:
Actually the size of rooms is very small for average Americans Maybe right for Japanese 
And you do not have many staffs working for you since the management is cost efficient
And good restaurants are away
And a few homeless people walking once in a while on Hill street where the hotel is located In summer time open doors out of emergency stairways
However 
This property has no crime 20 years I mean since the owner has purchased this property and remodelled building as hotel I heard
Five story old building has no bugs inside Isnt it very funny
The cleanliness is much much better than five star hotels such as Ritz Carlton GrandHyatt etc because of good housekeeping staffs and because the top management people is like TOYOTAsHONDAs stepping down to the level of staffs and talks with them which US auto makers would not do
I am running medical clinics in Tokyo Metro area hiring 20 doctors so sort of cleanfobic And I love this hotel

title: What a pleasant surprise
text:
This hotel was recommended by a friend of mine This is my second recent trip to San Francisco the first at the Westin on Market and now five days in the Milano Yes the Westin is nice but the Milano was larger and only a very minor step down in quality but under half the price
I really have no idea what hotel the people who gave this hotel a bad review were staying in this hotel was well above my expectations  I was wondefully surprised
I had a king which faced 5th street The room was huge and bright with with the blinds open but could be sealed up nice and dark The king size bed was comfortable The bathroom was modern well equipped and with tasteful modern decoration The room was air conditioned
I was here for the San Francisco Folsom Street fair weekend and associated goings on around that weekend The hotel was walking distance to the various venues in the area
It is very close to the Muni and Bart stations Powell Street on Market street  maybe 100 metres if that I read one review complaining about the lack knowledge of the people on the front desk about places to eat  we have internet  thats what Yelp is for
I only have a few of criticisms
1 You pay 995 a day for internet or 3995 for a 5 day option  and this is only for one device It is however less expensive that some hotels but not of course free However it did work flawlessly for the five days I was there
2 There is no room safe  though I didnt enquire about whether there was a hotel safe at the front desk
3 The power points are on opposite sides of the large room  I had to move the desk in order that my laptop power cord could reach But perhaps that gives an indication of the size of the room
All in all I would suggest you would have a very hard time finding a hotel of this quality for under 250 a night let alone the approx 120 a night I spent I wouldnt normally review a hotel but I felt compelled to give one in this case I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and certainly say here the next time I am in San Francisco
If you cant find it on any of the major hotel booking sites try hotelrescom  its what I used

title: Second Time a Charm
text:
A second visit made all the difference
A couple of months ago I had a miserable experience Restaurant closed room adjacent to ice machine indifferent front desk staff 
Nonetheless Id heard good things and gave the Renaissance a second chance And am I glad I did The front desk staff was efficient helpful and pleasant Checkin was quick and they referred me to several local restaurants WITH directions
The room was much improved  larger and nicer than the last stay Large flatscreen TV still great but better view of the harbor larger and nicer bath My bath was only a large shower so if you want a tub be sure to ask for it Internet connection is easy with the option for a 13 or 17 charge go for the cheaper rate  still very fast
Elevators are surprisingly quick Hotel decor is modern and bed was very comfortable Its easy to work in your room mine had a settee but Im not sure a couple would be comfortable here for a long stay
The Club Lounge is a nice benefit  hors doeuvres in the evening including sushi and shrimp honor bar with many selections free sodas and water magazines and a morethanadequate breakfast There is a 24hour fitness center lap pool and jacuzzi for all guests 
The only down side in my opinion is the restaurant Apparently they operate on somewhat of a tapa system for dinner  lots of small portions or something like that It seemed confusing and expensive especially for one person However there are a number of very nice restaurants seafood steak Italian within very easy walking distance
As others have stated location isnt an ideal for tourists in that its not close to anything but the water Still taxis are prevalent and the water taxi is nearby But if youre in Boston for business this hotel caters to you If youre here for pleasure and can get a good rate its definitely worth considering

title: Really good
text:
We have been traveling for 6 weeks In all this time we have never come across staff that are so attentive as here Nothing was too much trouble for example producing a full days itinerary for a days trip to Marthas Vineyard at 11pm Also very cool feeling about it and a great restaurant
The only thing that we would have loved is coffee facilities in the rooms please please

title: Exceeded my expectations
text:
After reading some of the mixed reviews I wasnt sure quite what to expect But I must say the Ballantyne was everything we were looking for They have the little details down such as warm towels when you check in complimentary valet jacuzzi tubs classical music playing in the room upon arrival and the staff was so attentive I was really impressed I would put it on par with a Ritz Carlton type place 
The only drawback was that when we arrived at 4 pm our room was not ready and we had to wait until about 430 but they allowed us to check out a little late so it wasnt a big deal The spa was very nice

title: Should Have Believed the Others on Here
text: My own fault  did not check out reviews on TA before arriving  but was a business trip and last minute at that so really had no time to research  generally I dont take others word for what they say about their visits  its all in the eye of the beholder  but this time  lets just say I wont be back  it was close to my business meeting therefore the reason it was chosen Back to staying only in BBs for me

title: Stay here  do not worry
text:
Just returned tonight from 3 nights in NYC This is the first time we did not stay at the Crowne Plaza  couldntwouldnt do the 37500 a night they wanted So after a lot of research I used Priceline and ended up with The Grand Hyatt I was apprehensive from the bad reviews but in the end Ill say that I would stay again in a minute
We arrived at 1pm and were in our room early by 110 The front desk was extremely friendly 
The room was fine  beds very comfortable Everything clean and pretty The room was cleaned every morning on schedule The bathroom was not large but certainly adequate  I have smaller bathrooms in my own home so no big deal
Concierge was very helpful along with the bellhop and the men outside the hotel who helped us get taxis
Nice to walk over to Grand Central Station without going outside to get a quick snack or lunch Starbucks there too
Cant say enough  for less than half the price of Crowne Plaza  Ill stay every time

title: This is a great hotel
text:
We went to stay at this hotel for both leisure and business actually The hotel has a great location in a really great part of downtown san diego within a couple of blocks of the Gaslamp area The hotel has nice rooms that are comfortable and the staff was very helpful The hotel has a comfortable and modern interior
When we arrived we had a speedy check into a 14th floor room The room was very clean and spacious enough
The beds were comfortable and we had no problems while staying at this particular property
The hotel has a hot barnightclub on the roof that his hopping at night at least on Friday and Saturdy nights when we were there
We would stay at this hotel again

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: I like many people was a bit concerned about staying at this hotel after reading the many reviews However upon arrival our room was immediately upgraded to a junior suite  fantastic  it was huge The room was clean and well looked after with coffee making facilities and a useful fridge if you wanted to keep your drinks cool The air conditioning was a little noisy but I would rather have noisy air conditioning than no air conditioning  it was sooooo hot and humid in New York They had a great Starbucks Coffee shop in the bar until 1100am so you could get coffee obviously and a light breakfast which was really useful The staff on the whole were very helpful and the concierge gave great advice when asked The hotel was situated at 45th and Madison which was a great base for getting around the city It was 2 minutes walk from Grand Central Station and 1015 mins walk to Times Square We would definitely recommend it and hope to stay there again

title: Not what it used to be  AT ALL
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Palmer House for seven nights during the Thanksgiving holiday Let me point out that Hilton no longer owns the Palmer House  a New York outfit bought it a couple of years ago Theyre undergoing a huge 150 million renovation and the Chicago charm is being killed off in favor of New YorkNew York No offense but if I want to go to New York City Ill go 
I have stayed at the Palmer House dozens of times in the last 40 years The last time prior to this visit was in 2004 We decided to give the Palmer House one more try While the 2004 visit certainly lacked lustre this visit was awful I remember the graciousness of the hotel Seeing all the staff happy and better yet happy to see you Now  we got the distinct impression we were a bother The bellmen and I use the term loosely look at you when you walk it like youre cramping their style We saw older guests lugging their cases up the steps while the bellmen yacked on with eachother In the entire week we were there no one opened the door for us  no one greeted us Shame on these new owners Dont they know the first thing about customer service First impressions Evidently not
The first room they gave us had a terrible stagnant water smell coming from the bathroom drains It was horrible and kept us up at night Furthermore the carpet had not been vacuumed and the bathroom floor and mirrors were not clean We had to call housekeeping three times Each time they would come they didnt correct the problems We gave up We tried to change rooms but were told the Were completely sold out line We made our reservations for this trip in July Were Hilton Honors members  who cares Anyway the next day we changed rooms and while the room was better we still experienced problems with water for instance on two mornings the water ran brown with silt Not good
The restaurant Lockwood did not open until Thanksgiving Day despite being advertised as opening weeks before We made reservations there for dinner several weeks prior I must say the retaurant is terrible The whole layout stinks The ceilings are far too low the tables are bare no table cloths no flowers no candles Stark The flow of the restaurant is tangled at best No one knows which way to go while making their way to the buffet which is situated at the far end of the long and narrow restaurant Its a zigzig game getting to and from Not only that but we ate there for breakfast each morning simply because our rate included it and the congestion at the buffet and lack of service was miserable There are plenty of waiters hanging about but I dont think the manager has told them what to do yet No salt and pepper shakers and silverware one morning No coffee the next morning Funny enough we spoke to the manager of the restaurant and he admitted to us that the restauarnt had been designed by people who had no restaurant planning experience No kidding Id avoid this place To think the hotel closed the wonderful French Quarter Restaurant and opened this Unforgivable One more thing about this restaurant The weird music choice Who wants to hear Janice Joplin while eating Thanksgiving Dinner  or any other time for that matter The music was awful Rap New Age Rock ect The manager said they were playing the staffs CDs Wwhhhhaaat 
For a good restaurant try Petterinos The South Water Kitchen WONDERFUL and Harry Carays Theres also a Corner Bakery that serves good coffee sandwiches and pastries
Lastly the decor is no longer tasteful The lobby looks awful with a bar sticking out in the middle and massive yellow chairs obstructing the once lovely view There are people guzzling drinks and half eaten plates of food cluttering up tables  in the lobby Dreadful No relaxation there at all anymore You cannot even walk through it Its a circus The carpet choice on the floors we were on 21 and then 15 is hideous I describe at as the stoneout peacock of pinball wizardry I have a feeling Potter Palmer would flip if he saw this mess
What are these new owners thinking A staff member told us the new owners also bought the old Carson Pirie Scott building directly across the street which closed in February I shutter to think
Well with Marshall Fields selling out to Macys Carsons closed the Berghoff Restaurant closed Trader Vics closed and now the Palmer House in complete shambles Chicago is sinking fast We sure hate to see it go Whats next are they going to raze Wrigley Field now They seem to be the last man standing Goodbye Chicago
We did decide on one thing No more Hilton Hotels for us Even though Hilton no longer owns the Palmer House their name is still attached Were sticking with Marriott who is fabulous We made the switch after our Palmer House trip three years ago
There are plenty of hotel choices in Chicago We stayed at the Marriott Renaissance last year and it was great If we ever get up the nerve to come back to Chicago thats where well be staying

title: Excellent Hotel with topnotch customer service
text:
I have stayed at the Hilton W 57th Avenue twice in the last 3 months Each stay is only getting better The service at this hotel is far and away the best and the nightly rate was a steal for what you get Rooms are terrific and location cant be beat
Free Breakfast was EXCELLENT

title: Overrated unclean room would not recommend
text: After reading reviews of this hotel I was looking forward to my stay the price was fairly reasonable for a San Diego hotel The selling points for me were the free parking and the free breakfast And in that respect it was fine However the room that we were given wasnt cleaned very well The toilet was filthy room wasnt cleaned well mustard packet lying on the floor of the room there was no soap in the toiled and there was an opened shampoo bottle on the bathroom floor We had already hauled our baggage up to the room and were too tired after our long drive to change rooms The next morning we discovered that the water was clogging in the tub Very disappointed with this experience Thankfully we were staying for one night only The breakfast was good and plentiful and the parking free besides that I cant think of anything good about this hotel Definitely would not stay here again

title: Not my first choice but good valuelocation
text:
Ive stayed here a few times on my business trips This is not my preferred hotel but I must say the staff is very helpful and the location is good  close to Greek town Although the rooms are pretty updated they need cleaning The wall lamps have lots of dust so maybe they just need to do some deep cleaning
Last time I stayed here May I had a pleasant restful stay but previously during the winter months I had a terrible 2night stay My room faced the front of the building so the wind would hit the AC unit and it kept making loud sounds I could not sleep all night The hotel was sold out so I could not move to another room

title: very good and very reasonable
text:
i have just come back from NY this was my first visit the park 79 is very well priced and in an excellent location it is mad busy in the centre of Manhatten there are lots of good priced eateries walking distance and the park is just two minutes away as is the subway which is very cheap The room although quite small was spotless and cleaned every day fresh towels daily and the staff were really helpful
I would stay at this hotel again

title: Nightmare for a person with allergies
text: This hotel was a baaad choice  First DO NOT make a reservation through Ritz it will cost you at least 100 more i was checking rates after i book it and found priceline and other site for at leat 100 less Now let me start with positive  The staff is very friendly and pleasant and the lobby looks neat and clean and you have the view of the Statue Now if you have allergies like me this hotel is a diseaster I wanted room feather free  of course it wasnt and not only that but there was feather on the carpet not sure why it wasnt vaccumed and the worst was AC griddles OH MY did it jump start my allergy the dust on it was thick and zesty simply horrible The chair in the room had marks and furniture was so dusty that i left a note for the housekeeper DUST writen on it the toilet didnt flush good and there was hair in the bathroom bathroom was nice size just wish it was clean  OOO And i forgot the dirty carpet  So if you consider this hotel make sure you are person who cant see good and has no allergies and youll be fine

title: Very nice room  great service  expensive parking
text: This has to be one of the best Hotels that I have stayed in The service was wonderful the fridge was well stocked and the room was very nice The bed was comfortable and the maid service was excellent I would definitely stay here again The only down side  The price per night is on the expensive side and parking is 50 per night The internet is not free  1295 per night

title: Hotel Giraffe a lovely small hotel
text:
My husband and I spent a weekend in NYC at the Hotel Giraffe We lived in NYC for many years and wanted to find a charming small hotel instead of one of the big midtown chains We were both very happy with the Hotel Giraffe 
 The valet parking was quick and the bellman and desk people were very polite and sweet Coffee tea capuccino etc were offered throughout the day in the lobby There was wine and cheese at night and a continental breakfast in the AM 
 We had a corner suite on the 7th floor with nice views down Park Avenue What is referred to as a balcony is about 2 feet deep and more like a platform to stand out and get some fresh air The suite itself was nice and fairly spacious It was decorated in subdued neutal tones I would recommend the Hotel Giraffe for someone who is looking for a small charming hotel

title: Great location great concierge and lobby is great for business
text:
Enjoyed the hotel was able to get an early check in since I had to get ready after my flight and to a meeting across town  front desk team was great Room size was small but good size for what you needit wasnt too small in other words Great views from my room and the windows opened so it was nice to get a cool fresh breeze The concierge team was probably the best We needed dinner reservation at Saxton and Parole and they were able to get our time and suggest a few other places nearby for an after dinner cocktail 
The lobby was great to get some work done while sipping on some coffee and the complimentary wireless Internet There were many others doing the same so it was comfortable with great views 
Overall I enjoyed my stay and always have fun while at a W Hotel

title: Not safe roaches and holes in the blamkets
text: ROACHES I would never allow my family to stay here again Please pay a little more and stay elsewhere The bathtubs do not drain so youre standing in old nasty drain water to take a shower I killed a roach on the wall less than 5 minutes upon entering the room The carpet smells funny and the bed blankets have holes in them Not a safe area at all  security cameras everywhere and back entrance is near a dumpster The WIFI is not strong enough to reach all rooms so you have to go to the lobby to check your email Ive stayed at several Super 8 motels and this one is well below par I knew it would be loud bc of the airport but therere too many negatives to ever stay here again

title: Happy PartTime New Yorkers
text:
Having stayed close to Times Square last year this was a perfect choice in terms of location just 2 blocks from Times Square I found the hotel to be modern clean and comfortable The room facilities were in good working order Not denying the rooms are small  but your never in Breakfast was a bonus with a good selection including cereals pastries bagels  cream cheese or jams fruit juices Coffee and tea was also available all day The best thing about this hotel was the service received from the staff on reception They were so friendly and helpful nothing was a problem They enquired various times on line to answer our queries and suggested various eateries bars and ways to get around I would and have recommended this hotel to many people Value for money was superb compaired to alot in NYC also Location location location
Thanks for a superb stay  Lynda and Diane

title: Great Location
text:
I read some reviews regarding security and we never had any issues with that Our van was parked in their garage for 5 days and was never touched either 
The entire facitlity is worn out but for the price in downtown DC it was tolerable Our room had a balcony overlooking the marina and channel It was great sitting out there in the morning and in the evening after a hard day of siteseeing Eating meals is difficult The restaurant in the hotel is pricy and there arent many places nearby Because they have free access parking at the facility we drove over to Arlington or Alexandria most nights for dinner and supplies
The location is good too We were only a 20 minute walk from the Mall and several memorials and monuments The Circulator bus stops right out front and will take you up 7th for only a buck We used it several times to get up to the sites when we had a time issue and about every evening it was a relief to ride back on because of our tired feet and children

title: A very good place to stay
text:
The Mosser Hotel does not dissapoint on the contrary  I was very positively surprised about this place The room was very small indeed but it was very neat and having all amenities in this price class Shared bathrooms were superclean and it was always a fere one available The hotel is located very conveniently right in the centre of downtown but it is also quiet so one can find peace and rest in the room I especially liked the comfy bed after a 15 hours flight Staff members at the reception were very friendly and helpful with all my questions
I can definitely recommend this hotel and I will stop by next time I pass through San Francisco

title: Gorgeous roomnice location
text:
Stayed for nine daysservice personnel were very accomodating The room was beautiful  kept well I liked having a small kitchenette and launderette in the room 
 I asked for foam pillows as I am allergic to downfeather pillows and received pillows with some sort of foam chips in them They were VERY UNCOMFORTABLE That would be my only negative comment and would suggest they correct this You might want to bring your own foam pillow if you prefer one over a feather pillow

title: Very pleasant experience and would definately stay again
text: This was an outstanding stay at the Hilton Midtown The location was great only a few blocks from Times Square one way a couple blocks to Central Park the other way and easy subway access The stay started out wonderfully We had booked a room on the executive level top floors which was a great move It only cost a little bit more but it is well worth it There is a separate check in on the top floor with absolutely no wait We were able to get early check in which was very convienent The physical hotel itself was nice nothing outrageous but nice In the evening they served complimentary appetizersfresh fruitetc which were very good and in the mornings you had continental breakfast When we went to check out the staff kindly offered us a very late check out 500 PM rather than noon This was OUTSTANDING because all I was asking for was to check our bags with the bell desk because our flight was not leaving until the afternoon and our original plan was to do some more sight seeing during the day It was a very rainy day so without us even asking for it they offered us this late checkout at no extra charge since we would be pretty misarable walking around the city in the rain The concierge was also EXTREMELY friendly and helpful This was a perfect stay and would highly recommend and if you do stay here I would also advise the upgrade to executive level

title: Good for a night
text: My family was traveling from georgia to el paso  we stopped here for the night The room upstairs nonsmoking was clean and actually a lot nicer than any other super 8 I have stayed in The front desk employee was nice and there were no problems I didnt feel unsafe in the area but then again we only stayed 1 night it wasnt expensive 52 with military discount But for that much in a super 8 I atleast expected a hot item for breakfast which was the only downside just cereal some fruit  muffins etc We went down the street and had McDs Overall it was a decent nights stay

title: Rewriting history in its rating
text:
I booked a three night stay with a popular online service It gave the San Carlos a 35 out of 5 The rate was about 60 less than a much better name brand hotel around the corner 
When I arrived I was told I did not have a reservation I assured the counter person I indeed had one They were insistant I did not I produced the confirmation number hmm thats not our number
 I produced the booking receipt and asked for the manager after additional explaining and 20 minutes she had to make the reservation on the spot 
I know this hotel had a grand history and boy are they doing their best to keep it just like it was in the 50s
Just a short list of deficiencies
Uncontrolable shower temp scald to cold in milliseconds 
No heat or cooling control They say just open or close the vent So 170 rooms are treated as one 
The original elevators are old and creaky and I think they were the first one west of the Mississippi And slow They even post inside the elevator that they are subject to breaking and to be gentle 
The walls have been pained so many times that its hard to tell where one wall starts and the other ends Even so the sound of the next rooms occupants was interesting 
No room service
If they promoted this monument as exactly what it is  a chance to stay in a really historic hotel with 1928 detail And play up the ghost thing even more than they do now some masochistic patrons would love it 
One positive was the wireless was actually fast and free 
Pay a little more and
Avoid this classic old rundown overpriced uncomfortable relic

title: not at all a touristfriendly hotel ESPECIALLY when it comes to asking if an area is safe to walk down
text:
There are only 3 things good I have to say about this hotel 1 The cleansiness is very good 2 The location made it easy for us to visit the tourist sites and the people at the reception were very nice Thats all but I have A LOT of bad to say about it
My advise in going to Washington DC when it comes to asking what area is safe and whats not and yes EVERY city has good and bad is to do ALL your research before coming because you absolutely can NOT ask the people is this area safe at least not at this hotel they get VERY angry and offended and this happened to me twice in a row the very moment I arrived in the hotel and I even mentioned how there are good and bad areas in every city First time I asked this arts lady and straight away budged in said something like your be fine how about just keep out of the NE part how about that very sharp and rudely and I think also she said something about why are you here then so I thought to myself Ill ask someone better if I am not going to be answered nicely so I asked the security guard who was standing around judging the fact he is a security guard so I thought he would be most helpful and he says yeah noones going to kill you or hurt you or anything and I says are you ok and he goes yeah Im just a bit ofended you know as if I had that intention to upset them they both KNEW that every city has good and bad areas and that I was a foreigner a tourist that is not a immigrant who knew nothing about it AND the act of being angry and being offended was all put on me ending up throughout the whole vacation holding my breath I have travelled to the USA 8 times now and every time I asked about low and high crime areas and everybody in every place told me and helped me out unlike this hotel I have crap like this in the UK time after time even directed at me and we all get fed up with it I did not save up all that money to USA to experience another UK attitude 
Other complaints is that as soon as I arrived I went up to the swimming pool and it was all set out which looked like there was going to be a party ok I understand its a conference hotel but I asked if I could go in the pool and apparently its only for people in this Arts thing I could not use the pool the whole time I was there and when the people from the arts group came you could not MOVE in the lobby because it was crowded so much so that we felt that we werent guests anymore the elevator was unmovable at times and they were all drunk I mean VERY DRUNK you could not even stand outside in the entrance at night without the crowd screaming about next to you therefore unless you were toat least put up with the outside bit you are limited to your hotel room because you were in the crowds way allthe time you can tell the body language when you walked past The only nice people there really was was the people in the reception they were VERY nice but the rest I would go as far to say that they need to know how to respond to tourists better even when we were waiting in the lobby for the airport shuttle the people both inside and outside couldnt seem to get rid of us quick enough 
Apart from all that there was nothing really in the hotel shopwise apart from a gift shop even there there wasnt much that was worth buying apart from the hotel resturant in which we had to book to get in we had to live on McDonalds on the other corner of the road
I do sound like a complaining Brit here but I would by far consider it worth complaining when you have spent all that money to live your holiday like that
I would never again in my life waste a single dollar pound or euro on even USING this hotel even if I won the lottery let alone staying and I would not recommend others to either
DISGUSTING

title: Mini Pineapple Cupcakes in the Lobby
text:
Nice location with easy access to everything by foot or by car I was most intrigued by their unique mini pineapple cupcakes that welcomed you in the lobby They were a whimsical way to reinforce their brand
The bathroom was my favorite  spacious and sleek The rooms were very clean and the bed was full of pillows you could sink into prop your feet on or just squish as you sleep the night away Ill say we didnt spend much time here but we used it as our book end for our trip from Seattle to Victoria to Vancouver and back to Seattle We were easily able to walk from here to the Space Needle Pike Place the piers and even uphill to Queen Anne 
I will say their reservations process was not as smooth as the stay  my friend experienced multiple charges and phone calls required to correct it However they did correct it and our stay was comfortable

title: On the beach in Pacific Beach
text:
I have stayed at the Pacific View before  several times  and I find them consistent The place has been upgraded gradually over the years and is still not a fancy place thanks for that  but while spartan it is neighborhood friendly and clean 
Ive always had great service and prompt response from the staff whether it is onsite during the stay or via email before or after and theyve always been flexible and accommodating You cannot beat the location if you are looking for being in the middle of things  if you like the beach you really dont have to leave the neighborhood for much of anything The bed seemed new and was very comfortable with good quality linens 
The room furnishings otherwise were almost nonexistent  I would have liked to have had a decent table and chairs  but I made do with a couple of the deck chairs pulled into the room from the balcony outside there was a high table in the room and a couple of plastic stools  one of which had a crackedbroken seat Thats about my only criticism  and it would certainly not cause me to look elsewhere  the other positives are numerous This little motel has the feel of a small business  and thats one of the things I like most about it
I opened my windows and had the sounds of the neighborhood California beach culture and the ocean in my room not to mention the cool sea air and sounds of the waves 24 hours a day There are many great places to eat within easy walking distance I love you Pacific View Inn Ill be back soon

title: Nice room served its purpose Lobby is too crazy for me though
text: I probably wont stay here again considering its size and the chaos of the lobby The lines to check in and out was 20 people deep each person taking a total of 20 minutes to a half an hour The front desk person I got after waiting in the line for nearly an hour or more was a nasty nasty woman by the name of JOY Dealing with her was a very unpleasant experience given her HARD ALPHA woman attitude She addressed me as a man calling me sir after asking for my ID that clearly says im FEMALE The trip to the hotel was horrendous as I arrived at port authority  115 and finally got up to my room around 345 leaving me no time to enjoy my day in the city before having to get ready for an event in the evening

title: GREAT LOCATION NO BED BUGS Horrible WiFi comfy bed needs updating
text:
Not very modern
Rooms could be remodeled but hey  its NYC
No breakfast includedbut there is a starbucks 1 block away
GREAT LOCATION2 blocks from 96th street subway stop and you can take the express red 1 subway from Times Square so it takes maybe 10 minutes to get there from Times Square ALSOonly 3 or 4 blocks from Central Parkgreat place to run early in the morning
Wifi was really badhad to go to Starbucks Bed was very comfortable
I was in room 212 very quiet corner room so was very large
Asked for a room with 2 single beds got a queenkind and wasnt charged for the upgrade NO BED BUGS
Dont wait to book 2 nights beforehandyoull get ripped off

title: Well worth it
text:
Me and my wife stayed in the Donatello in Sept 2008 and it was a great start to our California holiday The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was large bright clean and comfortable Really god bed too which is important to us I used the gym a couple of times which is a little small but functional Unlike some other reviewers we didnt have any problems with noise from the street even though it was Friday and Saturday and we could see the entrance to a nightclub from our 15th floor window
The only negative is the breakfast Its fine if youre happy with coffeee croisants bagels fresh fruits and gooey gunky sweet muffins but the breakfast room itself is very small and nowhere near able to seat all the guests who come in so most ended up taking their breakfasts to their rooms to eat Again fine if you dont mind doing that but something to be aware of
Location is very good and it seems quite critical We popped over to look at the Hotel California which is only a couple of blocks away and one we were considering staying at But those couple of blocks make a big difference The neighbourhood takes a swift dive for the worse into a world of liquor stores and downbeat people hanging out on corners Not exactly romantic But the area immediately around the Donatello is fine
Overall then a very nice hotel for the price and in a great location

title: Beware of thief
text: I left diamond earrings on nightstand and they were stolen So a thief works for the hotel I realize it was my mistake in leaving them but the hotel needs to find out who is robbing guests I filled a claim with hotel that was turned down Big surprise They said no unauthorized entries in room but had the incident date wrong Hotel handled event poorly no one called back after I reported theft I had to make several phone calls and emails before I heard from hotel I am sorry that I gave housekeeping generous tips before they robbed me Also taken were other personal items such as soda beer and snacks

title: Amazing in every way
text:
My wife and I received a free night from Hotelscom after staying 10 nights elsewhere over the past year We chose the fanciest fivestar hotel in San Diego the Grand Del Mar We stayed between Christmas and New Years expecting a crowd but the hotel felt rather empty Nonetheless the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating The hotel itself is part of a resort that includes a worldclass golf course four swimming pools a spa at least two restaurants and a comfortable lounge 
Our room was by far the most plush luxurious entrylevel room weve ever experienced The bed was heavenly with down pillows and turndown service The flatscreen HDTV was huge Our bathroom featured marble counter tops a sunken tub separate large shower and even a television We loved the Grand Del Mar

title: Very Uncomfortable Stay
text: Before arriving we had a change in plans we contacted the hotel and requested that one of our rooms contain two double beds instead of one king they informed us on three different occasions that this would not be a problem We also told them that if we could not switch rooms for whatever reason we would like a rollaway bed because on their website it stated that these were available upon request Upon arrival 70 Park informed us that there was no such conversation made with them about switching the rooms Note Both my wife AND myself spoke with the hotel several days prior to arrival We were also told by managment that in order to get a rollaway bed we would have to had contacted them days before so they could make arrangments to get one from another hotel We checked into our room which we were told that it was upgraded because of the inconvience only to find that we couldnt even walk around the room without one of us sitting on the bed because lack of space We also found that our toilitries were opened and used there was hair in the sink and the bathtub As we turned back the sheets for bed we found hair ALL OVER THE SHEETS We contacted the front desk and found out that because it was Christmas they had let all of their housekeeping staff leave A manager showed up to the room with sheets in hand but it took her almost an hour to make the bed I even had to help her There was not any thermostat control and it was so hot we had to sleep with the windows open in 20 degree weather 70 Park also doesnt believe in changing the sheets daily you must request this service That was obvious our first night Also if you would like to have a drink at the bar downstairs a glass of house wine will set you back 15 Note half a glass We travel every 4 months to NYC and thought we would try a new area of town and this hotel is not worth the money comparable to other hotels in Midtown Manhattan We do not expect to have service and quality that we receive in our own homes however cleanliness is a huge issue If you can stand the filth you may be able to stand 70 Park

title: Great location
text: Ideal to get to a the popular sites Staff friendly and rooms fit for purpose Nice and quite too for such a central location Breakfast on the terrace Restraunt  7th floor looking out on Rockefeller Centre was pleasant affair Would definitely go back an happy to recommend it

title: Good for the Money
text: Good location Good bed Great value for money Not an immaculate place but if you can deal with that its fine It did smell a little If you are after 5 star luxury stay somewhere else If all you are going to do is sleep and shower its fine Service at reception was blunt but efficient They offered us a later check out which was appreciated

title: Great hotel
text: New hotel Nice modern furnishings Similar layout to SpringHill Suites but slightly larger rooms Refrig and microwave in rooms Breakfast available in the mornings for a feebar open at night This hotel is just across the street from a large mall with numerous chain restaurants Only a few minutes off the highway

title: Beware of this hotel
text: I should have read reviews beforehand ABNORMAL BILLING is rightWe used Travelocity where you prepay and the hotel still charged then at the front desk claimed it was not doublecharging Went home and checked online banking yes they doublebilled Travelocity has a guarantee to fix things but that was an HOUR on the phone with the hotel thru them THEN since the only incidental should have been 24day parking chargeWHICH IS HIGH they debited my account a 50 hold for parking instantly but the CREDIT to my account will be seen in 25 days and with some banks they said can take 23 weeks Well luckily I use Bank of America it should be soon But this is ridiculousI attempted while there to reconcile at the front desk and they said Oh dont worry we wont doublecharge Forget this hotel you can not trust them And yes reaching the accounting department is impossible You get voicemail and they dont ever call you back Good thing I atleast had Travelocity to deal with them for me or who knows what would have happened

title: Noisy freight trains and bad location between highway and train
text:
My company booked a room there for me I was very disappointed by the noise during the night due to the freight trains and also by the location as again due to the trains there is no way to reach the Domain area just 200 feet from the hotel You need to take your car and do several miles to go to a restaurant at that place There is also no way to eat or drink something in the hotel
Otherwise it is clean with a good breakfast there is an outdoor pool and hot tub
I do not recommend that hotel

title: Nice but pricey
text:
Pros Lovely in many ways Lots of hospitality and high end toiletries They provided me wa free NY Times when I asked about one Excellent breakfast buffetexperience it once but see my suggestion below
Cons Everything from the coffee in the gift shop to the restaurant to the business center were too costly A better bet for a quick  affordable breakfast is the Starbucks in the Marriott across the street or the Dennys a block away The business center needs to be more efficient especially for the costs Servers in the restaurant put the napkin in your laptoo personal

title: Very reasonable choice
text:
This hotel at Lombard street is a good option when visiting San Francisco We had no major complaints but we missed a refrigerator Also no breakfast was served The room was clean the staff was friendly The relatively large room had a somewhat somber appearance but was otherwise OK Lombard street is busy and there is certainly some traffic noise in the room at least in front side rooms WIFI worked well Car parking is free It takes about 45 minutes to walk to Fishermans Wharf and about an hour to the boats leaving for Alcatraz However you will have no problem getting a taxi in Lombard street 
There is a nearby stop for the San Francisco doubledecker sightseeing bus 
Taken into account that hotel prices in SF are relatively high the overall pricequality balance was good

title: Undrewhelmed
text: My husband and I were in New York for a long weekend with friends I was anxious to stay at the famous Waldorf Astoria but found it didnt measure up to my expectations for such a prestigious address The staff at the desk and the front door were pleasant but stiff Our room wasnt ready when we arrived We decided to stroll 5th Avenue while we waited Upon arriving 30 minutes after we were told the room would be ready we were informed it was still not available The desk clerk noted we would be there for three nights and offered an upgrade to a larger room with a view I was pleased until we reached the closetsized room I cant imagine what the original room would have been like if this was an upgrade At least twice we went out to catch a taxi in front of the hotel and there was no doorman to help us These are admittedly minor irritations but more than one should expect at a renouned hotel Weve stayed in many first class hotels around the country and based on our experience elsewhere the Waldorf was marginal

title: Average hotel good location
text: What I look for in hotels is location and price The Gaylord was fairly inexpensive and seemed to be in a good location which is why we chose it The location was actually pretty good within walking distance to the center of SF and to some attractions eg Crookedest Street One slight issue with it is the close proximity of it to the dodgy area but as long as you dont wander off its fine The rooms were clean enough and suited us we were there to see the city not the hotel but if going back to San Francisco I probably would spend a little more money for a nicer hotel

title: Great comfort and full of room
text: This hotel is located very convenient to the airport has a massive amount of room in each suite and is very comfortable The inner plaza was very nice and there were fire pits to sit around What shocked me the most about the hotel was its affordable price In my opinion it offered a better deal than any other hotel of its kind in Phoenix considering what it offered

title: Great service
text:
Literally every person on the hotel staff whom I encountered at the Hotel Commonwealth was friendly helpful and just good old fashioned courteous including front desk staff doormen housekeepers and roomservice Whether I needed more pillows or scrambled eggs after breakfast hours or even a wheel chair without an advance notice each request was fulfilled promptly and politely After I said thank you the typical reply was with pleasure 
Also great fitness room with new high end equipment
Very convenient for parents of Boston University students Suggestion quieter rooms on the higher floors further from traffic noise below on Highway 90 on one side and Commonwealth Ave on the other
Located at Kenmore Square T station

title: Basic and a tad expensive
text:
This hotel is not good value for what you pay It is clean and the amenities are very basic  nothing to write home about I am guessing the rates tend to be high because people need to stay close to hospitals they need to visit If it werent for convenience no one would stay here 
Boston has a great public transportation system If you are traveling on leisure there are better hotels and better locations

title: OK hotel good location
