text: I have stayed in this hotel several times in the past 5 years I have never had an awful experience Some of the queen bed rooms are small This trip I stayed in a room with two double beds for the first time The room was larger as was the bathroom The drawback was we were right over the CTA bus stop outside However when we put the ventailing system on fan and created a somewhat noisy white noise we were fine The breakfast had actually improved since I had last stayed about 2 years ago the offerings were OK nothing special There are some good breakfast places to eat nearby if you dont care for what they offer All in all not a bad place to stay if you want to be in the Lincoln Park area

title: Thank you Ritz for a topnotch getaway
text:
My girlfriends and I met there for a onenight stay to celebrate our friendship to bask in the luxury of all things RitzCarlton to savor a few drinks and tasty food and to enjoy watching some college football together Yes we love our pigskin All missions were accomplished in a way that has set the bar higher than any other hotel weve visited together When it came time to depart we didnt want to check out 
Frankie checked me in at the front desk and I couldnt have asked for a more pleasant check in He is the kind of employee any business would love to have  exceedingly polite friendly smart and efficient I was impressed I asked about paying a fee for an upgrade and he quickly accommodated my request with a reasonable fee I told him that my girlfriends and I were meeting in Charlotte to enjoy life spend time together and watch the football game that night on TV and mentioned we wanted to see Virginia Tech win I had a spa appointment to get things started so he suggested he have someone deliver my bags to the suite so I could start enjoying the spa Excellent plan Frankie 
I had a deep tissue massage in the spa and quite simply that rocked The whole spa experience was exactly what I needed There is a full body shower at least one regular shower some quiet areas a steam room and a sauna room The whole area was spotless and the attendants were available when needed but not intrusive They werent hovering around the spa area all the time which can be awkward if one is partially dressed andor make one feel rushed to leave but there was always help at available at the very closeby front desk When I booked the appointment the attendant had mistakenly left me on hold for a really long time so when I checked in she gave me a small gift to apologize which was not needed but very kind of her to do My friends and I met in the spa and spent a lot of time just chilling out which we sorely needed One of my friends also had a massage and gave it a thumbs up
Next I saw our room  and WOW was it a room It was the most beautiful hotel suite Ive ever seen It was incredibly spacious with a separate bedroom with two queen beds and a large living room area The decor was immaculate with original artwork and beautiful furniture The bathroom was huge and featured rich marble decor with a shower with a glass door a tub and a toilet room My friends and I felt like celebrities  it was that VIP On the desk in the living room area was a bottle of complimentary champagne with a note from Frankie wishing us well for a fun evening in the hotel and even a Go Hokies message Now THAT is how a hotel rocks out the customer service We felt cared for and important 
We tried to hit the Urban Sip but it was closed due to a private party I love that place so it made me a little bummed that I couldnt share that experience with my friends who had not been there before But who could be disappointed in the Ritz when we were having the kind of experience we were having
We ended up having drinks and some light food downstairs at the bar it was a great scene for people watching and relaxing and it was pretty hopping even for a weekday it was Thursday night The appetizer specials are reasonably priced We watched the Hokies start the game on the TV at the bar then went in the restaurant for dinner where we could continue to watch the game and eat The food there was quite good and service was excellent 
In fact we had such a great experience at the hotel that we ended up staying there all night and not leaving the hotel at all When it came time to crash the suite was completely quiet and the beds were like little clouds of heaven  an A sleeping experience 
Thank you to Frankie the spa staff and everyone else who made our visit truly exceptional I hope my friends and I will be able to find the time to rendezvous there again soon The Charlotte Ritz is the kind of place that truly offers an experience versus just lodging and that was exactly what we needed

title: Very Good but there is a twist
text:
Nice digs for the price and here are the good things
Buffet awesome in the mornings Saturday they get behind but still good
Parking lot is great costs 22 per day but still ok
Managers Reception Awesome Great deal Cocktails and pupus
Location is easy find
Weight room and pool good deals too
Business center is all free Nice but had to wait to use it 3 stations 
Now this is all great with ONE EXCEPTION Internet access in the rooms and suites is per IP address What the heck As a family we had three PCsand had to pay for each day for all three PCsnot customer friendly 
Other hotelsone code is for the room and use 1 2 or 3 PCs Cmon break down and take care fo the customers

title: Worth it for 150 per night or less
text: My husband and I stayed at the Palace for Memorial Day weekend The lobby and dining area of the hotel are beautiful We were in a Grand Deluxe room which was OK If I were to go back I would spend less on the smaller room bc the only difference seemed to be a higher ceiling and a few extra feet of space The rooms are clean and old elegant but the bathrooms are small and need an update There was no turn down service We mentioned this at the front desk our last night and they said you have to request it No one told us in the beginning The concierge was not very helpful and actually recommended a restaurant that was overpriced and poor quality Aqua The Palace is in a very good location but there are plenty of other choices in Union Square Breakfast is outrageously priced 60 for two Room service is a fortune as well Overall the hotel is charming and we had a pleasant stay Were not ones to spend much time at the hotel and we didnt visit the pool or anything Only book it if its a bargain

title: Listen to the food Comments
text:
Take note of the other reviews when they talk about food
The Hotel is pretty good rooms clean large well maintained etc Reasonable bar although theres not much atmosphere
Only down side is that in the evening the Restaurant trys to pretend to be somthing its not The Menu is a bit fancy and doesnt really live up to what it promises Breakfast is OK but no more and if its busy the service at breakfast is patchy
For dinner your better off going to PF Changs which is a 100 yard walk through the car park
All in all is does what a hotel of this standard should do

title: This hotel IS NOT FINISHED
text:
Stayed here nearly a month after the hotel completed construction but it is still very much under construction Ive stayed in worst hotels  but this hotel wasnt worth the cost
We had to change rooms 3 times
There are two elevators to service 30 floors prepare to wait on one day they had one evevator closed for construction use only
Elevators stopped working entirely during the stay 24 floors is a long walk down
On day of check in concrete was being pored on a closed sidewalk I had to call the front desk to figure out how to get into the hotel
Construction workers EVERYWHERE
Wires hanging from wall
Had to wait 30 minutes to ice as they ran out and had to go out to buy some
So there are some positives
The rooms are nice and very quiet especially for New York Theyre not large but large enough The staff was friendly and apologetic but I think they have to be used to apologizing by now New York is a big city with tons of hotel options and for the cost Id stay somewhere else

title: NOT worth the moneythere are others with better service for the same price
text: My first introduction to the hotel was the restroom in receptionit was dirty and not of the standard I would expect for a Hilton hotel The staff were not particularly friendlythey seemed to have a take it or leave it attitudeand werent very friendly And the NOISE from the construction was bad And it goes on all night PS The hotle staff lie to guests about what time the construction starts and endsI wont stay here again

title: I could live in one of these lovely suites
text: I have stayed at SS several times over the last 3 years I love the rooms the staff and the facility I highly recommend it Close to many fabulous restaurants and shopping in Hillcrest close to 8 5 and 163 the zoo Balboa Parkcant beat it for the price and the staff are friendly and helpful

title: Clean hotel but terrible location
text:
I just got back from my trip to Detroit and I had stayed at Hotel St Regis for 1 night Thankfully it was just one night The hotel is quite an old architecture and is located in a neighborhood that appears to be quite shady I arrived on a Sunday and found the neighborhood to be deserted Although the hotel is located not very far from Downtown I was terribly disappointed to know that there was only one eatery across the street I went around the block trying to look for a decent place to eat or order my food from but found it hard to believe that near a bug hotel like that there was one fast food store Happy pizza and a Chinese take out place None of them seemed to be decent places to eat I saw plenty of suspicious looking people walking around people who looked like they had doped and drunk for days Gleefully the city Police Department is a block away The only saving grace was a CVS phramacy from where I ended up getting chips and soda for lunch The hotel menu is terrible
As far as the rooms are concerned they were clean beds were comfortable I am saying beds because in the room I was initially assigned the conditioner started making a noise and I could not sleep further So I called the front desk person who told me that he would send someone to my room After waiting for about 30 minutes I went downstairs to ask if someting could be done about it I was surprised when her said Is it still making noise and I thought to myself You said youd send somebody and now you expect the conditioner to get fixed by itself Then he quickly assigned me to another room and called someone to accompany me to the room to make sure everything in the room was OK The other room was alright but I was surprised that not a single word of apology was mentioned for the inconvenience caused
The hotel looked desserted and at night in the lobby when I went down to report the conditioner making noise I heard the sound of glass being shattered as if someone was repeatedly banging a heavy glass object with a hammer at 23 minute intervals from the private party room the whole time I waited in the lobby There were no lights on in that room The front desk person went inside the room and brought back someone else with him and that person quietly went and sent down in the lobby waiting area It felt a little strange
2 positive things They let me check in earlier than the hotel check in time and check out a little after the check out time Hence I give a 3star rating
Bottom line Plus  Clean rooms and spacious bath rooms Minus  Old building malfunctioningnonfunctioning gadgets in rooms poor location with very shady activities in and around the premises poor options for dining personnel can improve on courtesy

title: We can recommend it
text: We were looking for an unexpensive hotel in the San Diego Area and found Ramada We did not got disappointed It has everything you need to stay some days in San Diego The customer service was very polite and helpful The room and bathroom were very clean The breakfest was ok I was happy abputh the tasty yogurt and fruits We can recommend it

title: A wonderful oasis of calm in the middle of Manhattan
text: My husband and I spent a week at the Library Hotel in late August I discovered it through this site and thought it sounded lovely the fact that Im a diehard booklibrary fan helped make the sale It was everything I had hoped for and more Ive stayed at many different hotels all over NY and this is by far my favorite The room was small but very well designed so it didnt feel cramped Also there are so many wonderful places to hang out particularly the spacious 2nd floor lounge area which offers free breakfast wine  cheese MonSat evenings and coffeeteacookies throughout the day Theres a Starbucks across the street but you wont need it since there is also an espresso machine that makes a yummy cappucino The free business center with computerprinter was also welcome so I could check my email every day without having to track down an internet cafe I never bring a laptop with me when Im on vacation but I do like being able to stay connected at least a little bit I also appreciated the fact that there are only 6 rooms per floor so its MUCH more quiet than larger hotels where people are coming and going at all hours I never heard a peep from outside our room Times Square is an easy 10minute walk away and with Grand Central practically right next door its always easy to find a cab or take the subway Highly recommended I definitely plan to return to the Library Hotel

title: Clean Room  Good Service
text: We spent the week of July 4th 2012 at the Boston Sheraton The rooms were clean and fairly nice We were at this hotel for a convention and the hotel handled everything quite well The location is good with access to the Charles River and bikerunning trails The hotel is less than a block from a subway station which turned out to be a really quick and easy way to get around The hotel is also connected to a shopping mall with a grocery store nearby which saved a ton of money on food The restaurant in the hotel was waaay too expensive for us as we had two children with us The lobby has free computers and a Starbucks and the concierge station The room we had was large enough with two beds  smaller than queen size but the bathroom was tiny The door on the bathroom took up almost so much space that you had to stand on the toilet to close the door once you were in I used the gym everyday and it was stocked with plenty of high quality equipment although the thermostat was broken and it was really hot and humid I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again

title: Both stays deligthful staff housekeeping restaurant lounge
text:
We stayed at the Plaza Hotel for part of our honeymoon so we have set some high expectations Having visited NYC several times over many years once we discovered the charms of downtown and this hotel we have no desire to stay up in Midtown again We have stayed at the Millinium for the past 2 Octobers for a long weekend Thursday  Sunday and highly recommend it 
Noise has not been an issue on either stay but we are typically out on the town by 900 and its so wonderfully quiet at night Weve always had toplevel service from everyone and in the past year there does not seem to be many changes we recognized several people who made our fist stay and now our second stay so enjoyable This stay Andrey of the front desk was a standout helping me set up the initial reservations and then was so helpful when I made some changes As many other reviews pointed out the rooms are larger than most even the bathroom the view of downtown the river etc remarkable My husband is a Hilton Honor member so wifi was free
We are comfortable taking the subway so we are a quick ride to Times Square Central Park Theaters the Met etc More importantly for us the hotel is within walking distance of Tribeca and if we are up for a longer walk or even a very short subway ride we can span across the island and visit Soho the Village Little Italy wonderful nighttime walk and Chinatown a must on a Saturday morning 
This trip we took our nephew a firt visit for him to NYC and we could walk to Battery Park for the traditional tour of Lady Liberty and Ellis Island We enjoy seeing and even running across the Brooklyn Bridge such a stunning engineering accomplishment 
Previous trip I used the fitness center and it was well maintained I have not been to the pool My 21 year old nephew dressed up from a night on the town with us went to the first floor lounge when we returned back to the hotel from dinner The bartender chatted with him about my nephews upcoming life plans and it made for a good Im on my own and finally an adult experience It solidified for my nephew how easy it is to visit NYC and that people ARE friendly

title: Luxury and Value
text: Excellent service from all Concierge was very helpful to these first time DC visitors Housekeeping staff was very stealthy while servicing our room twice daily The bed was comfortable and the room was reasonably sizedwe were there 8 days The bathroom was upscale with quality fixtures stone and glass and plush towels Traveling around town was easy with cabs always at the ready and only 1block to the metro The White House was an easy 3 block walk a nice large park was onehalf block away and there were a variety of eateries within walking distance The food and service in the hotel restaurant was superb One minor inconvenience was the limited drawer space in the room The only negative in our stay was the hotel bar where service was extremely slow and they did not offer frozen drinksdaquri margarita etc

title: Diamond in the Rough
text: We just got back from this wonderful hotel We had 4 kids and two adults and loved it It is brand new and beautiful We had a two bedroom suite with no kitchen The shower had double heads which made it easier to shower more than one child at a time On the weekends they have a nice breakfast homemade waffles muffins bagels juices and coffee There is a computer for your use with no charge There is also a hotel cat that just adds to the whole ambience Although you cant get into the ocean from there it is still a lovely setting Very quiet and quaint The hotel staff is very accommodating and friendly Driving to the hotel I was questioning where we were going but once there it was definitely a fine I would definitely stay here again

title: In our moment of griefSheraton was there to comfort us
text: We made a lastminute reservation with the Sheraton Four Points LAX due to our mother being taken to the hospitaland subsequently being admitted to the Intensive Care Unit We booked a block of three rooms for family members who were taking turns holding roundtheclock vigil by my mothers side The entire staff witnessed 10 family members going in and outexhaustedcryingand at the hotel just long enough for the 2hoursleep shifts we scheduled This went on for 7 long daysnights until out Mother passed away In my 10 years of being a frequent travelerAND staying at every major hotel chainI have never experienced the kindness and accommodation offered to us by everyone we encountered at this Starwood hotel Justin the Manager is exceptional and we thank him and his entire staff from the bottom of our hearts Whenever my family travels  well be staying at Starwood hotelsand when in the Los Angeles areano matter the glitz of other hotels OR the offerwell be at the Sheraton Four Points LAX SheratonYOU and your employees are nothing short of wonderful THANK YOU

title: I love the Ace Hotel
text:
My boyfriend and I have spent many nights at the Ace Hotel over the years and I couldnt be fonder of the place That said we hadnt been there in at least a year when we realized our keys were locked inside my apartment sometime last month It was after midnight and the resident manager had apparently gone to bed so we walked into the Ace and were immediately checked in to a simple room with windows overlooking Wall St at the reasonable nightly rate of 8900 Check in was quick simple and casual 
I was sad to see that the chess board in the lobby was gone but they do have a computer available for guest use and a hip selection of complimentary magazines Our room did not have a private bathroom just a sink The shared bathrooms were clean white and spacious and there was never a line to use them
The complimentary breakfast is quite possibly the best thing about the Seattle Ace Hotel Its self serve available from 611am and delicious The breakfast room is accessible to guests at all hours and is equipped with a snack machine coffee a microwave dishes and a coin op washer and dryer 
There are a couple rooms that are really cool 116 features a spinning glass mirror wall between the bathroom and bedroom as well as a private terrace if I recall correctly and 128 as well as others has a sexy glass wall between the shower and bedroom Many of the rooms feature Shepard Fairey type stencils on the walls and minimal modern furnishings

title: Stylish and New
text:
Arriving in Houston after dark with no reservation we stopped at a few hotels in the Galleria area They were either completely booked or over our budget At the Courtyard we were pleasantly surprised that the price was 99 plus a fee to park that was less than the others For an additional 10 charge we added a hot breakfast for two
The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful both when checking in and out Everything was new squeaky clean and beautifully decorated
The breakfast was a buffet with eggsomelettes prepared to order served on real dishes with real eating utensils

title: The best boutique for the miracle mile
text:
Our family stayed here for two nights in march The hotel is clean friendly and run very professionally The location is right next to nordstroms and within an easy walk of all the miracle mile shops
The doormen were helpful in arranging transport to the museums and the blackhawks game
The rooms are bright quiet and very clean
A lot of the guests were there on business or were from europe with lent itself to a very efficient stay which is what we liked 
The presupper drinks and morning coffee were a treat The restaurant in the hotel has top rated food although skip the coffee for breakfast as it free in the lobby
We shall definitely return and highly recommend this hotel

title: Best location
text: This hotel is just the perfect place You do not have to walk outside to get to the metro The lobby is gorgeous the rooms are fabulous the service is great and the White house is within walking distance So many other sites are within walking distance as well China town is a couple of blocks away and they have many good restaurants at reasonable prices If you are thinking of taking your family to Washington DC this is the hotel to stay at Great spot

title: Mixed review
text: We choose this hotel due to all the Trip Advisor reviews The location is great and the hotel size was just what we were looking for no lines for the elevator or lines for breakfast etc The rooms were clean and spacious and staff very attentive Our only concern was the noise in the roomwe were on the 10th floor but we did not sleep a wink Taking this in consideration that its NYC but we have stayed at other hotels before and we did not hear the street noise like this one Sorry to say we would not stay here again

title: Always welcomed
text: I have stayed at this hotel only three times All three times there hasnt been a line to checkin Moreover two times I was offered a suite and Im only a HH Gold member The executive lounge is well stocked and elegant Great prices last time was under 90 free private shuttle to LAX nice pool and jacuzzis Carls Jrs burgers next door what more do you want

title: good but some minus
text:
stayed there 26 august  4 september
room is clean bed sare good as is bathroom staff is friendly
but the person after the desk is very important 
we recieved a call that there was no more money on the creditcard and that i had made some phonecalls so immediate payment was ordered Going down it was a woman on the desk she saw that the creditcard attached to the room was the wrong one 
 the confirmation for the picking up for the airport person on the desk refused to do it had to make the phonecals ourself After that we saw another person make the phonecalls for the clients 
 halfempty of empty shampoo and douchegel not always replaced
 glasses not always replaced so shortage of glasses when drinking something a the chamber
probably typical of New York but the airco outside made a terrible noise
 something to consider as i was on holiday i did not have my portable with me so the internetaccess in the room was for me useless There are 2 computer available but they charge 8 for 10 minutes The possibility of free internetaccess woudl be nice
Do not expect a wow but it will do

title: Great hotel and even better people
text: Took my girlfriend for the weekend to Philly and was not disappointed The hotel was first class from start to finish and its location is iincredible Service was exact and nothing was too much trouble  kudos to the concierge team for guiding us to the sites and scenes of this great city Room was immaculate and we really enjoyed the cocktail bar Were going back

title: Nice hotel will stay there again
text: Clean rooms free wifi was surprised how close it is to Michigan ave will stay there again for sure I didnt have extra time to do other things Parking garage is right next door Only gripe they should validate the parking fee Other than that no complainants

title: Comfortable but hard to get too
text: We enjoyed our room at the Hyatt Place in Austin very much It was spacious and comfortable The hotel is not however in a convenient location You have to work your way through a maze of highway ramps access roads and city streets and one wrong turn puts you into confusion The hotel advertises itself as being easily accessible to downtown but this is not the case The hotel is not in central Austin but rather in north Austin To get to downtown you have to take I35 which will be a parking lot at rush hour To get back to the hotel you have to work your way through the maze The hotel breakfast was way above average except for the coffee They say it is Starbucks but what we had was weak and tasteless The staff was very helpful and polite We probably will not be back it is just too inconveniently located

title: well located nice hotel
text: Perfect location close to Times Square but in quiet street Very Comfortable room and bed Bathroom something special Staff friendly and helpful Wifi wouldnt work in our room on top floor but good access to computers and printer in lobby Walking distance to good restaurants

title: Fantastic hotel brilliant location
text:
We visited San Francisco for our honeymoon and chose this hotel for its value for money and location  the price we paid for the Donatello was very reasonable compared to a lot of hotels in San Francisco especially in the Union Square area We stayed for 4 nights in total Our room was on the 8th floor and was a lovely spacious room including a fridge coffee machine flatscreen TV safe iron and plenty of storage space There was even a turndown service provided every evening I have noticed a few people commenting on the rooms being noisy due to street noise however during our stay this was not an issue as we barely noticed any noise
All staff were very pleasant and happy to help with any questions we had On the top floor of the hotel was a club lounge which had free tea and coffee a lounge terrace gym and jacuzzi all included in the price of the room We didnt eat in the restaurant however we did visit the bar once and would recommend you go at happy hour as drinks could be pricey outside of then All in all this was a great hotel and if we visit San Francisco again we would definately come back

title: Horrible Should get no star
text: Just needed somewhere to stay for the night while we were in town Expedia set us up with this room over the phone so we had no pictures of the place or anything  We figured a room for 100 dollars would be decent enough to just sleep in We arrive at the motel hoping the rooms look better than the outside of the motel Go inside and we look at each other like REALLy I wouldnt of even paid 50 for this room I didnt feel safe at all here We slept with a chair up against the door The carpet was filthy I didnt even walk on it without shoes The tv had porn on channel 4 It was just a very unpleasant place to stay at I was upset with Expedia that they would even recommend anyone to this hotel  especially after reading all these reviews Yuck  When morning came I was so glad to get out of that hell hole

title: The quality I had come to expect from the Westin is gone
text:
I booked a terrace suite and looked forward to arriving since I was a frequent customer about 3 years ago and my experience was always great Boy was I disappointed The valet team has been changed and they are nonchalent and I finally had to ask them to come over to the car to give me a hand I went inside and the service desk personnel were professional and courteous and so were the bellmen
 I received my room key and went up and the room was clean and neat the Heaven beds are truly heavenly and the complimentary amenities were very nice It was at night that things went wrong It was a cold night for LA and when I tried to turn on the heat in the bedroom it didnt work I called down a guy came up got the fan to work and said it should warm up in a while It didnt Not only that but when I called back he never returned It was like an icicle I called the front desk asked for a floor heater or just extra blankets if they couldnt get it working but they said they had neither and there was nothing they could do but send the guy back up I feel asleep on the living room couch since it was warm in there and if he came I didnt hear him The next morning I was greeted with a cold shower because there was no hot water I was told they were working on the boiler but by 1130 am still no hot water so I took a cold shower and realized the Westin I had known was no more I would have to think long and hard about spending money with the Westin LA anymore and thats sad since I used to be a Gold member

title: Hyatt grand in Downtown
text: Hyatt is grand in Downtown SFO the place is really big and you are very impressed by the first looks Very good to stay for business travelers going to SFO but not that good if you are all alone in the town for the first time

title: Great Place to Stay
text: Overall a great hotel recently built with stylish rooms and a cool bar on the roof overlooking the city Walking distance to the Gaslamp and if you feel you need to walk off the Sunday brunch at the Del you can walk to the Aircraft Carrier museum

title: Great hotel with even better service
text:
This is one of the better Marriott properties that Ive travelled to over the years The hotel was upscale and inviting and the people were terrific This was our anniversary and the staff made every part of the experience great from choosing a great room with a view of the city to sending up a bottle of wine to help us celebrate Probably the most helpful person there was Nash He was always available for assistance no matter what we needed and sent up a great card thanking us for choosing the JW and wishing us a happy anniversary What a great touch
The only negative part of the trip was the loudness of the city Im not sure the hotel could do much there but many times we woke up at 3am with the banging of trash trucks or people on the streets Not sure if better windows would help or not but minor in the scope of things

title: GigaHotel but with good and kind service
text: This is one of the biggest Hyatt Hotels in the US The room is very good and clean Attended to a meeting in the Hotels Convention Center  That is Giga too The elevators get crowed several times during the day due to the peolple attending to the convention center The location is perfect close to all shops and in front of the Chicago Tribune Building Also in front is the pier to the boat sigthseeings  a must in Chicago Cons When checking out there was a fee for receiving packages i had bought a book from amazon when I complained that there was no mention of that in the web site  they just removed it from my bill

title: Good Value for area
text:
I came to stay at this hotel as part of a conference Out of the options available for my conference and checking nearby hotels not part of the conference this hotel is a good value for the price The location is in the financial district but on the border of a not so nice area It is a good location to walk to different places nearby and to get to the BART Also the hotel is a short walk to the cable cars if you want to a nice ride up to Fishermans wharf
The hotel room itself was average The bathroom was a bit outdated I was on the top floor with a view of the hotel pool which can get quite noisy if children are playing in the pool There was also a persistent sound that I relate to hearing an automatic garage door opening and closing at all times was heard from my room I know my room was a couple doors down from their service elevator and the smell of garbage was drafting down the hall during my stay One of the ice machines close to my room was not working which isnt a big deal but I thought Id mention
There is a Starbucks and restaurantbar as part of the hotel I would recommend if youre here for a conference avoid the hotel starbucks hilton honors club members receive free certificates to starbucks which makes it really busy in the mornings There is another Starbucks down a blockor try the Boudins down a couple of blocks for a more San Francisco experience
The service was as expected The staff tried to reduce the lines at check in and tried to help different requests Their emergency guest toiletries spare toothbrush toothpaste etc was a bit sparse but there is a convenient store across the street 
The gym is adequate with updated machines and weights This hotel does have a Supershuttle stop outside with vans leaving frequently without having to make a reservation It also is not difficult to get a taxi from this location
I guess I expected more from this Hilton chain but it was a fine average experience

title: Great hotel solid location
text:
Wandering around unfamiliar cities is one of my favorite traveling pastimes and the area around the Grant is terrificlots of local flavor in the bars and restaurants nearby
The hotel itself was quite nice though they gouged us for parking I also found the room to be a bit on the small side Having written that I would stay here again in a minute Wonderfully comfy beds nice and friendly staff and cool amenities

title: Ideal location
text: We stayed 6 nights at the Rivercenter at the end of November This is a high rise hotel in an excellent location close to the Riverwalk and attached to the Rivercenter Mall It is close to public transport routes and the buses are very good Hertz car rental is in the lobby although it is cheaper to book with them online which we did from the room We had a large room on floor 36 It was clean and had a really comfortable bed There are tea and coffee making facilities although they were not always topped up The bathroom was a good standard but minimal on toiletries for the price You could still hear traffic and noise from the ice machineThe staff are helpful and courteous There is free wifi in the lobby area and Starbucks in the Rivercenter Mall and a UPS post room within the hotel We had one evening meal in the hotel which was of a high standard and reasonable price There is a huge shopping outlet at San Marcos 50 miles away which is good but you need to hire a car to get there The pool area is small but nicely done where you can sit inside or out Towels and cold water provided Easy check in and out

title: Terrible customer service
text: My husband and I stayed for our anniversaryLocation is just ok Water view is a fish pier We had a terrible encounter with security We were not offered any kind of customer satisfactionThe pool was freezing and there was no jacuzzi or hot tub Not a very well run hotel We stay in boston very often and learned a lot staying here Would pay the extra to stay somewhere else

title: Almost perfect everything only avoid the room 222
text: I was there in august 2012 in the hottest period of the year Generally i can say that the hotel and his suites are perfect for stay in DC The rooms are spacious and well equiped clean the bed is perfect the staff is professional Only one thing that left me disappointed The room 222 is looks directly and close to the central aircondition compressor engine And no noise isolation in the window So every 5 minutes the huge compressor starts and you feel in the room like in the diesel engine deck of a big merchant ship Any way if you are enough tired maybe is not a problem but for me it was to noisy This room is simple not fit the general apparence and service level of the hotel maybe they sould be convert it for some other use store for example

title: Palatial as the name suggests Incredible location views service and excellent value
text: I stayed in the hotel with three friends on a holidayshopping trip to New York Friendly helpful staff idyllic views of St Patricks Catheral very spacious bedrooms palatial foyer It is located one block from fifth avenue which makes it ideal for shopping siteseeing and theatre Times Square is within walking distance For us we appeared to get an excellent deal  it was incredible value for money however ithe breakfast appeared overpriced so we ate in a deli two doors from the main door of the hotel I would highly recommend this hotel

title: Nice room sufficient bf and helpful crew
text:
AS we entered the clerk welcomed us with a smile she verified our reservation quickly and we got to the room the elevator was a bit old but it did the job the room was not too modern and you could have seen that the furniture are not new but it was not shabby at all the room and bathroom were clean and tidy and they maintained it every day the breakfast consisted of your regular coffee muffins cereals and boiled eggs  it did the job
when we asked the clerk about places to visit  she willingly offered us a few alternatives and gave us precise directions
the location was central and close to a bus station our rooms window turned to the street so it was a bit noisy but we managed to sleep

title: 10 second walk and BAM youre on Times Square
text: This hotel was literally a 10 second walk and BAM you are on Times Square We payed 300 a night in early November which was the best deal we found for such a great location There are two entrances to the hotel the main entrance on 44th street and the back entrance on 45th street which is handy depending on which end of NYC your coming from We stayed in a superior room which is just a standard room but bigger and on a higher floor The hotel seem a little out dated but had been renovated so it looked nice but it wasnt all nice and shiny new like a new hotel Over all we plan to go back to NYC and stay here again it was such a good location and nice hotel

title: Clean and met expectations
text: The rooms at the Intercontinental are spacious and immaculate Im a clean freak and it passed my standards with flying colors We stayed there after a few days at the Cape and welcomed the Metropolitan feel of the hotel The bathrooms are lovely and the sheets are soft The room was cleaned quickly each day The bar and restaurants outside are delightful to spend time in The bellman and the doormen are warm and welcoming but the rest I the staff needs some warmth training They are almost stoic It seems to be much more o a business hotel but was close to Quincy market and the aquarium which served our needs fine The gym is top notch for a hotely only complaint was it was a bit sterile and cold If thats my only complaint they are doing a good job

title: Great suites and personalized service
text: I stayed here for my brothers funeral It was a tough time because I had lost my son three weeks before The staff was so accomodating Will and Ray were so nice and the staff behind the desk were very kind The free full breakfast was good dinner at the Courtyard was too Coffee tea and hot chocolate were served all day All around my experience was terrific

title: A great downtown bargain
text:
This hotel was clean moderately priced with modern amenities and a larger that usual room for a downtown hotel The staff was friendly and helpful The breakfast was delicious with a variety of hot and cold items The free wifi was wonderful and also a rarity in downtown hotels it seems The hotel is a convenient walk to all downtown attractions and a short bus or subway ride to the historical district or the the University district in West Philadelphia Buy transportation tokens at a discount a block and a half away on Market street It was also a short few blocks walk to the train station for the ride out to the airport
Nearby 13th street was a wonderful location for restaurant and happy hour hopping

title: Nice Location but tiny room and bathroom
text: Just off 5th ave I liked location very much However the bathroom was very tiny If you are solo thats fine but 2 people no place to put your bags The staff were very nice though

title: It was a Super 8 and it still feels like one
text: It recently changed ownership and went from Super 8 to Ramada Its a blight on the Ramada chain What made me the most upset is that the picture they show makes it look like a nice hotel from the front They have the word HOTEL really big on top What they dont show is that the majority of the rooms are MOTEL style and not hotel We were in the way back in a building on a slope Second floor with no elevator and many steps No offer to help with luggage No offer to help with anything really It looked like they slapped a coat of paint on it and maybe bought new very hard beds The blanket inadequate was stained The windows dont have screens so I wasnt comfortable opening it to air out the room The ice machine as listed on their ammenities flyer was not to be found at all in my group of buildings and you had to walk down a sloping parking lot to the main building The fitness room had 5 machines and the bike didnt work They advertise a shuttle service but never mentioned one and when I asked they said to get downtown was by taxi or local bus Theres a nice espresso barcafe across the street but when I asked about any local restaurants they said the only thing is their own restaurant yet their website lists over a dozen restaurants It was very misleading and since I didnt have a car I was stuck there after returning from my business downtown My advise is to stay away unless you want to stay at a newly painted Super 8 Motel

title: Fall asleep to jack hammers and construction and pay a premium for it
text: The location of the hotel is great for being in viewing distance of the World Trade Center construction site unfortunately that closeness also includes listing to the TNT explosions and jack hammering of site preparation The hotel provided no advance warning that the Superior room with View meant a view of a construction site and listening from 600 AM to 1030 PM to construction sounds Once we arrived to checkin we were provided with notice unfortunately a bit late to make better reservations We were accommodated with one room change reluctantly The self service kiosks were also not working for checkin and at checkout had to use two of them

title: Brand New Hotel
text:
I had a great stay at this hotel Since the hotel has been open only a month everything was spotless in the room which was a little small but they managed to get a lot in the room The king bed was very comfortable and there were two bedside tables HDTV and a chair and ottoman The bathroom was a good size and spotless The free wireless worked well
I was on the seventh floor directly above the entrance and could see the upper portion of the Empire State Building above the building across the street 31st Street is not very exciting but in just a block or two you are at Herald Square and another block or so at Penn Station I ate every morning in the restaurant and enjoyed the breakfast choices
I definitely will consider staying here on my next trip It is super convenient if you fly into JFK as you can take the train to Penn Station and then easy walk to the hotel

title: Recently stayed at the Colonnade I must
text: Recently stayed at the Colonnade I must say I was extremely impressed with the staff and overall appearance of the hotel It is obvious that the employees put their customer first and they take every opportunity to ensure your stay is the best it can be First rateThe rooms look like they have been recently renovated I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to family and friends

title: Clean and Cheap  very hard bed
text: Very friendly helpful staff I had reserved the room online so we had a quick check in The motel was full so we had the choice of a second floor room or a wheelchair accessible room on the first floor We choose the first floor room It was a smoking room and we are not smokers The smoke smell was not so bad that we could not stay in the room and it was very clean However being that this motel gets a lot of visitors the double mattresses seemed flat They were very hard and my husband and I did not sleep well We woke up stiff and achy

title: Fine Hotel in a Fine Location But NO Breakfast
text:
This convention style hotel is located in the Back Bay It is conveniently located two blocks from the TGreen Line Prudential Station making for quick trip in and back to Logan Airport for only  2 each way and avoiding the rush hour traffic that would have made trip twice as long The room was newly redecorated with a comfortable bed and the 15th floor offered a nice view of the Bay
Check in was quick and that is not always the case when conventioneers show all at once
The location is a couple blocks from Boylston and Newbury Streets with plenty of top notch restaurants and shops Really a great neighborhood There is a large shopping mall that you can get to without going outside
The one thing that I could not understand was why there was no breakfast restaurant Everybody had to leave the hotel for breakfast or go with the coffee pastry yogurt etc from the kiosk type food services
I would recommend this hotel for the convention trade If I were on my own I would consider the Lennox on Boylston St

title: Great hotel at a great price
text: First time at theWit Traveled with a group of 3 couples from Hartfordefficient check in friendly staff clean and quiet rooms everything is new and fresh great breakfast and best of all a very reasonable price for a big city hotel Would recommend it highly

title: Old and Tired
text:
Booked two junior suites for family weekend at famed Parker House Hotel 
Arrived to find no doorman or bellmen in sight
Both suites were on the 2nd floor both overlooking a building under construction approximately 5 feet from the windows Hotel entrances are surrounded by scaffolding for repairs No mention of construction on the website
In my search for electric outlets found significant layers of dust behind furniture Hallways are poorly lighted walls are in major need of paint job and carpet is filthy
High speed internet is very slow
These junior suites each had 19 televisions  smallest that i have seen at any hotel in at least 15 years
Took a trolley tour of Boston and saw any number of hotels far superior in location quality and price
This oncefamous hotel has seen better days

title: A Great Holiday Inn
text:
For what it is this Holiday Inn certainly gets the job done Great location walking distance to pretty much everything in town helps that Philly is an extremely walkable city 
The rooms are large and clean bathroom is a little small but it sure isnt a dealbreaker The staff were helpful and friendly The free wifi was a great deal
Parking is 21 a day which might seem outrageous at first but for the in and out privilege and looking at the prices around nearby hotels it really isnt so bad
A well run hotel all around

title: Wasnt that crazy about the neighborhood but it was okay
text:
We stayed here for one night since we were flying out of SD Intl Airport at 630 AM The fact that it seemed to be convenient to a bunch of stuff down in this area of town might be of importance to you it wasnt to us Lots of stuff in walking distance though  right like anybody walks in SoCal
Thought it was pretty wack that they had signs up all over the place crowing about the fact that they change the bed linens for EVERY GUEST Really Has it gotten commonplace that ALL hotels dont do that Pretty creepy if you ask me
This place was a pretty good place to stay only had one gripe  if you need an airport shuttle make sure their schedule is going to work for you As close as they are to the airport having one ride per hour may be convenient for them but if you have a 630 AM flight it gives you a choice of going at 430 AM or 530 AM Cool just what I wanted get to sit at the airport that extra half hour at 5 AM
The room was good pretty large and adequately equipped Really liked the hot Otis Spunkmeyer cookies at the front desk mmmmm The neighborhood looked a little dicey but on the other hand if youre wanting to spend some quality time at the World Famous Body Shop stripclub its real convenient for that Just saying

title: Served its purpose for half the nightsmoke smell woke us up for the other half
text: This seemed to be an average hotel upon arriving We went swimming and then to bed At 430 we woke up to a horrible smokeburning smell Needless to say we didnt sleep the rest of the night because we were worried that wed all burn up We called the front desk around 500 and they said it must just be the oven However the hallway and downstairs didnt smell at all So Im not sure how it could be the oven When youre on a roadtrip you need a good nights sleep I would have enjoyed sleeping the ENTIRE night

title: Worst hotel experience
text:
One of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had
I was in Dallas on business and reluctantly booked the Anatole after previous negative experience with a reservation not honored
I arrived at 11AM and they did not have a room available so we checked our bags and they told us that as soon as our requested room was available king bed no smoking they would put it aside for us So we went to work and returned to the hotel in the evening There was no room set aside for us and we were told we got the last available room However we were put in a smoking room on a smoking floor and were told there were no other choices because they were sold out The managers refused to meet with us or speak with us We spent FIVE nights in the most rancid smoke infested room When I got home and unpacked everything I own including the suitcase was smoke infested I also received zero satisfaction from customer service after my stay they do not care

title: We have stayed here several times and every time it is a wonderful experience
text: Great clean affordable place in a perfect location

title: Excellence has a new meaning  Boston Harbor Hotel
text:
I recently booked a small group at the Boston Harbor Hotel I will admit that this particular group although small in size is extremely high maintenance and are generally a challenge to every hotel There were many changes and special requests prior to arrival that required me to speak with hotel employees from several departments My prearrival conversations and email correspondence were attended to timely and professionally but also with a refreshingly sincere friendliness 
Upon arrival I was prepared for some of the numerous requests to have fallen through the cracks but every single thing I had arranged was in place Additionally the staff in the various departments followed up with me personally during my stay to ensure their particular departments were responsive to our needs and even suggested things I had not yet considered talk about anticipating your guests needs
 The hotel itself is lovely and located in an excellent location The amenities are well above average and the restaurant alone is worth a flight to Boston however it was the warm reception each of my attendees received coupled with the consistent high level of service from every single employee we encountered that will have book ONLY at this hotel in Boston Really an amazing experience

title: Best service EVER at a hotel
text: We only stayed for one night but it was wonderful I had to call the hotel a few times before we arrived and every time anyone who answered was so accomodating Robin and Jorge who work the front desk are wonderful They went above and beyond to do whatever it took to make our stay fabulous The next morning we needed to check out but werent flying out until late that night They helped us plan our entire day and even let us keep our bags behind the front desk while we went sightseeing When we returned they had called a car to take us to the airport I plan to return to San Fran and will never stay anywhere else

title: Just handy for work but generally poor hotel
text:
I have stayed at the Hilton Post Oak three times so far its handy for walking to the office and is chosen by the company I work for so I cant be fussy but the place itself lacks character rooms need refurbishment they are not very clean carpets are worn out and stink
Air con blows cold air on your head as the beds are just close to the vent so you end up turning it off and sweat during the night
Staff at reception are rude and snobbish however the waiting on staff are brilliant and the buffet breakfast is very good

title: Budget hotel at a good location Slightly overpriced
text:
We stayed for one night at this hotel We chose this based on its location  the cheapest available in the area 
Location Excellent Five minutes to the downtown shopping district about 15 minutes from Pikes Place Market However there is a gentlemens club at the back side of the hotel and the area may not be that safe to walk around late at night
Amenities Exercise room is minimal but equipment is functional No cleaning agent for wiping down the machines after use though
Room Old but adequate The bath tub is really narrow and small Problems with dialing outside calls Complimentary internet access but the wire wire only no wifi is very very short and is awkwardly located in between two beds I couldnt put my laptop on a desk and had to kneel down to work with my lap top very inconvenient
Like LOCATION
Dislike Across from Gentlemens Club feeling a bit unsafe to talk around at night

title: Ive always been a skeptic but
text: The Hampton Downtown is a great place to stay not only for the value but the service is excellent We are always skeptical when we read reviews and so that is why I decided that I needed to provide input on this hotel because we had a very positive experience First of all the hotel is a price value considering it is within walking distance to the cruise ships restaurants the ocean etc etc The rooms are very nice and well maintained The staff is excellent Their shuttle service is VERY accommodating and the breakfast buffet is yummie Not only did the staff go out of their way for us during our stay but they allowed us to store our luggage on our return from the cruise week Our flight didnt leave San Diego until 6PM We got off the cruise ship around 930 am and the hotel picked us up stored our luggage while we toured San Diego for the day and then drove us to the airport We were very impressed and will DEFINITELY stay there again when we return to San Diego PS Yes the train does come through the area but it really isnt as bad as some have reported in the reviews We were on vacation and a little noise from a train wasnt going to bother us The positive to this is that you can go all over San Diego from the train shuttle

title: FIRST CLASS SERVICE
text:
Seven girlfriends and I stayed at the Aloft on our way to a cruise we were catching in Jacksonville
There was an airport shuttle and it was so fast and efficient
The hotel was modern and very cool
Walkable to restaurants and last minute itmes
Being near the airport it is used a lot but very clean
Quiet and even has a pool
I bookeds the room on Priceline and got a GREAT deal
I cannot say enough about the desk staff They were so friendly and accomodating

title: Great location for a 7 night stay highly recommended
text:
We originally chose the Empire Hotel based on its proximity to Central Park since we were on our honeymoon for a week we didnt want to be in the busy centre of Manhattan the whole time On our arrival we were helped with our bags by the bellman straight away and Miriam made our checkin quick and easy at the front desk She was a credit to the hotel giving us plenty of friendly advice on local sights Throughout our stay we found all of the staff to be nothing short of friendly professional and courteous
Our room a deluxe king was exceptionally clean and wellmaintained with a great view On the 8th floor it was away from the noise of the lobby and the rooftop bar and the sound of the street We had 7 nights of great sleep even with the window open We didnt know what to expect of the room before we came having read many reviews that the rooms were small but ours was a great size for the two of us If you want a bigger room you cant expect to pay for a standard queen and get a large suite
The Empire Hotel is in the perfect location for exploring Central Park visiting the Lincoln Center and getting into downtown Manhattan its only a twenty minute walk from Times Square in fact When theres a Whole Foods at Columbus Circle a fiveminute walk you cant beat the location for convenience
Wifi in the lobby area is complementary and If your flight isnt until later in the day on your day of checking out theres a free luggage storage room This was great for us as our flight wasnt until 7pm that evening
Wed definitely come back if we chose to visit New York again

title: overpriced and over rated
text: Stayed here for 2 nights and that was too long They didnt accept our Travelex card for payment whereas every other hotel had been happy to accept it We have two children so we wanted to drop our luggage off and then head off to Universal Studios We didnt get back to our room until about 9pm When our son tried to go for a shower we found we couldnt adjust the temperature as the handle was broken We called reception expecting that someone would come fairly quickly but we had to phone again over half an hour later by which time wed had to shower our kids with cold water as they just couldnt stay awake any longer Also the shower was so smallwe could barely turn around it didnt seem clean and the shower nozzle was so low we couldnt wash our hair The next morning we asked them to fix the shower and I told them wed had to put up with cold showers but got absolutely no recognition that this mattered When running a so called up market establishment we would expect prompt service a warm shower that was usable and to feel that every customer was important After travelling from Australia we were tired and not having a clean usable shower was extremely disappointing especially considering the high price of our room Would never recommend this hotel or stay there again

title: Consistently a great experience
text: We typically stay here the night before an early morning flight out of the airport and normally using out Marriott rewards points The staff could not be more accommodating and welcoming We have stayed at JW Marriotts and Ritz Carltons and have not gotten the same service Rooms are beautiful and always very clean the bar is a great place to unwind and the concierge lounge has a most adequate breakfast to get us started Cudos to the management of this hotel as it is always a welcoming respite for us

title: Great central location
text: Stayed 4 nights from 12 May 2008 Arrived just before 530pm which proved timely for the daily wine reception Staff were friendly and helpful room well decorated although the bed was a bit on the shortish side for a tall person like me 63 Last 2 days we were in San Fran were stinking hot no air con in room but we were out all day and slept fine at night with the window open and ceiling fan on Good central location away from the noisy wharf and with good access to public transport Ate in the restaurant one night which was good Overall an enjoyable stay

title: Very nice hotel but not perfect
text:
Most stuff about this hotel was fantastic I liked the rooms the bed the shower and amenities the breakfast and I think the bar was good too though expensive if I remember 
We only experienced two problems First when we arrived to check in we were asked if we could wait until 7 pm as they had a large group to check in In return they offered us breakfast coupons for each day we stayed there When we returned to check in that evening the person checking us in knew nothing about it So we had to argue for a bit and wait until that person could contact the person who had checked us in My wife was more annoyed than I as she would not have agreed to check in later without getting a substantial return for it being tired from the trip It did get sorted out later and we received what they had promised 
The pool was also closed while we stayed though they had made arrangements with another hotel for us to use their pool 
Without those two experiences which I assume most travellers wouldnt have I would definitely give this a full 55

title: One of the best so far
text:
My wife and I have just returned from a five night stay at the Crowne Plaza Manhattan starting on the 26th of May 2008 and I have to say we were very impressed by this hotel Although the hotel is currently under renovation our stay was by no means interrupted by the work being carried out We have stayed in some of the big named hotels in New York and this was by far one of the best We arrived at the hotel at 230 in the afternoon and had to wait approx 30 mins for our room to be made up as the check in time is 300 pm When you enter the lobby you need to take the lift to the first floor as this is were the reception area isThe rooms were extremely spaciousvery clean and also had air conditioning Fresh towels were provided and the room was cleaned each day of our stay For location it dont get much better than this The view from our room was amazing looking out on to Times Square and also on to the Hudson river All the Broadway theatres nice restaurants shops and the NY information centre are within walking distance of this hotel The only thing I would fault the hotel on is their Wifi acess in the rooms Firstly for the daily cost of 20 and also the signal strenght was very poor It was like trying to connect using dail up  Very Slow  But this was only a minor issue I would highly recommmend this hotel to anyone looking for good hotel in central manhattan Thank you Crowne Plaza for a very pleasant stay I have posted some pics of our room for everyone to see
J  J

title: Service exceeded my expectations
text: Im here on business  have stayed here since November of last year The staff goes ABOVE  BEYOND to make sure my stay is pleasant Everyone from the GM to the cleaning staff is very friendly  eager to help in any way I may need I highly recommend this hotel

title: Great Hotel
text: My girlfriend and I had a great stay at this hotel The roof top bar was amazing and we couldnt of asked for better accommodations

title: The roof top bar
text:
Beautiful viewnice atmosphere
Beware of the tip being added in by servershe gave herself a tipwe were a group of six and were surprised that she closed out the card and when we received the copy to sign she had already given herself a very generous tip
Be sure to ask about the give yourself a tip clause

title: Expectations Met
text: My husband and I booked a room impromptu and stayed in a 2 Queen room with our 12 yr old son Upon arrival we were told that we could use the Valet Service or choose self parking in the attached garage for 28night we chose to self park which was actually great Check in was very smooth We were greeted immediately and completed the process within a few minutes Our room was on the 19th floor and situated in the center of the building the view was amazing of downtown Indy The accommodations were lovely with modern furnishings WIFI large flat screen television upper scale bath amenities robe safe feather pillows etc One thing that stood out for me was that the room felt very peacefulwarm and comforting We enjoyed the Starbucks located on the 2nd floor and the connection to the Convention Center which allowed us to navigate to Circle Centre Mall without ever stepping outdoorson a very rainy day That was a wonderful convenience Loved it and would definitely choose to stay again

title: Gorgeous
text: Gorgeous hotel Great service worth every penny Free lemonade iced tea water cookies fruit Right on the beach They had turn down service at night so free chocolates too We had a partial oceanview which included a little parking lot but a surprisingly great view of the ocean all the same The water there had big waves but the beach was great The only downside is that you are pretty secluded not a ton to do aside from the poolbeach in the area but there is happy hour at the pool everyday The pier nearby is just a hotel and a lot of shops in the surrounding area are closed But overall a great stay  I would make a point of staying there next time

title: If it werent for my business meetings I would have never had a reason to leave the hotel
text: My colleagues and I had some work to do down in San Diego over the weekend but also wanted to stay somewhere where we could enjoy the nightlife after our work was done the Hard Rock had it all After our work was done we enjoyed ourselves at the pool bar in some unseasonably warm weather After a few drinks at the pool we headed back to our suite with a balcony overlooking the main street and rested up a bit while enjoying our iPod music through the rooms speaker system The shower and bathroom were separated which made it easy for me and my colleagues to get ready quicker than usual Although we decided to eat somewhere else many restaurants walking distance from the hotel the hotel has a Nobu Sushi Restaurant downstairs as well as a late night diner for those after hour cravings After a quick bite we headed to the Hard Rocks multilevel club and enjoyed some of the amazing San Diego nightlife that we had heard so much about Aside from the cutting edge design features and amazing amenities the Hard Rock San Diego has to offer the staff was as friendly as can be from the concierge all the way up to the GM Craig Martin I will definitely stay here again next time Im in town and urge anyone that wants to experience all that the San Diego Gaslamp Quarter has to offer to stay here as well

title: Top Notch hotel in every way
text: We also mentioned it was our anniversary 30th for us and received the same goodies  Very nice touch The room on the harbor side 14th floor  was incredible Our experience with spa services was also exceptional The hotels location is great for sightseeing and shopping at Quincy Market

title: Great for Business
text: Stayed at the hotel Monaco this past week while in Chicago for a conference My room was large the bed was comfortable the water pressure in the shower was good One nice thing is the shower head is set HIGH no need to duck your head to get wet here Not much in the way of views from my 8th floor room but the window was large and let in enough light The hotel is near the EL and is right between the loop and N Michigan easy to walk to either

title: Perfect for 6 year olds up to 16
text:
Just returned from 5 nights with my wife and 2 daughters 7 and 10 What a perfect place for the family We are a very active family and this was perfect for us Tennis golf and hiking close by 
Excercise in the AM and hit the pool about 11am Lunch at the pool for the kids is 5 for a Cheeseburger Chicken Tenders or Quesadilla  great deal My wife and I like to have some beers during the day and we brought our own cooler to the pool each day Great Happy Hour from 46 every night with half price drinks and Sushi in main lobby area  did that daily Complimentary laundry was nice 
We used points for our stay room rate was 400 a night Great place to use points with the kids not a place to use points without the kids I would not pay 400 of my own money to stay Instead find a condo unit to rent across the street at Marriott Canyon Villas that gives you full priviledges at the hotel pools Probably get one for 15003000 for a week depending on time of year
The Blue Sage is a satisfactory place to eat breakfast lunch dinner I would pay the 25 resort fee per day gives you access to tennis golf driving range and free meals for the kids at Sage each day per each full paid entree 
Roys on site is overrated 
I have stayed at many Marriotts all over the US and abroad this is probably one of the nicest

title: Not really downtown
text:
This hotel is in excellent shape The renovations are finished and the final product is nice and comfortable We found the room spacious and everything was clean The breakfast was good and the employees friendly even with a 6 am maintenance call because I couldnt get the hairdryer to work which turned out to be operator error
The only bad thing about this hotel is the location granted its actually affordable so I would stay again but the Downtown part is misguided It is a quick walk to the monorail which will take you downtown but it is not in downtown Seattle

title: Spacious room ideal location
text: Excellent hotel Spacious rooms very clean great view if you choose upper floor Workout facility was bright clean with good equipment and pool was perfect for early morning indoor swim Staff was professional pleasant and sincere in wanting to ensure a comfortable stay Location is ideal for walking to Back Bay Boston Commons or Newbury Street Would definitely choose to stay at Westin Copley Place again

title: Comfortable inviting and responsive
text: While the room was starting to show its age with a dulling carpet and wellused shower head the room was spacious clean and quiet and the housekeeping staff quickly replaced the dead batteries in my TV remote and the burned out lightbulb in the bathroom I was pleased to see energyefficient CFL bulbs in all the lamps and the bed was the exceptionally comfortable When I inquired as to complimentary upgrades I gladly accepted a poolview room The selection of available restaurants onpremises was convenient but betterpriced options are available for those willing to make a short walk

title: Better than expected
text: the hotel was bright and clean the rooms were big and clean and hotel staff were very nice The hotel was walking distance to the Joe Louis Arena and lots of restaurants nearby I was very happy and would stay again

title: Excellent hotel with top quality service great restaurant fun penthouse bar
text: I would highly recommend staying at Dream in NYC Without asking I received a free upgrade from a single to a double The room was immaculately clean the sheets were white and crisp and I did check for those rumored bed bugs that everyone says are haunting NYC hotels The bathroom was also lovely The only convenience missing was a 2 cup coffee maker I will definitely stay there again in the future We had a delicious meal right at the hotel restaurant Italian reasonably priced and an afterdinner drink in the penthouse bar which has a remarkable view of the city Very memorable and reasonably priced for NYC

title: SFO Hilton Finance
text: Stayed here many times over the years on business Great location next to China Town with many shops and restaurants Hotel restaurant is a good choice for breakfast and for a cheaper selection the mom and pop restaurant next door for breakfast ans lunch

title: Great hotel friendly staff
text: I was here with a group from work while we put on a conference here All of the hotel staff were extremely helpful and aided us in having one of our most successful conferences ever The AV staff banquet staff front desk staff EVERYONE was so helpful and friendly The conference rooms were very well suited to our needs kept clean and refreshed often The location was great and allowed us to explore downtown easily in the little down time we did have The rooms were lovely with a large desk for working and cozy reading chairs too The sink was actually a bit noisy in my room sometimes but that was my only complaint in my week stay This was simply the best business travel experience Ive had

title: Not worth the money
text: We consider ourselves to be openminded hip young parents so we thought it would be fun to try this place with our kids ages 5 and 8 We live in the Bay area and have stayed at other boutique hotels in San Francisco but liked the area where this hotel is located and the appeal of the art We were sadly sadly disappointedfirst at the reception when we arrived The front desk doesnt have a welcoming attitude at all We were barely acknowledged and were told that we wouldnt know which room we would have until 300 pm we booked this 2 days prior with a staff member When we got the room key and saw that the room was right there in the lobby area facing the street we asked for another room I asked if there were other rooms for us to choose from the flat answer was no all the rooms are booked but that wasnt trueas we later heard at 100 am when a passerby was able to book a room on the spotThe room was located on the 2nd floorvery noisy noisy noisyfacing the street listening to any and all conversations outside the hotel as well as in the lobby The room itself looks outdated Putting IKEAish furniture doesnt make it clean or cool For the same price try a Joie de Vivre boutique hotelbetter service better attitude better rooms better breakfast

title: New Years Eve Disaster
text: I took my boyfriend to the Hyatt Regency as a Christmas gift I wanted to spend two nights including New Years Eve at a luxurious hotel Knowing how gorgeous Hyatts can be  particularly the Grand Hyatt in DC where I had wanted to stay  I assumed this one would be just as beautiful We were in for an unpleasant surprise the outside of the building makes it look like a cheap motel the facade is grungy and dismal Though the lobby was nice enough and the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable there were more problems The cleaning people did not replace our towels the second day and they did not provide us with new bottles of water The worst part of our stay came on New Years Eve  just past midnight Due to a computer glitch all guests of the hotel were locked out of their rooms Chaos broke out with the 500 Asian professionals group who were ANYTHING but professional when they could not get into their rooms The rowdy guests were drunk and fighting smoking in the elevators and running like crazy people all over the hotel They set a fire alarm off at 130 am The Hyatt staff did not have an appropriate way of dealing with the glitch There was just one person who could unlock the rooms so it took hours before every guest could get to bed It was an absolute circus Though not the Hyatts fault the computer glitch the way that they handled the crisis was terrible We were also annoyed that they hadnt told us that a rowdy group of hundreds of 2025yearolds would be staying in the hotel I would not stay at this particular Hyatt ever again Bad memories

title: They wowd us
text:
Check into one of their suites and enjoy all that New York has to offer 
Let Alan and Venessa take care of threstaurants and theatres 
Rooms are large and luxurious
Staff is attentive and courteous 
All together they helped make our January breakation very special

title: Great Market Center Renovation
text:
Our competitive cheer teams from Oklahoma CityTulsa and Midwest City stay here annually during Nationals for the National Cheerleader Association This spring we were there during their renovation Despite the awkward checkin the service was great 
We stayed there during Thanksgiving holiday Wowthe newly designed lobby common areas and atrium are chic
I appreciated the friendly breakfast staff The new flooring in the dining area looks awesome
The TV console in living area provides great storage for the kids thingsThe curtains provide great room darkening I actually sleptin 
Great space for family

title: Wow what a fantastic hotel
text:
We arrived after a 6 hour drive to be greeted by very friendly staff to then be told that they had upgraded our room We were very impressed with the staff the room is lovely clean and quiet We are very glad that we booked with the Conrad
The concierges are very very helpful and extremely pleasant to deal with
Would definitely come back and stay if we are ever in Chicago again

title: My new favourite San Francisco hotel
text:
I had the pleasure of staying at the St Regis for 4 nights while attending a convention at the adjacent Moscone Center The San Francisco Museum of Modern Art is next door Union Square Market St and the Ferry BuildingFarmers Market are within walking distance The hotel deserves high praise for its location design style technology amenities and especially its service 
The St Regis and Luxury Collection are the Starwood groups high end chains Having stayed 3 times at the wonderful St Regis New York and having visited the St Regis Monarch Beach CA and Washington DC I was looking forward to my stay here and at a convention group rate to boot
The hotel is about 2 years old and located on the corner of Mission and 3rd Directly on the corner the facade of a historic 8 story building was preserved and a high rise tower was integrated behind beside and above it on what once was a parking lot The hotel occupies the first 20 floors of the tower the top 20 or so floors are St Regis residences Within the older building are the hotels 2 restaurantsAme dinner on the first floor and Vitrine breakfast and lunch on the 4thas well as the 2 level spa and offices There is a landscaped terrace on the roof and another larger terrace on the 4th floor which was tented for an outdoor dinner party when I was there The lobby in the newer building is compact but stylish and welldesigned A design feature of rose petals is echoed throughout the public areas
Our convention rate was for the superior room category on the lower floors 58 so I was pleasantly surprised when I was upgraded to a deluxe roomsame size but on a higher floor 15 I also was able to check in early My room looked similar to the photos posted on 1106 by a TripAdvisor member from Sunnyvale CA My room faced west with a view of Yerba Buena Gardens Moscone and points beyond The east facing rooms face the Bay but several employees told me the views are often obstructed by the high rise office buildings of the Financial District
