The room itself was not too large but contemporary and sleek The entry foyer had a table wooden floor sculpture and leather walls There was another wood wall hanging in the bedroom The bedside table held the St Regis signature phonecomputer that can control the thermostat lights window shades alarm clock etc via a touch screen There were 2 desk chairs and an easy chair but no chaise lounge or fainting chair as seen on the hotel web site There was a large marble window ledgegreat for counter space One wall held the 42 flat screen TV which did not swivel and 3 recessed doorsone was a too small closet only about 2 feet of space another held a safe fax machine out of ink and 3 drawers the third held the minibar and fridge and DVDCD player The spacious bath had an enclosed WC a tub that opened onto the bedroom a separate shower stall with marble bench rain head plus handheld head There was a 2nd flat screen TV but only one sink In the room and bath there were not enough places to hang clothes or towels
Technological glitches included 2 remotes did not work but were quickly repaired batteries With the phonecomputer the party I was speaking to occasionally could not hear me though I could hear them The hotel turned this glitch into an example of great service when I requested a wakeup call and the operator called twice but could not hear me so she sent someone up immediately to give me a personal wake up call at the door Alas the phone still was acting up on check out day 
Overall service was top notchquick courteous and professionalespecially the front desk and housekeeping The problem of a constantly barking dog in the next room was handled well and with many apologies The doormen were not so attentiveoften talking with the valets No one helped me when I walked up with my luggage when first checking in Some of the concierge staff while helpful were a bit aloof I believe all the St Regis offer Butler Service In New York this is quite formal but seems less so here One Butler I spoke to on the phone was rather unprofessionalwhen she couldnt answer my question she yelledasked another employee without putting me on hold so I could hear every thing
The public facilities include a medium sized fitness center open 24 hours with the friendliest staff and a wonderful indoor infinity lap pool also open 24 hours The whirlpool steam room and sauna are within the spaall are on the small side The Business Center consists of 2 computers and one printer squeezed into a 3rd floor alcove by the elevators This may be a temporary location
Regarding the sound of sirens mentioned in other reviewsyes you can hear them but I imagine the other nearby hotelsW Four Seasons Westin Marriottcan as well
I have stayed at a few other highend hotels herethe Ritz Carlton Campton Place the Palace I would like to one day try the Four Seasons and the Mandarin Oriental but for now the St Regis is my favourite San Francisco hotel

title: Really good position
text: The location is excellent for exploring the city in a few minutes you can get to Fishermans Wharf or Ghirardelli Square the Hotel is also very close to two terminals of cable cars The hotel is not bad the staff is nice there is a large car park for a fee Room is quite and clean even though the view of the inner courtyard is not exactly the best The room price is quite high though in line with San Francisco prices The wifi is free of charge while breakfast is extra All in all our stay was positive

title: Just blown off
text: We arrived on Dec 27th and left December 31 and were booked in room 12225 We could not view the Pay per view movie and I called the front desk to asked them to fix it We were charged for the movie and spent the rest of our visit with a television that did not work properly I was informed by the operator that 50 of all televisions were inoperative I also complained that the exaust fan in the bath room did not work This caused a lot of steam as well as the room heating up The vanity faucet leaked and there was quite a bit of mold behind it The toilet ran constantly and many times I had to remove the lid to secure the flapper valve The room was not cleaned properly every day because twice our ice bucket was left without a new bag and water in the bottom of it In addition the window lock was broken and the batteries in the safe needed to be changed because once I could not get into it The front desk did send someone up thenbut they never changed them That was the only time the front desk sent anyone For what we paid we should have gotten better service and a better room

title: What Happened Here
text:
Spent 5 nights at the Lenox The location is superb Refurbishments to the rooms were evident Beds were ok Linens were very good Air conditioning controls left alot to be desired in 92 degree weather 
Service was below average room service unavailable at peak times 
Advertised bars  cafes Sam AdamsUpstairs Breakfast Cafe were not there When I booked this was listed as one of the Small Luxury Hotel members Having stayed at other Small Luxury Hotels SLH I expected more in comfort service and hotel amenities

title: Ramada Inn better than expected
text:
We recently mid April stayed 4 nights at Ramada Inn and were pleasantly surprised bearing in mind some previous reviews Seems to be having a facelift and is looking good so far  our room was freshly painted and the bathroom was new We had a fridge and microwave too  handy for purchases made at the Farmers Market Close to the Metro with several people offering assistance with ticketing and directions although we did use taxis at night Caught train to Universal Studios and upgraded to A list front of line ticket so no waiting in queues  still cheaper than taking a tour and meant we saw everything LA was hot during the day and cold at night so be prepared 
The staff very friendly and helpful We would definitely stay there again as excellent value Also there is a good budget Chinese Restaurant across the road

title: Good hotel in a good location
text:
This hotel is convienently located from the transportation centre We arrived there from the airport and was pleased to find the hotel so near We also used the bus service from here to the Stockyards which was ideal for us
We did not realise the historical nature of the hotel until we arrived It is very close to the Convention Centre and our room overlooked this 
The room itself was a standard Hilton room nothing extraordinary but functional This was great for us as we spent most of our time out and about in Fort Worth There is also a Starbucks within the hotel if needed The staff were friendly and helpful greeting us with a cheery hello each time we passed That was a nice touch which is not always found within this hotel chain
We did not partake in the breakfast at the hotel but there are other places nearby where you can get a variety of breakfast options
All in all we enjoyed our stay and the hotel served our purposes of having somewhere to lay our heads whilst sightseeing A functional hotel room with air conditioning clean room and clean bathroom

title: Great location and price
text: Wonderful central location to Times Square and the theater district clean and tidy

title: Not as bad as the other reviews lead me to believe
text:
We live in the Columbus Ohio area and wanted to take our kids 6 and 3 for a short staycation The kids always love Kalahari but we didnt want to drive the 25 hours each wayand part of the lure of Kalahari is the outdoor activities as well So we decided to go to Fort Rapids However after reading all the reviews I was more than hesitant 
Generally speaking the hotel and waterpark are just fineas long as you arent expecting something upscale The hotel room was a bit dated and does need repairs If not careful the water in the bathroom came out scalding hot but that could be managedbetter than no hot water The bathroom had some tiles that were cracked and falling out and the TV was circa 1999 However the room was comfortable and our family of four slept just fine I read a few people talk about bed bugsand then I read a 5star hotel in NYC also had them
As for the waterpark let me put it in simple terms If Kalahari is the major league of waterparks than Fort Rapids is a solid AA farm team Our kids had a great time and were never bored For them they saw no difference bt Kalahari and Fort Rapidsat least from a waterpark perspective The two arent even comparable when it comes to food quality food choices arcade and indoor play areawhich Fort Rapids doesnt even have 
I would say that if you have older kids 10  14 Fort Rapids is probably still fun for a few hours or one nightas long as their expectations are set I definately would not make a weekend out of it A onenight stay is probably perfect If your kids are older than 15 then stay away They will hate it after 20 minutes There just arent that many rides for kids in that age group How many times can you go down the same water slide
Another tip is to arrive on Thursday instead of Friday We got there at 4pm on Thursday and shared the waterpark with 50 other people total On Friday morning I would say the numbers swelled to around 100 Stillno wait for any ride It was like the park was all to ourselves But about 6 or 7pm it got packed not helped by the 300 kids that got off what seemed like 10 buses 
Finally a quick word about the staff There are plenty of life guards and they are ON at all times I watched them carefully and they never stopped walking and they were diligent about keeping their eyes on the water They have been well trained As for the rest of the staff they were pleasant but you could easily tell that they werent a professional staff I know working sucks but at least they could try to be happy
One last thingabsolutely no problems with the high speed wireless Internet Work great

title: We had a great experience
text:
This hotel has Lake Union right across the street The staff is friendly and always willing to help Jim  front desk was always kindTheres always a bowl with delicious apples at the reception and also different teas  coffee The pool is not big but is indoors and in Seattle this is a great thing theres also a hot tub
Our room was spotless very spacious it had 2 queen beds and a sofa bed desk chair big LCD TV and 2 vanities one outside the shower area and another inside More than enough room for a family of 4
AC worked well Breakfast area was ample with a terrace area so you can have breakfast overlooking the lake Breakfast was good my daughter loved the blueberry waffles Breakfast staff was always attentive and kind 
The hotel provides and excellent shuttle service to downtown one of the drivers dont remember his name was super attentive The hotel but specially the people who work there made our stay unforgettable Thank you
Tip If you happen to be in Seattle on a Sunday and want to go for a free ride on a wooden boat go to the Center for Wooden Boats you can walk there at 1000am and sign up on one of the waiting lists they have for different boats every Sunday they give free rides beginning  300pm but you have to sign up early My family and I had a great time there

title: they lost my top
text:
the hotel was very good and clean nice viewwhich you pay
But after the cleaning lady came to remake the bedI could not find any more my new top which I had left on the bedIt was very disappoining as when I went and ask the reception they did not help at hallI could choose to not doing anything or make an official reportToo much for a topBut for the price you pay they could at least give you a free drink when something like that happens

title: Pennsylvania Stay Away details
text: Took a trip there on monday April 12 2004 I have to say i wish i read this board before i went THIS HOTEL IS THE WORSE I got a deal11000 a night  and was a prime pick so i gave it a shot The lobby looked great and clean The checkin lines were very very long A tleast a 10 minute wait When I got to my floor seventh i could tell it wasnt going to be good The walls were very very dirty and the carpet was stained When i got in the room it wasnt much better You had to wear something just so you wouldnt get your socks dirty No view from my window at all and the windows could not even open The room was very dusty and looks like it wasnt taken care of No bags in the garbage the tub looked like it been there for years without cleaning with all the stains The only thing that did this room justice was that it had web tv 5 for half an hour and 3 every hour after that it also had on demand movies to pay for like payperview 12 a movie and you can check out of your room using your tv so you dont have to stand again in that long line At Hotels site they have pictures there of the rooms in Pennsylvania ITS A LIE ITS NOTING LIKE THAT AT ALL RUN UNLIKE MOST HOETLS IN NY THERE WAS NOTING IN THE ROOM WORTH TAKING AS A KEEPSAKE IF YOU KNOW WHAT I MEAN  THIS IS THE WORST EVER

title: Great place to stay in Baltimore for the Inner Harbor
text: This hotel is a good place to stay for the location near the Inner Harbor of Baltimore at a reasonable price My husband and I stayed in a suite that had free wireless internet refrigerator coffee maker and hair dryer The continental breakfast was delicious and filling The hotel staff were pleasant very helpful and polite Across the street from the hotel is the Charm City Circulator  free public transportation throughout the city This is very convenient Overall this is a good place to stay

title: Good weather GREAT hotel
text: My girlfriend and i traveled to phoenix this past week to search for an apartment We move in September and wanted to get a good idea of places We are moving from Columbus its spring break and the weather there was perfect so we came down for a businessleisure visit The hotel was amazing beautiful architecture great location in the mountains ample pools and hot tubs excellent service and the room was large and comfortable The only negative i could find is that there were lots of teenagers and adolescents  The only problem was that they were all in the main pool area but thankfully there is a pool inside our hotels courtyard This was a great place to come home to after active Phoenician days and i will be recommending this hotel to all my friends and family that come visit

title: Grand and Comfortable
text:
Cant beat the midtown location on 54th between 5th and 6th Aves and its 
Its a grand old hotel in very nice condition without the madness that is known as the Hilton across the street The rooms are spacious and the beds are VERY comfortable but do not expect to have any view from your window other than a brick wall Valet parking is available The weekend rate in early June was 265 to 300 but adding another 30 to have breakfast for 2 included is the right decision The buffet breakfast was more than adequate with eggs bacon sausage smoked salmon fruit cheese etc even though there is no omlette station and no pancakes That certainly beats going out for breakfast someplace else where you will certainly spend AT LEAST 15 per person I would choose this a place again

title: Old and Run Down
text: I booked this hotel for 2 nights on businessthere was no fridge or microwave it would have cost an addition 50 a nightThe water in the tub could not be shut offEverything was in bad shape the bed was the only thing that made the stay bearableit was comfortableWould not recommend

title: Wow Even better once you have actually experienced it
text: I would like to just say our checkin was done in an efficient and professional manner by MEI and her professionalism didnt stop there We had few problems but she was able to help solve them before it was even noticed Had a couple other glitches with service but overall it was on point You have to know to apprecite places as the Waldorf in order to really enjoy your experience there It was centrally located to mostly everything Time square rockerfeller center subway and shopping on saks fifth Also I have to give a HUGE thank you to Ms Ana who works in groups dept and made the whole trip worthwhile

title: Nothing to worry about staying at this hotel
text:
I had read mixed reviews before I stayed at HIE Fishermans Wharf and was a little worried The check in staff were all very helpful The lobby was welcoming and you had free internet and printing access 
The room was a little smaller than I had expected but was clean and in good condition There was no view out of the window but the hotel location was good close to the pier and the cable car turnaround 
The free breakfast was a bonus having read a few reviews I did not expect fine dining We went early as our body clocks had not really adjusted from UK time 8hours and never had a problems finding a table 
Overall the hotel was fine it did everything we needed it too I have not stayed in any other hotels in San Francisco so I can not compare it in terms of value for money

title: Best Location and Value
text:
Very friendly staff the thing that impressed me the most was the value and location of this hotel The hotel is located directly on Michigan Ave Magnificent Mile and it is within walking distance to Navy Pier Lake Michigan Bus Stops there is a Corner Bakery right around the corner where there is excellent breakfast the Water Tower Mall is also close by approx 5min walking
The rooms were clean everything was working and what you get for what you pay is an excellent value

title: HGI for sure in next nyc stay
text: Weve been at HGI for 15 days in january2011  Excellent elevators  absolutely clean  no problem at all with external noises or even next roomcorridor noises  good bathromm  good shower  a little bit small as the most of nyc non luxury hotels  exccelent beds  2 double beds   fridge  safe  daily cleaning and towel exchange The location is superb  at 8th between 48 and 49  I can not thinl about other place for our next stay

title: On point and current
text: The yotel is an awesome hotel to lodge Beginning with the Bellman at curve side the high tech speedy checkin the awesome background trendy music the modern edgy decor the chilled lounge the friendly professional staff members the free wif internet the free breakfast muffins and beverages and the breath taking cabins AWESOME

title: Damned by faint praise
text:
Before you read any more of my review please do not think I have rated the Warwick as Average in a bad way It was a great base for our trip being located on 6th Ave hence only 1 block from 5th avenue shopping and 2 blocks from Broadway and all the shows There are lots and I do mean LOTS of choices to eat nearby  we chose not to eat in the hotel for any meals as we wanted the opportunity to sample New York properly
As for the hotel itself it was comfortable although the heating took some getting used to The room 2608 was a decent size although the view was restricted  but for me part of the experience of New York was being amongst the skyscrapers The bathroom was small think Travellodge but adequate The beds were VERY comfortable and the TV gave you access to more than you will possibly want although we hardly watched anything too much to see  do
On a negative note the decor was a bit tired and could do with a revamp but it was clean and housekeeping looked after us well enough There were no coffeemaking facilities in the room but a coffee maker was provided on request with no fuss
Generally staff were pleasant and helpful although in truth the only request we made of them was to get us a cab to the airport when it came trime to leave
We tried the bar on our first day and were rewarded with a pleasant environment  pleasant staff
All in all I would stay here again and would recommend it as it makes an excellent base to explore Manhattan
Maybe Average is a little too harsh after all

title: Excellent Stay and Cruise package
text:
Prompt pickup at airport Clean comfortable accommodations within walking distance of 
convenience store and several restaurants Cecil the manager oversaw all connections to the ship and pick up at end of cruise He was very customer focused at all times Would not hesitate to use this hotelpackage again in the future

title: Great location good value at right price
text:
I stay in Manhattan a couple times a year on business and leisure travel All the Affinia hotels are good to great This one is quite good A priceline bid got a standard sized room by Manhattan standards small for 115 before taxes It was clean and comfortable The hotel was a couple blocks walk from the megabus stop and right next to Penn station 
There are lots of places to eat right nearby I suggest Cafe R to the east on 31st for good reasonably priced eats of all sorts

title: Great hotel if a bit noisy
text:
Room was tiny  but wed got a really cheap rate so were expecting a box  but was stylish and clean and bathroom was good although had a glass panel to the bedroom so could be embarassing if you werent travelling with your partner
Location was excellent for the East Village and LES  loads of bars and restaurants nearby plus subway on the corner Only problem is that it is right on a busy road with lots of late night revellers so it was noisy at night despite the double glazing so not a good choice if youre a light sleeper like me
Staff were fantastic friendly and efficient and gave us vouchers for free drinks and the cute japanese bar next door 
One of the best things about the hotel is the roof terrace which gives great views of Midtown and downtown over the roofs
Breakfast was ok  usual buffet stuff on disposable plates but plenty of it Free wifi and internet downstairs is a definate bonus
Overall defintely worth a stay although no way would I pay the rack rates on the hotels website  make sure you get a good deal on a discount site

title: Great location
text: Location is excellent Rooms are a little small  so are the bathrooms Concierge is very helpful

title: Not for Those Allergic to Animal Dander
text: This hotel has so much going for it a great location beautiful historic details and excellent service But in attempting to be totally pet friendly it fails to be completely human friendly I am very allergic to animal dander Allergy pills dont completely control my symptoms and they have side effects that make for an unpleasant experience Most hotels that allow pets have some designated petfree rooms especially big hotels that host conferences I expected this but the Park Plaza doesnt Animal dander isnt removed by regular vacuuming and laundering of sheets and pillow cases It requires steam cleaning of carpets and furniture washing the walls and it cannot be completely removed from mattresses and pillows This is why its meaningless to tell guests that their room has been carefully cleaned I was told that if I had a bad reaction to the room I could be moved and try another room but unfortunately since bad allergy reactions can take a day or two to manifest and days to clear up thats not a good solution Not only did I start to have bad symptoms by the end of the second day I found the lack of an upholstered chair in the room increasingly uncomfortable I had to avoid the bed as much as possible as it made me wheeze and the hard chair with a plastic seat necessary to cut down on pet damage I guess made working in my room hard I had to avoid common areas as they were overrun with dogs If I hadnt been at the hotel for a conference I would have checked out and found another place to stay As it is I will ask the organization never to use this as their conference hotel again And Im sad about that as it is a beautiful place Im not sure why pets have to come before people here Hotels stopped letting smokers have the run of the place years ago The current pet friendly policies are a big step backwards The millions of people who have severe animal dander allergies arent trying to be difficult we are just trying to breathe freely How about designating some rooms for pets and some petfree

title: Be Careful About Hard Rock
text: I was scheduled to stay at the Hard Rock in June but had to cancel I had booked the hotel back in January When I called six days before my arrival date to cancel I was told that I would be charged for my stay because I did not cancel seven days in advance I told the customer service rep that I had never heard of such a practice but she said in a very smug manner that I was told back in January I honestly dont remember being told of the cancellation policy but think it is a unprofessional practice to capture some additional dollars since it is not an industry standard to require a seven day cancellation policy when you book directly with the hotel I for one will never stay at a Hard Rock hotel and will make sure that my friends and business associaties know of this unfair practice

title: Just Great
text: A beautiful hotel excellent service the concierges are attentive and always looks for your benefit the location is great you are in the Michigan Street so is pretty good and if you get a higher room the view is UNBELIEVABLE

title: Fishermans wharf stay
text: The Hyatt was a very comfortable place to stay Very good service and the restaurant was pretty good too Good beds pillows linens climate control We stayed there during the 2012 US Open Golf tournament Very convenient for public transportation lots of restaurants and shopping close by Only criticism is that the wifi should be free Would stay again

title: The is a fullbilling hotel
text:
Even before you step in the hotel they will ask for more money than you have already committed to From the pricey valet parking and high drink charges to the upcharges for basic utilities like access to the internet they are committed to pulling as much money from you as they possibly can irrespective of the amount of service you use
Whats odd is that the lobby is all but useless since they play music I find obnoxious and the seating is sparse and uninviting If you are going to spend the money do like all the US Presidents do and go across the street to the Fairmont and at least get a nice atmosphere

title: Great party location and great staff parking weak
text:
I would recommend this hotel if you have activities downtown

We visited Austin to see family and a night out The location was great walking distance to food and fun The staff was very helpful and friendly Rooms were ok and I was able to get a room on the 23 floor good view looking east I did later find out they offered a free breakfast but only after we had already check out wish that had been relayed at check in no big deal Beware of the parking The valet service told me their area was full and I need to self park in the area below the hotel After driving around the 5 floor garage found this full as well I located a spot on the street and on my walk back to the hotel noticed the valet parking still cars guess Mercedes trumps Dodge trucks Well the street parking was free on the weekend

title: Superb Hotel in a Fabulous Location
text:
We booked this Hotel Via Ebookers and it was nothing short of excellent The staff were extremely helpful and the rooms were spacious and had all facilities that you would expect plus much more
We travelled with a 6 month old baby and the in room microwave fridge and kettle were brilliant for warming food and keeping it fresh
We stayed in a deluxe room and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever stayed in 
The Hotel is in a great location and within 5 minuites of Times Square

title: Cool hotel with nice rooms and great location
text: I am a Starwood member and there were few good choices in Boston the night I stayed here I paid close to 400 a night which is more than I usually would spend The hotel is very nice It has a very interesting history as a converted prison from the late 1800s It is a bit trendy and hip which I enjoyed The lobby is especially cool I did not try either restaurant but they both looked good They are lots of local neighbor hood places to eat and drink to just a short walk to Beacon Hill The rooms are nice see the pictures attached I stayed in room 1103 with a great Charles River View and City View Get a odd number room on a high floor

title: Great hotel
text: Perfect location and great beds Great service I would stay there anytime again

title: An oasis of comfort and service in Times Square
text: Located at the edge of the theatre district on 42nd St between 7th and 8th Avenues this hotel provides a convenient oasis of serenity and comfort as well as a great location for getting all around NYC by subway The front desk staff is the best Ive ever experienced especially guest service agents Coretta Elcock and Gwen Raquel Ortiz

title: Clean spacious value for money and great staff
text:
Ofcourse I was worried after reading all the reviews on here but I still took my chances and booked this hotel I can rate this hotel best among my entire stay in the States To give a clue it was better than Stratosphere in Vegas The best part was the polite staff especially Marvin All of them were really cooperative and helpful I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone travelling to San Francisco 
And yeah dont miss the small shabby Mexican eatery on Market St I think its called Taqueria on the corner of 6 St and Market St you will certainly bless me for this tip

title: Nice location
text: Although not in the heart of the Riverwalk area it technically is on the San Antonio river so youre able to walk the river to the main restaurants but sometimes easier just to walk the surface streets Staff member were very accomadating and friendly There is not an executive lounge level to enjoy the perks of executive level so the only perk we could see of the executive level was one robe in the closet not great for 2 guests Bed was comfortable but walls are a little thin so you get a bit of surround noise especially from the ice machine With a Platinum Priority Club status I was expecting some perks but none were offered so maybe youll have better luck when you go Will try other IHG properties next time I get into San Antonio

title: Great Hotel great location VERY Friendly Staff
text: My wife and I got a good deal on a suite at The Magnolia so we figured wed try it out The location is in the heart of Downtown Dallas very close to everything downtown and close to the major highways in Dallas The Room was large and spacious The bed was comfortable and the room service was actually good Kobe Burger I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in Dallas

title: Clean comfortable and convenient
text: My family traveled to Baltimore to drop our son off at Johns Hopkins for the second half of the summer This hotel was a terrific place to stay Not only is it located right across from the stadium at Hopkins but the rooms are very comfortable the internet is free and the beds are really cozy My only complaint would be that the bathrooms are small but we didnt spend much time there so it didnt matter much to us Parking is extra so be prepared for that We got a great deal that included breakfast and the breakfast was very nice The staff are helpful and pleasant Oh when you check in you get a yummy warm chocolate cookie

title: Excellent in every way
text: Stayed here 3 weeks ago with my mother in a double room The rooms were big beds super comfortable staff fabulous Location great near 2 subway stations close to 5th avenue It was wonderful to retreat here after a huge day in NYC Would not hesitate in staying here again or recommending to friends The kitchenette was great as we could have our own breakfast in the room if we wanted too We never had to wait more than a minute or two for the lifts Lovely ambience and the restaurant downstairs has fantastic food

title: Location Location and shuttle service
text:
This hotel is located in the middle of great shopping even beyond the Galleria next door Four ladies on a girls trip never had to venture further than a few blocks the entire weekend for great food and retail therapy 
Malle the shuttle service driver was courteous and very helpful driving us back and forth to dinners The other staff was pleasant as well
The hotel itself is updated in some places like flat screen tvs carpeting in rooms and vanity area but less in other places like the showers 
Overall a good value when booked through third party provider

title: One of the Best
text: Had a great experience at the Inn at the Market Very very clean Extremely comfortable bed and bedding Great location was able to walk to public transportation Superb restaurants within walking distance Used the free business center every night for email Staff was super friendly and helpful Loved all of the lights and outlets in the room

title: dont expect anything more than a good nights sleep
text: lobby good and clean valet nice not knowledgeable front desk personle not informative on anything didnt know where things were could not give information on where to get transportation interacted with 3 different front desk employees and they all were a bit snippy all that was tolerable but the onsite restaurant dine i will not recommend at all the staff was rude the food quality is overpriced some staff didnt speak english or even understand it there was not a blow dryer in the room and it took 3 calls to get on and then they acted like we stole it and looked around our room before giving us a dryer would not stay here again for 16000 a night

title: Great place
text: Been staying at this hotel since 2006 and they have always done me right The hotel is in a great location next to NASA Clearlake of course Keamah shopping great food and the beach Not toention the hotel price is right compared to lesser valued hotels in Galveston This place is always our first choice when were wanting a quick get away

title: Thanks Cadillac
text: We found Cadillac very comfortable and the staff were efficient and accommodating Great bathrooms nice lobby a short walk into town and right near the beach Its worth checking out the Venice Beach skate park those kids have got talent

title: Id say excellent if theyd not charged me twice in the end
text:
I liked the hotel very much it creates the sense of luxuriance large nicely decorated bedroom separate kitchen room everything is clean but wellmaintained though not brandnew Centrally located in Washington Street bicycles rental next street if anybody is interested 
I was charged twice Ive got 2 alert messages immediately and told the same to the lady at front desk She assured me only one is charge another  hold Ive left my bank phone numbers and she promised to release the hold However it was pure doubleprocessing Now I have to spend my time for initiating chargeback  Better pay cash in this hotel

title: Great service
text: The staff was very friendly and the concierge made an excellent job helping us with dinner reservations

title: This is the friendliest place I have ever stayed
text: Over the years I have stayed at the Alexander Inn around 40 times while traveling on business While not luxurious the rooms are clean quite comfortable and charming What keeps me coming back is the friendliness of the staff From John the Innkeeper to the housekeepers and desk clerks the staff is very friendly and helpful The Inn is conveniently located and just a couple of blocks from the Arts district There are wonderful resteraunts within a block or two The Alexander Inn is by far the best lodging value in the city I will be back Again and again

title: Could be better
text:
Good location 
Nice property that has seen better times 
Carpets needs replacement or at least some intensive cleaning Hallway carpets were filthy 
Elliptical machine at the gym is old and noisy 
Service is correct but slow nothing special 
Needs improvement to keep up with Hilton standards

title: Room was just OK
text: The room was a little worn but the bed was very comfortable This hotel has a great location downtown but as a business traveler I was very disappointed by the poor wireless I would have written that off as a poor room location but heard the same from others at my meeting

title: Clean Hotel  Reasonable Rates Great Location
text: My family of four including two teenage boys stayed here for five nights in August The location just off M street was very convenient to the shops and restaurants in Georgetown as well as the Metro station about 1 mile away The hotel rooms were very large and reasonably priced The free continental breakfast included cold cereals pastries breads fresh fruit juice and coffee The hotel and surrounding area was very clean and we are picky about the hotels we stay in We felt safe walking around town and back and forth to the Metro station at night Even the few homeless people that we saw were very friendly and respectful I would definitely stay here again

title: Loved the space
text: We stayed at the Buckingham 1 Nov  4 Nov 2008 Excellent suite room loads of space kitchenette area lounge area with sofa bed so easy can accommodate 4 people Great location 57st off 6 ave Only 2 blocks away from Central Park in the heart of everythingwould book again

title: Good value and location
text: I like the fact that the hotel is directly 3 blocks down from great shopping in Union Square The hotel room was very large clean and comfortable Its a older hotel with loads of character The Continental Breakfast and evening reception was a really nice touch The staff was very professional and personable

title: Great place to stay when visiting Chicago with family andor friends
text:
I went to Chicago with a group of friends for the weekend This hotel was centrally located  short walk to Millenium park the river architectural tour a walking food tour and a block from the L which we took to a White Sox game The rooms were suprisingly spacious for a big city and very clean We opted for a river view room and there was little to no street noise The staff were friendly and professional  the concierge easily got us tickets to Second City the same night While I didnt use it the workout facilities were clean and had a fridge packed with cold bottled waters
The hotel also has some nice touches such as Starbucks coffee each morning in the lobby as well as a wine and sangria hour with lite hors doeuvres
All in all Id highly recommend this hotel especially if you are visiting Chicago with friends andor family for the weekend

title: Whats wrong with this place
text:
Not a lot really 
I stayed for a single night Its well positioned in Chicago North of THE River a few blocks from the miracle mile The front desk is prepared for your arrival and efficient I got a good sized corner room on the 5th floor well appointed for business good bathroom good sleep even thought there was some traffic noise Sable restaurant provides a good variety of food 
The next day we ran a meeting for 25 in room designed to use natural light The room was good and activity nicely supported Departure was smooth

title: Comfortable Stay
text: While not in the city center this hotel is conveniently located by a major route so it is very easy to get anywhere The room is clean and comfortable While the signs of the hotel indicate room cleaning on the weekend is available upon request only we found our rooms cleaned without asking on a Saturday The complimentary breakfast offers some good options The only down side is that there seems to be only one elevator in the hotel and it is slow Oh and the pool is more of a splash pool than a swimming pool so it was a little disappointing because we ere going to try to swim

title: a very pleasant stay
text:
My family and I 4 adults stayed at the Monticello Inn for 4 nights We booked a nonsmoking room with 2 king beds online throught the MonticelloKimpton website with no problem 
 The location was great Right in Union Square it was within easy walking distance of shopping and cable cars Although we had a car we could have easily used public transportation anywhere since it seems that most lines cross through Union Sq
 The room was very nice Despite the buildings age the hotel is well kept and clean with comfortable beds and pillows I was relieved that the room did not in fact smell of smoke at all being a nonsmoking room I expected that but Id been rudely surprised before The bathrooms are small but how big does a bathroom need to be They had dispensers instead of bottles supposedly to avoid the waste caused by amenity packaging for hand soap lotion shampoo conditioner and shower gel My only real complaint about the bathroom is the shower head was not very good
 Since we did had a car we opted for the parking package which included valet parking in the price of the stay Although we did have some trouble due to some miscommunication between the front desk and the parking garage it was convinient to not have to look for parking every night The downside to this is if you leave something in your car you need to have them bring the car back up from the garage in order to get it
 The staff were all very friendly and always offered directions when we took the car out Unfortunately the continental breakfast was 6 per person but the staff gave us very good recommendations for nearby breakfast places
 Overall it was a pleasant stay and since we could walk to so many places we felt that we got a much better idea of what the city is actually like rather than just hitting the tourist hot spots

title: Some aspects were very good some just average
text:
We stayed for 3 nights this month with access to the club level 
Pros
Club level is awesome Excellent assortment of food and beverage each day Beautifully decorated for xmas and great service
Nice spacious rooms Considering the size of a typicaly nyc hotel room this was great Separate bath and shower king size bed desk area and ample closet space
Housekeeping and valet were excellent 
Cons
Location While I did like being away from the fray at night its a good 1520 minute taxi ride to midtown which gets expensive and a tad annoying after a few days
Reception concierge restaurant staff were ok not great Ive had better and more genuine interactions at budget friendly hotels eg We had dinner at the restaurant waiter never checked back to our table to ask how dinner was or offer drink refills 
No gift shop Be sure to pack all your toiletries or be stuck with tiny selection of goods stuck behind concierge desk or hope you make it to Duane Reade during regular business hours 
I would need to rethink staying here in the future For the  you pay there should be more onsite amenities better service and transport services offered by hotel to take guests to midtown

title: My family had a great stay
text: I along with my family enjoyed an extended stay at the hotel We thoroughly enjoyed the time spent at Residence inn I was very impressed by the services provided by the hotel staff They were very friendly and always keen to help That made our stay very comfortable The canal view is fantastic and one can always take a walk by the canal Highly recommended

title: Location Location Location
text: My recent visit to the Hilton Garden Inn was my third stay The hotel is in a great location the rooms are very good and the staff is wonderful I highly recommend the HGI Times Square and I will return

title: Great for the price
text: I was a little skeptical about this hotel after reading some of the reviews but my fiance and I decided to chance it We booked the Astor for a long weekend Mar 30Apr 2 We are both extrememly fussy and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived Lobby was a bit small but check in was a breeze People at the front desk on both night and day shifts are very nice Be careful with the doorman hes a little pushy about bringing up your bags The elevator is a bit small only fitting about 4 average size people I was extrememly suprised once I opened the room door Yes our room was small but it had a private bathroom and remember this is NEW YORK if you want big you gotta pay big Everything including the bathroom was impeccably clean Checked every single spot in the room before we decided it was perfect Our room 1005 has a small balcony facing out to other buildings Not the nicest view BUT ok for us The bed and sheets were comfortable and yes we were woken up at around 6 am on Friday morning to the rattling radiator but it only lasted about 5 minutes and didnt happen again for the rest of our stay There is a subway station on either side of the hotel which is perfect for getting around It is a little far from all the attractions BUT with the subways so close we had no problem with that In the end we actually prefered it that way after standing in front of the Hilton in Time Square  2 am Check out was quick and they offered to make arrangements for a transport from the hotel to the airport at 18 pp which was not bad but we had already made other arrangements To be perfectly honest I thought it was a steal for 89 a night and would definitely stay there again

title: Wonderful setup so why do they nickle and dime you
text: Very nice location close to 5th Street right beside Petco Park  baseball good rooms good fitness centre Was there for a convention  good meetingconference rooms Main peeve was that the wifi was 1520day The Business Centre was even more expensive The convention had to set up an Internet Cafe so that attendees did not get dinged but that was only for day use Even in this day and age Hotel 8 has free wifi Everything was set at gouge prices A Coke can in a machine was 450 Parking was 25selfpark 30valet per day Did not expect that from a class organization that caters to businessconvention crowd

title: Best Place in Manhattan
text:
By all means check in to the Chelsea Pines Inn After traveling to NYC for over thirty years I finally found the best kept secret
Its on West 14th in the heart of the meat packing district the Sky line and Chelsea Its walking distance to SOHO china town and Little Italy
The Inn is SPOTLESS Rooms are bigger than you would think for NYC
Each room has a theme of stars from the past which makes it even more inviting 
Every morning starting at 730 they offer a continental breakfast which is surpasses for sure Fresh Muffins home made breads bagels croissants peanut butter cream cheese butter assorted jellies coffee tea juices cereal yogurt fresh fruit even a splash of an English breakfast with ham cheeses olives beautifully displayed they have a closed in patio that when you are sitting there you forget you are in the city but instead in an English gardenThe staff is the bomb friendly and so helpful they will suggest restaurants shopping places comedy clubs you ask them you will get an answerand when you return from a day out in the big apple they all want to know what you did and how it went they are genuine people which makes Chelsea pines a home away from home
Oh yea and be sure to look for Charlie the resident cat hes the best 
Thank you Chelsea Pines for a great 15 day stay Cant wait to see you next month
I was traveling alone so security was a big factor for me I felt so safe and welcomed there I felt like they took me under their wings

title: Nice Hotel But Huge Inconvenience
text: I booked a room through priceline for 90 per night  taxes and fees I was extremely happy with this price as I have stayed at this hotel before and remembered it to be very nice I was really happy with the quality of the hotel Our room was clean spacious and very modern Overall The staff is friendly and helpful The hotel is in a very central location a short distance to Navy Pier the Magnificient Mile and several rail system stops the El I would have rated this hotel very highly and been incredibly happy with our stay EXCEPT for one huge inconvenience We checked in around midnight and were told that the hotel had been overbooked due to their contract with British Airways and poor weather in Europe resulting in the grounding of many European flightsI understand that this situation was out of the hotels control They offered to move us to another nearby hotel for the night and Swissotel would take care of the cost for that night As much as I would have rather just stayed there and paid for all 3 nights I realized that there was nothing that could be done and this seemed like adequate compensation I was under the impression that i would be refunded the cost of one nights stay This was not the case When I inquired about the refund upon checkout the clerk informed me that the hotel had merely covered the cost of the other hotel I said that I did not feel that this was adequate compensation for having to move to another hotel after midnight then packing up and checking out of the other hotel less than 12 hours later I had already paid to stay at the Swissotel so them paying for the other hotel did nothing for me She only said that she was sorry to hear that I emailed the hotel upon my return home but I have yet to receive a response from anyone at the Swissotel Chicago I would be extremely upset had I paid full price for this room Overall this hotel is very nice and the staff is friendly and helpful however this situation was a very inconvenient start to our trip A simple response to my email would have been nice

title: Wont return
text:
I have recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Hyatt Place Arboretum in Austin Texas and I am glad to be home 
The positive of the hotel were the hotel was quiet rooms were spacious and the television was one of the biggest plasma screens I have yet to see in any hotel room 
However the negatives outweighed the positives
Upon arrival was placed in a room directly across from the elevator When I asked to change rooms my request was acknowledged but required a bit of a nudge 
Upon arrival to the second room the room appeared to need an upgrade or at least a good carpet cleaning There were stains present on the floor as well as big gouges in the door The bathroom door had rust on the hinges and black gunk on the a few of the grout lines between the tile floor
Each shower became an adventure since prior to drying my body I had to dry the floor Why you may ask Well it was because water would flow underneath walkin door This problem was eventually rectified by creating a water barrier with numerous wash towels and the mop up would only require one towel
The hotel provides a breakfast but bring some type of protein if you arent looking for a strictly carb overload at 7 am The breakfast was mixed semi frozen fruit a bowl of what appeared to be grapefruit and yogurt Another bowl had apples oranges and bananas There was hot oatmeal but no sampling of this was conducted There were also cereals and breads Coffee was also provided
The breakfast staff appeared to be bothered that people were attempting to eat On one occasion staff decided to move the mugs and glasses oblivious to the seven people in line attempting to get the morning dose of caffeine
There is a gym with a couple treadmills an elliptical machine and a bike The first few days there were two twenty pound dumb bells but at the end of the stay a whole dumb bell rack appeared
The pool about the size of the room was closed on a day that it was 108 outside
Additionally the hotel offers free wireless internet But the speed I experienced was around 11kb 
The above info was provided to Hyatt and a prompt response was returned saying the problems will be addressed But figured to put it on here anyway Good Luck

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is located in a great area within walking distance to most of the great sites like the Vietnam memorial and the Lincoln memorialIt is about 34 of a mile from these famous landmarks the hotel restaurant does not open until 7 am so if you have an early conference or workshop dont expect any coffee or breakfast There is a Starbucks within walking distance and a few places to eat within a few blocks The rooms are not equipped with the usual amenities of big name hotels like coffee makers and ice machines but the restaurant will bring you ice if you need it The internet is free although I could not access it and chose to go to Starbucks instead of sitting on the phone with tech support They have no business center and no place to print boarding passes but Kinkos is around the corner This hotel was very roomy and quiet the only noise I heard was people walking around in the room above me This is not a good choice for handicapped people they have several steps into the hotel lobby and not much of a lobby to speak of with very very small elevators This is a boutique hotel and is representative of a European hotel the ambiance is very quaint They keep you supplied with bottled water for free

title: Great location in midtown Manhattan
text: This Hilton Garden Inn does exactly what it says on the wrapper Dont expect swimming pools and goldplated taps Do expect great service and the most fantastic breakfast in the adjoining restaurant and clean rooms And if you are a hhonors member there are great benefits to staying here as well You can walk everywhere from here bar lower Manhattan  and the subway is 50 yards away

title: Great stay for a family of 5
text: Just returned from a week at the Salisbury Had low expectations due to the age of the hotel It was a clean friendly hotel with huge we had a one bedroom suite rooms and so convenient to everything we wanted to do There is currently a big construction project going on across the street so if you get a street view room you will be awakened by the construction noise Didnt eat the breakfast there but plenty of bagel shops and delis close by Two blocks from Central park Close to Times square and museums This hotel is not fancy no doorman but room size price and location more than made up for it Will stay there again

title: Reminded me of Embassy Suites
text: We stayed here for a discounted rate offered during movein week at UT We checked in late in the evening so we didnt get to use any of the restaurants or enjoy the outdoor patio which looked lovely The hotel is set up in a triangular fashion with the rooms along the perimeter overlooking the big central area so it has a very open feeling We had a standard King room It was very clean modern and quiet Bed was comfortable and we had soft feather pillows Bathroom had all the usual things including a hair dryer Coffee pot provided in the room two robes provided We used the gym and it was clean with wellfunctioning equipment although it was limited as in most hotels The cardio equipment had personal builtin TVs and they supplied towels infused water headphones etc Very nice setup Valet available but we selfparked and it was another 12 The taxes were almost 40 for one night Location is convenient to campus but certainly not walking distance if you were in town for a football game Lots of interesting restaurants within one block Entry access to the jogging paths around Town Lake were within one block of the hotel which is fun if you have never done it I would stay here again but I cant imagine paying the usual rate which the front desk said was over 240night With taxes I think it will be almost 300 Its not that good

title: Incredible Customer Service
text: People really do make the difference when traveling We had made reservations for 2 rooms but the couple we were overnighting with had a child emergency and had to cancel right before checking in The staff could not have been more concerned or gracious They could tell we were frazzled and were VERY accomodating The rooms are always nice but the real value here is the staff Despite all of the options in town I wouldnt stay anywhere else

title: Good Murray Hill Experience
text:
I just finished 5 nights at Murray HIll East Suites The location is fantastic it is super easy to get anywhere from Grand Central The gourmet market around the corner is super The lack of internet access was a real pain you can get a signal from Kinkos next door in the lobby sometimes and pay with your credit card to surf but I ended up going to the Apple store at 59th and 5th for free access The staff was hot and cold sometimes modestly helpful but often disinterested  standoffish 
The rooms are super big very firm beds I had to buy my own pillow at Macys their pillows really bite esp now that premium hotels have such a nice selection and we are spoiled 
I think this was the loudest hotel I have used in NYC even at night there seemed to be constant noise out front in part because there is a steel plate covering a hole in the street that makes a racket every time someone drives over it but earplugs settled that problem
So every hotel has its ups and downs but I liked MHES overall and would stay again but only if it is mainly for the rate which was the case this time But it is sad when 250nt is a good rate Im not sure how much longer I will be able to afford NYC

title: New comfortable
text:
Stayed for two nights on business
PROS
New clean efficient
Quiet I had a room facing the parking lot on the 4th floor
Good value
CONS
Miles from anywhere San Antonio has urban sprawl and too few freeways
Commuting in the morning and evening from this hotel can take some time
Walls seem thincould hear the folks in the next room
Noisy AC

title: Excellent Very happy customer
text: I stayed in a View Room with two double beds with my friend for Westminster dog show The location was BRILLIANT Across the road to Madison Square Garden down the road from Port Authority great for shopping tours ladies Macys down the road you MUST go From here we walked to Times Square Empire State building and much much more The Subway is right next door and the Tick Tock Diner is great value for breakfast or a late night snack Staff were awesome  we felt right at home Rooms were clean  very comfortable Highly recommended

title: Setting its own standard
text: I live in New York city When I want to take a Mimi vacation I check myself into the Standard The hotel is located in the heart of the meatpacking district and just steps away from all the major bars and restaurant Rooms have great views services are great and people are friendly Having great restaurant and lounges you will never leave the hotel The only negative I have about this hotel is the checkout time

title: A great hotel
text: Stayed here for the second time on business having previously visited with my family I was delighted to find I once again had a huge room with a great view the front desk staff couldnt have been more helpful and room service was able to deliver me a sandwich at 10pm Highly recommended

title: Something was not quite right
text:
I stayed in this hotel while I attended a conference in Seattle from November 14 2006 to November 18 2006 I thought I was saving my company money by staying here rather than one of the hotels closer to the Washington State Convention and Trade Center but in the end I spent the same amount of money it would have cost me to stay in a closer hotel
The biggest problem I had with this hotel is its location It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the Convention Center due to the construction and the traffic lights Try doing this in the rain a few times and youll see how much of a problem it is Going to the Public Market and other tourist sites will require an even further walk Expect to be very tired at the end of the day especially if you are traveling here from the East Coast like I was
Be careful with the valet parking I woke up on the third day of the conference to drive my wife back to the airport When I went to pick up my car the valet came back and told me that my car had a flat tire I am rather suspicious about how that could have happened We did not run over anything during our drive from the rental car office to the hotel and there were no apparent problems with the tires when we picked up the car I have no way of proving if the valets caused the flat but I am peeved that no one noticed the flat until I had to go pick up the car Just imagine if I had discovered this on the day I was supposed to leave Seattle As it was I barely got any time to visit the Space Needle after waiting for roadside assistance to fix the flat I also had to shell out an additional 30 to get my wife to the airport via taxi
The breakfasts arent bad when you consider that they are included in the price of your room I would be more disappointed with them if I had to pay an additional fee for them The potatoes were usually lukewarm and the pancakes and french toast had that institutional taste They also premeasure waffle batter for the makeyourown waffle bar but many days the amount of batter they gave you was not enough to make a complete waffle
I also had an issue with the housekeeping I returned to my room at the end of the day only to find that the glasses in the bathroom had not been cleaned I know this because my wifes lipstick was still on one of the glasses It was things like these that gave me an uneasy feeling about this hotel
All in all I have to say that I was disappointed with this hotel It was not a bad experience but it wasnt up to the high quality I have come to expect from Marriott Hotels

title: good location
text: This hotel is nothing special the rooms are ok but not great If you want to stay in a famous hotel this would be a good one because it is not too expensive The best part about this hotel is the location We found difficult to ask for a 2 bed rooms and only got an extra bed instead When they brought the extra bed the person who brought the bed was not happy and you can tell which I thought was rude but may be normal for NYC I would not recommend to stay in this hotel only because you can find a cheaper one closer to the Central Park and probably as good as this one or better

title: Fairly nice
text:
This place is a good value for the money especially for the DC area However I did encounter a minor problem I made my reservations several months in advance through the front desk A week before our trip I called to double check our reservation The front desk had the wrong dates Feb instead of June I explained that I called in Feb to make reservations for June When we arrived we were given a room that was adequate for our family of 7 however it wasnt the room that was described I feel that we were put in smaller accommodations for the price of the larger The front desk was willing to give us a discount but said it would take several weeks to go through accounting We settled for free parking and no charge for our rollaway which was less hassle but not as much of a discount as we could have received The kitchen was also not as well stocked as I expected I dont recall a pot or pan in the place Since we were mainly using the microwave that wasnt a problem but just something to be aware of if youre planning on cooking to save money
Pluses Picturesque Georgetown location near the DC Cupcakes store and larger rooms for a much better price than other hotels 
Minuses Rooms are dated but clean Halls smelled of smoke though the room did not Be sure to double check your reservations

title: Mediocre hotel Fine for most stays
text: It was dated but clean Average hotel Ac only sorta worked Staff was unprofessional and not very friendly so we went our way an they went theirs Room was spacious but odd full size fridge and had only 1 outlet in the entire room So it was iron or have a cup of coffee And it was across the room so you couldnt use the iPhone for alarm if you wanted it to charge at night which also means no laptop in bed Nice bar and restaurant The most fantastic thing about this hotel was it was soooo quiet Bachelorette parties fourth of July volleyball tourney with a million highschool kids but I didnt hear a thing So Id stay here again

title: Great place but a few tips
text:
My husband and I just returned from six nights to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary We asked for a quiet location and didnt care about a view and were given room 701 a junior suite that faces the side of the McDonalds building next door It was well protected from neighboring room noise it was sandwiched between a stairwell and a supply closet and fairly protected from street noise but more about that in a minute The room was very large and clean the bed and chairs comfortable and the bathroom well appointed and perfectly adequate for two people though more than two might find it difficult to store their toiletries The bathroom desperately needs an exhaust fan as it has no vent or window and a couple of days when I attempted to shower around noon I had to wait about 20 minutes for hot water this didnt happen when showering earlier The kitchen could use a larger coffeemaker that takes regular paper filters as we did not like the inroom Pucks filter bags and wanted to brew our own coffee The Azure deli around the corner has a great salad bar including items such as stuffed tofu sesame noodles and seafood a hot foods bar and many essentials such as boxed cereal baked goods sandwiches and drinks so we went grocery shopping there and ate breakfast in our room every day and also brought in deli fixings for lunch or dinner A table and chair set would have been much nicer to sit at than the work desk and the room was actually large enough to accommodate both but we only had the desk
I had read some reviewers comments about rooms being too hot and they were right In fact the entire hotel is overheated and the heat seeps in through the walls and floors to the point where our room was too warm even though we kept our thermostat turned off and at least one window open to the 40degree air at all times including at night Fortunately the sound of traffic was nearly drowned out by the nearby rooftop air conditioning units which created a nice white noise for sleeping Unfortunately though the smell of McDonalds often wafted in A fanonly setting on the heatingAC unit would have been helpful to keep the room cooler and less stuffy but the only option at this time of year was hot air because the hotel hadnt yet switched over to AC Were lucky that we didnt arrive later in spring because I can just imagine how hot and stuffy the room would be if the outside air were warmer than the 30 to 55 degrees it was during the week we were there Also there were no screens on the windows so insects could be a problem if you have to have the windows open
I do have a tip for dealing with the small and crowded elevators Stay on a lower floor and take the stairs We were on the 7th floor and managed to take the stairs most of the time though that last flight was a bit of a struggle after a full day of sightseeing especially given that the stairwells were about 85 degrees and we were bundled in our overcoats
The second floor lounge is quite nice and well appointed and has two computers with Internet access for guests The trouble is theres no regulation of usage so when my husband went there the night before our departure to print our airline boarding passes he was stuck in a line with several other likeminded guests who were waiting for a teenage girl to stop instant messaging her friends Her mother finally told her to get offbut then the mother got on and proceeded to check her own email The other computer was occupied by a family happily uploading their photos to Flickr apparently not knowing or caring that others had more pressing computer needs The staff needs to set some limits for usage and supervise that area
Overall we would stay there again but only during the cold season on the quiet side of the building or during the hot season when the AC is turned on

title: Should have been great
text: Well Accor as a group normally provide excellent service and hotels the times square hotel is the exception From the moment we arrived till the moment we left the staff could not have done less to assist with anything from faulty items in the rooms to a very poor quality breakfast complete with cracked cups and plates The room was just OK at the price and location The door looked like it had seen better days and had been attempted to be kicked in a few times The location is great and if the staff gave slightly more than a damn about being there it could be just OK if they try Otherwise they are obviously selling based on location and name shame accor shame

title: Definately will stay here again
text: Stayed in San Diego for a few days before a cruise and got the best service from the staff and especially the shuttle service

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text:
Excellent hotel in the heart of New York city easily accessible to all you can do and think of doing in this vibrant cityThis hotel has some really good bars and the food is good tooVery nice Spa but mind you try and book treatments in advance as they are really busy
The rooms are very comfortable and have every convenience built in
The subway station is right there ans so is the bus stop so extremely convenientGreat restaurants all round the hotel as this is really a restaurant city with some great food
The managers at this hotel are really nice and i had to extend my stay due to an emergency but was immediately assisted by Mr Tim Mcdonnell and everything was taken care of inspite of the fact that the hotel was really busy
The concierge service was excellent unlike many similar hotels in the area
Will definately like to go back to this hotel again

title: What a wonderful boutique hotel Would stay again for sure
text:
My best friend and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Denver for a girls weekend for my birthday We had tickets to a show in Boulder and decided to stay in Denver becase there is more to do in Denver We live in Colorado so we were driving anyway
For some reason we had a hard time finding the hotel Its kind of in a weird place set in the middle of other buildings not really set apart like most big hotels are We drove by it once its on a oneway street and it was pain to get back to There is no parking garage just valet only I guess the complaint I am making is that there is no BIG sign telling you where the hotel is The sign is small make sure to keep an eye out for it
Hotel Monaco in Denver is in a great location within walking distance to the 16th Street Mall and the Convention Centeryou can pretty much see all of downtown 
Denver by foot from the Hotel Monaco when the weather is nice
When we finally arrived we were very happy with what we found The Hotel Monaco is very stylish very cute very clean and the staff is wonderful They are extremely dogcat friendly and that was cool We didnt have a pet with us on this trip
We had a QueenQueen room
Our room was beautiful and clean the beds were comfortable and it was nice and quiet The only thing I didnt like was that the windows didnt open They do advertise soundproof windows They are sealed shut and if I remember correctly there are solid panes of glass over the windows That bothered me as I like to open my hotel room windows for fresh air
The restaurant Panzano was delicious for dinner and for breakfast I highly recommend the Eggs Benedict We thoroughly enjoying our dining experience at Panzano
We also had spa services including massage and pedicure at the Renaissance Aveda Spa  Salon located inside the hotel 
We walked to Fado Irish Pub and Sing Sing It was quite a hike in dress shoes and it was cold but a nice walk nonetheless We ended up taking a biketaxi a human pedaled biketaki thing back to the hotel after an evening of drinking and that was fun
I highly recommend Sing Sing we had a blast there
I have spent a lot of time in downtown Denver and I absolutely love it There is a lot to see and do Hotel Monaco was a wonderful cornerstone to our girls weekend

title: Convenient location for my business
text: very run downthe free breakfast is only ok and the staff is not very friendlyfrozen donuts barely thawed but the belgian waffle is very goodthe rooms are old and musty with deteriorating issues in the bath area

title: Great base hotel for sightseeing
text:
We got a great last minute deal on this hotel through Expedia We went to Seattle to watch a Seahawks game and because its one of our favourite cities to visit The Fairmont lived up to its title  its an elegant hotel in a great location The lobby is beautiful the food was good try the banana foster creme brulee at the lobby bar and breakfast cost 20 ea service was prompt and more than helpful There is a 24 hr concierge who can recommend restaurants and activities for every budget 
I had read reviews before booking and I concur that the rooms are small but they upgraded us for no charge The decor is very fussy and a little dated but the bathrooms and room amenities were adequate although the room lacked a coffe maker My only real complaint is that the towels were thin and not soft at all but 2 robes were provided which was a nice touch
There are three entrances to the hotel each on a different street which is very convenient 
It was only one block from the University Street light rail station which brought us directly from SEATAC airport for 250 
From the hotel we walked to Qwest Field which was only 10 mins at a brisk pace Pike Place Market the waterfront all shops and malls and took the monorail to the Space Needle 
This hotel makes a great base for exploring downtown Seattle
PS The best Starbucks was the one opposite the hotel  great selection of treats compared with others visited and a good place to pick up a quick bite in the AM

title: The Best
text: Whenever you travel to Chicago it is a must to stay at Hotel 71 view service rooms are the best not to mention the restaurant Hoyts in the hotel The mac n cheese with truffle oil and prosciutto is to die for

title: Hotel Grand Hyatt NY  strategic location direct passage to the Grand Central Station and Metro
text: The Hotel is really close to Times Square Chrysler Building ONU 5th Avenue Rockfeller Center Public Library Moreover there is a direct access from the hotel to the Grand Central Station and Metroreal good to move fastly and easily in New York if you dont want to walk  My and my friends rooms were big only the bathroom was small My room was always clean but my friends room 2 times in 5 days wasnt clean so the hotel to apologize for this gave them a credit to spend in the Hotel restaurant and bar  All hotel services have to be paied and so without tell me anything during the Check In when I received an enveloppe from an express forwarder to pay a small amount for this service they charged on my Credit Card an important amount to cover also potential future extra costs I discovered this only when I received on my mobile phone the information of this debit and I called my Credit Card Assistence Service to verify what was happened may be someone cloned my Card After my complain the receptionist explained me that this was the hotel rule and they at the end of my stay will have recharged on my Credit card the change To close this complain they give me a small credit to use at the Hotel Bar Honestly speaking I think that this things have to be explained during the Check In and not after a complain  Anyway this is the turist life  I advice this hotel because it is nice and the location is really strategic

title: GREAT location beautiful hotel with Dale Chihuly glass
text: Just a few blocks from the market this is a great find and a lot less expensive than some of the boutique hotels Clean well kept modern Concierge was super friendly and helpful Free high speed internet Couldnt have asked for more

title: Convenient Hotel to attend conferences  exhibitions at Convention center Boston
text: Clean  value for money and convenient hotel to attend conferences and exhibitions in Boston Convention Center Hotel has shuttle to airport and convention center makes it very convenient for traveller attending I stayed all the thrre times I visited BOSTON SEAFOOD SHOW

title: so welcoming I wouldnt trade this hotel for anything
text: My husband and I went to Boston for a 2 night stay without out 3 children We booked our two nights at the Lenox through travelzoo and were not disappointed Upon arriving from the airport we checked in at the front desk Check in was smooth and after telling the staff we had a rough flightthey asked us what we wanted to drink Within minutes we were given a glass of wine and ice cold Boston Lager for my husband Now that is great service The next day we were headed to a Red Sox game We stopped to ask the concierge about recommendations for dinner He gave us a few suggestions made reservations for us and then proceeded to give us 2 tickets for the Red Sox game When we arrived back in our room we discovered a bottle of wine on ice along with 2 wine glasses I am not sure if this is typical or we just lucked out but I wouldnt stay in another hotel in Boston after this service

title: overnight stay at a great hotel
text: I spent Friday night at this hotel while recently in Boston Like all other times I have visited this Hyatt property the rooms service and staff were all excellent The staff was attentive and accommodating and made the check in and out process effortless The hotels location is easy to find and is superb if you are visiting anywhere in the City I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to stay in a classic city property

title: Basic but very acceptable
text:
Staying one night in an extended stay hotel takes some getting used to as it is not unusual to find no shampoo in the bathroom but sometimes it is a good option as the rooms are typically larger and there will be a small kitchenette 
I had to make a quick trip to Charlotte and then we realized it coincided with the Presidents visit to the DNC This was one of the very few hotels in Charlotte that did not double or triple their rates to fleece those attending the DNC and this is to be very highly commended The easy access to the ring road as well as a local supermarket makes this a very convenient hotel Internet access was free but as a new twist there is a charge if you want a higher speed access The basic free access worked fine but I would not be surprised if the clever IT folk dont start to slow it down until they get enough high speed paying customers 
Parking was fine but you need to watch for the very small entrance sign on Park road I drove right by it

title: Time for new mattresses
text:
We checked in at 11pm The neighborhood was a little rough The bed was awful it was as if someone had thrown a foam mattress on top of the old mattress If you got too close to the edge youd roll off the bed 
We forgot our shampoo and there was no small bottle of shampoo like in all the other BWs in which weve stayed We washed our hair with a very small bar of soap and barely had enough left for bathing The heavy curtains covered the air conditioning unit so we had to prop a chair under the curtains to hold them up so we could get cool air into the room When we checked out the next morning the two men at the desk barely spoke English so it was difficult to communicate with them We finally gave up and just left For the price it was fine but I would never stay there for more than one night We almost never stay in a AAA two diamond and this is the perfect example of why

title: Good enough but could be great
text:
Located on Hotel Circle this hotel is on the margin of getting a very good from me
The good things are that the rooms all open on secure interior hallways Theres just one elevator and to get to it you have to pass the front desk All the other doors are locked and accessible only with a room key
Next theres free internet free parking and decent rooms with a kitchenette No big frills but nice to have There is an ironing board hair dryer etc convenient plugs for you electronics and all the necessities you might need
Spacious Windows that open Plenty of lighting Nicesized bath Very reasonably priced even on walkup with no reservation
