text: I stayed here on a recent business trip It was convenient to the meeting location As Hampton Inns gothis one was very nice and the staff was exceptionally professional and friendly I gave the location only a three just because Im a runner and this location seems to be bounded by highways and very busy streets with a lack of sidewalks

title: Unexpectedly good
text:
Our family stayed here for 3 nights  our last 3 nights in San Diego We were relocating out of the country for my husbands next assignment Definitely a welcome comfort after weeks of packing and moving 
The 5 of us stayed in a Suite It was great Very large living room with a Queen sofa bed and bedroom with 2 Queen beds There was an LG HDTV the living and bedroom Very spacious it could fit all our stuff  about 10 luggages Beds were very comfortable Housekeeping was a little slow probably because only 1 staff took care of the whole section Airconditioning was a little loud but the comfortable room more than made up for it 
Our package included breakfast at their restaurant which was ordered from the menu Excellent food and fantastic portions The place also wasnt over crowded Kids ate free 
My husband had to complete a report so they gave him a private business lounge to work in for a whole day complimentary it was nice  couches computer printer kashi energy bar and fruit was in the room 
Free parking free wifi free 2hr bicycle rental and complimentary airport shuttle to San Diego airport It is also facing the marina  you can ridewalk to shelter island on a nice day

title: Chicago Stay  October 2022nd
text:
I recently traveled to Chicago for business and stayed at the Sheraton Chicago If you are up for experiencing the amenities of this beautiful city and staying in an over the top hotel this is the place for you 
This hotel is strategically located within walking distance of one of Chicagos best shopping experiences the Miracle Mile and is just blocks away from Navy Pier Taking in these mustsee experiences in downtown Chicago will be convenient and enjoyable while staying at this beautiful hotel
The view of Chicagos skyscrapers at night from my room was absolutely breathtaking This in addition to a beautiful decor cleanliness and over the top service makes this hotel my 1 choice when visiting this city This hotel is an expert is sleeping comfort You will sleep in comfort as never experienced before with this hotels signature mattress and bedding series
Parking is convenient and safe with the Sheratons valet or selfparking options with elevator service directly to the hotel lobby
All of these services made my experience the best that Chicago has to offer with my stay at the Sheraton Chicago

title: Great experience using Hilton Honors points
text: We had 3 rooms for 3 nights while in town to catch a game at Fenway and do some siteseeing The hotel is in a great location  within walking distance to shops restaurants and easing access to the subway Since we were using Hilton Honors points I was afraid that wed be given rooms in an undesirable location no view I was worried for nothing All 3 rooms on the 12th floor had wonderful city views One of the rooms was on a corner and had a sweeping view as well as a huge shower no tub with shower heads on both ends Our room was always cleaned beautifully and the staff in the restaurant during breakfast was wonderful The beds were very comfortable and there were plenty of pillows Boston is an expensive city to visit but when we get more HH points well be back

title: Just plain awful
text: The room I stayed in had a bunch of problems in and of itself Some buttons on the tv remote didnt work the room faced a brick wall the air was stagnant and reeked of cigarettes the AC didnt work the sheets were dirty no lie  there was red lipstick on the sheet  ewww and not to mention that the elevator was broken so I had to walk up and down 7 flights multiple times FUN

title: Very Nice and Affordable
text:
I must say Im glad i stayed at this hotel I was just reading the reviews on here and im glad I listened to the good ones 
This hotel had just recently been renovated and is very very nice The lobby and our room as wel as the restaurant were all in excellent condition The parking is 12day in a gated and guarded lot I had to smoke outside because my room was nonsmoking since i had children with me I felt comfortable smoking outside by myself at 100 am and I am a female Now I do not know much about LA but it did not seem dangerous in the slightest I had a 2 queen beds room It was very spacious with nice furnishings The bathroom was large The pool was very nice and heated It is outdoors inthe corner of the parking lot but there is a 6 foot concrete wall around it you dont feel like your in the parking lot and no one outside can see in the pool area There is a nice outdoor courtyard in the center of the hotel and a nice sauna The breakfast in the morning was more than nice Several beverage choices and hot  cold foods 
However the staff was not very helpful with directions to attractions or anything about where to go in the area The staff was not very friendly or helpful with anything The maid yelled at me in the morning cause i asked her to come back in an hour when we would be gone out for the day The front desk staff was very short and uninterested The breakfast staff was halfway okay they were efficient so i really didnt ask them for anything though
Overall I give this hotel an A due to the bad staff

title: Excellent location wifi substandard
text:
We chose this hotel for the location to the Mall and museums The location did not disappoint And around the corner are various coffee shops banks pubbars and restaurants This is important because the hotel wifi had a very weak signal so I would go to Starbucks to use their free wifi When we inquired the front desk had no explanation and offered to move us to another room We decided not to change rooms because of the hassle If hotels advertise free wifi they should make sure its adequate especially since this is in a business district The wifi in the lobby and breakfast room was acceptable but not acceptable in our 4th floor annex room
Housekeeping was inconsistent We hung our towels on the rack as instructed the first night only to have them all replaced On the 3rd night we didnt think housekeeping had come by at 5pm because the beds werent made Note that we put the beds together in a tidy fashion so they werent a mess to begin with but still It turns out they emptied the garbage cans and replaced the towels and that was it
I concur with the other reviews that the kitchen sink is too small to do dishes However the kitchen was nicely appointed with a full size refrigerator with an ice maker 2 burner electric stove and a large microwave The kitchen could have been stocked with kitchen towels however as we had to use the bathroom towels
The front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful
There is a computer and printer in the lobby which was helpful to print boarding passes 
On another note I booked this hotel via their website 6 months prior 2 months prior I checked the website again and the rate had dropped 100night Im glad I checked again as the original rate was very pricey

title: Very Nice Hotel
text: Dont let the reviews about the rooftop bar influence you This is a very nice small boutique hotel in a great location Staff was great other than one surly doorman who leaned on the lobby bar and watched as we struggled with getting the bags in the large front door Doorman later in the day was great though Cant comment on the rooftop bar as it was closed due to weather during my stay Great bed and bath Would highly recommend this property

title: Mediocre rooms in need of updating
text: Mediocre rooms in need of updating Terrible neighborhood Housekeeping overall is poor There are much better choices in DFW Avoid this one

title: Bed Bugs Do not stay here
text: Ive been up all night killing bed bugs wouldve left but bf is staring new job in the morning  were from a different area I cannot believe there arent more reviews about this problem Im horrified If you need more reasons as to why you should never stay here NO hot water the room heater does not work believe it or not in midJuly it is a cold cold night so I called the front desk and they said theres nothing they can do about it its central supposedly  why is there a thermostat in the room then they didnt even offer an extra blanket no amenities whatsoever not even kleenex or crappy shampooconditioner combo no coffee  nothing the area and people are super sketchy and extremely loud ALL night its stinky dingy gross and tiny  even the TV is tiny All this for 80 bucks a nightunbelievable

title: Poor Spa Customer Service and Maintenance
text: We live near the Arizona Biltmore and have been members of their Spa facility for more than 10 years Over that period of time we have seen a steady decline in the maintenance of the spa facility While they have recently replaced all of the equipment which is excellent the facility itself is poorly maintained In a clear cost cutting effort the hotel has reduced the hours that the gym will be staffed Now instead of staffing at 530 am they will not staff until 730 am While they are making it 24 hours the locker room will not be available until 730 am For what is supposed to be a world class hotel they are running the spa and gym as if it were not an integral part of a major resort Other resorts at least make bathrooms available at all hours In addition cleaning of the facility is now left to the operational staff during normal business hours As a result staff will be vacuuming while people are sitting in the lounge Anyone coming to the Biltmore because of the Spa and gym may wish to reconsider and select another hotel that values it spa users and club members

title: Nice hotel but problems spoiled the experience
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights last month for businesspleasure He was there for a convention but we extended our stay to do some sightseeing First the good points nice roomhotel decor good maid service very convenient location pleasant staff members
Now onto the bad It states that checkin is at 400 but our room wasnt ready until 500 which I think is a little late for checkin They allow pets which may be nice for some people but the fact that we were placed in a room next to a woman with a yappy dog who barked incesantly for hours was extremely annoying We called down to the front des who alerted security They came up and verified that yes there was indeed a barking dog next door but didnt do anything about it Also this same dog decided to relieve itself in the hallway while we were walking to the elevator with this particular pet owner In my opinion I think that there should be a designated floors for people who bring their pets with them to this hotel so its not an inconvenience for those of us who left ours at home The second issue I had with this hotel was the elevators For most of our stay 2 of the 6 elevators were out of service and this was a major inconvenience At times we waited 15 minutes for an elevator which is ridiculous My last issue with this hotel is that we had booked 3 nights through my husbands company and an additional night through his Hilton Honors points as a reward night stay At checkout they not only charged us for the reward night but also charged us for the reward night a second time on the original bill and stated we were a no show on the last night When my boyfriend called to rectify this situation they stated it would take 3 days to clear this up Hes still waiting
In summation this is a lovely hotel but the problems that we experienced during our stay would probably deter us from booking at this hotel again if it was strictly for pleasure

title: Great hotel Stayed for Final Four Weekend
text: This hotel was a great find for our stay for the Final 4 last weekend the hotel itself was very clean the staff was wonderful and we had no complaints what so ever the hotel was completely full for this big event and the staff had no problems from what i noticed The breakfast area was great lots to chose from each morning The pool was a bit cold still so we didnt use it but the hot tub was nice enough and we sat in it nightly after the games I would stay here again if we returned to Houston it is also located conveniently to the Galleria area as well as many places to eat high marks from our perspective

title: My home away from home
text:
I stayed at The Roger the week after Hurricane Sandy hit as I was unable to get back to my apartment after the storm It was a perfect boutique hotel I felt very comfortable living there for the week while also feeling completely spoiled by the wonderful staff Every time I left my room I was greeted with a smile from housekeeping offered help with my bags by the bellmen the front desk was extremely helpful and patient and the food  beverage department was outstanding 
I think the other comments didnt take into consideration that the Hotel was also impacted by the Hurricane But from my experience I dont think you would have ever known it because they really pulled it together perfectly They created amazing meals with a limited menu until the New York vendors got back up and running the breakfast was unlike anything I have ever seen before and the cocktails were delicious and presented beautifully Whatever you requested they made it happen even if it wasnt on the menu excellent service 
Also the location was extremely convenient located in the heart of New York it made it easy to get uptown or downtown
By the end of the week everyone on staff was a friendly face and I felt so comfortable staying there it was a perfect home away from home I wish I could live there yearround 
Thank you

title: Never again
text:
I had a very pleasant experience at the Omni in 2006 and 2007 but this year was far different Yes the hotel is nice and close to Metro
The staff was rude and gave me dirty looks I did not feel welcome at the hotel at all On one occasion I overheard housekeeping staff talking about me in Spanish they were surprised that I responded to them in Spanish Housekeeping did not respect my privacy and walked into my room without knocking 
I strongly urge everyone to avoid this hotel

title: Best hotel in Houston
text:
My stay was there May 4 8 and I am a little picky about hotels specially when it comes to Westin It is one of the best Westin I have been The location is fantastic service and amenities are great I didnt eat at any of the restaurants because you dont need to There are a lot of restaurants around and fast food in Galleria Mall The room was 48 of 5
The staff  well that is the only problem with this hotels there isnt enough but when they appear service is great as I mentioned before

title: Great location good for an extended stay
text:
Stayed here for five weeks in NovDec 2007 
Hotel location is excellent round the corner from Broadway less than ten mins walk from Macys two minutes from Bryant Park five mins from Fifth Avenue and about ten mins walk from the Port Authority good for those who want to take a day trip to Woodbury Common shopping mall  highly recommended Hailing a taxi from outside the hotel wasnt difficult and theres a subway station right beside it 
My room on the 35th floor was quiet and had a view north up 6th Avenue and over Bryant Park It had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in  no exaggeration The bathroom was small but very clean and nicely appointed shower was excellent and there was also a bath The room had a safe an ironing board and a proper iron Theres a laundry in the basement which costs a dollar per wash and per dry  washing powders available free from the front desk The dry cleaning service was good  same day delivery and the prices werent bad Broadband internet access was available by wireless but could be a bit slow My only issue with the room would be that it was very stuffy there was no way to open the window further than a few centimetres so getting fresh air in was a bit difficult 
There was a kitchenette with a huge fridge and a dishwasher these were useful but I could have done with a hob or ring for saucepans  I hadnt been made aware that this was available on request Theres a 24hour deli on the corner of the block next to the hotel You can also get hot snacks at the hotel bar on the second floor its tiny but nice and has a pool table Theres a hospitality hour in the evenings from MonThurs where snacks soup salad and so on are served to guests Breakfast is really rather good  selection of hot food like sausages bacon potatoes French toast waffles pancakes oatmeal and so on skip the eggs as they were nasty as well as pastries bread cheese and fruit Id advise getting down to breakast as early as you can as it gets a bit hectic after 830 particularly on weekends 
As other reviewers have pointed out the single biggest problem the hotel has is its elevator system Getting a lift in either direction between 830 and 1030 was very difficult  I waited up to ten minutes on occasion It appeared that some of the lifts werent even in service as it seemed to be the same two that were always in use at breakfast time
Front desk service on arrival and during the stay was fine however on departure I encountered some problems There was absolutely no flexibility as regards checkout times I requested checkout of 2pm but was told I had to be out by 1130 at the latest or else Id have to pay for another halfday This despite the fact that we had paid for thirty nights already Also the manners of the male concierge left a lot to be desired quite at odds with any other hotel concierge Ive dealt with The doormenporters were pleasant and polite 
All in all it was a nice stay  if the Residence Inn irons out those few wrinkles in its service Ive no doubt itll get more fivestar ratings from those on prolonged stays

title: Perfect
text: As a former New Yorker Ive always stayed with family but this time wanted a hotel I found Hotel Indigo to be everything I needed in a home away from home Quiet street clean everything and a smiling pleasant staff My room was small but more than adequate with plenty of hot water and a comfortable bed Chelsea is a great neighborhood for just hanging out New York style with easy access to public transportation The one and only glitch was the rubbery pillows but that was immediately remedied

title: Very helpful and accomodating
text: I was here for a convention and the staff was very helpful When our group needed anything the hotel staff took care of it immediately The room I was in was comfortable and clean I appreciated the refrigerator and microwave in the room although not all rooms had them There was ample parking for our group and the hotel was easy to get to I would definitely stay here again

title: Fantastic THE place to stay when visiting San Diego
text: I travel for a living staying in hotels and resorts around the world From the minute I arrived the valet was ready to assist with my car as was the bellman which was definitely needed when on the road for two weeks and with three girls traveling this time around  needless to say we had lots of luggage I was impressed by the friendly and accomodating service right from the start The lobby was beautiful and screamed relaxing The check in was flawless and up to the room we went Fast elevator with a british accent welcomed me to my floor Opened the door to the room and wow was I and my travel mates impressed Coffee is a must for me so the first I noticed was the upgraded coffee machine with real mugs and real creamer not powdered The room was furnished lovely  fantastic for us ladies  bright cheery and in the colour of the season  orange The room was oversized extremely clean and exactly what I had hoped for Need I say the beds were terrific and rather than enjoying the night out we decided to stay in Also loved waking up to the spacious bathroom and huge shower area We checked out the 9th floor bar as everyone speaks of enjoyed the view service and fire box which kept us warm which made us again think as to whether we should be going out Wine selection was definitely enjoyed as was again the staff We did eventually venture out and found very popular hot spots all within walking distance to the car Each day we throughly enjoyed mainly because of this fabulous hotel and outstanding service always with a smile and ready to please Darren at the hotel provided us great tips for places to visit and see which really made our visit and overall experience He was as they say the icing on the cake Sadly our visit had to come to an end and Im ready to start packing for a new trip I can only hope that I have the level of service and quality of standards that I experienced at this Indigoand I can only hope I wish I was going back to San Diego What a lovely and fun city And I wish my new hotel was the Indigo I truly hope the hotel knows as to what they have and the hotel manager knows what heshe has in their team

title: Great location staff helpful and friendly if youre into clean hotel rooms you might want to skip this one
text: We loved our stay in Chicago and we cant wait to go back The convenience of the hotel was a definite advantage We felt safe at all times We realize now that Chicago in general is pricey but thats ok  we never regret money spent on a trip Speaking of pricey  The cost of the breakfast buffet at the hotel is 23 Per person We would have liked to have had a usable fridge in the room The lack of this amenity makes it family UNfriendly There is no counter space in the bathroom And speaking of bathroomsthere was a horrible sour smell in there and really bad mildew and mold in the shower on the tile grout I really needed a bottle of Tilex Pictures of the recently remodeled rooms are a little deceptive The rooms look huge in the pics they are not Honestly  this Hyatt seems to be more for the business traveler and not so much a family but believe it or not  because of the location  we would stay there again Ill just make sure I bring my Tilex

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: Very pleased with this hotel from the moment I arrived and they let me check in early 10 am to the day I departed The lobby is gorgeous staff very nice location perfect if you want to be near Times Square only a block away and in a decent size room with a very comfortable bed and free wifi I even had a view of Times Square The rate was very good for the area so I wasnt sure what to expect but I was very pleasantly surprised and will definitely stay there again

title: Lots of Personality
text: I stayed here because the block rooms were sold out at the designated hotels for our conference I was glad I found the Hotel San Carlos This is not your hotel if you want a Hyatt or Westin experience This is the place for you if you enjoy history and a little of the out of the ordinary It s decor is dated but what what youd expect for a historic hotel It is very clean and has all the modern conveniences The pool area was very nice and a great place to relax I stayed in the Marilyn Monroe Suite which consisted of 2 rooms and was great for having guests Staff were friendly and helpful I would definitely recommend this if you want something with a little more personality Unfortunatley I had no ghostly encounters but enjoyed my restful nights

title: Great time at Rancho Bernardo Inn
text: I have stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn for the last several years while we visit some family that live in San Diego I look forward to to this trip all year We were only there for 4 short nights however I would have loved to stay longer We did manage to spend some time at the family pool where we ordered a wonderful lunch and enjoyed some drinks by the pool It was a great afternoon for the adults along with the kids who spent the day in the pool playing with some of the pool toys that were provided by the resort One morning I even had the pleasure of going down to the spa and having a wonderful swedish american massage And after the massage I spent some time in the steam room I could have spent all day in the spa but I had to get back to the room to spend some time with the family On the evening we ate in the Veranda there was an excellent buffet that was going on so half of our party ate from the buffet and then the rest of us ordered off their menu Of course we also made time to eat in El Bizcocho We didnt bring the kids along since this restauarant is much more of a fine dining experience After reading all of the stories about El Bizcochos chef we were definitely not disappointed The food presentation and service there is absolutely incredible I can say nothing but good about the Rancho Bernardo Inn  Everyone should experience it

title: Not bad at all
text:
I dont mean to damn with faint praise  we booked the Holiday Inn Beacon Hill for a very reasonable rate through Hotwire and we were not at all disappointed The location of the hotel is great  convenient to Charles Street Beacon Hill and not far from the Common Quincy Market and downtown We got lucky and found a legal street parking space at 6pm so we were good for the night
Inside the hotel is perfectly satisfactory The facade is new but a quick study and you get the program recent facelift on 1970s property This held true throughout our stay The lobby is pleasant but small with low ceilings The elevators are older but have been facelifted theyre still very slow though The hallways are fine  dressed up but still narrow and low And the room which was comfortably appointed enough feels like an older smaller room with nicer finishes The bathroom was however eensy  which made the whole thing feel small for a family of four when it came time to get ready in the morning
A couple minor glitches in our particular room The TV cable was out altogether the wireless connection seemed to bounce randomly and the beds which were on the harder side of firm werent attached to the headboard so if two people sat on the foot of the bed at once we did several times the whole bed tips up alarmingly
Overall  a decent hotel for a good price  conveniently located satisfactory quality You could do a lot worse in Boston I am not sure you can do a lot better for the money

title: The hotel is back
text: Stayed after the new renovations The exterior is the same but the rooms have been updated The rooms have a great tv with ipod hookup and the remote controls all lights and ac The only issue is that the bugs still need to be worked out with the electronics The staff went out of their way to help however The food was great and the overall experience was very nice The occupancy was not up to the previous levels but should be soon

title: Customer Service is a JOKE to this hotel
text:
I would highly advise not staying here No one at the front desk management office or anywhere in between wants to work They do not even acknowledge you when you approach the front desk The GM actually told me they did not care about customer service 
And sleep in a plastic bag so you can avoid all the bed bugs I was switched from 3 rooms and finally had to leave the place Of course they would not give my money back Gross

title: WOW What an amazing experience
text: I was overwhelmed with pleasure with my stay at the resort and also my experience at the spa I was in town on business and would highly recommend choosing this resort Theres nothing like it Go go go

title: Excellent place to stay in downtown Indianapolis
text:
My family and I stayed two nights at this hotel just after the Final Four The hotel is located on the west side of downtown and is adjacent to the Indianapolis Convention Center It is in walking distance of downtown Across the street from the hotel you have the NCAA national headquarters and the Indiana State Museum The hotel is brand new and opened in February 2010 It is adjacent to Fairfield Inn and Courtyard By Marriott All three hotels share an underground garage that sits beneath the hotels Self parking in the garage is 20day and valet parking is 25day There is a well appointed TGIFridays located in the Fairfield Inn and you can dine there or have it delivered to your room through room service
The hotel is very well appointed and serves a continental breakfast every morning Rooms are well appointed and are trendy Each room has a large Phillips LCD HDTV with plenty of HD channels available Free internet is available via WiFi or wired connections WiFi signal strength is very good and download speeds were 15 Mbit consistently The room has an independently controlled HVAC system with a digital thermostat microwave and small cube fridge The bathroom design is somewhat interesting in that is a split bathroom The main sinkvanity and tub are in one room and the toilet and small sink are located in another area The beds were very nice with high quality sheets and coverings The night stand contained a phone along with an iHome clock radio with iPod Dock
As for other features a fitness room was available with a variety of equipment available The hotel features a very small indoor pool that probably could safely fit about 20 people in it A business center is available where you can check your email and print off boarding passes The lobby is well appointed with free coffee and wifi The breakfast area was very clean and offered a variety of hot and cold items for breakfast Typically scrambled eggs and sausage patties were available along with a doityourself waffle machine A variety of cereals bagels and juices were available as well 
For dinner as mentioned previously a TGIFridays is located over in the Fairfield Inn Other restaurants are located in downtown and can be easily accessed by foot car or taxi
Overall this was an excellent hotel with quiet well appointed rooms and other ammentites

title: So much better than the Grand Hyatt around the corner
text:
Was bracing myself for another stay in the worn down and dank Grand Hyatt when I realized my Hyatt points would work at Andaz Hooray
Great hotel Exceedingly comfortable and spacious rooms Love the free beverage policy and the library selection in the lobby Location is fabulous too Staff were pleasant
The 2 negatives 
The coffee shop breakfast was poor quality and expensive The restaurant itself is inviting and always seemed to be people having coffee and snacks
As mentioned by others the staff while hip and friendly are quick to answer about things they dont know about Ask them to call the manager to get results
Still will never return to the Grand Hyatt and much prefer this Andaz to W Wall St although W staff seem to have more thorough training

title: Great room for Family amazing views
text:
We had an amazing time here booked a regular room with hopes of getting a better deal for a room with a view once we got there and we did
Literally a couple of feet from the sand the room had a microwave mini fridge coffee maker and a little sink area and 2 queen beds and was very clean 
The best part of course is the balcony our corner room on the 1st floor with the amazing view of the ocean
We could watch the kids playing in the sand from our balcony and that was so convenient 
Would definitely come back but do get the room with a view

title: Cool Design Hotel for a good price
text: I love the interior design at this hotel  all the little detailsthe rooms are very cozy the beds supercomfy You even sort of love that youre sleeping almost right on top of the 405 Its so well Quintessential LA right This hotel is very cool and chic for a more affordable price than other boutique hotels nearby My ONLY issue was the very bad very cheesy technopop playing too often and too loud in the lobby by the pool pretty much almost anywhere except your room thank god

title: Solid choice
text: Average Garden Inn Has a fridge and a microwave Bed was okay Room could have used a little more lighting My room has a nice view of a little pond and trees The room service comes from a restaruant across the parking lot their pizzas are really really goodIve gotten about 4 of them Staff is friendly Id stay here again

title: Do not stay here
text: Disgusting Room was filthy there was a cockroach on my nightstand on my last day Had the impression room hadnt been cleaned for ages Gross Breakfast area was nasty too Staff was friendly

title: It was just a place to sleep
text:
This hotel was just a place to sleep The hotel itself is above a YMCA and you have access to use the gym and pool during the hours that they YMCA is open The room was an older typical hotel room that has not been updated recently but it had a large fridge and a kitchen The view is of the street  nothing to exciting Location wise its ok  if its not raining You can walk the freedom trail over the bridge in and out of the downtown area of the city but I would not recommend this hotel to nonwalkers You can also take the ferry downtown which is a nice ride but the ferries stop running at 6 pm schedule varies based on time of year so check the schedule applicable to your visit There arent very many choices for restaurants near the hotel and there were only a few places that would deliver food there Room service is not available
No frills clean helpfulfriendly staff would stay again

title: Dont Bother
text:
I would stay well away from this place not only is it more hassle than its worth to get paperwork sorted out just to get in but the doormen and owner of the particular unit were of no help whatsoever The fridge was not working I think the cleaner forgot to come back after turning it off to defrost the kitchen was flooded The shower curtain was not held up properly and only lasted 1 shower and if you are taller than 57 you wont fit in the bed 
On the plus side its only a 10 minute walk straight up 47th st to Times Square and there is parking right next door if you are willing to pay a fortune for it
 In my opinion there has to somewhere alot better for the price and I will certainly be looking for it next time im in New York

title: Great location but not a true nonsmoking hotel
text:
We stayed for 4 nights in August 2001 to visit family and sight see in Chicago The hotel was great location close to family and tourist attractions in the city The hotel is funky in a positive sense We has a queen bed room and had plenty of room To recieve a discounted rate I had 3 reservations so when I checked in I was give 30 credit to use in the room bargreat I signed up as Kimpton memenr and ercieved free wifi in my room whihc was great My only concern was the hotel is considered nonsmoking however we and other guests complained for several days since other guests were smoking in thier rooms The smoke smell was very strong in the hallway however we couldnt smell it in our room The hotels staff after the first day was to spray perfume in the area which we and other guests determined it was worst than the smoke The staff responded that they would handle it and charge the guests a fee for smoking but that didnt stop the smoking My thougths are how about asking them to leave the hotel You could tell when they checked out since the smoke smell was gone
Overall the stay was a great location for us but Im not sure I would recommend to other to stay at this Kimpton property We have stayed at other Kimptons in ther cities and the hotels were very different

title: Enjoyable and pleasant stay Fantastic view of Times Square
text:
My wife younger daughter and I visited NYC this past weekend Nov 1215 2010 where we enjoyed a very pleasant stay at the Marriott Marquis The hotel room was clean and quiet with a fantastic view of Times Square 
We did not eat at the hotel but rather went to local restaurants One restaurant which we particularly enjoyed was Juniors right across the street on the south side of the hotel A great place for breakfast 
Other than at check incheck out we had very little interaction with hotel staff In general we found them to be friendly and attentive 
We found the hotel ideally situated for shopping and going to a show The Gray Line bus tours were great I would stay here again

title: Fabulous hotel
text: What a gorgeous hotel with amazing service The staff members are all lovely and helpful I got there a little early because of my flight and they had a room ready right away The staff was very helpful with suggestions and directions The rooms are beautiful and clean The bar area of the room has ice in a freezer so you dont have to call up every time you want ice I love that Turn down service and they leave water bottles on your nightstand While I was there for business while my husband was home with the kids I called him while watching TV in the bathroom mirror from the tub He said That really sounds like you are working hard Haha Great area feels very safe for a solo traveler easy to walk around the city Close to lots of shops and restaurants I would recommend this hotel to everyone I would love to come back for pleasure instead of work next time and bring my husband

title: Owwwwww Really great stay
text: Great hotel Modern and classicchic Very good location just one block from the waterfront and great restaurants Really nice and big room with super confort bed Room with lots of amenities Nice bathroom I had a great view from my room They also let me check in at 8am They have a great restaurant inside a Starbucks and a guy in the lobby that can help with maps and info about the area Really close from South Station and the Silverline stop right in front the hotel I ordered room service food and the only complaint is the 4 they charge for delivery which is not great cause the restaurant is inside the hotel Maybe a 10 min drive to the airport

title: Great Staff and Accomodations
text:
I stayed here for two weeks during a recent business trip to the area and was thoroughly impressed with the facilities and the amenities Breakfasts in the morning were decent Certainly plenty of options with regards to both healthy and standard egg and toast type breakfast I cannot speak to the dinners as I chose to take advantage of the kitchen in my room  I did however enjoy a few cold beers which was quite nice The kitchen in my room as well as the other rooms  I was told by a staff member do not have measuring cups among a few other kitchen essentials It wasnt too big of a deal as the wonderful woman she was a doll and good at her job who works evenings preparing and serving dinner lent me the hotel kitchens measuring cup so I could make my rice The maid service was quite consistent as well minus the fact that they forgot to replace my kitchen towels and rags once again no big deal as I was able to simply use an extra set from the bathroom Also I had to ask for additional ice bags for the ice bucket they provide
My one gripe which I was surprised no one else mentioned  THE WIRELESS INTERNET IS DREADFULLY SLOW It literally caused nearly all my apps on my tablet to time out due to the poor bandwidth Additionally it made updating my work systems on my laptop impossible Not terribly friendly for anyone who would like to get work done from their room 
All in all I would recommend this hotel to others and would not mind returning

title: Nice people but a little chaotic for the price
text:
Id love to be able to rate the Wardman Park Marriott as excellent on all counts It should have been but it kept falling down on small details When I book into an expensive hotel I expect them to leave my working papers untouched  but the Wardman Park leaves nightdresses untouched too and doesnt make up the bed if youve left your nightie on it Come on guys  this is supposed and priced to be a classy joint And the housekeeper left me a snotty message on my room phone when I suggested that good hotels fold pyjamas as part of bed making More often than not the water bottles werent renewed unless we called down  though shampoos etc kept arriving even if we didnt use the old ones Whenever we called down to concierge or housekeeping things were fixed immediately  but we had to make far too many calls 
Other things were variable too  the volume of spirit in a short varied from day to day in Harrys Bar for instance And of course theres the usual business that every cheap motel has free wi fi but top of the line hotels charge through the nose by the day  and it is slow slow slow But one expects that
Valet service cleaning is excellent quality and good value but dont expect to get it back on time  we were late for a formal dinner waiting for a suit to come back But they charge less than my local cleaner who isnt as good so Ill forgive them  in fact next time Im in the vicinity Ill have a suitcase full of dry cleaning with me
Air conditioning is fairly quiet and very responsive Desk could be bigger All the staff are both friendly and polite  just not quite as well trained as they should be from top to bottom 
Views from the concierge floor are stunning 
Value is fine if you are getting conference rates but rip off if you pay anything approaching full price

title: Solid choice
text: Service is the top pointbhere everyone wants to help and is very pleasant Clean hotel flat screen tvs decent size rooms comfy bedspillows A sure thing

title: Location Wins
text:
This hotel was the first stop for our west coast self drive honeymoon When we landed in San Francisco I already knew that I was going to love it
First impressions of the hotel were OK Its a typical city centre hotel and we went through the main entrance to the reception area which was quite small but very friendly staff behind the counter we had been upgraded to a king size room as it was our honeymoon and free bottle of fizz waiting for us too Nice touch Our room was more than adequate although the bathrooms were tiny They were refurbising when we got there so this could well be different now The room was lovely and perfect for a 3 night stay we had a beautiful view of san francisco bay
As my title this hotel deserves its stars purely because of its location its perfect we left from the rear entrance and thats it we were in the wonderland that was fishermans wharf walk 2 minutes the other way and you were at pier 39 which was wonderful with some lovely places to eat we ate in bubba gumps I know not a particuarly classy restaurant but the shrimp was amaaazing and it was good fun with some lovely cocktails and views of the bay
Walk the other way and you go further down fishermans wharf and eventually get to ghirardelli
square  where you MUST go if you are a chocolate lover We also rented bicycles from a little shop above ghiradelli and rode to the bridge which was amazing that golden gate bridge is just an amazing landmark The tram stops are only 5 mins walk MAX and that will get you everywhere you would want to go Union Square etc
I didnt really use the facilites as no time to swim and was too cold But the pool area looked lovely
All in all if I was going to San Francisco again  I would definetley stay here without a doubt Do not listen to people slating it  San Francisco is about exploring not worrying about what your hotel offers and this hotel is perfect

title: Old but not bad
text: Very old hotel location was ok 10 minute walk to Westfield shopping centre tram stop out the front cheap cab ride to all the main sights The room was average comfy bed clean but very small  basic bathroom Our room had a connecting door to another room which was locked made for a fairly noisy night as I could hear our neighbours talking Starbucks in the lobby is very convenient the buffet breakfast was nothing worth getting up for Free wifi was a plus

title: Great location
text: We came right at the beginning of the Cherry Blossom Festival so prices in DC for lodging were astronomical This hotel felt over priced but at a regular rate I would recommend it It is not the most up to date hotel but it is clean comfortable and the location to the metro is phenomenal I would stay here again

title: THE FINEST RESORT EVER
text: The Grand Del Mar was one of the nicest resorts I have ever stayed at Located in a beautiful area in the hills of Del Mar the setting is absolutely stunning The property is is lovely the buildings well detailed and overall just impeccable When you check in the staff is friendly and professional At check in they offer you a scented towel to prepare you for your delightful stay The rooms are well appointed and beautifully sized with nice furnishings and a superb bathroom Beautiful bath accessories robes room safe and lovely touches throughout The ONLY item I thought was deficient was the shower was not very good at all low water pressure Funny how a hotel with such exceptional attention to detail would overlook one of the most important functions of the day a good shower Turn down service was lovely with rose petals in the bathroom and chocolates on the pillow that were always delicious The staff is fantastic they cant do enough for you and very friendly yet professional I tried the spa excellent Great massage wonderful spa area steam sauna and whirlpool and wonderful amenities Excellent gym with the best equipment The food on property was also excellent I cant say enough good things about the Grand Del Mar and will definitely recommend it to everyone I know as well as come back

title: Beware unless you love shabby rooms Attitude Dirt and bugs
text: Was excited to stay since the location is fantastic Walking distance to many major NYC attractions shows etc Bell and restaurant staff are friendly BUT Beware the Front Desk employees The website shows beautifully appointed rooms But the reality is far from the truth Antiquiated air conditioners make for stifling rooms Chipped bathroom tiles queensized sheets on king sized beds leave you fighting with the bottom sheet all night The lack of bathroom exhaust fans are like being in an unwanted sauna The ecologically friendly light bulbs hang below the shades are too big for the lamps and provide a blinding glare when turned on The bathrooms have dirt rimmed shower doors and dirty grout When we asked to change rooms we were rebuffed by one Desk Clerk Finally after much hassle we did switch rooms Unfortunately the only difference was a larger space but this one had an ant colony in the bathrrom

title: You be the judge
text: Arrived here from out of town to celebrate 50th birthday At 400 pm our room still was not cleaned and the explanation given was that the hotel had permitted a late checkout The staff then suggested that we go grab some dinner at 430 And that we could change our clothes in the spa what We walked around for two hours waiting for housekeeping to clean the room and got soaking wet as it poured while we were out When we returned the room was ready but not what we reserved at 50 we arent into double beds After some wrangling about the reservation we were moved to a different room King size bed good but lost the view and the bathtub bad Management agreed to move us again but this time across the wharf in the pouring rain to a separate building By this stage we were late for our 7pm dinner reservation No thanks We went back to the double beds which was fine but not what we had booked Staff were friendly throughout but the hotel I guess got the first part wrong and it compounded from there Room booked as a deluxe harbour view with uninterrupted views didnt match the online hype So not the bargain or quality we had booked

title: Good place to stay in San diego
text:
My husband and I stayed in a premier room at the Omni The room was spacious and very clean including the linens and matress pad Prior to our stay a few requests were made and all of them were metReservations and check in were efficient the ladies at the front desk were excellent Actually all the staff that we dealt with from the concierge to the valet were very professional and courteous except for 2 individuals in the housekeeping department Robert and Mauda 
Apart from the above the only other negative was the Hefty 3500 to park daily and if you wish to leave a tip for the the valetwhich at 3500day should be included you can not add it to your room charges you must pay cash which if you dont know can be an inconvenience
Apart from the above our stay was very comfortable and we would stay at this Omni again without hesitation

title: Some nice features but nothing seems to work
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Los Angeles for three nights during a business trip We had been hoping that my Starwood Gold status would get us an upgrade to the executive level which has happened occasionally at other Starwood properties but we were happy to settle for a southeastfacing corner room on the 18th floor This turned out to be a mixed blessing the room was large and looked nice enough but the view turned out to be nothing special  the massive parking garage and some uninteresting sections of south Los Angeles  and the two walls of windows caused the room to be unbearably hot This was exacerbated by the weak and antiquated airconditioning Unlike 99 of modern hotels in which each room has its own thermostat and fan control this one only had an onoff switch and a lever that went from Warm to Cool We followed the advice of the hotel staff and kept the curtains closed most of the day although sitting in a dark room more or less defeats the purpose of having panoramic windows But when I tried to work at the desk near the closed curtains it still felt like I was sitting next to a heater
There were other technical problems as well The water in the shower never went beyond lukewarm and the water pressure was also very weak A hotel engineer explained that the state andor local governments had imposed low flow requirements on the shower heads and that the hot water had been restricted so that you wont scald yourself But the net result was that taking a shower was not a pleasant experience And I dont recall having had this problem in other Los Angeles hotels
Although fixing these big problems might require a toptobottom remake of the hotel there are other problems that would be much easier to solve The only drinking glasses in our room were flimsy disposable plastic ones the towels looked like they had been purchased on a budget a few years ago there was no safe in the room 
On the good side the hotel has a great location steps from stores restaurants and downtown office buildings and quite near historic Los Angeles neighborhoods and attractions including the old Pueblo de Los Angeles Little Tokyo and Union Station Theres also a Metro station right across the street The bed was comfortable and the large flatscreen TV was impressive And we found most staff members to be pleasant and helpful Unlike some other reviewers we found the Housekeeping staff to be hardworking and efficient A couple of the reception desk staff were brusque and cocky in an urban sort of way They probably didnt mean anything by it but all hotels should give frequent refresher training in the Golden Rule

title: staff very rude poor service and amenities
text: before booking my stay at the crown plaza i checked out their webside it said renovations were to be completed by end sept just to be sure i called the hotel and was told that everything is complete in the hotel with just some minor work outside everything was fully operational when i checked in as a platinum member of piority club normally i get some extra benefits such as an upgrade to the exec floor and complimentary breakfast i was told that this hotel does not recognise this status as it is upto the individual hotel i could not believe this as i have never had a problem anywhere else before i asked to see the manager and they were very rude and denied my requesti also discovered the resaurant was not open for dinner and the bars were also closed i was told they were waiting for a liquor licence i complained again to the front desk manager and this time they agree to give me a free breakfast it was as i was begging for it and i was made to felt bad i have read other review on different websites about this hotel and how rude the staff are they really could not care less i would not recommend staying at this hotel due to the attitude of the staff

title: Exceptional Service at an affordable price
text: I am completely UNsavvy when it comes to New York but after visiting on business a few times I decided to surprise my wife with a Valentines Day trip to the city I had many questions about where and which subway station would get us to our destinations and every question was met with patience and detailed instructions which got us to our destinations easily The front desk staff was VERY attentive arranging dining reservations time saving recommendations and advice on how to navigate the city Our room was cozy and bed was extremely comfortable

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text: We stayed here in August with friends and family I can not begin to say how perfect this hotel was for us The staff was wonderful friendly and helpful The bellhop Zach I believe was not only helpful to me but also made sure to pay attention to my children which is a plus in my book He also gave us great recommendations on where to eat The hotel was within a reasonable walk to the historic area of Philly and is very close to the terminal market Very convenient if you need to go to the ball parks or arenas the subway station is right there across the street from the hotel It was the perfect place for a great trip

title: Best Service  Definitely will return to stay
text: Everthing from the kind hospitality right up to the guidance provided by the hotel management and staff was excellent

title: Review of Hilton mahattan East Hotel in NYC
text:
Stay period  Feb 24 to Feb 26
1 Location  Middle Town near Grand Central Station from Grand Central Station walk to Hilton Manhattan East Hotel take 7 to 10 mins just a straight way its easy and not hard to found The area there is save lot of expensive shop famous building like Empire State Building New York Public Library around there and it took 10 to 15 mins or 20 mins walk to Time Square Taxi driver have no problem to found there
2 Hotel Lobby  Nice decorated Free Wifi have desk for trourist information like map guide comfortable sofa nice desk lady I had several time at midnight asking question the Front Desk Manager men forgot the name is really helpful like asking for help how to make the free wifi working on my Galaxy Note where to buy cigarette
3 Room  a  Room is small and you can say nice The most important to me is the TV and music player my one is not Ipod but the have the clock radio which can put my Galaxy Note to play my own music TV have not much channel but enough for a tried night when you fell very sleepy they dont have much movie channel also music channel The movie Channel is AMC and HBO movie was old and boring 
 b  The bed is very comfortable they have 4 pillow and its also comfortable the bed also have a long and big cushion and it occupied my bed a 13 portion so I just put it away
 c  The bathroom is dated bath tub have some dirty spot the amenities like shampoo conditioner is not really plenty and the most weird thing is they dont have hair dryer  On Feb 24 Friday night when I arrrived from Virginia to NYC at 530pm strong wind and crazy rain make me all wet even my hair and they dont have HAIR DRYER  and the room have coffee and tea complimentary but I cant found the water even the water bolier and there have no mini bar so I need to go to near supermarket at 3am to buy a can of beer
 d  When I want to have hair dryer I call front desk and they send me hair dryer and water within 15 mins At least I dont need to wait a long time with my wet and dirty hair and I want to sleep very much
 e  The view of the room is different from the site I saw I got a room on 1616 16F left and right side window is facing the back or roof or window of other building no city view
 f  When I asking is there any business center or the place which provide internet service and they show me the business center but charges is expensive 
 g  For sleeping the room is quiet  no noise to disturb you and there have a nice mirror which stick on the bathroom door so when you close the bathroom door the whole door mirror will be the part of the rooms wall So lucky my bed is not facing the mirror or I cant get in sleep
4 Awful thing  When I come back at midnight want to go to washroom I found the washroom at lobby end the toilet bowl is full of pp and lot of tissue floor is not clean the whole washroom is very dirty how can it happen on a Hilton Hotel
5 Front desk staff  When I want to add one more night on Monday the lady of front desk help me to check price she give me a good advise that if book in the front desk they can make it for me without problem but the price is US199 not including tax and the price I booked from Agoda on site is US169 so she told me book on site if want to get the same price
On the whole the staff of this hotel is friendly and helpful But some facilities like the lobby washroom is awful the room should be get everything really before the tourist move in The bathroom is look very nice little bit older and the bath tub look not really decent I think hair dryer is the MUST HAVE ITEM in the bathroom the advantage of the room is lot of adapter for charging So I can charge my camera and Galaxy Note
Totally this hotel not bad for the price US169 from Feb 24 to 26 But now I checked it already turn to US299 I wont move in for this price Lot of choice

title: Huge Hilton in Central Location
text:
Hotel is huge At nearly 20 per day parking is rather expensive considering the hotel is not downtown The location is central to much of Dallas but not near any attractions in particular so a rental car is a must
There are two or three connected buildings that make up the hotel and the rooms are different When checking in go to the Tower side so that you get a Tower room They are much more modern than the Atrium side If you check in at the Atrium side you are likely to get an Atrium room which is a basic Hilton room showing a bit of age It seems strange that there would be such a difference in the hotel rooms but the hotel has something like 1700 rooms so two checkin desks is a good idea you just have to be sure to go to the one in the Tower side 
Overall this is a generally good Hilton property It is apparently a convention hotel with most travelers on business during the week We got an unpublished fare for this hotel so the value was good overall However the parking was expensive since the hotel isnt centrally located The other hotels like the one next door have free parking so paying nearly 20 per night for selfparking seemed absurd Nothing is within walking distance so a rental car is a must

title: Great pool and happy hour but no free internet
text:
The rooms lobby and service were all very nice and comparable to other Marriott hotels Ive stayed at around California We had no problem checkingin or with parking We had one problem a concierge told us breakfast was free when its not but that was quickly resolved by Marriott
The pool area is very nice Although the pools not heated there is a spa sauna and very wellequipped weight room Plus there are free hammocks and these round couches were you can lay out in comfort and relax Theres also a poolside cabana thats available to be rented 
One unexpected plus was the happy hour which ran for 5 hours 3 in the afternoon 2 at night and had 5 drinks and certain 5 menu items which was great for a cheaper late night snack
The hotel location was also nice close to major freeways and several mallsrestaurant locations
The only downside was the internet Most hotels now have free wifi but the hotel charged to use the internet We paid 595 and once we logged off could not access the unused minutes wo paying another 595

title: great beds and pillows friendly and efficient registration
text: greektown hotel is a great place to stay especially if you are attending a sporting event or show in detroit  it is in walking distance of two stadiums and connected by the people mover to other places of interest greektown has many adjacent restaurants that accept casino comps and there is a free shuttle available to farther spots I has especially helpful and profeesional help from linda at reservations the last two times I stayed there the beds and pillows are the best around

title: Great location  rather expensive
text: Hotel appeared to be very new with everything in excellent condition The room was a comfortable size with good facilities Breakfast is expensive at 17 but there are so many little diners round the corner on 6th Avenue with breakast at less than 5 Found it expensive at 360night expedia but the location made it worth it It is a short walk to Times Square and the theatres or to the Subway We looked at the lineup for halfprice theatre seats and decided our time was more valuable So we went directly to the theatres they are all within a a short walk form Times Square and got good seats for 3 shows paying between 50  100 A must do is the Gray Line Bus Tour  they have a package of 4 tours for 54  and they are wonderful with great guides We did all 4 and saw most of Manhattan Brooklyn Statue of Liberty ferry included and a night tour Ive been to many large cities and found this Subway one of the harder ones to navigate but people are very helpful and offered assistance whenever we looked confused  it was fun and you cant get lost Taxi from the Airport is probably a ripoff at 50 and the 15 minute buggy ride in Central Park at 40 definitely is As for eating  we went to one of the many Irish pubs just before the shows and had great food for 1520 Empire State Building is a must but the Rockefeller Centre isnt Walked over Brooklyn Bridge for that great view Overall New York is fascinating and the Hilton Garden Inn is a great central location for seeing it

title: Hotel was a tonic for tired travellers
text:
We stayed here for the first night of our holiday in California arriving jet lagged and tired The first impression the hotel gives was a tonic and it was followed up by friendly desk staff and an impressive room with 2 enormous comfortable beds The bathroom was a great size We had a fantastic view of downtown from the floor to ceiling windows and we all spent a large proportion of the night enjoying this as our body clocks were still on GMT
I appreciated the extra touches in the bathroom such as good lighting and mirrors and lots of soap shampoos and conditioners There were lots of fluffy white towels for the 4 of us to use
We stayed one night and did not use any of the other hotel facilities We found it was within walking distance of some shops for the provisions that we needed and we were given a local map and clear instructions by the front of house staff
Next morning we walked to catch the Amtrak service to Santa Barbara and must recommend Union Station to all travellers It is a fantastic building and worth a detour if you are in Los Angeles

title: Worst Service  Mgmt was better as The Pointe
text: This resort used to be dedicated to luxury at a reasonable price with great service Since their change to Arizona Grand the quality overall has deteriorated the service is terrible and the management is pathetic

title: Really great comfortable hotel nice location
text: My family and I stayed in this hotel for a week and loved it We were in a suite and the room quality gym accessibility closeness to the metrotrolley stops and being close to Gaslamp and other attractions were all big pluses too The staff was really friendly and helpful and it was an overall great stay Would recommend to anyone

title: First Impression Changed by Superior Service
text:
Im generally not that picky about rooms when I travel by myself To me on this trip being within visual distance of the ocean was more important than the room and amenities My only request I made through the Wyndam Rewards website was not to put me on the first floor
I arrived an hour before check in time and the front desk hostess promptly checked me in anyway
I was put on the first floor Room 106 I was surprised that this room was even available given that the room across from me was partially demolished the lower half of the walls in the hallway had drywall removed with exposed studs and the carpet in the hall and up to my door was covered with cardboard ducttaped to the walls and threshold My balconypatio opened up to a lovely ground level view of the parking lot
I was pretty much in disbelief at the whole situation
I approached the hostess Melissa I think and asked for a different room She was very accommodating and immediately found an upper level room 352 which was an upgrade for me at no additional cost She saved the day
The rest of the staff were uniformly friendly and personable including housekeeping
The partial view rooms are exactly that I was able to watch the sunset and see the ocean waves by sitting cattycorner on my balcony and looking between the buildings
The tropical decor wasnt something Id choose the inside chairs were stiff and uncomfortable there were 2 paintings of the same thing but there were little things that I could really appreciate Oxygenics shower head with outstanding pressure bottle opener in the bathroom extra pillows bottled water ironing board plenty of hand towels decent coffee There were a few minor annoyances roof construction next door the door lock wasnt responsive the TV remote buttons were sticky but it was a quiet spacious and comfortable room
The pool was a little crowded and felt a bit enclosed due to the glass windbreaks but appeared well maintained Parking was 15day There is an excellent and popular beachfront restaurant World Famous across the parking lot with very reasonable prices that I ate breakfast at twice 
The boardwalk spans several miles back and forth and gave me about an hour of brisk exercise daily the sunsets were stunning Mission Beach was clean and there are plenty of convenience stores and restaurants nearby
I would stay at this hotel again but probably not for a special event like an anniversary I felt like all the provisions I needed were there it was weathered but clean and the staff warmed the place up Overall a nice hasslefree experience and I enjoyed myself

title: excellent hotel however Im not going back ever again
text:
The hotel is great the room was big staff friendly and we slept great on the week days However during the weekend it felt like a cheap Vegas hotel very very noisy on Friday night someone pulled the fire alarm at 3AM and the entire hotel was awake needless to say we were up since than Saturday night there was a party in a room nearby and we were up again for the entire night The staff offered a breakfast in return for 2 sleepless nights which was insulting
Im never going back there

title: Would stay here again  location friendly service walkable area
text:
The Westin was a great place to spend six nights Not far from the Metro about a half mile from the Convention Center Dupont Circle a walkable distance although there is a bit of a hill The National Mall is close about 10 minutes away
The room was very comfortable Felt like a home away from home without a kitchen Having a refrigerator in the room was a treat There isnt a view The bed was very comfortable The room was roomy The maid service was very good I liked the option of foregoing maid service for the 500 credit
There is a concierge on duty into the night time  a treat since I was in meetings from 800 am until 630 pm Kudos for recommending the Martin Luther King Jr Monument  if I hadnt been tired after 4 days of meeting with sore feet and just too tired I would have gone Both concierges that helped me did more than hand out a map and point
The front desk was attentive The bellmen were very nice The neighborhood has restaurants in all price ranges The refrigerator allowed making purchases at local grocery stores for breakfast yogurt and muselix
The convention rate was reasonable for DC

title: Good location and value
text:
We stayed for 5 nights in a double room with shared bath
Location was great a couple of minutes walk from a metro stop down a quietish street but safe The shared bathroom was clean and almost always available If youre looking for a budget hotel within easy travel of all major sights then you could do a lot worse

title: simple crash pad with stable rates
text:
I am an exlong time NYer who stays overnight 1012 times a year while doing things I used to do when I lived there I have become a big fan of the Jane because of its consistency and simplicity I just need a place to sleep overnight The Jane offers a comfortable single bed with free wireless internet a free bottle of water and rates that never seem to vary between 79 and 99 dollars a night In my at least 10 stays there all weekend I have never encountered a problem in the shared bathroom  Ive barely seen anyone else and when I do they are as silent and going about their business as I am 
I know theyve opened a trendy bar downstairs but I have yet to encounter the result of that  I must get in for the night too early or something but I have never heard anything I wish they had regular elevators but I dont mind walking and the elevator operators are also de facto customer service  once I bought a good night beer that required an opener and the elevator operator happily accommodated me and another time my key stopped working which made me really grumpy but the elevator operator was able to fix the problem without a visit to the front desk 
Really for me it is a crash pad in the city without the hassle of having to set up arrangements with a friend Andas a bonus there is an affordable car lot across the street but I have also found free parking on the street on many occasions Dont listen to the front desk guy who is nice but uninformed about the parking situation as I was when I lived therefollow the street signs which mostly indicate free parking

title: very excited to stay here
text:
Not a review yet since we still have to arrive but since we will be arriving here this Thursday coming in from Holland to stay for 6 nights just a short note to say that we are very much looking forward to it after having read all this reviews We booked the hotel due to the reviews here for my birthday which was this Sunday and are happy to see that it is still going strong especially since it is our first visit
So Jennifer and all here we come to enjoy ourselves and will defenitely post a review after our visit

title: A very nice discovery
text:
A very lovely hotel Great location to fabulous shopping and excellent restaurants
Room was very bright due to walltowall windows A stark contrast to the dimly lit hallways The room is not very large and the bathroom is somewhat on the smallish side but everything is very modern and slick The area was also remarkably quiet during the weekend It is a fair walk to the Old town but access to the T is right outside the door
We went to the dipping pool on the roof This area feels a little dated and has a backyard feeling and you are certainly not going to do laps But for a break from your shopping during the day it is a lovely quiet spot for a drink and a snack even without dipping

title: Perfect place for coming in and out of Charlotte airport
text:
I stayed with my daughter at this hotel on the nights before and after a trip to Costa Rica on the way tofrom the airport 
The hotel is new and beautiful much more redolent of an Omni or Hilton than a Hampton It is clean comfortable and even a bit chic The front desk staff was very friendly The rooms are beautiful with comfy beds and nice flat screen TVs There is a pool and hot tub which were clean and the right temperature 
There was a free 24 hour shuttle to and from the airport and indeed the same friendly driver dropped me off at 4 am and picked me up again a week later at 1215 am The only thing is that my cell phones information line didnt have the phone number of this hotel in the system yet bc it was so new so I had to call the central Hampton Inn line to call the shuttle when I returned to the airport It would be good to have the phone number handy You can call from the airport courtesy phone but I didnt see the phone 
The hotel stored my car for the whole week for 5 and there was security present onside and my car was fine 
There is 24 hour coffeeteahot chocolate service and I think they leave fruit out all the time There were cookies when I arrived at about 8 pm the first day but not when we got in at 1230 am understandably
The breakfast was good Make your own waffles scrambled eggs etc On the day of our 4 am flight they even packed us a bag lunch
I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel and would gladly stay here again It would be great for any purpose  business leisure etc It is a perfect place to stay on the way tofrom the airport

title: Great Location
text: The hotel was gorgeous I could see Fenway Park from my window Eastern Standard was just down stairs Its super close to BUs campus Ive been to a ton of hotels and this one was quite nice

title: Hip dog friendly nice decor
text: I tried to think of the first three things which came to mind regarding this hotel First of all its very hiptrendy The decor is nice and even a little quirky I mean who really gets to use leopard print terrycloth robes outside of their own home The rooms are small but well appointed I was a little taken aback by the number of dogs I saw enteringstaying on the property but my fears quickly subsided    I didnt hear one bark see any fur balls or any signs of the furry critters The staff are generally nice I was really impressed to see two iced down water containers with my choice of either mintlemon or strawberry infused water Gratis This is a lovely hotel although its almost impossible to get a taxi from this spot which was probably the only detractor I can come up with The hotel is VERY convenient to shopping and also the BART And when the going gets tough theres Blue Bottle Cafe just around the corner Eat your heart out Starbucks

title: A Dumpy Hotel In Koreantown with only attraction is Location
text:
I am some sort of hotelsnub and here is why I was a flight attendant for 15 years staying in the best and worst of some hotels in countries all around the world I could write a book about hotels from bed bugs to suites and from 0 starts to 5 stars hotels My experience has given me a quite range of knowledge about the industry Now with my credibility built up here is what I think of the Hotel Stamford
Location Excellent Steps away from great locations in Manhattan such as Koreantown Empire State Penn Station Manhattan Mall and many others this is for the people that do not care about rooms and do care mostly about location
Lobby Cold feeling not temperaturewise with a very small checkin desk old and dated counters furniture and an elevator that looks that it should be in an antique museum Light is very brightwhite business like and I feel like I am walking into an office building more than a hotel I guess you can claim that it adds feeling to the hotel yeah right
Amenities The hotel offers free wireless in the lounge floor only between the early morning hours until 3 pm After hours the guest must pay what That is the biggest oxymoron Ive heard in a long time Why charge for only a few hours of the night There is a couple of computers in the business center but after I heard stories of identities being stolen from public computers I do not like to use any of them This is not a lie or urban legend story one of my friends used a computer in the business center at a very reputable hotel in LAX and 24 hours later the credit card she used to pay for the charges was hacked and thousands of dollars of online purchases were charged to her credit card 
Rooms All I have to say is YUK Here is why The decorcolor is 60s green with super white bright lights old phones and televisions Furniture was chipping away and the room just felt as cold as the lobby 
The bed spreadcover is very old I immediately take it off the bed as they are the ones to harbor bacteria and the nasty stuff you can only find with a blue light The bed was very old and could feel the metal springs on my back and was concerned if one of them will come through the fabric and poke me in the back In addition the curtains were made of the same material as the bed spread The television channel selection sucked with only a handful of local channels and a few international 
The only positive thing I have to say about the room is that it has a refrigerator In other higher quality hotels a refrigerator is a luxury item with some even adding an additional 30 or more dollars to the bill when asking for one 
The ultimate cleaning test I do is to wear clean white socks and see how they end up at the end of the evening while walking around Lets say that in a mater of minutes my white socks were black I wonder when it was the last time this hotels carpets where shampooed and properly cleaned
Bathroom The basics are given such as shampoo lotion and soap Water pressure was good and towels ok but again old and a better cleaning detergent could have been used Hairdryer did its job but was very loud Everything else worked fine
Wakeup call worked fine but not even a voice at the other end Most hotels will have either a recording or live person give you the time and weather conditions but not here just silence
Service I only had contact with the Front Desk Staff and they seemed to be professional but along with the ambiance of the hotel cold and serious
Overall Experience Great location but in service decor amenities and cleanliness Hotel Stamford failed completely Hotel Stamford is in need of major renovations and upkeeping Better hotels for equal price in the area are available where it can be more comfortable to stay at

title: great deal great room great location
text: very comfortable room very comfortable for 3 people with the loft

title: Great location but rodent problem
text: On the surface the hotel is very beautiful It is in a great location and has nice amenities such as the spa and fitness center and a great pool The restaurant Roberts has wonderful food and there are nice gift shops However my experience was not so pleasant as there was a rodent infestation at the time I was there in late summer There was a mouse in my sleeping room that fortunately was not discovered until the morning I was checking out Otherwise I would have not have been able to stay in that hotel another night There was also a mouse in the main Regency ballroom It was a tramatizing experience as I have never had a rodent or insect problem at ANY hotel Ive stayed The hotel staff was quite apologetic but it was apparently a big problem I will not stay there again and even if there were no rodents I would not have recommended it

title: Dont love the namebut the hotel is great
text:
Recently stayed at this establishment for one night We were very pleasantly surprised to find a very nice facility with well appointed and decorated rooms The street that the hotel is on has free street parking available in the usual New York fashion you have to move your car twice during the week for one hour or so and we were able to secure a place right outside the hotel  literally 
Lovely staff and an excellent espresso machine Cimbali at the buffet breakfast just topped it off Would return

title: Love the building and space but ac was out
text:
The room size was absolutely amazing Great bed as with every Marriott old building with lots of character and great views from the rooftop patio The location is great and allows you to walk to a number of restaurants
