Two problems Air conditioning was out in the lobby elevator and hallways and this during a heat wave where the heat index reached almost 120 That meant breakfast in the 90 degree great room was just not that appealing And with limited self parking I was forced to valet and the valets were very quick getting my car Fine for a leisure trip not so good when youre expected in the office Especially not great when you dont have anywhere cool to wait for your car
Since I assume the ac was a on time issue and Marriott was nice enough to credit me with bonus points Id definitely stay here again

title: Another fab hotel in the Morgans hotels portfolio
text: Our family of 5 has just returned from a 5 day stay at this modern deign led hotel which can be described as a hip urban oasis in the heart of the ubertrendy SoHo area in Manhattan As a former hotel owneroperator it was great to stay in a relaxed and friendly hotel where the fabric of the hotel and the staff come together in harmony The fabric of the hotel is great as you would expect from this group but the staff make the difference and they were great from the bell boys to the concierge services team just to mention a few Nothing seemed too much trouble for them Concierge services are provided in a relaxed environment and they arranged everything from best Broadway theatre tickets to exclusive sightseeing rides and airline bookings and providing very useful local tips Check out the Penthouse suites for views to die for Rooms come with an iPad for guest use for paperless guest service directory and connecting to the electronic world for free  nice touch The GM Gary Thomas is a super guy and he has a great team around him We will be back soon

title: Great Inexpensive Clean
text:
Our stay at Hotel Adagio was great The place was very clean and the environment was very welcoming I found a very good price on Hotelscom The staff were all very accomodating The hotel provided coupons for two complimentary organic beers at the Cortez restaurant Although the bar staff was a little snobby the beers were delicious Overall pleasant stay 
 We stayed on the side that faces Geary St so we could hear the clubsbars going on at night Wasnt too bothersome but you could hear it Definitely recommend to friends and family

title: Phenomenal hotel
text: This hotel is quite amazing It has a very rich history and quite a bit of character The lobby the ballroom and restaurant are all beautiful The rooms are spacious and clean with marble floors leading into the bathroom The location is ideal just blocks from Lake Michigan and roughly a half a mile from Magnificent mile The hotel is unique in terms of the history of the building I would highly recommend this hotel for a couples retreat or even solo as it puts you in the perfect location

title: Outstanding  THE place to stay
text: Excellent hotel great front desk and ALL staff Wonderful room and bed  kitchen and room service Free hot Bfast is very nice and free coffee all day long Free shutle all over town and the location is close to everything You cannot beat this place Pets welcome too

title: Dedicated Staff
text: During my experience at this property I saw that some outstanding staff went above and beyond the call of duty to make the stay of their guests more amenable  at the LAX property in particular Fabiola Lopez at the Brewery who is very attentive accommodating and an otherwise outstanding server  you dont encounter them often especially in Los Angeles She was able to provide her excellent and tailored service in both English and Spanish flawlessly

title: My favorite hotel in NYC
text: I always stay at the Elysee for business and personal trips to New York While the location is very convenient what really keeps me coming back is the outstanding service Sometimes its the little touchs that set a hotel apart from the competition and the Elysee excels in many ways The attentive staff the exceptional breakfast free internet service its all here They also have a great boardroom thats great for a small business meeting I also need to give a mention for the Monkey Bar which is a very cool historic bar adjacent to the Elysee

title: Nice Hotel Mediocre Staff
text:
We stayed on the Peabody Club level and enjoyed the view not incredible but nice and the concierge The club room is nothing spectacular but was a nice touch The whole march of the ducks is an interesting experience probably more if you have kids and the lobby is a nice place to relax
My biggest complaint is that some of the hotel security is obnoxious I had a cooler with bbq in it and was told that security may have to inspect my cooler for alcohol as they dont permit outside drinks Also after dinner one night my wife and I were walking around the mezzanine at the suggestion of the duck march guy its a thing and we were asked to leave by security The security guy then proceeded to follow us the entire time talking into his 2way and reporting on the status of ejecting us He continued to follow us until we left the building even though we were guests
Could be a fun place and we probably had an unusual experience but make sure you follow ze rules or youll be treated like a delinquent teenager

title: Wicked Hotel
text:
Just returned from 8 days staying at Hotel 41 both my boyfriend and myself loved the Hotel The rooms werent as small as I was expecting so that was a bonus A nice big shower and the DVDCD player were a good bonus too
The complimentary breakfast was a great starter for the day with muffins danish pastries bagels OJ and Coffee brilliant
As many other people have said before the hotel was very clean and the hotel staff were friendly and polite When we checked in we got our complimentary bottle of water There was also the promised aveda products left in our room and they were refilled each day We didnt get any bathrobes but it wasnt a big deal
The location of the hotel was prefect a few minutes from times square but the street the hotel was on is quietthe best of both worlds
We would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to friends who are thinking about going to NY
Overall a great hotel for the price

title: Stay ANYWHERE else Bed bugs black mold in shower mold in coffee maker
text: We prebooked our trip for our sons Basic Military Graduation and were supposed to stay here from 720725 We arrived in San Antonio after 2 planes and just wanted a nice shower and clean bed which neither were available here This place is disgusting Stay ANYWHERE else We stayed 1 night and even after spraying the entire room with Lysol and Bug Spray we were eaten alive by fleasbed bugs The shower curtain was full of black mold and so horrible that showering was a chore instead of relaxing even the coffee filter was full of mold We ended up leaving and staying at Econo Lodge on W US 90 about 12 mile away which was clean and nice and only 5 moreday

title: Great Hotel
text:
I found this hotel online when looking for a good deal on a room 
The hotel was a little hard to find on getting there Staff at the hotel is extremely friendly and go out of their way to help out I arrived earlier than check in time the reception staff was very helpful and gave me an early checkin Rooms were fresh clean and comfortable The bathroom was spacious too
This hotel was my home away from home I will be visiting this hotel again next year

title: A great stay
text: I have stayed in many hotels in the Houston area and this one was by far the best yet The management was fantastic and went out of their way to help with whatever they could I have a great stay and sleep i accidentally left several items in the room safe and when I called to notify them they had already put them aside for me to claim

title: Very handy to everything
text: Recently spent 3 nights here was walking distance to most things pier 39 for Alcatraz hop on hop off buses supermarket bank etc had fantastic service from book in where we were booked in by a lovely Australian girl who made our day very friendly and helpful Rooms very comfy we had room 440 overlooking garden which was very quiet Very clean and met some lovely people at coffee in morning

title: A few redeeming features
text:
Externally very unattractive with poor room access due to few stairs and elevator being poorly located Clientele had a bit of a shady look with a lot of open doors and partying going on The room itself was better than the exterior as a full kitchenette was provided in my 2 Queen suite However maintenance was not up to par as two different lights didnt function
Access to Qualcomm stadium was good also there is a trolley stop a short distance away which provided good access to downtown SD and the gaslamp district Free high speed internet was nice as well

title: What an amazing place to stay
text: I can not say enough about this little hotel in the heart of Times Square I felt that my room was VERY affordableat 150 a night Its located just one block behind the heart of Times Square on 8th  48th The hotel was spotless the rooms were huge and very nice  for NY standards AndI have stayed in many other hotels in NYC and this is the first hotel that had sound proof rooms I couldnt hear the street noise or even the fire department next door To top it all offId mentioned in passing that i was in town for my bday to their front desk receptionist Abigail who then sent a free breakfast voucher to my room So sweet Thenmy flight was cancelled out of LaGuardia and I was already checked out and at the airport when I found out I called the hotel  they told me to come on back  and even offered me another free breakfast because of my problem Staff is top notch and the hotel is gorgeous Id recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Outstanding  and surprisingly a Real Value
text:
One up side of the down economy is that savvy travelers can enjoy some real bargains My wife and I recently took advantage of a significant deal offered by The RitzCarlton Chicago The hotel was offering a credit read discount of 100 per night for guests who stayed a minimum of two nights Because we planned to drive from Indianapolis after work on Friday anyway it was perfect the luxury of the RitzCarlton for a room rate of about 25 a night more than we would have spent on a much more modest hotel at the other end of the Magnificent Mile
The service was impeccable From the bellman who greeted us and took our luggage to our room to the desk clerks the concierge and room service attendants everything was topflight 
The hotel is located in Water Tower Place kittycorner from the famous Chicago water tower across from the John Hancock Building and adjacent to a shopping mall with the store my wife refers to as her mother ship Macys Try the Frango mints theyre a true Chicago treat
Our room 2222 was a Deluxe room and included a king bed easy chair desk bigscreen TV huge closet and a minibar The room faced south with what real estate agents would describe as a peek view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier but had shades and curtains that kept the morning sun at bay until we were ready to greet it
The bath was quite large with double sinks a separate tub and toilet area generous fluffy towels a hair dryer lighted makeup mirror robes and slippers and highend LOccitane en Provence amenities 
Lounging about in bathrobes reading the paper and sipping coffee is a great way to start the day so on Saturday morning we decided to treat ourselves to room service The French Country breakfast consisted of assorted cured meats and cheeses artisan bread a croissant citrus mostarda caf au lait and brewed coffee It was delivered within 12 hour of our call and was delicious
Thus fortified we got ready to head out onto the Magnificent Mile and enjoy some surprisingly glorious November weather 
After a day spent doing a little shopping and a lot of wandering through art galleries along the Mag Mile and in the citys River North neighborhood we were ready for a nice dinner Chicago is also home to a number of wonderful dining spots many are within easy walking distance of the RitzCarlton While my wife and I thoroughly enjoy fine food and arent hesitant about paying for it some of the trendier spots in the area seemed to smack of a popularity premium so we asked one of the concierge staff for other recommendations The concierge a member of Les Clef dOr recommended a new Mexican restaurant that opened on Kinzie Street in September just a short cab ride from the hotel 
Theres a lot to do in Chicago from shopping and sightseeing when the weather is good to a broad range of museums theatres and other indoor attractions when the weather is bad I highly recommend considering The RitzCarlton as your base of operations no matter what the weather

title: Great stay
text: I rented 3 rooms for family when we went down for my sons winging ceremony at the Naval base The rooms were wonderful breakfast delicious and the staff very helpful We will stay there again the next time were in Jacksonville

title: Good room for the price
text: We stayed here for three days while attending a conference The room was large quite and comfortable The hotels restaurant City Grill was efficient and served a good breakfast Happy hour snacks were tasty and just the right size The conference hall was comfortable and provided a good venue for the speakers

title: Location is brilliant
text:
Stayed here in august a great location walking distance from all the main attractions Staff were really helpful and pleasant Room was small but we were aware of that on booking but it was perfect for our needs The breakfast was great nice to have coffee in the morning and it was nice and quiet Tvs could do with some updating since the rooms are so nice and modern 
Thanks

title: As nice as we remembered from our last stay
text:
We spent three nights at the Omni It took us a couple of tries before we finally navigated the confusing streetshighways around the hotel and made it to the Omni
Checkin was smooth and quick The 5thfloor room was pleasant and clean The beds were comfortable a little too soft for my wifes taste but okay for me and came with tons of pillows Our only complaint is that there was only a sheer curtain that covered the entire window the heavier darker drapes only covered half of the left and right sides so it wasnt possible to make the room completely dark at night Parking was free which is nice
As a Select Guest member Omnis club I got two free beverages juices coffee or tea and my choice of the Wall Street Journal USA Today or the Austin paper delivered to the room for free each day Bagels or croissants werent free but came at a reasonable cost with cream cheese and jam Very niceif youre going to stay at this or any Omni I highly recommend joining the Select Guest program its free
The hotel is right at the intersection of Hwy 71 and Interstate 35 so it was a convenient location for travelling to other parts of the city Not as closein as a downtown hotel but we had business south of town in addition to seeing friends in Austin so for us it worked out great We didnt try the hotel restaurant or use the pool so I cant comment on those
All in all a nice place Wed be happy to stay here again the next time were in Austin especially at the low low price we got via Priceline

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel was clean and quiet which is very important to me The hotel is in the perfect location for downtown activities and 6th street I am with another review I had trouble finding outlets to plug things into but not a biggie 
My only complaint is that for a 4 star hotel there were no services for that 4 star price I would at least expect coffee in the lobbythat is a standard in the industry these days There was coffee but you had to pay for it  Starbucks

title: Nice quirky hotel definitely not a runofthemillhotel
text:
My husband and I spent our 10th anniversary here just for a short overnight Very modern popart decored hotel Its not my favorite atmosphere but because its unique its memorable So Im pretty sure that 10 years from now Ill remember this place vs a lot of other hotels we stay in for one reason or another that run right into the next one 
Service is fantastic Very very nice The first employee we ran into took complete care of us and said I will be your best friend We arrived just in time for the winebeer hour which is a nice touch When we arrived back from dinner someone had delivered fruit and a bottle of champagne to our room neither of us requested this but they did it for our anniversary
Valet is 40 so be prepared although its a one time charge you can get your car out as much as you want without additional charges 
The room was decently sized I think also because the furniture is modern it takes up less room than normal bulky full sized dressers and tables Bathroom is small but didnt really matter to us we didnt spend a ton of time in there There were 3 narrow floor to ceiling mirror panels in the main part of the room Im sure to give the impression of a larger room but Im not a fan of staring at myself while watching tv That said if you love you by all means youll love the mirrors The bed and pillows were very comfortable All in all we really enjoyed our stay but because we like to try different places well probably try another Kimpton hotel

title: Great staff and great location
text: We recently stayed at the Hotel Handlery in San Francisco for two nights while celebrating our 40th anniversary The staff was excellent from checking to checkout The hotel s in a great location with easy access to the cable cars ad the trolleys Our room was exceptionally clean and for a downtown hotel very roomy The concierge was very helpful with suggestions for sights ad restaurants and the front desk help was a pleasure to deal with We were 2 couples both celebrating our 40th anniversaries and this was the sat leg of a 10 day trip that began in San Diego We ad entwined our anniversary and the hotel sent a battle of champagne to each room Nice touch We all highly recommend this hotel It was difficult to leave this hotel and city and return to Boston

title: First trip to NYC found the perfect place to stay
text: This hotel was located in a nice area was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful

title: Small rooms poor service old TV weird decor
text:
Booked on priceline stayed 2 nights
First impression decor would be more appropriate for a seaside resort The room was barely big enough to fit a small bed Full size and a desk with one chair The TV was probably 15 years old and didnt have very good picture quality I have better at home with basic cable Small hallways Had to elevator down 12 floors to get ice Key cards worked about every fifth try maybe there is a trick they havent shared with us
Next day My wife and I passed on cleaning since we hadnt mangled the room much but the second evening when we arrived back at the room and were watching some tv we noticed a bunch of long black hair on the bed not ours Also found an yelloworange something smeared on a blanket I called the desk to ask that our linens be turned as we were leaving for the evening and they said that wouldnt be a problem Returned to find someone had left 2 folded sheets for us laying on the dirty bed no pillow cases no new blanket

title: This Hotel has no class It failed to honour a confirmed reservation
text:
I had a confirmed reservation with this Hotel guaranteed for late checkin I arrived at around 10pm after a long flight The front desk staff informed me that the hotel was full but they would be delighted to offer me a conference room to sleep in with a rollaway bed 
My thoughts Is this some kind of f joke
The appropriately stressed front desk manager eventually got me and my colleague in the Comfort Inn which wasnt bad actually
The only positive to come out of this was the attempts by the neutered frontdesk staff to make a bad situation slightly better We got free food and taxi to the Comfort Inn
I had a contract with the Hyatt and as far as I am concerned they broke that contract I am very sure that Hyatt will find some sort of legal loophole to minimise the responsibility that they should take for this kind of behaviour but in my opinion they broke the spirit of the contract between a customer and the Hotel I will not use Hyatt Hotels again

title: First and last time trying this hotel
text:
We stayed two nights here mostly for its good location to the airport and downtown It is an old hotel which isnt a problem in itself if it is kept up Checking in was easy The room was average and relatively clean the bath grout could use better cleaning The beds were comfortable enough and the pillows good There are only two floors to the hotel so the first floor windows face the parking lot  not so great and the second floor windows face a fire station across the street  not so great when they get calls in the middle of the night The hotel is next to the freeway making it easy to get where youre going and super close the the airport
The toilet in our bathroom kept running after flushing Since it had taken so long earlier in the day to ask a question at the front counter no one was around I decided it would be quicker to try and fix it myself than call and wait I stuck my arm into the tank and rehooked the plastic chain that had come off because it was too short Luckily I know how to do this but some people might not Anyway who wants to stick their arm in a hotel toilet tank anyway Definitely not the highlight of our stay Should have gotten a discount for fixing their toilet 
They offer a full breakfast but be sure you are there first thing in the morning Once they run out of something if there is less than an hour remaining for breakfast which ends at 10 am they will not make more Both mornings we arrived for breakfast at 930 am One morning they were out of bacon but would not make more  were closing soon and the second morning they were out of biscuits  same excuse we cant make more were closing soon In fact they dont wait until 10am to close they start packing it all up at 940 I told my son to run up to the counter and grab what he might want because they were putting everything away 20 minutes earlier than we expected We ate our breakfast while the hotel staff wiped tables and threw away trash around us Not very appetiting
The second morning they were also out of milk so he couldnt have cereal No biscuits no cereal He had a banana and toast The first morning we asked if there were more bananas They brought out more but all were covered with black spots  too ripe The second morning the bananas were better The woman working the breakfast bar was not friendly and a bit short when we asked about replenishing the empty trays
The lobby computer worked fine In room I could use my iPad then printed out boarding passes in the lobby No problem there
We got a note in our room that there were a slew of car breakins in the area so that wasnt particuarly reassuring But we never leave valuables in our car anyway

title: TRULY ONE OF THE GREATEST HOTELS IVE EVER STAYED AT
text:
I wanted to take my adult son on a great Thanksgiving long weekend and spent more than I usually do to stay at the Edgewater I must say I think it was totally worth it I told son that we both need to find someone to love and bring them back here cause it would be an incredible place to stay if one were in love Our room 244 overlooked the water 
and you could open the slider and lean on the railing There are mugs in the giftshop picturing the Beatles fishing out of one of the rooms
 The sea gulls fly around outside your window and the duckies do their thing and you occasionally see a ferry boat or big sport boat out on the water Sounds of the harbor are distant and add to the ambience 
 From our room you could see the lit ferris wheel The first night we were at the hotel we got in very late almost 11 and they were very nice in the bar and let us order some OUTSTANDING fish  chips Didnt rush us at all GREAT views from the bar and seasonally you could eat out on their deck
The room had a charming functional gas fireplace We loved the beautiful though small bathroom We both would have liked to have a bathtub beside the shower but its a very nice shower and the room is worth it Both thought bathroom needs a fan
Two comfy chairs by the fireplace but would be very very nice to have a small table for drinks andor coffee by the fire One can always unfold a luggage stand and put a hardcover city travel book on top and make ones own table but this is a tiny element that should be corrected in my view
You can walk to space needle Dale Chihuly museum next door to that and Pacific Museum after that You can walk to many good restaurants Anthonys I love and 
many bars and areas Walk to the famous market area
Parking is overpriced and only valet 38 a day but you can take your car out as many times as you want during the day
The staff is outstanding and gracious and not overly friendly just genuine friendliness My son left a cashmere cap in the lobby one day it was found I left my coat in the bar the last evening and it was found 
This is a place to make a wonderful memory and Im sure my son will remember it long after Im gone

title: Will return
text:
We stayed here for one night on 103111 The checkin process was very quick and the staff was friendly One of the biggest perks of this location is the FREE parking This is a rare find in LA and very much appreciated You cant beat the location In close proximity to a variety of places to see in LA If youre the walking typemany places to get to by foot If you feel like venturing further the subway is a close walk as well We decided to take the car to West Hollywood for the Halloween Carnival Aside from the regular LA traffic it was a quick ride Upon returning later that evening there were plenty of parking spaces still available 
The morning we departed we decided to hikerun Runyon Canyon The hotel staff was kind enough to give us a late checkout So after we hiked we were able to return and shower We really appreciated their flexibility 
The rooms were clean The usual wear and tear but nothing gross We had a room at the farthest end from the street so noise wasnt a problem Shower worked nicely and the fridgemicrowave were nice to have available 
This hotel has pretty much all the things you need when staying in Hollywood Proximity to attractions very close to Universal Studios Hollywood Bowl Hollywood Blvd the FREE Parking is a big deal trust me and a clean place to stay while exploring LA I have also stayed at the Days Inn on Sunset Blvd and would prefer this Best Western Cleaner and smells much better Plenty of options to eat at nearby as well There are also CVSFresh and Easy stores nearby so if you want to stock your fridge I would definitely stay hereand hopefully will be sooner than later Enjoy

title: Great Downtown Location
text: I cant comment on the value of the hotel as I was staying there on a discount program The rooms that my party had reserved were a bit small but they were meant for a maximum of 2 guests in each room The views from the 20th floor were beautiful of the mountains and downtown the staff was wonderful and courteous I would definitely stay at the Comfort Inn Downtown on my next visit to Denver

title: Great place
text:
Have to say after reading all the reviews i was worried about staying here
But after an easy check in found the room to be clean and tidy 2 of us stayed in a room with private bathroom and it was perfect for us perfect location for exploring NY
I would stay here again when i come back to NY

title: Funky  Fun But Inconsistent Service
text:
My husband and I just stayed at Hotel Icon for 4 nights midweek We booked through the Microsoft Worldwide Partner Conference site since it was one of the conference hotels and had such good ratings on TripAdvisor 
We generally prefer the individuality and funkiness of boutique hotels over large chains and the Hotel Icon delivered with a great deal of charm By modern standards some might consider the decor garish but we thought the blending of Victorian and modern was fun and interesting 
The 2 breakfasts that we had we good  especially the Icon Breakfast in the dining room The wireless connectivity was good too  this can sometimes be an issue with so many conference attendees on at the same time Comfy bed and wellappointed bedroom and bath too
Our only complaint was the spotty service The staff was friendly and helpful but  on our last night there when we had a 550 am plane to catch  our wakeup call AND our town car never materialized Wed talked to the bell captain about this the night before tipped him and assumed that it was taken care of Luckily we had enough reason to doubt from several other issues with the front desk and room service in particular that we set our alarm and went down to the front desk to check on the car They were able to get a cab quickly the bell captain recommmended a town car because the cabs here are unreliable

title: Amazing Customer Service
text:
My wife and I celebrated our honeymoon in DC yes we are nerds We reserved our room through the Hilton website and are Hilton Honors members I requested a room with a view and the hotel went out of their way to ensure we had a view of the Washington Monument In addition the staff went out of their way to advise us on places to eat and visit despite the fact they were not a concierge In fact it was raining and we could not get a cab so a staff member went out into the rain to hail us a cab then she went to get an umbrella to loan us 
The hotel is not a luxury brand but the rooms are modern with comfortable beds spacious and clean They do have in room air conditioners which make noise but should only bother light sleepers The breakfast is the best of any Hampton Inn Ive stayed and in the evening at 6 PM they serve fresh cookies coffee and lemonade 
Last the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Washington Mall It is a block from Chinatown the Verizon Center and a diverse group of both upscale and affordable restaurants 
We were able to get a low rate by reserving our room under a Hilton special offer so if you are planning a trip to DC I definently recommend this hotel There is a 34day parking fee but this is common in DC In addition I think you can park your car for a cheaper rate nearby Many of the lots were fenced off This hotel is worth every penny

title: Conflicted feelings about this hotel
text:
I recently attended a conference at this hotel and stayed for 3 nights Overall I enjoyed my stay but the service was very inconsistent and if I had been paying to stay there myself I probably would have felt much less satisfied
As others have commented the staff seems totally indifferent to you from the minute you arrive My colleague and I took a cab from the airport and the valets and doormen didnt even acknowledge us Finally another gentleman who was a considerable distance away from our cab came over to greet us and ask if we needed help Later I found the restaurant and room service staff to be very friendly and attentive Not sure why the service aspect of this hotel is so inconsistent
When we went to check in I was completely ignored in the Marriott Rewards line too  even though there was no one ahead of me Finally a desk person asked if I needed help and while I had requested a nonsmoking King she said they had a much nicer double that she wanted to offer me because I am a rewards member
My room was in the older historic section of the hotel It was very spacious with large windows and a huge walkin closet The flat screen tv had video inputs if you wanted to use your computer to stream video and even though I had to pay for wireless I had no connection problems and it was very fast There was a small refrigerator that I used to store water and snacks the prices to eat inside the hotel are pretty steep My room was very quiet and while the bed was sort of small and the blanket pretty thin it was comfortable and I slept well
On the down side the furniture and carpet was sort of shabby and because the heating system hasnt been updated the bathroom was really cold The lobby in the older section appears to be completely unheated There was no way to use the space and even walking through it to get to the newer section was very uncomfortable
 The location is absolutely terrific The metro station is right outside the older section and there are lots of great places to eat nearby 
Truthfully I think there are other great places to stay in DC and this property is probably best suited for large conference attendees I have enjoyed staying at the Renaissance Mayflower and the Westin on M Street must better

title: Service was very disappointing at this hotel
text:
Front desk staff were not helpful at all at this hotel A simple request of adjoining rooms could not be accommodated of course our travel package was to blame apparently Even after offering to pay more nothing could be done  The front desk seemed offended that I asked them to call our airport transport as they were late Nothing was easy
Breakfast staff were rude midway through pouring coffee waitress decides her boss is more important to serve than us The best thing about this hotel was the cleaning staff They were happy and cheerful everytime we saw them Couldnt wait to leave

title: Quarters were Delightful at the Club
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed in this charming upscale and suprisingly low priced hotel December 2729 of 2004 for a holiday getaway The lobby was a cozy living room with a fireplace and lush couches and armchairs Overhead the lobbys ceiling was tall and the peaked windows of the roof gave light to the citys most recognisable points in the city skyline Check in was a breeze and the staff was very friendly 
Contrary to other reviews our room was spacious and the ceiling was nearly 15 feet high making the room seem bigger than its already comfortable size The window stretched to the top and gave us a wonderful view of Philadelphias riverside The decorations in the room were tasteful and the wood work was done in deep chestnut Place a few candles on the many bookshelves and the room became quite romantic 
Our room besides the round table desk and cooking area offered up a couch nightstands and full sized mirrors The bed was so soft that we sank into it at night and there was no noise Granted we were on the 11th floor but it was nice to have a quiet room in the city like we were Area attractions are very close by within walking distance for sure 
The bathroom was perfect in size no complaints here It had extra shelves to put your things which is always appreciated Upstairs were two closets for you to get your own extras like coffee grounds for your inroom coffee pot pillows blankets even shower caps Also the 12th floor hosted a well equipt excercise room with TVs
I could gush forever about how much of an excellent value the place was but why should I Go get a gander for yourself you will not regret it

title: OK but needs updating
text: I understand why the mixed reviews here we had a garden view room but was upgraded to a bay front suite VERY HAPPY for that or I would have been writing one of those bad reviews our unit did need some upgrades  the whole place needs it but the location made ALL the difference in the world Being an owner of 3 units at the Maui Eldorado resort the comparison gave me a good feeling about our staff and property When i checked in I was not given any details of the resort had to figure it out on my own the maids did a wonderful job working with what they had the run down unit over all its all about location location location if I were to stay there again I would make sure I got a unit with the bay view on the side that does not have the pubic beach on it

title: Nice rooms comfortable stay
text: We have stayed at the sister property The Pointe at Tapatio Cliffs for several years in a row and really love it there This was our first visit at Squaw Peak Very similiar rooms hotel lobby and adult pool area which were all very nice We chose to use the adult pool area near the lobby which is nice and quiet and features padded pool loungers The lazy river and pools nearby need some serious updating Customer service here was superb just like at Taptatio Cliffs

title: Had a great stay
text:
We had tickets to the ChargersRams game on Sunday Arrived Saturday afternoon and had no problems checking in The room is nice size and the beds were comfortable The staff is very pleasant We had great service in the on site restaurant thanks Jessica Be aware if going to Qualcomm stadium you still need to leave at least 2 to 3 hours before game time to get in the parking lot It is a zoo We did run into some Charger players at our hotel who were all very polite My son used the pool on Saturday and Sunday and practically had it to himself both days There is also a jacuzzi
There are plenty of places to eat nearby and the location is right off the freeway Our room was on the freeway side and we were not bothered by noise at all Parking was no problem I would definately stay there again

title: once was enough
text: cool place but a little too high priced for what you got would rather spend the same  or a little more and stay at the Ritz or Satai

title: Unexpectantly bad service
text:
Zee had a lot of fun at the pool however when we first arrived we had reserved a king balcony suite and when we walked in we had two double beds and the too
Smelled awful like cigarettes We alled the front desk and they said the only thing they could do was spray the room They were fully committed Then we decided we wanted to stay late so we paid for a half day which was not cheap so we could hang out at the pool That was a lot of fun then we got back in the room to get ready and they walked in on us TWICE Both times we were not dressed and getting ready We were supposed to check out at 3pm and they first walked in at 2 and then at 230 They had been knocking on our door and walking in all morning There is zero communication at this hotel Im highly disappointed I usually love the hotel and service Hopefully this was just a bad day or maybe they should hire employees with intelligence and maybe actually consume food occasionally

title: Great Place to Stay
text:
You cant beat the location Close to Metro and Smithsonian Pleasant staff Knowledgeable and friendly Consierge
Clean comfortable rooms easy parking We had a great stay and well definitely go back

title: Wonderful Friendly and Very Reasonable
text:
Very clean 
Friendly and helpful desk folks 
Good simple breakfast with waffles 
Very comfortable beds 
Nice pool 
Beautiful landscaping 
Good restaurants within walking distance 
Would stay again
Reasonable rates

title: Standard city hotel
text: This is a good clean hotel with no outstanding features other than its location on Broadway convenient to the university and within walking distance of downtown Parking is 19 extra in the selfpark lot under the hotel Rooms are average size but include a small kitchenette  fridge microwave coffee maker and sink

title: Glamorous boutique hotel great service top location
text: You can spend a lot of money on a hotel that cliams to be an unber cool boutique hotel in downtown manhattan and be very disappointed Whilst 60 Thompson is not cheap you do get good value We booked ahead of time and got a deal on a room that was much bigger than the normal shoe box you get in major cities The decor is very cool and up to the minute Big bathroom with delicious products Great food from room service Impeccable service from the staff The big selling point in the summer is the stunning roof terrace bar which is very comfortable intimate and has amazing views of the manhattan skyline The hotel is in a fantatstic location a couple of blocks from broadway in the heart of the lively SoHo district

title: Great Choice
text: We arrived at The Bristol Hotel in the wee hours of the morning due to airline cancellations and delays and also had no luggage The night concierge was very sympathetic and kindly provided us with toothbrushes and toothpaste Our room was very nice and the bed was extremely comfortable The day concierge recommended some restaurants in the vicinity and after walking around and exploring we found that we were in an area surrounded by restaurants and shops The hotel was within a very short walk to the Horton Plaza shopping mall and a short drive to Coronado Island We would certainly stay here again

title: Dont be scared off by the reservations process
text: I was on a business trip to DC and the Washington Court hotel was recommended to me due to its proximity to my meeting I was travelling and temporarily without internet at the time so I called the hotel to make my reservation It was a nightmare I was cut off three times put on hold for 10 minutes belittled etc I didnt have high expectations going into my stay but I didnt have time or energy to search for another hotel That said from the moment I arrived at the hotel the service was spot on The room was spacious and extremely comfortable and all amenities were provided for I would choose the hotel again at any time

title: Excellent locations and even better price
text: After searching for weeks for a hotel I could afford for my first trip to the city I had all but given up when I came across the Astor for only 55 dollars a night I was weary of the quality or location of the hotel because it was so cheap but it was perfect The room was small but perfect for me and my boyfriend We even had a veiw of the park which was directly across the street and of the city though it was far away It was a nice quit snowy couple of nights There are some good places to eat right arounfd the corner too Im going back this december and weve booked this hotel again

title: Like being in Tuscany for a night
text: My husband and I live in Tempe only about 20 minutes from this resort but it felt like we were a million miles away This resort is so beautiful as soon as you walk on the property you instinctively take a deep breathe and relax We had one of the alvadora spa rooms and it was beautiful I was amazed at the tiny details that they made special like organic coffee in the rooms and bottles of water with turndown Every piece of furniture painting even the coffee condiment box in the room were obviously carefully thought about and perfect for the decor and ambiance The staff where wonderful and friendly We had breakfast at T Cooks the eggs benedict and the biscuits and gravy and everything was fantastic It was a wonderful escape from everyday life With two toddlers we dont get away like this often and this was the perfect night off I would absolutely go here again hopefully for longer next time

title: Love the margarita slurpee machine  housekeeping could use some help
text:
Had meeting at Convention center  easy walk down market  even in oppressive heat 
Breakfast was great  including texas shaped waffles could have started earlier  esp on weekdays Room was fine beds comfortable not super clean in bathroom Living room area could use a freshen up for furniture etc Tvs small But  overall  great price comfortable and good breakfast and evening food Id stay here again

title: Great food great service great hotel Welcome to Boston
text: My wife and just stayed at the Ames and loved it I admit I was unfamiliar with the property when we booked it through Hotwire but our feelings went from apprehensive to ecstatic the more we read Prior to the visit I had emailed the hotel to ensure we were getting a king bed as one of our goals was getting a good night sleep we have a toddler at home and another coming soon The concierge emailed me back to see if there was anything else they could do to make our stay special The gesture was much appreciated as was the upgrade to a suite when we checked in The room was fantastic with a large sitting and dining area adjacent to the bedroom and bathroom The color scheme was white with modern dcor definitely a contrast from other hotels where weve stayed in Boston The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was very chic Note that if you are looking to take a bath you may be out of luck as our room only had a standup shower  not sure if any other rooms have a tub The room was matched by the food from the restaurant Woodward Our quick lunch of squash flatbread and mixed nuts hit the spot and I sampled some of their funky cocktails the New Orleans Sazerac is addictive But we were holding out for breakfast and the hash menu We had the duck and sweet potato hash and the ham and cheese omelet delivered to the room and it did not disappoint Overall it was a wonderful experience Although we booked it at a discounted rate I would stay there at the regular rate any time

title: Great Chicago Hotel
text: Stayed 4 days for Thanksgiving Great location Walking distance to Magnificent Mile Navy Pier and Milleneum Park On trolley route Walked to parade Just great all around Big plush rooms Restaurants high priced Price for room is per industry average Reasonable for what you are getting Staff in all areas are wonderful Id stay again

title: Deserves the title of Western White House
text:
This hotel was fabulous Im a fan of the Hyatt chain and have stayed at many of their hotels but this one is noteworthy
As an architecture buff the design by Minoru Yamasaki is fabulous Yamasaki was also the architect of the World Trade Centre in New York
The staff is great you truly do feel like a Hollywood Star or a head of state when visiting the Hyatt Century Plaza
The valet and doorman were perfect in their roles They seemed plucked from a time gone by
The rooms were great the staff was phenomenal and the history of the hotel is great
The hotel is fondly referred to as the Western White House as it was President Reagans preferred hotel in California It deserves its title to this day
A note of caution though if you are attending a conference at the LA Convention Centre and this is a conference hotel it is about a 45 minute bus ride away

title: Good location and good service
text:
The rooms are relatively spacious for New York Its a great location within walking distance of times square and grand central stationThe hotel has a bar and a restaurant in the ground floor but didnt try either so cant comment on the quality of both My room on the 11th floor came with free wifi and the usual amenities of mini bar usual new york pricing though safe iron and ironing board temperature control shower with attached bath flat screen tv free paper in the morning USA today and writing desk Access to your floor on the lift is via your key card so the safety aspects are taken care My flight was at 11pm so i needed to check out before noon but the hotel stored my luggage till i came back to collect
PositivesGreat service specially from the front desk staff and doormen Great lobby area with a pool table and lounge off to the side Convenient location Fast check in and check out
Negatives The room i stayed in could use an upgrade of a few of the fixtures the hanger holding up the ironing board was broken would have been useful if the minibar had an icemaker

title: Great Place
text:
We spent march break in Washington DC and use the Holiday inn Express as our home base Perfect Breakfast was included The hotel had a suttle bus to take you to Union station A tip on the shuttle book your spots as soon as you check in its a busy shuttle If the time you want is full you can ask the front desk to check with the Marriotts shuttle to see if they have space
Pool was great and open till 10 pm
The hotel seemed to have a couple bus loads of students pass through but that wasnt a problem at all

title: Beautiful Hotel  Service is AMAZING
text:
From the moment I arrived the valet was SO friendly and professional he introduced himself to my husband and shook his hand  which was so refreshing He kept our car parked out front since we were just going to check in we were very early so assumed we wouldnt get a room and come back out The front desk is obviously a bit hidden but he gave wonderful directions to get to it Otherwise I definitely would have felt lost
When we arrived at the Front Desk Crystal was so friendly greeted us with a smile immediately upon turning the corner She gave wonderful explanations of all the amenities and where everything is and was just so nice
Our room was amazing The cleanliness was perfect which was much appreciated after our previous hotel I just love the entire theme of the property everything is just so glamorous and beautiful 
We went to the pool just to look on our way to dinner and were in jeans and obviously not pool attire Normally pool attendants wont pay you much attention unless you are in a swimsuit or pool clothing The gentlemen out there greeted us and engaged us asking how long we were staying what our plans were for the area and invited us to sit at the bar for a drink Honestly I would not have been upset if they had just smiled and said hello  wasnt expecting more than that They DEFINITELY exceeded my expectations out there  they obviously really know how to connect with people and live it every day
We also went to Tres for a drink before heading out to dinner and the service was just as phenomenal Usually the 3 meal restaurant can be forgotten if you have a signature restaurant like Bazaar but that was completely not the case here Our server was engaging talked to us for a while about the restaurant and Bazaar and how much he loves working there 
We didnt need luggage assistance but were in the elevator a couple times with the Attendants and they were very friendly as well  asking us how our stay was and if we needed anything etc
We didnt go to Bazaar I know Im regretting it now but walked in to look around The greeters were so friendly told us to walk around and look and even talked to us about the restaurant  and we made it clear we were not eating there again would have been perfectly acceptable for them to not engage us at all but they did Another exceeds expectations 
One thing that stood out to not just myself but to my husband was how excited everyone was to work there and about the property Associates engaged us everywhere we went to talk about the property and all the little decorations and such around us  and they were so knowledgeable
Overall I would stay here EVERY TIME I am in the area it is worth every dollar spent  such a unique experience

title: Great location reasonable price friendly staff stylish rooms
text: We had a great experience at the Chandler Inn We were welcomed by a friendly frontdesk staff and were even able to get into our room a little earlier than checkin time which was a welcome surprise after a day of airports and air travel We stayed in a queen boutique room which had a lot of great design detailsbrushed stainless steel ice bucket bentwood tray Chilewichlike pillows and a flatscreen TV We opted to add a tiny fridge to our room for a reasonable daily charge which was a great amenity to have available On either side of the bed there were nightstands with two large roomy drawers if you chose to move out of your suitcase The location was fantasticvery close to the Back Bay T stop Nice neighborhood to walk around in felt very safe We would highly recommend the Chandler Inn as a place to stay on your next trip to Boston

title: Close to airport
text: Basic hotel

title: Another great stay
text: I recently stayed at this Inn for 6 days Aug 28  Sept 3 while attending the US Nationals at Lucas Oil Raceway I attend this event every year and I stayed at this Inn last year and was very impressed Well I am still very impressed My room was spotlessly clean everything in it worked as it should and the staff was friendly courteous and efficient This Inn is right off of I465 Exit 27 and there are a great many restaurants and shopping malls nearby Bacause my days are spent at the race track I dont care about a pool or fitness center which this motel doesnt have I just need a good clean room with a comfortable bed to sleep in if that is what you are looking for you will love this Red Roof Inn

title: The best of San Francisco
text: Recently my husband and I plus small dog stayed at the gracious Westin St Francis on Union Square Our room with heavenly bed heavenly shower AND heavenly dog bed was superb Maxwell the dog cant wait for his return trip nor can we The atmosphere of the historic main building truly made our staysuch a San Francisco flair Our view of the renovated Union Square complete with Christmas tree put us in the holiday spirit The best part however was the staff Everyone greeted us with a smile and a pat for Maxwell We felt so welcome that you can be sure we will plan a trip back to San Francisco and the St Francis as soon as possible Be sure to visit this gracious hotel even if you dont have a dog

title: Gorgeous gorgeous gorgeous And great location
text: My husband and I stayed here for one night and we absolutely loved the experience The hotel was so immaculately decorated for the holidays it was breath taking The staff were all very helpful and friendly The bathroom in our room was gorgeous lol Glass shower with the hotel logo etched in the glass marble and granite floors and countersit was great The hotel is located next to 16th street which is a hotspot during the holidays for shopping lights etc The next morning before checkout we walked to Starbucks just a block away and took in some of the sights of downtown Denver most notably was the church located near the Brown PalaceGorgeous All in all we had a wonderful time and hope to return some day

title: The best hotel in town
text: This was my second stay the the Carlton and I cant wait to go back You will love this hotel Beautiful rooms excellent staff The free wine hour in the lobby is a great way to meet people of all ages traveling around the world and share your trip memories and adventures You can get great rates online but their website is not bad at all either

title: Amazing start to honeymoon
text:
A huge thanks to Wes and all at The Chancellor for an amazing start to our honeymoon I would recommend this hotel without hesitation We were in regular contact with Wes before our stay no question too much and he gave us some great tips including a visit to the gold dust bar where I believe we made many new friends a great night 
We found the hotel easily parked up dropped the cases off then went round to the organised parking it was a breeze 
On arrival we discovered that Wes had organised a top floor suite for us there was champagne on ice and a card and gift from the hotel team We felt so special and welcome 
During our travels around California we discovered many people who knew of the Chancellor and were big fans too We definitely know why its friendly quirky and perfectly placed We fell in love with San Fransisco and the Chancellor was responsible

title: A memorable bday  thanks Westin Times Square
text:
I recently celebrated my nonLeap Year birthday at the Westin Times Square WOW This hotel went out of its way First they gave me a corner deluxe room I had paid for an upper floor prepaid room but did not expect a corner room with fantastic views of the theatre district  the Hudson plus a sliver of the upper portion of the Empire State Building on the 42nd floor
Additionally they sent a special birthday cake most delicious surrounded by strawberries and blueberries to my room while I was at the theatre There was also a signed card I really appreciate the kind and thoughtful gesture I am not a Westin big spender and I just did not expect this
The room had a wraparound view as noted and there was a nice Hudson view from the bathroom as well Others have commented on the lack of shelf space but this was not a problem for me There was a mobile etegere for additional storage which should accommodate most guests toiletries
I LOVED the fast efficient checkin please take note Hilton Times Square No lines and I checked in at 3PM This was a pleasant stay and then some I shall remember to stay here again Great location too  walking distance to the theater subway restaurants drug store etc

title: Never book a junior suite
text:
Had booked a juniorsuite for 3 nights in august arrived at 1045 pm No valet no bellboy no help except the employe in the reception informing in that between 1040 and 1100 pm he was there alone
Room 618 was extremely small and as i should show alle junior suite was next door to the elevator on all floors We did not sleep that first night
Next day the receptionist after some discussion moved us to a standard room 615 in a more quiet part of the hotel This room was even smaller than the first aprox 20 m2
We asked if we could have money back for the difference in cost betwenn the two rooms  but was told that this was not possible becouse we had prepaid for our stay Instead we were offered 30  to use in the hotel the differnce was much more
So dont stay here if you want a desent room and service

title: wonderful for airport stay
text: We cannot say enough about this place We only stayed one night our flight left in the am and were delighted with the clean room and friendly service We had a nice breakfast before we were shuttled to the airport left our vehicle there for 10 days On our return we called the motel and within 10 minutes the shuttle was there to pick us up and bring us directly to our vehicle We actually stopped in to thank them for such a wonderful stay and easy access to and from the airport This place is definately on our plans for next year The price is very right

title: Girls 50th BDay Trip
text: Ive been to NYC several times and stayed in many different areas This hotel was EXCELLENT The staff was fabulousattentive helpful and friendly I would like to make special mention of Andre Mgr and Michael who were outstanding These folks could not have been more accomodating I want to spread the word but dont want to many people to find out about this gem of a hotel I cant say enough good things about this propertyfrom location cleanliness staff breakfast etceverything was topnotch Ill be back

title: Calling it boutique or European doesnt excuse everything
text: I was booked at the Paramount for a business trip  but I left before even staying the night The good lovely decor Times Square location personally I hate the area but I can understand why tourists might like it Not sure what else The bad TINY TINY TINY rooms Ive stayed is some small rooms  especially in NYC  but this was ridiculous The toilet was literally right behind the heater You couldnt even sit on the pot properly  youd have to sit sideways to take care of business Theres about 2 feet of space between the edge of the bed and the wall and the room really is completely consumed by the bed Not the cleanest place either the lounge chair had black soot all over it The wall covers were shabby didnt this place JUST get renovated The view from the room was horrible and just made it seem even dirtier I get that youre not always going to get a gorgeous skyline view but I didnt want to look out to see rolls of toilet paper and garbage See pics For a business trip this was completely unacceptable  so I left and rebooked at an SPG property

title: Clean Nice and a perfect location
text: We stayed here for two nights The hotel was nice and clean The rooms were comfy and had all of the amenities For the price of hotels in SF and this being one of the lower priced hotels it was perfect The distance to the Wharf was just 5 blocks down the hill and once you were there it seemed like hardly a walk at all The bus right by the hotel took us to the Giants game and it was easy to figure out The staff at the hotel was nice and helpful as far as pointing us in the right direction for food and services Would stay here again and would refer to friends and family

title: Nice hotel  Just a couple little things
text:
Would recommend getting a room on the upper couple of floors I was on the 2nd floor nice because that is were the breakfast is but you get the road noise He friends on the top floor and the road noise was almost nil Also they do not have blackout curtains like most hotels so the lights from outside can be bothersome Other than that the staff was always pleasant and the hotel clean Location really couldnt be any better you are right downtown and can walk any where you want to go
One warning though If you dont know its valet parking When I did my reservations over the phone they didnt tell me it was valet parking and it costs 17 a day The funny thing is that where they park your car is right next to the hotel I heard several complaints from people checking out that the valet fee wasnt disclosed They were nice enough to me and I got it taken off my bill 17 x 4 days yeahit adds up

title: Loved it SO much we came back for our Honeymoon
text:
I wont go into a lot of detail because I have already written a previous review for a previous stay here but I will say this THE MAYFAIR is the BEST 
When we called the hotel they remembered me from several previous visits They were giving us a discount which is VERY hard to find in December in NYC but when we told them that it was for our honeymoon they went out of their way to make it a TRULY special stay for us
Champagne awaiting us in our hotel room Great staff Everyone was so helpful in helping us to find perfect romantic spots to visit and eat Carriage rides through central park the Top of the Rock at midnight ice skating a Wollman Rinkit was a perfect NYC Honeymoon 
The Mayfair doesnt disappoint You just have to know who to talk to and when where to ask for your room to be and let them get to know you The service is unbelievable when you do so psssstthe rooms on the street happen to be a lot bigger Our first stay here was in a room where you opened the door and fell onto a bed and had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom We LOVED and LAUGHED over that Not many times you can say that you have that experience Only when we saw one of the maids going into one of the rooms facing the front of the hotel did we realize that THAT was what we needed to be asking for
We will ALWAYS stay at the Mayfair No CC fraud here and no problems at all with the staff Just a LOVELY unique hotel in a perfect location

title: I would definitely suggest you to stay there
text: Very very nice place Many major attractions are within walking distance The personnel is super friendly and helpful I really appreciated this a lot We had no bad impressions at all except that it was a bit noisy in the nights it seems that there are some night bars or clubs nearby that many people gather at nights which however would not be problem for people who are familiar with a bit of noise also if you choose a room that is not directly on the road it would be perfect Overall I can suggest this hotel to everybody If I visit Philadelphia again in the future I will stay in the same place

title: A Gem on the Bay
text: After a lot of review reading online we decided to go with the high ratings and take a chance on this little gem in San Diego After talking with the front desk we were able to get a room in one of the new buildings overlooking the bay and it was a treat We had coffee on our deck as a regatta went by and drinks at night with a breathtaking view of the lights For the money we couldnt have been more pleasedand we didnt even need SeaWorld A perfect two night stay before our cruise

title: The people make the difference
text: In town for a wedding and weary from a day of missed flights from the east coast our first contact at the Huntington was the professional and friendly doorman and bell staff Throughout our week there they were without exception friendly helpful and down to earth calling us by name all week I found myself tipping well and often The hotel was built in 1926 by CP Huntington one of the Big 4 railroad tycoons along with Hopkins Stanford and Crocker Having spent some of my career at Mr Huntingtons shipyard in Virginia the choice was a natural for me I was not disappointed The hotel is historic but updated in most respects Smaller than the other Nob Hill hotels the lobby is intimate and dining choices are limited to the Big Four Restaurant highly rated by Zagat Our dinner there was both very good and expensivea special occasion venue unless on expense account We also followed the doormans recommendation of the Nob Hill Cafe a quick 2 block horizontal walk Excellent choice with good food and reasonable prices We booked one of the standard rooms through Expedia for 121 per nighta bargain by any standard The King bed was comfortable and the room was immaculate The bathroom looked newly renovated with wall to wall mirrors and a window that could be opened to let in the bay breezes A caffeine addict I was annoyed that there was no inroom coffee maker Free coffee is available in the lobby only from 57 amok for the businessman but not if youre on vacation If you miss the deadline its 3 for an 8 oz paper cup in the restaurant Internet access is 995 a day ending at 1 pm No free WiFi as I have become accustomed to Another minor annoyance is the lack of ice machines You have to call the bellman and have it delivered The minibar was empty but I dont use those anywayit was handy for storing leftovers Another unexpected bonusthe Huntington has an agreement with Hertz rental caryour paperwork can be completed by the concierge and faxed to Hertz And for an additional 20 you car will be waiting at the front door of the hotel and when returning just hand the key to the doorman and walk in Just make your reservation ahead of time to ensure theres a car available Conveniently located on the cable car line 5 per person we found it more convenient to take a cab everywhere8 to Fishermans Wharf and 10 to the Museum The cabs are safe and the drivers the friendliest I have found All in all we were very pleased with our stay and left feeling like friends rather than customerseveryone was so helpful from the front desk to the doorman to the housekeeper Even as we were leaving at 330 am to catch our flight back home

title: Great value and excellent Customer Service
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights I find good value in the SpringHill brand and this property did not disappoint I find the SpringHill accommodations are really not suites but large rooms and this property would be the same When I think of a suite I think of the dictionary definition   a connected series of rooms to be used together but in the SpringHills I find they are usually one big room laid out in sections  this was not any different Having said that it was a large comfortable room and the suite with sink fridge and microwave is very functional for an extended stay
What really impressed me were the Customer Service skills of the staff All and I mean all greeted you with a good morning or a good evening and always a smile It was close to Fairmont quality Customer Service and that for me says a lot There were very attentive to any needs and the breakfast area was always spotless They were always replacing offerings and constantly cleaning Even the manager got in the act when the place was busy My benchmark is the cleanliness of the liquid waffle machine  a gooey concoction found these days in most complimentary breakfast offerings  normally a mess at most hotels This was consistently the cleanest and most attractive ever experienced
The hotel is close to the Metro Mall and it offers a wide variety of places to eat in the evening I had no issues at all with noise despite the proximity to Interstate 17
A well managed property where people genuinely care  a hotel I would stay at again and recommend

title: Pricey but fantastic
text: Having checked out of the pokey holiday inn we found this and what a find Fantastic room excellent service free cycle hire The bar was full of people full of themselves but isnt every big city  After realising we could afford to stay there the staff were very attentive Would stay again if in chicago

title: mediocre shelburne
text:
We booked a four night stay at the Shelburne in a two bederrom suite We did this based on our friends experience withprevious stays at the affinia chain First the good news The apartment was spacious clean and relatively well equiped Now for the bad news The rooms were not ready upon our arrival at check in time and we had to check back in with them The doorman was not in sight upon our arrival and i needed to search him out to have our vehicle valet parked This was done promptly There is no guaranteeof the type of beedding inthe suite and despite the large space there were two queen beds and a fold out sofa for our party of married couple and teen girl and 21 yr old son Needless to say the fold out sofa was so bad oly a young child could sleep in itThey did graciously bring us a very nice roll away bed Thedecor was ok somewhat datedThey had us on the 4th floor so there was some street noise
 One bit of annoyance was that the card keys didnt work for on of the interior doors of the suite I needed to go to the front desk at 11pmalong with another customer having similar problems I rode the elevator up with someone to unlock the door
 The workout room was in the basement next to the laundry Not elegant but ok
 Laslly It wasnt cheap Although 2 bedrrom suite in ny are hard to come by the cost was about 650night with tax for a soso suite in a not premium time period

title: My stay at Town and Country Resort Hotel
text: I loved and enjoy my stay at Town and Country Resort Hotel Thanksgiving Day the service was excellent Katherine Richardson and staff made sure we were taken care of at all time Whenever we called on Katherine Richardson she made sure it was done even if she had to do it herself Your Resort was the best stay in my life

title: W  as in WHY would you stay here
text:
Sigh Ws are really hit or miss Sometimes they work sometimes not If you are OK with what this hotel is  a night club hot spot more concerned with style than substance with tiny rooms and impractical furnishings that will simply frustrate you  then this hotel will be great for you I stayed here for a onenight business trip two days after a colleague of mine and we both had the same impressions although she didnt have to switch rooms several times
First it is basically a block from the White House so locationwise it has a lot going for it I checked in around 6 pm on a weekday night the lobby was crowded with bar patrons not hotel guests but the wait wasnt too long The staff was somewhat friendly but efficient the door and bell staff were as usual friendlier than the front desk When I arrived at my door I noticed the doorbell and other indications of an accessible room which I did not want I looked inside and the layout confirmed this So I went down and asked for a nonaccessible room The host explained the rooms were all the same and gave me a new room
I was surprised to enter the new room and find  a bed seemingly only inches off the ground and the rest of the furniture similarly designed for people about 3 feet high The rooms are tiny so perhaps they figure lowtotheground furniture will help make the room look bigger It literally took me 5 minutes to figure out how to turn on the main lights I was relieved to learn my colleague had the same confusion The bathroom is typical W modern and sleek but the sink is a raised bowl with a faucet whose opening is about 3 above the drain I could not fit two hands underneath it Im sorry but when style comes at the expense of function its gone too far This W goes too far and falls from hip into the far too frustrating category
When I returned from a late dinner to my topfloor room I was unhappy to hear a pounding disco above my head A call to the front desk assured me the noise would stop by 11 A second call some time later assured me the music would stop at midnight Then the room physically started shaking as the people above me were obviously jumping up and down in unison This time I insisted a manager come to the room She said it was a wedding reception and would be going on until well after midnight Of course if it hadnt been a reception it would have been the Ws standard night club To her credit she felt the room vibrate and heard the noise and quickly arranged a transfer to a room on a lower floor Once I figured out how to turn off all the little neon lights I got a decent sleep just two hours later than I wanted
Im an SPG gold member and have stayed at several Ws around the country This is one I will not revisit But if youre looking for a nightclub atmosphere this is definitely your spot

title: Great place to stay
text:
The rooms are clean and comfortable I dont know if the rooms around us were empty but we never heard any noise from the other rooms The hotel shuttle to and from the airportSea World and MCRD was great We picked Howard Johnson due to the location shuttle service and the breakfast We were not disappointed 
The front desk staff especially a gentleman by the name of Dobri was VERY helpful 
He was so helpful professional and friendly We had never been to San Diego before and he was able to answer our questions give us suggestions on things to do and places to eat Because of him we ventured out to a few places we probably would not have He was wonderful with my kids my younger son especially when he was telling us about the USS Midway Museum and how much he would like it and just telling him about San Diego in general He took the time to answer all of my questions and explain everything to me I also observed the way he handled other guests and he was always pleasant and professional but warm and welcoming as well In my opinion he went above his duties on a number of occasions We would absolutely stay again

title: Location service comfort for travellers
text:
Located on Van Buren the neighborhood isnt actually the best one of Phoenix but is pretty close to PHX and thats why we stayed there in 2010
Service is good as well as cleanliness and breakfast is actually excellent considered the class of the hotel
They serve the airport and the rental terminal with a complimentary shuttle bus
All in all a great value for anyone who need to stay close to Sky Harbor for some time

title: This location is unbeatable
text: What a fantastic hotel Its dark yes but this was not an issueits actually great if youre jetlagged it was clean and the sheets pillows and bed were all great quality and comfortable The rooms are smallish but we stayed for 10 days with two massive suitcases and didnt seem to have a problem The breakfast is included and its minimal but we ate out most days anyways Staff were all very friendly and there is always someone at reception 247 The locations is unbeatable a few doors down from Times Square Also  no bed bug issues which is a major issue in NY at the moment We got the room at a great rate and it was exceptional value for money  Wed stay here again

title: Rude Rude staff Total ripoff
text:
We stayed at the W last month and were completely dissapointed we had actually booked for 9 nights but moved after 2 it was soooooo bad
Firstly my husband arrived separately from a conference in the US He was not allowed to check in as they didnt have his name on the booking despite his name being on every booking form I had as well as receipts from the hotel when checking outHe therefore had to wait 3 hrs in the lobby whilst we arrived
Our rooms we had 2 were tiny noisy and bright all night
The staff were rude and arrogant with attitude they were so busy looking at themselves they had no time to assist anyone 
An extremely disapointing beginning to a 2 week family holiday Fortunately we relocated to The London NY which was far better value and fabulous in every way

title: Best Service Location Rooms for the Price
text:
I cant begin to tell you how much I appreciate staying at the Sheraton Jacksonville After my most recent trip staying at the W Miami Beach I have a new found love and respect for the entire staff at this hotel The level of service is far superior to any that I receive staying anywhere else Ive stayed over 70 nights throughout the year at this hotel alone Who would ever think that a 2 Star hotel would far exceed a six star hotel in Miami Beach 
The rooms are tastefully decorated and the beds are super comfortable The TVs are HD LCD and provide excellent programming However they need to get the History Channel back working again Strange that it is the only channel that doesnt work 
You simply cannot beat the superior location by the mall Every conceivable dining option is a short drive away If you have a pet the Sheraton Jacksonville welcomes you with open arms and a warm heart I cannot say enough great things about the entire staff They are a true Five Star Staff providing exceptional quality customer service Michael the GM obviously picks and trains his people well

title: Disappointed with the worn condition of facilities
text:
Positives Great location convenient to Metro Dupont Circle GWU Downtown
Large suites with fully equipped kitchens Quiet Clean Despite what others have written Friendly staff
Cons Furnishings have long since seen better days The sofa had a huge gash with stuffing coming out Several of the limited  of tv channels didnt work NBCPBSESPN2 The rooms were overheated Our room keys had to be replace twice in 4 days because of problems with the lock Treadmill in the gym didnt work and although there was a water cooler in the gym there were no cups available

title: Very comfortable suprisingly quiet and luxurious hotel
text:
Note I live in Boston but was awarded a free nights stay here through my business This hotel is housed in what used to be the Boston Police Department headquarters so Ive always been wanting to stay here and see how they transformed this landmark building While I did not pay for my stay Im writing this review with the mindest of how I would view this hotel if I had actually paid for the room based on the current prices listed on their website which is currently listed at 195 for a Superior King for the month of December 2010
Check in was smooth personable and very friendly I was made to feel right at home and even offered a warm towel to freshen up The staff also asked me if I already had dinner plans and was more than eager to offer suggestions 
My room was a Superior King and was very spacious and full of all kinds of unique and helpful items that set this hotel apart from other hotels Ive stayed at in this class For starters its stocked with a great selection of amazing Kiehls bath products They also have a towel warmer hair dryer iron safe and an empty fridge so you can go out and buy your own things and keep them cold Many hotels overstock the mini bar so you cant really use the fridge for anything you might want to buy on your own In my opinion this was better and if I really needed anything else they have 24 hour room service 
The bathroom had a motion triggered nightlight which was so helpful in the middle of the night Never saw that in a hotel before and think every hotel should have them Clever There is also a really nice CD player and sound system with a remote control a huge flat screen television free wifi as well as an ethernet cable for laptops and a large desk One thing that they didnt have in the room that I felt would be a nice addition is a DVD player but perhaps that will come in the future
The room was also very quiet as it was in the back part of the hotel Not sure how the front facing rooms are for sound but my room was really quiet the bed was very comfortable and I slept very well
