Another great feature of this hotel is the amount of drawer space for your clothes Many hotels either have just one drawer for your clothes or just enough for one guest While I was a solo traveler I noticed at least 3 large drawers on each side of the bureau as well as plenty of space in each of the nightstands and a very large closet Plenty of space for two guests to store clothes 
My room didnt have any views and Im really not sure what views the other room would offer in this part of town but I wouldnt expect too much in that regard since the hotel is surrounded by lots of other buildings
Breakfast was also very good They have an extensive buffet option but I chose to order from the menu The bar area is also very nice with a very cool and modern fireplace
There are also lots of great restaurants nearby including Geoffreys that offers great comfort food and cocktails at surprisingly low prices and Grill 23 which is a really great steakhouse with typical steakhouse prices
Overall I had a really nice experience and I will definitely be suggesting this hotel to my friends and family

title: Comfortable clean and convenient
text:
This was my second stay this month at the Courtyard at Easton and it has become my first choice for business travel to Columbus The hotel looks and feels new and the rooms are very immaculate The beds are comfortable and there are at least five foam or feather pillows on the triplesheeted king size beds The room is roomy with a large desk area and a pullout sofa if you need it Youll need to use a ethernet cable youll find it hanging in your closet for internet in your room but I think wireless service might be available in the lobby The sink and dressing area are separate from the toilet and tub and both areas are spotless Nice toiletries are provided
The breakfast is very reasonable 895 with lots of choices The cookedtoorder omelettes are delicious The service is excellent and its buffet style There is a little convenience store for snacks at times other than breakfast 
If you need a small refrigerator ask for one at checkin They are complimentary and will be brought to your room quickly Shop at Trader Joes less than a block away and stock up on beverages and snacks for your room
The hotel may be slightly more than usual for a Courtyard but due to location at a fabulous shopping area its great if you can travel on business and take time for shopping after work There are MANY great restaurants at Easton The airport is minutes away and the hotel has a shuttle
There are great chewy Otis Spunkmeyer cookies also complimentary at the reception desk The entire staff is professional friendly and very helpful Ill stay here again

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: We are currently staying here as I write this review The staff is wonderful the breakfast is delicious with great variety each day the rooms are so comfortable the pool lovely the showers are hot the beds and pillows are comfy and the location is PERFECT Our only issue was with our ac and the engineers were up to the room in about 2 minutes and very accomodating and offered to switch us to a different room which we didnt feel was necessary In the end I think it was just the exhast fan in the bathroom that wasnt working right which meant the humidity level was high We upgraded to a suite for the second half of our stay and it is wonderful too I would reccomend spending a bit more for the suite especially if you are traveling with your family Lots of space bigger kitchen area with a bar to sit at larger fridge and counter area We will stay here again anytime we come back to Chicago I cant comment on the restaurant because we havent eaten there yet

title: Great Location clean rooms but not as good a value as it could be
text:
Ive stayed at this property for nearly 25 years when visiting relatives in Encino and sadly its gotten harder to recommend it 
Pros My room was clean and comfortable The hotels location is superb  next to I405 and within five minutes of the Ventura Freeway Even someone unfamiliar with Los Angeles can find it easily Although the hotel is next to the freeway rooms have enough soundproofing that I didnt have trouble sleeping at night There is a small pool that appeared to be clean
There is too much traffic to go jogging in the neighborhood around the hotel but there is a 23 mile jogging trail about a mile west of the hotel around Balboa Golf Course that is safe and quite attractive Ask the front desk clerk for directions
Cons Although the rooms are clean and well maintained their decor is very dated it looks as though the decor hasnt been changed since the mid 1980s when Laura Ashley floral prints were the hottest fashion trend 
Also the hotel does not offer free breakfast unlike most hotels in this price point Yes there is a Dennys on site but breakfast for a family of four will be at least 30  day and Dennys food is not very nutritious At least the room had a refrigerator 
The next time Im visiting this area I would probably choose the Hampton Inn down the street unless the rates at the Carriage Inn were significantly cheaper than the Hampton Inns rates

title: spare a thought for this hotel at 911
text:
By the title I mean this hotel has a two lane road separating it from the Twin Towers what a scary thought as most of us only think about the people in the actual towers Anyway i arrived for my two night stay here and was immediately impressed lovely bustling entrancereception bbok in was quick friendly and efficient got a great room with amazing views I was actually looking at all the 4000 workers on the ground zero memorial site amazing I have always stayed midtown or uptown I like this part downtown round the corner from wall Street next door to trinity Church the walk to the battery park staten island and ellis island ferries was 7 minutes I am a solo traveller so safety is a major issue with me I never needed to give it a thought
Room was gorgeous modern VERY comfortable and spotless All the staff were very friendly luxurious toiletries beautiful spacious bathroom I could not fault this place There was a games consul and a mini bar I loved this hotel would definitely come back here and would recommend it to everyone Great discount shop next door century 21 brand names at fantastic prices

title: Amazing Stay Kids are treated like Royalty
text:
I had a terrific 5 night stay with my wife and 3 kids ages 9 7 and 5 We booked an executive suite with 2 double beds upon arrival to our room on the 41st floor I was struck by the amazing view Lake Michigan and the Hancock Building right across the street
The room was spacious and comfortable the bathroom was of very good size the showers water pressure was AMAZING Room service and housekeeping was fast and corteous always
My children received a treat every single day As soon as we left the room for the day they were looking forward to the afternoon evening to see what was awaiting for them at the room something different every single day The FS is an upscale venue but extremely kid friendly
The swimming pool is amazing we enjoyed it one night And the easy access to 900 Michigan shops is like icing on the cake
I must say that the concierge staff was amazing Karen made a difference in our stay The entire concierge staff really went out of their way to make us feel right at home
It has only been 2 weeks since we came back and my kids ask me to go back better yet beg me every single day

title: Second Stay better than the first
text: I95 is not know for great lodging options but this hotel has been great twice I stayed at this hotel after leaving home late for a weekend trip to Savannah in 05 and was very impressed Now once again this time on biz the property was clean and affordable As an additional bonus the area seams relativly safe and there are several other lodging options just in case Plus many food and gas options are available

title: Nice stay at the Sofitel
text:
Room was lovely had a view of the Empire State Building on the 20th floor Room number 2015 Chocolates every night and turndown service was quite nice
Apparently there was an understaffing issue when it came to the room service staff so I had quite a few delegates we were there for a meeting who hadnt had their linens changed and werent brought fresh towels BIG mistake 
Overall Id say this hotel is lovely If youre looking for a place that caters to a different kind of traveler IE the CEO of your firm this is the place Its a bit pricey for tourists but then again what can you expect of a hotel two blocks away from Times Square

title: This is a great Downtown Austin value
text: I live in Austin My husband and I stayed here overnight for Valentines Day This is a great hotel It is within walking distance of the Austin night spots The room was spacious and clean and we had a great view of the Capital Koriente is a lovely intimate cool affordable restaurant just a couple of minutes walk across the street Keep in mind that you are directly on 6th Street and it stays noisy pretty late Even on the 16th floor we could hear the traffic noise so pack your earplugs

title: Surprising space and customer service
text: I have stayed at this hotel twice as a business traveler The first time I was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a junior suite and the level of service provided The second time I realized the first time was not a fluke but a way of doing business at this property The rooms are large and comfortable and the entire staff appears to be intent on making each guest comfortable They quickly and eagerly provide advice restaurant recommnedations directions etc The fitness center is far above what most hotels provide and the elevators are very fasta big plus in NYC The rooms also have a very good deskwork area with lots of outlets for computers chargers etc To top it all off the rates are very reasonable Great views too Highly recommend

title: Perfect Stay
text: Stayed here in November Great service SPACIOUS room  i mean this is NYC and centrally located The person below who complained its not near times square should stay in a hotel in times square I would stay here every time i need a hotel in NYC

title: Not what it used to be
text:
I have stayed at this property on several occasions and I am sad to say this was the last The location is amazing but everything else seems to be on a steady decline Andrea at the front desk is one of the most incompetent people I have ever come across Each time I was at the desk there was another guest complaining We spent 45 minutes checking in for a onenight stay and all of the requests on my reservation were marked incorrectly 
The hotel used to have a welcome package in the room with snacks drinks and chocolates Instead I was welcomed by the permeating stench of a stale ashtray The rest of our party ended up on a different floor even though we requested the rooms together I get the whole concept of it being a request but there was no effort to fix or accommodate us at all 
They have imposed a new 10 daily resort fee Im not sure how a small inn with less then 100 rooms and no real ammenities can even use the term resort The bedding was uncomfortable and our view was a brick wall Parking across the street was 42 for one night which is completely obnoxious but better than waiting for the valet who was about as efficient as the girl at the front desk 
She charged the credit card that was supposed to be holding our room without consent While trying to resolve the situation it turned out it wasnt my card that was charged at all but our friends in the 2nd room were charged for both rooms We just gave them cash but now 3 days later I find that my card was charged after check out so we have paid for the stay twice at this point
Andrea told me she is the manager there now and I can promise IF and as long as that is the case I will spend the extra money to stay at the Radisson for my future visits

title: Really comfy convienient and friendly hotel
text:
I have just returned from 4 days in New York where I stayed at this hotel The staff are so friendly and helpful They can even tell you which subway entrance to take to get to a particular station The studio room was fine clean and plenty of room for just me Huge bed with fabulous cotton sheets Having the kitchen is great coffee machine provided Bathroom always really clean masses of towels and the toiletries they provide are very good quality The spa looked fine there is a steam room and a gym but I didnt get time to use it There are lots of coffee shops and a deli to buy food from nearby Best convienient restaurant is a little Italian called Squisito just up the hill on East 34th street from the hotel which makes great pizza and thick soups etc The people in there are really friendly and funny
I was on my own for almost two days and found New York a really easy place to walk around or take the subway The hotel will give you a good map 
Book the Hop on Hop off City Bus on line before you go for a really good deal and well worth doing as the commentaries are funny and informative and the extras they include in the online deals make it very good value for money
Have lots of other tips too but the hotel made the whole visit really a pleasure as a single lady in New York

title: Good for the money
text: When looking at Austin hotels I originally wanted something downtown but settled on the Omni Southpark My reason was it was about half the price of the hotels downtown but just as nice The Omni was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly The location is also a plus since it is close to both the airport and downtown The Omni also offered a shuttle to take us back to the airport when we were leaving This is now my favorite hotel in Austin and I will be staying here again in the future

title: Perfect
text:
I have always been keen to try this brand of the IHG as we dont have them in the UK might be one in London now I thought it was great Everything about it I enjoyed It is as its name implies within a few minutes walk of the heart of the Gaslamp district The location in fact is very good with many attractions within easy reach eg a 15 minute walk to USS Midway 
The lobby was smart modern and clean and this theme continued into the bedrooms which were very pleasant indeed the bathroom is modern and attractive with a very roomy shower There is no bath but we prefer showers Complimentary wifi was a plus point and the Ipod  Iphone docking station was a very welcome feature The outside bar on the 9th floor complete with fire pits was a very pleasant environment in which to enjoy a drink The only disappointment here was the fact that drinks are dispensed in plastic containers
We had breakfasts in the dining area  these were very good and good value for money eg I got 2 fried eggs bacon and potato for just under 10 
Overall an excellent stay and represented good value for money I wouldnt hesitate in recommending it and would definitely stay again I was very pleased to note that my Priority Club Platinum Membership was fully recognised Much appreciated It fully deserves its high ranking on Tripadvisor

title: Great location if you want to see the sights and dine well
text: We stayed at the hotel for three days had a great time Staff we on the whole very good Room was very nice Whilst parking was not onsite this was not an issue as we walked everywhere and didnt get the car until we were ready to leave Philly The choice of restaurants nearby was fantastic Breakfast was okay but not fantastic but this appears to be the standard in most US hotels now

title: The Most Fun Trip to Chicago  Ever
text: The Wit is a boutique hotel on State Street It is walking distance to everything downtown and is close to the Chicago River The rooms are hip and fun with amazing dowtown views But what makes this a GREAT hotel is the staff They are SO professional at what they do Everyone from the concierge to the servers to the housekeepers went way above my expectations We were treated like royalty and we will definately be back The 27th floor houses the Roof a bar and restaraunt with retractable a roof and walls This place is so much fun with amazing views and ambiance

title: My trip to Howard Johnson
text: The breakfast was okay the milk was warm and the food was not fresh The floors were dirty and the rooms were dirty But it is a good value for the dollar at the location I did not spend a lot of money I was happy about the value of the place

title: Nice but a bit noisy
text: Stayed here for just one night in December Very good location nice front desk man easy check in Room was small but very cosy clean and the bed was comfy However we were in a room next to the lift and this could be quite noisy with people in and out Also the bathroom fan was unbelievable noisy and the room next door left theirs on when they checked out early Ive slept through city traffic with windows open before but with the lift bathroom fan and wheelie cases going up and down the hall it was and early wake up call That said I would stay here again as the good points outweigh the noise

title: Simply a great hotel
text: The staff was extremely courteous and attentive The rooms well designed and comfortable Though we did not make much use of the pool and rooftop bar they looked top notch Room service was prompt and delicious as well This place is highly recommended

title: Good hotel  excellent location
text: After reading some of the previous reports I was a little worried about this hotel Dont take these reports in this hotel is just what you want when staying in NYC The staff are friendly and helpful and the location is excellent The rooms are clean and adequate and the hotel overall is v good The bar is expensive and the deli across the road is good for breakfast and a late evening snack Walking distance to the EmpireTime SquareRockefellerCentral Park etc There is a tube station a few blocks north on Lexington Ave if you want to go to the WTC I would stay at this hotel again and cant wait to return to NYC

title: Always Happy at The Marriott East Side
text: My husband and I have stayed all over the city with our children and without 2 girls 7  9 Comparing the Marriott East side to the Hilton on 6th or the W in times square its easy to give this hotel a rave review We were just their from Oct 69 When we arrive we are always greeting with smiles and hellos The hotel guest relations coordinator Kenda remembers us everytime we go about 3 times a year This particular stay we reserved a Jr Suite with a pull out sofa for our children When we got to the 6th floor room it smelled of smoke nonsmoking hotel and the tub was clogged I called down to the at your service desk and requested a change of rooms due to the fact of an asthmatic child We were not given the same room but instead the Ambabassador Suite on the 33rd floor The hotel staff could not have been more helpful My profile with Marriott states that I have an asthmatic child however I dont feel that this is why I was switched to such a large suite I believe it is the relations that the staff tries to keep with its guest I have never experienced a rude employee at this hotel Having stayed here about 3 times a year for the past 5 I find that quite amazing Not sure if everyone knows this but JW Marriott is the parent company for the Ritz Carlton As a frequent guest of the Ritz in Boston as well as the Ritz Beach Resort in Naples FL It is easy to compare this category 7 Marriott to the Ritz For anyone who expects a LARGE hotel room in NYC should do somemore research most that Ive stayed in have been quite small Im sure do to the fact that the city is so populated Paying over 500 a night was completely fine for what we got even if our room hadnt changed Location just blocks from the best shopping and sites in NYC The easy highway access and the fact that you are in such a large city and yet at this hotel you get the feel that you are in a neighborhood I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy New York

title: Good for business trip no free breakfast
text: I stayed there for a week in September The hotel is in an industrial part of San Diego close to freeways Youll pretty much need a car if you want to go anywhere although I saw a bus stop 5 minutes walking distance The hotel has a big enough parking lot and the rooms are standard but nice Mine had a mini fridge and a microwave The free wifi internet connection always worked The swimming pool is big enough to swim laps and the fitness room right next to the pool has 4 cardio machines plus weights The staff is friendly and helpful Unlike some other hotels in the area this one doesnt offer a free continental breakfast in the morning A short drive away on Cairemont Mesa youll find plenty of restaurants however at 7am Mc Donalds is the only one open

title: This is our favorite in NYC
text: We love this hotel in NYC Its clean and convenient right in the heart of Times Square Its pricey and the rooms ARE small but come on Its NYC What do you expect Staff is great

title: Go for the history and atmosphere
text:
We stayed at the Waldorf for a business event and we were there for less than 12 hours Overall its a beautiful hotel  the lobby the banquet hall etc The room was paid for by the company so keeping that in mind
Checkin took a very long time Our attendant was very nice however we think she may be been in training as we were standing there at the desk for at least 15 minutes  to the point that we asked Is everything all right We had booked a king bed room and they had us in a double bed room  I believe they upgraded us to the Waldorf Towers although I dont recognize any of the rooms in which we stayed on the website but I dont know if we originally had booked in the Towers or the Hotel We were on the 28th floor
The elevator and hallway were very pretty I did not notice any signs of aging in the Tower however I did notice a smell in the hall  maybe it was a smoking floor Our room did not smell of smoke The room itself was very nice  marble floors separate tub and shower and a walkin closet There was a nice view of Park Avenue and St Barts church below The water pressure was virtually nonexistent and when you used the sink the stopper held the water in the sink In the shower it was a tiny bit better Be careful walking around the room the bed frame stuck out several inches from the bed and we banged our shins on it a couple of times
Later when we went to sleep we could not figure out how to turn off the light underneath the sink nor could we determine how to close the opague shades at night so with the lights from outside it basically looked like daylight in our room We were so tired and it was late so we decided not to call the front desk to have someone come up to the room The bed was very comfortable
At the very least you should go visit the lobby of the hotel if you visit NYC You could find similarly located hotels with room rates that are about the same

title: OK location  trendy hotel
text:
We stayed in one of the smaller suites at this hotel because there were three of us Since we were travelling as a couple and a mutual friend we were hoping to get a separating door between the living room and the bedroom We called the hotel and they assured us that we would get exactly that Of course we were still nervous about this but when we arrived it all fell in to place The suite was big and there was a separating door just like we asked for They offered free WiFi in the lobby as well as in the room
The bathroom was quite small but very clean and well maintained There were two large TV sets and good storage possibilities for all of us We had a view overlooking the roof top gardens opposite the street
There were two elevators but only one working during the entire stay and the music inside the elevator was quite loud which will get you in to a party mood or get you annoyed  decide for yourself 
The location is quite ok but a bit off according to what we normally book whenever we go to New York Its a 10 minute walk to the Empire State Building
At one point we found a tiny insect in the bed and told the staff at the reception and they actually sanitized the whole room within an hour which we found to be very impressing
Over all we were very pleased with our stay

title: Kudos to Nina the Queen
text: We stayed at the Lenox for 3 nights to celebrate my birthday and run the Boston Half Marathon After checking in I stopped by the Concierge desk to get some information Nina the woman on duty commented on a crown shaped pendant I was wearing I told her it was a gift from my husband and that I am the queen of our home She laughed and said that she is the queen of the Lenox In fact they call her QB queen bee for short We chatted a bit more and my husband and I headed for a quick lunch at her recommendation of Pappa Razzi for some carbo loading excellent We went back to the room and Nina appeared with a basket of goodies power bars etc and a giant helium balloon It was a bumble bee of course How special and unbelievable I have never had such a thoughtful gesture made by a complete stranger There is no need to look further in Boston than the Lenox The location could not be more convenient the bed was comfortable and you are treated like family Kudos

title: Not a heavenly welcome
text:
A couple of weeks ago I finally managed to redeem a gift certificate for the Westin Seattle that I had purchased through a charity auction two years agoWe decided to take our 14 year old son along for a week in the city so I added an additional day to make the weekend in downtown Seattle a memorable experience for my wife and son
It was memorable alright
I took the advice of a fellow Trip Advisor member to forego the hotel parkade  save  of the parking costs by utilizing the Westin Building parkade which is linked to the hotel by a walkway As we unloaded the luggage from the car my son  I went looking for a luggage cart in which to transport our bags to the hotel room We found one at the end of the walkway on the 2nd floor of the hotel near the meeting rooms We took the cart back to where our car was parked where we loaded up our luggage  proceeded to the front desk to register 
While I was checking into the hotel my wife was approached by a bell attendant who told her that she could not use this cart When she responded that it was left in the upstairs lobby near the walkway the attendant then told her in front of other hotel guests the cart was his responsibility and that she should not have taken it and that he could get in trouble with his boss  My wife responded that maybe the hotel should have put a sign on it telling patrons to not use the luggage carts The attendant then insisted that he bring our luggage up to the room 
Unaware of the encounter that transpired I proceeded to the hotel room along with my family the bell attendant and our luggage After he left my wife then told me the story of what had happened It reminded me of a scene from the English comedy Faulty Towers 
Since we were on a bit of a schedule I chose to wait until I returned home to comment on this experience rather than make a formal complaint I felt sorry for the fellow as he appeared stressed out during my brief encounter with him

title: Paper Thin Walls in Expansive Hotel
text: Stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for several nights to attend a conference at the LA convention center The hotel is huge with 34 separate towersI was in the Blue The staff was OK Didnt always seem too knowledgeable of the area I asked which direction to head for shopping once and another time a specific address on South Figueroa Street to an Avis rentacar both times they werent sure which direction to send me The room itself was fine and the amenities were good The Heavenly bed just as comfortable as at other Westins Cons Charging 1295 per day for internet and paper thin walls My first night I was awakend at 3am by the party next to me2 guys and a loud woman The next morning I could hear a entire business meeting carried on in the room on the opposite side of me Also could hear the guests in the room above me through the vents from time to time Enjoyed using the fitness room which was large and well appointed Experienced the main barrestaurant in the lobby where the service and food were perfectly fine Wouldnt refuse to stay here again but hope to experience something else on my next LA visit

title: Comfy roomy and great staff
text:
Enjoyed the stay in the Wingate Jacksonville South The hotel was very quiet Nice outdoor pool and big indoor hot tub The breakfast room is very nice and great breakfast and service
The staff is very friendly on all fronts The rooms are comfy beds nice and clean The decor is florida style and getting a little more dated  but again clean and comfy
I will be back

title: True Southern Hospitality
text: I just got home from staying at The Peabody and I am happy to announce that Southern hospitality is alive and well in Memphis From the moment we walked into the hotel and were greeted by a bellman to the moment we left and another bellman saw us off our stay there was well worth the trip After reading other comments on this site I was feeling nervous about my choice however when I finally got there I could not understand all of the negative comments My room was a nice size clean and well stocked with area guides etc It is true that the bathroom was small however it is because that is how they were built at the turn of the century and it is simply part of the culture and charm of the hotel Also the staff couldnt have been any nicer or helpful I would recommend The Peabody to anyone

title: Good location but rooms not ready upon arrival
text: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Hilton Times Square Hotel very comfortable but was very disappointed that our rooms were not ready when we arrived at 2pm after a long and tiring flight We were told to come back at 3pm and they would be ready We had to walk around the area for an hour or so to kill time when all we wanted to do was get into our rooms and freshen up I was travelling with my elderly parents both in their mid 70s who were exhausted and just wanted to lie down When we got back to the hotel at 4pm the rooms were STILL not ready Eventually one room became available and then after 30 minutes of constantly calling reception I finally went down and argued with the desk clerk I booked this hotel because it had great reviews and is a better class of hotel but wouldnt recommend it if you are looking to get into your room before 5pm in the evening Why it takes so long to make rooms available especially when you have to check out by 12 noon is beyond me

title: A welcoming stay as always
text:
I recently returned from Boston and my 3rd stay at The Back Bay Hotel I really love this place Its location is definitely a huge plus point  right in the heart of the Back Bay area within easy walking distance of some great shopping Newbury Street the Prudential Center etc restaurants and Boston Common as well as a number of T stations 
As for the hotel itself it has real character throughout from the buidling the old Police Headquarters to the classic decor to the people working there The rooms although not necessarily huge are comfortable very clean and have great bathrooms The bar Cuffs downstairs is a great place to hang out relax and defrost in front of the fire and feels much more cosy and welcoming than a lot of hotel bars Ive been in The staff have been fantastic on every visit and this time was no exception They smile say hello to you in the corridor and hold doors open for you I have always made to feel like a welcome guest and will definitely return to the hotel in future

title: I wanted to love this place but
text:
The Palomar Kimpton is enigmatic Some aspects of our stay were wonderful Others not so much
I hope Tripadvisor allows me to say this so here goes I got 2 weekend rooms on a certain nameyourownprice website and ended up at the Palomar I had once stayed at the Muse in New York City another Kimpton and enjoyed that so I was looking forward to the Palomar Our price was good much lower than the rack rate
Like many hotels in LA the location is central That is its not walking distance to anything In LA I guess good location means no more than a 45 minute drive It may be excellent for certain business visitors though that was not our purpose
I detest smokers and I have a smoke allergy I called ahead to verify a nonsmoking room and was told not to worry all the rooms are smoke free Not so fast BOTH rooms given to us were obviously smoked in One so bad it would almost gag you I know the hotel cant control their guests but they can certainly scour the rooms after some deadbeat smokes in one And not release that room until it is clean We were transferred to smoke free rooms
Then there was was issue with the dead battery in the electronic door lock All I know is the lock stopped working OK new key Doesnt work Called maintenance Had an appointmentplease expedite I guess expedite was interpreted as expedition as that was what it took to get new batteries in and get the lock working
The doors have virtually no soundproofing so you hear everyone walking the halls The walls are thin for a hotel with high aspirations We could hear our neighbors through the wall Unfortunately it was all G rated Oh well
On the upside the hotel had a nice wine tasting in the afternoons The bar is nice The front office is very service oriented
This was probably a lower end Marriott or Hilton bought out by Kimpton and boutiqued But basically it remains a lower end Marriott or Hilton with an upscale finish and an excellent staff Because our price was low the value was there If I paid rack rate I would not be happy

title: Great NYC hotel
text: We originally booked the cozy room but asked for an upgrade during check in which we luckily got The upgraded room was large for a NYC hotel room and the bathroom was large too The location is great Its away from the major tourist spots yet only a little walk away We will definitely return to this hotel when we are back in NYC

title: Great Stay Great Prices
text: Stayed here last weekend and would highly recommend We got a great deal 13500 includes breakfast for two and valet parking Service was fantastic from start to finish Cant wait to stay again

title: Ive upgraded my previous review
text: I have stayed here a few more times since my first review and although the location is still a potential issue I have been impressed with this property on my last two stays The staff is great the place is very clean and the beds are exceptionally comfortable I arrived for the last stay during a snowstorm and the fire going in the lobby fireplace was quite welcoming Also Im not sure why I was told they did not have bathtubs on my first visit but it turns out they do have them And we were given a complimentary rollaway on one of the visits which was appreciated The best part of the place is their complimentary car service Its very convenient and the drivers are very nice too You naturally may have to wait at times though If you do not need to be in a specific area then this is a good option and be sure to ask for a room with a mountain view

title: central location but not great
text: Stayed here during a busines trip Choose the hotel based on the location which is fantastic The hotel is very large internet is only working for free in the lobby which was a bit annoying The rooms are clean and rather large for New York Overall the rooms are quite dated and could do with a general refurb Not sure if I would stay here again asfor the money paid I would have expected a five star experience Mieke

title: Fun and Friendly place to stay
text: This hotel is immaculately clean and well maintained We were greeted in a friendly manner by the entire staff Everyone was anxious to be helpful The checkin staff made sure to explain procedures clearly and offer assistance in any way possible The location was close to Dupont Circle and other areas were within easy walking distance It was easy to use public transportation and cabs to get around Parking your own car and then using the public transportation is the way to go We have stayed here twice now and been pleased by both of our stays

title: The worst service they really make you feel bad
text:
Stay away from this hotel
People in the checkin will make you feel as if you were bothering them then when you park at the entrance  they make you move your car to the back without telling you before that you have to pay 18 per day 
Those employees were very disgusting They have no manners no idea how to be courteous to the costumers 
The hotels heating system does not work incredible 
They will charge you for almost everything like WiFi TV etc
Im glad only was one night

title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
text:
Arrived for an extended business stay in Jacksonville Florida Our company normally places us in a standard hotel but do to my length of stay I opted for a suite hotel with a full kitchen Upon entry to the parking lot of this facility I could tell this place would be something special The area was very clean very neat and meticulously maintained Upon entry to the lobby I was greeted by friendly staff and a unique lobby decor I secured my key and proceeded to the room I entered a found a very well appointed kitchen area and very clean The living room had a large flat screen TV with a very comfortable couch and lounge chair with automon I then inspected both bedrooms They were clean neat and well appointed Each had flat screen TVs and a very user friendly clock radio The sheets and bedspreads were clean and smelled very fresh 
I then inspected the bathroom Very clean with excellent water pressure from the spigot The towels were of a better quality than expected
Overall the room was GREAT The air conditioners were quiet and kept the room and a very nice temperature 
The pool area was just as nice and the Jacuzzi worked perfectly
I only had one minor concern about an otherwise excellent stay The breakfast was not quite what I was expecting For such a well appointed hotel the breakfast was a bit disappointing but this would not in any way be the deciding factor of whether to stay again 
I highly recommend this hotelYou will not be disappointed

title: Overrated and overpriced
text: Location was good but it is not value for the money We stayed three nights  at an average of US275night for one room We were late arriving by train into Penn station and had no hotel booked and it was the first one we saw We were too tired to bother trying elsewhere even when we heard the price The hotel pictures online do not tell the real story The lobby is impressive but it deteriorates from there Our room was dingy but clean down the end of a long corridor on the 8th floor Bathroom fittings were antiquated and need upgrading Noise from night time roadworks and traffic was disturbing The lesson is do more homework and book in advance

title: Bad disappointing choice for us in Columbus
text: My husband and I like to stay at Homewood suites so as we got close to Columbus where we decided to stop for the day I researched with my phone and found this hotel and a Hampton Inn with rooms available We chose Homewood since we wanted the suite with the refigerator that we could use to refreeze our blue ice and a microwave to make popcorn in case we did not like the evening offering at the managers reception The staff member at the check in was not very helpful did not explain room or amenities tried to get away with giving us one key When we got to the room it was not a suite like we have had at other Homewoods did not even have a microwave or fridge and very small I wanted to go change it but my husband was extremely tired after driving for 11 hours did not want to bother The place where you eat dinner and breakfast is not connected to the rooms so you always had a long walk and had to go out in the chilly weather to get there The food was okay but not up to the standard of other Homewoods we have stayed at There are several hotels in this vicinity and this hotel was the closest to 270 and our room faced it so it was very noisy plus all during the night there were train whistles going off frequently We had hoped for a restful reviving night to get ready for our next leg of our trip and that certainly did not happen Definitely would not stay here again

title: Colonnade Hotel a great choice
text: Staff is friendly and helpful beds are very comfy T station just outside the hotel is convenient for seeing the entire city tons of restaurants within walking distance on our last day there we discovered Thorntons at 150 Huntington  a good choice for breakfast

title: Fantasy Stay at the Algonquin
text: My friend and I stumbled upon the Algonquin by pure luck Not only were we blown away with the character and charm of this FANTASTICALLY located hotel we were more than impressed with the attention and service we received from the hotel staff during our stay We stayed in a standard room two single beds free wifi two bath robes nice bathroom TV ipod docking station etc The Algonquin offers free coffeetea to its guests on the 2nd floor 24 hours a day via a single serve Tassimo or something similar machine this was great in the morning when I was up early and needed to catch a train The hotel is about 2 minutes walking from Times Square 10 minutes from Central Park and 1 minute to 5th Avenue The bar is really nice and has a replica round table that Dorothy Parker and her mates used to convene around every day back in the early 1900s Very nice hotel to stay in while visiting New York City

title: Never again  not at all like other HI Express locations
text:
We were very disappointed with the condition of this HI Express When we checked in we had the following problems
1 the air conditioner was not blowing coolcold air I called the front desk to ask for a different room The man  the desk told me he would call me back He never did We let it go because it was late  we were tired
2 There were no sheets for the sofa bed I had to go downstairs to ask for some because no one would answer the front desk phone
3 There was visible mold in the shower in the corner near the faucet on the shower curtain along the bottom and on the shower ceiling
4 There was a lot of dustgrime on the top of the ceiling fan blades AND on the air vents in the room They had obviously not been cleaned in a long time 
5 This hotel is in a weird downtown area There were a few shady looking people hanging out in the lobby when we checked in around 10 pm 
I mentioned the problems to the lady at the front desk when we checked out this morning I will never stay at that location again

title: Very good location
text:
Stayed December 5 to 12th 2007
From Sydney Australia
Very close to Times Square and a walk to everywhere Very busy with Christmas shoppers Did not have breakfast their as only very sweet and fattening things available Could do with boiled eggs as some other Holiday Inn Express have Across the street very close to places to have breakfast  Very good restaurants in street for dinner as well right next door Room was small supposed to be king bed but in width ok in depth cut off too short obviously to fit in room our feet hung over end of bed if you stretched out and I am only 52 tall Some desk reception people need to be more friendly and helpful Asked about arranging a broadway show were not helpful to us When leaving we asked reception to get us a car to travel to airport  after about 2 hours we got one  never been so frightened in travelling in my life private hire car and way too fast Do your own hiring of cars Also not one person from reception asked if we enjoyed our stay at end of 7 days  Also airconditioning outside motor in next door offices very noisy during week days  ok weekends as is turned off Made the walls vibrate and had to wear ear plugs This should and could be fixed by office owners next door Overall close to everything and very clean

title: Cant beat the location
text: You simply can not beat the location of this downtown hotel The Alamo out the front door the Riverwalk out the back Also the customer service is excellent especially the doormenvaletbellman  always there to assist you However the valet fee of over 2200 per night was a bit excessive There is garage parking self across the street Did not eat at the hotel as there are just too many choices in the area  both around the Alamo and down on the riverwalk Of course a trip to the Riverwalk is not complete without a stop at Durty Nellies  a very fun piano bar singalong Just watch out for the military folks letting off a little steam  completely understandable The only complaint I would have about this Hyatt would be the size of the bathrooms  TINY After spending a few days last week at the Hyatt Regency Lost Pines near Austin with their super large bathrooms the ones at this Hyatt were just too small And they need to upgrade their hair dryers as well Here is a restaurant suggestion  The Barn Door Great steaks and they have a twicebaked potato with jalepenos that is to die for Located about 15 minutes from the hotel not downtown And for the golfers try both courses at La Cantera especially the Palmer course if you like true hillcountry golf And The Quarry  another great course Overall a fantastic weekend in the Alamo City If you cant find a place to party here then you just aint looking hard enough

title: Surprisingly good
text: With the somewhat mixed bag of reviews I wasnt particularly optimistic going in However I found this hotel to be simply excellent The room was clean bed very comfortable best night of sleep I had gotten in a while and room service was both fast and delicious Very fast internet with download speeds around 1Mbsec I got a late start in the morning but the front desk had no problem extending my checkout by 2 hours Every member of the staff was friendly and efficient I will definitely be staying here the next time Im in the area

title: fab time at the pod hotel
text:
The Pod Hotel is a fantastic budget hotel my husband and I really couldnt have asked for better value OK granted the rooms are on the small side but who goes to New York to stay in their room
We opted for a bunk room as this was the cheapest option and we wanted to stay for as long as possible it was very clean with fresh towels spare toilet roll hairdryer wash basin and mirror provided
Our room didnt have an en suite so we made use of the 4 bathrooms available on our floor The bathroom system is excellent  there are lights above your door to tell you which bathrooms are available we stayed for 8 nights and only on one occasion were all 4 in use at any one time We never had to wait and they were spotlessly clean with plenty of hot water
A few reviews mention the noise in the pod hotel so we went armed with ear plugs I think you have to accept that New York is a noisy city we were on the 9th floor and you can hear the street noise if you have your window open with the window closed I had no problems sleeping and our room came with air con to keep us cool Yes the doors do slam if you let them but I cant say that this is a reason not to stay here
The staff were friendly and very helpful there are maps and tourist informationadvice available from reception they will also store your bags and arrange transport to the airport if needed They have a lovely lobby and outside patio area in which they have just started to provide breakfast for guests The general facilities are great ipod doc tvs and free internet access for every room you couldnt really ask for much more  even the location is great its close to the MoMa Top of the Rock 5th Ave shops and a subway
I cant recommend the Pod Hotel enough If you are on a budget and want to stay in New York  this is most definitely a good bet

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
Two night stay in August 2006 Paid 80 per night via Priceline
I highly expected the cold Priceline treatment when I walked up to the desk at 11am on a Thursday to checkin I am not sure if I just got a nice desk clerk or my Hilton Gold HHonors card did the trick but I was given a room in Tower 1 on the 37th floor access to the Executive Level and free breakfast for both days She even added my HHonors account  to the reservation which they are not supposed to do for Priceline stays
The room was small but had a nice view of the Golden Gate Bridge Everything was clean but room service was spotty The first night we received turn down service but the second night we did not We were given complimentary waters from the minibar but they never replenished the stock Everything else was fine with housekeeping
For breakfast we choose the restaurant on the lobby level rather than the continental on the Excecutive Level The buffet which you may choose instead of a menu item was aboveaverage and opens at 6am The finger foods offering on the Executive Level from 5  7pm was not as good as the views from that level Everything tasted like frozen food and the booze was cash bar Waters and sodas were free and were great to take back to the room for later
I am not sure if access to the Execututive Level is actually controlled because there were a ton of people up there no checks at the door and a ton of children Regardless it was a nice place to fill up on snacks before heading out to dinner
We did not use the pool but we checked it out and it was very small and basically sat inbetween the towersnot a very appealing environment The fitness center is small but I used some of the equipment and was pleased
One disconcerning experience was with the Bell Desk We needed to pickup our rental car so we asked to leave our bags for an hour or so after we checked out to save time We handed over the bags got our claim tickets and you could tell this guy wanted a tip already In my experience it is customary to tip after you retrieve your bags not upon dropping them off Perhaps the normal business clientel throws around money more than we do but what did he do for a tipPut a ticket on my bags
Anyway after we got the car we went inside to get the bags gave our tickets and requested a cart This same guy points to our bags say get them yourself and told us to put them on the cart At this point another person at the Bell Desk offered to help he took the bags to the car and put them in the trunk for us He got the tip not the grinch who told us to do it ourselves
As for homeless people being reported right outside the doors of the hotel we did not experience this However if you walk around town you will encounter many For those of you who have spent time in Manhattan this is not an issue For those of you from small towns I guess it can be unpleasant Although I was unphased by homeless there appears to be a large population of mentally ill homeless people evidenced by screaming talking to themselves and in one case a nude woman all within walking distance of the Hotel Right across from Hotel Adagio and Cortez restaurant
Every city has homeless so if it really bothers you perhaps you should not walk around at night One reviewer suggested giving the homeless money I am not sure I agree with this and many expect more if you give a little Again that comes from growing up around Manhattan To each their own I guess
One thing I am sure of is that you should not let a few homeless citizens take away from the otherwise great loaction of this hotel A few blocks from BART major bus stop hubs streetcars and trolleys I recommend this for your first stay in San Francisco since it really is at the center of it all

title: Very clean and spacious excellent location
text: Booked this hotel through priceline for a quick business trip Very clean and quiet very well appointed and spacious rooms and excellent location Business center and indoor pool were added bonuses Would definitely stay here again

title: Perfect location
text: London hotel has mini suites perfect for a new York getaway within walking distance to theatre 5th ave shopping and fabulous restaurants and an Avis rental office right next door could not ask for more the staff Is superb

title: cheap friendly noisy average
text: staff is super friendly and very helpful parking spaces are available free wifi too free breakfast means oragejuicecoffeemilk and muffins the walls are super thin you can hear everything from the room next door and from outside we found two ants in the bathroom

title: Clean great location good value
text:
We took a girls trip to Chicago and stayed at the River Hotel for three nights I booked the hotel four months prior to our staywe were supposed to get a two bedroom suite about 225night and three days before leaving I received an email stating that the hotel had made a mistake and that room was actually not available on the first night of our stay but that they could give us two single rooms and would only charge us 87 for that night for both of those rooms Then we would be able to choose if we wanted to move into the suite for the next two nights or if we wanted to stay in the single rooms Initially I was very upsetthey should have at least called to tell me this information instead of merely emailing We arrived at the hotel around noon and they provided a safe place for us to leave our luggage until our room was ready Around 3 we were able to check into the single rooms and we were pleasantly surprised Very clean and modern When all was said and done we just decided to stay in these rooms because there was not a thing in the world wrong with them Plus it would save us mega  They ended up charging us 87 per room per night and the first night we only had to pay for one room as a way to compensate for their mistake
Staff at front desk were extremely helpful and cordial Check in and check out were a breeze Rooms were kept clean Location was awesome Felt very safe
For all of you complaining about the rooms being small the beds being short the staff not being helpful enoughyou didnt pay Trump Tower prices why expect Trump Tower amenitiesservice

title: Charming and Elegant
text: I was looking for somewhere different to stay in Charlotte a change from the usual business hotels and found the Morehead Inn This hotel has a faded charm and elegance It is like staying in an old plantation house I stayed in the Kingston Room which is not in the main hotel but in the carriage house and was very quiet A few places on the bedroom walls were in need of a touch up but this did not detract from the overall charming impression Breakfast is served in the wonderful formal dining room Staying in this hotel is such a lovely experience I will be returning again to try out a different room

title: loved the chancellor
text: spent three wonderful nights may 222324at the chancellor there is no reason to look any further for a place to stay while exploring the city the hotel is spotlessly maintained the staff was friendlycourteousand helpful locationlocationlocation 12 block to union square macys 1 block bart 3 blocks powell street cable car out the front doorcable car passes available in the lobby we will not only recommend the chancellor we will return dave and sue molineil

title: A great place to stay for the convenience of the airport
text: We stayed here due to its proximity to the airport and our early AM flight Our room was clean and everything was in its place Nothing was broken like at our previous hotel We ate at the restaurant and had good food and good service The best part about it was the lap pool and whirlpool We werent sure if they had a pool until we got there and it was a nice surprise They also have a really nice gym  a number of treadmills and cardio machines and a whole lineup or weight machines I would definitely stay here again if I needed to be close to the airport We also used their airport shuttle which took us to our terminal we were out of terminal E and the hotel is connected to terminal B The shuttle came on time and even though we had 2 others to drop off before us it was very quick and easy

title: Good location parking Good for what you pay
text:
We found the hotel to be OK for the price It looked much nicer than other similar hotels in the neighborhood from the outside It was comfortable and parking  breakfast is included Dont expect a 5 hotel but youll get a good deal The location is good close to union st and about 15 minute walk from Lombards crookedest block 
If you stay there go for dinner at Parma Ristoranti Its only 3 blocks away and has excellent pasta for a good price

title: Great hotel Well be back
text: We had a great stay at this hotel our first experience with LaQuinta The room and entire facility was very clean The bed was very comfortable The bath towels were nice not paper thin The showerhead massage was a nice extra Theres a whirlpoolhot tub by the pool It was not working properly when we got there disappointment but after reporting it the maintenance crew had it bubbling the next morning Staff was very friendly The free breakfast was very good Well definitely stay there again

title: Great rooms crowded breakfast
text:
Great Rooms
 Rooms are large and newly remodeled They just finished remodeling all the rooms in March Decor was contemporary and classy using dark wood The rooms include a wet bar microwave and fridge 
 New large flat panel TVs 42 in living room regular though large TV in bedroom
 We were told that they improved the soundproof quality of the rooms which I believe is true because we didnt hear a peep from anyone elses room 
Breakfast Buffet was chaotic
 The breakfast area was too small for the number of guests in the hotel It was a nightmare trying to get food The line for the omelets stretched 15 people long There seemed to be lines for everything and such tight quarters that people were constantly trying to get by you with trays of food The food was just soso Good pancakes though Limp french toast bland scrambled eggs overcooked omelets good crispy bacon Potatoes consisted of nuggets of deep fried tatertot things
 They serve Starbucks coffee in the coffee urns but it tasted burnt most of the time
 They were frequently out of things like clean silverware plates bowls milk fruit 
 Now Embassy is going to remodel all of the common areas in May 2007 They may fix this whole breakfast situation by making the area more expansive and efficient I wouldnt go during construction though
500pm Snack Hour was kind of fun
 They only serve potato chips tortilla chips pretzels and salsa 
 However they serve shirley temples for the kids and any alcoholic drink for the parents including for me a Midori Sour Coffee and tea also included 
Indoor swimming pool was good and bad
 It was nice having an INDOOR pool since it was 62 degrees outside Pool was clean and wellkept
 However pool was small and extremely noisy Tons of kids running around screaming making canonballs splashing My 2yearold and I stayed near the stairs and we made do Im glad they had the pool because my son loved it but I just wish for my own sanity that it was bigger so that the kids would be spread out more
 I did appreciate the fact that the pool is right near the elevators so that you wouldnt have to traipse through the lobby in your robe and swimming suit
Front desk people and concierge were really helpful and just plain nice They got a crib into our room in record time When we called to ask why the heater was only blowing cool air they offered to send someone up right away When we explained that our son was already asleep and therefore we didnt want a repairman to come and wake him up they promised he would be very quiet I thought that was cute We still didnt take them up on the offer that night but he showed up the next morning anyway which was kind of nice
Overall I really enjoyed staying here but would go somewhere else for breakfast

title: Better than Average
text:
We stayed at the Hotel Chandler for 4 nights Our room was small but nicely decorated with quality linens thick towels nice bathrobes Aveda soaps shampoo conditioner Good water pressure  liked the rain shower head Only one small shelf in the bathroom which made it difficult to put out our toiletries I have a hanging bag which came in handy at this hotel 
Large thin flat screen TV AMFM clock radio with docking station for IPOD Desk  chair 2 plush chairs  small round table Large comfortable bed Ironironing board Hair dryer was in the closet There was no room to put it down in the bathroom
Small hanging closet The bottom half housed the honor bar There is an inroom safe There were NO DRAWERS for folded clothing No room for our empty luggage which we lined up against the wall 
There was coffee tea apples in the lobby all day NY Times newspaper at the door each morning If you showed your room key at the hotel bar between 7  8 pm you got a free glass of wine The hotel staff was very helpful with maps and directions There is no ice machine but room service will deliver a small or large bucket if you call 
The hotel is conveniently located We walked to many of the main sights  took the nearby subway to Battery Park to take the ferry to The Statue of Liberty  Ellis Island 
 We enjoyed Central Park especially Tavern on the Green We ordered an exotic drink 15 each and oysters on the half shell  a shrimp cocktail really large shrimp quite expensive but this is a unique restaurant

title: Definitely recommended
text: Nice little hotel with shuttle to and from the airport friendly staff clean rooms Within walking distance to Boston U Medical Center which was great Highly recommended if youre coming to the area

title: I should have stayed here all week
text: The hotel was fantastic I had a junior suite on the 12th floor and it was huge By New York standards it was gigantic It was a little more space than I actually needed but I got a good rate through TravelZoo and booked it for two of my 4 nights in NYC After checking in I felt as though I should have just stayed there for my entire visit to New York My other two nights in NYC were spent at my friends house  my junior suite was larger than her entire apartment so I can just imagine how spacious the 1  2 bedroom suites were All of the staff were very nice knowledgeable and extremely helpful It had a 24 hour drug store nearby which also had food items was close to the metro and walking distance to great shopping It was well laid out and had everything I needed and even more The room was very clean and well appointed too

title: Very impressed with the HIlton Times Square
text: We paid 406night for a Deluxe room on the 35th floor in the NW corner with a view looking North towards Midtown Money well spent The staff were very friendly by NY standards the room was impeccably clean and nicely appointed and the view was spectacular Even better the windows open rare in NYC so you can snap pictures of the city without an obstructing window This hotel is just off the Times Square crossroads and is actually quite peaceful and quiet If youre a Hilton Honors Silver member you can check in early and check out late Great hotel

title: Great Hotel  Great Location
text:
This is a very elegant hotel full of business travelers However they were hosting a wedding and reception the weekend I was there The rooms are quiet large and they were in the process of updating the decor 
The hotel is within walking distance of most everything Georgetown barsrestaurants and shopping the waterfront Dupont Circle the Kennedy Center We even walked to the Mall
The staff is very focused on customer service The restaurant is good but pricey Free internet and fitness club access if you join the Presidents Club its free to join The fitness center is large and has much to offer
I would definitely stay there again

title: Great location small rooms line for breakfast
text: You cant get a bettre location  upper west side next to Broadway and half way between Central Park and Riverside Park 3 blocks from the Subway plenty of greta stores and restaurants around The hotel was packed so we had to stand in line for breakfast  not fun The room was clean but small even for NYC stabdards Overall  good value for a family trip

title: Simply the best  5 dots are not enough
text:
We have just spent the most amazing 3 days at the St Regis for my wifes 40th Birthday I think it would be far to say that we are reasonably seasoned travelers and have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world but none of them come to close to the level of service we experienced at the St Regis 
I think every hotel you stay in there is always something you could say wasnt up to scratch but it wont be worth complaining about because it is so insignificant If you go to the St Regis you will have a funning feeling that you cant put your finger on because it takes a while to work out that everything in the hotel is done to perfection 
Every member of staff is one step ahead of your every move without been intrusive and you are always greeted with a smile Breakfast was wonderful room service was divine and the spa was out of this world The butler was excellent even with making tea at 530am jet lag and chambermaids made sure everything was spotless in the most amazing bedroom Finally afternoon tea to die for 
If you want the best and to experience something no other hotel has very achieved for us anyway then splash out and go to the St Regis

title: Great location for NYC
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights from the 29th Sept  4th October 2012 We booked one room for 4 adults
We found the hotel to be extremely well located we got the Air Train from JFK to Jamaica followed by the Lond Island Railroad to Penn Station and the hotel was 23 blocks fron Penn really easy to find and brilliant access for the subwaystrains
We arrived early and our room was ready we were able to check in straight away the staff were very efficient and helpful Our room was very clean and well stocked it was a bit of a squeeeze having 4 adults in so next time id book 2 seperate rooms The bathroom was very nice and great shower
We had to wait a day or so to get a safe deposit box as they were all full so thats my only real complaint but still very minor
I didnt experience any problems with the lifts if any staff were waiting for the lifts also they w ere very curteous and would let us take it first
The breakfast I thought was great just a buffet but a good selection of items from cereals breads pancakes cooked breakfast and fruit more than what you need to fill up to start your day we never really had a problem finding a seat althought i can imagine in real busy periods itd be a bugger
Free internet access and printing services bargain Stay here again Sure I would we had a blast

title: Good location ok hotel
text:
We spent 4 nights at this Marriott The hotel is just an average Marriott property It was clean We only encountered staff members at checkin and she was friendly The hotels location is great for shopping and dinning It is also an easy walk to Beacon Hill and The Commons Backbay subway stop is about a block from the hotels lobby making the hotel very accessible to all areas of Boston 
Although we didnt encounter any problems during our stay Im not sure that I would stay here again There are many other hotels in Boston in the same price range that are not only nicer but have staff that go out of their way to welcome you Plus its location between two shopping malls does feel a little odd when you are in the lobby area and elevators

title: Wonderful stay
text: We stayed on a Saturday night for my wifes birthday in part because we were able to get a dirtcheap rate and because it is only a 5 minute walk to the North End The entire hotel staff was pleasant and helpful I expected to get a minimal room for the rate we were paying but in fact we were upgraded to a great corner suite Couldnt be happier with the experience

title: Illegally Charged Credit Card DONT EVER STAY HERE
text: They had my credit card on file from a previous stay and illegally charged it at a later date months later and will not remove the charges The general manager Lenard is rude and doesnt not handle customers very well I would not ever give this hotel your credit card information

title: Old isnt always charming
text:
Just back from Denver Hotel has a lovely lobby superb interior architecture and excellent room service However our room a signature king was tiny hard Victorian chairs to sit in no double sinks or sitting area as promoted or wardrobe and a strange teeny closet Noise from the lobby made its way to our 4th floor around the corner room which also faced the street The thermostat had to be repaired right off the bat but was attended to promptly I dont think it ever worked properly 
 If you like Victoriana this is for you If you like modern comforts go elsewhere especially at the prices Very disappointed with this hotel Nothing like described on the website

title: Rather Decent
text:
The hotel has a great location next to the city trails bike run and the bat bridge As well it is right downtown and within walking distance of of 6th street barsrestaurants
The decor is decent overall The lobby is nice and they have an in house Fridays and Starbucks The Fridays bar was not typical there was a lot of lighting due to the patio exterior glass walls that view out over the river
Note there is no indoor pool as the hotelcom site said They only have an outdoor pool and no hot tub 
The best thing about the hotel is noted in my first paragraph The worst is that you are told NOT to park on the first 3 floors of the hotels connected garage  thats only for valet OK So if you are lucky enough to get the 4th floor then you have to take an elevator down cross through the lobby 50 yards to the other elevators that take you up to your room Jeesh

title: James and Chicago lovely
text:
We stayed at James at the beginning of a long trip along Us for our first time in Chicago
The hotel is as the city is elegant and full of design Everything in the room has a sense and there are a lot of nice details stuffs to prepare a perfect Martini yep in the room great Kiehls products a giant Lcd tv design cushions big mirror and more Complimentary coffee machine and radiocdIpod music device
Good Wifi Internet access complimentary business center with pcs and macs I mean no charge for connecting to the Internet or printing documents fully equipped gym
For breakfast lunch and dinner the hotels restaurant is really god but a little expensive
If I have to find something I didnt like I can say that the lobby could be better not the best way to welcome customers but it is really a little thing

title: I would do it again If I didnt have ears
text:
Like a lot of the others here I was a little apprehensive after winning a room at this hotel on Priceline But you know what It wasnt too bad
Yeah the rooms are small Sure the bathroom is lacking character And of course the location is dead come the weekend but the place is fine for a solo traveler for a couple of nights The only thing that would stop me recommending the hotel to a friend is the noise 
Paper thin walls are an understatement Thankfully my neighbors were quiet for the most part and I came prepared with some decent ear plugs to see me through the night
Fix this problem and I would happily stay here when traveling solo again

title: Always a pleasure
text: My husband and I have been staying at the Lombardy between 1 and 2 times a year for the past 20 years I cant imagine why I have not written a review before this It is by our favorite hotel anywhere The location is perfect central to so many sights and attractions as well as bus and subway lines The staff are extraordinary many have been there for quite a long time The hotel is always spotless the beds very comfortable with comfortable pillows and a generous supply of towels Whether we have stayed in a suite or a large double room the kitchenettes have been a big plus I highly recommend The Lombardy for a business or pleasure stay in New York

title: Great location  OK hotel
text:
Stayed there for a 4day business trip The lobby is nice Rooms are average  OK  but not even close to spectacular
I find that with NYC hotels its always a scary proposition since they are older buildings  a challenge to upgrade
I had a couple problems no washcloths and the tub was not draining properly which were fixed right away The maintenance and housekeeping staff were quite friendly
One other problem that I had were 2 bugs that I found in my sink  Im convinced that they were cockroaches that came up through the drain I left the bathroom light on for the rest of my stay in hopes of detering them and kept the sink stopper closed
Now maybe all NYC hotels have this issue  realistically how can they not But it was gross to me a country girl who does not encounter cockroaches in her daytoday life Perhaps thats a normal thing in larger cities like NYC
I also found one other bug in the tub and another on my nightstand  not sure if they were the same kind I kept all my suitcases  bags tightly closed to avoid bringing them home

title: Amazing Room Amazing Location
text: We stayed here the night before the Chicago marathon and everything was perfect Our room had two beds and two separate bathrooms The service was perfect and the staff friendly and helpful Considering how swamped they were the morning of the marathon they still delivered excellence service

title: Excellent location for a car free traveler
text:
I stayed three nights at the Wilshire Crest Hotel and liked it very much The room was big quiet I didnt notice any neighbor noises and dark at night It certainly wasnt fancythere wasnt even a radio and blessedly no minibar The furnishings are perfectly fine but not stylish The Wilshire Crest is a two story hotel with no elevator and there are no views to speak of although the Orange St side looks out on a pleasant residential street Theres free wireless internet unlikely some fancier places I stayed Staff was helpful 
I almost never eat free hotel breakfasts they rarely seem to be much good and there are lots of good places close by for breakfast At 125 per night the money you save compared to other area hotels will fund your breakfast
There were a couple of hiccups the room door one room required some jiggling of the key to open The flush handle on the toilet was a little looseit worked OK but it should have been fixed and wasnt I actually stayed in two different rooms because there was a break in my stayboth were good
As previous reviewers have noted you can walk to a lot from herethe Los Angeles County Museum of Art and Museum Row the Farmers MarketGrove restaurants on 3rd St Theres a strip mall with several restaurants a block away on Wilshire BlvdCafe Latte is a very nice breakfastlunch place Walkscorewhich rates how accessible stores and services are by walkinggives the Wilshire Crest a 97 out of 100 putting it in the top 2 of walkaccessible locations in the city of Los Angeles 
Transit here is very good I stayed without a car with no problem Wilshire Boulevard has very frequent bus service west to Beverly Hills Westwood UCLA and Santa Monica and east to Koreatown and Downtown LA Wilshire  Fairfax about a 5 minute walk away has a Rapid bus stop and the Rapids move along quite nicely Fairfax Ave has good bus service north to the Fairfax commercial area if you dont feel like walking and Hollywood There are also connections all along Fairfax to eastwest bus routes like Beverly Blvd Because the Wilshire Crest is very central to the visitororiented parts of LA the travel times to these places are reasonable

title: Very good experience
text:
The hotel is nicely renovated I was there with a group Upon arrival the desk clerk was one of the best I have ever had He was friendly personable He recognized my Diamond status and without prompting upgraded my room He wrote down additional information and his name if i had any problems Superb As I looked for my room cleaners asked if i needed assistance
The rest of the visit most service was merely very good not at this great level But all the especially the front desk and doorman was high quality
The room was nice on the Executive level The lounge was very good as well
On Saturday night there was a movie room with popcorn A free reception Friday evening I did not attend as I had a conflict
The lobby and sports bar were fine however they could not make high end drinks
The bed was a bit firm for my taste but comfortably appointed
As others have noted shower only no tub which is fine by me
One complaintthe eternal pet peeve of wired internet in the room costing 13day When will this end
Good restaurants in the area

title: Great ExperiencePillow Heaven
text: I was told upon making the reservation that I had a room with a bath tub but apparently none of the doubles or queens do When I spoke to the reservation agent about it he indicated they would upgrade me to a king I thought this was a free upgrade It wasnt a major additional expensejust over ten dollars but I am on a budget and would at least have liked to be aware of this But I was given free internet access and they comped my toothbrush 15 from the honor bar so it evened out Also there is an almost 20 per day city tax I was unaware of Other than that we LOVED our stayevery person we encountered was nice and helpful my dog got a bed she loved I had more pillows than I knew what to do with and even ordered an additional one from their pillow menu as well as Tao te Ching from the spiritual menu Overall a great experience even if it was a bit more expensive than Id planned on Thank you

title: My favorite place to stay in Dallas
text: The Sheraton Dallas is my favorite place to stay in Dallas It is always wellmaintained and the staff is exceptional Employees bend over backward to meet your needs My room is always what I have asked for and requests like early checkin have always been granted The location is perfect if you need to be in the downtown area with quick and easy access to 75 Central Expressway I35 and I45 From my experience they also do a fantastic job holding major events

title: Fabulous Romantic Getaway
text:
My wife and I stayed her for 5 days If this Hotel was not a Boutique it would be a 412 Star Property The staff and service were tops The Hotle had a cozy and warm feeling Whoever did the interior decorating for both the hotel and restaurant should get some sort of industry award
The only drwarback is the location as it is on the border of the seedier part ot town Howver this is more then compensated by the fact that you could walk to everything The major shops and stores theaters restaurants and bars and the trolly
I have stayed at many of the finest properties including RitzCarltons This property is a cousin
I definitely plan to stay here again

title: Recent Training Held Here
