text: We recently held a two day training at this hotel  it was fantastic I was planning the training from Michigan about a month prior to the actual training so I wasnt able to check out the site personally before arriving Everyone was wonderful the planning prior to arrival went very smooth and everything was ready when we arrived The hotel staff was incredibly attentive and helpful The guest rooms were clean and very spacious The meeting room was fantastic and when we ran into some AV trouble they made sure everything was working properly well before our meeting started They truly went above and behind to help make this a great training I didnt have to worry about anything It was close to the airport and not too far from the River Walk The breakfast was by far the best weve had at a hotel Everything was fantastic I would definitely reccommend it o anyone staying in the area The only slight downside was it was a little loud being so close to the freeway but nobody in our group had any trouble sleeping

title: Great Location  OK Hotel
text:
The Fairmont is a huge historic hotel in a great Nob Hill location You can walk to Chinatown North Beach and Union Square or take the cable car if the steep hill is too much Even though we got a basic room at a great internet rate we ended up with gorgeous city views from our third floor room in the main building The lobby is beautiful and the room was nice for the most part
The bathroom was cramped and the toiletries were minimal and nothing special I was disappointed that there was no coffee maker in the room The free coffee in the lobby was put away at 700 am so if you got up later you had to go to the cafe in the hotel and pay for it Our TVs reception was terrible It only got two or three stations We wanted to watch the Olympics in the evening after dinner and that station got no reception whatsoever We requested that someone fix the TV and a technician was sent to our room right away Everything worked fine when he was there but malfunctioned shortly thereafter A second person was sent to our room and he couldnt fix it either I eventually requested a new TV and that solved the problem 
Only one concierge was available at any given time and there was often a line of people waiting for assistance I prefer not to wait ten or fifteen minutes for a quick question Sometimes the bell staff were available to assist but they werent especially helpful for the information I needed
If you want to stay in a great location this hotel is a good bet Other than that it felt kind of impersonal and the staff was just OK  nothing special

title: Great Place and Location
text: The Cosmopolitan hotel is a great place to stay for the weekend This is my second stay and it did not disappoint The hotel is clean and all of the staff is very helpful The rooms are small but since we didnt spend much time in our room it was ok We arrived early at 11am and were checked in immediately The location couldnt be better Its within walking distance of Battery Park The Brooklyn Bridge and a quick subway ride to Times Square There is a lot of construction in the neighborhood but it did not distract us from anything

title: Loved this Marriott
text: I stayed at the J W Marriott while in Wasihngton DC for a conference The hotel is gorgeous and well located if you wish to be near the White House Accommodations were wonderful and service was great The staff was friendly and helpful Would definitely stay at this hotel on my next trip to Washington DC

title: Is there a choice for no circles
text: WHAT was I thinking when I booked this room What was supposed to be a New Years Eve celebration in New York turned into a whole lot of lost cash as a result of this place From the leaking toilet and sink to the falling apart shower to the burn and moth holes in the sheets and comforter to the lack of a blanket on the bed did I mention this was New Years Eve COLD to the friendly cockroach staring at me when I flipped the bathroom light switch which by the way was overlapping the nongrounded electrical plug and while I was standing in a pool of water from the leaking toilet and sink faucet I mentioned earlierhalf an inch to the right and I would have had a free perm I dont know about you but once I see a cockroach I WANT OUT If there is one there are thousands Those things have FRIENDS Of course the policy that they never explain when you check in is that you must complain within a half hour or you can not receive a refundand even if you do request one in time then they point to the bottom of your receipt which reads absolutely no refunds With conditions like these it is no wonder they ask you to pay up BEFORE your stay No one would ever stay Dont get caught in this trap The Internet site makes it look ok but I think that may be the owners room they show as no other room looks as nice For an extra couple bucks you can stay somewhere MUCH nicer and cleanerwithout the extra roomies

title: Hits the Spot
text:
Having just got off the California Zephyr Amtrak from Chicago we needed an all boxes ticked hotel and returning for the 2nd time to the Omni in San Fran did not disappoint Yes it is corporate but the decor is good the staff is on the ball good location andif you get the right pricea great hotel I paid less than 150 per night booked well in advance and for that price one cannot quibble You can join the Gold level membership on arrival and receive free wireless and complimentary teacoffeejuice in the morning Ill be back
PS  ok not very PC but The Occidental Cigar Club it is not private  just a bar you can walk in is around the corner  one of the best I have ever frequented

title: location is good view is amazing rooms are old
text:
We have stayed on our last two visit to new york at helmsley park lane hotel
The room was on 38th floor one of the executive floors with a great central park view
The size of the room was good but the bathroom was quite small and old
If you stay at an executive room the continental breakfast is included telephone calls and internet connections are free
What I like about this hotel is location
If you want to stay uptown close to central park and madisonfifth avenue with a good price I think this hotel would be one of the best choises

title: High Quality Throughout
text: This hotel was one of the conference hotels for a major medical meeting It deserves to be ranked among the best business hotels in the city All parameters room quality desk service housekeeping cleanliness quiet etc are high quality We didnt sample the recreation facilities

title: One time stay only
text: Unfortunately I cancelled a reservation to paramount hotel in search of a hotel closer downtown I cancelled max hotel for something better but then lots of hotels were booked so it was a choice of this hotel silvere cloud I lake union or silver cloud in broadway so I opted for a boutique hotel What a mistake Limited front desk personnel required a 15 minute wait the first time to check in and the other time to complain about garbage of food piled up on top of garbage can outside of our room Most important complain would have to be the most uncomfortable bed which brought my husband and I with extreme back pain every morning The flat pillows offered no cushion The limited tv channels did not distract us from the discomfort We asked to check out after the first day but were told we had a prepaid plan which seemed rather odd because I made the reservations from their own websiteanyways they did roll over a fridge and microwave fit for a frat house or dormno dresser for clothes to store in so I lived off my suitcase for the next 5 days The bathroom was clean and did provide hot water The view was fantastic but the drive downtown was too far This was not the right decision for us lesson learned We are already booked at the westin in November for the same price This hotel needs to upgrade their customer service and amenities to charge the same price as their downtown 5 star counterpartsits a good thing Seattle itself was worth the trip

title: Really nice hotel and great location
text:
Really good hotel in the heart of San Francisco  its a great base for a visit and good value too The complementary breakfast is very good and the cheese and wine set out in the afternoon is a really nice touch Its also a good way to meet other guests and to pick up tips on places to go 
We had a really nice room and the staff were all really helpful informed and keen to make sure that we had a great stay I would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Great stay at the Blake
text: My stay at the Blake was great My wife  I stayed there because of a recommendation from a friend We had a romantic evening for the two of us and we didnt even have to leave the hotel The hotel staff was very courteous  helpful The concierge even got some of our favorite Italian Ice from Tom  Wendees

title: Superb Customer Service Pampered Our Every Wim
text:
I REALLY APPRECIATE THEIR CAN DO  CUSTOMER SERVICE 
THE PEOPLE HERE WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU
YOU WILL RECIEVE THE UTMOST OF SERVICE PERIOD
The room was nice marble bathroom floors round jacuzzi tub separate shower with clear see thru sides and door  2 sinks  king bed with clsing double door other room tv pull out couch wet bar fridge glass glasses and ceramic mugs for coffee bottled water
we ordered room service allot and also ate at chazz at the hotel
you can order off the lunch menu for dinner and for room service 
they have some things going on movies on a big screen popcorn balloon lady  smores
the only thing i didnt like was the outside hot tub too deep dont let your kids in it
good people here ready to serve you

title: Good hotel for the active traveller
text:
If you like to bring your gym clothes  this needs to be on your list when you travel to Boston
1 Well stocked Gym
2 Pool  Okay its only around 1520 yards  but it allows you to do some laps
3 1000 feet from the water with plenty of tracks to go running
Location on Copley square offers you a chance to go mall shopping  but you dont get the feeling of Boston beeing an old town
Great rooms nice restaurants  overall a good experience

title: A very nice stay
text:
Mayflower Park Hotel is a great choice if you want something equidistant between the Space Needle and the basballfootball arenas as I did 
The needle is definitely walkable
The stadiums are too but are much longer
Definitely leave 3040 minutes for that walk
Another thing thats very close is Pike Place Market Its only a few blocks away
Also youre right next to all major shopping tins of restaurants Starbucks of course and plenty of fastfood joints
The staff was extremely friendly and I would easily stay there again The rooms are pleasant I had a classic room and it was a touch small but its fine fine for one or two people

title: Really quite nice
text: Booked this hotel for an overnight stay based on other TA reviews With a bright and spacious hotel lobby and lively bar the front desk was friendly and quick The room was a king bed suite with modern furniture There was a dressing area a beautiful clean spacious bathroom living room complete with a LCD tv with french doors that closed off the bedroom which also had a LCD tvThe king bedmattress was a bit odd as if there was a mound in the center of the bed with it sloping off to the edges of the mattress which were hard There was a only comforter no flat sheet It got quite warm using a comforter in spring We ate breakfast in the hotel in the morning Buffet is a bit pricey  19 a pop which after doing the math was a better deal than ordering items a la carte Server was attentive and friendly Valet parking was helpful and friendly but pricey at 30 which was included in our package Even the housekeeper who was cleaning the room across from ours was friendly I would stay here again most definitely

title: Wonderful honeymoon stay at Yotel
text: Great hotel modern and close to Times Square Loved how fast and easy checkin and checkout was Friendly staff very helpful and efficient My new husband and I would definitely stay there again Only thing was the mattress of our standard cabin was a bit hard for our liking but we were still able to have 4 great nights sleep

title: Even my teen age son was was impressed  great job selecting the hotel dad
text:
I had a free night at any Hyatt from a promotion during the spring so I used it for a onenight stay on a college visit to Chicago with my teenage son We were able to confirm only a two twin bed room but were advised to request two doubles at checkin We arrived early around 9am expecting to check our luggage Despite being sold out on doubles they checked for two rooms both with doubles and said we could check in soon After about 15 minutes wait we decided to get breakfast nearby when we returned we were told that we had an upgraded room ready We went to the room which overlooked the water tower on the 14th floor and had a great view of Lake Michigan down the street Two double beds a huge bathroom with two sinks a separate toilet room an oversized bathtub with a handheld shower head and a separate shower room with a raintype wall mounted shower about 8 up and a separate handheld The door to the connecting corner room was open and it had a king bed I couldnt believe that we had been given a tworoom suite so I called the front desk to check I was put on hold but got no response so I called back after a few minutes They first misinterpreted my question as a request for a second room but when I explained that I was just checking to see if the doors had been left open by mistake they confirmed that I had reserved only one room I locked the connecting doors myself
The room had bedside controls for the sheer and the blackout shades on the window and also for the lighting Flat screen TV ipod dock one robe but two pairs of slippers in the closet two toothbrushes and toothpaste iron ironing board shoeshine machine hairdryer safe etc Minibar jars of nuts 3 kinds bottles of imported sparking water basket of apples I assume that only the apples were complimentary though the sparking water bottles were moved to our nightstands with the turndown service  I guess they really wanted us to buy them Extremely comfortable beds with four pillows each a modern leather lounge chair with ottoman glass desk with chair and a cushioned window seat were more than adequate Complimentary internet access  wired and wireless although the latter worked for my son it didnt for me There was an ethernet cable in a fabric pouch marked internet cable in one of the drawers
We checked out around 7am and left our luggage in the hotel I asked if we could use the pool and locker room in the afternoon and they said sure no problem We didnt need to keep our keys because there was open access We returned around 430 pm and went to the pool Locker room had fullsized lockers stocked with robes and slippers towels were piles on a rack Keys were in the unused lockers Shampoo conditioner shower gel lotion shaving cream razors etc all available Two shower rooms one equipped for handicapped Large steam room Three or four lane lap pool with a small outside deck shared with the bar but separated by shrubbery in planters Small 4 person hot tub was relaxing end to a long day We went to the airport and arrived home late tired and relaxed Our one night stay felt like a full two or three day trip
I didnt rate value because our room was complimentary We really appreciated not being treated like second class citizens in any way  the service was first rate from everyone we encountered My only two admittedly minor suggestions would be to replace the towels with more fluffy ones  the ones we had were somewhat thin  and to add a mirror in the bedroom  the only mirrors were in the bathroom
My sons telling me that I did a great job in selecting this hotel  priceless

title: Update on my October Review
text: We were looking forward to our stay but were very disappointed with the overall experience We had booked and prepaid for a Superior King room and when we got to our room it was a tiny standard room I called the front desk to let them know they made a mistake They fessed up to the error and offered us another room An hour later we finally got our room and we were absolutely mortified to see that the room had no view but overlooked an old ugly roof I was tired of complaning so I just gave up and took the room I regret doing that to this day The staff are snobby and seems like this place catered more to out of town business people So red flag do not stay here to relax or vacation The entire lobby is dark with very dim lighting like a club The bar and food are overpriced for what you get We will continue to stay at our favorite hotel The St Francis Westin They have huge rooms and great restaurants and the staff are friendlier

title: goodwhich is typical for ES
text: Weve now stayed at all 3 Embassy suites in DC and can recommend all of them This one was the most recent I was a little worried because this one is on the eastern side of town which is considered the edge by some people We had no problems and this location is actually very close to the touristy stuff The breakfast is excellent which is typical for ES and free drinks at happy hour are hard to beat Seriously those to things probably save you 2535 bucks a day for each person staying breakfast and cocktails are not cheap in cities The breakfast selections were numerousfrom hardboiled eggs yogurt and fruit to a full hot breakfast buffet along with madetoorder omelets We also thought that every employee was polite and helpful The valet parking was expensive but thats just kinda the way cities are i guess Cant figure a way around it The room itself was spacious enough that when you hang out there for a while you dont have that trapped feeling Also theyre all suites So if one person wants to go to bed and the other wants to watch ESPN for a while its fine Room was clean had a fridge microwave couch chairs table and chairs etc Only downside was you could hear some noise from adjoining rooms such as running water doors closingwasnt terrible but the plumbing noises were pronounced The only other thing I wish they had was some type of noisemaker like a bathroom fan wall fan or something It would help mask the noises of the city on the street below i dont know why more hotels dont offer this feature They need to realize that people use fans for things other than ventilation And lastly weve found that on weekends you can get a room at these embassy suites for two nights for about the same price as one night Dont know why but thats a hard deal to beat

title: Reluctant to share this review because we are afraid we will not be able to get a reservation for the next time we visit
text:
We found this place on Trip Advisor and could not have been more pleasantly surprised with this inn and its sister property The White Swan First of all the location was perfect Situated just outside of Union Square the hotel is in a great spot for walking to many restaurants bars and shops As well the cable car is a short block away Reception was friendly with home baked cookies and a bowl of fruit in the lobby Complimentary water and soft drinks were also readily available We arrived in time for the afternoon wine and hors doeuvre which were lovely Our first room was acceptable although tiny We stayed the first night but because we were carrying extra luggage to attend a wedding we did not have enough space and requested a room change 
We were moved to the White Swan their sister property and treated with the same warmth and amenities Our room there was fantastic A gas fireplace dressing room and wet bar for a small upcharge This was clearly our fault for reserving badly We could have spent a month in the second room which was great

title: Like Marmite  Youll either love it or hate it
text:
This is certainly not a dull place to stay  on the positive side the location is excellent situated close to The Beverly Hills Center The hotel offered an excellent valent parking service and there was an interestingly framed roof top pool serving superb food with very attentive and friendly staff The rooms were a good size the linen wonderful and the bathrooms large if somewhat bizzare in design There was also a well equiped fitness centre
On the negative the hotel concept was definitely a case of design over functionality  as with the Hudson in New York guests should be provided with a flashlighttorch to navigate this hotel as lighting does not appear to be top of Phillippe Starcks priority list and why would anyone place a pool table in a communal area on each and every floor unless hotel management was actively encouraging its guests to stay up all night  in which case this was an unnecessary step as the noise from the lobby partybar was more than sufficient The reception staff had a problem understanding that they were the ones supposed to be serving the guests rather than the other way round and the roof top pool should be avoided at the weekend unless you are a would be starlet auditioning for Lolita The bedrooms lacked lighting and storage was sufficient only for those packing size zero clothing and going commando
That said if you are looking for a party hotel to hang out with the beautiful people then this is the place for you Overall we enjoyed our stay mainly as there was an amusing incident lurking behind every doorway But horses for courses as they say and this was probably just not a hotel for this particular filly Would I recommend this hotel to friends  well if they could get a good rate left their children at home and promised to pack a sense of humour then probably yes

title: Very clean friendly staff
text: I had friends that warned us that the hotel was far away from the center of the city and in a bad area but we found the hotel to be very convenient and in a perfectly nice area So close to the metro the staff could not have been nicer and it was very very clean The pool was spotless and the breakfast was terrific Overall maybe not the Ritz but a great quality hotel

title: Good central location comfortable rooms free breakfast
text:
I stayed at the Staybridge Times Square at the end of August 2012 for 7 nights
On arrival the hotel receptionist was very cheery and efficiant Was allocated a room with a view on the 29th floor
Room was a decent size double bed desk large flatscreen tv chair kitchenette Fridge Freezer hob microwave dish washer coffee maker utensils etc bathroom had sink and a large shower walkin shower
The hotel lifts are very fast but with 32 floors and only 3 lifts we did have to wait a couple of minutes at peak times But never more than a couple of minutes
The included breakfast had a good selection and was good quality It usually had 2 choices of cereal bread bagels muffins danish juice coffee oatmeal fresh fruit as well as hot choices The dining area was busy but we always manage to get a table easily
The hotel also offers a free managers reception 3 nights per week with free food  drinks sodas wine beer
The hotel is in Hells Kitchen right next to the port authority bus depot So it was really handy for getting around Only a couple of minutes walk to the nearest metro line
It always felt safe walking around the area day or night
There are a good selection of reasonable restaurants 50th  9th and Delis in the area
This was our sencond time at the hotel We previously stayed 2 years ago Nothing has changed its still as good as it was then I would have no issue recommending the hotel to anyone

title: Overpriced and extremely disapointed
text:
I regret booking this place But not that i could help it it was booked for us through hotwirecom Dont let the 4 star hotel line trick you here 
1 more like 25 or 3 star hotel
2 holiday inns have been better
3 rooms were small anyview of the city was obstructed
4 shower head in the bathroom were almost falling out from the walls
5 lobbys hallways and elevators were from the 20 30 years ago 
6 service at the concierge was terrible offered no help or suggestion was not knowelgeable at all even to resturants IN the hotel
7 parking was 25 a day ended up to be not so much of a bargain after all
8 pictures on thier homesite was mislead not anything close to the reality
9 3 words DONT GO HERE there are SOOOO many other places in downtown LA

title: New York New York
text: This was my first time in New York and I wanted stay in Irish Hotel as my OH fussy eater Our room was good size and in front of building that night I couldnt sleep with noise of traffic outside I was offered a new room on ninth floor the room was much bigger and quieter The breakfast selection was good We had the French toast with caramelised banana it was delicious Hotel very clean and staff lovely We spoke to Garfield in lobby and he recommend where to eat and what attractions to visit which was very helpful we where also able purchase bus tickets and organise trips from him We visited the Woodbury Outlet Shopping Centre which was brilliant The hotel is near Grand Central Station

title: Absolutely Perfect
text: I attended a family reunion in Baltimore however we were staying near the airport I wanted to experiene the city since Ive nevery been before so I came in a day earlier and stayed overnight at the Hyatt Regency because I wanted to be closer to the Inner Harbor I was solo and I was extremely pleased with my choice The location was perfect including a skywalk to the mall and my hotel room was very beautiful clean and nice cityharbor view Checkin was easy and the staff was friendly and helpful If youre looking for an indoor pool sorry not happening and the outside pool was remote and not very friendly for a solo guest However I did enjoy the fitness room and the restaurant I loved that the location was close to the city free shuttle bus and 3 blks from Camden Yards and the light rail actually I took the light rail from the airport Would recommend to my family and friends Cant wait to go back

title: Great location
text: This hotel provided us with a great locationwe could walk just about to most locations that we wanted to seethere are no views from this hotel but youre not in the room long enough to worry about viewsthe employees were all very gracious and very helpful with advice on where locations were and how to get therethe various gentlemen at the consierge desk were most informative and helpfulwe didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment on the food but plenty of great places within walking distance

title: Okay but definitely not great
text: This hotel was okay I guess I was hoping for better though The location was good and the staff was nice They suggested a few restaurants to us and held our bags free of charge after we checked out before our bus left But the rooms are very outdated On my first night there the heater broke and I had to move to a different room And further more I didnt have time to move my stuff to a new room at the time I was getting ready to go somewhere but they told me that I had to be out of my current room in the next 2 hours In my next room the TV made a very loud buzzing sound every time it was turned on All in all I was satisfied with my stay there but a bit disappointed It was one of the cheaper hotels I could find but if I were to return to Chicago I would probably not stay there again You could probably find a nicer hotel in that area of town for only a slightly higher price

title: Another wonderful stay at a top notch well located hotel
text: The Magnolia is such a wonderful getaway destination Staff is incredibly helpful and attentive Great location tucked away in Downtown convenient to nightlife venues Quaint hotel My husband and I were in the area for the evening from a nearby city for a company dinner and The Magnolia was the prefect place for us to start and end our great evening together The fireplace in the entry is amazingly inviting

title: Good hotel for the business and turistic trip
text: Nice hotel very close to White House Rooms are clean ac is quite quiet Price is ok for this locaion It was a fire alarm in the night but staff worked promptly and clear Recommend this hotel for the business trip in Washington DC

title: A Great Place near the Airport
text:
My wife and I had to go to Charlotte for a few days early December 2011 and tried to pick a place near the hotel for ease of travel Our fears of a dingy cramped unfriendly hotel room were pleasantly shattered within the first few minutes of arriving early 
The staff was so friendly since we caught an earlier flight we figured wed be out of luck checking in many hours early To our surprise they quickly accommodated us and even offered us to eat at their breakfast counter gratis When we got into the room it was clean spacious and well appointed for a room costing less then 100 per day 
A pool and spa were offered for use as part of the price although we didnt use them Breakfast was included as was free parking Overall this hotel was the best bang for the buck and left us with no hesitation in saying wed absolutely stay there again when in Charlotte

title: Fantastic location beautiful city views
text:
I loved my stay at this hotel The staff was so welcoming and hospitable really made my stay lovely The rooms were quite large and really enjoyed the spacious bathroom We had a balcony that overlooked Japantown and it was gorgeous Really enjoyed the personal snack bar tea kettle for making tea and the relaxing environment 
I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who loves a cozy room great hospitality and culture Its very close to fantastic Japanese food especially Benihana my favorite restaurant when visiting Japantown

title: A Gem of a Hotel
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights and everything was perfect The room was very spacious and the bed was really comfortable Best of all was the bathroom  clean well lighted and bright and with all necessary amenities
Front desk staff were friendly and helpful and service was impeccable I had a minor problem with the TV and the problem was sorted out within 15 minutes Complimentary wireless internet worked flawlessly
Location is great  just a couple of blocks from Union Square with lots of eating places and shops
Will definitely stay here again on my next trip to San Francisco

title: Small but still nice
text: If youre considering The Pod its probably because you want to find something affordable With that in mind The Pod is a good choice The location is good and there are plenty of places nearby where you can buy food and get a nice breakfast The rooms are small but when in NY you probably dont wanna spend too much time at the hotel room anyway Theres no luxory here but it provides what you need if youre on a budget

title: Clean Comfortable Great Hotel
text: Stayed there in May Of 2OO7 while we were On Vacation from Massachusetts We had the Jr King Suite the Bed was VERY Comfortable Bathroom was Clean  Always well Stocked wTowels  Such Nice Views to Downtown Dallas Pool is Kind Of Small although Not Crowded Parking is Average Room Service is Expensive though But Im Assuming thats All Hotels I would Def Stay there Again

title: Beautiful hotel wonderful staff small room notsogreat restaurant
text: We are definitely not high society but my sister and I were traveling through SF and decided to try a boutique hotel From the time our car arrived at the front door the service was beyond reproach The valet treated our Honda Pilot as if it were a BMW They were personable friendly and helpful Even retrieved our coats from the car after it had been parked The front desk was also personable and very helpful and we did ask a lot of questions The hotel decor was absolutely beautiful Our room was also beautiful very clean but very small very small The only flyintheointment was the mediocre restaurant the Grand Cafe The cafe decor was beautiful the waitstaff friendly and helpful BUT the most important ingredient is the food and it was very bland to put it kindly For breakfast I had the quiche and my sister had the burrito The quiche had the texture of and tasted like egg beaters with a tough crust My sister also commented on the bland taste of her dish Since everything else had been top notch we went into the restaurant expecting excellence never thinking to check the cafes ratings Big mistake Costly mistake I would NEVER choose to eat here and that takes away a star from the hotel overall

title: Just okay but there arent better options around
text:
Given the price of the hotels in San Francisco Rex Hotel is a reasonable option for under 200
The main reason for choosing this hotel was its location one block away from Union Square Also the staff was friendly enough
The rooms are recently renovated but the hotel is a bit outdated Slow elevator and old carpet
I would give this a lower rating because you normally get more in other places for what you pay here but I didnt really find much better options in San Francisco
The free wifi was very good

title: Fun Stylish Hotel in the Heart of the Action
text: Very new hotel 3 years old apparently that is right at the entrance to the gaslamp district The hotel was overall an amazing experience Stayed for 4 days during a conference and had a blast Experience has definitely changed my perspective on Hard Rock hotels and will now be looking for them to stay at in other cities Amazing modern hotel very clean very fun party atmosphere We had the most basic room you could get and were still very pleased Overall give it high marks with the exception of sleep quality The reason I rated sleep quality very low is due to the proximity to the train tracks brutally close to passenger and freight trains who blow their horn regularly throughout the evening and our room was right above bar 207 in the hotel which turns into a night club Base was so loud that it would shake the room until 2 am That being said you get what you pay for as we got a great deal on the hotel so cannot complain Would definitely recommend to others seeking a cool hotel in a great location Gaslamp district is amazing

title: Great location
text:
I recently stayed here for business and enjoyed the location and the access to the MAC gym connected to the hotel When I first checked in I was put in a tiny room where I could barely get around the bed I called downstairs and they moved me to a much bigger room with a better view
The only things that kept me from giving this hotel 5 stars were the parking situation and the breakfast Parking isnt easy and even getting to the valet parking area can take a long time I did like the ability to text for your car 
The breakfast was just OK While it had some of the usual amenities of an HGI breakfast it lacked some quality The potatoes and bacon seemed to be the same frozen and tasteless kind found at the Hampton Inn and Homewood Suites This may be the case because the HGI and Homewood Suites are right next to each other so I am guessing they share more than just staff and some amenities This disappointed me a little bit because one of the things I like about HGI is the highquality breakfast If I wanted the lower quality one I would have booked at a Hampton or Homewood
Overall this was a very nice place to stay for a multiday business trip Everyone was friendly and there are lots of great restaurants and places to shop nearby

title: We enjoyed our stay
text:
We enjoyed our room our view and the over all experience We had the free breakfast with our reservations The breakfast was great each morning but watch out for the Southwestern Benedict  it was really spicy The room had a nice view towards downtown the restaurant was wonderful and the help was very useful I loved my choice of 5 pillows
Thanks

title: Great Location
text:
Unless you like the younger crowd of Fishermans wharf then Union Square is right in the centre of things in SF and The Handlery is just 20 yards off the square
We found all the staff very helpful and seemingly happy to be there
We upgraded on checkin to one of the newer rooms around the pool 201 I think and it was large well appointed and comfortable The decor was modern in the bedroom The only complaint I could have if being picky was the shower bath thing Ive never understood the point of putting a tiny bath Im talking about 40inches long and then putting a shower above it with a curtain Just put a shower unit there Apart from that small point the room was great and had everything we needed including a coffee machine hair dryer and iron
location really couldnt have been better with just short walks to Chinatown the art galleries and trams  buses to all the piers and wharves
If you get breakfast vouchers when you check in walk around the right of the counter and into the daily grill to make a reservation for the next morning which will save you a 15 minute wait for a table There are 3 included breakfast options and we tried all of them and were happy with them all

title: Great Location  Free Breakfast
text: Although there are many hotels in the Fishermans Wharf area we chose this hotel because we really like the Holiday Inn Express chain and have stayed in many throughout the US Besides the great location I guess the biggest draw would be their incredible free breakfast  not just the standard cereals but scrambed eggs bacon etc Considering we found the restaurants in the area to be fairly expensive this was definitely a money saver and a nice way to start the day As to be expected though the eating area was always very crowded Our minisuite was somewhat disappointing rather small compared to others in the Express chain weve stayed at At night the room was quiet even though the daytime traffic was noisy Service was friendly All in all a very nice hotel A tip for riding the cable car at the turnaround near the hotel  we went later on in the day and there was hardly a wait Also wed recommend the Night Tour at Alcatraz Booking online well in advance is a real convenience

title: Simply Lovely 5s
text: I must say I was extremly pleased with the staff and the delicious breakfast and lunch I was served upon my lovely stay I would highly recommend this Rennaisance Hotel for a beautiful and not to mention enjoyable and relaxing stay

title: Its OK
text:
Its just soso The rooms smelled really smokey Carpet reeks of smoke and permeates thru my nonsmoking room
It is fine but I probably will stay at a different motel when I come back to Hollywood 
Convenient location Its a stones throw from a Metro station It is close to a food megamarket and a very good familyrun Thai restaurant best Satay ever

title: A Nice place to stay
text: A quiet place to stay outside of downtown in close proximity to U of W and good shopping and resteraunts Free Parking and not too expensive

title: Excelletn Place to Stay When Playing Downtown
text: Location is the key here Room was a little above average lobby very nice But if you want a nice place to stay just steps from the downtown action of the clubs it is perfect Staff was very helpful even helped with a billing dispute in a professional manner Only drawbackdriveway can be very crowded particularly at checkout A minor inconvenience not a dela breaker

title: A TERRIFIC TIME IN MANHATTAN
text: We stayed at the Edison Hotel because it was close to Times Square and Broadway I will definitely stay there again anytime I travel to NYK The location was perfect the lobby really nice the attached Sofia Ristorante was delicious and the staff there is great We even went downstairs to Club Cachegreat treat

title: Solid New York option
text: I have stayed here numerous times and theres a lot to like about this hotel Its centrally located very handy for meetings in midtown and for hitting the shops on 5th Avenue I struggled a bit with service this trip though Staff on the front desk werent as fabulous as they have been on past visits  and in some cases were downright surly Im looking at you Nancy My Superior King room was well appointed and a great size Id stay here again but it would be nice to have friendlier and more helpful staff on the front desk Concierge had a couple of shockers with restaurant suggestions but seemed genuinely contrite and eventually redeemed themselves

title: Great location
text:
This Hotel is in the best location near Union sqaure The people that work at the hotel are really nice and helpfull The room is clean but if you are in the front on the street side you need earplugs So maybe ask for a room that is at the back 
 Also something you have to keep in mind is that our room had a really hard bed This is ofcourse very personal But after three night I was happy to sleep in a different bed
Overall this is a very good hotel you get good value for your money

title: Shabby and Disappointing  Old in a Bad Way
text:
The Adolphus Hotel refers to itself as Dallas Luxury and I find that misleading to out of town guests Dallas has much more to offer The lobby is beautiful old world and happening  we saw a number of activities take place during our short stay A formal auction a Red Hat Society tea party and the remains of the Christmas Parade But once you leave the lobby it is obvious that less attention is given to the suites The wallpaper in the hallways were peeling the furniture was squashy and the carpet was clearly quite old and out of style Our overnight stay was very disappointing Everything in the room was old in a bad way  the chairs were stained the lamp shades were beaten in the carpet was mashed and peeling up along the edges and the bed was surprisingly terrible to sleep in  the pillows smashed down to nothing and the king sized mattress was lumpy rickety and not supportive at all The bathroom was very disappointing olive colored toilets and bathtubs with non polished brass fixtures and soap holders The hospitality area was a cubby etched out of the wall with the oldest locking refrigerator Id ever seen old candy and breakfast bars and a bifold door with chipped paint I feel confident that the rooms have not been redone since the late eighties looking at the window coverings and carpet 
We planned to order breakfastinbed but quite frankly didnt want to spend anymore time in the bed or the suite for that matter so we checked out of our romantic weekend early The staff were very helpful and kind but it was also clear that they were a bit understaffed as the registration table on a Sunday morning was backed up and the car lot was a mess Ive had worse stays in a Super8 along the highway but Ive never had as bad as stay for what we paid As much as I like to support Dallass history I say spend your money elsewhere and enjoy your evening

title: Had a great time
text:
Great hotel The staff were great with our young children 3  5  leaving gifts every now and again They gave a away free ice cream to the kids Also complimentary wine to guests every evening Room was very clean but it was small the only negative really Location is greatright outside the entrance to China town and a block away from Union Square and all the big label stores inc Macys
If were ever in San Fran again well definitely stay there again

title: Great stay in NY
text: Weve had good luck with La Quintas elsewhere in the US so my family decided to try Manhattan location We were pleasantly surprised with our stay First and most importantly the room was very large by NY standards with additional space not near the beds There were five of us so that was very welcome The room was clean and everything worked well save for the inconsistent shower temps We were on the 12th floor where it was quiet and we had an awesome view of the Empire State Building The Breakfast was great as was the location The price wasnt cheap but fair given the location We would stay there again get a courtyard view

title: Out of date smelly cheap small Cute pool staff average
text:
On arrival I thought it was a retro Art Deco hotel but quickly realised it just hasnt been modernised 
It was clean although the hall to level 2 where we were absolutely stank a kind of weird old musky smell The room equally stank but you quickly dont notice it
The room is clean good shower room The balcony is overlooked by everybody in a tiny courtyard so you cant sunbathe and also you hear everybodys phone calls etc really loud
The fountain in the courtyard is turned on all night long so you can hear it all the time
The bed sheets looked clean but stank of mens BO I didnt notice until the first night I didnt say anything because I was sure theyd be changed but no This went on the entire holiday too afraid to complain I put up with the smell
Breakfast was ok I suppose nothing groundbreaking if you dont like eggs youre screwed The toaster took an age to toast and even then to a poor standard Literally ten minutes waiting for bread to pop up warm bread
The staff were mixed The breakfast staff and cleaners were fab 
We had amazing directions from one of the receptionists The other guy who I can only describe as being the human version of Peter Griffin from family guy picked his nose through the entire check in
He managed to keep a straight face while charging us 90 for a small amount of phone calls due to our mobile being lost at Universal Studios He also kept a straight face while asking for 65 for a taxi to the airport too
The check out day is what has made me very angry We have to check out by 11am and our plane to the UK was 8pm we were allowed to store our bags and use the pool So by 3pm when we come to leave we needed showers We were told no We were given the use of me washroom only I asked for a towel and was offered a paper napkin I explained we had a ten hour flight ahead of us and needed to freshen up her response was only registered guests can use our towels we had been there a week and funded their pension by this time They couldnt even loan us a towel
A final insult is the taxi company they booked to collect us are dishonest
As the driver pulled out of LAX after dropping us I realised Id left a wedge of nots in the car about 60 I called the hotel who called the taxi company They called back to say he looked but nothing I misted he come back over half hour later where had he been he returned and surprise surprise nothing
Interestingly without any indication from me he got out of the cab and went straight to where I left it and pointed and said see nothing
Absolute thief 
Not happy with the hotel Once we had checked out they treated us like traps off the street I wont be going back

title: Extremely Freindly Staff
text:
We booked the Hotel for one week on tripadvisor reviews
We were not disappointed The room was clean large enough and quiet
The staff was extremely helpful whenever we needed any help
We will definitely stay there again
Thank you for making our stay in NY so pleasant

title: Comfortable stay
text: I had a nice sized room which was clean and not furnished with too much furniture in a small space like most hotels Service was unobtrussive and room service was very good The staff was freindly and helpful upon arrival and the lobby area was lively and upbeat I would say the only drawback is any noise from the hallway can be heard pretty clearly through the door so if you get a room near the elevator areas on any floor it can be noisy

title: Good family hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel It has a good location and helpful staff The breakfast buffet had good choices and the staff were friendly especially Connie who always made us smile The pool was nice but no hot tub

title: Good value and location clean a bit noisy
text: I thought that the hotel exceeded my expectations for the price I paid The room and bathroom were clean the TV was modern and the locationviews were great I faced downtown so wasnt expecting much but It was a cool city view with a little balcony Staff was very friendly Was able to walk around little Italy a bit of the gaslamp district and of course along the harbor Internet was fast and the free shuttle to the airport was a big factor in why I chose to stay here Only complaints are that there were no free breakfast items not that they misled I just assumed there would be and it was a bit noisy Walls were a little thin so I could hear my neighbors intermittently and the street below was loud enough to wake me up one night out of three I enjoyed my stay enough though that I added an extra night onto my stay when alternate plans fell through

title: SFD does not stand for Sir Francis Drake
text:
SFD stands for Sorry  Dump  The room was tiny The bathroom was a small closet The air conditioner was broke couldnt be fixed and no other option They said they would send a fan up  never showed up No offer to change rooms  nothing  Total lack of concern The walls in the room were marked and scuffed up The ceiling had water damage Street noise was awful All the money spent on this place goes to furnish the lobby and pay the fancy guy on the street Very disappointing experience
It is a good location The restaurant across the street  Sears is a great place to eat Eddie our waiter was fabulous
Do not stay here unless you want to be disappointed I would rate it lower but you cant select a negative number Enjoy San Fran from another location

title: great view great location
text: I thought this was a great hotel When i got there with my family they by accidently put us in a smoking room which is what we didnt ask for We asked to be moved and theymoved us to a nicer room for the same price which i thought was great They were very friendly and helpful We also had a great view of Central Park and we were a 1 minute walk away from 5th avenue I will defeintley go back

title: Great lobby rooms not as nice better values elsewhere
text: There is nothing wrong with this hotel but the lobby is the best feature Once you are checked in the rooms are far from special and in fact on the small side As with a lot of city hotels everything costs a premium that in this case is not warranted There are better deals to be had in the area and more historic and nicer hotels for the price range I generally look to Hilton properties first but this didnt do much for me Not bad not horrible just pretty average I will say that I got a great haircut in Spa Fusion and would recommend that I might go back there to get a haircut next time in town but Ill stay elsewhere

title: Great place to stay
text:
Overall a great hotel Our room was a good size looking right into Camden Yards Room was clean and staff was super friendly and helpful Even though there were tons of kids in the hotel we were not disturbed at all 
My tiny complaint is that the bathroom didnt allow a place to hang towels so they could be reused Being Ecofriendly and only staying for 2 nights I didnt really need new towels but there was no place besides back of door which didnt fit 2 towels or allow them to dry to hang the towels A towel rack is really all I can say that would have added to my overall experience
Overall a great stay

title: Excellent Place to Stay
text: We spent two days in Memphis on our way to Mardi Gras in NOLA We had not made an advance reservation electing to find a place once we got to Memphis Most of the downtown hotels were booked and we went to the Comfort only to find one small room available They were kind enough to call their sister hotel the Sleep Inn only a block away and got a room for us It was a beautiful room with a very comfortable bed and my husband loved the location near the trolley The trolley stopped behind our hotel and we loved riding down to Beale St and sight seeing on the trolley We were within walking distance to a great cafe recommended by the staff the Blue Plate and enjoyed breakfast there instead of the continental at the hotel This hotel is newly renovated and is awesome The staff was wonderful too We got our room for 99 and it was comparable to the 149 room we stayed in at a new Hampton in Wisconsin last year This was our first stay at a Sleep Inn but it wont be our last We booked while we were there for the BBQ festival in May We go through Memphis once or twice a year and usually stay on the outskirts of town but we wont anymore This is a jewel

title: Great in house bar
text:
I went to Chicago with TIGI haircare to attend the Hairshow in March The hotel is really central in an old Art deco style buildingit retais many original featuresThe rooms are very spacious and the quality of fixtures to a good standard wi fi waws available and there was a free ipod download playlist
The bar has a great dj and as we had travelled from Ireland we decided to stay there and party till we fell into bed the bar serves finger food which we were very gratefull for 
Breakfast was very high standard and plenty of it amaericain style
The hotel id within walking distance of all the shops and the seafront great for businesss and pleasure

title: The Only Choice
text:
No need to even think twice about booking here Its a great experience bar none
We just returned from a fourday stay and could not have been happier The hotel itself is located in a business park thats close to all attractions and freeways but devoid of noise and traffic The grounds are immaculate and the rooms are too In addition to an exceedingly friendly and efficient staff this hotel offers free Internet access complimentary drinks and free breakfast Overall its a terrific place to stay and comes highly recommended We will definitely be back

title: Central and very economical
text:
This is a very central Inn located in the University area with GREAT staff The king room we had was quiet spacious sweetsmelling comfortable bed and very reasonably priced including free parking and Wifi Its within walking distance of the shopping mall where there are great places to eat and handy for driving to Pike place market or to the football game which is why we were there They also have a free shuttle to the Uni Ave if youre so inclined and provide a decent little grabngo breakfast 
All in all Id say it was worth way more than we paid in comparison with those downtown places that charge 35 a night for parking Highly recommended

title: My new home before 5am flights
text: This is a great location It was a two minute walk to the terminal from the front door of the hotel We did not get to use many facilities due to our early morning flight But the pianos bar was a lot of fun

title: good location if you like bats
text:
This hotel is located on Lady Bird lake in Austin and a two minute walk from the famous Congress St bridge which is home to hundreds of thousands of bats Their departure every evening is spectacular to watch
The food is very good here with a delicious breakfast buffet and a nice lunch menu as well While the room was OK we found the air conditioning to be noisy and we never could get the room cool enough to be as comfortable as we like it
The staff overall was very attentive and helpful

title: Not quite what I expected
text: Booked this hotel based on its close location to Benroya Hall While the hotel and lobby are beautiful the rooms leave a lot to be desired for a 45 star hotel Our room was small and the furniture looked outdated The amenities were fine soap shampooconditioner etc but our bath robes were a mess One had a giant hole in the arm and the other was frayed at the sleeves It was also difficult to get a good nights sleep because you could hear so much noise from the street old windows On the positive side the service at the hotel is outstanding and the lobby lounge is great

title: Adult Family Vacation Exceeded Expectations
text:
My family of 5 adults stayed here toward the end of June for 6 days We were very pleased with the location of the hotel which was in walking distance to all the attractions of Fishermans Wharf and public transportation 
The concierge helped us learn the public transportation system and gave us explicit directions on how to get to certain places We also went to a baseball game while staying and they informed us that the game time changed from 7pm to 1pm  without them telling us we would have missed our game
Edita was awesome at checking us in I personally arrived a day before my family and she let me pick out rooms that I thought would work best We had a great view out of rooms and my parents were able to stay in a connecting room next door
The fitness center was very nice except it was extremely small which was a downside in the mornings You couldnt fit more than 6 people in there without being crammed Also the pool area was very nice just not a lot of chaise lounge chairs maybe 10 at most
One downside was the hotel was very very busy which we never did get a chance to sit outside near one of the fire pits At times the lobby area was so packed that it drove us nuts Another downside was the beds They were not very comfortable I could feel springs in my back when laying on it I tried other beds and they were all the same 
Other than that the hotel is fantastic the staff was awesome and friendly and I would definitely suggest staying here

title: great retreat from the craziness of N Y city
text:
We were very pleased with this Hampton Inn New York is a busy tiring city and coming back to this hotel at the end of the day was always welcomed The breakfasts were great free tea and coffee all day and computers available in the lobby as well The room itself was more than adequate nice bathroom and shower and good hair dryer The staff were all very helpful too
I didnt think the N Y Pass for 2 days was worth the money theres no way you can fit enough sites in to get your moneys worth Also the blue hop on hop off bus wasnt very good either Id reccomend seeiing the sites at your own pace we didnt encounter too many queues even on the Sunday Over all a great trip tho

title: Great Hotel
text: Across the street from some night life and walking distance to other great eateries and businesses this small hotel meet our expectations Our only complaint would be the sound of the air conditioner as it turned on but that is nothing in comparison to the quality of the room Compact in size yes but offers everything you need

title: Loved it
text: We felt at home here My dog Lily was a welcome guest and all of the staff were exemplary The location is great and I will definitely be back

title: Small but Nice
text: Spent a weekend here the hotel is very small but quaint Upon arrival the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful The electronic check in is very quick and easy The rooms are a bit small and the showers even smaller That was the only thing I found a little annoying I would definitely stay at this hotel again

title: Great location but nothing special
text:
Great location as its just minutes from 16th mall But thats about it really Rooms are pretty poor equipped no mini bar or mini fridge in rooms Thats quiet annoying 
Other wise comfy beds nice shower and great tv service Staff are pretty nice and helpful

title: Look no further
text: Our ladies group of 8 get together once a year so it is so important for everything to be perfect From the minute we arrived at the front door we were shown true Texas hospitality The valets were friendly and knowledgeable without being pushy This is a valet only hotel due to the parking space constraints of downtown but we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for our car even at peak time The valets RAN for our cars Concierge was friendly and helpful housekeeping did a super job and was quick to respond to our requests The cooktoorder breakfast is included and cant be beatyou name it its available Because some of us are early risers we appreciate the layout that has a completely separate living area People in the bedroom cannot hear anything going on in the living area as you know some hotels idea of a separate bedroom is a waisthigh partition Great location too

title: Perfect experience here
text:
We booked a promotional deal through Travelzoo which was very affordable We had a onebedroom suite for three nights in February 
The suite was very spacious especially by NYC standards The bedroom and living room format worked very well for us as we were five people There was plenty of closet space two TVs and two fridges which meant that we never felt as if we were on top of one another 
The rooms and bathrooms were spotless and very attractively decorated The linens were lovely and the beds very comfortable
Our room had a view of an air shaft but we didnt care at all as we were not there in the daytime very much
The staff were genuinely friendly and helpful  not a trace of attitude 
If we can get a deal here again we will definitely return A total delight

title: Courtyard  Non Smoking Hotel
text:
Won this hotel bidding on Priceline Regular rate was 99 Got it for 46 plus tax Fast friendly check in Nice lobby with bistrobar  pool area Rooms were bright  very clean  quite Comfortable beds Easy access to Freeway  lots of places to eat in the area 
Smoking allowed outside

title: Awesome place for TeensYoung Adults
text: I traveled to San Diego for the first time during the summer of 2009 with my church youth group The W Hotel is the coolest place for Teens and Young Adults The lobby has a contemporary style and has Techno music blasting all day long There is a restaurant there called Rice that serves cool stuff I had the pleasure of tasting Sexy Fries They were really good The pool is small but there is a beach on the rooftop in which you can order anything off the menu as well The hotel is awesome overall I strongly recommend everyone to stay there at least once

title: What a find
text: Great location and extremely friendly and helpful staff I was made to feel very welcome from the moment I arrived and the duty manager Tim couldnt do enough for me I was given a room with a view without negotiation The location could not be better  just off Michigan Ave and next door to a great breakfast bakery Enjoy

title: great location
text: the room very small but the location was great great great well stay there again

title: Beautiful area beautiful hotel with GREAT staff
text: The Laurel Inn is located in a very cute and comfortable neighborhood in San Francisco The staff is excellent and the rooms are really big and beautiful The hotel is also in a convenient spot for grabbing the bus line to the trolley and from there going to wherever you need to go If you stay at the Laurel Inn you wont be disappointed

title: Clean Friendly Contemporary Great Location
text: Great location on 46th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues so convenient to Times Square Grand Central Theatre District restaurants in Hells Kitchen subways and buses and the Lincoln Tunnel Beautiful old building with contemporary youthful rooms Great staff  very friendly They let us into our room at 11 rather than 3 and let us store a suitcase the final day after we checked out of our room but before we left NYC Decent free continental breakfast  bagels yogurt etc Certainly enough to keep you going until lunchtime Coffeehot chocolate tea water always available in the lobby Highly discounted rate with a parking garage on the next block We paid 52 to park from 11 am until 7 pm the next day We had 2 double beds with 2 parents and 2 teens Did NOT feel crowded in the room Youre in NYC  you shouldnt be spending much time in your room Highly recommend this hotel and its friendly staff

title: Hated this place do not stay here
text:
Where to start Lets skip over the horrible experience of trying to make changes to our reservation via Woogos email and phone help desk and cut right to the chase My boyfriend and I stayed at this place also known as the Grant Hotel on W94th St twice for 2 nights each time What a disappointment The check in staff were courteous but we straight away noted the fact that this establishment is extremely TIGHT 
1 Shared bathrooms usually OK in most places but there was only 1 bathroom to about 8 or 9 rooms and in the case of the firstground floor only 1 shared bathroom total The bathrooms seemed to be cleaned only once per day not enough for a shared facility they were pretty filthy by the afternoon No bath mat There were no hooks or anywhere to place things except on the toilet and in some bathrooms not even a toilet holder or towel rack 
2 The room we had a double on one stay and a double double on the other Both times the rooms were very dingy a single fluorescent bulb in the centre of the room and no table lamps The beds themselves were fairly comfortable except the bottom sheet was not fitted and you quickly found yourself sleeping directly on the mattress There was only a thin bedcover and 2 requests for blankets went unmet apparently they were unable to access blankets after hours This meant that the two of us slept in the same bed for warmth thus not using the 2 beds we had paid for The heating also did not work and we were informed there was nothing we could do 
TV limited channel selection but whatever cos there were only a limited number of working remotes in the whole hotel and the first time we stayed we did not get one
The first room the double double was very spacious but pretty much had nothing in it except the beds and remote controlless TV There was a gig empty closet off to one side which was probably intended to be the bathroom but thehy got too tight to put even a sink in which most places with shared bathrooms have 
Both rooms were very noisy The walls were paper thin and given that people are coming and going at all hours of the night you could hear doors slamming all the time 
3 In general No tourist information located anywhere in the hotel No pay phones The phones in the room were exorbitantly expensive to use and there was very poor cell phone cpverage The desk staff whilst on the whole quite friendly were absolutely unable to do anything about our complaints We asked to be moved due to the noise but the hotel was full The desk staff were unable to offer us a refund or discount We attempted to complain to Woogo but the freecall number could only refer us to the website where we could find NOWHERE to write a complaint or to a UK international number which we couldnt call there being no payphone in the hotel It was raining for all of these days and very cold so we didnt want to stand on the street at a payphone
On our second stay the toilet flushing mechanism broke on the only toilet on the whole floor and despite telling the desk staff this at about 2pm nothing was done till our second complaint later that night 
Dingy Cold Dirty bathrooms Poor sleeping conditions So why did we return for a second stay Because our return was going to be within a week of our first stay we found it hard to find anything affordable at such short notice so we were stuck
We would not stay here again We would not recommend this place to anyone For the money if you book with a few weeks notice you can find much nicer places to stay in Manhattan try Chelsea Lodge or Hotel 17 Not going to bother with photos cos the flash only makes the room look OK

title: Quite and Safe
text: I loved that the hotel seems to be in a quiet and safe location Good sized rooms and bath rooms The only thing that really bothered me is the amount of mold behind the overflow drain in the bathtub Ew

title: Nice place downtown  great location
text: We were at the end of a extended weekend stay in Colorado and had just come down from climbing Mt Evans and needed a place to stay in Denver We didnt have reservations but we are Mariott Rewards members so we called them up and they booked us a room at the Ritz for a very reasonable price The service was excellent  one of us had twisted an ankle on the mountain and the doorman immediately recognized this and came to our aid to help us with the bags to unload the car and to help us get into the hotel The lobby was beautiful and the room was superb Everything was nicely appointed and the bed was luxuriously comfortable We only spent one night there and had to leave early the next morning but we had a lovely stay and would highly recommend this Ritz property anytime you are in Denver

title: Got Trains
text:
I gave this property a low rating simply because of the trains The hotel is just a few feet from the train tracks and the rooms that face them are very noisy  not just from the Amtrak trains but also the trolley and the clanging of the warning gates each time something goes by Rooms on that side come with complimentary earplugs no joke and sound machines to distract you
After the first night I moved to a room on the other side of the hotel where the noise is not a problem but the long early trains do produce a vibration that you can feel throughout the whole place the first morning I figured it was either a train or an earthquake
Apart from the the train issue its an average to aboveaverage HI with the typical free Internet wiredonly in the rooms and breakfast The best part is the staff who were without exception genuinely friendly and helpful

title: Perfect
text: I often prefer modern and funky hotels but booked this on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews Its terrific Old school charm great service and comfortable well furnished rooms if a bit small Bose ipod dock is a great touch My floor was a bit noisy and the gym is tiny but I put this place in my Top 10 for City Stays And free wifi is cutting edge

title: Definitely stay here
text:
I booked this hotel for an interview at UW Out of all of the hotels I had stayed recently this is one of the best especially for the price The staff was more than friendly and helpful for everything I needed take out restaurants at 10 pm shoe stores shuttle information
The room is very comfortable with 2 queen beds The bedding comes with both synthetic pillows and feather pillows for your preference There is a small desk Wifi internet
As I had to be at the hospital at 715 am I reserved my shuttle the night before I would definitely recommend this but be aware that you need to make that clear as the driver may not come until 710
The front desk was also very helpful in directing me to the main street near the hotel where there were many shopsrestaurants
There is a afternoon tea but I was not able to partake of it The breakfast is nice with fresh fruit yogurt cereals baked goods hardboiled eggs and make your own waffle station which I might add was pretty good
The nice part about this hotel is that they also have a free washerdryer for the guests You can bring your own laundry detergent or they have packets for sale at the front desk 2 for 1 with dryer sheets included
I would definitely stay here again The only thing is that this hotel is not downtown however there is the hotel shuttle that will take you downtown and bring you back as well as the UW shuttles

title: Great Address Historic Hotel but just OK
text: Traveling 2 weeks in New England We stayed in July for a couple of days with our teenage sons so they could experience a bit of NYC I used Hilton points so I wasnt expecting the greatest rooms no view smaller etc It was clean and visually nice with the styling youd expect but definately starting to show its age Id guess that the last serious renovation of bathrooms was in the late 80s The AC wasnt great it got cool enough but we could never seem to get the dampness totally out of the air Its central air but I dont think the dials in the room actually control the temp other than the speed of the fan This is our second stay here in 3 years and we were realistic about it so none of that really bothered us We slept fine although the bed was a little soft for my taste My warning is that if you get the basic room here and are expecting a room with the grandeur of the Waldorf youre going to be disapointed Now the lobby bars resturants and the staff and all the rest is what youd guess they would be

title: Good location and value for me
text:
My son and I reserved a room at the Hotel Pennsylvania for the night of 101304 The hotel is a stately old building that no doubt has a very interesting history The lobby area is very impressive After reading reviews about this hotel prior to our visit I was a bit concerned about the cleanliness When checking in I stated in no uncertain terms that I wanted a refurbished room We were assigned a room on the 10th floor The room was clean not much of a view but the beds were comfortable The bathroom while small was clean and shower worked fine Plenty of towels and supplies Several lamps in the room and enough plugs to cover laptop cell phone chargers etc Joey Os restaurant in the hotel is a fine place for a late night dinner serves into the wee hours of the AM reported to be until 4am Breakfast at the same location was great slightly expensive but good Security at the hotel was ever presentneed to show room key prior to getting in elevator 
Check in and check out was rather slow but five or six clerks working the desk and a front desk manager was there assisting and taking guests into the Pennsylvania 5000 club to register to move the process along
Summaryprice I paid was very reasonable and I would not hesitate to stay there next visit to NYC

title: Convenient for a convention
text: Very convenient for the convention center and Seaport Village easy walk to the Gaslamp District Hotel public areas are very nice but the rooms were nothing special they were just your every day hotel room Venetian and Treasure Island in Las Vegas were much nicer and much less expensive For the money Id stay at the Omni or the marina Marriot next time were in San Diego instead Thought the 10day for internet was nickel and diming since other hotels nearby supplied it for no cost We had a great meal at The Fish Market nearby

title: Very Nice
text:
This is a great hotel to stay in when visiting New York Its just a very nice feeling to arrive at the Waldorf when checking in and for the money it can be a very good value and heres why This hotel does run specials quite often and you can actually get rooms here for around 200 a special which can occur more often than you think especially if you book early A very good bargain considering a plain Manhattan Holiday Inn can be over 200 I payed 159 for the Sunday night I stayed on the 19th of December and I booked directly through the hotels website I was very happy about this bargain
I checked in at around 140 PM and it was easy and not a problem The hotel staff is very good and friendly Nice vibe I got from them My room was very nice actually spaciousseemed a little bigger than the standard rooms at the Plaza hotel and comfortable While the bathroom is small it is very nice with marble Youll get bigger bathrooms at the Ritz Carlton hotel but youll also be paying over 400 a night there too The bed in my room was wondeful great down pillows and it was so comfortable to sleep on 
You might wanna be careful about room service Its insanely expensive I ordered an apple pie and it was around 17 Even though room service is generally expensive at hotels I only order it at special hotels that I like because it does feel good to get the service there I wouldnt order room service at a typical Hilton hotel so the high price at the Waldorf was worth it Its like hey Im getting room service at the freaking Waldorf baby So thats how I rationalize it and Ill pay the higher price because its like once in a life time that Ill probably do this Ya know So why not live the life for a few extra dollars more
Anway the Waldorf has a pricy steakhouse called the Bull and Bear and I have to say that the steaks are outstanding It was the best steak that Ive ever had I can honestly say this because Ive eaten at many steak houses Im not saying that its the best steak in New York but the standards are high at this joint Side dishes were very good too Very nice bartenders there too Be sure to tip them well if they give you good service Ill definetly be back for dinner on my next trip to New York City
In the lobby there is a piano and its actually a historic relic Its the piano that was owned by Cole Porter who lived in the Waldorf Hes a famous jazz song writer and on the weekends there is someone playing it for the crowd in the lobby and you can even order drinks there too Very nice especially hearing a piano that is a part of music history Porter wrote many songs on that piano too Just a little bit of trivial info about the Waldorf lobby
Checking out was very easy and lastly one odd thing that I want to mention I know its a bit strange but when I come to New York I like to bring my bike I prefer this mode of transportation instead of cabs and public transportation Anyway the hotel let me store my bike for free in their parking garage They actually have a bike rack where you can chain your bike It was a nice feeling to know that my bike was safe in the hotels garage Usually I chain it to a pole on the street All in all Im glad I stayed to stay at the Waldorf It has comfortable and homey

title: Rooms need major updating
text: The rooms at the Park Central are in need of major updating and cleaning Three of us stayed here for a 2 night business trip and we agreed that all three rooms need work Wall paper peeling in the rooms and bathrooms bathroom showers have mold one room has cracks in the ceiling The location of the hotel and comfort of the bedding were greatbut honestly the room conditions were the worst I have stayed in for years

title: Location location location
text:
We had a wonderful time in New York and part of the success of our trip was this hotel The location is ideal for those who want to be in the midst of the good stuffcentral park is a short walk broadway shows are nearby subway lines easy to access wonderful neighborhood restaurants drug store and a grocery within a block 
The room was spacious by New York standardclean and quiet The breakfast was typical Hampton Inn fareget there early to get a seat

title: Perfect start to our vacation
text: We had stayed at the Charlesmark before so when returning to Boston we had no hesitation in staying there again Our room was perfect and a lot more spacious than the one we had stayed in previously The breakfast was more than substancial along with very nice coffee which started the day well The location of the hotel is definately a selling point A couple of blocks away from Boston Common and a few away from the Prudential Centre We were looking for somewhere for our anniversary meal so we booked a table at the Atlantic Fish Co which was a short walk away The food and service was excellant I wish we could get lump crab cakes in England They were fab A highlight of our stay was going to see Boston Celtics play New York Knicks Definately a hotel we would recommend

title: Dont expect too much
text: I dont expect a Ritz Carlton experience at Doubletree prices but I do expect helpful staff a clean room and everything in working order Unfortunately we found a sizable hole in the curtain a non working phone a broken privacy lock and no air conditioning when we checked into our room It took so much trouble to get the air conditioner up and running that we didnt even bother with the rest At over 250 a night after tax I frankly expected a little bit better

title: Oh the beds
text:
This hotel is expensive but we got a great last minute deal and didnt pay full price The location is good for Time Square about a 10 minute walk I also walked to Bryant park in about 15 mins and central park in 30 mins There was nothing much happening in the immediate area unless you count the gay pool party in a hotel we stumbled into The room we had was smallish but really nice and the bed was the most comfy thing I have ever slept on The lobby is beautiful and old school However I wouldnt have been happy to have paid full price which when I enquired was 300 dollars per night for a single room
I would recommend this hotel if you get a good deal
