title: Perfect
text: We loved it they had a little store inside that offered food and drinks and other items They had free coffee and tea by the front desk They had an small outdoor pool and hot tub They offered free and it was very reliable shuttle to and from the airport The free breakfast was amazing Pancakes sausage and biscuits yougurt cereal and breads along with coffee and juice The rooms were small but just right There was a large fridge and microwave and coffee pot The beds were sooo comfortable The only bummer was we had to go outside across an enclosed patio to get to the main building Price was perfect We have stayed at nicer hotels but this was the best value

title: Believe me the best hotel in Jacksonville
text: As a consultant I travel every month to Jacksonville for business I have stayed at every hotel in downtown and in South Jacksonville By far the Omni is the best hotel in Jacksonville The rooms are large with well appointed furniture and clean In January 2006 the old Adams Mark hotel now a Hyatt will be undergoing a complete renovation and might give the Omni a run for the money However until they do I only recommend the Omni If money is an issue a 65 bid on Priceline will give you either the Hilton Radisson or Hyatt All are exceptable at that price but not a dime more Parking for all these hotels except the Radission runs 1012 The Radisson parking is free I understand that Amelia Island has excellent hotels but is a 45 minute drive from downtown Jacksonville

title: Great Hotel
text:
We stayed at the Chancellor hotel for 8 nights in August while visiting San Francisco We couldnt have been happier with the whole experience
We had requested a quiet room on a high floor  the room was clean and tidy and everything we had asked for The friendly and helpful staff made us feel very welcome and they were always on hand to answer any questions we may have had
The location is perfect right in union square and literally 5 mins away from everything shops  Restaurants and bars Also on the famous San Francisco Tram line so perfect to get around the city
An ideal base for any trip to San Francisco
Thank you for a pleasant stay we had a fantasic time and loved the city of San Francisco

title: Really nice hotel downtown
text:
This hotel was in a great locationvery short walk to Westlake station for transportation to the airport and throughout the city
The hotel itself is quite nice and very clean and the staff are very pleasant and helpful We asked for a room high up and quiet and received just that Wonderful view of city If you are a very light sleeper the traffic could keep you awake part of being downtown
The beds were just okay not the most comfortable for me because I dont like hard beds We were given a corner room on the 24th floor which was very spacious The darkening shades were great
My only gripe would be that for the price you pay for a room you should get FREE wifi

title: OK for an overnight stay but a bit of a dump
text:
Pros good location for travelling staff seemed very nice for the most part has a guest laundry which was handy buffet breakfast wasnt bad pool was OK plenty of parking close to fast food outlets
Cons tired appearance absolutely stank of cigarettes even the nonsmoking areas bit of a rough area located between trailer park and the firework factory very close to highways plastic cutlery noisy aircon

title: Wonderful place to stay
text: I did a lot of investigation before I picked the Sheraton and it was in my top two based on location price amenities etc but what sealed it for me was when I called the hotel directly to ask a question the women on the line mentioned to me they had a special and asked if I was interested She offered me a price better than I had found anywhere on line including priceline etc She was very helpful This even allowed me to get Starwood points Once we got to the hotel everyone was very helpful and extremely nice My only recommendations would be that they provide more information on city tours maps locations of sites and transportation information You had to ask the concierge about everything and sometimes they were a little short Otherwise though a very enjoyable experience The hotel is in a great part of town and we felt safe the entire time

title: Small but clean rooms great location
text: The Milner Hotel was everything we expected It was in a great location the theater district close to restaurants and near the Boston Commons and the start of the Freedom Trail It lies just a few blocks from a subway station which was great The only thing I feel the need to mention is that the rooms are very small They are very clean but there is just enough room for a bed a nightstand and a television This didnt bother us because we didnt spend much time in the room but if you are offended by tiny rooms look elsewhere Its in a quiet area so there wasnt much outside noise at night and we slept well Overall it was a great stay and a great start to any Boston trip especially for newcomers like us

title: Thrilled by the location
text:
When staying in DC I always try to find a place near the Metro as we dont have a car The Marriott is practically on top of the Red Line However we only used it to arrive tofrom the airport as we found everything we needed within walking distance of the hotel While I selected this hotel since it is near Adams Morgan easy walk we didnt have to look much further than a block away for several meals 
We were very pleased with the room  great sheets on the bed and the flatscreen was a fun bonus I was concerned about navigating through the hotel as Id read about its large size but that was never a problem 
I was very pleased with this hotel for our weekend getaway The location makes a quick trip to the zoo easy  the quick walk makes going only for an hour or so at offpeak times justifiable

title: If youre looking for a clean cheap room
text: If youre looking for a clean cheap room for a night or two I recommend you consider this hotel Room size was generous the bed was comfy with fresh crisp linen Bathroom was also spotless and the shower water pressure was great Free wifi was a plus and the room has a flat screen Telly coffee maker small bar fridge and a closet for luggage We drove and parked the car in the hotel parking lot which I noticed was under CCTV surviellance We did have to carry our bags up 3 flights of stairs and have seen some other reviews bellyaching about this Personally liked this because my wife and I had just finished a 13 hr international flight so it was good to use the muscles and get the blood flowing Would recommend a room off the street side if bothered by traffic noise I had ear plugs from my flight so it wasnt a problem Also theres a really nice little Italian restaurant 100 meters down the street next to a convenience store that sells cheap cold beer and some wines I think its close to many points of interest but cant confirm this as a fact as I only stayed one night and arrived late in the evening I drove to Vegas the next day so it was a perfect flop stop for myself and the missus Recommended

title: Aloft couldnt have been better
text:
My friends and I were visiting Philadelphia for a conference and were originally planning to stay at the Econolodge at the Philadelphia airport After reading reviews for that hotel online we decided to cancel our reservation and I did some more research and found great reviews about Aloft Not to my surprise I was just as thrilled by Aloft as most of the people whose reviews I had read 
Aloft was amazing First of all the location was pretty great We didnt want to stay in the heart of Philly because it was too expensive but Aloft ended up being really convenient They have a free shuttle that runs every 20 minutes 247 to the airport So each morning we could catch the shuttle then jump on the train from the airport and that took us directly into the city The shuttle was always efficient and on time The airport pick up location for the shuttle can get crazy but its nothing unnatural for a big city airport The only downside is that the hotel isnt within walking distance to any restaurants but many restaurants deliver directly to your hotel room so its not a bad deal Just remember that parking is about 7 bucks a day so that will have to factor into your Aloft stay 
The folks at Aloft are so nice and very helpful From the minute we arrived they were very attentive and friendly And the interior of the hotel is really great Its very hip and spruced up nicely Theres a bar area a pool table two computers for guest use and a lounge area They also have a snack bar but the food is pretty expensiveoverpriced But its still good to know its there in case you need it since they dont have room service Theres also a great pool very clean and really enjoyable to swim in And an even better fitness room The fitness room featured top of the line equipment and a very nice weight training area they even give you free headphones for your stay 
The room itself was incredible We booked on Orbitz so for 90 dollars we got a room with two queen beds a huge LCD flat screen TV free wireless a small fridge and a great bathroom with free amenities It was really pretty unbeatable Everything was very clean pristine even The housekeeping staff was very friendly and very efficient The beds were comfortable in fact I slept better there than I do in my own home  and I was on a business trip 
All in all you really cant beat it Aloft is really the way to go There are a few other hotels near Aloft but I think Aloft easily outdoes the others Ill definitely be visiting another Aloft location soon

title: Stay away from Staybridge at Sunset Station
text:
We just returned from a terrible vacation of 5 days at San Antonio Texas The rooms are very large but the hotel is not very clean rooms elevators bar area We have a theft incident
The good
 The rooms are spacious and well equipped fridge microwave sink coffee maker etc
 The beds and pillows are great
 Complementary drinks and snacks see below
 Free breakfast but see below
 Free parking but see below
The bad
 The room was dirty upon arrival the whole room was dusty the rugs had chips and pieces of candy all over the tub had hairs from previous guests
 We asked for a full room clean up never happened
 The cleaning room service is terrible they make beds and change towels but they do not vacumm the carpets or clean the furniture in a daily basis one day they even leave the room untidy we have to go to the desk for towels and shampoo and made the bed ourselves
 The bathtub was clogged up from day one and was reported 3 different days They fix it the very last day
 The staff is somehow polite but not very helpful they are short in employees the woman at the front desk makes the snacks serves the drinks cleans the floors answers the phones etc
 Although the complementary not every night drinks were good dont be fooled by the great snacks They are frozen microwavable junk food from Costco
 Keep in mind the free breakfast consist in microwave scramble eggs and greasy sausages If you get to the breakfast area 20 minutes prior to the end time you will hardly find a clean dish We take the breakfast one day but prefer to pay for a good breakfast outside
 The free parking is located in a lot 2 blocks away and is full during weekends
 The hotel is away from the river but there is a street car stop very near
 The business center is a small room with 3 slow computers and a printer full at weekends with kids browsing youtube videos I dont blame the hotel for that
The worst
 One night we were having drinks at the barrestaurant area of the hotel and forget to take with us a small bag with a expensive digital camera The bag was returned to the front desk but the camera was robbed There were not security cameras at that spot Long story short the camera didnt appear I should have called the police and make a bigger fuss but I save my family from a much more bitter experience I have the formcomplain incident sheet to prove this Prime suspects a group of Air Force personnel that were drinking there and of course an hotel employee that was on duty at the time Terrible terrible experience
With all the good reviews and pluses the Straybridge hotel at Sunset St seems to be a good place for the money But I will avoid at any cost If you like clean rooms efficient staff and safe environment Youll be better in a cheaper Holiday Express or somewhere else

title: Nice hotel close to nightlife
text: I stayed for a business convention The Omni is not as close to the convention center as some other hotels That said it was a pleasant surprise Nice clean rooms Ana pleasant staff Very close to many restaurants and live music venues on 6th

title: We got what we paid for
text: The serviceat the desk was horrible and slow The design of the hotel is very modern chic but as I went to the public restroom one stall was clogged and the other was dirty Then the hallway and the room smelled like paint It was new so the price was lobbing you get what you pay for

title: very comfy  good value
text: spent a night at the Doubletree before an early flight Warm professional greeting and checkin an odd waitress at dinner but food was really delicious room very comfortable and quiet no face cloth in the room and those weird 1cup coffee makers i prefer the old style so i can heat enough water to use my french presse for espresso in the morning as usual duvet too warm for sleep so had to take the bed apart and remake it very happy to have a regular blanket in the closet I do not understand how anyone can sleep under a down duvet unless youre in the Alps with the window open

title: Nothing Good to Say about This  STAY AWAY
text: Carpets were dirty  took a shower stepped on the carpet went back in the bathroom and left a dirty footprint Got locked out of our room and had to get new keys  twice Had to check out a hairdryer when I used it I blew a breaker  twice Air conditioner was LOUD and woke us up every time it kicked on Our beds were like sleeping on the floor while our friends beds in another room creased everyone to the middle There are 2 pillows on a queen bed each being 12 inches by 12 Used condoms in the parking lot Breakfast is a plain tasteless pastry Cost was relatively inexpensive but still not worth staying in this poor quality of a hotel Go somewhere else

title: Wonderful Family Vacation
text: My family and I stayed at Days Hotel for four days in the business class room The rooms were great My son especially enjoyed the feather pillows on the bed and daily snacks that were left The rooms were cleaned nicely each day without problem The hotel was packed each day but we were still able to find decent parking The staff was great too I will definitely recommend this hotel to others

title: Super nice staff but terribly dated hosted
text: This is a very out dated hotel Super nice staff however the physical facility is in dire need of an upgrade Eg Furniture in rooms is circa 1965 hotel is very dark etc

title: Unique historic and classy
text: The Arctic Club was one of the finest hotels Ive stayed in The rooms were not the largest most luxurious by modern standards but classy down to the finest detail The lobby  bar was super cool something out of a book an old 1900s classy gentlemans club that served old fashioned drinks Even the fries we ordered were tossed in truffle oil The hotel staff was also very attentive friendly knowledgeable and professional They gave us pointers were to find good Vegan food

title: great stay
text:
Stayed 2 nights and once again had a great experience
The staff was in excellent form as always and our room was wonderful
We love the MPD location and will return in the near future
I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends Ive never been disappointed in the Gansevoort They aim to pleaseand do

title: Lovely holiday in the desert
text: We took our 2 year old here for a 5 night stay in early April Admittedly we didnt realize it was still Spring Break and the resort was busy but we still enjoyed our stay Its a good location only a 15 minute taxi ride 20 from the airport and you can easily walk to the Mountain Reserve trails next door And there is a large grocery store just around the corner  we took a cab but you could walk so you can stock up on essentials if you want We also took a taxi to the Phoenix Zoo which is about 20 minutes away so you dont necessarily need to rent a car The restaurants are a little overpriced but thats to be expected Some reviews have complained about the older rooms but I quite liked the character of the older buildings and our room was clean comfortable and spacious Its a great place for families with lots to do to keep everyone happy We would go back

title: Wellrun hotel convenient to Convention Center
text:
I stayed here 6 nights during a conference last week It is very convenient to the convention center The suite was large with comfortable living room with work area and refrigerator
The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and efficient When I reported a maintenance issue it was taken care of quickly and a small belgian chocolate hammer with a sticker on it apologizing for the inconvenience was left in the room  a nice touch
Breakfast was good oatmeal omelets made to order fresh fruit etc and once guests figured out that CNN was showing every morning in one area Fox News in another and a third area was TVfree we could all choose where to sit according to our individual political persuasions and avoid having our sensibilities offended before the morning coffee
The pool is goodsized nice towels are provided and it was open from about 6am till about 11pm which is quite convenient The 24hr coinoperated laundry change and detergent available at the front desk was also convenient
The courtesy shuttle was convenient and comfortable
As others have pointed out the awkwardly hangingsliding bathroom door does not allow a lot of privacy if youre sharing the room with someone you dont know intimately Also the housekeeping staff seemed a little rushed and made pretty quick work of my room when they did their daily visits and did not vacuum or change the sheets every third day as was announced in flyers in the room this was not an issue for me but it could be for some 
And one night when I asked the bellman whether my destination a wellknown landmark in the city was within walking distance he made no attempt to find out and just replied rather unhelpfully I couldnt say would you like a taxi
All in all though I found the hotel convenient comfortable and very efficientlyrun and I would gladly stay here again if I needed to be downtown near the convention center

title: Stunningly beautiful
text: Absolutely beautiful hotel with fantastic rooms Staff was courteous and pleasant Very near to the University of Pennsylvania campus

title: Clean Quiet Comfortable and Conveniently Located
text: We were visiting San Diego for one night to catch a preseason Chargers game I had searched for hours online for hotels and was finding only outrageous rates Then I stumbled across the Dolphin Motel on Tripadvisor Even though it was after midnight I was able to telephone the hotel and to book a room Our room was fairly small but it was spotless and it included a minifridge and free wifi service The trolley that we took to Qualcomm Stadium was just a short drive or bus ride away The staff was helpful and the motel is located in an attractive part of San Diego This place is a great value

title: Excellent budget choice in East Village
text: I agree with other reviews here decent and clean place with unbeatable pricequality ratio a double room with taxes only 150 USD per night The room I had was fine for one person but would have been smallish for two However I guess this place is choice mostly for those who only need a place to sleep and look forward to spend their time mostly in the city not in the hotel room so it matters less The location is simply excellent I will definitively be back An extra nice thing is that you do not have to pay them when booking so you can more easily change the travel plans also later on

title: Highly recommend this hotel
text: This hotel gets it all right friendly knowledgeable staff lovely property 2 queen room was huge  well laid out good location no small detail has been overlooked

title: Great Staff and good location Great Beds
text:
I read an earlier review and was worried about the hard beds but no worry was neededTheyve just changed their beds and they are comfortable
Staff is very good friendly and helpful We didnt try the restaurant as it was usually busy Always a good sign
Its a good 20 min walk to Javits Center but a inexpensive cab ride
Nice area of the city with lots of good resaurants within 45 blocks
Overall a good place to stay

title: Will not stay here again
text: This motel is in a very bad area lots of people hanging out in cars etc When I walked into the room it had a stale unpleasant odor The room appeared clean for a budget motel but looks can be deceiving The towels were dingy as well as the bedspread There were roaches crawling on the walls The tv kept blinking in and out I was told that the satellite was having problems at this time

title: Worst hotel
text: Bad place to stay new owners do not know what they are doing

title: Would stay there again
text:
Had a small problem w the window not locking but it was quickly fixed 
Small yet clean and no bugs Excellent location and price

title: Save your money and go to Great Wolf Lodge
text:
The short review Poor hotel poor lifegurads poor customer service Great Wolf Lodge in Sandusky is a much better value and is run so much better than this place Dont waste your money
Now for the long review
We visited this hotel at the last minute so I didnt have a chance to read the reviews I wish I had 
The hotel was very run down They built the waterpark on to an existing old hotel Our room had 2 nice beds but the bathroom was about to fall apart The grout was coming out everywhere and the knobs in the shower were broken The toilet barely flushed There were only 2 very slow elevators working There was a 3rd one that apparently hasnt worked in a long time scary This made for long wait times to get up to our 5th floor room My husband waited 45 minutes on the day of checkout in order to get our cart of luggage down to the lobby 
The waterpark was pretty cool However the staff in there was terrible They were very rude and the lifeguards were hardly looking at the water I would not trust them to monitor anyone I was surprised that there were no major injuries There did not appear to be any management on duty The staff stood around gawking at teenage girls and making comments to them 
The evening we were there the watepark closed at 900 At 900 there were no towels The guy behind the counter said he was going to to go to housekeeping to get more After waiting several minutes  we left with our 3 kids 8 4 1 to freeze until we could get back to our room Guess who we saw pushing a trash can around in the hallway Yes it was the towel guy He never planned to come back at all It was just a lie so he wouldnt have to tell us there were no towels Some people had been waiting for 20 minutes for a towel Then we waited about 10 minutes just to get an elevator up to our floor There were several rude people cutting around the line and pushing into the elevators There were no security guards monitoring the situation 
Making the reservation should have been enough to tell me not to go there It took 4 calls to get our room confirmed Once because they dont book the stuff themselves so I had to call their reservation line Next I had to call the hotel back directly because the reservations people did not know if we could use the waterpark the day of checkout 3rd call was back to reservations after we confirmed we could swim the next dayonly to be told because we were a family of 5 one under the age of 2 we had to book the room DIRECTLY with the hotel because the manager had to approve it for fire regulations I told the person at the hotel on my first call we were a family of 5 with one under the age of 2 and she never said a word She just gave me the number for reservations My 4th call was back to the very first person I spoke with and she booked the room once I told her what they had said Her advice for future visits dont tell the booking people that there will be 5 in the 
room if one is under 2 Always just say 4 Nice

title: Good option
text: I am satisfied with this blind pick for a good fullservice IAHconvenient hotel and was able to secure a decent rate Architecture is dated 80s and studiostyle rooms windows into the corridor struck me as peculiar as well as having flat screen HDTVs without HDquality picture old LodgeNet interface not yet upgraded But hotel lobby is shared with an office building which apparently gives it enough traffic for a full Starbucks kiosk which was a nice alternative to the full restaurant option which I did not try but looked good Clean Staff is friendly But isnt it time for free internet

title: incomparable service in Philadelphia
text:
If you want to stay in a hotel that makes you feel pampered and special this is the place Of course you have to be prepared to pay premium dollar for the experience but my husband and I think its worth it The food is fabulous although outrageously expensive
We only have two gripesIn the wheelchair accessible bathroom the shower grab bars were used as towel bars so we always had to move towels and the bathroom did not have any extra towel barsIm hoping hotel management fixes this Also our room on the 3rd floor was noisywe could hear all the street noises

title: great stay
text: I spent a few nights recently at the Madison for a workrelated trip to DC I had a great stay The staff were very friendly and accommodating the hotel well located and the room was nice I especially LOVED the free WIFI Such a rarity in these higher end hotels I stay in for work where you tend to pay more and get less The hotel is right downtown so its easy to walk to most sights and only minutes from 2 Metro stations for more distant trips I would definitely stay here again next time Im in DC for work

title: Funky Chic or Bad Porn
text:
I never considered myself to be ultraconservative in fact Ive been called a Metrosexual and have no qualms about wearing Pink or Purple or Red or Orange and Ive lovingly stayed at Ws in other major cities but I have to confess this place looks like a really bad porn in relation to the decor 
To boot the funky chic furniture was very uncomfortable OF Course this is the W so the place is ABSOLUTELY IMPECCABLE WITH REGARD TO SERVICE AND CLEANLINESS BUT this is NOT A GOOD HOTEL FOR BUSINESS TRAVEL Decor can be offensive furniture uncomfortable and of course in the City that Never sleeps I should have never stayed in TIMES SQUARE  As my seven year old would sayduh

title: We had a wonderful honeymoon
text: It was our honeymoon We stayed at the hotel from 031403 till 032103 The room was not big but its decoration and the bathroom were beautiful Everything was pleasant I especially liked the wonderful foyer It had nice comfortable couches and a beautiful fireplace We took many pictures there They offered free wine from 500 to 600 pm every night In the morning they offered free tea and coffee Every day there were fresh sweet apples on a table in the lobby The staff was very helpful and pleasant It is in a very good location It was a short walk to the metro the cable cars the trolleybuses and the buses There is also a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge from outside the hotel It is also not in a dangerous area if you return late We again want to thank the Harbor Court Hotel for a nice pleasant time during our honeymoon

title: Great visit
text: This was our second visit to New YorkWe stayed at the Renaissance for five nights from 7122003We found the hotel to be excellentthe location is superb with all the action of Times Square just outside the door Found the room to be of a good size and well equippedAll the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful Our lasting memory will be the view from Foleys Restaurant Not one single complaint will visit again

title: Great value for the location close to lots
text: We traveled over spring break The hotel per night average was 129 and we received great service The pool is a little cold and the free breakfast isnt much but we took advantage of the free shuttles to attractions The room was clean it was quiet we had a good view but most of all EVERYONE was helpful polite and generally interested in making sure we had a positive stay I would recommend this property to others interested in having a great time

title: a gem in town
text:
I was there for a medical symposiumhabitual in december in SAThis is the best adress Ive made in 5 yearsother in order of preference were MengerHyatt
Sheraton Gunter
Situation is good near a walkway to the riverwalkMy room was more than perfect in sizecleaness quietness
Staff was courteous service was good
An adress to keep

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: After reading the reviews  I will admit that I was very reluctant about staying here However since it was the close to the airport and very affordable we decided to go ahead and stay here Everyone was very nice including the reservationist the checkin and checkout clerks and other staff that we encountered Our room was bigger than what we expected roomy and clean They provided quick transportation from the car rental place that night and took us back to the airport the next morning Although I had access to free dependable internet service  they also have a business center where I was able to print out my boarding pass

title: Always great
text: I travel to NYC usually once a year for work and my family accompanies me This is close enough for my business on 6th but close enough to everything else to keep my family entertained We love all of the restaurants on 9th just behind the hotel

title: Nice stay
text:
Just a few bullets
 Great location if you are going to Time Warner arena for an event
 Checkin was quick and efficient
 Room was clean with the exception of a dirty wash cloth hanging on the shower curtain rod Maid must have missed it Not a big deal but not something I generally like to see 
 Beds were firm We got two doubles instead of a King Pillows were fine
 Room has a minibar with various items in it we didnt use it however
 There is a CVS just a block away where you can buy a drink or whatever you might need which was convenient
 Parking was convenient although they do charge 15 for self parking overnight I wasnt aware of that charge until checkout Again not a big deal as I figured there might be a fee for it but no one pointed that out to us They have valet but not sure the cost of that
 We were on the 7th floor and got quite a bit of road noise cars sirens etc If you are a really light sleeper you may want to request a higher floor 
 Join their Select Guest program before you go This gets you several perks including wifi and drinks delivered to your room in the morning at your desired time The wife had their coffee and said it was the best shes ever had really and I just had a Coke Also had a couple of glasses of water and two glasses of ice You can also choose to have the newspaper delivered from a list I got the Wall Street Journal and USA Today They have several to choose from
Overall this was a good stay and wed definitely stay here again if going to a show at the arena Maybe upgrading to flatpanel tvs in the room and making sure the front desk knows to inform guests of the parking charges would be the areas of opportunity I see While this isnt a 5 star world class hotel it is a good stay at a nice price thanks Priceline

title: Great Stay
text: Me and my boyfriend took the kids on a trip to Dallas I would give this hotel a thumbs up The hotel was very clean and neat staff was friendly and courteous rooms were clean and roomy very comfortable beds My and my kids stayed in a room together we had a pull out sofa sleeper and two double beds very roomy my boyfriend had a king size bed with a sofa sleeper very roomy The only downside was that there was no microwaves in the room you have to down stairs to the kitchen No big breakfast just a continental breakfast But those are just minor things A block from the Galleria mall and surrounding restaurants I would recommend this hotel for leisure or business Great price too

title: Hated it
text:
I just got back from a small trip to New York over Easter weekend This was not my first trip to the city and Im a 20 year old student with little money so Ive had my share of stays at belowaverage hotels in the past 
When we got there the elevator wasnt working We had to walk up to the luggage room conveniently located on the 7th floor with all our luggage We were told we could use the bathroom right across from it There was no toilet paper
On the bright side they let us check into our room early Compared to the dirtstained hallways the room was passable I was able to look past our broken bathroom door and the little bugs in our closet but everything started to add up after a while
After showering we were forced to dry ourselves with towels that somehow made us wetter  and smelled like hot sauce When we came back to the room our beds were not made we did not have any new hot sauce towels and the garbage wasnt changed
General filthyness and little to no maid service aside the hotel is in a great location Its really close to Central Park and its cheap Those are the only two factors saving me from giving this dump the lowest review possible If you choose the stay here the only advice I can give you is good luck

title: It seems to be slipping
text:
I have stayed here many times and it has been fine but this stay is slightly more revealing The place seems to be more worn out grimy in spots noisy and not as good in many respects On the Honors floor the carpet is filthy the walls are spotty and I find the room musty and sterile The airplane noise is very pronounced and seems worse than on other stays The Cafe Restaurant has a buffet that has all the basics although by Asian standards it is sparse Very international guests Parking deep under building with all the good spots reserved for the valets
This used to be a very clean and smartlyturned out place but now seems overused and undermaintained I have not tried the Honors lounge Possibly that is better

title: Overall a good hotel
text:
We stayed at the Serrano on our second trip to San Francisico in 2002  I booked through Expedia  it was one of their special Name your hotel class and location for 99 and well tell you where the hotel is afterwards This hotel is farther away from Union Square but still in an OK neighborhood The first room we were in was very small with a double bed and a TINY bathroom It was very updated and clean though 
Luckily for us on the second day we were upgraded to a 3 room suite that had a bathroom the size of our first room All this for only 50 total for the rest of the stay That was a great room The staff was very helpful and pleasant I dont think I would stay there again unless I could get the suite for a good price only because there a similarly priced hotels closer to Union Square

title: Great day room rate
text:
The advertised 4995  tax day room rate stay 8am to 8pm and free airport shuttle was the drawcard for me when we had a ten hour layover at LAX
As mentioned in other reviews the hotel is dated and in need of a spruce up But for the convenience of somewhere to rest and freshen up and the added value of a pool unheated and free continental breakfast 69am daily  WiFi it is perfect
The rooms are standard with decent sized tv and coffee make no fridge Breakfast was a crowded affair in a small room with few tables Most guests bring a tray from their room and pile it high with bagels toast coffee and watered down juice then carry it back to their rooms or eat outside It is what you come to expect from a free continental breakfast
There is a Dennys restaurant next door
This property more than served its purpose as a break between flights and represented value for money

title: Great location small but adequate room
text: Its in a great location and so many hotels were booked I was happy to find this Its an old hotel with lots of charm and small rooms My room looked right across an alley to some office workers but I wasnt there much during the day I read about the ghosts on the hotels website but saw nary a one Comfortable bed

title: Excellent base for visiting DC
text:
Stayed at the Palomar for a week in October with my partner Jane
We booked this in July having researched Trip Advisor at which time rated the hotel number one in Washington
The location of the hotel is excellent and just a short walk from Dupont Circle metro station
The Dupont Circle area has numerous eateries to suit all tastes and budgets
Our room was a standard room on the 8th floor and met all our requirements with large bathroomcomfortable bedtelevison etc It was cleanmodern and certainly comfortable
A good nights sleep was no problem
Part of our package was a buffet breakfast which was certainly sufficent in itself but the value of same could be used to mix and match from the main breakfast menu
The hotel provided free limitless coffee in the foyer each morning and had a free wine hour in the evneing but we were always too late in returning and missed it
Bad news for two people from Scotland
All staff could not be more helpful including portersdoor staff and waiting staff and advice given on places to visit and how to get there
My only concern and it is a small one is that the hotel is primarily based at business clientel and can be extremely busy and as tourist it is easy to be engulfed by busy business people
Jane and I both enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend same

title: Youll be Happy at the Hilton
text:
I stayed at this hotel during a business trip and I could not have been happier The hotel has a very modern and clean feeling to it Rooms remind you of a nice botique hotel in a larger city The room had a very comfortable bed and down pillows it also had a flatscreen TV with plenty of channels 
The bathroom was wonderful It had granitemarble countertopsfloors along with spa toiletries The shower has a beautiful glass door An insider tip though There was no bathtub in my room The shower beautifully tiled is for standing only If you are the kind of traveler who likes to unwind with a bath you will want to ask about this if you call for reservations 
The location of this hotel is terrific You are a minute away from state route 71about fifteen minutes from downtown Columbus not in rush hour traffic of course There are several restaurants within five minutes of the hotel If you like steak try TEXAS ROADHOUSE If you like a party atmosphere with wings try QUAKER STEAK and LUBEthis is a cool restaurant with all kinds of neat car memorabilia Italian Try CARRABAS There is also a CHEESECAKE FACTORY at the Polaris Mall to satisfy your sweet tooth
I have stayed at numerous hotels in the Columbs area and this was the nicest If this hotel is booked I would recommend the recently rennovated Sheraton Suites in Worthington The Hilton at Easton is nice but the pricing is much higher 
Happy Travels

title: Nice Stay Downtown
text:
I was offered a Starwood room and it was larger and nicer than the lower floor rooms I turned it down and took a lesser room with a bay view a few floors down I think I should have stayed in the higher room with a view of the construction across the street as it had a better layout and more room with two chairs and a table The room I settled in had only one chair and was very small The bed was comfortable however the sheets were rough I had them changed once during our stay and the second set was better but still rough 
Hotel shuttle was going to be a 28 minute wait for the ride to the airport so I took a cab for 12 to make sure made my flight Not too happy about that Cab to the Zoo was about 10 to 12 and only took about 5 minutes or less Walking to the gas lamp district was 15 minutes to the far end or so A couple or few blocks to several places to eat and see About 4 or 5 blocks down to the water and the Midway aircraft carrier and the maritime museum 
Happy hour at the bar is really a good deal 5 well drinks and 5 appetizers that are more than just little things really good for the money Nice bar area to sit in and talk or watch TV Starbucks has the basic coffee juice and baked goods etc in the lobby The restaurant was dead every time I looked in and had a repellent feel that made me not want to eat there In the same building is the Emerald Cafe which has simple sandwiches and other plastic plate type cafe stuff About one block North is the Carl Strauss Brew Pub which as some good beer and higher end brewpub food very good and comfortable
Bathroom was small but clean and functional and lots of hot water clean towels and toiletries Housekeeping service was excellent 
I talked with and received excellent service and advice that made our trip better from three different concierge staff All excellent friendly approachable and knowledgeable with good food and destination ideas and public transit information

title: Loved The GalleriaKimpton Boutique Hotel
text: I planned a surprise birthday weekend for my sweetheart and booked the Galleria Hotel We desired a quiet  small hotel with unscented cleaning products in a convenient area The location of this hotel is perfect and it not only provided a quiet room it did not use any kinds of scents in our room or the lobby but the staff was delightful and incredibly knowledgeable and helpful from restaurant recommends to colouring routes on the map to guide us through different districts and onto a drive along the shore The hotel provides coffee and tea in the morning and a choice of wine from 530700compliments of the manager We paid 10900 per night price included taxes and parking We absolutely loved it

title: Great hotel
text:
We have stayed in a few hotels in Chicago and this is the best by far It is in a very good position for
good bars and restaurants and a few minutes away from the magnificent mile shops The staff are excellent helpful and friendly The room we had was on the tenth floor and was quiet very clean and serviced well The restaurant was good for dinner very lovely presented food even though we werent quite agreeable with some of the combinations of flavours in some of the dishesThe hotel bar was a very good lively place to have a cocktail in the evenings and seems to be popular We will definitely stay here again next year when visiting Chicago

title: Fairly Nice Hotel
text: Great price and great view Prett nice rooms and clean Bathrooms were typical Hilton quality The beds were very comfortable with nice comforters The only negative was the cleanliness of the pool area The pool area needs a full time staff to keep organized and clean We walked to the pool area located on the top of the hotel We walked toward the hot tub and noticed that someone had taken a  on the floor next to the hot tub It must have been there all night as me and my girl friend were the first to walk into the pool area that morning Overall the pool and hot tub area were nasty Other than that I think the hotel is a good spot for base camp

title: Decent room at a good price
text: Our nonsmoking room was clean although it smelled slightly of smoke The staff was polite The breakfast was decent with waffles two cereal choices and fresh fruit The hotel is located in a convenient location right off of the interstate We had no complaints and we would stay there again

title: Great Stay
text: I used the stay and park package at the crown and had a very good impression of the property The desk staff were a little aluff but helpful the welcome pack was a surprise and kept our grandson with munchies for the evening We also received a couple of coupons for free appetizers and beer which were very welcome and unexpected They are working on the road in front of the hotel but its easy to maneuver I will use this property again when flying out of Phoenix

title: Very disappointed from checkin to checkout
text:
We have stayed at Embassy Suites in other cities and have always been very happy so when planning a trip to visit family in Philly we decided to try this Embassy Suites I have also never written a negative review but felt that our experience warranted it When we arrived the two double beds that I had reserved were not available and we three adults were placed in a King room My daughter slept on the sleep sofa which is probably fine for children but was very uncomfortable for her resulting in complaints of back pain throughout the trip 
The room itself was fairly clean but lots of candy wrappers under the sleep sofa plaster bits around on the rug in both rooms and some kind of splatter on the walls and lampshade of the main sitting room I discovered that the plaster was from series of large patches on the wall of the bedroom That was the view from the bed The lampshade next to the patched wall also had been crushed Little things but felt like I was in a slum 
 Although we had reserved and paid for three adults the room was set up for two so we had to seek out glasses and towels each day The breakfast hosts on all mornings were short tempered and appeared to be overworked The buffet itself could have been ok but the kitchen obviously had difficulty keeping up with the demand We waited about 45 minutes for just some oatmeal one morning and finally gave up and left to buy breakfast elsewhere There was plenty of bread for toast cold cereal muffins but hard to get healthier options like bagels fresh fruit or hot cereal Coffee ran out 33 mornings also On the mornings that we had a little extra time we waited but were still not able to get our simple preferences On the morning that we had to be out by a designated time we settled for dry cereal and toast 
The hotel was very busy and the staff was generally courteous although if we mentioned any of our concerns the response was  We have a large group here today Evidently it was so busy that we often waited 10 to 15 minutes for an elevator up and a couple of times chose to walk down rather than wait Additionally the air conditionerheat unit was incredibly loud so we had to turn it on for a while shut it off to sleep wake up hot turn it on to cool then off to sleep At check out we were charged for an extra night of parking and after waiting for breakfast found it irritating to have to wait to resolve the overcharge We did stop a the managers reception one night where they served unlimited drinks potato chips and bags of chex mix It was nice although a couple of free drinks and chips certainly does not make up for the inconveniences The only saving grace for us for this facility was that the location is very good

title: Fantastic location  right on Union Square
text: Fantastic location right on Union Square and the cable car route Dont stay here if you are expecting facilities  gym etc  but the room was clean and comfortable although the bathroom was very small Free internet in the lobby and a tourist booth too Very convenient  would certainly stay here again

title: One of worst events ever
text: We stayed at this location before our trip to Aspen First they represent that they are at the airport but are in actuality 20 minutes away Next in took the shuttle to pick us up at the airport about 1 hr after we received our luggage with other hotel shuttles arriving and departing every 15 minutes When we checked in they tried to give us a smoking room even though the reservation was clearly for nonsmoking The room itself was ok The breakfast in the morning was horrible with even the cold cereal stale Would not rec this facility

title: Great experience  everything you want on a vacation
text: A brief two night cheer us up train trip to Washington A block and a half from Union Station and the Metro  what more could you want Oh yes an excellent room very supportive staff and great breakfasts

title: Charming and Affordable Alternative in Boston
text:
I have stayed at the NGH many times in the past but had not visited in several years until this October 2012 when I was there for three nights What a change Gone are the breakfast room in the basement the hardwood floors in the guest rooms and the aged bathrooms In their places are A restaurant off the lobby that offers a free breakfast daily the quality and variety of the breakfast is the only change for the worst from my last visitsand I am inclined to think that might be the result of the inattentive wait staff watching over the buffet The rooms well my room now have carpeting a modern decor in soothing neutral colors a small but full bathroom and a big flatscreen tv with a gazillion channels 
Theres no one to help with luggage the elevator is small and slow but the location is superbyou can pretend to be a Bostonianand single travelers can feel very safe
There is limited outdoor parking at an incredibly 20 low price And just down the street is a small gourmetish grocery store that makes fabulous sandwiches for not very much money
This a great base to experience Boston Closest T stop is Exeter StreetCopleya couple of blocks but not unmanageable with luggage
Guests in wheel chairs or burdened with luggage should enter the NGH from its rear in a public alley no steps and the elevator is close at hand Otherwise you will have to negotiate a steep set of stairs if you enter on Newbury St

title: Cheap Stay in Downtown Boston
text:
ClubQuarters is a low budget stay option available in downtown Boston Close to Quincy market faneul hall and also the boston harbor this place is a one of the best options if you dont get to stay in oakwood service apartments
rooms are small though but i would always prefer staying in downtown close to faneiul hall and the quincy market coz these are the most happening places in boston
no bed and breakfast available which is a little discomforting but you have a lot of dunkin donuts and other fast food joints below the hotel you have the elephant castle pub which serves great beer
my stay was pleasant and have had no complaints

title: Great location  nice rooms
text: I stayed here 3 nights 4 days for a conference nearby All staff members were very friendly and helpful when asked questions The rooms were great  comfortable bedding separate tubshower My room didnt have much of a view and my window did not open which bummed me out  but I would absolutely recommend this property and stay there again myself

title: Cool decor in a hip neighbourhood
text:
we had a really nice stay here the location is great for the Du Point Circle neighbourhood which is great for restaurants and bookstores etc Its still within walking of the White House etc
The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly The rooms are spacious and clean although it is a refurbished older building so there are some imperfections in the corridors and common areas but all in all it is very nice
Complimentary wine every evening around 6 pm is a plus

title: Great location
text: Stayed here five nights and you should be warned that great prices for the hotel are because it is completely surrounded by construction However very quiet indoors and the staff goes out of their way to make your stay great

title: The food service and decor of the French Room are second to none
text: The Adolphus is a nice hotel with an incredible staff Dining in the French Room is a delightful experience for each of your senses that is certain to unsurpassed by any restaurant in the world

title: Clean comfortable rooms
text: The rooms are clean and small but beds are quite comfortable Close to airport and has a heated pool and hot tub The pool area is very warm and comfortable Kids had a great time Would stay again Cheaper if you book online

title: Youll love it here
text:
My husband and I stayed here for part of our vacation Being casual people we still felt very welcome and comfortable The room we stayed in was large and clean Lots of desk area should you be on business The room had 2 phones 
 The replenished Starbucks coffee the all natural toiletries recycling bins as well as the working windows were an added plus 
The grounds are well maintained and comfortable Being just a few minutes drive from the airport seemed a little daunting to me at first since I am a country girl but the hotel sits on acres of wetlands and that really buffered out the city noises We felt very secure 
 The staff were all so friendly 
 The Continental breakfast is addictive We ate it 4 out of five days Its not your run of the mill type either Oats with nuts and fruits all sorts of breads fresh fruit salmon yogurts coffees teas juices Youll love it
 There is a commons room where you can grab a book off of the shelf or bring your own and lounge around to read There is a television in the room too The snacks in the room are available 247 When we were there they consisted of choc covered raisins white choc covered pretzels malted milk balls mint and choc chpis string cheese yogurt ice cream bottled water Awesome
 We were so impressed with the hotel We were there for pleasure but I can see why business meetings happen there I HIGHLY recommend this place If we travel again to the Seattle area we will most definitely stay at Cedarbrook

title: Loved it
text:
What an unusual hotel 
It was hip without being intimidating
Its location was excellent for a quick walk into times square or the subway excellent view of the Hudson river from our room 
The restaurants around the hotel were good too recommended by the concierge 
While other rooms say that the rooms were small we found that there was plenty of room
The rooms have an excellent design to make the most of the space
We loved the electric up and down function of the bed The only negative was that the mattress was uncomfortable a bit hard 
The muffin for breakfast was great

title: Best Deal in Town
text:
Great location large room comfortable kingsized bed excellent price Im really glad that I shopped around before selecting a hotel After looking up hotels all over town both on Trip Advisor and by actually going to each hotels website the Donatello won handsdown over all others I couldnt be happier my selection The location is convenient to Union Square The room was spacious had a very comfortable kingsized bed a sleep sofa a kitchenette with a coffee maker and a microwave as well as some dishes cups glasses and silverware  and they dont charge extra for these amenities like many of the hotels in town do  they are included at the price
The staff was very friendly My husband had an injury which required surgery to a tendon in his anklefoot prior to our vacation so we had a scooter delivered to the hotel prior to our arrival The hotel staff held onto the scooter until we arrived and then delivered it to our room upon our arrival They put us in a handicapped accessible room which was probably a little larger than a regular room We were very happy with the room that they put us in
Upon reading many of the reviews on Trip Advisor I saw many people complained about noise from the street and noise from the elevators We were in a room right next to the elevators and didnt have any issue whatsoever with noise from the elevator In addition our room was on the 6th floor and faced Post Street We didnt have any problem at all with noise from the street The first night we heard sirens from an ambulance or firetruck but other than that no problems whatsoever The windows are tightly sealed which helps to keep the sound from the street down 
The hotel is currently being renovated  new carpeting installed some painting etc so it will be even nicer for those who stay there in the future The staff was very friendly We were greeted by Jesus upon our arrival  he was very friendly and had a great sense of humor Kara was also very helpful in telling us about places to go and things to see around town There were several other people who worked the front desk and several concierge team members all of whom were friendly and accommodating Even the cleaning people were friendly 
I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family who plan to go to San Francisco It really is the best deal in town o

title: Top Notch in making you feel welcomed very impressive
text: We were not registered guests at this location but have stayed at Hamptons in other states We dropped in to use the restrooms and were warmly greeted each time and noticed how outstanding the staff was in meeting guests needs and making them feel at home There was always lemon water available to quench the thirst and the warm cookie we tried was better than Homewoods We asked questions and were astounded that their parking was free as all other hotels even ones 3 blocks more away from town center really soaked the patronage for parking fees We observed patrol in the parking area and at night it was well lit so we felt relatively safe as that whole area is plucked with delapidation and new construction intermixed I just wanted to say that based on the courtesy and kindness of this property we would definitely make it a base point for exploring the attractions within walking distance should we return to San Antonio

title: Very solid choicegood balance between business and hip
text:
As a business traveler who probably spends 30 nightsyear in a hotel conservatively Im usually have a pretty good set of options In Chicago Ive stayed at the W City Center downtown in the Loop the Trump and the Hard Rock Most recently I decided to take a trip to the Gold Coast area and stay at the Sofiftel
Ive stayed at the Sofitel in Washington DC and have been impressed by the chains balance between being hip and being a functional business hotel The Chicago Water Tower location succeeded on both fronts
The lobby is dark and the decor is pretty hip without being too minimalistic or trying too hard Its going to be hip for a guy whos used to staying at the Westin or Hilton but for a guy whos used to the W its gonna be more businesslike
Checkin was efficient and the frontdesk staff address you by name and ask if you have stayed with them before
Rooms are fairly spacious with a very comfortable bed and decent toiletries from L Occitane Desk space is pretty good and there is good closet space for longer stays Rooms are quiet and you have a good amount of privacy and quiet even though youre in a fairly busyhip area
The bathroom has a separate tub and shower so you can take your shower while your girl soaks in a tub
Room service was decent I had some kind of club sandwich with some tasty fries There is a minibar in the room which is reasonably stocked I think there is ice service on all floors as well
When checking out I realized I had one bag too many and might get stopped if trying to do everything as carryon so while checking out at 430 am I asked the concierge to ship my computer bag back to me No problem they said and they directed housekeeping to pull the bag and emailed me the tracking number soon after A very nice touch
I would definitely come back here My next stay however is at the Dana Hotel  Spa

title: Good rate and location poor rooms
text:
The location and the reception care are very good Old Hotel will need a restauration We reserved a suite 3 persons the rooms we got were really small the single ok but the double was in a space for a single one Even the bathroom was really sacrified
But how we pay canceled these problems the rate is very good to stay in Manhattan

title: Smeely room and bedding that was musty and old
text: The smell in the room was overpowering Each pillow too smelt like it hadnt been changed in years The carpet was extremely old and I could not wait to get out There were no bath towels so I had to ring for them Having requested towels and air fresher the staff delivered and were delightful about it but I will never stay there again

title: Upscale Washington
text: Stayed here 57 May 2006 Very elegant hotel Staff not overly friendly or helpful except bell boy Good size room with bath in bathroom Very comfy bed Really loud air conditioning in the room which we didnt mind white noise but some might find annoying Close to several subway locations which was handy Washington DC is the most gorgeous city we loved it 2 days was not enough Monuments at night tour is highly recommended Also leave some time to explore Arlington Cemetery  although a sad place it is beautiful peaceful and full of amazing history Try to fly in and out of Ronald Reagan National Airport It is on the subway line and much close and easier than Dulles

title: I love this hotel
text: Its surprising how some people could display total and absolute professionalism in their chosen career I have traveled a lot across the United States and rarely meet perfect hotel attendants and associates whose services meet not only my expectation but a model worthy of emulation I met Jacqueline of Chicago South Loop Hotel on Thursday morning and her courteous interraction decent language and professional approach to duty since is so inspiring that Chicago South Loop Hotel will forever remain my chosen home away from home Jacqueline is a wonderful and phenominal associate of this hotel It is my fervent hope and wish that her stewardship will go a long way into full recognition not only by the management and staff of this hotel but from all and sundry that comes close to her While congratulating Jacqueline for her exceptional services would urge her to remain blessed in the Lord

title: great location
text:
We had an adorable little room in the courtyard and loved our stay here Were here for 3 nights Within walking distance to great cafes restaurants and bars as well as the Palace of Fine Arts  beautiful There are bus stops within a block or so that can take you about anywhere youd want to go in the city We bought bus passes at the Walgreens just down the street and were good to go  very convenient 
On a chilly day turning the corner to enter the courtyard is like walking into summer time The flowers are beautiful and everything is well maintained Make sure to try the Cedar Hill Kitchen and Smokehouse just a block away  GREAT bbq

title: Exciting visit to the City of Chicago
text: Lauren Silberman Acct Mgr was absolutely wonderful arranging my hotel reservation to celebrate my wifes birthday Our room was outstanding and we met several excellent staff Erika Portocarrero Front Desk Herman waiter in the lower level Bistro Restaurant Mike ODea at the front entrance and the lady that cleaned our hotel room Lynetta was an amazing lady that brighten our day They were excellent Ambassadors of Goodwill for the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers

title: One of the best
text: Many older hotels are remodelling and upgrading their guest rooms but not many are investing extra time and effort to give their rooms some style and personality The designers at the Tomo in Japan Center went out of their way to create rooms that are comfortable and relaxing but also fun to be in with big handpainted murals on the walls and artwork suggesting various Japanese pop culture images Godzilla Hello Kitty and various anime characters Upon arrival I was greeted in the lobby by television monitors showing Japanese cartoons and old Godzilla movies and I was immediately handed a free sample of cold flavored sake Definitely the nicest greeting Ive ever experienced The desk clerk honored my request for a room at the back The room on the 7th floor contained a kingsize bed flatscreen TV which only got a few channels and even those were fuzzy and all the stuff you expect these days in a midrange hotel The decor was basically modern Japan with some unusual touches like the mural depicting a monster not Godzilla attacking Tokyo and a large photograph of a womans eye Even with the artwork the room was extremely comfortable and I knew right away I would enjoy a good nights sleep The location was so quiet I could have easily kept the window open all night weather permitting For a little over 100 this was an incredible bargain for a room of this quality in San Francisco I parked overnight at the nearby Japan Center for 15 still a great deal This neighborhood is packed with great restaurants Between Japan Center and the restaurants along Fillmore youve easily got a weeks worth of great dining all within a five minute walk I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting SF business travellers families honeymooners anybody The unique decor and the low rates should appeal to anyone

title: Prime Location and a nice hotel
text:
If you are looking to be in the Times Square  Theater District area of Manhattan this hotel is a great choice as it is located at 43rd Street  8th Avenue Used SPG points so great deal
The hotel as most Westins is very nice The second floor lobby is big with a bar and restaurant near the 8th avenue side and comfortable seating near the reception area The service was wonderful throughout the hotel 
The rooms are a decent size for a big city The beds were comfortable and the room was clean A few hiccups the water in the shower was hard to regulate the safe kept getting stuck and the TV remote was hard to work But all fairly minor 
We did not eat in the hotel Brought the kids to the Hard Rock Cafe one block away  we ate at Shun Lee West upscale very good Chinese by Lincoln Center and we all ate at Tramonti overpriced Italian but on Restaurant Row Had coffee at Toms Restaurant used for Seinfeld show up around 112th Street  Broadway fun 
Drinks at the Westin bar were expensive but what you would expect so we passed For a few dollars more 9 for a beer 19 for a martini we had drinks at the Mandarin Oriental Lobby Lounge in Columbus Circle It is on the 35th floor  great views of Central Park and NYC I can actually say it was worth the price Less expensive drinks were had at Smiths just a few blocks away
Added benefit  the Tampa Rays were staying here and ran into Evan Longoria  Johnny Damon Overall an excellent option for midtown Manhattan with the family

title: Very well appointed room pleasant staff continental breakfast
text:
We moved from another hotel and were very pleased
 Room is spacious and just as it appears in the photos
 VERY CLEAN
 Bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows
 The large couch was great with plenty of room and the ottoman is a great place for a food tray or a work area
 Refrigerator but wish it also had a microwave front desk staff graciously heated some food that I brought
 Good continental breakfast and a tray is provided in your room so you can bring it back If you go too late selection is more limited
 42 inch LCD screen easily swivels for easy viewing from the sofa or bed
 Work desk WIFI and adjacent connections you can connect to your 42 screen
 We loved the glass shower and our shower head worked great
 There are 2 computers for your use off of the lobby
 Free parking
 Its not really adjacent to the IAH airport but it does have a shuttle It is a block from Greenspoint mall which we preferred and on Beltway 8 between I45 and Hardy Toll road Our year old Garmin gave directions to the previous Hyatt IAH location when we searched by name but since were previously lived in Houston we knew that was wrong The address can be a little tricky even though the hotel is very visible from Beltway 8  so get good directions andor a good map
 Room rates are normally less on weekends Actually got the best rate from the Hyatt web 89 Thur and 80 Fri Rates were much higher for Wed which is why we originally started out at another hotel but we got what we paid for at brand X
I think I checked out every booking web site and hotel web for Houston Other than lucking out with Priceline or Hotwire I know I got a great deal

title: Great hotel
text:
Have been to New York a few times now and this has been my favourite hotel Received an upgrade to a deluxe room which was nice Staff were friendly location was great room was comfortable 
Only gripe is having to pay for wifi Seems to be the more expensive the hotel the more likely that there will be a charge for wireless

title: Hip and Happening
text: Love the way it is decorated great art pieces brilliant door pictures Quirky little things like not a standard bible but a spiritual menu Standard rooms are on the small side deluxe are a nice size Restaurant next door is also great Travis the FO Manager has done everything to make us leave happy and happy we were

title: First stay at the JW Marriott was outstanding
text:
We recently stayed over the Thanksgiving weekend at JW and found the staff thoroughly delightful from the telephone agents to the front desk all were welcoming and helpful They allowed us to upgrade to club access with our Gold status and had free wifi Had an interior room on the 11th floor that was smallish but well maintained and a friendly helpful maid
Had a very nice rate too as it was a slow time of the year for the hotel Looking forward to our next stay

title: Terrific hotel great location
text: This is a great hotel with a lot of character Close to Union Square so youre near everything The staff is really friendly and attentive to your needs We hosted a surprise film screening in one of the meeting rooms for my uncle who turned 60 and it was a very successful event Loved the wine tasting hour

title: LivingSocial deal is a SCAM second class citizens
text: At the Courtyard by Marriott there are customers and there are the dregs  which means anyone with a Living Social coupon First there are dozens of blackout dates which at least theyre honest about and show you up front BUT THEN there are severe restrictions on how many of the coupons they will accept each week so you have to book minimum four weeks in advance This they dont tell you until AFTER you purchase the coupon I spoke with the Sales Director who told me there are plenty of rooms available on various dates for regular customers but not for the lowlife Living Social people Its the Back Of The Bus for us

title: Great Hotel  close to downtown
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel while on vacation In some reviews it was said that the hotel was difficult to find The only difficulty getting to the hotel would be the oneway streets but its easy to find
We arrived before checkin and our room was already ready It was clean open and spacious We had a studio suite  which included a queen bed couch chair coffee table desk and chair and a full kitchenette  with plates glasses potspans dishwasher disposal etc The breakfast was continental we bought in groceries and cooked The first morning I missed the breakfast but the staff brought out bagels danish etc for me to bring up to the room 
The maid staff gave us extra towels and supplies because we were still in the room and came back to clean after we left the room This followed for the remainder of our stay The maid staff even finished the dishes in the sink and ran the dishwasher The maid staff was great
We had friends visit and the hotel staff called our room before letting them up to the room It was nice to know that the general public could not just roam the halls Also there was enough room to have a few people hang out in the room without being crowded it was a relaxing atmosphere
The hotel is next to a medical center with a helicopter pad The noise from the emergency vechiles was not distracting 
The hotel is about a 6 cab ride from the 16th Street Mall which is awesome You can walk to the 16th Street Mall in about 15 minutes The hotel is also realitively near the US Denver Mint State Capital Pepsi Center etc 
There is free wifi in the main lobby which has limited counter space In the hotel room there is internet via wire
This hotel isnt the romantic getaway type of place but it is a great clean hotel that didnt cost an arm  leg 
We are planning to go back next year and I will stay here again

title: Great place to stay to explore Seattle
text: We had excellent service and a comfortableclean room at the Renaissance Seattle Hotel We were on the eastern side of the hotel but we were on a higher floor so there was no problem with noise The hotel had a room available for us to check in early which was wonderful The location is a convenient walk to many attractions in Seattle

title: Great Location  Great for Your Budget
text:
The lobby is very European in feel The rooms are small and the decor is a bit bare However the rooms are bigger than the much more expensive Hudson Hotel You have a brand new sink in your room There are several very new very clean bathrooms per floor that you share with the other guests Never once did we have a problem getting into the bathroom They clean the bathrooms every few hours The doors on the bathrooms are a bit noisy so the first night I woke up every time someone went to the bathroom However that was the only noise we encountered and I got used to it quick  maybe ask for a room on one of the ends We were right across from one of the bathrooms Otherwise it was quiet and clean 
You cant beat the location You are a few blocks from Union Square and very close to the trains You can get anywhere in Manhatten quick There are also some great restaurants nearby We had great sushi in the basement of Washington Irvings house right down the street

title: Hotel for a Conference
text: I visited Philadelphia for a scientific meeting The hotel is well equipped for receiving large crowds of professionals The facilties are great I would review the air conditioning some of us complained bitterly on how cold it was in the meeting rooms Sometimes to a point of being difficult to remain in the conference being listened to In addition it look unsual that in thia stage and age there are no safe boxes in the rooms and valuables have to be kept at the reception The help received from the concierge was great Always pleasant and helpful Particularly nice was Mary Mastrobuoni I hope the hotel notices her She is good with people

title: Great Stay Friendly Service
text:
I stayed here with my wife and had booked one of the smaller rooms When we went to the room I was definitely disappointed It was very small and had a partition I called downstairs and stated that I wasnt that happy about the room The hotel was pretty booked up but the staff showed me an available suite He was kind enough to offer me the room for a reasonable upgrade fee which I really appreciated The suite was really amazing and spacious and had nice views The decor was very nice as well
The hotel is in a great location close to many restaurants and Horton Plaza
We had breakfast our last morning here My wife ordered a plate and when it was presented it was not what she had picturedthey happily took it back and let her order something else The staff at this hotel was great and accommodating which was much appreciated I have booked a room here for another stay in June of this year

title: What a gem
text:
Weve stayed in Ritz Carltons and similarly rated hotels over the years and were really impressed with the level of service spaciousness cleanliness and decor at the Palomar The complimentary wine happy hour was lovely as well as the coffee service offered in the morning This will be our go to hotel the next time we travel to Philadelphia Location is great right in the heart of downtown Philly The staff was particularly attentive the restaurant Square 1682 is fantastic and the room was well appointed Bed linens are particularly nice
I would highly recommend this hotel to anyoneand the fact that it is pet friendly is unusual and makes it all the more distinctive It really felt more like we were somewhere in Europe

title: Decent Choice near the Airport
text:
I have stayed at this property many times and find it is a decent choice in the PHL airport area The rate varies based upon demand but most times you can get a good deal using the Marriott website and AAA The property has ample parking but if it is very busy you may find yourself in a space that is a bit of a hike from the hotel Due to its location and layout the parking lot is safer compared to other PHL airport hotels in my experience Use common sense and NEVER leave anything valuable in plain sight when parking you car at airport area hotels
The property has a fitness center and an indoor pool The rooms are typical for a Renaissance and the ones on the upper floors are the best Room service is usually prompt and they have a decent menu of choices The bar usually has some sports programming on the many screens and even has a pool table to keep you entertained Lee behind the bar is an attentive bartender and reportedly is a decent soccer player as well

title: Copley Courtyard in the Middle of Everything
text: Great stay Rooms are a little tight with the feel of a smaller boutique style hotel near Fenway 10 blocks shopping on Newbury Street the T and quite walkable to the historic sites downtown Bernardo the GM goes out of his way to make his guests feel at home Whatever he can do to make your stay easier will be at the top of his list

title: Never in my life been treated so poorly by the front office staff
text: Had reservations for my best friends wedding The front desk staff was very rude and when I called him out on it he threatened me telling me to leave and he was calling the police

title: Cheap and Cheerful Stay Great Staff
text: Went to NYC with 7 other girls to celebrate our birthdays Arrived on the 13th April and was staying for 5 days Loved the hotel our rooms were massive enough room for 3 1820 year old girls to spread all our clothes and shopping everywhere The rooms were really clean and nicely decorated The hotel is in a brilliant location close to Times Square Rockerfeller Centre and Broadway and near to enough Subway stations to tour the rest of the city The staff were more than helpful always giving us tips and advice We were over there when the Iceland Volcano errupted so we ended up stranded for 8 days longer than planned and the hotel staff were amazing we couldnt have asked for more Would reccomend this hotel to anybody and will be visiting New York again in the near future

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
Checkin was great Stephen made sure we were aware of all the facilities and had our bags delivered within minutes We were apparently upgraded and the room was very spacious and chic 
Close to the MOMA as well as plenty of upscale and downmarket shopping 
By the bed is an LCD touchscreen unit that controls the AC Lighting Curtains Phone and Radio The king bed was very comfortable Despite being on the 19th floor some street noise intruded Good sized flat screen tv in the bedroom and a smaller one in the bathroom Large deep tub and large separate shower stall with waterfall shower head Nice big fluffy towels and dressing gown Slippers too
The Fitness Center is well equiped and the Pool is great for laps
Internet was fast although I am always annoyed at the extra charge for it in higher end hotels 1495 here
Housekeeping was very efficient Nightly turndown included evian water
Free coffee or tea in the morning in the 4th floor restaurant
Oh yes I would stay there again

title: Good location
text: The hotel is is on W 40th half a block to Times Square or Bryant Park either way Just a few blocks to shopping  the theaters The hotel was clean staff was friendly  very helpful Our room was on the 21st floor quiet comfortable king bed The concierge suggested Jacks bar  restaurant just down the street as we didnt have reservations for that night Good foodstaff
