title: Great location  good base for short stay
text: Chicago wasnt cheap and this one cost us more than some others but it was fine It is in a great location and was very clean The laundry free was a bonus for us as we needed to wash by this time The club room was a good spot for using their internet and hanging out We would stay there again

title: Very Bad Black Mold
text:
Noticed odor when we checked in turned on ac and did not think about it again until time for a shower when we noticed mold Stood on bathtub rim and took pictures of hairy growth black mold which we have had a horrible experience in the past Brought this to the attention of the manager at check out explained I would be contacting health dept when manager did refund our stay and accuse me of threatening him and his hotel I stated that this could be the serious type of mold and needed to be checked because we had complained earlier to staff and were shown another room that had same problems
Manager become irate and even hostile so we left and will not returntoo bad cause we liked the place we just wanted the health problem corrected and checked by code enforcement

title: Great Atmosphere
text: If you are looking for something at little out of the ordinary stay at the hotel Zaza Everything about the place is unique The quality of the service and back drops are not great but if you can overlook the details it is worth the stay We really loved the movies playing on the outside of the building when you arrive and depart in the evenings

title: Very convenient and new  just wish it cost a little less
text: The room was spacious and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in for a while The comforter helped me get to sleep Its very quiet even though its next to the new football stadium The price was reasonable compared to others I checked but it could have been a little less IMO The internet connection worked well  they have wired and wireless The place was basically spotless Breakfast was disappointing but it usually is at these type of places where its included this is very convenient to downtown I was surprised that the staff would only extend my checkout from 11 AM to noon  they could have given me more time especially since I am a Priority Club member overall would recommend I was also surprised that I had to pay 10 for parking in an open air lot behind the hotel

title: Excellent Squash and Racquetball Facilities
text: The Doubletree is a below average 2 star chain But this one location in Philadelphia is a rare gem that is wonderfully managed The rooms were comfortable and the fitness locations were top notch The racquetball courts should be free if you have your own equipment

title: The most expensive worst nights sleep I ever had
text:
We stayed here to end our recent holiday to NYC and Cruise to Bermuda Before the cruise we stayed in a small hotel called the Blakely on West 55th and it comparison to the Waldorf it was fantastic
The Waldorf was supposed to be the perfect end to a perfect holiday  it couldnt have been further We booked the room 6 months ago and when we got there we asked for an upgrade if they had any available which they did When we arrived in our room we were a little concerned as to what our nonupgraded room may have looked like This was one of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in and our view was of the aircon units servicing the building
As they had no other rooms to offer we decided to make the most of it and went out for dinner When we went to bed I woke an hour later to the aircon generators stopping and starting on rotation like they were in he room which us Then on top of that our room was close to elevators which ping twice when someone gets of on your floor  I swear every person in NYC was staying on our floor  that lift pinged twice on and off consistently between 130 and 330 When we finally went back to sleep we were woken at 6am by a constant creaking sould when we went to investigate we saw that our room was directly opposite the service lifts which are shielded by a swinging door that has never in its life been introduced to WD40 This then continued for the rest of the morning until we gave up trying to sleep and got up
We complained but as we had booked thru an agent they could refund the room rate which I will now never do again as you have no come back So we are trying to get a free stay in another Hilton Group hotel closer to home But as the previous poster said it would surprise me if we ever heard back 
If you are looking for somewhere special to stay DO NOT STAY in the Waldorf Astoria  it is completely rubbish and the most expensive worst nights sleep I have ever had

title: Great location
text: Stayed here on a leisure trip to NY Its central location ensures that most sites are within walking distance Our room was large and quiet The bath did not drain properly on the first morning but this problem was rectified immediately by housekeeping even though we hadnt highlighted it Didnt eat breakfast there as its 40 a head and I personally couldnt justify that given the options available in some many nearby cafes The decor may not to be everyones taste but we had a large TV a very spacious room and didnt require cabs public transport its very hard to find fault with this hotel

title: Disappointed by the Holiday Inn Express Sea World
text:
My husband and I recently spent 5 nights at the Holiday Inn Express Sea World based on the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor In my opinion the hotel does not deserve an above average rating The rooms were decorated on the lower scale of the budget hotel rooms I have stayed in The decor was sparse the beds were very hard the pillows were flat and the linens seemed worn out
On the first night of our stay the sink started leaking We called maintenance and they unsuccessfully tried to fix it We asked for a room change but the staff said one was not available because the hotel was full The sink leaked for the remainder of our stay The housekeeper managed to put a trash can under the sink to collect the water but that was the extent of the maintenance 
The hotels front desk staff is cheerful but no help in recommending area restaurants When asked about authentic Mexican restaurants we were referred to the local Chipotles a franchise restaurant 
The two positive aspects of the hotel are the location and the breakfast It is close to all of the attractions and the main highway The breakfast was pretty filling and a good way to start a day of touring attractions I would not stay at this hotel again and in the future will be more cautious when booking a room solely based on Trip Advisor ratings

title: Dont stay here when a convention is in town which is all the time
text: I stayed at this property during the American Academy of Orthopedic Surgeons I made the reservation well in advance When I arrived they stuck me in a conference room with a Murphy bed because they were overbooked A TV had been rolled in on a stand and a little circular table placed in the middle of the floor to serve as a desk Their compensation for this inconvenience was half off the nightly rate They should have given me the room for free I spoke with the manager who did not even apologize and would offer nothing more not even a free meal or a discount the next time I stayed there It was a horrible experience I pointed out to the manager that my firm held a conference there just months before and had used the conference facilities as well as several hotel rooms Still nothing It was like he wanted to say  you without actually saying it

title: Rooms halls and stairwells were very dirty
text: We were in 3 rooms because they were dirty Finally on the last room the housekeeping supervisor brought a crew to clean the room Piles of dirty laundry and garbage in the hallways broken glass dried food and hair in the stairwells

title: Have always enjoy it
text: My parterner and I are both Pursers for major international airlines We stay in a majority or hotels world wide When given the opportunity we consistantly stay at the Amsterdam Court It is personable staff is very nice and the location is great Weve never had a bad experience her in all the times 6 so far we stayed here We had to stay at the NY Hilton once and missed the comfort of the AMS Court Its the best value in town I would always choose staying here as would my partner

title: A Yearly Event
text: We have been down to Phoenix for the last 3 years in a row to celebrate Mothers Day and we keep coming back to this resort The rooms are gorgeous the food is great and the service is top notch Our only complaint is the location but you have to drive to get around Phoenix in any event so its not a big deal Our favourite family tradition there are 7 adults and 4 kids is sitting by the Falls and having snacks and drinks and catching up The pool staff at the Falls are always great and this year Ryan had us in stiches and was really great about making my dad and my brother the weird Canadian drinks they kept requesting The Mothers Day brunch is amazing and we always enjoy stuffing ourselves silly and then heading back to the poolside to nap and digest A really fantastic place for families and we cant wait to come back again next year

title: Treated Like Royalty at The Royalton
text:
The Royalton Hotel was everything and more that my husband and I wanted from a NYC hotel Typically NYC hotel rooms are tiny but our standard room was spacious and had an incredible bathroom with TONS of space mosaic glass tiles a giant round tub and a trendy makeup station The bed was very comfortable and had very nice linens There was even plenty of CLOSET space Location could not be better  a two block walk from Time Square and a ten minute or less cab ride to most places in Manhatten The lobby bar is gorgeous dimly lit and very eye pleasing
This hotel definitely caters to an upscale 20s30s crowd but I think that anyone would be happy with their stay We booked the hotel on Travelocity and were able to stay for 109night an absolute steal
I would recommend this hotel to anyone We had a perfect 5 night stay

title: Watch your Credit Card Bill carefully
text: Look this isnt a review about their ammenities As far as bed and facilities go this is a decent hotel but the jerks who run the billing and accounting for this hotel should be fired I booked the hotel for a stay in April  it was a regular booking no special discounts or conditions  they charged my credit card immediately and in full more than a month before I had the reservation scheduled I had to cancelweeks before the arrival date and in full compliance with their cancellation policy  I have still not receieved my refund to my credit card and dealing with their accounting department amounts to leaving a message on their voicemail and never receiving a call back  these people are total incompetents and Im now pursuing a refund providing all the relevant documentation through my credit card company because these idiots at Radisson are incapable of providing the assistance and customer support ANY other hotel could  their accounting department at this hotel is staffed by a bunch of incompetent screw ups  be very careful booking at this hotel and watch your credit card statement very very carefully These people are not to be trusted

title: could be better
text: The price was right so I was excited to find a great place to stay every time I come to NYC Really not happy The idea behind the place is excellent cater to biz folks Got in with a tiny but good room plenty of storage space No ac Ask for it to be fixed by next morning discover coffee pot also did not work Attendant stood there while I had just woken up stating he had to make sure it was broken then finally left and brought a new one Next told they could not move my room despite ac then said it was fixed when it wasnt and finally got another desk attendant who moved my room Suppose to have access to irons in hall closet but there never were any though to be fair when you call they bring one Came back one night and some poor guy had a reservation and no room at all Gym is so small you literally have not space to do a sit up Lastly they did not replace simple things every day like coffee and creamer in the room Ideas that are good include a grab and go breakfast for 5 bucks and the free water refills plus a free night stay upon return but honestly not sure it is worth it Nice staff just ineffective

title: great location great stay
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Lucerne Hotel for the week before the 4th of July We booked a deluxe king room but were given a complimentary deluxe king suite room Unfortunately it didnt even occur to me to ask why but the suite was wonderful Both the bedroom and living room had flat screen TVs and each room and the bathroom had windows overlooking Amsterdam Ave The room was very comfortable and quit and had outstanding AC which was more than welcome during one of the hotter weeks in NY At checkin the staff was very friendly We did arrive before checkin time and the room was not ready but we were able to check our bags and begin our vacation 
The hotels location cant be beat The Museum of Natural History and Central Park are a few blocks away to the east and Riverside Park is a few blocks to the west You have easy access to the 1 B and C trains and my new best friend the m79 bus 
Overall I loved this hotel and would stay here again However if you are looking for a modern hipster locale you really should keep looking The Lucerne is more traditional in decor and temperament

title: Would definately go back there
text:
I actually stayed in this hotel from 5th  9th December 2002 while the hotel was undergoing some refurbishment It didnt ruin the trip at all
I thought this hotel was comfortable convenient and unique 
The staff were always very helpful even suggesting good places to eat as there was no restaurant in the hotel
My one gripe would be that the blankets over the beds were very static and i kept giving myself electric shocks
If you go anywhere for lunch or dinner in NY and you stay here i highly recommend the sports bar opposite Madison Square Gardens its only a 5 minute walk away We went there just before seeing a NY Rangers hockey match another must and they serve the most divine cheeseburgers in the world id go back for them alone

title: Perfect Locationout of the hustle  bustle of LA
text: My husband and I stayed here between 1317 October and we were so happy we did The location was fantastic our room was 5 star it was so big and plush with stunning views and walking distance to city walk and Universal Studios Every night we would walk to city walk and have dinner in one of their restaurants and then walk back to the hotel The hop on hop off bus even comes to the door of the hotel I think every 30 mins and drops you right outside the Chinese Theatre and the metro is just a short walk down the road and one stop to the Walk of Fame This was our first time to LA and we loved every minute of it We would definitely be recommending the Hilton to friends and family

title: Spacious great view of Times Square excellent midtown location
text:
This is probably my 6th or 7th visit to this very large Marriott hotel While it is not my favorite place to stay in New York because it is so huge I prefer the Marriott Eastside on Lexington Avenue which has more intimate old workd charm it has all the services and amenities of a good midtown hotel
I particularly like the fact that every time I have stayed here I have had a nice large room and a different view
The fitness center is a good size and I have never had to wait to use the treadmill or elyptical trainer
The concierge lounge is also large and never too crowded

title: Satisfactory stay
text:
Just returned from 4 night stay at the Westin I was able to secure a rate of 77 on Priceline I would have preferred to stay in a trendier location but those hotels were often full and we wanted some flexibility to use public transportation as well as our car 
The room was clean and comfortable and the dream beds are hard to beat But the front desk was perpetually understaffed creating long tedious lines Additionally we felt that we wasted too much time waiting in line and then being ill advised by the concierge BTW we were forced to seek out the concierge because the Business Center was invariably closed For a site as large and businesscentric as the Westin the limited hours of the Business Center are unacceptable It wasnt open at all on Sunday and closed early on Saturday I would have much preferred to MapQuest my few routes on my own instead of waiting in another long line for the concierge What irked me most about the concierge service was their combined inability to get me the correct details on taking a public bus to Dodger Stadium Pick up the 2 or 4 bus from Broadway to the stadium and walk up the hill While I realize that most employees and tourists drive to each point of interest I was traveling from Boston and NYC and sought easy public transportation and walking routes to some sites At the very least for travelers such as myself the hotel should make available simple directions to local sites via walking or busmetro We ended up walking home the 15 miles from Dodger Stadium While it wasnt the prettiest walk it was easy and safe
For those going to an Angels game we took the Metro Orange line to the Anaheim stop and the Amtrak home It was quick and direct The Anaheim stop lets you off in the Angels parking lot
We did have a very lovely waiter for brunch at the Westin I believe his name was Edgar The valets and porters were each eager to help and efficient

title: modern and brilliant  wonderful interiors
text: Park Hyatt was brilliant It truly is in an elite class of hotels It stands out as soon as you walk thru the front doors  with its minmalistic design front desk etc The room itself like the rest of the hotel is new and fresh with ample of room The bathroom in dark tiles looks straight from a magazine The restaurant downstairs is also fantastic serving great breakfast and dinner  Obama came here to celebrate his wedding anniversary too restaurant that is 2 slight negatives  the gympool great facilities but so far far far away  its an exercise to get there in the first place  but that I guess wont be a problem for those who are already fitness fanatics Secondly its location sits in a quiet location in the north west corner from the White House  its walkable but its a decent walk Closest metro station is about 10 mins Other good things  they have bikes for you to u use to get around DC  which is great cos Washington is pretty much flat  its a fantastic way to get around all the monuments etc cos to walk it all will require a decent effort Great business centre will free printing with top of the range computers Overall a very very pleasant stay

title: Not what I expected
text:
I really am confused by The Magnolia in Denver Its got elements that are great and others that are just not Imagine for a minute that a luxurious Ritz Carlton and lowend extended stay hotel got together and had a baby the result would be the Magnolia It has some components of true luxury massive suites high ceilings friendly staff great core city location and then elements of extendedstay sleaze weird kitchenettes spotty delivery of service methhead youth hanging out around the entry and lobby that prohibit a good review
The front desk staff was good but I requested an upper floor and was given a room on the second floor of 12 This resulted in a bad nights sleep since the trolley runs by the property all night and rings its bell almost constantly Couple that with the yells of weekend drunks and the previously mentioned meth heads and it wasnt a great night 
When staying in cities I prefer to avoid the massive chain hotels and The Magnolia is certainly unique in its historical setting and giant suites so I cant give it a bad rating but I also cant highly recommend it

title: I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN
text:
Let me just say I hated this place before I even checked in I was traveling for work and needed a place that accepting the Government rate close to the location I would be working in Downtown Los Angeles I knew when I booked this hotel was attached to the mall I had no idea it was in the mall I was traveling solo and upon arriving to the hotel there were three huge tour buses parked out front blocking the check in entrance I was also aware that I would be parking in the mall parking structure after arrival as that is the parking lot the hotel uses I didnt bank on the fact I wouldnt be able to enter into the checkin entrance I tried driving around the block and call the hotel to see what options I had since their entrance was blocked mind you downtown LA you cannot park or pull over to the side of the road at any time as there are signs everywhere stating such Not sure why three huge buses were the exception the phone rang with no exaggeration for at least three minutes before someone answers Mind you I am driving cant pull over anywhere holding my phone and trying to maneuver through streets that dont allow right andor left hand turns at certain times of the day not to mention several one way streets When someone finally answers the phone they ask immediately if I can please hold of course my response was no I cant I asked where I could go to check in since the entrance was still blocked She told me to park in the parking garage next to the hotel and I could enter that way and it would be easy from the elevator 
I do as suggested and pull into the parking garage park near the elevators and think this isnt so bad the elevator will take me right there When I get to the elevator with my luggage purse and other items from my car I realize there are no signs as to what floor to get off on When I get in the elevator there is a button for the bottom floor that says Sheraton Okay great this works As the elevator stops on other floors there are shoppers people dressed in gym clothes and I realize that we are stopping in the middle of Macys department store Did I get on the wrong elevator Nope when I get to the bottom floor I get out in the middle of the mall I get to drag my suitcase through the shopping mall and as I continue to walk there is a sign as if I am going to a department store that says Sheraton at one of the entrances Needless to say I am not happy by this point
I check in hiking to myself just relax it will get better from here I go to my room and its okay nothing spectacular but not too bad You can definitely tell they tried their best to update the appearance while being in an old hotel It was clean and doable but definitely been in better I had picked this location thinking it was next to the mall it would be safe for me to find places to eat etc
I am so frustrated I go talk to the manager and nicely explain had it been one thing I could live with my check in issues but I had real issues with not being able to pull in to checkin and not being able to give the bellman my luggage having to pull my luggage through a parking garage through the mall and lastly having them take so long to answer the phone to be told to hold She graciously offered me dinner which I was happy with and not expecting I just wanted her to know tour buses should not be blocking the entrance AND they need to pick up the phone Anyhow I used it for dinner in the restaurant which turned out to be just as horrible as check in My 30 steak was overcooked chewy and dry The bread they served was as hard as a rock I have had better steaks from Chilis Grill 
Anyhow when I checked out early in the morning a few days later I had to take my suitcase and walk through the quiet and eerie mall and into the parking garage which just as eerie for that early in the morning I didnt like that at all There are too many other choices to have to stay here again in fact next time I will pay some out of my pocket and stay at the Omni which is top notch in downtown Los Angeles

title: Comfy and priced right
text: I stayed here during a convention at the George Brown Center The suite was half the cost of the other hotels near the convention center My suite had a kitchen with a full size refrigerator stove microwave sink dish soap paper towels dish drainer and cabinets The table had two full place settings of nice china and tableware The Wifi was free The bed was new and very comfortable The suite was clean and had everything I needed and more The staff was very courteous and helpful Breakfast was cold items toaster provided just what a busy traveler needs to hold him over until lunch Warning there is no elevator but the staff carried my luggage up and down the stairs The vending machines were not operating but they did have out of order signs on them The ice machines were also not operating but the suite had a freezer and ice cube trays The neighborhood was NOT scary One block to the east was the Toyota Center where the Houston Rockets played the night I arrived One block to the north on Carolina was a the Houston Pavilion a building with several restaurants Three blocks to the north on Austin was the Houston Center a building with a food court across from there was the Phoenician an interesting ethnic grocery and restaurant The Convention Center was a 510 minute walk however stop lights are timed against pedestrians not the fault of the hotel

title: WONDERFUL HOTEL
text: This is the best hotel by far that we have ever stayed at Staff was very friendly and was quick to help out with any questions Rooms was VERY clean bed was great and the views from our room on the 25th floor was beautiful I would recommend this hotel without hesistation and will come back for any future trips to Baltimore You are within a short walking distance to Camden Yards and Inner Harbor and streets are well lit and there is police patrol on the streets when walking at night

title: Not a bad airport hotel
text:
Make sure to confirm your room preference and bed type with the hotel ahead of time or pick another property to stay I had a bit of drama trying to get a room with two beds and manager had to intervene to solve my problem Apparently reservations are only a request and dont really constitute a reservation This shows poor hotel management and puts unnecessary stress on guests during checkin process If I book a room with two beds I expect to get a room with two beds Period
The rooms are clean with refreshed carpet furniture and flat panel TV with plenty of towels and amenities My only issue was with the bed It seems like an old mattress a little wobbly with not much support and padding Its a shame If you change the mattress with a good quality support it would be a very comfortable hotel
Both valet parking and selfparking are outrageously expensive If the room is 100 per night does it make sense to charge 30 of the daily room rate for valet parking and 15 for Internet access

title: Warning
text:
We stayed here for one night before we flew to Europe for one night the day we returned from Europe and one night before we flew from Charlotte to Albuquerque I complained about the same problems each time and each time got appologies but no improvements so this hotel will not get any more chances In short the room was dirty the breakfast was cold and the OJ was water with no concentrated juice the coffee pot was heated from the previous day The mattress was ancient and the bottom sheet kept coming off so I was laying on that unsanitary mattress like thousands of guests before me The noise in the hallway was caused by a sporting team or family of screaming little monsters whose parents had not taught them to be considerate of other people sleeping behind those walls and the hotel manager would not intervene to ask them to be quiet so I had to do it and I am not quite as pleasant at 130 am as I am during the daytime When we arrived for the 3rd night the hotel receptionist said we did not have a reservation at all We stayed here multiple times because we could afford it we were supposed to get frequesnt flyer points and because we didnt want to inconvenience a BB family by arriving and leaving in the wee hours
Dont stay here if you like to get sleep at a clean hotel It was miserable to sleep there for 160 total after taxes

title: I would highly recommend this hotel
text: My husband and I spent two nights here from 1120 to 1122 The room was clean and rather spacious for a NYC hotel room The bathroom was a nice size I wasnt a big fan of the half open shower  unless I stood right under the shower head I felt the cool air of the rest of the bathroom The bed was super comfortable and we both had great nights of sleep I would definately stay here again We were going to events at MSG so the location was super convenient plus we were in walking distance to attractions in Chelsea we wanted to explore

title: I loved every minute there they made me feel at home
text:
The location is great the stuff is warm and friendly the room was large and comfortable 
I had a problem with not receiving a package that was sent to me and the Hotel Service Manager tried to help me far beyond his duty

title: Comfy bed terrible bathroom lighting
text:
My husband  I stayed here for 4 nights while he was attending a conference in May Our room was on the 4th floor with a view of the river The view would have been excellent except for the moisture in the windows which blurred the view It was a nice room but not a 4 star room I would give it 3 12 stars 
The bed was very comfortable  we did get a king room which my husband had requested Also good fluffy pillows However our bathroom seemed old The lighting was very dim  not good for shaving or putting on makeup I stopped by the front desk  mentioned it to the girl on duty She was very pleasant  confirmed that a number of people had complained about the lights 
We liked its location  were able to walk to many places like the Art Institute of Chicago Millenium Park the Magnificent Mile etc The one evening when my husband had a business dinner I walked to the Oriental Theatre by myself to see Wicked which Id highly recommend 
We used the concierge services 2 times  received good service The concierge desks are setup like podiums close to the main checkin area

title: My favorite place to stay in NYC
text: Ive been staying at On the Ave for about 5 years and rarely stray While larger than a boutique hotel it has the same feel The rooms are small but well furnished and the beds are wonderful The staff is always friendly and helpful and the neighborhood is much quieter than those lower in Manhattan The hotel is at 77th and Broadway and theres a subway stop less than 2 blocks away at 79th Though the hotel lacks a restaurant there are a number of terrific places to eat within blocks Nice Matin at 79th and Amsterdam and Sarabeths at 80th and Amsterdam both serve wonderful breakfastsand theres a Shake Shack at 77th and Columbus Not to mention Zabars just a few blocks away at 81st and Broadway The upper west side is a wonderful place to stay in the city and On the Ave is the best hotel there

title: The Palace made us feel like Royalty
text: Our daughter is a Senior at Academy of Art and the Palace would be our choice if just for convenience and amenities  Best SpaSauna Pool in City next to BART Stop and easily walkable and easy taxi to where we need to go When you add people like Teresa and Scott in Desk and management Lydia in the Spa it becomes such a pleasure My wife celebrated her Birthday this visit and by mentioning it we were sent up Chocolate Strawberries and a breakfast tray There may be newer hipper properties in SF but if you appreciate the historical aspects of The City and embrace elegant style The Palace is the place to stay

title: What a revival
text:
The Hotel was renovated with taste by a flamboyant french designerTop Concierge service and beautiful Frederic Fekkai hair Salon on 2nd floor 
Beautiful white marble bathrooms but kitchenette micro wave fridge etc can be seen from bednot very romantic  HeatersAC hidden behind curtains once you shut those at night TV screens small and electronic system rather complicatedTop materials used for refurbishingThereforeoverall was satisfactory

title: A Home Run
text: It seems that the people running this oneyearold hotel got everything right Excellent location Clean modern and spacious rooms the highlight being the beautifully appointed bathroom with the large window for natural sunlight Terrific outdoor pool and terrace on the 7th floor But most of all outstanding service A staff that is always smiling and helpful indicates a pleasant work environment Congratulations

title: High priced Clean Friendly And Great staff and Location
text: i recently stayed at the Taj located on newbury street and loved it from the moment we pulled up and were greeted by the vallet attendents to the looby staff and maids the glits and glammer was all over it cathes your eye the hotel is big with only 15 floors and a rooftop garden a beautiful state of the art fitness center and a Chanel store located in the lobby the rooms were nice too with a HUGE bathroom and great beds overalll the hotel was Suberb and Serine

title: Great value for money excellent location if you dont want city center
text: A friend and I recently stayed here for a weekend Booked with little knowledge trough Priceline but we could not have been more thrilled Loved the atmosphere of being in a collegiate area yet super easy to get into the city center on the subway though some people tried to warn us not to use the subway as residents of new York London we couldnt see the issue  not as extensive as larger citys its clean and works We didnt try the service  great deal but contact with all staff was good Would definitely go back The living room is a lovely space to chill out in

title: Staff was excellent
text: Staff was excellent Rooms were clean and comfortable

title: Not up to Usual Marriott Standard
text:
The hotel seems a bit outdated to me and could do with being a bit more airy Also from the pool area which I did not go in it seems very motelish not typical of a Marriott
Service was OK but it was not people going out of their way to help as is normally the case at other Marriott properties
The best thing this hotel has going for it is the fact that it is adjacent to a San Diego Trolley stop so even without a car it is easy to get all over town Even if you have a car like I did it is still handy for those times when maybe you want to go to a bar and not drive 
There are plenty of big shops and take out places within walking distance and a bigger mall a couple of stops away on the trolley
You can take the trolley all the way to the Mexican border
The only place I drove to was Coronado not served by the trolley and one night I headed to a casino in the canyons
Below Marriott standard but great place to stay if you do not have a car

title: Not that great
text: Stayed here for 3 nights The room was large which was nice Having the kitchen fully stocked with dishes was a bonus For newly renovated the couch had holes and our feet were black from the carpet if we did not wear shoes There is not enough parking for the units unless most of the rooms had more than one car We were always on the side street I was also charged more than my confirmation quoted but my check out clerk would not change it

title: Another great stay in the heart of the MagMile
text: Booked for 3 nights to kick off the HolidaysPerfect location with quiet entrance on Rush and most views facing Michigan plus a Nordstrom connected right to it what could be better The staff is gracious and sincere and the hotel has a cozy feel to it even in the middle of the MagMile madness around it Nice touch is tea or hot cocoa by the elevator hall although we requested a coffeemakerKeurig in our room and it was kept full with a nice assortment of coffeesteas at no charge Room service can be pricey 26 for an omelette including all fees but very very good even at 330am when I was starving We stay here several times a year and are never disappointed Our room had a view all the way to the lake so we were able to enjoy the holiday lighting all the way down Michigan AND THE BED big cushy mushy pillows and a nice down comforter for a great sleep Decent shower and good bath products including an upon request Shanghai Tang bath amenity yum Cosi is across the street for a quick bite or bringback to the room snack and a good variety of restaurants are everywhere The Concierge staff is terrific nice girls who know the City and gave us great suggestions GO TO THE CONRAD CHICAGO NOW

title: Great frontdesk Brittney
text:
The hotel is close to Capital and mall area low price for a cab Brittney at the front desk was great very friendly at check in Called after 5 mins to make sure rooms were good remembers our names when leaving Very helpful
Thank you Britney for your help

title: Nice hotel good location
text: We stayed her over the weekend and spend some time in downtown Chicago The rooms are good and clean Roomservice is good too The location is grwat right around the corner of the Magnificent Mile Surley would come back here

title: New Attitude at the W
text: Dont let other reviews steer you away from this gem Yes the rooms are small but they are very comfortable and interesting Location is perfect for museums restaurants and theater The bed towels pillows and shower were first rate Best of all was the service Every staff member was warm friendly and helpful The parking attendant front desk staff cleaning staff and conciege could not have been nicer Thanks to them we had a terrific weekend in NYC

title: Got more than I paid for
text: I got a great deal on hotwire but was nervous after reading the reviews When I checked in I presented the front desk staff with a Starwood Preferred Guest card and was upgraded to a deluxe room on the 22nd floor of the newly refurbished tower The floor was designated Starwood Preferred guests and it was perfect I requested turndown service after hours and someone was sent immediately The room was very nice the heavenly bed wonderful The views were incredible and coffee and tea was free I felt very safe being on my own and the location of the hotel is the best I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel The spafitness center was very good also

title: No THRILLS NO FRILLS
text:
The Good stuff first
The best thing about this hotel is its location Right next to the Rivercenter Mall and right behind the Alamo and its just a short walking distance from the Riverwalk This was our 2nd time staying here Both times our rooms were very spacious and nicely decorated 
Now the not so good 
It cost 25 a day for Valet parkingNo in room safe I didnt want to carry a purse around all day but I was worried about leaving it in my room and not being able to lock it up We were told we would get a full breakfast when we booked but actually it was a Continental breakfastSKIP IT too many people just to get a waffle The AC would not cool the room Had it down as far as 68 and it still would not cool the room The room had this musty moldy smell to it Everytime we would leave and come back you could smell it The curtains were replaced with shutters which let light in as soon as it was daylight outside Housekeeping never cleaned the bathtub just wiped it dry leaving long hair behind  The hair did not belong to either of us Everything they wiped left hair In order to flush the toilet you had to hold the handle down the entire time waitting for it to flush 
You have to use your room keycard in order for the elavator to workFor Safety Everytime we got in the elavator there was people trying to figure it out and just sitting in the elavator because it wont budge if you dont do it right The Front Desk Clerk was rude and was even arguing with a guest that was trying to check in We decided that it would be better to pay a little extra for a better hotel than to be stressed when were trying to have a nice little getaway weeknend We just happen book when there was a special going on and got it at a good price I have seen better hotels with better amenities for less  Spend the extra 50 or 60 dollars just to have peace of mind

title: Great stay for the price
text: This was my second stay at this property in the last 3 months and I can easliy say that it will not be the last The service and the grounds are impeccable The beds are quite comfortable although just as the previous reviewer I too confirmed a King bed and was given two doubles instead I did not question the room switch since it was just me staying for the 3 nights The restaurant on the property is very good a little pricey but very good The first night I stayed I had the Braised Short Rib Risottoridiculously good Overall this was an excellent trip and I would recommend to business travelers who like spacious rooms and great service

title: Charlotte Ocr 2012
text: My wifes plane was stuck in Chicago and I called to ask if I could check out around 4pm and have the days charges removed since I needed to drive home be with the kids I was told no  even though there were plenty of rooms available The manager on duty didnt seem to care about my situation and when I said I may stay at another hotel in future during my frequent trips to Charlotte she didnt comment I contacted customer service and received a call back from the General Manager who took the charges off the bill In the end I called a friend to drive over and spend the night with my kids and I stayed an additional day I may try another hotel when I come back for a week in December

title: Georgetown Inn
text: Tony and everybody at the Seattle Georgetown Inn were so helpful The atmosphere was very friendly I enjoyed a comfortable stay and look forward to my next visit when Im in Seattle

title: Not Cheap No Freebies but a Good Facility
text:
I was here for a training event recently The meeting facilities and service were both top notch the rooms were very nice as well Nothing over the top fancy but nice
They advertise 10 a day wifi but they gave me the code on checkin This couldve been due to my training class or PC membership though However it was INCREDIBLY slow I used my 3G all week instead 
They have an onsite restaurant but the breakfast buffet after tip was about 15 Too pricey for me
There was a mini fridge in the room but no microwave 
Overall a nice facility but across the street connected by skywalks is the Drury Plaza which has free breakfast Internet evening reception etc If I had to come back I try that instead
Also it was a bit pricey

title: Highly Recommend Definitely Would Return
text: Owner Ron and staff were most cordial and helpful Neighborhood was interesting inviting and safe Room was very comfortable Easy to get downtown on nearby train Close to a major tennis club Continental breakfast was quite sufficient Wendall W

title: Good location and price
text: Not much to add to the other reviews Great location embedded among some of the most interesting buildings in Chicago Check in was fast and they gave me the room early The small room is just big enough for two adults Quiet and nice

title: Best Marriott property in San Diego
text: Fantastic location  you can see into Petco Park from your room Staff is intelligent friendly and they care about doing things right Rooms are comfortable the view is great the beds are fantastic AC works well water is hot internet speed is excellent HD TV  whats not to like

title: Decent but older property
text: A bit rundown and there was an ant problem in the bathroom Servicable stop if you need to stay close to the airport They allow long term parking on their lot for free which was a big plus

title: A Quirky Hotel with Character
text: We originally were reccomended to stay at the Hotel Monaco another Kimpoton Hotel but it was booked out This turned out to be on the next corner from the Seranno If I could I would suggest staying at the Monaco as a preference It has a more interesting lobby and restaurant  bar downstairs That being said the Seranno was a good hotel with some interesting quirks such as the afternoon drinks done at all Kimpton hotels The street around the corner was a little rough and once discovered we did avoid it The rooms are a little on the smaller side but good amenities and extra touches such as the yoga bag and exercise classes on the TV A good hotel and worth considering

title: Great Stay Great Location
text: We stayed at the InterContinental for one night in June and also for a few nights last September We enjoyed both stays very much The location is excellent We were here for a concert in Millennium Park and could walk to the concert and all the shopping we wanted to do The train station is at the Park also so we walked and stored our bags with the bellman Parking is ridiculously expensive A previous reviewer mentioned they thought the hotel was noisy So we were worried when we got off the elevator and realized our room was RIGHT THERE I thought for sure I wouldnt be able to sleep However I didnt hear a thing at all We kept our air on so maybe that helped The hotel is clean The pool is large but not for kids The staff was extremely friendly No complaints

title: Even Better Than Expected
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Strand The room was comfortable the bed was sublime the staff was friendly and accommodating and our view of the Empire State Building was spectacular The breakfast was quite extensive Dinner in the restaurant was delicious Sometimes the service was a little disorganized as when our wine and chocolates part of our package werent in the room when we arrived and only one chocolate was left at turndown two of the three nights actually rather funny Three computers are in the business office only two of them worked so there is usually no need to wait for someone to finish We would definitely stay there again

title: Didnt stay here but staff was lovely and helpful
text:
I had a last minute cancellation to my bosss reservation due to the storms in the North East We made the reservation through Expedia and it was a sameday cancellation so I thought we were doomed for sure in terms of getting a refund But everyone I spoke with was very kind and helpful from the reservations agent to the front desk agent to the Manager Ryan
We got a full refund because wed been flattened by Hurricane Sandy and then the noreaster and were unable to travel I know this was a onetime kind of thing but I so appreciated their willingness to take our circumstances into account when making their decision My boss was really impressed and well definitely be staying there in future

title: Would never stay here again or recommend it to anyone
text: The hotel is old and smelly and dirty I originally asked for a nonsmoking room and they gave us a stinky dirty old room I requested the front desk for antoher room and was told that they normally wouldnt change the room but eventually they gave me another room The new room still smelled bad with the wall papers peeling and the popcorn ceiling falling all over the coffee pot It was disgusting but since the hotel had no other rooms available I couldnt request to be moved again The air conditioning got my teenage son sick  The bathroom is small with molds on the ceiling and the beds are old and lumpy I could go on and on and on The only good thing was the location  it was walking distance to 5th avenue

title: Ritz Club Level is a MUST
text:
The Ritz in SF is in a great location  close to china town union square and central to port My room was 908 which was well appointed although you could barely open a window I stayed at the club level and must confess that this was the best thing we did The breakfast lunch snacks and dinner spread was one of the best I have seen and tasted Everything was so yummy and well presented This was a fantastic value I visited the spa while at the hotel but decided against services because I was in an exploring mood I ended up doing a day trip to Napa on my own rented car from Walnut Creeks Enterprise and that was lovely I also headed out into Danville and got a feel for some of the more suburban towns which had great character I visited friends there too Overall the Ritz provided good service  especially in the club lounge and was in central location 
ps ate at a little Spanish tapas place called Zarzuelas in Russian Hill that was great fun and right across the street from Swansons ice cream

title: Horrible Marriot Stay Away
text: I stayed at the Houston Marriott Texas Medical Center for two nights on business This hotel is right in the Texas Medical Center Complex The hotel is old and outdated The lobby is probably the nicest place in the entire hotel Although I didnt eat in any of the restaurants their decor looked like it was about 2030 years old Not so much dirty and worn but just the color style and decor The rooms were terrible The first room that I was given stunk of moisture and mildue immediately upon entering When I asked to be transferred to another room they did so with no questions However the new room on a different floor also smelled musty and of mildue I met another person in the elevator that saw me changing rooms and immediately knew why as he had also experience a smelly room and had changed to no avail In addition to the musty smell througout the entire hotel the rooms were small old and the carpet looked like it had been in place for decades It was all dirty and matted and disgusting The beds were comfortable and room service was great There is also almost no good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel They do offer a free shuttle within 2 miles but it is unreliable They charge 995 for high speed internet access for 24 hours but they have no wireless I would not stay here again Choose another hotel in the same area There are plenty of them I would suggest the Crowne Plaza or the Hilton The room rate was good at 109 but I would definitly pay more for an acceptable room

title: The Ritz in Chicago is the Best
text:
We have stayed in the Ritz in Chicago many of times and have never been disappointed Our kids are really treated well from the time they get there At checkin they are allowed to pick out a toy out of the wagon they wheel around When they arrive in the room there is a goodie basket for them with colors and a cookie
There is a tour they can take of the kitchen and bake cookies with the Chef  although we haven t had a chance to do this 
The beds are incredible and get turned down every night
The employees are fantastic also
There is also a great little park right across the street for the kids
This is our all time favorite place to stay

title: Awesome staff and services
text:
I really love the location of this property It is quiet as well as easy on your wallet The staff is by far the best out of any of the hotels I have ever stayed in nationwide always professional friendly and helpful with any of your needs I always feel welcome and comfortable here Rooms bathrooms and kitchenettes are always clean and everything appliances water lights etc is always working properly and efficiently
I know the property will undergo renovations soon and I am sure that it will only enhance the guest experience
Many thanks to Samantha Simmons for the handwritten note left for me upon my arrival Such awesome customer service

title: Full Service Hotel
text: I travel quite a bit I have stayed here before The hotel has everything you need The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful Good restaurant choices on premises Rooms great to work in

title: An incredible unique gem with a staff to match
text: This new hotel far exceeded my expectations An absolutely unique atmosphere of modern convenience blended seamlessly with an old world elegance Every experience with the over the top staff was positive and satisfying Our stunning suite had a living room and 2 bedrooms with a bar area and windows overlooking both City Hall  Penn Center Our room was in credibly quiet with wonderfully comfortable beds and linens complete with 3 big screen plasma televisions Service was top notch in every aspect When we returned from an evening out with our dinner doggy bags we realized we had no refrigerator At one oclock in the morning I phoned down to the front desk and not even 10 minutes later a staff member showed up with a fridge This type of service is what we experienced from all of the staff for our entire 3 day stay When I am in Philly this hotel will be my home away from home every time Just SUPERB

title: Loved this hotel
text: Loved this hotel Rooms were beautiful and clean Breakfast was great Convenient location Dont stay in San Antonio if youre not going to stay on the Riverwalk It is too beautiful to miss The staff was so wonderful We arrived early and they were able to store our luggage until we came back from shopping I would definitely stay here again

title: A very nice stay at a very nice hotel
text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of February and it was a wonderful time I made the reservations online which was very painless and requested a top floor room in the comments section which I received During check in the receptionist was very nice and helpful She encouraged us to ask them for any recommendations or suggestions for places to eat or things to do or really anything The room was very nice with a very comfortable bed and nice TV and everything else It was clean and extremely comfortable albeit a little small The location of the hotel is nice at least in my opinion It is a little bit away from Cherry Creek Shopping Center and all the bustle that goes with that but not too far It is a very easy drive to anything you want to do in Denver I requested a late checkout the day before checkout and the front desk was very accommodating and upfront about the fact that if I wanted to check out later than 300pm it would be a half day but up to there it is not I appreciated that Overall I thought this was a wonderful hotel for under 100 a night Definitely will go back again next time I want a little getaway in Denver

title: A great place to stay in DC
text: This hotel was the perfect location within walking distance to the White House and the Mall Also across from a Metro stop for tired children at the end of the day We walked back to the hotel one night rather late and felt very safe The hotel is very clean and well kept The indoor pool though small was a plus for the kids The restaurant in the hotel was pretty good too We would definitely stay there again

title: Millenium Hotels are the pits
text:
Ive stayed in many hotels in my time but this is at the top of my list as the worst hotel I have ever stayed in 
There are much better hotels in the area for a lot less than they charge and which include clean rooms and courteous staff I will never stay in a Millenium Hotel again

title: Great views and downtown location
text: Stayed here two nights with my husband while he had to be in town for business The hotel is in a great location with access to everything downtown Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and friendly when we inquired about places to eat and things to see in town The gym at the hotel was very nice with new equipment and a view to die for The room was a good size and the bed quite comfy Overall I say it is a very nice hotel if you are in town for business at the Convention Center but if you dont need to be right there all the time I think you can find a better value in another hotel

title: Loved Everything
text:
The entrance was modern and spectacular The check in virtually unnoticeable the ambiance was fantastic and overwhelmed with the detailsone did not notice the friendly agents 
The room was clean bed linen fresh Ver nice rooms with all the modern equipment Bathrooms cleanBed and comforter very comfortable
The breakfast was very good and the waitresses very nice A little disappointed that there were very few options for those of us that do not eat pork This could potentially become a problem if one prepays for breakfast and then given few choices

title: Westin great place to stay
text: I was at the Westin for 5 days of a conference It was my third stay there and I have never been disappointed The location is wonderful for all the Times Square things to do and convenient to restaurants cafes and delis The conference is at the hotel and is always well handled by the hotel I have never had a complaint to make while staying there and would stay there with my family if we should visit NYC

title: Great Service
text: Have stayed at this hotel couple of times now and have not been disappointed once The staff here are friendly and fantastic and would always go out of there way to make me happy Rooms are clean large and stylish with very comfortable beds The kitchen bar in room was a bit different at first but now I find it very convenient The location is right across from the Galleria but would not be an ideal hotel for a family holiday Would gladly recommend the Meridian if you are on business in the area

title: The best hotel for Otakon
text: We stayed here for the Otakon anime convention We selected the Hilton because of the connected walkway to the convention center which was great Also many of the convention events took place in the Hiltons conference rooms Check in was super fast with the kiosk in the lobby Self parking was 26 a day Steep but on par for other hotels in the area Nice room Good room service Nice HD TV with HD programming but it kept cutting out now and then with the satellite reception The pool and hot tub and spa were clean and very nice Room was quiet clean and comfortable Check out on the TV no problems Great hotel

title: Your valubles are not safe at the Westin
text:
I recently stayed at the Westin  Charlotte on business I am a consultant and travel often I left for dinner one evening and when I returned my room had been burglarized The perpetrators took close to 850 dollars in personal items and another 1800 in company items 
Since then they have given me the runaround having me contact their insurance agency and after three weeks simply denied any liability for the lack of safety in their rooms Their excuse They dont know how someone could have gotten in 
If you like to get your stuff stolen stay at the Westin They will be happy to accommodate you

title: Not even close to 5 star
text:
Stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend The lobby had a beautiful tall Christmas tree that was quite welcoming However with the not so friendly staff and illinformed conceirge the hotel scored very low on service from my point of view I asked a simple question to both the front desk and the conceirge and the door man if they knew if I could street park over night Without even trying to find out all of them total of 6 people quickly said I dont know but you can park in the garage across the street which would have cost me over 65 a night 
FYI parking IS AVAILABLE on the street from 6pmmidnight via meter everyday Midnight to 7ammidweek 8am weekend parking is available for free Take advantage of that
Ive requested for 2 beds on a higher level floor not next to the elevators Ignoring ALL of my requests I got a King size bed on the 3rd floor right next to the elevators Talk about catering to the customers requests
Tiny room and tiniest bathroom Ive ever seen at a five star hotel In my room with one King bed there was barely any room to walk around Though the room has all the necessary amenities such as iron coffee pot hair dryer etc how can you enjoy a cup of coffee when theres not enough space to sit How can you iron your shirt when you have no place to lay out your clothes
The fitness center and the steam roomsauna is very small and not very clean
The heater made weird cranking noises all night The outside noise though expected since its NYC was quite obtrusive since we were on 3rd floor 
To top it all off the hotels location isnt so convenient It is quite a walk to a subway station and Park street nor 48th has anything to see or do There is a deli at the corner of the street but it had terrible food If youre going to NYC in the winter when its brutally cold to walk outside DONT STAY HERE unless you want to cab around the city
For the amount of money I paid to stay here over 300 a night the service and amenities were not up to par I would never choose the Intercontinental Barclay again And unless you get a SUPER DUPER very good deal I would NOT recommend this hotel

title: Good hotel and service
text: Stayed here for 4 nights and was very happy The aircon controls on the wall werent working at first but the battery was replaced and it was fine after that There is a subway station right on the corner of the block which is very convenient for getting down to the village and its only a couple of blocks from other lines The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the free wifi was also a bonus The room was very quiet and I never heard any sound from the adjacent rooms and couldnt hear any traffic noise but that might have been because my room was at the back So this is a very reasonably priced clean comfortable hotel that ia a great base for exploring midtown

title: Better options for less unless you need a kitchen
text:
The hotel is right across from Phillys gorgeous City Hall Thats pretty much all I can say for it The lobby has extremely low ceilings and feels dark and musty The second floor bar area is much more what you would expect from a lobby Our corner room had one of the weirdest layouts Ive ever seen with a small kitchenette and living room tiny sleeping area and oddly configured bathroom The room was straight out of 1995 and the furniture showed it Wifi was fast and free As for the breakfast it only is offered til 10am on the weekends so by the time we got up and down there we were out of luck Ive never seen a hotel where breakfast stops at 10 on the weekend before
The hotel was very crowded and boisterous and I could see staying there if you needed a kitchenette for some reason Otherwise the Courtyard next door  which was the same price  looked much nicer Other hotels are in the nicer Rittenhouse Square area for the same or less

title: Probably the best budget hotel  ever
text: We stayed for a week and it almost felt like home for me As my boyfriend was working i explored the city on my own The parks location right behind union square was great for this with loads of shops bus routes and chinaown close by I felt really safe to walk around and Rodel was so helpful he had a great sollution for every question i had The room was exactly what i wanted clean well appointed with a nice bathroom and plenty of space I wasnt expecting there to be a kitchen but this too was excellently equipped and a real bonus as were the laundry facilities I wouldnt hesitate to recommend the park hotel to anyone especially travellers on a budget who nevertheless maintain high standards

title: Forget the Benjamin stay at Doubletree or the Michelangelo
text: We stayed at the benjamin during the Easter Weekend in a one bedroom suite I based my decision to stay there largely on the reviews from this site and the virtual tour on the hotels website Both are misleading The Benjamin is just an ok hotel nothing special Just like any other hotel they have some employees who provide great service like our doorman Jonathan who is probably the best doorman in New York and then mediocre to bad service like when we checked in We were promised a room with a view and were told no rooms had a view an outright lie but being on vacation I decided not to get upset and just make the best of it The room is much smaller than the one shown on the virtual tour and does not have windows on both sides It was reasonably clean and the decor was nice but thats all The bathroom was tiny cramped and annoying The location is ok but is by no means prime Its a good fifteen minutes to times square or central park We paid 289night including parking although they tried to charge for parking upon check out but then quickly corrected it For a business trip if you have to be in that location the Benjamin is fine For vacation youre much better off at the Doubletree The rooms are much bigger and the view and location much better If you dont care about the view then stay at the Michelangelo Around the same price look for deals on their website or other online sights with an upgrade included and the one bedroom suite clobbers the Benjamins You cant even compare the two the Michelangelo is that much better Hope this helps

title: Loved the Bryant Park Hotel
text: The Bryant Park Hotel was absolutely stunning in appearance We stayed for a Wedding Sept 16 and 17th in a junior suite I just need to say how accomodating sweet and friendly everyone was to us as well as the Bride and Groom and other wedding guests staying at the hotel Darren and Eric L were fantastic and made our stay so comfortable The staff will go above and beyond for their guests The neighborhood is also fabulous so close to Times Square and 5th ave directly across the street from gorgeous Bryant Park If you love boutique type hotels this is the place for you Worth the price

title: Nice property
text: Attended a Convention in San Diego stayed at the Marriott Nice hotel rooms very comfortable and attached to Convention Center Close to gaslight district and Seaport Village Did not eat there but heard good report from others that did

title: Convenient location and great service
text: This hotel is in a very convenient location I was in town on business and it was an easy walk to my office with a lot of choices for coffee on the way It is also an easy walk to Fanueil Hall the North End and close to the T if needed The rooms themselves were fine functional and clean The fitness room was better than I expected and was super clean had new equiptment towels and water The staff was also very helpful and friendly they organised a car at my departure and also emailed me a copy of my receipt within a couple of hours as I lost mine I definitely thought this could take a couple of days While not a luxury hotel I would happily stay here again The only caution is that it is in the Financial District so on the weekends a lot of the cafes and restaurants arent open

title: A lovely friendly place to stay
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Marriott hotel Staff were extremely helpful other than the lady on the Hertz rentacar desk Having said that we did complain about her to the concierge manager and she was a bit friendlier the next day Concierge help was excellent American service at its best Our room was clean and spacious except for the bathroom which was a little poky Bed so comfortable The maids were happy and courteous and sometimes made little designs on the bed for us Breakfast was good value Omelettes were scrumptious Maybe some of the staff at the poolside restaurant could have been a little nicer especially when they were closing down at night Overall very happy and we would stay here again as we will definitely return to San Diego What a fantastic city

title: This is a fabulous resort
text:
Great servicevery accomodating
We were here in mid September it wasnt crowded but there is plenty of property if it were
The three walking paths offer light medium or strenuous workouts If walking is not your style there is a fabulous gym 
The rooms are luxurious with grand bathrooms and inviting beds

title: Good location for midtown Manhattan
text: We got last minute reservations for Saturday December 3 to see the Christmas lights in New York The last minute rates were expensive  459 plus tax  but we splurged The location is excellent and the rooms arent too small The shower is tiny but the accommodatiions are normal New York But the location cant be beaten for sightseeing You are at the corner of West 31 and 6th Avenue right around the corner from Madison Square Garden Macys and Penn Station Nice staff at hotel and breakfast plus coffee tea and hot chocolate Overall it was a good last minute choice

title: Upscale hotel with a reasonable room rate
text:
We overnighted at the US Grant after our Panama Canal Cruise We chose the hotel online as it was in the Gaslamp district which we heard was an entertaining area to stay in close to shopping and restaurants with a reasonable price 14200 per night The hotel is a 100 years old but has been beautifully restored Our room was comfortable clean and was completely updated 
Staff were very courteous professional and helpful 
Unfortunately the day we arrived was American Thanksgiving so all the stores and most of the attractions that San Diego is famous for were closed We did not eat in the Hotels Restaurant as it was completely booked so can not offer a comment on the food other than to say the menu looked enticing but be prepared to part with at least 20000 if you order an appetizer a main and like to enjoy a bottle of wine with your spouse
We still enjoyed our stay and would recommend others explore using this hotel

title: Unsure about this one
text:
I am unsure about this hotel We booked it after reading the great reviews on tripadvisor and weve never been let down by any of the properties that weve found this way until the Fusion
Ou main issue with the property was the noise Not from the street but the people in the rooms next to us The walls sound like they are made of paper We could hear EVERYTHING from the other rooms Talking tvs phones people using the bathroom  and I do not mean the hotel plumbing nothing was left to the imagination On top of that the noise from above rooms sounded like elephants were racing round and round
The weather was warm while we were there so we wanted the window open  we had an internal room but the noise from the other rooms with their windows open meant it wasnt an option We ended up having to use ear plugs for the entire stay
We were offered another room but when we went to check it out the tv next door was blaring so it wasnt a viable option
The other issue we had was the house keeping When we checked in the room was immaculate However after that it went downhill We reuse our towels so didnt want them replaced every day however some days they would take towels and not replace them at all The floor wasnt vacuumed for about 3 days breakfast crumbs stayed for the whole weekend 
On the plus side the location was brilliant You could walk to shops the cable car restaurants the information centre and transport
Im not sure if we just got them at an off time as previous reviews have been excellent but I would struggle to recommend the hotel to to family and friends
Sorry for the late review we have been travelling since then

title: Comfortable place
text:
Just around the corner youll have all the NYC you will dream and need
Superclose to Koreatown 5 minutes walking from Times Square reachable easily from everywhere Subway is just at the exit of the hotel
This place is superclean and its elegant to be a 3 star residence 
I will suggest this hotel for business more than for a romantic visit to NYC
Staff is fantastic
Rooms are a little bit spartan but with a good taste and with a nice modern tv
Suites high floors have a close view to the Empire State Building Very impressive at nigght when the light of the famous Skyscraper will enter in your room

title: Excellent value for the money
text:
I was in Charlotte for a night for a tennis tournament and traveling with my three kids I booked a 2 room suite 2 queen beds and a sofabed with full kitchen for 75 
At that price point you are never sure what you are going to get I was very pleased with 1 the cleanliness of the room especially the bathroom and kitchen 2 The sofabed had clean sheets and a pillow cant always count on that 3 The staff was very helpful and accommodating 4 The pool was clean and we had no problems getting towels from the front desk 5 Free wired and wireless internet in the room There was an option to pay for a faster speed but I didnt have a problem with the speed of the free service I even took my laptop to the pool and worked there with no problem
The breakfast was serviceable For 75 I dont expect cooked to order breakfast With my kids as long as you have a waffle maker you are good And they did The dining area was clean which is most important to me
Of course at this price there are going to be some small things that you wish could be better The sofa and chair in our room had some stains on them The office chair wobbled a bit The walls were a bit thin and so sounds from other rooms echoed around a bit One of our neighbors called the front desk to complain that we were making too much noise even though the noise was coming from the room on the floor above If you are a light sleeper that could be an issue It didnt bother me or my kids
But relative to the positives I note above these were minor problems I would stay again for sure

title: Great Fun and Relaxing at the Best
text: Stayed there for 5 nites in May 2011 would go back in a Heartbeat They treat you extremely Well and make your stay a Time to Remember

title: Great location nice accommodations good priceline deal
text: Typical city hotel so you have to pay for Internet and breakfast but we enjoyed our stay Plenty of cafes nearby for reasonable breakfast food and free Internet

title: Very Nice
text: A very nice hotel in Downtown Denverthey have valet and parking it costs 26 a dayplace is busy so obviously people are staying herebarrestaurant has a great atmosphere and the rooms are good2 blocks from the famous 16th street which has all the bars and restaurants you will needpoolworkout roomweights are on the 2nd floor and are very adequatedefinitely would stay here again

title: Great Downtown Memphis Location
text:
Great location if you like staying in the city The hotel is located a few blocks from Beale Street and just a few steps from The Rendezvous Rib Joint
The staff is friendly and helpful My room was clean and nicely appointed The only meal I had there was breakfast and well it was breakfast Nice lounge with friendly bartender is adjacent to the lobby
The only complaint I have is that the the hotel shuttle vans with the hotel name on them will not take you to the airport or anywhere else unless you are part of an airline crew It cost about 30 plus tip for a taxi to or from the airport so you can expect to add about 75 to the cost of staying here if you need transportation I will have to do some research to see if there is another downtown hotel with an airport shuttle

title: Great Location  Very Clean
text: I stayed here with my 2 teenage daughters We loved the location room was very clean and spacious for a room in NYC 2 queen beds Great front desk service speedy check out Parking garage just accross the street The breakfast was basicsimple continental breakfast but it was all we needed  and it was fresh capuccino machine was surprisingly good Staff was very knowledgable in helping us get around even helped arrange our transportation back to the hotel I will come back and stay at this hotel hopefully soon

title: Great spot
text: This is a great spot This hotel was a pleasant surprise I having never been to Baltimore was not sure what to expect Admiral Fell Inn is quaint and historic a real gem The location is perfect for siteseeing and nightlife Many local bars and pubs in close walking distance Front Desk staff very accommodating professional and knowledgeable Nothing better than southern hospitality Would stay here again  next time in Baltimore

title: Location location
text: Nice location but not on too busy of street so you can get everywhere in a short walk Rooms are decent size Would stay here again Concierge was helpful to nightlife

title: Loved the Affinia
text: My wife and i have just returned from a four night stay in the Affinia and i have to say that apart from the superb location which is close to everything in downtown Manhattan the staff are second to none They helped to make my first stay in New York very enjoyable My wife had stayed there before and i understand now why she wanted to go back Keep up the good work

title: Great for the price
text: Just returned from 6 days at The Time Very good service and excellent location for going to the theatre Close to everything Walking distance or one stop away on the the subway Also great places to eat from NYC good and cheap to very special and very expensive very close by The room is on the small side but comfortable clean and kept that way daily Didnt really use the lounge or bar was a very busy place at theatre time For what we paid for the room it was greata few little things like the shower light going on and off we called it the shower ghost and had to check to see the door fully closed other than that a very helpful and friendly staff willing to take the extra few steps to get you what you need or lead you in the right direction Could have stayed in a hotel with a bigger room and paid twice the price buy why If your in NYC and staying in your room or eating at places that they have in your home town you might as well have stayed at home Have a great time get out and see it all

title: Very nice place to stay
text: We were here for one brief night but this is a nice clean comfortable hotel with all the amenities 10 minutes from downtown 15 from the airport

title: Avoid This Hotel
text: Folks beware this is basically a residential hotel complete with the nuts that inhabit such a hotel I was put in a room next to two boom box bozos who boomed their music all hours of day and night The staff could not handle them There was construction work being done in the room above me and next to me The walls felt as though they would cave in The staffers a Joe and Patrice are surly and you just know they hated being in the public When I asked for an extra blanket they said I had one although I told them I wanted another one I was begrudenly given a smoked hole rag for a blanket I left with fleas After many many complaints I was finally moved after I asked for the manager The other room had no view other than all the other windowss off the residents Forget about getting any sleep at all Do not waste your money staying here

title: A lovely unexpected surprise
text: I was in LaJolla and wanted to spend my last night of the trip closer to San Diego because Id never explored the city I found The Bristol Hotel on the web and got a 159 rate which I thought was great Location was perfect the staff were very helpful calling for cabs giving me directions and my room was very nice The bathrooms were a nice size and the lobby was pleasant to sit in I would highly recommend this hotel to others

title: Excellent Place to stay hereIts great
text: I stay at this hotel at least once a month for business purposes and its perfect for my needs The place clean and the front desk associate are excellent knowledgeble the area and customer service There are stores and restaurents available in the area in walking distance The Manager is very hospitable and goes the extra mild for the guests I would definitely recommend to anyone

title: Oh So Comfortable
text: Loved the ambiance of this modern ultra comfortable clean and chic hotel Wonderful location just off Rittenhouse Square Love Sofitel

title: Before the Cruise
