text: Our room was a corner suite with 2 windows overlooking the water boats and the airport which is just across the portharbor Since it was our anniversary I booked the sweetheart deal which included chocolate covered strawberries champagne and breakfast the next morning All of this was beautifully presented and quite tasteful The bed was great with a very comfortable mattress the bathroom was spotless and WiFi was flawless We were taking a cruise the following day and were able to hitch a ride to the cruiseport and other than the extra taxes and fees that are customary to the area it was a fantastic choice for us

title: Accommodating accommodations
text: We were pleased with our stay and found the staff very hospitable and accommodating of a special need We return to Houston for another appointment in this area in January and intend to return to the Omni as well

title: Beautiful hotel and rooms but service concierge valet lacking
text:
Best points Proximity to waterfront and other attractions beautiful historic hotel very clean room small but functional fitness center
Notsogreat 1 Parking fees exorbitant like most downtown hotels 2 Walls are thin I could hear people having a conversation in the next room and people down the hallway sounded like they were right outside the door 3Service was bad Concierge I tried using the concierge 3 times and all 3 were unpleasant experiences I called down once to ask what bus to take and after being on hold for a couple of minutes they told me to come down to the desk where I waited for 10 minutes ran out of time and had to leave Second and third tries unsuccessful as well Bell service I felt like the bellman was very rude after I gave him his gratuity 
Overall I got a great price on the hotel so it was well worth it It is a beautiful centrallylocated hotel The French boulangerie down the street is delightful

title: Incredibly comfortable and the staff was awesome They took care of our team
text:
Highly recommended thats all you should take away from this
We booked a bunch of rooms when our team was in Denver for the SIA trade show The hotel was really comfortable there is room to meet with your crew and have a drink I thought the staff went above and beyond to take care of us especially Taylor at the valet he helped us get our huge marketing truck in the building when it wouldnt fit through the normal gates
I felt like the value of the rooms was incredible we had to book a couple rooms at the last minute after our party and ended up getting a better rate than the group one we set up I will definitely be looking at this when we want to come down for the night to see a show or go to a game

title: Fabulous Hotel
text:
The Omni is a great hotel Nice area close to the Metro station Rooms are great Didnt eat in the restaurant but did eat in the bar and the food was very good and actually very good value The bar is a nice place with a good athmosphere which is greatly helped by some excellant waiting staff
Found the coffee shop in the foyer to be expensive and the staff in it are the only ones who let the side down
You have free internet access in the lobby but will have to pay to access it in your room
One word of warning this is a big hotel and covers a large area so your room can be quite a way from reception and the entrance and there are also various split levels meaning steps so if you have limited mobility it may not be the best choice

title: Wonderful attention
text: When I arrived at the Hotel I was given a room on the 11th floor I need antivet drugs to travel so I did not notice until the next day that the elevator gave me vertigo The staff moved us immediately to a lower floor and accommodated me each time I needed to come and go because I needed to use the stairs The staff was exceptionally nice and I never really had to wait very long for someone to get me up the stairs to my new room I give them an A for being so wonderful

title: Romance Package at the Hilton Seattle Airport
text: Spent 3 great nights at the Hilton Seattlebooked the Romance Package for 119 a nightthis included 2 full breakfasts each day and a bottle of champagne at arrival Room was clean and large Bathroom was pleasantly clean and large also Even though hotel is across the street from the airport I never heard airplanesnot once I would recommend this hotel

title: Nice Hampton Inn
text: Stayed at this Hampton Inn for 4 nights late Feb Hotel is completing finishing touches on renovations Outside does not look like typical Hampton as it is clad in yellow painted wood siding The location is convenient but not the best area but seems typical for San Diego area Inside areas are nice They finished the lobby wall paper while we were there Pool and hot tub area looked nice and heated but still did not used due to outside temps in upper 50s Stayed in a newly renovated large King with brand new carpet had that new carpet smell each time we went in Room had patio minifridge microwave nice granite counters new popular style furniture grade vanity new furniture and new white bedding and pillows that all Hamptons are getting Note that only the larger King rooms have the microwave fridge and patio or balcony Housekeeping starts early in the morning and the room was always clean Breakfast area is roomy with granite tables and counters and additional seeting just beyond in the lobby area so there was always a table to be had Breakfast was typical Hampton and not bad for what you get 1 hot entree each day wafflesausage eggsausagebiscuit eggbagel good fresh fruit salad whole bananas and apples cerials excellent coffee yogurt coffee cake bagels and bread muffins milk and the typical reconstituting orangeapplecranberry juice machine The breakfast staff always kept everything filled before running out Hotel is very close to Old Town but I still wouldnt walk there through all the major roads in between Other than the few restaurants in Old Town and several Mexican restaurants we found no very nice restaurants within a few miles of the hotel mostly fast food and chains Seems like most of the good restaurants are down in the gas lamp quarter Would stay there again if staying in the area

title: Just perfect
text: Left without a choise really there were hardly any rooms in all Manhattan at the time of our booking we booked this hotel We got the penthouse 17th floor and had a nice room with a great Manhattanview Everything worked smoothly during our whole stay 4 nights Elevators were fast enough breakfast room never to crowded and the room was clean and quiet There was some noice from the bathroom plumbing and when pointing that out we were imidiately offered to switch our room We choose to stay though The only thing bothering us is the fact that the hotel uses plastic wear in the breakfast room So much garbage Not very envoiremental

title: Clean and Friendly
text: We just got back yesterday from our trip to San FranciscJuly 1606 Want everyone to know our stay at the Fusion was great Staff was very friendly and suggested great places to eat It was very clean everytime the maid came to clean it looked like the first time we got there Everything was in its place Although the rooms were small they were very cozy and we had a flat screen tv too We would recommend this hotel to all of our friends and anyone who is still deciding where to stay It is also close to all the great shopping and restaurants We will definitely consider staying there again We want to thank the staff at the Fusion for making us feel welcome especially Rich who recommended we eat at Boca and Peppe Great restaurant for kids too Hope to see you again

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text:
Whenever I am at a convention at the GRB Convention Center I always try for this hotel It is usually less expensive than anything in the area it is nice it has a hot free breakfast and great free wireless Internet My only complaints are that there are only a couple of restaurants within a few blocks of course not their fault and the room heatAC is pretty loud  but that drowns out any noise from the freeway
It would also be great for the Toyota Center and not bad for Minute Maid Park

title: Smelly Utilitarian 1970s Nightmare
text: Let me preface this by saying that my husband and I are Starwood fans Platinum members for nearly a decade This Westin however should have been renovated at least 10 years ago and wasnt  the result is that it literally stinks throughout in the lobby in the hallways in the rooms The smell is a combination of cigarette smoke still left in the air circulation system from when not all the rooms were smokefree old carpeting and simply a lot of people congregating in a place where there are no open windows anywhere ever I am sure an upgrade to the 1970s air circulation system could have helped The other relic are the elevators  they are so poorly coordinated that you inevitably get squeezed in like sardines with 20 other guests in a tiny again unventilated space going up 40 floors The lobby is generic bland and resembles an airport waiting area The roomsbathrooms should just be gutted and refurbished I do not recommend this place

title: Great Hotel  Lives up to the Westin Name
text:
Overall this is a good example of a Westin property with nice public areas excellent service and clean  spacious guest rooms I stayed here on Business this past week and will be back with my wife for a weekend trip very soon
Pros
 Very friendly staff
 Elegant public areas
 Excellent location  surrounded by shopping and places to eat
 Overlooking Union Square
 Very safe area to walk around and feel comfortable if you are a firsttime visitor
 nice rooms with large LCD TVs
Cons
 Not a family hotel per say ie more designed for adult travellers
 Parking is pricey 50day
 no daily newspaper I found this a bit unusual
 Wired Highspeed internet  available 8 for 2 hrs 15 for 24hrs
Helpful Tips
 Starbucks is 12 blocks away 
 Streetcars go by right outside the front door
 2 large movie theaters within 5 min walk
Tip on Visiting San Francisco
If you are a first time San Francisco visitor and want to do some exploring I would recommend weather permitting jumping in a cab to Pier 39 Pier 39 has food shopping  incredible views of alcatraz Golden Gate Bridge Sea Lions  This is a touristy area and you arrange additional tours at this spot at your leisure

title: location location
text: The St Regis is a beautiful but expensive hotel located within walking distance from ATT park The rooms were lovely and the bar action was fun when returning from a night game The walk from the hotel to the park was enjoyable safe and just what was needed before enjoing a great Giants Game

title: Great Price Great Neighborhood
text: Stayed at the Whitehall second week in June Several conventions were in town and most hotels had raised room rates to full fare  so the Whitehall at 169 a night was a find I try to stay away from large corporate style hotels when possible since I find the service and personal touch of smaller hotels more friendly and personal The Whitehall did not disappoint on any measure Room was plenty spacious and clean Staff was very friendly and accomodating Quirky holdovers from days past include the small elevators and small hallways No ice machines but they delivered a bucket on request within a few minutes Grocery stores restaurants and transportation all within a short walk Decent fitness center and complimentary morning coffeetea made for an altogether excellent stay Give me a Whitehall over a Hilton any day

title: Horrible New Years Eve at The Westin
text:
I booked the Westin on the River Walk for my husbands 60th birthday celebration I requested a balcony room facing the River Walk so that we could see the fireworks Boy what an awful experirence we had I realize New Years Eve is a busy busy time but when you are paying 35000 per night come on get your act together Checkin is 300 pm we got there around 330 and we stood in line as they only had 3 ladies checking people in Got to the counter and checked in but were told your room is not ready yet come back in an hour to get your room keysokay I guess So we walked on the River Walk stopped and had a beer or two Went back to The Westin stood in line AGAIN got to the desk and was told Your room is ready but you will need to wait to the side for us to get your luggage our one peice Well 20 minutes go by Im fuming and finally we ask the desk why we havent gotten our ONE bag yet Oh its coming its at a another area No luck 15 minutes later my husband just goes behind the desk and looks in the holding room and there it is They NEVER offered us or anyone else that was having the same problems a drink in the bar or to bring the luggage to our room when it was locatedOh NOOOOOOO They would not even look at us
We get to the room its okay nothing special clean but certainly not worth 35000 The balcony door DOES NOT open and we are told for safety reasons none of them do Jeez What a joke that whole experience was The only ones providing good customer service were the valet guys 
My husband travels for his job and has stayed at The Westin in Dhaka Bangladesh and was treated like a Kingin Bangladesh but not San Antonio Texas

title: Location and staff good not be better
text:
From the moment we pulled up we were pleased with what we saw Great shopping right up the street The staff was very welcoming 
 Hazel checked us in and was very pleasant When we got to our room I was a little surprised by what I saw We didnt have a full length mirror and I couldnt find a plug in the bathroom On our way out I asked Hazel her thoughts on a place we were headed and then mentioned my bewilderment on the lack of mirror and plug She immediately gave us a new room  and a much nicer one 
When booking be specific floor number Sleep number bed or not Full length mirror

title: Northern Columbus
text: Excellent size rooms Clean Front desk person was very friendly and wanted to help but he was very new to the job and had some issued with the check out process Not his fault he needed a bit more training Hotel is fine just too close to the Interstate so there was noise leakage into the room as we were at the very front of the complex

title: Nice Rooms and Nice Area
text: The rooms and hotel were very nice They have a nice pool area with fire pits that are on at night The staff are very friendly The restuarant has a nice menu for dining in the hotel And there is shopping within walking distance You can also catch the trolley across the street from the hotel which will take you to some sight seeing spots

title: really really nice
text: Stayed here in October 2011 for a few days the standard of the hotel is really good nice and clean and I saw the cleaners working everyday Definitely a place to stay especially as there is a place to cook but would have been nice if they have a restaurant too The only problem is there is not much to do around there so good for business people but not a tourists delight

title: Not that great
text:
When i first got there they put me in a tiny room so small that if you opened the fridge door or tried to sit at the desk you would hit the front of the bed I got bumped up to a bigger room which was much better
The area around the hotel is scary If I was a women traveling alone I would think twice about going outside after dark The hotel is surrounded by broken down parking lots  very ghetto 
Furniture is old  and the bed was very lumpy

title: Great stay
text: This was our second stay and it was wonderful We were very graciously upgraded to a beautiful suite which really made this stay special Every staff member we encountered was warm and friendly I got into a conversation with a staff member while we were on the elevator and I asked him how long hed been working at the Barclay He has been there 13 years which says so much to me about the management  it must be a great place to work and that is reflected in the pride their staff takes in the facility and providing a great experience for guests We had drinks in the bar and breakfast one morning The service and food are good and the atmosphere is lovely Its a great location and an easy walk to many attractions including the UN Building We plan to return

title: Everything we needed for a comfortable stay
text: The staff was very friendly and professional and the rooms were very clean though seemingly outdated The suites are spacious and well equipped Complimentary breakfast was good and during the week they have complimentary dinner as well We were pleased to have fresh towels placed and our beds made while we were out and about during the day The service seemed to be a bit slow as we requested a few things that took quite awhile to be fulfilled While the hotel itself was quiet the nearby airplanes coming and going were quite loud and could be heard into the night Overall a good experience and comfortable for our family of 6

title: Home Away From Home
text: I love the Eliot Hotel It is refined yet cozy and not over the top There is a subtle elegance to the space The staff is friendly prompt and discreet a personal requirement The location is prime close to restaurants and shops I do not like Boston but I am very pleased to have the Eliot when I am there

title: Plan on spending lots of extra money
text: Obviously this is a luxury hotel From the first impression to the last thats what youll see The rooms are large and nicely decorated One of the best hotel bathrooms ever However it comes with a priceParking is an extra 20 add another 13 for the exercise room Oh and internet is another 13 We spent an extra 200 on incidentals for a four night stay which was about double what I expected

title: Best of the hotels at LAX
text:
Arrived at the hotel on 21st September after a late flight from London Shuttle bus arrived after about five minutes and we were greeted by a very effusive driver who welcomed us to LA Five minutes later we arrived at the hotel and all the check in desks were quickly opened so check in was very swift Got an upgrade to a corner room on my Starwood Gold card Breakfast included in my rate was excellent with a good choice of fruit fried breakfast etc Check out was also very efficient 
Having stayed at LAX several times this is without doubt the best of the airport hotels Combine a great rate for the room including two breakfasts 129 booked direct with Sheraton on the web and you cannot go wrong
Everything above expectation so definately will return on the next LA trip

title: Great hospitality and value
text: The staff really goes the extra mile here The breakfast buffet is generous the location is good if you want to be near Hollywood Blvd and the parking is inexpensive and convenient The common areas have a lot of oldHollywood charm although the back area and our suite could use some remodeling The bedroom was up to date and cushy though and we really appreciated the touches you usually expect from more standard hotels like bathrobes local magazines LA Times coffee maker Overall pleasantly quirky with a historical feel

title: Great location but very tired
text:
The Millenium UN Plaza is an excellent location where you are able to walk to Grand Central Station in about 5 minutes We were amazed that 5th Avenue Times Square etc are actually walkable in 1520 minutes 
The main mistake we made was staying for 7 nights after spending 4 nights at Caesars Palace Las Vegas The hotel simple did not compare and therefore maybe we were more critical than we usually would be
The hotel was chosen because its a 4 star hotel in a good location that was cheaper than most other hotels even the Travelodge by Times Sq was 100 When we arrived the reception and lobby was nice enough but as mentioned it is very much a high class 80s style The receptionist was quite abrupt and mechanical without the usual high customer service shown by the rest of the city However the bell boys etc were very helpful and polite
When we arrived at the room on the 37th floor we were surprised to open a worn out Motel like grubby brown door To be honest as mentioned the rooms are in need of modernisation and a bit of clean to the walls The shower although reasonably warm and quite powerful was like one from the 60s 
Although in general this probably sounds quite negative the hotel was decent enough for the price paid and for New York We were out of the hotel most days at 9am and went to bed 2am plus most nights spending about 2 hours chilling and getting ready everyday Therefore we didnt spend loads of time in the hotel because there is so much to see and do We didnt eat in the hotel as its expensive and the delis cafes and pubs locally are fantastic and very reasonably priced
We did go for a swim once but the pool was again a little outdated and need of a clean and not a big as the pictures show it to be To be fair though there were notices highlighting that the hotel going to be renovating its health and fitness facilities 
Overall the hotel was fine for us because of the price about 8090 a night and location but if you are on a City Break looking for luxury you may be disappointed

title: Good hotel but with problems
text:
For the most part this hotel is good Its close to a Metro station the neighborhood while not at all trendy seems safe and above all its close to downtown Washington DC without the high price we paid 14900 a night which included breakfast The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable Now for the downsides The staff seemed overwhelmed One morning at breakfast the food was almost completely gone We had to wait nearly an hour while the cook caught up Meanwhile the staff initially offered no apologies only blame on others Im the ONLY server here and I cant do everything I talked with the manager of the restaurant and she did apologize and took the cost of one of our breakfasts off the bill
The next evening we came back to our room at around midnight Our key cards would not work My husband went down to the front desk and got new ones They did not work He went down to the front desk again and again no staff person came up to help us get inthey just kept give us new key cards Finally the next time the security person came upthe verdict was that the door lock was broken and we could not get into our room until the next morning The one person that could fix the lock was not answering their phone That person did not have a supervisor that could be called and that was that We were offered another room for the night and the room charge for that night was taken off the bill 
Housekeeping left dirty towels and the trash in our room on one occasion 
Bottom line In light of the other reviews I think we just had a string of bad luck with this hotel but I cant recommend it to anyone else

title: A perfect choice in NYC
text:
This is truly a great hotel Comfortable with clean and beautiful rooms
A great hot shower with lots of water pressure Imagine they give you TEN different types of pillow choices Concierge was helpful The room was very large considering what we paid I wont stay anywhere else

title: Good place to stay
text:
The location was great in that it was close to downtown as well as the airport We stayed here before we flew out and it was a quick drive in the morning 
The place was well maintained and very nice looking The staff was helpful Based on the sunburns the kids enjoyed the pool for a decent amount of time I liked the lobby and a variety of things for guests to do there I always like it when hotels make that extra effort
The rooms had a DVD player and I think I was told that there were some DVDs in the lobby frig etc
The breakfast had a good variety and was a good continental breakfast
Id stay here again and I recommend

title: Great
text: Okay so the manager had a bad day dont make that a reason to avoid this hotel Nothing can compare for price cleanliness and location four in a bed is not so bad

title: Loved the Hilton
text:
Stayed a week at the Austin Hilton Downtown We had an executive king room on the 26th floor This gives you access to the executive lounge on the 25th floor
Room was good nice bed nice bath Only complaints were self parking was 16 a day lot was under hotel with key card access and internet was 11 a day When youre paying close to 250 a night would it really hurt them to include parking or internet
On the other hand there was free internet in the lounge on their computer The lounge also had free continental breakfast afternoon snacks and late night snacks and free nonalcoholic drinks all day long And they had a concierge available and a few other things such as umbrellas in rained one morning and my meeting was a block away
Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful Late night weekends they had security in the lobby to keep the kids from sharing their rooms You had to be able to prove you were a guest to get to the elevators
The pool was great It was a salt water pool with a hot tub many lounge chairs and a tiki bar All of this is on one of the building roofs
Overall a very good experience and I would highly recommend it

title: OK place but it has problems
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Adagio because of the price and the good reviews It was a clean place and the staff was friendly but our room did not have working internet My wife needed the internet to conduct business while we were away It was supposed to be included free in our room I told the staff about this problem and they worked on it right away Unfortunately after 3 days it still wasnt fixed even though each day I was told that it was working We were then offered a different room but that room was very hot because the AC didnt work properly Eventually they moved the AC unit from our old room to the new room and everything worked on our LAST NIGHT in the hotel
This hotel also has a restaurant but the prices are VERY high even for San Francisco As an example they offer a cold buffet breakfast that includes 3 cereals a small offering of fruit yogurt and juices The price is 14 That is bad enough but then they add an additional 3 gratuity on top THIS IS CRAZY I have never been charge a gratuity when I serve myself The total cost ends up to be after tax to be 20
Overall the place was ok but I felt that it could have been better It is the typical city hotel that serves but seems to fall short of expectations

title: Hotel Harrington was the best deal weve found in a long time
text: We found our stay at the Hotel Harrington to be surpisingly pleasant and convenient While it was not The Ritz it was extremely affordable close to everything and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful We were surprised to read some of the horrible reviews as the Harrington is truly not that bad The rooms are average size it was clean and we certainly had working air conditioning You couldnt possibly ask for a better location The only thing we found humerous was the ridiculously shallow depth of the closet which we had no intention of using anyway People need to remember this is a very old hotel and is in the middle of a huge city You cant find a better deal We will absolutely stay at this hotel again gladly

title: Staff make this hotel a good choice
text:
Stayed at this Doubletree hotel for one night while visiting Detroit 
Staff As mentioned in previous reviews the staff was great Upon checkin the front desk staff came out to greet me gave me a rundown of the hotel features and showed me how to get to my room 
Location Very convenient to the Southfield and I94 freeways Numerous restaurants near the hotel There is a Chilis and Wendys within walking distance right across from the hotel parking lot It was only a 10 minute drive from DTW The hotel does not have a free shuttle 
Room As a HHonors Diamond member I was upgraded to a king bed suite The room was very nice and included a whirlpool tub All the furnishings and tvs were new along with the Sweet Dreams bed The only complaint about the room was that the AC was very noisy Wireless internet access was very reliable and fast  it is free for Diamond members It is quite a walk from the front desk to the room as you have to pass a massive lobby and meeting rooms just to get to the elevators However the hotel offers many entrances To get to your room you need to enter your key card in the elevator  a nice safety feature
Food Ordered room service for breakfast Was prompt but for some reason it was cold Could have been better The restaurant looked nice but did not get to visit it
Atmosphere Lobby was extremely spacious with small waterfall and many tables and couches However the hallways leading to the rooms were dark  there were not many people staying at the hotel probably because over a holiday weekend and thus it had sort of a cold  deserted feel to it
Pool Did not get to use it but it looked nice 
HHonors benefits As mentioned above did recieve free wireless internet for the stay along with a coupon for a free breakfast in the restaurant There is no exec lounge or exec floor on this property 
During my stay I received a call to make sure everything was ok with my stay Upon checkout I received a personal email from the front desk manager thaking me for staying at the property and to email her if with comments I did not encounter one employee during my stay who didnt have a smile on their face
Overall I thought this was a nice looking hotel with very comfortable rooms minus the noisy AC unit The friendly and professional staff really make this a great place to stay I would definitely stay here again while in the Detroit area Im hoping the hotel will consider adding shuttle service from DTW in the near future

title: Best bang for the buck
text: I have stayed in many NYC hotel most which were more expensive yes the rooms were larger and the lobby more elegant but you dont stay in the lobby nor the room very long This was a newly renovated room which was very clean bed very comfortable  very clean bathroomThe only downfall was you had to pay for wifi and we couldnt controll the heat in the room a little too hot I would stay here again we only paid98 for a night best value I have ever paid

title: Best Hotel we have Stayed at in New York
text:
We stayed at the Belvedere and Dream hotels in our previous stays to New York and the Casablanca Hotel far exceeded either of these hotels
The location was terrific  so close to the plays we did not hear any noise at all and had no trouble sleeping
The breakfast was great a very nice selection and very friendly service and a nice outdoor courtyard to eat in as well as a nice lounge with internet
The wine and cheese was a terrific compliment to a new york schedule after a day of sightseeing you can relax with a glass of wine and some cheese and fruit prior to going off to a play
10 out of 10 and we will definitely be back

title: Lots of fun
text:
The hotel is well located to visit the Farmers Market and other attractionseg LACMA
It has a slightly quirky image such as giant rubber ducks floating in the pool denim bedspreads and the naughty farmers daughter slogans This is all really well thought out and does a good job at distracting from this being a fairly basic motel
Rooms were spacious bed comfortable shower hot staff friendly So all the key points covered off If you have expectations of a full service hotel then you will be disappointed
Downsides Aside from it being a bit basic the AC unit in our room was very noisy and the bed whilst clean and comfortable had quite badly worn sheets

title: Excellent stay near the Denver airport
text: We had an excellent one night stay near the Denver airport The staff was friendly and helpful the breakfast very good and rooms and beds were comfy We used the shuttle to get to the hotel and to pick up our car rental the next morning We would stay there again if at the Denver airport

title: It is what it is
text: A budget stay in a great neighbourhood The rooms are clean and functional Nothing is fancy and we were leary at first but hey it turned out fine At 14 of the price of other hotels researched we werent expecting 5 star And it it exceeded my expectations It was clean quiet and for the few hours that we spent there the rooms were okay Two blocks to Zabars and the subway close to many fine restaurants Central Park Trader Joes  what more could we ask for

title: Great Hotel
text: Had been recommended the Magic Castle by a friend and was glad to see good reviews here Had a great stay there for two nights the staff were very helpful and friendly The room was very clean and tidy  loved the turndown service newspaper in the morning and the breakfast was great The chocolate and cherry scones are worth getting up early for Got a pretty reasonable rate from expedia and i think the price for the room and location was excellent Provided a lovely start to our trip

title: Great Place to Stay
text: We stayed here a couple of months ago We were very pleased My husband had business in DC and I came along to do some sight seeing We loved the happy hour wine hour every night and we enjoyed seeing people bring their dogs Apparently dogs are very welcome in the hotel Nice touch They have water bowls out for them While my husband was at his meetings I had no trouble at all walking to the very close subway station and navigating to all of the sites Its a good idea to get a week pass for the subway if you are going to be there a few days Ask the desk They were all very very helpful to me The room was great and so was the breakfast Cant ask for much more

title: Not the safest hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights The reason I would never stay here again was that while we were out they delivered some champagne and strawberries for our anniversary and left our room door open This was very upsetting to us considering that we returned to our room at 3am When we complained they did not seem to care If a hotel cant offer a safe place to stay then what are they actually offering you

title: Great hotel
text: my wife and I stayed here after taking in the IU football game in Bloomingtonwere from Chicago and didnt feel like driving back up that night Property is definitely newer right off 465 nice lobby tons of parking Fountain at the main entrance was a nice touch too Staff was very friendly Room was good sized flat screen TV had a king and mattress and comforterpillows were excellent Fridge in room too along with microwave Got to the pool and it was heated Hot tub was great Suburban hotel so pool was nice sized as was the adjacent gymall super clean Precor equipment in the gym so definitely nice Didnt try the bar but did do room service Fast person was friendly and food was reasonably priced

title: Perfect Choice Great Location
text:
I have just returned from a 5nt stay in the Fairfield Inn  Suites Manhattan Chelsea and cant rate it highly enough
The hotel is very small and friendly in comparison to other large hotels in the City The hotel is very clean modern and quiet It is classed as part of the flower district and upon arrival you can see why
We had a slight problem upon check in with the room type bookedit was my sisters 30th birthday however the manager sorted this out for us quickly efficiently and without a problem The room was fairly small but was clean and we were more than happy with it Breakfast was complimentary and was plentiful with a selection of bagels muffins cereals eggs yoghurts fresh fruit etc Starbucks coffee and an array of teas and hot chocolate was available all day every day
The hotel was 56 blocks up from Macys they say 1 block is approx 1 min walk so not far at all and was also very close to the Empire State Building and Times Square The hotels location was so good in fact you could pretty much walk anywhere We even walked from the American History Museum down by Central Park back to the hotel one dayit took a few stops on the way but was certainly doable
The staff were amazing extremely helpful and knowledgable In fact the only negative I could rate from my whole stay was the fact that there were no safety deposit boxes availablethey were all being used so could prob benefit from a few more of these for guests ease of mind
Overall a perfect stay Id definitely recommend it to anyone and I wouldnt hesitate to stay there againthank you

title: Excellent service and great hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here for a minihoneymoon after we got married last weekend We are from Chicago but decided to stay local and were glad we did We got the room as a special and were upgraded as well which made it nice We stayed in a room on the 25th floor that had one bedroom and a separate room that with a fireplace that led to the balcony Chances are if youre looking at this place youve done enough research so just go already Service is great its no tipping so even if you try to tip they wont take it food is excellent and Ria is the same kitchen as Balsan so quality in both We had brunch there on a Sunday and the consistecny or service was the same    great Brunch is two courses one is a series of mini breads scones and muffin tops with different spread and dips the other is your choice of a series of entrees We went for a run one morning and were told to enjoy our run then when we got back we were asked how was our run and then when inside the lobby we were greeted by a nice young lady who said she hoped we enjoyed our run and handed us each a bottle of ice cold water Seriously just go and enjoy

title: 3 fantastic Christmas Holidays at the Marquis
text: Fantastic Views over Manhattan especially on higher levels also great view of Times Square itself facing northsouth very comfortable beds slimline tv and teacoffee machine very important if you want a drink just after waking or before sleeping If you decide to eat breakfast in the hotel you need to make your way as quickly as possible to restaurant as queues can be quite long

title: Amazing customer service and perfect location
text: First time staying here and it was a wonderful experience Helen at the front desk checked us in and was wonderful throughout our stay Thank you Helen for helping us and making our stay extremely pleasant Got this hotel via Expedias special rate where you find out the hotel after and we totally lucked out with this gem The room was very nice and the bathroom was amazing especially the shower Pillows were heavenly Suffice to say I loved it here

title: Horrible
text: I will never come back to this hell hole the cops busted in my room for no reason they harrassed me all cause they THOUGHT i was on parole The service was average at best I had beer bottles thrown at my room roomservice banging on my door dispite the sign the list goes on wow can u say prison

title: Great place and great location
text: Nice stylish hotel with excellent view Close to harbour and nightlife

title: Beautiful hotel and great location
text: Its true the construction noise is badthey cranked up at 200am this morning and theyre working loudly this morningbut I love this hotel My husband and I are celebrating our 25th anniversary here and except for this noise which is not the fault of the hotel Im glad we are here for this special event The lobby is beautiful and the staff has been helpful Our room is very spacious and clean The location is great for shopping or just exploring the city

title: Best small affordable delightful hotel in San Francisco
text: We love staying in small hotels that are centrally located We had been told that the Chancellor was a great small hotel We will be telling others the same It has just about everything a small three star hotel has in Europe and more The bedding was lovely the amenities in the bathroom were great and the service was as good as it gets It also had a save in the closet We hesitate to praise the hotel too much for fear of not being able to get a reservation when we returnA three star hotel with a five star locationso true

title: Great staff quaint residential neighborhood
text:
The staff at the Burnsley could not be more accommodating The hotel is in a nice residential neighborhood in the old Capital Hill area near the Molly Brown House museum but the free shuttle service to downtown locations makes it a convenient choice for a value hotel The rooms are very large with new beds and a fully equipped kitchen The room I was in had certain elements refurbished kitchen floor table freshly painted walls and other elements in need of renewal bathroom carpeting headboard 
For the rate we paid through AAA this hotel was a great value

title: Mixed feelings about NY Palace  needs to work on staff attitude
text:
The New York Palace
I stayed at the NY Palace with my sister and parents for 6 nights in June 2010 While the hotel offers a good location and spacious comfortable rooms many among the staff there do their best to ruin the experience
To list a few of the problems we have encountered
 On our first day I spoke to the concierge about booking a restaurant and thought they were extremely polite and I was very pleased Little did I know that while he was being polite to me on the phone he was making fun of my name to his colleagues at the concierge desk AND the person from the restaurant while making the booking All this was witnessed by my sister who happened to be downstairs waiting at the concierge about something else
I told this to the restaurant manager who a couple of days later asked us about our stay and to their credit he passed on the message to the concierge manager who then sent me a hand written apology note with champagne and strawberries also to my parents who were upset about the restaurant This was a nice touch and at least an effort towards damage control
 My name and surname were switched by mistake during the booking We tried to tell the hotel this from the first day however as they neglected to correct the mistake we had many problems
  We had forgotten some stuff in East Hampton where we stayed before arriving at NYC Our host there was going to send them to us by mail I gave him the hotel number and details he called to confirm the address and was told by the receptionist that our reservation was cancelled 
  He sent the package when I assured him that we were in fact still staying the NY Palace Just to make sure I called the reception and package deliveries and told them we would be expecting a package trying to ensure that they knew what name to look out for and didnt mess up As you can imagine we had to ask after the package for a few days constantly being told that it had not arrived The hotel finally gave us our package it on Thursday after my contacting the cargo company and getting the tracking number it had arrived on Tuesday morning on my name
 The service at the Istana restaurant where we went for breakfast was terrible and only after many complaints a few of the waiters started paying special attention to us Before that they were inattentive bordering on rude We regretted our breakfast being included in the price
The NY Palace is a hotel that holds potential but they need to work on the service and staff behaviour It seemed to us that the only people who smiled at guests were the housekeeping staff Everyone else had an arrogant and indifferent attitude

title: Very Friendly and Helpful Hotel
text:
My husband and I both have restricted height and hae just retuned from a weeks stay at the Doubletree 
We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful from the first greeting we received from the doorman through to the reception staff and maid
We had a wheelchair access room which meant that the wardrope and towels rails were lower than normal which was great for us 
When we actually met the maid and she saw how short we are she was happy yo leave the clean towels on the lower rails for us The towels are very soft and fluffy The maid was also happy to leave us extra tea bags instead of coffee you know how much the English like their tea
Internet access is free to guests so we were able to keep in touch with family and friends
The only negative point is the mini bar in the room Drinks in the fridge  snacks placed on top of the frige are all on pressure pads so ou only have to touch or move any item and it is registered So be careful I picked up a small pack of Pringles and had to remember to tell the reception staff that I didnt eat them They were fine about it and we were not charged for them
There is a great place to ave breakfast just up the road from the hotel called Panera where they do a great Latte if like us you dont like American coffee

title: Charming Hotel close to Museums and great shopping
text: We just spent a weekend at the Serrano taking in The Steins Collect and other coordinated exhibits at the Contemporary Jewish and DeYoung Museums The hotel is an easy walk to downtown Museums Yerba Buena Park the Powell Street Cable Car and all the shops of Union Square Rooms are elegant and light filled The Executive suite with Jacuzzi tub was great and the staff was very helpful The new beer pub in the hotel has imaginative tastes and traditional pub fare We enjoyed both the food and the surroundings

title: Great hotel
text:
Room was very spacious good for all our baggage very clean the staff bent over backwards to make sure our stay was pleasant food was good room was very quiet and in an excellent location Hotel was also very good value for money
Would not hesitate to recomemend

title: Basic facilities my experience was not brilliant
text: I checked in on 3rd Dec 2010 It was a cold December evening Heating in the room did not work I spoke to Reception who said someone would be there in 10 minutes No one ever did

title: really cool vibe at this hotel
text: This place is very nice The staff all the way from the valet attendant to the front desk to the bellhop to the room service attendanttop notch helpful and friendly The room was a bit small for my taste and the bathroom had limited privacy My room had this pacific island theme and there was a window with shutters that separated the living area from the bathroomweird But it was kinda cool The heavenly beds were very comfy and the view was great looking out across Lake Michigan Id have to say the only downside to this hotel is the fact that they were in the middle of renovations during my stay and we had to pardon the dustI understood Hey they have to upgrade at some point right And the weirdest thing would have to be when we came back at about 2 AM after the wedding we attended was over we pulled up and to find the lobby has been transformed into a nightclub I thought this was very interesting except for the fact that there was about 10 people laying down outside and they were clearly inebriated and ready to puke I mentioned to my brother that if we were just arriving for the first time right then I wouldve been very turned off that such a high class hotel turns into a pukefest nightclub Dont get me wrong I think the whole nightclub thing in the lobby was cooljust not the puking guests laying all over the place outside the front entrance All in all this is a fantastic place to stay in a tremendous location just 4 blocks from the magnificent mile

title: Uptown service with downtown delights
text:
I revisited the Voort recently and had a very nice experience Room was changed with no trouble when there was a problem Doormen superfriendly as well 
Just want to remind folks that both the Highline and Hudson River Park are minutes away and you can cycle skate run walk the length of the island at your leisure I ran up HRP and cut in at 74th to Central Park and ran around the reservoir and back I had a cocoa on the highline for my cooldown Really fun

title: Hated It
text: This hotel has very poor air conditioning and I had to check out after one day However the manager is very rude and confrontational He was trying to force me to move to another room and started yelling at me when I told him I just wanted to leave There is no reception or waiting area and the hotel is completely locked down Its very shady and the owner has a frightening attitude He hasnt refunded me the money after I checked out and were sorting it out with AMEX Im shocked hes still in business

title: Excellent value in a cracking location
text:
I stayed here for a week on a recent vacation  the entire package including flights was 700 approx 1000 so I reckon I mustve got a very good deal on the hotel
Checkin was swift and I was given my choice of type of room  I took the King The room was on the 1st floor 2nd US and faced directly onto the railroad tracks so I was a little concerned on the noise front I neednt have been I only got woken once by the train in the entire week despite being a light sleeper Just turned over and went back to sleep Didnt even need to use the ear plugs provided
The location is excellent Only 2 blocks from Petco Park and the trolley was even closer than that Plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance which is nice if you fancy a drink but dont want to get behind the wheel afterwards
The room was well kitted out with the exception of a fridge Wouldve been nice to have one but it isnt the end of the world Nice desk area with ergo chair and a separate chair and footstool to sit on if you wanted a more relaxed stance Bathroom was fine and I loved the Crabtree  Evelyn bath products provided
The gym was small but fairly well equipped with 2 treadmills a cross trainer and a reclined bike There were a couple of weights machines free weights mats etc too I used it every day and was perfectly happy with it The pool area was closed the first couple of days but opened again on Memorial Day weekend  the pool is quite small but clean The surrounding area has plenty of loungers and a nice decked area
Staff were lovely especially the cleaning crew who always left my room looking immaculate Ill definitely recommend this hotel

title: really nice hotel great lcoation near Convention Center
text: Juts spent six nights at the Embassy Suites and it was a really nice visit The breakfast bar in the morning helps fuel you for the day and at the same time lets those of us with a daily allowance spend our stipend on the many amazing dinners around town Osteria Marco and Rioja are two great spots I do have to say that the staff was a bit underwhelming The first night there I found a couple of hairs in the showeryuck Made me wonder how well the rest of the room had been cleaned however after a quick inspection I was satisfied it was probably just an oversight by a busy housekeeper with a lot on her mind that day I was also a bit disappointed in the staffs knowledge of the city I had directions to get the bus to Boulder by going to the Market St station which I decided to confirm before heading out I was told to go to Union Station instead however once I arrived there the bus driver informed me that Market St was the right place and I arrived back at the correct station just in time to see my bus leavefrustrating indeed The last interaction I had involved a request for a place with good dessert Three people couldnt offer a suggestion which I found amazing Even if you dont like dessert or are new to the area I would expect that a desk staff would have at least one suggestion for dessert even by just reading tripadvisor reviews Oteria and Rioja both had fabulous desserts by the way On the other hand a really nice bar person hooked me up with cocktail napkins and little cereal bowls to help me with the reception we had in our room for some fellow conference goers and the rooms are super spacious so all in all it was a good experience

title: Amazing Staff but Hilton What Happened
text:
OK I start by saying I feel sort of bad that I have not been able to write better reviews for Hilton properties lately It is where I stay the most because I have a multitude of points and of course Kimpton is not in every cityYET But Hilton what has happened You seem to be cheeping out lately I wont review my other reviews but check them out As for this property let me start with the AMAZING staff They were great from checkin by name greeting free bottled water free bar drink coupon to the late checkout that they didnt even blink over when I requested Dinner at the restaurant was excellent and again the staff there was so friendly and professional I would absolutely rate this property 5 stars based on the staff
However I have to rate the room since that is really what we all pay for
Bed  comfortable
Bath amenities soap shampoo etc  good
TV  probably good when it was new in1987 maybe SeriouslyTube TVs Come on Hilton spring for the flat screen But even that and its loud buzzing was not enough to lower the rating more than half a star Then came the morning shower I thought maybe I didnt turn it up enough but oh noit was full power The trickle was so bad that I had to move all the way to the wall and be completely under the spout to get fully wet Very FRUSTRATING
I am also frustrated because I really wanted to rate this experience high for my most visited brand but it just aint happenin

title: Comfy bed great staff and nice bathroom
text: Booked this hotel through priceline 113night for a late spring weekend to see a concert and visit with friends The bed was extremely comfortable the room was well outfitted althrough a bizarre window of sliding panels separated the bedroom and bathroom Lobby and restaurant staff were very friendly and helpful On the harbor side of the hotel there is a great patio area for sitting to enjoy a coffee or cocktail The pool in the spa is nice if a little on the small side for swimming laps This part of the Financial District is a little dead on the weekends so aside from the restaurants in the hotel a walk or T ride is necessary to grab a drink or bite to eat All in all a great stay and would be thrilled to come back

title: Good Value with a Great Location
text:
Clean comforatble rooms with great crisp fresh linen
Easy to use alarm clocks and tons of useable outlets for charging
Quiet room on the 12th floor offered a great night sleep
Nice restaurant for breakfast a few blocks from a Starbucks and very
reasonable rates Desk staff was helpful and friendly

title: Great location to all things Indy
text: Loved the hotel Very clean rooms Nice Decorand most of all close to everything Lucas Oil  Convention ctr capital and walking distance to most restaraunts The food was good and service excellent The only down side is parking is 35 a day Just like the BIG citiesYikes

title: Great for Christmas
text: i love this hotel so much at Christmas time the place is magic a true New York experience ideally located on time square every time i think of New york i remember the Christmas i had at this hotel

title: Beautiful historic hotel in a great location
text:
This is a gorgeous hotel that actually has quite a bit of history tied to it They have displays in the lobby showing the history of the earthquake in the early 1900s along with pictures and memorabilia They also have photos of famous people that have stayed there  a hotel channel that tells the history and famous people and the scandals they were mixed up in as a guest 
The Clock Bar is very cozy Go early to get a seat After dinner it gets packed The bartenders are great they had a diverse drink menu and eccentric crowd 
We stayed in a deluxe tower room with king bed on the 19th floor The front desk staff was very friendly and when I told them it was our first time in SF they made sure we were assigned to a room with a great view We could see all the way to the water even though we were in the heart of Union Square We had a corner room with the bay window shown on the website as well as a side window The room was just like the picture It was huge with a large Lshaped hallway that led to the bedtoom I dont know why they dont show the bathroom online Its marble with a tub big enough to soak in and the normal Westin heavenly shower We had a flat panel TV with plenty of channels I really liked all the dark wood and beautiful crystal chandeliers in the lobby Its very elegant We found a great special online three nights for the price of two otherwise it would have been close to 350 per nt for the room we chose If I could get a similar deal Wed definitely stay there again Otherwise it would be a bit pricey and wed probably get a basic room there instead
If you are taking one of the hop on hop off bus tours they pick up right across the street Very convenient

title: Great location Poor value
text: Stayed for two nights whilst attending a conference at the hotel Clearly geared towards large conferences even the lifts were trying to sell me litigation software the location is perfect for getting to Central Park the shopping around FifthMadison Av Times Square and Broadway  theyre all a ten minute walk away Gym was surprisingly big and well equipped though pretty busy Beyond that though it all goes a bit downhill Maybe I expected too much from a giant conference venue in NYC Aircon and lifts very noisy room so small there wasnt space for a cabinet on both sides of the bed breakfast service was appalling though the food was OK As a base for exploring New York it would work quite well but if youre planning on staying in your hotel why would you do that in NY then try the W on Times Square

title: Perfect Location For Me
text:
This hotel is right next door to my daughters apartment building so it was ideal for me Room was very nice clean and reasonably large with a great Hudson River view Although I didnt have much interaction with staff those that I did encounter were very helpful and pleasant 
Its in the Battery Park City area so a bit removed from midtown and a lot that is the City but its proximity to 911 Memorial Battery Park Financial District Ferry etc is excellent and all are but a few minutes walk Shopping at Hermes boutique on Broad Street is always a treat And a visit to The Palm Restaurant in Tribeca is a must Its within walking distance of hotel but area construction does make it a bit tricky especially if you dont know your way around At night its pretty quiet but that makes for a good nights sleep so you are ready for the excitement the next day will bring As NY hotels go price was quite reasonable I highly recommend

title: Good For Business
text:
I found the hotel very comfortable and ideal as a venue for meetings and for access to other parts of the city
The room was very spacious with a view over the harbour
The price was reasonable considering the location and convenience

title: Great location
text:
We think this place is good value for moneypleasant  helpful staff and good location The area looked a bit rough when we arrived but having walked into town  and back  at night turned out to be safe
The room was fantasticclean  comfy bed  coffee making machine  a safe  and many small extras The view was the hotel suitesbut we were not there for the view Breakfast was loud  but very good with a key system to enterDont forget your room key
Parking was extra From the hotel you can walk to the Towerwe went early and there where no queuesas we left there was a long queue We got the mono rail to the waterfront market very cheap Had lunch overlooking the bayreally great place to visit
Stayed 3 nights and would recommend Only draw back is the main road at the frontyou have to go to the lights to cross and there is no road crossing for cars
We had a problem with the plumbing and the service engender was there in minutes

title: Excellent in every catagory
text: I booked three nights here during a trade show because it was 100 per night less expensive than the Hyatt who was hosting the show I was pleasantly surprised to find out how much value I got at the Conrad Great location to some awesome restaurants sweet room and some of the friendliest staff that I have met in all of my travels Great job Conrad

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Washington Hilton is perfect for anyone visiting Washington for the first time The hotel is in a fantastic location with restuarants roundabout for breakfast and meals The hotel itself is fantastic especially the beds and pillows we would love to know the make of the beds and pillows which are in the hotel as we did not have one bad night sleep or wake up with any pains after all the walking that we were doing between sightseeing and also on the day of the earthquake we had to walk from Union Station to the Hotel The hotel should be compliemented on all their services which they provide especially the cleanliness of all the areas within the hotel Tour bus tickets can be bought in the hotel and stops right outside the hotel which is even better We would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Washington and the Metro is not to far away for anyone not wanting the tour bus but this is a perfect way to see Washington

title: We had a great stay
text: The room was very nice We had a king size bedThe room was roomy enough for my husband and I to stay in We enjoyed the view of Chicago outside our windows Beautiful The bathroom was very nice They had a seperate glass see through shower and a very deep bath to soak in after a day of touring  Anything we needed assistance with the help at Sutton were right on top of it There was hardly a wait I would recommend this place to others for sure This was my first time going to a bigger city and staying over night and I have to say I was very nervous and looked online along time after finding The Sutton Place on a discount site I booked it right away There are sit down resturaunts right across the street for all times of the day and that would meet any price ranges even subway  Walk out and you can start your shopping experience there are so many shops and the magnificent mile is just a block away Navy pier was a good time and Shedd Aquarium Take a taxi everywhere if possible you will more than likely save money rather than taking your car everywhere Parking prices are rediculous in Chicago The only thing I wasnt happy with is I feel the 55 a night to keep our car at the Sutton Place was rediculous I could see maybe 20 or better yet include it as something you give to your guests free of charge because they chose your hotel We also were happy that when we arrived in Chicago we were able to check in at 12 or 1 so earlier than the check in time and then we were able to go on with our day so that was nice All in all we had a very nice stay and yes I will be going back

title: Home away from home
text: We stayed 5 nights at the TownePlace Suites while having some remodeling done at our house It was very comfortable for us with a well appointed kitchenette cozy seating area good bed and desk While the walls were a bit thin everything else was to our liking and our time there was quite enjoyable Since I dont have a laptop I especially appreciated the computer with internet access in the lobby area where I could check my emails each morning The fitness center is small but all the machines were in working order and it was very clean I recommend TownePlace for anyone traveling to Denver its great for an extended stay

title: Loved the Holiday Inn Manhattan 6th Ave
text: This was our first time going to New York City and we absolutely loved it The hotel room was small but cozy It felt like we were at home The bed was the best Ive slept on while being on vacation The staff was so helpful and the location was great When I return to New York Ill definitely stay at this hotel again without a doubt The tshirts are right when they sayI love New York

title: Room was moldy
text:
room smelled like moldyou could see mold in the tubwhen i checked in on saturday agent failed to tell me the following day there would be a festival that would on shut down all street including the one in front of the hotel making it impossible to get a taxi to anywhere
The deorative pillows on the bed were so filthy i have to put them on the floor I would never stay here again even for half the price

title: Great hotel and service
text: My family and I stayed here in December 2011 during our visit to Phoenix The hotel was clean and the personal was nice The beds were comfortable the bathroom and shower were clean Furthermore the price was excellent for a hotel so close to downtown

title: Small but hip
text: The Pod Hotel was a great place to stay in NYC The hotel is stylish and hip It is located in Midtown and is just two blocks from the Lexington Avenue  53rd Street Subway station The rooms or pods are small but they are sufficient Everything is clean and well maintained Not all of the rooms have their own bathrooms however mine did I found the bathroom to be odd The shower stall was enclosed in clear glass meaning that whenever anyone showers all can be seen Keep in mind that the shower is in the room on one side not in an enclosed room The staff was nice and helpful This is the perfect place if you want to get close to your lover

title: Sweet place but make sure you get the right room for you
text:
The Inn is made up of several houses and I dont think there are lifts in any of themThere seems to be a huge difference in the size of the rooms in the different buildings Two colleagues of mine were in rooms in the main buildings right on Ferry Street and they were absolutely enormous with stunning bathrooms My room was in one of the two carriage houses set behind the main ones and it was much smaller I remember the shower in the bathroom being really quite small However once Id got over my jealousy I reasoned that my room was warm and extremely comfortable For breakfast you have to walk over to the main house  but there is a wide range of good food
The Inn is ideally placed for the Museum district and there are a couple of shops and restaurants nearby but to go downtown you need a car or to arrange something with the hotels shuttle service I think the wifi only works in the main house  or at least I couldnt get it to work in the carriage house I was grateful for the computer room uptairs from the reception

title: Nice Place to Stay
text: Very clean room excellent service everyone was very nice and helpful Room had great plugins in the lamps on nightstands also an IHome dock which was great Nice frig and microwave Large comfortable sofa bed was a bit hard Bedding very clean If looking for hair dryer it is in the closet not attached to wall in bathroom Wonderful complimentary breakfast with lots to eat Check out is nice and late if needed  1200 Hotel was very kind to hold our luggage after checkout so we could go down to the waterfront and not have to worry about our car getting broken into There is no room service DVD or payperview TV Room was quiet dont know if the nearby rooms were empty or if walls were soundproof

title: Luxury At Its Finest
text:
If you have ever wondered what true luxury is but you havent been able to experience it that is because perhaps you have never been to this majestic landmark nestled in the center of our nations capital
From arrival to departure everything about this hotel is absolutely flawless The staff is the most courteous and genuine always going out of their way to help and ensure you feel at home Singling anyone out would be unfair to the rest of the team especially those behind the scenes that dont have the opportunity to interact with you and make you feel special through simple acts of kindness such as remembering your name and addressing you by name and a warm smile every time they see you
The hotel itself is beautifully adorned italian renaissance design with all the modern amenities expected in a luxury hotel The location is superb as you can walk everywhere and the White House is a block from the hotel From there you are minutes to monuments culture museums restaurants shopping and a beautiful city 
A visit to The St Regis and Washington DC is not complete if you do not treat yourself to the best dinner of your life at the hotels restaurant Adour where you will be immersed in the culinary delights of Alain Ducasse The food nirvana The setting gorgeous eclectic and seductive The service unparalleled
Do yourself a favor and go nowyou can thank me later

title: Great location  not so good place
text:
The location is great but the place is not so good The room was dark and very old fashioned and during my 5 day stay the room was serviced daily but never properly cleaned There was dust everywhere which remained there throughout the stay So much dust that I woke up sneezing every morning
The lifts were a nightmare 3 times I had to use the stairs walked down 24 flights as they took 1015 mins to arrive There are 2 elevators and one seems to be used by the service guys most of the time so they lock this off Twice the elevators broke and the fire brigade came out with no apologies from the staff
I asked the front desk to recommend a good Thai restaurant but they said they didnt know of any yet in their inroom dining guide they have one listed I tried that one and it was the worse most unauthentic Thai food Id ever tried so dont use them
My coffee maker also didnt work and 3 times I could not get into my room as the card would not work Again no apologies and it was almost an inconvenience to them when I complained

title: Best place to stay in San Antonio
text: As soon as we entered we were greeted by the staff who were all friendly and helpful The hotel was very modern and had comfy sofas and beds The location was great my friends and i walked to the Alamo World Genus Museum the Haunted house and also did the 3d Tomb Raider rider The food at the hotel was amazing The Best food item was the Fried Macaroni Balls the Pizza was really good tooooo We also had a birthday partygathering and had food catered to us The chef and the 4 course meal were amazing We had a soup salad and entree chicken or steak and dessert for a reasonable price The overall experience was amazing and I would definitely recommend the Riverwalk Plaza and hotel to everyone

title: Great Stay for 5 families
text:
We had booked 5 rooms and had several people coming in at different times The hotel was great at helping us be on the same floor although a little spread out on the same floor This was after several phone calls to ensure we would be on the same floor and hopefully even adjoining We did not get adjoining suites hence the 4 stars instead of the 5 The breakfast was great and the evening happy hour was pretty good too although in the evening it was a little light on snacks 
Overall a great stay and we enjoyed our time in denver and this hotel

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
Stayed at this hotel for the weekend Got an amazing rate through the Marriott web site  despite the fact that every other decent hotel in DC was sold out The rooms are extremely well appointed and they accomodated all my special requests The staff was very friendly and helpful
My only complaints are that the hotel is very large and very busy The main ballroom is located on the entrance floor which creates excessive traffic in the lobby area every night Also the room service prices are excessive youre better off grabbing a bite somewhere in town
Overall I highly recommend this hotel

title: great location
text:
stayed at Nine Zero for a long weekend  great location  wonderful view from our 17th floor room a bit pricey but the bed was so comfortable The mini bar was full of expensive stuff  we asked if we could take a few things out to add our own cokes  milk  they said no problem
We walked to Quincy Marketplace The hotel is close to Sam Lagrassas  which was yummy

title: After staying at the W in Times Square the W in Sputh Beach this by far is the best maintained facility
text: Nice hotel room was nice My only complaint is that Ive noticed at all W hotels is the exhaust vent in the bathroom is filthy Thats 3 W hotels in less than a month This seems to be the only one that keeps the rest of the property and room well maintained unlike my last 2 W hotel stays This is by far the best But why cant any of them seek to noticed a thick layer of dust on the exhaust vent Pretty nasty if you ask me

title: Great in every way
text: Good and central for everything but check that your room does not face the train station as train go by through the night blasting their hooters

title: Unbeatable
text: I stayed at the Gem Hotel and truly it was a gem The staff were very congenial and helpful It is clean quiet and well priced A quick walk gets you to any number of great restaurants I really hate to share this fantastic spot but if I dont they may leave So when staying for fun or business they have earned my allegiance as they will earn yours if you stay here

title: Noisy dirty and poor service
text:
The location is the only good feature of this hotel The first night I didnt sleep because of noisy neighbors And this was a Tuesday Saturday night was apparently party night both in the hotel and the neighborhood I arranged to move rooms the morning after the first night and was later told it was not possible because they were fully booked They ran out of caffeinated coffee for the rooms on Saturday and I was told it would be available on Monday I normally choose Best Western accommodations because they are uniformly clean and adequate This room had dirty carpet heating and ac did not work The towel racks were not even hung on a level The people at the desk might as well have a sign on their forehead saying tell someone who cares 
I asked for and received permission to check out  1230 and I had people calling me and asking when I would be leaving

title: Great experience Very clean hotel  the staff was extremely friendly
text: Loved our stay in the North end The hotel is only blocks from the train station and Faneuil Hall The room was very comfortable  clean and the staff was super friendly Thanks for a great weekend in Boston

title: Terrific Hotel
text: The Best Western Island Palms is a beautiful hotel that is centrally locatedminutes away from downtown the Gaslamp District La Jolla the airport and many other destinations The rooms were very clean and the view from the 3rd floor marina rooms was fantastic Danny at the front desk was so helpful and upgraded our room Everyone we dealt with from the hotel was fantastic and the food at the restaurant was very good We will stay here every time we go to San Diego

title: Great Location
text: Nice trendy hotel as expected for Aloft Fantastic location Would certainly stay there again with the wifey Not with the kids not a hotel designed for kidos Lobby area is done nicely with a pool table and the pantry is very convenient

title: Argonaut great for families
text:
What a great place particularly for families with young kids Very good staff not fawning  just friendly cool and on the ball They sorted out babysitters and had a kids treasure box of free cheap toys 
Very new hotel lots of space everywhere and although the nautical theme is taken a bit far its not distasteful actually quite fun 
The Blue Mermaid restaurant is pretty good great with kids nice and relaxed and good value Why it shuts at 9pm was beyond us  go there early
Lovely big suite for 479 a night  tax which we thought was good value compared to our horror experience at its sister hotel the Triton Modern very clean and spacious with a superb deep hottub bath and Alcatraz framed in our bedroom window like a postcard 
The area is touristy but not crowded and we liked it as a base for a 3 day stay The cable car stop is just round the corner so off you go into the rest of the city and its very handy for the Golden Gate Bridge Alcatraz bike hire next door seafood restaurants and so on Cabs are so cheap that you can get to Union Square for 9 so being out of the centre doesnt really matter and it has a nice laid back vibe down there 
The wine tasting was a bit of a joke  a choice of two cheap wines one of which was from Australia but at least it filled up the spacious lounge with happy guests
One thing  dont make the mistake I made and call abroad from the rooms phone I had to change our rental car booking and a 10 minute call to an international Freephone number cost 128 They halved it when I complained but even so
Phone charges aside wed highly recommend The Argonaut

title: Great Getaway
text:
We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Arizona Grand Resort The accomodations were clean and spacious My kids found the room comfortable and enjoyed having a TV of their own to watch During the daytime the water park was both fun and relaxing I definitely would recommend the Santa Fe burger for lunch
We found the service to be friendly and personalized starting at checkin and throughout our stay We are looking forward to staying at the resort again

title: Centrally located hotel
text: Accomodations were clean and comfortable Best feature was that the hotel is within walking distance 2 blocks of the Smithsonian and National Air and Space Museum One negative was the Smithsonian restaurant in the hotel not at the museum The service was terrible Parking is onsite and only 25day and easily accessible from the lobby elevators

title: Great LocationCleanBut Overpriced
text: Staff was very pleasant and helpful especially with explaining how the hopon hopoff trolley operates Great locationjust blocks away definitely within walking distance from many eateries and places to shop Also very close to the Boston Common I have no complaints with the staff or the hotel itself although its very odd that registration  concierge are on the 3rd floor and we had to use 2 separate elevators to get from street level to registration to our roommy only real complaint is the value I dont have a problem for paying a lot for a city hotel but for the price I feel each room should have a fridge and microwave and that the hotel should have snack  soda vending machines The gift shop is extremely overpriced especially for snacks and drinks We ended up walking to a nearby CVS to buy snacks and drinks to save money A souvenir shot glass in other gift shops was 5 but the same shot glass was 10 in this hotel The hotel was very clean and thats always a plus

title: Amazing Location  Lovely Staff
text:
We stayed at Hotel Edison for our Honeymoon on Aug 23rd for 4 nights I am a travel agent so was recommended to me by the operator at Kuoni Travel  who i booked through I am so glad i booked this hotel 
After our amazing flight being upgraded to business class it was so nice to also be greeted by lovely staff at this hotel The porters were stood outside to greet you and help you with your bags We got a taxi from the airport as it was quicker which cost about 50 Check in was efficient and quick Dont know if we were just pure lucky but we were allocated a room on 4th floor which was huge Looks like we got the newly refurbished disabled room we had flat screen tv on the wall queen size bed the bathroom was a wet room Also had a street view  facing the Barrymore Theatre Theres a safe behind reception which you can use you are given a key for the duration of your stay Theres a cafe attatched to it which serve lovely breakfast Again they are quick and efficient also reasonably priced 
The best thing about the hotel is the location Round the corner from BroadwayTimes Square where its all happening We walked every where in midtown because of the fab location Greyline buses leave round the corner from the hotel too  which i recommend booking if you want to see the whole of New York Lots of places to eat and drink Theres a Starbucks on the corner where you get free wifi Dannys deli is next door but one which is open 24 hour my husband used to get some beers from there and take them back to our room
