We had a late flight home check out time was 12pm There is somewhere where you can store your cases  charge 1 per bag which is worth it so you can still explore NYC Theres also a big lobby where you can wait to grab a taxi to the airport 
The only thing that may bother some people esp the light sleepers is that because of the location it can be noisy It didnt bother us because thats New York If it does ask for a high floor Overall a brill stay at Hotel Edison would defo stay here again

title: This is the ONLY place to stay in Indianapolis
text:
This is the ONLY place to stay in Indianapolis Very impressed Its obvious the new owners worked very hard and are dedicated to making sure your stay is enjoyable I travel a lot and customer service is very important Everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to be accommodating Rooms were clean and comfortable Great Restaurant Location is perfect I wouldnt think of staying anywhere else Thank you to the new owners for making us feel at home
On another note I was shocked to see a couple negative comments and can only assume those people didnt communicate with the staff or the owner directly Cant fix it if you dont know its broke How many places can you contact the actual owner or speak to them personally You cant get that kind of service from big corporate chains  youd just get an 800 number to call Communication is key
Looking forward to staying there the next time were in town
Thanks again

title: Your needs will determine if this hotel is satisfactory for you
text:
We stayed in the Comfort Suites Mission Valley San Diego CA for 5 nights in July 2006
It depends on your needs to determine if this hotel is satisfactory for you
The prior reviews were accurate but that does not necessarily mean you should not stay here
1ParkingAs opposed to other hotels in San Diego parking here is free The spots surrounded the building there were quite a number of spots but still I wonder if one would get shut out if one arrived real late at night We got back late a few times did find a spot but we had to back in  as the spots were tight
If you are a good driver are adept at backing into a spot then you will be OK
So parking is free which is a positive
2The breakfast is typical Choice Hotel breakfast cereals bread danishes juices coffee and this hotel even had hard boiled eggs too
Aside from the indoor breakfast room there was an outdoor eating area also We were earlybirds so we were able to get an outside table each morning
I dont know why anybody would knock the breakfast at this hotel it was fine
3Location
This hotel was one of many hotels that were near each other
A reference to the AAA Tour Book spotting map will show that there are many hotels in the vicinity
I found the location of this hotel outstanding It is actually on the service road of one of the freeways
This hotel is centrally located as it is near 3 freeways concurrently
We went to 
Wild Animal Park
SD Zoo
Seaworld
Balboa Park Museums
SD Airport
The Wild Animal Park is a bit of a ride North but the other places and Airport are minutes from the hotel
In addition we were not real far from downtown and visited the
shops along the harbor
The entrance to the freeway was just a few blocks from the hotel what more could you ask for
4Movie charge
I just reread one of the reviews before I wrote this and was incredulous that I had the same thing happen to me
The night before we left I channel surfed for a few minutes while my wife was packing the luggage
When I got the bill the next morning there was a charge for a movie I told the girl that I did not watch a movie I just channel surfed for a few minutes She asked if somebody else was in the room with me and I told her my wife was  but she never even touched the TV She eventually took the movie off the bill but it took a few minutes to get it straight and I had a plane to catch at SD Airport I was not thrilled that I was even doubted
5The room itself decide for yourself
As mentioned in prior reviews this really was 1 room and a partial wall was installed to make 2 separate areas
You come into the room and the sleeping area is first
The air conditioner is in the next section not the section that you sleep in
To circulate the air they installed a fan IN the wall separating the 2 areas The fan is by BROAN the range hood people and the sound is identical to the sound that your range hood fan makes
We spent each day we were in SD out all day long and did not return until dark Entire days at Wild Animal Park LegoLand SD Zoo Museums Seaworld so we were pretty tired by the time we got back to the hotel showered and went to sleep
Somehow that fan did not bother us and we slept well each night
So if you can handle a fan whirring over your bed it will not be an issue if you are a light sleeper you will have a problem
There was a desk to work on next to the AC so you froze while working at the desk
The cold air did not seem to come into the sleeping area fan and all Still we were able to sleep
Conclusion
You need to decide what is important in your life
I liked the great access to several freeways
I liked the breakfast  it was fine
I liked the free parking if you found a spot and know how to back in you will be fine
The place was secure as your plastic room key got you into the outside property doors as well
The hotel was reasonable priced
If you just need a place to have breakfast sleep and shower you will be OK with this hotel
Downside
The room is claustrophobic as it is real crowded with that wall more a hindrance than a help
I was in an Embassy Suite and that is really a Suite
This may say Comfort Suite but I do not agree this is not a suite simply a room with a wall that divides one room doing more harm than good
I called Choice Hotels and stated my displeasure with this setup and the girl told me many of the Comfort Suites are like this
I will make it my business to stay in a regular room next time
I will not turn my back on Choice Hotels as I have been happy in many other properties that I have stayed in
I once stayed in a Clarion and it was magnificent and I once stayed in a Sleep Inn that was fabulous
You must really do some soul searching about this particular property to see if you can deal with a fan over your head while you are trying to sleep
The breakfast free parking easy access are all things that are right

title: Great location great service
text: Really enjoyed my brief stay The hotel was very centrally located The service was fantastic and the food was really good too Nice change of pace from the standard hotel chains

title: The staff went the extra mile when I left clothes behind
text: Thanks to Billy in Security I stayed at the hotel for a conference and accidentally left a jacket behind when I checked out I didnt notice till I was on my plane somewhere over Kansas I called the hotel they put me in touch with Billy and he shipped my jacket overnight Just like that Great service

title: Decent Marriott Fine for a Night by the Airport
text:
We recently stayed at this hotel for just one night after arriving into Phoenix on a late flight from the east coast The hotel isnt too far from the airport but it is probably three miles or so from it Airport hotels in Phoenix arent clustered right around the airport like they are in some other cities so be aware of this We had printed directions ahead of time but especially at night coming from the rental car center we wouldnt have known where to go otherwise 
The hotel is generally pretty nice Weve stayed at better and worse Marriotts in the past The hotel is perched right at the intersection of a couple highways so Id recommend requesting a room away from the highway if youre worried about noise We were given a room on the side away from the highway and had a nice view facing Scottsdale and Camelback Mountain 
The hotel itself is nice enough The lobby is nice and the grounds are well manicured with free parking The rooms are a decent size and ours was clean The room dcor is a little outdated a sort of southwestern motif There have been updates made to the rooms such as the new Marriott bedding It was the light fixtures furniture etc that looked outdated A full renovation of our room had not been completed and the same goes for the hallways 
Otherwise we didnt really see anything remarkable about this hotel It served perfectly well for a quick night by the airport before moving on to the Grand Canyon I wouldnt stay here for a vacation 
In terms of things in the area around the hotel I dont think there was much within walking distance A couple minutes drive up the road will get you to some grocery stores Target and chain restaurants The area generally looked safe but not fancy I think its a perfectly acceptable place to stay for a night near PHX

title: Nice Hotel but
text: The hotel itself is very nice The staff was great from checkin to checkout room was vbery nice and comfrtable I stayed for a conference that was in the hotel and it went well I did not eat at the hotel though they do have one resturant and the coffee shop The Sheraton is connected to the Marriott that has a food court which was very nice and that was where we had lunch everyday In the evening we walked to main street and ate at the Iron Cactus one night and then Wild Salsa another night Very good but expensive margaritas we also walked around downtown and saw some of the parks etc We rode on the rapid transit tram just for something to do and ended up in the west end and ate at a steak house It appears that they are trying to reviatlize downtown Dallas but have a way to go Good food within walking distance but if you are looking for something else to do youll have to go by bus taxi tram etc

title: Standing up to the Sofitel brand
text: Have stayed in Sofitel Lafayette Square twice Will keep coming back for its perfect location in the proximity of landmarks in DC and the museum district Their friendly service and delightful room service meals extraordinary breakfast selection is consistent with the high standard that Sofitel offers Rooms are spacious and well appointed with an extremely comfortable bed Highly recommended

title: Nice hotel in a great location but needs a little customer service training
text: We check in to this hotel after having a bad experience at another hotel a few blocks away The doormen were all very helpful and seemed very genuine We arrived around 8 am because we could not stay in the previous hotel any longer and the front desk got us checked in and to our rooms in just a few moments The room was also very comfortable and there was plenty or room for the four large pieces of luggage we brought There were a few small issues 1 I requested another blanket and called several times but never received the blanket The next morning I went to the front desk and let them know that I needed a blanket for that evening and it was taken care of 2 My rate included a daily coffee card subway card movie and mini bar credit I had to visit the desk three times to get this included value including the morning I check out to remove the mini bar charges 3 the afternoon before check out the next morning we called about weighing our luggage and were told not a problem just bring it down to the business center So at 530 pm we go down to the business center with four large bags wait inside the business center that appears to be closed until someone from the front desk finally comes over to ask if they can help She offers to find us some help In the meantime 545 pm the gentleman that actually works in the business center appears and says he is closing at 600 pm and does not have time to weigh our luggage that will take all of 30 seconds So we ask him to get us someone willing to help He sighs and gets the scale Overall this hotel is really a good hotel that could be great with just a little customer service and pride from the staff

title: Perfect accomodations
text: I am becoming a regular customer at the Vagabond Inn on Hotel Circle when I come to San Diego The rooms are clean the beds are comfortable and the service is great There are restaurants close by but they offer fresh cooked waffles cold cereal juice and fresh fruit for breakfast a convenience store right next to the hotel microwave and fridge in each room and the freeway is just down the street The hot tub is like icing on the cake

title: Great place to stay
text: We spent 11 nights at the Ocean Park Inn and enjoyed every one of them Yes there is construction going on in the hotel they are replacing balcony decks and railings and air conditioners and next door to it they are rebuilding the lifeguard tower We didnt find either project to be excessively noisy in fact many rooms were closed so the hotel was quieter than it might have been and the flow on the boardwalk was interrupted so it was quieter as well This hotel was somewhat removed from the party section of the beach which was great for our family we only had to walk out our the secure hotel gate and a few feet down the boardwalk to reach the stairs to the beach The room was very clean the bathroom somewhat dated but large and the beds were very comfortable The breakfast was great as well and they do now offer cream cheese with the bagels The building is of wood construction so there is some sound transference we could hear water running and loud discussions if they took place in the bathroom Most of noise we heard was created by incredibly rude people who felt that having loud discussions in the hallway or letting their kids play soccer there was perfectly acceptable They rank right up there with the ones who bypassed the handy outdoor shower and went straight into the pool or their rooms sand and all The pool was nicely warm and cleaned regularly There are lots of restaruants nearby our favorites were Taylors right next door and Joes Crab Shack a few doors down It was easy to drive to the attractions we wanted to see Sea World was about a 10 minute drive away Our view was overlooking a very old motel however we could see the ocean and it was quiet Our only issue with this hotel is that although it is a totally nonsmoking hotel they allow people to smoke on the balcony with the door closed As a result we were treated to flicked ashes and the smell of cigarettes on several occasions

title: Surprisingly upscale
text: Close to the convention center and next door to the more toney JW Marriott this sister hotel was a surprise with a modern upscale design and nicely appointed rooms My room wasnt a full suite bedroom with a door but perfectly fine for my purposes If you are there with the family an upgrade might be in order The staff were friendly and professional and the included continental breakfast was quite decent Applebees is attached should you want something more substantial The hotel is well located only a short walk to the tourist action but in a quiet section of the downtown  It was definitely a pleasant surprise at an excellent rate

title: Basic accomodations near downtown
text: Stayed here in late January Parking is indeed 10 which seems strange since we are not in the center of downtown Room was nice clean and modern but nothing outstanding Late checkout available for priority rewards members  but beware of the managers and housekeeping that will call your room and knock on the door every 15 minutes starting at noon Ruined the extra sleep and relaxing we needed The shuttle service was excellent  now only if it ran later so we could actually have stayed out without paying for a cab or parking on top of hotel parking The staff at night was excellent Because the shuttle was running a bit slow they took the initiative to call the restaurant we had reservations for to let them know we would be late Above and beyond  very thoughtful There were loud teenagers from out of town that blew a foghorn at about 12 am and the staff was upstairs before we could inspect the hallway I would stay here again if the rate was significantly lower or if there were more amenitiesless fees

title: Cant Put Into Words How Great This Place Is
text: My husband surprised me for our anniversary this past weekend by taking me to Hotel ZaZa in Houston He kept telling me that the hotel was a surprise I couldnt imagine a hotel being any better than the many thousands of hotels weve already stayed in I was a flight attendant for over 8 years and felt that if you stayed in one you stayed in them all Boy was I surprised From the moment we pulled up to the hotel I could tell things we were different Once we stepped into the lobby I noticed how upscale the atmosphere was Surprisingly though the staff and service was very warm When I walked into our room Thats Entertainment concept suite my mouth dropped Our room was gorgeous and I loved the theme The Monarch restaurant was outstanding The chef came out and spoke to me because I requested to alter a dish He wanted to talk to me on how he could make my dish taste great with some other ideas on my request My husband and I were supposed to go out to a club later that night but we had such a good time at the restaurant we stayed there all night and partied We were treated like royalty our entire stay all the way to the last moment of our stay when a staff member opened my car door for me and gave me a bottle of water This hotel surpassed all other 4 star hotels Ive ever stayed in We will come back for every anniversary for the rest of our lives Cant wait till next year

title: Just Lovely
text:
We stayed here over Presidents Day Weekend for two nights and really enjoyed the place The rooms are beautifully decorated with warm textiles and colors The walls are hand stenciled The bathroom had very nice fixtures and pretty tiles The soaps were spa soaps not your typical hotelpaper wrapped variety The bed was big and fluffy 
My two complaints are minor Although quite comfortable the room was also quite small The room only had basic cable And rather than wireless internet there was cat5 at the desk in the room I like to sit on my laptop in bed
Still this was an aboveaverage comfortable and very clean place The gardens are absolutely stunning too

title: Historic Magic
text: If you book a reservation with the Driskill forget about popular chain hotel experiences Its not flashy and shiny Its more  its beautiful classy and magical This is a historical experience within a hotel setting Nice artwork all through the hotel and hallways We booked the QueenQueen with window because of the small room factor Yes its small but it was clean cozy and quiet The beds are so comfortable so much so the middle rod supporting it popped out while we were asleep The sound woke us up We laughed thought about the ghost storiesrolled over and went back to sleep The bed was still comfortable 82yr old Mom said I had the best sleep and she has a pillowtop at home Our bathroom was large enough to accomodate a wheelchair if necessary had good lighting upscale natural products extra soft towels and they provided a makeup mirror in the bedroom if you needed it We could adjust the temp of the room We were in Rm 909 facing out 7th street because we were traveling with my elderly Mom and needed a quiet place The size of the room helped us out she didnt feel scared or intimidated when we left her for the concert that evening The staff was great very professional not snobbish They didnt make me feel out of place and I appreciate that as I was worried about this Ive traveled in and out of country and that has been a sad issue at some hotels that think snobbishness  class We felt welcomed from the moment we got out of the car to go into the hotel I was happy to see people of all racesages enjoying themselves in the piano bar and lobbies for the holidaysThey had the largest Christmas tree Ive ever seen beautifully decorated 6th street is youthful too cool Had to ignore only 1 persistent young panhandler Felt it wouldnt be a safe idea to show financial compassion so many down I prayed instead Music everywhere After partying I stayed up and read sitting on this wonderful highback chair State Capitol few blocks over Good mix of youth and history Delicious bakery and coffee Didnt want to leave and going back to stay for a few days for the holidays 2012 It has flavorcharacter and its deserves all 4 stars I booked through Expedia got a good price

title: Great location for staying in Chicago
text:
We had a wonderful week in Chicago The Hilton Chicago is full of rich history as you learn on the elevator monitors and is in the perfect location for experiencing the city and getting a great view of Lake Michigan
The only negative the AC worked very poorly in the parlor portion of our suite where the kids slept on a Murphy bed in spite of several calls and attempts by engineering to remedy the situation Otherwise the room was quite comfortable with respect to furnishings  bedding

title: Beautiful rooms  friendly staff
text: Recently stayed here as part of a business trip Front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful especially Sarah who helped get a room ready after I arrived from a long flight and needed to get ready before meetings Rooms are very nice  clean modern and tastefully decorated And I appreciated the small touches like toothpaste Location is superb to convention center shopping light rail and waterfront Pool is beautiful and was quiet with only a few people there locker room is shared with spa and was also very nice and clean Only complaint is that I had trouble connecting to the wifi In short great hotel  friendly staff Would highly recommend

title: I will never stay here again
text: I found the staff very rude and the rooms very worn The place is a dump

title: Brilliant hotel
text:
I stayed at the library hotel with my wife for our honeymoon 
The location is brilliant slap ban in te middle of manhattan and very close to 2 subway lines 
The breakfast was absolutely brilliant and the complimentary cheese and wine and olives crackers salad etc was a great touch 
The rooms were nice 
The service was excellent on the whole 
There is also free wifi throughout the hotel including in the rooms and a computer station with printer if needed as well 
Only very slight problem is the lifts were a bit temperamental 
Overal its the best hotel I have stayed in

title: perfect location to Convention Center
text:
Stayed at Hampton Inn for a convention being held at The Pennsylvania Convention Center The hotel was around the corner from the Convention Center entrance so it was an easy walk I drove and used the valet parking I didnt need my car until checkout so Im not sure how easy it was to retrieve your car if you needed something in it The staff was very friendly and responsive Despite the large number of guests we never had to wait for elevators or in the breakfast area The food selections at breakfast were good The room was a good size and the shower had great water pressure Always ice in the ice machine We didnt get to use the pool or fitness room but we saw others who had used it I think the pool opened at 7am 
FOODThere was a great little pizza shop one block over cheesesteaks pizzas beer and the Sheraton had a small restaurantbarone block over in the other direction The Reading Terminal across from Convention Center was AMAZINGmore food choices in one place than Ive ever seen It closes at 6 pm but we went there for lunch each day 
 The Hampton Inn is in a perfect location for us and the value was great It is the city so there is alot of people milling around but we never felt unsafe I would definitely return there

title: I will definitely return to Sutton Place
text: This was my first stay at Sutton Place and I will definitely return the location is unbeatablethe service was exceptional and my room was outstanding in every way I will return to this hotel on future trips to Chicago regardless of whether Im travelling for business or fun First rate in every aspect

title: Excellent service walking distance to restaurants shopping and gaslamp district
text:
We stayed at this hotel for the last 4 days of our trip The hotel was very clean quiet and well maintained The lobby is on the located on the 12th floor of the hotel which was nice Upon entering the lobby we were greeted right away and told that we were able to check in even though check in wasnt for a couple of hours The lady at the counter was very friendly and helpful
We had a one bedroom suite that wasnt huge but definitely served its purpose It was very clean and modern The bed was super comfortable and shower had a lot of water pressure 
In the lobby they had quite a few computers available for guest use We were able to check in for our flight and print off our boarding passes with no problems
The hotel is equipped with a gym and an indoor pool The gym had 2 treadmills and 3 elliptical all of which were very modern and equipped with individual televisions It also had a universal that was really nice Some universals are awful but this one was new and fully functional
There is a restaurant as well as a little bar just past the lobby We didnt eat in the restaurant but we did have some appetizers in the lounge They had happy hour menu for both food and drinks The prices were good food was average In all fairness we only had a couple of appetizers the nachos which were really good and the hummus and the coconut shrimp both of which were average
Most other times we ate out Karl Strauss is within walking distance and has fantastic food and a great selection of beer We also ate on the patio at the Elephant  Castle across from the USS Intrepid Really good food and a great place for people watching 
The hotel is also within walking distance to the gas lamp district where they have tons of restaurants and a pretty big shopping centre 
We would definitely stay at this hotel again 
The only complaint we did have was nothing that the hotel could control but a message to others who are staying in hotels Please be mindful of your neighbors and try not to slam your doors

title: Topnotch hotel  staff
text:
We were very impressed with almost every aspect of our stay The staff  room were great We were in Chicago for a few days for a wedding and reception that was held in the hotel which they did a great job with Having it all under the same roof was wonderful Our room was a cityview king room on the 15th floor The room does not come with a coffee maker but one was cheerfully brought right up upon our request We called Relax  Rejuvenate spa services to our room for a manipedi for her and a massage for me Jessie  Amy were great Some posts accurately mention the seemingly everpresent sirens in Chicago We never travel without our white noise sound conditioner Its about the size of a pack of cigarettes and is great for masking just about any noise
Two complaints The only complaint that we had with the room was that the AC couldnt be adjusted low enough for our comfort while sleeping In fairness to the hotel we never gave the staff the opportunity to correct it by reporting it
Rooms were blocked at a discounted rate for the wedding that we were attending By my fault I was late in booking our room The rooms with the discounted rate were no longer available when I booked I called and tried to get a discounted rate for rooms that were still available without success I was hoping that they would work with me a bit
We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone without reservation

title: Beautiful hotel with excellent service
text:
We were recently in New York on a weekend girls trip While planning our trip we were torn between the Andaz and The London House NYC We ended up choosing The London because they had 2 bedroom suites that better met our needs 
While we were there we decided to visit the Andaz for future reference We had lunch in their restaurant and it was excellent The service was relaxed and friendly After lunch we spoke with the Concierge Dana Steer to see if we could see a room He showed us a magnificently appointed room that was very spacious by NYC standards He also gave us a tour of the hotel 
The Andaz is not only beautiful and well located everything in their minibar is complimentaryas is room service coffee upon request They seem to go above and beyond to make the guest feel welcome and comfortable We will certainly stay at the Andaz on our next visit Thank you Danayou were awesome

title: Large Appointed BIg Apple Room
text:
Overlooking Central Park with closets and chests of drawers a large bath and shower gigantic room with couch and easy chair in the middle of the action for no more than all the fanciest of the fanciestand a lot more value
Back in a flash

title: good location comfy clean and metrofriendly
text: nice clean hotel at a great location walking distance to Soho Chinatown Little Italy whats left of it Washington Square and battery park A 30 second walk to the subway Staff friendly and helpful If you can get the right price this is a good option

title: Great room great service
text:
My wife and I stayed here on a saturday night We found the service to be excellent whether it was the front desk the phone operators or the valets All were extremely prompt and polite The bed was fantastic and the room spacious clean and quiet
We were part of a group of about 5 rooms and everyone had positive things to say about including my friend who went to get in an elevator and found a couple having sex in it Good times
We paid 99 for the room and as written previously the valet service was pretty outrageous 54 with tax I too thought that 14 for internet service was a bit much
For 99 a night Id go back in a heartbeat

title: Phoenix Vacation
text: The hotel and staff was wonderful We went to Arizona for a week and stayed in 2 other Marriott hotels I picked each hotel out through Trip Advisor They were all wonderful We planned on staying here one night after landing at Phoenix Airport After 2hrs of being there we deceided to book the night before we planned to leave to return home the following week They gave us an excellent price for the night we booked to come back Breakfast was great Clean rooms Wonderful staff

title: Modern sleek and great location
text: The view from the room overlooked the lake Wow real treat Make sure to ask for the view Beds were clean cozy Furnishings incredibly modern and expensive Dont bring too many clothes because the closet is VERY small and no drawers for things like socks undies and bras The pool area is AWESOME Wow Concierge was very helpful and accommodating Hallways kind of You do not need a car here everything is nearby shopping bikewalk trail music everything Awesome smoothie place down the street that can fix you an alkaline recovery beverage if you drink too much the night before and an upscale bodega right next to that

title: Awesome brand new hotel
text:
This is by far the best Embassy suites Ive stayed in If youre attending an event at the George Brown Convention Centre it only takes less than 10 minutes walk The hotel is fairly new thus very clean and nice Room is spacious with pull out sofa bed especially ideal if you have kids There is a door to the room thus privacy Theres a microwave  fridge too
Breakfast is awesome Hot breakfast scrambled eggs potatoes sausages  bacon cooked to order scrambled eggs  the freshly made pancakes are awesome Theres also oatmeal breads muffins  other pastries 
Theres a Managers reception from 530700pm with wine  some light snacks Line can be very long if the hotel is busy Theres a pool too 
Rate may be a little high for an embassy suite but very convenient to the George Brown Convention centre 
Valet parking is 28 per nite though

title: Lovely place to stay Made extra special by the staff
text:
Everyone at Hotel Erwin was awesome The staff truly made this boutique hotel something special
The rooms were clean the hotel had a great vibe The rooftop lounge was awesome
Special thanks to Carl and Miguel who were so helpful

title: Surprisingly Nice
text: Was very surprised by the size  cleanliness of this place It was like a cute little apartment with mini kitchen full size fridge dish washer 2 burner stove  dishware  flatware also had 2 flat screen TVs and the bed was comfy I found out upon arrival about the free breakfast and was surprised at the variety offered eggs sausage bread bagels muffins waffles cereal fruit oatmeal coffee juice  sodas It was pretty awesome There was a sitting room off the lobby complete with books magazines  family friendly games

title: Cool and ok
text: The rooms and service was good with fun and clever design solutions Our only complaint is that the pool by the poolside bar wasnt served by the bar The staff was very helpfull and had good knowledge of local facilities

title: fab hotel luxurious helpful and good location
text: The room was spotless with a lovely bathroom view of the space needle and very clean Bearing in mind this was back in 2008 but I will always remember it as a great stay and would definitely go back Pricey but worth it I thought

title: Next to Washington State Convention Centre  Emerald City Comic Con
text:
If you want to be in the heart of downtown Seattle you cant get any better than this location I booked in for 2 nights to attend the Emerald City Comic Convention in early March 4 blocks away walking distance not a probably for haling my film gear  occasionally with my costume on 
If you are coming down from Vancouver BC like me the hotel is just off the highway
I was on the 26th floor The view of Downtown Seattle is perfect Sunrise view Restaurant served simply and rustic breakfast the bar had a happy hour beer selection
Good thing there were internet stations because I didnt bring my computer along but they do have wireless
Slept well very quiet Friendly staff

title: Good choice
text: This is a nice hotel that has recently been updated It is slightly hard to get to if you are not used to the freeway system in San Diego but is close to everything About 20 minutes or less to Sea World Old Town Gaslamp Quarter Their restaurant is a bit upscale so we skipped it Dennys is 12 block away and there are other places not far Parking was 14day with an inout pass The parking is underground with lobby entrance The staff is very polite and helpful We asked for extra shampoo and it was delivered while we were out Rooms are very nice We did not hear anyone else throughout our stay Nice and quiet Although I prefer breakfast on the premises I would stay here again Went for 2 nights with my daughter and granddaughter We had a great time and felt totally safe coming in late at night after sight seeing Enjoyed the privacy of entering hotel without having to walk through the lobby Very clean hotel

title: Alexander there are better than this
text: This hotel is priced slightly lower than most other Manhattan hotels for a reason The rooms themselves are nice enough but the shared bath is a pain in the butt There is only 1 bathroom per hall so you end up wandering the halls looking for an open toiletshower There is no complimentary breakfast and they even charged extra to hold our bags for a couple hours after checkout The Comfort Inn in the theater district was a better price free checked bags and complimentary breakfast with just as nice of a room and your own bathroom I am sure there are also several other better hotels than the Alexander in Manhattan which are in the same price range

title: Great location but not great for families
text:
I just noticed the other review noting not a great family location and wanted to share another perspective While we found the costs of the hotel reasonable the rooms do not allow for a family of four to comfortably share a room If you are looking at this hotel I would recommend getting two joining rooms or looking at the courtyard airport The hotels double bed rooms have only full size beds and while I love my husband if we were the least bit overweight it would have been way too crowded in a full bed The bathrooms were beautiful but the wireless is 10day Room is pitch black and soundproof  you will get a great night sleep
One reason we choose this hotel was the positive reviews however the hotel staff we encountered were ambivalent at best with the exception of the housecleaning who were top notch The other reason we choose this hotel was the location and that was AMAZING We had the best breakfast ever at Richard Walkers pancake house a short walk from the hotel and went to a museum

title: Great apart from noisy local bar
text: Crystal Pier is a unique place to stay and we have just got back from a wonderful holiday Some people have complained about the waves but then we were booked into one of the apartments above the office ie one of the sides of the entry arch These are bigger than the cottages but the bedroom overlooks the street and Blind Melons bar has fairly noisey live music until way after midnight  be warned

title: Laughably AWFUL
text: We got stuck here by US Air when our flight was cancelled and they did not even pay for it just gave us a discount Rate of 58night No one should pay a penny to stay here The shuttle aka unmarked gray van took forever to pick us up in the airport Then we waited forever at the front desk while they tried to figure out if they had any rooms The first room they sent us to already had people in it who we walked in on and probably terrified at 1130 pm on a Tuesday night The second rooms door would not open We are now sitting in the grosssmelling third room writing this review IIICCCKKK Do not stay here It smells and the room was approximately 100 degrees when we walked in US Air are jerks

title: Good hotel for the price you pay
text: I stayed here because they had a good rate of 130 for one night incl breakfast The hotel was adequate very modern and bright but kinda cheaply done The room was a little grim as the window was tiny The breakfast was ok not great I would have preferred a Starbucks but it was included so we had it All in all the experience was ok but I am glad it was only a quick one night stay The location is good close to Quincy Market and Little Italy about a ten minute walk to both

title: Definitely Overated Itself
text:
We chose this hotel for its location and good reviews But we were very disappointed by the following
1 The decorations without much taste Its image is far away from the so called  Best Boutique Hotel in San Francisco
2 The note about Minibar and free water was confusing  made us think there is nothing free Only on our last day we found out there is complimentary bottle of water per person per day We almost thought the teabags and coffee are free but its over priced We have to call to check and the person who anwered the phone couldnt explain clearly  poor English
3 Only on the last day we found out there is complimentary coffee from 600 800 AM The tea or coffee in the room are nothing free but over priced 
4 The front desk people didnt explain about the free services such as the free coffee to guests 
5 The room cleaning was very delayed  almost until the evening 
6 There is only duvet and no sheet between the comfortor and the sheet which is very weired The sheets are not vacuumed full of lints
7 The room is really very small for the price of 300weekend rate Besides there is no parking at all
8 The manager will not allow a late check out  usually other hotels will give us until 200 pm but she gave us nothing Not friendly at all
The only thing we miss are the door men They are very helpful in giving dinning directions and very nice 
After all we want to tell you that this is NOT the Best Boutique Hotel in San Francisco far away from it Therefore please dont fool by the price Its over priced

title: Normally Good  Someone must have been having a bad day
text: Ive stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions always good value Unfortunately this last stay was spoiled by breakfast There were only 4 other guests in breakfast area little after 700am but there was no egg on buffet When I enquired I was told it was being cooked and would be out soon Only hot items on buffet are eggs bacon gravy and biscuits plus their cinnamon rolls so I had 3 rashers of bacon thinking egg would be right out Orange juice was also out and although Im not a coffee drinker another guest asked if there was more coffee coming out Never did get OJ or eggs  eggs didnt arrive until I was leaving at least 10 minutes Hopefully this was just a bad day because this is normally a great hotel to stay at

title: Affordable style in a great location
text:
The Palace Hotel is a great base for a visit San Francisco being just a short walk or ride from almost anywhere We really enjoyed our stay there the place has a sense of character and history presumably being built just after the earthquake The best part  the ridiculously cheap price We paid less than 240 pounds for three nights through Expedia and that was for a slightly upgraded superior room That said best to consider it room only as you would have to be wealthy to use the bar or restaurant Who needs to with all sorts of eating places just outside
The room was not particularly spacious but had two comfortable beds and plenty of storage space in all nicely furnished We did not notice the deficiencies in housekeeping noted by other reviewers The only downside was the lack of internet access really 20th century It is said there is a hefty charge for internet in the rooms but no mention in the room guide and the receptionist I talked to denied it existed There was supposed to be wifi in the reception area but I couldnt get connected and other people seemed to be having the same trouble
We used the Hearst parking centre mentioned elsewhere but it would be better not to have a car at all The Montgomery stop was right outside with vintage streetcars buses etc on the road trams below and Bart below that Cable cars only five minutes away although get there early to avoid the queues
In summary a great hotel in a great city

title: Worst NY Hotel in years
text: Literally one of the worst hotel experiences in years The lobby is lovely but as soon as one leaves the lobby one is shocked The hallways are dirty with paint chipping and wallpaper peeling The room was dirty There is no way to control the air conditioning in each room  and when we called they said an engineer would come right up and no one ever did We had to call twice for towels And this for around 300 Never going there again

title: I called the hotel directly bypassed Hotelscom and they waived the per person room charge Great hotel
text: Newly Remodeled Super clean and spiffy Nice pool and pit fires at night to sit around Warm cookies when you check in Great location to down town mission valleybeware of the parking fees 15 a nightOUCH

title: Nice Hotelbut had some issues
text:
Just recently stayed at the Hyatt from July 49
Pros Costumer services are wonderful The front desk and managers are more then accomodating when you have an issue Received a free bottle of wine and a 50 dollar voucher when problems arose during my stay at the Hyatt The fitnesspoolspa area is wonderful It is like your are at a real gym This area is not crowded and everything is very clean and neat Also the hotels restaurant altitude had a wonderful breakfast They give you plenty of food and it was delicious Also the breakfast was great but only enjoyed it because we got it for free when we booked the hotel If you have to pay for it then it is not worth it Can be very expensive
Cons
Have to pay for internet You could go to 16 street mall to barnes and noble for free wifi but that can be annoying Although the worst part of all during my stay was how you can hear everything from your room Now I understand the hotel can not help this issue but be mindful when you book a room at this hotel Request a room that is not connected unless your staying with a group of people The problem is you can basically hear everything in the room next door Not fun when you are trying to sleep at 1200 in the morning and it literally feels that the people next store are in your room However when I complained about the noise the staff was more than accomodating to help which was really nice and appreciated Also if youre staying here it is not really a hotel to stay for leisure because whenever there is a convention going on those people ie the shriners take over the hotel which can be annoying at times

title: New York vacation
text: Very nice hotel The entire staff was very helpful and friendly This hotel is in the middle of everything you would want to do in Manhattan Just be aware you are at the north entrance to time square so it is crowded the minute you step out the front door

title: Radisson Hotel Fishermans Wharf is a Fantastic Hotel
text: This is an excellent hotel in San Francisco It has everything you want in a hotel First it has a heated pool for the very cool weather in San Francisco Second it has restaurants for breakfast lunch and dinner It has a Johnny Rockets and it has an IHOP inside of it It also has a very small fitness room The staff at the hotel was very friendly and the place was very clean The room we had was average size but the balcony in most of the rooms have an incredible view of the bay and alcatraz island The beds were very comfortable with the Sleep Number beds and the room was very clean The best thing about the hotel was the great location in fishermans wharf It is very close to Pier 39 which is the most popular place in san francisco and it is near lots of restaurants all up the wharf Also it is close to ghirardelli square Altogether this was a great hotel to stay for families and tourists

title: homewood suites great for the family
text: Upon the the recommendations of TripAdvisor reviews we chose Homewood Suites on Grand Ave one block from the Michigan Avenue for a two night stay the week after Easter It cost 179 per night plus parking We checked in an hour early and were given upon request a corner room on the top floor The indoor pool was on the same floor My wife and two daughters ages 8  10 enjoyed the pool and the convenience of walking down the hall to go swimming There is a free breakfast buffet and at 500 pm wine beer and a light dinner during the week The location was great and we had a 15 minute walk to the American Girl Store The conciergebellman Rod was very helpful and got as a discount for the river cruise which was also a short walk from the hotel The entire staff was very friendly and helpful Check out the Homewood Suites web cite for room details and prices

title: Second Time at this Hotel  still amazing
text: I stayed here for the second time with friends from late October to November and absolutely loved it The hotel again is situated in a great location  a central point to all the sites We stayed here for Halloween and it was insane It was the best experience of my life We went to the Halloween party at the hotel which was fantastic and we also partied heavily for Halloween on Hollywood Blvd which was also amazing We stayed in a Junior Suite and it was a great size and provided great views I would highly recommend this hotel  in particular during Halloween because like I said the party they throw is amazing and the parties just outside the hotel are even better Its in a perfect location for Halloween fun and the way the hotel does itself up for Halloween is incredible Love the Roosevelt

title: Raining on our heads and beds
text: Was very pleased when we arrived at this hotel It was clean and in a great location After a train ride down to the city and a night of sightseeing we were ready for a good night sleep Went to bed at 11pm only to be awakened at 130am to water driping Opened the bathroom door to a shower of water flowing out of the sprinkler head then water started pouring out of the sprinkler in bedroom and the the light fixture Water was flowing from all parts of the ceiling Tried to call the front desk but phones did not work Went down to front desk were there were many more guests with water leaking Front desk calling fire department Did get another room on the other side of the hotel but this was a smoking room and not very pleasant to sleep in for people that dont smoke All of this and no compensation Just a sorry This was an unforseen problem but some compensation should have been given

title: We will not stay anywhere else when we come to NY
text:
We have 25 yrs of NY concierge experience between us We now live out of state but travel to NY for business at least 10 times a year and will not stay anywhere else
The staff is professional and friendly 
Gemma is their fantastic northern Italian restaurant The lobbyatrium is perfect for business meetings or delicious cocktails made by true mixologists 
You will not be disappointed

title: Quirky and Elegant
text: This property is the perfect stay when in Austin The grounds are beautiful and include a relaxing pool area dining nooks lovely lighting and fun music Speaking of music when checking in take advantage of the record album library Each room has a phonograph so you can lay back and enjoy some retro tunes The bar serves up interesting drinks and snacks We were in room 8 and enjoyed a good view of Austin and a private balcony The check in with Eric was fast and friendly I wish we had been able to stay longer

title: Just adding another 5 stars
text:
The only issue was trying to use the elevator between 830  10 when everyone is either going to breakfast checking out or just leaving for the day They left voice mails warning people about the potential delay which I thought was very nice We stopped at another hotel where friends were staying and there was an actual line for the elevators so in the bigger picture it wasnt that bad
The included breakfast buffet was more than I expectedeggs sausage hash browns and hot oatmeal on top of what youd normally find on a free buffet Coffee available 247
HUGE room for NYC So worth the extra money if youre staying longer than one night and with more than one person in the room The kitchenette had actual glasses silverwear etc which the cleaning staff washed every day Theres even an ice maker in the fridge Cuts down costs when you can have a few cocktails in the room  
1 block from the 42nd st subway entrance easily walkable from the Liberty Express drop off point at Bryant Park Another winner from Marriott

title: Not bad at all
text:
Plenty of mixed reviews on this hotel But let me lay it out simply If you need a good clean room and bed  especially if you are attending a conference at the Convention Center  this one provides them both quite well No this is not a luxury hotel Its clean and quiet and the staff was very friendly at all hours The location while not exactly 5th Avenue never felt dangerous  even when cominggoing at 34am each day 
Yes there is a homeless shelter nearby but if you have done any travelling to any city in the world youve passed by hundreds of these things and chances are like me youve never had any problems I attended a conference in early fall so the cold weather hadnt arrived yet but there were still a few guys hanging out in front and I never had any issues with anyone 
One note while this hotel is literally across the street from the Convention Center you are actually facing the backdoorsloading dock area meaning that you will have to walk around the building to get to the main entrance Its probably no more than 14 mile to the front side and the majority of it is actually on a sidewalk along a road that goes through a section of the Convention Center itself meaning that it is mostly all sheltered from the weather One more thing to note there are nice big sidewalks the entire route from the hotel to the Convention Center and the rest of downtown
Lastly if you are looking to do some touristy sightseeing in Philly while staying at this hotel the same 14 mile easy walk from the hotel will get you to the citys trolley stop which will take you all around town for a few bucks

title: Reliable For The Purpose Once Again
text: I have stayed here twice in the past year or so Both times were for a one night stay the evening prior to a very early flight out of CMH This is one of just a few hotels directly on the airport campus and this is where the value is together with the reliable free shuttle to the airport plus the convenient parking The facility is slightly dated and the carpet and amenities are in need of update although I noted that the breakfastsitting area in the lobby was under construction last month for an update No complaints at all about the service and you cant beat the convenience especially for a one nighter prior to an early morning flight

title: Superb staff great location
text:
I visit NYC 3 or 4 times a year and think I have finally found the hotel I will book for every trip
My room and bathroom were clean spacious and comfortable The huge closet and window in the bathroom are rare in modern day hotels The only downside was the outside noise Even on the fifth floor it was loud Next time I will request a higher floor
The staff went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and happy Jennifer remembered my first name after checkin and called me by name each time we spoke That has never happened to me before
I love staying in Murray Hill because everything  subway restaurants deli bar  is as easy walk

title: Always pleasant
text:
My husband and I have stayed here 3x within this year 
Pro Centrally located decent staff nice rooms clean hotel and quiet
Con VALET For some reasons this hotel charges 48 if you look at other hotels nearby some charges as low as 35 There is also a car garage less than a block away where you can park 24 hrs for 28 if that makes a difference just no inout privilege INTERNET they charge per day or weekly Sucks if your there for business

title: Really nice hotel
text:
We stayed 11 nights in Hotel Deauville at may of 2012 Location is excellent with just a one minute walk to subway station Bread  Butter just across the street and Empire State Building and lots of other things to see and visit just 15 minutes walk away Staff was very nice and helped us everytime we had questions wanted to know good place to have breakfast or what ever we had in mind Room was small but clean and ok and since we didnt spend lots of time in our hotel room it didnt matter The old elevator was cool
Next time I visit NYC I will choose Hotel Deauville again

title: Similar to a W Hotel
text: The hotel has a great location It is clean and friendly Reminds me of a hip W Hotel but it is not You are welcomed with a glass of champaign and greeted with a smile They have a complimentary coffee machine in the lobby area Rooms are a bit small but were modern and clean The bathrooms are nice large and modern Solid 3 star not a 4 star

title: Excellent location and service
text: A friend and I went to Chicago over the St Patricks Day weekend and stayed at The Drake From the moment we arrived until the time we left we were catered to with graciousness and patience Check in took only minutes and the concierge desk attendants Marianne and Donald I think took care of us very well making dinner reservations boat tour reservations and adjusting our tea reservation to work with our changing schedules  always with a smile The room was very clean the linens were amazing and the plush bathrobes were a pleasant addition Breakfast was wonderful and depending on your room the views were quite good Location was best of all

title: Reasonable price great location free parking
text: Ive stayed at Becks many times over the last ten years It has been awhile since my last stay and a few things have changed Theyve continued to renovate the rooms and have added fairly robust free WIFI The lack of WIFI was the one reason Ive stayed elsewhere on the last coupe of visits You cant beat the location minutes walk to the Castro minutes to MUNI and free parking While it may not be the fanciest Becks provides a decent product at a reasonable price for San Francisco

title: Great hotel in the center of SF but small rooms
text:
A great hotel in the center of SF but the rooms where very small Weve stayed here for 5 nights but after 4 nights we travelled back to LA because of the small rooms 
Breakfast was not included

title: Great service the rest is ok
text: As usual the RitzCarlton stands out in service Very friendly staff and very helpful whether you need to know where to grab some food or where to shop However location wise I would only recommend this hotel for a business meeting Otherwise even though the view of the Statue of Liberty is pretty nice theres not much to do nearby specially on the food front The only recommended restaurant is an italian place just next to the hotel The rooms are ok nice tub very small shower They room was clean and the bed was comfy but nothing remarkable All in all if youre main concern is service this is the place to stay If what you are looking for is great food and attractions stay elsewhere

title: Pleasant stay at the Gunter
text: We stayed here for one night on August 19 2011 We got a really good deal on Expedia half off and for that price I would say I am very satisfied Check incheck out was fast and without any problems We had a deluxe king room on the sixth floor The room was very clean spacious and comfortable The bathroom was clean too but a little small Parking in the hotel was almost 30 so we found a parking garage one block away from the hotel and payed 9 per day We also liked that the hotel was really close to the riverwalk The only complaint would be that the room doors openclose very loudly so you can hear when everyone opens their door from your room Also you could hear the noise from the street Overall we had a good pleasant stay but if we had to pay full price we would probably stay at one of the other fancier hotels down the riverwalk

title: best location for a trip of a lifetime
text:
Perfect location for Broadway theatres Times Square 5th Avenue Outlet shopping and Restaurants
A great place as a base for a 34 day trip to New York Must visit the Sky Bar on the rooftop 
The rooms are fairly spacious and are clean Breakfast in the hotel is expensive  the service was okay However the food served was good

title: Non smoking room with a smell of smoke
text:
We stayed 4 nights in the Sheraton Universal LA Our room 2 were located on the 18th floor with a view on Universal studios Wide views When we arrived in the rooms located next to each other we smelled immediately that someone had been smoking although it were non smoking rooms Down to the reception where the staff did excuse the hotel for this and offered rooms on the 4th floor So we had to choose between smoke smell and view or no view and no smoke smell Being in the opinion that the smoke smell would disappear we stayed on the 18th floor Afterwards I can advise you that seen the fact that you cant open a window the smoke smell didnt disappear during our stay Room service did their best with a spray we did by a Febreze in the supermarket but no help 
Some people complain about the size of the bath room Indeed it isnt big and requires a good coordination between the room mates But everything was clean 
The breakfast buffet is good food including the fruits but we were missing some regular bread or toasts One can expect these basic ingredients for the price of the buffet
The service was very good up to the standard expectable for a Sheraton Hotel
The self parking is very easy close by and charged to the room Simply easy and convenient
Conclusion If nobody had been smoking in room 1810 before our stay I might have quoted this hotel a 5 star

title: Good but not for everyone
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights and were upgraded to a partial water view on the second night Great beautiful location but this hotel is definitely not for everyone Heres the scoop
Location
Right on the water close to the Seattle Art Museum The views from the lobby are amazing right onto the water Unfortunately it is right across the street from train tracks The last train on Friday night was around midnight and the first one Saturday morning was around 830 Last one Saturday night was around 6 pm A 5 minute walk to the aquarium along the water where you can get some yummy ice cream and gift shops Theres also an amusement center with games and a carousel for the kids Definitely take the elevator just a block or so walk away on the same side of the street up to the level of pike market From there it literally is a few minute walk away On the way there a World Market is a great place to get cheap snacksdrinks 079 for a litre of water versus 329 along the waters They sell beer and wine as well with other house hold knick knacks 
Hotel
As you approach the entrance youre greeted by an amazing outdoor fireplace and water fountain Great views from the lobby Floor to ceiling windows looking over the water Its definitely has a unique decor Fancy Alaskan decorations I wouldnt call it tacky as others have I quite liked it This hotel has been awarded the 4 diamond rating from AAA 4 years in a row according to the plaques on the wall Great seating area in the lobby a couple of fireplaces Parking valet is 33 plus tax 40 total per night Thats standard for all downtown Seattle hotels we stayed at the Westin once and it was 40 as well After reading reviews we parked across the street in a parkade Its where all the cruise ship passengers park their cars Only 20 per day Safe and secure in my opinion It closes at 11 pm and no in and out privileges Theres an attendant until it closes then the doors shut 
CheckIn
Greeted warmly by a cheerful lady No problems and she upgraded us for the second night
Room City View
As per previous reviewers no matter what floor youre on request a higher numbered room For example 238 is further away from the street and the noise than 211 Our room number was in the 30s so we were kind of in the middle We could see the Space Needle and part of the harbour Traffic noise was busy Friday as lots of people were in waiting to board the cruise ship the next day The train wasnt too bad with the windows closed but it does cause a low hum Much louder when the train blows its whistle I wasnt too bothered by it but I can see how others might be The room was on the smaller side but comfortable Nice flat screen tv The bathroom was nice yet small as well I didnt mind it but can see others wanting a bigger one Lovely rain shower head granite tiles in the shower Good ac Each room has a gas fireplace nice touch The room was definitely decorated nicely like a lodge A fully stocked fridge but no safe You can give valuables to the front desk Some parts of the room was squeaky so not sure how the people below us felt 
Room Water View
The next night we were upgraded to a partial water view Wow what a difference The rooms were much bigger There was also a bear that acted like a foot stool The patio was nice 2 patio chairs and a table We looked onto the cruise ship docks A cruise ship was docked so it obscured part of the view But we could still see out onto the water fairly well Wow nice very nice You could hear the water Once the cruise ship left at 4 pm the view turned out nicer We sat out on the patio and soaked in the view Definitely cant be beat I can only imagine what the full water view is like Being on a lower floor we could hear at times the people above us as well as the bathroom It really wasnt that bad but I can see how it might bother some 
Amenities
No pool Business center on the second floor with 2 computers with free internet A lounge and a restaurant with gorgeous views Didnt try the food but smelled good There is a gift shop on site Theres a free shuttle that will take you I believe anywhere within a mile or two 
Overall
I would recommend this hotel based on the excellent staff and location If youre a light sleeper then Im not so sure unless you have a room furthest away from the street The rooms are good even the city view We were lucky to have been upgraded City view is 355 but partial water is definitely 45

title: Stop by the Club
text: Nice stay here with a friend in downtown boston The service desk was super nice and held our bag for us after check out The pub next door is pretty cool until all the Kareoke singers get drunk but no worries you can just stumble up to your room Make sure you grab a purified water from the station in the hallway

title: Not terribly impressed with The Old Town Inn
text: We arrived at The Old Town Inn on 77th for a one night stay I was extremely excited to stay there after reading all the fabulous reviews here on Tripadvisor All the reviews I read praised David as being a wonderful host When we checked in David was helping another guest on the phone and seemed to be going out of his way to help this person searching for a vacant hotelthey were booked going as far as looking up phone numbers for this wayward traveler What great customer service Unfortunately as David was busy we were checked in by Sarah who has a lot to learn from David it seems she was curt short and never offered so much as a smile or a welcome The room being a non smoking room smelled musty and old sheets came off both beds throughout the night they dont seem to fit the pillowtop mattresses as they should I would reccommend this hotel for someone not looking for anything special just a clean place to sleep at night I was extremely disappointed as I expected a lot more

title: The knowledgeable professional and friendly staff make this an excellent choice
text: I have stayed here before and will do so againat least as long as my child remains at UW The hotel is well managed The experience from reservation to arrival to stay to departure compares with luxury hotels in terms of personal attention and friendliness If there is a notable detracting feature it is the limited exercise facility Bring along a TRX The hotel is not luxurious but makes up for that in cleanliness and comfort as well as very good value The free shuttle service is a nice touch and makes getting around for the uninitiated out of towers easy The GM Don is extremely approachable and very responsive His front desk manager Max and revenue and guest services manager Senada are superb and attentive I particularly like the top floor suites Lovely balconies made for cool crisp evening with friends wine and tapas Try this hotel You will not regret it

title: Washington Square  standards are slipping
text:
I returned to this NYC hotel in October 2009 for oldtimes sake really Way back on my first ever trip to NYC I stayed here and enjoyed it so eight years later it was time to go back
Initial impressions remain positive Wellpositioned near the bohemian Greenwich Village the hotels located down a quietish side street Waverly Place and is two minutes trek at most from the subway station The subway station is served by the line directly to the JFK Airport station so thats an added bonus and theres a great diner across the street
Checkin was friendly and quick Unfortunately it would seem that not a lot if any work has been done to the rooms since 2001 although they remain comfortable and have free quick internet via a cable supplied by the hotel My one real gripe was service and cleanliness Obviously the room I stayed in was not vacuumed by the maid and evidence would suggest little other than making the bed was carried out
Surprisingly a bin wasnt provided in the room That said one doesnt really expect the previous days McDonalds wrappers and newspapers to still be present when returning after a days exploring  so it would seem a littlelot of work could be done in that area For the price  over 200 dollars per night for a single room  its not really good enough That said Id probably stay there again

title: Hope new managenment turns it around
text:
Stayed here two this in the past month Rooms somewhat dated No internet this time and was told by from desk sorry you are on the wrong end of the building So i checked out New manager said they jad ordered parts 
Also there is NOTHING around it You can eat at the windys or the truck stop This hotel is off of my teams travel list now

title: Very Nice Resort
text: My wife daughter 20 years old and a couple of friends travel to Phoenix for the first time in May We stayed a week at the Marriott Canyon villas which we picked up for a very good price through Interval Int We arranged transportation from the airport through the resort I believe the outfit was called Destinations driver was Todd Very clean vehicle and more reasonably priced that a cab or limo service We own at a Marriott timeshare in Myrtle Beach and this resort although set up slightly different is very nice We stayed in the two bedroom unit while our friends were in a lock off efficiency unit The two bedroom unit is furnished very well Beds are exceptional plenty of living space dishes washerdryer which come in handy 3 tVs kitchen with appliances Set up is similar to our timeshare in MB The lock off is fairly small but worked fine for two people with a king bed couch and small fridge coffee maker All units have decks We were in a 3rd floor unit in bldg 2700 overlooking the pool A couple of units overlooked the golf course others didnt have too much of a view The activities at the resort worked out well for us We played the two golf courses on site both were in very good shape alot of traps but fair off the tee and fairly large greens We lounged by the pool several afternoons never had a problem finding a chair The pool bar is a good place to get a lunch and a cold beverage or two Beverage manager Matt is top notch My wife and daughter took advantage of the Spa at the JW Marriott a couple of times while I was golfing and they said it was heavenly We took one day trip through Detours to the Grand Canyon Picked us up a 7Am returned at 7PM Fairly expensive but definetly worth it Dont get sold on only going as far as Sedona beautiful red rocks but nothing compared to the grand canyon We ate out most everynight The desert ridge mall is within a mile and offers several resturants and shopping The KEG was a good steakhouse reasonably priced and the Yard house offered about as many different beers as I have ever seen TGIF Maraconi Grill were also good Went into Scottsdale one night to the Capital Grill very good food and environment but overpriced compared to some weve been to We went over to the JW a couple of times during the week Only about a 10 minute walk and a shuttle is offered at times but we never seemed to match up The JW is outstanding The grounds pool spa are all top notch Ate at Rayes which was very good The one thing we found a little dissappointing at the Canyon villas was the market place Only the necessities very small Really had to go the JW or mall if you needed anything Overall we really enjoyed our trip to Phoenix and the Cannon Villas Id recomend it to anyone with small children to retirees that are just looking to relax

title: Great Hotel Great Location Great Service
text: I just stayed at the Belvedere and I loved it Its a great location on 48th St right around the corner from hotels costing 300 a night on Broadway You can walk everywhere to bars restaurants nightlife There are several metro stops also The hotel is clean and the staff very helpful and friendly from the front desk to the doorman The rooms were really nice with a fridgesink there are a few grocery store shops right around the corner on 8th stif you want to stock up your fridge Everything in the hotel looks new from marble floors in the bathroom and lobby and nice bed linens This is definitely NYs best kept secret We paid only 144 a night and you cant stay anywhere else for this locationcleanlines and price Definitely recommend staying here

title: Couldnt be Happier
text: Beautiful place  clean comfortable with grest amenities full facilities and stellar staff Styaed for 3 days in offseason and found everything to be close to perfect Spacious rooms in well tended grounds Friendly and helpful staff though never obtrusive Left some important documents in the room when we checked out and they had them in a UPS envelope to me later the same day

title: Feels like Old Town comfort
text: A really cute inn located close to Old Town San Diego A quaint exterior hides modern rooms The staff was very friendly and the continental breakfast kept is full for the whole morning All of the comforts of a hotel with the feel of Old Town and for a great price

title: Relatively expensive
text: We stayed for 4 nights The room was clean and service good But our room was tiny and located on the south side so very very hot To give you an idea I had rinsed a pair of jeans and this was completely dry in about half a day 90 USD is a lot for such a small and hot room

title: Nice Hotel  but
text: The hotelresort was very nice The concierge staff and bus driver was extremely friendly and helpful The only bad thing about the resort is that there are very limited options for food close by The resort is on a strip of hotels So there is really only hotel restaurantsbars to eat at Is close to Fashion Valley which was a good shopping centre

title: Dont drink the water
text: I have stayed at this Marriott twice in the past 30 days and both times I came home with bad diarrhea I suggest bottled water during your stay

title: Very nice property a little isolated
text:
Stayed here for two nights with my son Property was very clean and updated Staff was friendly offered recommendations and provided great assistance Rooms have views on both sides harbor view or runway view Sounds from outside are very muted however hallway noise seemed to be amplified as I could hear quiet conversations as if I was standing next to the person in the hallway Also the room thermostat didnt seem to keep the room as cool as advertised 
Exterior of the property has great landscaping and an amazing view of downtown across the harbor Food offerings are a little sparse with one restaurantbar being offered Transportation options tofrom the hotel are great Water taxi service is directly at the hotel for 10 per person There is also the Hyatt shuttle or the Port Authority shuttle to the terminals the T or the bus lines 
One small thing to note this seems like this is a large wedding destination on the weekends I would be wary of staying here on the weekends because of this

title: Great Location for Business in the Financial District Quiet  Comfortable
text:
I really love this hotel for Convience to financial firms located here The room is one of the quietest rooms In which I have ever stayed Upon checking in and going to my room which was immediately off of the elevator bank I almost asked for another room but decided to give the room a try To my total surprise I never heard anyone getting off the elevators or even talking in the hallway Complete quiet and I dont believe I have ever experienced this type of quiet 
My room overlooked the Statute of Liberty which wais quite beautiful and comforting I checked in on 911 and thought the view was fitting as a statement to our continued freedom
Service seems to be good as all was in order upon my return from meetings in the evening Shower is nice and bed is extremely comfortable Room is large by NYC standards with lots of work space Great home away from home
I highly recommend this hotel for the business traveler as well as it would nice for families or couples

title: Loved the RitzJust Make Sure To Have A Room On the Highest Floor
text:
My husband attended a conference in San Francisco and I tagged along to see the great city of San Francisco The Ritz Carlton is a beautiful hotel The lobby is gorgeous and the hallways are decorated with artwork from local artists that depict famous landmarks and scenes 
After flying into San Fran from NYC it was late and all of the restaurants were closed luckily there is 24 hour room service It is expensive My husband and I ordered salty chicken fingers and fries cheeseburgerfries along with two sodas and it came to 60 I later read the fine print on the receipt and there is a 4 delivery charge so I think there is no need to tip I did anyway I also ordered room service the next day for breakfast which was a 3 egg omelet cheese spinach along wtoast and a coffee that came to 40 After the first day no more room service though I must say the breakfast was superb 
The room was spacious and the sheets were phenomenal 400 thread count make it hard to get out of bed The Ritz also has different pillows to accommodate you fluffy soft hard The room had a 32 flat screen television with a wide selection of movies to order from Wireless internet service is available The room was also equipped with a Bose system that allowed you to plug in your ipod Bulgari also provides all of your toiletries I loved the turn down service I would come back to my room exhausted and have chocolates on my bed a copy of the latest headlines from the New York Times and the local jazz station playing It was so relaxing and thoughtful 
The location is perfect and a 2 minute walking distance to Chinatown Union Square tons of shopping bus stops trolley stopsand Grace Cathedral
The entire staff was very knowledgeable I needed walking directions to the murals on balmy avenue and there was a line at the concierge also extremely helpful so one of the bellhops just asked how can I help you How awesome is that He gave me directions and I was on my way I wish I had gotten his name because he was very helpful The cleaning staff was awesome I think my cleaning ladies name was Yalitza she was phenomenal
The only problem I had with my room 360 was that it is what I would consider the bottom floor In order to access the room you have to take the elevator one floor down to the 3rd floor which I think is the conference room floor then walk down some stairs to access my room It was directly across from the kitchen and above the beautiful courtyard Besides the steps which is not recommended for disabled visitors it was loud on the last 2 days of my stay There might have been a wedding or some function that lasted what seemed like 3 in the morning I also think hotel guests would go there to have a smoke or drink with friends which equals loud noise To be honest I expect to have a great room at the Ritz especially for someone who pays 500 a night I was a tad bit disappointed in the room I am sure I could have switched rooms but it was late and I did not expect to hear noise two nights in a row
 I have visited the Ritz Carlton in New Orleans and they are all beautiful hotels with attentive staff All in all I enjoyed my stay at the Ritz Carlton and I would visit again
I hope this review helps someone Happy Travels
There is parking available at the Ritz but it costs 60 a day you can park for 40 a day around the corner at St Marys parking lot You can also rent a car from the hotel if you need to

title: Friendly Centrally Located Boutique Hotel
text:
Hotel Vintage Park is centrally located in downtown Seattle it was very easy to get to the shopping areasPike Place Market and a few good restaurants We did not have a car and it was very convenient to get around
The staff at the reception were all friendly and helpful It really only took a couple of minutes to check in and out We were offered a coffeemaker which was delivered within 10 minutes of our arrival with coffeesugar etc all on a tray
