The room was spacious with bathrobessocksumbrellainroom safe inside the wardrobe and actually had plenty of hangers as well The bathroom had good lighting also with all the amenities that we needed Our king size bed was comfortable with good pillowssheets We liked the decor the couch and bed were not clattered with cushions lots of modern hotels have heaps of cushions these days and we usually have to move them around to create more room Our room was on the top floor so we had a leafy outlook of the city
The wine tasting evening was a nice social occasion to meet fellow travellers especially for the single travellers We really enjoyed it
We joined the Kimpton Intouch so we got free internet throughout our stay and it was great to be able to keep in touch with friends and family 
This hotel is just so unique one has to stay there to experience the difference  We will definitely stay there again when we are back in Seattle next

title: Horrible
text: For a Four Seasons they should be ashamed of themselves Horrible Front Desk Service Noisy Rooms Small suites that would be called a room in any other midrange hotel change  would not recommend to an enemy

title: Good experience for price you pay
text: I selected this hotel based largely on the overwhelmingly positive reviews on TripAdvisor I think that maybe my expectations were a little too high Dont get me wrong we had a positive experience and paid a great weekend rate However i was not overwhelmed by the experience We found it to be typical of any other Residence Inn The location is great The staff was friendly at front desk Staff was almost nonexistent in the breakfast buffet Again positive experience but not memorable

title: Love love loved the staff
text: My husband myself 2 teenage boys and our dog spent 3 delightful nights at the Onyx Hotel As others have noted the staff at this boutique hotel were superb We were a bit nervous traveling with a pet but were greeted at the door by a Welcome Willy sign accompanied by dog biscuits and water The boys had made an error when trying to watch a movie and the staff were gracious and nonjudgemental in refunding the amount The room decor was sumptuous the bath products of good quality and the complimentary wine hour was a treat As for the location we walked every night and at no time did we feel our safety was compromised Again the staff were adept at suggesting walking routes restaurants and the best way to exit the city We would most definitely return

title: Brilliant hotel in great location
text:
This was our first visit to NYC and had booked hotel Chandler as it was a good price and in a great location All of the positive reviews on this site are correct  this is great place to stay
We didnt spend too much time in the room but when we did we found it was very comfortable quiet even though near a lift and the aircon did a great job The staff were great didnt have to deal with them much beyond checkinout but were very helpful and arranged a taxi for our flight back
We stayed in a superior queen room which had a flat screen TV a safe free to use and was able to access the free wireless connection The shower was brilliant and the bed very comfortable Several people on here have said the rooms are small  although theyre not massive theyre more than enough for two people plus luggage etc
We went in the bar only once but it seemed nice and a beer was onlt 2 in happy hour
Everything we wanted was walking distance from the hotel Empire State is about a 2 minute walk and Times Square and central park were not too much further We only used the subway once but found it easy to get to
Would definitely stay here again

title: Location great but not overall
text: great location especially since we were there for a wedding in the Sheraton ballroom but many negatives No hot water we complained were told an engineer would take care of it but nothing changed There was no way to cool down the room Apparently at some point the hotel switches from air conditioning to heat and there is no going back Turning down the thermostat just causes the heat to blow less Hate paying for internet and parking but that seems to be the norm any more for hotels at this level

title: This is worse than terrible
text: We were faced with an extremely bad and disgusting service at the Milford Plaza Hotel We checked in flying all the way from Niagara Falls to Buffalo and then to New York arriving on December 28 2011  at around 1130PM  100 AM When we arrived at your hotel the two security guards  doorman told us that the elevators were broken and that we had to carry all four of our luggage up the stairs to our room We asked for a bell service but they told us that there was none and that we had to deal with it ourselves Please look back at your camera footage This is the worst service I have ever seen by far for a hotel of your nature We booked your hotel for New Years weekend and hoped to enjoy ourselves but instead found that the service your hotel provides is horrible and in fact racist Coming from an Asian descent we felt that the doormansecurity was extremely racist towards us due to our race and did not want to help us at all I was with my wife and two kids and with a total of 4 luggage Even a passerby another hotel guest was willing to offer their help to us Even a homeless person would offer their help seeing the conditions we were faced with In addition to the horrible service we received upon arriving the hotel room smelled disgusting similar to new plasticremodel Obviously nothing was done during our stay to help compensate this fact

title: like being a President  a diamond members treat
text:
we booked this as HiltonHonors diamond reward stay and we were extremely pleasantly surprised that  because all executive rooms were booked  they double or triple upgraded us to the Presidential Suite  WOW what a suite it was indeed Location of hotel also excellent lots of stuff at walking distance Parking indeed expensive but its expensive everywhere downtown chicago Breakfast was  although the food itself was great  the only poor point of this hotel it seemed disorganised and there was constantly a line of people wating to be seated although there were empty seats abundantly available one person taking care of that and she did other things in between as well also we had to wait like 20 minutes for our coffee and then it came twice ie dont go for breakfast if you are in a hurry 
But again this is truly a great hotel and next time well go there again also as paying customer

title: the best room the best service
text: The service was outstanding Everyone went out of their way to assist us The rooms were amazing  comfy beds incredible water views luxurious bathrooms great products and in room espresso A quick walk to the North End where you can find shopping and dining A beautiful area for a morning walk We will definitely go back soon

title: Nice place for a business stay
text: Pleasant staff clean rooms great FREE breakfast in room coffee maker actually had coffee that was drinkable I could go on but the bottom line is this is a good place to stay My only gripe is the beer selection at the managers reception Free beer choice is Bud or BudLight really  How about something local to the area Maybe Killians Coors I know Fat Tyre is pricey but I decided to skip the free drinks and buy something brewed locally Thats just me and it did not affect my experience

title: This is the best boutique hotel in the city
text: I travel over 170000 miles a year for work and have stayed at the Michelangelo hotel many times before Recently took my daughter for weekend of Broadway plays and restaurants This hotel is quite frankly the best in NYC for service rooms with a sense of belonging and comfort and location James the concierge can steer one to the best restaurants and out of the way dining places and the location is superb My first introduction was business but since I have been back 5 more times Truly a great find

title: I will never come back again
text: I came to NYC with my daughter for Broadway shows As I would like to stay in an area which is not far away from Time Square just within walking distance When I saw the website mentioned that this hotel is centrally located in NYC to many locations such as Time Square I chose this hotel because I had a good experience in staying Excelsior Hotel in HK for many times However I was quite disappointed about the location The room is not as good as the standard of 4star The TV channels are not clear Wireless Internet paid was slow This hotel is totally different what I have thought about the Brand of Excelsior When I complained with the front desk staff she was really not patient

title: Comfortable and reasonably priced
text: I found the motel to be comfortable and clean with a friendly staff The only negative I can say would be the sporadic and weak wireless internet service

title: Great hotel but why does the bar close so early
text: We are Marriott members and stayed at the Renaissance using our points We chose it for the location which cant be beaten if you want to be central After checking in we headed straight to the renowned R Lounge only to be found that all the prime seats were reserved The service in the bar was not particularly friendly maybe because we werent eating and the drinks were very pricey but the views were undeniably special We were going out for the evening but decided to come back later for a night cap To our huge surprise on returning around 1am we discovered the bar was closed lights were full on and the bar and lobby were being hoovered We were informed there was nowhere else to get a drink which seemed incredible in a residential hotel in the centre of NYC What happened to the city that never sleeps The rooms were nice enough and we enjoyed a good breakfast but we wouldnt choose the hotel again given the limited bar service after hours

title: no real complaints but no wow factor
text: Most of the basics are there comfortable bedbedding good plumbing acceptable service attitude and rooms that have aged relatively well The confirmed Gold Passport Diamond upgrade landed us a Park Executive Suite or at least that was what the front desk agent called it The 1BR suite was spacious and contained 15 baths a long sofa and a square living room table in lieu of a more traditional work desk no work surface in the bedroom We took advantage of the loaner bicycles at the concierge For the cost conscious the valet parking is 48 per night Perhaps a way to describe the property location would be near the center of everything but close to nothing except for the independent cinemas on the back side of the hotel but not a big deal if you are planning to drive everywhere as we were While I would rate this property ahead of The Williard in comparison to Park Hyatts in Asia this location falls way short

title: The charm of LAX two days before Christmas in the TSA wore black suits
text:
Excited about the W opening and reading good restaurant reviews we made a reservation at Delphines We pulled up in front of the hotel gave the car to the valet and were greeted with a chain of velvet ropes and men in black suits who did not say Welcome to the W but rather Where are you going We told them we were going to Delphines We were asked if we had a reservation We said yes We were asked our names We told them We were then passed through the velvet ropes and into reception area The restaurant was on the other side of the lobby which is essentially a giant nightclub To cross the lobby we met Man in Black Suit 2 He asked us where we where going did we have a reservation what were our names Testly we answered again and we were passed through On the far side of the lobby Man in Black Suit 3 allowed us to pass into the restaurant where the hostess said How are you doing To which we replied Not so happy about all the velvet ropes She was nice seated us and we proceeded to have a lovely meal fabulous food reasonably priced great service and we were wiling to let the bad experience pass because the food was so great We paid our bill and then proceeded to leave the restaurant where upon we encounter Man in Black Suit 4 who said Where are you going By this time we were ready to blow up We said TO OUR CAR After spending over a 100 we now have to go through the indignity of three more Men in Black Suits and three more velvet ropes to leave The manager was called Two managers arrived One listened the other yelled directly in our faces We both blew up So here you have two men in their 50s well traveled sober properly dressed screaming at the top of our lungs in front of reception with this evil managerbouncer while peopel are checking in to 300 a night rooms 
While we did not stay in a room and we cannot vouch for the rooms themselves I can assure you we will never set foot in the place again If you want to experience the indignity of the old Studio 54 in New York where people begged in get in to spend their money then this is the place for you
A perfectly lovely meal was ruined by hotel staff who have no idea what real security is about And never once was the phrase What can we do to make this right uttered amid the staff shouting
Ironically this morning in the LA Times there was a review of the restaurantclub on the roof where the owner bragged about turning away 2 to 3 thousand people a night The implication being that they were just not beautiful enough Please

title: We used alternative parking at the Hyatt Regency
text:
We stayed here 2 nights on our week long trip in April and really enjoyed our stay very much I had researched the nearby parking in planning our stay here and thought we would be able to park at Embarcadero 4 but when we drive in the guard told us that parking garage is now only for monthly rental she directed us to Embarcadero 3 which turned out to be even closer we were less than half a block from the front door of the hotel for 30 for 24 hours
We loved the hotel the view of the Ferry Building and Bay has to be at the top of the list next would be the beds pillows and linens best beds on our trip the lobby and elevators are beautiful We did not eat at the hotel but there are small restaurants in Embarcadero 4 and across the street All and all a very nice hotel

title: Clean  comfortable Not as good anymore for airline passengers
text:
The hotel is clean and comfortable While it used to be at the airport the new terminal is now 7 miles away We used the Park n Fly service which doesnt work as well anymore The shuttle service goes only once an hour We were actually left because we were only a few minutes early and saw it going down the road it came back for us When we got back to the airport after our trip we found that the hotel was not on the shuttle service kiosk and our cell phone would not work in the airport to call their bus
We would recommend it as a decent reasonable place to stay but the Park n Fly service did not work

title: Aleja and Teds adventures
text: If you are attending the Denver Merchandise Mart this is by far the most convenient place to stay You need not leave the building to access the Mart They do provide a breakfast and there are friendly staff at the front desk This is NO RITZ I have stayed here a few times to attend the mart and I must say the shower heads and hot water are always a treat If you do not care about staying so conveniently close to the mart you should stay somewhere else and have a rent a car to get back and forth

title: Great Location Will stay here again
text:
Our hotel room was a queen with shared bathroom and was bigger than we expected Facing 77th street NE there was a nice street view and sunshine in the morning Very comfortable bed good sized tv chair and suit case horse and wardrobe but no draws We were missing the information guide but no big deal The shared bathroom was fine much less of a drama than we thought three rooms are though a hall door with a bathroom which is not accessable to other people The bathroom already had a lot of other peoples toiletries in it which was no bother and we therefore left our bathroom bag in there but found it in the hall the next morning unsure whether this was other guests or the cleaner 
Tips 20min walk to Time Square 5mins to central park 2 short blocks to Subway 79th St 1hr train from JFK PC with internet in gift shop but no interenet cafes close to hotel Hair Straightnener may not work because of low USA power voltage Columbus street has good shopping and restaurants Check out Big Nicks Pizza big and fat but the best pizza

title: Super hotel  with character
text:
Stayed for six nights in December and Im looking forward to being able to stay again
For those who cant be bothered to read long reviews my summary
 Great sleep quiet and comfortable
 Characterful and friendly
 Good price
 Good location
 Dont eat the carrots
For those with more time on their hands
How very very nice it was to stay in a hotel with some character rather than the bland formula of an hotel like a Hyaltorriott I found the general feel of the Omni very comforting  like theyve been taking care of important people for years and I was in good hands I might not be considered that important by many other people  but they appeared to find me so and I enjoyed going along with it
A huge positive point for me was the fact that I slept like a baby Like a baby asleep in a beautifully quiet room in fact This hotel is made out of good solid materials not the usual plasterboard and echoey corridors of an ant hotel I wasnt once kept awake by frisky neighbours or woken early by the splash of showers or slamming doors of hastily abandoned rooms Good sleep  good mood and good work
In comparison to other business district hotels I found it very reasonably priced I loved the morning delivery of coffee and juice that was included as part of their rewards programme Oh how such small things make such a difference to the way you start your day
Other than that  friendly helpful staff and great location for the business district Although its a little way from the tourist hotspots its no big deal to jump in a cab for five minutes or travel by public transport  or heaven forbid use your legs
The one and only issue I stumbled across in my stay was in the steak restaurant  so maybe its not that fair to post here  but since the restuarant is affiliated and theres a pretty good chance that guests will gravitate towards it I will
The issue The gigantic phallus of a carrot that was delivered on my plate reclining in its selfsatisfied way against my mightily overpriced and presumably very embarrassed steak
That long lone carrot was quite honestly the most revolting vegetable Ive ever eaten  and that includes the times Ive accidentally bitten into renegade pieces of celery food of the devil in a salad I cant believe the carrot had come from anything other than a huge tin of brine and a ten year wait in a dusty warehouse somewhere
If youre a beef aficionado  or even just someone who likes good food  just dont bother Yes the steak tasted good  but not an eyerolling conversationstopping stresssapping umamiridden explosion of great that Id expect from a steakhouse charging that much per pound of beef
Oh and that carrot Gack

title: Good airport hotel
text:
Nice hotel located close to the airport providing a free shuttle bus to the airport
Not much in the area but its ok for a nights stay would recommend for business or leisure
Good price also especially through hotelclub

title: Loved the Buena Vista
text: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon and couldnt have been happier Because this was our honeymoon we didnt want to stay at any bigname impersonal hotel chains and this place was perfect The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location is close to Fishermans Wharf which is where we spent most of our time We also loved the charming decor of this hotel  especially the lobby and the sun room on the 3rd floor We didnt find the Buena Vista noisy at all  quite the opposite We cant recommend the Buena Vista highly enough  would never consider staying anywhere else in San Francisco

title: Not great
text: The lobby is in repair and the hotel is very dated and dark The layout is a little quirky too It was okay but wasnt great

title: Nice hotel but a little outside the city center for walking
text: Our stay was comfortable but this hotel is a about 5 blocks from the restaurants and the center of the city

title: Great hotel that goes out of their way to make you at home Great location
text: Very friendly staff all around With daily breakfasts and nightly welcome home meals with the manager this place is tops for families and those staying for a few nights like we did Overall we really enjoyed our stay Our only complaints were that the hotel seems a little out of date in some areas The beds were not the most comfortable and had an annoying bottom cover that was plasticlike and made you sweat at night The underground parking was not well lit and if you somehow forgot your key card there was no way out But overall the staff was friendly and warm Great location Within a short walk to Safeway resturaunts and the Space Needle Will return next time were in Seattle

title: Great Hotel
text: I love this hotel Free breakfast free happy hour and a small balcony It doesnt get any better than that in New York A welcome respite from charmless business hotels

title: Smooth service
text:
I picked the Omni because it was the highest rated hotel near the Convention Center Well it certainly was near 5 minute walk to the far reaches of the exhibition hall And the hotel was superb Everything worked well or was immediately fixed upon request the breakfasts were terrific 
But best was the smoothness of the service at ALL levels all the time Personable refreshing to have an easy talk with a bellman on the way down about tips helpful and efficient Overall Id rank it with my best business hotel experiences
BTW my 20th floor room looked down on the Padres stadium from the bathroom No noise pollution and quite a sight to see a night game

title: Good Price  Terrible Customer Service
text: The price and location were good However the other guest in the hotel were loud at night 3am banging on doors and cursing This happened on several floors I had many friends staying here on various floors The rooftop club attracted questionable patrons who freely roamed arond the hotel  security was basically nonexistent At one point we went to the rooftop to see the view and the bouncer at the door insulted us in how we looked and how we were dressed and would not let us in Overall I would not stay here again Complaints to the front desk about these items were ignored

title: this is not a hotel
text:
we went there in spring 06
After a long drive from the SoCal we finally arrived Boardway Manor Inn after dark We were placed on the 2nd floor the corner one of boardway and van ness
we requested a non smoking room but the room just smells like were in smoking area the bathroom is nice but not the room
It was so horribly decorated that they use some flithy white cloth as curtain to the window facing boardway
the cloth so thin that i can even see the traffic light at the corner of van ness and boarway
also the traffic on van ness is so noisy that it wakes me up several times during the night
so i was waken up by noises and the green red green red yellow light at night
not only this but the bed is horrible
i just felt like im floating on water when sitting on it and when two of us me and my husband sit on it the bed just made some cracking sound were just SITTING not even SLEEPING
so we went to the front desk but all other rooms are fulled and we were hungry and tired so we decided to stay there for only 1 night carefully lay on the bed and were frighten we will break the bed in the middle of the night
They claim to have free parking but their parking is so tiny that its so difficult to get out of the car after parking it in the space
Also there were not enough space
We were just so lucky to get the last parking when we arrive so we just simply left the car there and take bus right across the street on van ness to fisherman wharf
so after a warm dinner we got back and went to the front desk asking for password of wireless internet and they asked for my room card i gave them and they checked it and said Im not their customer so they are not giving me the password
i was likeif i were not a customer so how can i get your room card
so my husband went there with the receipt we got from checking in and they finally gave us the passcode
i dont know is their network so bad or only because we are at the corner room the wireless receiption is just so bad that it just go on and off and on and off and on and off and i just couldnt even check emails
so i gave up and went to sleep carefully
the other day we left the hotel immediately 
we were on a week trip and SF is our 2nd night thru the NorCal trip so we stayed in 4 nights of hotels after thatand all our clothes and belongings just smells like they were being smoked in the smoking area
so we eventually have to do laundry in our friends home in the south bay
its such an unpleasant stay that I would rather get more  from my pocket to stay in a much better hotel
all i can say is the only good thing is the location
staff are rude and impolite and unhelpful

title: Clean and roomy
text: There are quite a few hotels in the Hotel Circle We chose the Days Inn because of the reviews on Trip Advisor The room was large and clean Internet is included in the reasonable rate as well as parking OK Breakfast can be had at the nearby diner The Fashion Valley Shopping Center is within walking distance and offer everything you could need when it comes to eating and shopping If you have your own car it is very easy to get to both the Old Town and Sea World There is also a shuttle service which supposedly stops by the hotel but the hotel staff did not have much information about it so we ended up using our car instead

title: Not what it used to be
text: Rooms are extremely small No wireless Internet There updated rooms have a flat screen TV but there are a bunch of wires sticking out all over the place The elevators didnt work for the 23rd floor access and I had to go to the front desk twice to get it fixed

title: Glad I booked at Hotwire price
text: I booked the room using Hotwire which most likely reflects the room we were insmallest hotel room I have ever seen We were on the 4th floor of the North tower Room was so small they could only fit a table on one side of the bed Room was clean Staff friendly For the price I paid it was OK Location a little shady at night Next time would pay more for a better location nearer to inner harbor

title: Friendliest staff beautiful lobby  rooms with special touches like a handwritten welcome note from the maid
text:
I have stayed at the SF Omni several times I live locally and cherish weekend getaways with my husband Several things set this hotel apart from other nice hotels They know how to create a great first impression through their great valet parking staff and friendly doorman who greets you with a warm hello Upon entering the hotel marbled steps lead you down towards a sunken lobby canopied by a crystal chandelier Fresh fruit and lemonade are offered to guests The desk staff are warm and helpful Every hotel employee says hello The first time I stayed at this hotel I noticed the housekeeping staff greeted us on our way to our room Not just a hello but with a big smile The spare roll of toilet paper was tied with a satin lacy ribbon The end of the rolls are folded to make a double point and are embossed with the omni seal Their toiletries are really nice A handwritten note from the housekeeper awaits you near the phone welcoming you to you room 
We usually order room service and the delivery staff are quick and nice Bobs Steakhouse restaurant selections are available for room service and I have enjoyed lobster tail and perfectly cooked steaks delivered right to my room I
f you get a room on the Chinatown side of the building the cheerful sounds of Chinese music can be heard from your open window For outings we have found the front desk staff helpful and the really go the extra mile to help you They are even friendly when you check out It is the special touches and interactions with the staff that set this hotel apart and make it our number one SF place to stayI just wish I could take the SF Omni with me to every place I travel They should run seminars for other hotels on hoe to provide first class hospitality

title: Excellent service and great location
text: I recently had to stay there because of my job The rooms are nice and clean and the staff is always friendly and courteous You cant beat the price and location The best value in the area I would definitely return

title: OK Hotel but in needs updating
text: This is a nice hotel but it really needs some updating The TVs are the old tube type and the carpeting looks like from the 80s Other than that it is not bad The Health Club is nice and big and it has parking The food was decent

title: Outstanding In Every Way
text: This is truly a five star hotel It is essentially a luxury condominium property that rents rooms but the advantages to this approach are numerous The rooms are beautiful large and very comfortable with full highend kitchens living rooms and from 1 to 3 bedrooms each with a full bath The staff is very friendly and helpful A complimentary breakfast is served daily and there are lots of other perks such as a huge dvd library and free local transportation Plus the location is great Somewhat expensive but worth every penny

title: More than I ever expected
text: Chose this hotel because it was the cheapest rate for a decent downtown hotel that I could find This hotel was close enough to make almost anything downtown an easy walk with the one exception being the Willis bldg which is not close to anything We walked to shopping the theater district and the Art Institute For other tourist attractions Greyline has a trolley stop right across the street We booked a city view room but were delighted to find our room was a corner river view room with an absolutely gorgeous view of the river and city If I ever stay here again I will pay the extra we spent so much time watching the boats going up and down the river The room itself was beautiful with a huge bathroom No bathtub but a wonderful raindrop shower Found all the hotel staff to be helpful and friendly and elevators were no problem There is an attached resturant called Hoyts I thought it was overpriced for breakfast but they have a lovely sidewalk lounge if you like to peoplewatch This hotel is not far from the trains but far enough away to not have to deal with squealing rails all night Whats not to love

title: Cold
text: You could not pay me to stay at this hotel again The Hard Rock Hotel is not very warm or welcoming After staying here I have come to hate the color Gray

title: Good Location
text:
We took our 2 young kids there to support my sisterinlaw running in the Marathon
Location The location is great Theres a hopon hopoff doubledecker bus stop right in front of the hotel The ticket is 32 per adult for 2 days Its a wonderful tour it showed us the whole Washington DC in 25 hours The Metro Centre subway station and the Macys department store are just around the corner It was also perfect for the Marine Corps Marathon as were able to walk to the 12 mile checkpoint and cheered for my sisterinlaw There arent too many restaurants near the hotel though With 2 young kids we didnt want to go too far so we ended up having both dinners in the hotel restaurants which are not bad and reasonably priced
Facility The swimming pool is nothing grand but good enough for my young kids to have fun The gym seems quite spacious and well equipped
Service Cookies and lemonade are offered to guests in the front desk  lobby it was great especially when we arrived tired and thirsty But they dont refill it at night if you arrive late  thirsty you can buy a large bottle of water in the souvenir shop for 3 the one in the room was 5 I called housekeeping for a crib and they came set it up almost immediately All the staff greet us happily The only thing isthe Metro Grill restaurant seemed to be understaff for dinner
Price We stayed Fri  Sat night and paid 209 nite  tax with a sumptuous breakfast which is pretty good for the nice room decoration though not big and no view and convenient location I booked through the hotel website Its funny how they keep changing the prices every few hours just like the stock market I was lucky to finally get hold of this reasonable price
Ill definitely stay at this hotel again for my future trips to Washington DC

title: Comfortable stay
text: Had no problems at check in agent was friendly and accomodating I showed my SPG starwood preferred guest card and were given welcome bags for both myself and I which included a bottel of water a granola bar and coupons for restaurants A nice touch Our room was kind of a mix of old and new The rug looks like it could be updated still had an older tv and there was a slight cigarette smoke smellmost likely due to being an older hotel We were woken at just b4 midnight on the 1st night of our stay due to a hotel alarm that was going off they resolved this within a half hour Fortunately the beds are so comfortable that we were able to go back to sleep right away The pool looked great although we never got a chance to use it they did have a nice area for sunbathing right next to the pool They had a sizeable  of workout equipment such as weights treadmills and bikes but the area was right in the hallway on the way to the pool Unless we missed it I saw no locker rooms or whirlpool There are a couple of restaurants on sight as well as a lounge area just off the lobby The location itself was fantastic as it was close to a number of attractions I did receive an email a couple of days later thanking me for our stay which may be a canned response becuase Im a SPG member I would have been more impressed if I got an email apologizing for the inconvienice of the alarm going off The hotel is billed as a 35 star mostly becuase of the on site amenities and I think with a little work they can achive that but for right now they are a solid 3

title: A shared bath that is not adjacent to your roomin all my travels I have never experienced this
text: This hotel is in the midst of remodeling and our view was of the debris piled on the roof Upon realizing the shared bath was down the hall and shared by 3 rooms I produced my handicap placard and explained there was no way I could negotiate down the hall in the middle of the night It was after 11pm and we were in no condition to find another hotel With much insistence from my husband and myself we were given a handicap accesible room and told there was an addition 50  feeper night for the private bathroom This has got to be a violation of the laws relating to disabled persons Perhaps I didnt investigate enough but in 20 years of travel this is something I had never encountered even in the most economy grade hotels The room was nice and newly remodeled and the location was good

title: Great hotel near convention center
text: The room was clean and neat We had a nice view of the Mississippi River from our room We had to pay for internet which was a bit of a bummer but it is literally across the street from the MemphisCook convention center so the location was at least good We were able to walk a few blocks to go out to dinner although there was a restaurant at the hotel too All the staff was very nice and helpful

title: Great Location  steps from Times Square
text:
I stayed at this hotel in November 2009 and the location is excellent Steps away from Times Square and Broadway
The hotel itself is dated but the rooms are reasonable and the shower is hot This is all we needed as we didnt stay in our room much  only to sleep really
Had no problem with staff  they seemed fine and the concierge was extremely helpful We had a late flight back on our check out day and we only paid 1 to leave our bags
I wouldnt recommend buying ticket for Empire State Broadway shows etc in advance because its much cheaper when you actually get there
12 to get the ferry to Staten Island which included entrance to the Statue and the museum
47 for a ticket to see Chicago and we had great seats
We ate at Planet Hollywood and several little delis which were great value Shopping on 5th Avenue is brilliant I would recommend a trip to Abercrombie and Tiffanys Even if you dont buy anything the experience is brilliant
Just remember to budget for tips because you are expected to tip everywhere
Hope this helps

title: Right off I95 Close to Good Restaurants
text:
I stayed at this hotel right off of I95 across from the White Marsh Mall on whim This is the first Fairfield Inn and Suites I have stayed at 
The hotel is in a very convenient location to the I95 corridor just north of Baltimore MD The hotel is located directly across a major street from the White Marsh Mall and Ikea Directly beside the hotel is a Taco Bell and McDonalds on the night I stayed here which was a Friday the McDonalds parking lot was occupied by all of the local teenagers Luckily from the room I was in I never heard them from the hotel 
The hotel has a complimentary trolley that runs between a couple of the local hotels and the The Avenue there are several great restaurants stores movie theater etc at The Avenue 
The room that I had was adequate and there was a good amount of space my room have two queen beds There is a 32 TV in the room with about 30 channels a few of them are HD Internet they have wires and wireless in the rooms is Complimentary as well as parking There is a hair dryer and ironing board and iron also in the room as well as a Cuisinart coffee maker can make about two small cups of coffee
Check in was quick and efficient and the front desk staff was very nice the room overall is in great shape I will have to say that in the bathroom it was not spotless but relatively clean some hair in the shower from a previous guest Housekeeping started knocking on my door about 930am and it continued about ever 20 mins until I checked out something I have never encountered before
The lobby has breakfast in the morning complimentary and they sell sodas snack etc

title: AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS
text:
Absolutely the WORST customer service I have ever experienced in 2 decades of business and leisure travel  my husband and I have maintained gold Hilton status on both of our Hilton Honors accounts for years and this is the only time we have been treated so unfairly Booked 2 rooms for Spring Break then had to cancel 24 hours out due to a childs illness Was told by the manager that he would release the rooms back into inventory but 5 days later he charged our card anyway We have an email stating a 24 hour cancellation policy but the RUDE manager refused to reverse the charges then gave me a bogus phone number to the presidents line to call to complain
Google this hotel and managers name to see that there have been other incidents with this manager and this property and dishonest practices How on earth can this franchise maintain the Hilton name when they do not follow the Hilton policies and level of customer service
Avoid this hotel and find a Marriott

title: i would stay there again and again
text: i travel alot and usually always on a budget i think the most important factors i take into consideration are location and price on this basis the hotel is a steal now if you understand before you go that these points are what make the hotel great then you also understand that with the low price you must have to sacrifice ammenities i am perfectly willing to give up tv i was there in times square no need for the tv when i got back to the room everyday i was happy to have ac and a decent bed to sleep on the shower was small the phone did not work there was no maid service towels are scarce but if you ask for them they will give them to youterrible view but i slept like a baby and i could hop out into the action of time square within seconds i read all the reviews and was a little freaked out by the talk and pictures of bed bugs but if you look at the dates of those reviews that was a few years ago during the big new york bed bug epidemic and several hotels had that issue i did not see a bug or mouse i have no bites on my body so if you can handle the sacrifices and want to take advantage of the great location and price this is a great spot i will go back again and again without thinking twice

title: Solid business hotel
text: Stayed for two nights Very good location near financial district but also walking distance to great shopping  speaking of which Westfields shopping centre on Market has the most plentiful shops plus the Embarcadero has good shopping as well My room on the 7th floor appeared to have been recently renovated Was a little loud though with the window open as the cable car was right outside I thought the front desk staff were great My air conditioning wouldnt work and as a result I had a poor nights sleep but I should have let the hotel know and asked them to fix it

title: They did it again
text:
I cant believe they did but they did it again  My First stay was here at the Dana was back in 08 and boy did i thoroughly enjoy it My recent return last weekend to the Dana was Spot on perfect even better than my first stay
Immediately upon arrival the guy out side at the stand Very nice and Knowledgeable helped us with parking and showed us where to check in A young lad Andy Front Desk excellent service and very professional showed us our room on the map and answered all of our questions regarding the facilities What an awesome experience The room was beautiful Flat Screen Robes BIg Mirrors and even a Mini Refrigerator to keep the Coronas chilled And the view of the bay Perfect
We went out that night had an awesome time in San Diego and woke up the next morning wishing we had more days 
Overall Great Hotel and Even better Staff

title: Not on Par with Ritz Standards
text: Was very disappointed with the service and the room decor Many of the small details here are being missed

title: great hotel would recommend
text: I liked everything abt this hotel I would highly recommend its clean nice location etc

title: Decent choice for the price
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ramada Inn this past Memorial Day Weekend Overall the facility was decent We had a small corner room on the 7th Floor The room was on the small side but it had all the necessary amenities tv with remote radio lamps desk ironing board and iron hair dryer and was clean I was especiallly pleased with the size and condition of the bathroom The shower control knob was a little loose but that was the only issue with the bathroom We had a slight problem with the iron had to jiggle the cord to make it work and the service could have been friendlier Since I am from New York I didnt need to interact with the staff frequently but I expect someone from out of town might appreciate betterfriendlier service
The biggest problem we had with the room was the presence of bed bugs I found a big one on the blanket one morning which was disgusting When I complained to the manager he said these things happen and offered to have the maid flip the mattress and vacum it Im not sure either of these things were done but we didnt see anymore bed bugs 
Overall I would recommend this hotel for a budget traveler who doesnt plan to spend a lot of time in the room This hotel has a great location and the price is good However I will probably look elsewhere first before staying here again

title: Hotel Windsor stay is economical and ideal
text:
We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Windsor Staff was very accommodating and the room was spacious and well appointed Full kitchen dishwasher microwave and large size refrigerator is a wonderful perk The location was terrific close to museums and within walking distance to historic sites and nice restaurants We did not have a parking problem whatsoever Pulled into the garage bellman took our luggage and car was whisked away A Wawa market around the corner was extremely convenient for popcorn tea bags etc for late night snacking in your room Only downside was noise level outside Even at 3 am there was a clamor of activity Also sheets are a bit threadbare 
Rooms come complete with VCR but no tapes to rent at the hotel Staff was unsure where a a good rental place was All in all I would recommend this facility to anyone Good price good location

title: Really nice Hilton
text:
I stay at hilton hotels about 60 nights a year all over the country and this is one of the nicest I really enjoyed the view of the ballpark and the great fitness room
The hotel public areas and rooms are updated clean and very comfortable I will definately stay here again when in town
My only complaint is that the concierge lounge breakfast was not as nice as others I have experienced Very limited breakfast and snacks

title: Could be fine for some travellers but we hated it
text:
I didnt get the best deal I could have on this stay which just makes me all the more irritated about the Allerton I attempted to contact inhouse reservations prior to checkin to discuss adjusting my rate I felt a bit entitled as I was booking for an entire week at the end of a miserable Chicago winter but I never received a call back Due to the circumstances surrounding my trip I didnt have a lot of time to badger management about this issue so I let it be and hoped that the hotel would impress regardless 
I will say this the rooms are very pretty There were some issues with peeling wallpaper but it was not that noticeable Beds have feather toppers and feather pillows undisclosed on the web site so I now have a sinus infection from a weeks worth of constant exposure On a side note I didnt figure out that the pillows and topper were feather until nearly the end of my stay at which point removal would only have served to make the bed more uncomfortable These are flat pokey featherbeds not the highend kind so wear thick fleece pajamasThe ice machine noises the AC was making when I arrived were easily remedied by turning climate control off The windows are a nightmare dont open them This hotel is right across from Northwestern Hospital so be prepared for ambulance noises at all hours I guess if you are a big shopper the location could be a selling point For us beyond being nice to look at this place is absolutely not worth your time at the price 
My first room standard king was very spacious plenty of room for yoga and it even had a chair and a bench Unfortunately it was also right next to the elevator I grew up in a town with trains and planes so I got used to the whooshing fairly quickly However the doors here do not go all the way to the floor and they are thin thin THIN I rolled up a towel and shoved it under the door as a sound barrier but it made no difference at all After the second night of no sleep due to loud conversations outside my door at all hours of the evening I insisted on being moved The gentleman at the front desk did not argue about switching my room but he did point out that there was no way he could prevent people from having conversations outside my door in the future regardless of location Between exhaustion and frustration I had to talk myself back from punching him in the jaw Why would people randomly stand around MY ROOM assuming that my room wasnt located at the gateway for entering or leaving the floor Really 
Room 2 also a standard king was much smaller and was one of those rooms with a door joining it to the room next door Remember how thin those doors were Our neighbors loved Ray LaMontagne acoustic guitar singalongs and noisy sex Yay I could not bear the thought of moving again and they at least kept it quiet most of the night This is the room I was in when my husband got into town and its the one we stayed in the remainder of our trip It was a bed to sleep in and nothing more Hes never going to let me live down not going with his first choice the Blake

title: Solid choice in the Upper East Side
text: This hotel is lovely Great location close to the park and in a very nice neighbourhood Quiet and upscale Efficient bell concierge and front desk staff Nice room clean and decent size for Manhattan No complaints

title: Great hotel if you can afford the upgrade
text:
I stayed at this hotel at the beginning of July with my girlfriend
We booked a standard room and were allocated one on the 1st floor The room was very nice and clean if a little small which is what we expected however looking out of the window all we saw and HEARD was the air conditioning unit We asked to be moved and were moved to the 7th floor where we could still hear it and were looking out on it We complained again and were told that all the standard rooms looked out on this area 
We had no choice but to upgrade our room which cost us 350
The new room was excellent and money well spent it was very big and looked out over the Lincoln Centre 
All this aside the hotel is good and we enjoyed our stay once we had a nicer room We tended to get used to the good staff on reception and the not so good so waited until the good staff were working before we asked for anything
All in all I would stay here again and anybody going shouldnt be worried

title: In the Heart of the Alamo
text: The Hotel Indigo at the Alamo is easy walking distance to that attraction and the transportation hub of San Antonio We were on the 4th floor and could see the wall of the Alamo from our window We had a great deal with a Groupon and ate in the 1909 Bar and Bistro two evenings and 1 breakfast Mike is a most informative waiter and aims to please

title: Cheap
text: Clean sheets so and so carpet  street Its as cheap as they come in San Fran You get what you pay for

title: There are better hotels out there
text:
The pluses
The hotel is in a good location if you want to stay in the Fishermans Wharf and be close to NorthbeachChinatown
Excellent beds If you need a lot of rest and not interested in being out this is a great hotel for it But then again why pay Fishermans Wharf prices when you can stay somewhere else with much better rates
The rooms have recently been upgraded with very comfortable plush beds flat screen TVs and new fixtures 
Theres a decent size lap pool and jacuzzi
Theres also a work out room and a laundry room
The negatives
Absolutely no view I had one of the better views on the 5th floor I paid extra 20day to upgrade so that I can view the Coit tower When I got to the room I realized that although I can indeed see the tower theres a much better view of the Petco 76 and Cost Plus Market Their store lights prevented me from leaving my window open to see the better view in the distance
The wireless internet is NOT free This is SF folks We have the most amount of free wireless in the US Tip I managed to use the wireless connection from the Radisson nearby for free
 Although this is supposed to be an upgraded room the dresser bulb is missing and theres a bulb out in the bathroom There is also no mini bar and no real desk to work in
 There are never enough towels and they are not nice towels
 The hotel guest information book is outdated and incomplete We ordered room service and half of the menu items were no longer offered and the prices are wrong No information in it on where amenities were ie pool check out time etc
 If you do decide to stay here youll be tempted to order room service Dont The food is not very good and is over priced not to mention does not come as it is described on the menu For example the Continental breakfast for 1095 that comes with a basket of danishes actually has two very very small danish same size as a sweetener package plus a 2 cup pot of coffee and glass of orange juice To top it off we were charged the new price of 1695 plus the 250 delivery and the 18 service charge The corned beef hash tasted like it came out of a can and the baby back ribs had no BBQ sauce as described on the menu Ive ordered room service in every hotel Ive ever stayed at and understand that the prices are always exurberant but I am more often than not satisfied with the food Not at this Hyatt
 The elevator is located in one section and is not in the center Some people are lucky enough to be located near it but for most its going to be long trek
 Parking is 36 a night regardless if youre a guest or not TIP There are free parking spaces at the end of Beach street for 4 hours maximum and near the Argonaut for max 2 hours
Overall its not the worse hotel you can be in But there are better choices out there

title: Our trip to New York was amazing
text: The Hilton Garden Inn was a perfect base for our trip to theBig Apple We were on the dorr step for many of the tourist sites The Empire State Buidling was 5 minutes walk away as was Macys The Rockefeller Centre and Madison Square Gardens were only 10 mins away The hotel staff are polite and courteous The hotel is clean and the rooms are well equiped The business suite was a god send for checking emails and printing off directions and maps from Google  Would definetly stay there again on our next trip to New York

title: Great place
text: Our family of 6 stayed at the Pearl for 8 days and was never disappointed The staff was attentive and helpful Gave wonderful recommendations of places to eat and how to get great deals Azi one of the doormen was fabulous always remembered our names and gave great suggestions The rooms were beautiful and spacious and the location was amazing Just steps away from Hells Kitchen theaters and Times Square We will definitely be staying at The Pearl the next time we visit

title: Good but noisy
text: The staff here were great they recognized me as a diamond member gave me an upgrade and sent me on my way Room rice was prompt and ok if a little pricey My only complaint is that the air conditioning unit sounded like an old truck driving down a rough road making it hard to sleep As I have only slept one night here I do not know if it was just my room or all rooms that are this bad but I did not get a good nights sleep

title: Felt Safe but just the basics
text: I stayed at this Best Western because I read the reviews of the BW President which were not very good I really rely on Tripadvisor for the truth Location was probably the biggest downfall but it is in Manhattan This hotel felt safe because it was near the NYPD In the middle of the night we heard bullhorns pulling over cars Although it is a bit of a walk to activities aside from the Convention Center it was adequate for one night The staff were very nice and the continental breakfast was adequate It is best to walk towards the Convention Center and then take a right for night time walks That way you walk by NYPD which is more than safe Walk up to 42nd St and turn right There was a great restaurant along the way called Cafe Josephine As you walk up 42nd St it starts to light up The room we had was small but clean No frills I would stay here again if I had to go to the Convention Center which is right across the street The price was right at around 200 night during Thanksgiving weekend

title: Beware incorrect charges to your credit card
text:
Pros
 Nice decor with character and chic touches
 Good location
 Smart room design and use of space
 Large shower
 Lounge with live jazz singerband was fantastic
 One concierge male was very courteous and helpful
 Great taqueria a few doors down that serves delicious authentic Mexican food
 Free WiFi code obtained from concierge
Cons 
 Incorrect charges on credit card after visit completed and everything had already been prepaid and confirmed by concierge The charge was discovered days later when the credit card bill arrived and was for parking despite the fact that no automobile was ever used during my trip Concierge had actually confirmed specifically when I checked out that I had no parking during my stay After 2 months of trying to follow up about this it was finally reversed but due to currency conversions I still lost money
 Breakfast ran out every morning typically by 830am with extra food not being brought out for other guests and I even when other guests asked on different days
 Elevator broke down the last day while two guests and I were inside trying to get to the lobby to check out on time for our flights The emergency call button didnt work could dial out but nobody could hear us on the other end despite the call going through several times and the emergency alarm didnt work either We were stuck going up and down for 20 min until we manually stopped the elevator and opened it by hand we were lucky someone was waiting for it because otherwise the outer door would have remained magnetized and we would still have been stuck Concierge did not apologize
 Two concierge employees both female encountered seemed inexperienced and therefore not particularly professional one of which was borderline rude
 Toiletries were not automatically replaced every day
 Suggest bringing ear plugs We were given one of the quietest rooms and the street noise was still quite loud
 Drinks at the barlounge were expensive and small and I live in a city where drinks are notoriously expensive
 Inconsistent level of service at the barlounge on different nights During busy popular evenings the staff are clearly of a differentbetter calibre On quiet evenings staff are completely different and much less experienced
Fortunately I paid very little for this hotel stay due to a promotion at the time I would have been much more disappointed had I paid 100 or morenight

title: Great location Big hotel Shuttle is quick food options are lacking
text: Pursuant to the other reviews it is a big giant and as expected Hilton Nothing bad nothing special Location is very convenient for work travel but should be the only reason you stay here  airport access Bar is good area to meet other peers from work but other than that nothing spectacular Tired cliche Boston food such as chowder and the nothing on the menu really stands out Food is soso Would stay again for airport access

title: nice indoor parkpoor rooms and guest services
text: Upon arrival I had one room reserved but purchased another to accomodate everyone with me due to the fact I was told i could purchase two extra bands during a previous phone call which would of been an extra 5000 verses 25300 I checked into 302 and 304 302 was not clean I immediately called the front desk they were going to send up housekeeping Well housekeeping went in and walked right back out without touching anything I went to the front desk with pictures of the room I was moved to another room but was away from my family into room 366 way around the building they werent even considerate enough to keep us close Yeah I received 2 free breakfast coupons big deal So later that night in 366 I go to shower and bout fall and bust my head on the bathroom floor where water is standing I call the front desk she says well its raining and sometimes that happens mind you the 4th floor is above me not the roofwould you like for me to send someone up like I was supposed to fix the problem or clean it up myself So a man comes up takes a look and says oh its just the air conditioner unit like that was okay He finally says well I can move you to another room if you would like So we are now moved to 470 around the building and upstairs from the rest of family that we were vacationing with and oh yes given another free breakfast The next morning upon checkout I asked to speak to upper management about the issues and gave them their free breakfast back because it was not worth what I had paid to have a stress free vacation I was looked at like why and asked what part of management I told the lady my problem since she needed to be so nosy and all she said was sorry you had a bad experience and never got management but I asked for a paper complaint form and it plainly states ask for management before departure if you have had an unsatisfactory stay SO PLEASE BEWARE OF THE ROOMS AND BEING ABLE TO SPEAK WITH MANAGEMENT FOR A RESOLUTION ELEVATORS WORK POORLY AS WELL

title: What A Mess
text: Do yourself a favordont stay here My wife and I were going to a business meeting and after arriving we walked into the hotel only to be met wth a very strong stench of bleach The hotel lobby is a mess and after checking in and going to our room on a very run down elevator which there was no inspection tag in we had a hard time opening our room door After we opened it we could not get it shut and I mean we slammed it to try and still wouldnt shut I had to go get the manager and show him and he gave some song and dance The phone didnt work and management was aware of this The bathroom looked as though it had not been cleaned in weeks We were told that if we spilled anything on the already stained carpets that our credit card would be charged another 250 The room stunk of bleach so bad that we decided to go up the street to the Quality Inn which we booked a new room We went back and talked to a nice lady at the desk who was treated like dirt by management She stated that she could not refund us any part of room charge I have spoke with the man that runs the hotel He refuses to refund any money I will be disputing the charges with my bank and calling every day to get refunded DONT STAY HERE

title: Good location great staff
text: The location of Staybridge Is hard to beat if you want to stay in MidManhattan You can take the JFK Airtrain change to subway line E and reach the hotel in less than a hour with little cost The suite had everything I needed Niina Nick and other staff members were very professional and helpful There was some construction going on nearby waking me up pretty early but it happens in a big city Yes some patience is needed with the elevators but never more than a couple of minutes Alltogether a very enjoyable stay

title: Nice short spring break trip
text: We enjoyed a 2 night stay at the Public I was a little concerned as I normally like the hotels closer to Michigan but won this one on Priceline It was beautiful weather during spring break for Chicago and we made use of their free bikes We were allowed a 2 oclock checkout which helped as we had a 7 oclock train We chose to ride the bikes on the lake side trail and used the lobby computers until it was time to head to the train station We ate a Lou Malnatis which is close by as well as a Barnes  Noble It was first time in this area The hotel was very clean Be forewarned my husband is very cold natured and there are no blankets on the beds He called guest services and had a couple of comforters sent up It was a very nice stay

title: Great Location Hotel was okay but would not stay again
text:
When we got to this hotel they could not find our reservation so we had to wait an hour this was not good for two young girls travelling alone from England this was our 2nd stay in the city but our 1st stay at the moderne we would of preffered to of stayed at th Milford Plaza like last time but the hotel wasnt available for us through Thomas Cook 
The receptionist was very helpful when finding our reservation
we asked for a fridge which cost 20 where as at the Milford it was free we wait 30mins for the man to bring it up we got the impression as we had not tipped him straight away for bringing our luggage up he took his time for our request as my sister after 20mins went down to reception as he was just sat there after he brought it up we were a little annoyed as we wanted to go out straighaway so we did not tip him for his shoddy service
The room was okay for just the two of us it had 2 three quarter beds
the heater made the room too warm even when it was turned off the floor was slanted and it was at the reception are near the desk too
The safe was ridiculous it was battery opperated and we felt we didnt want to put our valuebles in it as we were worried the batteries would die out at the Milford it was electronic
so we had to put our money and passports etc in our cases and lock them and put them up on the shelf in the closet out of site  
The only great thing about the hotel was the Location  5mins from Times Square and 5mins from Central Park

title: Fabulous stay
text:
I have stayed at this hotel several times and am more impressed each time Every staff member is friendly and gives exceptional service It is not new but a very elegant classic Remodeling was going on during our stay but it did not bother us If new and shiny are more important to you than quality and class then you might want to stay elsewhere This hotel is for those who appreciate old world charm and service
I might advise those who are allergic to feather pillows to look in the closet for a standard pillow 
We ate at the Champagne Sunday Brunch for the first time on this trip and were amazed at the variety and quality of the items served We will definitely make time for the brunch on our next stay We cannot imagine staying anywhere else in San Antonio

title: Great location and great price
text: We stayed for two nights at the Gaslamp Plaza Greeted by a enthusiastic front desk girl named Merry She was a lot of fun and handled our check in swiftly Rooms are nice and large We had a one bedroom suite Room had two tvs and a mini fridge and microwave as well as plates and silverware Parking is 28 a day but the valet service was excellent The ONLY drawback is that at night when you are ready to hit the sack the noise from all the people that are partying can be overwhelming since the hotel is located right in the middle of all the clubs But you can get free ear plugs at the front desk Or better yet just go party with the rest of them and then hit the sack

title: Nice hotel good location
text:
Stayed here three nights for business It was a good location for my meetings but the area does largely close down at night The business center is off the lobby and charges for internet access and printing other than boarding passes They also charge for internet access in the rooms  a big pet peeve of mine Parking was 20 per day but very efficient
Room was nice other than poor water pressure and noisy water pipes  not unusual in an older hotel Occasional noise from airport but not bad
The staff were extremely friendly  valet always remembered me front desk was very helpful etc
I would stay here again when in San Jose

title: Nice hotel surrounded by offices avoid the Lodge
text:
Stayed here for a couple of nights for a work event This hotel has all the usual Luxury Collection elements extremely attentive staff faux French decor golf course etc And thats all great except if you are staying in the Lodge
The Lodge is seperate wing on the other side of the golf course approx 10 minutes walk to the main hotel along a main road They will drop you off if you ask The decor is trying to emulate a hunting lodge with pool tables huge stone fireplaces and big oversize lounges The Lodge has a lovely deck at the front overlooking the golf course and the beautiful trees of the Queens city Which would be great except my room was overlooking a parking lot and the office building next door
Hotels spend a fortune trying to create a style which works only for some of the rooms in this case The problem isnt in the execution of the place its the location Trying to place a French Chateau which looks across to a hunting lodge in the middle of an office park really doesnt work to make the illusion of Euopean grandeur credible 
The room itself was nice with a large jacuzzi bath and a king size comfortable bed Overall a nice hotel with quality finishes and excellent staff

title: Great property
text: Rooms are a bit dated and the valet parking price is outrageous but the staff is amazingly accommodating to any request Every room has a balcony Hilton is refurbishing this property and I look forward to future visits

title: Overpriced for the room
text:
If judging this hotel by room size and condition it was adequate and average Nothing great and nothing too bad Rooms were relatively clean but for the price over 350 a night  yes I know it is NY but this was early April for a room with 2 queens I felt it was overpriced The bathroom was tiny I was staying with a friend and there was very little counter space in our room to even store our toiletries 
The room was relatively clean but there was no AC or ventilation to speak off We tried turning down the air or raising the speed of the AC fan but it was very warm and stuffy at night We could not open the windows due to the loud traffic and frequent sirens during our stay 
Being a Hilton Gold member we received free internet access but it was not easy to log on using my iPad My friend was able to log on using her phone but I was never able to connect We were given vouchers that were worth 19 towards a breakfast This covered a continental juice coffee fruit bar pastry bar or a take out coffee and pastry The full breakfast buffet was 36 Glad to have the free continental but have had much better at 2 star hotel 
Best rating for this hotel is for their customer service  it was friendly on checkin at Concierge desk hint go early lines are long unless it is early am even though they had 23 ladies on duty every time I passed and in the restaurant Second best reason to stay is location close to theater district Central Park midtown etc Easy to walk from here
Biggest pet peeve They charged me 350 a bag to store my luggage when I checked out I needed to store luggage for 3 hours before leaving the city This was a first for me Have not experienced this even in Europe Maybe I have been lucky but I did resent the sign telling me to pay in cash on pickup and informing me that despite it being a paid service they were not responsible for any valuables

title: A nice part of Seattle
text:
Our 9 day vacation in the Pacific Northwest ended with a three day visit to Seattle The city has so many interesting areas I had a hard time deciding where to stay I am so glad I choose The Silver Cloud Inn on Lake Union
 We had an upper floor with an upgrade for a lake view It was worth it because at night we could look out our balcony and off to the side we could see the Space Needle During the day you could watch the seaplanes take off The Hotel is very clean and the room was more than enough space for the three of us Husband wife and 14 year old daughter 
The best part of the hotel for my daughter was the make your own waffles every morning out on the beautiful sun roombreakfast area There were many items to choose from on the breakfast buffet and it was complimentary 
My husband and I used the free shuttle service that the hotel offers We took it into town for the Pioneer Village underground tour That was so much fun The tour guides are full of fun stories and goofy jokes They kept the tour moving right along and you learn a bit of Seattle history History teachers should be this amuzing At the end of the day you call the hotel and the shuttle bus comes to get you It was amazingly efficient friendly and free 
The hotel staff was very helpful in giving recommendations on places to eat and travel directions They always greeted you as you came in and left for the day They seemed proud of their city and their job
 The hotel also offers free parking You didnt need a car to walk to the restaurants along Lake Union We had two fine dinners at Dukes Try the halibutyummy reasonably priced and the waitress was so nice to us
 You cant go wrong with this hotel I loved Seatle and got to catch a fish at Pike Place Fish Market

title: memphis graceland
text: A refreshed motelLooks good overalla fridge and microwave and hairdryer and iron big queen size bed which was comfy and clean The downside are that the sink drain doesnt drain and the plug wont fit the bath A vast improvement from motel 6 downtown We purchased a gorgeous sandwhich from the deli across the road I would advise again just to watch the area at night as the liquor store has bars on it and a few bad people around

title: Chic but a bit pricey
text:
Ive stayed here several times over the last couple of years and quite like the W Seattle Its a very chic very trendy hotel with a great location but the prices are a bit steep The staff is very professional and efficient from the valet to the doorman to the front desk
The decor is very design hotel and the theme is dark and cool It extends to the corridors and rooms The room decor is dark purples and blues This is actually a really good idea in Seattle since come summertime the sun is up early and down late It makes sleeping a lot easier They have the WSheraton Heavenly bed which is just that  Ive seriously considered buying one for home theyre so comfortable The bathrooms on the other hand are only mediocre
Overall I think its a pretty average value and would stay here again

title: what a place to stay at
text: First time at staying at this hotel and i would be very happy to come back again All the staff were very helpful and friendly not like the last New York hotel we stayed at We were here to celebrate my wifes 50th birthday and they made it as special as anyone could I did not arrange anything special with the hotel prior to arriving however the hotel manager mike obtained a wonderful cake for her at no cost to us and also the kitchen staffwaitresses also made a breakfast cake out of a freshly made waffle complete with candle and all sang happy birthday to her The hotel its self is just as it advertises Great location for touring New York clean and tidy rooms very functional nice beds with adjustable firmness control Not to noisy however you are always going to get a certain amount of noise in the city that never sleeps and we were situated on the 14th floor at the back and experienced very little and nothing that disturbed our sleep

title: Top Quality Hotel
text: My wife and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont from 25th Sepember till 29th September 2008 When we confirmed our room booking i asked for a high room with a view of the Chrysler Builbing This was from recommendations by previous Trip Advisor Travellers We were told by the hotel that they could not guarantee this as the hotel was fully booked However on arrival we were taken to Room 2904 and we were not to be disappointed We had one of the most spectacular views that i have ever seen The Chrysler Building and Midtown New York lit up in all its glory A magnificent sight to go to bed to at night The hotel was spotlessly clean the staff were professional and courteous They even have a pillow menu 5 different types of pillow from soft to hard never had that in a hotel before The hotel is only 4 blocks from The Empire State Building about 5 to 10 minute walk About 15 minute walk to Macys and 20 minutes to Times Square Broadway Contrary to reports before we went we found taxis to be clean quick and reasonably cheap We used one from JFK to our hotel it was cheaper than the train 4 of us were travelling  45 dollars which is the standard rate to anywhere in Manhatten plus a 4 dollars 95 cents payment for a bridge toll A deli that i can recommend for breakfast is Cafe Metro great value and everything cooked fresh and to order in front of you It is on the corner of 370 Lexington 41st a great start to the day And anybody wanting a great steak try Juniors at 1515 Broadway and 45th street a famous New York Steak house we had a 20 oz Sirloin with all the trimmings

title: Great View of the Hudson
text: I love the location of this hotel and you will get great views of the city or the Hudson A very short walk to times square and many places to eat and shop all within walking distance

title: Great City
text: We had a wonderful time in San Francisco The city is truly magnificant We stayed in a very large suite which was great The breakfast was wonderful the food generally was superb The pool was fabulous if not a bit too crowded and it was in the best location possible It was well decorated especially the dinning room and the building was very opulant And the service was some of the best I have exeperianced in the US I just wished we had stayed longer

title: Unexpected Gem in SD great staff
text: I was in San Diego for a business trip and was not expecting much from the hotel I was pleasantly surprised by the hip downtown location as well as the overall appearance and history of the hotel I was greeted by a few very helpful young men at the valet station  one of which a young man named John who gregariously brought my luggage up to my room and told me he could give me a historical tour of the building It was a former bank and most of the interior is original its a historic landmark Most notably the ceiling in the lobby is handpainted and immaculate There is also the original safe which was quite impressive I cant tell you all of the surprises  youll have to find John to take the tour  but its worth it The breakfast buffet was good too  with an omelet station A must for any business traveler with a long day ahead of them

title: Perfect location fantastic guest services lovely rooms
text: This was my second stay at Hotel Rex I would highly recommend it for anyone traveling within San Francisco The hotel is one block off of Union Square so it is quieter than the other hotels right on the square but still easily accessible to great shopping trolly cars etc The evening wine happy hour was a great way to meet new people and relax after a busy day

title: I would stay here again
text: Few blocks from Fulton subway station Really clean safe place Nice hot breakfast Staff was excellent I read one review about the slow elevator and thought how bad could that be but it really was slow I definitely would stay there again

title: what a great stay
text: Had a wonderful time staying at the W city center All the staff we met was soooo nice and helpful Especially Eden Bernal She suggested places to visit while in Chicago and was very helpful thank you Eden We will be back as i have falling in luv with the beautiful city of Chicago

title: Great old hotel awesome location wonderful neighborhood vibe
text:
We traveled to DC for Easter Break We arrived on Thursday before Easter The lobby was crowded but the valet service was prompt and helped us unload our car with ease There was a line to checkin but it moved swiftly Aside from a very annoying and rude customer in front of us who kept calling the Omni representative Evil Amy our checkin went smoothly We were given room 715 which turned out to be lovely Very spacious nice veranda with a view of the Washington Monument in the distance The room was clean and I would have rated it even higher for cleanliness but for the hotels failure to wash the windows  which were pretty bad We had no problems with the elevators or the crowds  the hotel complex is huge and there were a couple school tours staying there when we were but we were never inconvenienced The concierge desk was wonderful
