What we liked best was the hotels location One block from a Metro Stop  2 or 3 blocks from the National Zoo Also there is a nice little strip of restaurants shops drug stores etc right next to the hotel Open City Diner was wonderful and right across the street You couldnt ask for anything more convenient Yes you are a ways away from the DC tourist sites but the Metro can have you from the Hotel to the Smithsonian in 10 minutes  for a 130 no less The only time we had to take a cab was for Easter Services at the National Cathedral We did not take any of our meals at the hotel except for grabbing coffee and danish at the cafe in the mornings on our way out to see the sites The hotel restaurants were very expensive  especially Easter Brunch I have to disagree with some of the previous correspondents who complained of the poor rooms they were given and the indifferent staff  our experience was to the contrary We had a wonderful stay and would certainly stay there again

title: Unique and origional features Great location and value
text:
When arriving at this hotel you are greeted by pleasant and helpful staff You then go up to your room in the old style of elevator and behind the origional features you discover a spacious clean and ample living space 
You are perfectly placed for all bars restaurants and bus and tram stops You will never struggle to find somewhere toeat or drink and you could do far worse tan to walk across the road and sample the numerous reasonably priced local beers
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would happily return With a change of mattress to a more comfortable version and a reduction in the cost of valet parking at the apartments then this would be a perfect place to stay

title: loved the roosevelt
text:
stayed at the roosevelt for my partners 40th birthday 
the staff we found were very helpfull and the location was brill all in all a good alrounder rooms are better than avg well cleaned and fresh bedding every day bathroom well stocked downstairs in the lobby theres the bar fairly priced for newyork and bar food not to pricy but cheaper can be found at grand cental they have tons of eaterires to chose from there all types catered forand only 5 mins away from times square and broadway
would stay here again

title: Great Location
text:
This is another great Joie de Vivre property The hotel was built in 1927 and has been nicely renovated The rooms are small as one expects in a building this age but very well appointed Hotel staff was very friendly and customer service oriented as is the case with all Joie de Vivre hotels
Excellent location a few blocks from Union Square Easy walking distance to the Embarcadero the Opera House City Hall etc Onsite restaurant Saha serves very interesting Middle Eastern cuisine even for breakfast Service was a bit iffy but the staff were all brand new and very anxious to please
Outstanding value for downtown San Francisco We will definitely be back

title: A super value in a very clean hotel
text: We stayed in two rooms for five days while attending a convention The fiveblock walk to the convention center was a pleasure The downtown area was clean and safe Plenty of restaurants and other sites to walk to We will go back to this placeit was really friendly and clean clean clean Oh the beds were nice and firm

title: Location is great but the hotel needs some work
text: I am writing this review as I am traveling back home to Dallas from NYC The hotel is in a great location just a short walk from times square However the rooms need a few renovations most notably the bathroom showers elevators wallpaper and ac units The room we stayed in 1008 had an ac unit that made a loud rattling noise when on Maintenance came and fixed it the first night we were there but the noise returned the next night and we had to temporarily move to another room for a night while they worked on it further Also our in room mini bar did not work and that issue was never rectified Lastly if you stay here I highly recommend that you request a room on a lower floor This way you can avoid the elevator and take the stairs The elevators are extremely slow and will only comfortably hold 4 normal size peoplealthough we experienced several rides with 6 people cramed in Overall this hotel did not live up to my expectations for 340 a night The location is great but I would expect a better overall experience for the price

title: Loved the Distrikt
text: I got a special rate at Distrikt so it was fairly cheap for Manhatten Its 2 or 3 blocks from Times Square Not really our thing but might be for someone else There is easy access to the subway station at the 42nd st stop There is also a liquor store and late night pizza joint within a very short walking distance The doormen at the hotel are very friendly They will carry bags flag down taxis and anything you need with a smile Anthony at the bar is a great bartender He got us in the skyclub at no cost When we got our hotel we asked for a room with a view and quiet We were on the 29th floor so we heard no street traffic The elevators are very fast never had to wait on them The lobby and common areas are very clean The apple computers are free to use and there was always one available to print flight stuff Our room had a view of the Empire State building The room was small but arent they all in NYC But the amenities were fabulous The bed was comfortable and the shower was nice Free wifi Nice flatscreen tv We called the front desk for a wine bottle bucket and razors They were at the door in 5 minutes I would definately stay here again

title: Good place but find parking elsewhere
text:
Girlfriend and I decided to make a spurofthemoment weekend trip to Boston This was the hotel we happened to get through a website that allows you to name your own price
The hotel itself was great The facilities are newly renovated and everything was clean Checkin and checkout were a breeze Even though it wasnt right in the heart of downtown the T Red Line subway was just a short walk away Theres free wireless internet in every room and a business center allows you to surf the web and print things out for free This was a Godsend since we didnt really do a lot of preplanning for the trip we were able to plot out places we wanted to see and print the necessary Google Maps and look up stuff like hours admission fees and so forth
I had only two minor complaints and one major complaint Minor complaint 1  for being such a ritzylooking hotel I was surprised to learn the pool is outdoors and therefore seasonal Seems like a hotel that would have an indoor pool Minor complaint 2  the windows arent very energyefficient We had to crank up the heat to 75 degrees in order to make up for the coldness near the windows
Only major complaint about this place is that they dont own their own parking facilities Valets are available to take your car to a nearby private lot which is a jawdropping 36 a day As nice as this hotel is its still not the Ritz Carlton Who ever expects to pay for parking at a Holiday Inn Ive never been to a hotel where you pay for parking even at better chains like the Radisson or even at Disney World
Thanks to TripAdvisor I was warned this parking fee by checking the hotels amenity listing but there werent really any reviews to point it out so I wanted to draw attention to it
If youre flying into town and NOT planning to leave Boston at all ie dont need to rent a car I suggest taking the T from the airport to the hotel Its very easy to get around the city if you have an unlimited pass to ride the T or if you dont mind walking Take the airport shuttle to South Station then get the red line to CharlesMGH Yes if youre looking at Google the blue line Bowdoin station is just as close as the red line but the blue line doesnt stop there on weekends
Even if youre driving in like we did find an outlying T station and ride the train in Usually the stops at the end of the line have the largest parking facilities In this case we parked at Alewife the station at the western end of the Red Line It was just a short 6stop ride to CharlesMGH the stop closest to this hotel and the parking was just 5 a day So instead of paying 72 for 2 days of parking we paid just 10 Not to mention you get to avoid driving in the heavy hectic city traffic
When you buy a T pass I suggest the 7day pass even if youre only there for a weekend its cheaper than buying two 1day passes Unlimited rides on any subway or bus which makes it easy to jump around town without constantly wondering if youve got the right change for fare The T is pretty clean though some of the stations are in the midst of muchneeded renovatons We had no problems with it even at night
Of course if youve got a big family and lots of luggage taking the T might not be so convenient Even for a family of 4 taking the car in and out everywhere might be cheaper than getting 7day T passes for everyone

title: Above and beyond
text: I stayed at the Orchard hotel with a friend for a getaway weekend in the city We were greated by kind and genuine employees from the front door to the front desk Shortly after arrival I received a call from the front desk that my car wouldnt start and couldnt be moved to valet parking Several of the staff came out and we all tried to figure out what was wrong This was of course well after closing of repair shops but they helped us find numbers for AAA and for a local dealer and made what could have been a crummy situation as easy as possible I feel that they went above and beyond the call of duty and can say that the rooms and amenities in the rooms were in line with this assessment as well Good size rooms for the city and very comfy beds and the bathroom is bigger than the one in my home So I will absolutely stay there again

title: Good Hotel to see the sights with a young family
text:
We choose this hotel based on its central location and of course it being part of the Marriott family We have a two and half year old that we wanted to take to the Washington Monument so location was key 
Once we arrived we were greeted by the parking manager who got the car checked in 44 per dayinout privilege and a bellman promptly unloaded the car and got us on our way Checkin was quick and efficient by a friendly gentleman The hotel features smart elevators that cuts your elevator wait time in half which is nice
Upon arrival to the room we were delighted to see that we had a view of 14th street and not the courtyard i had forgotten to inquire at the front desk about this From the 10th floor we also had a nice view of the Washington Monument our main reason for the visit We found the room to be exceptionally clean and reasonably spacious for a DC hotel The corner window was a neat touch that a lot of the rooms had The bed linens were of high quality and very comfortable We had also requested a rollaway and it was placed in our room while were away It was much nicer than normal which was nice
We checked out the pool as well and found it to be acceptable The high speed internet is not free in the rooms but free in the lobby We did not use it throughout our stay
Overall the hotel is well located and in good condition I thought the service was great from start to finish The best part was the location it was close to the National Mall and Smithsonian Although pricey I felt it was worth being close to these areas as we had the two and half year old and couldnt walk around for long periods of time I would highly recommend

title: Good location  good roombut
text:
We have stayed here for four days First I thought this hotel is great
Nice location that be overlooked the WTC memorial park 
and nice room that has enought space to open 2 104L suitcases and 2 50L backpacks
there is a fridge  range and two TV The room design is modern 
I thought this hotel is great But second daywe came back after sightseeing
I surprised our room didnt finish to clean up 
Only bed making and amenity change was finished
Used towels were still there one room was not cleaned
I didnt know why  We didnt leave a message or didnt put the card not to clean on
Immediately I said it and brought us some towels
So next day  we came back my room didnt finish to clean up too
The day  the carpet wasnt cleaned up I disappointed at the hotel

title: AWESOME Cannot wait to get backeveryone was so friendly
text: Very convient to shopping food and Medical Center

title: Oh dear this is an apology for a Radisson
text: Having used Radisson hotels in the past we thought we couldnt go too far wrong We arrived in the early hours very tired and looking for a room and were advised by the night staff that they had just had a cancellation Despite the fact it was 0130 in the morning the reservation assistant was adamant that he could not include breakfast or reduce the rate We were also advised that we would have to pay a 22 valet parking charge After some negotiation and dismay with this and the room rates we were given a very small discount How I wish we had found another hotel We approached our room to find dirty glasses and coffee cups lying in the corridor outside and it went downhill from there Inside the room we found a half consumed meal and bottle of water in the fridge biscuit crumbs on the chair and table and a sticky pest control device underneath one of the beds Far from there being a cancelation it was clear that the room had recently been used and not been serviced Only one coffee cup and water cup remained there was no laundry bag no glasses or cups in the bathroom and the beds had not been made up properly These were the almost forgiveable aspects of the airport Radisson The completely unforgiveable centred around the grey and stained net curtains the stained bed linen the cracked sink the wallpaper peeling off the wall and the socket hanging out the wall The room was shabby and tired with old fashioned furnishings cathode ray TV and was certainly not what I would expect for nearly 300 Added to this is the audacity to charge 22 or parking and the valet parking service provided by individuals who openly tout for tips Unfortunately having travelled far with a half asleep eight year old we were far too tired to take issue with the room that evening We raised our disappointment the following morning with the reservation manager Gandy who was clearly dismayed at the situation and offered an immediate reduction We appreciate your efforts Gandy but this Radisson hotel needs to address the fundamentals of hotel value and service provision I have no doubt that our room had been double let having probably been used for a day let or airline crew and to then charge nearly 300 for an unserviced room is unacceptable However what is also unacceptable is the standard of rooms being provided at premium rates This hotel has obviously seen better days and needs a substantial refurbishment but there appears little incentive so long as there is a lucrative airport traveller catchment market Dont be fooled by the grand entrance and valetconcierge desks  if you have the choice do yourself a favour and find somewhere else to stay

title: Good Location Good Price for SF accomodation
text:
We stayed at the Town House back in May 2012 for 3 nights
Our first thought was OMG mainly because the chap at the lobby was a bit grumpy Once we were given the room we were very impressed with the size and overall state of the room
The best thing I found is the hotel location for the price we paid US 26700 for 3nights specially if you are at SF as tourist
The Fishermans Wharf is at walking distance 15 min we did it many times and also the crooked Street is at walking distance if you wish to walk if we didnt do 
You have the Hop onHop off double decker bus stop across the road and a few stores where you can few things you might need 
Union street its quite close too and there are plenty options to have breakfast and dinners I recommend you spend some time there for breakfastnice cafes
The cons for me were
 The air spray used by the cleaning lady was too smelly I know this might sound a bit a silly but for me it was definetely a minus
 The noise at nightas other people has appointed it gets better if you close the windows but you can still hear it
Overall I recommend to stay here if you are on a budget

title: The staff at SLS helped me feel right at home
text: During my 2 day and 2 night first stay and definitely not last  the staff made me feel right at home Thank you to Lisa both Jasons Tessa Fredo Wyatt Bari sp Natasha and the whole breakfast staff for going above and beyondapologies to those whos names Ive forgotten

title: Decent if not terribly interesting
text: I traveled here for a conference and was mostly satisfied with the experience All the staff at the hotel were very accommodating and helpful Rooms were clean and neat I liked the use of stone as part of the decor since limestone is famous in Austin There was nothing terribly interesting about the hotel itself but thats not bad Nofrills competence works on a business trip I did wish the elevators were not quite so congested during peak times I lived on the 20th floor and sometimes had to wait close to 5 minutes for an elevator and then had to stop at every floor as it picked up people They should make separate elevator banks devoted to different floors Austin as a city is incredible well worth the visit

title: Great Location fine hotel
text:
We stayed here with my parents and our young baby and it was all fine The location is great  just behind the Air and Space Museum which we love
The hotel itself is pretty average but if you get a good deal on Hotwire its GREAT value for money considering youre within walking distance from almost every main attraction in the area 
The breakfast buffett and room service were good  not too expensive for what it was 
All in all we were happy to have stayed here and would hope to again if were ever in the DC area again

title: The Adolphus is a Treasure
text: Great size rooms  we had a suite and it was perfect for 4 people The atmosphere is very elegant and the service was great We have stayed at the Adolphus in the past and once again it was a great experience The French Room is wonderful and they make you feel special

title: Great Location for shopping
text:
Very nice hotel right in the middle of all the shops in downtown San Francisco Hotel is also right next to the cable car stop so its easy to get about the city
Room had modern style duvet cover and was clean and tidy with a TV and coffee making facilities Whilst the hotel was not luxury it was certainly more than adequate for myself and my boyfriend as we did not spend much time in there Ok the view from the room onto an interior courtyard was not great but it really didnt bother me There are also free internet facilities at the hotel which was a bonus
I think if I stayed in San Fran again I would stay in a hotel in North Beach just because it was nearer the nicer restaurants Little Italy that we visited each night But Union Square was very good and literally right in the middle of the shops its just that there was not very many places to eat around there apart from Burger King etc Felt perfectly safe returning to the hotel at night though as the area was busy with lots of people
Visit to Alcatraz is a must but be warned San Francisco is actually quite chilly even in Summer and especially in the evenings  I think due to the fog the city gets So definitely take your jeans and a proper warm coat

title: Very good but not quite great
text:
The good great location by Independence Park and in Olde City very good service nice bedding and furniture terrific highend ambience jazz trio at the bar in the evening Omni Kids program nice 42 wallmounted flat panel in renovated room
The bad pool was being renovated could hear unmuffled noise thru room door and adjoining room door unrenovated room vehicle got a few dings from the tight parking garage next door used for valet parking

title: theWittrendy different
text:
I stayed at theWit for three nights My husband was in Chicago on business and had been there a week I was iffy as to whether I wanted to make the drive from Ohio but after I read the reviews I wanted to see the hotel 
The valet were very fast and friendly Parking was 5000 a day but there was in and out privileges so I thought it was worth it I cant imagine finding anything much cheaper
I didnt check in at the desk since my husband was already there so I missed out on the cookie everyone is talking about in their reviews The hotel lobby was very modern clean noisy and small Not a relaxing lobby like some hotels
From theWit you can walk to Millennium Park Navy Pier Michigan Avenue Art Museums and Theaters There is a radio and TV station across the street so you can watch and listen to the news unfold if you like There is shopping the next several blocks that is great There is also the train loop right out the front door Great for getting around but very noisy and dirty
I thought the room was fineaverage We didnt have a corner room with large windows etc The view was an office building across the street 
The room had a nice desk and chair for work purposes but the internet was expensive There were three tiers of service offered for internet and I think the cheapest was over 1100 a day I did use the business center once and it was very nice but also expensive to print For some reason our cell phone service was terrible in the room The beds were comfortable not bad but not great
The bathroom was clean and large The sink was different as some have stated on here Not something I would want at home but cool for the weekend The door to the bathroom was a large sliding door that didnt close all the way and was really heavy and hard to handle It was weird
Housekeeping was fine They cleaned the room daily In the evenings when they did turndown service they left little witty cards with different toys to go with them We got a frisbee and several other items Cute idea
I didnt hear crickets or other noises that people have talked about in the halls
In the evenings it was crazy You had to show your room key to get into the lobby There was a guard at the front door People were lined up outside for the entrance to the rooftop bar and guests were lined up inside An elevator was dedicated to the bar and roped off It made the small lobby even crazier and louder Elevator service was slower The elevators have a security measure where you need to use your key to access the guest floors but some guests dont get the concept so it was even crazier and slower
I had breakfast in the restaurant The hostess was very attentive to the guests needs and happy to be sure you were taken care of quickly I thought the food was fine I loved their yogurt parfait Not cheap but what is these days
So all in all I thought theWit was fine Clean friendly staff but I would probably stay somewhere else next time It wasnt my cup of tea If I want the noise and crazy I go to Vegas

title: Should probably have a tetanus shot
text: This place is gross I was there for a convention and heard over and over from the participants what a dump it is The lobby area is nice and meeting rooms are ok and the beds are comfortable To be fair it appears that they tried to update the rooms but painting over a hole in the wall doesnt cover up the fact that theres a hole in the wall Im not a germophobe by any stretch of the imagination but I wouldnt walk barefoot on the carpet The hallways especially in the nontower parts of the building stink horribly The final straw for me was after dragging my luggage through several doors and down carpeted hallways I actually had to carry it down some stairs because there wasnt an elevator handy In the process of trying to do this my calf rubbed against the stair edge which had a sharp metal piece hanging off of it Of course since I was wearing a dress it cut my leg and still more than a week later I have a scab from it There are much better places to stay in Houston  Id advise looking elsewhere and for Petes Sake dont book a convention here

title: Experience at the Carlyle
text: My family spent 9 nights at the Carlyle in DC and enjoyed the service and hospitality The staff was very friendly and service oriented Two of the staff Jordan and David were especially helpful with restaurant recommendatiions and directions to different places in the DC area The rooms were well serviced and clean The hotel is located in an area surrounded by restaurants cafes and grocery stores in the historic Dupont Circle section Most of the essentials were within walking distance of the hotel

title: What a dump PLEASE READ MY REVIEW
text: I was not expecting a palace but this place was a disgrace Typically hotel rooms are no big deal to me because I merely sleep there However I believe as a hotel it should be condemned It had a filthy carpet stained walls broken night lamp broken oldfashioned tv flea market furniture no ac or fan small and few towels dangerous uncovered steam radiator dim lighting lumpy bed very weak shower pressure and the walls were painted different colors How they do business is beyond me There are better hotels for the same money It is so awful I intend to contact the NY dept of consumer affairs Save time money and stress STAY ANYWHERE ELSE

title: Good Value Close to Downtown
text:
Located close to town The approach is bit disorienting as you pass by a abandoned building The Hotel looks pretty much used but our queen bed room was fine and clean
Our room was on the 5th floor the shared balcony that run all around the building offers a nice view at the Mississippi river Service is really minimal But you get what you pay for

title: Always a pleasure
text: We stayed here last week for my birthday The front desk upgraded me to a bigger room without me asking The parking is very reasonable and safe at 1600 a night You are in the perfect location to walk to the Filmore Polk Russian hill and some of the most beautiful parts of SF Japan town is such a wonderful place to explore There are so many shops and delicious places to eat I am always more than happy to stay at Hotel kabuki The rooms are stunning and the service is outstanding How can you beat the amazingly romantic views from your window This is the place I most like to stay when Im in San Francisco

title: Great location  affordable price
text: why pay more when youre only in the room for about 10 hours a day

title: Great hotel with a lot of personality
text: Hotel is on the San Antonio Riverwalk The rooms opening up to the courtyard are great Fabulous bar and the Hotel staff is very welcoming and friendly This is not the typical Marriotts or Hiltons but has a huge personality which make you feel at home Fits the name as the hotel is designed to give you the feel of a spanish villa It has nice restaurants around it I will recommend visiting Acenar Restaurante and The Esquire Tavern Huge thumbs UP

title: Stylish modern hotel in fantastic location
text:
The hotel has a fantastic location right near the White House and only 3 blocks  5 mins walk from the Metro Centre tube station This made the city easy to explore
The room we had was very spacious clean and modern
The hotel was very busy on friday  saturday night with a party atmosphere The rooftop bar is definately worth a visit for the views and to watch the sunset but got quite chilly so wrap up warm
There are not that many restaurants in the immediate area and the ones about were very busy so we would recommend booking a table
We found the staff very helpful and would stay again if we were to return to Washington

title: Go there to eat and drink but be careful of the rooms
text:
I had a relatively enjoyable stay at the Palmer House I will say that the concierge and bell staff is absolutely exceptional For example I had a question about parking and asked the bell man He was unable to answer me but then later sought me out to give me an answer That is above and beyond service and is definetely appreciated 
I have stayed at the Palmer House several times The first time I had the lovely accomodations which included two bathrooms and absolutely fabulous fixtures and finishes The second time I was put into a room where the wall paper was falling off the wall the fixtures were rusted and the tile in the bathroom was moldy I literally threw a fit and was granted a free voucher for my next stay That brings me to my most recent stay I was once again put into a notverynice room with rusty fixtures a dirty bathroom and scratched furniture Since it was free I was okay with it But thank goodness I was only staying one night I travel quite a bit and I will tell you that Ive stayed in nicer hotels in the middle of nowhere Wisconsin for example the AmericInn 
The lobby of the Palmer House is outstanding The vibe is wonderful the restoration is beautifully done The food and drink is delicious My recommendation is that the Hilton people find a way to improve their dumpy rooms ASAP I will continue to recommend the Palmer house for a drink and dinner but will advise all travelers to be sure to specify one of the suite rooms green decor if they choose to stay there Otherwise you are better off at one of the other fabulous hotels that Chicago has to offer in its downtown

title: Nice Hotel Difficult Access
text: Beds were comfortable room was clean and breakfast was good 2 of 3 mornings The overall location is good but access into the property is difficult It has one entrance accessible only when traveling west The hotel sits on an island between east and west bound lanes of congested Poplar Ave and near I40 I240 merge lanes If you are not familiar with the area be prepared to circle a time or two

title: Great place to stay
text:
Stayed at the Sofitel for 2 weeks on business and enjoyed it completely Rooms were sleek and modern and the bathroom was marble with both a shower and bath The bed was on the soft side but I found it terrific as I did the huge TV There are Keurig coffee makers in the rooms plus complimentary bottled water and also coffeeteafruit in the lobby early 
The gym was respectable for a hotel gym and had a mix of cardio weight machines and dumbells One of the few drawbacks was the elevator  one needs to swipe ones key card to get to your floor but they often malfunctioned Of course its a good security measure but could be annoying Since I did not pay for the room I cannot judge if it was a good value
The Rittenhouse square area was wonderful Loved the park farmers market on Saturdays and all the shops nearby Marathon was a reliable favorite restaurant and Trader Joes is walking distance Another tip the Palomar Hotel across the street had a happy hour from 1011pm

title: Good Location Tiny Hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed here for a surprise anniversary trip to NYC The location was great  close to a metro stop very near Macys on 34th St and close to the Empire State Building The hotel is very small in general The lobby elevator hallways and rooms are almost miniature Our room was clean enough but there wasnt room to relax The small window was blocked by an AC unit so there was almost no view of the street 
The bathroom had a stand up shower with no edge therefore the shower water would run onto the rest of the bathroom floor
The service at the hotel was very good The concierge was friendly and helpful On the early morning that we left it was pouring down rain The concierge hailed us a taxi and gave us an umbrella
While I did enjoy our stay in NYC this hotel was pricey and small If you dont plan on being in your room much I would recommend it Otherwise go for something that has a little more space

title: Wonderful Anniversary Trip
text:
My husband and I stayed here for our Anniversary trip from April 16  19 2012 It was a wonderful experience beginning to end This was our 4th visit to the Distrikt Hotel New York City New York 
Starting with the reservation process Peter was so helpful in making sure the details of our stay were correct Also I did a last minute followup email where Kayte reconfirmed everything was ready for our stay Their professionalism helped set the tone for our visit Thank you
Upon checking in at 245 pm Will at the front desk was so helpful and professional making sure our room was ready for us With keys a complimentary continental breakfast coupon and a 20 coupon for food at the Collage Bistro in hand we took the elevator to the 30th floor to Room 3001 It was a beautiful King room with a city and river view Very quiet super clean There was a note from Ms Rota the General Manager welcoming us with brownies a welcome note A Distrikt tote bag and chocolates in a plastic container WOW This was wonderful
We went out for a walk to the Chelsea Market and when we returned the turndown service had been completed along with two amazing chocolate cupcakes and a card from the staff welcoming us too Plus chocolates and a weather card on the bed Another WOW
The room is beautifully appointed with fresh clean towels robe a wonderful Coffee Maker with coffee and tea thank you from an early riser and a great flat screen television Our room was wonderfully kept by housekeeping and the turndown staff We appreciate that greatly
The breakfasts in the Collage Bistro were wonderful and the service from Anthony and Miguel was flawless A great way to start the day
Peter again was so helpful with change a cheerful disposition welcoming and professional Ana was wonderful and checking if we needed anything Neesha was wonderful and helpful with the printing of our boarding passes 
Upon check out Rachel was wonderful super kind and professional Joseph was great at hailing a cab for our return to JFK airport and loading our suitcases in the trunk of the cab
ALL THE STAFF AT THE DISTRIKT HOTEL ARE THE BEST
Ms Jennifer Rota the General Manager should be commended for her management skill and leadership of her staff We are also SO APPRECIATIVE all of her help with our room selection the warm hospitality and gifts which made our anniversary celebration trip the best ever We will definitely return to the Distrikt Hotel in the very near future
Much Appreciation and great Thanks to you all
LV Hoffman Florida

title: Old New York Gem
text:
I just wrapped a long weekend in a Grand Luxe room at the St Regis Our little family of four 2 kids under 6 fit easily in the vaulted beaux arts chamber and even into the generously sized double beds
Jacob Astor would feel right at home in any of the giltbedecked chandelierlit rooms What you give up in modernity you get back in an indescribable feeling of participating in history not unlike taking a weekend holodeck visit to the roaring 20s My two girls were positively awestruck the minute they hit the lobby and the room sent them over the top Its the princess reaction Disney aims for and will always fall short of because there is nothing like the real thing That classic feeling permeates the whole hotel from the tuxedoed butlers to the clubby King Cole Bar to the silver and china breakfast in the Astor Court The unrelenting sophistication can make you feel perpetually underdressed in anything short of ball attire but never uncomfortable
Sure there are shortcomings The phone control system is a total trainwreck the TV remote was rubbed unreadably clean running the hairdryer destroyed the TV reception the butlers were sometimes unreachable the 800nt room had a view of an HVAC there was only one robe there is no lobby lounge area the doormen seemed to run hot and cold and the furniture was a little wobbly Management was totally unaware of a massive 5hour long and very VERY loud party on the floor  but was quick to react when notified I wouldnt want to pull a late night working out deal documents at the Louis XIV desk and matching straightback chair either 
I could see why someone might criticize the ol gal when compared with a nice new sparkly glass tower at the same price point  especially if one was on business But for a family or romantic getaway you wouldnt come close to the transporting experience of the St Regis So much of the best of NYC is within walking distance of 55th and 5th you might not even need a cab And speaking of transportation the Bentley house car wasnt too shabby either driven by one of the nicest employees at the hotel 
We will definitely be back

title: Perfect in Everyway with the Exception of Checkout
text: This hotel is a great value for the money The location is great and the rooms are well appointed and comfortable and very spacious The checkin experience was exceptionalwe two couples traveling together were offered room upgrades suites for an additional 20per room and complimentary champagne upon arrival Staff are extremely perhaps a little over the top friendly and very accomodating The only disappointment was at checkoutI instructed the clerk to charge both rooms to one credit card but unfortunately our traveling companions were charged separately for her room This was a simple request that should have been honored

title: Great rate wonderful stay and super staff
text: We stayed here for three nights in August We chose the hotel for the nightly rate Seaport location and great parking rate We were happy with every part of our stay The hotel is in a perfect location to walk to the Seaport  Brooklyn Bridge and Battery Park The subway is just down the street What was by far the best part of our stay was the wonderful hospitality by the staff Every person we encountered in the hotel was so helpful and kind The front desk was so full of information and suggestions The night we arrived the gentelman working even offered us some yogurts to take to the room for our young children The rooms are large for NYC size and the doubles have 2 queen beds instead of 2 doubles as most hotels offer The day we checked out we were able to store our luggage in a storage room while we spent the day in the city The parking is 20 a day just across the street that is a fantastic rate We would stay here again in a heartbeat

title: I cant believe it
text: I was more than shocked upon arriving at the registration desk on Saturday November 6 I had made my reservation three months in advance I had requested and was promised a room in the Towers Upon speaking to the clerk he said to me we do not have a room for you We are overbooked I replied You must be joking as I made my reservation over three months ago Furthermore you have my email address and you never contacted me at any time telling me that you were overbooked You left me no option but to come to this desk and be told Too bad we are sorry we have no rooms The fact that you offered me another hotel and would pay for it was of little consolation It was 6 miles away and all of my colleagues and meetings were at the Marriott It is a sad day that a hotel chain that prides itself on friendliness and professionalism has fallen so far and perhaps so fast

title: OK Location Expensive Parking Dated Rooms
text:
The hotel itself looks very nice including the lobby and restaurantbar Our reservation included breakfast buffet which was delicious Staff is very nice and helpful We got a refrigerator in our room upon request
The rooms are dated with worn down furniture The carpet under the bed visibly was never vacuumed and had a thick layer of dust The bed was comfortable but the linens didnt fit properly and kept sliding off The bathroom was clean 
The valet parking is the closest parking available within a few blocks and costs a a mind blowing 45 for one night

title: This time it was ok
text: I have stayed at this hotel quite a few times in the past year and it was pretty good until this Sept 2009 The pizza guy knocked on our door at 11 pm at night when I had just gone to sleep then at 530 AM I had taken a shower and washed my hair and when I used the hairdryer it made a funny noise and quit working and the noise from the hairdryer some how made the alarm go off in the room and it woke my son up The beds were hard this time and I had a hard time going to sleep The location is great for going to Seaworld and right next door to shopping and the price well you get what you pay for  its nothing like the Hyatt The people were friendly and helpful

title: Funky hotel in central location
text:
Whenever I book a hotel I always expect the worse so I was pleasantly surprised to see this place was nice clean large enough for two people for 5 days and has a bath tub The street people can keep you awake at night on the weekend but its ok during the week Lucky there were heaters in the room to dry our clothes from all the rain 
Pro central nice clean bathtub gym comfy beds
Con littered noise Im ok with and lift little slow again if this is my only problem then this is a great place

title: nice hotel terrible location
text: Honestly the bums you hear about are dangerous they are not only homeless and in need of money they are mentally disturbed Its a shame because the hotel was nice though the rooms were outdated old TV that did not work properly and the sirens keep you awake like most cities the walls were paper thin a group of people were walking past our room at 2am and i could swear it sounded like they were IN our room it was that loud But i give them points for trying A few incidents occured we got abused for not giving the hundredth bum a quarter who in turn threatened violence crazy people hovering around the ATM across the street one guy was groping people in inappropriate places its such a shame as this has nothing to do with the hotel But all he same i would not return

title: Heater sounded like lawn mowerfriendly front desk staff
text: Prior reviews complained the rooms are in a state of disrepair When you check in and first visit your room take nothing for granted Check to ensure everything works properly Dont wait until you are unpacked and half asleep before you decide its getting a bit chilly and you might want some heat Because if you do this in room 1239 you might have a problem unless you can sleep five feet away from a sound that mirrors a running lawn mower The folks who run this hotel must read these reviews That means they must know things are in a state of disrepair Despite this they continue to rent rooms to guests who mistakenly believe they will find everything in working order when they get assigned to a specific room The folks that run this hotel should be ashamed of themselves

title: Extremely classy hotel with some drawbacks
text:
We were in town for a wedding for which the reception was across the street at the St Francis and chose the Kengington Park becuase of its higher reviews and it seemed to be more dog friendly In fact it turned out to be probably the most dog friendly of many hotels where weve stayed with the little fella not in terms of amenities no dog bowels blankets etc but who really needs them but insofar as how the staff acted toward him Which gives rise to the next highpointoutstanding service We decided we didnt need want full housekeeping service on the second day of our stay but did want the garbage emptied The staff was on the scene within two minutes of our request Front desk staff politely greeted us by name upon entering and exiting 
The decor of the hotel is just as subtly classy as the service Complimentary juice and coffee are served in the morning and sherry and tea in the afternoon Some light snacks with the latternuts etc would be a nice touch Room service is from a deli La Taza two doors down and stops at 7 with what is basically a lunch menu We just went there and got take out for breakfast opt for the fruit rather than the burned potatoes to avoid the service charges Theres another deli Cafe Encore two doors down thats open until 8 and has a broader selection of sandwiches and salads that can suffice for dinner but a less appealing breakfast menu The Farallon a highly regarded restaurant is part of the hotel so its hard to understand why they dont have room service from it at least for dinner
The room was fine nice decor great TV comfortable beds but quite cramped for two people and a dog including a small bathroom The low speed internet access was adequate for our purposes higher speed connections are available for a fee The room was supposed to be one class up from the base it was about fifteen bucks more per night but in fact the only difference is youre on a higher floor with a view of Nob Hill or Union Square Our view of the latter was the side of the new tower of the St Francis There is a well functioning ceiling fan but no ac and the window lacked a screen It was in the low 70s the day we left and you could tell by 1130 that with the sun coming in through the window unless you drew the shades there was going to come a point when the room would get stuffy As a native northern Californian I can attest it can and does get into the 80s several times a year in SF and even the 90s an handful of times I would suggest checking the 10 day forecast if planning to stay there any time from April through October and if theres a chance of such temps changing to a hotel with ac Noise from Post St was a real problem up to 130 am on Sunday morning partiers literally screaming and many sirens I would imagine thats a problem anywhere you stay in the Union Sq area 
All in all a very positive experience at quite a reasonable price for that part of SF around 130 per night through the hotels web site booked over a month in advance

title: Excellent Service  Perfect for Business Travel
text: The concierge was exceptionally helpful I needed some items at 630 am at my room and did not realize it until 11pm the night before Everything was there at precisely 630am No fuss

title: OK for minimum time spent at hotel overall experience not great
text: I usually get annoyed when reviewers badmouth places and try to give the benefit of the doubt but I cant do that here Spent 3 nights at this Best Western with my boyfriend Usually Best Western is a solid name for quality but this place needs a little work The breakfast area was complete chaos each morning which could be corrected by extending the hours of the breakfast one hour since everyone was scrambling to get food by 9am which meant not much for selections The rooms are nice and I love the soapshampoolotion dispensers instead of the normal little bottles most hotels have Beds were comfortable TV was nice but limited channels unless you know Spanish 2 biggest annoyances I had  the toilet overflowed once and everytime you flushed it took several minutes to finish My boyfriend did not like how the room service came around at 8am and knocked on the door 3 times within a half an hour We were awake but it certainly was not relaxing or romantic The ice machine was outside our door not in a separate hall or room and people seemed to need ice at 5am Kind of noisy

title: Not worth the hype
text: My stay at the Willard may have been unique since the other reviews have been glowing I went with two friends and we were dressed in jeans and sneakers The staff treated us horribly The doormen wouldnt help with the doors or your lugguage and the concierge was very rude Our room was nice but not 450 worth I expected the Willard to deliver the service you would receive at the Four Seasons but that was not the case The location was great and the lobby was beautiful But in the evenings the lobby turns into a smoking room and you can barely breathe as you walk through the lobby to the elevators I personally would never stay here again and save the few cents and stay down the street

title: Definitely not luxurious
text:
I arrived at the hotel at 245 pm to check in and had to wait about 10 minutes for my room OK 10 minutes no big deal The lobby was nice enough the lounge was relaxing and the front desk staff was friendly I got my room key dropped my bags and left to go shopping I came back around 7 pm that night only to find that I had no hot water among other probelems For a luxury boutique hotel I was truly disappointed 
The rooms had been redone but they forgot the bathrooms The fixtures are outdated think 1970s there were burn marks on the orange countertop and there was a significant black and rust stain in the tub Not to mention there was hardly any water pressure The rickety cheap metal closet doors dont open and close properly if the safe door is open The walls were so thin I could hear the phone ring and the subsequent conversation in the room next door I could also hear the people above me walking around all night I called the front desk who immediately sent people up to try to fix the problems Housekeeping told me there was nothing they could do about the stain The safety lock was also loose The maintenance man told me I would have to wait at least a night or two before he could fix and as the housekeeper left the entire thing came off in my hands She just looked at me and shrugged 
The pool is a joke Ive seen tubs bigger than that The restaurant is OK The free breakfast is basically fruit and yogurt If you want eggs bacon or toast you have to order it All in all I will NEVER go back or recommend this place to anyone If you want something in the area try The Parc Suites Its MUCH better

title: Excellent service and accommodations in a small footprint
text:
Staying in a downtown Boston hotel was an interesting firsttime experience for us seeing as we lived for 25 years less than a mile away from the Back Bay Hilton and still consider ourselves locals This property is perfectly located in close proximity to many of Bostons cultural dining and shopping venues and was for us a perfect home away from home
Commercial property available for new hotel construction has been virtually nonexistent in Bostons congested downtown and Back Bay areas for decades This would explain why the Hilton a relatively recent arrival to the Boston hotel scene is appreciably smaller than for example the much larger and older Sheraton directly across the street which has the advantages and disadvantages of being integrated into the Hynes Convention Center and Prudential Center complexes The Hilton on the other hand has a very small triangular footprint on a tiny lot and is only 26 stories tall this gives it the unexpected and highly welcome ambience of a Europeanstyle boutique hotel rather than a bigcity American commercial property
The feel of a boutique hotel was reinforced by the front desk staff housekeeping staff and other lobby service personnel who were all extremely friendly efficient helpful and solicitous almost to a fault We were greeted by one or more staff members each time we passed through the lobby This level of personalized service is quite remarkable even by high Hilton corporate standards and especially so for this city Bostonians in general have a wellearned reputation for being rather unfriendly and xenophobic the thought idly occurred to me that perhaps all of the Hiltons staff had been recruited from nonnatives imported from elsewhere
The room rates and parking fees are rather steep as is normal for bigcity hotels The adjacent parking garage was wellmaintained and convenient to the lobby As Hilton Gold members we were given a free upgrade to a corner room which is somewhat larger asymmetrical and appreciably less claustrophobic than the standard rectilinear rooms Our room seemed to have been recently rehabbed and was nicely decorated and wellequipped including a large flat screen HDTV with a generous assortment of digital channels
The free breakfast served in the executive lounge was somewhat more limited in selection but far higher in quality and freshness than the standard breakfast fare served in Hampton Inns and Hilton Garden Inns in the Hilton family  in fact it was much better than the restaurants in most Hilton hotels as well We plan to give their adjacent 40 Dalton restaurant which shares a common kitchen a try on our next stay All in all this was one of the most satisfying and rewarding Hilton experiences we have had in recent years To find this extremely high level of guest accommodations and service in our former home city was as astonishing as it was unexpected

title: A big ole cockroach on the 15th floor
text: I stayed at the W on Lexington last night and actually got used to the small rooms They reminded me of Europe rooms and although theyre a bit too modern for my taste I prefer the Westin it was still fine This morning after my shower I was greeted by the largest cockroach Ive ever seen and I lived in South Florida for 4 years as it scurried right past my feet in the bathroom I ran into the bedroom to pull my suitcase off the floor and onto the bed so he wouldnt climb in and figured the bug had run into a corner and wouldnt be back Well about 5 minutes later the same cockroach comes running toward me in the bathroom again I managed to flip the opaque trash bucket on top of the roach I finished getting ready and when I mentioned the incident to the front desk and how it was still there under the trash bucket all I received was an Im sorryno explanation nothing Needless to say even though my work is keeping me in the city another night I went a block and checked into the Doubletree It was a much lower rate even as a walkin and the rooms are more comfortable and the staff so far is very friendly

title: Not special cheap decor
text: We booked three nights at this hotel when others nearby were full so we probably paid full price The location was excellent near great shops and restaurants We did have internet access but the bathroom towels were cheap In fact the room had the decor of a hotel less than half the price Really I was embarrassed for the management The housekeeping staff was conscientious and friendly while the lobby staff was competent in checking us in and out They certainly didnt seem to value us as customers Frankly I cant believe another reviewer called this hotel the best part of Philly For us it was a convenient and comfortable place to stay in order to enjoy the city but it was overpriced not special or attractive

title: Fabulous hotel  will stay again
text: We traveled with 2 other families to NYC and stayed in Affinia Dumont Got a great deal from Priceline The manager gave us upgrades from the studio to 2 queen bed rooms This hotel was great for our large group and for the kids Excellent location very friendly and helpful staff HUGE roomsuite for NYC Walking distance to the subway Macys Bryant Park Dunkin Donuts is right outside the hotel grocery store and fruit vendors are nearby Would definitely stay here again

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
I stayed here for five nights while on a business trip This is a phenomenal hotel and the rate I paid was below many of the surrounding properties It is in a fantastic location right near the financial district but also close to Union Square and all lines of public transportation I also walked to North Beach in around 15 minutes
The employees were all extremely helpful and the decor was adorable You cannot miss the wine reception 
As other posters have noted there can be some street noise in the wee hours but it did not disrupt my sleep Also some of the restaurants in the very near vicinity were not open on weekends
I would stay here again in a heartbeat

title: Hotel GeorgeThe Hotel Youll Want to Pack Up and Take With You
text:
My son and I went to Washington DC this past week I had not been there in several years I searched Trip Advisor and other places to find the best hotel that was within my budget After reading several very good reviews and then seeing the room rate on Expedia almost half of the what other hotels were charging I thought something isnt right here I continued to go back and forth but then finally pushed the button and booked the room Initially my son was not going with me on this trip It was a few weeks later when he decided to join me So I contacted the hotel to see if I could get a rollaaway bed in the room I received the nicest email back from Patrick Donovan Hotel Georges Asst Front Office Manager who took care of that for me and then later sent another email that they had an opening in a better room and moved me there at no extra charge to me Very nice
Upon my arrival the hotel staff were so friendly and accommodating It gave me the feeling that I was among friends Already this trip was off to a great start
When we walked into our room we were not only thrilled with the spacious luxury that it offered but were so moved by the thoughtfulness of the staff
They knew this was Alexs first trip to DC I mentioned in an email So there were passes to museums maps and a lot of information about the city especially for us on the desk Also a couple of gifts that they specifically chose with Alexs age and new driver status in mind Outstanding
We had not eaten for some time at that point and couldnt believe our eyesthere were wonderful treats on the desk for us as well
Fruit and Cheese Plate Hotel George
This was a first for me and the many hotels Ive stayed in around the country Travel several times per year and usually stay in Expedia rated 3 and 4 star hotels 5 being highest based on room rates services offered etc A very nice note from Jasmine Ward Guest Services Agent for the hotel accompanied the gifts and food We also received a call from the front desk checking to see if the room was suitable and if we needed anything else Wow I told Alex Id like to pack this hotel and take it with us
The bathroom was simply beautiful It had marble tile flooring a stand alone shower and the bath tub had the handles on the side which was a nice touch The vanity had my favorite featurethe makeup mirror with magnifier  awesome Lots of little extras too The shower also had its own set of shower gel shampoo and conditioner No messing with little bottles and such 
I felt a woman must have designed the bathroomwell done
The bed was heavenly So soft with its pillow top mattress and quality bedding The pillows were perfect for the support I need for my neck yet so soft too
The locationthis is where I thought the other shoe would finally dropit didnt Because the room rate was so much more reasonable than other hotels with similar ratings  very high I kept thinking there was a catch
There wasnt
It is within walking distance of the Capitol and the Supreme Court as well as many other landmarks We walked a lot and I can tell you that the area also was very safe We walked to Chinatown and back our first night there No problems just need to be alert There were a lot of people around too Friday night I had to spend the rest of the evening going over my notes on a presentation I was to make the next day and had plenty of time to do so after our walk around the area Upon our return the doorman greeted us again by name
Also special note to runners  they have a running map in the room Another nice feature being a smaller hotel  once you leave your room you can be outside in about 2 minutes
Service and staff  As I said before nothing compares to this stay and hotel 
The staff make or break a hotel
It can have all the best amenities but if coupled with poor customer service most guests wont go back Also I have to add it wasnt just the arrival and such that the Hotel George staff were so thoughtful friendly and helpful it was through out my entire stay I met up in DC with a larger group 12 of us and we had a tight schedule Locating family friendly restaurants in DC that have entres under 10 and can accommodate our group on short notice was a bit of a trick On Sunday night  930 we were looking for a restaurant like I described We had just finished up with our last function and had not had time to eat since noon We drove up to the hotel and the gentleman behind the desk quickly made a recommendation placed the call and made reservations for our group that were waiting in their cars out front The group was really happy with the restaurant too Clydes
There were many other instances where staff went over and above  doing so like it was their standard mode of operation
Our last night followed a very long and tiring day I needed to print out boarding passes for flight home I put it off as long as I couldnot having the energy to get up and go find the business center Finally I called to ask where to go in hotel for such Michael Love the Hotel George Front Office Manager again almost read my mind He offered to take care of this for me and just slide the passes under my door Another first Usually if bringing something to the room its another interchange that requires among other things another tip I really appreciated Michaels help  he was placing them as he said under the door  within minutes Michael Love also wrote us the nicest note thanking us for our stay with them and included a gift certificate too Wow the hotel that keeps on giving More from the allstar staff  awesome
From the doorman to the guest and front office housekeeping staff etc Everyone was more than accommodating Setting a high bar for hotel customer service
Lobby  beautifully appointed with grand piano tasteful yet comfortable furniture There are two very large windows they span from floor to ceiling so if you are waiting on people as I was its perfect to sit have some lemon water or hot chocolate Also they have a wine reception in the late afternoon complementary I wasnt able to make that but would have if I would have been around the hotel at that time I didnt snap a picture of the lobby but it looked just like this that I plucked from dcluxuryhotelscom The black chairs were very comfortable
The Restaurant Bistro Bis  Alex and I had lunch there on Sunday It has great atmosphere We ordered 2 hamburgers medium well They were good
The last morning before we departed I went in to the restaurant to get change The staff there that morning were wonderful Very nice  even made me a cup of coffee to go and were very gracious and warm The coffee was great too
When Staying in DC do yourself a favor and stay with the folks at Hotel GeorgeWashington DCs best kept secret

title: Wonderful customer service
text: I would definitely recommend the Westin Times Square The front desk staff is wonderful and the hotel is a fabulous oasis of calm amid the hustle bustle of Times Square

title: Use your money to stay elsewhere
text:
I went to Boston on vacation to see the city The hotel is NOT in the downtown area You have to walk though a construction area under the freeway to the subway I didnt stay out after dark There is no store not even a 7 11 or any type of restaurant within walking distance The cafe on premises is not a cafe Its place to get something to eat to keep from starving The hotel is very noisy Children running and slamming doors which shakes the building It is not worth the money at all I was there for 4 nights I would have moved but upon check in they give you a contract that entitles them to charge a penalty if you check out early I booked this hotel throught Hilton I was very disappointed
The one good thing They asked their shuttle driver to drop me and pick me up at a restaurant on their way to the airport

title: Elegant and romantic
text:
If you prefer minimalist ultramodern dcor then this is probably not the place for you The Waldorf is all about old world charm  big sweeping chandeliers lovely art deco1920s style rooms The bathrooms arent super modern but bright and airy with highquality fittings and scrupulously clean A huge bath tub if like me you like a good soak
We stayed in a suite which was really luxurious  roomy with lots of period furniture and helpful staff on hand whenever required Really tranquil and relaxing I found the Waldorf the ideal place to catch my breath after the bustle of the city Id go back there in a heartbeat

title: Love the old school vibe
text: Stayed here for 2 nights in the yacht club suite Amazing Enjoy the many fitness options plus the happy hour

title: Unsafe and Scarey
text:
Unsavory neighborhoodnudie bars etc
Unclean walkways
Food only soso
Felt unsafe in parking lot
Someone tried to enter our room around 700 AM Was not room service the man tried to enter from the sliding glass patio door
A definate lack of security

title: One of my favorite hotels in NYC
text: I discovered the Lucerne Hotel many years ago and try whenever possible to stay there The rooms are spacious and comfortable the concierge is always amazingly helpful The restaurant next door is just fine and the location is perfect near Central Park and just off Broadway The only problem with the hotel is that a lot of other visitors have discovered the Lucerne as well and I have found it very hard to find a room when I need one so Ive had to venture out to other hotels which have mostly been disappointing by comparison Also as the hotels popularity has risen prices have escalated Alas

title: Business Trip Sparkling New Modern 21st Century Hotel
text:
Im a business traveler looking for specific things very cleanquiet and modern excellentquiet airconheat system that is user controlled good wifi connection good tvreception no bedbugs proximity to major subway lines
I dont care about room size light or views
PROS Brand new sparkling clean excellent king bed WiFi has strong connection great TV reception attentive maid service better than average size NYC room a real 21st century room with power outlets everywhere excellent use of space in a small area great desk plenty of taskroomlighting plenty of natural light although it doesnt matter to me Staff are very nice and cooperative but they need to keep some bathroom amenities close at hand rather than relying on housekeeping to supply later at night For a business traveler on a budget like me this gives me plenty of comfort for the money Major subway lines at either 34thHerald Square 3 mins walk or just east of Penn Station 2 long NY blocks 6 mins walk
CONS This stretch of 31st Street is pretty meh Not creepy or dangerous but guests need to be willing to walk a couple of blocks in either direction to find restaurants etc
Neighborhood Dunkin Donuts is at the corner of 31st and 5th Plenty of good dining options but dont expect the street itself to wow youit wont The hotel is a gorgeous modern building surrounded by well buildings not as nice Close walking distance to hip eateries like the John Dory Oyster Bar down Bway 4 or 5 blocks on 5th theres a very hipmod Kyo Chon Korean place great value cool vibe Further up on 5th36th Pret A Manger which stays open till 10pm for light fare 31st east a couple of blocks things get better for dining 
To date Ive spent two trips 6 nights here and plan to return for my business travel

title: Great service location
text: I have stayed in Marriott locations in many states and I think I have found my favorite This hotel is a beautifully restored old bank building Everyone we encountered from the front desk to the valet to the bellmen to the bartenders at happy hour treated us like royalty Arnecia and her boss who we chatted with during the really great food and drink specials at happy hour at the bar made us feel like old friends visiting We even got a hug during our last day They also made some great restaurant recommendations We got a tour of the building from Danny the bellman who went out of his way during a very busy day to take us around and discuss the history and renovations of the building He even has some great ghost stories if you like to be spooked I was also impressed when I walked by one of the maids on my way to our room and she asked me if I needed anything Service here was really impressive It is in a great location close to the gas lamp district I would definitely stay here again when visiting the San Diego area One tip if you are looking for brochures discounts or other info about attractions in the area ask at the front desk as they keep them locked up

title: Loved this place and will return many many more times
text:
You do get what you pay for and yes this place can get expensive during peak times However this place truly showed its worth to us We came here for the first time in May for our daughters 2nd birthday We wanted a beach vacation and I found this place while searching hotels near Sea World I instantly thought how it reminded me of our trip to Hawaii and how perfect this place would be being right on the bay and with a room feet away from the sand It did not disappoint for a second The pools were great the bike rentals on sight the restaurants quick room service other activities ducks and fish all around the property but most importantly the fire pit on the beach 10 feet from our door and water another 10 feet this place provided such a wonderful time for us and our 2 year old that it quickly became one of the best places we have ever visited and we travel extensively 
As a side note we wanted to come back to San Diego the next month for a quick getaway and this place was a little too pricey being that it was June I found the Hilton across the street almost and thought it was similar in features We had such a terrible experience there that we checked out the next morning and I called Paradise Point We were upgraded all the way to the Presidential Suite and they saved our vacation which had so been nearly ruined by the Hilton I can not say enough about this place and with all that they have done for us and how we were treated both times this is my FAVORITE place to stay in San Diego and should not be missed We are going back in September My only mistake in June was not going with Paradise Point to begin with Dont second guess this place Find a good rate go with AAA or Destination Delivers or call them but choose this place for a real great vacation

title: Comfortable beds clean rooms anf very friendly staff
text:
After reveiwing Trip Advisordecided on this Hotel
The Hotel is only 3 months old and was in a great location
Would stay here again

title: Great place to stay  bed very comfortable  good tourist location
text:
Location is great  right near the art center of Dallas Be sure to go to the Chase Building to see the view It is open during the work day The Westin Center which is adjacent to the hotel and accessible via skywalk has many places to eat It also has an ice skating center The Dart public transportation is located right near the hotel and for 4 day you can travel to the downtown area West Side to see the 6th floor museum JFK memorial and the Dallas Aquarium more like a rain forest We basically walked everywhere Be sure to stop at the visitor center located at the Old Red Courthouse at 100 South Houston Street in Downtown Dallas  they are very helpful
The bedding is excellent  very comfortable Internet was free in the lobby section
We were able to get a great deal for this hotel through Hotwire

title: Well worth the money
text: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at The Salisbury It was our first trip to NYC and I had found this little gem on this site We had read the reviews and figured for the price and location we would give it a chance I am so glad we did The staff was very friendly the room was huge with a kithenette and king sized bed We were minutes from Central Park and Times Square We didnt use the subway much instead opted to walk alot and also bought a 3 day tour bus pass the hop on hop off type So woth the money and it stopped minutes from the hotel door I would definately stay here again and will recommend it to anyone I know

title: Girls Night Out
text: Wonderful resort with lots of amenities for the entire family Gorgeous facility Golf for the adults water park for the children nice pool outdoor fountains and firepits shopping nearby with shuttle service Great location with city and mountain views

title: A hidden jewel in Century City
text:
I was on a business trip to LA and I needed to find a hotel with the following criteria
 Must be close to the venue
 Must be economical
 Must be in reasonable distance from LAX
I did a little research and found HIE Century City
The hotel was clean the staff friendly and the breakfast was great Helped start each day with a smile
In particular staff member Troy front desk was exceptional He was able to provide local intel on restaurants and entertainment and even helped with some tips on visiting Venice beach
When I return to LA on vacation I will always stay here If I could give them 6 stars I would
If you have any other questions you can reach me on FB httpgooglboljF

title: You can do better
text:
The hotel was clean and the grounds were well kept The front desk was efficient and despite a large crowed who arrived just ahead of us it only took a few minutes to check in 
The room is fairly large about the size of two standard rooms but everything was as cheap as you can get The carpet towels cabinets and bedding were of the lowest standards The bed was like sleeping on a giant slice of stale bread 
My wife and I went to Austin to see the Round Rock Express they won It is about a twenty minute drive to Round Rock from the hotel and the route is a little hard to follow with all of the construction The location is not very convenient to anything though the area is nice enough
While we thought the hotel was okay for the money we paid the next time we are going to find a place a little more comfortable

title: New favorite place
text: The building we stayed in was newly renovated and was immaculate The beds are the kind that you can adjust the firmness great The window covering was full length sliding 3 panels shutters You could still get light in and have privacy plus you could adjust the amount of light you got just like at home Okay so the view was great There was a small play area across the street for kids swings and their was a pier to fish off of and some beach to have a fire You could see downtown San Diego across the bay very easily since there were no clouds to be found Everyone was friendly Then there was the marinabeautiful I would love to retire here with my husband and just enjoy life

title: DO NOT BE FOOLED LIKE WE WERE
text:
I am wondering if the people that wrote good reviews were paid off
They speak no English and when we recieved our room the FIRST time it was wrong and it looked 10 feet into a bare wallquite a viewlet me tell you
The SECOND room which was wrong again was as big as a closet or pantry
The THIRD room was OKkinda we were just tired of moving around At least it had a direct view of a giant tree 10 feet away from the window
The TV did not work
Free dinner was disgusting and felt like we were in a hospice
HORRIBLE
LEARN ENGLISH

title: Poor Service
text: Do not stay there if you do not have to  such poor service  so dissappointing

title: Typical ridiculously priced average NYC hotel
text: Lives off of its glorious past Rooms are fine but nothing special food is at best average and the prices are typical NYC absurd My wife and I had lunch in their lobby restaurant for 140 which constituted two Caesar salads with average quality seared tuna not cooked according to request two iced teas some fruit for dessert and two cappuccinos If not for my business expense account I would never walk in this hotel Ultimately its nothing more today than an overpriced NYC Hilton with a glorious past

title: Nice property good location good value
text:
We chose this property for its proximity to the beach and because it looked a little funky We were pleased with what we discovered here
Situated at the southern end of Venice Beach the Inn is located near a lot of restaurant choices and away from the craziness of the ocean front walk 
The rooms we booked several different rooms due to group size were nicely appointed with seemingly newer furniture and the bathrooms were furnished with good quality toiletries
The continental breakfast was also sufficient to meet our needs to begin the day
The front desk staff is friendly very helpful and wellversed in area attractions restaurants and points of interest 
Well be staying here when we visit the area again

title: Very nice experience
text: Just the opposite of the kind of ultramodern hotel we usually stay at but with the charm that goes with oldschool European type hotels Very reasonable rates great location and helpful staff made this place a find

title: Location location locationand great service too
text: The Ritz Carlton in Chicagos Water Tower cant be beat for its location especially when the cold winds blow off Lake Michigan An elevator ride delivers you to eight floors of shopping heavenWater Tower Place without ever braving the elements Ive stayed at this hotel a number of times and am always taken with the warm welcome helpful staff and very comfortable accommodations On my last trip Concierge Laurel was a wonderful resource booking hard to get tables making terrific recommendations and organizing reasonably priced transportation to a wedding in the suburbs The small but lovely spa is a nice place to unwind and indulge in a bit of pampering and a dip in the pool is a great way to end a day of touring The barlounge area is a terrific place to relax and chat too

title: Better than I expected
text: The rooms open to the outside in a typical motel like setting so needless to say I did not expect much but I must admit that I was pleasantly surprised The rooms are very well appointed you have a full kitchen a desk a sofa and a very comfortable bed albeit it was full size not queen My only complaint is that the breakfast which was included was not good at all I did not have dinner which was also included The internet connection is not good however I prefer to use a mobile wifi which is secure If I had to rely on the hotel internet I would have not been happy Overall if you need a nice clean place to sleep with comfortable amenities this is a good choice and the price is very reasonable

title: Great Hotel
text: We had a wonderful stay at Hyatt We stayed in King Room on the fifth floor above the swimming pool The hotel was very clean and nice I would stay there again All the employees were all freindly and helpful Walking distance to the pier cable car and plenty of restaraunts we ate at both restraunts across the street we felt they were good and plentiful Knuckles had an excellent buffett and food as well but a little more pricey however I would say is average with most restraunts

title: Great Hotel but too classic and old style
text:
Four Seasons is a very well known brand but mostly due to the service they provide
During my stay at the hotel the crowd was 90 years or older Even though the staff is very young I couldnt feel very welcomed Everybody is nice but very impersonal Didnt feel very welcome and I felt I was one more number to the hotel
The rooms are spacious and work well for two experienced travelers however very classic and the Plasma TVs dont go well with the furniture
The service is good but could be better for 5 hotel
Location is good but not the best 
Rates are what we expect for a Four Seasons but you can get a suite at a 4 for less
Overall is good but not excellent

title: Great Accomodations
text: As a first time guest at a LaQuinta I was really pleased with this hotel The staff was friendly and welcoming The rooms were spacious with comfortable accomodations I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area

title: Good value clean comfortable
