text: I stayed here with my toddler for one night We were given a handicapped room even though we did not request it The bathroom was spacious and had the toilet tub and sink all in one place The bed was comfortable and bedding was clean Breakfast is simple bread muffins makeyourown oatmeal and grits packets juice coffee There is a JackintheBox and Waffle House in adjacent parking lots Room was fairly quiet We could hear people passing by in the hall but could barely make out a screaming kid in the room next door who managed to keep it up for an hour Very good value for 45night No complaints for this price

title: Great place close to everything and great service
text: Staff was very attentive to all our request They go the extra mile to make your stay very comfortable I am already making this place my home away from home Looking forward to the new restaurant and bar next year Thank you

title: Spacious rooms
text:
We stayed here for one week for sightseeing and enjoyed our stay very much The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful We had several inquiries for the concierge including making reservations at restaurants and were always helped promptly Checkin and online reservations through the hotel website was smooth and without any problem 
The rooms were spacious in absolute terms not only in NY terms I think you could place an additional double bed in that room The only disadvantage is that that space was left quite unused aside a chair We had a couple of times breakfast in our room the rooms come with a kitchen but we did not have a second seat I cannot image how we would have managed to eat dinner here the kitchen would have allowed to prepare a real dinner Anyway it sure was not very disturbing
As a whole the rooms are very clean and modern We asked for a room on a rather high floor and we got one on the 21st floor This gave us a splendid view on the city Certainly recommended
The hotel is very well located the subway is just one block away 34th street also has a lot of shops Empire State although I recommend Rockefeller and Madison Square Garden are within walking distance
Highly recommendable

title: Always Great
text:
I stay at INK48 twice a year for business The hotel is only a few blocks from great shops and restaurants and a fairly easy walk to the Javits Center where I am working while in NYC Yes you might have to walk a bit more than you normally would but honestly thats one of the reasons I like staying there a little exercise never hurt anyone 
The hotel is always clean and the staff is always friendly I Definitely recommend INK48 whenever I have friends heading to the ctiy

title: Felt like I paid more for the room than I have actually paid
text:
The service is exquisite It felt like no else was staying in the hotel because the hotel employees was genuinely happy to greet us every time we walk in and walk out of the hotel 
The other great thing was the awesome Whole food market downstairs It is very convenient to grab a bite to eat Definitely one of the best Whole foods weve been to
I would stay in another pan pacifiic again because of our experience here

title: Like staying with Friends
text:
This was our first time at a Howard Johnson and the hotel was attractively done the price was very nice and the breakfast being included was just amazing We stayed 4 nights and each morning was eggs sausage biscuits gravy donuts muffins cereal waffles bagels ect We ate in our jammies and got around nice and slow no rush
Bigger than all of this we came to San Antonio to visit a brother and the second day of our stay I got a call from home in Missouri that our dad died I was not near a fax of my own or anything I needed for such an event BUT the general manager of the hotel Labib is his name faxed funeral stuff out for me received faxes for me and was all around a fine and compassionate new friend Sarah at the front desk also helped us plan our day trips with her great suggestions Go and enjoy

title: Not up to par
text: Considering this is a fairly new property its a disappointment Im a Gold Elite Member for the past 10 years so I think I know what Im talking about This property is lacking in many ways and sadly a lot of it is common sense The staff is young and clueless you should know that the loop of the business park you are in is just a tad more than 05 miles and you shouldnt be giving out handouts claiming its 129 Your staff should know how long travel time to attractions Bank of America Stadium etc should be distance and time wise Its just sad that they didnt There is no exercise roomfacility on site but they do offer day passes to a local gym but they cant tell you how close it is The pool area is only accessible from outside Its a nice pool but nothing special The breakfast area is small but I left too early to comment on the amenities The room is fine and is pretty standard The sink area indeed is a touch small but not a problem The Wifi is a little slow but not achingly so The problem with this property is two fold A its newish so the expectation level is higher B the Fairfield brand has undergone major upgrades over the past few years so here again the expectation level is raised This location looks good but doesnt deliver Too many other choices in the Charlotte area for me to consider coming back

title: Great Location
text:
Huge hotel right on Times Square location great for NY sites theatres and short walk to nearest subway station Room was good size large flat screen TV tea and coffee making facilities large bed and all very clean Free newspaper delivered to room each morning Awesome lifts check in is on the 8th floor
Coming from the UK we found NY very expensive and asked the Concierge if she could suggest some less expensive restaurants but those she suggested were breathtakingly expensive We quickly found a street of restaurants nearby that didnt require a bank loan to pay for the meal

title: NIce Stay at the Hotel Felix
text: My 10 year old son and I stayed at the Hotel Felix for two nights while the Phillies were in town I got a great rate on priceline The staff checked us in at 10am on the day of our arrival and was permitted to check out at noon our last day I found the staff to be very accomodating and friendly Room was small as stated in other reviews but it was nice Bed was very comfortable Our room looked over a parking lot when you looked down but I choose to look out and saw some nice views The location is good not great you are just off the action maybe four short blocks to Michigan Ave I would stay again

title: Ok but not up to Marriott standards in some ways
text: First of all Im a Mariott Platinum Premium which means I spend way too much time on the road and in Marriotts The room was very good spotless and checkin was very pleasant The downside is that the hotel is overpriced even for the location tends to be a conference hotel and has a really bad room service menu Its not that the food was bad it wasnt but the menu was pretty limited All in all an OK Marriott but not at the price

title: Loved it
text:
I read plenty of reviews of this hotel before booking it Many of the reviews complained about the room size and the noise I decided to ask for a room away from the elevator alley and on a higher floor My stay was wonderful 
The room was very nice and clean and it was not like a sardine can as others have suggested The size was just fine for my husband and me and we enjoyed it I noticed someone said the bathrooms have showers only but ours was just a regular room and we had a bathshower combo Bathroom was stocked with Aveda products small travel sizes of course and the mini bar had lots to choose from True there is no bar or restaurant in the hotel but right next door is a little cafe where you can get wine pastries and other food Plus there are tons of other places nearby It is located in Union Square right across from the China Town gateperfect location 
Overall the decor and hotel condition is a little oldseeming but it was not bad We stayed just 2 nights and I have no complaints I did not need ear plugs but its a good idea to bring them just in case when staying in a city if youre a light sleeper 
The one bad thing is that there was a sign on the inside of our door that mentioned the dangers of lead cant remember for sure but I believe it was lead in the building I think it said something about not having prolonged exposure to it I wasnt too happy about that but since we were only there 2 nights I figured it would be ok
Overall a great experience

title: My family and I enjoyed a very
text:
My family and I enjoyed a very comfortable stay here at the Doubletree in San Jose 
The service was friendly and efficient The mattress and bedding were very comfortable so we all slept well Location was good Facilities were all above average My only problem with this hotel is that I would not consider it a 4star hotel All the furnishings need updating torn wallpaper worn carpets dirty ceiling drop panels broken wood moldings Efficient and clean yes but not a destination location My Aunt Sandie would never approve but we found it nice enough

title: Hotel QT  be very careful
text:
Review of the Hotel QT
I recently stayed 4 nights at the Hotel QT off of Times Square in New York City It is a newly opened hotel The design of the rooms and common areas is non traditional but fun The hotel staff were extremely pleasant and helpful However
I made my reservation through an internet site which handles only booking the reservation and suggests that you contact the hotel directly for rates etc I did twice before our arrival
I contacted the Hotel QT about a month before my arrival and told them that this was a long anticipated daddaughters trip This would be my 17 and 19 year old daughters first trip to New York City Obviously we would need a room with at least 2 beds I confirmed this a second time a couple of weeks before our arrival
When we arrived we were assigned a micro sized room with one small bed I had previously agreed to pay a premium rate for what was described as a roomy deluxe room No one would consider this a deluxe room and certainly no one would consider it roomy Apparently this was the only room available and so one daughter slept on the floor and the other on a shelf under the TV While the room was far from deluxe and the room rate was outrageous
The following night we moved to an entirely acceptable room however rather than apologizing for their obvious error the night before we were treated to a room rate which skyrocketed To add injury to insult a friend of mine staying in the same hotel was given a room which was just a bit smaller than the one we had been moved to but charged substantially less per night He made his reservations several days after I had made mine
Perhaps most disturbing aspect is the lack of responsiveness from hotel management I explained my situation to several hotel staff and left a written description of events for the manager I was absolutely guaranteed that the manager would get back to me While I left both cell phone and work numbers to date I have received no response
In fairness a night manager did listen sympathetically and reduced our rate by a nominal amount but in light of the amount we were being gouged the reduction was by her own admission insignificant
Mistakes are going to happen from time to time but the fact is that as a result of their booking error my daughters had to sleep on the floor and a shelf per our the first night in our deluxe micro room The Hotel QT compounded its original mistake by gouging us on the room rates and then avoided andor ignored their promise that a manager would get back to us
End of the world no but very disappointing yes

title: Convinient for morning flights
text:
I stayed at this hotel the night before a flight and thought it was fine Parts of the hotel are a bit dated but I think that some remodeling must have been done since some of the previous reviewers were there because it was fine 
My room was very well appointed with nice furnishings a good desk and a comfortable bed A portable crib had been left in my room from a previous guest and I needed a data cable so I called the front desk and within minutes someone was at my door with a cable and to take away the portable crib 
I had dinner at the hotel restaurant which is at the top of the hotel and rotates  that was fun The service was excellent and the food was pretty good 
The next day after check out I went downstairs to the airport tram and took it directly to my terminal  very convinient

title: Great hotel in excellent location
text: We stayed at the hotel for two nights on the 16th floor of the Union Street Tower We had a queen deluxe room which accommodated our family of two kids and two adults well All of the hotel facilities were excellent especially access to The Daily Grill where we dined for three of our meals The hotel was well located for shopping walking distance to the Pike River Market and attractions We would definitely stay here again

title: Beautiful lobby  hotel  but poor service  extra charges at every turn
text:
The hotel is grand and the lobby is beautiful with high ceilings filled with paintings reminiscent of the renaissance period Great location to watch the parade and very central However my wife  I did not have a pleasant stay The service is poor We realised an error in our package selection romantic package vs breakfast package which is the same price same room type We were told computer would not let them swap it sorry one hour after we made the selection Eventually forced them to get the manager at which point it was resolved without touching the computer  they just swapped our voucher Walls are paper thin you can hear the beeps of the safe in the next room doors closing content of conversations etc
Re costs the free breakfast voucher only covered the first 22 according to one staff member the next no could have whatever you liked from breakfast menu Internet is 15 per day for throttledspeed or 20 per day for fullspeed To check your email in business centre is 795 for 15minutes use ie no free email checking Fitness centre is extra 10 per day and so on Dinner was 70pp for average buffet that closed before we had finished Early checkout 11am 
Generally  feels like you are staying with large corporation as your host  service is very impersonal and combative  its as if Hilton headquarters has given them no discretion to help guests Not recommended

title: It was okay
text: The only real problem I had with the hotel was the keypad at door 3it was broke so I had to go to another keypad to enter hotelThe staff on duty was very helpful thoughMoetyother than that I would stay there again for the priceOhand my card was actually charged 8500 instead of the 7005 initiallyIm still waiting for the 15 to drop off

title: Great Hotel
text:
Booked this hotel via priceline I was a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews on here so I took it all with a grain of salt Here is what I discovered
1 Clean rooms nice clean bathrooms plumbing worked fine
2 Our room was large but I saw the small rooms when walking down the halls
3 Its an Historic Hotel and I enjoyed being part of its history
4 All of the presidents stay here
5 Great staff no problems
The only complaint that seemed to be true is that the walls are a bit thin and you can hear your neighbor we had kids for the model UN next door 
So I would stay here again It was close to cheap parking at the Boston Common and it was near a lot of restaurants
Great hotel to pick up via priceline

title: Not sure why this hotel has such a high rating
text:
My stay nothing capable of 5 stars During Checkin the computer system shut down Staff just stood there and talked while the checkin line grew to over 100 guests My Criticism is that staff should have informed those of us waiting in line what the issue was Nothing fancy just honest and accurate information rather then seeing from afar staff talking and joking around while customers wait and wait and wait 45 minutes to check it Ouch
My first assigned is was YUCK Small VERY SMALL dingy no furniture other then a VERY SMALL BED and night stand The Television was bolted to the wall almost behind the door as that is how small the room was it did not move or angle The window was blocked with the fire escape stairs I walked in had such a awful feeling that I immediately left and when to the check in desk another long wait I was given another room on another floor I was promised a queen bed The next room was a little bit bigger but not much The this room did have a tv standcredenza and the view was unobstructed Thank You However the BED WAS SMALL 
All in all there really is nothing special about this hotel It is old and tired Management please check the rust patch growing on the bathroom shower towel holder in room 20170 YUCK The bed was small full size but comfortable The bathroom was small the door almost hits the toilet and is awkward to close if you are a larger person as there is no room to maneuver The door must be either opened or closed in order for me to fit No Coffee in rooms The line at Starbucks downstairs was over 50 people at 9am 
The keypad on the inroom safe did not work dead battery Management again please check the room to make sure all is in working order
Walls are paper thin as I could hear discussions and activities of the rooms on both sides 
But all in all the location is great Easy access to L Subway  restaurants and entertainment
Looking back The most positive interaction I had with any hotel staff was at the BELL DESK Thanks Guys These men were quick witted friendly and Johnny on the spot for my luggage needs We had a good conversation and quite a few laughs
The most negative was the gal directing the checkin line Worthless as she did not interact with guests and only talked to staff See my beginning comment

title: Great Ambiance but not DCs best
text:
The rooms were a good size and the bathrooms use great soaps and the location is superb This hotel would be ideal as a city break for solo travelers or a young couplenot for long term business travel
The street lights from outside shine through the room as the curtains do not extend far enough to block the light

title: Barton Creek Golf outing
text:
My son purchased a two round golf package over night lodging and a breakfast through ideal golf An exceptional deal I golfed one round on the Crenshaw course and the second round on the fazio foothills Great course and really enjoyed them
The hotel staff was extremely pleasent and always mentioned me by name The Hotel had plenty of things to do The meal we had there breakfast was great
The only downside is the traffic on highway 360 attempting to go to dinner Very congestion and a royal pain However it did not take away from a great father son trip Would certainly do it again

title: newer excellent value and location
text: This hotel was newer and appeared more business oriented but met our needs as tourists with a great location close to Macys and easy access to two different subway lines which meant less transfers fast convenient competitive breakfast options with varied continental for 10 or full for 15 which was great for us as we had limited time in the mornings We had considered the Hampton however we found the little more luxury concierge and extra cost for breakfast was the best value for us

title: Stuck in the 90s
text:
Somebody needs to let this property owner know two things  
1 For quite a while now there have been wireless internet devices available that are faster than 54K or so 
2 Televisions that get only eight channels went out YEARS ago Satellite and other services are widely available  its been in all the papers Oh yeah  one of the favorite cable channels in America is called FOX NEWS This property doesnt carry it Must be owned by a Democrat
I will not return to this motel and I travel to El Paso a LOT

title: Outstanding Customer Service
text: I would like to commend Hichem at the front desk of The Liaison for exemplary customer service I was there for business and needed assistance with some paperwork and he made it work in a very positive and gracious manner Im the Professional Development Coordinator for the Delaware Division of Libraries and customer service is one of my areas Im often disappointed in the quality of customer service I experience but not at The Liaison thanks to Hichem Kudos for a job well done I will definitely recommend The Liaison to others

title: Very good but only on position
text: This was a hard one to review  we picked for position and it was spot on just of times square on check in after traveling hours we were told a room wasnt ready till 3pm so we had to leave our luggage it was 245pm When we did check in it was the smallest room ever no floor space for cases and we were there for 5 nights  only room to walk around the bed so we went back to reception and free upgrade  To a larger room all ok apart from had not been hoovered there was even some pills on carpet and other items that you could clearly see  We are not complainers but the pills could be anything and I took them to reception along with other bits  we were apologised to and that while we were out the room would be given a deep clean  But no the carpets were never hoovered the whole time we were there and behind furniture was discusting so take slippers  other than that the hotel was fine we were out site seeing day and night so it was ideal to crash and very good area but paying the sort of money we did you expect the place to be cleaned New York overall is brill but people dont do anything not even speak to you unless you tip  I only tip for good service not when people expect it which is what seems to go on in new York

title: Very Nice
text:
We really enjoyed the Serrano We stayed in a corner room 1001 for 3 nights It was beautiful and very comfortable The bed is wonderful The staff is very friendly The doorman recognizes you as you come down the street and opens the door before you even get there The wine in the evenings and coffee in the mornings is very nice The bathroom was large with marble floors and jucuzzi tub Cheetah bathrobes are a nice touch The only complaint and its not really a complaint would be when you open the sofa bed you cant get around it to get to the bathroom The Tenderloin is very close so dont walk in that direction 
We would definetly stay here again

title: Your stay starts in the lobby they got it right
text: We stay here 2 or more times a year  With medical appointments this trip we were already stressed  the lobby host Maricha Alvarez has always been nice to talk to and get help from  This trip she started our time at the Westin with wounderful service  it helped set the pace from the start so all went well thank you roger  Chong M

title: Great location and value
text:
This hotel was very conveniently located right in Fishermans Wharf Many tours meet around this area and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from Its great for tourists
The room was clean and quite no view from my room though Continental breakfast buffet was good make your own pancakes with a press of the button
Also includedfree internet access
Id definitely stay here again

title: Comfortable and simple
text:
Pros  this place is so handy to The Mall You can walk to many sights or rent one of the Capitol Share bikes and see everything The staff were friendly and helpful 
Cons  The place has had a bit of a refurbish and there is paint smears in places on things where its been a bit rushed  rough 
Also the whole place features cheesy photos of a balding man and a younger woman in the theme of Liaison  In places the theme is just a bit seedy to be honest

title: Not a bad place
text: The mixed reviews I read about this place are all very appropriate The rooms are spacious and okay However it feels like a fixed up apartment Our room had some imperfections However we werent in the room that long the beds are comfortable its clean and the location is superb I mean you can easily walk to the supreme court and library of congrass and the capitol If you need to go to the zoo then you can easily get on the subway that is only a long block away I got along with the staff just fine and depending who is there they are very helpful and full of information In the lobby there is free wireless internet No need to pay the 10 to get it in your room Just remember to bring your laptop with your wireless card The breakfast was soso I mean there are cereals juices bagels and fruit This came in handy when we went to the zoo because we took some extra fruit and bagels in our backpack and had them as snacks Please make sure that you do your homework if you will be going to this area because there are four 2nd and C streets NESENWSW I learned this the hard way You wont go wrong with this hotel and I got a great deal of 80 I would easily stay here again

title: Great Location and Service
text:
Weve just returned from a very nice stay at the Marriott Downtown Checkin staff was extremely nice  Abigail at the desk asked if we had any kids with us who might need special accommodations She was kind enough to offer my daughter some of the goodies from the Nickolodeon package even though we were registered under a different rateplan
Our room on the 19th floor was fine for us Spotlessly clean and comfortable Location was great enjoyed breakfast at the Reading Terminal Market every day and the 711 across the street was great for snacks DD loved having the Starbucks hot chocolate in the lobby every night Philly Phlash stop was less than a block away and we used the nearby subway stop for a trip to Citizens Bank Park Very handy
Parking at the hotel was 36night  tax We found a garage 2 blocks away in Chinatown with a 1024hour rate so opted to leave the car there The valets let us park in front of the hotel while we checked in and unloaded and the reverse on the departure which was very convenient
We used the pool quite a bit Its a lap pool so not ideal for leisurely swimming though it seemed like the pool was mostly used by families during our stay 
Would definitely stay here again if returning to Philadelphia and rates were favorable

title: Good choice
text: We got a room on the 23rd floor with spectacular views The room and bathroom is a bit outdated but we enjoyed our stay

title: Excellent hotel in the theatre district
text: We spent 5 nights and it was an excellent hotel experience We strongly reccomend it for couples families and even business trip Not for business venue Breakfast is very good quality even if is not too fancy Concierge was very efficient in restaurant reservations For runners both central Park and hudson river are very close

title: Great location on the Riverwalk
text:
I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Riverwalk for a conference Overall it was a good experience Beautiful hotel and the location could not have been better We had a little over an hour for lunch during the conference and I was able to walk along the Riverwalk to the mall food court for a quick lunch The conference rooms were easily accessible comfortable and set up well for our event
My only complaint is that my sheets kept coming off of the bed and exposing the mattress Gross The mattress pad was stretched out and kept popping up I requested that the issue be fixed at the front desk They said it would be fixed but it wasnt I had to ask a second time before the issue was resolved I struggled with the sheets for two nights while needing to wake up early for the conference 
Pros Location friendly staff beautiful hotel
Cons Front desk did not take care of a housekeeping issue

title: Perfect little Hollywood I miss
text:
Very nice for extended stay in mini suite Would like a little more magic involved Maybe some slight of hand around the pool or some old scary magic movies to watch in the room Do some merch tie in w the Castle I love magic so this was pefect if youre going over to the Castle Drink as much as you want and your a short treck up the driveway back to your room Ladies remember this if you wear heals
I hope they keep this place a boutique hotel The price does not matter to me just keep it cool 
Needs a 24hr coffee shop ala The Standard and Id never leave

title: Good business hotel with amazing views
text: Stayed in the Hilton for a few nights on business The location was great extremely easy to get to from the Airport via a walkway The views over the bay were fantastic and very easy to get to using public transport Big room with a very large bathroom and two king size beds Fantastic for a business trip

title: You can do better in Austin
text:
I stayed at this hotel in late June when I was in Austin on business
First thing I noticed upon entering the room was there was garbage in the trash can in the bathroom I dont think this is a big deal but always makes you wonder what else did they forget Did the toilet get cleaned
I then proceeded to iron my shirt But the water resevoir had some corrosion in it and my shirt was stained and completely ruined
To cap it off I asked for a wake up for the morning I was leaving as I had to catch an early flight It never happened nor did my work colleague receive his 
When I was rushing out in the morning to make my flight because now Im running late I stopped briefly at the front desk to complain I was told a manager would be in touch with me Of course that never happened either
Finally I went onto the Hilton website and left a complain detailing the same issues as this review Never heard from them
Safe to say this is the last Hilton I will be staying in

title: Great HotelGood Value
text: Stayed at this hotel and was a little nervous based on the reviews of construction outside and an unfriendly staff My stay was just the opposite The staff was very friendly and helpful The room was small but a good size for New York City The room was on the 15th floor and was very quite The location was perfect Just a few blocks from the center of time square and close to all the shows we wanted to see

title: Great Service
text: Historic landmark hotel in downtown Denver close to Larimer Square Rooms are a bit dated but very comfortable beds great showers Great service all around with free car service to go for dinner and back free internet

title: Never want to leave
text: I have always being a reader never a review writer Well I just couldnt help myself this time I just L O V E the Palomar Hotel Im still here and dont want to leave It truly takes a lot to WOW me The staff is amazing and friendly I felt like I was back home in GA where everyone talks to everyone When you have a group of 20 and they can STILL remember all of your names Thats amazing I love the energy every time I walk in Its in a great location and everything is close by

title: great stay at Jurys in Boston
text:
We stayed for one night for a little weekend getaway in Boston We chose Jurys based on the TripAdvisor reviews and werent disappointed What a lovely hotel and the people who worked there were super nice and accomodating We got a fantastic deal through one of the discount hotel websites and when we called to ask if we could check in an hour early or so they upgraded our room to a deluxe The room was very nice spotlessly clean and attractive the bathroom was goodsized with very nice amenities there was free internet access and a flatscreen TV The beds were super comfortable There was a fair amount of traffic noise from outside our window we had a room facing Berkeley Street but I consider this just part of staying at a hotel in a city 
The public areas are very attractive and kind of quirky with lighting overhead on the stairs and on a waterfall wall next to the stairs that change colors from green to blue to purple to red etcThere are very unusual gas fireplaces covered with sparkly stones I know it sounds odd but it looks great The trash containers near the elevators had a bowl of potpourri on one side  We ate dinner at Cuffs the bar on the lower level and had a great meal of sandwiches and fries with two awesome desserts which I would highly recommend a trio of ice creams in cups made of thin cookies and a blackberry creme brulee Prices were very reasonableWe had breakfast in the Stanhope restaurant and it was very good too pricey though if you dont order either the full or the continental buffet where the beverages are included watch out for the prices on the juices and coffee
All in all it was a great stay and Id love to stay there again

title: wonderful home away from home
text: we enjoyed our visit very muchroom was wonderful and the people made us feel like welcome guest we will visit again

title: Trendy exceptionally friendly staff a real bargain for the price
text:
Bottom line Outstanding boutique hotel This is so different from a chain hotel it doesnt make sense to try to compare it to one If you want a sterile cookie cutter same as I stayed at in you will be disappointed If you want unique friendly and trendy this is the place to stay
We were attending the 2011 Hollywood Reel Independent Film Festival at the near by New Beverly Cinema and wanted to stay in the area at a boutique hotel We were not disappointed 
The Farmers Daughter Hotel appears to have been designed as a quintessential motor court in the 50s or 60s It has been redesigned and they have done an amazing job of working with in the constraints of the original structure We stayed in room 101 located in a quiet corner of the property I dont know what the other rooms look like so this is unique to 101 The room is decorated with copper counter tops and accents throughout the room and includes a subtle continuation of the farm theme in the bedding and wall mural The bedding was very comfortable The faucet was style like an old fashioned sink pump The shower was simple but included an adjustable rain style head and there was plenty of hot water
The staff were all very friendly and attentive They made every attempt to accommodate us as we dealt with the logistics of visitors They helped us find a great place to eat  Animal  just up the street It didnt matter if it was midnight or 8 am there was always a smile and helpful attitude Over all I cannot say enough about the facility and staff If you are in the West Hollywood area dont miss the Farmers Daughter

title: Location Location
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Milford Plaza for 4 nights and in my opinion as a seasoned traveller you cant beat the Milford on price and location Sure it is being renovated but during our stay no inconvenience what so ever    Sure the rooms are small but so are so many other NY hotels but if you are serious about seeing all that NY has to offer then you wont be spending too much time in your room

title: Great HotelGreat Location
text:
My wife and I visited NYC in early October to see some Broadway shows and enjoy the New York City Cuisine The Hotel Elysee came highly rated on TripAdvisor Everything I read about the Hotel was true First of all the location You can get anywhere in the city from 43rd and Madison All the staff from the doormen welcoming you to the hotel to the front desk staff were courteous friendly and extremely helpful The housekeeping staff did a great job in servicing the rooms There were no bedbugs validating the accuracy of the bedbug report 
The Continental Breakfast in the Club Room on the 2nd floor was excellent Fresh bagels and bread cereals hard boiled eggs fresh fruit and yogurts were there for the taking and replenished as needed Lattes or cappuccinos were there for the asking The staff who looked after the breakfast were very pleasant and congenial Monday to Friday in the late afternoon there is wine champagne and cheese served in the same Club room Its too bad they dont have it on the weekends I made sure I got to try it when we arrived Friday afternoon I dont know why there are so many negative comments about the single elevator Its a European style hotel and thats what they have in Europe except this elevator is twice the size We didnt have to wait long for an elevator at anytime
The rooms were a very nice size and you are able to open the windows I like that the bathroom is down the hall and separate from the sleeping area The hotel was booked through bookingcom and I found the rate to be reasonable I highly recommend the Elysee and we will definitely stay there again next year As far as dining in the area is concerned I highly recommend Del Friscos Steakhouse The steak and the atmosphere was amazing Its at 39th and Sixth Ave a short walk from the Hotel Forget about Magnolia Bakery for the cupcakes Head to Crumbs There are quite a few stores and there is one nearby the Hotel on Madison Avenue

title: Great location near downtown Seattle overlooking a nice park
text:
We stayed at the hotel two separate times on our trip to Washington last week The location to all of the popular attractions is perfect The one thing youll learn about Seattle is that youll get used to walking While you can easily get around town in a rental car its much easier to just use your legs
In regards to the hotel it was very clean and includes your typical amenities including shampoo body wash lotion and conditioner This hotel uses a pump system to dispense the various items in the shower as well as at the sink preventing a TON of waste with the little bottles There is also a safe refrigerator and microwave in the two different rooms that we stayed in two double beds as well as a single double bed room
The front desk staff was helpful even though there was a little mixup when we checked in There had been a large group that had checked in earlier in the day that wanted to move their rooms around for whatever reason The person that had been working during that period accidentally gave away our room two double beds and we ended up staying in a single bed room for the night The staff person quickly offered a lower price on the smaller room and indicated we could switch to our correct room the following night No harm no foul on that
One thing to watch out here is the breakfast room especially on the weekend We went into the room around 9am and it was a NUT HOUSE They do not have enough seating for the size hotel that it is so plan on getting your food and taking it back to your room The other guests I found to be very rude in the breakfast room acting as if it was their last meal But I guess that can sometimes be expected when there are free items in the room
The poolwhirlpoolsauna are all open 24 hours which was nice since most hotels close their poolsspa area down around 1011pm
Parking is 10night but free parking is VERY rare anywhere in the greater Seattle area However if you use Foursquare you can checkin to the hotel location and unlock a free parking special At least as of when I was there last week
All in all I would say that I would have no problem staying here again especially with the location You are just close enough to everything yet far enough away to be away from the majority of the city noise

title: Nice but average hotel
text: This hotel has a nice lobby decent breakfast and is well located The carpets in the room were filthy stained and the first hotel that I wore my shoes the whole stay They could certainly use new carpetingit makes the nice room feel dirty However the staff was nice the beds comfortable so for me it was average nothing great and not that bad either just not the kind of hotel that I enjoy

title: Would NOT recommend
text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights  July 2526 with a friend and this hotel was chose by a tour group that we booked with in Montreal We had reserved 2 double beds and were given a room with one double bed The manager was not very polite about it and acted as if giving us a room with 2 single beds that we know someone else from out gorup got changed out of was doing us a HUGE favor The room was old and dingey THe toilet gurgled and spit water on the floor every so often and there was no fan The lobbys furniture was old and dirty The hotel should be refurbishing No radio no minibar THe airconditioning was very noisy and smelled awful moldlike My friend woke up the next day so congested and stayed that way until we were home I suffer from allergies dust mold etc and did have symptoms I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is particular about cleanliness brighness of the room and space in the washroom extremely small THe location is fantastic however  right in Time Square Too bad

title: Good clean hotel right near Times Square
text: I booked this hotel after reading TA reports Very glad I did The hotel is a block and a half from Time Square and we walked to most places from there The hotel is an older art deco building and very nice inside All the staff were helpful and obliging Yes the lifts are old and slow but thats not a big problem except in the mornings when everyone tries to leave around the same time We had an executive room which gave us free wifi  bonus Our room had plenty of space but was not huge  enought for the two of us but the bathroom was tight The shower in our bathroom was one of the best Ive ever used Windows that actually open There was a mini bar microwave and a safe Soft and comfortable beds with clean and fresh linen All in all the rooms were good Unfortunately we decided to have breakfast downstairs one morning It is a buffet but it really wasnt worth the effort Bland cold food that wasnt worth the money Esp when there are so many good food places nearby We didnt go back again Would happily stay there again but certainly not bother with the food there

title: The Only Place I will Stay When In NYC
text:
We travel to NYC about 4year and after having stayed at numerous other hotels over the years  we decided to try the Beekman after hearing from a friend about the excellent food and accomodations Were glad we did The suites were beautifully decorated the staff courteous and welcoming and the food was scrumptious We have dined at both the main level restaurant and at the skyline level  the view was breathtaking 
The waitstaff was courteous and we even noted that the head chef came out and checked on the guests and their mealsevenings  what a pleasant and nice touch Keep up the good work Beekman  Well be back

title: Great place to stay for weary travelers
text: We were on our last leg of our trip back to Illinois and found this gem Nice front desk nice big queen beds  great for 9 and 11 year olds with parents  good breakfast with cold cereals yogurt waffles bagels juices and coffee Nice bathroom as well The kids enjoyed the pool  a few details for the hotel management  maybe touch up the metal parts in the pool area on the signs  showing rust spots from water condensation on walls Otherwise very nice overall

title: Great modern hotel at a good price cant go wrong
text: There were plenty of staff at checkin The rooms were modern in design spacious and clean Plenty of comfy pillows Late night dining room service was quick breakfast room service was right on time The location was about a 1015 minute walk5 cab ride to Merchandise Mart where my work required me to be Would definitely stay there again

title: OK but not for everyone
text: If you like being in the center of the action in a fast paced city environment this location is perfect Close to shops restaurants and attractions but parking and driving as expected is quite a hassle Valet parking is pricey but its the way to go here We were there when it was unusually warm and didnt realize there was no air conditioning when we booked our fault didnt ask The building is old but well kept rooms are nice with good beds and decent bathrooms Noise levels were not bad even with the windows open most rooms have a view of a brick wall The complimentary wine snacks and continental breakfast were fine but available in close quarters at the end of hallways trays are provided to take it all back to your room This place is still probably a decent value for this part of town

title: Top Notch Service and Amenities
text:
From the moment my husband and I walked in to the hotel we felt at home We stayed for three days over Christmas and every aspect of our visit was very enjoyable From the doorman to registration to housekeeping the restaurant and staff and everything in between everybody we encountered was polite helpful and genuinely seemed to care about our visit 
The food and service in the restaurant was superior Next year make sure you book a reservation for the Christmas buffet The view from our room was breathtaking the room smelled clean and fresh the bed was heavenlyI could go on forever Thank you Hyatt for making this a very special Christmas

title: Good location business men like hotel but nice
text: The room was ok with a beautiful view of the city and the bathroom was clean and spacious The location was perfect walking distance to shopping and restaurantsThe staff was nice and helpful The hotels restaurant was nice and the food was quite good but the Thai restaurant attached to the hotel which has a direct entrance from the hotel was not very good at all and the people working there were not very friendly Its a business men type hotel clean nice big

title: Nice Stay
text: It was our first stay at this Holiday Inn my wife and I were looking at the downtown Memphis area or at another Holiday Inn closer to the airport but my wifes cousin highly recommended this Holiday Inn at Wolfchase Galleria I am so glad we booked a room at this Holiday Inn It was originally built in 2009 so everything is fairly new and of new construction We arrived early and was quickly given our key cards to our room hours ahead of our check in time and no lines Maybe this is Memphis living Our room had a window view albeit the parking lot Being from NYC I was in eyeshot of our rental car The king size bed was nice and comfortable The flat screen TV was big enough to be viewed from all points of the room It was very nice The shower was a walkin shower plenty of instant hot water Other amenities include a small fitness area located adjacent indoor pool I consider it decent sized given the size of the hotel One can definitely relaxed pool side and feel the warmth of the sun Did I mention the free parking That was a nice plus The entrance way of the hotel was clean and the reception area was spacious as to not to feel closed in Complimentary newspapers and coffee were available gratis We stayed 6 nights overall it was an excellent stay with the exception of one night were they had a family reunion event where the music can be heard in our room I thought there was a part in the next room But I believe the event was being held on the ground floor I was kind of surprised that the music can be heard on the 3rd floor where we were staying Nevertheless I contacted the front desk and they assured me that the music would be turned off at 12 midnight We would definitely book another stay at this hotel as it was convenient to many stores and restaurants

title: Sheraton Fishermans Wharf
text: We had a fantastic experience based at Sheraton Fishermans Wharf The location is excellent as it is around the corner or a short walk from the main activities of the pier area Lots of restaurants and places of interest nearby The rooms and service were excellent with no complaints We were lucky to have a room above the main lobby area so we could log into the free wi fi from the comfort of our room We went on the Alcatraz tour as well as the open top bus tour around San Francisco which was very informative The biggest surprise was the Walt Disney family museum We thought we would go for the kids but it was a fantastic history of Walt Disneys life and his start in animation Highly recommend

title: Nice room and five star service
text:
Great place for a 3night stay Our king room overlooked the pool and was very quiet But we sure did not need the beds heavy comforter in the Texas heat Fortunately there was a light blanket in the closet 
Service could not have been better Staff members were amazingly helpful friendly and knowledgable about the area I made an online reservation the day before I wanted to arrive and I requested a room without scenting cleaning products and away from the elevator Staff made sure BOTH requests were fulfilled Later when the inroom telephone misbehaved a hotel employee was promptly there to fix it A front desk clerk knew just where to find a nearby selfserve carwash When the TV was blaring in the breakfast room we were able to get the sound turned down During our visit we bought a new camera and accidentally trashed the camera box with the strap inside Our garbage had just been taken out so we asked if we could check the trash A staff member volunteered to check the garbage and he found the box retrieved the strap and had it delivered to our room in very little time
Bonuses included the freshly baked cookies at the front desk and DVDs to check out for free the rooms have DVD players

title: Great Basic Hotel in Excellent Location
text:
When I began my search for a reasonably priced hotel reasonable for New York that is I had several specifications
1 Private Bath  Im at the point in my life where I dont share well with others especially bathrooms
2 Decent location  walking distance to at least one subway line
3 Free WiFi  I never leave home without the laptop
What I found with the Hotel Deauville
Clean basic room with my private bath
The hotel is within walking distance of the 456 lines  the NQRW lines which with connections will take you anywhere you want to go in the city
Free  fast WiFi to help me make lastminute plans
I also got air conditioning which was welcome on two muggy nights
I need to reiterate that this is a basic budget hotel  its definitly not the Ritz or even the Holiday Inn but its a clean quiet place to put your head down after spending the day in this fabulous city

title: Best stay ever for the price
text: We were in town to see the King Tut exhibit downtown We brought our dog and the hotel was very pet friendly Usually when traveling with a pet they give you one of the rooms that isnt the greatest Not the case here The room was on the lobby floor with a back door leading out to the pool and hot tub It was too cold outside to use the pool but the hot tub was great Beautiful courtyard around the pool The room was very clean and comfortable Continental breakfast in the lobby was nice Good variety including make your own waffles The lobby had beautiful marble flooring and lots of sunlight with floor to ceiling windows facing the pool area We would definately stay again

title: Great value close to Cherry Creek and Hwy 25
text: This is a very nice Fairfield Inn close to Cherry Creek and Washington Park The foyer is clean and homey and the breakfast area was large and well stocked with lots of breakfast options Free WIFI nice room and a 42 inch plasma There is some traffic noise from Colorado bvd even on an upper floor We were on the 8th floor But we did have a view of the mountains

title: Labor Day Oasis
text: Stayed at this stylish hotel in downtown over Labor Day weekend with friends Despite the busy area and influx of tourists our room was quiet and comfortable The hotel staff was very kind especially when I needed some assistance after my wallet had been stolen at a nearby bar  They were more than willing to let me use their computer at the front desk to file a police report and print out a needed document Unfortunately there are all kinds of touristtrap restaurants nearby but thats no fault of the hotels Also the bathroom doesnt feel completely private when sharing a room with 3 other people but the sliding door sure looks nice Extra points for the lobby happy hour where we got to sample a drink before heading out for the evening

title: Comfy beds in a busy and loud downtown area of SF
text:
Stayed here with my girlfriend in 2 separate stays either side of a camping trip to Yosemite AugustSeptember and my first thought was so easy to get to Desperate for a quick afternoon sleep after an early flight over we were horrified to hear the surprisingly loud street noises which went on pretty much 247 and kept me grouchy and sleepless for the first 3 nights we were there Not that I expect a quiet stay in downtown San Francisco but it wouldnt hurt to invest in some windows that attempted to block the sound out Needless to say the room was at the front of the hotel so Id request that you dont stay there if I were you If you do stay at the front be prepared for loud noise all night and no chance of a lie in homeless man drumming outside isnt that talented in case you wondered
Our 2nd stay however was TOTALLY different It was at the back of the hotel pretty much quiet the whole night and we slept well The room was about twice the size too we had 2 double beds instead of 1 and the ensuite was definitely bigger with a more powerful shower 
Wi fi didnt work on the 5th floor but did work on the 6th Not the end of the world really  loads of places in San Fran have free wi fi if you need to log on 
2 or 3 of the hotel staff were really unfriendly which was unfortunate as it didnt feel like many of them would be very accommodating if we had any requests On 2nd thoughts this may have been because it seemed to double up as a student residence and therefore they probably saw people so regularly it would drive them crazy smiling all the time Saying that the guy that worked over night was really helpful in getting us to our tour bus for Yosemite at 6am so it evened out a little
2 very different stays but I was mainly frustrated because of the noise at the front of the hotel in the first stay and slept terribly 2nd stay was probably 4 stars

title: Very charming
text: This is a very charming hotel located next to the river and close to the Ben Franklin bridge I called a couple of days in advance and got a great deal from the concierge on a room with a fireplace and whirlpool tub The room was spacious and had a tiny balcony which faced the alley which was fine because it was quiet and the building across the way was empty The whirlpool was not really what I expected and was an oversized bathtub The concierge was very friendly and accommodating and the bar in the lobby has a great selection of wines The neighborhood is chock full of great restaurants bars and coffee shops I would bring slippers because some parts of room have wooden flooring and is cold We had a very romantic relaxing time overall and I would definitely stay here again

title: Best hotel in United State
text:
We were totally happy during the time at this hotel Room location staff were very great Beds are really comfortable nice flat screen TV safe in the room free Internet and a nice big shower that even has a seat but no bathtub in case you carewe didnt 
Great in everything and we must come back next time

title: What you expect from a Four Seasons including prices
text:
The Beverly Hills Four Seasons is a beautiful hotel The grounds and rooms are everything you would expect from a Four Seasons My room was a lower floor so I had an entire outside deck to myself rather than just a small balcony The bathroom complete with its own television was fantastic and I used the wake up call every morning without incident
I will point out that even after youve spent the money on your room be prepared to drop a lot more coin The first day there we had a pitcher of their sangria at the cabana by the pool The pitcher was 64 The only restaurant on site is a incredible one but its also priced as such The only parking available is valet which was 30 a night All that being said the hotel is magnificent
We had mixed results from the concierge and while we were there the normal Rolls Royce was in the shop and had been for over a month so we a Mercedes in its place This was convenient for getting to our location however on the way home the driver was unable to pick us up because he was too busy 
All in all the hotel is phenomenal and in a great location within short driving distance of the Hollywood sign the Walk of Fame Rodeo Drive the studios and the Capitol Records building

title: Good location but needs better windows
text: Great location right next to the convention center and just a few blocks from the Alamo Right on the river walk The rooms were clean and good service but the carpet in the hallways looks dated for a fairly new hotel The only real dissappointment was that you could hear the traffic outside through the windows Not loud but when you are getting into bed and everything else is quiet you could hear it Cant say it kept me up more of a distraction

title: Fantastic five days
text:
My sister and I took our teens to NYC last week We were lucky enough to stay at the Belvedere hotel We found the staff exceptionally professional hospitable and helpful
The rooms were spotless the beds comfortable and the overal environment quiet and calm The refrigerator microwave coffee pot and kitchen sink make it possible to eat breakfast in our rooms each morning Our only complaint was that the elevators wait can be a bit long at times 
The location was so convenient on a quiet street but within minutes to theatres restaurants delis subway stations and Times Square Strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for reasonably priced and safecomfortable lodging

title: We would stay in this hotel again
text: We found the Omni Severin to be delightful Our room was exceptionally clean the staff was very friendly the amenities were lovely This hotel is wonderfully located to enjoy all the activities sports shopping restaurants leisure in downtown Indy

title: June Gloom but awesome time at Hard Rock
text:
Wife and I stayed at the Hard Rock recently and had an amazing visit Check in went smooth There was no wait and the girl that checked us in was super nice We found out that she is from Oklahoma so it was kinda cool talking to her 
We were given the introduction by a nice young man He took us to our room on the top floor and showed us how to operate everything He was super nice I ran into him a few more times during our stay and he would always greet us and ask how things were going
We were in a suite A pretty awesome sweet I believe it was called the Black Eyed Peas Suite It ran about 33000 a night I am very glad that my wifes company was picking up the bill I loved the shower with the two spray heads One normal and the other coming down from the ceiling The decorations were pretty awesome Loved the contemporary feel We slept very well in the beds and found the reading lamps very cool and useful 
We had a view facing downtown and the Gaslamp area It was cool to look out at night and see everything going on Everything is so lit up If I looked over the balcony and too the left I could see an aircraft carrier in the harbor If I looked to the right I could see part of Petco field There were games going on two of the nights we were there It got loud when they scored Not too loud We kept the balcony doors open most of the time we were in the room except for when we were sleeping When the doors were closed we really didnt hear much except for an ocassional siren or horn After a couple of days I tried to get a pool view suite but since there was a huge conference in town there were no rooms available
Got to check out the pool area a few times Never swam We hung out for a bit and did some people watching There were several parties going on during our stay If you want to party like a rockstar then this is the place to be Seen a few celebrities in and around the hotel It was pretty awesome
Didnt check out any of the restaurants in the hotel but they do have a yogurt place connected that was fabulous We did try to eat at Mary Janes one night but they had already closed FYI there is a convenient storedeli around the corner that was very handy
We really had a great time at the hotel Loved the location Loved the staff Loved the visit Wish we could have stayed longer

title: business
text: My stayeing in thiss hotel was good But what I can tell you is that kind of hotel is good for business staying egjust a couple days If I can choose if this hotel I want for my holiday staying I will say NO Nice interior athmosphere cleaning serviseetcBut I can call this hotel  Hotel on the way or FAST food hotel

title: Great location
text:
My partner and I wanted to get away fro the weekend and book this place with Pricelines name your own price we got an excellent deal and were happy that this hotel was just a block or two from the 6th street mall which made it nice to be able to walked around have dinner and drinks be a short walk from the hotel
 The staff was smiley and friendly The place was nice enough rooms were good but not anything about it stood out or screamed this is a 4 star hotel The fitness area and pool wasmeh We stayed in a standard King size room The bed was comfortable we were lucky to have a high floor and an excellent view The bathtub was deep and spacious We had a snack and some drinks late at night at the lounge and it was very good They have a late night happy hour with excellent deals Try the sweet potato friesI 
Overall not bad probably best for business rather than a couples getaway Again for what we payed excellent But I think at the regular rate Id opt for somewhere else with a bit more ambiance for my needs for a business traveler it may be a better fit

title: Nothing wrong with this hotel but not a particualrily good value
text:
My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights and while we did not have an unpleasant experience we also did not have a remarkable experience The hotel was clean the bed comfortable the AC worked well and the hotel was quiet However it was not that different from the BEST of the Hampton Inns For the price we paid I expected a more luxurious room We stayed at another Marriott on Vancouver Island last year and for the same price we really had a luxurious room luxurious bedding and a marble and granite bathroom This one simply was not up to that standard
I thought the bar was quite expensive For two glasses of wine one mixed drink  two light  snack type meals the tab was almost 10000
 There was no free access to a computer  to print our airline boarding passes early and even in the room the daily fee to plug in your own computer was 995 each day

title: Modern Tasteful Awesome LocationGreat overall
text: We stayed at the On the Ave for our Honeymoon and had a great time The location is beautiful and not too busy you are no more than 3 blocks from a subway station the staff is AWESOME they were so helpful it was unreal The rooms were a decent size Superior Room but were very nice and modern And youre only 3 blocks from central park there are some nice little bakeries near by and with the subway you are like 3035 mins from Time Square The hotel itself does not have room service BUT the restaurant across the street acts as room service and will bring food up We loved this place and would recommend it to anyone and will be going back

title: Location
text:
We stayed at the Salisbury between the 21st and the 25th of October 2011 The hotel staff and greeting were both polite and informal with the minimum of fussWe stayed on the 11th floor facing West 57th Street unaware of the competition taking place across the street to find the loudest mechanical digger in America
The hotel itself has loads of character the rooms were spacious and the beds large and comfortable Visiting New York though if you spend more than your sleeping hours in your room then you are wasting your time there get out and walk around
The decor is a little jaded as you would expect with a hotel of that age but a superficial touch up is all it needs leave the old lady alone to grow old disgracefully
The Hotel offer you a continental breakfast for the fixed price of 6 The fare is ok if you like coffee and pastries for your breakfast
Around the corner down 57th street we found a place called The Rock and Roll deli It offers a full breakfast at 6 which includes tea or coffee and has eggs of your choice sausagebacon home friestoast butter and a pancakeThe breakfast is very good and challenges you to go out and walk it off which I guarantee you will
Our other option of breakfast that regrettably we only found out on our last morning was to walk into Central Park which is only about a two hundred yard walk from your front door Go past the Bethseda Fountain  The fountain featured at the start of the TV show Friends  about three or four minute walk past there is the Boathouse Restaurant This place is split into an upmarket restaurant and a Cafe style eatery You can get a full breakfast of your choice for 7 only and sit there with the vista of the early morning sun over the boating lake in front of youYou may well be so moved by the sight and a full stomach as to make you reconfirm your undying love to your partner It did me no harm
New York reviews I read before going there for the first time mainly always refer to getting a hotel with a prime location to all the sights you wish to see this hotel has this in SpadesOnce you work out how to navigate the streets and avenues everything within New York is within reasonable walking distance of the Hotel
As I have referred to earlier on the mechanical digger competition Absolute Purgatory
You can hear the street noise per se through your rooms Air Con unit however their is a derelict space directly across the street from you and the morning chorus starts like this
10630am Large lorries arrive and take pleasure in reversing up and down the street to show off their reversing alarm noises
2 0650am The drivers of the above vehicles get out of their cabs and attempt to out do each other in the ancient art of whistling and shouting loudly
3 0700am On The Dot The multi skilled shouter and whistlers then alight their respective mechanical diggers and begin to hydraulically hammer the hell out of the New York bedrock beneath themIt is impossible to ignore and means you are forced out of your room by 730 am
I suppose it may well be a planned rouse by the New York Tourist board to get frazzled hotel guests out of their rooms and into their retail outlets the rouse works unequivocally
All in all I would definitely go back there but only after the US Olympic Digging team had finished there training

title: My first choice
text: I am a seasoned traveler Lived in NY my entire life until recently I absolutely loved the hotel Staff are second to none Room was ample tastefully decorated and clean Location could not be better if you want to do the sights of the City It has a very European feel which personally suits me Pricey but thats Manhattan Would definitely return and recommend

title: 2 week holiday we have stayed here every year for the past 10 years
text:
Since change of ownership a few years ago the hotel has lost its friendly charm The reception staff do not remember returning guests and dont even know who the new owners are
The most unacceptable change of new ownership is that they now allow the general public to use the swimming pool for 1020 per day This has resulted in very noisy unruly and rude childrencarers into an otherwise relxing pool area The swimming pool area is the best feature of this hotel and this has now been totally destroyed It we were guests staying at the hotel for the first time we would not return It is only because we have been staying at the hotel on a regular basis for over 10 years This is a false sens of economy  remove the general public and give more priority and attention to your fee paying guests please

title: Perfectly Average Big Hotel
text:
First off I must say that thanks to priceline I got my room here for about 200 a night which was SUPER cheap compared to everywhere else I looked so for that price a bed was all I needed It is a perfectly average big convention hotel Nothing remarkable but nothing awful either
The room was very nice and comfy and I like the bath products that they stock they smell good View was crappy in the day not that I was in my room much but at night could see Fenway and the Citgo sign all lit up
My bellman was VERY nice
Trouble Spots Were
Rooms dont have wifi yet which I would expect in 2009 
Valet service was HORRIBLE I called ahead 45 minutes like youre told to and when I came down they had not done a thing so I still had to wait outside about 35 minutes Thus I was very late for a dinner reservation
When I initially called for directions the concierge was a bit snippy when I asked her to slow down so that I could write down what she was saying Very odd but maybe she was having a bad day

title: Very pleasant small hotel
text: Competent staff very clean rooms comfortable bed reasonably priced and good complimentary breakfast selection Property is convenient to Times Square subway and the Hells Kitchen Market weekends is just down the street

title: Clean Friendly  Economical choice
text:
We just got back from a weekend stay at The Wharf Inn The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful The room was very clean I do agree with previous opinions about it being a little too warm however
This is a great place to stay if you are looking for basic affordable lodging right in the middle of all the great SF tourist attractions
The free parking is a great feature Most other hotels charge 30  38 per day which is something people may forget to consider

title: This hotel was the highlight of my trip
text:
I spent 17 days in the Northeastern and Mid Atlantic states in August  September 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed my time in Washington DC and the Palomar In an attempt to get out of the way of the direct path of Hurricane Irene  I called the Hotel Palomar to see if I could check in three days early Not a problem Not only was it not a problem the price for my stay went down Nice And it was already reasonable to begin with because I have an AAA card Less than 200 in Washington DC Pretty amazing
The hotel personnel were very welcoming  from the front door personnel who learned my name from the moment I arrived and chatted whenever I came or left to the front desk personnel who were enthusiastic and helpful and the cleaning personnel who were friendly It was a welcome change from other stops I made on this trip 
The hotel did very well in communicating its Hurricane plan for guests and provided instructions regarding food what happens if the lights go out etc 
The location is good  a few blocks from the Dupont Circle Metro Station and enough people out at all hours to make it feel safe Lots of restaurants shops and art galleries nearby The National Mall is 2 metro stops away and very easy to get to 
I would stay at this hotel again if I have an opportunity to return to Washington DC

title: Welcoming  Posh
text: We travelled 8 hours to attend a concert in Columbus and chose the Westin for a 2 night stay  this was no mistake The valet service was quick and friendly Upon arriving we were greeted with champagne and personal welcoming service The staff we quick to offer us inside tips on how to get the best of hot spots for locals and tourist points Our room was slightly smaller than the average and as a result were given a voucher for the in house bar and eatery The room was fantastic as were all the amenities the discount was a nice gesture a large wedding was scheduled and as a result rooms were scarce The on site bar was fantastic and seemed to be full of locals and tourists alike  a nice mix The hotels decor was posh and in no need of updating the service was excellent There is a lot to see and do in Columbus this hotel comes highly recommended if you are visiting the area

title: Luxury and Beauty Meet Convenience
text:
We recently stayed at the Hotel Andra during a weekend getaway to Seattle and couldnt have asked for a nicer place to stay Aside from the convenient location blocks away from Pike Place Market and DowntownBelltown shopping and restaurants this hotel is beautiful I felt comfortable and welcome immediately with the cozy lobby and friendly staff and right at home in our room that overlooked Fourth Ave The hotel is a seamless mix of original 1920s details and modern decor and the bed was so insanely comfortable we actually opted to lounge about instead of touring around the neighborhood 
This may have been the nicest lodging Ive ever experienced and I definitely hope to return on my next trip to the Emerald City

title: Friendly Staff Clean Rooms
text: Very friendly staff clean rooms very accommodating all at a reasonable price The free wifi is quick and has always worked which is important to me as a business traveler I usually dont partake of the free breakfast but it looks fine

title: Very Nice
text: I found the hotel to be very nice Besides the central location 5 min walk to Central Park 15 min walk to Times Square the staff was warm and friendly the room was large and comfortable everything was spotless and they offered a very good price for the area Id definitely stay there again

title: Two thumbs up
text: Headed up to Seattle to go to Woodinville wine country so it was great that Priceline gave us a hotel whose decor and activities revolve around Washington wines Each room is named after a Washington winery and one of the hotels TV channels broadcasts a WA wine country documentary 247 Cool stuff Service is VERY friendly and the smallish lobby is like going back in time a century or so And although we didnt take advantage a different winery does a tasting in the lobby for guests every afternoon Location was terrific 7 short blocks from Pike Place Market and a similar distance to Westlake Center gateway to the Seattle Center monorail The rooms were clean comfortable and nicely decorated Two negatives keep it from being a 5star on TripAdvisor for me First our 2nd floor room was at street level Downtown Seattle is very hilly Street noise was minimal to nonexistent but more of a view would have been nice One of the hazards of Priceline I suppose Second overnight parking was 30 Steep That said I can definitely recommend the hotel and would stay here again without hesitation

title: Old old old and really tired
text:
Why is this hotel a Westin It is a shame for the hotel chain to own this property and I am not exagerating
After reading terrible reviews about the hotel I contacted the property and told them my concearns regarding the condition of the hotel they told me to give them a change and that they were sure the reviews were not up to the hotelthey ended up convincing mebad mistake
First the car drive of the hotel is horrible the entrance letters are torn off and the lamps are broke the floor is full of bird pooreally disgusting
The lobby is really old and the furniture is dreadful the style is really old and they tried to decorate it with minmalist furniture in bad shape
Check In staff is really bad
Elevators are really old they even crack
Hallways have very bad management the walls are stained carpet torn down and a funny smell
Rooms are big but inhospitable you dont feel like being in your room the furniture is in a terrible shape scratched stained broken beds are good but you find the same bed at all Westin Hotels The only good thing about the room was the TV
Staff is terrible throughout the hotel they are rude and it seems they dont care The only friendly staff were the waiters at Zuccinis which has delicious breakfast
Stay away from this hotel dont waste your money in here stay at the JW Marriott across the street which is beautiful and has recently been renovated or at the nearby St Regis
Ive seen the management response to negative comments saying that the hotel is going to be renovated little by little this hotel should be shut down until the renovation is complete
I am really disapointed at Westin

title: Great location fantastic price
text:
We stayed at the Columbus for 3 nights early April booking with the hotel directly via their website for a Suite with 1 Queen bed and 2 doubles  non smoking We requested a high floor room and were allocated Room 215 which faced Columbus Avenue and was located on the 2nd floor at the very end of a long corridor 
At first I was apprehensive about having a room facing Columbus Avenue as I am a light sleeper and have read past reviews about the traffic noise but I was not kept awake by the street noises at all however as we were there from a Friday night to a Monday morning the traffic noise may be different on a weekday
We found the Suite to be very clean and it was great to have individual air conditioning units in each room When we woke each morning we put the air conditioners on and the rooms quickly heated up We found it a bit chilly in the mornings
Sure the furniture is not ultra chic and of modern design however there was plenty of drawers and wardrobes if you wanted to unpack All the furniture was a dark timber almost antique design and was not shabby at all 
The queen bed was located in a seperate room from the two doubles which allowed privacy 
The bathroom was clean and free of mould etc with the shower located over the bath and toilet located in same room
 The water pressure of the showe was fantastic and we did not find the shower head too low at all as previously reported and husband is 6 2 tall It was good to have a large vanity and basin located just outside the bathroom with a hairdryer
There is a very large ice machine on each floor located next to the elevators It might be wise to not get a room near this area as the ice machine was really really noisy all the time It seemed to be constantly churning over the ice and sounded like it was about to take off into orbit it was so noisy 
We did go to Pats Cafe once for breakfast which is located in a nearby side street but we found the menu very limited and a bit expensive We then discovered a Cafe on Columbus Ave heading 3 blocks towards Fishermans Wharf  across the road from The Holiday Inn The DinerCafe sorry cant remember the name had alot more variety with very good prices and with alot locals dining there also Located next to the Diner was an Internet Coffee Shop we used the internet here to precheckin for our flight on Southwest Airlines and they also printed the Boarding passes for 50cents per page
The Columbus Inn was a fantastic find in a great location for a truely great price and we easily walked to Fishermans Wharf Lombard Street and to the Pier which the ferry for Alcatraz tours leaves from and we caught the bus which leaves outside the hotel to Union Square and then caught the Cable Car back
I had originally booked a hotel in Union Square but then changed my mind and booked the Columbus Motor Inn mainly for the great price and for the additional bedroom and I was so glad that we didnt stay at Union Square as my husband and 2 teenage sons were not at all interested at shopping at all so I was glad we settled for a hotel that was close to Fishermans Wharf and the attractions that are in that area
When I pointed out to them the hotel that I had originally booked at Union Square they were all so relieved that I made the accommodation change to the Columbus and so was I
We also could not fault the professionalism of the Front Desk staff who were always ready to provide information and maps of the area We also arrived 3 hours earlier than checkin time and our room was ready which was really nice after a long 13 hour flight from Australia
Our stay at the Columbus Motor Inn was made purely from reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not dissapointed at all We would stay here again without hesitation

title: Great Stay
text:
