We stayed here on January 1st 2012 before a flight The hotel was nice and the room was great for an airport hotel The price was right and look forward to staying here again the next time I need to fly out of Philly early in the morning 
The rooms were nice beds were so soft and it felt like sleeping on a pillow Rooms were quiet and couldnt here any of our neighbors The open bar from 530pm730pm was also very nice We got there at 650pm so we did not get to fully enjoy it The only problem we had was the floors outside the room were not the cleanest There were shreds of paper on the ground in front of our room and some other rooms
I would tell my friends to stay here

title: Closer almost not possible  good for the nights
text:
If you are looking for a bed and shower  here we go Only 100 meter away from the Cable Car Stop Bush Street only 2 blocks from union square a 23  fee for valet parking in the parkhouse across the street thats all we needed for our stay in SF Not taking the free continental breakfast its only hot drinks and some kind of bredcake we can recommend Loris Diner one block away direction Union Square walk down and its on the right side
The rooms at the Grant are older some look modern some look oldstyle But they are clean and functional offering CableTV a showerbath and a you need The only crtitic I can do is that the hotel is kind of sensitive to noise coming from rooms above either reflected by the wall of the neighbouring house or from the floor
Free WLAN is offered in the Lobby its not too fast even when many people are surfing A starbucks is only one block away
Stay in the heart of SF stay in Grant  I would take it again

title: Great Small Place
text: I was expecting this hotel to be quite good in light of all the reviews that have been posted here I was not dissapointed The location is prime  there is a subway station just one block north from the hotel We stayed in a room with a double bed and a private bathroom It was small but manageable It was decorated nicely something youd expect a suffragette to stay in during the early 1900s There was a TV a very efficient heater and AC The rooms were cleaned each day very nicely The hotel itself was quiet the entire time Only on Saturday night did some street noise filter in but we turned on the air to low and it was blocked out Be sure to book your room through the internet or with the internet price on hand over the phone  its much cheaper The staff was friendly and the iron and ironing board I borrowed from them worked well My only quip is that the man who checked us in gave us an uncomfortable and bothersome stare and remark about my boyfriend and I sharing a double bed He wasnt hostile but you sure dont expect it less than a mile from where the Stonewall riots took place Also the elevator is small but quaint with its archaic gated door All in all a great great great place for those people who dont need to be pampered and overcharged but enjoy sleeping in comfortable and quiet hotels

title: I will return
text:
We stayed two nights in room 432 a deluxe double queen room The room is located at the back of the hotel with a view of the space needle It is spacious enough for our party which consisted of 3 travelers The decor is funky and vibrant following the theme throughout the rest of the hotel
You cant beat the location within a ten minute walk you find yourself at Seattle Center the Pike Place Market and waterfront or Westlake Center The hotels neighborhood Belltown is home to many delectable restaurants
The staff is friendly and helpful We had to alter our itinerary due to a minor setback and the staff was able to accomodate our changes seamlessly We were afforded early checkin at arrival and the front desk was knowledgeable in answering our questions We did dine in the attached cafe while it was busy our server was attentive and quick The fare hit the spot and is reasonably priced
Because of the location of our room we did not hear the various construction projects outside We did hear our neighbor briefly but that was a fluke as they raised their voices to an unneighborly level We overheard that the hotel was at capacity but the hotel was refreshingly quiet despite it
I did comparison shop for hotels before our stay and Hotel Five Seattle consistently beat comparable boutique hotels price wise From my experience youll be pleasantly surprised by the superb hospitality provided by the hotel I will definitely return to Hotel Five during my next visit to Seattle

title: Nothing wrong with Arlington except a bit of building work
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at The Arlington for 10 nights starting March 21 After seeing the reviews over the last month we were serious considering changing hotels but after contacting the travel agent who contacted the hotel to see what the building situation was we decided to keep the reservation When we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff and given a really lovely large room on the 11th floor 1107 which had a view of the Empire State Building from the bathroom was newly decorated and very clean and fresh Yes the towels are small but the hotel is cheap and you could buy a big towel for less than 10 in a cheap store if you were really that bothered The building work was still ongoing throughout our stay but it was mostly painting so the lifts were never out of use although when we left on the 31st there was heavy building work going on in the lobby behind a partition wall 
We were asked to change rooms after 2 nights because they wanted to replace and paint the doors on the landing we were on which was a bit of a nuisance but it would have been worse to stay on that landing through the building work and they extended our check out time to compensate for the time spent moving
The new room was 1107 which was to the same standard but without the view Every day the room was cleaned and all the towels were replaced we had use of a safe and fridge and had an adaquate sized wardrobe but only 6 hangers 
Throughout our ten nights you could not notice the noise from outside the hotel which Ive never experienced before in my 5 previous stays in NYC in other hotels The hotel staff were friendly and helpful to us and we never felt unsafe in our room or on the street outside even late at night The location is great really convenient for lots of places Try the food at LA Caterers beside the subway and 5th Ave Clock you wont regret it
I would definately stay at this hotel again although I expect it wont be so cheap once all the building work is finished

title: good location dated rooms okay service
text:
Stayed here overnight because I had an early meeting in Baltimore and couldnt afford travel delays due to weather The location is great  right between the northern edge of the inner harbor area and the piers on the edge of harbor east The rooms are comfortable but standard and a little dated We were there one night after the hurricane so it was pretty empty which might explain the one service debacle there was no one at the front desk for more than 10 minutes We would have left and gone somewhere else but the room was prepaid so we were stuck We had to wander around looking for a staff person to check us in When we finally found him he was pleasant enough but perfunctory and not at all apologetic about being MIA
All in all if the rate is cheap Id stay here in the future Id never pay full rate for this place with the Marriott and the Four Seasons immediately adjacent with comparable rates

title: Horrible Service
text: I stayed there on business at the end of June Every time I stay there the computers are down when you go to check out and it takes days of calling to obtain a bill This time they told me that they would email a bill by 800 am in the morning Of course this never happened I have been calling to try to obtain an invoice but they take an attitude with you when you ask for the bill and want you to keep calling back I tried express check out once and when the charges came through my credit card there were all these extras which took me forever to rectify with the hotel Dealing with this attitude is tiring and is not even close to being good customer service At a minimum it seems like a hotel should be able to provide a copy of an accurate bill to its customers They talk over you and raise their voice I have learned my lesson and will be staying somewhere else in the future where I can receive an accurate and timely copy of the charges without having to beg for it

title: It is comfortable to in
text:
Good stay
I booked this hotel for my conference visit in Boston This hotel has good facility and nice staff Breakfast was quite good and room service was great It has courtesy shuttle facility from hotel to near by stations and airport I liked it

title: Bed Head Central
text:
The front desk employees are desperately in need of training in gratiously greeting their guests and providing pleasant costumer service during their stay The housekeeping staff and the valet were the complete oppositeshelpful and most accommodating The rooms were incredibly heavy with bedroom odoriebed head I had to spray perfume on my pillow to block out the odor YUCK I asked for new pillows at the front desk and was abruptly told I could find extras in the closet Guess whatno pillows in the closet and no pillow replacements were provided after informing the front desk that there were no pillows in the closet
The bathtub was half full of water by the time I finished my shower YUCK again And the hairdryer is a joke It died after a minuteI suggest you take your own
It was so hot in the room that it was ridiculousand this is November A couple in the elevator with us said they thought they were in a steam bath all night and no satifation with the front desk in remedying the situation
Heads up Look further for lodging You wont regret it

title: Upgrade to a real room before you judge
text: I booked a room here for very cheap for me and my friend to stay in Once arriving they told me it was a shared bathroom situation So I upgraded to the real room WITH a bathroom for barely 50 bucks more This room was awesome I loved it I had a great time Dont bother staying at this hotel if you have hang ups about hostels or anything trendy If you love design and art direction STAY here

title: Good value for a place to rest your head
text: I stayed at the Corktown Inn while working a promo job for the Belle Isle Grand Prix As a solo female traveler I would recommend this place Its not the nicest place but its cheap clean enough and the staff is nice After reading some reviews I had my doubts especially arriving at 1AM but the room was clean and I never felt unsafe in the 4 nights I stayed The only downsides were the old school cigarette smell that permeated EVERYTHING and the incredibly thin walls between rooms Overall it did the job and I plan on staying there every time I work in Detroit

title: ILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN
text: I Stayed At Hotel St James in December The first and only night I stayed there was no heat or hot water I think the heat finally kicked in in the middle of the night but I will never stay there again

title: Loved Ames
text: Recently stayed at the Ames hotel for three nights The hotel is located in great downtown location The rooms are modern and stylish Receptionist was wonderful and even gave us a upgrade We had a room on the top floor and it was very spacious Loved everything about the Ames and would definitely stay there again

title: Big surprise in small package
text: The price is right the location is good and the service is outstandingYou are located in the shopping district but just a cable carbus walk away from ChinatownNorth Beachand Fishermans Wharf Tip there is no place to park and it is expensive to do so If you do not need to do not This is where the Mosser stands out The Mosser staff would see me ask me where I was going and assist me in my plans for the day by directing me on how to get there by using bus cable car train or the subway It was a lot cheaper than parking and often quicker than using the car because hard to find a place to park They also provided toothpaste and a razor besides the regular shampoo and soap

title: First Class Service
text: Every staff member is so attentive Lauren Gruber concierge was so nice  helpful with all my questions Matt was a great door man  Kevin in maintenance was superb Great location for the AAOS conference at the Moscone Ctr

title: Business in Boston
text: After reading the reviews for this hotel after my company booked it for me I was a little weary about staying there for a week lol When I got there i was welcomed by a wonderful staff and clean secure lobby Did I mention the Free Keurig Coffee After long flight i passed out and went to work the next day without issue After work i went to the lobby again and was greated by Big Matt who i have to say is the cream of the crop when it comes to service and willingness to help the people who are not used to the the boston hussle and bussle Waterbottles and self serve closet on everyfloor is awesome I Would totally tell all my coworkers and friends about this place And want to try more of there locations to see if this chain holds up So close to everything No need for a car at all All and all great staff great location great hotel Period

title: Loving the Marmara
text: Well what can I say I have been too Manhattan three times and I can safely say this is the best accommodation I have stayed in The apartment we had was fantastic No central park view but hey how long do you spend in your apartment A couple of blocks from the Maramra is a little restaurant and bar called the Barking Dog Food is fantastic and so is the price Great service apart from one time You will find it at 150 E 34th St Try it out You are about 6 blocks away from Central Park and 5th Avenue Not far from the museums There is a store across the road from the Marmara that sells all the essentials you need A fantastic stay Will stay again here next time

title: Best Place in Hollywood
text: I was staying in different hotel i got moved to hollywood city I stayed there for week My stay was very pleasant service was great and staff was friendly tahir was very kind and helpful breakfast was good no seat but who cares i used to take it to my room Pool is very clean lots of flowers very covenient to hollywood blvd Metro station is one block away Room was very clean and i am very impressed the way they maintain I will stay again

title: Too many other places in San Diego
text: I would skip Too many other places to stay in San Diego with better prices and atomsphere We were looking for a Hawaiian themed hoteland this was not it We did have a room right on the marina but the room smelled like a Motel 6 room I would rate this hotel about a 25  definitely not a resort The decor is definitely outdated and the breakfast with the AAA rate is not worth the deal The front lobby clerk processes checkin onlyunconcerned with giving you the usual spiel about where to find the internet access code or that the AAA breakfast is ordered off a special menu and you must notify your server ahead of time The rooms lead out to concrete hallways and the walls are paperthindefinitely not resort material  especially by San Diego standards

title: Standard Clean Rooms in a Convenient Location
text: Our small room was quite clean and equipped with a comfortable bed The price makes it a good value though for some 20 more one can stay in a much higher quality hotel in the Times Square area The lack of a spacious lobby is a drawback as is the low elevator capacity that results in waiting time going up and down from the rooms The breakfast in the pleasant restaurant was very good with prompt attentive service

title: Best place in town
text: This is our second stay here and it was better this time because we knew how great it was going to be The staff was all so friendly and helpful its tricky to pick just one person who was the best  but I would have to say  William was at the front desk I do best with some special accommodations such as NO CLEANING scents in my room and the staff for the second time in a row had the room clean but fragrance free and the windows open for me upon my arrival To anyone with asthma or chemical sensitivities reading this you know how amazing it is to travel and be able to breathe My family and many others with us on this visit love the character of the Sainte Claire A bonusyou can walk anywhere including a beautiful park and relax or go out

title: One really great night out
text: My husband and I had a wonderful romantic night out with our stay at this hotel The customer service at the hotel proper was very helpful and friendly The food at 42 Degrees North restaurant in hotel was FANTASTIC though the servers were a bit on the lackluster side not very professional for such a nice place Our room was very comfortable minus the mattress which felt a bit old dipped in the center But linens and pillows very comfy They use Bath and Bodyworks bath and shower products in the bathroom  very nice touch The view from our room was breathtaking Being close to the Riverwalk and all kinds of downtown fun was great We cant wait to go back and would recommend it to our friends looking for a date night

title: Great Hotel
text: This is the second time we have stayed here and we will continue to stay here each time we go to either Hurrican Harbor Six Flags Rangers game or Cowboy game I love the attitude of the employees willingness to help with all your questions or if you are looking for a certain place The room was great and clean Thanks for the great stay

title: Wonder hotel experience  highly recommended
text:
I stayed at this hotel for the first time over Memorial Day weekend I wanted to write this review because I had a an exceptionally good expereince The location is terrific and the room was modern spacious and comfortable No doubt NYC hotel prices are high  put this hotel delivers your moneys worth The staff was incredibly attentive The concierge desk is right by the elevator and they greet you as you go by and ask if they can assist Join Omnis select guest program for free and you get free room wifi and morning beverage on the spot 
I go to NYC often and I have found the place where I plan to stay in the future

title: Carefully Examine your Bill
text:
I actually wanted to give this property 25 stars because of the inaccurate room description but it is not possible
We stayed at the Residence Inn Vermont Ave for 3 nights February 2012 I booked the room at this hotel because I needed a one bedroom suite with two beds Upon checking in I was given a room with two beds and a kitchendiningliving area but no bedroom door I immediately went back to the front desk and requested a room with a bedroom door The clerk was nice and offered me another room butI was informed that there were no suites with two beds that had a bedroom door even though I booked and eventually paid for a one bedroom suite I actually paid more than I wouldve for a suite with a door because I requested two beds Everyone at the hotel acted like it was okay to advertise a one bedroom even if the bedroom has no door No concession was offered 
Thankfully my 4 year old was fairly quiet in the mornings
Additionally even if you do not use the valet you are immediately billed for all the nights of your stay if you have a car The front desk staff agreed to remove one of the charges from the bill We had to ask two additional times to have it removed 
Other than the false advertisment about the one bedroom suite and the valet bill issue it was a nice hotel with a good location If I had not been traveling with my family the door would not have mattered It was a large room
Breakfast was great with a waffle machine some eggs and other hot items They had all premium condiments including flavored coffee creamers and Splenda and Equal There were also continental items yogurt cereal breads and juice and soda machines The breakfast staff is very accommodating The eggs were somewhat runny but I know some people like them that way
The workout facility is very nice
Housekeeping was excellent The hotel staff was friendly except for one argumentative Valet Porter
The McPherson Square Metro is a few blocks away Cabs are abundant Stans a pub down the street has decent food and very real drinks
I wouldve given the hotel a higher rating if I had gotten what I paid for

title: Probably wont be a Sheraton for long
text: Lobby area was dark and uninviting The former Ramada did have a make over but it seems like more money could have been invested I paid 66 a night for the room on a Priceline bid At that price it was a bargain but at full price I would have felt cheated My stay was over the weekend and there were a lot of guests in town for different celebrations The halls and corridors were not kept as clean as possible Some of that was the guests fault and not the hotels A room service tray was left on the hall on the third floor of the south tower and some guests decided to scatter the left overs across the carpet Room was comfortable but the window was small and the view was of the freeway Bathroom was small in comparasion to the room size Self parking is outside on a surface lot Valet parking is covered and worth the extra expense

title: I thought I had moved into a Starbucks
text:
Being from the great Northwest home of Starbucks I was amused when I entered the lobby of the Hyatt Place It was obviously designed to have that coffeehouse look In fact the checkin counter is also a Starbucks counter I am not sure if its an actual Starbucks franchise but they serve many of the Starbucks drinks 
After a long day of travel I arrived at the hotel The check in was pretty easy but the hostess wanted to sell me on some kind of plan to reduce costs for me and my companyat that point I wanted to get to my room and crash She was gracious when I told her Id talk with her later 
I was staying here while working up in St Marys Georgia about 30 minutes away Because of long work hours I didnt really get a chance to experience all the hotel had to offer 
The room was very comfortable and included a large flat screen TV with a connection interface box to satisfy the latent geek in anyone There was a large couch a desk and a coffee area with refrigerator wish they also had a microwave The bed was extremely comfortable and had an offering of a variety of pillows with different firmness characteristics 
The free breakfast was delicious and offered some bistro style egg dishes each morning The juice was good and cold the coffee was not very hot but was remedied by the person over the breakfast area I especially liked the fresh fruit salad with large chunks of pineapple
This place was a great value and very comfortable The staff was friendly for the most part The only downside to the stay was room cleanliness It was pretty obvious that my room was not being vacuumed each day however other things were well maintained
One funny little perkthey provide you with a new tube trial size of toothpaste everyday I wish all hotels did thisjust one less thing to pack in my quart size ziplock TSA liquid bag

title: Super trendy hotel awesome location
text: I was so nervous about getting this hotel on a bid after reading the reviews BUT the hotel ended up being awesome YES the rooms are tiny If you are going to spend a lot of time in the room opt for another place We came here to relax for an hour and sleep at night 2 adults and a 3yo and it was perfectly fine The staff were nice the decor was great the room was clean I really have no complaints We requested a higher up floor which by the way makes NO difference in outside sounds and they accommodated us with no issue Dont be put off by the negative reviews It seems as though they added lighting to the rooms they werent dark like the other reviews said The lobby is dark and the hallways are dark but we never found it to be an issue Its in an amazing location half a block to the 59stColumbus Circle subway and just as close to Central Park There are 2 parking garages on the street Central and Icon print out a coupon online and its 1520 cheaper than their 55 valet at the hotel

title: Great room great location
text:
This property is a real find if like me youve had enough of corporate midtown hotels
You just have a room and a key  no concierge  bar  restaurant etc so its more like staying in someones house although you can order room service from the bar next door
The decor is quirky and quaint  shabby chic meets Victoriana  the bathroom is particularly unusual with a old claw footed tub and brass taps
We stayed in December and were grateful for the fire that you can light as you wish gas with flames not real wood  it really adds ambiance to an already spacious room
The usual amenities and mini bar are on offer with a few thoughtful extras like maps
The location is great as well  easy walking distance into Soho and of course the lovely Bowery just around the corner for drinks
This place is edgy and cool and beats more traditional hotels hands down
Only criticisms would be that the TV was very old and it took us a long time to get any channels on it at all and also the iPod dock  alarm clock didnt work  but technology didnt really seem appropriate in our oldschool room anyway

title: Room was small but staff were very friendly and helpful
text:
I got to the hotel early 11am so I could spend the day out with my friend in Manhattan I didnt get any sleep on my long flight with a layover in Atlanta so I was actually falling asleep in the lobby waiting for my friend to come meet me The front desk staff was very nice in offering early checkins for me and another couple that were waiting for checkin time 3pm I gladly took what was available so I could get a much needed nap before exploring the city The elevator was busy with housekeeping using the 1 elevator but I still didnt wait too long for it to be available for me to use The housekeepers were friendly while I passed them by to get to my room One of them even helped to make sure that my room was ready before I walked ion the room and bringing an extra blanket that she found missing The room was very small but was very cozy At the end of the rooms hallway was one of the beds was very close to the wall and was obstructing passage to go around the bed I have a picture of the bed near the wall and blocking the hallway But all and all a nice small room There were robes and nice bath amenities  which I gladly took home for a future bath or shower the lotions and soaps not the robes The tv was small and didnt have many stations available but I didnt care since I was there to go out and be entertained by the city I got a quiet room without a view which was perfectly quiet for me to take a nap and slept well later that night The front desk in the morning were very nice and expedient They also asked if I needed transportation and would help me if needed The hotel is just across the street from Central Park If I moved here I think this would be a nice neighborhood to live in 
It felt safe There were cafes and shops within 3 to 4 blocks and the hotel is half a block away from a bus stop and the subway Its very convenient I would recommend this hotel to someone who spending the day out and not staying in the room much although I think its still cozy You will have easy access to public transportation and will get a good night sleep at night The price was the cheapest that I could find at the time I would tell you what it is but its irrelevant since room rates will change throughout Manhattan depending on the time of your trip Oh okay It was 14700 inc taxes and fees

title: Classy with great service in a great location
text: Always a pleasure at a Fairmont property service was top notch We were there for a long weekend and to attend a Seahawks game Location was great We walked to Pike Place Market shopping  cool restaurants nearby There was a nice little bar in the hotel for a nightcap and we ordered room service for breakfast one day which was great  tasty  fast but pricey It is not a hip hotel like the Hyatt is but more a classy and comfy vibe We were upgraded to a suite with a comfortable sitting area the furniture was a little like Grandmas living roomand the room smelled slightly musty when we first walked in Overall it was really very nice the doorman were very polite friendly and helpful It was a great spot for us to be at for the weekend Seattle is a great city and the Fairmont Olympic a great place to sty

title: Great place
text: Stayed here 32112 The service was outstanding All of the people were very helpful from checkin to checkout Nice to see people taking customer service to excellant levels Thank you

title: Very Nice I would recommend
text: My husband and I spent one night at the Magnolia July 23rd The staff was very friendly The location is perfect if you plan on taking in some theater or maybe a show at the Toyaota Center They even offer transportation He had a suite It was big comforatble and clean My only small issue is that the TV could have used an update to a flat screen RM 1901

title: Good value for the area
text: This hotel is not the nicest Hilton Ive stayed in The location is good if you need to be in the Union Square area When looking at a map of the Union Square area be aware that the entrance to this hotel is on OFarrell It is a little hike to get to the heart of the Union Square shopping area Although the location is on the border of the Tenderloin neighborhood I did feel safe coming and going There are doormen who are always there and a security guard outside sometimes We took advantage of the loaner umbrellas that they offered and they were large and highquality The room service is very expensive for below average quality food and I would not recommend it The business center is a Kinkos You need to pay to use the computers I paid 4 dollars worth of computer time to print my boarding pass

title: Kind of Just Misses
text: The suite was quite nice comfortable and made me want to give this hotel 4 circles When we arrived it was set up for one person  one wash cloth one hand towel three towels A call to the front desk brought housekeeping fairly quickly with additional towels The living area had a blank wall where a full length mirror would have fit nicely and made use of the bathroom by two people more efficient The light over the kitchen area was very dim To see anything in that little nook required other lights to be turned on Our second day we had breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel Good food good service but expensive The real problem came at check out I went to the lobby to get a cart for the luggage shortly before checkout When I reached the room the elevators are very slow it was still a minute or two before checkout but my key didnt work Fortunately my wife was still in the room to let me in As I was finishing loading the cart less than five minutes later the head of housekeeping was knocking on the door wanting to know if we were leaving As I opened the door she could see the cart was loaded I explained the difficulty getting back into the room but she didnt want to hear it This is very Motel 6 not 4 circle hotel in Baltimore Bottom line price was right but we will probably try someplace else next time we visit my wifes sister

title: Nice cozy hotelwith great staff
text:
This hotel is very cozy feeling and is great if you want to be near the water or in the Pikes Market area only a 10 minute walk My room was suppose to be a city view room but when I checked in they upgraded me to a water view room It didnt have the tub that you see in the pictures but it had a great rock and glass walk in shower The beds seem to be very comfortable at least for me The decoration of the hotel is a little kitchy sp but cute I felt like I was in a lodge or a place that should be in fhe forest The fire place was a nice touch I didnt use it because I was in Seattle on one of those off days in June when the weather was actually great and some what warm 
The staff at the Edgewater were very helpful and accomodating They were able to help me with many of my questions or issues that I had unrelated to the hotel I bought fish at Pikes market and they were very quick to make sure it was well preserved until I was ready to check  out I was easily able to connect to the wireless network that they have available through the hotel 
The location of this hotel is great for anyone that may be taking the Clipper to Canada The dock is right next door to the hotel and they will even help you with your luggage to the ferry Very accomodating
I would stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to people who want to stay on or near the water in Seattle and near Pikes Market If you go to Pikes Market and enjoy Cheese there is a great place called Beechers they have the best soups and Mac and Cheese ever

title: Vastly overrated
text: It is hard to believe that a hotel with double occupancy 125sq foot single double bed rooms could possibly be rated as Four Stars It questions the validity of the entire star rating system For the Omni chain a chain generally associated with upscale accommodations to associate itself with such a hotel is mind boggling This is a hotel that is clearly stuck in the ninteenth century Any modern four star hotel evaluation includes the designation spacious room not here This is really a fraudulent use of the star system and an embarassment to the Omni chain

title: Decent hotel Tough parking lot to enter and exit
text:
Not a bad place I was satisfied with my stay 
Check in
No problems and I was right off to my room
Bed
I liked the bed like usual the major problems was the pillows They always seem to have these pillows that are worthless to me I had to pile 3 to get a decent pillow
Shower
The shower was not that great in my room Plus its weird Its not labeled well so it took some trial and error to get the hot water 
TV
Decent TV and decent amount of channels They did have some HD channels
Fitness room
It had a great fitness room At one point there was 5 people in there and we all had something to use
Parking
The hotel is on the point of 2 main roads so its a bit hard to enter and exit if there is heavy traffic 
Internet
Decent signal during my visit 
Overall I was happy I did walk run across the street for dinner They had a good selection of decent places over there

title: Comfortable rooms amazing location
text: I stayed here when attending a conference up the street at the Omni The Normandy was less expensive and tenfold as nice The rooms are thoughtfully and elegantly appointed the beds are comfortable the bathrooms large Many boutique hotels tend to be heavy on the attitude but light on the amenities and comfort not here One complaint The staff while polite and attentive was very slow to answer my emails and I had to ask three or four times and wait five days for a confirmation to be sent to my email address

title: VERY BAD dont stay here
text: Rooms are from the 1980s maids simlpy hung my towels back up that were on the floor no new onesI know because my wife wiped off her eye makeup the day before WOW Place is digusting Only one elevator was working oppisite end of the building Front desk manager Arvid is an idiotseriously

title: DUMP Save Your Money
text: This is one of the worst properties I have ever stayed at Where to begin First it should be noted I got this for cheap by NYC standards on Priceline  but I dont think it was even worth the discounted price The rooms are beyond tiny and the bathrooms so small you can hardly move I can deal with size of the place is nice but rooms are disgusting Everything is stained ripping or dirty I felt so dirty just being in these gross rooms UGH On top of that the walls and doors are paper thin You hear everything it is so noisy  I couldnt sleep at all during our 3 nights there And on top of that the cleaning staff stands in the hallways gossiping and talking they MUST know how thin these walls are early in the morning or vacuming This hotel is so gross  dish out a few extra bucks and stay the nearby Marriott or Hilton The ONLY plus is its location

title: Its a Marriott
text:
All in all its a nice hotel Our room was nice clean and just what we expected from a Marriott We did not eat any food at the hotel so I cant speak for that If you want to be close to the water and the piers its a great location Also very close to the Pike Place Market and some other neighborhoods worth checking out Of course you are paying for the water front location Two things I really didnt like 1 The cost of parking However if you go a couple blocks past the Marriott and turn on Bell or Wall you will find a municpal garage says for cruises but anyone can park there for 14 a day 10day if you have a cruise receipt Its about a 4 block walk back to the hotel But if you prefer to pay 42 a day for valet knock yourself out 2 12 a day for internet Really In this day an age when nearly every cheap hotel offers it for free Im gonna pay top dollar to stay at the Marriott Waterfront and you want to insult me by charging for internet I just find that so tacky
Anyway enjoy your visit and enjoy Seattle lots to do and see

title: Beautiful hotel with fun ghostly lore
text: The Brown Palace was a gorgeous hotel within walking distance of plenty of shopping and a mall I didnt realize there were tours but heard a nearby tour party discussing some of the eerie fun ghost stories from the hotel The tour guide was even dressed in old fashioned costume to fit the tale I wish I could have stayed for the tea service it looked lovelydefinitely next time Very comfortable bed nice views and great prime rib at this hotel Very helpful and friendly staff as well Definitely worth staying here

title: GREAT HOTEL TO STAY THOUGH WISH THE MGT MORE FLEXIBLE W Lugguage Policy
text:
Stay 1 night on Sept 3 2009 using the Priority Club Points as we had to join a tour in the nearby Chinatown the next day and the location of this hotel from the pick up point is about 4 blocks away Everyone is VERY NICE upon check in as my 3 yrs old daughter was crying out loud her heart to learn that we didnt stay in Sheraton LaGuardia as we did the previous 2 nights but here I was really embarrassed but the check in staff was fanstastic came out and tried to calm her down but futile Beat me sometimes todlers are so sensitive   passionate about the hotel that they once stayed 
The only complaint that I have is that the hotel will not hold our luggage for 2 nights if we dont have a future reservation and quoted us due to liability and suggested that we stored our lugguage in Penn Station This is a crazy suggestion as we arrived in the late evening that night and will have no time to travel to Penn Station that night as we only need to store 1 piece so that the next morning we didnt need to drag 2 pieces of luggage when we joined our 3 days 2 nights tour to Philly Washington DCNiagara Falls and Thousand Island We explained that we are going to book their car service upon our return on 3rd day to Jersey City and would this change No SORRY that is the reply I found this VERY DISCRIMATING as a guest as it sounds like they will hold luggage for you if you have a future stay otherwise once your stay is over SORRY you are not my guest anymore and that is your problem In my prior stay of hotel like Sheraton Vancouver they willing to hold and charge you a nominal fee per night of holding  This is at least an option and being helpful to your guest and not give us a rediculous suggestion that we store at Penn Station So apart from this issue of not able to hold our 1 piece luggage since we have no pending reservation which I found unappreciated as a guest as well as being an UNHELPFUL hotel meeting guest needs
Overall room is clean and comfortable as they put us on club floor and indeed no street noise or subway train vibrations Staff are friendly  helpful apart from the incident that not able to hold our 1 piece luggage for 2 nights even though we booked with them the car service upon our return
I would still recommend this hotel stay to friend and family though would advise them to take into consideration the no luggage hold if there is no future reservation with them

title: Not normal sheraton quality bay tower
text:
This tower is fairly average The view and location however are outstanding Restaurant is more like convenience cafe very small and limited menu Beds suck guess they havent upgraded to new cozy ones Toilet paper and tissue are cheap and scratchy details that add to feeling of nice detail or am I in motel 6 Front desk staff was friendly but a bit too much to the point for my taste I like the is there anything else and other courtesies Took 3 calls and 2 visits to front front desk over 4 hour period to get corkscrew and room service menu delivered I called guest services made my request only to hear allow me to transfer you to room servicedid this 3 timesnever got connected Just wonder why he didnt send it up 
Room service and bar staff are super friendly and food was tasty

title: AWESOME location for a tourist
text:
Being 50 metres from Times Square made this hotel much enjoyable
Big credits to the hotel for what they did on 911 
The gym was top notch

title: Great Location  Reasonably Priced
text:
I stayed here with my wife during a week long business trip to San Antonio and was delighted with the hotel and its location it is right on the riverwalk and great for the nightlife The rooftop swimming pool is beautiful and a great place to relax
The room was clean the staff friendly and the service is as you find at all Drury hotels with all the usual extras which help to keep costs down
I will stay here again when I come back with my family

title: Nice atmosphere great location but small rooms
text:
I liked this hotel Booked through Priceline so got a good rate 90 but would definitely consider returning even if I had to pay more
Room was small as you would expect at a boutique hotel The whole building shows its age with a few cracks here and there but is very clean Decor is in keeping with the style of the hotel It was on the 5th floor at the front of the hotel You can definitely hear the street noise but I am not a light sleeper so it didnt bother me The alternative seemed to be rooms at the back with views of brick walls so if a quiet room with a view is a priority for you this might not be the best place
Location is great  right in the center of things Lobby is always full of bustle In all the place had much more character than the business hotels I generally end up staying at Service was good  everybody I spoke to was very pleasant and attentive
Nice place but not ultraluxury by any means

title: Outstanding property in a great location
text:
The Hilton Charlotte University Place is conveniently located in north Charlotte close to shopping dining UNCCharlotte Charlotte Motor Speedway and zMax Dragway The staff is friendly and helpful rooms are well appointed and comfortable and common areas are well kept Make a point of having dinner in the onsite fullservice restaurant Its terrific and my waiter was informed helpful and prompt The food is delicious
Terrific property Great staff

title: Could not get front desk to answer phone
text: i loved this property until it came time to contact front desk to ask them to stop the party in the courtyard There was a picnic table outside our room that was apparently the place to meet It is 10 minutes after midnight and I cant get security to remove these people

title: One of my favorites
text: This is a wonderful place to stay The price is always worth the luxury Comfy beds and very helpful and nice staff The lounge upstairs is amazing at night

title: Will stay here again
text: We enjoyed our stay a the Bay Club Hotel Overall it was a good experience The rooms and hotel are clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful They offer a buffetstyle complimentary breakfast which was ok We ate breakfast 2 days there but after we went out for breakfast The fitness room over looks the marina but honestly we enjoyed walkingjogging along the bay much better The equipment is a bit outdated We discovered after the first full day there that you have to call the front desk to arrange your room to be serviced but after that was pleasantly surprised when they came in thereafter on a daily basis without the phone call All in all a good experience and we will definately stay again

title: Youre paying for location
text:
One spends a lot of money to stay at this hotel In return one gets a super location if theater is on the agenda However even when paying 400 or more nightly one has to ask for a fridge to be placed in your room Need a shower cap One has to request that also Want to log onto the Internet in your room You can get it for a mere 19 a day tax included Our rooms decor was classic hotel standard comfortably innocuous but large 
 All in all the beancounters have sucked the luxury and welcome out of this hotel at no sacrifice to the bottomline Call me cheap but I think at these prices the hotels save a couple of bucksapproach is bush league

title: Great deal in the theatre district but
text:
The location is greateasy walking distance to the theatres Millennium Park and the Art Institute
The price is goodcheaper than other properties in the same neighborhood
If youre on a budget skip the valet parking and park in the garage on the opposite corner of Randolph and Wells and save 14 Skip coffee delivered to your door Dunkin Donuts is across the street on Wells
The staff is pleasant if somewhat confused at times The room was small but within acceptable limits for the location and price
There was one thing missing from the room An electrical outlet There was one that was not behind furniture in the small bathroom What good is an iron and an ironing board when the only place to iron is in the bathroom while standing in the tub
While the property was recently renovated expect to be mildly annoyed by the small things The iPod dock was broken The TV didnt work well with the inStream receiver There are ice machine rooms on the even floors but the one on 10 was an empty room The computer center next to the front desk had a broken printer On the other hand the wireless network worked well
Verdict Great deal for a short stay to see a few shows but plan to obtain services by walking around the neighborhood

title: Great Location Tiny roomsThin walls
text:
San Francisco  the hardest place on our trip to choose a hotel that sounded like it would be safe and quiet After scoping over all the trip advisor reviews on San Fran hotels it became apparent that Chancellor was the ONLY choice  What attracted me also was the fact that if there were any negative parts of a review  management would come on trip advisor and try and explain the WHY  it shows they have a lot of self respect for their customer service
When we arrived we were served by professional and friendly staff who gave us vouchers for a drink in the bar later on which also had friendly people serving We were taken up to our room and soon after the fridge I had order for medical reasons arrived  only problem was someones left over ice cream was still in there But I was happy that is arrived so quickly after we arrived unlike other establishments with poor service
Let me begin with the room  in a country where its all about BIG  these rooms were tiny  but in saying that that is what you should expect from a boutique hotel The beds were single beds  quite small and soft Theres a bay window that looked out onto the street below where we watched a busker outside our hotel getting rowdier and rowdier as the day went on  this is not a hotel you want to be in if you want to keep the windows open lol  unless u like noise With the windows closed I didnt find it at all too noisy The bathroom perhaps needs a face lift as the new feature wall and bed linen in the main room has given it a great look but for all intent purposes was fine Free wireless internet was fabulous and fast Apart from being small  the rooms were clean and comfortable
Biggest flaw with the rooms  The extremely THIN walls in the middle of the night we were awoken and kept awake by noises that well were a tad R rated  with a 5am wake up call the next day we were a bit tired the following day
Location Location Union Square is right there  shopping district surrounds you and the cable cars ding ding at your front door step Tour buses are easily booked and acessible from the Chancellor Restaurants and food places are just a hop skip and a jump away My personal favourite  Bangkok Noodles and Thai BBQ  110 Powell St  yummy fried rice Actually  best Ive ever had
Stay at chancellor for the location and the service

title: Fabulous location
text: We got a great deal on a discount website 90 a night Other reviewers are correct in saying that the rooms as very small but we had a corner room with three windows which probably made a huge difference as the other rooms on our floor only had one small window with a window unit air conditioner Those rooms could have felt a little cell like but our was certainly adequate for just sleeping and showering It has a lovely roof top deck with lots of seating The work out facility is small two treadmills one bike one eliptical weights and a pulley station Its abt a 5 minutes straight shot to the beachabt 10 minutes to Navy Pier a one block walk to Michigan Avenue at Ohio There are plenty of restaurants within a couple of blocks The location couldnt have been better I highly recommend it for its location and roof top deck If I wanted a beautiful room with lots of room and a spa like bath then I wouldnt recommend it but if youre just looking for location convenience and a good price then this is the place

title: Great Staff Great Location Great Savings
text: Came with family for a three day weekend Travelling with a two year old and our elderly parents is sometimes a challenge Easy walk to the Riverwalk a few minutes and San Antonio is beautiful Pool is small but wasnt crowded and has an oasis feel Rooms were huge and clean Two flat screens in each room was nice touch Kids had a cartoon break without parents having to endure it Staff was very considerate of our needs Room fees were easy on our wallet compared to other downtown hotels that we considered Would come back over and over Breakfast was included in our room and staff was nice

title: Marina Tower Only
text: We used Hotelscom to book our 5 night stay at this hotel and had chosen a marina view as opposed to a bay view However there are two towers at this hotel and they are quite different The marina tower is far superior to the bay tower which they had booked us into We asked to be moved to the marina tower which they did with no complaint and after bring placed in two unacceptable rooms we were upgraded to a gorgeous room on the 9th floor of 12 The marina tower has all the facilities which the bay tower does not ie two pools fitness center bike and segway rentals bars and restaurants including Starbucks and is far newer than the bay tower We ate at their restaurants each night and had great servers You can have valet parking or use public transit from this hotel Valet 2000 day vs transit 500 day San Diego has a wonderful history and the downtown core is quite newWe recommend taking a trolley tour to get an overview if you havent been there beforeThe beds and pillows were heavenly and we had a balcony with two chairs and a table

title: Nightmare on West 47th Street
text:
I used to read the stories about other peoples nightmarish travel experiences with a certain amount of indifference but after my recent stay at the Econo Lodge at Time Square in NYC Ive definitely developed a lot more compassion for those individuals
Through all of my travels and stays at hotels I have never experienced such a complete disregard for customers and their needs and the worse part it was that although Id tried to reach the manager of the hotel Ronica throughout my stay each time I was given a response that she hadnt arrived at work this being 1000am on Friday morning or that shed already left at 430pm on the same day and when Id asked whether she would be in during the weekend the receptionist only responded by telling me that She doesnt really have a fixed schedule

title: It was better than I expected
text: The property isnt brand new but it is clean and well kept Its the customer service that puts this place 1 on my list I called to the office asked for extra towels and another ashtray late on my first nite there Before I had a chance to walk to the office to get the items the young man working the front desk was at my room door with my request I found out the next day he closed the office for a few minutes to bring me these items so I wouldnt have to walk the property at such a late hour Housekeeping stays on top of the job too they never just poke thier heads in to see if Ive checked out nor do they come banging on the door asking if Im staying or not constant communication and updates with the front desk ensure I the guest dont feel rushed off and i get exactly what i pay fora room w a check out time  12 Ill continue to use this hotel look 4ward to more 5star treatment Ill keep you updated with more GREAT reviews

title: Excellent Choice for NYC
text: Excellent Choice A very nice small hotel on Lexington near 57th st Close to Shopping Museums and 2 street blocks from a Subway station at 59th  Lexington The Rooms were very clean and the staff was friendly We had a Bedroom Suite which had 2 rooms and 2 flat screen televisions which was perfect for traveling with Teenagers The cost of the 5 nights was less than staying at the large chain hotels in Times square and we had a lot more space Only ate at the restaurant once but had the Irish Breakfast and it was excellent and recommended Would definitely stay here again on future trips to NYC

title: Excellent hotel with a very courteous staff
text:
Excellent first rate hotel with a very courteous staff
we checked in for our anniversary in Octoberr and were told that the hotel was overbooked  and that they did not have a room in the bay tower that night  however they did find a last minute accommodation for the night and then upgraded us to the penthouse suite for the next 2 nights  it was excellent service all around after that The front desk went out of their way to make this happen and they had no incentive to do it for us  they could have very well given us another room  I believe the person on the front desk that night was Eduardo but I do not recollect his name It was a 2000sq ft penthouse and the huge balcony has excellent views of the San Diego skyline the marina is just steps away from the hotel and you can plan to watch a romantic sunset by the oceanside in rather silence also we were given free parking and breakfast vouchers for all 3 days of our stay  now that was surely a royal treatment Thanks for making it a special vacation for us We left a small bottle of champagne as a token of appreciation

title: NARPMWe use Hotel VQ once a month for meetings
text:
I cant express how grateful I am that I get to work with you and your awesome staff Your staff is very patient and kind well mannered and always willing to make us happy They must get that from you
I want to thank you for dealing with all my back and forth questions the menu changes and my sometimes tardiness with lunch orders over the last year You really do make my job so much easier Not only that I really do feel like we can count on you for help and I know for a fact that there isnt any other venue out there that will go beyond the limits like you guys will to make us happy Thanks again so much and know that we appreciate you I hope you have a great holiday and cant wait to see you in January

title: Perfect inexpensive neighborhood hotel  Best Hotel Value for  in NYC
text: Two of us stayed for 5 nights at the end of March in a room 217 with a single and double bed and couldnt have been more pleased I wanted to stay in a neighborhood setting and not spend much money because we would hardly ever be in our room We shared a bathroom right across the hall which worked perfectly  we never saw anyone else use it  it was spotless and there was a sink  hairdryer and two mirrors in our room The lobby was quaint and I loved all the dark wood trim throughout We laughed about the fact that the only noise we heard in our room came from birds in the morning  no traffic noise The room looked better than what we saw on the website Wed stay there again for sure

title: 3 star service in 45 star accommodations
text: Beautiful location and views sparkling new hotel and lackluster uninspired service Even the front doorman couldnt work up much enthusiasm

title: FiveStar Service  ThreeStar Rooms  FourStar Review
text:
September 6th through 8th 2005  This was my first stay at this Marriott hotel I will likely return
I arrived early evening and checkin took only a minute or two I received my guaranteed room type king nonsmoking My room was 405 in the older 5story section of the hotel The room was pretty average but I liked it because the sliding glass door opened onto the front of the hotel and it was very quiet I intended to sleep with the sliding glass door open
The room had a nice two level work desk with an STSN Ibahn HS internet connection I had trouble accessing the system but was finally able to get online However the system worked only intermittently After several calls to the help line a hotel engineer arrived at my room with several new boxes None of them worked and I would up changing rooms
My second room 583 was on the concierge level 5th floor and was also a nonsmoking king room Before I did anything else I checked to make sure the internet connection worked properly which it did I did not notice it until I finished my work but this room was on the back of the hotel and faced I25 I am a light sleeper and the noise from the interstate meant that I did not get a good night sleep
The next morning I stopped by the front desk and said that I would need to change rooms again My request was handled quickly but there were no king nonsmoking rooms available I wound up with room 7308 in the newer tower section of the hotel I did not like this room as much as either of the others because it had a much smaller desk did not have a worktype chair at the desk and the windows would not open
Common to all three rooms was a unit that housed an empty compact refrigerator and a coffee maker The bathrooms were small but spotless There were plenty of thick white towels All of the rooms had the type of single room air conditioners that are not as quiet as wholehouse systems They worked well but were somewhat noisy
One of the best features of this hotel in my opinion was the Marquis Lounge equivalent to the Concierge Lounge in most Marriott Hotels The lounge was very large and comfortable In the evening there were three different hot appetizers chili and a nice selection of fruit and cheeses I ate enough that I considered it my dinner In the morning there was a nice continental breakfast plus scrambled eggs There is complimentary wireless internet access in the lounge
For dinner my second night I decided to eat a full meal in Comparis the full service restaurant The food and service were excellent It was one of the best and most enjoyable meals that I have had in a while A glass of premium wine salad pasta entre desert and coffee came to 40 with tax Jam my waiter gave truly excellent service and he looks a lot like Al Pacino The restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch also but I only had dinner
The rooms in the older section of the hotel are built around a 5story atrium Odd number rooms face outward and most of the even number rooms open onto the atrium Within the atrium is the Great Divide Brewing Company a bar and lounge Right off of the atrium is the Front Range Trading Company which is a combination gift shop and Starbucks
The health club is at the back of the hotel The exercise room was quite large and had a good selection of equipment that all looked in excellent condition The indoor pool area that also has a whirlpool spa is adjacent Just out side is the outdoor pool There were plenty of clean towels in both the exercise room and the pool areas
There is a display in the lobby of what the rooms will look like after they are refurbished early in 2006 My guess is that the rooms will go from being comfortable but boring to very comfortable and beautiful
There is plenty of free parking all around the hotel as well as valet parking for which I think there is a charge Walking through the lobby I was constantly asked by hotel associates if they could help me or direct me The service at this hotel is excellent
The Denver Marriott Tech Center is located at the junction of I225 and I25 It is almost exactly 26 miles from Denver International Airport The hotel is located in a business park with a few restaurants There is a FedEx Kinkos across the street
I can highly recommend this hotel for the service The rooms are very clean and comfortable but nothing special I am anxious to see this property after the rooms get an extreme makeover in 2006

title: Stayed there before will stay there again
text:
I stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square North last year and rebooked for my trip this year Could not beat the price for the location and ammenities
I was greeted with a welcome back and an early checkin to a room at the end of the hall on a high floor just as I had requested My room faced 8th Ave and to be honest I was not bothered by street noise at all I would rather have the 8th ave view too
The staff here are really warm and helpful They are also professional and friendly I had a problem with a slow drain and it was fixed by the time I got back to my room
The rooms are large and comfortable I used the safe everyday And I always felt secure even staying alone here 
I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to the city

title: Would have been great if the airport shuttle had been on time
text:
I really liked this hotel when I first checked in The front desk staff was friendly and welcoming and I thought the decor was quite nice for a Doubletree The room we were assigned was spacious and the bed was comfortable I did not have a chance to use it but the pool looked like fun
Anyway I stayed at this hotel because of its proximity to the airport as I had a 700am flight out of San Antonio the next morning I asked for information on the shuttle as I checked in The front desk agent stated that we should be in the lobby just 15 minutes before we wanted to be at the airport as it is just a few minutes away In the morning I went downstairs 15 minutes before I needed to be at the airport The front desk agent called the shuttle driver multiple times and could not get in touch with him The shuttle was parked in front of the hotel so it was just a matter of the driver coming to the lobby It took FOREVER The front desk agent was so nice  even offered to pay for a cab In the end we had to wait in the lobby for 30 minutes to get the shuttle and were at the airport about 40 minutes from the time we arrived in the lobby I was livid and almost missed my flight Granted one might suggest I pad some extra time to get to the airport but my reason for staying at an airport hotel was so that I could sleep in a bit It was just so frustrating
All in all my experience with the airport shuttle was a real damper on my experience with this hotel Otherwise I would have rated the property much higher Bottom line If you are an airport hotel make sure your shuttle is running on time

title: Great relaxed lobby bar
text: Had a great cosmo at the lobby bar  relaxed easy conversation with clients Tricia Littlefield is a great bartender

title: Crazy good service and great location Ill book again for sure
text:
Great stay We arrived early in the day and since our rooms were not ready we checked our bags We all received phone calls when our rooms were ready Im a Hilton Gold member so upon arrival to my room I received a hand written welcome note with a bag of complimentary snacks and water in lieu of a room upgrade as no such upgrade was available The rooms are spacious for NYC and seemed recently renovated very clean and up to date We opted for the Bed  Breakfast deal which got our day off to a good start I was happy to see that breakfast was served in the adjoining restaurant Pigalle as I have had numerous good dinners there before I was very happy about the free internet and the MP3 hook up to the alarm clock Its pretty easy to pick up cabs from the hotel and there are great restaurants on the surrounding blocks 
My only word of caution would be to ask for a room on a high floor so you dont hear the traffic I was on 9 and could still hear quite a lotbut this is New York and is to be expected My coworkers were on lower floors and their only complaint is that they were close to the ice machine and elevators so you may want to ask for the best room available away from noisemaking things
The staff aim to please They seem to want to bend over backwards to make things right Everything WAS right in my opinion so I didnt need to call on them 
Did I mention they have cookies at checkin
I will be back in May

title: Insecured
text:
No secuirity guy
Open parkingno gate
Homeless  Prostitutes are all around Gangs in front of 711
Extremely busy traffic hard to get out  in
Cramped parking lot
Swimming pool water has not been changed ever since these gujus take over
Manager has double roll selling room  selling tours
Poor breakfast so called continental
Bed bug
ANTS

title: Very comfortable hotel close to shopping at Arboretum and the Domain
text:
We spent 7 nights here and enjoyed our stay the room was very comfortable the hotel is close to excellent shopping and restaurants and located in a park so very quiet despite the busy neighborhood
To the posters complaining about smoke were smokers and appreciate that we can get a smoking room Most hotels no longer have smoking rooms If the odor of smoke the idea of smoke is so upsetting to you stay in a nonsmoking hotel there is one right next door to the Homewood Suites
The hotel loses a star because of very slow internet access and the breakfasts were uninspired especially when compared to those we got at the Homewood Suites Galleria in Houston

title: Good location good price lowsy staff beware personal belongings
text:
Good things
The location was great Macys Plaza one block from metro station7th Ralphs around the corner buy breaky or lunch to go at a decent price and get pharmacy stuff The area seemed clean and harmless even at my very early arrival on saturday am although my local friends freaked out at the downtown location being dangerous
Walking distance to Staples Center and area good location for concert stay
Photographs seemed true to what I experienced
Several coffee shops around the corner for a decent breaky including a famous one I cant recall that had huge lines on a saturday morning and Dennys were I ended up 
The price was at its lower end so in all a value 
The location is visited by a lot of young europeans probably because of the cool design And a photograph shoot was happening the morning I checked out 
Problems
My fault I left out my fashion jewelry and laptop 
A set of brand stainless steel rings were removed from my luggage they are probably looking really good on whomever is wearing them After a long day of tours I found my laptop bottom screws were all unscrewed so that one of the covers fell off just before I checked out Their problem was probably it was an older laptop and couldnt get anything for spare parts or didnt have enough time to dismantle it
Be sure to placed high up since the lobby is used as a bar and events are held downstairs 
The staff seemed to be distract with visitors at the lobby they were unhelpfull and made themselves scarce 
When I confronted the clerk with my laptop situation she said The only people that have access to your room is the cleaning staff   Duh who else would like a set of rings for free She was surprised unprepared to deal with the situation and clearly wanted me to just dissapear Glad I did this on my way out Because I would of had long faces during the rest of my stay
The cleaning staff seemed just as discontent witht their job as the clerks at the desk
Their was a musty smell from the rug that went away with the AC
I would stay there again storing everything under locks ad of course taking a chance  and extensive use of the security box even on a tight schedule and would not expect service just on the location alone if you need to move around on your own it serves well 
I would be embarassed to recomend just on the belongings issue alone what if a friend got their things meddled with like I was

title: Charming and affordable
text:
I stayed at the Hotel Fig for 5 nights for a conference at the LA Convention Center Its super convenient and only took me 10 minutes or so to walk to my conference The hotel is very charming with old SpanishMoroccan decor Lots of handmade tile wrought iron and heavy drapes The lady that checked us in was very nice I didnt experience any rudeness like other guests whove posted to this site 
We were lucky and got a big corner room We enjoyed our double twin bed room with TV fridge desk and sitting area with a small table and two big chairs I passed by some of the queen bed rooms when the maids were cleaning and they looked really small 8day parking is also very reasonable Also for you Mexican food fans check out the great holeinthewall Mexican place called Fernandos Taco Inn attached to the Car Wash next door It looks like a fast food joint but as a native SoCaler I can vouch that it is cheap tasty authentic Mexican food I couldnt help myselfI ate there 4 times
Its old though so if you want something more modern stay somewhere else If you want a hair dryer ask for one at the front desk Also bring your own alarm clockthere isnt one provided My only major complaint is that the shower did not drain Usually by the time I was finished with my 15 minute shower Id be up to my ankles in water Oh well Still the hotel is a great buy and very convenient for conferences

title: AVOID THIS HOTEL
text:
Got up to turn down the AC in the middle of the night and the rug by the AC was all wet Perhaps drips from the AC but unfortunately it also had a nasty urine odor
They claimed to have free wireless When I called down to say it wasnt working they said yes it hadnt been working for several days DAYS to fix a router Are you kidding me The Santa Cruz fire had just started and we didnt know if our cabin was on fire The restaurant had mediocre food and CLOSED with no room service after 9 PM We just wanted some water No water at the front desk The vending machines were only taking nickels Do you carry around a dollar or two in nickels No place to get change Terrible service TV was very low quality and the advertised free HBO also didnt work I would NEVER stay at this Clarion again It is very disappointing because we have had good experiences at other Clarions Also the area around the hotel is not good  not safe

title: Great RateGreat FoodGreat Location
text: This hotel is great after just arriving or getting ready to leave LA Minutes from the airport and they offer free shuttle service We rent a car from Budget which is literally on the opposite corner of the hotel and return it the night before our flight walk back to the hotel and then take the shuttle to the airport Included in the room rate is a delicious cooked to order breakfast each morning The indoor pool is OK  a little cavelike but it does the job They also have HBO and Cartoon Network  heaven This hotel is clean and a good bargain They are also close to attractions such as the LaBrea tar pits Hollywood Blvd Rodeo Drive and Sunset Ranch great trail rides through the Hollywood Hills Also if youre into snowboardingskiing check out Mt Baldy  about 45 minutes from this hotel My husband and son went snowboarding on our trip in April and were very impressed by the size of the mountain

title: Great hotel will come back
text:
Great hotel great location great rooms Came with friends and will come back with friends spouse or family again 
One of the few hotels we found that had more than one bed in a room Since we were traveling as friends we all wanted our own bed 5 of us had 2 rooms one with 2 twin beds and one with 1 king and 1 twin loft Good layout never felt crowded Lots of mirror space for ladies getting ready Nights were quiet Never heard neighbors hallway noise or outside noise And did I say its 12 a block from Times Square Its a very central location Even if you want to stay away from Times Square its such a central location its easy to get anywhere We used the subway to get around walked a lot and took a few cabs 
The Deli 2 doors to the east is great for good inexpensive meals They have grocery items deli and hot and cold items We ate at least 1 meal a day there or brought it back to our room Our reservations included a free breakfast at the hotel It was a great variety of cereal yogurt breads fruit coffee juice 
We didnt use the pool a pool in NYC but it looked cute 
I recommend to any traveler Single couple friends families Have fun

title: Perfect for my family of 4
text:
We stayed here one night while on a road trip from MD to FL We had to stop in Charlotte to visit and decided to spend our one night here The property is gorgeous we had a one bedroom suite which provided just enough space and privacy for settling our 2 small children after an 8 hour road trip Breakfast the following morning was great and well stocked Free parking is literally right across the street very easy to get to We opted for the valet parking because it was raining and we were dealing with fussy kids 
I would highly recommend this location for anyone traveling to downtown Charlotte Rates were more than reasonable for the quality stay

title: Never again
text:
We travel to NYC yearly and have stayed in 3 other hotels prior to this one I booked 2 rooms at this hotel through my time share We confirmed that one of our rooms would have 2 double beds a couple weeks prior to check in They confirmed that it would but also accidentally cancelled the 2nd room When I went to check in they claimed to have only one room booked for me with 2 double beds My time share still had it as 2 rooms so I know it was the hotels fault I contacted my time share rep who contacted the front desk while I put all my luggage in the one room The time share called me back assuring me it was straight and I was to go pick up my 2nd room keys When I went down to do so the desk clerk looked at me like I was crazy and said they still only had one room booked for me They refused to retrieve the lady that spoke to my time share rep After much frustration and back and forth they straightened it out with the manager in the back whom they refused to retrieve and I was given my 2nd room keys
Then I checked in and as we were settling in we noticed blood on the sheets Im talking obvious substantial blood on the sheets as well as the ceiling I had them change the sheets immediately The toiletries were minimal soap shampoo and conditioner No extras whatsoever No fridge a tiny ice bucket and no free WiFi except in the lobby Although if you depended on the hotel computers in the lobby you were waiting in line because there were only 4 
When I asked to speak to the manager later in the week to discuss some possible comp free WiFi etc to make up for the confusion at check in and the bloodthey brought out a man who knew nothing of my situation barely spoke english and who I suspect was a bell hop since that is the role I saw him in for the rest of the week vs a managerial role He blamed the issue of the room confusion on my time share and refused to offer any comp 
The concierge was not helpful gave little insider tips and barely knew where anything was
On the bright side the location was good for a first time tourist Just a couple blocks from Time Square and 30 Rock The room was clean despite the bloody sheets and housekeeping was pleasant

title: Respite from the real world
text: I was warmly greeted provided time line for traffic to die down and piping hot cup of coffee with lots of cream to add Staff that I met in the hallways were super friendly The room was comfortable clean and had everything I needed to retreat from a hectic life

title: Great location small room
text:
I stayed here recently for a game at Camden Yards The hotel is in a fantastic location for the park as it was only about a 5 minute walk however our room was on the first floor next to the street and the elevator so it was very loud The sidewalk leading from the ballpark was literally outside our window so there was heavy foot traffic for hours before and after the game 
The room itself was decent but small as we only had a single bed There was a microwave which was a plus There is a coffee shop in the lobby that sells bagels and such for morning but a bit on the expensive side
Overall a decent place to stay just ask for a room not on street level

title: Dont stay here
text:
Yuck I would never stay in this hotel again or recommend it to a friend It was billed as a charming B and B type of hotel which really means it is old and run down The carpets were threadbare the furniture was dusty and worn out we had to put a towel on the upholstered chair in our roomit was that stained The floors creaked and the windows leaked cold air it was a terrible experience The TV in our room was placed to the side ot the bed so that you had to sit sideways on the bed to watch it you could not even lay in bed and watch TV There wasnt enough room in the very small bathroom to set your toiletries I was very disapointed I could hear everything in the surrounding rooms The neighborhood is awful I felt unsafe walking to my car There were many beggers asking for money There were not any bellhops to handle the luggage So trying to drag my suitcases across the old streets while fending off panhandlersnot fun 
We were there for business and will stay next to the convention center next time we are in Baltimore At least in that area there are clean restaurants and well lit streets

title: Great place to stay
text: My family and I were traveling and we stayed at the Inn at Longwood We had an excellent experience The people had great hospitality and the restaurant was delicious

title: Great location  helpful staff
text: We stayed at the Jewel for three nights The room design and layout really maximized the space the front desk staff were very helpful  especially in keeping our bags both before and after checking in and out We really enjoyed the chilled water and the coffee in the computer area I had requested a quiet room  and we never heard another guest  even in the hall My only issue would be about the speed of the internet  it was quite slow This hotel was so close to everything  Times Square and Central Park as well as the subway

title: Great Location Nice Room
text: My wife and I just returned from a 4day trip to NYC We chose the Sofitel based on TripAdivsors customer reviews and my previous experience with Sofitel Hotel in France This hotel is in a perfect location to walk to Madison Ave and 5th Ave shopping Times Square Grand Central MET MMA and many excellent restaurants The room was very big for Manhattan and had a modern European feel Although the rates were fairly expensive hey its New York Overall we would definitely stay here again

title: City Club 20
