text:
Almost 5 years ago I gave this place two huge thumbs up I decided to return to see if my experience could be replicated It was not it was exceeded As usual the doorman was ready with both assistance with luggage and advice about things to do I booked late and through a third party site during a very busy time in NY While I was prepared for a broom closet with a bed I was upgraded without request upon arrival Later in my stay I met the manager who seemed genuinely welcoming which seems almost surreal in NY I had to come back to the city the following week and mentioned this to the manager as I was checking out I had checked the 3rd party site but the City Club wasnt showing any availability Not only did the manager secure a room for me but also at an extremely competitive price He also gave me his card I shot him an email the next week to inform him of my arrival time and BOOM Another upgrade this time to the two story suite All I can say is dont die and go to heaven without staying in one of these unique rooms which bring the original crown molding casts into arms reach boast two story windows and a spiral staircase that is ultra hipamazing and would be well worth the standard suite price Let me give 2 more quick asides about this place 1 I was running late when i realized that I had forgotten a toiletry item A call down to the front desk rendered a knock on my door within 2 minutes  this is the advantage of a truly boutique hotel Larger 5 star properties would be hard pressed to match that response time 2 The front desk called to tell me that my driver had arrived Then a few seconds later called back to inform me that it had begun to rain lightly and I should be sure to bring my courtesy umbrella from the room The City Club is still in a great central location with great design and amenities but it continues to shine because of the great service from the staff top to bottom My wife wants to see the Yankees in the playoffs for our Anniversary Anybody wanna guess where well be staying 
Cheers

title: I Have NOT Been Put Out of a Worst Place
text: The outside of the hotel the lobby and the elevators are truly misleading Once you step into the corridors of the hotel the horror begins The doors are hideous Theres old paint over older paint The room was very small the bed minute and the furniture rummaged The towels smelled of burnt popcorn the toilet leaked and the shower looked like something other than water was going to come out I wondered why the television was so loud when turned on then the answer was given when I turned on the ACHEAT unit It was then a judgment call on whether I wanted to be warm by the heat or entertained by the tv If you used the cliche I have been put out of places worst that this this hotel will definitely be the subject of that claim It was the worst place I have stayed in my 33 years of breathing and blinking

title: A Beauty found in 5 minutes
text:
Weve been staying in a lot of hotels world over We like to travel We were looking for a decent hotel in a budget And we had 10 minutes to find one My hubby found this one in 5 
We were in Vegas and the extreme weather on the East Coast cost us and thousands others their flights initenerarys schedules time and money We finally decided that if we could go across to the East Coast only 5 days later we were not going to spend another 4 in Vegas so we decided on a last minute trip to San Fran And everyone who has been there will vouch for this decision
So we had to finalize everything double quick or risk getting stuck when we reached San Fran or hang around the San Fran airport till and if we got something decent in our budget There were too many variables and too little time and even less money after the weather tossed all plans up
So we accessed trip advisor at McClarrens and looked for the best rated in value for money propositions after fixing a budget of 50 bucks a day My hubby saw the Opal the review and the price decided to go up by 10 bucks more a day and booked it
And it was beautiful
The service at the reception and in the rooms was courteous and thoughtful and the 3 or 4 people rotating at the front desk all looked like old and experienced hands which at times may come at the expense of courtesy 
They seemed to be quite well versed with international travellers and their needs compared to those in Miami and I was pleasantly surprised when they obtained the Jet and Austrian airways numbers for me off a pad kept for ready reference on the side
The breakfast was a basic fare but the room and location was brilliant Amenities were pretty basic but way more than what we expected considering what we were ready to pay at that time
All in all we got really lucky with this one The location price look and feel and the service were worth quite a bit more than we paid And we had just come in from Circus Circus in Vegas so it felt even better

title: Soso hotel in a great location
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights while visiting SeaWorld Great location and easy access to the freeway We stayed ina kids suite and the boys loved their bunk beds and separate room The other room for adults was cramped with furniture the wardrobe takes a lot of space and doesnt hold much but there was no closet and tended to be dark the kids room has the window Breakfast was crowded but fine except for our last day At the waffle line three waffle makers two women were making waffles for their entire families at least 4 or 5 apiece and I stood in line for at least 20 minutes Maybe the hotel could suggest folks make 2 waffles during peak periods Anyway aside from those inconsiderate ladies folks were generally nice Front desk staff was supremely unhelpful though I asked where the closest gas station was and the staff couldnt tell me Compared to another hotel we stayed at in Carlsbad during this trip it was clear that these staff members didnt give a hoot about helping us out or making sure we had a good experience Next time I think well stay in Carlsbad and just drive a little farther
We stayed during ComicCon so hotel was crowded
Also found it frustrating that hotel charged by the minute to use their business center computers or printers We needed to print out boarding passes for our flight home We already paid for the room and for parking Adding this cost on just seemed punitive Also had wifi trouble like another guest mentioned but I called the 800 number for help and was able to resolve

title: Great location good value
text:
Stayed there for three nights and it was fine
Positives
 Location location location
 Reasonable rates for the area especially for a suite
 Very roomy
 Very clean room
 Helpfulfriendly front desk
Negatives
 Kitchen and bathroom somewhat dated
Will stay there again

title: Ignore all the other reviews
text: I just spent two nights in this hotel and was terrified before arriving and desperately tried but failedto book other accomodations after reading reviews on this site Needless to say I asked to see the suite we booked before presenting our credit card The friendly desk clerk obliged with no problem The rooms were small as advertised but clean The bathroom was miniscule but adequate and spotlessly clean The beds were extremely comfortable and the pillows were of high quality There was no sign of any bugs either cockroaches or bedbugs Our rooms were freshly painted and there was no sight of peeling paint anywhere I slept like a baby with the window open The second night I asked the desk for another blanket and it was on my bed upon my return The neighborhood is quiet and safe The subway is two short blocks away and cabs were easily caught on West End Avenue a block away If your plan is to find inexpensive accomodations and are travelling with a friend or with children the suite at 109night is unbeatable The two rooms connected by the bath gave us privacy we could have never had in a standard double room I will stay here again

title: Possibly the worst hotel Ive ever stayed in
text:
Was put up here by American Airlines after my flight was cancelled There is not enough space to describe how bad this place is I will sum it up by saying it Smells is Dirty the food is Awful The sheets are so bad that they light up the room at night with static electricity  There are no curtains that close and this is after I asked to change rooms to a better one
I would never stay in this place again next time if there is no choice of Hotel left I will sleep on the floor at OHare

title: Pleasantly surprised by the good service and clean room
text: For our 40th wedding aniversary we decided to spend the weekend in DC with our bicycles I had called earlier to clarify the parking situation and was informed of the 28 fee per 24 hours but also the possibility of parking on the street for free I asked the likelyhood of finding a spaceand was told it was good if we arrived early Saturday morning The doorman Larry came out and assisted us with pulling into the garage entrance and removing the bicycles from the roof He not only helped get our cycles into the hotel but secured us a parking spot in the front of the hotel Since a room was not ready they also allowed us to change our clothes in the restrooms The room was very clean and comfortable

title: Fantastic stay
text: Clean clean clean great price for NYC and the friendliest staff

title: Loved it
text: We stayed here for three nights on Business This hotel is wonderful and the staff is outstanding

title: Great location
text:
The hotel itself is clean and very busy It is very busy and always hustling When they say conference center they sure mean it It isnt a hotel with any personal touches 
The rooms were very comfortable and clean For a person who is a germaphobe I was comfortable there that says a lot The beds were really comfy The hotel wasfull as they said at the front desk so housekeeping seemed to be backed up Our room wasnt cleaned until midlate afternoon I didnt love returning in the afternoon to shower and find the towels from the morning still on the flooroh well
If you have a room facing Camden Yard I have heard you can turn on a radio and watch the game while listening to it  Unfortunately there was no game the night we were there

title: Great stay at the WJ would return
text:
After reading lots of reviews we were quite concerned that our stay would not be good however with one or two minor exceptions we had a great stay here
Reception staff are fantastic cant do enough for you Had problem with hissing from radiator on checkin to our room fixed within the hour
Rooms are very small but quite stylish and clean Good quality bath and bed linen Stairwells and corridors very dingy and dark in need of a lick of paint
Location is just fantastic 5 mins walk to Times Square across street for subway station Bar at end of street House of Brews very good lovely food and great atmosphere We went to two Ice Hockey games during our stay Rangers at MSG and Islanders at Nassau Coliseum on Long Island both had fantastic atmosphere and great crowd our longest road trip to date

title: Wonderful Remodel  Bathroom Configuration is Odd
text: Hotel is only five minutes from LAX but one can not hear the airport noise day or night Valet parking is 20night with inout privilages while selfpark is 17  might as well pay the extra 3 for the convenience The hotel has shuttle service to LAX and the Marriott every 15 minutes which is very convenient This hotel has had a complete renovation unlike some Courtyards which have only remodeled the lobby The lobby is the Bistro concept which Courtyard is rolling out and is standard fare We walked to the Marriott which has three restaurants on site and took the free shuttle back after dinner  very convenient and better options if looking for a proper sitdown dinner The floors looks beautiful and the newly remoded rooms are spacious  however and this is the only reason I did not rate this hotel as excellent the bathroom sink is not enclosed and is right next to the closest in the main living part of the room It is very strange configuration is unsanitary for one person but is just gross for two people or more in a room  There is a total lack of privacy with this concept and I really dont understand what was on the minds of the designers with this I understand that this hotel caters to onenight only business travel which usually indicates one person in the room I would not feel comfortable AT ALL traveling with my husband with this concept  I need a bit more privacy than this room afforded As long as people are aware of this issue upfront and are OK with it this is a great hotel for an overnight near LAX For a couple or family not so much

title: Highs and Lows
text:
The bed was wonderful as it is in other Westin Hotels Location is great as it is linked to the Copley Place mall and is located in the heart of Back Bay 
For some reason though housekeeping did not do a great job of cleaning our room and when we came back from a days meeting the room did not look cleaned at all though the sheets and towels were changed
Unfortunately there was a fire a few blocks from the hotel on our last night there and we were not allowed to go back to the hotel in the evening for fear of toxic fumes And although the staff worked their best to keep guests comfortable the hotel was not ready for such emergencies so there were no lights in the rooms the hotel ran out of flashlights as well only one elevator was working and we had to contend with cold showers in the winter
Hopefully the emergency situation has taught the Westin a lesson in running a hotel during and emergency

title: great 4night stay
text: walking distance to a lot of key places  time square rockefeller broadway 5th ave shopping subway etc the room is big and clean love the bathroom friendly and helpful staff if we could afford it next time we will come back unfortunately we can be members at this time

title: Good experiene
text: our stay was as planned nice Only problem was that the 4th floor ice machine was broken so a few times I had to go up or down a floor to get fresh ice other than that nice place Breakfast was a deff PLUS my two yr old loved everything they offered i give my stay 5 stars

title: Not good for 3 ina room
text: The hotel itself was very clean and friendly staff helped to make our stay enjoyable I had booked a room for 3 people not near the evlevator we arrived to find our room next to the elevator and only 2 beds This was rectified by allocating another room for us but it was not big enough to have the cot bed out until the other 2 people had finished in the bathroom each night This was very inconvenient The restaurant did not cater for vegetarians during our stay there either

title: Convenience is Not Enough
text:
After a long day of flying we were greeted at the front desk with annoyance that we had interrupted the conversation As the adage says you only get one chance to make a first impression
As we were reluctantly checked in another customer came up and asked about the rate for the evening When he was told a rack rate 25 cheaper than our reservation rate I asked if I could have that rate instead again with reluctance the clerk agreed Geez
If you are a HHONORS Diamond you get the cold items only on the breakfast buffet and a completely uninspired and loud room Guess they get so many folks as a captive audience they dont actually have to TRY to please you
The ONLY reason I would stay here again is if I were stranded and there were no options off airport 
Convenient Sure but then again so are the dozens of hotels surrounding the airport that have shuttle busses  even though I am a HHONORS Diamond
Never again

title: didnt live up to Park Hyatt brand or expectations
text:
leaving aside the odd layout of the rooms my husband bumped into walls several times and the hotel itself try the walk to the health club the most confusing aspect was the service while staff were friendly quite frankly their communication skills were poor had two bad check in experiences that set the tone for the visit check in check out getting a cab all the basics of a hotel stay with exception of room service staff who were lovely and delivered on time were awkward and unpolished
there must be better luxury hotels in washington in fact there appear to be two within two blocks

title: Lovely room but not 5 star service all around
text:
We booked this stay last minute and thus paid a pretty penny for our executive 1 bedroom with a fireplace I booked the Fireplace Package as that seems like a nice option My spouse checked in before me and when I called to ask him about the room he said it is nice but had no fireplace I then called the front desk on my way there and a very helpful front desk staff moved our room right away to one of the suites with a fireplace This made me happy although I had wished they had not made the initial mistake 
When I arrived at the hotel and pulled up in front no one came over to help me with my bags or to move my car so I pulled out my own bags and moved toward the door and finally the bell hop came and gave me a claim ticket but did not ask to help me with my things I do have to say I expect a bit more service at this caliber hotel 
When I arrived we had a fire in the fireplace and I found the room very clean the carpet comment from a previous reviewer is on target as they did seem a bit worn The furniture was nice and the bed very comfortable I do wish there was a fan in the bathroom as the mirror quite fogged up after my shower Yes as another reviewer noted the drain could not handle the lovely shower head as it did back up a bit We were only there one night so I cannot speak to housekeeping but they did have nice robes towels and toiletries
The next morning on my way to the Cafe for breakfast I dropped my valet tag with someone from the front desk I told him I was grabbing a bite to eat and would be done in less than 30 mins He told me my car would be out front waiting for me This was busy but not overly hectic Friday morning so when I got outside and found out that there was no car and no knowledge of getting my request 30 mins earlier I was not impressed with the staffs ability to followthrough I ended having to wait another 10 mins to get my car and when the valet showed up with it he was very apologetic but also did not offer to help with my bags he only did so after I asked if he could grab them off the luggage carrier 
Overall I think lovely accommodations with sometimes spotty service staff

title: Elegant urban refuge with friendly staff
text: Located in the heart of downtown Seattle right across the street from the stunning Seattle Public Library designed by Rem Koolhaas the Hotel Monaco is a friendly and extremely attractive urban refuge for the busy visitor I found the reception staff friendly and highly responsive and my room was a joy  modern welldesigned immaculate and countryquiet Some hotels I tolerate others I delight in This one definitely falls in the latter category I highly recommend it

title: Loved it
text: I stayed on my own in this hotel and felt totally safe The surrounding area is great for food etc and easy to get to the subway Shared bathroom wasnt a problem  always clean and didnt have to wait around to get in The room was very small and basic but clean If you just want a base in a nice area this is perfect Ive spent more for less This is really good value for money

title: Great Room
text: The room was awesome Very tastefully decorated Only stayed for one night and was perfect location to walk to Coors Field Only drawback was the price of parking I was under the impression that parking was includedif so I had no proof of that Parking attendant wouldnt let me exit until I paid 13

title: Great Location average rooms
text: I stayed in this hotel to attend a conference The venue was great right on the Riverwalk and just a block over from a shopping mall In fact I rented a car thinking Id leave to explore the city a bit but there was so much within walking distance it never left the garage The hotel itself is pretty standard  nothing spectacular I did like the 24hour coffee bar and newsstand The inhouse restaurant was dreadful  food service everything They had a gym facility however that was really good  each machine had its own TV there were fresh towels and sanitized headphones and a full weight room There was also an outdoor lap pool which looked nice but I did not use it The rooms were decidedly average and I got a lot of noise from the neighbors but they were otherwise comfortable I have a CD of rain sounds that I use as white noise so the music coming from elsewhere wasnt too bothersome Aside from the hotel restaurant the place was pretty good

title: Great hotel
text:
We have stayed in this hotel for three nights in the beginning of June The hotel is huge and amazing The lobby is very grand and spacious staff is very friendly The rooms are nice and clean and about average size and apparently well insolated There was a large wedding party sleeping across the hall and we didnt hear a thing  We were exhausted after the flight but still 
I have only eaten in the Marquee bar so I can only comment on that but it was great Very tasty and reasonably priced For breakfast I recommend Open city across the street You can sit outside or in and they have a great breakfast selection catering to both american and european tastes And you can choose healthier options like fruit or tomatoes instead of hashbrowns I have not tried the breakfast in the hotel
Absolute highlight of the hotel is the Pool Its gorgeous You feel like youre in a resort Because it is a rather expensive hotel we had een good deal of about 500 dollars for three nights through expedia but the normal rate is more than double the pool is not crowded with people who hog all the chairs And if you put up a little flag next to your chair the waiter will come and help you how cool is that
As for the location in the surrounding area there is the zoo a supermarket the woodley park metro stop and several places to eat including aforementioned Open City and McDonalds The National Mall is about 10 min Metro ride away so perfectly acceptable 
The next stop 2 min away is Dupont Circle which has a lot of nice places to eat 
Dont forget to sign up for the loyalty program because you get complimentary wifi and the morning paper for free

title: Cant wait to go back
text: This is a unique hotel experience as it is so spread out on its own island I Loved every minute of it The spa is fabulous ask for Desiree for a therapeutic massage that will change your life I was there for business the hotel convention staff led by Rebecca were top notch along with Swank Audios team led by Jackie everyone was excellent at what they did as well as so very nice and helpful I want to return with my family as I could see all of the fun family activities to do I asked the front desk at check in for a remote spot and wow did they accommodate I felt like I had my own island apartment cant wait to go back

title: Nice Stay Clean Hotel
text: I like Homewood Suites in general and this was one of the nicer properties I have stayed in The hotel and rooms were very clean quiet and spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable This hotel was great for a night and would be very nice for a prolonged stay

title: Joi de Vivre should be ashamed of themselves
text:
This place looked a little funky from the photos online but we assumed that because it was part of the Joi de Vivre chain that we were safe Boy were we wrong I have no problem with kitch or bright colors etc but expect at least CLEANLINESS in any hotel 
We checked in with our young baby only to find that the crib we requested was brokenit got worse when the replacement crib arrived covered in stains and we found long black hairs all over the dilapidated bathroom The couch was also stained and the queen size bed as advertised was a saggy Fullsized that my husband and I could not fit in to After an 8hour car ride to get there and check in we quickly scrambled to find another hotel for our weekend stay VERY disappointed
The one upside They were very nice when we said we wanted to check out and did not charge us anything for our trouble

title: Beautiful but watch out for hidden costs
text: Clean and Pleasant with friendly staff The low cost headline price was attractive but expensive breakfasts and parking bumped up the cost a lot

title: Another great W Hotel but so expensive
text: This a great W Hotel in a fabulous location on Park Avenue But at over 700 a night with internet 20 a day on top its difficult to be upbeat Nice rooms modern as is the W way and very helpful trendy staff I was staying on a business trip so the bill wasnt painful personally but I cant say that it is worth that price Shame really otherwise it has everything going for it

title: One of the better hotels I have stayed in
text:
I stayed in the hotel for 3 days and unfortunately landed there on the weekend of the Memorial Holiday which meant that we were unable to sample the restuarant as it was closed 
We had no problems with the staff
Our room was lovely but our bathroom was very much on the small size There was no way you were getting two people in there at the same time and we are not big people
Apart from that I would recommend this hotel in the future

title: Good Older hotel with decent restaurant
text:
Spent 2 nights recently Comfortable Rooms are somewhat tired but good value for rate I paid 2 really good features Starbucks coffee wellmade in the coffee bar in lobby and quite good food for dinner in dining room  I had grilled fish that was tasty and not overcooked
I found the front desk staff to not be properly energized in responding to guests However all other staff were gracious and responsive Shuttle to airport runs every 20 mins

title: Friendly an welcoming service
text:
A week in the Sheraton was pleasure they could not do enough for me from providing a courtesy coach calling cabs and giving travel directions they were really helpful The guys at reception were always friendly and welcoming as were the bar staff The food choice in the bar was limited but was very good
Rooms were excellent and having use of the executive lounge is well worth the extra
Ill definitely be back here next time Im in Houston

title: Despite a few problems very good place
text:
Just finished a twonight award stay at the Intercontinental Times Square Judging by the clientele Id say its more touristoriented than businessoriented But as someone who fell into the latter category it was ok
On balance in fact I liked it a lot Rooms are fine and quietnot huge but decent size Excellent and friendly staff including reservations front desk concierge etc Goodsized flat screen tv As someone who likes and needs caffeine to get going first thing in the morning the quality of the machine Netspresso and coffee is a level above many other hotels 
Ive noticed a few complaints about street noise on lower floors Upgraded to an upper floor room I had not problem with this at all
There were a few glitches to report however
1 The wireless internet for my laptop didnt connect both days which in turn meant the hotel passed my on to an offsite service provider which has a rather complicated process for making the connection In other words 15 minutes both days for something most other hotels provide without a problem
2 Even once connected with supposedly higher speed premium service the connection was kind of slow
3 One morning I did not get the wakeup call I requested I always set an alarm as a backup but this could have been a real problem otherwise
4 That aforementioned coffee machine is not strictly intuitive for someone who had trouble functioning until he gets his coffeethe water compartment didnt open automatically I suspect most folks could sort it out more easily than I did though
5 The tv was a bit glitchy one of the times I used it
Having said all this the good outweighed the bad so Id give the hotel another shot If the same problems cropped up though that shot would be my last one

title: hair in the tub and sand on the bed
text: from the directions they had given us i could not find it for a while  it was off of the main road hidden in a dark spot right behind two strip clubs while we were walking up the stairs to our room there was a homeless man digging in the garbage can and a couple other people sleeping next to it the people in the office had no idea what they were taking about and actually couldnt even speak english well enough for me to understand them i forgot my phone charger in the room and got all the way back to phoenix az and called them and there words were  ummmm uh can you describe the charger um uh well the maids might know where it is can you maybe call tomorrow its just not a very SAFE place and actually kind of scary at night i would NOT reccomend this to AnyONE unless you like sand in your bed when you lay in t and little curly hairs in the bath tub THANKS  ASHLEY

title: Nice Hotel but not for travellers
text: We selected this hotel for its history and were very impressed with the pictures and agree with the other review about the pictures etc The room was clean service was good but our view was of the air conditioning systems for the hotel which was very disappointing that view became a common theme throughout our stay in the US I would not recommend this place for travellerstourists who do not have a car Public transport is not as easy or available as you think We waited over 15 hours for a bus to Warners Studio that he hotel guide advised would be along every 20 minutes The train was close however did not feel that safe using it

title: Location and Price
text: We came in for the weekend and return to the Belvedere This was my second stay at the hotel Price and location are the two main reasons for returning both cant be beaten Our room was on the 16th floor The remodeling was still continuing below the 16th floor Because of this the room still needed to be updated The room had a 1980ish feel to it Nevertheless the room was big enough by NYC standards and clean The front desk clerk was outstanding We came to the hotel to drop off ours bags at 10am and we were able to check in earlyvery nice I would definitely return If you thinking about staying here I would recommend it Just keep in mind hotels in New York City are notoriously small and if you are looking for a big room pay and stay in a suite

title: For Real
text: Found this place on choicehotelscom and was pleasantly surprised at what I saw Imagine our surprise when we got there and it was just as nice The lobby was very warm though maybe the ac wasnt working no bother we checked in and was helped by the front desk in a very friendly manner I think the girls name was Kelly The building was an old warehouse that was transformed into the hotel Clean clean clean There was a welcome letter from the manager on the table in our room with a complimentary water bottle and 2 small bags of chips The ac in the room worked great Breakfast wasnt just continental it was hot and abundant Unfortunately the 2 days that we went the same hot food was served sausage and eggs Would have liked to have seen potatoes or bacon The area was small but very clean and there was someone who was constantly filling up the food There are some chairs and tables outside of the building along with a bbq grill The best part of the hotel would be the location of the Circulator bus Right outside and FREE Did not like the fact that parking was not included At 15night we left our car there when we arrived because there werent as many parking spots to accomodate the amount of rooms Not to mention no security in the lot either Would defintely stay here again if in the area

title: Great location
text:
Hotels in Manhattan are extremely expensive When you accept this  Hotel 31 is among the best deals
The location is the best part of a stay at Hotel 31 You can walk to a lot of the must see attractions and some of the best shopping The subway is nearby which connects you to the rest of the city in a fast and cheap way
The neighbourhood is not among the must see attractions but it provides several good restarants at fair prices and some pretty cool bars as well We recommend the Les Halles at Park Av between 28th and 29th
Our room was rather small and dark However it was clean and everything was working The bed was comfortable
Breakfast is not included or available at the hotel However Guy and Gallard around the corner is nice and gives a large selection at fair prices 
The staff was friendly eg arranged transportation to the airport and helped out with our online check in 24 hours before departure
All in all the Hotel 31 was a good experience and contribution to a great vacation in NYC

title: Continuing Education and MORE
text: Went on Wednesday and stayed til Sunday noon and had the time of our lives I had no idea of how great the city of Indy was and is until this visit though my daughter had told me it was a rocking site Summer in Indy is great fun tho warm Our room was a corner room on the 9th floor overlooking the City and Veterans ball fieldAs my wife got smarter I visited the City and enjoyed especially the Indianapolis Art Museum the Eiteljorg and the Childrens Museumswhen it was hot during the day At night we ate out at superb sites and went to the Indians feeder for Cleveland game Goodclean fun at every turn

title: Loud but great
text:
This is my second time here at the W the staff are very friendly The service is excellent and the room is very comfortable and stylish as I have come to love about the W chain My only issue is that its not the quietest place to stay It feels like single pane glass versus double pane Sirens are easy to hear as are whistles etc outside 
Having said that the room really is great

title: Great hotel quiet location away from the chaos
text:
If you want a nice hotel with great amenities in a quiet location of NYC stay here You get a refrigerator free wifi continental breakfast and warm cookies Near the South Street seaport  very quiet location  dont hear the subway or honking of horns 
Its about a 15 minute walk to the nearest subway stops  but multiple stations on various lines so easy to walk to About 12 mile from Chinatown and great restaurants Great view of the Brooklyn Bridge
One of the favorite hotels in NYC  away from the chaos that you find in most areas in NYC
If this is your first trip to NYC it maybe too far from a subway stop  but I highly recommend this hotel and location Friendly staff too

title: Great place and SOOO convenient
text: I canot believe how easy the Westin makes it to travel  we arrived at the front and was immediately greeted by somewhere to valet the car In the morning all we had to do was take the elevator downstairs and walk directly to the ticket area for Delta Upon arriving back we gave the valet our claim ticket and within 10minutes out car was waiting for us at the curb AMAZING

title: Typical Decent Marriott Property
text:
This is a big hotel I found out how big when I was assigned my room I was in the Horsehead Tower thats not the exact name but I dont remember it It DOES start with H To get there you had to go up one level on the escalator walk down the hall and across a skybridge over 13th Street into the Convention Center Once there the Convention Center was gated off but there was an opening to another corridor You walk down that corridor to an elevator which you take to the 4th and higher floors You then walk down another hall to your room
Once inside the room was a large box with a very high ceiling The furnishings seemed a bit sparse for the size of the room It WAS comfortable Ill admit Its just that the walk was so darned long in and out
There was a large convention going on which made lines for all the restaurants and bars Better to take your chances with some of the fine restaurants a block or two away
Staff was friendly and helpful I stayed here several years ago in the main building and enjoyed it more without the long hike
I did stay for a corporate rate of 136 so THAT was a good value for downtown Philly

title: Why stay here
text: Picture a grandiose apartment complex on a large golf course in the middle of a suburb sourrounded by many other apartment complexes That is this resort Why does anyone stay here Perhaps it is the golf course and the spa which I did not try It cannot be the rooms  mine had cheap western decor and halfchewed cherios and chips on the floor It is not the service which was mostly indifferent For instance when I checked out 4 hours after breakfast and asked to have breakfast on the bill the front desk clerk said rudely well youll just have to wait until you get your credit card bill It certainly is not the grounds which have mroe in common with suburban San Antonio than the Texas Hill Country You would do better choosing a hotel with character in San Antonio or going to the real Hill Country far outside the city This place is just depressing

title: FAB FAB FAB  Must stay here
text:
I can say nothing but positive things to say about this hotel
The reception staff and so helpful really go out of their way to help especially the indian chap sorry Ive forgotten your name 
The rooms are lovely and spacious clean and the quiet
Breakfast is lovely  great to sit outside by the pool and have breakfast reading your comp newspaper

title: Well Worth It
text: We stayed at this hotel because it was close to a conference we were attending and it had received high marks on TripAdvisor My only complaint was that it was tricky to pick the right exit from the Expressway Other than that the staff was very friendly the room was clean and quiet and we enjoyed the pool and fitness center Breakfast was perfectly adequate with sufficient choices from waffles to fruit Well stay here again when were in the area

title: Excellent Hotel great staff valet was reasonable and helpful
text: Stayed here July 22 and 23 with my wife and children It was nice and the room was nice and clean with a balcony overlooking Riverwalk mini fridge and coffee maker TV was flatscreen and love seat had fold out bed as well Nice bistrobar in hotel and direct Riverwalk access We checked out and they allowed us to leave our cars and luggage there in lockup for an additional 3 hours while we took our kids on the Riverwalk barge tour and ate Very nice staff and helpful with all our needs

title: Enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree
text: I recently stayed 4 nights at the Doubletree Guest Suites and it was just wonderful The staff were all very helpful The suite was very nice and the bed oh so comfortable Of course the hot chocolate chip cookie at checkin was thouroughly enjoyed I also appreciated the close proximaty to the Southcenter Mall and all the great restaurants there Thanks for the great stay

title: Amazing deal in NYC Walk back into the days of TITANIC
text:
I found that if you find a cheaper rate anywhere on the internet this hotel will match it and give you another 10 off the room per night The hotel is very elegant and classical inside The rooms are a little small but the overall room is very nice and more importantly th bed is very comfortableNot too hard The hotel had alot of history and fun to read about Ive stayed in some of the most expensive hotels in the city but for the price and location I cant complain I found some people were paying 39900 a night for the samew room we where paying 16400 I am returning next week and paying 14500 a night for 5 nights You may not always be able to get this good a deal but I promise if you surf the internet enough for the best price you will come out ahead compared to what other hotels are charging and not half as nice I have only one complaint about the hotel
Service We had to wait in a line for check in but this was a problem each day we walked by at 3pmI suggest showing up a little later for check in if you can And when our cab pulled up the bellman didnt offer to help with our bags I was glad we didnt have too much It saved us the tip If you want to spend over 50000 a night in the city the best place for me is The NY Palace Hands down But if you want a nice place but not the price tag then I strongly urge you to try The Roosevelt The location is close to everything and beautifully decorated I felt like i had walked back in time Ive stayed at THE PALACE many times and love it but its just got too expensive in our economic crunch right now
I am happy to return to The Roosevelt again and again as long as I can keep the rate where it is Im not too concerned with service when i have my husband with me to carry the bagsLOL Im sure I will be able to get a bellman when I return alone next week

title: Comfortable charming hideaway
text: I liked the old world style charm of the hotel with friendly helpful staff It is well located only a few blocks from many attractions such as Empire State and easy walk to times square I was originally a bit dubious when we were offered accommodation at the hotel at quite a reasonable rate as part of a Qantas package but I was glad to be proved wrong The hotel and room were generally quiet with my only minor complaint being the air conditioner seemed a bit noisy at times but I was glad to have it I have already recommended it to people at work who are looking at going to New York

title: Not sure what to think
text: When we arrived we loved the hotel We loved all the space in our room The people where nice and the free shuttle took us to the Red Wings Game Great location The next morning we went to the continental breakfast There was cereal but no milk There was picked over muffins There was very very black bananas that I would throw out at home There were mostly empty juice containers There were danishes wrapped in plastic like you would get at a truck stop The coffee was good I went to the desk and they said they would let someone know A very nice Bellman came and refilled everything but said that he hadnt been asked to My biggest concern here is that the next day someone tried to spend a lot of money on my credit card in Canada Of course I do not know what happened We had not been to Canada but it is probably about a mile from the hotel It was the only hotel we stayed at and I would probably have to think twice before going back

title: Very good location for this eclectic hotel
text: Stayed in Sept 2011 after checking reviews of many hotels in San Francisco before booking The Mosser The hotel lived up to all the hype its exterior design being typical of San Fran architecture and the reception and communal areas reflecting its art deco styling The welcome at checkin was warm and welcoming and the room was as per the trip advisor and hotels own description A lack of air conditioning in the room meant that it was very hot especially at nighttime so if I were to return Id definitely upgrade to a room with aircon Overall very good value and being just off Market Street the location was spoton Would definitely recommend this hotel for a comfortable and relaxing time in San Fran

title: Know what your expectations are prior to booking
text:
We had a wonderful vacation and this was exactly the place we needed knowing what to expect after reading all the mixed reviews If you want a 5 star hotel this is not the place for you It is older and this is evident by the furniture and the carpet in the rooms but our room was very clean and the grounds were spectacular The room reminded me of beach front condos we have rented and have also enjoyed We stayed in a bayside studio and it was clean and comfortable It was very quiet I think that is also dependent on your neighbors no matter where you stay We loved being able to step out of our room with our daughter to go play in the sand and watch the beautiful sunsets It also had the convenience of a small kitchen that had a small fridge a microwave and a full sized coffee pot We bought our own drinks and snacks The employees were all very cordial and accommodating The restaurants had great food The barefoot grill had a wonderful atmosphere with a great view on the bay Kids enjoyed feeding the fish and the frequent visits from the seagulls We knew it would be pricey to eat on the grounds The hotel IS overpriced overall The 22 parking fee was no surprise thanks to the other reviewers and when we were checking out other hotels in San Diego most of them had a 20 parking fee We were taken by the hotel tax 
In summary this a great place to get away from it all and be with your family I suggest staying in a studio or bungalow if feasible to get a better room judging from the other reviews Staying on the water is expensive no matter where you stay in San Diego and there is certainly no real value here Being on the water was a priority for us and this place met our expectations

title: Simply the best
text: I only stay at the French Quarters when I come to New York City on business which is several times a year The rate is incredibly reasonable especially considering you are literally a block and a half from being IN Times Square The staff are friendly an helpful housekeeping keeps things very well madeup every day while you are out and the location could not be better You can literally SEE about 20 restaurants from the front door great food within walking distance and Times Square one Avenue away Manager Colin is fantastic as are all the staff members I would not stay anywhere else

title: Gorgeous
text:
What a gorgeous Hotel
Very modern which I loved
The Lobby is beautiful and spacious The High speed elevators are great and not at all scary If you dont fancy them you can always use the normal elevators or the stairs 
The Food is gorgeous Its a great place to meet up with somebody for a meeting or an interview
The staff are very friendly and help with anything you need
The Rooms are GREAT Flat screen Televisions great views of TIMES SQUARE
I highly reccomend this
The BEST hotel I have EVER stayed in

title: Was ok for me but I would not bring my family
text:
I needed a relatively inexpensive place to stay for a night and at about 40 of what other national chain Boston hotels were charging I gave it a try And I probably would stay there again  by myself or if I could get tickets to a Red Sox game for my family I dont think there could be a more convenient hotel for Fenway
But I actually did move a chair in front of the door because there was no secondary security like the flippy bar thing on the door and on a Sunday night when the Red Sox were not playing the hotel seems a little sketchy I am not saying it is But arriving late at night when no one is around seemed it
I think the room was clean There was an old area rug on the floor that again seemed like it may have been chosen because it could hide stains And the furniture  other than the beds which were comfy with good pillows  was not only old but really worn  with lighter areas where the stain had born worn off over the years There were wooden venetian blinds on the windows that could no longer be operated by just moving one center slat  all of the individual slats had to be moved to shut them And they felt like a tictactoe at a beat up kids playground where you try to get it to stay on x but it keeps moving So I dont think I ever really got them closed
And Id probably be accurate if I said the bathroom was a little weirdcreepy It was spotless as the paper strip on the toilet said was sanitized for me But it was uncomfortably large and empty  imagine sitting on a toilet in a warehouse
But like I said for the price I probably would stay there again  Id probably just walk around in the dark in case I didnt get the blinds properly shut

title: Great Location  Service Bad Dwelling
text:
I only stayed for one night while visiting the zoo with my wifes family and it was right down the road from the zoo The park was literally right across the street so that was great too and it was far enough away from the beach and downtown to avoid horrible parking and most undesirable people There were a couple of shoeless hippies wandering around with walking sticks outside the inn in the morning The staff was friendly and brought us an iron and ironing board with a tasty pastry and fruit breakfast in the morning They let us check in a little early as well which was very nice of them
I had the same problem as a previous reviewer the heat was on full blast when we first arrived That wasnt too difficult to take care of though
The buildings seem like very old apartments All the floors creak and I can imagine that anyone staying below us would have heard every step we took on those old floors The paint was peeling the carpet seemed very old It wasnt a bad place just old and probably shouldnt be ranked 3
If you need to be close to the zoo and are only planning on doing the zoo and the museum then this is a fair place If you want to see any of the rest of san diego or socal get something a little nicer

title: The only place I stay in San Diego
text:
I stayed here three times during the month of June family stuff and my husband has been coming here for years What is not to like Great service Comfortable and affordable rooms Hasslefree FREE internet Waffles for breakfast Nice pool Great location to base yourself for pretty much anything in San Diego across the street from the Trolley station 
Small older style charming rooms near the pool or larger suites in the bigger building We will always stay here in future San Diego visits

title: Absolutely fabulous
text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Staybridge Suites Times Square with a friend from the moment we entered the hotel we felt comfortable the guy on reception was so happy and upbeat we immediately felt welcome We arrived Thursday and attended the free evening buffet with drinks you dont usually get that in NY which was great as we had just arrived after that we went to the nearby Duanne Reade for some milk and nibbles Our room was amazing two double beds kitchen area with full size fridgefreezer and everything you could possibly need the bathroom was plenty big enough with a shower in the corner and the water was always hot We always had clean towels and our cups and coffee maker were always cleaned while we were out Breakfast was fine and we always found a table to eat it didnt need to take it to the room although some people chose to do so we found it an opportunity to chat to other guests I had noticed before leaving the UK there were comments about the street the hotel was in as two females on our own we felt very safe and never once felt threatened or uncomfortable the shop selling sexy lingerie and sex toys made us laugh not that we went in just what we saw from the door as we passed and in the window The parole office was just another place no shady characters around that I saw but then I wasnt looking to find anything wrong with the area We didnt find it noisy at all and were on the 12th floor overlooking the Port Authority bus station I would definitely stay here again when visiting New York City as it is centrally placed and one of the most welcoming hotels I have ever stayed in and I have stayed in many hotels around the world AN ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS HOTEL

title: Great place for the money
text: Been here a few times and for the price you cant beat this place Of course its in the city do you do have the L and traffic but you also have FREE parking The rooms are a nice size with large bathrooms Both the cafe and bar are overpriced with lousy service It meets my needs for have an inexpensive place to sleep in Chicago

title: Outstanding Service  Amenities
text: Amazing room huge kitchen living room  balcony with a view of the HOLLYWOOD sign and the walk of fame below Record player in the room with a great selection of LPs Super friendly and very helpful staff Couldnt have asked for more Fantastic value for money Coming back in Feb

title: Great service
text:
Have to say we had a great stay thanks to the great service we got from the staff and a special thanks for George Hotel suite was spacious and provided all the amenities microwave fridge cutlery which worked out great with the staff recommended late night pizza 
The hotel has a roof top lounge which is a nice place to relax and have a drink
Location was quite central to the places we were going and we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go
The only negatives were the decor which could use an update Also the washroom door which did not have a lock saying that it seems the washroom was built to be barrier free and likely was a feature If you have mobility issues this suite would have worked well for you
Overall yeah for the Beacon

title: Great Hotel Great Staff
text: Great hotel good location staff was very friendly Rooms clean and big We could get just about anywhere easily from this site Pool was terrific for the kids Room was comfortable although I thought it had a kitchenette in it  only the very expensive bar I would have preferred a small refrigerator with children I would stay there again

title: Great staff great service great location great price
text:
I was very hesitant to stay at the Aloft in Dallas because of a lot of negative reviews I took the gamble due to the price and proximity to the convention center
The room was perfect Nothing too fancy just a very comfortable room The ac worked perfect the bathroom yes even the water pressure and temperature was great and I wanted to take the bed home with me
Had free wifi and wired internet a nice desk and nice big hdtv
I had an urgent need to print and fax some documents and the front desk staff was only too happy to help
Only criticisms would be the location of the couch under the tv and the proximity to any eating establishments All restaurants were between 48 blocks away
The fitness room was good and the bar had very good food at a pretty reasonable price
Although I am not much of a fan of Dallas as a location for a conference this place made my stay much more enjoyable

title: Totally RelaxingAlmost
text: Even though our destination was Sea World we stayed at this inn as an alternative to the noisy San Diego hotels RBI reminded me of Palm Springs The grounds were beautiful and so peaceful We had a room in the Fountain building There were at least 12 dozen fountains or so in this area with running water that was very soothing The pools were very nice Restaurant was pretty good I believe it was called the Verandah but not sure My daughter liked the childrens menu I had the buffet one night which was pretty good but could have been a lot better for the price The paella was probably the worst Ive ever eaten with sticky sticky rice and the puff pastery that the swordfish was cooked in was chewy I had to pick it off just to get to the fish My husband had one of the few chicken dishes which he thought was fair Breakfast buffet was good which was included in our room rate otherwise it would have been 5000 for the three of us My only real complaint about this hotel is that the beds were as hard as a rock I had the hardest time falling asleep the first night and that was after a few glasses of wine I would hardly call the room that I stayed in a 4 star The decor was a little boring though the bathroom was nice To me it seemed the room needed updatingespecially those beds I would stay at this hotel again only if they got it softer beds and Im usually not that picky BAD BAD BAD BEDS

title: Amazing honeymoon hotel
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon in December We couldnt have wished for a better location or better service We received complimentary champagne and the hotel also informed some of the restaurants that we visited where we also then received complimentary drinks One evening whilst we were out at a show the room was decorated with rose petals and we arrived back to soft music playing Nothing was too much trouble and there was not a single area we could fault
Both my husband and myself had the best nights sleep we have ever had as the bed was super comfortable with a feather pillow top mattressheaven
We would definitely stay again and was well worth the money for a special occassion

title: Get a Room with a Treadmill
text:
I stayed here in June 2012 for 3 nights due to a conference I was attending The hotel was impressive by its shear size with a stately lobby gorgeous grounds hammocks included and a distinguished history inaugural balls have been held there In addition to those features there were 3 highlights for me
1 I had a room with a treadmill  definitely a first I had read about their availability ahead of time so I requested such a room Very cool I had a beautiful large corner room on the first floor in the West Wing and it was extremely quiet and peaceful I imagine the treadmill rooms are on the first floor and at the end of hallways so as not to disturb ones neighbors I used the treadmill twice as well as the Get Fit pack that was provided to me gratis included a yoga mat weights fitness band
2 The fitness center rents bikes for 7hour which is very convenient due to the nearby Rockcreek Park Trail which continues on to the National Mall area I rode down the 2 12mile trail then onto the Lincoln Memorial area during an evening ride It was a glorious ride and a fun cheap way to see the city and get some exercise too The bike rental includes a helmet as well as a bike pouch for personal items as well as a small bike pump and tire repair kit
3 I was able to walk to the National Zoo about 5 long blocks away Seeing the pandas and gorillas are a must The metro is also just a block or so away which is very convenient
Even though the two small elevators in my wing were slow I just used the stairs which didnt bother me since I was on the first floor I had very easy access to the conference rooms which were also in the West Wing below my floor The conference rooms by the way are gorgeous  beautiful moldingdecor and some had incredible frescoes 
The staff was very accommodating and friendly My free morning beverages arrived on time join Omnis free Select Program for those as did anything else I requested
Though it was pricey I would DEFINITELY stay here again The weekend rates are cheaper so if I were paying on my own dime I would make it a long weekend stay

title: Showing its age
text: Although room was large and clean this is a tired hotel in need of some attention and is a good 15 to 20 minute walk away from the city centre

title: Great stay
text: It has been definitely one the best hotels I have stayed in With what most be the most comfortable bed we have slept in The hotel is located in a very convenient area right at the centre but unlike others not near the dodgy central areas The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times The bed was absolutely lovely comfortable like no other and the bathroom also very nice and functional We could rest which is not something we can normally get while traveling Ironically so we normally have to put up with all sorts of noise in many of the hotels we stay in or with horrible pillows ugly sheets etc no matter how pricey the hotels are I highly recommend this hotel

title: Sure its clean and spacious but
text: Yes the location is not great I did not feel okay about walking anywhere from there and seattle is a walking city Price was reasonable for a night stay and the staff at the front desk were friendly Room was large and kitchen was well equipped Bathroom was acceptable All in all feel that it is a good place to stay unless you want to walk somewhere

title: The best place to stay in Seattlehands down
text: University Inn has the best rooms evermedically almost pathologically clean bathroom with a tub that dont allow water all over the floor free spring water bonus Keurig coffee makers recycling shampooconditionerbath gel dipsensers in shower outside balcony with access to fesh air if needed a location that is easy to get to close to great Thai American and Italian cuisine and free and ample parking Only things that were average is the internet wifi is slow and the breakfast has limited items If they only added some fresh fruit to the breakfast it would be absolutely perfect Fitness room is at adjoining hotel which seems to work OK

title: Worst Hotel Ive Ever Stayed In
text:
Where do I even begin
1 We booked a two bed room 3 months ago and when we checked in they sold out of double beds but upgraded us to a king from a queen No going from two beds to one is NOT an upgrade especially when youre a married couple sleeping with two kids
2 Our room was not nice At all Our bathroom had paint peeling off of the walls and rust everywhere The shower curtain did not cover the entire side of the shower so our floor would flood Finally every night we went to sleep our sheets felt damp I dont know why I dont know how but I didnt like it
3 We got back to the hotel one night pretty late and the kids were ready for bed Needless to say our keys would not work and we had to wait for TWENTY MINUTES for someone to let us into our room 
4 Our last night we ate in the hotel I ordered lobster rolls and was served a cheeseburger After sending it back I finally got my lobster rolls 30 minutes later and they were HORRIBLE I have never eaten food that didnt taste like anything in my life it was like chewing on air or something Anyway I had 3 lobster rolls and ate less than half of one and they still tried to charge me 18 for them I told them I wasnt going to pay for something that wasnt good and that I didnt even eat anyway
Terrible service terrible food terrible rooms That is what you will get if you stay at the Roosevelt

title: You get what you pay for
text:
We got a great deal on our 5night stay but we regretted not paying a little more for a better experience elsewhere Our main gripes were the following
 They were way too short staffed on the first couple days and so breakfast was a real mess You had to stand for 15 minutes to get a table they were out of coffee and most of the food We had to go to starbucks to get a real breakfast I mean come on if you cant even provide coffee at breakfast youre failing on the very basics of hospitality
 One reason we had picked this hotel is that parking rates were reasonable 25 However we were charged an extra 5 per day due to our oversized vehicle ford expedition I would have liked to know that beforehand Having said that parking valets were great and fast
 Beds not very comfortable
 Never changed the sheets Id expect that after about 3 days
 Only 3 towels in a 4person room Minor annoyance but annoying
But again it was decent for what we paid and location was pretty good Despite some homeless people in the nearby streets we felt relatively safe during the 15minute walk to Union Square

title: If you want to feel pamperedtry this
text: Over the years I have stayed at the Eliot Suites Hotel many times for medical conferences in Boston It cannot be beat for attention to detail its personal touches the large and elegant newlydecorated suites the courtesy and professionalism of staff the cleanliness and comfort of the beds and its two five star restaurants Clio a formal californiacontinental restaurant and Uno a more casual Japanese bar Gym facilities are available for guests Another important feature for me is its proximity to major conference meeting halls in downtown Boston and shopping on Newberry Street all within pleasant walking distance Additional upgrades greet the traveller with every visit

title: Speachless Business or Family
text: I stay at a hotel almost weekly for business and also on a regular basis for family trips throughout the county The Commonwealth hotel has to be one of my top 3 picks if not my top pick The service is unmatchable the friendly staff is always a pleasure the rooms are beautiful extremely well kept and comfortable The best part is that all this never changes The experience has been the same from my first stay a year ago to my most recent stay last week The times I have taken my family the staff has given extra attention to my 5 and 7 year old by remembering their names throughout the stay I could go on and on but you need to go experience this one of a kind hotel yourself

title: Wonderfully Sensitive Service
text: I arrived at the Hyatt at Olive 8 for the MLA Conference and was horrified to find that I had been given a room with no bathtub As an older woman relaxing in a warm bath is an important stress reliever for me and a normal part of my day When I was young a room with just a shower was called a half bath and you only found them in the cheapest motels But I now have come to understand that modern people dont take baths only showers so this new hotel was built without many tubs I tried to be a good sport but felt unhappy Laurie at the front desk picked up on this and decided to upgrade me to a suite with a spa bath It could not have been more lovely In addition to a generally sensitive and helpful staff this hotel has everything anyone could want Its very clean quiet and beautifully appointed The beds are comfortable the artwork attractive The restaurant is also very good I do plan to return and when I do Ill make sure when I book that my room has a tub

title: Good Value Better Than Expected
text:
Much nicer than expected Pleasant helpful staff nice room and very good value for money overall Reasonable breakfast Short 5 min walk to shopping and Applebees and about 10 minute easy walk to Andrew T Station 
The area is not overly fancy and while walking is fine during the day there are not a lot of people around after hours If you have any concerns a cab ride at time of writing was 6 from downtown a small price for peace of mind 
They also have a shutte to airport for nominal fare
Overall excellent value for money and nice place to stay

title: excellent stay and great service would love to return
text: Christine was very helpful and help made our stay even better

title: Stay elsewhere
text: Staff is pleasant but theres where it ends Dead bolt wouldnt lock on door coffee maker had not been emptied from previous guest bedside lamps would not light with new bulbs and no maintenance people in the evening

title: Fabulous Hotel in an Excellent Location
text: Stayed here in June It was the third and final stop on our honeymoon From the moment we arrived we were treated very well We were upgraded to a suite without even asking and were greeted to a champagne reception with fresh fruit when we got to our room We ate in the bar that night as it was late when we arrived It was really busy but service was good Food is good and hearty pub grub Little on the expensive side but portions are huge Potato skins with guiness porterhouse cheese are fab Breakfast wasnt included but there are many places to eat within walking distance Grand Central station is just a two min walk away so its in a great location We walked to Times Square in 15 mins Staff are really friendly and helpful Bed and pillows were so comfortable I would definately stay here again

title: first timers to nyc
text: stayed for a week from memorial weekend great location just 2 min walk to time square no problem with room on 23rd floor looking at hudson river checkin was quick and the guy cheking us in was very helpfullplus the cleaners took away shopping bags every day and did a good jobjust a block up from hotel on 52 street a good thai restaurant overall we had no complaints about this hotel as some people complain about anything if we come back to new york we will certainly stay here again

title: We really love the Inn at Penn
text: This is our third stay at the Inn at Penn and we love it here Our daughter was married here two years ago and they did a wonderful job with the wedding and reception Since then weve stayed here when visiting her most recently in July Their newly remodeled rooms are just fantastic They are so clean comfortable and quiet Everyone here is very helpful I used the exercise room and it has great equipment and is spotless If you have any reason to stay in the University City area this is the place to be

title: Stinky and worn out
text:
Sofitel  Los Angeles was our second stop during our 3 week vacation in the West coast Coming from a Four Seasons hotel it was a definite downgrade Our expectations werent too high given the fact that were not spending that much on our stay in this hotel however given this is still a four star hotel and ranked 11 for LA on Trip Advisor we thought it shouldnt be too bad
Bell Boys
As soon as I stepped out of the cab I overheard the bell boy complaining to his fellow worker man these bags are heavy Well I dragged them all by myself through 3 different airports and Im a size 6 woman
Lobby  Front Desk
I wandered around the lobby while my husband was checking us in The tables had finger prints all over them and the black supposedly cool surfaces didnt look that clean The flowers werent fresh and the carpets were too worn out Before giving us the room keys the front desk lady asked someone to go do a final check on the room Why would they do that in front of the guests Arent they supposed to have the room ready well before the guests are about to check in This makes it seem like the housekeeping doesnt always do their jobs thoroughly and that someone has to check after their work
Room  hallways
When the elevator opened its doors to the floor our room is in I smelled something was off When I got into the room I thought this is definitely some really strong detergent trying to cover a very unpleasant smell like an old carpet that has been puked on and cleaned way too many times To my horror when I took off my shoes I stepped on a wet spot of the carpet I hate dark full carpets in hotel rooms in the first place only God knows what sorts of germs guests leave in them let alone one thats wet in patches I thought theres no way I was gonna be able to stay in that room too much longer so we went straight back to the front desk and requested another room telling them that the reason was because it smelled The front desk was very apologetic kind and helpful and didnt hesitate to give us another room right away We took the key to try out the other room which was in a lower floor but slightly larger The smell wasnt that bad its at least something you might get used to if you stayed for long enough
Bathroom
The shower didnt drain very well I had to get off after 15 minutes or else the water wouldve overflown I reported this the next morning and it was fixed during the day while we were out All toiletries I expected were available including nailfilers which not many hotels Ive been to provide
Bed
The bed didnt look too welcoming The sheets were yellowish and didnt have that feel of crisp new white sheets that I so look forward to in hotels However I did sleep throughout the night so nothing about the bed bothered me during my sleep
Breakfast
The breakfast was included in our stay which I think was well worth it It was a menu breakfast instead of a buffet but you could order anything you wanted for 50person Anything beyond that would be charged However we ate there comfortably for 3 mornings and it never exceeded 50 The breakfast staff of the restaurant were friendly and the service was fast I loved the food too everything was fresh and good quality
Concierge
The concierge didnt really know to suggest things to do to our liking I asked what was there to do in LA besides shopping it was still too early for nightlife he pointed out a few museums but that was it When we asked where the best spot would be to take a good picture of the Hollywood sign he showed a corner on the map we marked it on our navigation and drove there but then decided to get closer to the sign and found out there are a dozen better places for a picture
Lost  Found
On the last day while I was packing my bags I realized that I was missing a jacket I thought I mustve left it in the first room that was too stinky to stay in So I called the Lost  Found and asked if there was a jacket left in that room they said yes and brought it right away Then I though what if I completely forgot that jacket wouldve they called me to inform that I might have forgotten an item in a room that I checked into before We stayed there for four nights I forgot the jacket on the first night and they neglected informing me about it Ive forgotten a jacket in a dorm room after a semesters end in collage and they called me afterwards so that I could claim it This is a four star hotel
The hotel was trying too hard to be cool with the style and furnishing but at the bottom of it its just stinky and not very well maintained which only makes it look cheap A wide flat screen TV is not the solution to a modern hotel
Weve stayed in another Sofitel Hotel before and that wasnt that great either so I guess this will put an end to our stays in Sofitel

title: Reservation Mgr Craig solved problem
text:
This hotel is in a great locationThe staff all did a great job with wonderful attitudges However Craig the rsv mgr resolved an
issue we had with our booking and we left with a very pleasant
experience This is an old hotel though impeccable therefore the rooms are small The most difficult is in the bathroom with
very little shelving to put personal items

title: Wonderful time
text: I was there alone and the room is a single Although small it was compact and comfortable with a good bed and roomy shower The elevator was definitely a oneperson experience but it worked fine The staff were very helpful and I loved the neighborhood I will definitely plan on staying here again

title: Great location Good service Could do better
text: I was pleased in the end A few issues over reservations and room allocation were very quickly sorted My laundry didnt come back when promised but again the staff sorted it as soon as it became an issue Good managers who jumped on any issue and resolved quickly Good for business and leisure trips

title: Noisey stay plus no running water
text: Recently stayed with my sister Had connecting room but with extremely large chairs the walk thru both rooms was hardly possible Closet sliding doors were broke Small pool area with lots of butts on ground Poorly designed bathroom Our first morning we woke up to no running water Was told plumber was called Came back to no HOT water in afternoon Last day our rooms were not even cleaned Food trays were left on floor in hallway for 1 day Night time sleeping used ear plugs since too many loud partiers Will never come back

title: Location
text:
Ok so its a shared bathroom and shower BUT where is it Right next to Bleeker St and Washington Sq Park  so your in the heart of the village You can walk to everything that you could possibly want and need
Great for what ever  exploring the city or just for staying to the local area And what a local area  this is the greatest area in NYC 
Its a real leafy brwonstone street that has you halfway between 5th and 6th and you can soak up it all Go to 5th and wander up to the Empire State or down to the park or go onto 6th and just soak up the atmosphere Bars restaurants and everything in between here At the end of the street is a newsagents where you can get your morning paper or magazine before heading to somewhere for coffee Then wander to the subway on 7th to explore the city Come back in the evening and then head a couple of blocks south to the heart of the area and find bar after bar and restaurant and have a great night out
Forgot to eat Thats ok theres a couple of pizza places open 24 hrs to get a slice This is just a great place to explore and its cheap cheap cheap
They will store you luggage also before your room is ready and for the day after you check out brilliant stay

title: George you rock
text:
Hotel George was a great place to stay really enjoyable in a great area that is walkable to many DC attractions and the concierge was excellent with his recommendations to restaurants and nightlife in the city And we even got to meet LL Cool J and all his bodyguards in the hotel lobby on the way up to their room 
I will be staying  George next time I am in Washington DC

title: Great Stay
text:
Stayed st the W City Center for a fun weekend getaway and loved it I mentioned to our conceirge TK that we were celebrating a birthday and we got a sweet treat delivered to our room What a great surprise Nice touch TK
Lobby and bar were fun and lively and the rooms was beautiful Location was greatright downtown we enjoyed a walk to the lake and back for our morning excercise

title: A great little hotel
text:
We stayed at the Nob Hill Motel for three days at the beginning of October 06 It was a well presented and very clean hotel set in a very good location this enabled easy access to all the sites you would usually visit in San Fransisco They have free covered Parking beneath the rooms which is watched by close circuit TV so your car will be safe whilst you stay The Hotel is run by a very friendly couple who will give you all the advise you need to enjoy a perfect stay which will include where the best places to eat and drink are located how to safely get to all the tourist destinations and will even tell you where to avoid to stay safe they really are friendly hosts and nothing is to much trouble for them
The room we stayed in was well equiped and spottlessly clean but was a little cramped when you need to be living out of two suitcases as we were when we toured california although they do have larger rooms and I would recommend reserving one of these if you are to stop longer than one night
I would not hesitate to return to the Nob Hill Hotel if I was to return to San fransisco

title: Great stay but some noise issues
text:
Everything thats been said about this hotel is true its a great location round the corner of the no 1 subway which will get you to the most important tourist hotspots And just a few blocks from penn34st street station for all business puposes Cabs are not hard to find 7th down and 8th for uptown travel Just walk towards any corner 
Staff is great efficient and polite This is not however your New England BB but it doesnt pretend to be Breakfast is a zoo when full but is provided with swift service So you dont have to wait for food very long if they are out 
Bathroom is great new and big enough 4 people in a room would be more than a squeeze though If you have however stayed at a London or Paris budget hotel this is the Ritz
One big issue for me is the lack of soundproofing Or at least the doors not being soundtight at all It wouldnt matter if you had the door wide open youd hear the same Slamming doors the whole night people talking in the hallways etc If this bothers you you should REALLY consider another hotel We moved twice and although the staff were very helpfull it did not solve the noise problem So bought earplugs and turned on the airconditioning to drown out the sound but still no better Streetnoise is virtually non exitent due to great double glassed windows Why dont you guys just finish it all off by putting in they right doors
If they get the sound issues straightend out I would give them a 10 out of 10 
So all in all
If youre a light sleeper MOVE ON
If you want to sleep cheap in a great bed with good morning food in a good location in a great new room and a smile on the staffs faces STAY HERE

title: Sofitel on Capital Hill
text: Sofitel is a nice hotel with a great location The staff are helpful and friendly I did not eat in the restaurant so no opinion on that The room was comfortable but not fantastic it was certainly above average I got a good price for such a convenient location I think others in DC are a little more spacious and nicely appointed but I recommend this hotel

title: Stay here and be happy
text:
Stay here and be happy
