We loved this hotel we had a 2 bdrm suite on the 11th floor This is a great histroic hotel in a great locale walking distance to Beale St and all that downtown has to offer 
We got in early we had a 1 bdrm reserved we wanted an upgrade to a 2 bdrm which was not ready but the front desk was so nice we went to a little place down the road had an appetizer and when we got back our bags were in the room and all was good with the world 
It was like the front desk folks were old friends they wanted out sstay to be the best it could be The workout room was nice and the am breakfast was super The lending library had some super books and movies and we got a game to play 
This is a great place in a city that is on the upswing Take the horse drawn carriage ride and see how Memphis is rebuilding a downtown 
Would I stay here again YES indeed

title: A fun neighborhood experience
text: We stayed for three days at the Hotel Tomo We usually stay in the luxury hotels downtown but this time wanted a more neighborhood experience This fit the bill The hotel was clean and rooms were sufficeint There were no frills but we spent very little time in our room so why pay for things you dont use This hotel is two blocks from Fillmore street where there are a lot of great restaurants and shops It is situated in Japantown which had some interesting shops and restaurants but would not be considered a destination The mainline bus stop was across the street so it made for a good base Overall a good experience

title: Chic urban sophistication
text:
Ive loved this hotel for years staying there many times in its previous incarnation as the Rihga Royal The allsuite layout boasts a promiscuous use of space by NYC hotel standards The recent renovations provided the polish and sophistication befitting a top notch luxury hotel Combine that with world class dining perfect location and efficient courteous service and you have one of the best choices in the highly competitive NYC luxury hotel market 
Only one issue marred my otherwise flawless stay When I arrived I was taking my rollerbag out of the taxi The doorman attempted to take it from me I said No worries  Ive got it He insisted wrestling the bag out of my hands and then rolling the 30 pound bag to the check in desk less than 20 feet away While the agent at the desk was welcoming me and asking for my credit card and ID he stood there staring at me Eventually I realized that he had no intention of leaving without a tip Nor did he intend to help me with the baggage to the room 20 feet of unwanted assistance and then he demands a tip While tipping has historically been customary with NYC bellman it is a rarity elsewhere on the planet But even if you allow that tips are traditional this sort of aggressive behavior verges on a scam and is unworthy of an otherwise lovely hotel

title: Perfect place to stay
text:
My husband and I had one night to stay in Seattle and found a special rate at the Andra hotel What a great choice it turned out to be Not only was the location superb within walking distance of shopping restaurants and Pikes Place the room appointments were very nice and the service was excellent We arrived early and our room was not yet ready but they were happy to park our car and store our luggage while we went exploring Upon our return our room was ready and the luggage was brought up We were very pleased with the room  an extremely comfy bed nice streamlined furnishings a very European feel to the bath and a separate closetdressing table area Very upscale It was nice to have a docking station for our iPod and theres a cooler full of bagged ice in the hall near the elevator Nice for coolers and chilling the wine 
The front desk gave us some good restaurant recommendations in the area but we found an Irish pub Kells just a few blocks away in Post Alley that had some wonderful seafood specials that night The best part of the evening was returning to Andra and going into Lolas for martinis The bartender made an excellent cosmo We would certainly stay here again

title: Good Location  spacious rooms
text:
Stayed here for a weekend Currently the place is redoing their pool area I believe they said it would be completed in April or so Our room had a king size bed and was spacious Good view out the balcony as we saw some fun times 
My partner and I are gay so this hotel was close to the bars Hamburger Marys was a happening place Flicks on Friday is great deals with the 200 drinks Happy hour from 56pm at Sommerset was good Transportation provided to and from airport was also good They also have transporation to the zoo This place isnt high end but for the price and location you cant beat it

title: Pretty Good what youd expect
text:
For the class and type of hotel this is good but not excellent Its a pretty vast hotel 
On my visit the first room I checked into was dark and looked onto a huge ventilation system couple of yards away I then asked to be moved and was given a room which had not been cleaned or touched since the previous occupier Rubbish left on the floor bed unmade etc etc  Finally got a reasonable corner room with a view It was comfortable though dated 
I was there for a conference so didnt make full use of the leisure restautant faciltlies however appeared ok 
Great location nr Michigan Ave Navy Pier I would stay again however think the Hyatt Regency on Whacker Drive  2 mins away has more of a buzz and a better bar

title: Left Electronic Toothbrush  and now its MIA
text:
Liked the hotel pretty cool concept all in all and perfect for business travels Only complaint is I accidentally left my electronic toothbrush in the room After checking with LostFound 2xno luck Clearly housekeeping took it and passed it along to someone who knows Who would want an old toothbrush is beyond me but it makes me wonder whatelse theyd take or refuse to return to hotel guests think about it 
Hotel was pretty indifferent to the fact I can understand on some level but perhaps the GM and leadership team should educate housekeeping on the proper protocol Makes me not want to ever stay here again and I am in Dallas alot for business

title: Nice hotel and good location
text: This is a great gem of a hotel Large hotel but not overwhelming Service was efficient and attentive Got a good night sleep Great for a business traveler and leisure traveler

title: Nice but pricey
text: We stayed here several nights but found it to be quite expensive The restaurant and public areas were nice but the rooms just ordinary

title: Fantastic comfortable value for money hotel
text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn in March 2011 The hotel is very new and very well furnisheddecorated The rooms are super  we had an Empire State View King Room  Fantastic Spotlessly Clean  Lovely comfortable bed Satellite TV all mod cons Great bathroom with good water pressure in the shower Plenty of towels and lovely toiletries Staff very friendly Located on 6th Ave and 26th St Chelsea Nice quiet road but still near enough to everything Cant recommend enough

title: We had a great time
text: My family and I were in town for a wedding and our stay was great Everyone one was very nice and accomodating They have a great breakfast buffet for a very reasonable price The location is great We went to a really nice steakhouse that the concierge recommended and it was amazing They took great care of us  they even bought us an appetizer My family and I had a great time at the Crowne Plaza and we will be back

title: Clean  Spacious
text:
I stayed at the Beverly Hills Plaza Hotel for 3 nights while on business The hotel looks a bit dated but was clean Desk service valet room service were all attentive and polite
I stayed in a huge one bedroom suite that looked like an apartment rather than a normal hotel room The room had a good sized kitchen and would have been great if my family was with me 
The bathroom was very clean and that is one of my pet peeves when judging hotels I cannot stand any cracked marble or tiles dirty grout corroded chrome areas etc This bathroom was spotless
The bed was very comfortable and firm However my room faced Wilshire Blvd and the street noise was terrible I would suggest some sort of weather stripping or something that would seal the edges better to keep the street noise out My first night was miserable due to meeting anxiety and hearing the street noise That would be my only complaint about this hotel
We had a really good rate of 225night for a one bedroom deluxe suite so it was an excellent value as well

title: Super 8 is super great
text:
I cannot say enough good things about this hotel There is nothing like a good nights rest when you are on vacation and every night of our stay was great The ceiling fan in the room made a huge difference Austin can be quite warm and humid so it was so nice to have a cool comfortable room to retire to at the end of the day And the bed was actually comfortable not like most places weve stayed 
I am very picky when it comes to hotels This is one of the very few that measure up as far as Im concerned The staff was so friendly there was a variety of breakfast options in their eating area ate something different each time and the rooms were always more than adequately cleaned 
At the end of our 10 hour drive to Austin my husband sat in the massage chair in the lobbyhe rates that a 10 especially after a day of driving That was a nice surprise 
The ONLY thing that I can think of thats a con is that its a little ways away from the action in Austin but that is also a plus since it was nice and quiet

title: Ok hotel if you are on a Budget
text:
Happy New Year Everyone
Just returned from a 7 day trip Our taxi from JFK accidentally took us to the hotel Peninsula When we got to our hotel we wish we had got out at the Peninsula 
Firstly the Building itself is very impressive and as many have said the lobby is beautiful
On exiting the lift a strange musty smell hits you but thats easy to live with We werent impressed with the room what so ever We were up for asking for another room but decided to wait till morning We had a good night sleep and the maids cleaned the room and got new towels We decided we would stick with it
As i say the hotel is perfect for anyone on a budget In other words if you have come to New York for the sights and not the hotel its acceptable

title: Very friendly top location
text: Short trip to chicago with family Perfect location for city walk shopping museums

title: Great People
text:
We were pretty excited to visit LA and stay at Venice Beach as we have friends living just 13 blocks away 
What we liked from the start was the hospitality Rasha was the one who received us and she was indeed very funny and welcoming We had just got off a 23hrs flight and she was definitely a breath of fresh air 
The room was comfortable and very very clean which I totally love The housekeeping team is really sweet and does a very thorough job of it every single day The bathroom is small but we didnt mind it as it is extremely clean I am very fussy with toilet cleanliness especially
Alfonso helped us a lot with the Disneyland tour which we thoroughly enjoy The place feels very personable friendly and comfortable
We were there when there was a huge commotion at the inn Helicopters buzzing around on top of us  policemen everywhere Very terrified But Rasha and Cassie made us feel better with their warmth and attentiveness They are real sweethearts those two Even the other staff gosh cant recall his name but he told me he was of Egyptiandescent was always very helpful when it comes to taxis sightseeing tips etc
Breakfast was really basic Nothing to shout about The Inn is kitchy the TV probably need replacing as does the furniture but the staff there made the place special They could do with a refurbishment or two hopefully theyve done so already
Its just next to a great Mexican place can be noisy during weekends if your room is facing towards the beachside and just down the road there is a drugstore so its really convenient
The only real complaint I have is probably the fact that they dont have a security guard on the premise There are quite a few drunkardsrowdy people coming into the inn or just hanging about at times and having a security personnel would be a good idea I think
We stayed from April May 2011

title: Great hotel with great employees in a great city
text:
After my plane was delayed and I was super frustrated it was great to come into such a nice hotel It was such a nice change of pace from the normal impersonal hotel experience
Steven the front desk employee went out of his way to put me in a better mood and it certainly worked 
Then the rooms were beautiful and very well styled I stay in many hotel rooms across the country and its so nice to not have to worry about whether or not your room is clean It was spotless Comfortable Had all the amenities
Great experience with this hotel Im totally recommending it to others and my family in the city

title: Peace and comfort
text: We arrived in Seattle just before Thanksgiving for 2 days of exploring downtown Unfortunately my husband had a bad cold so he did little wandering However if he had to be sick the Sheraton was a good place to bevery comfortable bed nice TV screen to watch football and the inhotel restaurant was delicious The hotel is within easy walking distance of most of downtown so I enjoyed checking out shops and bay scenery The hotel is also just 2 blocks from the Westlake station of the light rail from the airport Well return

title: The Best Deal in Boston
text: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a couple nights because 1 It was the cheapest hotel in Boston and 2 It was a block from my brothers apartment The hotel room was very nice though the first room we got the thermostat was set at 95 so it was boiling We were given a different room one that was much cooler The next morning the hot water for the entire building was down The breakfast was good with a very good selection Other than the few minor setbacks at the beginning of our stay the hotel was wonderful Good rooms and service in a good location

title: Clean Comfortable and Close to Walking Sites Downtown
text: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel Five and were very pleased with the customer service and cleanliness of the room Wish they had a complimentary breakfast but they did have a restaurant nearby with complimentary coffee always available It was also near a great donut store Top Pot within easy walking distance We will stay there again on our next visit to Seattle

title: Beautiful property excellent amenities flawless service
text: Everything you want and expect in a firstclass hotel They want me to add more characters to my review but I really have nothing more to say If you can afford to stay in this lovely hotel you will not be disappointed Is this 200 characters yet

title: Charming great location
text:
The Palace Hotel is beautiful My husband and I and our 2 daughters spent 4 nice nights at this splendid hotel The location is great Its just a short walk to incredible shopping Chinatown and great restaurants The moment we got out of our car the service was nothing short from great They took care of our bags and our car as we proceeded to checkin We had reserved a one bedroom suite which turned out to be quite nice We were a little nervous about the noise as an aquaintance had just stayed at the Palace and said that the walls were a bit thin I inquired at the desk about the noise and they assured us it would not be a problem with our room 
The suite itself had a great old world charm to it The rooms were clean although the sofa in the living room needed a good cleaning and the king bed was extremely comfortable The bellman unloaded our luggage to their respective places showed us the room and welcomed us to the hotel The only problem we had with the room was that they gave us a king instead of 2 doubles so our daughters had nowhere to sleep I immediately called the front desk they quickly apologized for the mixup and said they would send up two complimentary rollaways The rollaways were brought up within 10 minutes of the call and fit perfectly in the livingroom since the room was quite large
The concierge service was very nice they were very helpful in recommending restaurants and making reservations and giving directions The steakhouse in the hotel Maxfields was decent not overly great but we didnt want to walk to a restaurant outside the hotel after walking all day long We ordered room service for our daughters a couple of nights so that my husband and I could go out on our own they enjoyed it  and loved eatting in the room while they watched High School Musical 2 
The front desk was correct our room was relatively quiet The mixup with the beds worked out great since it gave both my husband and I and our daughters privacy after a long day of being tourists My daughters found the long hallways a bit spooky but they enjoyed themselves as well Well definately stay there again if we return to San Francisco

title: Labor Day WeekendGreat Location
text: This hotel was great for the price given the location It is so close to so many things  very close to public transportation spots On the down side for what I thought was such a highend hotel the cleanliness of their room was questionable When we checked in we noticed a huge stain on one of the pillows  on the bed Was very disappointed to find that Everything else was fine The bathroom tube was smaller than what I thought  the view wasnt great But I did book through Priceline  was getting the most for my buck One warning On priceline it states you can pay more to get internet access but that is not the case We had to pay the hotel for internet access we are going to call priceline to see what they can do for us for that inconvenience Besides that everyone was friendly  extremely helpful staff really aiming to please

title: Far beyond our expectations
text:
The Marriott Financial in terms is kind of a calm and quit hideaway on manhattan island We slept in more than comfortable beds and had beautiful views over the Hudson and Ellis Island Our room has been astonishingly clean so that you could feel like home using the bath and bed after a long day of sightseeing and shopping The Marriott is located in an absolutely safe and quiet part of downtown so that we had a peaceful and undisturbed sleep during each night Breakfast at Roys has been a good start into our day but if someone wants to he could also find many quality breakfast cafes and restaurants close to the hotel Subway station is a 3 min stroll away and within just 15 min after locking your room youre right in the middle of Times Square Its the same time with a cab ride for which we never paid more than 15 tofrom uptown
Many of the world renowm tourists sites are near the hotel like Battery Park the Ferry to Statue of Liberty Wall Street the Woolworth building and Pier 17 Not to mention Ground zero which is just a block away and a mustgo to remember and give a prayer 
After listening to so many horrible stories about even more horrible NYC hotels that our friends and family experienced before us we were more than relieved to realize that the Marriott Financial is a real 4star hotel with all amenities one would expect We were lucky to get rates for a kingbed room which havent been higher than the rates for all the dirty and rundown 2star tourist hotelcages uptown So the Marriott Financial made our stay in New York an unforgettable nice one 
Highly recommend it

title: Service so bad I cancelled my reservations
text: Booked this hotel as part of a package with Expedia One week prior to arrival I emailed them requesting a cot for my teenager Three days later I had not received a response so I called the front desk and made the request The rude guy who took my call informed me it would 3000 per night for a cot When I told him i thought that was pretty steep he said talk to the manager thats our policy Based on their inability to accommodate my request and the complete lack of hospitality I cancelled my stay and booked another hotel

title: Ditto bring your earplugs
text: I recognize New York is noisy and while youre up high in the Hilton Millenium construction at ground zero can be pretty loud even on a weekend The rooms are very clean and for business travellers to downtown the location couldnt be better Its a bit overpriced but which hotel in New York is not

title: Hard Times Befall The Bijou
text:
Perhaps the Bijou was a good place when it opened but its fallen on hard times The upholstery and curtains in the lobby and the rooms are grimy The location is very dicey and the rooms facing the street are incredibly noisy all night longsirens shouting etcwhich means you cannot open the windows and the rooms are stuffyno AC or fan
Internet access is available through ATT and I was horrified to find that when I signed on I had access to other guests hard drives Parking is an additional 30day in an offsite lot not bad for SF but I waited 45 minutes for my car to be brought around There are no security locks on the rooms just door handle locks no wall outlets near the desk for your laptop The wall lamps above the bed are mounted so low you cannot sit up in bed to read 
Apparently the Bijou used to be part of the Joie de Vivre group of boutique hotels but is no longer It has not kept it up very well Its cheap but not a good value for your money

title: Perfect base for seeing the city
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights in October 2007 and it was absolutely brilliant we had a queen pod on the 11th floor which was ensuite so no need to share the facilities as on the lower floors Absolutely spotless great housekeeping and a really funky and fresh design 
The rooftop area was fab for unwinding after a long day sightseeingshopping
Location was pretty spot on  only a few blocks walk to the heart of the city and there was a subway stop at the end of the next block
we had room 1104  which had a private outdoor area with great views also ideal for smokers as the hotel is non smoking
there seemed to be a diverse clientele  older couples young travllers europeans other americans  everyone seemed to love it
overall id recommend to everyone

title: Renovation going on
text: I found the motel overall to be very good My room was very clean and up to date The AC worked perfect and was pretty quiet Not at all annoying The front desk staff was friendly and very accomodating I was there for 5 nights I did have a couple of small issues that the staff took care of immediately The motel is about 1520 min from downtown A very easy drive in the morning and afternoon both There was some renovation going on in the lobby hallway areas but nothing that interfered with my stay The breakfast was not anything fancy but it sure beat driving thru somewhere

title: this hotel was terriblea real ripoff
text: we stayed at the westin oaks hotel in houston in february 2009 it was the worst experience of my life the air conditioner was blowing hot air all night long so finally we just opened the patio door and sweated all night also there was not enough hot water to take a shower so we just got up at 300 am to drive on home which was five hours away You would think if you paid 50000 for a room it would at least be cool air and hot water i would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy thank you do not stay here

title: Wonderful home away from home
text: We were in Austin for the marathon so the addition of a kitchen was very convenient The room was great the breakfast that was included was really good We will stay there again

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text:
I picked this hotel because I was able to get a good rate and the location is very convenient Having stayed at CQ in Philadelphia I was expecting another small room but the room I got in DC was very spacious  luck of the draw I guess Very clean Front desk staff was OK Only problem was that the inroom coffee maker didnt work well A big plus was the lighting  desk and bed lamps had 3way bulbs which made it really easy to read unlike dim bulbs in many hotel rooms
Location right on top of one Metro station and near another was also a plus Firehook Bakery a block away on 17th St is excellent for breakfast The area is pretty dead at night for better or worse

title: Much better than I expected
text: I gotta admit on the trip up to NYC I was getting a little nervous about this hotel as I was reading some of the reviews We stayed there four nights and were truly happier than I thought we would be with our experience there Sure the rooms and bathroom are small but they put the square footage of the rooms on their website so that was no surprise The room wasnt so small that we were uncomfortable at all We got one of the renovated rooms and I loved the decor It was simple and I love when hotels have allwhite bedding The hotel was such a convenient walk to everywhere we wanted to go When we looked out our window we could see the reflections of Time Squares lights on the other buildings The theater we went to was in the same block as the hotel so that was nice And it was only maybe a 10 minute walk to Rockefeller Center at most The rooms were so quiet we didnt hear any noise at all from the hotel only street noise but its New York City what do you expect If you go here expecting crazy luxury you are not going to find it but if you want a nice clean and quiet room with a short walk to theaters Time Square or Rockefeller Center this hotel is perfect We would happily stay here again

title: town and country is excellent terry ng from front desk is amazing
text: room is wonderful Service is world class especially from the front desk

title: Great location beside space needle  5 minutes from downtown on sky train
text: Clean reasonably priced  we picked eat sleep and park package  decent deal Great buffet breakfast Helpful friendly staff Overall good for 1 or 2 night stop over in Seattle

title: Lovely
text: I recently flew to New York to celebrate my birthday with friends The lobby my room lounge and doormen were all gorgeous The front desk very helpful My linens robe towels etc all new sparkling clean and comfy My stay at 60 Thompson ranks about the best experience Ive had at a hotel The restaurant was closed for renovation which allowed me to explore the neighborhood even more Lovely

title: Really nice hotel but a bit overpriced for what it is
text: Went to Seattle for the ChargersSeahawks football game Splurged on hotel at Olive 8 because it got great reviews online It was nice certainly but nothing super fancy My fiance thought the late night happy hour in the bar was superb The rooms walls were a bit bare and it almost had this feel like they just opened When we got there we were told the only way we could get a good view would be to upgrade Since we booked directly with the hotel we were already paying full price for the room and opted not to Our room faced an office building which we could see right ito You can easily walk to our hotel from the Public Market so the location was greatjust not sure the hotel was worth the money

title: Much better this time
text: Stayed here 2 years ago and wasnt impressed then Stayed again this past September and was fantastic experience Everyone went out of their way to be accomodating The room was spacious and clean The toilet clogged during the stay but they came up within 10 minutes and fixed it though could have cleaned up after themselves when they did The valet parking was quick and efficient The front staff was kind courteous and went out of their way to make sure we had directions and everything we needed Well done and will definitely stay again

title: Not bad if youre exhibiting or attending a convention at McCormick
text:
The rooms are pretty solid and definitely for business travelers If you are attending or exhibiting there the convenience is unbeaten They just added a minifridge which is good for those who like to stock their rooms during these trips Do stock plenty of water since the air quality will dry you up like a prune during sleep Unfortunately they have not upgraded their TVs yet and have a terrible channel selection The sauna pool and gym is not bad at all for a business hotel The concierge is pretty solid when they are around They also have auto checkin and checkout but there is no flexibility with changing your room using the machine The store at the hotel is a complete ripoff Unlike many other midwest hotel stores the markup is incredible  especially the booze and refreshments The inhotel bar provides the best value for the food there There are many TVs at the bar just in case you are a sports fan 
About the convention center the food is slim pickins so be warned For a normal lunch you will spend close to 20 They have a cafeteria with hot food which is the most expensive and a Connies and McDonalds on the lower level Truthfully the McDonalds is the only food establishment there that is not a complete ripoff Tip  the taxi line is much shorter at the hotel entrance as opposed to the convention center entrance

title: Great location but a few little things
text:
Trying to find an affordable hotel in Boston can be quite a challenge We took advantage of Starwoods second night 12 price promo at the Westin Copley Place
We arrived at 930 in the morning and were planning to have our bags stowed for the day Happily our room was ready and we were able to move from two queens to a king bed that wasnt available when I booked online 
The room size is adequate and the bathroom is fine The shower head is very 1980s as noted by a previous post The tub was worn but the room was clean The main issue is the soundproofing at this hotel We could hear our neighbours sneezing and coughing and their cell phone conversations word for word When they checked out early they forgot to reset their alarm clock which we could hear through the wall for hours
The location of this hotel cant be beat Its very central and a block from the nearest tstop Its extremely simple to get to the Westin from the airport using public transit There are several decent restaurants if you cant make it out for dinner 
The concierge service at the hotel is great They could answer every question and gave great advice regarding local diners and restaurants 
If the rooms had updated soundproofing we would stay again Otherwise well stay in the same area at another hotel

title: I know the city is overcrowded and dirty but seriously Its the Hilton
text:
I was up north visiting my husband on the weekend of the 12th through the 15th of August while he was out of town for business We had booked a hotel room at the Hilton in the city because we were visiting friends for a couple nights as well 
On a Saturday at 6PM we made our way to the Hilton only to be told our room was not ready and they were still cleaning it We were fine with waiting because they gave us drink vouchers for the bar plus the decor was so nice and plush we didnt mind hanging around downstairs to wait We were on a time schedule though and had to be back at our friends house by 8 So we waited about 20 minutes and they came and got us and sent us up to our room
The first thing we always do whenever we get a hotel in any city is strip the bed and check everything for bed bug signs which is exactly what we did We didnt find any bed bugs but we did find a pubic hair a clearish white stain and a brown stain on the sheets By this time we only had an hour to shower iron our clothes and get where we needed to go so I called downstairs and told them what happened They did send an apologetic person up to change the sheets and remake the bed
It was quite obvious the room had not been cleaned at all The floor had not been vacuumed and the bed was nasty I was pissed because
A We are Hilton Honors members and even if we werent I would still expect a certain level of cleanliness from a Hilton
B Check in for most of these hotels is generally 3 or 4 so I was a little miffed when she showed up at 6 and they had no room for us
C They obviously lied to us when they said they were cleaning the room because they werent
D Even though we didnt pay for the room we used Hilton points my husband had saved up for a fun trip and we basically wasted them on a bed filled with bodily fluids
Like I said I knew New York was a dirty overcrowded city so I sort of knew what to expect but I didnt expect it would be that gross

title: A good value hotel in the heart of Times Square
text:
We stayed for 5 nights and were very pleased with the hotel Couldnt get over how close it was to the very centre of Times Square just 70 metres away Check in was quick our room was smallish but clean and comfortable A basic airconditioner was in the room not sure how efficient it would be in the middle of summer though Bathroom was very large Coffee machine was provided in the room and you could also help yourself at any time to tea and coffee in the breakfast room A very good free continental breakfast was provided with cereal fruit pastries toast and yoghurt Make sure you tip the attendant though
The hotel was close to public transport which we used all the time Theres also a tiny gym with treadmill which you really dont need just walk everywhere whilst in New York Free internet was also available in a small business centre in the lobby All in all a great place to stay whilst visiting the Big Apple

title: Excellent location great service
text:
My mom and I stayed at the Fairfax for three nights We got the room on Priceline for 150 and I think we had the same room as the other priceline reviewer below king with pull out sofa They got a better price than us though  Anyway we did not feel any less welcome due to our Priceline status
The pullout sofa was comfortable and the bed was so comfy Service was excellent the door people are so friendly We asked a couple of times for extra coffee and it was delivered immediately and with a smile The bathroom was very spacious tons of counter space free standing hairdrying vs the hose attached to the wall excellent water pressure and hot water through two showers 
The location just could not be any better Dupont Circle metro is right there and it is right near tons of excellent restaurants barsclubs if you want nightlife bookstores shopping excellent consignment shop at Secondi Embassy Row We didnt eat at the Jockey Cllub but did have some drinks in the Farifax Lounge
For the Priceline price this was an outstanding value and we really enjoyed it

title: Beautiful Hotel with a view of Coronado
text: Stayed at his hotel for three nights  everything was just fantastic The spa pool was awesome Perfect location for walking to Seaport Village Gaslamp USS Midway etc The lobby and lobby bar were just great Very clean Because of the many events taking place there the elevators were really tied up during peak times Nothing to take away from this beautiful hotel though

title: Excellant Choice for early morning flight
text: We have stayed at the Crowne Plaza several times in the past when we had an early morning flight This time we were very pleased with the recently refurbished rooms The food in the first floor restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced A good start to our vacation

title: Excellent location and wonderful staff
text:
My husband and I booked a night with Pricelines name your own price feature and our bid was picked up by the Marriott Wardman Park I was nervous at first because I saw this whole huge story about some major GOP convention having been there in January and everyone having bedbug bites Understandably I kind of freaked out and I contacted the management with my concerns They replied promptly and courteously gave me quite a bit of info on how they deal with those kinds of situations and apparently the story was rather unfounded So we decided to give it a shot Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted by the extremely nice front desk staff and allowed to check in 2 hours early Our room was neat and clean with the exception of one old pillow which I removed from the bed We inspected every inch of the room for bedbugs and found absolutely nothing Everything was spotless True as many reviewers before have pointed out there was no view from the room and the towels were scratchy but I wasnt there to gaze out the window and the towels were clean so I didnt care I didnt observe any nasty attitudes from any of the hotel staff despite having read reviews about it before going In fact every person on staff that I dealt with was exceedingly nice and helpful
All in all this was a great hotel Its across from the Metro has beautiful gardens to walk in and allows you to be in the heart of the city without feeling bombarded by traffic all the time I would stay here again in a heart beat

title: Awesome value and location
text: Perfect for a few days stay Checkin was a breeze The hotel is located win easy walking distance of Quincy Market the State House and other touristy sights Staff was quite accommodating and helpful I even enjoyed the Elephant Bar adjacent The room was large enough for me  might have been tight for 2 or w a kid Check out this value  least expensive of all in the area

title: Not that impressed
text:
I was in Chicago for the marathon and stayed at the W for my last night in town because I was able redeem Starwood points for a free night Although Ive been a Starwood member for a long time and stayed at many St Regis Sheraton  Westin hotels around the world this was my first time at a W so I was excited to see what the W experience was all about
What I liked
Although I arrived about 10am they had my room available and I was able to check in which was great The front desk clerk was very friendly The room was a bit small but fine The bed was very comfortable I ended up ordering dinner from room service the prices were about what you would expect but the dinner was surprisingly delicious I think this is the first room service meal that Ive ever really enjoyed I had the flatten grilled chicken ceasar salad and tiramisu for dessert
What I did not like
The train is very close to the hotel and although that makes getting around very convenient you can also really hear it rumbling by every 10 minutes or so which is not that pleasant My room was a corner room with two huge window that looked directly into office buildings across the way so I had to keep the curtains closed most of the time I know it goes with the hip vibe of the hotel but it is so dark in all the public areas and even in the room that it makes it hard to see I guess that is a sign that I am now officially old One of the whatever whenever concierges was not very helpful and had a bit of any attitude when I ask her for train directions The concierge who was on duty the next day was great and helped me checkin for my flight online and printed my boarding pass for me so I guess its just a matter of who is manning the desk Overall it is very loungy feeling but that is what you would expect when you stay at a W 
I much preferred the Hilton on S Michigan Ave which I stayed at the two previous nights

title: Unpretentious comfort and luxury
text: Chosen for a night stay in Boston I was impressed with the service the style of the hotel and the comfort of the rooms The little touches such as complimentary water decent sized towels and quality toiletries make it a great place to stay The quirky history and stunning renovation make it a unique place to stay The location was good a 5 minute walk from Newbury and Boylston St attractions I have high expectations for hotels as a former flight attendant I have stayed in so many I lost count but this was a great choice for a Boston

title: Convenient to all downtown fun
text: The view from our room was amazing Jets in bathtub were relaxing Easy walk to anywhere you want to go downtown Il Forneo restaurant has excellent food and service Bed so comfy I slept like a log 14 the price of a San Francisco hotel Thanks to William who checked us in and out He was so friendly and helpful I definitely will stay there again

title: Great hotel at LA Live
text: Just returned from a seven night stay at the JW Marriott I stayed at this hotel whilst attending a conference The hotel is close to the Nokia Theatre Its the second time I have stayed here and the service was much improved on my last stay Check in was swift and very helpful My bags were delivered to my room without any fuss Room service was good and fast  which is what you want when attending a conference My room was clean and the bed comfortable I found the Guest Service phone connection extremely helpful and if they couldnt answer your question immediately they would get back to you soon with an answer I only ever ate lunch in the hotel restaurant and was not particularly inspired by the menu but again the service was good and fast You have to pay on a daily basis for WiFi which is mildly irritating The Spa is located at the adjoining hotel the Ritz Carlton and is excellent I spent a relaxing morning there and had a wonderful massage Although I spent long hours away from my room it was always nice and relaxing to go back The check out procedure was again fast and for a very large hotel they just seem to have got things right I would definitely stay there again

title: A fantastic hotel to stay at
text: Myself and my husband recently returned from a 5 night stay at this lovely hotel Everything was just perfect but if I had to say one minus its maybe that its not as close to Times Square as it could be The rooms are very big for NYC hotel rooms housekeeping was exceptional staff are all very friendly and polite My husband said it was the best hotel bed he has ever slept in Definitely join the Select Guest Programme its worth it for the free internet access and morning coffee Concierges were all very knowledgeable and helpful If you want a great hotel then do stay here

title: What a dealbut not via bestwesterncom
text:
Booked this hotel via Hostelworldcom and it pulled up as AAE Hotels  Hostels Loyal Inn It was much much cheaper booking this way rather than going through Best Westerns website
We got room 101 on the ground floor on the right side of the hotel Our window overlooks the parking lot This room is right across from Housekeepings staff room or supply room Every morning we can hear the doors banging openshut The walls are very thin we can hear people talking in the halls and walking around in the room above us The room is also very close to the stairs that lead up stairs so a lot of traffic a lot of noise Its close to the breakfast buffet room and business center
The bathroom amenities include towels and hair dryer There is soap and lotion via wall dispensers mounted on the wall over the sink There is body wash shampoo and conditioner via wall dispensers mounted on the wall in the showertub I like the curved shower curtain rod The curvature prevents the curtain from billowing inwards during the shower The shower water pressure and drainage was good The sink area is outside the bathroom area and there are limited hanging and no shelf space in the bathroom Its all outside
Room amenities include ACheat unit coffeetea maker two very comfortable queen beds and soft pillows plenty of floor lamps fridge and microwave safe large desk and large LCD TV
There is wifi the passcode changes every Monday There is a business center with 2 computers printing is free there is a gym two machines and a few weights and buffet breakfast All complimentary Parking is 10 plus tax a day
The hotel is within walking distance to the REI Flagship store Space Needle and Whole Foods Dickys Drivein a gas station and I5 are also close by Not too many restaurants in the area though
When we returned from our side trip to Vancouver we were given room 306 Its a four level building but in this room we hardly heard any overhead noise The AC unit was changed one day It was different when we came back from our day out The set up is the same with minor differences like the hair dryer and AC unit Its an overall much quieter room Being on the left side of the hotel and higher up our window over looks Denny Park

title: Lovely place in a convenient location
text: Just stayed one night but everything worked smoothly and the room was excellent Nice continental breakfast very close to restaurants Copley Square etc

title: Better than those huge hotel monsters
text:
If you need to be in or near downtown Houston for a couple of days dont look any further The hotel is clean the rooms are huge with huge TVs every room has a fridge and a microwave theres a complimentary breakfast and a happy hour during which you get free drinks and snacks
That is all very well but what really makes your stay at this hotel worth your money is the very personal approach of the staff Of course you can go to hospitality monsters like the Double Tree which is actually IN downtown Houston and not NEAR it but youll feel like a number like a soulless statistic out there 
So Id say dont go to those horrible huuuge hotels IN downtown Houston just take this one Youll love it

title: A Grand Old Lady
text: Stayed 2 nights at the Biltmore between Xmas and New Year 2008 Fabulous room I think we were on a special floor  but not sure as I didnt do the booking with a four poster bed Amazing old style common areas with very grand decorations Bathrooms small and a little old fashioned but if anything it added to the cosy traditional feel of the place To be recommended if you are looking for some character and dont mind being in what seems like a slightly outoftheway area We had 2 good evening meals within walking distance  Roys which is Hawaiianfusion and at Engine no 28 which is American Both absolutely EXCELLENT with great service

title: Comfy beds and overall very nice
text: Yes the trolley does run late so if you want quiet stay on side facing river But of you will be out into the late evening go for a room with balcony They are few but face the park and its a nice place to enjoy a good conversation glass of wine or breakfast Loved the beds Very comfortable And the kitchen with own sink was nice Will stay here again

title: Good location and basic
text: Spent 2 days at the Residence Inn Dupont Circle in November 2011 Rooms were clean and basic but a bit on the small side The kitchenette was a plus Breakfast was OK but nothing special People at the front desk were very helpful Location good for restaurants but a few 34 blocks from a Metro station

title: Great Location Great Price
text: This was a really great place to stay for the price It was very close to North Beach and many sites were within walking distance The rooms were nothing fancy but clean and very nice We had a car and there is of course since its a motor inn a garage underneath the hotel which was very convenient for us

title: A very nice place to stay
text: I stayed here for one night and it was a very nice room at a rate that is very reasonable for SF This is a quality place with all nice modern room ameneties and you wont be dissappointed I was upgraded to a king room which was very large Not much street noise no trouble sleeping

title: Management was insenstive to my needs even when my father was dying
text: I travel quite a bit on business Overall the hotel was very nice However I received a call from my family in Dallas that my father was dying He had 24 hours to live and I had an hour and 12 to book a flight and go I had been in the hotel for about 4 hours and had to leave suddently I asked the hotel staff if they would charge me they said they would talk to the manager I left in a hurry My father passed away 2 days later  and I realized the hotel still charged me for an entire day I called the mangement back and they said it did matter because they couldnt rent the room for the evening and house keeping couldnt clean it Not that it even mattered bc the hotel was empty when I left He wouldnt even prorate the room for me Not to mention I have status as an SPG member I wil NEVER go to this hotel ever again and I will recommend for others not to stay here They just lost a lot of busines from me Too bad because I travel quite a bit I cant believe how insenstive people can be

title: What a nice hotel
text:
We just stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Elysee Our room was spacious and beautiful We were on the 12th floor and never heard anyone although one night I did hear the garbage truck picking up outside 
The breakfast was very nice and consisted of pastries muffins scones and lots of bread choices with yummy jellies Also several cereals prunes and hard boiled eggs There was a big bowl of good mixed fruit yogurt and packs of instant oatmeal Also several kinds of juice 3 types of very good coffee with syrups and many tea choices 
We thoroughly enjoyed this club room throughout the day and night also stopping in now and then between our activities There were newspapers a pc with internet and a piano and tv in a smaller attached room which we always had to ourselves There was always fresh coffee tea and little cookies 
The staff was pleasant and helpful Great location We would definitely stay here again

title: Loved the pool side bar
text: The pool is lovely especially in summer Great to hang out there

title: Very friendly staff nice clean place
text: Great place  close to airport Good breakfast Great service I got this room at 2 am after expedia had screwed up my reservations The hotel that I had booked through Expedia sold my reservation off to make more money I had to drive around for two hours after midnight with two little kids

title: Great First Time In Chicago
text: We booked our hotel through Hotwire we were a bit unsure as we would not know where we were staying until the transaction had gone through When it popped up Palmer House of course we searched like crazy to find the reviews Some were good some not so much so we began to regret our decisionuntil we arrived in Chicago The Palmer House was gorgeouswe were upgraded to a room with 2 bathrooms great for 2 girls  without even askingthe staff was courteous helpful and the atmosphere was always enjoyable Our room was oldervery clean beds comfortable and the concierge was very helpful at suggesting restaurants and things to do and see The location was goodwe walked several times to the Magnificint Mile We would both stay there again

title: Always a pleasure
text: I recently stayed at this hotel for Mothers Day It was such a delight to find this gem in downtown Phoenix The attention paid to every minute detail and the courtesy shown by the entire staff made this a memorable and most pleasurable experience for me and my family l must say their Mothers Day Brunch was just as pleasureable to look at as it was delicous from filet mingnon to all of the delectable desserts They even had a cute station where the little ones could make the very own personlized cards to present to their moms And most of allIt all wasnt a budget buster All in all just a beautiful experience

title: This Is A Goodie
text:
We spent two nights here over Christmas in a loft suite No idea why they call it a loft Its just a reasonably normal hotel room 
Nice large bedroom with fabulous furniture plus a little dressing room and loads of wardrobe space Its in a great location really close to Union Square for shopping
The reception is a bit different really dark with a roaring fire and lots of unique furniture There is a funky bar  great for people watching The staff here are really helpful
This is a goodie  go if you can

title: I am so pleased
text: What a GREAT experience Clean contemporary and friendly We had a few constructive suggestions that we mentioned in a online survey request and actually received a personalized response from one of the hotel directorsHow often does THAT happen I appreciate good service and a good productthe Airport Radisson delivers both

title: Consistently excellent Westin standards
text:
This is a lovely hotel perfectly located for business in downtown Denver right on the 16th street mall Downtown Denver is very walkable so no need to rent a car unless you plan to go further afield 
Check in was friendly and efficient Was up to my room very quickly and it was up to the usual Westin standards Clean functional and understated decor  perfect for business
Very nice pool with a view over downtown
Overall an excellent reliable choice for business in Denver

title: Comfy beds in a great location but somewhat shabby
text:
I stayed here last Thursday  Sunday I attended a business workshop on Friday and my hubby and I stayed through the weekend for leisure Checkin was smooth and fast and the staff were courteous and knowledgeable The lobby is nicely decorated in a contemporary style but the building sure shows its age once one heads up to the guestroom floors The woodwork outside our room was so battered looked as if someone had been hacking at it with an ax 
On the positive side I liked the overal design of the room and the bedding was of nice quality But there were some serious flaws The bathroom cabinet was cracked so severely that some of the wood veneer had copletely fallen off And although I asked for a nonsmoking room the place smelled strongly of smoke We are not smokers and didnt spend any time with smokers during our trip but our clothes absorbed the smell from the room When we got home and unzipped our suitcases the smell of smoke was extremely strong I had to dryclean the brand new overcoat that I had just purchased that very weekend at Saks
Other positives about this hotel are the location It was very convienient to Magnificent Mile shopping and attractions The cafe attached served great coffee and I never waited more than a couple of minutes for my order And again the staff were helpful and pleasant 
Overall the room was a good value but the the stay would have been much more pleasant if this hotel made some basic maintenance efforts

title: these people should be banned from the Industry
text:
DO NOT STAY AT THIS HELLHOLE
I booked late on returning to here from my first leg
IT is overpriced airless and disgusting and the people who run it should not be allowed near a hotel Rude inconsiderate and ignorant dont cover it
I looked at the rooms and after explaining my displeasure we left
needless to say a refund was not forecoming

title: Good Value Comfortable
text:
I stayed in early December 2010 Got a 139 rate for weekday and 89 for weekend 30day for valet parking These are very good rates for DC
The hotel is on the west side of the White House which is the unfashionable side so you will find yourself away from good restaurants attractions and the Metro It abuts GWU The building is old and plain but maintained very well The place is very clean and the staff much more helpful than usual My room was quite large with a full sized separate kitchen Small 5x7 bathroom
The windows open The only real disadvantage of the buildings age is that it is noisier than a modern building both street noise and adjacent rooms The shower temperature varies as other guests flush but not dangerously or uncomfortably so I found it amusing plus the faucets that had been polished so many times the chrome was worn away They will be sold for a lot some day
The bedding was excellent also there was no sign of bedbugs
My stay was very pleasant and I would stay there again The only real blot was the restaurant Breakfast was 35 for two and the most unsatisfactory buffet I have ever had Avoid it Four short blocks away is an excellent breakfast at Founding Farmers
There is no wifi The wired internet is free but very very slow

title: The best kept secret
text: OMG this place is fantastic We are used to staying in 4  5 star hotels so I was a little worried about the boutique nature of this hotel but I was wrong The welcome from Ann on reception and the fantastic advice about restaurants etc from Wayne not to mention meeting other guests at the very generous wine and cheese happy hour each night really made our stay There were 3 of us and we stayed in the Penthouse Suite which was roomy and cozy with 2 tvs and 2 toilets There is no better location We walked to North Beach for fantastic ITalian food at Ristorante Ideale and to Chinatown which are both an easy and interesting 15 minute stroll We were sorry to leave The Inn and will stay there again on our next visit to San Fran Thanks Wayne and Ann for your hospitality

title: Location is tops
text:
Husband and I stayed 5 nights at the Lucerne the end of May to the start of June and loved it The room on the 12th floor was clean no smell of smoke the bathroom was recently updated and the bed comfortable 
The location in a more residential area with tons of great restaurants within a few blocks the subway stop a mere block away and the pleasant staff all made this a place well definitely stay at again if we ever make it back to NYC We paid 210nt booking through the hotels site and our room had a king size bed

title: Not fancy but it gets the job done
text: We visited Seattle for 6 days at the end of May 2008 A fancy hotel is not important to us but we do require a safe and clean place to stay The Sixth Avenue Inn was just what we needed  it was fairly cheap compared to the other hotels  and its location was great which was about 6 blocks from the piers It was a little run down and the elevators and hallways sometimes smelled a little funny but the rooms were always clean and smelled fine If you want a luxury hotel this is NOT the place for you but it was perfect for travelers who want a comfortable place to come home to at night and a safe place to leave your things during the day

title: A new hotel with some kinks to work out
text:
This hotel is tragically hip I have stayed at Ws before and havent felt this way so to me theres something about this one in particular It started with the completely black foyer with only an elevator and the far away door to the bar This is a very sparse and nonwelcoming way to be greeted Then I went to the 5th floor to check in and walked into a lounge that was trying really hard to be a club Unfortunately I couldnt hear a thing the woman at the desk was saying because of the pounding club music from the DJ table a few steps away  so I had trouble hearing important things like your room number is My hotel room had no TV remote and while someone did bring it it was annoying that it was missing in the first place I ordered room service at one point but the dessert I wanted was no longer being offered The clock radio was set to 445am when I arrived at 930pm The lighting in my room was WAY too white  I had to play with the various switches to make it less industrial and more homey The lighting was a problem in the bathroom too because it shined right down on me creating shadows when I was trying to do my makeup I had to use the scary magnifying mirror so I did my makeup hunched over the sink to see into the little magnifying mirror 
Also I find it rather forced to be called by my first name by hotel staff Who wants this I would think young people who would like it couldnt afford the W and older people would appreciate a little less familiarity Im not an old lady  Im 37  and I wonder how middleaged guests view this familiarity 
The wifi is rather pricey at 1495 PER DEVICE per day and the signal wasnt the strongest either I only used one device my iPod and was charged for two so I was unable to use the automatic check out on the TV as I had to go discuss the charge with the front desk At least during check out there was no DJ blasting music so we could actually hear each other 
Finally the W offers a free ride to certain parts of the city as an Acura promotion but when I tried to use it it was totally booked Seems like there may only be one or two cars so book immediately upon your arrival if you want to use it 
On the plus side I really liked the shower products and the bed as always was very comfortable The room service dinner was quite tasty so I appreciated that And the bathroom was fantastically clean  not a single stray hair from a prior guest In all I think there are a lot of kinks to work out here I still like Starwood hotels but might not choose this particular one again anytime soon

title: Nice and New Hotel Easy to Navigate City
text: We stayed for 5 nights in Sept 2010 Like others have said it was easy to get to from the airport via the light rail 250 Also all buses in downtown area are free We were able to walk to several restaurants Pikes Market the water etc We walked to the downtown shopping area as well but it was a bit more of a hike The area felt very safe during the day but it was pretty empty at night seems like more of a worker area The room was nice although small The Bistro was great for a snack or drink The service was great In all a nice stay

title: Great place with good Elvis ambiance
text:
This place was pretty nice The outside was slightly worn down but the rooms are newly renovated It is literally across the street from Graceland and there are Elvis stores all around Right up the street about 12 mile is a supermarket liquor store fast food type mall area to pick up anything you need The neighborhood is not the best but that is simply the neighborhood that Graceland is in nowadays 
The hotel has the fancy guitar shaped pool free Elvis movies all day and night and a pretty cool lobby area with pictures of Elvis and gold records etc 
The breakfast was a little above average for a free one Decent selection of foods Pets allowed for only 10day Great staff too 
Highly recommended to get into the Elvis mood if you are going to visit Graceland If you are just looking to stay somewhere in Memphis you probably should look elsewhere Graceland and this hotel is several miles from Beale street and other downtown attractions Overall this place was a great value and a good time

title: A service oriented gem on Pacific Beach
text:
In an age where my low expectations of service are often consistently met  I must share the enjoyable experience I had in dealing with the staff at the Pacific Terrace Our midnight checkin was greeted with pleasant front desk staff that got us situated quickly thank you Kyla Professional concierge staff provided us with information on local attractions and dining The housekeeping staff observed we had our kids with us and made wonderful origami towel animals that delighted our 8 and 3 yr old when we returned to the room after playing at the beach Gabriela didnt hesitate and patiently took time from her duties when asked if she could show my daughter how to make them 
Every encounter I had with the staff at this hotel made us feel like welcome guests  we look forward to more stays at the Pacific Terrace

title: Can get a much nicer deal for the money Dont recommend
text: I was intrigued by all the positive reviews I read about this hotel but when my friend and I arrived we were very disappointed First of all for 170 a night for 2 people accommodations and even location should have been much better Our room had an awful smell when we came in It smelled like burnt rubber We tried to change to another room on a different floor but there was the same smell there too It was so bad that people next door to us were sitting with their door open to air out the room because their room had the same smell Then my friend went to take a shower and literally got stuck because the shower door was completely broken I had to rescue her The door was never fixed and we just kept it open out of frustration We checked out the very following day and went to a motel that wasnt too far away but was cheaper much nicer and also had the free parking Last but not least in a hurry to get out of there I forgot my phone charger in the room and when I called an hour or so later they said they never found anything I dont really believe they even looked for it which is very sad Basically I vote a no on this hotel

title: A unique hotel haunted so they stay Very comfortable rooms with an exceptional staff
text: Historical hotel which gives a unique experience The hotel is very well kept and the staff is great Be alert to the fact this is a very busy hotel with lots of weddings and social gatherings so the common spaces can be loud but never heard anything in the rooms which are well insulated All of the amenities were very nice Did I mention that the staff was great

title: Perfect Place to Celebrate an Anniversary
text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary with 9 nights at Ink48 in November We were really pleased with the hotel and its amenities As In Touch members we received a room upgrade and all of the other perks of membership like free wifi and a mini bar credit The room was large clean and very comfortable with a fantastic view The hotel even provided Aveda bath salts for the huge tub The staff was friendly and cheerful In honor of our anniversary the hotel had a bottle of bubbly and a gift box of delicious treats waiting in our room We loved the coffeetea set up in the morning and the ice water that was available all day Although we did not participate every evening the wine reception each day was a great option before heading out to dinner and a show We love to walk so the location was not an issue for us but it is a good three blocks to the nearest Metro station and farther for some lines Dinner at their restaurant Print was excellent We also really enjoyed Stecchino Wine Bar on 9th PJ Clarkes across from Lincoln Center  try the lobster BLT Caffee Ciello on 8th and picking up some take out from the Amish Market on 9th Sunday morning we took a walk along the river and then came back through Chelsea where we had a great breakfast at Le Grainne Another favorite for us is Crepes on Columbus followed by walking the full length of Central Park We met many fine local people who were all eager for us to enjoy their city It was a memorable trip

title: Not worth the money avoid if you can
text:
While I got a decent deal from priceline decent by NY standards for this hotel USD 300 a night while the hotels quote was 400500 USD it still wasnt worth the money It would not have been much different staying in a 3 star for less 
First of all the hotel is derelict and badly in need of refurbishment The room was like a shoebox with the door giving directly onto the room  which increases your exposure to the corridor noise and the bathroom small The window was small and there was no minibar  very surprising for a hotel like this one Worst of all the room was dirty see attached photos 
In addition they charge you 2 per piece of luggage you want to leave with them after checking out why that I have never seen that before This should clearly be included in the price like in any normal and decent hotel 
The location is one of the few strengths of the hotel  but then there are many others in good locations too The service was ok  no major problems on that front and thats obviously important 
But do go elsewhere if you can unless you get a great deal for the hotel which may be possible depending on the season

title: Great Place To Stay in DC
text: We really liked the Hotel Lombardy Its an old building with lots of character and charm The elevators are small and slow but thats the only minus The hotel is located a few blocks away from the mall and crowds but only two blocks away from a Metro stop from which you can go anywhere The staff was friendly and helpful The rooms are enormous and clean Ours was on the 9th floor and was very quiet For the price you wont do better in DC

title: Amazing rooms staff food location need I go on
text: I echo a lot of the reviews already here The staff were friendly and professional without being in your face nothing was too much trouble Complimentary drinks and snacks in the room and the lobby including complimentary wine at 6pm every night Amazing breakfast definitely worth the B and B option Large modern and sleek room with everything I could have wanted No bath but what the hell the shower was ace anyway Even the toiletries were gorgeous One minor thing to mention we had read that the bar was a really good place to go but it wasnt that happening when we went However we had some good cocktails there Go stay

title: Good value in great location
text: This hotel is 3 blocks west of the White House adjacent to the campus of George Washington Univ It is a converted apartment building so our room had a full kitchen and eating area which was very nice It is an older building and has been renovated with a minimalist feel but I thought for the area it was a good deal Good free internet There was only 1 elevator that was slow Like all DC hotels parking was expensive

title: NYC Family Trip
text: Hotel was great for the price Good location quite rooms Breakfast was fine Better than expected gym Only real down side was slow elevator and inability to adjust heat Would stay here again but would try their Times Square hotel if available

title: Do NOT stay here
text:
Awful place We would not stay the night  terrible odors room was dirty  bathroom was worse and even had a dirty towel still hanging on the bathroom door When we went to leave after being in the room for less than 5 minutes the front desk person shouted at us and the other families several who all wanted to check out He accused us of dirtying the towel and refused to refund our money We have filed complaints with the corporate office
We stay at many ABV inns across the country and have NEVER experienced anything as bad as this

title: Nice stay but wheres the sunlight
text:
We decided to stay locally for my birthday so we decided on the US Grant We are SPG Platinum members and got upgraded to a suite so it was definitely a nice plus 
The suite was somewhat cozy so I wonder how a regular room may look like Also we were afraid to pull up our window shades because our outside view was straight into someone elses room or bathroom 
Overall the room was lovely and we got a good rate for it but I think I would prefer to stay outside of downtown San Diego for a more spacious room with sunlight If I had to stay in downtown for a convention I would probably shop around because theres plenty of other hotels with good ratings to try

title: Not your usual Hyatt
text: Far away from all Memphis attractions Poor service Ok rooms Good price

title: Great Airport accomodations
text:
Just got back from a three night stay at this hotel The room was spacious quiet and easily accessible The staff is great Should be able to book for about 100 a nite This does not include parking which is an additional 17 per day
Beware of the free airport shuttle Its not a problem leaving the hotel to get back to the airport if you try and catch it when you first arrive they sometimes get crowded and will pass you I arrived at the United Airlines arrival area and two shuttles to the hotel passed me because they were full Ended up catching a cab Evidently United is at the end of the run

title: One year on and still excellent
text:
I wrote a review of this hotel having stayed here last year and having now just returned from my second stay here I thought I would provide an updated review
Having enjoyed my stay here last year when booking this years trip I dealt with the hotel directly to make the booking The 7 nights stay was booked very quickly and I was given the choice to pay at the time of booking or at check in this gave me the opportunity to keep an eye on the exchange rates secure the best rate I could when paying
We arrived at the hotel and through the front door it was good to be back We were immediately welcomed to the hotel There were a few guests in front of us so we had a little wait but nothing too long Our suitcases were taken to the side for us whilst we waited Whilst waiting it was evident that the professionalism and level of service had not changed as the guests before us were being dealt with quickly by the very helpful front desk staff
I am happy to report that the hotel is still as excellent as it was a year ago When our turn to check in arrived we were welcomed back this being our second stay at the hotel The staff member checking us in was very polite and processed us quickly asking if we needed anything like a map of the city etc and was quite surprised when I said I still had a map from a trip some 3 years ago 
With door key in had we were ready to head to the room Heading to the lift we were asked if we needed assistance with our luggage but having only small cases we were happy to take these ourselves Into the lift and heading to our room
This year we were staying on 24th floor in a City View room the room was the same size as our room last year which was on the 16th floor this time we had a view of the Hudson from our window I really like the rooms at this hotel they are a decent size and very comfortable with excellent amenities The addition of the coffeetea machines in the room is a plus though I still prefer the fresh coffee in the lobby each morning
The staff here are still very professional and always seem happy and nothing is too much trouble whether that be asking for directions or making a reservation at a restaurant The staff always have a smile and a welcome back  enjoy your day as you pass through reception 
The staff seem to be very proud to be a part of what makes the Distrikt Hotel such a special place and welcome comments about what is good  bad about a guests experience This can be seen when a guest last year commented about not having coffee  tea facilities in the rooms and within a day or two every room had a machine
Overall I have had yet another excellent stay at the Distrikt and cannot recommend this hotel enough I do not usually make return visits to hotels but having had two excellent stays here this is a hotel that I will not hesitate to return to so much so that I am already planning next years trip
If youre looking for a decent hotel in Manhattan that offers a bespoke service has excellent rooms excellent staff and a great location then this is it 
The hotel is still highly ranked here on trip advisor and that has to say something about the quality of this hotel 
This is a great hotel which gives a level of service and experience that in my opinion you just dont find in a lot of hotels especially ones part of big chains
If your thinking about staying here do it in my opinion you wont be disappointed

title: Beautiful hotel near the Space Needle
text:
We loved the slightly quirky design of the Maxwell and stayed in one of their level5 Duet Queen Hill rooms Service was friendly hotel and room were clean and well maintained Free parking which can get full Free wifi
Walking distance to several restaurants We liked the Bamboo Garden Chinese Vegetarian restaurant just 1 block away on Roy St We also tried the Banh Thai restaurant which was ok
Decent sized fitness room which overlooked the indoor swimming pool
Our wishlist  suggestions for improvements
1 Selfservice Laundry facilities would have been a bonus
2 Our room was located as far as you could get from the Elevators and it was quite a walk Would be nice to have a second set of elevators
3 We would have wished for a little more manouver room in the basement garage but free parking is always appreciated We were driving a minivan
4 Boost the wifi connection speeds

title: Credit Card Fraud No More
text: I am pleased to write that after a few months of disputing the unauthorized charges on my credit card Doubletree has decided to refund most of the charges just as a courtesy It was neither theirs nor my fault that the charges were unpaid I am very greatful for this polite gesture I will definitely be back aside from the credit card situation our stay was very pleasant The rooms were comfortable and clean and the warm cookies at check in were to DIE for Thanks for all your help Joanie  I really appreciate it

title: Very Nice Would definitely stay again
text: My handicapped brother and I stayed here Aug 1115 for Elvis Week It was a very nice property  very clean and new The room was amazing  very spacious and had everything we needed It had two queen beds that were extremely comfortable as well as a large pull out sofa and kitchenette We requested a handicap room and the bathroom was wonderful It was very large with a rollin shower The pool was clean as well as the area surrounding the pool Everything was well maintained at this property The free breakfast was delicious with lots to choose from including a fantastic waffle maker You could eat indoors or outside They were in the process of setting up a nice little bar area in the lobby while I was there They have two computers in the lobby that you can use for free Elevators were spacious and fast The staff were outstanding Im sorry I didnt get the name of the lady who was extremely helpful in getting our handicap room keys so I could mention her here There was a gentleman named Kevin who was also very nice and helpful the shorter of the 2 Kevins The best part was the location You walk out the door and right onto the 100 trolley downtown to Beale St or you could walk 10 mins  I timed it twice It was on a very lovely tree lined street with a park across the street as well as a Walgreens and great restaurants Sams on the corner had a wonderful chicken breast sandwich  fries for 650 Another restaurant on the next corner called The Flight I think was also very nice  a little more elegant and a little more pricey but very good food  1126 for chicken or steak dinner depending on the size you order Beale St had a great bar called Wet Willies I highly recommend this property

title: Average stay at central hotel
text:
We stayed at this central hotel was very average but close enough to centre Service was fairly decent but just found some basics were missing for a hotel that should be 4 star Easy to take the streetcar to the wharf and to take No30 to Chinatown It was nice trip whether was hot in early November we couldnt wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel 
Expensive to eat in hotel we went out to Chinatown 
Restaurants are average in SF Airport  watch out for the shuttle bus Do not be conned to take one even if they appear to be in a nice shirt and tie the drivers are dodgy be aware It cost 35 when it shoud have been 32 better to take a taxi it is actually cheaper 32 Finally when you book online via travelocity you get a good deal and also get tonnes of spam just be sure you use an email you dont care about Travelocity naughty naughty you spammed me and sold my email to make money did you not Tut tut will not book through you next time for that so I hope you learn next time Overall I would say this is an average hotel probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holidayand I am extremely fussy Perhaps not the most convenient if all you want to do is walk around abit

title: Stay somewhere closer
