text: The hotel itself is in a historic building with art deco design However the furniturebedmattresscarpet dont appear to have been updated or changed since the thing was built The room was mostly clean however it gives off a dirty appearance when the furniture is all cracked scuffed and broken Walls were dirty with some handprints and the carpet was worn and had several dark stains in one area of the room The mattress was terrible  felt like it could bend underneath you and fold you up The heater was terribly noisy one of the nights we were there and the walls are extremely thin so that we could hear whoever was in the hallway the room next to us the room above and the room below The positive part about the hotel is that the staff were very friendly and nice If we had a question they were happy to answer and they offered to call a car service upon our departure This hotel does not offer free internet which was hugely disappointing but not surprising considering everything in the hotel was from about 87 years ago It is advertised as Midtown East on Pricelines website but this was at the very furthest end of that far from most attractions We would not stay here again based on the room and location We would gladly have paid a little more for a better room and location

title: Nice Room great location
text: Found this location on line Hotel was great People were great also

title: Great friendly service
text: I stayed at Le Meridien for an outside meeting It was an easy walk to the Ferry building I loved the rooms The extended hour concierges were extremely helpfulI had gone to St Regis too much attitude to check it out for a drink and I greatly prefer the service at the bar at Le Meridien The service at the Le Meridien bar was great professional yet friendlyI realy enjoyed the view from my room of the bay bridge My only comment is that the CD player in my room was glued to the counter and too high for me to read the dials  I will stay there again with my I pod

title: Go elsewhere
text: We stayed for two nights in September and after having stayed at Le Meridien in Chicago this was a major disappointment No one was at the door when I arrived which meant shlepping my large suitcase up the stairs there is no handicapped sloped platform which would have made life easier The lobby while rather grand in spots has all the charm of a convention center The front desk folks were busy but did their job efficiently But what greets you upstairs really scares you  hallways that are narrow dingily lit and rather institutional We were upgraded to a larger room but the bathroom was no bigger than a closet And if there was no one at the front entrance when I arrived there were two doormen and one other guy didnt know what HIS role was standing around chatting while I dragged my bag to the car This place needs a major makeover and a change of staff Go elsewhere

title: Hawthorne was great
text: My visit to the Hawthorne was pleasurable compared to recent reviewers comments It was not the nicest hotel room but I found it clean and responsive to any of my needs such as a refrigerator n my room I didnt have a suite Internet was free and the breakfast was one of the better ones for a hotel eggs bacon refried beans potatoes cereal fruit yogurt etc And it was good There was a happy hour in the evening They also have shuttle service I did not see ANY bugs of ANY kind I would return to this hotel

title: Excellent location and service
text: After arriving in NY at midnight exhausted and in the middle of a heatwave the staff at Wellington hotel were fabulous We had someone help us straight up to our to room which already had the air con for us The hotel is perfectly situated inbetween Central Park  Times Square both only short walks  straight across from the famous Carnegie Deli All the staff were extremely polite  helpful in every way The rooms were on the smaller side but in a city like NY I doubt u go there to hang out in ur hotel room so it was just perfect

title: Very Nice Hotel
text:
As 35 star hotels go Id say this is a 5 star 35 star hotel based on my experience
Very clean and well maintained
Awesome indooroutdoor pool
Pretty decent gym
Only about 1012 minutes from downtown and 15 mins to the stadium
About 2 minutes to food and grocery store
However they didnt have free continental breakfast Probably because this a business hotel with restaurant
Should also mention that I forgot my cell phone charger in the room and when I called them to check for it they found it and shipped it to me in Toronto by registered mail for free

title: Nice location and clean but old and shady
text:
At Hotel Carter you get a cheap room in a great location half a block away from Times Square So there are concessions to be made The entrance and lobby of the hotel looks like they are in the middle of a renovation except that nobody is working to actually renovate The elevators make weird noises and should probably be displayed in a museum Everything needs a new coat of paint
Our room was small but clean It had a large closet which lacked a light and had a single coat hanger The bathroom was large and clean and the shower was very good
The interactions with the hotel staff were good and they were quick to provide us with additional pillows

title: Just OK for business traveler
text:
I stayed here for two nights after arriving at the airport I didnt have a car which was a problem as there is no restaurant at the hotel just snacks and the only close ones are fast food places So if youre looking for a decent place for dinner its not easy There is a sports bar a 12 minute walk away but if its raining youre out of luck Ironically theres another Hyatt Place right next to it They have a shuttle but you better plan plenty of time to get it both times I tried the wait was over 20 minutes  for it just to arrive I walked instead
The internet is another problem Although they have free wifi its pretty slow and seemed to slow down at night probably because everyone was using it This is compounded by the poor ATT cell service Its non existent in the lobby and spotty in the rooms
On the plus side they have a very nice continental breakfast free newspapers including the WSJ the rooms are spacious and nicely appointed 
But for a business traveler without a car Id skip it Youre isolated both physically and digitally

title: just as expected for Hilton super cute for the price  distance from city
text: This airport hilton used to be a military control tower Converted into a cute eclectic hilton Round funky building with a huge rotunda restaurant Everything you expect when you walk into a hilton Of course knowing you are at the airport and plane traffic I didnt have a problem with any noise Updated furnishings with mild texas twist not country or anything too crazy but Ill call it southern touch City was close with a car and this hilton was half the price as the one downtown I enjoyed my stay and my meal

title: Best view service and SO much fun
text: We stayed here for our 14 year anniversary and my birthday And WOW what a great time we had The staff was SUPER Friendly and a little tip check out their social media it will be worth your while One of the best parts our room was on the 9th floor facing the riverMichigan Ave during the day you could see the wonderful city and at night there was the beautiful Wrigley Buidling Everything about our trip was wonderful and you could not be in a better location than this the views from everywhere are wonderful and have a drink in the Big Bar that is a great one right in your hotel Oh I almost forgot DO NOT forget your workout clothes Their fitness center is a dream come true And you need that in a city with such wonderful cuisine

title: The Unexpected Gem with Unbelievable Service
text: I found Symphony Inn due to good reports from other people on tripadvisor It was in a price range that was unbelievably low so I was a little skeptical though the reviews were solid I booked five nights on a business trip and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the bed Its better than the one I have at home and mine is a very high quality mattress The room was spotlessly clean and the bath area had been recently remodeled with very high quality tile and a pattern even It was a suitesized space with a love seat king bed fridge microwave CD player and DVD player Now for the fun of the place When I turned the lights off at night stars glowed on the walls and the ceilings There was a blacklight and some really neat murals on the walls When I came the first time I had asked for bedside lights to read by since the room didnt have any I also could not get wireless plus had a broken bathplug When I came to my room later the same day as mentioning it to the manager the tub was fixed I had a hardwire cord in my room for internet and two bedside lamps I was so impressed Any property can have issues but its how quick they are addressed that makes such a difference This was whiplash fast Now for the really good part I came back two weeks later for an overnight trip When I arrived to check in the same nice manager had the same room reserved for me He greeted me warmly and said he had the room I liked the lamps and the internet ready for me I was so touched to see what a great memory he had and how helpful he was You know its really great to have people care about what they do and to do it the best they can I travel a lot for business and I must say that I really feel welcome here like my business matters You dont get that much these days especially for a such a great value

title: Please dont tell anyone about this hotel
text:
We stayed here in a 1 BR suite with two adults and three small children This was a phenomenal deal The room was very spacious and well decorated The beds were comfortable and the kitchenette was great for small meals eg bagels for breakfast The staff was also very helpful and my daughters loved the little tea room in the lobby
I also like that it is in a real NYC neighborhood  not midtown or god forbid Times Square If you want to be a hardcore tourist this may not be the hotel for you

title: Nice Stay
text:
We recently stayed 2 nights at Hotel Palomar in Washington DC Overall it was a good choice 
The hotel was easy to find and Dupont Circle is a great place to stay I was especially glad we picked this neighborhood after seeing the other areas of DC closer to the sites which seemed pretty dead after dark We felt safe walking around after dark and it was convenient to so many restaurants and bars as well as the metro CVS is very close in the event you forgot anything We took the metro most places but took a cab to Georgetown for shopping We were told it was about a 20 minute walk but we were too tired at the end of the day to walk it and the metro does not go to Georgetown Cab ride to Georgetown cost about 10 each way 
The lobby of the hotel is decorated well All the staff we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful We stayed in a room with one queen bed Since many reviewers on here were raving about the spaciousness of the rooms we were pretty surprised when we got to our room It was very small with hardly any room to walk in between the end of the bed and the tv The only other seating in the room other than the bed was a small bench that was against the window So if a spacious room is important to you make sure you book something other than a queen room However the decor of the room was nice and the bedding was comfortable The room was also very clean We had no problems with noise 
The air conditioning worked very well and the dimmable lights were a nice touch One annoyance was the lack of a fan in the bathroom The room we stayed in had no separate area to put on makeup so without a fan the bathroom mirror was completely steamed up The hotel advertises turn down service but this was not provided either night We wanted to take a dip in the pool but when we tried to access it it was closed even though it was still daylight out That was very disappointing I was a little worried with the pet friendly policy but the room showed no traces of any prior pets and the few dogs we came in contact with were very well behaved 
As far as the valet parking goes when we called for our car on the day we left it arrived in less than 5 minutes so we had no problems with that 
As advertised the hotel matched the discount price I found on hotelscom without a hassle 
I liked this hotel and will definitely look into their other hotels when traveling

title: Horrible and smelly
text:
The minute I walked into the lobby I encountered a foul smell The second floor had a different but almost equally foul smell The room itself smelled of chemicals which was an improvement over the other areas of the hotel The rooms are old the mattress was old and had only a thin worn sheet on it no mattress pad The toilet made a very loud noise when flushing Im sure the people next door hated it just as much The deadbolt lock would stick and made it difficult to get the door open if you used it Basically I felt like I didnt want to touch anything I asked for an extra sheet so that I could have two sheets underneath me because no matress pad and one on top and not have to touch the blankets The only positive things about this place which DONT balance out the negatives are the location central to S Congress shops and restaurants Barton Springs downtown and the friendly staff The facility itself stinks literally The outside is very misleading it looks fairly new but the inside is gross 
This is the first time Ive felt compelled to write a review on a hotel It was THAT bad

title: Not as good as it should have been But ok
text:
We are HHonors Gold Members We favor Homewood and Embassys for the room when we travel with family This was our big trip of the summer The 2nd half was at this Homewood The location is ok We needed to be in between San Diego and Carlsbad so it worked for that It wasnt real convenient to San Diego There is nothing near by except a Hilton Garden Inn The spa and restaurant they described on the Homewood website is really next door 
The room and hotel were an average HS What we werent excited about several things 1st time ever a homewood charged us to upgrade to a room with two beds we had three people We were there on rewards and at this hotel that isnt good enough for two beds Ive stayed at many many HSs and never had this happen Parking is extremely limited Come home early No wifi in the rooms Only one wired connection We run ecommerce businesses and we travel with two to three laptops phones that would benefit from wifi and other stuff Ridiculous in this day and age that you have to go to the lobby for a Wifi connection The breakfast closed early at 2 out of the 3 days we tried to make it the 3rd had very little selection available and wasnt quickly replenished 3 breakfast burritos and the family in front took all of those The evening reception we never saw open Im sure it must have been but again not for the posted hours 
Again we love HS but this one did not do it for us

title: Friendly service huge room good location
text: The St Giles was conveniently located within walking distance to Grand Central Station and Madison Square Garden Our room on the second floor was large clean and comfortable The bed was great with nice linens and pillows The temperature in the room was hard to regulate but it kept us very warm The shower head didnt have a lot of pressure but these were minor complaints compared to all the positives

title: Standard Hampton Good Location
text:
The hotel itself is your standard Hampton Inn which is why I stay at Hamptonsyou know what to expect The location was literally right next to the Convention Center and a short walk from Old City The room was nice and our bathroom was large When I first saw the breakfast room around 715 am for a cup of tea I was pleasantly surprised at how large it was Then I went back a little after 9 for breakfast and was so packed we couldnt walk Eat early or dont bother
I had trouble sleeping because the AC unit was pretty loud and obviously kept kicking on but it will only bother you if you are a light sleeper my husband slept fine anbd wasnt bothered by it at all
The parking lot is just past the main entrance on the right side It is 25 to self park and they take credit cards I think it is called Patriot parking They tell you where to park and you keep your key It is not covered
The only snag we hit was asking the front desk staff for help with directions Two different people couldnt help us and one said they didnt have a metro We just used the map app on our phones and figured it out Fortunately we happened to be asking during the free cookie hour so it made up for it

title: The Mariott can handle a crowd
text: We stayed here for one night and we were quite pleased  The hotel was booked solid but its such a big hotel it never felt crowded We received a complimentary upgrade to a room with a better view on the 32nd floor and it was very quiet and spacious Had a light lunch at the Katen Sushi Bar and it was reasonable We had 530 reservations at the View restaurant but decided to eat in the View lounge instead 2795 pp for the buffet The deserts were good but the dinner items were just ok And of course the view of NY was fantastic My daughter was hungry at the end of the evening and ordered room service Although I was hesitant to pay 10 for the double hotdog item listed it did come with a hefty order of steak fries and arrived within 30 minutes Service throughout the hotel was great Elevators were not a problem the longest wait was 1012 minutes when we left The View lounge to go to an 8 pm show and again when we came in from the show around 11pm Only complaint is we wanted to make a quick bathroom stop as we left for the show and decided to use the bathrooms on the 3rd floor where the Marquis is on our way out The line was so long and we were surprised that there were not more bathrooms Check out was super quick All in all we would stay here again great location

title: Beautiful Hotel  I couldnt believe it was a Holiday Inn
text:
I just stayed here this weekend and the hotel wasnt like any Holiday Inn I have seen before The front desk associate told me it was a new design of Holiday Inn Everything was new and clean It is very close to the airport and there is a sports bar attached It reminded me more of a Marriott then a Holiday Inn 
There is also a Holiday Inn Express in the rear of the hotel which is seperate from this Holiday Inn

title: wonderful customer service
text: We stayed over night before our cruise on September 10 The employees from the front desk to the shuttle drivers were all very friendly willing to answer any of our questions with a smile The hotel is not in a great area but I never felt unsafe the rooms were spacious and clean We appreciated the free shuttle service to the inner harbor and pick up after Also the free shuttle service back and forth from the cruise port The free breakfast in the morning was plenty and good The great thing about this hotel is they have a cruise package if you are going on a cruise you can leave your car there for no extra charge I would absolutely recommend this hotel and I would stay here again Thanks to a staff for a job well done

title: Not bad at all
text:
I was somewhat concerned about this hotel because I did not find any recommendations and I really just booked it because it was the cheapest hotel I could find in Manhattan at Christmastime
I stayed here 10 straight days including having my family with me for 2 of the days
I know New York and I love it however West 57th is VERY noisy all night long Perhaps its the easy access to the Westside Highway but emergency vehicles are almost constantly coming down 57th It is also the preferred route for UPS tractor trailers for some reason I had a third floor room so I heard everything For those who might have trouble sleeping in those conditions  be warned
I had a room with double beds and it is a very spacious room for NYC at the rate I paid The bathroom is ok clean everything works Housekeeping was excellent and when my kids were there and made a mess the room was spotless when we returned 
The bedspreads are disgusting and you just want to tear them off immediately Chintzy old flimsy bedspreads straight from the 80s They need to upgrade Otherwise bedding was decent and clean Double beds were very small and some adults might find them too small to sleep two people
Restaurant has excellent breakfast but a little pricey Wait staff was all very nice General hotel Staff for the most part was very pleasant Concierge is a very nice lady
Several decent places to eat along 57th I liked the Morningstar on 9th and 57th and went there once for breakfast twice for dinner
On one of my last nights there I had to perform an emergency computer repair and was in need of a phillips head screwdriver I dont normally carry those kind of tools so I called front desk and asked if I could borrow one from engineering They said they would call and send someone up I had my doubts about whether it would really happen but 10 minutes later a maintenance guy was at my door and allowed me to use his screwdriver He stopped by about 12 hr later to retrieve it I just thought that was unusually good service for such an odd request It was a pleasant surprise
I did not drive into the city but if you were driving in this is a great hotel as you can get right off the Westside Highway and park in their garage for a very reasonable price

title: Had a great stay
text: Stayed at the Fort Worth Hilton one night with a couple of friends and had a great experience The front desk staff was very friendly check in was super fast and easy the valet attendants were extremely helpful and our room was nicer than expected Overall we had a fantastic stay here

title: Liked the central location and excellent customer care to make the trip enjoyable
text:
Our family stayed at the Marriott Courtyard at Copley Sq in Boston over the last few days Excellent location in the middle of the city with easy access to subways and buses as well as within walking distance of the shopping areas of Newbury Street
The rooms are spacious and clean and the front desk staff very helpful and personable They want to make your trip enjoyable and comfortable Overall it is a well trained team with excellent customer care Great service

title: my new favorite place
text:
My hubby and I travel to Chicago annually and stayed here at the recommendation of our friends for the first time this past weekend 
we took an early flight and were allowed to pre check in 8 am and our room was ready by noon they upgraded us to a corner suite which over looked the Chicago river The bed and linens were wonderful 
I have no complaints about the hotel employees and felt like they really tried to make our stay as enjoyable as possible I have only two things that I didnt like
lighting in the room was horrible especially the bathroom they do have a make up mirror but the room was soo dark this could easily be fixed and im over it 
two drinks at the bar in the lobby bacardi coke and a grey goose gimlet were 2700 I understand we are in Chicago but it just seemed excessive the bartender was very nice and the bar was welcoming other than that i have nothing at all to say that isnt 100 positive
it may be worth noting that ive stayed in the Four Seasons Hotel Palomar and Hotel Sax while visiting chicago I would say the Westin is my new favorite along with Palomar 
well be back

title: Great location service average
text:
Great location comfortable hotel 
Service in bar average yet food quite good

title: Harbor Court very nice and relaxed
text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Harbor Court on the weekend of december 2628 for two nights WIth both of us being kimpton in touch members we received an email from kimpton with a pretty good promotion So we booked the room and then after reading tripadvisor contacted the manager Jason Stone via email and hw was generous enough to offer us a complimentary room upgrade to a king Unfortunately Jason wasnt available to personally thank while we stayed at the hotel Dulce and John at the front were very helpful and friendly The wine hour is a great kimpton staple and I really enjoyed the living room area of the Harbor court It was pretty quiet and relaxing even though many guests were enjoying the wine hour Definitely a difference with the other kimpton hotels union square hotels that seem to have too much traffic Had dinner accross the street at sinbads and also a couple doors down at mexico df both highly recommended Satuday was able to go to the farmers marker right accross the street which was fun Also the F line streetcar runs very near the hotel so you can take that to get to fishermans wharf or union square in no time

title: very clean and nice hotelgood locationgood staff
text: it was our third visit to the USA and we where lucky to find the best accommodation and very high value for moneyvery good location clean and nice hotel very good staff

title: Great location but very small rooms
text:
We went to this hotel in a group of 22 We had to wait 20 mins to get the keys to go up because they werent ready for us Then we all go in to go to the 11 12 or 14th floors but waited 20 mins because the hotel staff was using both elevators Instead of them using only one We then walked into the smallest room ever 
On the 2nd day of the 4 days the ac stopped working I called and she said it was the battery in the wall unit and it would be fixed We came back about 2 that afternoon and I called down and told them it is displaying numbers but the unit will nit work We left and came back about 8 It wasnt working I called down and the woman at the desk said that there was no one to fix it So I just waited on the phone and she didnt suggest anything to do so I asked her well what are you going to do for me She said that she would call me back 30 mins later when I didnt hear from her I called back down and she tried to ignore me So I let it ring about 30 times the mgr gets on the phone I asked for at least a fan She does bring it in about 10 mins I was hot all night The next morning I went down and asked the lady at the desk I wanted to make sure my room was on a list to get the ac fixed It wasnt so I added it It was fixed by the time we got back hours later
We also had to get our own wash clothes because I guess u need towels and hand towels but no wash clothes They didnt pick up the garbage from the floor area but 1 day of the 4 There were hairs in the tub on the towels and in the sink 
The good thing about this hotel is the location It was located near Michigan avenue a lot of shopping and dinning

title: Not what I was expecting
text:
ProsThe hotel had many little things that just made me smile because they were an effort to show they wanted to please their customers laundry basket scale free treats in a basket in room pilllow menu cd player on alarm clock dvd player with dvd selections in lobby books to borrow in lobby as well little store in lobby free dessert and coffee in the lobby evening The hotel was CLEAN which is the only thing I care about when hotel shopping The desk staff was courteous and knew the area well to direct help me downtown with a map and directions Bed was comfy and room had basic amenities Quiet location Breakfast although not gourmet had hot options and offered a nice little selection 
ConsThe location is not really near anything but is within 5 miles of the downtown area Im really trying here as I am usually quite picky but on this stay we did not have any negative experiences 
Overall this is not what you would expect or receive from your average 2 star hotel I think they have the amenities at this location probably put them in the 3 star range although Super 8 arent traditionally 3 star hotels I read the reviews so we were not too surprised about what they offered so it lived up to the ratings For the price this location was a winner

title: The Best
text: This is by far the best Hampton Inn that weve stayed at The quality of this hotel is superior from the lobby on up to the rooms themselves It was so nice that we extended our stay an extra night  the beds are fantastic nice breakfast assortment lots of parking and its only a few minutes to everything around San Diego There are a few restaurants down the road from Panda Express to Subway Check in and out was easy quick and professional  hotel was extremely clean Only minor flaw was that there is some sort of convention center behind the hotel and they were having a loud concert of some sort for a while  other than that its an absolutely fantastic place

title: customer service so terrible I never even got to book a room
text:
Called the new W Boston to book a WOW suite for a specail anniversary
Got the run around from reservation clerk who tranferred me to someone else That person told me to hang on as the phone is ringing off the hook I waited for about 5 minutes when he returned he told me he couldnt reserve a WOW suite without going to corporate sales On hold again he came back and said could he call me back Unbelievable He NEVER called me back This am I called and spoke to the W Boston hotel reservations manager and he barely appologized That is it for the W what horrid service I have booked at the Four Seasons instead

title: Everything extra
text: front desk is nice the room decor is outdated WiFi should be free they want to charge for everything

title: location location
text: This is probably the most convenient of the various PHL airport hotels other than staying at the Marriott at the airport Next time though I think thats where Ill stay Ive stayed at this Embassy Suites four times in the past few years simply because its convenient But this place has proven consistently to be a dump A few highlights from this stay My room had a dirty overflowed toilet didnt the housekeeper even look at it water glasses which didnt appear clean the pillows had the pillowcases in tight knots never seen anything like thisit was like the housekeeper was being either malicious or bored the rock music on the intercom played LOUD until sometime after 11PM the lazy person at checkin gave me incorrect instructions on signing into the Internet so I had to call down to get it right etc I am SO done with this mediocre place

title: UpDate  revisiting this hotel
text:
Based on my previous experience I returned for a nine day stay over the Christmas 2007 holiday
Again found the hotel clean staff helpful room service good accomodations pleasant and location good for Beverly Hills  Westwood  Century City
THe update is this first they are building some big apartment building across the street The pile drivers and saws started earlyat least up until the day before Christmas Be aware that this construction looks to be going on for some time to comethough the noise from it will likely deminish as time goes on However we found it difficult to stay asleep much beyond 730 am on the days they were working especially true if you open the windows to let in fresh air
Second hotel rehabbing is ongoing THe main lobby area has been closed off One of the elevators wasnt working Clearly some rooms were in the process of being redone They said they were looking at a copule of months workthen they would be raising their rates to about 375 per room per night above the very reasonable for location and siize I paid Still the accomodations were a better bargain than some other suite hotels in the areabut the potential price increase will move it out of the good deal catagory
Third when we were there in October our room had a regular matress that was one of the more comfortable hotel beds my wife and I ever slpet in This time we had one of those temperpedic sp matressesie foam that seems to mold around your body Far less happy with thatthough I am sure some like it It felt like we were sleeping on sand and also made the bed hot IMO Much perferred the oldstyle matress this would cause us to reconsider staying there again as we never felt we got a great night sleep
Fourth the water pressure in our room was problematic There were problems when we mentioned it to the desk they seemed to hop to and get it fixed but it seems like more problems with water pressure were looming given the hotel rehabbing
Overall we continue to like this hotel Having a full kitchen available as well as living room and eatin dinning room for the price we paid in Beverly HillsWestwood was terrific We gave it a higher rating the first time we stayed It is still a good hotel but price and conditions may reduce its desirability affordability and many of its good points

title: Comfortable and cozy
text: I was pleasantly surprised upon my arrival to find a wellappointed and spacious suite for such a modest cost The entire property was wellmaintained staff was very cordial and services were prompt I could not have asked for more I look forward to returning on my next visit to the San Antonio area

title: Nice rooms fair price
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights on business Hotel is in the process of becoming a Hyatt Plaza property Breakfast was included and very good Dinning was limited due to construction Staff was friendly and helpful 
King size bed was comfortable 42 plasma TV and free Internet worked fine

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel and great location Middle of the city not far from Union Square The hotel also offers transportation to the city and the pier Nice rooms and bathroom Very comfortable beds The staff is very friendly and accommodating go above and beyond to meet your needs The best part is there is complementary breakfast with a nice view on the roof top Would definitely recommend The Cova Hotel

title: Windy City MustSees Just Steps Away
text: I love Chicago its a helluva town Whenever Im in town for business that requires me to stay downtown I stay at the Embassy Suites Hotel Chicago Downtown The property itself is beautiful the atrium is aweinspiring and the rooms are wonderfully appointed The managers reception is always a great networking opportunity though get there early if you want a free drink Free breakfast great atmosphere lots of meeting space  perfect location too

title: clean and comfortable but bizarre location and facia
text: It may be Philadelphia but this hotel was in a non descript street does not look much from the outside and blink as you drive past and you would miss it The rooms were well appointed and comfortable though ac was a bit ropey Staff and atmosphere non existent All in all stay here if you want ok room and have were with all to find your own way about the city Very impersonal

title: Great Stay
text: This hotel was a great find It is conveniently located next to a number of resturants and donut shops It is both clean and inviting and the staff is extremely good at what they do The front desk help was kind and considerate towards our children and made them feel like they were at a home away from home The breakfast offered is not just donuts and juice but a mix of hot and cold items including biscuits and gravy eggs cereal waffles etc The best part about breakfast is the host Most hotels that offer food have a staff that keeps the food stocked but this hotel has an actual host that cares enough to ask how your stay is going sings songs and genuinely enjoys brightening your day The rooms are spacious and the beds are plush The best stay we have had in a very long time

title: The perfect stay
text:
Traveling for business and must say that I thoroughly enjoyed the stay
Lynn and Antonio at the front desk were welcoming and knowledgeable The housekeeping staff very kind and helpful the shower worked by pulling down on the faucet in the tub and that was new to me
Our business meeting was in the hotel and facilities were excellent
Continental breakfast tasty and fruit very fresh and plentiful
Walking distance to some great restaurants 
All in all a perfect business trip

title: Wont go back
text:
My stay at the Crowne Plaza Charlotte left a lot to be desired I drove around the block twice upon arrival because the front entrance to the hotel was not clearly marked and the hotels shuttles were blocking the doors The front desk staff wasnt exactly rude but they were in no way polite They acted like I was interrupting their conversation
I was given a room right next to the elevator although the hotel was clearly all but empty Upon getting to my room I found a CD of soothing music that the Crowne Plaza provides to guests to help them relax I soon learned that this CD is apparently intended to help you drown out the noise that bleeds through the walls I could hear every word of the telephone conversation that occurred in the room next to me and the racket from the elevator kept me up all night 
The bed was one of the worst I have ever encountered There were crumbs and little pieces of chocolate on top of the clean comforter when I got ready for bed and the pillows felt more like old afghans stuffed into pillowcases The room itself was dingy the furniture was in terrible shape and the thermostat was dysfunctional The temperature fluctuated between 6580 degrees all night In addition there was a floodlight pointed straight into my window from the parking deck below The hotel staff had thoughtfully provided a clothespin so that you could shut the curtains but enough light made it through that I did not have to turn on a lamp to read  and I did plenty of reading that night since it was impossible to sleep
I generally try to be optimistic and laid back when traveling but the Crowne Plaza Charlotte really tested my patience I dont like to complain and since I was only staying one night I decided not to contact the front desk about all of these problems As a result I got about an hour and a half of sleep on the night before my business meeting and I will never stay at the Crowne Plaza again

title: Potential If They Address Maintenance and Cleanliness
text: This hotel has potential but is far from there I would not go back until a major overahaul is done I travel a lot on business so a clean hotel that is well maintained is a must I do not need a four star hotel just a reliable hotel The bathroom shower had peeling paint There were stains on the carpet and on a blanket

title: Favorite Place to Stay in Boston
text:
Quiet even though it is at a busy intersection 
Comfortable clean pleasant staff continental 
breakfast Close to many resturants and historical
spots Just great all around

title: Very nice place to stay  Great staff  great location
text: We had our wedding ceremony  reception here at the Sofitel and a lot of our guests also stayed here for the weekend The overall consensus was that the staff were extremely accommodating genuinely friendly and super attentive The rooms are great but mainly its the great service that you get here Would also recommend based on its convenient location  just a few blocks from the magnificent mile

title: Great deals available for good quality hotel downtown
text:
We booked on the hotels website which offers great deals particularly if booked in advance
We had a room with 2 queen beds 2 breakfasts valet parking and a gift certificate for 50 in the Galleria mall all for 159 Feb 07 Amazing value 
Not too much to say really good checkin good quality coffee and coffee maker in room pool nice and breakfast very good As we were there for a Saturday morning there was an omelette bar 
Good facilities for printing out your Boarding Pass in the business suite next to the breakfast room

title: Dupont Circle Getaway
text: Hotel is a great location in Washington DC Excellent shops and restaurants and nightlife to choose from Georgetown a short walk Metrostop is 3 blocks from hotel to get you into downtown dc for all your sites Excellent coffee shop in Dupont  DolceZZA for excellent Cappucinos and gelatothis is a must visit Hotel was very clean staff was pleasant and helpfull and a Happy Houry everday from 56 PM Great area to stay Only downside was the slow elevators

title: Great place for the whole family
text: Very nice place to stay The water park is great if you have kids Worth the money Lots of places to eat near by

title: Awsome
text:
This place was great We booked 3 nights and added on a 4th night because we liked it so much The staff was great very friendly and helpful The property is beautiful overlooking the water and in a very safe location which was important to us because we had our kids with us Our room was amazing it was a mini suite with a kitchenette overlooking the water with a patio There was a bedroom with seperate living room it even had a pull out sofa bed which we didnt even realize until the 2nd day that was a plus with the kids We only paid 89 a night which was a great deal I think they must be slow because their regular rate is much higher Overall it was just a great stay and we would stay there again anytime we go to SD
My few complaints our remote didnt work and even changing the chanel on the tv itself didnt work most of the time maintenance came up but only brought a new remote that didnt fix the problem but they were very friendly Also room service went ahead and charged an 18 tip without telling us so we ended up tipping an extra 5 on top of it The food was ok and kind of expensive I would not really recommend it but what can you expect from room service They also had another guest with the same name as my husband and ended up mixing up our 2 reservations with caused some problems with the keys but they tried to fix it right away

title: What a Great Hotel
text: Dont understand the complaints on this website about this hotel We stayed here for two nights in late August and loved everything about it First the location was great It was within walking distance of both the waterfront and Pike Place Market and we could easily take the monorail to the Space Needle There are hills in Seattle so if you have someone with you who has trouble walking you may want to consider taking a bus or taxi Both the lobby and the room were nicely decorated and the staff was very helpful Being on Pioneer Square meant that we could go next door or right across the street to get a drink andor something to eat Of course we didnt walk through the square at night because of the street people who hung out there but thats just common sense We were never bothered by anyone and because this hotel is so well located we were able to easily enjoy this great city If youre worried about street noise call the hotel directly and ask for an interior room We had an interior king and it was very quiet We plan to return to Seattle and when we do well stay at the Best Western Pioneer Square Hotel again

title: Disappointing compared with last years stay
text:
I stayed here last year and had a great stay and susequently left an excellent rating However my stay in the king george this year was a big disappointment the room was smaller which in itself would not be an issue but housekeeping was terrible our room was only half serviced each day towels were rarely changed over the 5 night stay coffee was never topped up in the room and the musty smell in the room was very annoying The radiators made a loud rattle or humming sounds which we were told was because the heating is on an old steam system We didnt experience this problem in the rooms we stayed in the year before In addition to this there must have been a leak from the radiator as the carpet alongside the radiator was saturated and i can only assume most likely responsible for the musty smell in the room
The were a few things about the hotel that helped keep up the rating 
1 Its location
2 The staff FrontDesk and especially Drew in the Bar
The hotel as I stated in my previous review of the hotel is excellent only a block from BART shopping and other activities
The staff in the hotel were at all time friendly and polite However our best experience was in the hotel Bar at night We spent a lot of time this year in the hotel bar and were entertained each night by drew the barman We met drew during our previous stay at the hotel in 2007 and at that time were impressed at his ability to relate to each person in the bar 
Again this year he remembered us and couldnt have been anymore helpful and friendly
Another great thing about the frontdesk staff was the facility in place to advise and arrange our daytime tours and taxis to the airport 
It is these staff in the hotel that made our experience more comfortable considering the unexpected drop in standard of the rooms compared to our previous stay there
Another improvement in the hotels offering was the change to the breakfast menu a self service buffet replaced the original overpriced menu The variety on offer had increased making it more suited to our needs

title: Bed bugs Good price Good location
text:
I have stayed at this place twice before with no problems I am actually quite disapoined that I was bitten so badly this time I wont be back
While I can understand that bed bugs can happen anywhere The staff was compleatly unhelpful  Even when I showed them a bug I had actually caught and trapped in a cup Not to mention the numerous bites all over my body 
I liked this place because it is one of the cheepest in SF And it comes with a microwave and a minifridge in all the rooms 
It is definatly not the cleanest place inside or out But it is not disgusting or anything I dont like the tile floor in all the rooms either Its cold to walk on
The location might be scary for some people who are not used to big cities 
This was my first time having been bitten by bed bugs It was terrible Maybe I am allergic or something I ended up going to the emergency room because the swelling from the bites was so intense It took about two weeks for the bites to fully disappear
Someting interesting to note as well
My boyfriend slept in the same bed with me and did not recieve any bites I think this is interesting because I just read something similar in another review for this place
It seems as though bed bugs do prefer some people over others or maybe women over men

title: Not bad but great location
text:
I stayed here 3 nights in September while attending a conference at the Convention Center Supposedly the taxi fare is 32 from the airport as adverstised on the cab window but none of my colleagues or I got that rate Something about extra taxes due to the airport Our fares all ranged from 3845 The bellman at the Hilton were all very welcoming and friendly and the front desk was nice enough I checked in at noon well ahead of the 3pm check in time 
The room was clean and fairly uptodate The downside was that the bathroom was very tiny It was quite awkward getting in and out of the bathroom to close the door Also the hangers for the closet had the tiny hooks so they couldnt be used on a normal clothes rod in order to help combat theft As a result of this you couldnt hang your clothes just anywhere The only place besides the closet was a tiny hook on the back of the bathroom door This became quite annoying very quickly when getting ready 
On my last night there it was after 10 pm at night and I heard the sink make a funny gurgling noise When I looked in there it was full of brownish black water I called the front desk and someone came up and had it fixed within half an hour I dont know if this was an ongoing problem as my neighbor had the same problem that night but the response was quick and was taken care of quickly 
The location of this hotel cant be beat We were two blocks away from the convention center and about 56 blocks from Pikes Street Market I walked down there 3 times during my stay The walk down is all downhill and the walk back can be quite a challenge depending on which way you come back If you walk down University street which the Hilton sits on it will take you straight to Pier 57 where youll find many restaurants We ate at the Crab Pot one night where they have a crab boil and dump all the goods on the table for you to break open with a mallet Coming back up the stairs and hill after a full dinner was a real challenge But fun nonetheless 
Overall this was a decent stay at a decent hotel Not the bestbut not the worst The location of the Hilton and walking around the city made this a memorable visit

title: A great place to stay
text: Booked the room from the net We were very surprised at how nice the Hotel was It was easy to get on and off the freeway The service was excellent  The breakfast buffet in the morning was worth the stay as it was included in our room cost We will stay there again There was some remodeling being done it will only improve the Hotel It is right on the Lite Rail service line

title: Nothing fancy
text: This is a good place for a night or a couple of nightseast access to freewayswill not be staying there again was not as close to where i was going the place is kind of dated older bathroom fixtures

title: Belvedere better than expected
text: My 13 yr old daughter and I stayed at the Belvedere over school vacation in April I booked it because the rates were good and the reviews seemed good I did tell my daughter that it was a budget hotel and not to expect much BUT we were both pleasantly surprised It was a great choice The location was perfect and we were able to get early check in They held our bags on our last day while we were out and about before our train back home

title: disgustingly filthy
text:
The only good thing about ths hotel is the location The lobby is inviting displaying a grandeur which reflects its name We were allocated room 411 which had fungus on the walls the showerroom was broken tiles and dilapidated The toilet once flushed wouldnt stop running and we had to call maintenance five minutes into the stay
The clothes wardrobe was a barebricked hole in the wall with a louvre door
When we complained to the duty manager he was most unhelpful and suggested we book out  so we did
Object lesson  examine the rooms before you register with this group as its not what you see on the brochure
McShuggles Scotland

title: Charming Hotel with a Great Location
text: Booked 2 rooms here for a family meet up in the city We came from San Jose and travel to San Francisco a lot but the rest of the family was travelling down from the Eureka area The Hotel Palomar has a great location with everything you would possibly need just minutes away The rooms were a great size and very clean When we checked in the kids were greeted with their own kids backpack filled with goodies They were very excited Us adults took advantage of the wine in the lounge which made for a nice relaxing little treat Would definitely stay here again in the future

title: Nice stay Staff very friendly
text: I recently spent six days at the Marriott City Center in Denver If you are visiting for a convention or to enjoy the downtown 16th street area this property is a good bet Staff are very friendly and helpful They went out of their way to help and came away from their desk to make sure that each person in the lobby was assisted as quickly as possible The accommodations were very comfortable and clean I would recommend this hotel In fact the only complaint I had was that they charged for Internet service

title: Excellent Experience at the Holiday Inn Riverwalk
text:
Although it is an older hotel and therefore does not have the larger bathtubs or fancy bathrooms of modern hotels we have been delighted with each stay at the Holiday Inn Riverwalk 
We have held two workshops for educators at this hotel one in December of 2003 and the other in June of 2004 We were extremely pleased with the service food and facilities each time and we will be going back for another workshop in December of 2004
We have held workshops at 4 and 5 star hotels throughout the United States and this hotel is above and beyond many others when it comes to attentive management large meeting spaces separate dining rooms for the attendees beautiful setup and the abundance of fabulous food 
The management was excellent and worked well with us in considering our budgetary constraints Everyone was thorough attentive friendly and totally professional They made sure that we had everything we needed and that it was done the way we needed it done We have held workshops at some 4 and 5 star hotels when we never saw or heard from the management
The food was wellprepared and beautifully presented the banquet staff was outstanding  and special thanks to James and Lourdes who took excellent care of us  there were beautiful fresh floral arrangements on the buffet and individual tables and the menu was bountiful varied and delicious
Our sleeping room was wonderful as well We greatly enjoyed the patios overlooking the Riverwalk It was very nice to be at a part of the Riverwalk that was quiet and beautiful yet just a short walk to the busier section with shops and restaurants
The filet mignon served at The Windows had to be prime beef  you couldnt taste a better steak Each time we have dined there weve had a seat at the windows enjoying a beautiful view as well as excellent food and watistaff
If youre going to San Antonio we would recommend the Holiday Inn Riverwalk
We couldnt ask for more

title: Very nice Hotel right at DFW get your luggage and check in
text: Stayed over night here on a layover coming back from vacation Grand Hyaltt is beautiful great location within the airport I think its terminal B but if you are not in B the Skylink is quick Check in was friendly and a breeze The room is very up to date with granite counters and floors in bathroon nice shower toiletries We arrived after nine so stayed in the hotel and had some snacks in lounge which was very nice albiet expensive but what hotel luinge isnt Bed is very comfortable Beautiful gym and spa Its a lovely hotel

title: Fine business hotel in the heart of the Financial District
text: The Financial District does not have too many hotelsmost are uptown around Union Square This boutique hotel is situated near the Embarcadero and the California  Montgomery intersection The staff was quite friendly and check in was quick One staff member mentioned that they have a regular clientele which allows them to become familiar The rooms are a bit spartan if youre looking for luxury or fine appointments but they serve well The room also was quite quiet for where it was situated Theres a Starbucks downstairs plus several nearby restaurants so its easy to get started Parking is in the Embarcadero Center across the street The Wifi was easy to sign into free and fairly quick

title: Brilliant place to stay
text:
We stayed here for 5 days at the end of June and we were very impressed The rooms are lovely very large particularly for NYC and modern We were on the 7th floor and heard no noise from the street The staff were all excellent extremely helpful The guy working on the door was great and so friendly cant remember his name sorry Hotels location was perfect and the lounge came in very useful too
I often judge a hotels quality by whether or not I would revisit it we will definitely be going back here and I wouldnt hesitate to recommend to friends

title: Good value for money
text: Good location 3 blocks away from metro Rooms are pretty spacious with a separate closet room Nothing too fancy but all the things you need for a good night rest A very comfy bed clean room and good housekeeping service We stayed facing the courtyard which was nicely quiet

title: Some things are off
text: The overall feel of the hotel is very nice It is a modern hotel and well located But there were some things that I was not pleased with First of all the room was not clean I found dried food on the wall paper hairs on the bathroom floor and the desk in the room when we first entered was not cleaned Furthermore we used the 2 glasses in the room to drink some water and they were not changed for the 4 days we stayed there even after we left a sign on top of them requesting that they be taken away The most annoying for me though was that we were flying out at 630 in the morning and the restaurant would obviously not be open for breakfast therefore we spoke to the front desk in the early evening if we could have breakfast sent to our room as room service at 400 am They told us they would ask and let us know later in the evening At 10 pm upon asking them they informed us that yes we could have breakfast and to order it from now through room service We then called room service they told us no problem and to put what we wanted and the time on the paper hanging outside our door We did so and needless to say at 4 am NO BREAKFAST Upon checking out we asked the front desk why we were not sent breakfast and they told us that since we booked with expedia and even though we paid for a room with breakfast they do not honour the expedia bookings as we were leaving early Then we were told that we could have had room service if we had paid for it seperately I then told her that we had ordered room service but no one had brought us anything Anyways I would not stay here again They definately need to upgrade their customer service

title: Great Hotel
text:
This hotel is great I would definitely recommend this one to anybody As soon as you get there someone opens the door for you and asks how your day has been and chats with you for a few minutes while the valet driver gets information for your vehicle They were very efficient The front desk clerks were fantastic fast check in and early check in as well the lady made conversation with my boyfriend and I and was very pleasant All of the staff had smiles on their faces We went to the room and it was sparkling with cleanliness The housekeeper also helped us find our room The only not so great thing was the bathroom although still very clean just a little small and odd Small double doors to get into it and somewhat of a small space Manageable however 
We had ordered a few things from room service and it was delivered promptly I wish they had more of an option for certain areas and prices were a little high but it was expected
Location was perfect Literally 1 minute away from the Aquarium

title: Great Find
text: My husband and I stayed at the Omni 22426 and had a wonderful experience Having arrived mid morning from an early flight our room was not ready but we were told that a rush would be put on preparing the room It gave us time to walk around the hotel and have lunch in the resturarant We found everything very pleasant When I inquired again about our room 15 hours later we were told that it wasnt ready yet Still way before the 300 check in time so we decided to take a walk outside just as we were about to leave the premises one of the desk staff ran outside  in about 30 degree weather to catch up with us to tell us that our room was indeed ready That is what I call service The entire staff from the doorman to the maids were always pleasant and accomandating I would absolutely recommend the hotel There are a number of resturants within walking distance and the zoo is a short 4 blocks up the street It is a short cab ride away from the National Mall and monuments  15 each way but nice because it is away from the hustle and bustle The room was enormous and clean and as a Omni Select Choice member were given complimentary beverages each morning and for a few dollars extra able to order a bagel or muffin which was just enough to hold us over until lunch We also enjoyed a late check out time as a Select Choice member and would highly recommend you join the service

title: Great location Service and facilities could use some work
text:
The good location Close to everything I needed and wanted to do and to subway Room layout was good for a NYC hotel I got the King room Very small but design and layout was practical and appealing Exception was no full length mirror except inside closet door The door did not open so that you could actually see yourself Lost opportunity on not making the overthedesk mirror taller so you could see yourself when standing Stayed there because rate was better than most in location 
The not so goodmaintenence and service issues 2 light bulbs and sink drain control were not working at checkin Fixed promptly but took 2 trips Was not offered or given newspapers or turndown service despite being Wyndham Rewards member This seemed to be just a random occurance A colleague received both without asking Charged 10day for VERY slow internet service Room service errors resulted in cold coffee and toast waiting for a return trip for 2nd person setup they were told twice that we had 2 diners when order placed Workout room is gloomy hot poorly designed and equipped and water cooler was empty Apparently you can get a pass to a nearby Golds Gym and if you have time and want a real workout that would be a must Regardless it was not OK

title: Great For Center City Visit
text:
As an expatriot of the immediate Philly region I find myself living about 3 hours away I have found the Doubletree to a fantastic hotel for many reasons Honestly the best nights sleep I get is there their beds are amazing 
Parking is adjacent  in line w expected parking lot prices Check in is hitmiss based on time of arrival Rooms are well decorated clean and the views have always been great and welcomed I havent dined in so I cant offer much about the hotel restaurants You could ask for a more central location to all that Center City has to offer 
Have been there many times and will continue I highly recommend but with reluctance cause I want to be sure I have a room there when I want one

title: Not the best choice
text:
This is not the best choice of hotels if you want to kick back and relax This hotel is the shell of a luxury hotel without the substance 
 We didnt get any sleep on Thusday Friday or Saturday nights We could hear noise in the halls of the hotel and people getting into cars at 2 and 3 am They have banquet facilities on the same floors with guest rooms Management needs to decide whether they want to host parties or cater to guests The beds were not comfortable The mattresses were lumpy and you could feel the dips You have to pay for wifi Most hotels offer this for free The internet cost 995 per day They provided internet access in the lobby however there was also a fee attached They provide a book of instructions on hotel facilities An entire page was dedicated on how to make calls We tried using a calling card from your room but after numerous attempts we were unable to do so You cannot dial a toll free number from your roomWe contacted the front desk and were advised that the instructions were invalid and that there was a charge attached for making long distance calls During our stay we were locked out of our room and had to go to the front desk to have our keys recoded 
 What good things can we sayThe hotel is in a great location It is located across from the Faneuil Hall Marketplace and the Quincy Market it is close to the North end and many restaurants in the area The staff at check in and the doormen were all extremely polite throughout our stay

title: Not the best hotel specially if you consider the price
text:
I have stayed in Sheraton in may The rooms are smallish I am from europe where the rooms tend to be small so I have nothing to complain However it is very small for american standards the bathroom was probably the smallest I have ever seen It is impossible to get out of the tubeshower if the door is open Wellnesfitness facility is probably the worst in the hotel  old dated would not be ok for a 23 star hotel either Service was good In quality the breakfast is comparable to the spa
If you are willing to pay this price for a hotel go and search for other in Boston There are better hotels in this range in all aspects

title: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here Would recommend
text: We stayed here on the first leg of our fly drive holiday This was our 5th trip to USA and we like to stay in good hotels This fitted the bill exactly Convenient with the Metro just across the road good room excellent restaurant Starbucks in the lobby and friendly and professional staff If we are back in the area I would definitely stay again

title: Great location Good value
text: This boutique hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Manhattans upper Westside neighborhood convenient to subway restaurants shopping and Central Park Weve stayed here several times and always found the rooms although varied in size clean and comfy Prices vary with the season and more popular times in NYC are obviously pricier weve overall found this hotel to be a good value and plan to come back again

title: Wonderful 21st Celebrations
text: Came to New York to celebrate my son and his friends 21st birthdays once they had finished University I picked the W at Times Square as we had stayed at a W in Atlanta and loved it The New York W did not disappoint on any level I had contacted Patrick Armano before we left England and he very kindly made sure we were well looked after We had great rooms all on the same floor and near each other  The Hotel Manager Jon arranged for a bottle of champagne to be sent to the boys and all the staff were so good and extremely helpful The location in Times Square cannot be beaten if you want to be at the heart of the area It is a great Hotel and has a fabulous vibrant bar to relax in at the end of a long day We had an amazing time and have wonderful memories of New York thanks to the W  Patrick Jon and all the staff Would love to go back there in the future

title: Will not go back
text:
My mother and I stayed at the Park Central hotel in NYC for 6 days in September We were quite impressed when we walked into the hotel lobby but were quickly unimpressed by the front desk guy who acted as though we were bothering him by checking in out of about 4 front desk workers i spoke to over the duration of our stay 1 was pleasant The room did not have a coffee maker or anything extra to make the stay more welcoming just shampoo and soap not even a shower cap but that isnt a big deal but when you pay 400night you think youd be getting the best of the bestbut i guess it is New York after all and it is waaay more expensive What was a big deal was our first day of housekeeping someone went into my suitcase and stole my favorite skirt i didnt notice until the next morning when i went in to get dressed for the day and realized it was gone We searched every inch of the room for it We contacted security who was really friendly and said that this does happen I had my suitcase closed but not zippedso be sure to zip and lock it ive traveled all over the world and stayed at all levels of hotels and never experienced this we kept the room locked and security ensured that no one would enter our room without a supervisor we asked that we not have our room serviced again well the next day not one but two people tried to enter our room while we were in there I told front desk who didnt seem to care In the end all we got was 100 off our 400night room for a guest complaint they wouldnt even comp the one movie we rented on the tv terrible barely covers the cost of the item that was stolen im just glad more wasnt taken from me or my mom
On a positive noteConceirge was AWESOME which we later found out were not employees of the hotel but a hired company placed in the hotel they were FANTASTIC best service ever heck id go to the hotel just for info definitely not to stay
Room service was crazy expensive so we never ate at the hotel so i cant judge the food but it must be good for that price
I would stay somewhere else next time for sure because of the theft the location was pretty good although i would recommend staying on the other side of Times Square where you are more central to everything
Good luck in your hotel search

title: Nice price for a downtown hotel
text:
Stayed for 7 nights while attending a convention at the nearby Colorado Convention Center It was by far the most economical hotel within walking distance of the Center It is also only a block from 16th St with many shops and restaurants and its free shuttle that runs across downtown 
I chose it primarily for the location and the cost I booked the room rate that included breakfast which is much cheaper than paying for it separately if you eat at the hotel The restaurant cant handle the breakfast rush without some delays at peak times but the wait wasnt over 10 minutes We didnt eat any other meals there 
The room was clean but not spotless There was some dust on the table lamps Three of the curtain hooks were disconnected from the rod which made the end hang down a bit but you had to pull them all the way closed to know 
We usually hadnt yet gone out for the day before Housekeeping began their rounds in the morning and that apparently threw them off a bit as one day they forgot to make up our room Other than that no housekeeping issues at all
The air conditioner coffee maker hair dryer all worked well Im a big decaf drinker and had no problem getting multiple extra packets from the front desk In fact the front desk staff were very pleasant in every interaction 
Plenty of hot water in the mornings My wife spent three days at the pool while I was at the convention and found it very well kept 
One tiny nitpick I could not get a pack of matches Not at the front desk not at the bar 
Parking at the attached garage is 16day Wireless internet was free

title: central location  would recommend
text: Hotel was recommended by travel agent Has excellent central city location for siteseeing the trams buses shopping and eating Be aware which we werent prepared for the downside of this is that you see all the homelessness in the city Friendly helpful receptionists recommended local places to dine Bedroom was comfortable coffee making facilities powerful shower cleaned daily ironing board and hairdryer We had a bedroom to the back of the hotel so hardly any city noise to disturb us Complimentary tea and coffee in the mornings with wine in the evenings complimentary use of the computer and internet all in the reception Safe deposit boxes available at reception also We would recommend the city pass if you havent been sightseeing here before you can swap one of the tours in the pass for Alcatraz We would also recommend hiring a bike to visit the Golden Gate bridge if you want a bit of freedom We found long waits of 45min plus for the tram at the Piers to return to the city centre even at offpeak season

title: Great Location for Exploring San Francisco
text:
This hotel was exactly what we were looking for and expecting for our three days in SF We got it though a flighthotel bundle on Expedia and were really pleased The location is close to multiple forms of public transportation and pretty centrally located for any exploring you would do as a tourist We had an interior room so we didnt have many of the sound issues that others have mentioned but this did mean that it was rather dark 
The front desk staff was helpful though one did send us to a restaurant in the Mission District that ended up being at a completely different location than what he wrote down We should have double checked online but it turned out fine We still found a great place to eat just not the one he recommended

title: Welcoming hotel with friendly staff
text: Good airport transfer service Room keys were ready and reception staff efficient Breakfast in the restaurant finished a bit early for those suffering from jet lag

title: Fabulous Hotel which gets better every time
text:
I have now stayed at this hotel on 5 occassions when in Philadelphia on business and have just booked my next 12 night stay for next month This hotel is a home away from home and the only place I would consider staying in the city Close to absolutely everything and with so much to do in the area I love Philadelphia and tend to wander out in the evenings after work for a bite or just to chill Try Fado on Locust and 15th or McCrossons on N20th past the Franklin Institute for some great places to chill Also as my business trips usually include a weekend it is the perfect base from which to explore the city for the weekend But on the nights when I still have work to do or when I just want to relax the rooms are very well equiped with a large work desk and free wifi or the gym on the 4th floor which while a little small is never too crowded and is just about right for my needs I have had a varied selection of rooms on my travels some larger than others but all perfect for a longer stay The larger ones in particular Rm 701 in December are well fitted out with plenty of space and would be my recommendation
Parking is a little on the expensive side and not being a big breakfast eater it would be useful to have a Bed and Parking option for people not wanting BB Food is great and the service is outstanding On my last visit I had a late flight but wanted to wander around the town for the afternoon Securing a late checkout was not problem at all On previous occassions whenever I have had a question never a complaint the front desk staff have sorted it immediately On one occassion a small problem with my room had been rectified by the time I made it back up
For as long as I continue coming back to Philadelphia I will return to this hotel every time Keep up the great work guys and see you next month
M

title: Great hotel with exceptional service
text: I have stayed at many hotels and I found this Best Western to be exceptional The room was affordable and exactly what I needed The customer service definitely exceeded my expectations Thank you

title: Will Return
text:
The hotel was very clean throughout We were impressed
It had been a long time since staying at a Hampton Inn and they really WOWed me First their rating was 10000 very impressive The lobby area was very inviting When encountering the staff they seem to make a conscientiousness effort to say hello very rare in this fast paced world And the continental breakfast was more than DELUXE It was a full meal  superbe And the Shuttle drivers on duty during our stay Eddie n Chris were ever so patient with us  thank you

title: Great Price Great Location Great View
text: Just returned from two nights on the 25th floor in the North Tower Could not beat the view Housekeeping and the parking valet services were very good front desk soso Got the room on Hotwire for 96 nite The location is fabulous with Newbury Street a short walk away and close to the T Would stay there again

title: Good value and great staff
text: We stayed here with the family and booked two rooms begin of October for three nights Good rooms definetly worth the money Location is good if you want to visit Universal Studios or northern parts of LA Staff was always friendly and very helpfull Will definetly recommand this for short term stay to visit the northern parts of LA

title: Needs a good dusting new staff but location is great
text:
So as an SPG Platinum Ive come to expect certain things from a W Hotel  it tries a little hard it feels like a nightclub but typically a nice hotel very well kept great service rooms are nice if you can get an upgrade especially 
This W does not live up the brand We went to NY for a show and although the location is perfect walking distance to lots of restaurants shopping Central Park the hotel is old underneath all that flashy decor You can see it in the paneling and the floors and the doors The rooms are TINY TINY TINY We were upgraded to third level of room  Superior  superior WHAT I get the hotel was full there was a wedding and of course the hurricane displaced people The bed itself was comfortable 
The bathroom was so small and the lights kept flickering The closet was actually as big as the bathroom but the light didnt work 
My favorite part of the stay Sunday morning  for 60 minutes a loud horrible blaring noise coming from two doors down I called and asked about it  was told security was on it and maybe 20 minutes later I heard W staff working on it Upon checking out we asked about it  no answer no response 
I also was curious about the security of the hotel Every night they had people standing at the elevators asking to see our room keys The elevators had a place to put your key that was technically required to get onto the guest level floors but it didnt seem to work What was happening at that hotel that they had THREE guys standing at the elevators 
Save your points save your dollars stay somewhere else

title: Nice Stay Nice Staff Nice Price
text: My stay was the result of a business trip The hotel is undergoing some renovations but none of that affected my stay The room was clean the plasma screen TV was wonderful and the four plugs on the desk were great for charging my cell phone laptopand IPOD Very comfortable bed I did receive a free breakfast which was good the free breakfast is available for Federal employees on official business Friendly staff Parking was 26 but it was self park and I could come and go easily Metro stops are a few blocks away

title: Absolutely fabuloushotel W
text: An incredibly wonderful experience The hotel is gorgeous We had an amazing time staying there Worth every penny Cant wait to go back The staff was so nice and accommodating Allen and Eden were both so wonderful and made the experience great They both suggested Sunda as a great place to eat Eden worked her magic to get us in She helped with other suggestions and helped us get our boarding passes at the end Wonderful wonderful wonderful Whatever whenever Cant say enough

title: Very nice and in a Great location
text:
This hotel is just down from Grand Central station The location simply cant be beat
The price was also acceptable for the area
The hotel is quite small from the lobby to the rooms so dont be surprised about thatit is New York after all That being said it makes me wonder how affordable the rooms would be if you are staying alone We had a Deluxe room for 2 people and it was quite tiny We were just using it as a place to sleep though so it didnt bother us 
Lots of people to help you at the front desk and the lighting and decor is pretty cool

title: Loved the Ballantyne
text:
We stayed at the Ballantyne for one day the Friday after Thanksgiving I was impressed that we checked in around 1030 in the morning and they put us right in a room no hassles
Checkin was pleasant The staff were all friendly  the valet doorman baggage handlers front desk clerks
We booked by going directly to their website and getting a holiday special of 18900 per night Their price on the Ballantyne site was cheaper than any of the prices we found on other sites
Room The room was beautiful Its a nice touch that when you enter the room the stereo is on a classical music station
The beds are very comfortable I am 52 and my husband is 6 foot It was a bit difficult for me to climb into the bed because it was a bit high but the comfort was worth it
The room has a great coolingheating system
The bathroom is gorgeous and luxurious  Marble floors garden tub separate glass enclosed shower 
The robes are comfortable and nice The towels could be a bit softer but they were the typical hotel fare
Turn down service was a nice touch they turn the music back on and leave dark chocolates on the bed
We did not use the spa or restaurants so we cant comment on those We do plan to return again We used this one night stay as a meter to tell if we would like to return and we definitely will if we can get a similar price

title: Should have listened to other reviews
text:
