My husbands company booked us here for two nights I am writing from hotel right now After he told me where we were staying I read the terrible reviews and was very concerned I do have allergies and other reviews mentioned the stale moldy smell We decided to continue with the reservation as my husband did not want to stay at a different hotel than his coworkers 
We checked in this afternoon and were given a room on the 5th floor It was horrible My eyes started to burn and I got a headache within minutes They had an ionizerair cleaner running on the top of the TV stand so that should have been a clue We left the room immediately and tried to determine what we should do We had just parked our car with valet and had dragged all our luggage in with a hot and cranky 5 year old We went down to the front desk and spoke with the assistant manager She said she totally understood my situation as she suffers from allergies She said it was worse on the 5th floor and gave me a key to a room on the second floor I looked at it and there was a difference in the smell but still musty We decided to just stick it out for these two days figuring it was not worth all the hassle to change My husbands company was paying and they had secured the rate etc had this been coming out of our own pocket we would have moved rooms immediately
Ok now the positives The staff here has been very friendly We love the location and always enjoy staying in historic hotels This place is interesting and memorable and has a lot of character It is right next to the Alamo and a quick walk to the river We had a great time in their pool very large compared to the Doubletree Airport location we just came from
I just dont understand why they have let this hotel go downhill like this Carpets are old dirty The halls smell musty and stale Decor is cheap 70s in the rooms and the bathrooms need a serious updating This could be a really great place if someone took the time to update the rooms If you have a problem with mold dust mites or if you are allergy sensitive stay somewhere else They were not surprised at the front desk when I complained

title: JUST WHAT I NEEDED
text: Arriving Saturday for a Sunday seminar I found the Jane Hotel to be a more than pleasant surpriseIts location on a quanint cobblestone street lined with well maintained brownstones is charming Front desk personnel were kind professional and courteous The gentleman on duty the evening I arrived was able to direct me to an excellent all night deli My cabin style room while small was clean well appointed bath shoes and robe provided The TV lights alarm clock and internet all worked fineAn underbed set of drawers were large enough to store my goods A safe is also provided to lock important items when out of room  One large window afforded me a view of the river and skyline The shared bath was clean and neat Renovations were underway in the lobby area which by the way is wonderfully vintage  and I hope to see the final results on my next NYC trip  Overall if you are looking for quiet clean and very affordable NYC accomadations then the Jane should suit your needs

title: pretty great stay nice hotel
text:
Just got back from a really pleasant weekend in Chicago I am from New York City and have never been to Chicago There is lots to do too much for one weekned and it is a beautiful place full of nice people I chose the Hotel Burnham based on trip advisor reviews and I liked that it was a historical building The place is really beautiful I loved our rooms They may be a little small but I have never had a very huge hotel in the middle of a city before The beds were really comfy and the ceilings were high The room felt really cosy and elegant Also at night you didnt hear any kind of street noise Really awesome considering we were on what is considered a busy street
 This hotel is in the loop Like I said I have never been to Chicago so I had no idea what all these neighborhoods meant What was the difference between magnificent mile and the loop or lincoln park well the loop is the business center theater center it is also right next to Millenium park which is a nice place to walk around chicago isnt that large so you can walk around to just about any area and the subway is really easy to navigate so that is a big plus There was plenty of regular shopping such as HM oldnavy walgreens macys marshall fields gap ny and co and more If you want highend shopping you go to magnificent mile 
The staff was so friendly and welcoming Reginald greeted us and after we checked in gave us the tour of the room The staff seems small which is a great bonus to being in a boutique hotel because they all knew who we were and we knew them They were all really helpful with recommending places to eat calling for reservations and giving directions on where to go When my moms wallet was lost they looked up phone numbers of the taxi companies so I could call and see if it was found 
The hotel has a small gym but it was up to date and never crowded The restuarant Atwood cafe had very busy lunch and dinners filled with locals We only ate a breakfast there It was good and really pretty inside

title: Terrible accommodation Horrible neighbors
text:
renovated with new furniture but dirty and stains all over the bed you can hear foot steps upstairs not to mention the next door you may be trouble sleeping if you have wrong neighbors like i did
They said to pay in advance at check in and no refund i wondered why

title: great new hotel
text: We stayed at the Solamar over the Independece Day weekend this year so it had been opened for only three months then The location is great within the walking distict to the restaurants and bars of the Gaslamp District which by the way is not that interesting on its own but in the evening its fun to hang out there The decor is great beautiful colors artwork very modern and swanky  it reminded me a bit of a Pottery Barn catalogue  Awesome outside bar great atmosphere you definitely should start your evening out there The service was ok a bit too much on the hip side  I prefer the old school politeness but had no problems The rooms were really nice medium in size but the decor makes up for it Loved the great idea to put sliding doors in the bathroom  saves a lot of space We didnt try the hotel restaurant  we dined at Chive  loved it Overall a great hotel I also liked the fact that its new which adds some sort of freshness to it  and hey nothing is worn out yet

title: W Boston  Go In Style
text: I have done extensive traveling and this was my first time staying at a W property I was warmly greeted at the door and the associates were friendly but not invasive on personal space The W Boston was trendy hip cool and had some impressionable touch points  ex flavored waters vitamins to stay healthy eclectic lounge unique decor personal service with front desk agents weatherinfo station etc The room we stayed it was spacious enough space to work and very clean The next morning upon checkout I was assisted by a polished associate named Laura G Her outgoing personality and professional manner is the epitome of what hospitality should be She went above and beyond to ensure that I had a fantastic last impression of the W And so I write my review on here

title: Great for business
text:
I have only stayed at the Wyndham for business purposes Having stayed at half a dozen hotels in Boston this is definitely the best for business and NOT the best for leisure travel While it is near certain interesting places the immediate area is dead at night because its the financial district Go elsewhere for vacations
For business travelers the place is ideal The customer service is very high and the rooms are alway comfortable Sometimes they were much larger than I was expecting Never tried the barrestauarnt but always looked like a good place for a drink

title: Great staffproperty improving
text:
We stayed at this hotel for a week the staff is welcoming and helpful I do agree that there is construction noise and we asked for a room on the newly redone floors to accomodate that By the 3rd day the noise on floor 26 was Very minimal and there was more noise from other hotel guests and at that not much 
Parking rates are Very typical for not only Marriott hotels but for the San Antonio area downtown they know people come to see the RiverwalkAlamo so the make money in parkingAny city does the same If you come to SA just for that area I would Not rent a careverything is accessible either walking or with the inexpensive downtown trolley system The airport is also close so taxi fare is not outrageous
Our room was newly redone and very nice Bed very comfortable nice tv and bathroom area with outside sink Housekeeping was especially cordial and worked around Our schedule All of the staff was quick to acknowledge us no matter what area of the hotel we were in The Bellmen are wonderful helpfulfriendly and ready to answer any questions you have about the area as was the Concierge who was very helpful and kind at all times Customer Service is excellent here
The gym is large by hotel standards everything youd need and very nice equipment treadmillselliptical machines free weights stationery machines and even a Smith machine which is rare in hotel gyms If you jog the Riverwalk before 8am is Ideal for a runyou can go all the way to the opposite end which is new and where the locks and small damn area areno stores or shops just beautiful flowers and scenerylook for the overhead canopy of woven treesniceThe pool area is a bit outdated but is indooroutdoor and well maintained and relaxing The Bar in the hotel lobby is a great place to relax maybe catch the game scoresbut its def Not a sportsbar and they make Great lemon drop martinis
The proximity to the Rivercenter Mall and the Riverwalk make this an ideal place to stay the food court at Rivercenter is great for a quick bitenever seen an Ihop on the Run before but it was goodpancakes omelets etc cooked to order
If you do have a car try to get away from the Riverwalk area to eat Biga on Banks pricey but wonderfulask for Beth to be your server when you make a reservation Josephine Street Grill for a Perfect example of a great chicken fried steak mashed potatoes and gravy and all Burgers steaks and salads make this a great choice night or day We do like Boudros on the Riverwalk but again it is not inexpensive
Best places to buy souveniers is the Walgreens within walking distance about 4 blocks or CVS on the Riverwalk
We go to San Antonio often and I would definitely stay at the MRC again and just call ahead to ask for a newly renovated room

title: Outstanding  surpassed all expectations
text:
I had known about the hotel for some time before actually staying there and had heard very positive things Upon making a spurofthemoment decision to stay in Manhattan late on a Saturday evening we had enjoyed a wonderful day and didnt want to leave I remembered the hotel called and that was the start of an absolutely firstrate experience The rate was good the service impeccable the decor and room far exceeded my expectations 
Dont let the typically small Manhattan entryway fool you  once you enter the hotel and pass the front desk guests are treated to a very spacious and wonderfulldecorated environment You honestly have no awareness that you are right in the middle of the maelstrom that is Times Square  its almost strangely insulated 
The staff were unquestionably excellent Check in was fast smooth and extremely courteous We were personally shown to our room which was wonderful and a huge surprise since we were expecting the normal shoebox room one normally finds in Manhattan
The next huge surprise was breakfast Included in the room rate and a wonderful spread served by welcoming and helpful staff 
All in all I could not have asked for a better stay in any hotel in Manhattan or anywhere else This hotel should be 1 on the TripAdvisor list I cannot speak highly enough about it

title: Great hotel for the price supurb location
text: Stayed for 5 nights last week as many people have stated before the rooms are small and dated but as I booked the cheapest room I was expecting that That was the only downside and the rooms were cleaned daily fresh towels dailynice comfy beds great shower massive tv But I suppose you dont go to NYC and stay in your room too much to see The breakfast is a bonus too lots of choice but the dining room gets full quickly as not many tables The staff are really helpful and friendly This hotel is superbly located 2 subways nearby however we decided to walk down to midtown not that far to Times Square Lots of great places to eat nearby If like burgers pizzas try big Nicks at the end of the street Dont let the appearance put you off the food burgers are amazing and really cheap compared to other places For New York prices this hotel is great value for money and if you book early they have some great deals available

title: Washington
text:
In regards to the location It is good for its proximity to Dupont Circle and quality dining However it is a fair distance from the nearest Metro stations Dupont Circle  Red Line Farragut West  orange and Blue lines To access the National Mall it is a 10 block walk or 5 block walk to metro 
The hotel is older styling but the room was very large and nicely appointed
Service was slow the valetbell desk was understaffed and took a long time to drop off and pickup car and baggage We paid 29 plus tax for parking through the valet which was the weekend 1day rate

title: Hate this place
text: this place absolutely sucks The rooms are paper thin you know who has gas next door or when they have to get up and go to the bathroom in the middle of the night What a disapointment for the very high  they charge

title: a night at Andaz Wall Street NyC
text: Awesome in every sense of the way absolutely amazing minimalist decor without looking cold outstanding service great location downtown my old neighborhood and the rooms were fantastic spacious and in mint condition we were lucky our room came with an air purifier which made it an even more delightful night in terms of breathing  I would certainly come back and would recommend it to people I know It was pricy but in my view it was worth it

title: Amazing Exotic Greek Experience in USA
text: My girlfriend and I went to the Greek islands for her birthday and The Black Olive was the same experience Huge room amazing jet tub included bottle of wine A true 5star experience And especially if you want a Santorini or Paros islandtype experience its perfect I cant believe its in Baltimore

title: Above  Beyond Expectation
text:
We have had a wonderful experience each and every time we stay The staff is very accommodating and knowledgeable about the area They have great recommendations for attractions activities  restaurants that are slightly off the beaten path
 The Area Director of Individual Travel has gone above and beyond expectation time and time again Assisting us with all of our needs down to the very last detail We feel confident that the Monaco will always ensure that all of our needs are met and everything is perfect
I am very pleased with the Monaco and would highly recommend it You know you are in good hands when you are not just another guest to the hotel you are a new found friend of the Kimpton Family

title: Brilliant brilliant brilliant
text:
I have visited NYC many times and wanted to stay in Tribeca this time I choose the Smyth partly due to reviews here on Tripadvisor We booked 3 rooms as our son and daughter were joining us for our 25th wedding anniversary celebrations Well I couldnt have picked better It is a fantastic hotel  location is superb Easy to visit Lower Manhattan walk by the Hudson visit Brooklyn subway is just along the block and the subway right outside the hotel door takes you to Midtown and Uptown
Whats not to like about this hotel The rooms we booked were Queen rooms and even better we each had a balcony with views downtown to the Freedom Tower and uptown to the Empire State building  brilliant despite the trees on one balcony being blown over during a big thunderstorm one evening quickly rectified by the staff when we reported it The staff make the hotel They were friendly courteous and very helpful especially Michael on the front desk The door guys were really friendly and helpful too 
The beds were SO comfortable rooms clean and well looked after Bathroom clean modern and with lovely Kiehl products The barlounge area is cool and casual and great for chillin after a day in the city The only change Id make would be to the decor in the hallways which were kinda dark but that was a very minor thing I would certainly plan on returning to the Smyth for my next visit to NYC Its my sort of hotel

title: Would definitely stay here again
text:
We have just returned from our stay at 6 Columbus and our experience was very different to that of some of the other guests 
We booked a Queen room for a reduced rate via the Quikbook website The Quikbook site clearly stated that the room was for a maximum of 2 people Upon arrival it was clear that booking via Quikbook meant that you were given the smallest rooms in the hotel There was no way that 2 people could stay comfortably in this Queen room
There was only 1 single wardrobe no natural light hardly any floor space around the bed and nowhere to store our 2 large suitcases 
I spoke to Lula on the front desk and she went out of her way to ensure that we were happy with our accommodation She showed me 2 other rooms which were much more suitable for couples and managed to offer us a larger Queen room at an extremely reasonable upgrade price Throughout our stay Lula made a point of checking that everything was ok with our room 
With regards to the rest of the hotel we really couldnt fault it All of the staff were extremely friendly particularly the doormen We didnt try the restaurant but we did drink at the bar a few times and they even served sushi to us at the bar My only gripe would be that the bar area is quite small with limited seating 
The room we actually stayed in was a great size The double wardrobe was more than adequate and there were large drawers under the bed also The ipod docking station was a nice touch as were the Khiels toiletries in the bathroom and the free daily newspapers The room temperature control took some getting used to but overall it served its purpose and the underfloor heating in the bathroom was very welcme after a hard days sightseeing The bed was also very comfortable
Housekeeping did a great job at keeping the room immaculate and also turned down the bed every night leaving little treats on the duvet
In addition to the great service and comfortable room the hotel is in the most amazing location The Time Warner Centre is literally across the road which houses a large Whole Foods market and lots of nice restaurants Starbucks is next door and there were several places to get a great breakfast just up the street Columbus Circle was right on the doorstep including the best entrance to Central Park 
Overall we really enjoyed our stay at 6 Columbus and we would definitely stay here again on our next visit to New York

title: Great Staff Couldnt Make Up for RunDown Noisy Hotel
text:
We were looking for a beachside town and Ocean Beach fit the bill We stayed at the Ocean Beach Hotel which looks like its been around for a long long time judging by some old pictures we saw including pictures of the hotel before a street separated it from the beach The front desk staff and cleaning staff were very professional accommodating and friendly 
We stayed on the second floor with a partial ocean view rates for each of our days varied between 140160 Our view also included colorful local characters as one reviewer has noted who hang out near the POWMIA memorial across the street The local color also attracted the SD police three times who twice hauled away people The third time appeared to be some kind of contact visit by cops to talk to the homeless the skaters other rough characters and the welldressed people attracted to them drug sales 
That said we walked around day and night and never felt threatened  no aggressive panhandling and little panhandling in any case no need to watch wallets etc like we might have felt elsewhere The vibe was good
Ocean Beach has done a good job of deflecting chain stores although the foughtover Starbucks up the street from OB Hotel easily had the biggest crowds of the coffee shops we frequented In fact our find was that one should hit a local coffee shop Besides the lines being shorter folks are remarkably friendly and open the coffee is excellent and the pastries are local and better Hit the same place three days in a row and youll be shooting the breeze like youve lived there a year So while the anticorporate mentality may be a bit militant it makes for a pleasant main street to wander up and down 
Now to the hotel The room smelled musty and the carpet had that mildlywet feeling from highhumidity climates Our bathroom sink faucet swiveled leftandright though not by design The toilet was constantly on the verge of stopping up did the previous tenants through a baggie of dope down it There was a table on the patio but the patio had some kind of halfworn off macadam covering that made it uneven repairmen were working their way down patios sanding that stuff down which was very noisy during the day The room had two chairs on opposite sides we used the bed for sitting and as a table
There was a fridge and microwave
The wall had been torn and repaired badly There was a new door to the bathroom and while that was fine the frame around it was unpainted 
An attempt has been made to spruce up the courtyard  box planters on the 2nd and 3rd floor railings container plants below strings of lighting overhead and so on Some of the lights were burnt out and the fountain in the middle was bone dry Indicative of good intentions that are not wellfunded
A good cable TV selection and free wireless internet were bonuses
As others have noted the rooms are very noisy From newlyweds on one side theyll learn I guess to a guitarist practicing his heavy metal riffs presumably for a local show one evening to drunken screeching in the courtyard to the sound of Harleys being revved to one fight on Newport Ave outside our room to revelers at all hours including nine am one morning to a pretty good ad hoc music jam session think three of the talented players were sailors at the POWMIA memorial to fire trucks to a thumping bass from a nearby bar to the occupants above us daring walk to the bathroom to people yelling at their buddies across the street  the joint is NOISY Weve lived in 247 congested areas of several large cities abroad and in the US and never had noise like this So if you want a quiet weekend by the beach this aint the place by a long shot
We enjoyed the town and its freewheeling environment but hated the hotel  save the staff
We figure for the annoying noise level and the rundown condition of the hotel its worth about half the price we paid per night And a major chunk of that is what Ocean Beach Hotel is all about location location location

title: Confirm your reservation
text: I had read the many reviews of this Hotel and having booked through another booking service and not directly with the Hotel I heeded the advice of others and tried to email them at least twice to ensure they had my reservation even though I had the email to prove it and had paid a 10 reservation fee No reply to email sent to the web site so just before leaving tried the other email on the Hotel site and received a confirmation notice Just as well because when we arrived from the airport with printed out reservation in hand we were told that we were not on their system and the Hotel was full It wasnt until I provided proof with the confirmation email from the Hotel that they took us seriously The receptionist was very nice and tried to sort it out by ringing the Manager but he did not respond and then the lady for the evening shift appeared We ended up being given someone elses booking for the first night at a lesser standard than we had reserved and were told that we would have to move in the morning and the Manager would sort it out So back we went the following morning at 0800 and met the Manager who was very nice also who told us we could leave our rooms in another room which would be ours after it was cleaned on our return We returned late that night to find our bags had been moved to a smaller room but at least it had an ensuite The bed was so uncomfortable as you could feel the wires  springs through the covers In the end they never charged us so we only paid the deposit for the 2 night stay The location was close to the metro but still some way from the central shopping area but pretty close to Central park Make sure you have written proof of reservations when you arrive otherwise you might be left looking for alternative accommodation

title: Great place to stay  very friendly
text: Everybody was so very nice Loved the breakfast buffet and the evening reception Rooms were clean bed very comfortable the garden tub was nice I was so busy I didnt miss that they dont have a pool My only regret is that I didnt have time to get to the milk and cookies buffet

title: Great
text: Excellent location Clean Very friendly Staff Good Value I would stay there again

title: Perfect for a anniverary getaway weekend
text: We arrived early on a Saturday in July during a very busy weekend in SF We found out that the marathon was happening the next morning so were concerned about traffic getting out the next morning The staff checked our bags in so we could start our sightseeing day and were very helpful and friendly about directing us to parking and easing our fears about leaving downtown with all the street closures the next day Room was cleanquiet and decent sized for the two of us There are plenty of places to eat nearby and for location to tours bus rides transportation and the wharf attractions it is a perfect stop Parking at the garage next door is pricey but we expected that based on reading other reviews so we were prepared I would not have felt comfortable leaving our car on the street because it was so busy and crowded in that area on a summer saturday

title: Great location  big room
text: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel It is in a phenomenal location  just a few blocks from Independence Hall and the Liberty Bell shopping restaurants and historic buildings Parking is 21 per day which is automatically added to your bill so keep that in mind when budgeting Although you can come and go as you please the parking garage is quite a cluster so dont expect to just get up and go Everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful The maids front desk breakfast personel and maintance were all ready to bend over backwards for us Our room was very spacious  much more than a standard hotel room The bathroom was VERY small though Thankfully the sink was not in the bathroom There is very little space to change in the bathroom One tip Pandoras Lunch Box just down the road was PHENOMENAL We had a variety of foods and went back more than once  everything was sooo good

title: Across from the Convention Center
text:
This Hilton is in a prime location right in ChinaTown You are smack in the heart of Philly You can walk take a taxi or utilize public transportation Parking her will run you 3000 a day Let me tell you about our room It was an enormous King corner room with several windows that let in the sunshine of the city The sleep number bed can be adjusted on both sides for a comfortable shared night of sleep
The restaurant and lounge was beautiful and located on high floor of the hotel The staff was very attentive and quickly responded to all request I spent a week here and was treated like a live in guest At night this can be a very quiet area but it is close to offices restaurants and shopping by day

title: Great location average Marriott
text:
I stayed at the hotel for two nights while attending a convention at the attached Philadelphia Convention Center For convenience if youre attending a convention there its super The location is right next to the City Hall  and there are dozens and dozens of restaurants within an easy walk 
My room on the 9th floor was very comfortable and clean A typical Marriott My room was ultra quiet despite being in the middle of the central business district I was able to rest well during the night on the super comfortable bed and do work during the day without disruption The internet was highspeed and excellent
The staff were very friendly and helpful The Starbucks in the lobby a nice touch Overall a very good choice for business travel

title: Great location average room but still had an issue
text:
How can I be fair   lets see  
My husband and I stayed their with my daughter over Spring Break The location is excellent literally within walking distance from the Riverwalk and Alamo My daughter is 7 and the walk was not an issue for her The rooms are average if anything they are outdated but overall pretty good  possibly could be a little cleaner but it is nitpicky stuff I noticed so not bad overall Rooms were cleaned everyday with plently of clean towels As far as the pool  dont get excited It is outside next to the highway So if you dont mind being on display to every car on the highway then its not a big deal The continental breakfast is held in the lobby where you check in so there is very limited room The food was good  your typical donuts bagels cereal juice coffee and such They advertised free wireless internet connection in the rooms but we could not get a connection 
The BAD is we originally booked this trip and reserved the rooms with a credit card Because my husband travels during the week and typically stays at Days Inn when traveling he is enrolled in their Trip Reward program After the inital reservation was made we decided to use his Trip Reward points to pay for the room and save a little cash for all of the other activities in San Antonio When he called to book the room he let them know I had already reserved the room we just needed to verify we were going to use the points to pay I had also called to cancel the second room I reserved as my inlaws had made a seperate reservation on their own We arrived checked in and everything was fine with the points However when I returned home and checked my account my card had been charged for the rooms yep tow of them I called to explain the situation and I was told that they probably just ran the card for preauthorization and it wouldnt be posted to my account and that I should give it a few days Of course it posted and I was charged to I called back again to get my money refunded I was told they are busy and would look into it No return call so I called back and was notified I was charged because I was a no show and that they know my husband checked in but had a seperate room for me and charged me since I did not cancel I explained the situation and how my husband frequently stays there I did cancel one room I did not have my cancellation number to prove it but of course not the other because that is the one we stayed in Apparently when we called to use the trip reward points they made an ADDITIONAL reservation  not so sure about that but that is the only conclusion I can come to After no cooperation what so ever my husband notified them we would be calling their corporate office They kindly informed us they are not a affiliated with corporate and that they are independently owned and basically that we could take a hike So sorry 
Hopefully this isnt a reoccuring incident at the motel and I am the only unfortunate person to have this happen  but though I would share just in case

title: wall street inn  battery park  liberty islandellis island ferries
text: small but good hotel very clean european style furniture breakfast included in the hotel room close to financial district and Wall Street also close to many subway stops lines 23 45 jz  no shops but many restaurants nearby quite area

title: One of the best resorts
text: My wife and I spent 3 nights at Desert Ridge on vacation and had a wonderful time The hotel and property are beautiful The hotel is only 3 years old and is in excellant condition The room was great with a large bathroom balcony and view of the moutains The restaurants are very good  dinner at Roys was a treat Drinks are surprisingly cheap 7 pools and an excellant spa Palmer golf course is in great condition and 95 degree heat was not an issue The thing we were most impressed with was the quality of the staff EVERYONE was friendly and did a great job They were the best staff we have ever experienced We ate all of our meals outside and really enjoyed drinks on the patio overlooking the beautifully designed property We highly recommend this resort

title: My family had an excellent time in Jacksonville and the hotel was part of the experience
text: The room was nice the check out was great The Deane family enjoyed there time in Jacksonville THANKS

title: Excellent location and great staff
text: Was there to see a Giants game at ATT park Arrived early and they honored our package which included valet parking even before we got the room This is a very modern hotel with modern decor Staff is very friendly and helpful with everything The location is superb with easy walking distance to everything on the Embarcadaro Ferry Bldg ATT Park etc

title: We liked it and would go back
text: The hotel was a quaint place in the centre of Denver We had a room on the top floor beautifully decoratedin modernistic black and white The night we stayed there was a function in the lobby with two rock bands and a local artist showing her exhibits as i said we were on the top floor so we could not hear the bands But we would go back again

title: Close to the Beach Great beds and a great amazing time
text: I stayed here with a few of my buddies to get some relaxation from work and school It was a great time to get away from work and and school The sleep was amazing and the beach was practically right around the corner If you are looking for a place to get away go to this hotel  Its fantastic

title: We really enjoyed our stay
text: We enjoyed our stay The hotel was spotless the rooms spacious and modern and the pool area was nice and clean We appreciated the pool being open 24 hours as we checked in fairly late I cannot say anything negative about our stay at this holiday express The free breakfast was good they kept it well stocked and their was plenty of space to eat The staff was friendly and the location was convenient to the airport

title: Very Nice Stay
text: This was my third or fourth stay at this property and it was very pleasant We were upgraded to a Junior Suite very large and nice Its disappointing that the Executive Lounge is now closed but the 7 offer for HHonors members for the buffet breakfast was a pretty good value The location is great as its so close to Union Square Just make sure you dont head in the wrong direction from the hotel and end up in the Tenderloin district

title: Great hotel and great location
text:
This hotel was a great Union Square location The lobby was packed and loud so I did not have high expectations upon checkin However when I arrived at my room in tower 3 I was pleasantly surprised It had all the charm of a boutique hotel The single room was small but utilized the space well and was quite cozy My boyfriend and I were only spending one night in the city and then heading up north to wine country but we almost extended our stay at the Hilton San Fransisco Union Square because we liked it so much
The hotel staff was so nice and we had a very pleasant experience I will return to this hotel the next time Im staying in the city

title: AWSOME ANNIVERSARY WEEK END
text: Living in Houston we travel to San Antonio periodicall for a week end get a way How we missed this wonderful hotel in the past is beyond me From the champagne upon arrival in the lobby to Phillip and Kat who we came to feel were our personal concierges to a lovely spa work out room and delicious restaurant this hotel is a must stay in downtown San Antonio They even washed the bugs off the front of our car before we departed for home

title: Gem was great and Cesar was awesome
text:
I almost hate to say how great the Gem Hotel in Chelsea is because my selfish side would prefer to keep it a secret Its a very afforadable alternative to the big chain hotels in mid town which can cost literally hundreds more
The Gem is sort of funky and artsy with small European style rooms Its very clean and quiet and the staff is great Very friendly and helpful especially Cesar who is very polite and helpful and can help steer you to local attractionsrestaurants Cesar also speaks Portugese and Spanish in addition to English
I really like this place and its very convenient for me As long as you are ok with small roooms at a great price this is a great place to stay

title: Great service great location great room
text: We got one of the corner rooms overlooking times square even though it was a priceline reservation Big bathroom as well There were 4 of us room for 2 small air mattresses Luggage storage before and after check in lobby was convenient Everything is right there couldnt ask for a better location

title: Love the Loews nicest people working there
text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Loews the last weekend in April while we were visiting family in Philly Our room was gorgeous and spacious with the best view of the Philadelphia skyline you could ever ask for Everyone working there was SO pleasant and helpful best staff I have experienced in a while We also utilized the pool and workout facility and was very impressed with the number of machines they had available in the gym Location was perfect as well everything you could ask for is in walking distance most notability the Reading Terminal Market Would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend

title: World Class Hotel
text: I stayed at the park Central the last week in Feburary and found that this experiance was the best From the moment I arrived I was met by Lina who directed me to the baggage check as I arriveddue to weather a bit late for a meeting Lina upon my return checked me in summond Nestor the bellman and he showed me to my room This was just the start of an unbelieveable Customer Service Experiance The lounge Bar Bella staff was top notch John the mixologist and Pam the server made me feel as if I had been there numerous times The Restaurant staff was courteous helpful and always had a smile on their faces Upon Checkout I was assissted by Mike M helped with my bags by Steve and escorted to my cab to the airport by Allejandro This was an absolutely magnificent hotel and staff Everytime I caome to New York I will definitely stay here I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel

title: Great place to stay close to Hollywood and Downtown Los Angeles
text:
The Inn is clean and neat parking is secure and on site Very courteous service and our every need was taken care of promptly The continental breakfast is very good fresh fruits waffles cereals bagels toast juices and coffee Quick and easy in the mornings The location is great close to Hollywood and Downtown Los Angeles There is a 24 hour restaurant across the street I will be traveling to Los Angeles again soon and I will stay
at this Comfort Inn

title: Loved the quad bunk room
text: We were looking for a clean safe and reasonably priced basecamp for our family of four on our last trip to NYC The quad bunk room was a great find Sure the incredibly efficient layout means there is no privacy and everyone gets a single bed  but thats a small price to pay for the small price And our 8 year old girls were thrilled to sleep up high

title: Just a few comments
text:
We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago the weekend of March 911 We booked the room through Hotwirecom and paid more than we usually do through Hotwire 155night but he Housewares Show was in town so rooms were at a premium 
Just a few commentsmost of the reviews say the rooms are darkwell they arent BRIGHT but there was sufficient task lighting to read or work and I thought the bathroom was very well lit The decor is very contemporarysome may like it and some may not but we thought it was fine The room size isnt huge but bigger than a lot of hotel rooms Ive been in in Europe and New York The bathroom was more than adequate and well appointed
The main plus this hotel has is the location Perfect for shopping on Michigan Ave or strolling through Millenium Park and the museum campus Id stay here again without any hestitation if the price was right

title: Great hotel
text:
Positives
 Large rooms
 Nice decor
 Refrigeratorsink in the room
 Decent restaurant I had breakfast only 
 Location was next to stadium and a 5minute shuttle ride to downtown 1520 minute walk 
 Service was great I ordered a taxi and it was there immediately Staff was nice
Negatives
 Couldnt order breakfast room service for the next day When I called the evening before the person said hed stick the order on the computer but he hoped it wouldnt get lost so I was worried it wouldnt go through So I had to call the following morning to doublecheck
 Once when I called for a shuttle from downtown they didnt pick up at the right spot and I saw the shuttle pass by So I had to call again One of the shuttle drivers wasnt esp friendly
Overall I liked this place Unfortunately had a view of the inner courtyard Pool on top was small but nice views

title: Great stay  will be back
text:
My husband and I spent 2 nights at The Nolitan The hotel is modern and well designed Hipster but not too Hipster The front desk staff is extremely friendly and helpful as were both doormen Our room wasnt ready when we got there but we were quickly found a room that was ready and on a high floor with a balcony 
The beds are so luxurious that next time were booking an extra night so we can stay in bed all day They have turn down service with slippers and chocolates on your pillow And the mini bar prices are actually reasonable and theyve got a good selection Vosges chocolates Pop Chips et al There are a selection of magazines for you to peruse Vogue GQ Time Out and free Wi Fi and bath products by Red Flower
The hotel is minutes away from Soho shopping Tory Burch Uniqlo JCrew Madwell Top Shop and the New Museum as well as great restaurants La Esquina Torrisi Parm Lombardis Pulinos Balthazar etc 
The bar at Ellabess downstairs was great We hung out for 12 priced drinks and apps at happy hour The roof is also accessible  I can imagine that it would be amazing in the summertime
We will definitely be back So certainly I almost want to book now before people find out how great this hotel is Stay sweet Nolitan
PS Just want to give everyone a warning that the shower is clear glass so if you forget to pull on the curtain you can see your partner  brother  sister  child sitting on the bed

title: One of the best hotels in SF
text:
We stayed here for three nights in a suite  two adults in the king bedroom and our adult son in the living room Wonderful space pullout couch was excellent hes 62 and he was very comfortable Bathroom huge shower terrific big two person soaking tub with jets City noise outside but thats to be expected  hotel is very quiet internally
We had a car and valet service was good
Service in general is the problem here and its just spotty  not mean Examples asked for a coffee maker in room was told it would be there never saw it Coffee in the lobby was very good though so we gave up Alos manager emailed me in advance asking for input so I told him we were would like to have enough towels and bedding for our third person he agreed I mentioned it again when we checked in but we ended up having to ask yet again before we saw pillows and a couple of ratty old but clean blankets for the pull out Oh and the down comforter on our king bed was an old worn blanket too encased in sheets
Generally the space was well planned clean spacious and comfortable with good lighting This a great location for walking to the MOMA Yerba Buena gardens Union Square and shopping Chinatown the Embarcadero and lots of wonderful restaurants

title: Great small hotel in NYC
text: We chose Park79 for its quiet location and good price for a long weekend in NYC Yes the room was small but its New York small is fine It was clean comfortable and served our needs very well as we were out and about all day While our bathroom was very small it did the job Staff were terrific and always very nice Wed definitely choose this hotel again

title: A sophisticated escape
text: My husband and I chose this new hotel for a muchneeded onenight getaway The first room they brought us to smelled like smoke which I noticed and mentioned immediately The staff were gracious and admitted the problem saying they cant police their guests and moved us to a nicer room even though they were fully committed The room was spacious with a king size bed desk armchair a settee and other table The bathroom was done in a unique spanish tile and was very large with a dualhead shower The bed was outrageously comfortable We enjoyed the included wont call them free for this price snacks and bevs We had massages at the spa which were excellent and given by the top guy there The pool is warm and lovely Our only complaints were an intermittent highpitched whining sound perhaps the elevator and the fact that our breakfast did not arrive at the requested time and required two phone calls to resolve Ohand the wifi requires a password which they do not include in their printed guidewhy not All in all a good stay and I wish we could afford to stay longer

title: very nice one night stay
text: We arrived late at 9pm and checkin was a breeze The lady at the front was very friendly Rooms were nice and the beds extra comfy Also the room was very clean Like someone else said this room was as nice as some 4 star rooms we have stayed in Breakfast was very good Only small complaint was the hot tub was cold Will stay here again as everyone was very friendly and the rooms were nice The price of the room for 94 seemed like a good value

title: Showing a little age and could use a cleaning
text:
Got this on priceline for a steal so I have no reason to complain too much Only stayed 1 night
Positives Great front desk staff very comfortable beds pretty nice bedrooms and lobby Super nice shuttle driver
Negatives Not very clean bedroom hair on bed and floor make up on one of the pillow cases Very small bathroom that smelled like mold On the end of main street are still close to the trolly but after dark kind of seems a little scary Did not complain about the cleaniness so do not know how they would have reacted

title: Excellent location friendly staff
text:
Had a fantastic room on the 28th floor and despite how huge and busy this hotel is the staff were always extremely friendly and helpful In a hotel this size its surprising that staff in the lobby remembered my name for the duration of my short visit there Maybe I stand out  I dont know 
The rooms were great but I was extremely disappointed with the cost of the in room Internet service extremely expensive given the price of the rooms and the fact that this is San Francisco and the poor mobile phone coverage up that high
If its in your price range its definitely worth staying here as its very easy to grab the BART from the airport and its in a good location for shopping and getting around San Francisco

title: Great location  stay
text: Excellent location in NY Large room comfortable bed Great personal service with breakfast included Wine  cheese a wonderful idea providing a wellearned break for the feet Would recomend to any traveller

title: Great value for a good hotel
text:
This is my 5th stay this year Not a new property but priced accordingly and the staff have gone out of their way to be accommodating 
In response to some of the critics
1 The breakfast is priced the same as comparable Marriotts and the quality is good
2 The hotel is clean
3 On the comment it should be a SheratonWhat doctor do you use

title: If you can pay the tariff its a great place to stay
text: We enjoyed the hotel Not a very large room but it was on a high floor and the view of the harbour was super The technology in the room is way exceptional and the service is excellent although they made a big deal of asking about my husbands birthday and then ignored it after we arrived

title: Fabulous hotel  prime location great staff large clean  comfortable rooms
text: Travelled to DC with my family this summer and had the good fortune of choosing The Carlyle Suites on a few recommendations The place is simply wonderful The rooms are large clean and luxurious complete with flat screen tv wifi kitchenette and even TempurPedic mattresses They have a great restaurant a fantastic breakfast buffet and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful Just a short walk to many shops restaurants and the DC Metro I will stay here every time I travel to DC This is certainly among the best lodging choices our nations capital has to offer

title: Walking in downtown Seattle has a price
text:
and its not a cheap one
The Roosevelt hotel is located in downtown Seattle which means you can walk from here to practically every major landmark in this beautiful Pacific Northwest city Whether you want to walk to Pike place or to the Space Needle the Roosevelt Hotel is a great option 
Elegant foyer cozy rooms just across the street from Barns and Noble which if you come from abroad is always a treat
The only think lacking here is a restaurant of its own that holds up to the reputation of the hotel The pub around the corner which is accessible through the lobby is ok but just ok Filled with Americana and levers from beer barrels the place offers a small variety of items for breakfast Having lunch there is just not worthy go to the Market and have sea food lots of it
Expensive but I didnt spend a single dime on public transportation or gas Just parked in and walked around Location location location

title: This property runs the gamut
text:
Overall this is a respectable property with all the amenities that one might expect from the Embassy Suites brand I would have no reservations about returning over and over again  however there are a few items to consider for the occasional traveler
Rates EXCELLENT On corporate policies finding the appropriate room allowing early checkin if possible shuttle service tofrom airport and T station 
Rates VERY GOOD On housekeeping effieiciency of service and a professional presentation
Rates FAIR On staff demeanor the hospitality hour and breakfast Although they are provided they are not as extensive as at other Embassy Suites properties During the managers reception we had our sodas in styrofoam cups and no one offered us any other beverages 3 days in a row The breakfast is plentiful but not prepared with any great care  the food is allowed to get cold in the trays and the bacon was so soggy as to be inedible on two mornings The front desk staff as I mentioned earlier is efficient and capable but certainly not overly warm and friendly This in stark contrast to the desk staff at the Embassy Suites Manhattan 
NEEDS IMPROVEMENT The only real issue we had with this property was the lack of selfservice laundry facilities or if they existed they were not mentioned in the Service Guide and the little store in the lobby Horrendously overpriced and poorly stocked Sodas are only sold in a vending machine down there and the desk had no change 
Many reviewers have mentioned the neighborhood  and while we can see their point of view we certainly did NOT feel unsafe We found a spectacular pizza parlor three blocks from the hotel as directed by one of the shuttle drivers that we would never have encountered if we had stayed within the confines of the building We walked from the T in the daylight hours and called for a shuttle when dark That only because one must traverse a construction site with very little light 
Good value

title: Super staff great service
text:
Very friendly and helpful staff 
No silly fees for all the little stuff like wifi soft drinks in your room etc 
Classy  The free coffee was not from a machine but made by a brista in the lobby 
For infants they had the option of a cot or a packnplay playpen
Great beds large rooms with plenty of room for your luggage

title: Beautiful Hillside Atmosphere
text: The room was a comfortable and roomy suite My view was fantastic There is much to do there if you are so inclined Caveat  it is on a hillside and sum of the room may require an uphill hike Parking is a problem if you want to be near your room

title: Great place to stay
text:
We stayed at the Topaz July 35 2009 We found the staff to be extremely courteous and friendly Rooms were nice size and very comfortable and clean Room rates was great for DC Parking is expensive but we were advised by a staff member that parking is free on the weekends and holidays This saved us 70 or more by parking on the street The staff member actually walked down the block a little found us a spot and held it til we pulled our car into the spot Hotel is 3 blocks to the metro line in quiet safe neighborhood Great restaurants nearby Couldnt think of a nicer place to stay Would definately stay there again
La Luna is a great restaurant with breakfast lunch and dinner Good food and good prices right around the corner Highly recommmend

title: Perfect location great service
text:
3 night weekend stay a week ago for combination of business and pleasure Room was a king park view and was as advertised in photos on this site I was very happy with the style of the room and spent a good amount of time in the eames chair and at the desk getting work done on day 1 All service was impeccable prompt and highly responsive including 2 room service meals great sushi platter from NOMI serveral other special requests and car service to dinner one night
The location is right in the middle of mag mile easy walk to river loop shopping lots of great restaurants and red line L stop 23 blocks away if you dont feel like hiking down to loop or further north
Stopped into the NOMI lounge on way out to dinner on Sat night It was definitely hopping and crowded I can see why a table for 20 would have been tough per review below but we didnt encounter any attitude by anyone working at this hotel  all were very gracious and helpful Also didnt see any indication of security issues at all and felt completely safe walking in and around the hotel at all times
General vibe of this place was quiet understated with small boutique hotel feel Seemed to be mainly business guests while I was there I would definitely go back but might try different place next time for some variety

title: Great Customer Service
text: The people were great my fiance asked me to marry him on this trip and the hotel was very helpful giving him phone numbers and anything esle he needed to prepare The other thing that will bring us back is location and the shuttle THOMAS was the bomb He took us where we wanted to go and picked us up which was very helpful we saved time gas and confusion The pool was a little small but everything else was great We would definatley stay again

title: Great Location  did I say Great Location Excellent Location
text: The hotel is a short walk from the Muni at Van Ness and the west bound F and buses stop practically right out front East bound is really close as well Great resturants next door CAV and Zuni great coffee place Cafe Trieste  which also has free WIFI across the street and great bars close as well Pizza Zone is a few blocks away on south Valencia that is open late The rooms are small but when will you be there except to sleep BUT there is no air and no fan I brought the portable the pillows are flat and the towels are scratchy The shower has no water pressure but the place was clean David was very friendly and helpful I would stay there again but I would research parking since the lot the hotel recomends is spendy Also not handicap friendly the elevator would be difficult for a wheel chair or walker

title: Great attention to detail
text: Fabulous staff Beautiful imaculate rooms and all of the little amenities made it a memoable stay Watertown has raised my expectations for other hotels

title: Clean quiet bland and cheap
text: This hotel is close to the River Walk about a 510 trek but the rooms are about onehalf the cost Recently given a cosmetic facelift the rooms are clean and quietexcept for the trains for which the helpful clerks will give you earplugs if you ask We paid 99 a night during the final four which we thought was a bargain

title: Call Anthony Melchiorri this is a Hotel Impossible candidate
text:
I found the Sheraton Dallas to be so cheap that I would have been better off staying at a more mid range hotel They lacked in service lacked in quality and failed to deliver a good guest experience Shameful as I now read reviews I see other guests experienced the same problems over and over
At checkin I dealt with a front desk agent that seemed overworked and didnt really care to be on duty The front desk failed to deliver on room location requests and failed to inform on delivery options for a guest folio or receipt Apparently you have a choice between emailed folio or delivery to your room I now wonder if there was a similar choice for newspapers that I was never offered
Once in my room I enter to find all the lights off Guests shouldnt have to fumble for their phones and flashlights simply to turn on a bedroom lamp The room otherwise was ok It appeared clean but was slightly on the small side There were no offensive odors but it seemed within fifteen minutes any time I entered the room I began to feel stuffed up and suffered from sneezes I found it odd the closet lacked a luggage rack and housekeeping never replaced the laundry bag taken from the closet
The bathroom was sized appropriately with plenty of space to operate but seriously lacked towels Im all for helping the environment but leaving a room only stocked with two towels is laughable They didnt even have a bath mat Just two bath towels two hand towels and one wash cloth I was not pleased I requested more towels and it took 23 minutes to deliver what would be considered a full towel set The shower had rust marks on the tub floor and was in need of a full tub replacement There was a mystery hole in the ceiling above the bathtub
Bedding wise they offered decent pillows blankets and sheets but no fitted mattress cover So every morning you wake up with a sheet curled under your feet or feet touching a bare dirty disgusting mattress How can a brand name socalled full service hotel not offer a fitted sheet for a mattress Thats something youd expect from a bad motel
The Sheratons hallways and common areas were very dirty during my stay There were many empty beer bottles just left on the floor in the morning I came back one night to find a housekeepers vacuum just laying the floor in the hallway I think this location needs serious help when it comes to the housekeeping department Additionally they need to stop with the cheap green initiatives Its one thing to save a couple bucks on the lights or skimp on towels but now theyve permanently lost my business because of those aggravations If I wanted to be green Id go camping I wouldnt stay at a hotel At a hotel I have a minimum level of expectations that help me with my business travel this hotel did not meet even minimum requirements

title: Excellent Environmentally Friendly Facility
text: I was very pleased with a recent hotel stay at the ATT Executive Education and Conference Center We paid a very reasonable price for a clean and comfortable room While staying at the hotel it was wonderful to see the environmentally conscious steps taken in the building and management of the entire facility  especially the indoor air quality control and the use of local materials in construction Recommended for anyone traveling to Austin

title: dont choose this hotel
text: choose this hotel as it was a landmark of nyc and had read a lot about it my reservation was made 3 months in advance and paid about 350 usdollars per night based on the condition that my room would not be in the back side where according to internet work in a close building did not allow you to sleep of course by room did face these works and could not sleep as from 6 am which gives a bad opinion of the reservation system in this hotel the room was clean but small and unsatisfactory fitted  wardrobe too smal even for one person breakfat was fine and lobby bar great but you do not need to pay this uncomfortable hotel to attend to their music eveings as a guest I WOULD NEVER REPEAT AS GUEST OF THIS HOTEL can get better things in manhattan for less money

title: Location Location
text: Located right on Union square you are in the middle of it all Shopping access to sightseeing is easy good food walking distance Our room was very clean and housekeeping didnt mind us sleeping in My kids loved the glass elevators The original part of this hotel was very nice with chandeliers and updated ammenities in rooms like a dock for your ipod Concierge was helpful and all around hotel staff were pleasant

title: Another amazing stay
text:
in this beautiful hotel Our second time staying here and this time uuas even better than the firstpossibly because it uuas for longerpossibly for other reasons Our anniversary uuas very special and as far as I can make out the staf uuere very helpful in making arrangements for my partner to surprise me 
If you happen to read this honey please can uue go back O

title: the best part of the trip
text: My husband and I went for the family day long weekend The trip started out a bit of a disaster almost missed the flight the airline lost our luggage but when we got to our hotel everything felt better We had no complaints with the exception of one of the concierge i think his name was diego I was asking him about reasonable options of getting to the airport in newark from the most connected city I told him that we took the transit here and it was just fine  he was shocked that we would do such a thing He suggested hiring a limo or the other option was taking a cab which would cost me about 120 Although i think he was trying to be helpful I found him to be quite snotty EVERYONE else was lovely

title: Worst Part of Our Trip
text:
This hotel made me wish I had missed my flight They failed to send me a car when I ordered one online through the Econcerige because they sent it to my travel agent not the email I had provided No one helped me out of my cab with our luggage 2 bags and a stroller with a 8 month old 
 The room was small and very dirty duvet was stained by droll and had been turned inside out to cover it The bathroom shower had tile that was poorly done so the water stood at your feel instead of draining Our sinks drain was backed up not good when you need to clean your babys bottle All the ice machines were broken and tried to charge me 14 to get ice from room service The wall paper was peeling in the bathroom and the paint job was fast and streaky If I were them id get the money back from the painters
 Hotel room didnt have a room service menu Called twice for it and they said a manager would bring it right up After a hour and a half I gave up and ordered blindly from room service Three hours after I ate someone brought a menu up waking up my sleeping kid We went to the concierge to rent a private car because getting a cab at that hotel was impossible He wanted 111 an hour They were under contract to rip us off I guess With the Ritz hotel I never paid more then 80 an hour I went to the bell men who helped me get another car
 The hotel elevator is a death trap and lawsuit waiting to happen We tried to get in one and it started to close My husband put his hand in it failed to stop so put his leg in it clamped down hurting him It took all my strength and his banging on the doors for it to let go We had to file an injury report which they called us at midnight to give us the info So rude Next day we were getting on the elevator and the elevator car suddenly just wen up with the doors open 
 The positive of this hotel Good location The burger I had from room service was excellent The bellmen at the end of our trip was great They should run the hotel

title: Not so drake as Id dreamed
text: We were a party of 6 in 3 twin bed rooms from May 29th to June 3rd 2 rooms were quite OK but the 3rd was so small and facing a wall that we complained and after much begging were given a half lakeview one 3rd floor It was unusually cold 20 less than normal but the heating was off and the best they did was giving us very old and not so efficient small heaters The inroom TV hotel services account gave each day a different and wrong total so we spent every morning half an hour waiting anc complaining to a most untypical Assistant Manager no french no spanish speaking The public rooms are nice but not gorgeous Best assets housekkeping maids and buffet breakfast

title: If the company hadnt paid Id be annoyed
text:
I stayed here for 8 nights on a business trip so had no choice in the matter Upon arrival I was greeted by a male receptionist in jeans and a football shirt who moseyed over from the bar area to check me in At the weekend he was replaced by more professional looking staff but it was a strange opening sight The room was okay sized for American standards with a decent sized bathroom The elevator was slower than molasses
On the plus side the room came with some decent sports channels every booth table in the alwaysempty bar had its own personal tv and its very handily placed for some nice sports bar and restaurants in the area If you are going out locally leave the car at the hotel parking after dark can involve a walk depending on where your room is

title: How the mighty have fallen
text: Stayed at the Homewood Suites 1022  24 2012 I was given my room keys on the evening of the 22nd Got to my room and found that neither key worked Unfortunately I had all my luggage with me so I went to the service phone and told them about it The woman that had given me my keys said she would be right there After waiting 20 minutes I called backshe said that she got busy and would be there shortlyIn 15 minutes I called again and she said OH Im sorry I will be right there This time she actually came running So I said what about my keys they dont work She said I will take them and activate them and slip them under your door Well I fell asleep waiting for her to return as I had a rough day It was about to get rougher At about 1130 pm a guy came in the front door of my room and said he was pretty certain that this was HIS room I was groggy and must have appeared miffed and I was He said Im going to leave and go to the front desk I said uh yeah Shortly I was called and told that I had the wrong room and that this guys stuff was in the room closet I checked and sure enough it was UNBELIEVEABLE I kept the sheet that showed she had given me room 229 and I saw the sheet that he had that also said 229 I understand errors but this type of error could cause bodily harm My previous stay there I came into the room and noted that it smelled bad in the room I looked around and found that the kitchen sink had backed up and overflowed in the kitchen They said they didnt have another room and they could send maint in tomorrow WOW In neither case did anyone say anything to try and make these problems right No future discounts no free bottle of water no Kewpie doll NOTHING Did get an I am sorry from the lady who gave two of us the same room but that was it I had been going to this particular Homewood for so long that I went ahead and tried to make reservations again for my monthly trip to Indianapolis and they didnt have my credit card on fileThey DID have someone elses card on MY FILE That was the end for me

title: Pleasant hotel but terrible internet service
text: This is a fairly old looking at least property on one side of the Seattle Center near the Space Needle Pluses very pleasant front desk staff clean and goodsized rooms good location Issues I could not get the WiFi supposedly free and available throughout the hotel to work at all in the 2 days I was there I reported this to the front desk staff who promised to contact the IT people but the situation never improved Even in the business center the computers were slow and I finally gave up Note to travelers with families the breakfast served is only about as good as the free breakfasts I have in most hotels but there is a charge for it 795 plus tax and presumably a modest tip Not worth it in my opinion  the second day I had a muffin in my room purchased while out the first day There IS a microwave and refrigerator in the rooms Location is excellent for seeing the Seattle Center its not an area I as a single woman would feel comfortable walking back to alone at night though unlike hotels on the other side of the Seattle Center So some pluses and some minuses  just be aware

title: Star ratings may mean nothing
text: This is place is masquerading as a luxury hotel It has a large lobby with large murals shiny surfaces marble bathrooms etc Yet nothing is really well made or well designed In our room granted very large the remotes needed batteries the upholstery on the sofa was some kind of plasticized fabric that made noise whenever you shifted your weight the floor tiles and counters in the bathroom were Cracked and had multiple repairs The breakfast was an absolute joke There were four boxes of cereal and some cellophane wrapped muffins

title: Pretty good
text:
This hotel is well located near Time Square but as a result it is pricey Even on Priceline it came in at over 240 a night
Rooms are functional and have all the necessities I have to say they are small but aparently most rooms in New York hotels are Either way it was a comfortable room The service was good and the staff helpful 
As the location is very central it is very busy and noisy around the hotel Time Square is busy at all hours so consider this as most outdoor noise can be heard from the hotel

title: Great location
text: I love the location of the hotel in the middle of all the stores and great if you are going to use public transportation Right next to the Bart station that can be taken right from the San Francisco Airport The rooms are on the very small size but if used only to sleep and shower it is great

title: Hard Rock Chicago Really Rocks
text: What a place this is My wife and I stayed there for Valentines Day last year and had a wonferful time The rooms are nicely decorated and the beds are very comfortable The hotel provides a bathrobe to slip into  unwind after a long day of fun in the Windy City The flat panel tv is a plus right along w the DVD player and the surround system in the room Loved the lighting in the room because you can keep it dark  romantic or just turn on the lights for some reading The lobby itself was a fun place for the ambiance  music Very modern hotel within a landmark building Great Michigan Avenue location close to shopping dining theaters river tours and about 5 minutes away from Navy Pier Really consider this place next time you stay in Chicago

title: Not too great but not horrible
text: Didnt spend any time in this room except for sleeping The towels are very rough A little itty bitty coffee pot Decent iron Good blow dryer

title: Bring your own toiletries
text: I read the reviews before booking being a Hilton diamond member I had certain expectations which this hotel did not deliver Besides that they are in a middle of renovations the whole hotel was upside downcalling front deskhalf hour on hold going to breakfast half hour waiting for a tableparking fees are outrageous at least five times greater than other Hilton hotels Very dissapointed

title: OK if it were half  the cost
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights as other guest mentioned its still covered in scaffolding But even if it were not I cant help but feel the picture is an Artist impresion of the Hotel in a differant location the Hotel iswas nice But it is very tired and the rooms and Bar area quite simply need re decorating  Service and Staff were good the Cost was totaly unjustified  Small bottle of Beer or Coffee 10bucks  tax  tip about 3x what iy should be for a coffee 2x what it should be for Beer
Food was about 3x what it should be So if you stay here make sure you have a good credit limit on your card

title: Lovely room great location
text:
Stayed at the Metropolitan from 2226 Jan 2005 during the blizzard Cold and fed up after long difficult journey arrived at the Doubletree Metropolitan to be presented with a warm cookie each  delicious and very welcome I loved the room  the bed was so comfortable and the decor was nice Good TV and shower and the room was well heated to just about the right temperature
I was worried about staying there after reading reviews on this site but I was completely satisfied with my stay and the location is excellent And like some other reviewers I can wholeheartedly recommend the Oxford Diner for breakfast  good food and very friendly service sets you up for the days sightseeing

title: Hip and happening Ace ticks all the boxes
text: I visited the Ace Hotel whilst in New York and was pleasantly surprised to find this was a trendy hang out for the upwardly mobile and the cool Visually this boutique hotel has thought of everything huge comfy settees to sit and sip coffee a long table for the lap top fanatics to take root and lively buzz underpins the dimly lit foyer I didnt stay the night but wanted to it has the old world feel of the Dorchester Hotel London and the cutting edge decor that lets you know youve arrived Will definitely book a room the next time I am in New York cant wait 2012 here I come

title: THE RIGHT LOCATION AT THE RIGHT PRICE
text:
What more could one ask for Well maybe a few improvements that would make me want to stay here again
At checkin some minor issues There were 2 errors in my reservation name and length of stayseems like this data is critical and should be correct  A photocopy of my printed reservation was made so You wont be charged twice  and I had asked for a high floor and extra pillows neither of which I received The desk assured me pillows would be sent up They werent Be warned that if you are on the 2nd floor as I was you will not have time to swipe your roomelev card before the elevator has passed your floor and you will accompany other guests to their floors 
The room was lovely the bedding crisp and clean The blinds shut out the morning light the hallway doors did not slam and I was able to sleep comfortably A complimentary New York Times was enjoyed over coffee and croissant at a delicafe around the corner and my bags were gladly held for several hours after check out  I enjoyed a significant discount at the nearest garage with my validated parking stub and I found all the staff to be friendly especially if I said good morning first
Fashion Magazines in the room would link some fashion to the Fashion26 Hotel 
As a native Manhattanite I chose this hotel for location and price only I was pleasantly surprised that there was room to walk around the bed there were plenty of towels and a coffee maker with capsules and nondairy creamers were supplied My room 208 had no bathtub and a narrow shower
I have stayed in many NYC hotels deluxe and funky  to suit the occasion  so the Fashion26 worked well for me on this trip There is nothing outstanding about this hotel in a neighborhood of many choices I would stay here again if it were the right location at the right price

title: Enviable location but spoilt by miserable staff
text:
On Mission Bay and across the road from from Mission Beach  must be one of the best hotel locations in San DiegoLovely grounds and tropical birds But the staff were so miserable and some especially on reception were rude Room tired 
Such a shame

title: Great place to stay for a Dbacks game
text: Stayed here one night for a Dbacks game A very safe five minute walk to the light rail system very clean by the way that drops you off right at the stadium Room price was reasonable with free parking Location and room were clean and breakfast was fine for a continental offering Intend on staying here when I return Front desk staff were friendly and genuinely interested in helping you see the city

title: Great Hotel Very Chic  Fun
text:
Very nice stay overall Stayed there on an almost sold out weekend of 62808 for one night As a plat member was upgraded to cool corner room at the checkin which is more spacious got an extra window balcony to sit on However was travelling with friends so I requested a fabulous 2 doubles instead no problems
Lobby The staffs were friendly and efficient the lobby is very hipchic just like what you would expect at the typical W hotel I like the hotel ambience espcially at night so pretty Youll see many people hanging out at the lobby XYZ bars at night time Theres a DJ there too Theres an Acura MDX Experience counter available from noon to 7ish at night everyday which gives you an oneway ride to most of the places in SF area except airport of course and we did take advantage of it during our stay The drivers are friendly and no sales pressure which is an added bonus But due to the popular demand I recommend reserve your time spot early
The Gym Very nice with complete sets of eplical machines weights and the swim pool jacuzzi is right outside of the gym which is very hip looking too The gym opens 247 but the wet area only opens from 4am to 11pm Bliss Spa is right across from the gym which is very popular for girls to have their manipedicure and other services but I did not get to try it out so I am not going to commend on that
The Room Some room can be quite noisy at night since they are right next door to a firestation so for those who hates siren at night you should request a room away from the firestation Good AC very quiet and the lights in the room are very nice too The bed is the typical W bed not as heavenly as the Westin Heavenly Bed but certainly better than Sheraton Sweet Sleeper and other competitors bed I actually bought the pillow and the mattress topper home after I stayed at this hotel since it gave me a really nice sleep That tells you how much I like their bedding The room is towards the small size 300 sq ft but still plenty of space for you to store ur luggages n stuff The shower pressure is good not strong like rainforest but enough to wash you clean Toiletries is the standard Bliss Sinkside 6 lemon sage scent which is one of my favorite hotel product One thing the bathroom door has no lock and its very clearsee thru so be prepared if you are not comfortable with it This is one of the thing that annoys me the most at this property but hey its W so you need to be more open minded about it Turndown service available on request every evening
Parking 42night 12 off if you drive a hybrid Since its SF I did not drive its just so much easier to travel with their convinent subway system isnt it Also internet WiFi are free at the lobby so youll bump into many people with their laptop throughout the day
