Overall This is a good well maintained hotel and the renovations gave the room more freshier look instead of the dark depressing color Some people liked it some dont Of course the price can be high for most people at least 200night but if you want to have fun meet people or just want to enjoy the W scene you should give this property a try Dont stay there if you want a QUIET weekend getaway W is all about fun D

title: Convenient to University City
text: A one night business trip found the hotel convenient right off I85 and my meeting at UNCC was nearby New style Kingbed room was kind of wierd has new furniture with an integrated pull out desk dresser and closet along the one wall made the room seem smaller then a standard Courtyard room used to be The old closet area was converted to a coffee area not sure why closet seemed to be better there no more wallmounted hair dryer had to search for it in a dresser drawer buffet breakfast in the morning was standard and not memorable at all including the service No bike in the fitness center was missed also

title: Many more pluses than minuses
text:
Hotel staff was quite friendly helpful and attentive The correct room was available on our arrival and the room seemed clean bright and well appointed It was also a fairly spacious room Even though it was close to the elevator the room was quiet My father my brother and I shared a room with two doubles felt like queensize and a pullout couch
The room has a small wet bar which includes a sink a refrigerator a microwave stored underneath oddly and a twocup coffee maker which was inoperative on our arrival but quickly replaced The thermostat is near the window in the pulloutcouch room and had to be turned up to nearly 80F to achieve a comfortable temperature  a designinstallation flaw the maintenance person assured me Also between the two rooms are double doors with ball catches at the top One door did not have this catch  maintenance informed me they did not have the part to fix it Not a huge deal but a little odd
The only somewhat major drawback was my brother reported as have others that the pullout was very uncomfortable I cannot personally report on it as I did not sleep there Hey I was paying for the room I was sleeping in a real bed The doubles were really quite comfortable on the other hand Wired Internet didnt seem to work the modem had been unplugged from power but even plugged in it wouldnt connect WiFiInternet access wasnt free anyway At a downtown Hilton in a major city having to pay for Internet access is unreasonable On the plus side I discovered the 4GLTE signal was powerful and the onetime lowcost tethering program works well
Another very overthetop expense was parking We had taken a cab to the hotel but when family came to visit they found there is no nearby parking and the valet costs 3500 for between 26 hours I think it was 2700 for 02 hours and something like 50 for beyond 6 hours The family lives in town and said the cost was beyond the pale
Returning to the positives there is an unsurprisingly expensive coffee shop which has a few snacks and serves Starbucks coffees There is also a restaurant which I will review here as well which is really quite good

title: Afternoon Tea
text: Staying at the Palmer House in December is truly wonderful Best lobby ever Historic building in downtown Have Afternoon Tea it is delicious and a lot of fun Be sure to check out the Christmas Tree and the Peacock Doors and the gingerbread fireplace

title: Make sure have a printout of your confirmation
text: The hotel didnt look like much but the rooms were clean We had 3 rooms and one of the bathrooms was missing a shower curtain The pool was great and the shuttle service was too The only problem I had was at checkin I had prepaid and the man at the desk told me that I had only paid for 1 person per room I insisted that I had paid for 4 people per room and he argued with me I was able to show him my confirmation with proof that I had paid for 12 peopleEven though I only had 10 Then he told me that the teenagers that were with me werent under the age of 17 He finally let it go but without proof he would of charged me more money

title: Nice Hotel But Beware
text: We moved my daughter into her housing at UMD College Park and decided to take an extra day and spend the night in Fells Point as wed been there before and enjoyed it quite a bit We honestly werent totally sure about this hotel based on some of the reviews posted here but we went with it based on the location Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised by the staff and the look of the lobby Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable We had a great night out and enjoyed Berthas Mussels and gelato for dessert The cost of the room was reasonable and we had a great parking spot on the street The rub that I have is this when we received our bill at checkout there was adestination charge of 995 When we questioned the charge at the front desk we were told that that charge was imposed by the hotel and was not a city or state tax It was to cover the telephone in the room and the use of the lobby I dont know how many people use the phones in hotels anymore  we dont As to the use of the lobby we just walked through it Im not totally sure how a lobby wold be used I told the clerk they should just raid the rate by 10 rather than be deceptive He had nothing to say I would have rated this hotel higher but really feel like we were decieved by the posted rate

title: We so had a great time Great Staff
text: Your front desk Staff are so on it I have been with Starwood for 20 years we use to Stay at the Denver westin But No Longer  Because the Staff at your hotel Blows away there StaffWestin They could use some training from your Staff  Excellent Staff my family stays at your hotel several times a year and thay all say nothing but great things Westin not so much Short note  I was there foe the U2 concert and your room servicelate nite was Slammed but the gentleman that delivered us Room sevice was excellent  Thank you for a Great stay Laurie Alire

title: Had a great time in Indy
text:
The Canterbury is a very nice hotel in the heart of Indy I am not used to staying at boutique hotels so things like a doorman having ice brought to your room instead of getting it out of a machine and valet parking were all new to me That being said I enjoyed my stay immensely
The hotel is located in the heart of Indy and is walking distance to just about anything you would want to see in downtown Our room was well appointed and quite comfortable with plenty of room to relax The staff is all top notch and very willing to take care of your needs
There are a couple of items that indicate that this property is not as outstanding as a true 5 star should be The first is when the lobby was being used for a wedding notices were taped to the elevator wall with a piece of scotch tape IMO a true 5star would have a frame of some kind to display the notice Second the property is festooned with art and several of the pieces were identified with an Avery folder label stuck either to the art itself or just below it Lastly keep in mind that this is an older property and the walls are quite thin These are nit picks and did not detract from our enjoyment They are merely presented so you can make an informed decision
I would recommend the Canterbury if you are visiting Indy and want to stay in a very nice place with a great staff in the heart of a vibrant city

title: Not completely upgraded yet  and beware the standard rooms
text:
This hotel is very conveniently located and has had some excellent upgrading done in the past few years but the air conditioning system is still old and very noisy This is now in sharp contrast to the modern furniture and beautiful bathrooms 
A second issue is the standard rooms which should be renamed standing rooms We were put in a standard room first and barely managed to squeeze past the bed to the bathroom For single occupancy when on a business trip this is perhaps OK but for a couple it is cramped and claustrophobic The hotel had changed ownership  we booked at the LOLA hotel and their room bookings had different names  and we distinctly remembered booking a larger room than the standard and the hotel staff kindly put us in a larger room the second night However when reading through other reviews it seems the policy is to put unsuspecting guests in the standard room for the first night and then upgrade them on the second night 
Another issue that others have remarked upon some rooms seem to be rented out permanently and people may smoke in these rooms  our standard room was nonsmoking but smoke filtered through somehow from somewhere The second larger room we had was smoke free  and the noise of the air conditioning was less bothersome as the room was larger But in both rooms it was difficult to sleep through the noise of the AC 
If they do something about the smoke and if they upgrade the AC system and if they dont rent out the standard rooms to couples they would have a winning proposition

title: Do yourself a favorstay somewhere else
text: Service is nonexistent and the rooms are very small The staff was unable to do simple tasks like bring pillows or provide the items offered on the menu The coffee they have outside the guest rooms was very good but not worth the lack of hospitality

title: Grrreat Hotel
text: Stayed in this hotel in January 2007 and can say no bad things about it The hotel staff were extremly friendly and catered to all our needs and sorted any problems and queries we had quickly and efficiently The rooms were a reasonable size and as you dont go to new york to stay in your hotel was more than adequate The rooms were always spotless with fresh linen and towels everyday the bathrooms were lovely with a great shower with round the clock hot water All in All the washington Jefferson was a great experience in an excellent location Only 5 minutes from Time Square Highly Recommended

title: Chilly Feb in NYC
text: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt at the beginning of February for 4 nights Booked through Expedia I got exactly the room Id requested non smoking king size The room was much bigger than Id expected after reading some reviews on trip advisor although the bathroom was smallish However we were in New York and not intendng on spending much time in the room at all The location was fantastic we used the subway to get about which meant it was so easy to get to and from the hotel at any time of the day We ate in the Commodore Grill on our first night as they were listed in Winter Restaurant Week we did not however end up eating from this menu due to the time we had to wait to get seated and served The food was good when it finally came however I would definitely recommend this hotel and would return in the future I was pleasantly surprised after looking at previous reviews on this site

title: Thankful for an uncleaned room
text: If you can afford it get the King Executive We were booked in a Queen Deluxe on the 7th floor which was dark cramped dingy and felt its age Fortunately it wasnt cleaned nor was it clean 5 hours later when we returned so we were graciously moved to a lovely King Executive on the 3rd floor 2 windows lovely view to the garden spacious I get that old hotels have character and history instead of level floors and big rooms but its the lack of value here I object to I shopped a lot of hotels and paid extra but was sorely disappointed with our original room With the upgrade Perfect Otherwise nice staff good coffee great locationmaybe with the book theme they could have a shelf of borrowable books  old paperbacks down in the lobbyjust a thought

title: Fantastic locationvery happy we are staying again
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Novotel Times Square in 2010 i couldnt select the earlier date when submitting this review and we loved it The location was absolutely perfect and so close to times square We really enjoyed having a drink at the end of the day out on the balcony and enjoying the view
Yes the rooms are a little small but isnt most in NY What more do you need when you are there to explore the magnificent city and not to sit in your room all day worrying about silly things Starbucks just over the road for coffee and wifiPerfect
We enjoyed it so much we have now booked in again for our second trip to NY next year in March and hear renovations are about to start I hope we will enjoy it just as much as last time Thank you

title: Best value for the price Georgeous lobby splendid views on the bay
text: We booked this hotel with priceline I never knew of this hotel before an would Ive been expensive otherwise but we got lucky and got it for 90 per night This is a super nice Vegas style hotel Would highly recommend to anyone

title: Nice Looking Place  Horrible Service
text:
The hotel was beautiful and the location was great Our room was very nice However the service was terrible
We were travelling with a baby and informed the hotel before we arrived that we would be needing a crib 2 hours and 4 calls to the front desk later they finally brought it up
The concierge gave us the wrong directions on two different occasions 
The valets always kept us waiting on our car even after calling from our room at least 15 minutes before we needed to leave
Checkout was awful We called the front desk and asked for someone to help us with our bags before we went down to check out Their express checkout took 15 minutes and it was another 30 minutes before our bags made it down
We have stayed at other Intercontinentals before and have never had any problems This was by far one of our worst experiences with service at a hotel Ive had better service at a Holiday Inn

title: What a little gem of a boutique hotel
text: Just wanted to let fellow travelers know what a wonderful time my wife  I had at this quaint centrally located boutique hotel this past weekend Really a charming little hotel Had no idea it was the original Hilton in 1925 until we got there We loved the bright and airy dcor in the rooms and lobby and all of the staff was friendly professional and simply added to the entire ambiance of the place My wife and I have decided that although we live only in Bedford about 25 miles away we are going to make every effort to come back and have a staycation about every 3 months for a little getaway

title: Short stay perfect fit
text: I spent one night at the Monaco and it was too short a stay The location was perfect for me close to the theatres I had a tall room which was fun think tall ceilings extratall robe plus regular sized robe Only problem I had was to adjust the shower headI needed to climb on the side of the tub to reach it However the staff was very accommodating and Im sure someone would have helped me had I asked Loved the lavender chocolate for my pillow too

title: Disappointed and frustrated
text: I booked this hotel for my stay in Fort Worth for 3 nights thru Hotelscom My room was nice enough I had the jacuzzi suite room After a long drive I was looking forward to the jacuzzi I filled up the tub got in and hit the button for the jets and nothing happened I complained the next morning and was told that that room isnt reserved very often and the master switch hadnt been turned on Later that day I filled up the tub again got in and hit the button for the jets and once againnothing I didnt bother to complain The other complaint I had was the wifi connection popped off more than it stayed on When I had complained about that I was told that if there are lots of people trying to be on it it does have a tendency to kick off Sure didnt look like hotel was very busy so that didnt make sense The other reason I was given for the Internet connection not staying connected was that someone might have a virus on their computer and the resources were being used up causing the connection to pop off Needless to say I would not recommend this hotel and will not return to this hotel should I ever be in Fort Worth in the future

title: Worst hotel ever Do not stay here youll regret it
text: As soon as we checked in we knew something was wrong There were cameras every where felt like a prison and we were all being closely monitored There were stains all over sheets yuck Then the staff decides to change the locks on the door in the middle of our stay 3 different men literally came in with a saw and hammer and changed the lock for what seemed like an eternity as we sat there awkwardly on the beds Creepiest thing ever Then during check out we were charged extra for having people over The hotel manager was a total nazi and I say that in the kindest way possible He charged us 200 for one night Ive never heard of a hotel charging gor visitors We complained about the lock situation and how rude that was but he didnt care No refunds He told us we need to check our souls but we think he needs to check his reviews on this and other trip review sites Hes terrible and so is his filthy hotel

title: Not the worst but not the best
text: Just wanted to throw a flag for the extremely small rooms Even for NY this was exceptionally small The decor is nice the cleanliness was average the location is good if you want to be on Times Squarebut the shock of the closetsized room was enough to ruin it for me Also they have the tiniest elevators ever So small and so slowmakes it annoying to go in and out

title: Ringing in the New Year
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt on New Years Eve 2011 We had stayed once before and we absolutely loved it so we decided to ring in the New Year there We found out that the hotel has a New Years Bash on their top floor for around 100 a person We hadnt reserved our tickets so we missed out on the party but we found out the hotels downstairs lounge has one as well And it was free They played great music They also serve dinner or appetizers if you arrive early enough to score a table We ended up there and we had a wonderful time We ended up getting engaged that night It was a great night We love it so much that well be ringing in 2012 at the Hyatt again this year  
The hotel staff is wonderful and the hotel lobby is very nice Check in and check out was hassle free The view from our room was amazing They have a very nice pool which we havent been able to use because we always stay in January They have a fire pit which you can enjoy a nice bottle of wine at The hotel is walking distance to the downtown bars and shops We love the Manchester Hyatt Its one of our favorite places to stay in the gaslamp district

title: Lovely hotel not so lovely area
text: Hotel was very clean nice helpful staff decent breakfast and a little welcome gift bag We had a room with a nice little balcony4 Wasnt thrilled with the area it was in Pretty dumpy

title: A great base of operations
text: Located just a few blocks from the heart of Time Square this hotel is reasonably priced for the area at 159 a night We were pleased to find that we were right in the middle of the action just a few blocks from Broadway and there is a NY sight seeing bus stop right outside the door The concierge desk was okay not great The rooms are plain approaching bare bones but if you are looking for somewhere that is clean affordable and spacious enough that you can stretch out a bit then look no further The hotel was undergoing some serious renovations while we were there so it may be getting a major face lift We were happy with our stay and would return if we could get the room for the same price

title: Great location great staff great room
text: A onenight business stay to scope out Chicago for future transfer here This hotel was perfectly located in the heart of Chicago close to new office and close to Joffrey Ballet and shopping I had read the staff was friendly so I asked as many stupid questions about the area that I could and they answered without a blink The room was nice if a little dark and about what one would expect of a Hilton product I would without equivocation recommend this hotel

title: The GREATEST hotel in NYC
text:
The lobby is incredible simple clean lines and very light
The room I got was a single with a shared bath I stayed overnight but just wanted a place to crash The room was brand new It had a flat screen TV sinkmirror easy to use FREE WiFi phone The bed was comfy and the room was bright and cheery Were the rooms big Heck no But who cares I only need a clean place to sleep
The shared bathrooms were very nice There were 5 individual bathrooms had toilet sink and shower on my floor Each one is completely seperate from the others with its own entrance so you are not sharing your experience with others
The staff was very welcoming and attentive The one desk clerk said that they were originally going to just repaint everything but he said they ended up redoing everything down to the wiring
If you want a great room at an affordable price this is the place i actually will start going to NYC for the weekend now Gone are the days of 350 unaffordable rooms Thank you Pod Hotel Now we can come back to the city

title: Great stay and would recommend it to family and friends
text: Great value Friendly courteous clean and comfortable Great location and would recommend a stay here to others

title: Not bad  Not great
text: Had to stay here since my regular hotel was sold out I am not a picky traveler Overall the room was nice and clean I did get the sense that the hotel was a bit on the tired side but overall it served it purpose of providing a place to sleep for the night I utilized the shutttle service to and from the office and to the and from a local restaurant This was a nice touch Would I stay here again I would if I was not able to get into my regular hotel that I prefer

title: Great location comfortable rooms
text:
I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a few nights in May You couldnt ask for a better location Its adjacent to the convention center and within walking distance of shopping and museums 
The room was on the large side and I felt the bed was comfortable There wasnt a minibar in the room which always disapoints me when that happens but thats life 
I was put on the 27th floor which is on the same floor as a bar This caused me some issues as drunken guests would yell in the hallways and keep me up I dont recommend staying on the 27th floor if you stay here That is unless you wish to join the drunkards which could make it fun
I would stay here again if I were to come back to Denver but I would avoid the 27th floor

title: Neighborhood ambience
text: A charming hotel in the Village with an outstanding staff Located across from beautiful Washington Square Park Barefoot in the Park When Harry Met Sally with subway station an easy walk at the end of the block Restaurant on site offers excellent selection enjoyed their breakfast and lunch reasonable prices and an attentive staff genuinely interested in making your dining experience pleasant and relaxing Many other eateries nearby including the wellknown Babbo Restaurant which is across the street Lots of interesting shops Nice area for an afternoon stroll Desk will provide information on points of interest if you care to explore the neighborhood Rooms are small but nicely appointed

title: So pleasantly surprised
text:
We had traveled up to UCLA Medical Center for a family medical emergency to support our family About midnight all of the children were fading fast and I quickly searched for a local Holiday Inn to book rooms The desk clerk was wonderful and we were able to get the internet rate by phone a definite plus
The hotel was only one exit from the hospital and was right off the freeway from the north side Just go past the intersection and turn into the parking 
We checked in at 1 am and were offered late checkout should we need it We didnt but it was nice The rooms were on the small side but completely functional with fridge coffee maker and individual climate controls Everything was clean and in order The beds were so comfortable we fell asleep quickly Only one of our entire group found the street traffic made it difficult to sleep 
The extended continental breakfast was a bonus Not gourmet but good and hot and started our day out great The cinnamon rolls were fabulous though They had free coffee and tea in the lobby as well
The neighborhood wasnt great and the hotel seemed out of place but we sure were glad it was there
We did note that several local restaurants offered delivery for dinner 
Our oldest wants to attend UCLA so we will probably be returning to this hotel in the next year or so
Overall a great stay a good sleep and a great start to the next day

title: A Bargain in the Heart of the Big Apple
text: A midtown hotel providing comfort and amenities at a bargain price We have a suite with kitchette and huge closets coffee maker CD stereo 2 TVs and the best shower in NYC This hotel even has a decent exercise room Yes it was a little noisy  thats only to be expected in the heart of the BIG APPLE And rooms at the suites hotels a block up start at double the price for less than you receive at the Buckingham Very attractive and classy hotel with a welcoming and professional staff Highly recommended for people who appreciate value

title: The Four Seasons Boston is the best hotel experience Ive ever had in any city in any country Really
text: Ive never written a TripAdvisor review but then I wasnt expecting the Four Seasons Boston to be the best hotel Ive ever stayed in The location the service the food the pool area on the roofI loved it all I only wish I couldve stayed longer I would have eaten more french fries They were sublime and I dont particularly like french fries

title: Great hotel Poor location
text:
My friends and I booked two rooms off Priceline for 65 per night I thought this was a great deal for the Warwick Rooms were spacious and pleasantly cleaned The bathrooms looked updated as well 
The rooftop pool had AMAZING views but the pool itself and lounge chairs were extremely basic Considering we spent the day rock climbing the pool did its service in helping us relax 
For the cons  Location location location The downtown vibe seems to be around Market St and 16th St Mall The hotel is a very lengthy walk to these areas and I found myself walking next to sleeping homeless people at night So if you dont mind the distance I would recommend staying at the hotel but have some sort of transportation readily available

title: Spacious central location for visit
text: There are many good posts for this location A forum post recommended hotelrescom for San Francisco hotel deals and I want to emphasize that here We got a very good deal from the site when the hotel site said it was fully booked We had a king room with a sofa bed that was perfect for a family of 4

title: A fine hotel in a super location
text: The Staybridge Suites in Times Square is a lovely hotel that is equidistant from lower Manhattan and the Upper East and West Sides For those who are looking to stay on or near Times Square this is a great choice Our room was of a goodsize with nice amenities including refrigeratorfreezer stove microwave kitchen utensils and a wellappointed bathroom Rates included a free happy hour every early evening with beer wine and munchies as well as a fabulous buffet breakfast each morning Though no rates are cheap for New York hotels the abovementioned amenities must be factored into the price as their being included would add a hefty sum in a different hotel The only small gripe I might mention is that when serving breakfast in the large chafing dishes each morning the eggs bacon etc have gotten lukewarm or cool after a short while This might be remedied by having a source of heat under each large chafing dish similar to the stern that is put under fondue pots Other than this small item I can find nothing to complain about with the nice room and friendly staff Oh yes the nice large flatscreen TV plus various free newspapers each morning are a welcome treat

title: Top notch experience the room the atmosphere the food the event space
text: We held our annual user conference at The Allerton Hotel The staff is attentive and the hotel seems to have low turnover as we see the same faces yeartoyear The food is excellent and the rooms are small but well appointed

title: We loved it so much we will be back in three weeks
text: We especially loved the family pool area and the golf course Our waitress at the pool area Clarisa Jaramillo took care of our family exceptionally well making sure we were all hydrated and fed She also made sure our kids had essentials ice cream floaties etc Golfing was awesome Loved the service there as well

title: A perfect bargain
text: This Hotel is well worth the price Located perfectly on Lexington Avenue we were just blocks from everything The Chrysler building is four blocks away and times square is about six The rooms were spacious considering space constraints and very clean The people working in the office were more than helpful whether they were bringing your bags to your room for you or recommending a good place to eat This Hotel offered more than some fivestar chains ever would and I would absolutely stay again

title: Good value for the money
text: Close enough to San Diego to be downtown in under 20 minutes but its suburban setting meant better prices at local restaurants and no tourist traps plus the pool wasnt crowded The room was comfortable and had a microwave and wet bar I was disappointed that the rate did not include a fridge but one can be rented from the front desk One caution the hotels brochure says the breakfast buffet is complimentary but they tried charging 995 per person Theres better food for less money at area eateries

title: Golden Age Opulence with all the Modern Comforts
text:
It never ceases to amaze me that everyone does not choose the Waldorf
for their New York trips This is one of the Golden Age beauties that
has been meticulously maintained and updated with all the amenities
The lobby and other common areas are works of art but this is one of the older hotels that does not disappoint when you get upstairs You feel like you have stepped back in time but never lack for modern conveniences and comforts The beds and linens are comparable to any top property We have consistently gotten truly fabulous suites for the price of a standard room elsewhere The service is amazing and we have never been disappointed by anything at this property including the restaurants bar and room service While we have stayed at other properties in New York for a variety of reasons we will return to the Waldorf time and time again and next time if we need to be in another area of town we will just take a cab

title: My kinda hotel before heading down Route 66
text:
We arrived very late at night after a 9 hour delay flying over from UK and we received a warm reception on arrival Our request was for a twintwinsofabed room high up with a front facing view We were on the 21st floor but none of these rooms face the front  we could just see the tops of the Sears Tower ariels sticking above the other nearby towers
We ate out for all our meals including breakfast  tip of the day is turn left towards the Michican Avenue and not right towards the Lake otherwise youll be hungry There is an amazing McDonalds a few blocks west  huge fancy thing unlike any other you will see in the world  it a special to mark their 50th anniversary and worth a visit
Everywhere you will want to see downtown is within walking distance so we didnt hire our car until time to drive Route 66 The hotel has an integrated public mutlistorey car park and you get a much reduced rate for staying at the hotel
The kids  I appreciated the free high speed internet service  two PCs you can use so dont worry if you forget your laptop like I did
Nice lounge bar and a few tables on the pavement outside or side walk as you call it in the US Nice Califonian red by the glass though I cant remember the label Not many sidewalk cafes in Chicago shame
Friendly staff including some Brits fresh fruit at reception and one day we even had free miniature Hersey bars though I still dont like them it aint chocolate
Our family party of 5 managed to share the single bathroom We enjoyed our 3 night stay here and would recommend this hotel

title: Excellent Hotel for first time Philly experience
text:
WOW This place exceed my expectations I read the great reviews on Trip Advisor and knew this place must be special It was This was our wife first time in Philadelphia and we couldnt have picked a better place We were in walking distances from major historical areas South Street and amazing whole in the wall cafes and restaurants We stayed for two days and had an amazing time The rooms were small but cozy All those reviewers not giving this place A rates because their rooms are small or they dont have a parking lot on premises fail to understand this building is historic and was built during the time where a large rooms were not the norm and cars where not around However they provide a discounted parking rate a couple small blocks away Also the rooms are super clean and the small size did not bother us Moreover the staff was super friendly the manager was so helpful and suggested an amazing breakfast joint a few blocks away that is now on my top list of amazing breakfast places Thanks 
Overall this place was amazing

title: Beautiful renovation but then theres
text:
Ive used Priceline before to book hotels for Seattle but in this instance and like all others I wanted something right downtown close to everything While the Renaissance is considered downtown its kinda a reach to say so its right on the end and literally right on the highway So if youre hoping to do a little shopping downtown expect to either cab it back to the hotel or walk quite a few blocks with bags in your hands
The hotel has been renovated beautifully the lobby is gorgeous even the rooms have been renovated nicelybut theres one thing I wouldnt have thought of prior to staying here and that Ive never ever experienced in a hotel in Seattle before
The building is built on springsI believe for the sake of earthquakes etc which isnt a problem other than you will hear the ear piercing and CONSTANT sound of the building swaying and screeching throughout the night with the same rhythm as the wind 
After trying to figure out this noise for about 3 hourswe finally called the front desk and they explained all of the above of course there isnt much they can do about the construction of the building which is understandible but she kindly offered us earplugs which we used and finally slept through the remainder of the evening This also helped drown out the noise of the highway traffic
On a positive note there are some great restaurants within a nice walk from the hotel we enjoyed a beautiful dinner at Elliots on the pier and were able to walk there
The staff were quite nice the security out front was more than accomodating and offered us directions and an umbrella
Its a nice hotel that they are definately doing their best with it but it is older and the location didnt fit our needs this time around but for quick accomodations right off the highway on a not so windy day may be worth it

title: Great Locationat the right Price
text:
Needed a place to stay for one evening while dropping my son at
school in DC Booked on Priceline the evening before for 75 Bargain Room on tenth floor  king bedVery comfortable
Bath was updated and clean TV was a little olderbut worked
I had dinner late on Sunday at the restaurant off the lobby and
yes it was not cheaphowever the food was good and service
excellent Park in the public lot which is directly across the street
No worries About 25 per day You do not need a car to travel around the city as the public transportation system is very good
Lobby is clean Plenty of police around the area If you can
get this hotel for 200 or belowtake the deal

title: Great place  great location
text:
I just returned from another visit to NYC and once again stayed at The
Time Having worked in the city I like their central location The Time is a boutique hotel and to me therein is the difference 
I find the staff there courteous and pleasant and committed to providing service unlike the larger chain hotels Here you are treated as a special guest whether its your first time there or a returning guest Along with a great staff the rooms are clean quiet and secure  what else is there 
They are in the process of opening a new restaurant Serafina that offers gourmet pizza If there is one thing I love about NYC it is their pizza
PS I am not associated with nor do I know anyone at this hotel outside of being a guest there

title: Clean comfortable convenient friendly great location
text:
Not enough great things to say about this hotel I was quite impressed with the perfectly clean white linens and the overall cleanliness of the suite and the hotel itself Attractive decor inside and out Comfortable kingsize bed with lots of space in the room Comfortable sitting area in the suite Inroom fridge microwave coffee maker cable tv Nice big windows Good breakfast selection
The friendly staff greeted us by name whenever they saw us They were very informative and knowledgable 
Hotel is a short drive from the airport shopping malls downtown and business areas

title: Great Location and Value
text: I live in the Boston area but stayed here for a night out with girlfriends The Back Bay location could not be beat the hotel is right next door to the Back Bay T station and within easy walking distance to both Newbury St and the South End The rooms were average size with basic accommodations but were very clean We had a small problem with our first room and the front desk immediately switched and upgraded our room Great room and hotel at a really great price

title: Good Hotel and service AVOID THIRD FLOOR
text: This is a good hotel and great service We arrived late the first night where planning to sleep in until 10am but at 7am we started to hear a lot of person traffic talking and standing by our door For our surprise the third floor you have a guest room and two rooms who have been converted to a conference room We requested a room change which the front desk found us one with the same harbor view provided us with some refreshment and snacks for the night

title: Classy
text:
The Huntington is a quiet comfortable classy Hotel The Room was very very spacious for a Hotel of this age and also for the city Other than following the curious Hotel trend of no Qtips or Cotton balls in the bathroomunless requested
an enjoyable perfect stay Well I got my Qtips on day one and a mountain of them were graciously delivered by Housekeeping and carefully laid on a clean tissue within minutes of asking  
Heres the short list of good things LOccitane bath products deep soaking tub viewalicious pool killer Manhattan Martini nice old school Restaurant quiet location sweet Doormen and Lobby Staff a very nice Spa Shop with great product selection FAST and delicious room service Super comfortable friendly non intrusive vibe You wont see or hear the Staff other than in the LobbySpa etc which is nice

title: Great Hotel for Midprice Range
text:
My five star rating is based on the price range Im basically comparing it to 3 star hotels 
This LaQuinta was VERY CLEAN I was shocked to find out that it was over five years old The rooms were comfortable and quiet
The manager was checking the kitchen each morning and even doing some room service I suspect that the commitment of the manager is one reason this hotel is in such great shape
Overall theres not much to do in the surrounding area but if you are working nearby this hotel is a great place to stay

title: Good for Low budget
text:
If you want a low budget hotel in Ny this will serve your purpose well Spent 2nights here and didnt have any problems Booked a room with shared bathroom but never bumped into any one at all during my stay Nice situation 5mins from central park 1min from subway station and easy access to bus stops
Clean and friendly staff
Not 5star hotel but excellent for the price as you only spend the night in your room anyway

title: Beautiful Resort Hotel With Loads of History
text: The Omni Shoreham is a welcome respite in a fast moving city and I would definitely recommend it in the summer months if you want a combination of a resort and a city hotel It was really nice to come back to this beautiful hotel and relax at the pool  which was incredible  complete with drink and food service and a 24 hour fitness center We booked two rooms one a suite and the hotel accommodated us nicely placing the rooms next to each other We did enjoy our stay  even though we had the misfortune of being there two nights when fire alarms went off the week prior to 4th of July Being an Omni Select member I expressed my dissatisfaction and insisted that I would only be happy if fully compensated for the nights that were interrupted by the alarms I know others reviewed this hotel and were very unhappy with the fire alarm situation but to tell you the truth the hotel did deal with it well  in my situation  maybe becauseI was more assertive in expressing what I expected of them Thus I am still rating the Omni 5 stars and I hope the they have corrected the faulty alarm system so that no one has to experience being evacuated without just cause In summary I would give this advice to my fellow travelers If you are at all dissatisfied with a stay be professional and polite and express yourself If you dont get the answer you are looking for make sure you are dealing with the manager If you still dont get the answer you are looking for write to a manager in the corporate office That usually works especially if you are a frequent guest of that particular hotel chain

title: Nice room poor breakfast and apathetic staff
text:
I love to go to Philadelphia  and I go at least once or twice a year I always stay at this Comfort Inn Love the location rooms are very clean and pretty spacious with a good breakfast
This time I stayed in Room 921 which was right next to the elevator I was initially concerned about the noise but was very pleasantly surprised that I didnt hear the elevator even once The room was very nice  air conditioning worked well great shower pressure in the shower one negative about the bathroom is the insane placement of the toilet paper spindle  very awkward
My only quibble this time was the breakfast quantity and the staff in the breakfast room First day when I asked politely about whether she was going to bring out bananas she very rudely told me that she had already done that once The second day the breakfsast room was filthy Trash was full overflowing crumbs all over the counter empty cups that had held waffle batter on the counter tables sticky andor covered with crumbs Plus there was very little food when we got there and had to wait for the same staff member to bring it out It was down to bran muffins and cold cereal no milk before she got off her cell phone to bring food out That part was very disappointing

title: Old and Dirty  Nasty
text:
Well where do I start First of all  it looks nothing like the pics I can not believe Super 8 would let their name be used on this property
It was old dirty and nasty The bathroom looked like the 1940s There was something all over the lower part of the wall in the bathroomnot sure what it was The bathtub was stained We put bath towels down to stand on No trashbags in any of the trashcans Cobwebs and dust everywhere Towel racks in bathroom were rustyMicrowave was blocked up on one side to make it level We chose not to have maid service because we did not want anyone in our roomWould I recommend this motelno way

title: Europeanstyle hotel in Houston
text: Most hotels in Houston are pretty boring standard rooms and service belonging to the big hotel chains and somewhere along a busy road Not so with Sorella The hotel has an eye for design and is located in a hotspot pedestrian area with plenty of restaurants shops and a movie theater at walking distance The hotel offers a nice complimentary breakfast It has a small swimming pool but that is more for decoration than for actual use Fitness room in the hotel is small but you can get access to a major fitness complex two minutes away

title: Clean small bathrooms need a revamp
text: We stayed here for 3 nights staff were friendly and hotel was clean room was on the small side but I expect that with city hotels However the bathroom was a bit of a let down old fashioned poorly decorated old and quirky are fine but this was just old Breakfast was OK nothing fantastic juice cereal croissant coffee and some fresh fruit Its position in SF good not far from Powell St BART close to Chinatown and shopping if you like that sort of thing Had dinner the first night in Finos effectively the hotel restaurant was very busy and food was good would recommend reserving a table if you plan to eat there on your first night

title: Generally good
text:
We stayed at the Loews for 6 nights last week Generally we found the hotel excellent A nice corner room with comfortable beds and very friendly helpful staff Room service was always delivered exactly on time and with a smile with only one slight error in one order Housekeeping sometimes a bit hit or miss but that might have been due to the fact that my husband was in Philly mostly for business so sometimes worked in the room on his laptop so we may have missed our slot a couple of times
The area is very convenient as you are right in the middle between the historic and the museums district so everywhere is a bit of walk The Phlash bus mentioned in other reviews only operates until 3rd Sept
Reading Terminal market is defintely worth a visit for the experience and a cheap breakfastlunch Best restaurants we found are either down by the historic area try Chestnut St for Amada and Buddhakan or Rittenhouse area where we went to Twenty Manning
Happy hour at the bar was mostly good with the martini specials and cheaper nibbles  definitely worth a look
If you like the more sleek art deco look to a hotel without the fancy twee decoration of somewhere like the Four Seasons I think the Loews would be for you If you prefer Four SeasonsRitz Carlton style then probably not

title: a little piece of heaven
text:
I spent the weekend here with my family and I couldnt have asked for more Great location service and accommodations and a great value on the weekend
We had a club suite plus a king room for our family of four and the club lounge was amazing Great patio with a view hit breakfast and evening snacks and cocktails
Cant wait to return

title: Well run friendly stylish good food Whats not to like
text: Well located in the floursihing Meatpacking district the Soho House is supremely comfy and easy place to stay The service is good and very friendly the public areas are stylish and relaxed and the food is great And like all Soho House establishments the rooms are very well thought out and equipped Its expensive but worth it

title: A fantastic hotel in the heart of downtown that maintains the standards we would all like to see
text: A great venue in this refurbished hotel in the heart of downtown I have stayed here twice and both times were excellent I have been accompanied on business trip and found everything I needed There is an adjacent parking garage which guests can use and valet service is available The communal areas are light and freindly Breakfast was a great selection

title: Perhaps because I lived in NYC I think Park 79 is nice and reasonably priced
text: I have stayed at Park79 twice both times while in town for business The rooms are small but clean with comfortable beds The walls are a bit thin but it is NYC I found the staff to be friendly and helpful You cannot beat the upper west side location If you are expecting luxury you are not going to find it in NYC for 109  189 per night If you are looking for a comfortable room in a great location this is a good deal

title: Ugh
text:
Well where do I start HORRIBLE Okay the location was good and the restaurant was superb Ralphs market was across the street and great as well as Dahlias restaurant 
As for the hotel itself We arrived there an hour early and were punished Desk Clerk had something to say about our New Yawk accent We were then punished by being given a handicap access room that had no bathtub The room was drafty and it faced the parking lot and construction site which was noisy The bed and the bed linens looked and felt like they were from the original days of George Washington Shabby and nasty The tv was antiquated the stations limited No fridge small towels and never enough of them Parking was almost 30 dollars a night and internet was exorbitant as well The pool was nothing to write home about and the fitness room was  limited as well all in all i would say that if it were the last hotel in Seattle I would sooner camp out

title: The best hotel staff weve ever experienced
text:
What a magical place this hotel is Its not fancy or luxurious but its clean bright the rooms are large and the staff is absolutely wonderful The hotel has a family feel to it although there were singles there as well The pool was great right in the middle of the courtyard And late in the afternoon a staff member comes and offers lemonade and popsicles to the people in and around the pool  free of charge Upon arrival to Magic Castle the reception staff offer champagne flutes with lemonade in them Breakfast is complimentary and quite adequate  cereals fruit pastries bread spreads coffee juice etc Soft drinks and snacks are available at the front desk any time of day and are also complimentary
We could walk to Hollywood Blvd in 5 minutes where we visited Graumanns Theater the Walk of Fame the Kodak Theater and lots of interesting shops There is also a Metro stop right there so you can take the subway wherever you need to go
What made the Magic Castle Hotel so special to us was the staff On our second last day we found out that our pet cat weve had her 12 years was very ill and would probably pass away at any moment I informed the front desk staff that we would have to check out a day early and they were very understanding A few minutes after I had gone back to my room one of the staff knocked on the door and gave us a little card they had made for us saying they hoped our cat would be alright They also gave us a little stuffed mouse for her to play with
So to Gretchen Adam Shawn and I think Daphne thank you so much for your kindness and hospitality We will definitely return
And to anyone considering staying at the Magic Castle go for it
Weve never experienced such helpful and friendly people as we did there
PS Our cat is still hanging in but she doesnt have much time left But she was so happy to see us

title: Outstanding Quality
text: Amazing property Highly recommended Spent a few nights here in June 2011 The room design was phenomenal The layout was unique The details were very well considered and executed The French connection was also cool Seems that the entire staff is bilingual

title: Good pre flight stop
text: Stayed before heading back home to NZ Great links to airport and near the hire car places Good pool clean with nice friendly staff Would use it as a starting or finishing point of a US trip anytime

title: Do NOT stay at this hotel
text:
Hotwire has this hotel in the category with Hyatts and other 4star hotels this place is FAR from a 4star hotel This place cannot be compared to a Hyatt Westin Crowne Plazanot even a Hamptom Inn and Suites 
The description of a boutique hotel couldnt be further from the truth The carpeting through the halls needs to be replaced there is mold and mildew in the bathrooms  along with furniture that is chipping and needs to be replaced the furniture with the sink is chipping and warped The shower temperature control was loose and the handle falling off On a positive note theyve got GREAT beds
1 Know that you cannot use a luggage cart there on your own You MUST use a bellhop even if you want to do it yourselfand the bellhops are annoying and pushy
2 DO NOT pay for a guaranteed room through Hotwire The hotel knows NOTHING about this offer and wont refund your money when they dont have a king bedroom available like they didnt for us They will continue to give you the run around like they seem to do with everything see 4
3 The first room they gave us REEKED of sewage So after carrying all our luggage wedding gifts stroller pack n play and my 13 week old to the 9th floor I had to go back downstairs and request another room
4 They dont just swipe your card for incidentals They actually put a hold on your account for 50 When I called to see why 50 was charged to my bank account they brushed me off and said it was a hold used for incidentals Well someone should have explained that when I presented my credit card Ive stayed at Hyatts Westins Marriotts Holiday Inns Hampton Inn and Suites Crowne Plazas Sofitel Intercontinental and tons of other hotels in the US and internationally and this is the first hotel that actually placed funds on holdThe explanation I was given by Erwin  sp was that it was explained on the registration form I signed at checkin Problem is I NEVER SIGNED A REGISTRATION FORM AT CHECKIN Jonathan the individual who checked us in never gave me a form to sign Erwin transferred me to Ashleywho passed the buck and transferred me to her Accounting Manager  Laverne Green  Why not just apologize for any financial inconvenience tTheir customer service leaves something to be desired
5 Parking   RIDICULOUS 46nt for parking Ive never paid this much for parking at ANY hotelnot in DC not in NY not in LA not in Honolulu not in London Tokyo or Madrid
The customer service overall was abysmal The staff acted like snoody people who really didnt care if their customers were happy or not The staff and management should be ashamed of their behavior
I always read these reviews and think this person is probably some yuppy who is only used to posh places Well I am FAR from that Heck Ive stayed at Comfort and Red Roof Inns and been EXTREMELY happ Im not someone who HAS to have the top of the line I really just like clean places with a friendly staff And if there is a problem I like for it to be handled 
This hotel was definitely a MAJOR disappointment I will NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone This hotel literally ruined a weekend that was supposed to be a great trip Back to Hyatts and Westins

title: This Hotel is quite a find
text: This boutique hotel hasnt gotten the credit it deserves I just returned from a 3 night stay and it was great Yes the rooms are small but plenty of space for 2 people maybe 3 The bathrooms are large nicely appointed and the toiletries are top notch The staff was very nice and helpful with one exception but there always is an exception I wouldnt let her bad attitude change my opinion of this quaint very clean and lovely hotel Plus the beds are FABULOUS

title: Classic and Nice
text:
I absolutely love this hotel The rooms are classy and marble bathrooms are a nice touch One of my favorite things is eating in the Windows Lounge for some of the best people watching in Los Angeles 
A little overpriced but hey its the Four Seasons Would definitely recommend

title: Comfortable accommodations friendly staff in a great location
text: We enjoyed a weekend visit to New York City and The Distrikt Hotel was a perfect choice for us We arrived by train into Penn Station and were able to walk easily to the hotel On Saturday we walked all over that part of town Empire State Bldg 5th Ave Bryant Park and to dinner and theater that night The hotel staff was courteous  helpful and our room was very comfortable great bed  free Wifi It is located next to a couple of other nice hotels which are a lot more expensive so it felt like a very good value Thank you Tripadvisor for your recommendation of this hotel

title: really great location quiet nights sleep great for a stay in NYC
text: I too was very apprehensive about the reviews about this hotel especialy comments about the staff  but cleaning staff porters doormen all great  a couple of the desk staff could have been much more smiley and responsive to visitors when checking in and out  but wasnt really a problem and if you walk right round the side of the block and walk 2 blocks over there is a fantastic cafe wine bar  Italian with brilliant breakfasts and lovely lovely lovely staff who made us feel part of the cafe regulars I woudl recommend this hotel for brilliant central location and very quiet atmosphere

title: Perfect
text:
Im going to keep this review short and sweet because I could type away all day explaining how amazing this hotel is It was simply perfect in everyway great staff great location great room great everything and what a fantastic city New York is 
Will definatley stay here again and will recommend it to all friends and family who decide to go to New York 
Thanks to Adam Lindsay Darren and to all the other staff we dealt with

title: Great location
text: We loved the location of this hotel just a short walk to all of the sights Room was great with lovely shower and good quality toiletries Bed was comfy and linens good quality Liked the wooden floors as they felt cleaner than carpet Cupcakes were good too

title: Great location with boutique rooms
text: We stayed here to watch a Detroit Red Wings game The hotel room was boutique AKA small but very modern looking and comfortable It was nice just to walk to the people mover for the game The casino is very smoky so it was nice that the whole hotel is smoke free We had the breakfast buffet which was very good in the hotel Staff were very friendly  I checked out but left my coat in the room One of the managers asked for the room number and where i left it and got my coat for me rather than wait in the long check out line The only think missing is a poolspa area but for the price of the room I would stay here instead of MGM or Motorcity

title: I like this Hotel  would stay here again
text: Hi  Im a New Yorker who currently does not live in the city but when Im in the city I have strong preferences to stay downtown  particularly near the Lower East Side or the East Village This hotel is about a year old pretty new with a strangely good location on Ludlow Street  very prime There is a nail salon across the street and a Crepe place as well as all the other cool shopping Mint Julep right there The best gelato is just down the street Il Labratorio  and is not to be missed Though the elevators were a lil slow what I liked best about the hotel was its smallness even if there rooms were a lil small but it just seemed easy to get in and out as though I lived there without being a huge hotel with a bunch of elevators Bathroom was big room was small but view was okay Do stay here

title: Theres good news and theres bad news
text:
Bottom line this is a very pleasant place to stay and was convenient for us since we were visiting the U of SD and Sea World
The bad news
In general there was a bunch of little things that were kind of annoying for us We are two men in our 40s that rented 2 rooms a small one and a larger one the larger one had a kitchen and sofabed as well as a queen both nonsmoking
1 The first larger room they gave me had a strong cigarette smoke smell The carpet actually had cigarette burns in it in spite of the fact that this was supposed to be a nonsmoking room
2 I was transferred to another room no smoke smell but it and my friends room both had a perfumydisinfectant kind of smell that we both found unpleasant Perhaps its that Fabreze stuff and you might not mind it but both of us left the windows open to get rid of it The second room also had cigarette burns in it these were on the blanket In addition the back of the door to the room had some heavy scratches and dents on it as if something heavy had been thrown against it
3 When I returned later to my room and turned on the tap to brush my teeth there was an overpoweringly strong sulphur smell rotten eggs smell coming out of the tap
4 I went to buy bottled water and the vending machine I tried was out of water the second one stole my money and failed to dispense my water
5 When we arrived The pool had a sign on it saying that the water heater was broken although I saw people swimming in it later in the day who said it was warm
6 The make your own waffles for breakfast were pretty tastelss and the cereal had a stale taste The cereal was dispensed from large glass jars via scoops I thought it strange that the scoops were stored by hanging them by the scooppart not by the handle on the wooden knobs that were screwed into the center of the jar lids In this way every dirty hand that came in contact with a jar lid  and left its germs on the lids knob resulted in those germs being transferred to the scoop which in turn was repeatedly inserted into the jar Yeech I believe that the reason the cereal tasted stale was that the jars were never emptied and washed  just refilled from time to time
7 The remarks of the prior posters notwithstanding there was some traffic noise from the street My room was about 12 way back from the driveway entrance and you could still hear some noise in the distance with the windows closed It didnt disturb me  I feel asleep easily but it might affect light sleepers especially if your room was closer to the street FYI the smaller rooms what they call the bungalows are farther away from the street than the larger rooms in general
Ok the good news
1 The lobby was very nice  there was the fireplace and attractive furnishings 
2 Checkin was a snap Mary at reception who later changed my room was a delight as was everyone who worked there
3 The rooms were very nicely decorated even the smaller room was nice  the only slight drawback was the smaller rooms bath which had the original tile which while clean looked a little old
4 Everyone who worked there was very helpful and kind When I lost my money in the soda machine the deskclerk led me to the third machine in the laundry room and gave me the money I had lost
5 The Orange Juice and tea at breakfast was tasty I did not try the bagels but they were large and lots of people appeared to be enjoying them
Ive sinced talked to a plumber who told me that the sulpur smell that I experienced which was not in the shower btw could have resulted from a recent plumbing repair and probably would go away in a week or less
All in all Id rate it 312 stars if that were possible The hotel was completely sold out both days we were there so Im sure they had their hands full

title: Great Location
text:
Front desk were very helpful they were able to give us lots of information about the area Internet is available free to use on two shared computers next to the lobby Breakfast was okay a bit plastic tasteless but complimentary Good location 2 blocks back from fishermans wharf very easy walk and back far enough that you didnt have any noise or crowds Tour desks close and end of cable car turnaround is only 2 blocks away Everything was an easy walk and transport was easy to catch if you wanted to venture to down town or take a tour over the Golden gate bridge
Rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable You dont get a view from most rooms however you dont spend much time in your room anyway as there is so much to see in San Fran If you want to do laundry you do need to use the coin operated machines in the next holiday Inn which is in the same block The front desk can swap notes for quarters to use the machines

title: Perfect location
text: Stayed at the Handlery for 5 nights and have nothing negative to say The staff was friendly the room was clean The location is absolutely perfect You got the cable car practically on your doorstep you can see Union Square from the front door All shops Levis Westfield Gap UO AE and more best diners 3 Loris diners within 5 minutes walk from the hotel all transport cable streetcar and bus on market st are within very short walking distance Because of the ideal location I was able to walk around in the evening feeling safe If I was lucky enough to go back to SF for a 3rd time I would definitely book in the Handlery again

title: Great Staff and overall Service
text: I stay at the Sheraton LAX a few times a year for business Its great place to stay for business while in LA I person that always stands out is Estela Estrada A great server that always takes cares of our group Always has a smile in her face and makes sure that everyone has what they need Thank you for all your hard work Estela

title: Always love a homewood suite
text: I love the free breakfast and dinners on weeknights The hotel is clean and nice rooms The pool needs some updatingbut kids dont care My friend and I took our granddaughters for a grandma grandaughter outing and this hotel was perfect

title: A first class experience
text: The Park Hyatt is located just off North Michigan Avenue adjacent to the famous Water Tower Abundant shopping and restaurants are close by and its only a short cab ride to the Art InstituteThe hotel itself has been extensively refurbished with ample and tastefully decorated guest rooms It is a very efficient operation from the time one pulls up to the entrance With a reservation you should be in your room within 5 minutes There is an excellent hotel bar and a superb restaurant for those that may want to stay in one night Check out was equally efficient and overall the experience was fantastic

title: Stay Somewhere Else
text:
I usually dont expect much from Airport Hotels  but I expect more than this
None of the business center computers worked the entire time of my stay  I even called ahead to ensure they had them so I could check work email without lugging my work laptop with me
I kept putting my Do Not Disturb sign on the door and EVERY morning the cleaning staff would knock on the door to see if I wanted service
Nothing to eat after 10 pm  so if you have a late flight like I did bring your own dinner Dont bother looking in the book in the roomit is VERY outdated
Ordered room service  it was the wrong order and no silverware was on the tray
Breakfast staff was rude and it took over 20 minutes to order
They gave me written directions to return a rental car to the airport  the directions were wrong
What were the postitives The checkin process was good the front desk staff was friendly and thankfully I only had to stay 3 nights for a business trip

title: Bad experience for us all
text:
Me and 3 girls stayed at this hotel briefly The outside of the hotel seems nice an updated but the inside is a different story When we arrived the floor in our room was very damp  The room was rather bare and echoed really bad  we had to go to the front to get a remote for the TV The nights sleep was not great and one of the beds was HORRIBLE
The next night we arrived back late to our hotel and found that the mattress was in terrible conidition  The picture posted on this site was what it looked like 1130pm and a girl in our room made a call to the front desk where he was LESS that customer friendly She had to go to the front desk for help and he was not helpful and ended calling the cops for us to leave when he was the real problem We got our money back and left to find a nicer hotel Thank goodness we left there  the cops had even mentioned it was not a nice place
Dont STAY HERE

title: One of san Franciscos Finest
text: I have stayed a many hotels for business and leisure and found the Hilton Union Square to be more than adequate I actually visited the Hilton two weeks for two different business meetings and found the service provided by the staff to be exceptional The hotel is located within walking distance of many restaurants night life and a varity of shopping venues I stayed in one of the suites which our group used as a hospitality gathering place the staff provided excellent service and the rooms were exceptional

title: Spacious and comfy  but a bit tired around the edges
text: Stayed for one night at the beinning of October The hotel is in an excellent location and is easy to get to and from everything of interest Rooms are spacious and the bed is really comfortable Impressed with the clean bathroom as well Furnishings are a bit tired around the edges and showing some age Not much of a view from our room Not as romantic as I had hoped and somewhat pricey 220 Try to find a cheaper rate if you can Not a bad place to stay though

title: Always Comfortable
text: Stay here often Usually very comfortable and consistant Rooms are average but have always found them clean Breakfast fare is pretty standardmuffins toast cereal waffles etc Easy access to the airport Dennys and several burger places next door Easy to get a quick meal before heading out Good shuttle service Recommend you book room directly on their website I have found these are the best rates I always book as a senioralmost there age wise and they give you a discount Have never been checked at checking to verify my age Maybe I look older than I am

title: Great location in Manhattan
text:
Decided to stay at NYMA for 9 nights in June after reading the reviews and we were very pleased with our decision We requested and got a room with a view of the Empire State building which was great even though you had to crane your neck a bit at the window
We also requested a fridge and microwave  but used the fridge only The bed was very comfortable and the room was a good size for New York standards We changed rooms after the first night as we were right next to the lifts and it was too noisy rooms ending in 01 This request was no problem at all for the friendly and helpful reception staff There are only 2 lifts and they are quite slow Breakfast was included in the rate we booked directly on their website and it was more than sufficient to start the day A real bonus to get breakfast included in Manhattan The location was excellent for sightseeing and a busstop for the hopon hopoff bus tour was just around the corner Subway and Penn station were 58 minute walk away as well as Macys and JC Penny 
It was an excellent choice to stay there considering the price paid and the excellent location plus you get breakfast also Wouldnt hesitate to recommend

title: Comfortable but something is missing
text:
I was lucky enough to be given an upgrade to an oval suite which was a very impressive set of rooms and provided a very pleasant base for my 2 night stay The bed was huge and very comfortable The lounge was spacious and light filled with plenty of windows The bathroom had everything that was needed My room service dinner was delivered quickly and was hot and of a high quality
The reason I dont give it a higher rating is because
 staff were polite but impersonal and a little cold
 lobby was very crowded and noisey
 charge for wifi and for use of PCs in the business centre
 windows arent double glazed you could clearly hear the commentary from the hop on hop off buses passing the hotel

title: perfect stay great location
text: A bit hard to spot at first when trying to drive to it but it was very clean employees were great  a special thanks to Jasper who was a tremendous help when there was a mixup with our scheduled tour quaint a true part of the atmosphere there I would stay again but rooms are very small Beds could use improving

title: Beware of false rates
text: Although the hotel is great and the staff friendly If you decide to extend your stay beware they will charge you more than what is online I tried to negotiate with the front desk because posted rates were 100 lower and they would not honor that Since I had already stayed at the hotel for 3 nights at the higher rate it would have been courteous to extend the price for my family So much for trying to keep customers happy I think I will give the competition my business next time Buyer beware

title: Dumpy and Noisy
text:
I was shocked to see that this place got such high reviews by tripadvisor users I tend to agree with their assessments but absolutely not in this case The rooms are old and in desperate need of remodeling The frequently slamming doors and the loud maids are the tip of the iceberg This may be the loudest hotel at which I have ever stayed and that is saying something after being in Los Angeles party hotels My earplugs were little help to block the noise from the slamming doors which I just heard again while typing this review
The rooms offer the charm of a large closet yes the room is like a closet and pink tile in the bathroom The common areas are actually nice looking which is probably what makes the room look so horrible The downstairs exhibition hall is just a complete mess They took a room with acoustic ceiling tiles and put a wires and pipes running on their surface in plain view 
The hotel has two restaurants One is upscale or at least billed that way by its high prices and limited menu selection and a pub with high prices but not as high as the upscale restaurant Unfortunately the pub allows smoking everywhere The service at the pub was friendly but the service at the upscale restaurant was spotty Also the buffet at the upscale restaurant was a real letdown I expected it to be something unique to this restaurant but unfortunately it was standard Marriott breakfast Not great not bad either
This hotel would be appropriately priced at about 80 per night but not the 200 to 320 per night

title: Similar to Hotel 17 but a little better
text: Its the same basic concept as Hotel 17 except this one is in midtown We were lucky the staff person at the front desk was very kind gave us very simple of course but still comfortable room looking out at the Empire State Building It felt like it was one of the better rooms and he knew this Quiet definitely no frills but for what it was it worked Its a bare bones hotel but it still makes the effort within those bare bones

title: I agree with most of the posts for this hotel
text:
I agree with most of the prior posts on this hotel except that we didnt find the walls paper thin  we had no problem with hearing others
A few points
Yes there is no pool but the hotel has an arrangement with the University of Mass  14 mile away to use their fitness center Our kids loved the high dive The center has all the ususal stuff plus racquetball courts but they wont let kids under 18 in except for the pool
The hotel is in the middle of no where  you will need to rely on the van or the shittle to get to meals The traffic on 93 the main drag into downtown was bad at all times of the day
Au Bon Pain had a nice variety of stuff for breakfast and had nice omletts on the weekend  and it wasnt too pricey given that its Boston
This place isnt a Marriott or anything close  the doubletree website has very good pictures of the pretty basic room

title: What a dump
text:
Stayed here for two nights last week and could not wait to leave I was completely surprised by how run down this place is Our two room suite had a hole in the wall and cracks in the walls and ceiling It was obvious that this place is old and has not been updated since the day it was opened 
The breakfast which was pitiful even for a continental consisted of bread buscuits and gravy which I wasnt gutsy enough to try but my mom did and after one bite threw it out cereal only 2 milk available and donuts
The staff all seemed nice enough but they do not make up for the complete disregard for the upkeep of this hotel Stay somewhere else

title: So Bad We Forfeited Prepayment Even Though Im a Cheapskate
text:
We intended to stay here in 9311 based on a Travelocity TopSecretHotel deal 45 I think it was described as a three star hotel by Travelocity but it may have been 2 star Our first surprise was that they had only smoking rooms Our second surprise was that Travelocity TopSecretHotel deals allow the hotel to stick up with a smoking room We looked at the room and based on the smell could not sleep there Even before we got to the room the hallways were quite dingy and smelled of smoke The clientele was also a little concerning the three adult guests in front of me took about 15 minutes to rent a room pooling their cash since none had a credit card the speed was the fault of the desk clerk
I would say that on a scale of 1poor5 I would rate Travelocity as 2 for helping me get out of the room Allegedly they called the hotel to try to move but did not succeed They did not get my money back However they did help me book another room and did give me 25 towards that room

title: Clean and convenient
text: March is busy in Austin and we were happy to get any hotel at all with only one weeks notice However we were quite pleased with the location cleanliness and price after searching many hotel chains nearby and finding them all full We wanted near I35 and near UT We were pleased with the restaurants nearby as well Pappadeaux We will be traveling to Austin to see our granddaughter again and will check out the La Quinta again

title: Not as bad as all that wouldnt expect more for what we paid
text:
Having just returned from San Francisco I can honestly say the Renoir Hotel was a breath of fresh air compared to the dirty city of San Francisco and the couldnt care less people of the city The hotel itself is old but well maintained is centrally located and staffed with a team who cant do enough to be of assistance The area around the hotel itself is quite murky UN Plaza and civic centre residence facing the hotel makes it a very popular place for the cities many many homeless to congregate Although none of them imposed on our visit their presence alone in such large numbers may be discomforting for older persons or a woman traveling alone but this is just my opinion
Overall I thouroughly enjoyed our trip to San Francisco The people of the city as a whole arent the friendliest bunch in the world but the Renoir staff and a few other individuals more than made up for the rest
Thanks a mill Renoir especially Philip and Ricardo on the front desk

title: You Pays Your Money You Make Your Choice
