text: The great Broadway composer Alan Jay Lerner used to quote Sibelius  in all the cities in all the towns in all the villages all over the world noone has ever erected a statue to a critic So whatever I write about the Doubletree Guest Suite on Times Square has to be personal and subjective I happen to like New York And am here several times a year When I stay with more than one person I aim for the Doubletree It really is very good value for two people who like each other a lot but not too much There is plenty of room and surprisingly not much sound leakage between the internal rooms in the suite The checkin was smooth and friendly and the first room we offered seemed fine  away from elevators and ice machines as requested  but it had an adjoining door to the suite next door Avoid Two of Gods Little Ones decided 800pm was the time to scream So having just checked in and unpacked we asked to be moved The Front Desk and then the Duty Manager could not have been less sympathetic Yes they changed the room without question but we had to go to the new room with no question of a porter being offered to bring the new key and help to move bags I later spoke with the Assistant Front Office Manager who was positively hostile implying it was my fault the children were screaming in the room next door She was a real let down to the Hilton chain And then we moved rooms It was fine and phew quiet Of course the safe didnt work but an engineer fixed it within minutes Likewise a clock radio ditto When a good hotel fails it responds well and promptly The Doubletree did just this And that night when we returned to our room late there was a bowl of fruit and chocolate with a handwritten apology from the Duty Manager A classy solution to the earlier unhappiness Would I recommend this Doubletree Guest Suite Absolutely quiet roomy friendly and at the crossroads of one of the most exciting destinations in the world

title: We would go again
text: The room was nice but a little small The parking ramp for the hotel is free as is the breakfast buffet We didnt care much for the buffet will purchase off the menu next time or go somewhere else

title: Deserves a great rating
text:
This small hotel is in a great location if you want to experience staying in a great neighborhood rather than a crowed business or tourist district It is about a 10minute walk from the Convention Center and the Market Street Subway So you dont have to pay for a taxi from the airport or train station if your luggage has good wheels
Great neighborhood restaurants At least two are BYOB and they dont even charge a corkage fee The state liquorwine store is a bit less than a 10 minute walk away on Locust between 12 and 13 streets They are open in the evening but close at 5 on Sunday
Very clean Small bathrooms but not a problem Some rooms may be small Splurge for a larger room  its still cheap AAA 10 discount
They have 2 free internet terminals which should have good availability for this 48 room hotel with free wifi in the rooms Free printing of boarding passes but 1page otherwise
Very good breakfast as long as you are not low carb limited
Reserve as soon as you can because there is great demand for this hotel with great value Appears to have been renovated just a few years ago Am looking forward to my next visit

title: Great value  too many noisy children
text:
My partner and I stayed here for 6 days as a base for exploring Washington DC The positives were fantastic staff  large well appointed room A free breakfast was included The food supplied was OK but the general crowd noise mess  children running free were hard to cope with The same can be said for the managers drinks
This hotel is great value for money but I would only recommend if for families It is not relaxing for couples or business people

title: Not upto the expected Four Seasons Brand Customer Experience
text: When you stay at a Four Seasons you expect certain key deliverablesThe Four Seasons San Francisco meets most of these but where it does not is the conceirge servicesthey have a very serious attitude problem and are actually quite useless and dont bother to fulfil requestsI suggest the Four Seasons San Francisco Management sends off their conceirge to the New York Four Seasons to see how it should be done and invest in correcting their attitude

title: Exceptional on the Riverwalk
text: I stayed here for 2 weeks on business The facilities are way above average for the price and i could not have asked for anything more It is centrally located on the Riverwalk Meeting facilities were adequate What trully made the 2 week long experience was the hotel staff a true delight Everyone from the front desk security valet meeting rooms staff kitchen housekeeping bistro etcwere knowledgable very friendly engaging warm and professional It is rare when you come across a property where there is a consistant level of high service across all departments Congratulations

title: Best and coolest hotel in NY
text: I spend again 2 days in NY Andaz 5th got the nicest and biggest rooms On the 11th floors the rooms even got a terasse The stuff makes you feel like home In the basement there is THE BAR Great stuff  great cocktails  just the bar manager is a little bit stiffThe cocktails are wonderfull

title: Great location
text: The location was unbeatable 3 blocks away from the White House and plenty to do around the area one complaint the staff was ok Rain poured down on us and we were waiting for our bags to be brought up so in the mean time I asked for robes so we could at least get out of our wet clothes I waited and waited they never came I called front desk 2 more times requesting the robes and by the last time the lady even said that I already had 3 requests Well if they had brought me the robes in the first try I wouldnt have to make 3 requests That lady made me feel stupid for asking for a simple thing like I shouldnt be bothering her with my silly request But all in all great location breakfast at Twiggs was delicious and the waitstaff was definitely super friendly and helpful

title: Decent place to stay close to attractions
text: Very decent hotel clean and provides free parking and breakfast Liked selfmade wafles fruits eggs and sausage Not expensive and close to all attractions Family hotel with free Internet and WIFI

title: Help Hurricane Irene messing up plans Trying hard to contact hotel
text: We were booked to go to this hotel but had to reschedule our trip thanks to Hurricane Irene disrupting flights Now trying desperately to get in touch with hotel to check our booking has been rescheduled for 2nd  9th Sept spoke to someone midstorm and she confirmed itd be ok but said shed need to wait for the manager to change the booking and we should phone back but phone lines now look like theyre down with storm damage If the manager is reading this please get in touch Really looking forward to going and hoping itll all be ok Will add a proper review once weve been

title: Surpassed my expectations
text:
I recently attended a conference that was being held at the Grand Hyatt so for convenience booked a 2 night stay at the hotel I usually like to stay at boutique hotels for a more personal touch I was a bit wary that the Grand Hyatt would be like a convention center type hotel but had a really wonderful time 
 The location is perfect I was fortunate to get a room overlooking Union square with the Christmas tree and icerink in view Macys Saks and Barneys are just down the street and so cute to see the SPCA dogs and cats up for adoption in the windows of Macys It is a few blocks north of the Montgomery BART stop
 The room was spacious modern and bright Instead of drapery there was a button operated window screen I felt so relaxed The only thing that I disliked was that one could hear the wind but I was so tired that once I fell asleep it wasnt an issue
 The restaurant on the 37th floor has panoramic views of the bay and city Unfortunately the area reserved for happy hour is limited so it was packed at 5pm With so many great restaurants in San Francisco including those with Michelin stars I ended up eating outside the restaurant
 I am definitely looking forward to returning to San Francisco and a stay at the Grand Hyatt

title: Bathroom Lights and Elevator Frights
text:
Yes the hotel is very beautiful with a luxurious feel but you can read that in all of the other reviews Here are some of the items that I thought were most pertinent
Valet parking is 33 a night We found that a bit steep considering additional tips We decided to park at an overnight parking garage Merchants Garage I think It was 16 for 24 hours and less than a five minute walk from the hotel which we figured would be faster than doing valet Do some research on Google Maps to look around for what is best for you
Yes the elevators are fast but they also say that you are on the desired floor seconds before you actually stop This gave me a few brief heart attacks when going to the lobby thinking that we were crashing into the ground
The rooms are very nice but somewhat small for what I expected We had a King room
The TV is very large for a hotel but with a limited channel selection I dont think anyone really wants to watch the exercise channel when on vacation or on a business trip
The bathrooms are FANTASTIC and very clean I did not find any hair in the shower like I normally do in other hotels They include a soaking tub glass shower with a duel shower head phone TV dimming lights hairdryer and a makeup mirror Towels are over sized 
Lots of fun bathroom goodies including shampoo conditioner shower gel soap body lotion qtips dental picks mouthwash nail file and a dental kit which includes the smallest and therefore cutest toothpaste I have ever seen The products were all very nice and of good quality
The hotel offers free bottled water at the desk if you ask However it is not chilled
Turn down service includes getting the bed ready dimmed lights light sconces by bed turned on music and free bottled water and ice
We ate breakfast at the Capital Grille using the coupons we were given I think because we are Hilton Honors members They were good for a free continental breakfast assorted pastries and fruit with coffee juice etc or 10 off a meal My husband opted for a meal that included eggs potatoes bacon toast fruit and coffee normally 14 I got the Healthy Start meal with came with fresh fruit strawberries blueberries and blackberries and tons of yogurt and yummy granola normally 11 Both meals very excellent However it was a very fancy restaurant and we felt under dressed in jeans among the business travelers we dinned near However when we left we saw many others dressed like us It was hard to tell what the dress was before entering because you cannot see into the restaurant before you enter
The hotel is connected to a sky walk called the Arts Garden which will take you to the Circle Centre Mall lots of good shops without having to go outside
Yes the hotel charges for internet but we saw a sign in the Arts Garden for free wifi It is connected to the second floor of the hotel with lots of places to sit if you really dont want to pay
There are plenty of restaurants surrounding the hotel Rock Bottom Brewery Weber Grill Panera Champps Hard Rock Cafe just to name a few
Overall we were both very happy with our stay and would return again

title: Absolutely Horrid
text: Worst excuse for a luxury hotel Ive ever seen anywhere including the Third or Fourth World aStayed in Upgraded king room with Hilton Diamond highest status Rooms are extremely dated and in poor condition Bed and bed linens smelled as if they had not been changed from the last guest the beds had to be changed twice on check in and the pillows had to be swapped out for new ones Room was not ready despite Diamond Status and notification to the hotel upon booking of time of arrival Carpet was so worn as to be slippery and indeed we did both slip several times Very very loud even for location I have lived in and visited Manhattan my whole life and I assure you there are much better hotels at the price  try the Sherry Netherland or Lowes Regency When I was a child in Manhattan this was known as an hotel for business parvenu tourists and an event venue for second rate debutante balls  but I cannot think anyone in even any of these classes would put up with this hotel If you really think there is something special about this hotel visit the lobby and the bar  if you need to get your hair done go the Kenneths by all means  but for Heavens sake stay elsewhere

title: Great Hotel good area
text:
I booked a room in the French Quarters February 13 2012 for the next day Valentines Day The person who took my reservation was very friendly while taking my information He checked to see how I was getting into the city and told me about a parking garage they have a deal with that was only a block away 30 for 24hrs 
When we checked in they were able to upgrade us to a room with a King originally they only had Doubledouble rooms It ended up being the same low price of 200 which is low in comparison to the other hotels in the area
The room was great 103 Extremely comfortable bed Kitchen area was nice keurig coffee machine sink minifridge with water electric stovetop Large flatscreen TV with DVD player Desk with a hookup to the internet including instructions Closet had iron ironingboard and a little stool for luggage Dresser with 3 drawers Decor was very nice with a brick wall behind the bed Bathroom has a large stall shower with a glass doorwall Room was spotless
My girlfriend had issues sleeping in the early morning because the traffic outside garbage trucks delivery trucks etc but that is any NYC hotel especially on a lower floor Newspaper delivery right outside your door New York Post Continental breakfast
The bar attached to the hotel was very cool Burbon Street We had a few drinks there before heading out There are a number of barsrestaurants within 5 minutes of the hotel
Overall great stay

title: Good location dismissive staff
text:
This is a great airport hotel if your planning a layover in LA as its really close to LAX dont expect much in the way of customer service though 
I asked the concierge on two separate occasions staff members for assistance and was met with a dismissive attitude the first time he actually answered the phone in mid conversation with me  offered no apology The reception staff arent much better to be honest one particular girl who looked like she really didnt want to be there and would be better placed working on the phones 
This coupled with the hairs and cigarette ends round the pool will ensure that Ill be taking my business to the Westin which is just down the street

title: Location location clean
text: Our family booked four rooms for 4 nights including a large suite Service was good The breakfast was brought to the room promptly and was excellent The valet busted his buns hailing a taxi every time we needed one though the waits were sometimes quite long The NY Times was waiting outside our door each morning The rooms were clean but somewhat cramped and small There were sufficient easily accessible electrical outlets for laptops The refrigerator was packed with items we did not want such that there was no room for leftovers So we moved some of the items out of the frig to make room for leftovers and were charged for those items because they had been moved This issue was rectified by a simple complaint and our account credited I cannot comment on the hotel restaurants because we did not eat there Overall the stay was acceptable especially considering the prime location on Central Park

title: Clean and Comfy
text:
good rooms and clean and comfy
Good services and great restaurant

title: great stay with no problems
text: Ive just returned from 7 nights in SF and had a great stay in this hotel Arrived about 1 12 hour before check in time and we were upgraded to a king room on 23rd floor and able to check in immediately The front desk staff were all very friendly and I have no complaints about them The room was large and bright the bed was comfortable although soft so if you like a hard mattress it may not be ideal Bathroom was small but nice Im a light sleeper and did find that the room doors were loud when openingclosing but other than that there were no real problems with noise Requested a few extra coffeesmilk during the week and these were bought up to the room quickly by very pleasant members of staff Internet was 1495 for 24 hours Breakfast 28 per person unless included in room rate but there were plenty of nice places to grab something for breakfast around the area so we didnt bother with the hotel one At first I wasnt sure about the location but by the end of the week i was convinced that the location was great All the public transport we tookleft from Market Street which is only a couple of blocks away and we would have had to walk just as far if we had stayed in Union Square Like others after reading some of the reviews on here I was a bit worried but had absolutely no problems once we were there and would definitely return

title: On top of San Fran central to everything
text:
Request a corner room if u can we had sweeping views over half of San Fran
Lovely hotel we enjoyed being on top of the hill a good calorie burner

title: Absolutely terrible
text:
I recently completed a stay at the Residence Inn  Houston Medical Center I travel quite a bit as part of my job  probably around 2000 nights over the last dozen years The hotel itself certainly was much nicer than the average hotel that Ive stayed at over the years However Id have to say that there were a few issues
 My flight into Houston was cancelled and I was rerouted through several other air carriers These airlines were unable to successfully deliver my luggage in a timely manner Alas I checked into the hotel on March 10 2008 without my luggage
 I went to a grocery store along the way and I picked up a bunch of food and essentials for the week On the morning of March 11 2008 I left all of these items in my hotel room along with my toiletries medications platinum arrival gift and several other belongings I also left a note asking for the AC to be looked at as it was not working luckily the room was not uncomfortably warm yet
 My luggage managed to be delivered to the hotel later that afternoon I picked it up when I stopped by the hotel during a quick break in my work schedule I was very happy that it arrived and I brought it up to my room Curiously the room was in a state of disarray Every cabinet and drawer in the entire suite had been left open and the sofa cushions were propped up in a very odd manner This was odd but I just figured that some special cleaning had been done or something Lots of odd things tend to happen in hotels
 My elation at the luggage arrival must have kept me from immediate recognizing that almost all the things that I had left in the room that morning were now missing I did notice that my note about the AC had disappeared and the air blowing out of the vent felt slightly cool I figured that they must have fixed it I turned down the thermostat a few more degrees and went back to work
Several hours later when I arrived back in the room it was still quite warm in the room I went to grab a water out of the refrigerator and I saw that it had been completely emptied out I quickly realized everything else was missing as well except for my cell phone charger and a magazine I had left in the restroom I called the front desk and asked for an explanation and I was told that it must have been a mistake I was absolutely furious I ended up leaving a message for the hotel General Manager Barry Shank explaining my situation The room was very warm  clearly the air conditioning was still not working properly
 The next morning March 11 2008 I left a series of notes in the room asking for my belongings to be returned and for the AC to be fixed To be safe I packed up all of my belongings before I left the room I stopped by the hotel again that afternoon to find that all my notes had been removed except for the one on the thermostat and nothing noticeable had been done to fix the AC The room was uncomfortably hot I searched the Internet for alternate accommodations but due to the nearby rodeo in Houston the area was sold out
 None of my belongings were returned but there was a message from Mr Shank on my phone letting me know that I was welcome to go back to the grocery store and repurchase everything that the hotel had removed and I would be reimbursed Apparently I was guilty of not leaving enough luggage in the room which at this particular hotel is understood to be a signal to the hotel staff to steal everything in the room Clearly Im paraphrasing a bit but the implication was definitely made that I was at least partially to blame for not leaving any luggage in the room and I was lucky to have received such a generous offer Nonetheless I decided it would be a waste of my time to purchase more items which the hotel staff may or may not steal again
There was also an Easter basket on the counter filled with some candy particularly Peeps Marshmallow Bunnies That would be a fine gesture but I am vegan and I dont eat candy made of ground up horse hooves
 On my way out of the hotel I stopped by the front desk and explained the situation with the AC I talked very slowly and I made sure that the gentleman understood that it was not working I must have been successful as when I returned to my room late that evening I had a voicemail from someone explaining that the maintenance staff had determined that there was a problem with the air conditioning in my room Mind you it wasnt actually fixed yet but they were going to fix it someday In the meantime the hotel was going to need me to change rooms the next day
 I rolled around in bed for a while sweating and uncomfortable Eventually I decided to leave my 189 per night room and go out to my car and sleep since it was much cooler outside It was the best sleep I had during my stay
 On the morning of March 12 2008 I was able to find a new hotel I gleefully brought a premature end to my stay at the Residence Inn  Houston Medical Center

title: Thirty minutes for a fork twenty minutes for my carbut nice helpful staff decent rooms
text:
Unfortunately I have to highlight that room service kept me on hold for 30 minutes and all I wanted was a fork Also valet parked my car in the wrong place so had to wait 20 minutes for my lost car Other than that room service food was one of worst if not the worst Ive ever had But enough of the good things
Seriously I got a phenomenal rate with valet parking included I thought the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and when I did complain no questions asked My lousy room service was taken off the bill etc
Although my room smelled old and musty the whole time it was very clean housekeeping very prompt and thorough front desk staff very accommodating and in spite of the 30 and 20 min wait I had a very positive experience

title: Filthy
text: Nasty odor Stained bathrooms Unclean floors Bed seemed unclean I ended up sleeping on the top of all the covers with a hoodie on Worst of all NO TV REMOTE

title: Unimpressive business hotel
text:
Attended conference in this hotel and found the rooms to be comfortable There was no safe and some of the nonsmoking rooms got mislabeled The staff changed our rooms once we alerted them and this is not something wed hold against the property
The fitness facility was awful and was a single converted hotel room with aging equipment Room service was expensive with below average food quality It was hard to find quality restaurants within walking distance and we had to drive to the outskirts of town or Mountain View for decent food Downtown San Jose otherwise seemed pleasant and walkable and the hotel was very close to the light rail 
In summary the hotel was comfortable but lacked amenities one is accustomed to in hotels catering to business travelers and it was hard to find a decent bite to eat nearby or on site

title: That was a first
text:
We have stayed at a lot of hotels over the years but we just experienced something that impressed us Whenever we fly out of LAX in the early morningwe stay at the Marriott LAX Its consistently good clean and has a friendly staff On 93 we checked in around 7pm and were greeted by Michelle a very friendly young Lady 
After our pleasant check in and dropping our stuff in the room we headed for our traditional burger at Champions As usual the burgers were great and so was the service
After a good night sleep in the comfy bed we woke up in the morning to our bill and a hand written note from Michelle thanking us for our business and wishing us a safe journey That started the day out right A small gesture that meant so much to us Good training Marriott and thank you Michelle

title: Nice little hotel
text: I stayed here with my girlfriend for about a week earlie september The room was a bit tired but clean and cosy The staff were real nice and helpful at all hours and you cant beat the location at this price and standard

title: Very Pleased
text: As I walked into the lobby I was pleased with the cleanliness the attention of the front desk staff and inviting seating The staff was so nice friendly and engaging

title: Nice for the price
text: I have used this hotel about 20 times Yes if you get a regular room it is very small basically only fits the bed with minimal walking space I have also stayed in a family suite which was huge  almost like an apartment and is not that much more in price The hotel is extremely quite the staff is nice  and it is very cheap at times i have found a room for 80 alot of the time you just have to keep checking

title: adequate hotel but seen better days
text:
I had stayed in this hotel before so decided that due to the good location I would stay again
However it seemed that nothing had changed apart from the new TVs since I had last stayed there 5 years ago The outside of the hotel does not have the wow factor but the foyer is nice and the staff helpful
The rooms however have seen better days The bathroom suite needs a complete overhaul  deep clean and the bedding was yellowingold however it was clean
The location of the hotel is good 49th and 10th A 510 minute walk from Times Square and Broadway
Overall if you only want somewhere to rest your head at the end of a long day of sightseeing then this hotel is adequate for your needs which it was for us However if you want to sleep and bathe in luxury then I suggest you stay in the Hilton up the road

title: Cute but BEWARE the Rockhard beds
text: I pricelined a room at the last minute and ended up here This is a cute little boutique hotel with quaint rooms The only criticism I have is the ROCK HARD beds Yowch I woke up with a sore back the next morning I think the floor would have been more forgiving Oh and the road noise from outside was a bit much

title: An amazing place to stay downtown
text: We booked this hotel using points on our credit card When we arrived we were immediately greeted by a friendly face We arrived several hours before checkin However they let us checkin early They also gave us a free room upgrade The hotel is absolutely stunning In addition it is off of State Street There are many things to do  shopping dinning theater It is also close to public transportation if you would like to go to the United Center or the airport The hotel also allowed us to have a late checkout at no additional charge The room was so dark and quiet we slept in

title: My NYC home
text:
Spending A LOT of time in hotels I like to find apartmentlike suites where I can enjoy my own meals  snacks This is how I found the Affinia Manhattan It is now my fifth stay minimum of 6 days and I simply feel right at home
On the positive side  My experience with the service has always been impeccable Everyone is extremely professional  from maintenance for a burn light bulb and a small bathroom problem taken care of promptly and both times with an excuse note from the hotel with delicious mints to housekeeping which comes within 3045 minutes after I request my room being service I wont forget the front desk which always double check if the room theyve provided is to my liking 
Having either a friend or a family member sometime accompanying me I find the second fullyequipped bathroom very practical especially for 2 women
The location is convenient with everything easily accessible
On the negative side  the general look of the hotel  rooms is a little outdated Clean but just old 
I also do not appreciate having to shop around to find a good price for the same onebedroom suite I always book I much prefer to deal directly with the hotel but not at any cost The bestrate guarantee policy offered by some chain is very practical but Affinia doesnt offer it As an example Ive booked my next stay 6 days in June with Expedia and I saved over 600 When I called the hotel to mentioned it they simply told me to book through them that they couldnt match the price
After staying in a dozen different hotels in Manhattan I can admit that theres many other hotels for this price more luxurious and newer But the convenience of the fully equiped rooms and the quality of the service is what makes me come back

title: Great location for a reasonable price
text:
I spent a weekend at this property and was pleased by the fantastic location one block off the East River you are within walking distance of Saks Bloomis Central Park Rockefeller Center the Theatre District and the adorable Dylans Candy Bar There are several places to eat nearby inluding my favorite Mr Chows on 57th
The service was reasonable the property is nice enough the rooms are clean

title: Great Marina service OK Hotel
text: I spent one week with my family at the Hyatt We stayed on our boat in one of the rented slips That was great We were right near Einsteins Bagels Mark tha Harbor manager was awsome We stayed two night in a double room ocean view suite The room was ok The service was not so good We had a stained dirty blanket We called for an extra blanket four times and had to go to the front desk and complain the following day before we received the blanket We requested extra towels but never received them We did pull some from the maid cart when we saw it in the hall way The pools were nice but the wind was not The location makes the pool area very windy and cold Even on a hot sunny day 80 deg F the wind made us cold We are local Socal people so we made the best of it all We rented Jet skies Paddle boards and the electric floating lounge chairs Mission beachBelmont park is only two miles away The hotel Restaurant Red Marlin was very good but a little pricey Over all it is a good place to stay and we had a great time We plan to go back next year and stay on our boat for the entire week If you have a boat that you can sleep on it is a much better deal than getting a room You get all of the services as the normal hotel guest We even had room servide delivered to our boat That was cool The birds and seal Lions can get a little annoying but that is part of the fun The pool servers were great Our kids loved the water slides We recommend parking on the street and saving the 140 for the week The extra 20 steps is well worth it

title: Great value overall and secure
text:
I stayed two weeks in October I had a 1bedroom suite with a kitchenette which was nice to be able to stock groceries in the fridge
The rooms are spacious but the bathroom is small but clean and in good working order
The bed was too firm for me however but in good condition
I stayed in the quieter end of the hotel room 710 and enjoyed it
The rooms overall are clean and comfortable but pretty basic furnishings however in pleasing colorful taste
The rooms are very secure with good locks
This is an older hotel with signs of wear used to be a resident hotel and I believe it still is in one section but it is a wellrun hotel and in good working order
The shower has excellent strong water pressure which I miss 
The hotel staff is nice courteous and very attentive Adam is especially helpful with a great personality 
The hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance to many resturants grocers and shops
There are also 2 subways closeby 79th and 72nd St
The Upper West Side neighborhood is lovely and very safe
Central Park is a comfortable few blocks from the hotel
I was pleasantly pleased overall with my stay at The Milburn and would stay there again 
If you dont need the extra frills and luxury this hotel is an excellent value in an excellent location

title: Great Customer service
text: was gone all day came back to hotel room and smelled of cigarette smoke the hotel staff moved us to new room quicklyThe staff was very friendlyWill stay at hotel again  would recomend to friends

title: The Best Location but noisy
text:
You couldnt ask for a better location if you need access to all of San Francisco Walk out the door and you run into two cable car lines Powell Hyde and Powell Mason Close to Bart and a 10 minute ride to Caltrans Public transportation is the best I recommend going to the visitor center first to buy a Muni passport Muni is a general term covering all of public transportation buses railways and cable cars not Bart or Caltrans
We had room 1116 One king bed Not the biggest room and the bathroom was about as small as they come Temperature control was excellent although the weather was perfect The free continental breakfast wasnt much fruit and toastcroissant or a muffin Try Loris dinner across the street towards Market Street
Even though we were on the 11th floor the street sounds came up loud and clear The cable cars are especially noisy and they run until 100am I think Take earplugs Noise minimal from the halls or other rooms
Restaurants are plentiful China Town is two blocks away Take the cable car to Lombard Street lets you off at the top to Fishermans Wharf We took the F railway to Alcatraz tour 
Id go back but I might try to find a hotel off the cable car street

title: Great location and amazing Chocolate Bar
text: Stayed at the Langham for 5 nights in October The location is great  walking distance to 2 different T stops Close to the Financial District and many of the attractions including Faneuil Hall and the North End Rooms are very nice including chocolates on the pillow Hotel staff nice and concierge helpful

title: A perfect hotel for a memorable trip with our grandchildren
text: We traveled to Chicago on the train with our two grandsons ages 4 and 7 for a three day stay in the city We were somewhat skeptical of our Hyatt Regency reservation after reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor We were pleased as we entered the hotel and met friendly employees at the door the front desk and throughout the hotel We were fortunate to book a room through Travelzoo offering an upgrade to the Regency Club located on floors 3235 of the West Tower Our room was on the 35th floor and had a Lake view so our grandsons could see the fireworks at Navy Pier The Club room is also located on that floor and offers complimentary beverages snacks breakfast food dessertssomething all day long This was a big hit for our grandsons and definitely was a plus for our food budget The people in the Club were very accomodating and friendly with the children They also offer free internet service in the club area As we checked out the boys asked if we could return somedaywe would be happy to do so and would always want to be on the Regency Club Level of this conveniently located hotel

title: Beds were hard other tenants were loud Restless nights  bruised hips
text: The rooms were odd and not comfortable The beds were so hard I had bruised hips the next day Its WAY over priced for what you get and the front desk wouldnt confront the man running a marathon all night in the room above us or the group partying til 3am next door They were nice enough to move us the second night after getting no sleep the first but paying 100 a night is not even close to worth it I would never stay here again

title: Lovely place to stay
text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel It was built in the late 1700 and has lovely character Sometimes its a bit of a worry to stay in an older building things are usually cracking or there are drafts or the amenities are not quite up to scratch not so for Morris house The only draw back that sound does travel a little bit but that didnt bother us much

title: easy stay
text:
This hotel is adjacent to the Domain shoppinglifestyle center The rooms are modern calm and clean The hotel is fairly new so it is modern and hip I am not a fan of the Heavenly Bed so it didnt impress me which is why I didnt rate the sleep quality below as very good  just a personal thing for me so dont let that affect your decision
The fitness center has nice cardio equipment a universal machine and some free weights It also has a filtered water cooler which is great since Austins water has an odor 
Overall good stay I did not eat at the hotel so I am not sure about the quality of the food and that service but I did smell the food wafting about the outside of the hotel and it smelled very good
I would return

title: Great Bay Views
text: We stayed at the Comfort Inn By The Bay on August 25th  26th We booked through Expedia and got our rooms for around 150night which includes tax We paid for a panoramic view of the bay  we were not disappointed We were in room 811  had a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge as well as the neighborhoods surrounding the hotel by the Wharf As another poster said if youre looking for luxury accomodations this is not the place however if youre looking for a clean comfortableaffordable hotel with a great view then give this place a try We had 2 double beds in our room The bathroom has 2 areas 1 room which is very small for the tub and toilet  then an open area with your sink mirror  hair dryer We didnt mind the small bathroom since we were not in our room a great deal The location was great We loved being able to walk to the Wharf Union Street Shops  other places in a fair amount of time We ate at the Cafe Lombard right across the street for dinner one night  the food was fabulous  affordable I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone They also let us store our luggage since we had an 1130 flight that night which was nice

title: Good Hotel for NewYork
text:
Me my wife and our two kids 4 and 7 YO stayed at The Belvedere the first week of August 2005
Overall the Hotel is OK NewYork hotels are quite expansive and this hotel is a good value It is well located especially if you are on a Broadway theater trip
The rooms are not very large but they are clean and relatively quiet Air Conditioning was working properly A big 40 Celsius almost all of the week The beds were comfortable and they have a fridge coffee makers etc Very usefull
We didnt go to the hotel restaurants and preferred to go at different places We discovered restaurants named Rice They have very good Asian food with very friendly service
Shopping was great especially at Century 21 in Lower Manhattan
Have a good trip

title: extremely convenient location good rooms very nice bar and restaurant
text:
Stayed here for a seminar during Sandy Probably the best thing was the staff and their interest in our being prepared for well whatever Right down to giving us flashlights Maybe Ive never been in a hotel during dire weather conditions but I thought this was pretty cool
Never missed a beat solid back up generators I guess
The only minor complaint was that while the shower head was one of those massive disks the water pressure was weak Everything else was what Id expect from a solid citycenter hotel

title: Positive Experience Good Service
text: Stayed here for two nights last weekend Will return From checkin to checkout the staff everyone from the bell boy to the concierge to the bar staff were lovely and ready to help whenever necessary Our room was a high corner king 18th floor By NYC standards the room was big and the bathroom was huge It is true that the room furnishings were showing a little wear but the true beauty of the room lies in the glass walls which put a panoramic view of NYC on display At night the view was memorable The Tempurpedic spelled that wrong bed was beyond comfortable to me although spouse thought it was not firm enough The room has a small bar with a fridge that you can use for your own items Cookies or fudge left by the turndown staff  nice touch The club at night is popular but we never had a problem getting back into the hotel I liked having nightlife right in the hotel so convenient to head upstairs to sleep when youve had enough but some may be turned off by that The only downside to our stay was that Saturday night was noisy outside even on the 18th floor we could hear the street noise until 5 am Friday night was fine I would suggest a stop at the attached hair salon I had the best blowout of my life and Serge was a great stylist Neighborhood was full of interesting shops especially vintage cafes and bars

title: The Sheraton was disappointing
text:
My daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Sheraton which was the host hotel for the Philadelphia Marathon that my daughter was running in They had a special rate for the weekend event We had to make 3 separate reservations to stay one day before and one day after the special It became quite confusing with the key cards becoming invalid and the maid service thinking we were vacating 
I tried to clarify our choppedup reservation upon checkin but found myself at the front desk too many times The hotel had many other things going on and it was very full
The concierge was inundated with requests but was very helpful in finding a restaurant reservation for us on a very busy Saturday night
The room was clean with comfortable beds but there were very few amenities especially in the bathroom The very first day we checked in the toilet paper roll was nearly empty and we couldnt find a refill in the room There were no washcloths either One day we got no maid service even though we left the  do not disturb  sign off the door 
The hotel staff in the restaurant told us their prices were too high and that it was very cold in the eating area both were true and encouraged us to go elsewhere for breakfast 
At the end the billing got complicated the airport shuttle wasnt direct to the airport and the parking was way too expensive for hotel guests If I return to Philadelphia I will look into other hotels first

title: Clean Comfortable LAX Airport Hotel
text:
I have stayed at this hotel more than 10 times over the past few years Its a modern Clean comfortable hotel just a few minutes from LAX airport by way of a free shuttle Check in staff are fast courtous and friendly and the rooms are typical sheraton decor the bathrooms are a little dated but clean with plush towels
If you are staying at this hotel and have some time to kill there is an Ocean Trolly that picks up just outside the hotel on Century Blvd and goes to Manhattan Beach then Manhattan Beach Mall and El Segundo Outlet Mall it cost 3 each round trip and you can hop offon
Manhattan Beach is lovely and has lots of wonderful boutique shops Restaurant etc It also has a Jamba Juice Yummy
Manhattan Beach Mall has lots of shops inc a Apple Store CVS Drug Store Victorias Secret Pottery Barn Islands Restaurant and lots of other Shops and Eateries
If anyone has any questions please dont hesitate to ask Have a great Trip

title: Older property a little tired
text: This is not the oldest Hampton out there but maybe built just after they switched to interior corridors I have stayed here multiple times I always swear never again but it is just so convenient to where I work Ive grown to dislike the Chilis next door but the traffic on 183 can get so bad you dont want to get back in the car I have seen several maintenance issues with this property incluing one day when they turned off the water to the hotel to repair the boiler To their credit they warned guests the night before Stay here if you must but if you have a choice there are better locations

title: Nice stay
text: It was a nice stay very clean the room was cleaned and prepared by the employees one down fall though there was no kleenexesIt was a very nice stay i would definitely recommend

title: Best value for the money
text: My husband and I spent last week here After a day in buzzling NYC full of impressions and really tired it was wonderful to come home to this hotel Superclean a very comfortable bed a great view over Columbus Park and skyscrapers in the background and on the 10th floor the noise from the street didnt bother us much Location great and the staff very helpful Next stop in NYC Mulberry Hotel again absolutely

title: Nice NYC Hotel close to Times Square and subways
text: Stayed here for one night when visiting NYC for a concert We werent expecting a 4star hotel but were pleasantly surprised We had a slight issue when trying to check in at 245 just 15 minutes before 3 and were declined Then we had been given a room at 3 and when we got to the room the bed had not been made and there were wet towels hanging up We immediately went back to the front desk and they gave us another room on a higher leveldefinitely worth the inconvenienceThe hotel offers a continental breakfast The room was spotlessly clean and had a pretty decent view of the NYC buildings nearby The windows were nice and big and even opened for a little fresh fall air breeze The beds were extremely comfortable and cozy I did not even want to get out of it The hotel even provided Bath  Body Works products and offered things you might have left at home The location is close to 34th street MSG and a short walk to Times Square We had a great night here at the Wyndham Garden and would definitely recommend it to other people Also this hotel is now named Hotel 36 it has recently been sold from Wyndam even though there are still Wyndham signs in the hotel room

title: DECENT HOTEL IN AN UNFRIENDLY CITY
text: I want to start by saying although I am a born  bred OkieI have been a Red Sox fan my whole life So I always wanted to go to Fenway for a Red SoxYankees game At 47 my husband finally made that dream come true Glad I went but will never go back This hotel was ok but NOT as great as the price shows they are We have traveled a LOT in our marriage  Boston has to be the most rude people we have ever met We got royally screwed right off the bat by a cabbie He made us pay more than what the meter showedhas anyone ever heard of that The only folks more rude than Boston people were the Yankee fans that were there I am so glad I got to live out my dreamglad I got to see the Green Monsterglad I got to chant Yankees Suck while wearing my Ellsbury jersey in Fenway Park But sometimes things are better as a fantasy than a reality Wish I would have realized that about Boston

title: Loved Loved Loved it
text: A friend and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for the fourth of July Weekend The hotel was very nice The location was amazing We could walk almost anywhere The room was very nicely appointed and the bed was sooo comfortable Eventhough the bathroom door did not close all the way it was still pretty private My friend and I were not put off by the door I really liked the Sangria during the cocktail hour in the living room But what I liked best about the Palomar was the staff They were soooo nice and accomodating from my boy D money at the door to the ladies at reception to my new friend Greg in housekeeping and my other friend Ricky Any questions or request we had were answered and fulfilled They had us smiling and laughing the whole time We really appreciated all the information they provided us with about where to go and what to do When I come back to Chicago I will definitely stay at the Palomar again I am sure there are other nice hotels in Chicago but I am not sure if you would get the same level of friendliness and attentiveness from their staff If you stay at the hotel and the doorman D is there tell him that G Money sent you Lol

title: Room and staff exceptional
text:
I have stayed in many hotels in the Dallas area I wish I had found this one sooner The suite was clean the bed was comfortable and the staff very helpful We arrived late and 
hungry Keith told us of restaurants in the area and of a Chinese Restaurant that delivered until 2 AM we ordered if you like Chinese ask Keith for the number the food was delicious My next trip to Dallas I know where Ill be staying

title: Excellent location service but beds and pillows are not good
text: I love kimptoms simply because they are so pet friendly but also because their service is normally great The palomar in San diego was in the gas lamp district with great food night life and ambience All the major attractions are a 15 min drive so its convenient The one complaint I have is that the beds and pillows were very uncomfortable My wife and I found it extremely difficult to get a good nights rest over the 4 nights we were there Otherwise it was an amazing hotel

title: Wonderful Location
text: A great choice to stay at if you are on a budget and looking for the Point Loma location Close to the airport also This hotel is small and dated though offers walking distance to the fishing docks and also local neighborhood restaurants and shops Very close to the San Diego Yacht Club Rooms have all of the basics and cont breakfast is included

title: Too much noise
text:
I am currently sitting in the hotel room and can hear so much too much that my quiet family keep waking up
The rooms are fine clean and thing s somewhat work Staff are friendly willing to help and assist s The location is great walking distance from the historic sights But we are going to be too wiped out because of all the noise I hear conversations all around us from a kid to people down the hall to outside noise
Quite frustrating So if u dont mind hearing everyone  the city then come stay

title: Room with a view
text:
This was our first hotel and our next door neighbours who had stayed there on a stop over assured us it was a good place to stay
Our taxi driver from the airport was concerned about the immediate area to the south but we didnt venture south of Pine Street trip advisor advice and we felt quite comfortable at all times As it happened we felt really safe as our floor was swarming with policeit was a 2 day interview session for new recruits 
From our window we could see a view over the bay well from a certain angle which was unusually fog free heatwave Rooms were a reasonable size and clean and comfortable the staff were very friendly and the breakfast buffet was very welcome The only disappoinment was the rooftop pool It was small ugly looked dirty and was located in a very utilitarian area
As for location there were bus stops and a cable car very close to the hotel and for two of our three days it was Spirit of the Earth day so all public transport was free What timing We also did a fair bit of walking 
The eating places near the hotel were unexciting but with free transport we coild eat elsewhere The cable car stopped in the middle of China Town for example
Oh and we had booked our Alcatraz tickets in advance

title: Great Motel
text: My BF and I had the best time with thanks to Becks Moter Lodge Freesafe parking clean rooms short walk to all the bars and restaurants on Market and Castro and an even shorter walk back I have read the negative comments about this place and most are off This is not a fancy place but a very safe clean friendly and affordable MOTEL and next to the Castro Cant wait to take my BF back

title: Nothing less than pure SATISFACTION
text:
I have stayed at this hotel more than three times  the stay is always pleasant 
PROS
The hotel security is always circling the parking lot
The hotel is very quiet VERY QUIET
If you are a starwoods member you more than likely will be upgraded for free
You will receive a complimentary bottle water upon arrival
The hotel offers movies for a fee that are currently still in the theaters
The hotel provide free breakfast and it it pretty good with a wide variety of options
The hotel provide HAPPY HOUR 
The location could not be better you are across the parking lot from the movie grill Walmart is 24 hours and less than 5 mins away Pappadeaux is in walking distance and Memorial City Mall is less than a mile away 
You can easily find a room for less than 10000 a night here 
Free Wifi
CONS
I dont have any

title: THE best service and breathtaking scenery
text:
One if the best hotels we have ever stayed in Stayed here over labor day weekend and cannot get over how charming cozy and beautiful it was All the good reviews could not be more accurate The service staff was the most consistently great staff weve ever encountered This cant be a fluke or good luck must be part of their business plan 
Weeks before we arrived concierge Mona helped not just with suggestions but made arrangements for every detail from hot air ballooning to horseback riding to spa appointment She kept in touch through email and phone calls to clarify details of our trip and to remind us of all sorts of things like dont plan any outdoor activities between 9a and sunset during the Arizona summer  thank goodness she warned us Upon arrival we met the quickest and most courteous valets in the business While we were still pulling in looking lost at 11p trying to make sure we were in the right spot two valets appeared one on each side of the car and gently whisked away the car keys and our luggage and took care of everything Everytime we needed the car they had it waiting for us outside in what seemed to be under 60seconds and every time we returned we were always greeted with two valets to help escort us and our baggages out of the car 
At the pool was a staff of one gentleman jose who was unbelievably efficient friendly and ran the operation like a well oiled machine It was scary how he always seemed to anticipate our every need well before we even realized it Before we realized we were parched he was right there with large cups of lemon ice water  and refilled it well before it ever reached halfway empty If we looked a little uncomfortable from a towel that was too wet before we could decide what to do Jose was there with a dry toweland he provided this degree of excellent service to every guest at the pool
We loved how well this resort seamlessly blended indoor and outdoor space Very classy and comforting decor all around We stayed in one of the designer casitas Very cozy and clean but was disappointed that patio doors opened up to communal walking path and there was no view of the mountains Will try for a balcony suite next time Room may not be as spacious as other resorts but decor very unique  they even had some classic books laying on ledges around the room which was a nice touch 
Spa massages were okay and once again decor and use of indooroutdoor space made it worth experiencing 
Planning our next trip back already

title: Worst hotel on the planet
text:
We stayed here last week Arrived at around 12 midnight The room was sparse No comforter on the bed the sheets seemed dirty and the blanket was filthy Mattress was covered in body fluids probably blood and God knows what Curtains were filthy and we got a room with a pull out couch for my two daughters It wasnt even a pull out couch It sagged in the middle and was filthy Bathroom was gross We had to spend the night because it was so late and we had been traveling for hours They also told us on the phone that they would valet our car Not true We had to find a garage about 4 blocks away and walk back at midnight in the freezing cold in an area that we knew nothing about This hotel is definitely not as advertised seemed to be hooker palace We payed 350 for this scummy place
We were not able to get a refund But the manager was pleasant enough when we complained about the filth If you want to stay at a great hotel for the same price around the same area we moved over to the Cooper Square Hotel in Cooper Square Everything was immaculate they were super accomodating and the food at the restaurant was incredible

title: Great stay at the Sofitel New York
text:
We also booked this hotel on the strength of the reviews on tripadvisor and we werent disappointed The hotel is exactly as others have described Very welcoming staff extremely comfortable beds so much so that I pulled the bedding off the mattress to try and figure out what was making it so comfortable in the hope to replicate for my bed at home
Very clean and well maintained room and public areas The location is perfect we were in walking distance of most central attractions You wont go wrong with the sofitel

title: Good value when you need to stay near the airport
text: We needed to stay near the airport for an AM departure on the last night of a trip The location of this hotel is very convenient to the terminal and they offer shuttle service if you need it Our reasonable room rate included internet breakfast and evening happy hour snacks that were substantial enough we didnt need dinner The bed and pillow comfort was not raveworthy but OK and the staff were very friendly The breakfast buffet was reasonably good The room was spacious and comfortable

title: Double check taxi prices to the airport
text:
What was GoodPositive
 Room was spacious and nice although no refrigerator Front office Mr Ibanez was very helpful in changing the room from one in the back noisy to one in the front of the hotel nice room
 Bed was comfortable
 Pool was average
What was negative
 During the morning of our check out the cleaning knocked at our door 3 times at 0800 1000 and 1130
 We asked in the morning of our check out to the front office for a taxi to Dulles Airport for the afternoon and were told it was 60  even if in the room brochure it says 40 We arrived back at the hotel to get the taxi we had booked and the price had gone up to 75  without an explanation
Altogether I would rate as average with good rooms in the front upper floors of the hotel

title: Excellent Hotel and Ideal Location
text:
No real faults with this hotel other than the heating in the room in grim When we walked in it was set to 72 degrees and felt like a furnace so had to open a window and leave it switched off for the stay
The hotel did not seem that busy and we when we booked in asked for and got a high floor room with a great view of Times Square
The hotel is ideally located for access to Times Square and other local areas and attractions such as Central Park and Hells Kitchen plus a number of subway stations
The only negative is always being approached by the sightseeing bus ticket touts when anywhere on Broadway or 7th Ave

title: Not worthy or Renaissance title
text: I am a elite traveler on Hilton and Marriot This hotel continues to disappoint Some of the loudest rooms in NYC with street noise windows are paper thin Rooms are smaller than any hotel other than W Hotel on Lex Better bet for Marriot traveler is Marriot East Side Good restaurantbar scene but rest of hotel subpar

title: Great location
text:
Nice to stay in a small boutique hotel  being part of an international chain
Free wifi was welcome Shame the rooftop bar was closed for the two nights we visited  but not an issue Downstairs cocktail bar was good

title: My favourite haunt in DC
text:
My work takes me to DC at least 5 to 6 times a year and I have stayed at many hotels in the Downtown Capitol Hill and DuPont Sq area Even though not as fancy as some of the other places I look forward to staying at this property every time
The staff is friendly the hotel is extremely well located and extremely convenient for a business traveler The beds and the rooms are well equipped checking in and out is generally a breeze and the breakfast service is excellent
A bonus is the free internet and free printing facility available
The only ve is the high rates that this hotel charges for a Garden Inn category but given that it is DC and that the Government business is recession proof all hotels in the area charge a 2X premium to those across the Potomac

title: I will definitely be back
text: I have been to Seattle many times but this was my first time I stayed at Hotel Max The Hotel Max is in a perfect location Macys Pacific Mall Pike Market the tready restaurants are within walking distance from the hotel The staff of the hotel are very professional friendly and attentative The space in the room is somewhat smaller than most other hotels that I have stayed at but given the location cool stylish decor and most helpful staff the smaller space didnt really matter I always always enjoy going to Seattle staying at Hotel Max just made it even better

title: Good value  good location
text: Location is nice within a few blocks of the Pike Market and really close by to the Space Needle Also convenient that the buses to Vancouver depart from across the street Helpful staff and clean room were a plus Since it was a hotel from a national chain the room was basic but nice

title: Fine Quality and Location
text: During this tough economy we were happy with the quality of care from everyone in this hotel From greetings at the curb to service of the housekeeping staff all of the Sheraton personel were top notch The location was very convenient to nice restaurants for evening dining

title: Walking distance from Lucas Oil Stadium
text:
Stayed in this hotel for a game in Lucas Oil The valet parking was STEEP 35 for a city like this but since it was walking distance from the stadium it eliminated the cost for parking at the facility The service at the front desk for check inout was superb The staff up front couldnt be friendlier or more accommodating The housekeeping staff nearly walked in on me in the morning Not sure why they were there to clean my room before I even checked out
Once again the beds in the JW Marriott are THE WORST Great plush bedding on top of a cardboard box made for a very restless night Its starting to be what to expect from a JW same as my stay in Houston Ripped towels in the bathroom really

title: 5 stars all the way from lobby to service
text: Had a tremendous experience there while traveling for business Its in downtown and right next to all shopping and plenty of dining The lobby was great and the atmosphere was even better It did not feel like a Marriott for sure The service I had was tremendous and the room was huge with a view of the city The rooftop bar was awesome as well with the drinks being fair priced I did have 1 small complaint as I was sleeping one morning the adjacent door that connects multiple rooms came open and people in the next room were staring at me so that was not too cool Partly my fault for not checking to make sure the door was locked Its a good thing it happened when I was there otherwise who knows what would have happened Still partly my fault Hotel was great all in all Definitely recommend

title: Very Nice stay
text: I booked into this hotel for three nights initially for some job interviews in the area Check in was quick valet service excellent The restaurant in the hotel Tugs had good food although typical of hotel restaurants on the expensive side Just a couple issues housekeeping did not clean the room on one day of my visitthat said I had an initial reservation for three days checked out the immediately checked back into the same room for an additional night That was the day that housekeeping did not show up The morning of my check out when I had a chance to sleep in a bit they were knocking at my door at 830 Only ice machine was on the 4th floor this is a 37 story hotel and the morning of my check out the internet connection didnt want to work As a previous reviewer indicated the room seemed to be a bit warmer at night than I like but I just opened a window Worked for me

title: Better than my last visit  a good place to stay
text:
Last time I stayed here I had a few complaints one of them being that the staff were unfriendly and another involving the menu choices Both have got better which was great to see
Checkin was swift friendly and effortless Just what I need after a red eye flight
Once again I enjoyed a few drinks at the rooftop bar Rare View Its really worth going to see the Empire State Building lit up against the New York skyline Spectacular I wish the bar served food or even snacks  I would have stayed there longer if it did
I had a good meal at the ground floor Rare bar The service was excellent and the menu much better than last time with a good variety of healthy foods as well as the usual burger  fries type dishes
The rooms are very small which can be a surprise if youre not expecting that The hotel also feels very corporate largely due to the clientele and business meetings that go on there so it wouldnt beat my go to New York hotels like the Andaz or Peninsula But for the price and excellent location I would stay here again and recommend it for business and vacation travelers

title: Dont let the low price scare you GREAT hotel
text: This is our 4th time staying here and well be back again The staff at this hotel takes pride in its hotel from the nice gal in the front desk to the sweet housekeeping lady offering extra towels to the cheerful waiter in the morning Always consistent Always clean Best location On my last visit I had a small situation and had to deal with the hotel manager He was very kind and went out of his way to please me Would definitely go back and highly recommend

title: Great value for so close to Beverly Hills
text: I like the location and the service staff is very good I use it primarily as a busines hotel and have stayed here a few times in the past

title: extremely noisy barebones motel
text:
This was the first motel I actually had to leave early and find somewhere else to stay at You can hear the people in the room next to you as if they are standing in front of you Part of the problem was that there was a sealed door in the wall but the effect is the same as if they are in the hall right outside your room 
Next there were smudges on the sheets The socalled continental breakfast was some orange juice and coffee and apparently there was also some prepackaged breakfast stuff which was long gone by the time I arrived with an hour left of the breakfast The heating was a primitive radiator whose temperature was hard to control There were no cups of any kind in the room 
After a sleepless night I eventually just left early and went to a motel a few blocks down the street which was a million times better for only an extra 10 dollars a night

title: expected more from a Conrad
text:
The experience started off badly We had decided not to pay 25day for valet when we could park around the corner for 10 We pulled up and declined the valet service Then we quickly took 3 bags out of the back ourselves and put them on the curb where I stayed while my husband parked I was ignored for a good 5 minutes It wasnt until I finally started taking 3 suitcases in myself that someone finally asked if I wanted assistance 
We were allowed to check in at 11am
Hint the nonexistent ice machines are behind a door marked private One private room is for housekeeping the other is the ice machine room
Other reviews commented on the good size rooms I guess we missed out because the room was cramped There was so much furniture in there we kept bumping into things and each other Everything was new and top of the line The bed was fantastic with high end linens 42 plasma TV is a big plus Bathroom was spotless and huge
The pool hot tub and gym met expectations
Upon check out I was presented with a bill for the minibar I pointed out that if they had checked their records they would have seen that I refused the key to the minibar I do not expect that kind of nonsense at a luxury hotel

title: Great hotel location service Would stay again
text:
This was a great hotel The location was perfect 3 blocks to White House and 6 blocks to the National Mall And for added convenience there was a Metro station across the street if needed We walk everywhere Several good restaurant close by and an ice cream parlor right next door for the kids
Service was outstanding From the Bell Hops to the front desk and the restaurant They were great with their recommendations for any place we needed to go very knowledgeable We had a deal with breakfast include 204 per night Well worth it We did have to pay for parking 30 per day  but again well worth it Sometimes the extra cost are worth it

title: If your thought Regency inplies regal it doesnt
text: We were in the west building overlooking an office tower Good job they were off on a public holiday Room on 24th floor had been renovated Location is great a few steps from the magnificent mile and on the river The hotel is split between 2 buildings the main hotel on the east is connected by a 2nd floor walkway to the west Tower which has no services We paid 89 a night Labor Day weekend for 2 nights from Travelzoo with 50 off valet parking which was regularly 50 a night With so many guests valet parking is busy and we had to go to the basement to get the car With a name like Hyatt Regency I thought it would have been better I guess we paid what it was worth and didnt get a great deal especially as other readers say they paid 62 on Priceline

title: Went for business trip  enjoyed they stay
text: I had to attend a business training event in the area and as a frequent Hampton Inn customer I knew what to expect I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was better than average Friendly staff clean room very clean bathroom Quiet After a long day of training it was nice to have a place to take care of myself work on my laptop  free internet and relax Breakfast was very good Only thing missing was SciFi channel to watch Ghost Hunters It is very near Easton Town Mall with hundreds of great stores and restaurants too The price on this one is a bit higher than other Hamptons I have stayed in

title: Clean room satisfactory breakfast and excellent value
text: Missed my flight connection at Denver and had to make a last minute reservation Room was large and clean Breakfast in the large lobby area was your predictable free breakfast but it covered all the bases The room rate was very reasonable as I recall only 82 AAA rate Service was excellent I left my iPhone 5 charger in the room called the main number when I got home and talked with the front desk A young man looked in lost  found found my charger and dropped it in the mail I called a second time about the shuttle service and talked with the new manager Jeff and he explained that because of construction at the airport the shuttle leaves guests off at only one side of the airport

title: Great location OK hotel
text:
Although Union Square has nicer hotels for the money I prefer the location of the Marina district Hotel del Sol seemed like it would be the nicest option in the Marina area The location of the hotel is great and we liked the colorful decor in the room However in the end our room really felt like a cheap apartment from the 60s It was dark low ceilinged and had a funny smell We were upgraded to a junior suite which had a small living area with a pullout couch and TV and TINY bedroom I dont recommend booking or paying extra for this room Since I was travelling with my teenage son he got the pullout and I got the bedroom Two adults in the bedroom would have been really cramped The pullout sofa was extremely uncomfortable thin uneven mattress cheap quality sheets and stained old blanket My bed in the bedroom however was very comfortable I looked into a double room as they were cleaning in the morning and I would definitely request a double on the third floor if I were to return here Nicer looking than our suite 
There was a lot of noise from the courtyard and pool but I already knew this and so it didnt really bother me We also heard some noise from late night revellers leaving local bars This is not a quiet peaceful hotel by any means so if you are looking for that look elsewhere
Staff was always friendly and the included breakfast was really fantastic good coffee OJ bagels great muffins and breads not your Costco variety Free SF Chronicle 
I would probably try the Cow Hollow Inn next time just down the street

title: We were the only guests in the entire hotel
text:
We were the only guests at this poorly maintained motor inn marketed as a hotel on various travel sites 
I should have known the second I saw what appeared to be a lagoon shaped pool of toxic waste in front of the place 
Is that a pool I asked my boyfriend
It must have been he replied 
The checkin process was rather strange and the coffee in the lobby was empty apparently until further notice The internet was not currently functional on the circa 1998 computer made available to users in the lobby Under strict supervision and with frequent reprimands Wireless internet was not available
We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room which featured two Queen size beds and a roomy but semi functional bathroom We were exhausted the first night of our two night stay and fell asleep without noticing the substandard air quality and freezing temperatures It was literally close to freezing in our room and despite numerous calls to the front desk we were not even given extra blankets to ease the chill
We woke the next morning to the front desk pounding on our door telling us it was time to go although we were planning to stay two nights and had prepaid on line We went downstairs to consult the womans computer but unfortunately the whole system was down Since we were the only guests they elected not to offer the usual continental breakfast With no where within easy walking distance to get food we looked at one another and said lets bounce We then snuck out the side door at the far end of the pool to avoid having to explain this to the front desk lady
The stay was without a doubt the creepiest I have experienced I would never stay here again I cant even look at the place without cringing

title: Great Value but cant walk to downtown
text:
This hotel always offer great rates and if you are looking to stay near sea world and the bay its a good location If you are looking to indulge in the nightlife of the gaslamp district you are better off at the W Hard Rock or the US Grant hotel This is primarily a tourist hotel for families or a good place to stay if you have a flight out the San Diego airport
The hotel is starting to show its age and is need for an update

title: Good choice for Times Square
text:
We recently stayed three nights at the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square Arrived by cab and a porter was on hand immediately to assist with the luggage Very simple but functional foyer with the Reception tucked away to the left of the entrance Check in was simple and pleasant Our room was on the 7th floor and very well laid out although a little smaller than other Hilton Garden Inns we had stayed with at LAX and Washington Downtown The usual high standard that we had come to expect from the Hilton brand was present with very comfortable furnishings Everything was very clean and functioning Our view was over 48th Street from the 7th floor and not very inspiring
On the first evening I became very concerned as while down on the footpath indulging in my filthy smoking habit seriously loud alarms sounded and I found that the building just down 48th Street from the hotel was the Fire Station and when the engine and ladder truck went out across four lanes of oneway traffic they made their presence felt However during the night I only heard them go out using a very brief low level siren for a few seconds and that was before I had gone to bed I never heard them again at night after I had gone to sleep and I am a light sleeper I would not let that be a concern to anyone considering this hotel
Breakfast was at the Pigalle Restaurant down stairs and was OK but overpriced In addition with the exception of one waiter the staff were pretty standoffish in contrast to the staff of the hotel who were great
I loved the location but it may not suit everybody as Manhattan Island is so big with so much to see and do The Gray Line booking office was just across the street and that was convenient to book and take tours I asked the Concierge about the best way to get to Newark Airport the next day for an 11am flight and he suggested a shuttle service as a cheaper option but that picked up at the hotel at 630am  far too early The other suggestion was for the AirTrain from Penn Station as only taking about 20mins but we would have had to take a cab to Penn Station I had researched private car hire and had been inclined to use Dial 7 and when I mentioned this to the Concierge he was noncommittal  I ended up using Dial 7 who picked up at 815am for a trip of about 20mins
I would recommend this hotel for people looking to stay in the Times Square region

title: decent hotel but nothing to do there
text:
was in town to catch some baseball at Minute Maid Park
This hotel was very nice Our room had superhigh ceilings was very clean and was very quiet 
The rooftop pool was a nice touch but it was closed bc someone had gone to the bathroom in it and the staff was cleaning it up Soon a hot June day in Houston we had to sit in the jacuzzi 
There isnt much to do in Downtown Houston on a weekend One walk around the hotel block will tell you that There are lots of transients in the area but the hotel does a good job keeping them out
Great breakfast buffet in the morning LOts of cabs lined up to take you places Great choice just wish there was more to do in the neighborhood

title: The Donatello was the perfect choice for an extended business stay
text: I plan to make The Donatello my home base when in San Francisco Its convenient location near Union Station and just around the corner from my SFO office is perfect Friendly service and generously sized rooms made staying over several days a pleasure

title: A Hotel that Wreaks Perfection
text: Any traveler that appreciates boutique hotels MUST visit the Palomar when in San Francisco I spent two nights there after researching boutique hotels on the internet and this one just kept coming back to me as the one to choose What a great decision For starters great door service very friendly informative and helpful front desk georgous decorated rooms we had a standard King a tiny lobby but beautiful and classy pet friendly I brought my Yorkie and he received his own water  food bowls the breakfast was a bit pricey but gourmet the location is right in the heart of everything in San Francisco and yet you cant hear a sound from inside the rooms knowing that just outside is the hustle and bustle of the cityA simple yet lovely Zen Garden accentuates the inner courtyard of the hotel from window view Great decor WE LOVED IT Everything was fantastic Next trip we plan on trying out one of their suites This hotel is a must stay

title: Great hotel in the the Gaslamp district
text:
Very stylish but not lacking substance Service is spot on rooms are comfortable  fast Internet through out the hotel
Have lunch at the roof top bar great views and comfortable place 
Highly recommend this hotel

title: Very Disappointed
text:
Ill try to make this short
First CheckIn was horrible girl at the desk was rude pretty much asked my name and credit card And followed with your room isnt ready ok i figured because we got there at 1130am We asked if she could call when it was ready Didnt receive call at all I had to call at 5 And finally it was
