Second Hall ways have a horrid old smell mixed with a lemony strong perfume smell gave me a headache
Third Door luggage guys are rude They pretty much follow you around if you have luggage When leaving the bell guy asked if we needed transportation to the airport which we didnt we said no and he would not take no for an answer We we re hanging around the lobby waiting to leave for the airport and he stayed very close to see where we were going to go and if we were lying about not use his transportation even opened the door and followed us down the street The final thing about this guy was when retreving our luggage he insisted my sister to go with him further in the storage room and she said politely NO thanks Im fine right here Seriously how unprofessional and i dont know why she said to follow him further in the room because no one else had to
The only positive thing from this hotel was the rooms were clean however very SMALL

title: Everything is OK but nothing is special
text: Have stayed here several times in January with colleagues for an annual convention at the Moscone Centre Location for Moscone is excellent Everything about the hotel is adequate if you get an advanced room rate of 250 Rooms catering facilities are all functional I would be very disappointed at the last minute rate of 550

title: Everything you needed in a hotel with Ideal Location Our room overlooked a snow covered Times Sqaure
text:
Great location
Great service on my Mums 50th room service provided drinks and chocolate truffles to our room
Cleaned daily with fresh towels toiletries Beds made etc
Fantastic Gym being a fitness enthusiast I used the gym every morning prior to breakfast and great facilities and equipment available fresh fruit and water provided too
Overall I would give it 910 great 5 days spent there

title: Fantastic stay Loved the hotel
text: We spent 3 nights at the hotel Our stay was flawless The room was big and had an amazing view of the St Patrick Cathedral The service was perfect and the staff was eager to help at all times Would definitely stay there again

title: First class service at affordable prices
text: A very nice hotel in an excellent location for access to Central Park it is also within easy walking distance of Time Square and most other attractions we wanted to see while visiting New York The staff of this hotel was excellent very friendly attentive to every need or concern we had The hotel room was very clean and unlike most older hotels it did not smell Everything was very well kept Overall an excellent experience

title: Fantastic Location Modern Amenities
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel and was pleasantly surprised by the ambiance and overall rooms
The location is stellar and you are in the middle of Union Square But the rooms were excellent clean and fresh The bedding was fantastic mini bar was something to be stood by and overall a very peaceful and serene environment
The lobby has a jazz club that I didnt go to but it seemed to have a good following when I observed Overall I would recommend staying here for any reason

title: VERY NICE PLACE TO STAY WITH A GREAT LOCATION
text: Stay one night room was clean and tv worked rooms could be updated front desk person trudi was great she went out of her way to make sure my cab was on time she even found me a soft drink and didnt charge

title: Stylish European Hotel in a great location
text:
Recently we visited Chicago for a holiday shopping weekend and decided to stay at Radisson Blu at Aqua The hotel is brand new
We had a suite on the 16th floor that had a large sitting area desk kingsized bed and large modern bathroom with a large tub and a separate large rain shower The room also had a small balcony with a view of Millenial park one block away although it was too cold to go out on it during our visit
The hotel also has a nice Italian restaurant Felini that we enjoyed and a great lobby bar with a pizza oven
We enjoyed the location just a short walk to all the holiday activities on State St and Michigan Ave We will definitely be back

title: Not recommended staff trained to handle emergencies like the one occurring during my stay
text:
I arrived at the LAX Sheraton 4Points during a bad couple of days for the hotel
Last things first  on my last day there was an area power outtage lasting several hours 
All electricity in the hotel was effected and guests had to get their luggage down 
to the lobby by the stairs because the elevators did not work 
Does this hotel have a protocol for emergencies 
I would expect that protocol for a major power outtage would require guest notification of
electricity interruption via staff going room to room to offer luggage assistance 
and to explain the situation to the guests No notification by LAX 4Points staff was remitted 
until the guest made it down to the lobby area via the dark stairway 
Other negatives During my stay the shower fixture broke off and thereafter spurted water
from the side the bathtub would not hold water the buffet breakfast was dry and  prior
to the outtage  the maid knocked on my door at 1030 am  sorry just checking 
I know that chain hotels like their maids to knock on guests doors one or two or three
 times before posted checkout time 
Here is my suggestion for the hotel Assign the maids the duty to perform the emergency guest services so sorely needed 
First knock  replace sorry just checking with either need any assistance with checkout or no emergencies yet or emergency eg no elevator  do you need assistance 2nd knock  see 1st knock above etc 
The benefit of my suggestion for the hotel is that at no extra expense the hotel could comply with the basic rules of civility and with local state or federal regulations requiring contingency plans for the circumstances I encountered And the benefit to the guests is that 
annoyance is replaced by assuranceassistance
In summary I would neither stay at nor recommend LAX4Points until the staff has been trained to adequately handle emergencies such as the one occurring during my stay

title: Clean room nice hotel
text:
Sheraton is connected to the Seattle Convention Center so what you are getting is a huge hotel with little personality That said for a big downtown hotel it was better than most
Location is great Right in the heart of the city Room was decent size clean bathroom was very clean  Beds were reasonably comfortable Front desk help was polite Expensive parking 41 a night for Valet 31 a night to self park 1 12 blocks away Though nothing special I would stay there again

title: Fantastic hotel with lots of amenities and great service
text:
This has been a great hotel When I checked in the personnel at the front desk could not have been more friendly I got to my room and stood out on the balcony and took in the beautiful city view of San Francisco and the bay
The bed was very comfortable and the room was very spacious The hotel is located a block away from Market street if you like shopping and only a few blocks from Masconi Center if you are here for a trade show I would strongly recommend you stay here

title: What a waste of a view
text: I stayed at the Hilton for an end of summer getaway with our children 11 8 6 from for two nights We had stayed with friends last year and went back to enjoy a relaxing stay by the bay We splurged on our room to get a bayview lanai for 400 a night so that we could enjoy the beautiful view I called the hotel to clarify the room and asked which room was a patio so that we could enjoy the grassy area outside the room The reservations at the hotel told me that this room had a patio so we paid our 400 per night plus parking and set it up We arrived early hoping to enjoy the pool while we waited for our room The pool was closed for some contamination problem so we sat by the bay Finally when checkin was official we went to get our room The 400 room was on the second floor not the first When I explained about the first floor the management said too bad we are full They offered to cancel my reservation at no penalty but that was it So we headed off to our second floor room to check things out On the balcony our 400 view of the bay was obscured by a huge tree The room had been renovated inside since last year and they did a nice job with the color schemes but the trendy furniture on the balcony was horribly uncomfortable That night we went to the nice restaurant We were greeted by the hostess and asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside I asked for outside and the hostess quickly announced that there werent any tables availabe When I asked how long the wait was she rolled her eyes and strode off to check She seemed aggravated by my request That sentiment was standard among the staff at the hilton They were all dismissive and curtnot what I expect for 400 a night After all of that fuss my kids got food poisoning at the restaurant that night so for the entire next day our balcony was lost to the dirty laundry On our final day room service for a pot of coffee took one hour and they double charged our room I have never paid so much money for so little Other than the location on the bay the Hilton was a bust At the price of their rooms I would have been better served staying at the Hotel Del or the Pacific Terracethey are expensive but worth the splurge

title: Great room great service
text: When you check in the staff is very friendly and helpful Walking to your room you notice the beautiful grounds nice big pool and jacuzzi Very well kept We had a suite overlooking the marina The room had a nice sitting area kitchen with medium sized fridge came with glasses and even a much needed wine bottle opener two beds and and roomy bathroom and vanity area 2 TVs with cable and HBO The deck looked out into the marina Beautiful view The beds were very comfortable We thought we might have additional friends staying with us so we called down for a rollaway bed and it was delivered within 5 minutes for no extra charge Great service The room and bathroom were very clean We will definitely stay at Humphreys again

title: Have been going here for 10 years
text:
My wife and I have been staying at the mark Hopkins Hotel very years for the last 10 years
There is a reason wonderful service and and a very dependable hotel In fact we have reservations for for a stay in two weeks

title: Trellises Restaurant is an excellent place for business meetings
text:
I frequently use Trellises Restaurant at the Town and Country for business meetings The atmosphere is both quiet and private and the service is outstanding In particular Pati Muklevicz who hands down is one of the best waitresses in San Diego She always remembers her guests and makes you and your company feel like the most important people sitting in the restaurant Great service quality and price 
Kathleen Pacurar

title: English Country comfort in the heart of San Fransisco
text: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at this boutique hotel We were in a king room at the back of the building overlooking a small garden The room was spacious with a walkin closet separate sinkdressing table and a equipped bath Our room was very quiet with almost no sound from the street at all A full breakfast is included in the rate and included pastries quiche or a fritatta sausages fresh fruit cereal hot and cold beverages all served in a charming dining room with a cheerful fireplace Wine and nibbles are also available every evening but we were out each day at that time so did not partake The hotel is well located to walk about the city and the staff were helpful and friendly We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone wishing to have a quiet stay in very comfortable surroundings The only caution I would mention is that the building does not have air conditioning but it really is rarely needed in SF as the weather is generally not hot enough to require it During our stay the average temp was about 65 degrees during the day time and a little lower in the evenings We never felt the need to even open a window

title: One of My Favorites
text: I was in town for a tradeshow and stayed here This has to be one of my favorite places It is a historic building yet they have managed to renovate everything I layed eyes on Upon entering you are greeted by young and smiling bellhops and as you step into the stylish lobby you can smell a nice aroma This scent follows you every where you go Spectacular clean great scented spacious rooms roman tubs and my room on the 23rd floor had an awesome view

title: The Marriott Plaza San Antonio sold my prepaid room to someone else
text:
I had a fully paid reservation for this hotel for 4 nights beginning March 17 2011 I arrived at the hotel shortly before midnight due to flight delays and was told incorrectly that my reservation was for the following night and that there were no rooms to be had in all of San Antonio or environs within a 25mile radius The desk clerk was not sympathetic even when I pointed out that I had a prepaid reservation for that night for 4 nights and showed it to her After I left and went to the Fairmont next door where their very helpful desk staff tried in vain to find a room for me I went back to the Marriott Plaza where after another hour they sent me to a nearby Marriott Residence Inn which also did not have rooms I was one of two parties sent on this wild goose chase The other was a family of four 
I had to return to the Plaza where they finally found me a room at the Westin I did not get to bed until 230 am March 18 CT after being up since 452 am CT March 17 I was there on business and had to be at a meeting the next morning
I am a Marriott Rewards Member who frequently stays at their hotels on business and I am furious that I was so badly treated by the Marriott Plaza San Antonio The clerk later told me the mistake was hers  they had given my room to another guest who decided to stay an extra night I strongly suspect that they gambled that the room would be vacant and tried to make an extra few bucks Meanwhile I faced the prospect of having nowhere to sleep I contacted Marriott customer relations with this complaint and told that them that I would post this complaint on TripAdvisor at the end of my trip I did get a prompt but tepid and noncommittal response from Marriott The hotel for its part did give me free internet access and said they would adjust for two nights lodging but that did not make up for their thoughtlessness in the first place

title: Nice stay in the heart of new york
text: Spent there 4 nights in during the hot season Hotel is very well located in a quiet street Unfortunately the air con was very loud so that we had to sleep with earplugs Rooms are very small but well equiped Otherwise hotel is very good value for money

title: Extended Pleasure w Business
text: My husband invited me to go along on his business trip to Memphis then spend the weekend His company selected the SpringHill Suites Memphis Downtown for our stay I had read some negative reviews on TripAdvisor so was a bit apprehensive about our stay From the moment we arrived though I saw there was no need for apprehension The staff couldnt have been friendlier or more helpful from the beginning to the end of our stay The location was fantastic My husband had suggested we rent a car at the airport but I told him from what I had read it didnt seem that there was a need for one He admitted at the end of the weekend that there was not plus we saved having to pay for parking at the hotel Of course we did have the taxi fare each way to and from the airport also would have to rely on the free shuttle from Sun Studio to Graceland if you didnt have a car and wanted to go there The hotel location was perfect for downtown sightseeing  Mudd Island riverboat cruise Beale Street all a very easy walk It was also an easy walk to great restaurants like Flight and a two name restaurant second name Suzanne both of which we enjoyed during our visit The trolley stops were at the back of the hotel which made it convenient for transportation to the Civil Rights Museum farmers market other parts of town I did have a friend who drove me to Graceland but otherwise there is the free shuttle from Sun Studio think you can access the timetable online We thoroughly enjoyed the hotels complimentary breakfast and thought they had quite a bit to choose from Wasnt Breakfast at Tiffanys but still a very nice beginning to the day Also appreciated computers in lobby with easy capability for printing boarding passes Our room was also very comfortable I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends who want to visit Memphis

title: Great place
text: My husband and I stayed at the Silver Cloud Broadway for 4 days in midOctober We thought it was great Our room had a king size bed with a microwave oven and frig We had our laptop and the internet connection worked great We thought the pressure in the shower was awesome and the curtains kept the light from coming in so it was super dark in the morning which we like Its little things like that that make a big difference We didnt hear any of our neighbors we later traveled to 2 other locations and stayed in cheaper hotels where we could hear everything The breakfast was fine The first day there werent any eggs but everytime afterwards there were hard boiled eggs The coffee was delicious and the waffle maker was fun They had the other usual things bagels danishes yogurt fruit and juice We didnt rent a car and had to rely on the buses The front desk couldnt provide too much assistance on the buses The shuttle van is good for downtown locations only and the driver was very friendly I would recommend this place to all my friends

title: Excellent place to stay
text:
We stayed at the Candlewood Suites in Houston at Willowbrook for extended stay We are relocating and our house is not complete Everyone was absolutely awesome The facilities are immaculate There are many extrassuch as a workout room free laundry room service weekly maid service and much more I really felt like I made myself at home there and did not want to leave The staff understands good customer service I highly recommend this facility I am a marriot girl But from now on when I am in this area I will stay at this hotel 
smtm

title: New clean quiet and good service
text: We had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton in downtown Phoenix Upon checkin my wife told the front desk agent that she was a Sheraton points member The front desk agent gave us a free upgrade to our room for being a member The rooms are super clean and AC works great Everything is simple and clean Hotel is close to everything downtown I would definitely stay here again

title: this place is the bomb
text: we went to kona kai mostly because they are very pet friendly and had the best time ever starting with trudi at front dest was so very helpful and the private beach for guests  our dog kya to play how cool is that we want to thank you trudi for all you did for us  the kona kai for being the best pet friendly place we have ever been to and we have been to alot of places that take dogs we will be backkrisanise duffy

title: small place but comfy Parking fees sucks though
text: My love and I stayed here last month on our short Chicago trip and we received a 90night thru Priceline bidding The hotels location is awesome and the front desk girl was nice enough We didnt like the size of our room too much since it was a bit smaller than what Im used to especially the bathroom but we were glad we only had to stay here for one night the king bed was very comfortable and the concierge staff was helpful in helping us plan sightseeing options in the city of Chicago Good to be able to walk to Grant Park and also to Caribou Coffee shop near the hotel for breakfast Only real downer for me aside from room size was the high 42 parking fee even if it does includes in and out privileges Nice place though and Id stay here again if i dont have to drive here

title: The Best Hotel At The Airport
text: This hotel is the BEST at SeaTac Valet parking was very quick and hassle free Check In went very smooth and we were upgraded to a very large suite at that time The pool is very relaxing and big Lounge is great The rooms are very spacious and very nice Beds are SO comfortable and the best sleep I have gotten at a hotel Shuttle service is very quick and so great They leave every 20 minutes on the hour I have stayed at many hotels at the airport and this one beats them all Especially with the shuttle service You can guarantee that we will be back soon no doubt about it

title: Room with a view
text:
We stayed in the yellow tower on the diamond level which is the 28th floor
The room was overlooking the highway but thanks to insulated windows it was not noisy at all
Absolutely comfy bed with high quality linen
The bathroom was big and nicely equipped It even came with a cozy bathrobe A few more towels would have been nice 
There is Starbucks coffee in the room so you can prepare a nice cup of coffee at your convenience
Pool available Lots of restaurants in the hotel complex
Valet parking only for an additional 35

title: What a Great Weekend
text: Great location great style and great views The hotel staff was very accommodating but the reason I gave the service 4 and not 5 stars is because the service in the restaurant Perrys was awful However there are plenty of other fabulous places to eat near by so avoid Perrys and you will have a great stay

title: Way Too Small For Two People
text: i cant belive this is a 4 star hotel yes the service was very nice and helpful but the room was just silly i would say maybe 90sf i did not know that you could have a 4 star hotel with a full bedtwo adults cant sleep comfortable on a full bed no chair no storage space had too keep cloths in our luggage and store it on the one small window sill over looking a ally the bath room was so small you had to step out just to dry yourself and there was not even a place to put your soap or shampoo very thin walls also hard to sleep when every time sombody gets off the elivator or opens there room door it is so loud it wakes you up maybe it was that i booked on priceline and they put us in the worst room in the hotel but looking on the web site and the regular prices that they charge it is way way overpriced 4001200 a night for a glorified closet i dont think so

title: Excellent Hotel with a decent location
text: I stayed in this hotel this past weekend it was great My sister and I came to DC to just do an adult trip and see everything we have in the past Upon arrival we were thrilled that there was a 24hr CVS right next door along with a liquor store The check in the great  we arrived early then the check in time and they gave us our room anyways Were on the 8th floor  view is eh but when are you really in the hotel room The rooms are great  people have wrote that the rooms are outdated and need to be updated The older style rooms and furnture go along with all the oldness of DC The kitchen is great we made coffee and bagles every morning  the toaster is great along with the fridge and maid service does the dishes Bathroom is small water goes hot and cold but oh well didnt bother me and the little powder room was great for me and my sis getting ready Bed are SUPER Comfy i want to take one home  Location  everything is like a 1015 min walk Not bad at all it was refreshing downside of location is that not too many bars around We walked a few blocks to Circa  great little place A lot of college kids though but we fit in Over all place is great and will def stay here again

title: beautiful rooms great service
text: the renovated rooms are beautiful and the rooms were very clean we had a suite which was turned into second bedroom each evening my child ill in the night and housekeeping was quick to respond at 130 in the morning with fresh linens the doormen offered us use of their hotel limo to take us to FAO Schwartz when we requested a cab On the egative side the cup of coffee my husband had a breakfast was 9

title: Perfect Hotel for Philadelphia
text: We had a wonderful experience in this hotel earlier this week My previous stays in Philadelphia were underwhelming with small hotel rooms and I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel Our 5th floor room felt very spacious for the 4 of us 2 adults and 2 children Our room was nicely decorated immaculately clean the beds were comfortable and the shower was outstanding Breakfast was very good and the dining area was more spacious than other hotels with a free continental breakfast The wine and cheese reception was very pleasant and cookies were available daily Best of all the staff was fantastic They went out of their way to be friendly and helpful to both adults and children We highly recommend this property to families with children visiting Philadelphia

title: Great New Years Eve location
text: We booked the hotel through Priceline It was a great surprise Received the room for 5 nights over the New Years holiday and it was only 249 a night Being so close to Times Square for the ball drop was the best part The staff was a little rude when we arrived One of the bellhops storing luggage for early arrivals was tipped badly by the person in front of us and as they walked away he mumbled for that tip I might not be able to find your luggage We had some issues with our door key and the staff seemed irritated by us asking for new keys the second time around Other than that the room was great room service was a little pricey but the food was excellent and the location we couldnt have been happier with

title: Great Location Terrible Hotel
text:
This is pretty expensive hotel with bad and not friendly service and cleanliness The only good thing about this hotel is the location  close to Radio City and Broadway theatres
I wouldnt recommend this hotel

title: Alot better than expected
text:
After reading the reviews on here before we went I was a little worried so when we arrived at The Wellington it was a pleasent surprise 
Firstly the location is perfect A very short walk to Central Park and Times Square without all the hundreds of people on your doorstep Surrounding the hotel is a couple of cafe  resturants which all served breakfast We ate at Ben Ash every morning which is just across the road I dont know about other meals but breakfast was great
When we arrived before check in time luckily our room was ready There were quite a few people in the lobby checking in and out and we was asked if we could make our own way upto our room as all the bell hops were busy This was not a problem at all as im more than capable of getting in a lift with my suitcase and finding my room The room wasnt as small as expected iv stayed in similar sized rooms in Europe Our room had a double bed huge tv with loads of channels a desk a bed side cabinet and chair a very big mirror on the wall and a cabinet with the tv on top There was also a walk in closet with a hairdryer iron and ironing board inside The bathroom was small but it had a toilet sink mirror towel rails and a bath  shower so everything you need in a bathroom There was another hairdryer in the bathroom but i couldnt get this to work 
We checked out first thing in the morning and the bell hops were very efficient in storing our cases for us They also organised us a car to get back to the airport I was abit concerned that they had ordered us a car and not a yellow cab but he assured us it was a flat rate just a little more than a taxi which it was and it was nice to travel back with abit of comfort All the staff we spoke to at the hotel were very friendly and helpful
A great little hotel in a perfect place I wouldnt hesitate in stopping again

title: Great Leisure Get Away
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Blake for our first overnight trip to Chicago We mainly chose it because of the price and that the purpose of our trip was to explore the city Didnt use the valet service since we took the train in from Indiana and we were pleased to discover the hotel was about a 5 minute walk from the train station Greg the door man was very helpful we were checked in promptly and our room was immaculate Loved the Gilchrist and Soames toiletries and the shower Bed was super comfy and the room was spacious And while there is not an abundance of shops and restaurants in the immediate area they are not far away We ate dinner at Hackneys Irish Pub a recommendation from Greg which had authentic pub grub and Ive only had better fish  chips in England Greg also suggested a great jazz club on Clark St called Close Up 2 so we changed for the evening drank cocktails in the Custom House restaurant and set off for a great night of live music
 So in my opinion if youre just going for a get away and dont mind getting a little fresh air everything we wanted to do was less than two miles away including shopping and navy pier attractions or taking a very inexpensive cab ride to your destination I recommend Hotel Blake Prices are excellent great service quaint neighborhood and yummy drinks and food

title: A super New York hotel with large bedrooms
text: So this hotel is a mile or so from Times Square but its easy to move around as there is a tube station right outside Its a stones throw from Central Park but the biggest advantage of this hotel is that the bedrooms are very large especially by NY standards Didnt really use any of the facilities but the bedroom was very clean  the staff were very helpful There is a really interesting market over the road selling everything you can imagine and as the bedrooms all have a kitchenette this is a bonus if you fancy a night in All in all a great hotel in which to unwind after a busy day in the city

title: Good locationworks for families
text: Week long stay with four kids Go early for breakfast Parking is tight but all of San Diego seems to be like that Nice that there is a laundry room but no where really to sit and wait Our kids loved the pool and hot tub Friendly courteous staffvery helpful love that there was microwave and fridge in room We will stay here again

title: Chamber Holiday Mixer
text:
Last night the Canoga ParkWest Hills Chamber serving the communities of Canoga Park West Hills and Warner Center had their Holiday Mixer at the Hilton Woodland Hills and what a wonderful event it was The staff and management of the Hilton are wonderful The hotel was very festivally decorated for the Holidays 
We were a group of almost 100 and everything was done and taken care of without any questions Words cannot describe how good the food was for this event The Chef out did himself for us 
We use the Hilton for many of our events because of the great service we always receive They make planning an event very easy 
The entire staff of the Hilton made this our best Holiday Party

title: 1st Choice for New York
text:
I simply cant praise this hotel and its staff highly enough The last couple of times weve visited New York we stayed in the Westin but this time no room was available at the time of booking We chose the Muse based on the location and our previous experience with Kimpton hotels we are keep in touch members
We e mailed in advance to say that we would be celebrating our wedding anniversary during our stay and with this in mind could we have the nicest available room  well its always worth a try On arrival our anniversary was acknowledged at Reception and there was a bottle of Prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in a lovely corner room with views from the 14th floor At no time did we hear construction noise from our room gentle traffic noise could be heard during the night but not enough to disturb sleep
Our package included complimentary continental breakfast which included coffee juice and a selection of fresh fruit pastries toast and preserves The quality and service was excellent and was probably one the most relaxed breakfasts wed experienced in a hotel setting On one occasion there was no table available but we were offered coffee while we waited and a table soon became free
All the staff we experienced from checkin to check out at the door or in the restaurant couldnt have made us feel more welcome
The evening wine receptions are a welcome bonus just whats needed after a days sightseeing and a refill was always offered when we took back our empties
We will definitely choose the Muse when we next return to New York

title: expensive but so nice
text:
This hotel has a lot Good location nearby subway stations lovely decorated rooms a separate shower in the room a microwave an fridge a simple breakfast and very nice personnel
The only negative pioint is that it is very expensive like most hotels in NYC

title: Enjoyed my stay will return
text: This hotel is about 15 minutes walking distance to the Davies Symphony Hall and the War Memorial Opera House It is also steps away from both the metro and the light rail that connect all the dots of the San Francisco financial theater and shopping districts The interiors are decorated with a simple classic ambiance I was in town for performances over two evenings and was able to work in my room in the day time The inroom wifi connection was reliable during the day though it slowed down later in the evening I liked the fact that the restaurant downstairs was not too busy and dishes were reasonably priced Overall service was courteous and prompt Tucked away on the mezzanine there is a nice gallery preserving artifacts of historic interest

title: Great location and service
text: This hotel is located on the river directly across from where you can ride the riverboat If you sign up for free as an Omni Preferred Guest you will receive complimentary coffee delivered to your room The front desk is very efficient as well as the valet parkers and every one does refer to you by your name Every weekend they have a brunch that is really beautiful It is not inexpensive but worth it I have stayed at this hotel many times before and this is my favorite hotel on the river It has a lot of history and is not your typical hotel

title: Lovely Stay  as usual
text: The Conrad is our usual choice when staying in Chicago Comfortable beds nice modern rooms  corner suites always the best for nice views of Michagen Ave  Fantastic location  especially for shopping Staff are always helpful

title: A lot better than expected
text: My husband  I stayed here after a very long day of traveling The room was very nice  the bed was comfortable The only drawback was that is cold that night and the heater didnt come on until 300 am

title: Clean and quiet place to lay your head
text: My husband daughter and I stayed her for 3 nights on a trip to Seaworld I wasnt expecting too much because it was one of the lower priced hotels near the park but I was pleasantly surprised The hotel was clean and quiet and worked perfectly as a place to lay our heads The hotel staff was extremely friendly and accomodating The buffet breakfast was nothing spectacular but certainly adequate for a complimentary breakfast before heading out for the day I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced place to sleep after a long day out and about in San Diego

title: Clean comfy great service
text:
I came for a work conference so I got a great rate 
Airport shuttles and robes are always selling points for me and Omni had both Call the hotel directly to let them know you need a ride from the airport The free shuttle leaves the hotel at the top of the hour only so expect to wait as much as an hour depending on when your flight arrives at the airport 
The checkin process as smooth and accurate I had called the hotel directly for the reservation
The amenities had something for everyone The Onion Grill was a terrific late lunch and the conference food at the hotel was excellent most with a Texas and TexMex theme A fitness center pool and hot tub were popular A onechair business center had a charge for internet use but a free ability to check in with airlines and print boarding passes The lobby bar was a good place to wait and enjoy a cocktail
The bathrooms were typical hotel bathrooms with tubs that perhaps need resurfacing The room was large and confortable with chairs in additional to the very comfortable bed
Id definitely stay here again if I could get a good price

title: The Best Stay in the South to Call Home but not Home
text: Ver yvery good service clean rooms My wife love exercise room The room is what I like best Location was good

title: Paper thin walls
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights over Spring Break with our teenage son Main concern is how thin the room Walls are Heard most of went on in adjacent rooms  every night meaning a bad nights sleep and extremely inappropriate if you have children with you You can hear every word Bathroom is the smallest Ive ever seen its difficult to turn around in it and there is no storage area at all apart from the floor The bath was not cleaned for the duration of our stay The pool was not in operation during our stay but we had hoped to sit outside and enjoy the sunshine Unfortunately the area was not cleaned and a duck had made the pool home 
Overall the hotel is tired a little grubby and very very noisy

title: Comfortable convenient stay downtown
text: I agree with previous reviewers that this seems like the best noncasino choice downtown It is clean and modern inside with the parking garage right next door 10day if you want to save on valet It is right next to 2 popular upscale restaurants 24 Grille part of the hotel and Roast Also a convenient 1 block walk to the People Mover Michigan stop if you want a 50 cent ride to Greektown or the Riverfront Unfortunately downtown Detroit seemed a little dead the weekends and there is not much hustle and bustle on the streets Nice sitting area by the hotel bar  plush sofas and chairs

title: Its not that bad
text: I read some of the reviews of this hotel and I have to say it aint that bad The hostel is basic and the service is a bit off but its cheap and fairly close to town Our room had everything you might expect inlcuding a microwave and a fridge and the free breakfast whilst minimal was a nice touch It could do with a lick of paint and some REAL flowers to give the place a more welcoming feel The one maajor downside is that although it is fairly close to downtown it is not easy to walk and youll be forced to get a cab or use their 3 shuttle service If there are 3 or 4 of you it is cheaper to get a cab whilst for 1 or 2 I would recommend their shuttle But dont use it to go to Graceland as there is a free bus from downtown As for the hotel overall Good value

title: Delivered as Promised
text: The Casablanca was exactly as advertised Very nice for the price a welcoming staff and a perfect location The hotel is less than 50 feet from the center of times square The 17 dollar per day savings on the parking garage next door was a nice perk The rooms were small but decorated in keeping with the theme and very comfortable Ask for a room that is 04 304 404 etc because they have larger bathrooms Tony Ds restaurant which is downstairs was excellent Ricks Cafe on the second floor was a perfect spot for a complementary evening cup of coffee and snack as well as the free morning breakfast We definitely will be staying at the Casablanca on our next visit to New York

title: Like a beautiful gold watch that turns your wrist green
text:
Shiny and beautiful at first glance but scratch the surface and something is missing As a qualifier I have stayed at many top hotels around the world including The Peninsula NYC which this is NOT Basically this isnt my first time at the rodeo Please see my other reviews
I booked this property for 3 nights through the American Express Platinum Fine Hotels and Resorts program Typically this entitles you to a room upgrade free continental breakfast early checkin4pm late checkout and a hotel amenity specific to the property In this case that was a 100 dollar credit to be used at the spa At the time of my booking there was a promotion for stay 2 nights get the 3rd night free
Checkin was very smooth When our car arrived someone was waiting curbside to take us to our room The driver had clearly given them the heads up about our arrival Very slick We were taken directly to the room we did NOT receive an upgrade with a view of Rush Street and the tourist hotspotpizza joint across the street We were not really told any specifics about what was included with our package or other details about the roomhotel we were given an envelope and asked if we had any questions
Room The room is pretty and spacious for an entrylevel room The closet is very small but there is plenty of room for suitcases The bathroom is large and welllit but has only one vanity which is odd in a hotel of this caliber There is a full desk with fax machine people still use those and small sitting area with loveseat and cocktail table There is a central control system for lighting phone and privacy that works pretty well but seems antiquated The one at St Regis Bal Harbour for instance is touch screen and much more advanced The whole time I was here I thought this thing would give my parents a coronary Negatives single vanity uncomfortable bed flat lifeless pillows torn sofa cushion and stained desk chair
Getting in and out of the hotel onto the street is A PROCESS The location of the hotel is fantastic but to utilize it you must take the elevator down to the lobby walk past the front desk and concierge down another hall take another elevator down to another lobby and go out the door onto the sidewalk Admittedly its kind of a princess complaint but its not very well thought out and I thought it would prove problematic if there were a fire in the hotel Just my opinion
Room Service Ordering was easy the food came within the window they specified and by room service standards the food was above average for taste and presentation
Service A month before arrival someone from the hotel called to see if there was anything special I needed I set up carservice from the airport and also explained that we would be celebrating a birthday and I would like a cake for the room on our first night when we returned from dinner I was told that I would get a call back that afternoon after she spoke with the pastry chef A week passed with no call so I called the concierge spelled out all the details again feeling confident that it would all work out Three days before our stay I got another call from the hotel saying that someone had spoken to the pastry chef and did I still want a cake I said yes I want a cake but I never heard back from you so I worked it out with the concierge She said oh I will contact the concierge and cancel their order and put this one in instead I said they could work it out between the two of them since I had given both the exact same details about the cake
Day of arrival The car service was wrong I specified a type of car because we were celebrating I wanted everything topnotch which wasnt there although the staff at the airport from Metropolitain were very friendly and efficient After going out for lunch at Pierrot Gourmet hotel restaurant where the service was poor if I am being nice and shopping before dinner we returned to the room to find the cake on the table waiting for us Nothing like a big piece of chocolate cake BEFORE dinner
Check out I was charged for the third night on my bill which they would not adjust despite the fact that I had confirmation from AMEX Instead they offered the use of their phone so I could hash the issue out publicly in their lobby while other people are checking in and checking out I declined and said I would address it when I got home It felt very EconoLodge
Bottom line Blame me blame AMEX but at the end of the day it falls to The Pen to coordinate their programs and that wasnt the only issue The bar is chic and beautiful room service is above average the rooms are spacious and quiet We did not receive an upgrade despite the hotel not being full which I confirmed with a staff member I thought the service was inconsistent I did NOT feel valued as a guest and since I am spending my first day home after the trip squabbling with the hotel and AMEX about 600 dollars in charges instead of basking in the memories I would probably not return I hear the WaldorfAstoria is gorgeous with similar rates and larger newer rooms with fireplaces

title: location Location LOCATION
text:
We reserached this trip for months Having been to Chicago before we wanted to make this trip even better We picked the Sheraton because of the location to almost everything we needed The bus tour acrtually had a stop here our bike tour was within walking distance as was the mag mile tribune building and Navy Pier This was by no means the cheapest of accomidations but I would pick it over others again The staff was friendly the in hotel resteraunts we went to weregood and the all you can eat breakfast buffett we splurged on the last morning fantastic I would definantly use it again
The ony draw back we had was the burger joint in the lowest level were more attentive to the sidewalk customers than those indoors we had to go ask the folks behind the counter to take our orders after waiting for over 20 minutes for a server to She had to seat us as well and was apologetic when we returned to get attention
Our room was nice and reasonable I might upgrade nesxt time for a lake view but with the pierwithin walking distance the rivier view was fine

title: What More Can You Ask For
text:
This is one gem of a boutique hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago It provides all the important things that a traveler needs such as free breakfast free internet friendly concierge  free happy hour and of course a clean and stylish room This hotel does not have a big reception area it does not have an overpriced restaurant and it does not have a lot of facilities that you find in the big chain hotels but you really do not want or use these facilitates anyway
Great check in experience our room safe need resetting and the service manager was there to fix it in a flash The concierge helped me organize a taxi for the four of us lots of luggage to the airport with a smile 
I wish all hotel are like this one give the customer what they really need and want

title: Very nice CIS
text: Stopped for night while driving to south Florida Clean rooms great staff and an adequate breakfast The Inn is close to the highway so the back of hotel has some road noise but we stayed in the front and the room was very nice

title: Great hotel
text: I feel I have to write review about this hotel great location minutes walk from Time Square and subway and bus stations Rooms nice and clean small but why do you need a large room in New York bathroom again clean and tidy staff within hotel very helpful especially Maria who looks after the bar a mind of information very helpful with looking for restaurants etc would certainly book this hotel again if returning to NYC

title: Brilliant Hotel  Beautiful City
text: We stayed at this Hotel for 7 nights from 20th June 2011 and from checking in to checking out we found the service to be first class Our deal included continental breakfast which was very enjoyable and the service excellent the staff are so friendly and welcome you at all times The wine hour at 500pm is great and you meet so many new friends  when we were there it was Hardys wines which suited us also there was Snagria and soft drinks  one night we even got Oysters in the Bar area which my husband loved The hotel is very well situated we walked to the White House The metro is very close also fantastic restuarants Have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel and area Very safe

title: Great night before my flight
text:
I had just spent the last 4 days in the desert outside of Wickenburg Az and was ready for a nice relaxing night back in civilazation and the Radisson delivered They have a great restaurant a nice little lounge and very friendly staff The front desk clerk upgraded me to a two room suite It was bigger then I needed but sure was nice The suite was equiped with two wide screen tvs a incredibe bed and was clean and comfortable
I also ate at the restaurant and had a great meal The server whose name I forget but she has red hair was friendly and attentive Could not have had a better over all experience at this hotel 
I travel to Phoenix and the Wickenburg area about once a month This Radisson will be my first choice whenever Im close by

title: The BEST hotel in Chicago SERIOUSLY
text: My classmates and I were absolutely amazed at how beautiful modern clean and AWESOME The Raffaello was from the moment we walked in the front doors We loved it The doormen were so hospitable and friendly The people at the front desk were so nice  always smiling  helpful I felt important while I was there This hotel is nothing like your normal chain hotelsits so much better It looks like it would cost a fortune to stay there but it is VERY AFFORDABLE I cannot wait to plan my next trip to Chicago and the only place I ever want to stay in Chicago is The Raffaello The location is PERFECT 112 blocks from Michigan Ave and 1 block from Lake Michigan I absolutely LOVE the Raffaello Hotel Thank you Raffaello Hotel for making my stay in Chicago the very best it could be I couldnt ask for anything better

title: Nice hotel but Terrible house keeping
text: The room was nice and the concierge  valet parking attendants were excellent The overnight parking is very expensive 33 a day The bathroom was not clean very well when we checked in There was hair on the floor and the toilet was not very clean at all We did not make a big deal out of it we decided to speak to the cleaning people and told them to make sure they cleaned the toilet the next day They still did not do a thorough job of cleaning the toilet at all There were visable stains on the back toilet and the inside For a new hotel the toilets should not look so dirty and dated Before you fully check I would advise you check the bathrooms to make sure its thoroughly cleaned before you get settled Also the buffet breakfast area is very tight so I suggest you come down for breakfast very early The hotel is in a great are but you have the occasional homeless and old drunks around the next corner but they wont bother u at all Its very close to the train and the megabus depot

title: Has some good things going for it
text: Stayed here on a couples trip to DC Loved the fact that the Metro stop is right under the hotel This make easy access from Reagan Airport and super great for hopping on and off Metro for sightseeing and dinnerespecially at night We had previously stayed at Embassy Suites Convention Center and although I loved the free alcohol and breakfast there I really didnt like the 10 minutes walk at 10pm on dark streets That is why this time we picked Lenfant If you stay during the week you have a food court downstairs with Five Guys Yogurt shop AuBonPain Starbucks Moes sushi place and more But keep in mind this is business district and most of it shuts down at 5pm and isnt open on weekends There were 2 or 3 places open on Saturday but nothing was on Sunday However with the metro being just downstairs we hopped on Sunday morning and went to Ballston stop for IHOP  Room was nice and our superior room was an 8 on scale of 110 Best was comfy things were clean TV was old and nothing too impressive but we werent there to watch TV They had restaurant and bar downstairs didnt eat at restaurant because it seemed pricey Went to bar once and got weak drinks for super high price and didnt care for that Staff held our bags since we had early flight as well as held them due to our late flight No issues with staff everyone helpful at check in and out I would stay here for convenience and safety of Metro and also location that is close to all the museums Wouldnt stay with kids because we like having a separate bedroom from them Loved DC

title: Phenominal hotel
text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni on December 4 2005 for 1 night The hotel is beautiful and service is excellent I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco

title: Great Location  Awesome Stay
text:
Stayed at the Marriott at the Renaissance Center on the weekend of Sept 30th a Saturday night stay 
Pros
Amazing location  The hotel is located at the entrance of the WindsorUSA tunnel  this provides easy access for Canadians Being on the waterfront afforded nice views Lastly the property is directly linked to the People Mover  we were able to get to Joe Louis Arena quickly and safely for 050 person note also got to Comerica Park using the People Mover  for more info visit thepeoplemovercom 
Amazing property  The inside of the hotel is quite nice The facility is modern clean and architectually stunning
Great access to restaurants and shops  All without leaving the building  there is a Starbucks on the concourse level and a small convenient store located in the lobby This is in addition to the restaurantsbar located on the property
Great room  very clean and modern with great bedding and a nice shower
Great food at the Rivercafe  while pricey the portions were big and the food was excellent
Cons
Small annoyances
The volume on the television could not be turned down fully unless muted  it was very unusual The lowest volume setting was still quite loud  had to eventually turn off the television so my family was not disturbed
The heating system for the room was unusally loud It might have been a problem for light sleepers It was not really an issue for us
While the Renaissance Center is quite beautiful it is also very complex it might take a while for a visitor to figure out how to get around the facility
Inroom high speed internet seemed pricey at 995 per day
Advice
If visiting this hotel from from Toronto or SW Ontario  Take the 401 thru Windsor instead of going thru Sarnia The trip is much more straightforward and as mentioned before the hotel is located right at the entrance to the tunnel
Take the People Mover everywhere It is significantly cheaper than taking a cab
All in all  the facility is great and I highly recommend it Fyi  my rate was 111 US  tax per night  I signed up for Marriott ebreaks and was notified of the rate shortly before my stay

title: Great hotel exceeded my expectations
text: Very nice hotel much nicer than the WaldorfAstoria in NYC where I stayed for business travel in January Lobby and public areas very nice handy access to a lower level arcade of shops and restaurants including Wow Bao Asian fast food yummy and a Starbucks though beware the Starbucks isnt open on Sunday They also sell Starbucks coffee and a small selections of prepared foods pastries and yogurt for breakfast salads and sandwiches at lunch in the lobby coffee shop Hotel restaurant very good and not quite as outrageously expensive as at some higher end properties Huge corne room had lots of space great view and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in You get a little bit of noise from the el even on the 19th floor where I stayed but it is not loud enough to disturb you unless you are a really light sleeper Charging 1495 for wifi in the rooms is outrageous though st least they provide free wifi in the lobby

title: Overall great stay  Lovely rooms
text: Stayed here for a few nights in April and everything was great Nicely decorated rooms very modern but tastefully done Reception staff were very friendly We didnt have breakfast or use the restaurant so cant comment on that Location was superb  just far enough back from fishermans wharf that you dont get all of the noise but within a minute or two walk to the bustling front Overall  fantastic Just what you want from a hotel

title: In the heart of Beverly hills
text: The Hyatt Regency looked like an old hotel which had got a facelift but still required more to be done the location was fantastic and with Starbucks in the hotelwe were more than happy But the rooms and the entire hotels definitely needs a major makeover

title: Wow is for Woah
text: Traveling through San Diego on our way home decided to stop and book the W in San Diego We had recently had a great experience at the W in Austin TX Well here goes Try and get help with your bags Nope Try to get a bucket with ice for a bottle of champagn  You must make 3 calls and a personal request wait 5 hours and if your lucky it will eventually come It did Robe for your room call and ask reply you want two more answer no there are none here we would just like 2  have them upgrade you we got an upgrade right next to the associate floor closet Banging all the time night and early Sunday Morning forget sleeping in Worst attempt to sleep that night in my last 50 hotel stays The worst Find somewhere else it has to be better Check out look for a bellman take your own cart and get your own things I hate to say it W this time is for Worst

title: Great location
text: We got a deal on Sniqueawaycom that enabled us to stay 3 nights at the Onyx The room was small but the location was the best We were close to transit and were given great directions when we walked The breakfast in the morning was expensive and not all that special so we opted to go around the corner to Duncan Donuts The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful The location was very quiet We were quite happy with our stay

title: Excellent hotel with a desire to please their guests
text: We originally planned to stay for 3 nights then switch to another hotel for the remaining 2 nights We had a really good conference rate 220night when I made the reservations but they would not honor the rate for the weekend as well conference ended on Friday We got a room on the 33rd floor overlooking the lake and Navy Pier We were celebrating our anniversary that weekend they asked if we were celebrating anything and when we arrived in the room there was a special treat waiting for us chocolate covered strawberries chocolate treates and some cold beverages for no extra charge It was a great room with a great view Im pretty sure they upgraded us to this room based on our anniversary It was very clean and well appointed The bed was incredibly comfortable and we slept great every night The location is great Right in the middle of everything but off the beaten path just enough The service and attitude of the staff was awesome You could tell they wanted to please you and get you anything you needed We liked it so much I called down to try to extend our stay for the additional 2 nights Not only did they extend it at the same rate they made several adjustments so that we could stay in the same room our room was reserved the other 2 nights and so I at least expected that we would have to move to another room That kind of hospitality will definitely bring us back to the Swissotel when we are in Chicago again The conference I attended during the week was also very successful Highly reccommended for business and pleasure

title: Nice stay
text:
Me and a friend have stayed there for 3 days visiting LA Hotel is placed on North Vermont av a bit a distance  to walk  from Universal Studios and Hollywood center so you should have a car There is not many good places to eat around hotel
Hotel is nice and clean with pretty good breakfast included Stuff are nice and polite and rooms are clean and fine There is safe parking place at hotel garden for extra charge Hotel have free WiFi internet Hotel have a pool I havent used it but I could see people using
Hotel is great stay for price

title: Better with room upgrade
text: Charming and cozy oldstyle hotel Big mistake to get a room with a shared bathroommy neighbors kept shuttling between their room and the bathroom slamming the doors until 2 am The room with a private bathroom was 25 morenight but completely worth it Even though I was by the stairs it was much quieter You also get a safe in which to stow your laptop and a much better desk One elevator was not working so the trip to the room make the exercise room unnecessary Good restaurants on Stuyveysant St are a short walk from the hotel and its convenient to reach Columbia University on the 1 train

title: Use the info from these reviews to have a great time
text:
I read all of the reviews and called the Radisson with any other questions that werent answered here I would say the use of the word resort is a bit loose The Radisson is definitely not what I would call a resort And for what they charge they should include a mini fridge and microwave in the suites They will however provide you with either for 10 per night per item I just think thats cheesy But I knew before I booked the trip that this was the case I have 2 little ones so a fridge full of fruit juice milkits a must We just happen to have a cooler that can be plugged in and used just like a fridge Perfect The pools are great for kids and not so great if youre a single adult or couple with no kids They are only 4ft deep at their deepest so its perfect for kids The kiddie pool didnt look yellow to me but the bottom surface is sandy colored which probably led to the previous reviewer saying it was yellow We stayed in a Jr Suite but really only for sleeping We spent the majority of the two days in Sea World Loved the free shuttle service We went to Sea World on a Thurs  Fri and those were the perfect days to go As we were leaving Saturday am the shuttle service line was packed and Im sure folks were getting hot  irritated by the wait With the package we booked through the Sea World website we received free breakfasts every morning We also ate there for dinner and had the ribeye specials The pecan pie is delicious In fact we were happy with everything we were served Oh they do charge 3 for the Smores kit which you can avoid by simply bringing your own and a stick to roast the marshmellows with The Radisson is very kid orientedwhich is the main thing I care about when Im traveling with my kids They have a wonderful staff that does free face painting necklace beading  various other crafts They also do manicures  hairdos for little girls that they charge a small sum for In fact all of the interactions I had with different staff members were pleasant friendly  helpful
My adviceread all the reviews have realistic expectations and enjoy Its not as bad as the horrible reviews its received but its not the Ritz either nor is it a resort This is a great place to stay if youre taking the kids to Sea Worldperiod I would not stay here if it were my honeymoon or if my husband  I were going on a trip without the kids

title: Beautiful Hotel  Good Location
text:
Standard KingQueen Room  557
I couldnt resist the great deal I found on this hotel from TravelZoo 199night  FREE breakfast  which turned out to be a 40 credit for breakfast We only stayed one night though wish it could have been longer
Once we pulled up the staff there were very attentive and nice It didnt take long to check in and even though we were early our room was ready for us to head up to later we noticed in the lobby that there was a long queue to check in and only 2 attendants
THE HOTEL The hotel was already decked out with Christmas decorations and a Christmas tree in the center of the lobby I was impressed by the lobby of the hotel  very classy grand and beautiful 
THE ROOM High ceilings new large flatscreen tv and roomy bathroom with comfy robes In case anything was forgotten the room is well stocked with amenities Bed was a little on the hard side but we still slept well The walls seemed to either be really thin or the people in the room next to us really loud We could hear every word
THE GOOD The service was excellent except for in the Laurel room The waitress was a bit slow even though it didnt seem too busy for dinner Dinner in the Laurel Room was great but not spectacular Presentation was lovely The ambiance of the hotel was very nice and gave off a relaxing and not to stuffy feeling
THE BAD 50 for 24 hour parking Since they can get away with it I guess they might as wellBreakfast pricing was steep as well  29 for the buffet albeit a very nice one per person I guess thats what you should expect in a hotel like that anyways 1395 for internet service in the room They should offer free WiFi
Walking to Union Square is doable However walking back up the hill is a different story It can be done but be prepared to work your legs We also walked down to Fishermans Wharf more then 4 blocks away but that is also doable North Beach seemed to be just around the corner Very good location

title: Nice family hotel not right in the middle of things but close enough
text:
We got there early about 1100 am and early check in was no problem at all even though they were fully booked Our room was the standard size for a city hotel youre not gonna find too many huge hotel rooms in DC unless they are suites The rooms are equipped with besides the standard bed desk chair dresser and wardrobe theres a flat screen HD TV and mini frig also I called down to request a microwave they said they would see if there were anymore available We left the hotel and when we got back they had set up the microwave for us 
This hotel is one block from a metro stop which is very convenient Theres a couple of sandwich places nearby and a CVS However there isnt any nearby restaurants except the on site Marriott restaurant 
There is on site parking The parking deck does fill up at night and they have to valet park your car so you have to leave your keys I have to say they have the cheapest hotel parking Ive seen in DC 
The area this hotel is in is right near the new Nationals baseball stadium There is a lot of new development coming up around the hotel so I do see restaurants and more stores in the future 
Im not sure if this hotel is always as busy as it was when we were there because we were there during the Cherry Blossom festival in the heat of tourist season and with the new baseball stadium there seem to be a game every day Nevertheless even with all this people traffic the service was still good

title: well located
text:
The hotel is well located in the heart of san francisco 100m from union square everything is around Subway shops rental bikes shop shuttle to airport BART cable car etc
For nightlife discos and bar is around The only thing is that the hotel was under rennovation when we arrived and we could not enjoy the loundge bar they have
Prices is correct Parking is nearby and will cost you approx 40 USD night
BUT with such a great location no need for cars

title: Comfortable and Pleasant
text:
On the recommendation of a colleague who told me it was decent I spent three nights here and found that it was everything that I could possibly want for a breakneck business trip
The rooms are pleasant the beds are comfortable and the pillows are plentiful and varied I had a large desk where I was able to work in the evenings and the television system is wellstocked with a variety of channels to which I was able to fall asleep Above all I appreciated the FREE very fast internet Good for them  thats a savings over other hotels
The lobby is quiet and the staff is nofrills but competent friendly and efficient The neighborhood is okay  you have to walk a blockandahalf beneath the 405 to get to the Sherman Oaks Mall and some restaurants But if youre okay with not much other than that in the vicinity then you should have no problem with this very solid business property

title: Very trendy at a price
text:
We stayed there on our honeymoon we wanted something a bit different and contemporary and we thought that this Philip Starck hotel was the perfect place
Location was a plus as it was near Central Park As soon as you arrive the lobby is very impressive but everything its a bit too dark even on a sunny day it doesnt seem to get much light insidethe lobby was constantly busy with people coming and going not matter what time of the day was one of the busiest hotels ive ever been to The staff were pleasant and helpful The rooms are small and i can imagine that if you live in a big houseapartment you will feel claustrophobic inside My husband and I live in a very small apartment in London and we are quite petite so it was nice and cosy enough for us We never had any food at the hotel cause it was very expensive but we decided to have some drinks on a saturday evening in the main bar we were sat in the middle and we were asked to move because they had to leave those tables for those who wanted to buy champagne or be prepared to spend a min of 300we left straight away but we thought it was quite rude to do so specially when were guests at the Hotel We moved to the Library Bar which i think its much nicer the other bar is more for people to look and be looked at and you feel too overexposed At the Libray bar we had 6 cocktails in total at 22 each one plus tips iI think we must have spent around 120 or more throughout the evening we never went back although the experience was good In general we would recommend this hotel as a one off experience if you like trendy boutique types but i think for that price you could find something with a better balance of all you want whilst you stay in a hotel New York is so amazing that the Hotel was never a concern great food at Flame diner opposite the hotel huge breakfasts We truly recommend a visit to the UN because it is a unique experience and go for a walk in Central Park very early in the morning on a sunny day its quiet and romantic Best Restaurant we have been to in a long time Home 20 Cornelia Street 2439579 in Greenwich Village The food is comfort food in good quantities and absolutely delicious Enjoy NY

title: Every need is met Palomar thinks of everything
text: One of the best city hotel experiences Every single staff member was so courteous and friendly The rooms are beautiful with lots of privacy Love the real gold fish coffee table centrepiece The little added touch of the next days weather report with some chocolate at turn down service was a nice touch Palomars complimentary wine hour is great for mingling and meeting new people Beautiful pool area and ideal for small group gatherings Having Golds Gym right beside the hotel and included with our hotel stay was so convenient Last minute shoe and accessory shopping by the hotel is perfect for every woman Pharmacy and groceries right outside the door too Thanks Samantha our concierge for booking our dinner reservation in Scottsdale and including directions as soon as we arrived The Bellmen always greet you with a big smile and are very informative A special thanks to Manager Jim Hollister for preparing a great staff for our arrival Wonderful experienceback again in January

title: Great Hotel  Super close to Grant Park for Lollapalooza
text: Excellent hotel comfortable beds and great service Just wish I had time to hang out in the gorgeous lobby bar or try the restaurants time was limited due to Lollapalooza Would definitely stay here again

title: Lived Up to Ranking at TripAdvisor
text: Checked in on my wifes birthday Large clean comfortable very convenient location Will definitely stay here again

title: First time at the Edison and wont be the last
text: We stayed at the Edison for the first time from 31st January to 6th February and were delighted with our stay We normally go cheap and cheerful and book in to Milford Plaza when in NY but decided to change to the Edison a week before our stay as we had the option of taking a suite for a little more than what we were paying at the Milford We were not disappointed with this decision The Milford is currently a building site and would have meant for an awful stay in NY In comparison we found the Edison to be peaceful relaxing friendly clean and an ideal location As one of our party has not been keeping great health recently taking a suite was the ideal decision as it meant he was able to relax in much more comfort Yes the room was a little dated but you get what you pay for if I wanted super luxurious modern quality I would have gone elsewhere and paid three times the price That said the suite was clean comfortable the bed was soft the bathroom well stocked and clean and we really couldnt find fault I have read reviews on here of construction work going on  I was not aware of any work going on in the hotel maybe we were just lucky Will we back Oh yes The Milfords loss is the Edisons gain and I look forward to our next stay with great anticipation

title: Great Hotel
text:
This was a very nice hotel for the price The location is a little out of the way but a free shuttle service is provided making getting around extremely easy 
The room was huge and comfortable The staff was pleasant and knowledgable there is a reasonably priced parking lot there and the breakfast was decent

title: Great staff great location great feel interesting rooms
text:
Ive stayed at a lot of Ws This one was strange as it has been in Westwood for ten years but I never knew about it when I lived in LA Its really sort of a little gem Tucked away off the main stretch of Westwood the location is homey but a very short walk to Westwood Village The front desk and valet were all very friendly and welcoming The elevators have this cool camera that makes a montage poster of you as youre riding up although it may catch you slouching and looking like a schlub 
The room itself is a bit odd It feels like a mini suite with a separate living room and bedroom I believe the building used to be a dorm and the room feels like it although in a good way as I appreciated the separate bedroom Felt much cooler than a normal hotel room I also got a really cool view of the pool
I lucked into a really great rate at the W However be forewarned that valet parking is pretty exorbitant And theres not really anywhere else to park easily in Westwood One big drawback Also Internet is not free I think thats pretty ridiculous for a hotel at this price point Also the AC is pretty loud Not sure why that is Also its easy to hear noise outside

title: u r in the heart of chicago
text:
i really enjoyed my stay there
the rooms are very clean
the stuff are so friendly
the location is awesome u can go anywhere in the downtown in few minutes walking
the view from the room was really nice 
the only annoying thing was the internet it cost 13 per day i went to starbucks which is about 5 min walking to take my cofee and enjoy a free wifi

title: Horrible for families with infants
text: I requested a crib and about 20 minutes later the oldest wooden crib Ive ever seen was wheeled in I didnt let my baby sleep in it for fear that my baby might loose a finger in the gaps in the crib joints The crib bumper also looked antique as was tied on with what looked like shoe string

title: Best deal near downtown Denver
text: The place is old and worn but considering the price under 50 and location a quick 10 cab ride to the convention center I was very pleased The rooms are very old but clean and comfortable The shower worked and the bed was OK The TV looked like it was bought at a flea market and I never turned it on But compared to 200 for rooms downtown Ill stay here every time But bring your reservation confirmation because they tried to charge me 120 a night when I checked in

title: Lack of service at a nice place
text:
We like to stay at the Hyatt but thought about trying the Hilton I always thought it was a cool hotel Nice clean and updated rooms Very quiet with great view no matter where you stay however the service level would rate a 2 on a scale from one to 10 First off Valet parking I dont think twice about paying for someone else to park my car and retrieve it The valet parking was questionable at check in The amount of cars waiting to valet was extraordinarily long Had to wait until someone asked if we were staying at the hotel and wanted to check in From there we had to leave our car go check in and then go back to the valet line so that we could check in our car no wonder there was such a long line of cars
Secondly Check in What a joke we were the only ones checking in the rest of the lobby was a ghost town where were all the people that belonged to the cars The check in hostess was indifferent that we were there and shoved our room cards to us and said elevators are down the hall then she started chatting on the phone to a friend Luckily I heard someone speaking to the Concierge for instructions on how to access the elevators and get to the correct floor should be easy but this system is a crapshoot the first time you use it without instructions Lastly Valet again You must call down 30 minutes ahead not a good thing but something I can deal with We went down to the car and waited for the valet desk to acknowledge our presence as she was on her cell phone I showed her the receipt and she handed me my keys without looking up No thank you no offer of directions no offer of any level of service I guess talking to her boyfriend on the cell was more important than some tourist that was going to tip I didnt
The hotel was nice but not worth the price when you are sacrificing the service levels that you get at Hyatt Marriott or any other hotel chain

title: The service and room were fantastic
text: My wife and i stayed at the Westin for our 22nd wedding anniversary We were given a beautiful room and treated with tremendous hospitality and graciousness We were even given a congratulations card signed with notes from the staff In particular Liz at the front desk was extremely kind and helpful Thank you for a wonderful stay

title: Great Downtown LA Hotel
text: The Miyako Hotel was spotlessly clean and even elegant all at a very reasonable price for rooms in Downtown LA Its within walking distance of Los Angeles Union Station in the heart of Little Tokyo with excellent choices of restaurants also within walking distance The staff went above and beyond and were helpful with directions and suggestions in addition to being cheerful and friendly and welcoming I was traveling with my mother who is in her eighties and she also enjoyed the stay Highly recommend Didnt sample any of the spa offerings nor the cafe Downtown LA by the way has a lot of attractions and is becoming a nighttime center as well as the business district

title: Lovely stay great location nice room
text: A few years ago I stayed at the Dupont Hotel on Dupont Circle this time I was looking for something a little cheaper Room was a good size amenities include all the things you want as a woman conditioner body lotion and a good hair dryer Would stay there again

title: Basic room
text: If you want a place to store your luggage and have a bed then this place will do the trick No frills with this place I did find it weird that there are two comfort inns on either side of the highway but i had a GPS so it didnt take me to the wrong one i can see how it can

title: Great Location Friendly Staff
text: Walking distance from the beach Variety of restaurants and shopping centers around the area Nice little newly renovated hotel a little noisy if you get a room overlooking the roads Great breakfast choices Excellent staff very sweet and helpful front desk lady Rasha Overall this is a nice little place with a very convenient location and excellent staff The only negative was the noisy room

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is conveniently located to all of the downtown Indianpolis businesses including the Convention Center and Lucas Oil Stadium Everyone was polite helpful and pleasant The rooms were nicely decorated The only negative thing I can say about this location is that there are no USB ports or docking stations located in the rooms

title: Nice old hotel horrible customer service
