text: Was there for a wedding and had specifically requested and were told we had an early check in due to the time of the wedding and that we had a young infant and needed a room to feed her in When we arrived we were told that no room was available and would not be available until 130 The wedding was at 3 and that would leave us no time plus we were stranded with all of our luggage and infant daughter Fortunately we were able to stay in a family members room until one was made available for us hours later 100 The front desk personnel where not only rude they were extremely slow and did not seem to care that they had a long line of customers waiting to be served In fact they shut down one window leaving only one to serve at least 8 prospective guests Furthermore the gentleman who shut down his window stayed at the window and acted like he could not see the waiting guests while he did other work Overall I was thoroughly disappointed and would advise travelers to pay a little more and stay elsewhere

title: Beautiful HotelComfortable Rooms
text:
We were in town for the Volleyball Jr Nationals last week and stayed at this hotel It was extremely convenient to walk over to the convention center and be so close if needed to go back to our room We had to feed 12 boys and look for options each day besides snacks Both restaurants were great to accommodate not only large orders to go for 21 in our group but work with our reservations as well The hotel rooms were comfortable and the boys loved the tv in the bathroom The close proximity to downtown was great because on down time we got to take the whole group to the JFK memorial within walking distance from the hotel Rooms were spacious and comfortable The hotel is very pretty given its still new only opening in May 
Recommendation No coding on windows outside people can see in Make sure curtains are closed tight as the neon lights on the outside of the hotel building go on all night and are very bright
We have to agree our only complaint was the pool hours and pool bar After a long day of play and some nights not getting done until 9pm you want to take a swim They pool was only open until 10pm and for the parents who wanted a drink it was so crowded but the time we got up there and got one drink we were being kicked out We also figured since the hotel is sold out you would at least extend the pool hours longer

title: Lovely friendly hotel
text: Have just got back from a 4 night stay room was large and clean bathroom was also clean if a little dimly lit very quiet and slept very well great location staff and service excellent It was the added details that made it a little special ie chocolates and next days weather report when the beds were turned down after we returned from a long day out siteseeing We paid a vastly reduced rate for the accommodation due to my work but I have to admit I would grumble at paying full price for a room which I see as 3 star but I have to add it was a 5 star service

title: Cheap rate for a suite with complimentary drinks cookies and breakfast buffet
text: We scored a greatly reduced rate for a suite and enjoyed the complimentary evening drinks bedtime cookies and milk and delicious breakfast buffet

title: Large comfortable rooms and great ambiance
text:
This location is perfect for both work and pleasure Walk right across the street to the Colorado Convention Center or up a block to the 16th Street Mall Bike rental is available from a kiosk across the street and the Cherry Creek Pathway is just a short ride away
The hotel store serves up Starbucks coffee and is open 247 Check out the cool climbing sculpture near the lobby bar
Rooms are quiet and well appointed but I still hate the smell of Hyatts Portico white ginger scented toiletries
The food in Altitude the main floor restaurant was surprisingly innovative and delicious The bar offers a wide variety of beers and unique cocktails likely wine too but I didnt drink any this trip
Ask about the business package that will save you money if you eat breakfast in the hotel and need inroom interwebs

title: Surprisingly Good
text:
I didnt really know what to expect with this hotel not having stayed at any of the Hard Rock Hotels previously 
The location was perfect 5 min walk to the magnificent mile shops and 5 min walk the other way to Millenium Park The L train is1 block away and Willis Tower 1520 min walk
Rooms are full of funky rock colours and textures with each floor boasting different rock memorabilia from various artists
Good value for 
I would stay here again

title: Clean central friendly hotel
text: Rooms are spacious and clean The bathroom had a variety of toiletry samples including toothbrushes and paste which was a welcome treat Located only mins fom Union Square and the Bart its ideal for exploring the city Street where it is located can be a bit dodgy particularly at night Our room overlooked the street and was a little noisy but we didnt mind it too much Front desk staff were pleasant to deal with

title: Loved being able to walk to shops
text: It was great being able to walk to southpark for shopping bring back our bags and go shopping again The only problem we had was the area smelt very smokey One huge plus was there were washing machines in the building When you have been travelling with 3 children this is the best facility possible

title: great ambiance with professional staff in one of bostons best shopping locations
text: stay there walk the inside corridors for blocks with good choice of restr and stores

title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Chicago
text:
I stayed here for one night for a business meeting and was thoroughly impressed I checked in very early in the day and was upgraded to a beautiful suite overlooking the river and the Trump tower The staff was extremely friendly and all seemed very much like they enjoyed working there
The hotel had a wonderful turndown service with a chocolate on the pillow and your bathrobe laid out for you The robes are either zebra or leopard print The bathroom in my suite had a large jetted tub and a separate small shower The room was very clean and had neat window seats by every window Everything was in excellent working condition and the room just felt comfortable The only small complaint I had is that I ate lunch in the restaurant and they screwed up my order twice and offered nothing but a shallow apology
They have a wine reception every night in the lobby which was nice The hotel is convenient to downtown and close to multiple train stations Wonderful experience that I would strongly recommend when staying in downtown Chicago

title: Great price and good location for visiting Graceland but
text: Arrived in the evening and did not realize it was not the best neighborhood especially for a woman alone Except for the pancake place next door no place nearby to eat Thought it was odd when I inquired about places to eat the desk clerks response was to give me brochures for places that deliver didnt even mention the place next door also a place that would pick me up She was obviously getting a kickback on that oneOverall an OK experience but personally will not stay there again

title: Ace put me in a uniquely NYC Frame of Mindhighly recommended
text:
I had a very enjoyable stay at the Ace Hotel in midtown Manhattan near Penn Station and only a block away from a subway stop from which you can get to just about anywhere youd want to go The Ace Hotel is moderately priced by NYC standards recently remodeled clean and features excellent service by a friendly staff
I liked the offbeat motif of the hotel As it could be described as stark it will not be everyones cup of tea One persons starkness however is another persons bold statement and in any case the industrial appearance is only a style the hotel does not lack comfort or amenities although at the time of my visit it did not have its own restaurant they do however provide room service using the resources of nearby restaurants and they serve a breakfast of croissants and coffee All this fits in with a corporate sense of humor that includes its motto Thank you for sleeping with us
One disclaimer about this review I received a free upgrade due to the unavailability of the class of room I had booked I dont know what my cheaper room would have been like but the room I got had a refrigerator coffeemaking supplies a manual pencil sharpener more of that sense of humor a guitar I didnt check to see if it was functional and some opartish wallpaper to offset the mostly blackandwhite dcor There was a flatpanel TV and a featurepacked but austerelooking clock radio into which one could plug personal audio devices
I highly recommend this hotel all the more so if youd like a place to put you into a uniquely New York frame of mind

title: Loved this hotel
text:
I booked this hotel via their website and had a last minute change which they very happily accomodated We stayed from March 28March 30 The interior is very basic but very clean The bathrooms were always spotless even though I never saw anyone cleaning them Even with a shared bathroom we stayed in room 512 and the bathroom was right next door to us as we were at the end of the hall Our 2nd morning there I glimpsed a woman walking by my door from the bathroom and that was it 
The desk staff were all very friendly even sustaining a weekend long joke about my daughters blanket that they found after the luggage room had been emptied by guests The area was safe and central We had a wonderful time and will definitely stay there again

title: Unfortunately the negatives outweighed the positives
text:
Positives Great location and amazing views Very nice decor and furnishings Price was reasonable Helpful staff Clean rooms Taxis readily available outside 
Negatives No indoor or outdoor pool No DVD players for the TVs No microwave in the room Free wifi but the connection speed was slower than the 288K dialup modem I had in 1995 Some pipewater noise in the walls at night The fitness center is laughable The business center had 2 computers and no printer

title: Excellent accomodations  a great place to relax after a busy day touring the Windy City
text:
Being retired and living on a fixed income I looked to the internet to help find an affordable place to stay for a few days while I showed my 2 exchange student sons around Chicago After looking at the reviews of the Midway Carlton I booked online 
Was I ever glad The reviews were righton Easy parking nice rooms and breakfast pleasant staff that were willing to go out of their way to make your stay more enjoyable Conveniently located within a few blocks from the Orange Line train that will take you into the city and transfer to a bus 
Close to ethnic restaurants my Polish son had an enjoyable dinner that reminded him of home with both boys awed at the Hard Rock Cafe
Again if you are looking for a great place to stay while visiting Chitown dont hesitate to stay at the Midway Airport Carlton Inn

title: Great location  Better than expected
text: I thought this hotel was great It is located right near the trolley within a short walking distance to the Moscone Center and tons of shopping The hotel rooms were more modern than I had expected The room was clean and bathroom was updated The only downfall was the hair dryer in the room was broken and the lighting was not so great as some others suggested Overall I thought this was a great place to stay for business Would go back again

title: Trifecta of Location Price and Room Trumps Poor Service
text: We just returned from a weekend at the Raffaello Hotel in Chicago I booked through Hotwire over a month in advance and got a really good deal under 150night at the Raffaello After having read some of the reviews here though I was a bit nervous about staying at this hotel We arrived around 11 am figuring we could at least check our bags Check in is at 4 pm and we were initially told to return then  but the concierge told us we could come back at 2 and a room would probably be ready This was fine  we did some sightseeing and then returned The room was not yet ready however the bellman had already brought out our bags and so they had to be rechecked No problem so far We came back at 4 and check in itself went smoothly  however they had lost our bags After some frantic searching in different employees offices they were finally located Its this kind of disinterested service ethos that really brings the Raffaello down  its the level of service one would expect from a college town Days Inn The employees at the Raffaello are affable enough but they really dont want to concern themselves with any problems or questions guests may have  they seem to universally want guests to just go away and leave them alone Lousy service aside the room itself was as pictured  quite lovely actually Bed was great  tv was nice  all were up to snuff Location cant be beat for the price  right off Michigan Ave behind the Hancock building I would probably still stay here again  I just wouldnt check my bags with them If they find a way to work out the service kinks this could be quite a nice hotel FYI  they charge 40 bucks a day for valet parking  and all they do is drive your car to the deck across the street You can self park there for 23 for 24 hours

title: Great hotel service was excellent
text: I stayed at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown during a business trip It is a convention style hotel but very accommodating and even with many large groups the staff maintained excellent service We had no problems with housekeeping and everyone was extremely responsive to our requests

title: Killer location good value overall great
text:
Very small clean true boutique 34 rooms in midtown Location really cannot be better especially for the price Very friendly staff efficient service very clean room and overall good experience
Room has all standard amenities fullsize ironing board iron blow dryer safe wood hangers flatscreen tv closet with door CD alarm clock good bathroom amenities desk lamp etc and I had a large window which allowed for natural lighting
Old bones but I found that to add characteresp because paint tile carpet etc were all very clean and new feeling I would stay here again without a second thought
My wifi signal was strong and great which is KEY for me One negative was not enough electrical outlets in the room  had to rotate out my cell charger and laptopthey might think about adding a larger power strip or adding new outlets to rooms Most people need at least 23 for cell camera laptop etc
Plan ahead for food and drinks because there is no restaurant or room service but the location is so good there is much to choose from within walking distance Probably too small for a family or a group but for a single or couple leisure or business traveler I would certainly recommend Location location location

title: Location Great
text: this hotel is on the Mag mile and close to the redline L train that can get you all over the city the room was small but so was the price I paid to right on the Mag mile  the beds were comfy and room super clean close to Hancock tower great resturants and shopping I love staying at this hotel and stay there alot

title: Excellant value we loved the Chancellor
text: My family had never been to San Francisco before so we looked on Trip Advisor for help to choose our hotel the Chancellor received excellant reviews time and time again so we booked over the internet The hotel was perfect for us great service and location cable cars stop just outside food clean rooms although bathroom could not be much smaller Excellant shops and shopping arcades were closeby as were all forms of transport I will most certainly stay there again and on top of that it was excellant valve for money Thank you Trip Advisor

title: shhh its a secret
text:
I dont want to write too good a review because hey I dont want them to get over booked but in the land of karma you HAVE to share 
This was a gem of a find for us for several reasons 
1st  the people at Chelsea Pines  We were warmly greeted and our bags whisked away while Jay gave us the low down on the surrounding area He personalized our experience by asking what we wanted to do Troy made sure we had great recommendations for dinner
2nd  location  close to the PIER SOHO VILLAGE the HIGH LINE and Google NYC Headquarters MEAT DISTRICT shopping
3rd  the rooms  good size nice amenities  great decor
4th  the food  good breakfast and snacks
5th  cool cat

title: Great Location
text:
Good checkin excellent staffconierge Room above average size Bathroom adequate however shower curtain yeuch
Comfortable good tv good room service
Great location on Union sq

title: Great little hotel
text: The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly The rooms were clean The location was very close to union square and market street but at night I did not feel safe going out due to the abudance of homeless people not like the rest of san francisco Overall a very nice little hotel

title: Lives up to expectations
text: Stayed 4 nights in the Sofitel in May 04 Booked a suite got the best deal from their website Staff room and view were excellent I simply cant complain and would certainly choose the Sofitel again

title: Great place to lodge
text: The hotel staff from the valet bell boy front desk and concierge were fantastic They all really knew the gaslamp district and gave great tips The room was quite large and very comfortable It was extremely clean and very inviting We order breakfast from room service and found the prices very reasonable and the food was good We look forward to our next trip to San Diego and will make this Hilton our choice for lodging

title: Fantastic Property
text: The Casablanca Hotel is a truly remarkable hotel just steps from Times Square The room was nice  not huge but also certainly not as cramped as some places Ive stayed at while in New York The extra amenities free breakfast and afternoon wine  cheese add to the overall charm of the guest experience The hallways were a bit warm some days the elevator was a bit lurchy and the toilet in my room periodically ran all to be expected considering the age of the property Overall the room was immaculately clean and the provided extras were a nice touch The best feature of the Casablanca Hotel was the staff who I found to be extremely helpful efficient and professional  especially Vinnie Ill definitely return to this hotel and strongly recommend it to anyone with discriminating tastes and high standards

title: Great Deal on the South Side of Town
text:
I had been to this same hotel as a Wyndham about 15 years ago for a wedding Although it looked a bit dated with dark wood decor in the lobby the hotel was actually very nice Great spacious rooms and very warm and attentive service They do have a callahead shuttle for the airport and free parking
The only problem which I didnt really mind was the noise of the interstate highway that could be easily heard I found a rate of 60night on Priceline for a Friday and Saturday night stay

title: Standard Airport Hotel
text:
This is your standard airport hotel Given the large number of hotel rooms around LAX  make sure to use one of the bid sites as you will pay alot less this way than the quoted rates Checkin was quick and efficient Hotel is very busy with lots of people in the lobby and bar areas Room was clean and had standard Crowne Plaza fittings Was abit shabby in places
TV needed replacing as picture was awful Served its purpose for a one night stay
Parking 12 per night

title: Nice place near downtown
text: I booked this hotel as I was bicycling through LA and it was close to Dodger Stadium short 12 mile walk I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness the motel amenities and helpful staff I would definitely stay again if making my way through LA Great place to stay of youre visiting and attending Dodger games

title: Clean Comfortable and Convienient
text:
The Hyatt at South Street blvd is a a great quality airport hotel It is within 10 minutes of the airport in a quiet businesscommercial area 
Breakfasts are top quality and have Starbucks brew coffee 
The rooms are of a decent size for a airport hotel and the staff are friendy and conscientious 
I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel

title: Good Location But No Smiles
text:
This hotel wins on price and location You cant argue that it represents good value and the roomsbathrooms are more than adequate However it is greatly let down by the staff who treated us as if everything was too much trouble
We had booked 2 rooms for a family reunion each travelling from opposite ends of the world but in spite of booking some 4 months ago the hotel could not put us on the same floor Caution to others As we were travelling on flights from different parts of the world we arrived at significantly different times As I had made the booking the hotel would not allow our family to check in until I arrived in spite of them having a copy of the booking confirmation and the same surname They were also charged for leaving their bags in the hotel until we arrived
On one occasion our room hadnt been serviced OK we accept anyone can make a mistake so we went down and asked for some shampoo and coffee one complimentary coffee is given each day when this was finally brought to the room the person went off with the huff because we did not give a tip for something that should have been done anyway
Bell staff were also keen to push guests into unofficial overpriced taxis as opposed to the cheaper yellow cabs
Throughout our stay we never got a hullo or a good morning and we were given to feel that guests far from being paying customers were just a nuisance
We did however like having a coffee machine in our room and an ice machine in the corridor
From here we moved on to Holiday Inn By the Falls in Niagara in Canada where the difference in attitude of the helpful staff was like a breath of fresh air
Visitors tip and New York runs on the other sort of tip so this is the only one youll get for free If you stay here try the Morning Star Restaurant for breakfast turn right when you come out of the hotel cross the road and its on the corner its good value and the staff are all very helpful with suggestions and ideas on where to visit its a shame they did not work in the hotel
I would recommend this hotel on price and location if it was not for the staff

title: Outstanding attention to detail
text: Four nights at this Hotel was an eyeopener to how we would like to be treated at other facilities Every person at the front desk knew the places to visit eat and those not necessary to see The FREE breakfast was beyond abundantthe staff in the breakfast room was extremely attentive and friendly as were the persons at the front deskOur room 417 was clean  quiet The beds were comfortable although the pillows were not to our likingWe would highly recommend this hotelHF

title: A night at the RED ROOF
text: Stayed three times there last week because I was getting my house remodeled I was helped by Ivan Juarez all three times he provided a caring service and got me an excellent price  Recommend the red roof at remcon to everyone cinemark right next door and a quick access to I10

title: Terrible and Rude
text:
Do not stay here We booked online for 876 and then they called later to say we have the dates available but as its shopping week it will be 1600 We questioned why and the member of staff was very rude on the phone 
We told them to cancel everything and they processed the original transaction the next day Will be sorted but a massive inconvenience and we hadnt even got there yet

title: definitely not a 4 stars hotel
text:
In the morning upon arrival we were never offered to keep luggages I was obliged later on late pm to bring by hand my heavy luggages in the staircase and across the street to find a valet who took the elevator
In late afternoon hotel UNABLE to find our reservation refusing to see our confirmation number and mentioning the computer was down they knew I had pay in advance  
I was supposed to have a king bed We were given a Murphy bed we usually give to children
No glasses of wine were offered on arrival it was mentioned in the reservation
Location fantastic but service poor

title: Basic clean safe rooms in a great location at a value price
text:
The motel is currently under significant renovations about 34 of the rooms completre Guessing that the renos should be done by late November 2008 This motel is appropriate if all you want is a basic clean new room in a great location for a value price This is not the Four Seasons 
I found the staff at this family owned Motel to be very helpfull This area of Memphis has been cleaned up alot and I felt safe walking back from Beale St at 100 am 
The room I had was smaller then the average NA Motel room having only one King sized bed A little tight for a couple but definately doable
You can walk to all the sghts except Stax and Graceland free shuttle runs from Sun studies which is walking distance

title: Lovely hotel excellent service
text:
We recently returned from four days at the The Michelangelo and were very pleased with this charming Europeanflavor hotel its staff and the location We are very particular and experienced travelers who make every effort to select topclass hotels that not only offer quality accomodations but provide a unique experience  we were not disappointed with The Michelangelo
I contacted the hotel directly prior to our arrival explaining the circumstances of our trip and they were very kind and receptive to helping to make our stay a special experience  Louis and James are excellent representatives for this hotel 
When we arrived we were upgraded to a larger room and a thoughtful box of Godiva chocolates was left for us our first night The overall ambiance of the hotel was warm and inviting elegance and the service exceptional We were traveling with some friends who had lost their luggage and the staff at the hotel were very instrumental in helping them locate their bags  they even stayed on the phone for more than 45 minutes to get through for information on the lost luggage
We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New Yorkunless you are like one of the previous reviewers who prefers hotels with vending machines If so this is not the hotel for you Our congratulations and appreciation to The Michelangelo and its staff for the great job you are doingdefinitely a class act

title: Excellent value for money free parking great location
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a long Californian road trip Read reviews on here and decided to book great idea 
San Fran can be quite pricey on hotels and as we had a car with us we needed a cheapish hotel with free parking Most hotels charge 30 a night parking so to get it free was great value The hotel lobby is tiny just a desk and 1 man really Was a bit dubious at first and as we were told to park up top of hotel my first impressions were not great However who needs a huge hotel lobby with lots going on when you just want to explore San Fran
Our room was huge With a massive bed TV separate dining area and clean bathroom Much bigger than we expected a bit dated but very clean and tidy Views were good and never too noisy outside
Great location
Would definitely stay there again and would recommend
Not a 5 star hotel not luxury and no real amenities but if you want clean comfortable and afordable accommodation stay here

title: Great spot near Brooklyn Bridge
text:
Ive stayed here 4 times  each time I am glad I did There are many nice restaurants nearby as well as an open air market a block away Not too long a walk to subway Parking lot across street too Our room last time had a decent view as well Our friend booked a room here also  had a very nice stay The rooms are nice  we always sleep well Some typical banging of doors as guests checkout but Ive found this to be common most places sadly that people cant be aware theyre being rude 
I like staying here as it is a bit off the beaten path  quieter If I want noise  late night out its just a short taxi ride Tho my 2nd time here my taxi ended up going over the Brooklyn Bridge instead of turning onto Peck Slip lol With GPS its much easier to find now

title: Great Hotel
text: The hotel was in a great location just walking distance from the theatres The staff was friendly and there was free water champaigne coffee and hot chocolate The hotel was very clean with a modern decor feel to it This hotel can be for anyone

title: Pretty full of themselves
text:
This hotel definitely has an unwarranted superiority complex Stayed one night in a very blah room breakfast is Dennys quality Turns out they not only wouldnt honor Hampton Inns advertised holiday rates but their lowest rate was almost 50 morenight than the 5star Grand Hyatt Marina we spent the next two nights in on an Entertainment rate
Unless you have to stay in this neighborhood definitely look for something better

title: Expensive for mediocre service
text: My stay at On the Ave was not exactly thrilling It is an expensive hotel with not a single benefit No breakfasts lunch or dinners They have two restaurants attached to the hotel where the service was very bad at times I guess because its on Broadway and relatively close to Columbus Circle is the main reason for its hiked up prices The reason I chose to stay there was because I had to attend a conference at Columbia University at they are relatively close to it

title: Great stay
text:
I stayed nov 09 with my wife for a weekend The place was clean and modern food was good and location is great because of the local malls and highways and only 12 hour from downtown with traffic Ive always like hampton inn better because of their breakfast but this place comes in at a close 2nd for the category of hotel class that it is in 
My room was clean big comfy big flat screen free internet couch with prompt room service The whole place had a really decent welcome feelingvibe if you know what I mean 
BTW despite it being a cheaper hotel right next to expensive hotels the other guests were not obnoxious  noisy and etc which is what I always worry about The guests were all different family sizes races ages etc and all nice But we did notice the next morning a cars back window was busted out I have no idea if it was from theft or vandalism but Im guessing most likely someone must have left valuables in their car rather than random violence because the area does not seem like that

title: Good hotel Great Location
text:
Recently stayed in the hotel with my partner The location is great Near Dupont Circle and transportation Restaurant and bar very good to excellent Service in restaurant and bar was excellent The staff were just okay from checkin and checkout staff to the valet guys No one smiles here They dont seem to go up and beyond except in the restaurant and bar
The rooms were fine Nicely decorated The bathroom is a little claustophobic Toilet right next to shower and I mean right next to Very little dry off room Bed was comfortable and most importantly the room was CLEAN To all those who write about the noiseGIVE ME A BREAK Yes there is noise because you are in a city If you dont want noise stay somewhere in the boondocks The noise level was tolerable Sky Bar is a nice idea and a nice place to relax but it has no good views except some roof tops Overall nice experience Lets face itwhen youre in DC youre not staying in your room for large amounts of time

title: Nice hotel not so great location not too kid friendly
text:
Overall this is good hotel to stay for the price about 130night via htwre Staff are friendly and helpful Very convenient and affordable parking The complimentary breakfast is good but dishes are replenished very slowly Julito the server seems to have a perpetual frown as if he is worried we would eat up all of his breakfast 
The location is not great but as long as you use your car cabs or the hotel shuttle you should be OK Not advisable to walk in the vicinity of the hotel
The big disappointments are 1 the shuttle which is usually too full  book your spot early and b not having TV channels with kids programming 
Also make sure you get the room you booked We had booked a room for 2 adults and 2 kids but ended up in a room with just one king bed because they had no other rooms available This after they assured us that we would get a room with two double beds They remedied the situation the next day but it was an uncomfortable first night Leaves a bad taste Avoid their strollaway bedsthey kill your back

title: Expected less and got alot more
text: As a business road warrior living in NY area I used my points to spend a night and see a show during the July 4th week Ive stayed in NYC hotels before and I usually expect long lines small and worn rooms terrible food and lessthanaverage customer service This hotel is in the center of Times Square which is very very congested but I thought I would compromise so I could walk to my show without dealing with the hassle of taxis and subways Times Square was as I expected  it was gridlocked by people and cars lots and lots of tourists and difficult to get any dinner reservations or do any shopping without having to deal with long lines Stepping into the Renaissance was an oasis of cool calm quiet and great customer service With check in and security being on the ground floor and the hotel lobby requiring an elevator ride I felt quite safe It is a small boutique hotel smack in the middle of Times Square The lounge has 3 sides of floor to ceiling windows overlooking Times Square It is breathtaking and very exciting to feel you are in the middle of it all without having to suffer through the crowds Service at the loungerestaurant was great The lounge serves as the executive club in the morning for Elite members to get their free breakfast The bedroom I had overlooked the city and had a nicely designed tiled stepin shower Overall I had a very pleasant stay and would definitely return for future 12 night excursions into the city

title: Bel Air Hotel A little bit of paradise right in Los Angeles
text: My husband and I have made an annual event out of going to the Bel Air Hotel Yes its that good We had to go to the Los Angeles area for business quite a few times over the past several years and each time we stayed at the Bel Air The surroundings are lush and feel entirely removed from the hussle and traffic that Ive known to be LA While one of the Concierges and a front desk staff were a little snooty it was more than made up for by the wonderful bellman the delicous food the amazing pool the pool is a mustsee as well as our terrific massages Well let me qualify that by saying that the couple of massages we got were actually not that great but then we discovered Sascha and Eida and we were hooked Be sure to ask for them or you may be as disappointed as we were at first Prices range as do the rooms but theres something there for everyone Weve had a different room everytime and always were happy I wouldnt stay near the pool unless you have kids though Enjoy

title: Great Location
text: We stayed at Hilton Times Square in May 2011 We had arrived from Australia after a very long flight we arrived at the Hotel and loved the location in Times Square We wandered out to grab a bite to eat at one of our favorite Pizza Places Patzeria Pizza on 46th and gave our kids their first time in NYC a glympse of Times Square at night We returned to the Hilton it was like a haven we were exhausted and needed sleep The rooms are clean and not too cramped the beds were very comfortable and we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful if needed The next day we walked  walked along the Hudson right down to the Financial District where believe it or not we bumped into the singer Cee Lo Green kids thought that was cool We only stayed two nights as we were leaving from NYC on the Carnival Miracle for a Caribbean Cruise which we saw arriving along the Hudson that morning from our room at the Hilton All in all a very nice stay at Hilton Times Square

title: Perfect place to stay for a central location in Boston and value
text: We stayed for three nights over a weekend and will definitely stay again on our next visits Everyone was friendly courteous informed and helpful Loved our corner room on the fifth floor Roomy quiet and very comfortable A small suggestion would be to give a light cleaning to the chairs Not a big issue

title: Short stay
text: Loved the stay here The bed was wonderful wish I had one at home Front desk staff was courteous and professional Easy check in easy check out

title: Great staff could do without the velvet tiger decorations
text:
My wife daughter and I stayed here for three nights while we collegeshopped in DC The comments you see about friendly staff on TripAdvisor are true These folks go right up to the line of being obsequious without crossing over
Its a good hotel however all is not perfect First parking is outrageously expensive and then DC gets into the tax game for a total of about 50day Second the decor is late90sStarckbrown and the place is dimly lighted That combines to make the place seem a little dingy Plus furnishings are somewhat worn I especially dont care for the tigerpattern robes which might do better framed on the walls than on my back The plumbing is especially designinconvenient The shower volume cannot be varied though of course the temperature can And the sink faucet makes it impossible to splash water on your face without getting the entire countertop soaked
On the plus side is a location not to be beat competitive prices they matched the lowest price I could find elsewhere and two restaurants nearby to die for the Kabob House and a pizza place right at Dupont Circle on P Street whose name I forget
My family loved this place they arent frequent travelers And so thats the difference if you are a seasoned traveler youll see that the cosmetics dont make the grade But any traveler will appreciate the staff

title: Weve tried the rest and this is the best
text: Corny but accurate We visit SA frequently as we only live 80 miles north Weve stayed at many Riverwalk hotels and while theres some worthy competitors the Westin is our favorite The staff is well trained and friendly unlike a competitor one block east The spa while under promoted and hidden down a hallway was fantasticTwo thumbs way up to Dora for the wonderful massages The rooms are spacious well maintained and of course the heavenly bedding is wonderful The only negative is that both the pool area and health club are in need of a face lift if not a makeover The gym has far too much equipment jambed into a small room off the pool If you use the treadmills which we both do youll feel like a sardine with the stranger next to you being only inches away Im a retired pool builder so a little hypersensitive about pool areas but this is a residential size pool serving a large hotel so managing families with guests who like a quieter pool scene is difficult Perhaps management can come up with a creative solution because if you like to lay around the pool have a beer and read a magazine then youll find the half a dozen screaming kids the parents of which do nothing to control just a little irritating The pool area itself is overdue for a serious cleaning The concrete decking was filthy some sling chairs need replacement and there were only enough terry cloth covers for about 6 of the chaise lounge chairs The bartender and bar were nice but Westin needs to give this area some attention because while the hotel is 4 stars the pool area comes in around a 25 Unless you spend 100 percent of your stay around the pool you wont be disappointed at the Westin

title: Beautiful old hotel beautifully maintained
text:
Deserves four plus stars Public spaces are magnificent and location is great  a block from the Art Institute around the corner fromthe Symphony Center and theaters and literally on several L lines
Rooms can vary greatly in size We had a small king bedroom which was more than adequate but then were moved to a queen double with two  yes two bathrooms when we complained about the noise from the maids storage closet across the hall Both rooms were on the executive floor which meant access to the lounge a real benefit because it means not having to pay downtown Chicago prices for breakfast coffee or occasional snacks Lounge was very crowded in the weekend a drawback but stilltolerable Staff was exceptionally courteous and responsive We asked for and promptly got a change in rooms and when we had an allergic reaction to the feather pillow they were quickly replaced Housekeeping is first rate from the room maids to the staff who keep the heavily used executive lounge clean and fresh 
We usually stay on or near the Magnificant Mile but were put up at the Palmer House for a business meeting We had booked another hotel for the weekend but were so impressed with the Palmer House that we cancelled the other reservation and stayed the weekend The Palmer House is our new goto place in Chicago

title: Best location Good value
text: The reason I chose this hotel was for the DuPont Circle location The best hotel choice ever 2 minute walk to the Metro tons of restaurants bars coffee houses banks and a CVS store We were very happy with the hotel Very clean comfortable room We got the superior King room with the city view on the 8th floor What a view Best nights sleep ever Bed was great The staff was friendly True there are no bar or restaurant in the hotel but why eat or drink in your hotel when you have DuPont Circle a few steps away We brought our own drinks to the rooftop pool and enjoyed the view The breakfast each morning was a great way to start the day We have already recommended the hotel to our friends We will stay here again on our next visit

title: Noting was too much trouble
text:
Arrived at 1am after 3 plane connections with my friend who had had an accident and had difficulty walking more than a few steps We had lots of luggage as we had been travelling for a month
Helpful friendly staffwheelchair appeared
Room upgrade
Pot of tea and cookies appeared
Ambience was peaceful room gorgeous lobby flowers stunning
Concierge organised doctors appointment for my friend
Checkout was fast Doorman extremely helpful Faultless

title: Absolutely Wonderful
text: When looking for a hotel in Philly I reasearching using TripAdvisor and they did not steer me wrong Doubletree was an outsanding The staff was great they knew exactly how to explain where to go and the rooms were spotless The AC was cold the rooms were big the beds were very comfortable the bathrooms were clean and the location was perfect You are 1 block away from some outstanding bars and restaurants in the area The parking garage was connected and the blocks are shortnot like the long NYC blocks The hotel is about 5 miles from Citizens Bank Park and in the Arts district where it is clean and safe As an added bonus Doubletree is only 1 mile from two of the most famous Philly Cheesesteak places Pats and Genos Next time I go to Philly I am going to go right for the Doubletree Very impressive and very reasonably prices You will not go wrong staying here

title: A cool oasis in humid NY
text:
Booked on Priceline 225 per night After reading the reviews I was prepared to be disappointed but this place is an oasis I called ahead to confirm we had a non smoking room and they told me to ask for an upgrade when I checked in and they would do it if it was available
When I arrived they promptly upgraded me Yes the rooms are small but this is New York  anywhere central is going to be small The room was clean with good quality linens Our room was renovated and I think all rooms are now at the W Bathroom nice and clean and bright Room was light with 2 big windows and a view down Lexington Very handy for the subway Didnt order room service or dine there but reception and concierge very helpful and friendly this place is not at all pretentious Housekeeping were friendly and did a very thorough job
This is a great place to base yourself in Manhattan It was over 90 degrees in NY the weekend we stayed and returning to our quiet cool room at the W was perfect Well above our expectations for the price Definitely recommend it to others
The only thing Id add is that it is always worthwhile asking for a room on a high floor just because there is always so much going on at street level in NY

title: relaxation
text: The front desk staff is very wonderful and helpful they renovation on the hotel and i still enjoy and had a relaxing time LILY in the front desk gave a great room considering the renovation She is always smiling when i stay there

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed here on business and have nothing but great things to say Room service is great and operationally everyone is on their a game which is rare for such a huge hotel Will stay anytime I was in Dallas its a great great property

title: Loved this hotel
text: Location on the waterfront but away from main city However 10 mins walk and youre in downtown or Faneuil hall or 5 mins to south station t Rooms are big and beds really comfy I had a club room with access to club lounge which was excellent Concierge were great with restaurant recommendations and bookings

title: Amazing customer service crusty hotel
text: My husband and I stayed here for our 5th wedding anniversary We wanted something in the heart of the city and relatively inexpensive  asking a lot we know This hotel fit the bill and was overall average for the cost It fit in with its surroundings  gritty DuPont Circle The first room we checked into was stinky and had some mildew on the ceiling Customer service was fantastic  they upgraded our room and gave us two continental breakfast passes The second room was still a little damp smelling but DC had a lot of rain the past week  which might explain it Regardless we love the Kimpton hotels for their funky interior designs and fun amenities such as hosted wine hour cookies at night though we didnt see any the night we stayed and 10 in mini bar raiding for InTouch members their membership program Overall the hotel was a little crusty but in a fantastic location and with excellent service Im not sure I would stay here again but my brand loyalty is still strong

title: Great choice for New York City hotel
text: My husband and I spent 5 days at the Lucerne on a leisure trip We selected the hotel based on its location upper West side and Trip Advisor reviews The Lucerne is close to several museums we wanted to visit and to Lincoln Center and not too far from Broadway theaters Taxi fares were reasonable to all of these locations Other reviewers had reported accurately on their experience at The Lucerne The hotel itself is quiet very clean and with comfortable beds The staff was most helpful and pleasant I had to see a doctor on short notice and the hotel staff set up the appointment with their recommended doctor who took care of the problem The surrounding area has everything travelers would need  good restaurants a large drugstoreconvenience store across the street and many small shops selling coffee etc for breakfast or snacks

title: You get what you pay for
text: I will start out with the pros We arrived at the hotel at 200 pm And were given our room right away We got a newly renovated room and everything was very clean The elevators were pretty fast didnt have to wait a long time to get on them The staff at the concierge desk was very helpful in arranging a car to take us to the airport when we left Location is excellent 5 minute walk to time square good walking distance to central park top of the rock and etc Price was also a great deal Now for the CONS the room and bathroom were clean but there was a funky smell probably because theres no ventilation in the bathroom We tried calling the front desk several times but no one ever answered the phone We tried using the fast check out that appears on the telephone but it didnt work We checked out at noon and took our luggages to the luggage holding room and immediately the man asked for a tip I will most likely stay here again due to the great location and a good price

title: You get what you paid for
text: I have just spent 4 nights at the Days Inn Broadway I didnt get an upgraded room so the carpet was stained the room smelly etc But the bed sheets were clean and the room bigger than I expected Service is poor and staff fast and direct but this hotel is cheap with the subway at its feet and exactly what you get for the money you are willing to spend Would stay here again

title: Crummy location
text: Very nice hotel in a really crummy area Careful where you walk at night For a Ritz we were expecting that the hotel would be among nice shops restaurants etc Its near Boston Common and a few Dunkin Donuts and thats about it Save a few bucks and stay in a better area like Cambridge

title: Good for a Comfort Inn
text: We felt this hotel was above standard for the Comfort Inn brand The room was very comfortable spacious and well equipped We had a car and the location was perfect for starting most of our LA adventures The local area had many good restaurants and terrific fish taco stands Good location for catching buses across town as well

title: Pricey but Great Location
text:
This was a trendy hotel in the meatpacking district but is pretty pricey The rooms were minimalistically decorated but with a comfortable feel but be aware that there is a barpool on the top floor If you are trying to get a peaceful nights sleep on the weekends this is not where you want to stay as the place gets noisy with patrons going upstairs Good for hotel guests as they do not charge to go up
The reception and concierge staff was very helpful in directing us to different spots to visit throughout the day and even suggested their own favorites in the city whiich was a suprise and very welcomed There was surely no signs of snobbish behavior as Ive heard rumored from reading reviews of this place
Gansevoort is in a great location to travel and explore in the neighborhoods around it with a group of friends for a short visit No so much for a family environment but definitely a great spot for couples and singles

title: Terrible Experience  as if the whole staff was novices
text:
Stayed their for a training class for a few nights The experience was bad right off the bat when we pulled up at the hotel and the valet or doorman was no where to be found We waited a moment and then I went inside to find the doorman coming back from God knows where I asked him if he could grab a valet for my car and he said which car and I said the one thats sitting there There were no other cars other than mine No good evening or anything else from him he says its taken care of and doesnt hand me a ticket and gets in my car and drives off
The lobby is undergoing renovations which did nothing to improve my opinion of the place  so lesson here is  if you are undergoing renovations do whatever you can including good service to distract your guests from the fact that you are under renovations Failed We go to the front desk and I begin checking in the agent seems confused and I tell him that I did not get a valet ticket and that confuses him even more He asks me who took my car and my colleague jokes some guy wearing a hoodie did So the agent tells me AT RITZCARLTON mind you that when I need my car I can just describe it to the valet and we can figure it out from there I told him that would not work and he would need to figure it out now We get that sorted out and I ask the agent a question I cant remember what exactly and there are now several other people in our area and he calls me by my last name and then in the same phrase gives my room number STRIKE 2 The second rule of hotel security is you never give both of those out where someone can overhear it The first being you dont grant access to a room without verifying identity
The rest of the place looks good and the room is nice However for the remainder of my stay I never ONCE got a bottle of shampoo in my amenities I did get two body washes and the first housekeeper didnt replenish my bottles while the next one did My last day they decided I shouldnt get a Wall Street Journal either We also had to wait 30 minutes for our car to be delivered from valet the first night
Knowing this I was prepared for check out Now the hotel knew since our group had booked a majority of the rooms that we were all checking out en masse this day So I called ahead 30 minutes in advance to have my car pulled up and I told my colleague we would rush to get our luggage from Bell before anyone else had a chance I knew Ritz would somehow screw up our attempt to make it to the airport on time Well thats where they got us at the Bell Stand My luggage was available but they had brought my colleagues up to another floor and he had to wait 15 minutes for his luggage while I sat on Broad Street waiting in the car dialing furiously to get Ritz Customer Service  which the hotel understood as the Sales Department at that hotel who then fumbled to deliver me to the main Marriott switchboard in Maryland who then delivered me to someones voicemail Wow Either you dont have enough problems to be organized on that front or you just dont care
Ritz Carlton you have NOTHING on Four Seasons or Kimpton except for a regal name and an impressive looking logo well see how long that will hold you up you have lost my business indefinitely

title: A great place to stay right in heart of Fells Point The staff is fun effecient and welcoming
text:
This was our third stay during the Fells Point Fun Festival We cant imagine having the same experience for our girls weekend anywhere else 
One tip we learned is to self park your car Instead of paying 60 plus tip for the weekend we paid 23 On Sunday the streets are closed so you have to walk to your car anyway 
Check in was quick and service was awesome We were able to get the room we requested and had a refrigerator within minutes 
The entire staff was fun helpful and always met our requests

title: Over the top in convenience and comfort
text: Our Mary Kay group had a wonderful comfortable and convenient stay at your hotel We loved the complimentary shuttle service and breakfast buffet every day The staff was the best I have ever experienced in my 30 years of travelling with Mary Kay We will return again next year for sure

title: Exceedingly Average
text:
I stay at a lot of Courtyard Marriotts while on business I would never book one to stay at for a personal vacation and this one is definitely not one of the better locations
First the area is covered in strip malls I guess that could be OK if thats youre thing One side of the hotel does have a mountain view in the distance while the other side overlooks a Hooters My room was very clean and otherwise comfortable
Breakfast is not included at this location as it is with other Courtyard Marriotts That could be an issue with the business that negotiated my rate The breakfast is good not great And the hotel does not offer room service 
The elevators are very loud My room was about 3 rooms away from the elevators and I could hear them all night The most annoying thing was waking up early the day I was leaving to go to the airport and no hot water 
Given some of the unique locations to stay in Denver this is not high on my list If youre a business traveler with no choice then you could do worse the free internet does work

title: Top shelf business travel hotel
text: Great location to the Energy belt west of Houston Super clean hotel good food in the resturant and the happy hour that seems to extend beyond the normal 2 hours is great The bartender does a great job and really hustles Very clean and well equipped work facility as well

title: my very last stay at the 60 Thompson
text: I am currently staying at the 60 Thompson I was mucky enough to stay in this hotel when it was very new the staff still committed and enthusiastic These days are gone the staff looks utterly demotivated does barely notice you I was not given a hello when I arrived at reception for check in I had to say hello The person had me wait for 8 minutes to come back and say that I had to be downgraded as my room was taken by a guest that had extended his stay No apologies no effort whatsoever This hotel still benefits from a undeserved glow of trendiness and quality I strongly recommend not to go this hotel any longer

title: Charming and great location
text: Just a few steps away from Central Park and 5th Avenue The Surrey brings alive culture and sophistication with their classic modern European style The staff was so welcoming and gave friendly personal service The breakfast in the hotels restaurant was fabulous We travel a lot in many states and countries we Highly recommend the Th Surrey and consider it our home hotel when we visit NYC

title: Close enough to everything far enough to breath
text: Booked the night before on a whim for a layover on my honeymoon It is under a mile from the start of the walk of fame My wife and I were sketical thay we could find a Hollywood hotel for 107 a night but were pleasantly surprised Easy to grt to from the HollywoodVine metro nice pool clean room great food at the 101 diner downstairs

title: Avoid this hotel
text:
The official pictures obviously look more nice than as it is
I got a very dark hotel room to the backside of the hotelpretty dark
In addition the noise level in the night from the backyard was really annoying
In addition to that there are union protesters running in circles in front of the hotels
almost each day for hours Google for Boycott Hotel Frank in order to get more background
They even protested on the weekend between 7 and 8am
In addition my office chair was broken and has not been replaced
There are better options around Union Square

title: New hotel but not maintained well
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights due to its proximity to Canal St but I wouldnt stay here the next time I visit New York simply it is located in not nice neighborhood Also the hotel alone looks new but not well maintained though 
The staff was friendly at least they tried but you can still sense the forcefulness of the staff trying to be friendly Its better but you need to hire more staff thats friendly in their core character But anyways the room is typical Sheraton but I was surprised with the lack of sports equipment when I used the gym 
Again I will choose another starwood hotels the next time I visit New York

title: Terrific service
text: My husband and I stayed with our two kids ages 6 and 8 at this Wyndham in May 2011 and were impressed by the staffs effort to make us comfortable and happy There is free wifi for all guests which is a lovely perk to staying here in addition we wanted to save money by eating cereal with the kids in the mornings and the staff quickly borrowed bowls and spoons for us from the restaurant downstairs and stored our milk in the employee fridge each night and delivered it to us each morning The staff is great

title: Outstandingly helpful staff
text: Stayed here for one night whilst en route to Fort Worth Hotel currently being renovated which will no doubt mean a great improvement as the generously sized rooms are slightly dated decorwise though the bed was supercomfortable Location is convenient to the US35 but far enough away not to be noisy All the staff we encountered were superhelpful and friendly to us a nice change in a chain hotel  thank you Bar meal and breakfast food were very good dining room is cold and souless but presumably will be improved after the refit A brief but very enjoyable stay

title: Outstanding Guest Services
text:
Not only is Dury Inn beautiful and perfectly located but the guest services are the quality of a 5 star hotel After checking out June 2012 and returning home I discovered I had left my wallet in the room I was catching a flight the next day but Martha in the guest services found a courier that would deliver my precious id and credit cards the same day 
Her follow up call confirming the shipment eased and otherwise stressed out day Thank you Martha

title: False information on website and customer service
text:
We had two problems 1 major and 1 minor
Minor problem
I called the hotel the day before to find out how I could get a shuttle in the airport They said they had a courtesy phone in the airport But I couldnt find their phone The info desk told me they had discontinued their phone because they did not pay I had to call them myself I was on roaming It was pretty expensive for me as they had to contact the driver to find out when he could come while I was on hold
Major problem
We did not have a car with us It said on the website that they had a restaurant Thats the deciding factor on whether we would pick this hotel as there is no restaurant within walking distance We found out the restaurant was closed on arrival The staff told us they could shuttle us to Olive Garden We first waited 15 mins for the shuttle When we arrived we found the resturant was full and the waiting time was an hour But the shuttle was gone and we could not go anywhere else When we finally finished dinner I tried to call them for a pickup I was put on hold for at least 15 mins while they were looking for the driver I was on roaming and it was very expensive So I hanged up I asked another hotel guest in the restaurant to call this time he got connected and told us we had to wait 15 min The driver ended up coming in about 20 mins We spent the whole night waiting and trying to get a shuttle I will never stay in this hotel again

title: Perfect Location
text: The location of this hotel could not be any more ideal It is directly across from Central Parkso perfect for grabbing a coffee  taking a nice stroll We got into town early  we were able to get into our room at 100 two hours before official check in Highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a more relaxed NYC experience The only drawback to our stay here was the 11 apple juice I had ordered in for my daughter Other than that great place  great location

title: Superb locationquaint rooms with a great view
text:
Our goal was to experience New York as a New Yorker and not a tourist The location of CI was fantasticlocated in a residential neighborhood one half block away from Central Park We arrived on the Memorial Day holidayNew Yorkers were everywhere sunning themselves jogging eating lunch and drinking beer down at the Pier on the Hudson Take a right out of the hotel and walk straight down towards the Hudson River Outdoor tables beer and good food available 
Yes the shower water ran hot and cold more of a problem in the winter months and the toilet seat was loose But the windows on the 14th floor opened and we had a birds eye view of people lounging in their roof top patios We had very warm weather during our stay but the air conditioner worked the WIFI was included and we were able to grab a coffee and bagel before we headed out for the day There was a manager lady whom we did not get her name but she was always friendly and would acknowledge us leaving and entering the hotel
I did check for bed bugsfound not a one not to say that there arent any in this hotel but they were not in our room on the 14th flr New York City has experienced a surge in bed bugs and they are found in even 5 star hotels And yes the elevator is slowthere is only one so be prepared to walk the stairs if you are in a hurry or wait patiently for its arrival
Overall I am grateful for having read the reviews regarding the size of the room and the slow elevator Knowing these things helped to prepare our frame of mind
I would definitely recommend if you are not in need of a luxurious hotel experience and just need a clean quiet and comfy place to sleep and shower Another plus is that the bed was very comfy and linens were soft and clean

title: Great location Bad AC
text: Spent several nights at the River Hotel on both business and a fun weekend trip with my wife We have always loved the hotels restaurant Bella Bacinos so we tried the hotel The room was not as small as I thought it would be from other reviews The motif of the room is contemporary with pocket doors for the bathroom tile bath and a very usable and updated work desk The AC was negligible Ironically the hall was AC all the way If you need an iron and board just ask because there was none in the room Service was good But the optimum reason to choose the River is the location We have traveled to Chicago on at least 20 occasions Have stayed at numerous hotels but Wacker Street is the central location to Michigan Ave shopping and the great little restaurants in the Loop You would probably want to taxiit to Rush and Division but it is walkable on a great day They will park for 45 per But there is a tiny little lot that is public parking next to the hotel for 28 OUr car was safe and I could grab things from the trunk at my leisure I liked it better than valet All in all I received a great value on the at 119 when compared to other area hotels like 71 and Swissotel I would recommend the River hotel and will always recommend the deep dish pizza and portabello appetizer at Bellas Just make sure you check the AC first

title: Acme Hotel
text: Excellent Hotel It is an Old Chicago Hotel that has be updated completely  was the old comfort inn Good WIFI Room size for a standard king is 200 sq feet Small compared to newer hotels You can get larger rooms paid 1167 per night for the room Booked directly with the hotel They have a good app for smart phone Located on Ohio st 2 blocks from Mi AVe Great location rooms quiet Interior rooms have windows but no view Just a hotel core overlooking other buildings  Old Tokyo Hotel  Will stay again If yoyu want larger room book suite They are 2 rooms together with a wall removed double the space and 2 TVs

title: We liked it and well be back
text:
We stayed at the Hampton Inn for a night The hotel has a nice hall with comfortable sofa and armchairs Staff was friendly and helpful The checkin was 23 minutes
We asked for a quiet clean room and high floor The front desk stuff gave us a room on the fourth floor We got a room according to our request The room was clean and everything worked well It was not refrigerator in the 2 double beds room The 2 double beds were comfortable We were sleeping well
We enjoyed the free hot buffet breakfast which was typically an egg dish yogurts instant oatmeal fresh fruits muffins and bagels Only a waffle maker did not work properly The outside swimming pool was open from 800 am but it was too small to swim there Here were a lot of leaves there Nobody did clean the pool from them
The hotel has free parking with a lot of parking lots there 
Overall is a nice place to stay for the price location and friendliness
We will definitely return the next time were in town

title: Great hotelgreat service
text: Although my stay at the Hilton Houston North Hotel was brief the staff was welcoming and professional the roon was very comfortable and the lobby was a great setting for several business meetings I had scheduled I look forward to staying there again soon

title: Location Location Location
text: My husband  I spent two days at this Holiday Inn before our Panama Canal Cruise The hotel is right on the Boardwalk directly across the street from the Cruise Terminal so all you have to do is walk across the street with luggage in hand to the terminal The USS Midway Aircraft carrier Museum is half a block to your left from the hotel  the Hop On  Hop Off Tour Bus is less distance than that from the hotel Anthonys Seafood Restaurant is also across the street to your right slightly The Hotel itself is clean excellent servicecomfortable beds and the rooms are good size If  when we go back to San Diego we will definitely stay there again

title: Decent rooms but extortionate parking charges and slow service
text: We stayed here for three nights in June 2011 On arrival we were shocked by the price the hotel was charging for parking 36 per night although we found parking garages a few blocks away which charge 10 per night or 15 per night at weekends Our room was good and was functional although it was lacking tea coffee making facilities The bathroom was a triumph of style over function with the raised sink being inconvenient and the sliding door not giving much privacy We tried to get a drink in the poolside bar but we had to wait so long for service that we gave up We also had to wait an age in the downstairs bar and to check out I am not convinced there were enough staff on duty for a hotel of its size The rooms and facilities are generally good but the services and extra charges are not

title: Great Hotel at a reasonable price
text: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for our nieces wedding the weekend of July 20th It was very clean and since we had an interior room very quiet The front staffSue and Tony were so helpful getting us cabs and suggesting restaurants to eat at that were within our budget My husband and I were so happy that the next time we visit San Fran we plan on staying here again Close to Fishermans Wharf Russian Hill Union Street with its eclectic shops this hotel even offers FREE covered parking for its guests and visitors Did I mention that this hotel is a winner and the rooms were HUGE Also provided lots of freebies in the form of maps guides etc

title: great location
text: Wow we had a great time there It was only an overnight romantic stay without the kids but we did as much as possible in that night There was alot to do right near the hotel with a dock and plenty of scenery Ample choices of restaurants and pubs alike The staff was very knowledgeable about the local fare as well The hotel was very nice and peaceful with all the amenities that you would need If you needed something else just ask any of the staff they were very professional and friendly

title: Great locationbut looooud
text: If youre looking to be in the middle of all the Memphis action this is the hotel for you From shopping to restaurants to the night life on Beale you cant get any better Having said this if you value staying in a room that provides an expected amount of quietness then you DO NOT want to be in a room that faces 3rd Ave There is a park across the street where local blues bands set up and play loudly until 1100pm or later  well after midnight on the weekends After my first night in a room facing 3rd I asked to be moved to a room that does not suffer from this and was much happier The customer service in this hotel is average to aboveaverage The rooms bedding and bathroom the same

title: Would Not Let My Enemy Stay There
text:
We had a major event at this hotel costing thousands of dollars and were treated like DIRT It was the worst experience ever and the management staff was TERRIBLE  NO CUSTOMER 
SERV ICE AT ALL AT ALL The way they treated us other people as we were so passionately called was nothing less than unacceptable I was very disappointed

title: Great Hotel
text: On arrival Hotel was easily found and in a nice location We had reserved a king room two months in advance but on arrival they stated that we had been upgraded to a suite which we found out only has a queen size bed We stated that we wanted a king room and did not want the suite We were told there was not a king available which we did not like to hear that after a two month notice One of the night managers heard our discussion and that we were not satisfied with the upgrade and amazingly he managed to find us a king room We were completely satisfied and thanked him and he took us to our room I had heard all of the small room stories in New York and did not know what to expect since this was my first visit The room was extremely nice and a very nice size so the photos on line were accurate We had one of the lights above the bed that was out and no wash cloths but other than that I would relate our stay excellent The room had been updated and was clean the sink in the bathroom was a little small but it was updated and clean Our bed was very comfortable which was nice after a long day We never had a problem getting an elevator and we were on the 10th floor The elevators are small but were quick getting to our floor This is a nice Hotel that when we return to New York we would like to stay at again especially with the location and easy access to the subway It is nice that they are offering the buy two nights and get the third free which is a nice savings Dont pass this one up

title: Seattle Sheraton
text: We stayed here last weekend and everything was so clean My daughters refused t believe it was the same hotel we stayed years before but it is It has undergone a huge renovation everything was great s nicely close to everything will stay there again

title: New Chic  Modern Hotel
text: I was very pleased with our stay this weekend at the 48 Lex Hyatt Location was great Our room had a terrace which over looked Lexington Street The hotel is about a year old and is tastefully decorated  stylish Customer service was excellent Hyatt offers free Wi fi for anyone who is hyatt passport memeber  I believe its free to join Our room had a king size bed and was very comfortable We were on the 4th floor and street noise was not a problem The hotel offers complimentary tea coffee water  wine on the 2nd floor and pastry in the morning I would definately return

title: Great Staff location and Facilities
text: If you can get a good rate at this hotel do not hesitate to bookGreat Service and location

title: Great staff and hotel
text: We have stayed at the Sutton Place for several years and think of it as our home away from home when visiting our son in Chicago The staff is the most welcoming group of people We feel like royalty each and every time we stay there It is in a wonderful location with shopping nearby and lots of places to eat right there The beach on Lake Michigan is easily within walking distance The rooms are wonderful with great views But for us the people are the best asset of the Sutton Place Hotel in Chicago

title: standard Hyatt hotel in a good location
text: This Hyatt is very large and I agree with the other reviews about it serving mostly as a convention hotel There were at least three meetings ongoing during my stay They charge a fortune for everything eg  food internet even in the lobby or meeting room areas parking room rate The service is fine and the rooms are fine but nothing extraordinary In fact the rooms are not at all sound proof you can hear conversations easily from the hallway or the in the rooms next door and street noise but I was lucky to have courteous neighbors The location is greatwalking distance to restaurants museums shopping Millenium Park bus lines and more Overall I might stay here again but I might look for other hotels that are less expensive in the area in the future

title: classy
text:
Just recommended by a friend we decided to go for it and venture into the unknown world of an unsearchable hotelwhat a pleasant surprise
First the room at the junior suite was tuck away in a sort of corner in the room nice and dark for sleeping in with he bathroom located next to it for conveniencewith a little balcony tat although face the street was amazingly quiet
The best were the bedswow  it was better than ANY other high priced hotel I have stayed and I have traveled all over the world
Clean and cozy room service was quick and the food was still warm when delivered 
The appointments in the room were much more than the price demanded and we loved the quality and abundance of towels
Staff was helpful and courteous
Our stay was so pleasant that we came back a week later and got a suite looking over the marina again wow  everything was detailed and the two balconies provided much room outside to bbq and the like
The kitchen however was a little lacking in some cooking essentials and more were requested and delivered one thing  although the grounds are meticulous maintained the paint below the kitchen counterbar was thin and peeling off from the wall an unnatural sight on this sea of detailed attention
We are returning to say the least
Jorge  Llama Mercade Twain Harte  Ca

title: Comfortable in a great location
text:
Things we liked The location was excellent near UCLA in a safe environment The valet guys pointed out a free parking space that enabled us to avoid one night of valet fees  now that is great service Quiet and comfortable room The decor is interesting and stylish We were able to sleep two adults and two children ages 8 and 5 without a problem When we asked for extra towels they were delivered within a few minutes
A quibble The toilets flush loudly and I could hear flushing from other rooms Very minor issue but thought I should mention it
We did not take advantage of the wine hour the restaurant or the pool  maybe next time Wed definitely stay here again if the price was right

title: A true find
text: Great hotel people wonderful  Rooms great  an oasis in a big city Felt like I was at the beach

title: There was poop on the bathroom walls
text: Not only were the tiles falling from the ceiling the exhaust fan in the bathroom was hanging out and there was poop on the bathroom walls My family came for a visit and refused to stay there after they entered the room and now they cant get a refund from Priceline or the hotel DO NOT STAY HERE even if you just plan to spend a little time in the room

title: Loved the staff and excellent service
text:
I love the hotel The General Manager was extremely nice so were all the hotel staff members I had complementery breakfasts every morning priority club and complementery fruit baskets every week for staying there The gym is pretty good however the equipment tended to break down though the management would fix it quickly The location isnt the best but the Orpheum theatre is close by so people walk around all the time The hotel is also really close to the BART Civic Center station which is very convenient for anyone who would like to travel via BART
I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting SF

title: Hilton Chicago
text:
The Hilton Chicago Hotel located on South Michigan Hotel is a lovely old historical hotel graced by former US Presidents and Queen Elizabeth The entrance lobby from South Michigan Avenue is ornate in neoclassical style I had a room on the 20th floor executive floor and it was clean comfortable and with all the facilities of a deluxe hotel At the time of my stay the executive lounge on the 24th floor was closed for renovation 
The hotel is a short 10 minute walk to the Harrison Red Line station and just opposite Grant Park I would certainly recommend the Chicago Hilton to any visitor to Chicago

title: Great room pool area value and location
text: This hotel was a great value There was a promotion that included the breakfast buffet so to get the room breakfast and free parking at a location near the RiverWalk we were quite pleased The decor in the lobby has a contemporary look with lots of televisions and a couple of computers We loved the pool areait had lots of chairs and loungers along with a nice waterfall and a big pergola with even more chairs It was really a nice setup Lots of pool towels were available in the pool area The room was also very nice and clean The cookies are really yummy too

title: Wonderful place to stay very convenient
text:
