When we checked in the staff was very willing to give us directions to all the attractions we planned to visit They gave us information regarding public transportation and tips on restaurants and must dos The room was very large and even though we were next to the interstate suprisingly quiet Covered parking was an extra plus Breakfast was hot and plentiful 
Every staff member we encountered seemed truly tuned into meeting every need We will stay here next time we go to San Antonio

title: I had a wonderful experience with 100 of my friends in Feb 2001
text: I stayed at the Hyatt with The Metropolitan Detorit Chorale from Michigan  Feb 2002 andt sang at Carnagie Hall Everything was great I am returning May 2003 to sing at Carnagie again and am looking forward to my stay at the Grand Hyatt

title: A great exchange in New York  would definitely request again
text: A very convenient location for Times Square and all Midtown destinations and less than one block away from the subway We had a one bedroom suite which was just right for our family of four The walls however seemed quite thin or we just happened to have very loud neighbours as we could clearly hear what was being said next door on a couple of occasions Yes there was a 25 a day hospitality charge however there was free Internet coffee tea and popcorn was replenished daily and if you were around free hot drinks and cookies in the members lounge in the afternoon Before arriving we received at least four invitations to the RCI presentation which we duly ignored On site we received one written invitation and one call about this We declined and were left to enjoy the rest of our stay

title: taking advantage of fire evacuees
text:
My wife and I were evacuated from the San Diego wild fires in October When we checked out of the hotel we found a charge for local calls 1 was for 20 for 30 minutes while calling my insurance company to get help for fire damage and lodging expenses The other calls were for less than 30 seconds and were to reassure friends and family we were safe The phone charges were 2 and 3 for each 30 second call
I contacted the manager but he never bothered to call back to explain why they took advantage of fire victims

title: Very Nice
text:
This is the 2nd time we have stayed here The hotel is in a safe area not too far from downtown memphis Check in was a breeze and the front desk employee was polite and checked us in right away The room was clean We enjoy staying at Hampton Inns because for the most part the rooms are spacious beds are comfortable and they offer free breakfast 
No issues to report about this particular hotel Very nice

title: Great location and value near Penn Station and Empire State
text:
My daughter  I spent one night at this hotel in October chosen for the location very near to Penn Station and transportation as well as it being part of the Hilton family It was a bit hidden as we approached and the next day was obviously garbage day so the first impression wasnt great and our cab driver almost missed it but we were welcomed warmly even at a late hour We were thoroughly surprised that our room had a view of the Empire State Building very impressive lit up at night 
I was thoroughly surprised and pleased with the quality quantity and variety of complimentary full American breakfast options and the helpfulness and friendliness of the serving staff We checked our luggage in order to enjoy a day of shopping and it was retrieved quickly and easily when we wanted it For location and value Id highly recommend this hotel and would stay again

title: What a treasure Will definitely stay here again
text:
This hotel is a real gem The location on the river is great and sitting outside in the morning or afternoon on the river bank is wonderfully relaxing 
The rooms are clean organized well and attractive Nice large bathroom comfortable bed The staff is very friendly and efficient I read another comment about slow elevators and was really surprised We were there on a busy weekend and the elevators were quite prompt We also stayed on the 6th floor The only negative about the elevators is that the voice announcing floors etc is a bit annoying You do have to pay for internet and my question not just for this hotel is why do the higher priced hotels charge for Internet access and the cheaper ones provide it free
Restaurant and bar is good We had drinks and appetizers in the bar and breakfast in the dining room and were pleased with both 
The hotel is wonderfully situated with comfortable quiet rooms Couldnt ask for more

title: Amazing staff  Awesome service
text: Truly enjoyed this business trip thanks to the friendly and professional staff I did feel like they were my own throughout my stay Alex thanks a lot for the seem less checkin and help

title: Do Not Stay Here  Carpet and Ceiling Stains
text:
Staying here is a bad idea I stayed here for business and wish I hadnt The first room I checked into had horrible carpet stains everywhere Lo and behold when I looked up there was a huge stain on the ceiling I was the top floor 
I asked for another room This one was no better More carpet stains and dresser was so chipped I could barely see the fake wood The third room had no ceiling stain some carpet not as severe and I was too tired to try another room 
THIS HOTEL BEAT ME DOWN

title: A great spot
text: nice cosy rooms wonderful atmosphere good food I highly recommend this place

title: The only thing that saves this property is Alizee Restaurant
text: I stayed at this property as part of a New Years Eve package that included a 5course dinner at Alizee and 5900 for a king size suite The dinner and service at Alizee was impeccable as was the case when we dined there for Thanskgiving However the Doubletree checkin service left much to be desired The gentleman who checked us in was unimpressive and we simply felt unwelcomed The room was acceptable but we were disappoined that the king size suite did not contain a refrigerator as is custom in all of the Hilton King suites Ive stayed On New Years Day we awoke to barely have hot water to shower and used it as an opportunity to share a shower I reviewed my bill to find I was charged 2499 for valet service that was included as a part of the package This was removed from my bill again by a staff member who again was unfriendly and seemed bothered by my request to have the charge removed As a Hilton Honors Status Member not a property I would ever recommend

title: Nice hotel with exceptional service  location
text:
Staying here on business and am impressed by the exceedingly cordial staff The room itself is nice but not exceptional I am actually a bit overwhelmed by what I refer to as the Alice in Wonderland decor  gold and purple walls green and purple carpet green doors highbacked abstractly shaped chairs etc It is a bit like something out of Wonderland although one of my colleagues swears it reminds him of South BeachThe bathroom is nonexceptional  combination showertub nice long counter and typical lousy hairdryer I SO wish hotels would give consideration to their female clientele There are no refrigerators in the rooms but when I requested one it was promptly brought up for me The king size bed is comfortable and includes a multitude of pillows of varying firmness and fill My HVAC unit is on the noisy side with no option for continuous fan but this is also not uncommon in older roomsThe breakfast buffet is typically overpriced 12 for fruit cereal pastry etc however the fresh berries are a nice touch blueberries strawberries blackberries  all available Again the service was very attentive Lastly on week nights there is Crabby Happy Hour that consists of homemade crab dip and free beerwine The crab dip was great I think that the chefs was good but DJ  did a better job by adding mustard for a kick and made for a super appetizer 
Considering the location on the innerharbor excellent service and more than adequate room I would gladly stay here again

title: Loved the tub but there are some quirks
text: We were intrigued by the Japanese Hydrotherapy Suites so we opted to spend a bit more to try it out Since the tubs when fully filled weigh a lot we expected to be on the ground floor and we were The tub was FANTASTIC as was the rain showerhead BUT the one downside was that the tub is basically right next to the bed No biggie just be prepared We thought it would be in the separate bathroom area but it wasnt Also for some reason the bathroom wall shower  toilet didnt reach completely to the ceiling Thus every sound made in the bathroom could be heard in the room Its not a big deal for couples I guess but if youre bunking with a friend or family member just be aware of that Otherwise the hotel was nice and clean service was fine although after the first night the cleaning staff took the hotelprovided robes and didnt replace them and didnt refill the inroom coffee supplies The continental breakfast at the adjoining restaurant was initially a bonus for us but it left much to be desired It consisted of singleserve cereals toastenglishmuffinbagels which you toasted yourself at the end of the buffet often resulting in a long wait oatmeal hardboiled eggs a couple of fruit choices Yoplait yogurt juice and coffee After day one we opted for the Starbucks across the street OH one other quick note  the hotel does have highspeed internet but only if you have a wireless card We thought they might have ethernet cables but there was no option for that so we had to upload our vacation photos on dialup Needless to say we decided to wait until we got home and just bought an extra media card for our camera instead

title: Honesty goes a long way
text: We just returned from a 3 day stay and this is the first time I have written a review Hotel is in a great location right in the middle of Times Square but once you are inside it is peaceful and tranquil unlike other TS hotels ive stayed at The rooms were clean and although there is traffic noise it did not keep my family up Here is the best part of my review I had left 2 very expensive designer handbags at the hotel We called the next day after realizing it and spoke with Alex in security THEY HAD THEM The staff were amazing during our trip to NY but nothing is better for someone to know when booking a hotel that the staff not only can tell you the best way downtown but are honest

title: Great place to stay
text: I would stay here again The oldest continuosly running hotel in the nation This historic hotel is still beautiful and very well taken care of The staff is very friendly and helpfulWe stayed for a week and loved the location It is in the midst of the Freedom Trail and a short walk away from Quincy Market historic landmarks the North end Cheers and more We walked everywhere

title: Like an Old Lady that needs Facelift
text:
I booked this hotel through hotwire where it was rated as 4 star If this hotel is a 4 star then the Ritz Carlton is a 7 star The star rating has become the most misused guide to a hotel but in my book a 4 star hotel has ammeneties IN the hotel Not a bolt on restaurant and bar as this does 
But I digress Check in was busy and one poor lady was handling eveything a common theme in other revies so check in was slow Several people came in after me and eventually the second reception desk was opened Now the lady was very polite and checked myslef and my colleague into 1608 and 1708 Bearing in mind the 2 rooms were booked via Hotwire alarm bells went ringing in my head that the XX08 rooms are reserved for those patrons booking a discounted room type My fears were confirmed when right when the lift door opened across a very narrow corrdor was 1608 
On opening the poorly fitting door I entered a small room that could be described as European  at least based on its size Same could be said for the bathroom Both have nice furnishings but this room would be unsuitable for 2 people The metal framed window let in quite a bit of noise as did the door to the corridor  between the 2 it was a noisy room  light sleepers look elsewhere
Bathroom ameneties were quality and of a wide selection Plenty of hot water and the bed was comfortable with fine sheets There was a fake 8 plant jammed between the TV and the work desk  covered in dust  really come on 4 Star
The restaurant is not part of the hotel but can be accessed through the hotel On the way you pass a beautifully appointed bar that is closed What an opportunity missed
Like my tite says  older property with some nice window dressing but definitely not 4 star Needs a refirb from the ground up and then it might be

title: Sisters in the City
text: This was a great hotel for the price we paid The location is really close to the theatres of Times Square and the lobby and staff are very friendly and accomodating The room was pretty large for New York standards and average in quality

title: The Horror
text:
I got a room for 189 and after spending a night in this dump I suggest you keep your money and find a nice park bench instead This hotel might have been nice 50 years ago when they last likely renovated it They are understaffed I had to wait in line for over 45 minutes to check in The room while decent sized had dirty carpet and walls not painted in several years the furniture was old cheap banged up and I had a table in the room that shook every time I typed on my laptop it was so flimsy the room smelled of stale smoke and the bathroom had cracked tiles bad plumbing and a toilet that was bolted to the floor crooked so that you couldnt sit on it squarely
It boots a free breakfast HA You go to the 12th floor to a former room that has a few tables set up where you can pour yourself a glass of bad OJ a tray with few rolls on it and a TV in the corner with a few seats around A bad joke doesnt even begin to describe it 
Stay away from this place if you have any standards at all

title: The staff was so polite
text: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights so my son could have medical tests at John Hopkins It was cheap and convenient to the downtown After my sons test he vomited all over the floor in the lobby and one of the staff members rushed right over to help He was so sweet and cleaned it right up They were so helpful and we were able to rest quietly It wasnt the most modern in the rooms but the fridge was a great plus I would definately recommend this hotel

title: Lots of fungreat location
text: We were able to get a great price using the priceline site and thoroughly enjoyed a couple very busy days in Chicago We joined the Chicago Architectural Foundation since we wanted to go on several walking tours as well as the river cruise The tours are free to members and the river cruise discounted All were very informative and enjoyable We walked 29000 steps the first day and needless to say needed to tone it down the second day The Planetarium and Art Institute were fabulous  Looking forward to getting back soon

title: Great Hotel in an amazing place
text:
We recently stayed at The Casablanca Hotel and from the moment we were welcomed into the hotel we knew our holiday had begun 
Great setting great hotel great staff great experience 
Thankyou very much

title: Cool hotel but why doublecharge for Internet
text: This is a great hotel with comfortable rooms lively bar and excellent restaurant But I was charged twice for inroom Internet access because I used both my laptop and my iPad its bad enough being charged at all for a service they provide for free in the lobby but to be doublecharged puts the W in IFI  charge

title: Found my new business hotel in NYC
text:
After a few not so great experiences at the hotel I normally stay at while in NYC I took advantage of Jetsetters sale to obtain a room at the Surrey for an unbeatable rate to see if I should make the Surrey my new business hotel The first thing that raised my eyebrows about the Surrey was that it doesnt have the same buzz as some of the other hotels in its category such as the Park Plaza St Regis or Athenee However as I came to find the Surrey was every bit as luxurious as some of the other boutique hotels but without the crowds and traffic
I will say that I probably wont be booking the Surrey when using Jetsetter again because it was a total logistical nightmare Normally with my busy schedule it is very hard to follow up on a hotel booking but it seemed that the Surrey was having some major issues with the Jetsetter site because it took at least 7 emails back and forth with the very helpful GM Spencer to lock down the day I needed as Jetsetter kept saying it was unavailable and would not show the reservation I was told there were some issues with the hotels reservation computer system which might have accounted for the glitch
However once I actually got to the Surrey all the hassle I went through making the reservation was worth it I was upgraded to a fantastic room with a small sitting area and plenty of space The hotel staff couldnt have been any nicer or friendlier One of the ways I always judge a hotel is by how the staff treats the guests From the desk clerks to the doormen to the GM himself you will be treated as a valued guest here and the staff will go out of the way for you if you make a request
The thing that stood out the most to me was the bed It was amazing  without a doubt the best bed Ive had at any hotel in NYC It had extremely nice bedding including one of the nicest down comforters Ive seen  I forgot to ask where I could buy one when I was checking out of the hotel I was only there for one night during a worldwind schedule so its too bad I did not get to use it more There are plenty of pillows as well which are not too firm or soft
The room is very tastefully decorated Normally I do not love grey white and black color schemes because I feel they are not very warm and semidepressing however the Surrey did it right The room felt classy and comfortable without feeling too blah The bathroom was also one of the biggest Ive had in NYC with a nice shower that had a great double head and awesome water pressure The marble and mosaic made it feel very classy The toiletries were nice and plentiful
One thing I did not use that I thought was cool was instead of the nipsized bottles in the typical minibar  the Surrey offers bottle service in the room For 45  55 you can buy a 350 ml bottle of liquor enough for 34 drinks and a bartender will come to your room with the mixers etc and mix your first round and leave you the accoutramonts for the other drinks you will make There are about 15 different drinks you can choose to go with depending on the bottle you choose
The location is great Those who want to be closer to BroadwayTimes Square would not want to walk there and back as it took 30 minutes at a fairly brisk pace to make it to Broadway It is a short cabride to that area and they are pretty good about calling you a cab because this hotel is fairly removed from the action so cabs arent plentiful The location is in a residential part of Central Park 5th Avenue and Madison Avenue are only a 10 minute walk and because it is so close to Central Park the walk is not bad I prefer staying here as opposed to staying more in the action because it is very quiet and laid back  not at all hustle and bustle It almost feels like being in a residential neighborhood which is probably why the price is a bit higher than some comparable hotels
I found the rates to be reasonable  midApril seemed to be in the 400  500 range for a standard room You could stay at the W for much less but I wouldnt say the two are comparable in terms of the luxury beddingservice however the vibe is similar One thing I didnt like as much is that if you are traveling with a business partner they do not have many rooms available at the entry level price range with two beds I was told upon checking in the only room they had available with two beds was a junior suite which would cost 795 per night The regular rate for an entry level room was 495 at the time
I did not use the restaurant or bar at the hotel The lobby isnt as spacious as it looks on the website however it isnt as busy as a lot of other hotels so that isnt really a problem I did notice that the staff at this hotel do not beg for tips as they do at a lot of the other full service hotels in the area At many hotels I stay at for business it seems like one person takes your bags out of the car one person wheels them into the hotel one person parks the car and another person takes the bags to the room I didnt really find that at the Surrey I was at the Barclay during this trip as well and was literally chased down into the street by a bellman who moved my bags from my room a few hours earlier who wanted to let me know that it was him that moved my bags earlier that morning
If you have some money to spend and enjoy being outside of the action in a more laid back area the Surrey is for you I will say that after several years of staying at their nearby rival hotel I am making the Surrey my new home for business travel in NYC I would describe my stay here as luxurious and relaxing and thank the staff and GM for making my businesspersonal trip so enjoyable

title: Great Hotel in Good Area
text: We stayed at this hotel the week of May 21 The hotel is very nice and i felt in a convenient location to Times Square only like 2 blocks The rooms are nice bath a little small but the area is not loud and if you have your window closed you cant even hear the traffic The only complait i would say is that the elevators never seemed to be working and when you have been walking all around the city it was a little like oh i am tired anyway overall i would stay at this hotel again definately

title: Perfect NYC base
text: I loved this hotel Our room a studio suite was spacious by NYC standards spotless and very comfortable The location was great for us being away from the frantic pace of Times Square but close enough to walk there There is a multitude of great restaurants and bars within a stones throw of the hotel The staff were super friendly I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a midpriced hotel for a stay in NY

title: Fabulous clean hotel with great staff
text:
The running theme in the reviews for this hotel are about the small rooms and mine was no exception only about 24 inches surrounding the twin bed on all 3 sides and had to step OVER the toilet to enter and exit the shower However I cant say there wasnt enough room for my luggage or toiletries the small armoire provided plenty of room to hang my clothes and there were lots of electrical outlets available to charge my cell camera battery MP3 player etc
The room was SPOTLESS and the maid did an excellent job daily The down comforter and pillows were comforting after long tiring days sightseeing and the sheets were always sparkling white and crisp
The staff was super friendlycant recall one instance where I passed by a staff member when I wasnt greeted with a smile and friendly hello They were superquick with special requests and seemed genuinely happy to help with their knowledge of the city
The view from the room was a dark ugly airshaft but I saw this as a plus because it kept out street noise which along with the thick walls between rooms made for a very quiet stay
My only complaint about the WJ was that one day during my 4 night stay they turned off the water for maintenance with no notice and I was caught halfway through my shower with no water pressure I see this as a minor inconvenience and isolated incident that would not keep me from staying at the WJ again

title: Great hotel and excellent location
text:
We just got back from our trip to San Diego yesterday We stayed at the Marriott in the Gaslamp and have nothing but good things to say about this hotel
You really cant beat the location It is 2 miles to the San Diego Zoo 5 miles to Sea World and Petco park is adjacent to the hotel There are tons of restaurants and bars within walking distance The Altitude bar on the top of the hotel is great We could only go up during the day because we had the kids with us but it overlooks Petco Park so you can watch the game from there You can also look into the park from the concierge lounge
We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to the concierge floor I am not sure why we were upgraded other than that my husband is a silver or maybe gold not sure Marriott rewards member but it was a very nice perk We got free continental breakfasts and hordeuvres free Wifi and there was a computer and printer in the lounge that came in handy for printing our tickets for our activities If you are lucky enough to be upgraded be sure to get a to go container for your breakfast and you can take it up to the Altitude Sky Lounge and eat your breakfast outside
The room was very nice and clean The kids loved that the turn down service included rock candy and Oreo cookies each day I am not sure if this is a perk of being upgraded or if they do this for everyone but the kids loved it They also had bowls of candy in the lobby The only drawback to the room was that there was no refrigerator The hallway carpets were a little on the dingy side but other than that I was completely happy with the hotel and I am a high maintenance kind of girl
The staff was super friendly Everyone we met from the maid to the valet guys were super friendly and helpful Outstanding service
If you get a chance to go to a Padres game I highly recommend it Were not Padre fans but it was still fun and the tickets are so cheap that we were able to sit in the 8th row The kids got to meet some of the players and they will sign autographs The best part was that its right next to the hotel so there was not fighting traffic We also went to Heavenly Cupcake for my sons birthday which is just a few blocks from the hotel They were really good but a bit pricey We ate a Buds one evening and recommend it If you are on Foursquare you can check in and get free tater tots There isnt a kids menu but they did have chicken tenders and sliders and what kid doesnt love tater tots My husband also recommends the Strip Club which which is a restaurant where you pick out your own steaks and cook the steaks on a grill We did not do this on this trip but he was there a few months ago and said it was neat experience and the food was good We also found a great breakfastbrunch place called Mary Janes We loved it I had a great breakfast burrito and the kids enjoyed the bottomless bowl of cereal and Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes
We would definitely stay there again

title: Great Room Great Location Poor Service
text: Rooms are great newly redecorated and surprisingly quite Location is perfect to any venue in Times Square Bring your wallet Food prices are off the wall Suggest restaurant located in Edison Hotel across the street  nothing fancy but breakfast and lunch prices are 70 less than Marriott Service at Marriott very poor At check in the individiual uttered barely 3 words Asked concerige for assistance to get a package  you might have thought I asked for a trip to the moon Leave early for any appointment you have scheduled The wait for the elevator may be 5 to 10 mintues

title: Great Hotel for a New York Visit
text: We stayed at the Library during a conference in late February The conference hotel was elsewhere more expensive and much less fun Our room was small clean thoughtfully arranged and very nice The reading room with refreshments all day a generous breakfast each morning and lovely wine hour each afternoon is a wonderful amenity Books magazines and newspapers everywhere Rooms numbered by the Dewey Decimal system each with books focused on a content theme Very convenient to Grand Central Station airport transportation and the attractions of the city A wonderful experience that we hope to repeat in future trips to NYC

title: The definition of luxurious
text: I spent a couple of days in Chicago and had the pleasure of being a guest at the Elysian The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and the accommodations are designed to pamper The room had a magnificent view of downtown Chicago was modern in a very refined way and felt very residential The spa and fitness facility was the best I have experienced All the equipment was state of the art and included Pilates and Gyrotonic programs The indoor lap pool was treated with saline instead of chlorine and featured a beautifully serine lounging area The mens locker room was unparalleled The staff was very attentive and genuinely interested in making you comfortable in any way possible Chicago is my favorite city and this made a fabulous trip even better

title: Decent stay but better options
text:
Dont know what was paid for the hotel so I really cannot comment on the value Basically this is a no frills HI that would be less than 100night anywhere than NYC Ok but youd get a much better deal via any travel site or do better paying a little more for nicer digs 
Good decent but small lobby rooms were actually large by NYC standards had interior courtyard room away from city noise which was good since we were on a low floor
Other rooms were spread in other towers odd configuration average basic furnishing and linens mixed cleaning
Bad small double beds when two queens could have easily fit very noisy with hallneighbors dated dirty small bathroom

title: Ask for room in back away frm street  Very clean nice staff quaint great price and location
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights last week had an amazingly good price combined with airfare from Pricelinecom Never been to Baltimore before Nice convenient location near many tourist sites in historic Fells Point Staff helpful room good  clean Nicely decorated with old photos and information about old times which fits into neighborhood
BE SURE TO GET A ROOM THAT IS NOT FACING THE STREET AS AREA IS VERY BUSY AT NIGHT WITH POPULAR RESTAURANTS AND BARS We did and had no problems
Quibbles 
1 10 daily resort fee per room which can not get out of covers usage of business center two OK pcs in lobby which were not that hard to get onto free unlimited localnational phone calls most probably use their cells anyway  2 bottles of water  access to a primo fitness center about 15 blocks away
2 A cigarette hole in comforter cover

title: Beware of wifi charges
text: BAD start with crowds in the lobby and a long line waiting to check in Unfriendly reception staff who were apparently not very experienced at their job and who did not make you feel welcome at all Not even an apology for being kept waiting Room quite newly decorated but in very ugly colours from the 70s era so not pleasant to look at and lacking a luxurious feel Bar and restaurant are extortionate Go outside to eat and drink Worst of all were the mind blowing charges to connect to wifi for each appliance This was a real kick in the teeth after paying so much for the room in the first place and this issue left a bad taste in my mouth for sure Would never use this hotel again and urge you to research elsewhere for more a generous hotel that does not aim to rip you off and somewhere that gives better service than this place

title: Horrible experience on so many levels
text: I planned to stay for 3 nights but moved to a different hotel after 1 night due to terrible experience At checkin I asked to upgrade to a larger room I was told one would be available in a 12 hour We went to lunch and returned an hour later and were given our room keys We entered the room and saw it had not been cleaned We walked around the room and found personal belongings cell phone and realized the guest had not checked out We reported this to the front desk and were sent to a different room I questioned the bed size  looked like a double and we wanted at least a queen  and was told the bed was a queen but come back to the front desk and well give you a better room We went to the 3rd room and found it was identical to the 2nd The room was so small that my husband and I could not walk around We had to hop over the bed to get to the bathroom We tried to take a nap but couldnt sleep because the pipes in the bathroom were rattling each time a different guest used their water There was a problem with drainage in the shower I stood in water up to my ankles while showering While waiting in the lobby for a friend I witnessed a fight amongst the front desk staff A woman said to a man dont you dare raise your hand at me like that again You are not my boss and she stormed out of the lobby onto the street Other arguments between them were witnesssed during the stay Lastly we asked the front desk when breakfast coffee would be available because we were starting our day really early at approximately 5am We were told breakfast is not available that early but the front desk staff member offered to make coffee and provide breakast pastries to accomodate us The next morning the front desk was left vacant and the breakfast area was dark We entered the room in hopes that something would be available We only had 5 minutes to spare We found the front desk staff person sleeping in the breakfast area We asked for coffee and he said he could provide juice instead After all of these issues I found another hotel in the area to accomodate us We then checked out after one night This hotel was terrible and I will never stay there again

title: Great Hotel for Family
text: We stayed at the hotel after attending a Phillies vs Nationals game in late August We wanted a hotel that offered free breakfast for our family  2 adults2 children as well as one that had easy access to the subway We were more than happy with our hotel choice Hotel was very nice and CLEAN and there were many restuarants win walking distance Staff was friendly helpful and responsive wasted no time bringing us more towels etc upon request The breakfast according to our sons 10 and 7 was awesome they are big eaters The free buffet was pretty much anything you could possibly want for breakfastthe madetoorder omelettes were great even had egg whites as option My husband and I thought the breakfast was above average as well Best of allthey allowed us to keep our car in the garage paytopark reasonable while we went to the Natl Zoo the next day You can catch the metro under the hotelSO CONVENIENT Will look to stay here again for sure

title: Nice location and clean rooms
text: Front office staff is helpful and the rooms are comfortable Only thing that I wish I could change was the lack of ice machines as the closest one was three floors down and about 25 rooms away Hotel circle is always a great place to stay as well from a location standpoint as its close to a lot of the attractions Bathroom doors didnt quite close all the way but other than that the room was fine

title: Perfect location
text: I arrived at the Night Hotel on December 28 the day after the big blizzard My friend and I had to walk to the hotel from Penn Station because the cab line was so long Just so you knowits possible When we arrived we were very impressed with how sharp the hotel looked The people at the desk were very friendly although when we asked for a seafood hotel suggestion one of the girls recommended Red Lobster The room was very spacious for New York standards and it smelled great The lights were on and the radio was playing which we really liked We ate at a wonderful Greek restaurant the first night Kellaros Jersey Boys was wonderful and the hotel is steps away from Times Square yet its very quiet once youre in the room At one time there must have been a free continental breakfast but that didnt come with our room so we walked across the street to the Cranberry Cafe and got a coffee and pastry the next morning for 300 There is also a Starbucks next door The next night we tried Bobby Vans next door We just had bread two appetizers and drinks It ws quite expensive but they were perfectly fine with us just getting appetizers and were very friendly Back to the room our towel rack had fallen off the wall so we both had to use the hook on the back of the door but this wasnt really a problem The bed was very comfy and there was turndown service each night with chocolates I would definitely stay here again I think we paid around 24500 per night and I thought it was a pretty good value for the city

title: Outstanding service lovely rooms great food
text: We booked into the James for two nights and extended it to four nights  BECAUSE WE LOVED IT The staff were wonderful From the moment I called to book it to the moment we checked out we were treated like FAMILY I have traveled a lot all over the world and NEVER had such a great hotel experience in my entire life The beds are so cosy the room service was so good and the views from the room were fab BOOK IT

title: Nice Business Hotel
text: The Westin was perfectly nice I had read other reviews critical of the hotel but did not find any of those issues during my stay The conference facilities were convenient and well attended by hotel staff The room was large and even had a partial view of the water

title: Fantastic location
text: Great location friendly staff Dont expect too much with the rooms but you dont go to NY to stay inside any way Best part about the location is the bakery pizza shop and coffee on the next block Five minute walk to time square in one direction and two minutes to crntral park in the other direction FANTASTIC We will be back

title: Seventh time at the Marquis and still love it
text:
We generally avoid large hotels but the NY Marriott Marquis is an exception Recently stayed there for the seventh time and found that nothing had changedits still a very good hotel Rooms are spacious although our room was a bit odd on this trip in that it was a little smaller than the norm and the door opened OUT into the hall rather than inmaybe it was part of a suite at one time No worries though as its very comfortable and wellappointed And the best part Quiet Its a huge hotel and youll rarely hear anyone else Thats rare
Location cant be beat We actually dont like Times Square but its so convenient to all of Manhattan Nearly every subway line runs through the 42nd St station Cabs are also very easy to get and Hells Kitchen next to Times Square has some great bars and eateries
I have to laugh at people who complain about the elevatorsthey work AMAZINGLY well Far better than the old days when people fought for the next available lift Signage could be better for firsttimers probably
My only real complaint is the wonky WiFi It simply didnt work if you werent on the side of the room where the bed was located At the desk forget it So I was forced to plug in for internet service Marriott generally charges a lot of money for this but as a Platinum member it was free so Ill let it slide If I was paying I would have disputed this charge and simply purchased an ATT data package for my iPad

title: City centre location
text:
After reading many reviews from tripadvisor I decided to stay near Union square in San Francisco As Grand Hyatt was newly renovated and have received quite a number of good reviews I decided to give it a try
The taxi from airport to hotel took around 15 mins and cost USD 50  including tips Hotel lobby  reception area was rather small and was crowded maybe due to the fact that one side was still under renovation There were people and luggages everywhere Check in was smooth but kind of cold It was kind of mechanical without any smiles nor word of welcome
I have requested high floors as suggested by some tripadvisor members and was given a room on the 19th floor so noise disturbance from the streets was minimal
My room was newly renovated and had 2 twin beds and a flat screen tv Although it is not extremely spacious I did not find it too small or cramped It can still fit 2 big suitcases if you do not keep them open at all times Beds are soft and comfortable and the down pillow and quilt are also very comfortable
The bathroom has a large sink and hand held rain shower head  Unfortunately my shower pressure was a bit weak There is tooth paste and hand soap but no shower cap  shower cap is important for me as I have long hair  No slippers nor bathrobes
The room fridge is completely empty so you need to remember to get your water or drinks from nearby Walgreen  There is coffee maker in room but no glass coffee pot with it I dont really bother with it as I prefer to order my coffee or have it outside However there is no room service menu and we had to ask for one from housekeeping And when we made the order we were told that quite a few things were not available as that was the old menu Not a big deal just minor annoyance
In room wifi works well but can only connect only up to 3 devices
Location is wonderful  There is a small convenient store Walgreen  3 mins walk away  when you get out from the hotel goleft then turn left again when you reach traffic lights Small diner  Loris is opposite Walgreen which is good for a quick bite or breakfast Starbucks is 2 mins away
You do not need a car in San Francisco city as everything is pretty close by Taxis are not that expensive But of course if you are going to napa valley or Carmel  then it will be better to have your own car
If you plan to do shopping this hotel will be a great choice as there are many shops and a few large department stores all around Saks Macys and Barneys are 2 minutes away and Nordstrom and Bloomingdales are 5 mins awayAnd you do not have to wait long for taxi in front of the hotel
If you want to buy a prepaid sim card walk straight down stockton  exit hotel turn right then turn left on market street walk about 34 mins then you will see AT T  The prepaid sim card starts at US10 or 2 per day
Overall I am quite happy with this hotel and I would definitely stay here again if I could get a high floor room

title: Fantastic view of empire state building
text: First trip to New York hotel well placed for sightseeing The staff were great really friendly and happy to help with advice and suggestions Everything really cleanBut the location was the best  to wake up in the morning and see the sun on the empire state building without leaving your bed

title: Great place to stay
text: The Marcel was great Yes the rooms are small but its to be expected its NY It was such a cute room with an authentic boutique feel to it I loved it The lobby is hip and stylish its close to some great restaurants etc and the staff was super friendly I would highly recommend staying here especially for the great price my room was 215

title: Ace hotel was brilliant
text:
I had read bad reviews and good reviews so wasnt sure what to expect It was a great hotelthere are a few steps up to the front desk but its not that bad and when i left the guy on the desk offered to carry my suitcase The staff were really friendly and helpful happy to give directions They even helped me unpick my suitcase lock when it broke and they printed up some stuff for me I stayed in two different rooms while I was there as I had a few days at the hotel then went to university of washington then came back again Both rooms were decorated differently The beds were comfy in both rooms and there were lots of TV channels which is always good when u first arrive somewhere and just need an hour or so to relax The wireless internet connection was good and fast The showers and toilets were really clean and they provide shower gel and shampoo Also get your own bathrobes which was handy
If you wanted your room cleaned you had to put a thing on your doorI saw people complaining about this but you dont need clean towels every day
Breakfast is basic Toast jam cereal apples yoghurt and then theres coffee tea orange juice and milk I think the hotel is also pet friendly as I saw someone with a dog
There is a mini supermarket across the road and you are near everything like pike place market capitol hill and downtown etc This hotel really is in a great location Id heard some people complaining about noise from the cyclops club which is below it I didnt get kept awake at night at all although my second room was not on 1st avenue and so was quieter than the first one In any case i am sure you could request a room not on 1st avenue when you book
I would definitely come back here its funky clean and the staff are lovely

title: Adequate hotel in West Seattle
text: Stayed here for four nights in November 2012 Room was spartan but clean It did not have a dresser for clothing Staff was very friendly and kind Breakfast room was minimal but adequate YMCA was only a block away and cost for a days membership was only 5 Only hotel in small community of West Seattle

title: Maybe youll have better luck
text:
This is an OK hotel with a somewhat responsive staff I arrived first and gave them the name of my friend who would be checking in later which the front desk person seemed to type into the computer though his name wasnt in the system when he arrived
When the battery in the smoke alarm in our room went low and began making an intermittent clunking sound they changed that right away When the chain that lifts and drops the sunscreen that scrolls over the window broke they fixed that pretty quickly and the woman who came to fix it was nice When we asked for some nondown pillows and comforter which caused allergies they did remove the pillows and comforter when we were out but they didnt replace them until we called again and asked them for uhm some pillows and blankets The King size bed is actually two twin beds stuck together or actually not stuck together so you pretty much stay to your own twinbed side of the bed unless you want to sleep in a crevice
The bathroom lights are painfully bright and I suspected in fact at one point that it might also double as a tanning booth The water turns on scalding hot unless the faucet is all the way to the right You can tell this is a not an American hotel
After going out on our last night I asked the folks at the front desk about arrangements for getting to the airport the next morning  that is scheduling a pick up for the airport express bus I was dismissively told to talk to the concierge in the morning
Actually as I write this Im becoming much more critical and view this as a pretty bad hotel experience with small though cumulatively annoying misfires  though maybe our experience is not typical and you might do ok 
Having said that I LOVED Chicago and my time there I will definitely visit Chicago again Hotel Sofitel not

title: Great place to stay
text:
Wonderful boutique hotel great food great rooms great atmoshphere friendly staff I could go on
Best of all was their nightly roundthefire get together with free wine and popcorn  a chance to chat and mingle with other guests or just relax with a glass or two of wine after a busy day sightseeing
Very central and easy to get about from
Loved the animal skin print dressing gown and slippers Some other nice little touches such as iPod chargeralrm clock in room and free WiFi
 Would most certainly return

title: Shoddy overpriced dump not worth the money
text:
I was very dissapointed by the Belvedere the first room was tiny and didnt have a mirror other than the small bathroom one I requested but was never minded When my 16year old granddaughter joined me for 5 nights we had to move twice until I finally got a decent just decent room The furniture is old shoddy the drawers fall apart the shower curtain was too short The airconditioning old and noisy
Bad place will never go back and would never recommend it I stayed for 9 nights and regretted all of them

title: Nice place to stay
text: Thanks for giving us a best time when I was there with my friends I stayed there for 3 nights I arrived at 9am after our flight from Australia expecting to drop our bags and kill time until check in however the staff sent us off to have a complimentary breakfast while they readied our room We were in having a shower and freshening up by 10am The room was very comfortable and clean the included breakfast simple but great and the staff were very helpful They sorted us with a hop on hop off tour of LA offered to make us dinner reservations and even arranged a late check out We didnt sample the free nightly wine and cheese but there was a nice selection being enjoyed by quite a few people

title: great choice
text:
This Hotel was a great choice for a short weekend of sightseeing in DC The location was excellent a relatively short walk from everything we did  National Gallery of Art and 3 other Smithsonian Musuems the Kennedy Center and some theater at the Josephine Butler Park Center I use the word relatively for the distances because I did not find the walks long but I am used to walking distances of 13 miles easily Also the Metro was about a easy 5 mi from the hotel and I took it in from IAD and leaving thru DCA and no problem
Room was very clean and well laid out Hotel was very quiet also no street noise We were on the 8th floor street side with a nice view nothing spectualar but not an alley view
Only very small annoyance was the heatingcooling unit in the room I found it a bit noisy when it ran but I am a light sleeper so others may not be bothered by it There were signs up in the hotel saying they were upgrading their heatingcooling systems but I have no idea if this was a new or an old unit
The hotel was an excellent value for what we paid and would definitely stay at this hotel again as long as the rate was reasonable

title: This was our first stop if our round the
text:
This was our first stop if our round the world tour and it was great The location was perfect So close to times square and restaurants 
Hygiene was good although we were there for 9 nights and by the 6th night the bathroom sooo needed a good clean with bleech as it started to smell I didnt report it though My fault 
There are restaraunts everywhere and for the best pizza u must check out Armedeus famous pizza Its litteraly up the road 8th ave  5 min walk Cheap too Really good pizza

title: Save your money  Go to a Hilton Hotel
text:
I took my boyfriend to San Diego for his first time as a birthday present Since it was a present I thought I would reserve a room at the W so he could feel like it was an upscale fancy trip BAD IDEA When I took a shower the first night the shower drain was clogged so I couldnt take longer than a 15 minute shower without the water overflowing onto the bathroom floor It is a bad feeling to know you are at the W and standing in your own dirty water The next morning I went to the front desk to ask that they send someone up to look at it It seemed like an inconvenience to ask
The carpet was in really bad condition It was pulled and we kept tripping over it on the way in and out of the room
The ice machine was broken on our floor Since its the W you can only use your room key to go to your own floor and not go to another floor for ice My boyfriend went down to the lobby to get ice and notified them of the broken ice machine that they said they would look at The machine was not fixed by the next day
I travel a lot for business and pleasure Ive had better service at so many other places Stay away from this one

title: Comfortable Clean and Good Service and Affordable
text: I was part of a group of football coaches in Baltimore for a clinicmy wife picked this hotel for the price proximity to the meeting and the amenities that were included We were 8 of us very pleased The fitness room was nice and whirlpool very clean The beds are probably the most comfortable i have slept in on a trip away from home The breakfast buffet was top notch and coffeeteafresh hot cookiesfruit available as we got back in the late afternoon was a an UNEXPECTED SURPRISE Close to 2 friendly neighborhood pubs and Camden Yards is right across the street I will use this hotel on all future trips

title: Wonderfulagain
text: My wife and I first stayed here on the San Francisco leg of our honeymoon in July 2005 We were there for 3 nights Now were fortunate to live in the local area and went back for a weekend in the city and stayed at the Monaco againits still great We arrived early and checked our bags with the bag check station As I was handling the valet my wife was chatting with the front desk personnel explaining that we had stayed here for our honeymoon and we were not going to be together for our anniversary this year because of my work What a pleasant surprise it was to find they were gracious enough to send a bottle of champagne to our room for our almost anniversary The rooms are very comfortable and spacious enough They were very quick to have nondown pillows sent up as we asked The wine hour they have was fun and the staff was very friendly and conversational If you are a light sleeper and go to bed a little earlier than most I would advise against room 224 or 225  there is a balcony right by the doors to the rooms that overlooks the bar downstairs The noise may keep you up Its not deafening and is no worse than traffic but you never know

title: First timers to New York
text: This was our first time in New York so it really is hard to compare the Jolly Madison Towers with any other hotel We were in town for our 20 year anniversary a special time and I booked the Deluxe room which was just beautiful in pictures on line and was to also have a view of the Empire State Building When we got into the room is was far from what the pictures viewed as deluxe and the view was of a brick building Our room was changed when requested but still far from what they advertise as deluxe on the web site The room was clean but in real need of updating The concierge was very friendly and most helpful in helping us back to the airport on check out day This hotel did have perfect location and in walking distance to so much Considering it is New York I would say the price is fare and would consider staying here in the future not so sure if I would recommend it to others though

title: Best hotel in New York
text: Just back from a stay in this wonderful hotel I have been to New York 8 times now and this was my first time to stay here Have stayed in the likes of the Plaza on 5th ave before and have to say that i found this hotel the best of the lot I can not recommend this place enough the friendliest staff you will ever find anywhere The hotel itself is very clean I though the room was a fine size considering what i have read the bathroom was also fine Only problem was I would have liked it to have air con as when opening the window the smell from the Italian next door was not to pleasant Riks cafe was fantastic Great breakfast and great wine When we checked out i couldnt believe it when we were told to make full use of the cafe until we had to get the flight We were also told that if we had a late flight the make sure we came back for the wine and cheese later even though we were checked out They were truly amazing Cant fault anything location cleanliness friendliness food everything was great Try Tonys next door for the best Italian food ever and apple martinis Jimmys Cornor around the block is an experience A dive but a fantastic dive Owned by a professional boxer who serves behind the bar this place has so much atmosphere Want to meet true New Yorkers well here is the place to go Also try St Andrews 2 doors up

title: Great Club Lounge
text: SPG is great in its treatment of Platinum members The club lounge at the Gateway is great with nice food offerings and great service My wife and I were even allowed to bring in our own bottle of wine to have with our dinner which really it was there is certainly enough to fix a small meal on what they offer The room was spacious but the bathroom was small The halls are tired and certainly not up to the same standard as the lobby The internet speed was fine for our purpose The guest laundry on level three was appreciated however the single washer and dryer could be augmented with another couple of machines and moved to a larger area The price for the machines was 250 each

title: Great Hotel
text:
I was very worried about staying at this hotel after reading many of the reviews on this website 
However I was very impressed after staying here 
The check in was simple and very helpful The concierge helped us find our way to IKEA and was very pleasant Whenever we passed an employee in the hallway they would smile and say hello 
The location was perfect for shopping on Michigan Ave 
We couldnt have gotten a better price than we received on priceline MUCH below the asking price of the hotels website 
We would stay here again anytime

title: great place to stay on the riverwalk
text: great location excellent rooms great breakfast buffet and good fitness center

title: Beleive the Hype
text:
The Chancellor Hotel comes highly recommended The staff were friendly and approachable The location cant be beaten close to train tram bus and of course the cable car
The room was very similar to that on their website It was clean comfortable and quiet considering the location
It made an excellent base for exploring SF Would definitely use again if lucky enough to return to SF

title: Very enjoyable for a business stay
text:
I stayed here for two nights for a business trip I drove from DFW and it was easy to find right off I30 I had some concerns about my car being broken into based on some reviews of neighboring hotels but I had no issues at all I had the king semisuite which was a oneroom suite that had the bed a couch desk fridge microwave and flat screen tv Also free wifi is much appreciated There was some road noise from the interstate but it didnt keep me awake or anything so I wouldnt let that dissuade you from staying here It was very nice
Some other nice things about the hotel 1 fresh baked cookies for free in the lobby along with infused ice water 2 free breakfast every morning was excellent Makeyourown waffles bagels wcream cheese assorted pastries and muffins cereal fruit juice plus a rotating daily menu of hot items like omelets french toast sticks hash browns etc Usually hotel breakfasts are lacking but not this one 3 I didnt get a chance to use them but this hotel had a very nice looking pool hot tub patio workout room and business center 
Cons
These are all nitpicky as I didnt have any real complaints about the hotel First I had recently hurt my neck and the pillows were reaaaaaaaaally soft I normally wouldnt have even noticed but I ended up having to stack multiple pillows to get any sort of firmness for neck support
Second since the shower was a walkin glass enclosure that meant there was no tub ledge to sit things on There was one tiny ledge that would hold a bar of soap but otherwise you have to put all your toiletries on the shower floor which means a lot of bending over to pick up bottles Again normally not a big deal but the neck injury made it very annoying
Overall this hotel was everything I was hoping it would be when I booked it and I would definitely stay there again if Im ever in the area I was comfortable felt safe and felt kinda sad when I had to check out

title: Top notch AND affordable
text: Needed a place to stay in downtown Denver for a budget family vacation This place was a short walk from most of the tourist attractions at a decent price and had STELLAR service The staff at this hotel surpassed their counterparts at even the swankiest places Ive stayed  they were professional but above all else highly personable and authentically caring I would definitely stay here again

title: Best staff ever super clean a perfect stopover hotel
text: This is a clean comfortable wellrun hotel with a staff that bends over backwards I was amazed at how helpful they were Truly what a hotel should be

title: A Perfect Blend of Setting and Service
text:
My husband and I just returned from 5 days at the Inn at the Market From the first moments of checking in when I was asked if Id prefer a Seattle Times or a New York Times in the morning until the last moments of the bellman carefully packing my rental car I enjoyed the supreme customer service of this lovely hotel Our room was beautiful with a great view of the ferries crossing the Sound Because we were literally only steps from the Pike Street Market I visited daily bought fresh flowers and fruit and did some great people watchingThe Cafe Campagne associated with the hotel served the best French bistro food we have had anywhere Steelhead Cafe across the street was also fine as was Place Pigalle And all these great restaurants were less than a 2 minute walk The little patio at the entrance to the hotel contained two lovely shops where I did all my Mothers Day shopping in spite of great other shopping also walking distance away
And the bed Divine Room service Fast and delicious Overall ambiance About the best US hotel we have found in many years

title: Great Birthday experience
text: Just celebrated my birthday in Austin at the W in late March From the moment I walked in I felt like a celebrity Their customer service was second to none The icing on the cake was coming back to my room the night before my birthday to a great piece of cake and a bottle of champagne I would recommend this place if you want to feel what luxury feels like Awesome place

title: Half Moon was Great
text: My wife and I stayed  Humphreys October of 2011 We went to San Diego for a wedding We stayed a Thursday thru Monday in one of their Grand Marina Suites The room was fantastic very clean  lots of room We were on the 2nd floor great view of the Marina The hotel is minutes from the airport Shelter Island is very nice If you like mexican food go to Miguels mexican restraurant walking distance from the hotel The hotel also has stage shows For our stay George Lopez was the entertainment for two nights If you dont want to spring for the tickets you can clearly hear the shows from the pool area just grab a seat and enjoy We spent one night in the lounge and danced all night with a band that was playing dance music from the 70s  80s Both my wife and I give Humphreys two thumbs up

title: Great place to stay
text: The hotel was in a great location Close to 5th Ave and Central Park and there was a subway right out the door A friend and I stayed for the weekend and had a great time The room was ready when we arrived and got to go right up The elevators were a little small but it was no big deal The room was good for the two of us perfect size It was clean and the AC worked well The only thing that didnt work was the phone but we didnt use it anyway We did forget to pack conditioner but the hotel offered complementary shampoo conditioner body wash and lotion They had one of the great magnifying mirrors too There was a flat screen TV in the room with a minibar and a safe The only thing the room didnt offer which I would have preferred is a little refrigerator But the hotel was very nice and everyone was very friendly The bed was super comfy and at night we could not hear the traffic honking horns and sirens I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and stay there again

title: Older hotel but exceptional service and friendly staff
text: We booked a last minute stay after an awful experience at our usual stay Hampton Inn at Southpark in Charlotte We stayed on the executive level and enjoyed the lounge that offered drinks snacks breakfast etc Although the room was a bit dated stains on carpet chipping paint on bathroom door standard hotel furniture the experience more than made up for it and the cost was fair There are lots of little shops nearby and Concord Mills within 20 minutes One thing to note is you have to request the mini fridge upon reservationarrival if your room type is not a larger suite We were unable to obtain one Hope this review is helpful Happy Travels

title: Good start to the year 2011
text: We stayed in the Hilton for a week over the New Year period Despite it being a busy period the staff were good and the house keeping excellent Lots of visible security made it a reassuring stay and none of the wild partying occurred to our knowledge of the type mentioned in other reviews Its a good hotel in a great location

title: The location is the only good thing about this hotel
text:
We spent 6 nights in a triple room at 80 per person per night
The location is great if you have not been to NYC before and want to be central
However
When we checked in we asked which floor the gym was on as advertised on the website and was told the 3rd floor and was told it is open 24 hours a day
Due to my jet lag I went looking for the gym at 430am I was surprised when I found the gym with dismantled equipment walls with large sections of plaster missing and the strip lights in the middle of the floor Needless to say I did not get much exercising done
We made it to our room after a relatively long wait for lifts they are on a strange automated system and we were very disappointed with the room on the 12th floor The carpet was stained old and tatty aong with missing bathroom tiles and a continuous running tap we were not overally impressed The heater did not work instead blowing out cold air and the safe did not close We got the safe fixed and they did comoe up straight away However we did not want to wait in all day for the engineer for the heating so went without during our stay At check in it was made very obvious to us that this was the only room available with triple status
The website also offered a good restaurant We did not see any signs when we checked in but when we checked with a very unhelpful receptionist we were told in a very rude way that renovations were going on and of course the restaurant was closed
7am each morning was the time the builders started banging there was no let up even on Saturday So we got used to getting up very early which meant that we did not stay out late into the evening
I cannot decide whether the staff did not care or were so embarressed by the situation that they tried to block it out Toilets in the lobby were kept locked and the key kept at concierge Not an issue if the concierge were working 24 hours a day but guess what 
We also asked about a local attraction taking place in October an annual event for some years but they had no information
I understand that refurbishment is necessary however I am a strong believer that you need to be honest with your guests No restaurant or gym were big issues for me along with tatty rooms noise at 7am and staff who were demotivated and unwilling to help My advice is to stay at the Intercontinental across the road or another reputable hotel and avoid the Milford Plaza
Also as 3 guests in a room I would love to know how we were meant to share 1 bath towel
If you do have to stay here dont pay for internet at 15 a day Walk for 30 seconds and use Starbucks  where the staff were really friendly and they are open from 530am

title: Luxury with a chill vibe
text:
The Surrey is a beautiful tranquil hotel with great service and a nice cool vibe My girlfriend and I spent our anniversary there and had a great time I have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and this ranks up in my top ten The interior decor is beautiful contemporary and sleek The rooms are quiet and comfortable with great ammenities Service with a smile and without pretense is among the guests who happened to be a very european while we were there Interesingly enough none of my New York friends have ever heard of The Surrey which made it even more special as it seemed like I discoverd it The only negative was there was a smoking fee of 200 dollars added to my bill at the end of the stay My girlfriend smoked one cigarette while there We were never told about the no smoking policy or the fee which aggravated me until my girl talked some sence to the manager who finally omitted the fee 
Great place just keep your stash out of the room

title: Great hotel right near I95
text:
Booked this hotel being familiar with the Butler BlvdI95 area Turned out to be a great location and a nice comfortable hotel Lobby is not the newest fairfield design but updated and modern with an invitiing feel Checkin was efficient and friendly Was pleasantly surprised with the upscale design of the room especially the bathroom with nice tile floor and an upscale vanity area Bed was very comfortaable with two differnet types of pillows I preferred the fluffier ones Lighting was another plus with several fixtures throughout the room on three way switches Never did get to breakfast but it looked to be just as nice as the rest of the hotel 
Location is great with easy access to I95 and Butler Two minutes away are a Cracker Barrel and Applebees with many more options a few miles away at Town Center

title: Perfect place for an individual to stay
text: I chose the Chelsea Lodge mostly for the price because I was only going to be in NYC one night and just wanted a safe and comfortable place to sleep I was given a room on the third floor which faced the back of the hotel The hotel will not guarantee you a specific room but I think it is important to note that my room faced the back because I heard no noise from the street when I went to sleep at night or in the morning This may not be the case if your room faces the front The hotel gave me a key to my room and to the front door of the brownstone so I could come and go as I pleased It felt like coming home at the end of the night The room had a double bed which was very comfortable for one I dont know if you book a double if the bed is any bigger It would have been tight to share that bed with my husband The room had an open closet for hanging clothes a dresser a TV which I never watched a small desk a double bed a small chair a sink and a shower The shower had good water pressure and lots of hot water The room did not get wet when I used the shower as has happened in some hotels I have stayed in The one thing I felt was missing from the room was a full length mirror could be put on the back of the door It would have been nice to help with getting ready to go out The location of the hotel is ideal Quick walk to the Village and Midtown Great access to subways and you can always hop in a cab The neighborhood has lots of great restaurants and bars and there were lots of people out and about late at night The hotel is on a treelined side street though so it is quieter I would definitely recommend this hotel but the rooms ARE small so if two friends are travelling together it woud be best to each get their own room

title: Great value and excellent location for family travel
text: This is a very good clean spacious option at a fantastic price in an amazing location for lower Manhattan I urge you not to pay attention to the reviews that say its dirty its not or hot and noisy the ac was fine in the hottest month ever My wife and I enjoyed the double bed our son had the couch and we rented a rollaway for our daughter We did not cook but the kitchen was fine The suite is spacious and comfortable for four people And its New York so youre not there much The hotel is close to a subway and easy walking to SoHo shopping and attractions the Lower East Side and up Broadway Tons of great restaurants the Tenement Museum nearby Whats not to like here

title: First trip to New York
text: My wife and I stayed at the Affinia Manhattan on December 1923 2011 We arrived at the hotel before 1000am and was able to check in at this time When we arrived at our room the first thing we noticed was that the room was small The queen sized bed took up much of the room The bathroom was even smaller The bathroom door could not open all the way because the toilet was in the way Since this was our first trip to NYC we were not in our room much Generally we left in the morning and did not get back to our room until after dinner The hotel is a very nice hotel The concierge was great Meg was the person we dealt with and she is VERY knowledgeable about everything NYC The doorman was always gracious and showed us how to summons a taxi The room service people were never seen yet every time we came back to our room everything was cleaned and straightened up They say whomever they are the best way to tell if the hotel was good is if the people who stayed at the hotel would so again I would not hesitate to stay there again It was a great experience

title: Great Hotel
text: This is a quietly elegant hotel in a very convenient quiet location Service is typically great specially the valet and doormen The rooms are spacious and very well appointed and a big plus for us is that they accept pets The restaurant is good specially breakfast and there is excellent complimentary coffee in the lobby early in the morning I only wish they left it out a while longer since it is typically gone by the time I get there at around 10 am Oh and the rates are way higher since about six months ago I hope they bring them back down so that we will continue to stay here

title: OK but price seemed a bit steep
text: The Dylan provided a comfortable room and a good sleep and I was grateful to it for being able to provide a booking at short notice in the early hours of the morning due to a mixup at another nearby hotel Everything worked including good air conditioning and a serviceable bathroom with excellent piping hot water in the basin Its let down by a slightly rundown feel to some of the public areas of the hotel given that 440 a night seemed a bit much But ok overall and as others have noted the position is brilliant including for the good New York deli next door that does fantastic sandwiches

title: Nice Hampton
text: Good location downtown right beside the NASCAR Hall of Fame Easy safe walk to the Time Warner Arena as well Took the family for a fun weekend of shopping and AHL hockey Breakfast is included with the room as is standard with Hamptons which is nice to have with kids Room was clean comfortable and quiet There is a parking garage attached to the hotel where you can valet or self park but there is a charge even to self park Overall it was a nice hotel and I would stay there again

title: Top Notch
text: The view from my room looks out over the bay and I see all the key sights Very comfy beds with great linens and pillows also very clean Its fantastic if you have to work a bit because the desk looks out over the amazing view Hotel staff is very helpful and nice Only problem is the key card to the room is super sensitive and I have to try it several times to get it to open Great location for China town and I do love Chinese food I totally recommend staying here

title: Perfect
text: Just got back from my stay at this hotel Everything was perfect The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful from checking in directions to nearest subway station or any other questions I had The room was clean and I had a great view of Bryant Park The location of this hotel was perfectI would and will definitely stay here again

title: Nice pleasant atmosphere
text:
Coming from the caribbean missing our flight to Munich and without warm clothes luggage was not loaded in STT we had to stay near the PHL airport until the next afternoon Following the recommendation on tripadvisor we choose the Fairfield Inn and got the last available room
The shuttledriver offered us to drive us directly to a shop to buy some items for the night 
Large very comfortable beds and a nice breakfast
Also we were offered a late checkout without any additional payment
Overall a very recommendable hotel

title: A Great Place to Stay
text:
This was the third time that we stayed at the hotel The hotel is located in a convenient area relatively a short walking distance to China Town and Little Italy On a nice day it is a nice walk to the Village There is a subway station around the corner If you drive in from the south it is right near the Holland Tunnel so you dont have to drive through the city We like the fact that it is not in the nosiest busiest part of town
The staff is fabulous welcoming friendly helpful Always with a smile on the their faces 
The rooms are cozy clean with comfortable beds The room size is typical for many NYC rooms In the past we paid much more for smaller rooms The price for NYC is very reasonable
Two things to consider The breakfast is not worth the money You can get a cheaper and better breakfast nearby If you are driving in dont pay the hotel to park the car There is a cheaper deal around the corner On Spring street

title: Loved the bed
text: I have never experienced such a comfortable bed in a hotel before Kudos to the Kitano for picking such a wonderful bed We arrived very early 11am but were allowed to check in which is always appreciated but never expected The room was very clean and extremely quiet due to the soundproof windows We had a room right above the Jazz lounge and were warned that we would hear the music but it wasnt bad at all Ive come to expect a fee for the internet but was disappointed that we could only use one device In this day and age people travel with smartphones computers ipads so it would have been nice to be able to connect with whichever one we wanted without having to pay a separate fee for each I was also surprised that there was no ironironing board in the room Other than that the room was very nice bathroom was spacious and welllit climate control was good My husband used the free pass for the New York Sports Club to work out and loved it Overall a very enjoyable stay

title: Awesome Trip
text: My husband and I just came back from a 6 day stay at this hotel service room food view and scenery was top of the line we have never had better service in all of our travelsthanks Boston Harbour Hotel great staff

title: great place
text: Great service the rooms are awesome loved the tv in bathroom mirror the view was great from the room  The room was kept clean at all times Skywalk to the convention center is a added plus didnt have to be out in the heat Pool light display was beautiful at night Having a Statbucks was great Texas Spice has a great buffet and the wait staff was always there with refills and taking the dirty plates away very good service

title: A great place to unwind after San Diego Freeways
text:
We stayed at The Sofia on a quick overnight trip to visit the Zoo I dont like downtown areas generally but once you enter this calm and lovely boutique hotel youll feel like you could be just about anywhere The staff was exceptionally warm and welcoming offering us a very reasonable upgrade to a larger suite which we opted for The rooms are on the small side but classic clean and cozy especially for a short stay Make sure to take a selfguided historical tour with the help of the hallways and their dreamy fact  imagefilled lithophane light sconces 
Not wanting to revisit the bustling streets at dinner time we decided to try our luck at the hotels restaurant CURRANT Delicious Perfect choice for two hungry foodies The predinner Sangria was exceptional Our waiter was exceptional too It was an easy drive from there to the zoo

title: Felt right at home here
text: Ive stayed at many downtown Chicago hotels This is my new favorite Location is handy The service at checkin and during my stay was flawless The room was large and immaculate including the bathroom I really enjoy a good breakfast while traveling and was not disappointed here All the servers were topnotch My full breakfast arrived in 4 minutes one morning Great coffee from an admitted coffee snob Really pleasant effortless stay

title: Days Inn Chicago 101212
text: It is always a pleasant stay at your facility The staff is always efficient and friendly I always look here first when visiting Chicago

title: perfect bargain city hotel
text: I made my reservation online at the Bijou because it said that the last person whod reserved lived in France Turned out to be an excellent choice and it is mostly Europeans who seem to stay there They know bargains comfort and chic obviously The hotel is very well kept up and the staff is friendly PLUS you get a free breakfast buffet thrown in with your 60 a night double They also show old movies in a charming little theater though you wont have time to watch themthe hotel is conveniently located near everything in downtown San Franciscotwo blocks to Market Street three to Powell for a cable car about the same for Union Square not to mention many restaurants and all kinds of transportation Amazing at these prices for a major American city

title: Wonderful hotel for my journey to the Pitchfork Festival
text:
I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton to attend the Pitchfork Music Festival I stayed July 1619 2009 I booked through Pricelinecom very cheap and was pleased with the hotel
Comments
 I thought the location of the Palmer House in the Loop was perfect The hotel takes up an entire block and there are three entrances each of which is right next to a subway or EL stop the blue red and all the loop trains It was so easy to get around The hotel is one block from Millennium Park where the Bean is and also about one block from The Art Institute of Chicago 
 The hotel is huge It was packed with guests the entire trip 
 The room was clean stylish and comfortable The queensze bed was firm with nice bedding The bathroom was immaculate and had a wonderful bath tub The only strange thing was that the TV was on the dresser in the corner of the room but I only watched for about 30 minutes the entire trip
 There is no free Internet wireless which was kind of disappointing You could pay for one hour in the lobby about 7 or 15 per 24 hours in your room But there is a 24hour business center where you can print our your boarding pass for free
 There is a Starbucks on the ground level No coffee machines in the rooms
